reviews.review: Old world charm. For $1 you can hop on part of Hong Kong's history. Ferry ride travels to/from Hong Kong Island. Nothing fancy, but quick and efficient service.

Great views of harbor. This is one of my favorite ways to see downtown Hong Kong. Take the time to go from Central to Kowloon this way and you will have a chance to relax as the ferry carries you across. Worth doing at least once!

Boat trip . A wonderful way to spend an hour or so, with spectacular views and wonderful experiences, giving you a unique sighting of HK harbour and the background scenery.It's an absolute must to do the trip at least twice, once in daylight and once at night - 2 very different atmospheres. All in, it is probably one of the best and most cost effective tourist attractions in the world.
Star Ferry. A must for tourist to HK. Offers a leisurely way to cross the harbor with great views. It's very nostalgic ride for most people in HK

Scenic travel. It is a must-do activity for tourist / travelers in Hong Kong. You would be able to see the best view of the Victoria Harbour in between of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. The pier in Tsim Sha Tsui is next to the bus station and Ocean Terminal. It is considered to be the most convenient one to get on board. The Central Pier and Wanchai Pier require a 10-min walk to the town.
Stunning . Great views. Lost of time to spend and very easy for tourists. The tram is fun. Got up to the observation deck. It's free with the tram ticket.

Best deal in town for transport. This is a HK staple and not to be passed up. Can't miss the green boats going back and forth across the harbor. Best and cheapest way to get from island to Kowloon by any measure.

Breezy Boat Ride in the Harbor. This is a very scenic and inexpensive way to get between Kowloon and Central District. Ride takes only 5 minutes but provides good photo vantage points both day and night.
Must do fun when in HK. Tourist or not - this attraction is pure HK :-) (the other being the tram). Take ur Octopus and give a go!

Great value and fun. The Star Ferry is a cheap must do while you are in Hong Kong. It is a cheap and fun way of getting between Hong Kong and Kowloon with very frequent service running every few minutes.

Family Trip - Adults. Super nice experience for my mother in law and husbands family. Star Ferry is one of the usual transportation for us, Hongkongers. It can provide a great ride for tourists also with the big window/door they have.

Old World charm. Definitely do this.....Its a relatively inexpensive way from Central Piers to Tsim Sha Tsui. The costs are around 4HKD / adult for a small 10 minute ride and the harbour view with full lights will be quite a sight. These are not modern ferries and you feel the Old world charm of HK the minute you get on. Most locals use this and adds to its charm.Its a must do and will take 30 mins max.

My must do every time I am in Hong Kong . It's not just a ferry, it it a well organised ferry that crosses from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island offering great views on both sides of the city. Great with blue sky during daytime (this happens a bit seldom in HK), excellent when is dark in the evening with all buildings full of lights and colours. The short ride from Kowloon side to Island side is very cheap. Tip: choose the upper deck for only one dollar more
Never miss at least one trip.. We have been coming to HK for nearly 40 years, while the character has changed significantly in that time, these ferries plug on. Really don't miss doing this

Must do while in Hong Kong . The star ferry is a must do thing when staying in Hong Kong. I'm sure at some point you will cross over from TST to Central and vice Versa so instead of taking the couple of stops on the MTR why not go across by boat, it's a little longer but the breeze and views are excellent and it is a great way to get some great skyline photos. You can also take it in the day or night time to get a different view of the iconic skyline Hong Kong has to offer. If you already have an octupus card then like most things in Hong Kong you can use this to get across and it won't cost you much either. Boats go to central and wan chai so make sure you get the correct one.

First time in HK? Or second, or third...?. The Star Ferry is the best way to get across the Harbour from Kowloon to Central and back - pretty cheap, pretty quick and with great views of one of the world's most famous harbours.

Was there ever not a Star Ferry?. You just have to do it. Crossing the harbour by Star Ferry is a must-do for every visitor to HK. It leaves frequently and it gives wonderful views of the harbour and the shoreline - and all of the activities going on on the harbour. If you are very lucky, you might see a junk in full sail. The Star Ferries are unusual crafts since they have two bows and two sterns. To save turning round, they can travel in either direction!
Transportation . Cheap and relaxing way to get from kowloon to hong kong island. About a 5 min ride, very calm waters. $2 each way

Best way for Harbour View. Star Ferry gave us a different experience crossing from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon . It is cheap and convenient. The ferries were old looking but they maintained it clean and safe.

Super Easy to Use and easy way to Hong Kong Island and back. Super easy, old boat but safe certainly did the trick for the price and good access to major spots on Hong Kong Island. Great tourist experience for low cost
Great in all weathers. I love the star ferry. It is great in all weathers and at all times. The sunset is a particularly good time. The views are fantastic. Best value attraction in Hong Kong.

Classic travel in Hong Kong. I've been travelling on Star Ferry for almost 20 years and I still love it.It's an amazing historical transport ride along with the trams that cannot be replaced anywhere in the world.The views of the HK skyline are always great.Pay the small amount extra and do the top deck. Get on first for your pick of the best seats.

Relaxing ride with fabulous views!. Traditional Hong Kong transport with the best view of the harbour day & night! Well worth your time & the small fare for a trip. Be adventurous & ride each way in a different class!
Its a ferry. Quick efficient service. Good setup for wet weather. Staff helpful. Clean and tidy. Only used to travel between Kowloon and Kong Hong

Great for views of Hong Kong. I caught the ferry twice on my stay, once during the day and then again in the evening. You get your token from a machine in the pier building then queue up to get on. I didn't actually join the first ferry to arrive after I'd gone through the barrier, I waited for the crowd to get on then waited at the front of the queue for the next one, only a few minutes later, so I could then sit close to the edge. It only took about five minutes but you get great views of the harbour, especially all the lights in the evening. Well worth it.

Best Harbour View. If you come visit Hong Kong without try the Star Ferry crossing the harbour, that means you lost the chance to visual the most famous harbour view with just few hk$ - the lowest in the world. Please try both day and night time. Oh, of course bring with your camera is a must. Then you'll know why it's called Pearl of the Oriental.
Very good. Great to see star ferry still running, great way to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong island, cheap and you don't have to wait long for a ferry
Old world charm. Cheap relaxing way to cross Victoria Harbour. Excellent views of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon skylines.

A chill commute. Star Ferry gave us a different experience crossing from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon (MTR is one of the other options). It is cheap and convenient. The ferries were old but they maintained it clean and safe. I don't suggest this mode of transportation though if you are in a hurry as MTR is obviously quicker. It is highly recommended for people who want a different taste of Hong Kong where one could appreciate the sea and the buildings that grow taller as the ferry moves closer to land. We took the ferry in the afternoon and there were only a few passengers. I wasn't sure though how crowded it could get. So the cruise was chill and relaxing. Taking the ferry in the evening is also highly suggested as the view gives a colorful skyline from the lit buildings.

A must for first-time visitors to Hong Kong .... A must for first-time visitors to Hong Kong ...It's just about the cheapest attraction in Hong Kong, except perhaps for a tram ride.If possible, schedule your ferry rides so that you cross one way in daylight and the other way at night, so that you get to see the HK skylines with and without make-up.Take the Tsim Sha Tsui - Wan Chai route as it's longer and you'll see a lot more.
amazing sea view. a amazing sea view with Ferry to amazing blue water experience and nice weather, a journey with down to earth touch feelings

Star Ferry. We stayed in Peng Chau with family this visit. The Star Ferry terminal is conveniently located 100 meters away from the #6 ferry pier for Cheung Chau. The ride is a scenic 5 minute ride across the harbour to Kowloon. On both sides the central bus terminals will conveniently take you to many local attractions.This is a great alternative to traveling on the underground MTR all the time.

Travel like a local. Very cheap way to get over to Hong Kong island - only 2hk$ (about 25p). Should be good views of the harbour but we were in middle of a typhoon when we travelled so did not see much. Very efficient and easy to use.
Ferry with best view. Star ferry is a convenient way to cross harbor between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. The price is even cheaper the MTR. And you have a stunning view on both day and night.

A Hong Kong Icon. It's been 32 years since visiting Hong Kong as a teenager and the thing I remember most from my time there was the Star Ferry and Star Ferry terminal. It hasn't changed a bit...and that's a very good thing! It's just a ferry ride but it's part of the Hong Kong experience to me...a must do!

Wonderful HK Night Scene with Lowest Cost. At a cost of only HK$2.50 (Mon-Fri) and HK$3.40 (Holidays),you can enjoy best night scene of Hong Kong Victoria Harbour. The Hong Kong Star Ferry offers this publicly opened transportation is so favorable for free and easy travellers.

Very cheap attraction. This is not a real attraction but I really enjoy the trip.I try to cross by ferry during each visit to HKK.You have a great view of the skyline from the boat.I definitely recommend it

The best 20p you will ever spend!. If you want the best views of HK skyline from sea level, grab the star ferry, 7 minutes to savour!Head to the south end of Canton Rd/TST MTR station, or head back to the main land from Central.Take it at 8pm and experience the Symphony of Lights show at the same time!

Old fashion ferries in a very modern city. The ferries are built locally in the '50-'60 and keep going, crossing 70.000 people per day between Hong Kong and Kowloon. The crossing is in itself a touristic attraction providing excellent views of both sides of the channel, and for only one euro/single is one of the best HK value for money activity.

STAR FERRY. a short ride but lots of photo opportunities. Recommended but not much to see once docked on the other side from Kowloon Point. Buy your own tickets don't be encouraged by the touts offering tours as package it is more expensive
Great Views. Hop on to the ferry and sail across the harbor. The views of the skyline either side are spectacular and worth the trip alone. Plenty of ferries regularly so not much waiting time.

Cheap and cheerful but what character. Got the ferry from Hong Kong to Kow Loon - $2
What a beautiful old vessel, wooden decks are gleaming and you can see down into the engine bay, which is spotless.

Excellent Value, Fast and a Breathtaking view!. Been going to Hong Kong for 25 years back and forth. The star ferry is a great way to go from kowloon to Wanchai or Central etc... its always on time and efficient and you cane beet the view for picture taking. After 25 years i never get tired of the view. The star ferry is an excellent choice a historical ride and a have to do on your HK bucket list.

Landmark of Hong Kong. Beautiful views of Victoria harbour. It was an important transportation between Kowloon Peninsula and Hong Kong Island before the Hunghom habour tunnel was built and in service as well as before MTR was in service.The old Hong Kong Island star ferry terminal/pier in Central was demolished and moved to the new site. Tsim Sha Tsui star ferry terminal/pier is the only historical building for ferry services between T.S.T and central and the landmark and symbol of Hong Kong where another landmark, the former Kowloon-Canton railway clock tower is located. Enjoy the boating ever.

One of the Top 10 visitor must do's in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry has to be one of the most famous ways to travel in Hong Kong. Not only is it a cheap (around 25 pence per trip), the views and atmosphere is amazing. The old ferries with their wood and metal work are beautiful. For a first time ferry user, I would go from the Ocean Terminal dock in Kowloon to the dock near the exhibition centre. The views of the high rise buildings as you approach Hong Kong Island are one of the classic skyline views in the world. Setting off in daytime is amazing, but a night trip is all that more special.

Quick and easy. Used the ferry multiple times to go from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Seemingly effortless - pay at the machine (very straight forward), load onto the boat and then off again on the other side. Ferry runs regularly - a quick ride across the channel and voila, you're at the destination!
Nice experience at night time!. Just few HK dollars for taking ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central, we love the spectacular view of Victoria Harbour with sparkling lights from Hong Kong island.

You have to take a ride. You have to take a ride. It is nice to use this alternative way of going around and visiting Hong KongSpecially in the late hours after dusk you can enjoy the city, the impressive buildings and all this lights...Impressive and nice and beautiful

A very good transport to see the Victory Harbour.. If you want to see the beautiful harbour light in Hong Kong, a round trip night ferry tour by Star Ferry from Kowloon to Wanchai (not Central) is one of the best choices.Clean, cheap and classic is what we will find in this ferry. I have been enjoying this trip for over sixty years since I was ten. The only thing I dislike is the sailing time is too shortbecause the harbour becomes more narrow after many reclamations.
Nice trip. This is a great trip that we have a wonderful time when we get to the other side of Hong Kong by ferry

Convenient, Easy and fun. Excellent trip from TST to Central - takes about 8-10 minutes.
Cheapest way to cross HK harbor.
Definitely recommend.

Once is Enough. As a hong kong resident, I sometimes take Star Ferry to cross the sea. Rather than a mode of transport, it's my (too) brief excursion to ponder over something or clear my mind.However, for tourists, I think it's enough to take the ferry once on your first visit if you really want to get something out of it. If you need to travel between Central and TST, it is also efficient and cheap with a little more fun than MTR.

I Love You Ferry Much. One of the oldest mode of transportation in HK, the Start Ferry is over 100 years old. It's a short and sweet ride to experience the past and see the future, which are the amazing buildings along the harbour. A wonderful and cheap way to cross Victoria Harbour and see the HK skyline. A must do when visiting HK.The fare is roughly HK$2.50 - 3.40.

Scenic and cheap way to cross the harbour. The Star Ferry that operates from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui is undoubtedly the most scenic and cheapest mode of transport to cross the harbor. The 7 minute ferry ride provides breathtaking view of Victoria Harbour. The only drawback is that the ferry pier is quite a walking distance from Queen's Road Central, which is the heart of the financial district. A MUST DO for every tourist visiting Hong Kong
Best view of harbor in the world . It's one of the best harbor view on any ferry ride in the world. Enjoy unobstructed view of Hong Kong Island & Kwoloon. Especially the night view.

Best tip for Hk tourists. With the Hk team the Cheapest and best way to sightsee While the team offers a Meandering tour of various different districts and areas of Hk, the star ferry is he way to see the harbour and the skyline both should be a must for any visitor and are a fabulous way to spend 30 minutes and feel a part of the daily life of the city
Love this experience; peacefully crossing Victoria harbour. It is classic way to have a peaceful way crossing Victoria Harbour; Love the sailor doing this authentically.

Best way to cross the Harbor.. Simple to find, easy to board and just a short ride to cross Victoria harbor. Very inexpensive as well. Make the trip from Hong Kong to Kowloon in the early evening to watch the city come alive with its bright lights. The boat is basic and old, but that is part of the charm of the approx 5 minute crossing. have done it many times since moving here am I am sure we will have many more.
Best ride in town. Crossing Victoria Harbour on board the Star Ferry is such a pleasure. Good to do ride it at night and day time. Its cheap and offers a great view of HK skyline.
Cheap and historical. The cheapest way to get across the harbour ,which allows great views and photo opportunities. Travelled off peak so not congested.

an everyday event but always enjoyable. Even after living here for 7 years I still love getting on the star ferry.Its a very short trip, but allows you to connect with Hong Kong in a very special way.There is no doubt that this is one of the worlds best harbors with arguably the best skylines - to experience it from a beautiful old vessel like the star ferry is a must.

Amazing view. Great place to be in , the breeze will kiss you & thats bliss. The star ferry is not very Hi-tech but it gives you a good feeling. It saves time, it allows you to reboot. A must visit place in Hong hong.
Nice trip. Good experience to travel Victoria Barbour between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island, and it is cheap. Could be paid by the octopus card or by cash machine.

Great. I prefer to take this to the MTR living in HK, the ride over is only a few minutes but it's so relaxing and the views are awesome. It's dirt cheap, you don't wait longer than 5 minutes to get one, and it's not too busy. As a local I have to say this is one of the best things in Hong Kong and a must-do if this is your first visit to Hong Kong.

A great trip on a sunny day. Whilst the MTR is a quick trip to get to and from Hong Kong Island the Star Ferry is must more scenic. It costs only a few dollars but also only takes a few minutes thanks.
Harbour crossing. We used the Star ferries to cross the harbour today. Very straight forward, no issues at all. Cheap as well

A must do whether you are visitor or resident. It never gets old. The Star Ferry in Hong Kong is the most wonderful way to be awestruck by what this city has fit into its rich history. The skyline, beautiful harbour, amazing transport system and energy of the people can all be experienced in a breathtaking 10 minute ride.
Very dependable transportation. Like clock work in and out. all day every day. For what they charge they do a great job. I will continue using them

I take the Star Ferry as much as possible!. Something about these ferries is amazing. Perhaps it's one of the few times on public transportation when you feel like you can just sit back and relax. Even though the subway is much faster, it's nice to actually enjoy one's urban mobility sometimes.

Easy, fast, cheap. The ferry service is super efficient. There is never a long wait time (15 minutes between trips?) and the cost is negligible. It is also a great vantage point for photographs of the two skylines.

Iconic symbol of HK. Not to mention cheap and practical. It's about £0.25 per single trip. Even with the rubbish state of the GB Pound this will always be good value.
We used this almost everyday of our stay and preferred it to the MTR simply because of the experience of crossing the harbour.

Efficient and Pleasant. Great mode of transportation from Mainland to Island with excellent city views. If you enjoy boating this is an opportunity to see watercraft of all sizes, personal, recreational and international shipping.

Value of money. great choice for good view in cheap way
recommended for sight seeing hongkong and kowloon sides.
enjoy your trip

Quick. Went on the star ferry as it is classed as one of the tourist things to do when in Hong Kong. We simply went on the star ferry to go from a to b just as an experience. Very quick but good views and good to do for the experience
very cheap. This is a very cheap way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island, less than 25p each way. The sailngs are very frequent and very reliable.
an easy way to travel. from Kowloon to Hong Kong and vice versa - an easy and cheap way to cross the river.Very regular and very quick with good views of both sdes.
worth it. I take the ferry all the time when I need to leave HK island. I prefer this way, then the MTR, it's cheaper, so much nicer and of course not crowded at all. Mostly locals use it ;)

One of the best views of Hong Kong. A "must" for all those people who want to get the old view of this great city, both leaving from Central or Wanchai, the trip is really worth especially at sunset.
Wonderful and unique experience at only few HK$ per way.
Highly recommended!
29 pence to cross the harbour!!!!. An amazingly cheap tourist attraction for everyone to do and see. It is as iconic as any other attraction in the world, one to tick off the list.

One of the HK must do's. A little piece of history, can be accessed using an Octopus card, or purchasing tickets/tokens at walk up. Great views of the busy harbour, and a nice way to cross from Kowloon to HK island.

An Outside View of the City. The Star Ferry provides a little break from the hustle and bustle of the city and a great view of the aforementioned city. Free pineapple cakes are provided to every guest, and other refreshments can be purchased. There's interior and exterior seating and a bathroom below deck. You may need to take some motion sickness medicine.
Good. is a must if you are in HK. Do not expect the Titanic. Fast, easy, clean snd very very cheap. Use the MTR to get back if day. Good to use it en the evening to see city lights

Good mode of transport between HK Island and Kowloon. While the two sides of Victoria Harbour are now connected by a world-class infrastructure system of road and rail tunnels, this ferry service is still a good & inexpensive mode of transport between Central / Wan Chai (Hong Kong Island) & Tsim Sha Tsui (Kowloon). Great for experience of the beautiful harbour/sea view of Victoria Harbour! Just get the Octopus card and travel around HK at ease!

Nice little tide. A popular ride across the harbour. Extremely safe and enjoyable quick trip. Plenty of time to snap the world famous postcard harbour views. If over 65 it is free. Otherwise it is still a cheap short cruise.
Smooth Short Ride. We rode the ferry once. It was difficult to get to the ferry dock via taxi. We rode it for the experience, but I would not say it was a must do.
Scenic Transportation . Great transportation option! So enjoyable relaxing on your way to Kowloon for High Tea at the Peninsula Hotel.
Fun. The star ferry was a cheap and easy service of transportation to get to the peak. Tickets were cheap and easy to obtain

A nice old fashioned ferry. An easy and cheap way to get across the water. They are frequent throughout the day and you can get some great views as you go accross especially at dusk. Make sure you have change- the tokens are purchased by machines and the largest notes they accept are $20 HKD.

Cheap as chips!. My partner and i came to hong kong in early October for our anniversary and used the star ferry numerous times to venture from Kowloon to hong kong island.It was a cheap but quick and efficient way to get from either side of the island. Takes about 5mins to get from either side and you get a fantastic view of the buildings on both islands as you go across.Highly recommend even just for the view!!
Functional And Fun. Good for both work and tourists. Pack lightly as theire are no elevators to carry luggage. Plus, no air conditioning in summer months,

The icon is a must to visit..... It's always fascinating to get a ride on the star ferry. Even the pier itself is nostalgic.
Whenever you visit Hong Kong, it is a must to visit and ride the star ferry. Otherwise it is considered you have never visited Hong Kong

Most beautiful mode of transport. A great way to spend your evening. You get to see the city skyline and experience cold breeze. Go after 5:00pm to avoid the sun. Cheapest and best way to travel b/w wan chai and tsim tsa tsui.no advance booking needed.
Cheapest Thrill in the World. There is no reason not to take the ferry across the harbor. Day or night the view is awesome. Do it a few times.

Spectacular but mediocre. So Victoria Bay is truly one of the seven wonders of the modern world. The Hong Kong skyline is the most impressive on the planet. Bar none (note: I'm from New York). What better way to see it than from the bay on a super cheap vintage ferry? Right? How could you screw that up? It sells itself. Well . . . First you pipe in a poorly conceived tour that barely scratches the surface of the epic vista you're looking at. Really raises more questions than it answers. You couple that with a tuneless MIDI instrumental soundtrack that sounds like it was composed by a sadistic robot in 1993. Over. And over. And . . . well, you get the idea.

It could be so much better. Rated 'Top 10 Most Exciting Ferry Rides' by the Americans, the Star Ferry in Hong Kong is one of the best-known icons in this town. Not only is it a tourist attraction it provides a useful service to many local commuters, too. However, the state of the pier on Kowloon side is shameful! It is dingy, dark and dirty, a far cry from what one usually associates with stars.It has been like that for many years. The pier on Hong Kong side is fairly new due to the relocation. We do not need chrome and glass to upgrade the Kowloon pier but if they wish to retain the third-world charm they can still make it more pleasant by giving it a new coat of paint, improving the lighting, or as a minimum, getting rid of the grime and cleaning up the place.The Star Ferry is almost a 'must-go' for all tourists and I wonder how the parent company, The Wharf (Holdings) Limited who is not without money, can bear to see the pier in such a poor condition. After all, how much does it cost to paint and install better lighting in a small pier like that?

A Hong Kong Institution. The Star Ferry has been around for about a century, connecting Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. A fast trip - about ten minutes - very inexpensive. Good views of the skylines and the various boats traveling in Victoria Harbor. Takes you right to the heart of the Museum and Hotel district on the Kowloon side. Something you need to do.

Must do. Whenever I go to Hong Kong I will take a ride on the Star Ferry. A must do for Hong Kong travelers with a phantastic view on both sides of the Victoria harbor. And all that for a very small amount of money!

The best value attraction in Hong Kong. Even though I have been in HK a while I still take every opportunity to ride the Star Ferry. A symbol of old Hong Kong from which you can see the impressive skyline. Must see.

Great way to get around. Rode the ferry several times. Very easy and quick method of crossing the harbour. There is plenty of seating and the ferry runs frequently. You can use the Octopus card for the ferry and most other transport in Hong Kong.

A bit to miss. This is not expensive and definately worth adding to your tick list when visiting Hong Kong. A trip across the bay that even in a cloudy day was very enjoyable and shows Hong Kong from a different perspective - bottom to top instead of top to top of bottom.

Brought back childhood memories. It's amazing to me that this type of commuter transportation has not changed in over 30 years without missing a beat.
It is exactly as I remembered! Including the ramp walk to the mildly rocking boat. You have to experience it when in Hong Kong.
Fast and easy. Great ferry, fast and easy. It takes you from Kowloon to Hong Kong and back in less than 10 minutes, and they have ferries every 15 min.

It was fun. We had fun as he feel if entire ferry was awesome ... wooden benches and terminal and entire atmosphere was good. While you are sitting in the ferry you can see the all lights which are blinking of Hongkong's... tall buildings....nice breeze and beer awesome experience

Ferry trip. We bought Big Top Bus package which has a ticket for the Star Ferry. We got onto the Ferry which took us to the Hong Kong Maritime museum and the Hong Kong Eye. The Ferry ride was a short one but we enjoyed it. Ferry not just for tourists but locals use it to go to and from work. It is better to get on it outside peak periods as it gets full during peak time
Its a cool place to visit Light Show.... its a cool place but u should visit there after 8 pm because after 8 there was a light show every day and its wonderfull

It cheap and efficient transport. The ferry just keeps on running on a regular basis.It's good cheap and efficient transport.It's a great was to meet local people and to be outside on a busy and regular changing harbour.Big boats and cruise shps ..it's a great view
Very efficient. Efficient and easy to use. Make sure you have small bills or change to pay because it only cost 2.50 Hong Kong dollars to travel from Kowloon to central

Nice ride over Victoria Harbour, only €0,25 one way!. Nice wooden ships take you from either Kownloon to HKI or vice versa. Dirt cheap and not a long wait at all. I like this way of crossing the harbor over the modern catamarans. We were the only tourists on board by the way.
Great fun, really chep. With a bit of time to kill we opted for the ferry over to Kowloon. Great vistas, short ride, air conditioned front cabin.

Great, inexpensive ride. The least expensive way to cross the harbor and, by far, the most fun. the most scenic, too. Most tourists ride on the upper deck, which has air-conditioned sections, but on a tip from the HK tourist people (they are really knowledgeable and give great advice), we rode back and forth on the slightly less expensive lower deck (both decks are free with a Senior Octopus card). the lower deck is just a few feet from the water and completely open and a lot more fun.
Best commuting in the world. Old but/and very nice. Extremely cheap. Great views. Nice and attending crew. Really great experience. Should be on to-do list. Also great evening cruise.

Super quick boat ride! . This is definitely a great way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. It's super cheap and you wait less than 15-20 minutes for the next ride. I recommend taking the metro to Kowloon right around sunset and seeing the skyline light up. Then take the ferry and see the stunning skyline. Ferry is very short so make sure to take enough photos before you enter to go across!
Nice ride. travelled from HongKong Island to LanTau island and back via Fast ferry and regular ferry. Liked the ride, absolutely safe and the harbour line view on the trip is awesome.

What a sight!. Do it at night back from Kowloon to HK Island and admire all the lights. Takes about 5-10 mins and is super cheap. Laser light show can be seen from Kowloon at 8pm each night but it's nothing special. The building lights that are on the rest of the time are spectacular enough.

A must do while in Hong Kong. A step back in time, a piece of history, the Star Ferry offers a cheap and classic experience from old Hong Kong. Stunning views of the harbour.I took the ferry only from Kowloon to HK and return, but there are other points further along to outer islands I'd love to check out on my next visit. Incredibly inexpensive. The upper deck is more expensive than the lower deck, but both are very reasonable.
still great value. the star ferry is still great value,a great way to travel to the other side of the harbor,all ways travel top deck to avoid fumes below .
Just a ferry. Rode ferry to other side of the bay, nothing fancy, just a quick boat ride, much cheaper than taking a taxi

Scenic way to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. You can take the star ferry almost in front of the peninsula hotel. It is a short walk from there. There are wonderful views of Hong Kong Island from the Star Ferry terminal. The price is not that expensive. Be wary of the shifting gangplanks and sometimes the ride is not very smooth due to the choppy sea. The ferry is not really that modern, it is pretty old. But, it adds to the charm. On the short ride you can enjoys views on both sides of the harbor. Many times, fog obscures the view. A late afternoon ride may be better compared to early morning.

The best view in Hong Kong. Use this to get from Hong Kong island to Kowloon, or the reverse. its cheap (cheaper than the tube) and gives you the best views on Hong Kong's harbor frontage. On a sunny day its a nice place to sit and drink a coffee (buy it from the Starbucks on the quay).

Quickest and cheapest way to get from IFC Hong Kong to TST. I'd been on the Star Ferry as a tourist but I wasn't familiar with travelling back and forth between Central (IFC) and TST. The Star Ferry is the cheapest and easiest way to travel between these two destinations. The view in the daytime well and truly beats the austere MTR but in the evening, the view is a magical kaleidoscope of colourful buildings and skylines, a must for everyone. The Star Ferry is a much more pleasant option to the crowded MTR. Getting there is relatively simple, if you're in IFC, just head towards the Apple Store and then exit and follow the signs (or ferris wheel) ... the ferry terminal is a 5 minute walk once you exit the IFC Mall. You can select either the lower or upper deck. Ferries come approximately every 5 minutes so you never have to wait long. The Star Ferry is a relaxing and delightful way to commute between Central and TST.
Such a cool ride especially in the evening. The most Hong Kong thing to do, enjoy the view from the ferry and just enjoy the short ride and take great pictures.
Great way to travel. Wonderful way to see the harbour . Cheap and easy to use. We would have do more trips if we had more time.

Hong Kong Star Ferry easy to ride. This must be one of the easiest boats to catch. The token for entry are dispensed by vwending machine. These are easy to use and we bought 4, one way at the one time. The trkens are then inserted into a access gate which allows you to pass. The ferry arrives and the boarding couldn't be easier. Plenty of seats which can be oriented to face either way ( forward or aft). views from the ferry are worth the trip
Small ride better in night . Very short ride. Good view in the night. Don't waste time on laser show. Worth visiting once. Not much than that
Excellent!. Cost $3 HKD from Kowloon to Central. Fun ride! The water is a little smelly, but that is the south china sea

Most economical public transportation over the Hong Kong harbour with a view. Postcard phototaking opportunity on this public transportation that will only cost you a couple of Hong Kong dollars BUT offer you a great easy and comfortable ride across the harbour. Get to enjoy the breeze and serenity (at the right hours). MUST DO when in HK!

Most efficient way to cross the harbour. I stayed at the Intercontinental Grand Stanford hotel in Kowloon, about a 15 minute walk from the Star Ferry terminal. This is by far the best way to cross the harbour, the cost is extremely cheap (HKD$2), it is not that busy, and if you time it right, it is pretty quick. The best part of the journey are the views, you get million dollar views for a couple dollars. I took this from Kowloon to Central and back, the only drawback is that the ferry stops running between 10-11PM, so if you miss it, then you'll need to take the MTR. You cannot go to Hong Kong without riding the Star Ferry!
A must do and cheap program. For almost nothing you can enjoy the view of both sides from the sea, it's also a bit of time travel.

Best way to see the harbour.. I have traveled on the Star Ferry since I was born, use to go everyday to school in Kowloon for many years. It's the best way to see the harbour and life of those who work on it. It's free for the over 60s.

Easy way to cross from Kowloon to hong kong Island . If needed an easy way to cross the Victoria harbor, the star ferry is a great and fun way. Takes about 10 minutes from side to side, and with great views of the city.
short trip. I bought a return ticket without and problem and travelled across the water on the Star ferry which was rather pleasant on a sunny day.

Fantastic way to travel!. If you like history go with the star ferry! It's a fantastic way to see hong kong fron the sea!
Wow go there now!

It Works. The two ferries cross the channel constantly so you do not have to wait long...buy you token for Hk$ 2 per person and in minutes you are on for quick crossing . Taxis are not keen to drive from Kowloon to Hong Kong island or back...the ferries the answer !!!

Fun and quick. Nice way to get around HK and super cheap!!
The boat isn't very rocky so people like my sister who get motion sickness very quickly we're fine for the most part ☝🏼️💕
Regular crossing of harbour. Use your octopus card or cash to cross the harbour on these quaint, double ended ferries. Good views of skyline
A Piece of History. Old-time wooden hull ferry which runs every 8 minutes to and from Kowloon. Very inexpensive. Very efficient. Highly recommend.
just wanted to say I'd done it. Have read about the Star Ferry so many times and I always wanted to do it. It's actually a very short trip but very cheap,

Must do quick harbor boat ride!. This was a shock for the price.
Wonderful old ferry boats to cross the harbor for about
50 cents Canadian one way!
Go from Kowloon to the island and back for a little less than a dollar!
I say it is a must do!
Convenient and with nice view. Very convenient and cheap way of getting a great sea view perspective of Hong Kong. I definitely recommend trying it.
Just a must!. You cannot visit Hong Kong/Kowloon without a ride on these historic ferry boats. Very cheap and affords a great view of both skylines.
Convenient!. A very cheap and convenient way to get across the harbor, with the bonus of amazing views. Also remember to go for a night ride, best bang for buck in HK.

Good way to see Hong Kong skyline . This cost to ride this ferry can be paid with Octopus card - this gets you on train, bus, ferry and funicular from The Peak.
The ferry trip is relatively short but a good way to see the Hong Kong skyline. A nice alternative to the MTR which is not scenic at all

Pleasant, hassle free and cheap!. I was amazed to know that the Star Ferries were actually started by a Parsi - Dorabjee Naorojee Mithaiwala back in 1880! it's an inexpensive way to cross the harbour on a sunny day or even at night - for some good views of the famous HK skyline. Costs much lesser than the MTR - you get dropped at Central with an easy walk to the MTR.

Tour very expensive! Just take the ferry. 71HKD for tour, 3-4 (forgot) HKD to do a one way trip. 3 HKD is 50 cents. That is pretty dirt cheap - the tour isn't worth it. Didn't take it during night but I imagine it'd be beautiful then.

Easy connection between Hong Kong and Kowloon. We used it as a connection to ride our 24 hr hop-on hop-off tour. Great reliable very affordable service. Do not attempt using free Wi-Fi anywhere in the area to avoid being hacked (happened to me).

Absolutely must take this in HK!!. We were recommended to use Star Ferry to cross Victoria Harbour as it's what all the locals use & at 25HK$ one way (25p!) why would you choose any other way. It's not luxurious but it's clean, very efficient & you get a great view of the area all around the harbour - a real must do!!
Star ferry . Very easy to use - make sure you have local currency in coins - very cheap and a great way toget from o w side to the othet
How can you not? . Super easy and cheap. Great way to travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Great views across the harbour. Ferries run approx every 10 minutes.
Very relaxing. It is very easy to find the terminal and easy to buy the tickets. Go at night when the skyline is lit up. It is a very gentle introduction to Hong Kong.
Cheap with a nice view. This is really a very comfortable transportation. When you take it in the night, you can the beautiful HK city buildings with lights.

Amazing ferry ride with views (and very cheap). No visit to Hong Kong is complete without taking a ride at night on the Star Ferry.
Cost was $3.80 HKD each way and the views are amazing. Great photo taking opportunity.
Tourist trip. If in Hong Kong you must have a ride on the Star Ferry. It will give you a fantastic view of the harbor, even better at night with all the tall buildings alight

Brilliant. Really nice way to travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon and at a very reasonable price. Great to travel as local people do. The downside was that the engines were a bit smelly, but overall a great experience.

Watch the beautiful Hongkong. I like the view from outdoor 2nd floor, hk is very beautiful! You will take a better selfie point, take a pic with sea,building, ship..you can feel fresh.. its windyBut..its hot because of direct sunshine. There's a roof but the sunshine will make you feel hot.. sweatyOutdoor is not recommended on rainy day.If you want to be comfy pls choose inside, because there is an ac

Refreshing and quick ride from one side to the other. Use your octopus card to travel the ferry (must have money loaded on it), or buy a token at the entrance. The upper deck is slightly more expensive than the lower deck but it's still silly cheap. The front of the boat is enclosed with aircon
An Icon of Hong Kong!. For 2.5 HKD (25p In English money) an absolute bargain simple to use with out an Octopus card too! great views across the harbour!
Just do it. It is the Star ferry! No more needs to be said!.Great views and remember A/C is at front and back..

Best Night Skyline View. this is a cheap and nice way to see hong kong with the night skyline and lights, after visiting hong kong numerous times this was my first time taking the Star Ferry and I absolutely love it.

You just have to do it. The star ferry is an institution, something that before the 4 tunnels existed was the way people got across the harbour.But now it still does the basic thing well in that it's efficient and cheap way to get across the water. Cost is under $3 if you go on the upper deck and cheaper on the lower deck. Less seats on the lower deck.Nothing unforgettable but enjoyable

Excellent . The cheapest way to get on the harbour, a couple of bucks each way. If you work it right you could spend a couple of hours noodling about on the different routes and not spend a lot of money. The ferries are 50 years old so they definitely have some charm.

Star Ferry is a must. The token to take the Star Ferry is very cheap. Just walk all the way inside and you will see a machine right before the entrance, usually there is someone there to assist if you have any issues with purchasing. My mom and I took the Star Ferry to Hong Kong Island just for a few hours and came back. The Star Ferry is definitely a must!

Star Ferry. Although it was fun riding the Star Ferry; however, it can be crowded especially if you want to see the laser light show at night time. There were just too many people there and I didn't really enjoy the ride. Also, if you sit on the wrong side of the Star Ferry you'll not see much of the laser light show. Be sure to keep the ticket voucher because they'll give you a snack and a drink on the Star Ferry.
Efficiently managed. An easy and attractive way to travel. Travelled from Kowloon to Hong Kong Central return. Easy mode for payment.

Best value for money and must do attraction in HK. This is the best attraction in HK. If you are staying in Kowloon go to TsimShaTsui star ferry pier and take a ferry to central. If you are staying in HongKong, take a ferry from central to Tsim Sha Tsui. Short trips but beautiful. Night trips are amazing.The above costs around 3 HK$ per adult and 2 HK $ per kid/elderly. Best value for money.Star ferry also offers more expensive one hour trips on sea. They are good but on expensive side.
Easy and fun. Kids had a blast, cheap and easy to use. The staff were helpful, it is a great way to get around and see Hong Kong and very frequent. A must for any traveller.
Old school. Great views of the citt. Went to Lantau and it was very scenic on the way there. Used a metro card to pay. The prices are very cheap.

The best way to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Very quick and efficient service for crossing the harbour between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Cheap and great views of the harbour and both sides of the city. Almost worth doing the round trip, just to take pictures!
So cheap and great views. The views of the city are great and it only costs 2.5 yuan. Departs every few mins and really gives a great view of the skyline. Make sure you get a window seat
Quick Scenic. This is a fun little aside and an easy way to see the city from another angle. Buying a pass is very simple. You can also take this to see the light show at 8pm.

Cheap transport with a great view. Star ferry can get you from Hong Kong island to Kowloon and back. Tickets are extremely cheap (no more then 8HKD per person). You will have a great view of both islands and boat ride is fun.
Unbelievably cheap. Fun way to get across to Hong Kong island from Kowloon, it was great to see the city from the harbour.
Iconic. These lovely old boats are part of the DNA of Hong Kong. Much more fun than taking the metro. Just do it!

Enjoy the city view 360. If you want to experience the city view try the ferry. No air condition. We're going from north point to hung hom pier. To get to tsim sha tsui, walk towards whampoa garden bus terminus. Take bus 8a or 8p

A commuter ferry with a view? yes.. Costs under 5 hkd each way, short 5-10 min ride connecting Tsim Sha Shui and Central. Quick good view of the skyline, and you can take it as a form of transportation as well. At some point during your HK trip, if you have a chance to take it do it. Get an Octopus card and load money on it to take the ferry and MTR.
A must do.. Good service throughout, fast & efficient transfers. The harbour cruise is a good way to see all the skyline.

Go at sunset. What a great way to experience Victoria Harbor. Less than $3HK for a token or use your octopus card for convenience. I sat on the upper deck at 6pm and caught an amazing view of the sunset.

A must when visiting HK. A bit of fun and as cheap as chips fare-wise. I used my Octopus card, no problem. Children + adults alike will enjoy the short trip over to Kowloon or vice-versa. I was surprised to see the crew wearing sailor suits, most impressive but I suspect a little hot in the oppressive HK heat. Some of the ferries were painted different colours, like the teams.

Star Ferry is Hong kong. I love the Star Ferry! It's traditional, smells of diesel, is cheaper than chips and gives you the very best views of Hong Kong (and gets you from one side of the harbour to the other!). **DO NOT FORGET CHANGE OR SMALL NOTES TO PURCHASE YOUR CROSSING TOKEN**

Best way to get to the island and back. What can I say about this ferry? - It is cheap (2 HKD for a single trip), nice old style boats and great views.If you are in Kowloon and want to visit the island (or the other way round) consider using this ferry.
Beautiful views. Beautiful views, very inexpensive. Great pictures, sorry 15 minute ride. It cost less than an American dollar.
great little trip. cheap in cheerful trip across. Great views of the other boats and the city......a must do !!! WE even caught site of a beautiful junk in the water.

A Good Way to Orientate Yourself. As a Harbour City, Hong Kong takes a bit of getting use to. For a first day activity, the Star Ferries experience is a cheap way of getting a few peaceful minutes to view the city and work out where a few landmarks are.

Easy access with good views of the Harbour. We took the Star Ferry to cross from Hong Kong island to Kowloon. It was easy to get a token (use machines with a $2 coin). I'm not sure how often the ferries run, but it seems fairly regular and we were. It waiting for long at all. Once on the ferry the journey was quick and we got to enjoy the views it offers. Excellent mode of transport for getting between the two island conveniently.
Very efficient and cheap service. Was pleasantly surprised at how efficient and cheap this ferry is. Just make sure you have small change and small notes to pay with at the machine.
Great way to view the HK skyline. The Star Ferry's are great fun and give you superb views of the Kowloon and HK island skylines. Added bonus is they are cheap as chips!

great way to see Hong Kong by day or night.. A good connection between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.Regular ferries at very little cost.Allows you to do what the locals do and gets you there throughout day or night.
cheap and quick!. Easiest and cheapest way to travel to the other side of the island. Go early in the morning, when they just open to get a good seat. Clean, comfortable and very quick!

Holiday Trip. The ferry terminal at central is near the hong kong station exist and i personally took the ferry to cheng chau island and it cost me about 20hkd to travel there and the duration is about 1hour. the ferry is quite stable.
A must see ride in the evening . A very relaxing and great experience to take a ride on the ferry , evening fantastic light view , morning stunning building view !

Best way to appreciate the harbour. Before the tunnels under the harbour the Star Ferry was the main way to cross the harbour. Now it's a little tired but it's a great way to understand Central Hong Kong and Kowloon foreshores.
Great fun. Such an amazing way to see the light show. East with your Octopus card, One of the must do activties for your time in HK
Cheap, easy, relaxing. It is probably the most relaxing was to get from one side to the other. Its cheap and easy to do and you can get some nice photos.

It's better than the " Ferry across the Mersey". The Star Ferry is the very essence of H.K. A tourist must and the best way to travel between Kowloon and Central. At 2 H.K $ it is a give away. Great variety of people, great skyline, great fun What's not to enjoy.

You're Not In HK If You Haven't Been On The Ferry. A true icon of HK. Hadn't been to HK in years and yet the ferry hadn't changed. Cheap transportation as well as a quick harbour cruise. Easy to buy tickets, every tourist needs to give the ferry a try.
nice transportation. i liked to be in those old slow bout and exchanging a bit of ife with the local people even if only for the little bit who take us from one side to the other of Hong Kong.

one way to cross Victoria Harbour. Can't say it was much different than taking MTR -- which is far more cool/comfortable -- there was no upper level observation deck to help with view/perspective of the two sides. Otherwise the ride was quick and very warm.

Regular Transport Across Victoria Harbour. These gives great views while crossing to Kowloon or other islands... Takes about 10-15 minutes and there is very little waiting time as they are extremely regular
Good but not perfect. I used a ferry from Macau to Hong Kong. The problem is that ferry was late on my way back. There were lot of people and and not too many officials to help you....Must be better.

Cheapest Harbour cruise around. I always love jumping on the Star Ferry. It would not be a trip to HK without using this service. Cheap and efficient way to travel with wonderful views of both the harbour, Kowloon and Hong Kong Island cityscapes. Use it!!!

Must do. One of the musts when visiting HK!
The lower deck gives a much more immersive experience though less comfy that upper deck.
Try it especially at night when the harbour view is breathtaking and cooler.

An iconic way to travel. Cheap and frequent service across harbour between Kowloon side and Hong Kong side. Takes about 5min. There is a lower deck and an upper deck. Upper deck is less crowded and jostling but costs only about 50HKcents more.

Evening cruise. Go to the lights spectacular. It's great and worth the money ($100 HK per person). The free drink and snack is a nice added touch but the lights speak for themselves. It is also a great way to view a large amount of the city at once. Would recommend for anybody going to Hong Kong especially as a first trip.

Nice to experience. Nice type of transport to experience in HK. However it required long walk. The walking takes more time than the sea crossing. We asked several students about the public toilet and they advised us to have in the mall instead. "The toilet here is not clean," said the student.

Excellent boat ride & great view of Hong Kong Island!. Our favourite tourist attraction was taking a ride on the Peak tram (landmark of Hong Kong) and taking a ferry boat across Victoria Harbour which was so beautiful and gives a great view of Hong Kong Island We took a trip across Victoria Harbour on one of the white-and-green ferries of the Star Ferry Company which carries passengers back and forth between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon ever since 1898 These boats have come to symbolize Hong Kong itself and are almost always featured in travel articles on Hong Kong Island. The Star Ferry is very fun, easy and smooth ride.
A must do. A must do Hong Kong experience. Regular ferry service to and from Kowloon giving excellent harbour and skyline views. Very inexpensive

Star Ferry is a treat and a bargain. Whenever I have visitors in HK, and sometimes on my own, I enjoy taking the Star Ferry between Central and Tim Sha Tsui. The ticket price is so low that it might as well be free (about 32 cents US on weekdays) and you experience a little of old Hong Kong by stepping aboard. On hot days it is a refreshing way to travel and enjoy a breeze, and the trip is quick. It really is the "can't miss" Hong Kong experience.

Best way to get to Kowloon!. Unbelievably cheap - about 25 pence - and not long to wait. Quaint uniforms and a quick and scenic ride from the top deck. The MTR is quicker but the ferry is something you have to experience!

The way to see Victoria Harbour. This was included in my hop on hop off bus & really enjoyed the views whilst listening to the commentary, etc. The views of the skyline are equally impressive whether it is day or night. The only thing I missed is the opportunity to spend more time in Hong Kong to travel on the sampan ride
Cool, cheap way to go across the bay. Great experience, only 5 minutes ride, very cheap., good views.Take in the views or if you want take pictures
Nice and easy. Not overly crowded, not expensive and a great view as you cross make this a really good choice to get across the water when needed.

Authentic Hong Kong. The wonderful Star Ferry is perhaps one of the few authentic parts of burgeoning Hong Kong that remains THE SAME! I say this happily since it is still the way I remember it from my two prior trips, one in the '80's and the other in 1994. So much else has changed but not the Star Ferry, which is easy to use and has the romantic appeal of the harbor view and wind in your hair!! Use it as often as you can while in Hong Kong!
Perfect day trip. We used the ferry to travel over to know loon we had a great time and the ferrys were every 15 mins everyone had a seat and the crew pleasant.. a must when visiting Hong Kong
A Must!. Take a least one ride back and forth from TST to HK island. You have to experience the Star Ferry when visiting.
Still a "must do" for anyone visiting HK - awesome, stunning views. Where else in the world can you travel across a beautiful bust harbour all day for less than 50c US ?

Easy to use and nice change from subway . We used the Star Ferry multiple times over 4 days. It was easy to access from either Kowloon or Hong Kong island. Directions are in English, as well, so you should have no problem. We only wished that the ride was longer! One thing to be careful of is getting on and off the boat, as the plank is bobbing up and down with the waves, and if you aren't careful, or if you have any physical challenges, this could be a dangerous moment. Make sure you either go upstairs to ride on the upper deck or just go straight ahead as you enter the pier, if you want to be on the lower deck, as you cannot change decks once on board, or at least we didn't see a way. There is no difference between upper and lower decks. There are no bathrooms on hoard, but there are ones in the terminals.
Quick trip across the harbour. Great way to cross the harbour & stupidly cheap (about HKD $2.90). Go for the open lower deck if you can..
Must do. You have to ride the star ferry your first time in HK, after that just take the MTR. You get a nice view for a cheap price.

Smooth Subway Alternative. We love taking the star ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong, esp because the HK side has a great fish and chips restaurant with great brews located right in the star ferry entrance. It's a fun alternative to the subway and nice to be on the water. We use our octopus card and it's really simple. The trip is not too long either, about 15 min altogether.

Bargain tourist attraction . One of the must do activities for just over $2hkd or 40cents aud. Great quick trip between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Views of the city worthy of some snaps for your holiday album.

Great way to travel. Take the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong return. It's fast and cheap as well as giving you a feeling of belonging to the hustle and bustle that comes with living in these cities, not just a tourist. The views across the water is magic. Watching the other boats and ferries going about their daily routine. A must do.
Great Views of Hong Kong. The best way to see Hong Kong day and night. Price is cheap, views priceless, clean and regular transport.

Try to combine with the lights. Try to grab the 7:55 ferry from North of the harbour to south to catch the lights show. Not amazing show but worth combining for the best experience. Don't go for the tour otherwise and just take a ferry like the locals do. Ridiculously cheap if you do this vs. Relatively expensive if you do the one hour round trip.
A time to remember. This quaint reminder of bygone days with the odd notice reminding you that spitting is an offence on the ferry harks back to good old colonial ways.
Can't complain. E and my husband just took the ferry across the bay for our first trip. Quick, clean and efficient and we'll how can you complain when it's about 25 pence!
A simple must do. Don't miss this as an easy and fun way to get out on the harbour. We did it a few times and it was always good
Atmospheric way to travel . Caught the ferry from central district over to Kowloon. Doesn't cost much at all and is so much nicer than using the MTR.

Fast connection to Hong Kong. Star Ferry is a quick way to get between Hong Kong island and Kowloon. You dont have to wait too long between ferries. Trip gives a nice view of the harbour, try a trip at night to get the city lights.
A tourist attraction in its own right. Even if you don't need to cross the habour do it anyway its quick and the view to both sides of the harbour are just breathtaking

CHEAPEST & FASTEST way from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui. Cheapest mode of transportation from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui (Victoria Harbour) at only 2hkd. Fastest way to get there if you want to skip traffic & mtr.

Great Way to see the beauty of Hong Kong. I like the Star Ferry for going between Hong Kong and Kowloon. But I like the view even more. This is a great way to enjoy a wonderful view of Victoria Harbor.

an essential in any tourist itinerary. THE BEST way to see the Hong Kong skyline. Do not waste money on the harbour tour, use the regular star ferry from tsim tsa tsui to wan chai or central pier. super cheap, fast and reliable.
Awesome, and dirt cheap. One of the best views around, and it costs next to nothing. I love riding it just after dusk, and watching all the lights come on.

Fantastic views for a fantastic price. This has to be the best bargain around. The Ferry runs frequently so there is never a long wait, tickets are very cheap and you get to see amazing skylines. Just has to be done

A piece of old Hong Kong still making its rounds. Is it transportation, an attraction, a tourist experience? All of the above, and my only regret is only using the Star Ferry once in my three day visit. It reminds me of the Washington State Ferries, on a much smaller scale and equally amazing experience. Have an Octopus card? You have everything you need to enjoy the Star Ferry.Unfortunately the upper deck was closed off during my transit from Kowloon to Central, but the views were just as amazing. On a Monday afternoon, there was maybe 1/3 occupancy aboard giving visitors ample room to move about and take in the skyline. I would highly recommend, while the MTR is a fast people mover....it's nice to step back in time and soak in Hong Kong from the water.

Another quintessential Hong Kong experience. It's cheap, it's fun, it's convenient and quick, offers the best views of the HK Island and Kowloon skylines from the water, and it's been the traditional way to cross Victoria Harbour for many years. You can also use your Octopus card so that you'll quickly be travelling back and forth across the water like a local.

easy way to get an amazing view of HK. Star Ferry is one of those things that you just need to do when in HK- you can buy tickets before boarding, but put some cash on an Octopus card (available from railway stations) and you don't even need to take the card out of your wallet (just hold your wallet/purse over the octopus sign beside the entry barrier). Saves time and that annoyance when you just missed the ferry because you waited in a queue for the ticket machine! If you miss one don't panic- another will be there in a few mins.

Not to be Missed.. This is an excellent way to take a trip across the bay from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and to get a perspective on the density of population in the two areas. A oneway ticket, from the vending machine, costs HK$25 or about 30 euro cents. A moving pavement on the island takes you undershade into the commercial centre. The crossing time is less than 10 minutes which is also the interval between sailings. This is a must do budget trip for all.
Nice to get on the water. An easy, inexpensive and efficient mode of transportation and the breeze was great! It was a treat to get on the water.
cheap. The cheapest and fastest mode of transport to and from the islands of hongkong. Make sure you have the card to tap.

Great way to visit Hong Kong Island. The ferry was a quick and expensive way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. The views from the ferry are impressive. I would definitely recommend this mode of transportation.

Very nice ride . If you want to have amazing view of Hong Kong skyline this is one of the best ways to do it . It operates frequently and the its not expensive . Usually not to busy . Have fun and try it .
Step back in time.. These ferries are original. Very short ride to cross either way but very convenient. Buy a token first then proceed to dock area to pass thru turnstile with token.

A must if you come to Hong Kong !. Beware of addiction.. lower deck propels you back in 19th (close your eyes).. quite amazing.. it is also a way to feel the city.. a mix of tourists, locals and expat. Soon you will take the ferry every time you come to HK just for the feeling..

Nice ride, the cheapest tourist attraction in HKG. Although the Star Ferry is no Staten Island Ferry, it offers great views of Victoria Harbour all hours of the day and night for just a few HKG bucks. Without a doubt, the cheapest and most value-for-money attraction in HKG, and maybe even the world...
Just got to do it!. The iconic Star Ferry. Don't miss at least one crossing to or from Hong Kong Island. And take a photograph. We forgot!

Back in Time. While we were in Hong Kong we were told by friends that you must go on the Star ferry. It took a bit of finding as there are building works going on along the water front. It is an old ferry and feels like you are traveling back in the 1930s, The view is spectacular watching all the ship movements within the harbour.

Great way to see the city. Always take the star ferry when in HK. A cheap way to see the city from the water. Cost about AUS 1 pp. Buy a token fom the machine just before the gates. Takes less than 10 minutes. Great photo opportunity. Wander to the peninsular for a AUS 20 chocolate luxury milkshake afterwards. Must do experience if you are in HK.

Star Ferry. This is a must do if you travel to Hong Kong. Cheap, and a bit of fun.Travel across to Central where you can them catch one if the old trams along the business district, or up to the Peak.
Easy to use. Great way to get where you need to, easy to use system and easy to understand what to do. Quick trip and no long waiting time. Would use again.
Outstanding views. One of the greatest skylines in the world can be enjoyed on this ferry trip across the bay.Not to be missed on any visit to Hong Kong.

Iconic! . You can't go to Hong Kong and not travel on the iconic green Star ferries. Travel from pier 6 at Central piers beneath IFC building over to Kowloon for 2hk dollars (about 25 pence) great photo opportunities not to be missed

Quick trip. A 5 minute cheap trip across to Kowloon for a different view perspective on Hong Kong City.
Much better at night when all is lit up. Can also be done during sound and light show at about 8pm.
Not much roll on the ferry used as much by locals as by tourists

It's Cheap and it's Quick. There is not a lot that can be said about the Star Ferry other than it is cheap and efficient public transport to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong or vice versa. Make sure you stay on the top deck though.
Easy activity. Used this as part of our Big Red Bus tour & to access shops & attractions on both sides of the river

Not sure why this is a top attraction!!. We were told by trip advisor and friends to make sure to catch the star ferry. I honestly did not see the attraction. It just like telling some one in Syndney yo make sure they get the Manley ferry! Compare to the clean efficient MTR this is some throw back from last century. Take it if you want to grt across . Otherwise dont just take it as an experience in itself.
Perfect !. Nice service, frequent trips, an "old style" (and chilly) way to cross from Kowloon and HK Island. Very cool !

Great View of Island & Kowloon Skylines. Not as fast as the MTR but a must do at least once to experience a piece of history. The ferries to Lantau, Lamma Island and others are a great way to see the sights in a very relaxing manner
New View in the Hong Kong side.. Great Value to view the new landscape while crossing the harbour. New recreation area was developed in the old Timor area with a tall Hong Kong Wheel.

Ferry Tour of Victoria Harbour. We took the Star Ferry for a tour of Victoria Harbour. Lasted an hour for a reasonable price. Very nice way to get tour bearings and enjoy a little respite from the heat. Receive ticket for free beverage and food if you like at the start of the tour which was an added bonus.
Why Wouldn't You?. The ferry is inexpensive, convenient, and provides a great layout of the city. It is a comfortable ride. Make sure to bring your camera.
Awesome!. Great way to cross the river. It's cheap. Provides an amazing view. It's huge so you will always get a place to sit. Make sure to take the ferry at least once.
A must when visiting Hong Kong . The cheapest way to get across the harbour and such fun. The ferries are quaint but travel on the upper deck to take advantage of the views.

How can you not love the Star Ferry?. It's a must-do thing for the visitor, whether the $2 trip from Central to Kowloon (oddly $2.50 to return) or the $71 one-hour harbour trip. Both are good value. Fabulous views of the skylines on both sides open up to the traveller and it's especially good to sit on the right-hand side coming back from Kowloon as the sun is setting. The fourth incarnation of the ferry is running now, dating from the 1960s. A taste of old Hong Kong.
Iconic must do.. Enjoy this brief but famous ferry crossing. It's cheap and crowded but absolutely a must do when in Hong Kong.

Best way to get to the other side and take in the views. A easy & stress free way of crossing to the other side, very simple process especially if you have an Octopus card (recommended), this can be used on all public transport in Hong Kong.The trip takes no longer than 15-20 minutes, it will offer you great views of the towering skyscrapers of Hong Kong and a close up view of all the boats/ships in the channel as well.It is great to see a working vessel on the water, real deckhands going hard at it, you will also get a great view of the wheelhouse. The ferry itself is old but she still goes!I think it is a must do if you're in Hong Kong!Trip Advisor's South Melbourne's #1 Reviewer (Australia)
Must do . Always a bit of fun, cheap as chips and a great way to get across to the peak tram. HK $2.50 per person per voyage.

Star Ferry a must!. Hong Kong transportation is the best in the world. The subway system is fast easy and cheap, but there is nothing like riding the Star Ferry. The ferry takes you from The Island over to Kowloon and to many other points. It's super cheap, fun and gives you some great shots from the water. The cost of the ride is cheap and worth every penny.

Must do . Had to do this trip we did it in the evening just before sunset absolutely awesome the way the sun hit the buildings really wonderful, quicker than I expected but really good nice to see the junk boat going across the harbour in the sunset
Wow. You can't say you have done Hong Kong unless you have experienced this ferry for a cost of next to nothing you can have a nice ride across the harbour 10 out of 10 for this experience.

Iconic and cheap transportation.. Great to travel Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. These ancient British build ferries are great fun and low cost travel. The slight breeze affords some cooling from the heat and humidity of the summer months.
Great City Views. Hong Kong can be hot (36C yesterday) but the Star Ferry between Kowloon and the Island is a great way to cool down cheaply!
Old Hong Kong. Old Hong Vintage... Unlike ferry ride across the Hudson New York you can buy lunch when you arrive opposite side.. An enjoyable journey it is.. 5 Miltary Minutes to the other side...

Iconic. How long has the Star ferry service been established? It is such a part and parcel of the island that every tourist should take a ride just for experience. A no frills service, best visited during the night when the Hong Kong night sky view is an added bonus.

Good way to get Central. You will have some way from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central.
One is a MTR, second is a bus and the last is Star Ferry.
You can take this ferry at the edge of Kowloon and a ferry starts every 12minutes.

Meh. Average. went during daytime. I guess had higher hopes given its #2 ranking on HK Things to Do. It was good for getting across the harbor, quickly, efficiently, and cheap. They run quite frequently so as far as a transportation method they get 5 stars for operation. On the Central side, the pier is well-integrated with HK Island. There is an elevated that will directly connect you to Hong Kong station (for connections to the Airport), which also has underground walking connectors to Central MTR station, for transfer to other MTR lines. Unfortunately, the Kowloon side is not as well-integrated, a bit far from Kowloon station or other stops when its hot out. Also, due to the old nature of the ships, the top deck feels fairly closed-in. I was hoping to get some open photo ops of the skyline and got a few, but would be nice to have a more open deck. This would probably be a better experience at night.
Nice boat ride and a good view of the city. Very inexpensive boat ride to the other side of the harbor. We enjoyed seeing the city views from the waterfront.

Our favourite!. My wife loved this old but simple way of getting across the water. All the boats are from the late 50's or early 60's very cheap and easy to access.We used it many times - a mini trip every time.Tied their harbour cruise as well and it was excellent.If you watch the Suzie Wong film clip it hasn't changed but Hong Kong sure has!
Very efficient . Used the ferry on several occasions. Always prompt and speedy service between Hong Kong and Kowloon. Very reasonably priced.
Amazing. The star ferry is an amazing place to go sight see and have a relaxing time. You can see other boats floating around and you also travel to another part of Hong Kong exploring all the shops.
Classic. Old standard...must do in HK. Worth the time and cheaper than chips. Take port side Kowloon>HKStarboard side HK>KowloonSeat backs are reversible.
Ease of transportation. Best way to get from TST to Wanchai exhibition centre. The ferry comes in 15 minutes interval and has great seatings.

Must Do!. Growing up riding the Star Ferries and made sure at least ride it once whenever we are back in Hong Kong. Brought back a lot of memories crossing this beautiful harbor with families years ago. The skyline has changed, a lot, but the view still amazing!

A much cheaper way to do the harbour. If it's your first trip yes certainly do the night ferry plus drinks however to really see what happens in Victoria Harbour use your Octopus card and get on the Star Ferry harbour tour at Central Pier. Great value and no hassle

Star ferry had been there half a century. This is a nice experience to see the victory harbor on the sea. Jist get back from Cheung Chou and need to back to kowloon side. Hate the traffic jam at cross hatbour tunnel. Its a good chance to walk to pier 10 to take star ferry back to kowloon. Its take $2 for lower deck with opening view. Schedule is fast almost one just left and the other is waiting to park. About 10 minutes you are at Tsim Sha Tsui bus station. You could carry on you trip with any bus or shopping at Carton Road.
Very easy to use and cost $2 HKD. Great and super cheap! Cost is 2 HKD which is £0.20 an icon of Hong Kong! Takes about 10 minutes to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong island!
Ferry ride with a view. It's pretty straight forward. Buy your token. Get on ferry. Enjoy short ferry cruise with an amazing view. And it really is quite the view.
Wonderful view on Victoria Harbour !. Perfect way to go from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon side ! The view is amazing and the ferry is really cheap. Highly recommended to get a view on both skylines :)
Experience the Ferry Star. Most of the water city we should get experience to view the city through the river/sea. Hong Kong has prominent view from this viewpoint, a must try in Hong Kong.

Must do!. This is one of those things you must experience at least once. It captures the spirit of Hong Kong, and allows a moment of peaceful contemplation among the hustle and bustle of this great city. It costs almost nothing and there is so much history here, all the hopes and dreams of so many generations.
Must do. You havent been to Hong Kong of you did not went on a Ferry of Star Ferry, a real must do. Cheap and easy.

Nothing to see, okey to explore. It's an almost free ferry ride. The staffs (old man) who work at the Star Ferry pier gate were very helpful. We ride on the ferry to get to the Hong Kong Island. Just exploring Hong Kong with our kids.
great way to travel. super trip into the past and only 20p each way to hong kong.the boats are unchanged in decades and the staff are great
Very efficient . The Star Ferry is a must to get between Hong Kong island and the mainland. The fare was very cheap and the boats are every few min so no need to wait.
Interesting!. Convenient and regular, even if no plans to visit the island it is an interesting experience. Top deck gets the better views.
still the same. Visiting again after 19 years we still enjoyed the Star Ferry experience, convenient and super cheap.

Great views . Always recommended to take local ferries whenever one is available. It's a local experience, usually cheap and gives you a great view in most cities. Star Ferry is no different, despite a much shorter ride than it used to be, it was still entertaining for the kids to see the city from a different view. Surrounded by lights and buildings on both sides of the shore, it's one of the best places to enjoy Hong Kong (albeit for 10 minutes). The construction going on in Wan Chai may make transport back from the ferry a bit inconvenient. MTR, buses and taxis are still available with a short walk but if that's too much, go towards Central instead.
Quick Ferry - Super Chaep. Quick Ferry ride across the harbor. Buy your tokens, wait for the ferry and take a seat. Not much else to it.
Just takes 10 minutes to cross. Very easy to go by ferry as you find one after the other as don't have to wait for long evan if you happen to miss.
TRIP IN FERRY. Just do not forget to take it in the most early time in the morning, later it may be catastrophic, because so crowded day & night
A must have . The best way to get on Hongkong island coming from the mainland. It is like a little cruise. Better than taking the MRT , and very cheap , buy an octopus card.
Must do - Iconic Star ferry. Definitely must do - crossing Hong Kong harbour on the Star Ferry. 2 HKD lower deck and 2.50 HKD upper deck.

what a pleasant experience not only to commute but to see more of the bay. ferry cruses evening times are a treat say 19.00 onwards...otherwise crisscrossing at all times the bay it is so convenient....

Cheap and good view of the harbour. It's the most easy and cheap way to travel.
We took this in the evening but even a day ride will be quite pleasant. It's nice,breezy,pretty fast and convenient.

An attraction in itself. . Enjoy Hong Kong famed attraction. Famed I tell you because its not generally visited by tourists.
Famed because it takes you back to history. With Hong Kong's rich sea faring culture.
Great ride. Quick ride from downtown side to the harbour in Kowloon and got to see alot of other boats and cruise ships

A must place when you are in Hon Kong. Its not a special place, but have long history and worth to take the ferry between island and main land (much cheaper than taxi). Who's know when they shut down.

Great service @HK from Kowloon to Hong Kong. The Ferry Service is amazing. It takes you from side to side of both islands with great ease. It's very cheap and convenient to cross over. The route is about 15 minutes and they are working almost non stop all day long.
I had a nice experience on Star Ferry.
