Great Experience. If you are a first time visitor to Hong Kong, this is one of may favourite experiences. It is so relaxing especially in the cooler months and my favourite mode of travel from Kowloon to Central. I can ride on it all day. Best time is around dusk from Kowloon to Central
best transport between hong kong and kaolun . very cheap and speedy not more than 10 minutes from victoria harbour to other bank and Peninsular hotel
Well Organised. We took TurboJet from the China Star Ferry to go to Macau for a day trip. The place was well organised just like an airport.
best way to travel to the fair. Really easy and sheap to go between kowloon and wanchai. Monday to Friday only 2,50 one way and there is lot of space to sit down.

unique experience. the kind of experience you dream about when planning a trip to Asia. authentic asian boat to get to the other side of the bay. was probably the best part of the hop on hop off ittinary. a nice trip in the trip!
Cheap and efficient. This is one of thr cheapest and most efficient way of getting across the channel to and fro Kowloon and Hong Kong.

Can't 'DO' Hong Kong . This is an iconic yet cheap fun thing to do- enjoy the Star Ferry!
During the day is the best time to take a ride less people!
Good fun!!

Most valued trip ever! Nice view, good price! . Can't find better valued trip elsewhere! Took just a few bucks and we have enjoyed the fabulous view of Victoria Harbor! The sunset was magnificent and almost surreal! It'sdefinitely not just a transportation from Central to Kowloon but a great must-see spot!

I love the Star Ferry. The Star Ferry is a beautiful way to cross the bay and it is a historical, nostalgic trip in not uncomfortable fashion. As a boat lover and all things classical the Star Ferry is a pleasant and fun experience offering an excellent trip from the Island to Mainland
Want to slow and enjoy the view of Hong Kong. Nice experience to anyone visiting Hong Kong. Inexpensive yet very memorable. You will see and appreciate the beauty of both sides of Hong Kong

Cheap and Efficient. Crossing the narrowing Victoria Harbour is never too difficult with MTR, but it is sometimes more enjoyable taking ferry instead. Similar to the tram, the Star Ferry is nostalgic, cheap, and efficient.
You can choose upper deck - cheap, and lower deck - even cheaper.
Nice view of the skyline. The ferry offers a convenient way to cross from the island to Kowloon and provides you with a good view of the skyline. Recommended to do at least once.

Incredibly cheap, quick and different way to view the skyline. The journey from Tsim Sha Tsui to Wan Chi cost approximately 25HKD which is about 25p with an octopus card and the journey takes around 10 minutes, thus a super easy and cheap way to cross the river!
If you want you can always hop on and off again to simply enjoy the ride!

FerryTrip. I would recommend taking the Star Ferry to Hong Kong. From this vantage point you get an excellent view of Hong Kong, Kowloon and various ships and boats travelling in the harbour. It is an inexpensive means of travelling and you can use an Octopus card to pay for your fare.
Fair. Fun. Easy. . Still a fun and enjoyable ride across the harbor. Nice and cool. The fun part are the reversible seats on the ferry.

Cheap and enjoyable way to travel across the Harbour. Travelling on the Star Ferry between Hong Kong and Kowloon is easy, cheap and a very enjoyable way to move across the Harbour. Tokens for tickets can be bought at the pier and ferries travel very frequently. Recommend this for any visitor to Hong Kong.

Famous ferry where you have to do it!. Been on this many times and for 5 minutes either way from Central to TST it is a great way to visit HK island and Kowloon peninsula.
Great for weekend rides since seats are pretty empty and the fare is cheap!
I suggest taking this at night to get some great photos!

Best inexpensive harbour views. You must do this in HK for the best water views. Relatively inexpensive. Just get on and you don't even have to get off at the other side. I did it morning and night...worth every cent.
The leisurely way to cross the harbour. Efficient. Affordable. Relaxing. Great views. With some history thrown in. What more can you ask for.
Easy. Very easy to reach. Nice walking bridge with great views on both sides on the way. You buy tickets very cheap at coin machine and go
Brilliant way to travel away from the hustle and bustle!. Such an easy way to travel around the islands of Hong Kong and Kowloon. Very cheap travel and reliable.
Must try!. A cheap and fast way to get across the harbour without traffic jam. Thought it is more beautiful to catch the city skyline at night, a must try for all visitors.

Great way to see harbour while transiting the bay.. Very economical and a great activity for kids.
I recommend the upper deck for great photography, lower deck if you want to save a little as well as watch the captains.

Great mode of transport. Best way of getting from Central to Kowloon (TST area) - not the fastest, but the most scenic. Ride costs HK$ 2.50 (for upper deck, 50 cents less for lower) and takes around 10 minutes. Great view of both sides of the harbour on the way.

Fun and very cheap experience. Had some spare time so took a trip on the star ferry.
It's very very cheap and if clear then very nice views during the trip.
Highly recommended just to see all the buildings from a different angle and a pleasant experience compared to the trains in rush hour!

Efficient and cheap . Have to do the star ferry.. Good way to get around and very easy
Good views across the bar ou and watching the boat activity
Quick and efficient between Kowloon and island

Try the wooden traditional boat instead. The scenery is nice but it is much more special with the harbour night tours on the wooden boats.
The ferry is good for transportation not relaxing.
cheap way to go hk island. its cost $hk2.50 to cross to HK island take 15min each side its a safe and quick way to feel the ferry
Not your everyday transport. This mode of transport is certainly not a norm for most of us. Thus, a nice chance to take a ride from HK to Tsim Tsa Sui instead of the MTR rides. Its cheap too!
A unique experience not to be missed?. To travel across Hongkong Harbour is an experience you will never forget. the ferries and sailors are a reminder of history . Day or night do both.
cheap and relax. It is convenience to travel to Tsim Sha Tsui but not easy access to Central. Night visit is better to enjoy the sea breeze.
Good and enjoyable ride!. Really a good bargain and pleasure to use this service, l particularly enjoyed the light sea breeze when you sit close enough to the windows.

Super cheap, easy, convenient and fun. If you need to travel across Hong Kong Harbor, the Star Ferry is the fastest and easiest and cheapest way to go - it only cost 2 HK Dollar (about USD$0.25). Its easy on and easy off. It runs every few minutes all day. The views of the sky line are fantastic. Enjoy!

Practical, cheap and quick authentic way of getting to Kowloon.... Does what it says on the tin, cheap, effective, quick, authentic way of getting to and from Kowloon. Good skyline views especially from upper deck. Well worth a return trip.
Great way to move across the island. Cheap efficient way to travel. Sit on the upper deck for a great view of the skyline. Runs daily until 11. Buy your tokens on the pier from automated machines.

Best 20p I have ever spent. If you have a spare hour, hop over to Kowloon on the beautiful star ferry. At 20p one way you cannot fail to: firstly impressed by the loveliness of this ferry and secondly taken in my the Hong Kong skyline that drifts by as you cross over.In an expensive city, full of Gucci and Chanel shops, the Star Ferry is a wonderful reminder of an age gone by.

Hong Kong Icon. The Star Ferry is a Hong Kong icon and when visiting Hong Kong you really have to take a cross harbour trip on it! The easily identified green and white ferry has been carrying passengers from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon and back since 1888. It is a wonderful, and cheap way, to get out on the harbour, albeit briefly.

Great transport . Not a lot to say really other than this is a really easy and cheap way of getting across between kowloon and Hong Kong. Can get mega busy but really quick. Pretty helpful service. We were luck to travel day and night without the smog that often covers the amazing views so we hit a good day.

An iconic Hong Kong symbol. Riding on board the Star Ferry would be the number one thing to do if you only have a short time - say, a layover - in Hong Kong. From the ferry you will get the best 360-degree panorama of the city.Hop on the upper deck to get beautiful view of the peninsula or stay at lower level to witness the sailors' work and peek inside the engine room door. It is a noisy, old, and diesel scented trip across the harbour. But is cheap, and it is legendary.
History. Fantastic way to travel and relive the past with stunning views of Kowloon and the island at the same time.both terminals very handy for shopping nearby

Fast, reasonably priced and clean.. Pay the small amount extra and go first class. bigger seats, no one standing and at no cost they provide snack box and something to drink + you get to board first and exit befor the throngs.

Star ferry harbour cruise. Great bargain!. This takes one hour and trundles round the bay giving u ample time for photos of all the best sights in the harbour. We rode the first of the day at 11.55 am which had only around 20 people on it. Compared to some of the tour prices we were quoted for trips around Hong Kong this is an absolute steal at $71 hk and a great way to see the city from the water.
easy to use. We traveled on this ferry servile times going island to island plenty of seats,only takes approx 1/2 hour to get across other side

Nostalgic ferry ride. It was a short ferry ride-- the distance between the two coasts has become drastically closer with the past half decade due to land reclamation in development. It is beautiful in the sunset and the well-lit lights of the high-rise, some topped by neon signs. The breeze was welcoming after a hot day.We took many photos of the skyline and the harbour during the ride---a nostalgic capture of the "Beautiful Pearl of the Orient" ( a name well-known globally as we grew up in this place). $2+ for the ride--- surely worth the money and the time spent. Just watch your steps while you disembark.

Best way to cross the harbour. If you finished shopping at Ocean Terminal/TST, hop on the star ferry to go across the water n enjoy an afternoon tea/drink in Central (mandarin oriental or IFC)..the ferry is cheap and relaxing...is my favourite thing to do in HK. Just make sure is not during rush hour or a very windy/rainy day. And if u see the ferry is leaving...no need to run for it..relax as the next one comes within 5 min...just enjoy the view

Greeeat view!. This is a very cheap way to have a boat ride to the Hong Kong island. Try to arrive at least 15 minutes before the boat to chose a nice seat on the left side if you are on your way to the Hong Kong island so you have a nice view of the buildings!
Awesome! Be a tourist ride the ferry. It was awesome and very inexpensive. My kids loved going across the river. Go at night the Hong Kong skyline views are amazing!

Good Old Star Ferry. Enjoy a ferry ride for only HKD 2.00 and do some island hopping. We took the ferry from Kowloon Island to Hong Kong Island and back. It's one of the cheapest ways do go around Hong Kong on a budget. The ferries were clean, well maintained and not foul smelling. We also adored the sailors authentic looking uniforms.

What a refreshing way to spend 10 minutes crossing the Victoria Harbour. It's difficult to find tranquility in the midst of the hustling and bustling. One day I decided to start my day earlier and crossed the harbor on ferry instead of the usual MTR. There I was gazing at the Victoria harbor feeling the breeze brushing my face with a touch of salty smell. My mind and soul were pampered. What a way to start the day.

A summary of CBD in Hong Kong. Don't tell others you've been to Hong Kong if you haven't take the Star Ferry. It's an iconic transportation which is always taken as the sign when introducing the city by various international media.
Nice views and reliable. Taking the ferry from the star pier is a good option if you're going to Kowloon or back to hk island.The views are stunning. You can't miss it.
Good way of transportation. . Star ferry is really good. It's nice for transportation and really very cheap..Used for going to the convention centre. Must enjoy the ride.

Every HK tourist must see!!. The Star Ferry has been moving people across Victoria Harbour for over a century. It's a great way to see the HK skyline, and a fun way to get from HK island over to Kowloon and back. Use your Octopus card.
Star Ferry. Very fun way to get across to Hong Kong Island. The water was smooth and the ride was nice and relaxing.
An institution. Perhaps quaint compared to the MTR and the Airport Express but amazingly cheap, charming and efficient.

Quick, easy and scenic. Very easy to use. Very cheap. Frequent service (10 mins).
Great views. A touch of history. Not espicially comfortable but only takes 10 mins

Easy & Breezy, with great views. Sit on the right hand side of the Ferry when boarding from Hong Kong Island, Dock 7. From this side you get the perfect views of the Hong Kong Skyline, day or night. It's easy to get to, and cheap and easy to buy tokens. Once you get off the ferry you can walk over to the harbor (to you right), and there is an elevated platform, from here you can get great photos of the HK skyline.
Great View, Short Wait, Cheap. Highly recommend you take the ferry (at least once) from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. View is great.

A must in Kowloon. No matter you need to visit Hong Kong just the pleasure of watch the ski line of the bay will worth the few money it cost.Day or night, a prefect place to take few pic.The ride is about 5-10 min for just 3 hkd,

Great view! . I visited this place alone. Actually i went to tai cheong bakery near star ferry, but i stopped when i saw the views of city in the night. It was so beautiful, everything was perfect. But i smelled something bad when i walked around here. Overall, you must visit this place if you go to hongkong.
new experience but nothing much. its about 10-15 minutes sail, very good view of the buildings, good to travel in the night, all the high rise buildings have colourfull lights

Quick and easy. We were going to do the round the harbour tour but had just missed one as they are every hour, we then picked up a leaflet from a lady outside from the intercontinental for a free crossing on the star ferry, in the face of a freebie we went for it. Had some great photos from the ferry and then as you come off the ferry head left to see a great Italian restaurant that does a good buffet, there is also the harbour city mall and then Stanley street shopping nearby.
Star Ferry is a must!. Loved the experience at sunset, you can see the most beautiful lights of the city while being carried away by the peaceful waves.Would most definitely recommend it!

A great way to see the harbour and get from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. A cheap way to cross from one island to another. Persons over 65 get half price travel. Sometimes you are asked for ID so photocopy your passport details before you leave home so that you don't have to take your passport with you every time you leave the hotel. Ask for a senior ticket. if it's an automatic booth just hit the concessions button
Awesome views of harbour! . My family and I went on the one hour tour around the bay. The views of the harbour were amazing. I would recommend the trip.

Harbour tour. We did the harbour tour on the upper deck which is much quieter and comfier than the standard lower deck. Great views and you also get a drink and cookies included for about £8 each. It was a nice trip for and hour.

Cheap way to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. I can recommend the Star Ferry to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. They run every few minutes and you need to get a token from the machine at the station then insert it into the barrier gate. The service is very efficient, quick to get on and off. The scenery across the harbour spectacular.
Lovely and quaint , must do. Just a lovely thing to do and way better than using the tunnel, we used it several times and it costs pennies.
Went to Discovery Bay. Nice trip, went to a monthly market at Discovery Bay. High end and really nice stalls. Very hot though
A MUST when in Hong Kong. Very cheap and easy to get too. Only downside is its a relatively short ride and the terminal is a little dated.

A super cheep way to get across the bay. We decided that since we were in Hong Kong we had to take the iconic Star Ferry across the bay. We did it in the evening time and to see the skyline from the water was so beautiful. When you board it is like a heard of cattle however once we got on board there were plenty of seats. It was a very quick sail across and then we debarked and they reloaded the ferry and went back across the bay.

Fastest way from Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui. The best way without walking so far from Hong Kong convention center to Tsim Sha Tsui area is by star ferry. Jetty is located right next to convention center, and cost few dollar for you to travel from wan chai to Tsim Sha Tsui by star ferry. Alert: you may have seasick when come to raining reason

Cheap ticket enjoy nice sea view for 10 mins(From Central to TST). Recommend to tourist by ferry from Central to TST enjoy nice sea view for 10 mins. just HK$2.5-3.4(upper desk) only. You can take some nice photos is also. Not expensive but recommend to all when come to HK.

Value for money to get to Hong Kong islan. Cheap and reliant service to hong kong Island. The ferry runs very frequently, staff speak English from my experience. The boats are not luxury but do its job.
good ride. cheap and iconic transport for HK with good view while onboard. the crew is friendly. more or less easy access with a stroller.

Iconic. A trip from Kowloon across to the island by the Star Ferry must surely form part of any trip to Hong Kong. Basic but fun to use. Great views on the way across and you really feel like you are experiencing a little bit of history.

BSET HARBOUR VIEW HK - KOWLOON.. Fast and regular service with excellent view of the high rises.
Traverses to Wan Chai/Kowloon and vice versa. Romantic evening attraction! Drops you off a short distance from Nathan Road and Peninsula hotel

History on the water and on the cheap.. There's no better way to get a sense "Honkers" than this short ferry trip across Victoria Harbour between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Cheap as chips tokens from vending machines are all you need for this historic ride. Kids love it.
Vintage Hong Kong experience. Taking a ride on this ferry is a must in HK. Amazing views of the skyline and u reach your destination for almost nothing to pay. Octopus cards can be used..
star ferry. best free cruise.! Fantastic view of both sides of harbour. neatly free! try to sit upper deck. not to miss sunset nd night view. follow up with star avenue and convention center

Must experience and try when you are in Hong Kong. This is part of life in Hong Kong. It goes ways back for 50 years or more. Remember the world of Suzy Wong ! A must try experience and see while in Hong Kong beside the Peak, Stanley Market, Tram Ride, Women Street Market, Shopping Malls, Subway Ride etc...Hop on and off and enjoyed the breath taking view of the beautiful view of the Hong Kong Harbour. Also try to Harbour cruise ! You will never feel bore. It energies you to see the vibrant progress efficiency development high rise feels of a dynamic city. So much to do here.

Worth an experience . Took the night ferry from central to tsim tsa tsui. HK dollar 2.80. Love the experience because of scenic view of HK night view. Ride is less than 20 min. Definitely worth an experience.

Easy, cheap, fast!. I was getting lost in Hong Kong traffic- then decided to follow my Google maps to get from Hong Kong island to Kowloon. Then I realized my navigation was taking me thru the Star ferry route- and how awesome it was, to cut thru traffic, cross the bay for cheap and so efficiently, and enjoying the awesome views along the way!

Sea Breeze and Views. As you know, taking the Star Ferry is a must-do thing for tourists. As a local guy here, I'm also proud with this transportation which brings people across the harbour in the past, a few decades ago. After entering the pier built in the 1950s, you can see old concrete with scratched paint on it and rusted iron bars, representing the damage through the years.After the ferry started sailing, you can feel breezes of sea wind onto your face, and you can devour in the splendid array of scenery sailing on Hong Kong's harbour, seeing both sides of Kowloon and Hong Kong with huge towers. If you are riding this at summer, an air conditioning cab is available (free entry with ticket and only for some ferries)!You can choose the upper and lower deck of it while the upper deck is more enjoyable with the views and the lower deck for sea winds. The fare is about 3 USD and be sure to take this in the afternoon otherwise you need to be on the boat with large amounts of the crowd.

Convenient transportation mode across the islands. Convenient transportation mode across the islands. Between central and Tsim Sha Tsui. rather than MTR. Especially if you intend to transfer to other ferries to other islands

Not to be missed.... If you are visiting and want to get full-dose of HK flavor, you must travel the Star Ferry. Though the journey isn't long, it gives you the feel of old colonial HK and generally great views from the Harbour. Start in with Wan Chai or Central, and take the ride to Tsim Sha Tsui. It's still an amazing bargain (about 45 cents US) and a relaxing way to travel. Bring your camera but use the strap - or it may end up in the Harbour. On the TST side, venture into Harbour City mall for a wide variety of shopping and restaurants.

Best way to watch the skyline of Victoria Harbour . Star ferry is part of the pubic transportation network in Hong Kong, therefore, I often take the ferry. However, I am sure that it would be a very romantic and relax experience for visitors to Hong Kong because you can enjoy the stunning skylines of both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon peninsula at one time with the Peak and the Lion Rock as their backdrops respectively. Though the ferry fare is cheap (about US$0.2 to US$0.3 for a single trip), visitors may be surprised by the efficient and effective service offered by the ferry company. It is what we call "the Lion Rock spirit"!
Scenery of Hongkong. I love taking the ferry from Kowloon to Hongkong Island. Less than 10 mins ride and you need not have to rush with the crowds at MTR during peak hours.

Convenient and historic. Used the star ferry multiple times while on holiday in Hong Kong. A most convenient and fast way to get from Hong Kong island to Kowloon and reverse. Lovely harbour views. Only takes 5 minutes to cross.
Star Ferry . A cruise on the ferry is a relaxing and inexpensive way to see Honk Kong harbour area it takes about an hour for the round trip I enjoyed it and would do it again.
The one and only star ferry . So glad that this piece of history still remains. It's not only a convenient way to cross but also an ex excellent way to enjoy the skyline.

A fun way to get from Hong Kong island to Kowloon. First of all, The Star Ferry (named, I guess, after its stop in Kowloon, which is right next to the Avenue of Stars (Hong Kong's version of Hollywood's Walk of Fame), is a part of the integrated transport system, connecting Hong Kong island with Kowloon (Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui) and you can use your Octopus card to board the ferry, just as you would board the MTR or a bus, and the charge for this is was really affordable - HK$2.50 in working days and $3.40 in the weekend or on public holidays.
Best way to get across. Best way and the fastest way to get across. We brought a Big Bus package that included going and coming back, which was a great idea to do. We got to Kowloon in a great time.
Ferry))). What can you say about a ferry, works great gets you to the other side... Seriously no problems great way to get across to the city shopping and restaurants.

Good n cheap across the Harbour. A ride on the Star Ferry is a must do during a trip to the skyscraper city of Hong Kong. As cheap as HKD2.50 per trip between Kowloon side and Hong Kong Island side gives you the best view of the harbour city in this 10 minutes ride. With a frequency every 15 minutes throughout the day, Star Ferry ride is popular with tourists as much with locals who use it as a daily mode of transport. I captured the best view of the city during my ride on a Star Ferry.

HongKong Star Ferry. We love Star Ferry as a transportation going to kowloon.. lovely view and I'd guess very cheap fare..I suggest to get you octopus card its easy access to any transport here in hongkong, you dont have to worry if you run out coins..And highly recommend star ferry as a transpo way to kowloon, you can see the beautiful hongkong view.

Good fun!. It's a great experience to ride the Star Ferry across from Central to TST. At TST, have a stroll around the harbour front and take some photographs. The ferry runs efficiently and it is very cheap. Great fun and a nice alternative view of the great city of Hong Kong

Cheap and nice harbour view . There is two destinations, one is to central and one is to wanchai. I usually take the wanchai one. It's only HKD $2.8 , and during the 15 mins trip , you can see the harbour view of Hong Kong. I highly recommend you to take it during night time as the night view of HongKong is excellent. And the best thing is.... It is really cheap.
Day trip. Glad I experienced this ferry trip, it was definitely worth doing and the staff are dressed in traditional sailor outfits!

Experience some history instead of taking an MTR. Apparently this ferry has been in service for over 100 years, so it is a piece of Hong Kong history that you are experiencing when getting on board. The ferry had the classic design with engines at both end, so it doesn't turn. It just goes in one direction with one engine, and goes back with the other. The seats are also designed to be able to face both directions by simply moving the back to the other side. If you travel at night, you can enjoy the night view which includes HK big wheel - something the underground MTR won't have.
Cheap and cheerful. Easy transit to mainland. No frills. But the views of the Bay are excellent assuming the weather is clear.
Great way to move around. It a very well planned ferry station that connects you to cities and countries. Good option to move around
Fun to do and very cheap. Star ferry is a new way to see the skyline of Hong Kong. It's so cheap! around 3 HKD or so I guess. Just take the ferry and enjoy the view

View the Harbour on the harbour. The Star Ferry is cheap and a great way to see the harbour and the buildings on both sides as you cross from TST to the Hong Kong side just relax and take photos, it is easy to catch the ferry and they leave very all the time, so there is very little wait, they run every day weather permitting.

Quick way to/from HK island to Kowloon. Great way to get back and forth from The Island to Kowloon. Open sided boat is great as well as fun. Takes about 5-10 minutes by the time it docks and lowers the ramp. Can bring beverages if you want. Can be a little hot in the summer as well as cold in the winter!!

yup, i didnt sink, thumbs up. Its almost like a slow moving thrill ride.
although its a water taxi to take you across the bay, it still puts a smile on my face every time

A little soul left in HK. The family & I love the Star Ferry - it truly reflects HK in its essence. The new-old feel of crossing the Victoria Harbour are a nice break from super modern HK. The sights are amazing. The ferries are regular and reliable - they've kept an amazing safety record in decades. The terminal at TST could do with an upgrade but generally it's still charming to be able to ride on the waters on a bright sunny day.
5 stars experience but only HK$2. We could cross the Victoria Harbour by Star Ferry only ten minutes . Have best experience with the harbour view between Kowloon and Hong Kong İsland.

So lovely ~ best views for only HK$3 . This the best thing you do in HK ~ views from the water are spectacular. A must do when you are in HK. Close to both sides is lots of food in the shopping malls there.
Nice. Good views, relatively quick, cheap and efficient way to travel across the pier, not much else to say
Great Service. Very efficient and easy to use. I can't remember how often they run but we did not have to wait long in either direction - pay using an Octopus card - see my MTR review for details
Cheap and characteristics. If you are in Tsim Sha Tsui and want to reach Honk Kong Island there is an alternative way to MTR. That Ferry is nice and maybe romantic. Recommended at least once

This ferry is a star on its own. Nothing fancy but it is very affordable, and gets you faster from one side to another (HongKong to Kowloon and vice versa) with a priceless view! Truly Hongkong visit won'tbe complete without a Star Ferry ride!
boat ride. the star ferry is a must you catch the ferry at tsim sha tsui and it takes you across the harbour to central where you can see the skyline which is good in the day or night all lit up.

Pleasent Ferry . The Ferry service will make you enjoy stunning views of the city. It is something that you need to do once in Hong-Kong. Once you get to Tsim Tsa Tsui, you will find good restaurants, cafés, malls and street markets on lady's street.

Best Value. You have to, and it only costs 2.5HKD
There is a separate boarding gate depending if you want to travel on the upper deck or the lower deck. Do not get confused with the Star Ferry tour boats.

Great service!. A really cheap and easy way to move around Hong Kong.
Easy to use and fast. Ferries operate all day long and make a stay in Hong Kong even more memorable!

Nice and easy way across the water!. We used this to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. it is quick and easy. You buy your tickets (3 HKD one way I think??) at a machine if you don't have an octopus card. The boats go quite regularly so you don't have to worry about timing it to a tee!

Try it Atleast once. When in HK dont miss the Star Ferry, Easy to access, Cheap tickets, Octopus card work here.. this is a relaxing way to get across the harbour. it can tend to get a little crowded during peak hours but definetly worth the trip.. kowloon side u reach the esplande whic is the ideal place to see the HK skyline from in the evening.. Take ur camera along to click various shots of the vast skyline hk offers

Highly Recommended!. Cheapest fare to get across the Victoria Harbour and see the great view of Hong Kong's harbour front. The ferry itself is already a piece of Hong Kong's history. Too bad they couldn't keep the old Star Ferry Pier on the Hong Kong side, but the new one is still amazing offering great views of the Harbour. I would recommend taking the lower deck - the fare is cheaper and you can take great pictures of the Harbour. Take the ferry during daytime and also during the evening at 8pm (travel from Tsimshatsui to HK Island). I guess the laser show is on during that period.

Best way to cross the harbour!. The ferry is a almost a hiertage and an identity of HK. It was been running for decades, and still run smoothly so. It has services from Central <-> Tsim Sha Tsui (TST) and Wan Chai <-> TST, ferry time is around 5-8 minutes depending on the route you take. The view of Victoria Harbour seen from the ferry is magical. The services are reasonably frequent, the ride is always smooth as there won't be traffic jams, and the fare is more than reasonable (tips: passengers of 65+ yo gets to ride for free!)It is absolutely my favourite way to cross the harbour and a must do in HK!

Nice ferry ride across the harbour.. Taking the Star Ferry across the harbour is always the best option where you can avoid any traffic jam via the tunnels. You can also enjoy the breeze from Victoria Harbour.

Felt over hyped. We took the star ferry Harbour cruise which costs about 150 hkd for 1 Hr ride . Supposed to cover the symphony of lights show . The ride gives a view of the skyline but the show itself was so so. I would rather suggest to take 10 min ferry ride to Kowloon which costs less

Most cost effective way to go between HK and Kowloon!. Most cost effective way to go between HK and Kowloon. Also allows you to dive deep into the history and culture of HK and enjoy the views of the harbour. Highly recommended!

Crossing the Fragrat Habor on a Legendary Ferry. The Star Ferry is one of Hong Kong's most famous historical landmarks. This is a must-try, a must-ride and a must-see! It costs less than 1 USD to sail across the Harbor, which many years ago used to be wider than it is today. Apart from the historical aspect, the Star Ferry will also give you a prime vantage point for snapping amazing pictures. It can become a bit funny when the maritime traffic gets busy. Between barges, ferries, dinghies and other tugboats, there is a lot of floating devices in there.Last, the Star Ferry remains a cheap and efficient mode of transport to go back and forth between Tsim Sha Tsui and Central. This is why thousands of local commuters are onboard every day of the week.

Great way to see the views.. At just Two dollars each way to Kowloon there is no better way to see the sights and skyline of Hong Kong, go at night to watch the buildings come alight from on the water. They run every 15 minutes so you never have to wait long, a must do if visiting HK.
Quick and easy to switch sides. Also can use your MTR card here and its really reasonable and quick. You can also enjoy views of both sides as you cruise over

Relaxing crossing. This was such an enjoyable way to travel across Victoria Harbour. A true piece of history. Lovely old boat. So inexpensive. Could easily have spent the afternoon going back and forth
Trip across the harbour. Quick trip from Hong Kong Island across the water on Star Ferry. Very cheap and quick. 10 minute walk from central station thru IFC exit A
Star Ferry. A great way to get across the bay from Hong Kong to Kowloon.Very Cost effective and fun. A great way to see Hong Kong Harbour.

What's not to like for a 25 pence ride one way. Where else can you get the best tourist views in Hong Kong, from the island to Kowloon, return for just HK$2.5 each way?Up stairs is first class and downstairs second, they are as good as each other and great fun. You never wait more than a few minutes and then down the ramp on on, if the bench faces the wrong way, just flip the back and turn it round, to face the right way.Make sure you get the ferry at different times of the day, to get the iconic skyline shots of the city.One of the best tourist attractions in the world.

Star Ferry! The scenic route to cross Hong Kong/Tsim Sha Tsui!. The Star Ferry is the most scenic way to either go to/or come from Tsim Sha Tsui/Hong Kong. It is also very affordable. If you have enough time, then I suggest you to take this, as this will also give you photo opportunity to capture The Clock Tower in Tsim Sha Tsui, The ICC, and the IFC Tower in Central. Don't take this if you easily get sea sick.

Old but a must. I always use the star ferry to cross the harbour. It's like holiday and a fresh brise and a great view is granted. And it's cheap, even they increased ticket-prices almost year by year. But is really an attraction.
If your there it has to be done !. cheap way to cross the harbour, if nice weather good pictures to be had, can get very busy though at peak times

Always a pleasure.. With over thirty years travelling through Hong Kong and cruise on the Star Ferry is always a welcomed distraction and a reminder of a more simple and affordable diversion from the business of Kowloon and Hong Kong
nice to try. 5 min ride cheapest ferry ride in the world i guess? i took the ferry at night just to enjoy the city view
Must try in HK. Super cheap mode of transport unique to HK. I would definitely recommend to try to this at least once during your stay.

A good experience. A very good experience to take the ferry from Kwoloon to Hong Kong Island.
Very convenient, and the labeling of directions is clear.
Enjoy the ride to see the surrounding from another angle

Convenient, cheap, and a slice of HK culture. You can take the Star Ferry at Tsim Sha Tsui going to Hong Kong Island (Central Pier) and vice versa for 2.50 HKD. It’s surprisingly relaxing and a good way to spend around 15 minutes of your time. Great way to immerse with the locals. Plus, the view at night is also amazing.

Cheapest crossing and best view of Victoria Harbour. All that for 30 US cents, and a ferry leaves just about every 10 minutes or less from various points on either side of Hong Kong island or Kowloon.
Great way to travel across Victoria Harbour. Not only does the Star Ferry feel like a piece of history but it is so inexpensive!!!! Great way to travel.

nice view. The ferry it a bit old, they should upgrade it. The view is amazing, it{s a must to do!
it´s not expensive. I have done it at night.

Not to be missed. I first rode the Star Ferry across HK harbor in 1990. Not much has changed. It is still under a $1 USD to ride I believe. You get from Kowloon to the HK side or vice verse in maybe 15 minutes. The views in the harbor are spectacular. I always have several rides back and forth when I'm in HK. Fun.
Fine. It was fine, but nothing more. Cheap and a nice change for using the subway all the time to get between the island and the main land. Worth the trip.

Super nice ride with scenery at cheap price. One of the cheapest transport in Hong Kong, but with good view on seaside of Tsim Sha Tsui and Wanchai. Highly recommended to all visitors in HK. Even locals like this transport much for the relaxing time travel on sea with nice view, instead of rushing bus and mtr
Fast way to get across the river. Fast and convenient to go across the harbor and cheap. Less crowded then the MTR also, night time is great if it's clear anyway.

We love it. Have gone countless times and still love the short trip across the harbour and back.. Great sense of holiday! The quick trip across is enough to transport you to another era, and take a break from the chaos that is Hong Kong. My kids love it too, the ferry ride across and back is a frequent treat for us. And the price is an added bonus.Lovely views of vic harbour.

Great value and amazing views. The star ferry is a Hong Kong classic. It is extremely cheap (about $0.50 CAD per person) and the views are insanely beautiful, both day and night. Highly recommend for a cheap, beautiful way to get across the harbour.
Must do as a tourist.. It was a very inexpensive way to cross the island. It was a quick ride about 10 minutes or less. Every tourist must try.

Nostagic Trip. Short hop across the Victoria harbour. Short journey but nice. Many people in Hong Kong commuted by this route before the cross harbour tunnel was built. It is cheap and links up two touristy places in Hong Kong.

Star Ferry ride between TST & HK island. This is a must do in HK! It's cheap (a couple of HK dollars) and it's the best place to discover or re-discover the HK harbour. The best time to do so is at sunset or just before.I've lived in HK for 10 years and I still enjoy the ride. This is the first place I take visitors to. You can couple that ride with the 8pm start light show best viewed from TST waterfront promenade.

It's a must do in HK. You can enjoy the nice view of Victoria Harbour while crossing it by the Star Ferry with a very low costs at only HK$2. I as a local like to do it too.Suggest to visit also the Hong Kong Maritime Museum at Pier 8 which is next to the Star Ferry pier at Central.HKMM is a vibrant cultural institution dedicated to preserving, collecting and displaying objects that tell the story of trade and maritime in Hong Kong and the Pearl River Delta.

The most economical way to appreciate the sea view. If you have plenty of time and you want to appreciate a wide view of the sea, try taking the ferry to and from TST and Central/Wanchai. Very economical - only a few dollars! Go in autumn - it's cool and relaxing! It's a great entertainment, both alone and in pairs.

Exciting ride may expected. If you ride the ferry on a nice weather, I'm sure you'll be attracted to the nice scenery, but if it's a rough day, then you may consider to cross the harbor by car or MTR, because after the harbor become narrower, the wave is strong! However, if you do surfing a lot, then do choose to ride on a rough weather, you'll never thought of riding on a big surfboard! Enjoy!

Fun and super cheap activity. The Star Ferry is a super cheap way to experience the Hong Kong harbor. I think the fee was 2.50 Hong Kong dollars, or less than $0.50 US. You buy a token, go through the turnstile, wait in the holding area, when the gate opens and the light goes on, time to go down the ramp and board the boat for the 10 or so minute crossing. Fun to see the harbor from the water. We even bought a token as a souvenir.

Short Trip. Order the noodles if you're so hungry. It's delicious enough and their service is quick. It's pretty much a short trip but you can use it to take a nap, to stock your energy before the big game. Lol.

Great experience!. Brought my teen to meet up friends in Hong Kong few days ago. As this is my teen 1st visit to Hong Kong, we took a MTR to Aberdeen side & took a ferry from there to Kowloon. She enjoy the ferry ride & is a great experience to her.

Great views of the styline at night but very quick. The whole ride must have only taken a couple of minutes but it only cost about $0.25 American for the ride and you can get closeup angle shots of both skylines on either sides of the harbour that can only be viewed from the water. Recommended time to go is around 8pm so you can see the light show as well.

Best value boat ride in HK. You have to do this - and you will do it again unless you get sea sick! HK10 for a trip across one of the best harbors in the world, and great photo opportunity to take pictures of both sides. This is iconic and you can't say you have been to Hong Kong if you haven't done this.
A great experience. Great way to get from one part of Hong Kong to another . Cheap and gives you the opportunity to get away from traffic .
A must-do. No-one should go to Hong Kong without a trip or three on the Star Ferries. They are legendary, and when you get home, people will ask if you went on them! Great fun, and frequent.
Stopover. Used this local ferry for great tour of harbour, very cheap and frequent. Easy to get tickets better than paying for a guided tour
Hong Kong classic. The Star Ferry has been there forever but never gets old. I can't imagine visiting HK without a trip across on the Star Ferry. Just do it.

Classic and fun. Skip the light show. If you take the ferry during the day, it's incredibly cheap and you have stunning views of the city from the water. We got suckered into buying the "symphony of lights" tickets to see the sound and light show that takes place every night at 8pm. The city is really beautiful at night if you're into to the "bright lights, big city" scene, but the light show was pretty lame. And the tickets weren't cheap!! It would be just as nice from the Kowloon side of the city and you'd save yourself $25 per person.
Cheap and effective. Be part of history and get to cross the harbour on these iconic ferries in 15 minutes for a few pence.

Lovely trip. For a quick and cheap journey connecting Hong Kong this is brilliant!! Would definitely suggest going to the station and buy an Octopus card - this can be used on so many other transportation. It's a lovely bit of tradition within the city.
Iconic as a Ferry on the Mersey.... When you travel with your octopus card, travel on the Star Ferry is part of the public transport system, and an alternative way to enjoy Hong Kong.

well preserved steam ferry. Famous for its white and green colour with smoke trailing up out of its chimney. Around 2-3 dollars for each 5-10 mins journey of Victoria Harbour crossing. Connecting both sides of harbour, Central in Hong Kong Island and Tsim Sha Tsui in Kowloon. It is a double decker ferry perfect for enjoying busy harbour crossing
Great value for money . Using the ferry is a very cheap way to enjoy the beautiful views of Hong Kong especially at night .A must do if you visit the city !
HK ferry . The ferry is a great way to get from one side of HK to the other. Buy tickets on the spot. Goes regularly is very cheep and lots of fun too!Has its own easy to use website.

Quick trip across the river. Quick trip across the river to Hong Kong island. Cheap and well run.. it's worth the 15 mins. Not much to do when you get off on the Hong Kong island side, so turned around and went back.. great way to sea the harbor.
Must Try!. For a small amount of money, You get a stunning view of both sides of hongkong. There is no wrong time to ride this ferry. The view gets better in night.
Cheap and quick. Best way to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Very cheap and quick and with great views.after 8 you can cross while enjoying the lights

Must do for first time visitor. It is an inexpensive and good way to take photos of the harbor by taking the ferry. The ferry runs frequently. The cost is HK $ 3.40 per adult one way on weekends. The token for the ride is purchased from the machine. There was no ticket agent on duty on Sunday.
Easy transportation. Very easy way to go from Wan Chai to Kowloon and visceversa .It is very easy to take it , cheap and secure , yo have a nice view of the bay , no rush , people are very nice .

Easy and Cheap. Go over to the train station and buy an Octopus card. It's minimum $150 because of the deposit but you can get the money back if you go back to the counter before you leave HK. Great swipe system and the ferry is only $3!
See the harbour at a miniscule cost . Super transport efficient and quirky many various trops which if you have invested in an Octopus card is cheap and fun

Iconic and a must do in HK. I use the ferry every time I visit HK and usually at night to take in the stunning view. You can use your Octopus card so its really easy and super cheap. The ferries are like museum pieces which really adds to the charm. Theres one every 10 or so minutes and the ferry terminals are well located to take advantage of this brilliant city.
A Must!. Used the famous star ferry in1982, hasn't changed at all. Everybody who visits HK must go no this. Kowloon to HK island return.

For a glimpse of our past. I remember the days when we were students and was so envious of the people that could effort taking the upper level. Star Ferry was the only means of transportation for millions between Hong Kong and Kowloon but lost its glitter and glory since the inception of MTR. Hong Kong, like many major met has developed into a world giant financial hub since the 1970s. The advancement evolution has decoded our old favorites into tourist attraction, Wikipedia describes “The Star Ferry Company is a passenger ferry service operator and tourist attraction in Hong Kong”. I hope The Star Ferry Company will keep the operation moving forward, not for the sake of its past historic glorious scenes appearances in The World of Suzie Wong and Noble House, but for those who grew up with, returning to Hong Kong as a visitor and now can afford the upper level.
Use it . Quick, easy and cheap. Nice view of the island which ever way you take the ferry. Easy tram or underground links when you arrive.
Taking in the view. It is a short and pleasant journey to take some photos. You get to see the view of Kowloon or Hongkong island when you take the ferry.
Charming!. Catching the ferry across the harbour in Hong Kong is an experience not to be missed. It is particularly good at night on a clear evening. Of course, the MTR is much more efficient!

Historic Ferry Trip with Amazing View of HK. As HK resumes more land on each side of the harbour, the ferry trip may be getting shorter, but it is still a 'must do' on a visit to HK. Spectacular views of the city and busy harbour.

Best way to cross the harbor. Easy and fast way to cross the harbor. It wasn't raining when you used it. So I cant till how it would be during rain. Although it is ceiled and there is a big closed compartment at the front

an old ferry . i was on kowloon and want to go to hongkong soon. so i took the ferry from ferry star harhour. the sea view is very good so i can see many buildings of hongkong companies from the harbour.it only took some coins of hongkong to go to hongkong from here. it took not kore than 15 minutes i guess to the another harbour. the ships are the old ones, but it is nice.

1 hour harbour cruise with Star Ferry. This little-known harbour cruise offered by Star Ferry is a very cheap option if you want to cruise Victoria Harbour. The timetable runs throughout the day and is offered at regular intervals. Included in the ticket is a refreshment of a drink and a small packet of biscuits. A better option than paying a much higher price for a very similar harbour cruise..
An absolute must see in HK. A trip on the Star Ferry is a must when visiting HK. The views are amazing and the old boat is a throw back to the good old days!

Things To Do,, is a must. Beside as a port, this place must be visited for you who want to take a breath of HongKong fresh air and will not make your skin sticky. From Star Ferry Pierre on Tsim Sha Tsui to Central of HongKong 12 minutes only :):)
very pleasant views. fast 10 min trip to Hong Kong island offering nice views in both directions.. the service runs very frequently so you never have a long time to wait.. it is also very cheap
Truly a classic ride. Its a classic ride and a part of hong Kong history. One must take a ride in these ferry which runs every 10 minutes to cross over between Kowloon or central
Night time is beautiful. Great value way to see the night lights. So safe, I took my 8 yr old daughter at 8.30pm, breathtaking views.

The most amazing skyline in the world. I like to consider myself well travelled but the hong kong skyline is the most amazing I've ever seen. A couple of tips. Get the ferry from kowloon not the island. It's quieter. Go at night. The skyline looks amazing lit up. And book early. It gets booked up fast!

Unique & inexpensive public transport. No trip to Hong Kong is complete without a ride on the unique & very inexpensive Star Ferry. Fast trip across the harbour with efficient docking. Vey short waiting times between ferries & connected to bus terminals on each side of the harbour
So nice!. Was surprised by the price, so cheap. Gives u a nice view of the city. Must do! Especially exciting at night:)
beatifull. I highly recommend to do it at night, you can cross from island to island, and you can enjoy the Hong Kong charm

Spectacular Views . The best way to view the Hong Kong and Kowloon skylines is via the Historic Star Ferry. The Central ferry terminal has moved to a new berth. It doesn't really give a feeling of a historic berth. Hong Kong is always re-configuring the shoreline by adding and adding more land. 25 years ago the harbour was wider. The Central Post Office and Exchange Square was the border of the harbour. It was even wider back in the good ole days. The Mandarin Oriental sat at the water's edge. None-the-less to view both skylines, nothing like ground zero view from the harbour. It's spectacular. The ferry has still retained it's wooden decks and dual position bench backs. The bench back swings forward and backwards to orient the direction of the seating to the direction of the ferry. The ferry sides are open so you can get the battering of salt laden winds. The ferry's fore and aft are protected from the elements. The deck hands appear gruff, but are very polite. The Central and Tsim Sha Tsui terminals have various types of concessions. There are historic Star Ferry photos at the Tsim Sha Tsui terminal. There are ferry terminals in Wanchai and Hong Hom too. However the most popular is Central - Tsim Sha Tsui terminals. The cost is nominal. It's a good way to experience Hong Kong.

quick ride, terrible diesel smell. cheap way to get across harbor. good views. terrible smell from the diesel though. it's a bit tough to get back to hotel from the ferry station though, tons of construction.

Favorite transport in Hong kong. When I go to Hk I always try and make sure I do the star ferry - not only is it the quickest way to get across town . It's a great way to see the city skyline . The boats are quirky and old with wooden seats . The ticket is easy to get at the ticket machine inside the terminal .

Hong Kong must do!. The Star Ferry is a must do whilst in HK - especially at night. It costs a mere HK$2 (20p) from Victoria Harbour to Pier 7, Central, HK Island and visa versa. You can sit on the upper deck for HK$2.50 (25p). The journey is approx. 10 minutes and gives you fantastic views of the skyline. It's a great photo opportunity!
Cheap and quick. Efficient, cheap, quick and the best way to cross the harbour. Clean and plenty of seating, worth doing even if it's just to turn around and come back again!

Cheap, charming, a must in HK!. The trip lasts about 15' and costs about 2 HKD. The view in the evening is astonishing and brings you back in time to when commuters did not have tunnels nor MTR to travel to and from HK Island, despite the fact that you see all the lights and towers surrounding you.It is interesting to see how many people still use it during their daily commute and allows a break in HK's stressful life.Did I mention already that the views are lovely?
Nice view of the skyline. Ferry offers a very low cost way to enjoy HK's beautiful skyline, although it's something you do once. Would have been nice to have some food/drinks available on board
Beautiful. Cheapest and most relaxing way of travelling between the Hong KONG island and the mainland. Fresh air and you can see all the buildings. Thankful I didn't use the metro
Fast and cheap . The title of the reviews states everything that you need to know. The boats are a little old but they get the job done.

Crossing over and relaxing while doing so. You can take the Car, you can take the Subway, the Helicopter even (that must be nice!), OR you can take the Star Ferry.
It's not a luxury, it's not expensive.
It's definitely a more relaxed way of crossing over to either side.
So if your not in a hurry, go ahead and try it out.

Love the star ferry!! . The star ferrys are awesome. They all have super cute names which are fun to spot. They run until quite late and they have plenty of seating onboard - some even in air con. Liked the whole process, getting the token, getting on, the views.. All of it!

Great mode of travel to the island. Very easy and cost effective method of travel from the main land to the island and vice versa. You can purchase an Octopus card, or alternatively pay the fare as you need. The boats are very clean and run frequently. It certainly is a good alternate way to travel to break up the monotony of what can be crowded buses.

Quite possibly the cheapest ferry in the world. Well, this is not really an 'attraction' as such, it's a mode of transport - and a lovely one at that. As mentioned in the title, it's extremely cheap. At just over HK$ 2, for the 'upper' deck and cheaper on the 'lower' deck.The Star Ferry is an Icon of HK, and if you visit you MUST do it.At about 4 mins ride, it's very short (HK Island to Kowloon side) it's worth doing just to say you did it. On Kowloon side there are many places within 2 mins walk.About 5 years ago the HK terminus was moved next to pier 6 of the ferry piers in Central which caused a local uproar. However, now it's just accepted.If you want, there is a 'Farmers' market on Sunday (HK side) on the bridge as well as a restaurant on the pier itself (you can feel it moving).I have no idea how many times I have used the Star Ferry, but it must be thousands by now.

Old and New Hong Kong. A cheap, easy and fun way to travel back in time in Hong Kong. Cheap -- HKD 2.50 on weekdays (each way) and HKD 3.40 on weekends (for 1 trip). Easy way to get between HK and Kowloon, a little more crowded during AM and PM rush hour. Great way to see the modern HK skyline -- for even better view, take a trip at night. Try upper deck one way and lower deck on return. Star Ferry trip has to be on your HK to do list. Would not recommend if raining, as a plastic sheet is used to keep the rain out of the ferry (and you can't really see thru it).

Best view of skyscraper of Hongkong . A must do if u visit Hongkong at day and even at night. The view is stunning and out of the world. If you want to save money take ferry from Kowloon to Hongkong harbour and back. You can also pay extra and travel in Chinese boats at night.

Cheap and easy way to see the Hong Kong Harbour and Skyline. Great regular and cheep service between two sides of the Hpng Kong Harbour. The boat are a bit outdated and sometimes overcrowded but very cheap.

A Must Do. The is a must do in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is a great way to see the skyline of the city and the island for a ridiculously low fare each way. we did it at night just as the skyline light show was ending from Kowloon to the Island, but probably best to do it both day and night If you have the opportunity, and in both directions as they offer different kind of views.
For the sights of HK. For a very cheap fare, you'd get to enjoy the full view of HK Central/TST. A trip in evening also gives you a glorious picture of the CBD with the sunset as a backdrop.

Enjoy your trip across the harbour!. Within the busy financial centre in Asia, you can slow down yourself, see the amazing view and skyline of the Pearl of Oriential, enjoy the fresh air and sun shine across the harbour!!

Like the subway, but better!. During my travels in Europe and Asia, I've written about how wonderful traveling by whatever mass transit system I've ridden has been. Well, this is better, mostly because of the view! As an added bonus, traveling across Hong Kong harbor is VERY inexpensive when you travel by ferry. Loved all the rides we took this way. The best views of all were at night, with the city, on both sides of the harbor, all lit up. As a hint, use an Octopus card and pay to ride on the upper deck, the view is better and the trip through the turnstiles is even quicker when all you have to do is hold the card to the reader. In short, this is THEY way to cross the harbor. Try it!

Cheap, Cheerful, and completely Hong Kong. An absolute bargain for one of the best views in Hong Kong! As it crosses the harbour, you get a great view of Hong Kong island, particularly at night. Often overlooked as a tourist attraction, but it shouldn't be.

Great view @ cheap price!. My family and I tried this experience since Ive been reading about this in Tripadvisor. It is indeed a great experience at a very little expense.(2.40 hkd/1 way). You can get a lot of angles of the TST Promenade. When you arrived at Central, its only a 2 minute walk to the Observatory Wheel. Its a must try for every tourist in Hong Kong.

Must do. Unfortunately the HK side pier has moved so it is a bit of a hike to get anywhere if you go from Kowloon to HK. Best to taxi to HK star ferry pier and take ferry to Kowloon. It's a short trip but an institution and worth doing.
Quick and efficient view of the skyline. One way ride is about 5 to 10 min for 2.50hkd. For that, you get a nice view of the skyline and it's generally spacious.

Iconic Hong Kong. You need to do the Star Ferry trip between Ocean Terminal and Hong KOng Island and if your lucky with the weather you will get some great photo opportunities of Victoria Harbour from both sides.Its a cheap trip and well worth it.

Cheap and fast. Depending on where you are in TST area and where you need to go, the ferry offers the cheapest option of crossing Victoria Harbor. The ferry is used by the locals during rush hours. Simply hop on and hop off. The ride takes less than 10 minutes and you get to enjoy the skyscrapers.
Central to TST and back. Took the ferry from Central to TST. Was quick, not crowded, got great views of the harbor and Hong Kong skyline. My transport of choice to get to the mainland.
Good alternative. Good alternative to cross over to Central or Tsim Sha Tsui. Fare is hk$3.40 (on weekends) and about $2.80 for normal days.

Good experience. It is very cheap ticket and will take not more than
10 mints to reach the opposite side. It is good experience.
Easy way to travel. We crossed when the foot traffic was light, it is apparently differently at the busy times of day obviously more of a cattle truck styke ofmtravel. However it is quick and cheap.

Easy way to get across to the other side . Cheap, easy, efficient.
If you take it at night you get the bonus of looking at all the buildings lit up. Probably not an attraction in itself but I lets you easily explore the other side of the harbor.
Must do. Absurdly inexpensive, awesome views, and a fun ride. Absolute must-do in Hong Kong. Use Octopus Card to make it super easy.

Convenient mode of transport to go to the Kowloon side .. Had a pleasant cross over to Kowloon side and back . They come at regular timings ,hence one does not have to wait much for the next ferry. Convenient for crossing over.

Best way to enjoy the harbour. Another of a must do in Hong Kong, the Star Ferry is a cheap and fun way to observe the Harbour. If you have the opportunity, do it both day and night and in both direction as they offer different kind of sights. You can choose to board the upper or lower deck but to me, it didn't really matter as they both provide the same view. When going to Central, sit on the left side and right when going to Kowloon. The seatback can be flipped so that you will face the correct direction.
Quick and frequent services. Jump on and Jump off ferry services that are cheap and very easy to use. The ferry's go all to the islands and across the harbor.
Good opportunity to take a picture of HK. We took it at night and got great shots of HK skyline at night, so worth it. You can use the octopus card.
Great way to travel. This is a great alternative way to travel from Kowloon to HK island or vice versa, it's cheap & cheerful.

We still get a thrill using this.. OF course the tunnel has meant that most crossings between Kowloon and Victoria Island are via the MTR under the water. But there is still a lot of magic in crossing the Harbour the old-fashioned way. Costs very little, is quick and easy. Strongly recommended

cheap thrills. At HKD 2.30, the 5 minute journey from Kowloon to Hong Kong island can't be beaten as a cheap and effective way to see the spectacular skyline. Use your octopus card to avoid queuing fro tickets

A must do while in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is such a lovely experience, you can either use it for the short trip between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island or you can go on a longer cruise / tour.It is such a lovely trip and doesn't get old, even if you are using it multiple times a day- it's particularly beautiful at night, try and time your trip during the daily "A Symphony of Lights" show so you can watch the skyline light up from the ferry.For the one way trips you can either pay by cash or by Octopus Card and it only costs about $2.50 for an upper deck seat and $2.00 for a lower deck seat (always opt for the upper deck though!) For the tours / cruises you need to buy a ticket at the desk and these vary in price.

Iconic Hong Kong . Before I first came to Hong Kong in 1994, I was told that Star Ferry was one of the cheapest and best rides in the world. Twenty two years later, it has not lost its magic for me. There is no other way to cross the harbour. Use deluxe by all means. Use airconditioning if you must. BUT also travel on the lower deck closer to the water, where the real action is !This for me is part of the magic of Hong Kong. Enjoy!
Great fun. Going on the star ferry is a experience not to be missed on a visit to Hong Kong the views are fantastic the experience is overwhelming

Typical. This is easiest way of transportation between the different islands of Hong Kong. The view is excellent and this is very typical.You can use the Octopus card which is very convenient as well.

Nostalgia. Enjoyed the iconic views from a nostalgic fleet of boats & amazingly cheap. No waiting boats are very frequent. Tickets can be bought at a machine or for an even better deal purchase an Octopus card which can be used on all forms of transport in HK.

Great Views, Great Value. Most economical and relaxing way to enjoy Hong Kong water and waterfront. Good photo opportunities. Just go to the pier in Central, Tsim Sha Tsui or Wanchai and enjoy the scenic, atmospheric ride. Did ours a few years back in June.
Nathan. Best mode of transportation from one side to the other to Macau quick and efficient and cheap.On time and clean.
Good to see the sights. Not good for those who get sea sick but a great way to see the harbour and the skyline, very cheap at only $2.50HKD

A must activity. Took the cruise at 1755 hrs for an hour trip at HKD95.
Its cheaper than the night cruise.
The view was very breathtaking and clear explanation was given at all the point of interest (the skyscrappers).
Make sure you sit at the front.
Must try !. Nice view & excellent view of Hong Kong skyline Day & Night time, Very Cheap & Chic, very enjoyable and relax ferry trip only takes 10 mins. Must try, don;'this this special ride!

Very good experience with short riding. . I took this Stsr Ferry at night which make the view more beautiful.
You can use Octopus Card (It is a card for transportation and CVS stores), so it is very convenient.
Once you take you have to get off at the other end and get on again, it is not round trip.
Iconic HK experience. I always looked forward to travelling on the ferry from Kowloon or HK island, very evocative of "old HK"
Perfect way of transportation and sightseeing. The ferry has two purposes. The transportation and sightseeing. Frequency of the boats are good. The Chinese are masters in efficiency!

Short hop across! . Nothing spectacular here except for the fact that it is damn cheap and quick way across. Getting to central pier to take the ferry across involves a good 5-10 min walk from the nearest bus/metro station ! The views are good and especially when you take it post sunset!
Short crossing from Kowloon and Hong Kong island and vice versa. This crossing is on a regular basis and has amazing views of the city especially at night. it is also cheap for the crossing.
Night light in Hong Kong. The ferry was worth the view. I loved it. 1 hour is all you need. Great for a date night. I enjoyed the trip
Cheap, spectacular.. For 34p, this is a wonderful ride. It is a fun way of crossing the harbour and gives each passenger a superb view of one of the greatest urban landscapes in the world.
Easy!. Convenient and super easy. Such a great way to make it across to the other side and a great alternative to the train, cheaper too!

easy, cheap and fun. If you are looking for a true Hong Kong experience, try the Star Ferry. You buy your ticket at a machine at the entrance (it has a way to get the information in English) and off you go. Each ship only goes to one place--the other side of the river. You can't get lost or get off at the wrong "stop"! Easy as can be. We got great photos from the deck...and it is super-cheap. Try it!

Cheap option used by the locals. This is a great way to travel between the two main sections of Hong Kong, across the iconic bay that separates them. Very inexpensive (probably the only thing in HK that is!)
Great service. Frequent service, cheap as chips . Sailed back and forth with some coffee and rolls, a very pleasant breakfast.
Best way to travel between HK island and Kowloon. There is no better way of travelling from Kowloon to HK island or vice versa. It takes just 10 minutes and is cheap. Just great.

Fantastic . After many years of seeing Hong Kong and Hong Kong harbour it was an amazing event actually signing round the harbour it was easy to buy the tickets for two was one hour and it was really enjoyable you even got a complimentary drink and cookies.

Great little trip. An absolute must do. At least once during the day and night. This is a very cheap and very accessible thing to do. You can't put a price on the views of Victoria Harbour as seen from these magnificent aging boats. Should be number 1 for any visitor to Hong Kong.
Star Ferry. There's a new, modern, super big mall, port of Star Cruise, also ferry terminal, close to Chinese Ferry Terminal as well, close to Victoria Harbour, Tsim Sha Tsui center area

Cruise Across the Harbour. We took a few ferry rides across the harbour from Tsim Sha Tsui Star Ferry Pier to Hong Kong Island Wan Chai Ferry Pier and Central Ferry Pier and vice versa. It was the cheapest mode of transport for cross-over compared to bus rides and MTR rides which are slightly costly. Taking the ferry allows for scenery enjoyments and breathing some sea breezes.
Must do this while in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is a cheap, clean, and interesting way to cross Victoria harbor. Go on a sunny day or during the night to see the HK skyline.

Awesome Price!. The star ferry is a fast way of going to kowloon from hongkong and vice versa, it's very cheap compare to the MTR and bus, the scenery is also an spectacle! I'm so looking forward in riding this one again on my next viait on hong kong!

Short, fun & cheap. Take the ferry for a short and fun trip. Even just to see the hongkong skyline or waterways. Its very cheap and quick. You can choose lower or upper deck. Lower deck is 2.8 HKD only.

Efficient . 2 to 2.5 dollars to cross
Efficient
Note the wan chai one stops earlier then central one
Nice views
A must do

Great efficient service. You never wait long for this tourist/local friendly trip over to Hong Kong Island and back. TIP the seat backs on the benches on the ferry move backwards and forward so you can always face forward travelling, in case yu get travel sick like me.

A must for the views.. Although it would have been quicker to take the MTR, we chose to travel on the ferry for the experience and the fantastic views.
The single journey cost us around 24 pence each.

Great deal!. This is a great way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong. It just a few dollars and you can get great pictures of the harbour. We took it early in the morning and didn't have to wait and two of six people on the big ferry. It gets more crowded towards midday. Great in the summer to catch a breeze, take photos, and way cheaper than a taxi! We didn't use it for tours just transportation and found that to be enough.
Very nostalgic fery boat. The Star Ferries are world famous and a trip over to Kowloon is a must if in Hong Kong, very cheap fares but u pay a little more for upstairs
Fun short trip. Since we had the Big Bus tour tickets, we went with the ferry from Central to Kowloon to take the ride there. Well wort doing.
MUST DO. Just trust me do itTake the ferry over from Hong Kong Island to KowloonIts a very quick tripCheap and a must do experience

Used many times, quick efficient cheap and reliable.. Apart from anything else the Star Ferry is a lot of fun. We used it to go backwards and forwards from Wan Chai and Kowloon, as well as Central and Kowloon. I think it works out to around £ 0.25 per ride so well wort it. Amazing views of the skyline as well.
Views. Crossed from Kowloon to Wan Chai after dinner. The process was easy and the views of the skyline at night were amazing. Very cheap (almost free) and fun. A harbor cruising by ferry is a must!

A must do.... Get a feel for the harbour city by hopping on one of its iconic ferries. The uniforms of the sailors are enough to take pics of let alone the worn teak floors and the brass captains wheel. Enjoy one of the cheapest ways to travel in Hong Kong.

Just a quick cruise. I've been to Hong Kong many times and this was the first time taking the ferry from Hong Kong to Kowloon. It was very convenient and cheap. (If you're a pokemon go player, the piers are great spots.)
Aside from that, it's a nice way to enjoy the Hong Kong skyline and sea breeze. Definitely recommended.
Cheap. Its 5 mins.to go Hong Kong island or Kowloon with Star Ferry.And of course very cheap.Must Try it ...
A must in Hong Kong. The best of Hong Kong for an incredible low price, good to go both ways to be sure not to miss anything; there too, better go early to have a seat
Easy and cheap and great views. Very convenient ... Reliable ... Cheap .... Plus great views ... Can't really ask for more when you use this to get across the harbour
Fun inexpensive trip. Nice fun inexpensive boat ride with beautiful views of the city great at sun down take to the island walk around and see the view of the city and mountains.

Perfect . No visit to Hing Kong is complete if you don't cross the harbour in a Star Ferry.
Cheap, frequent, fun and a great view.
If you are not rushing about forget the Metro and jump on this. Along with Sydney, Statten Island this is one of the great ferry trips there is.

Cheap and easy transport. Very cheap, you just buy a token at the machines on the way in to the ferry, $2.50 per adult each way. Drop the token into the barrier machine and then to the waiting area until the ferry is ready for boarding, they run very frequently and take a short time to cross to or from Hong Kong Island, nice views on the way and plenty of room.
Iconic and enjoyable. An "old style ferry" experience but also efficient. The sea air and wind enhance the ride in a polluted city.
A landmark. This ferry has been operating for MANY years.It is a quick and easy way to cross from one side of the bay to the other.
Still great value. . Loved it 30 years ago and love it today. The mixture of cultures using the ferry is amazing, nothing has changed but still a great way to get to Hong Kong Island.
Great price and efficient. The process to buy tickets and hop on the ferry is very easy. Plenty of seats on the boat. A fairly quick ride so no need to worry about getting motion sickness.
Quick, easy, cheap. Quite frequent, easy to catch and get across to Hong Kong island or Kowloon. Takes about 7 min each way
Great views!. This is such a great little ride. You get great views of both sides and it's cheap! We used it during the day, once at sunset, which was beautiful!
A must do . Great way to see the harbour and high rise buildings, fabulous shopping mall with all major designer brands Kowloon side, with great A/C to get out of the heat!

Quick and cheap. We stayed in Kowloon and so used the ferry a few times to move between there and Hong Kong island. It is cheap and it is really easy to buy tickets. We travelled at various times of the day and never had to wait long and always got seats.The ferries are a bit old and rickety but that's their charm.It's a good way to move around and gives good views of the harbour.

Miss the good old days..... Someone may say the Victoria Harbour is beautiful.....yes it was.Since the Government keep on having reclaimed land on both sides of the shore in the CBD ..... the harbour is more narrow, so the ferry trip is hardly 10 minutes with no seagulls flying around as in the 80's.The ferry trip can be wavy cos the harbour is narrow, so hold on when getting on and off.Also, the Wan Chai pier area is constructing the Island Bypass, which made that area a huge construction site. If you just want to experience the Star Ferry, you'd better take the Central side. Anyway, to watch the sunset on the deck is still a lovely experience.

Best way to cross the harbour. If you looking for he best way to get between Kowloon and Hong Kong this is it. At H$2 a trip on the Octopus card it's also the cheapest. Head upstairs and to the front and sit in the air conditioned room and enjoy the passage across the water. The system may be old and slower than the subway. But you get to see the city better even in rainy weather.

Between tradition and innovation. Few cities have kept their identities by maintaining their historic transportation system. Hong Kong is one of them that has has maintained the Star Ferry system as not only a unique mode of traveling between the island and the mainland but is a most for any tourist who wants to get the breeze and the feel of one of the most beautiful, busiest and mystical harbors in the world. A must which is also the most inexpensive fee for a 5 minute crossing. See you on the many iconic Star Ferry vessels.

Cheapest way to cross Victoria Harbour. Taking star ferry is the cheapest way to tour round the beautiful Victoria Harbour of Hong Kong. No matter you go in daytime or night, you can experience the breeze from the harbour and the unique view of high rise buildings in the Central.

Mr R. The star ferry is a great and cheap way to cross the water, it's quick and clean, we went on the star ferry harbour tour, this was worth doing, it was a slow tour of the whole harbour, free wi- Fi, enclosed and air conditioned, a nice way to spend an hour away from the hustle and bustle.
Take it both Day and Night. Incredibly CHEAP way to travel from Kowloon to central Hong Kong. The views both day and night are spectacular and you need to experience both!

Pursuing Pokemons on a sunny Sunday afternoon. An inexpensive boat ride between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon that provides glorious views. Exceptionally busy when we used it on a sunny Sunday afternoon. Great entertainment provided at the shopping mall in Kowloon where Hong Kongers' obsession with their mobile phones verged on the alarming as users clustered and sometimes stampeded through the centre in pursuit of Pokemons.
Sights and sounds of Hong Kong. Nothing quite matches the feel and rythem of Hong Kong like a ride on the harbour. Very cheap for the pleasure it delivers.

Transportation with long history. It is a great way of transportation between HK Island and Kowloon. For one thing, the fare is really cheap: HKD 2 for weekdays lower deck seats. This cross harbour ferry offers you a great view for Victoria Harbour.

Super Convenient . Indeed a very convenient and cheap way to cross the river. Get the tokens from the vending machines before the gates. I highly recommend a trip if you just arrived to Hong Kong and want to get a first impression of this buzzing city.
Average. Average experience.. It's good for a one time visit, but nothing exceptional. Takes about 20 minutes to undertake the journey.
cool. this is fun..i go by ferry going to macau..the view is so nice..like floating ..you can the views as building from hongkong the ocean as well..great.
A nice experience. It is an efficient way to travel within Hong Kong but could be cleaner.Very affordable and convenient.
A relaxing ride for our tired feet. On the dot arrival and departure of the ferry on time for the light show, a delightful slow ride to and fro of Central and Tsim Sat Tsui
