Not to be missed. Offers great view and ist just a must do when travelling to HK! NO matter what the weather. Make sure you go to the upper deck as the view is better

Pier 7 ferry. Easy to cross over to Kowloon from Hong Kong Island. Purchase a token from the little machine or use your Octopus card at the card reader. You get great views of the skylines on both sides.

Convenient way to Hongkong Island . Convenient way to Hongkong Island if you need to go for business to Hongkong Island. Not as crowded as the other public transportation systems. Make sure to wear something warm during winter season.
Always a good option with lots to look at.. By far the best way to get across the water. Lots of people spotting and the views are always good. Recommended

Most cities, you'd pay a fortune for these views!. For next to bothing, you can get amazing virews of the Hong Kong skyline any time of the day and most of the night. The MTR is very efficient, but this is the way to cross from HK Island to Kowloon!
cross the sea. It's nice to use it once, it's a little boat that take you from one side to the other, nothing exceptional but it's relaxing
Easy to cross the harbor. This was very convenient to use. We had close access to our hotel and crossed for the light show. The show was okay, but not worth moving your trip around for

Relaxing . We took the star ferry a few times.
It's always my preference - such a great way to see HK harbour.
There's nothing like downing a cold Pocari looking at the amazing scenery.

Worth the $2.5. Like my title, to get on the ferry it costs $2.5 for a single trip. And you should not expect much from that small amount of money. But if you board the ferry at night, you get more than that.Hongkong is most beautiful at night with its dazzling lights from various buildings and star ferry is one of the best option to enjoy the night view. If you go to hong kong, you should ride the star ferry.

Quick way to get to kowloon and a great view . We purchased a big bus tour ticket for kowloon . It included star ferry crossing , plus sky 100 ticket  Crossing was lovely and i'm not good on boats . Its not long . Hop on hop off from pier 7 from HK island . Way back across at night . Last ferry 23.00 that was in august 2016

Convenient to cross the harbour. If we want to get back to HK Island after a concert at the Cultural Centre, we walk to catch the Star Ferry. It's a lovely way back in the evening enjoying the view of the bright displays of light on the skyscrapers and so efficient. It's old, has a lower deck which smells of oil and is under $2 a ride and a more expensive upper deck for $2.20 a ride. The fares are set to rise as there are less people using it now and they need to pay for it's upkeep and salaries of the men who still open and close the drawbridge doors for passengers to embark/disembark. It's romantic as tourists love to lean over the sides to take in the views and photographs while locals sit in the seated benches looking at their mobile phones.

First ferry with my kids. It's a lovely short hop from Kowloon to HK Island. Plenty of space so no need to stand. Saves you a ton of time if you try it by taxi.This was the first ferry my kids ever took and what a lovely experience. The tokens are available from the vending machine just before the turnstiles.Make sure you have small bills or change, the machine only returns coins.
Cheapest trip in HK. You can't go to HK and not do a few trips on the Star Ferry. You have to buy tokens with cash, and safer to have coins than notes as machines a bit temperamental.

Must do activity. The Star Ferry is an absolute must is you're in Kowloon - it doesn't take long, is a beautiful and peaceful activity, and perfect for a break in between other attractions to sit and rest your feet just for a while. Great for kids, families, or solo travellers.
ferry. A must while in Hong Kong, to get the real feel of the city, amazing views, feel like a local travelling from one island to another
Harbour views. Worth it just for the natural harbour views. Nothing glam about these boats, but they have been there for years,
Historical travel. amazing way to travel from Kowloon side to Hong Kong Island and see the beauty of both especially in the evening

Old Port Facilities for Star Ferry. We were shocked by the state of the Kowloon port facilities for this ferry at Tsim Sha Tsui. It really looks like it was built in the 1950's. It is old and not tourist friendly. There was really nowhere that we could get advice in English about the service. We had to ask another tour operator about the ferry to know where to go.
Best views. Great way to get to Kawloon side and a great view to be enjoyed along the way. Get tokens from the machine, no cashiers and the machine gives change.
just wonderful. its was a great experience, we hope that the city keeps these wonderful ferries running for many many years to come.....

Say that you did it. This was on the list "of things to do". Taxi to dock, used octopus card to get on board. 10 minute ride across victoria bay with some good views. Not as efficient as the MTR but you don't ride for efficiency, you ride to say you ride.

Suggestion for the future. There is nothing new to say about the Star Ferry except that it is living in its own past now that it no longer serves as primary transport for almost anyone--including me, as it once did, years ago. The ferry company struggles unnecessarily with the Hong Kong Government to raise fares by the equivalent of a few US cents, or UK p, and collectively, we here have never seen so much angst over what should be a simple problem to solve.They have already cut routes to the bone and have nothing left to do about that. It is impossible for them to make money without a huge subsidy or some change to the business model. So, since this is primarily a tourist thing now and since it links two significant tourist areas (Tsim Sha Tsui and Central District), here is my suggestion:stop trying to be a mass-transit system, apply to raise the fares to something like HK$50 per trip, reduce the frequency and let the ferries go in a circular direction around what's left of the inner harbour. Tourists could still say they "took the Star Ferry," it would be affordable, it need not be a full-fledged harbour tour, and some of the staff reduction could be managed through attrition.Considering that HK$50 barely buys a beer in most night clubs, what's to lose? But I suppose they have done the homework on this, and decided it wouldn't work, but it's clearly not working financially now either.End of lecture!

A must do for visitors. For a slice of the past, pay less than a dollar and take a trip across the Harbour. After living here ten years, it's still fun, especially at night with the lights on either side. It's on our "A list" of things to do with friends and family who visit.

Convenient and scenic. I am a local and I often commute via Star Ferry between TST and Central. It is very convenient. Be sure to go for the upper deck. It's less crowded and then view is slightly better.

Relaxing ride. I enjoyed so much the night view in the star ferry. The fee is cheap which you can cross the Victoria Harbor of Hong Kong from Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui with only HKD2.50!! Here has like millions of tall buildings...Amazingly packed...

Must-Do for first timer. If you have never visited Hong Kong before, Star Ferry to cross the legendary Victoria harbour is a must! Although not as pretty as a decade ago, it still worth a try with the price of under HKD2.5 (weekdays) and HKD3.4 (weekends).The journey takes less than 10mins and very accessible as one of the major transport between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui. If you wish to take some postcard pictures, remember to shoot it from Kowloon side.

Hong Kong Star Ferry - A Must Do Attraction. Everyone's heard of the Star Ferry, featured in so many films across the decades. If you are visiting Hong Kong, you must go on it at least once. It runs every few minutes from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui and a bit less frequently from Wan Chai to TST. The boats are old but comfortable and it has to be one of the best views of the famous HK skyline - both Island side and Kowloon side - available at any price. And the price for the Star Ferry is dirt cheap - about the equivalent of 30p sterling for what is one of the top attraction in the Territory. And that's the price for first class! It's not just a tourist ride - locals use it all the time to travel between the island and Kowloon. The ferry terminal in Central moved a few years ago and is now a bit less convenient to get to. But it's well worth the effort and still not far to walk from the IFC Mall or Central MTR. Don't miss it!

One of the last few traditional remains of the city. Conncecting the Kowloon peninsula with Hong Kong Island the ferry trip lasts about ten minutes. The ship diesel from the engine makes you feel being reset to a past century in a city that has not much reminders of these days. Enjoying to view the modern sophisticated shores with their unique skylines while crossing the beautiful waters of the harbour and breathing some fresh sea air.
It"s what you do when in Hong Kong. Not a brain snapping adventure, but you do it when in Hong Kong. You get a view from both sides and good for a few photos'.

A Must!. Old but very safe, dependable and relaxing to use. This mode of transportation exist before computers were invented. It's very well maintained, still very sturdy and offers a different perspective of Hong Kong.

A must do. Have travelled on this ferry many timesIt's one of the great trips any traveller can makeMillions of commuters and tourists have made the journey over the yearsThe star ferries are old, traditional and well maintained They are double ended and so don't have to turn aroundTravel on both upper and lower decks as both are slightly different Whilst nothing lasts forever these ferries are an enduring symbol of HK
Quick trip. Went from wan chai to Tsim Sha Tsui using the octopus card and cost $2.50. The ferry came on time and was quick and scenic way to see the city.

A must for first timers, experienced travellerand business people. Like the Trams the Star Ferry is steeped in history, even down to riots in the 1960's when they attempted to raise the fair.Up until the early 2000's the Hong Kong side terminus was right in the heart of the Central business district and it was a two minute walk from the Tram to the Ferry. Unfortunately in the mid 2000's , as part of the reclamations that are slowly filling in Victoria Harbour, a new terminal was built around a kilometre from Central, so the Ferry lost its convenience factor . However its still a must travel experience even if only a one way trip. There are still two classes, upper deck, favoured by tourists and lower deck where you mingle with local traders and their goods. This is open to the weather. The upper deck has air conditioned compartments front and rear with the middle section open to the weather except when it rains and plastic curtains are rolled downThe upper deck seats have hinged backs so can be arranged depending on the direction of travel.

Great way to get around. Really cheap and fun way to see all the different places and islands, ensure you have the right change for the ticket machines, great simply to go for a ride, very safe late at night.
Must do. We rode this from Hong Kong to Kowloon. A short and easy trip. Nothing fancy but very cheap and very Hong Kong. I would recommend this just for fun.

You just have to!. My wife saw the Star Ferry on TV 30 years ago and was so excited to travel on it. The trip across the water to TST must be one of the most attractive commutes in the world. The Hong Kong skyline is incredible during the day or at night time. Cheap ticket too!

Another efficient service.. I enjoyed the ferry trips between the island and Kowloon, quick and comfortable. The trips to the outer islands were also enjoyable, especially the fast ferry. Over the weekend, the fast ferry was full and within 15 minutes there was another ferry to take the balance of the passengers.

cheapest cruise price. If you want to see the harbour of Hong Kong, why not try the Star ferry at a price of HK two dollars something. It is cool to sit on the top deck to see the structures on both sides of the harbour and to enjoy the breeze and a cool drink of your own. Evening is just the best time to ride the boat. It takes only 10 minutes to cross the harbour from Kowloon side to Hong Kong. At the wharf, there is also a good Italian restaurant (at Wharf 8). If you still want to ride the boat, the other ferry piers are just next to Star Ferry Hong Kong side.
Star Ferry. Great, inexpensive way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Quaint ship that dates back to the 1900s. Must do for anyone visiting Hong Kong.

The Star Ferry is the cheapest scenic trip you will ever take. We have been to Hong Kong many times and still get a thrill out of taking the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Central and then back again after an outing on the Island.It is cheap and very scenic as you get a panoramic view of the Island or Kowloon.

Ferry time. I took the Star ferry from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui Ferry Pier.. It was quite convenient and gives you a nice view of the skyline. It cost around 2.50HKD on a weekday & 3.40HKd on the weekends with a frequency of 10-15 mins.

A taste of old Hong Kong. This is one of those "you gotta do it once" type experiences. The Star ferries go waaaay back and are one of the things people do just to say they have done it. It is also a dirt cheap way to cross the harbor. And I appreciated the A/C on the forward part of the top deck.
Star Ferry by night. Take the star ferry from Wanchai Ferry pier to TST Ferry peir at 7.55pm and enjoy the free light show from the middle of the Harbour. All for 3 hong kong dollars!

History and current combined. It is always fascinating to watch and look to Hong Kong & Kowloon skyline, the cheapest way of getting to and from the Island... For only HK$ 2.20 (U$ 0.30) one way in Upper Deck.... Have been using the Star Ferry since 1987.... It remains a phenomen ...

Still the best way to travel. There are various ways to get around Hong Kong, however if you're not in a hurry; concerned about being claustrophobic, or perhaps want a view; then absolutely nothing beat this. Although the ferries themselves are very old but still sea worthy; but if you suffer from sea sickness then I'd highly avoid this as there is a great deal of rocking motion. In trains for MTR/KCR, you're shoved and squished into a can with lots of other people but at least its air conditioned unlike a star ferry which is not.If you have small children with you, I'd recommend taking a good pram with brakes and situated close by so you can keep an eye on it. Or a baby carrier. As i said it does get rocky a fair bit.

Easy and scenic way to get to central Hong Kong from Kowloon. The short ferry trip between Kowloon to central Hong Kong provides fabulous views of the city. The boats are comfortable and clean, and the fare is very affordable.

nostalgie. you haven't been in HOng Kong if you didn't take the star ferry. It's not the fastet way to cross habour, but the view you will never forget. it's the cheapest crouse you can find in the hole world. Don't rush, there is Always a ferry waiting

Some real transportation + nice view of the Harbor. The Star Ferry is a great way to get to/from Kowloon to HK Island.It's dirt cheap and the scenario during the ferry is fantastic.I've taken it quite a few times ... always a mix of locals who use it as cheap transport and tourists who are enjoying the view.

Cheap fun and a must do. Take the ferry from central to Kowloon or vice versa and take in the breathtaking skyline . Very cheap but should be high on your list of things to do in Hong Kong . At 8pm each evening there is a laser show on the skyline which is ok but the skyline itself is what you should see . A good thing to do at night .

Must be done . Have used the Star Ferry both as a means of A to B with suitcases and also just for enjoyment. No better way to eat your ice cream than leaning on the rail of a Star Ferry gazing across the bay. With the chug of an old engine in the background.

Iconic. Simply the easiest way to get to Hong Kong
It's super cheap and great fun.
If you want to go shopping make sure you take the ferry to Central NOT wan Chai

A fastest way from Central to Tsimshatsui. I can say Star Ferry is one of the icons of Hong Kong.Two decks of the ferry, the upper and lower. It can be splitted into 3 parts at the upper deck. The seats are the same at 3 parts. At the middle part, there is no window. In case of rain, the sailor will come and pull down the plastic curtains at the top, You can find windows at both ends. In summer time, one of the ends is air-conditioned. Please don't open the window.The lower deck cost you lower (only a few cents less). It is very near to the engine room. So, you can imagine that it is a bit noisy and hot. No worry about it. Many travellers sit there. It is a very good experience for you to get close to the sea and see the ferry surfing fast.One thing I have to tell you. Please pay attention on the platform between the ferry and the pier. Victoria Harbour is not a quite sea. Sometimes the sea is a bit rough and the platform will go up or down according to the sea waves. Most of the time, you can easily come across. But at the time of rough sea, the sailor will stop you until the waves got calm for a moment.Another thing I have to tell you is the chair back. All of them can be changed direction by simply pull to the other side.It is a very good experience that just pay $2 something and can enjoy a 5 minutes journey. Also you can enjoy the ups and downs in a windy day.

Must DO!. Easy accessible, great panorama, cool "city by the sea" feeling: a MUST if you're in HK! The crossing is super cheap, so I'd recommend you to try both options: the crossing during day time and another at night -> same price for the crossing but totally different experience :)
Convenient!. Great transportation from Hong Kong to Macau. It's cheaper than riding a plane. It's clean and organize.
very easy hong kong island to kowloon. easy to find. very cheap. and super quick trip. gives a great view of the hustle and bustle of the harbour. they seemed to run every ten minutes or so

we did the Harbour tour. this was worth the price. There is an attempt to make the Harbour tour a good experience by including seaweed cookies and cold drinks. Although the tour is scheduled as one hour...I had pretty much seen it all within about 30 minutes.

The most convenient way to view the Victoria Harbour. It's a very cheap and convenient way to get on the Ferry which takes you cross the Victoria Harbour. Journey which takes about 10 minutes, bring you from one side of the Kowloon peninsula to the other side of Hong Kong Island. You can feel the breeze and enjoy the beautiful scene especially at night with lights on the buildings.
Very cheap and very useful!. It cost me $2.50 (roughly 25p), took around 5 minutes (I travelled from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central). Would recommend to anybody trying to cross the sea to use this.
No need to take the full ride. No need to take the full trip... just use it to cross the river... you can even use the octopus which costs virtually nothing...

Great views. We love the Star Ferry, without doubt the best views of the Hong Kong skyline, for the cost it has to be one of the best value trips in the world for the scenery, take the trip both on a day and at night.
Ferry. We used this to go downtown is a nice short trip to get to main central downtown it was usefull since you are able to look to both sides of land
Go at night. Incredibly cheap, and if you time it right, you can catch the Symphony of Lights from the boat - an amazing sight to see from the water!

One of the highlights of HK. Best way to see the skyscrape.
Quick and easy yo use. Toilets provided, which the MTR does not have.

Worth doing once. This is worth doing once, but it's not as efficient as the MTR. We took it to the Central side from Kowloon to see Victoria's Peak, and actually had to trek a bit to get to a bus stop that took us to Victoria's Peak from the Ferry. On the way home we took MTR and it was much faster and easier.
Holiday . Quaint way to cross the fragrant harbour. Ferries run frequently 24 hours a day but at night is best as you get a real sense of all the city lights.

What better way to see both sides of Victoria Harbour...?. Fantastic, original ferry services between Kowloond and Hong Kong; incredibly frequent service, and costs next to nothing. If you have an Octopus just touch and go as you would on the MTR or Tram services.

Great way to see Hong Kong. Great way to see the length and breadth of the waterline of Kowloon & Hong Kong. Good value for money and you get the local feel by travelling this way. You can get some awesome photos from on here.
Getting from Hong-Kong to the mainland. Easy way to get back and forward from HK to mainland.... they want 100 words minimum to tell you about a ferry service.. the boat floats so that a bonus ..

Cheap and traditon public transport. The star ferry started service for a long period of time in Hong Kong, the ferry still look very tradition, the fare was very cheap, you can either travel from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central or Wan Chai, while to Central would be more convenient, where can take another ferry to the outbound island of Hong Kong, also, while traveling on the ferry, you can see the buildings both on the Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.

Nostalgic. My 1st ride on the epic star ferry since i left hong kong in 1980 after serving there in the british army. It was still the same and brought back good memories. The noise and the smell hadnt changed and even the price was still really cheap. Its a must do in hk

Where else can you get an hours excursion , a drink and a snack for less than £5. The star ferry harbour tour is amazing value.An hour long trip round the harbour with commentary and 3 potential boarding points. The breeze calms the humidity and you get a drink and a snack included In Your ticket price.Best £4.79 I've spent. I believe it stops so you can watch the fire works nightly too. Be doing that the next time!

Very nice. Small travel, very chip and pleasant travel and a great view of hong kong and tst. At night the ferry is not to busy and the night view of hong kong is one of most beautiful cities view at night in the world
Easy to use!. Easy to use and the cheapest way to get across to the other island! Also a good opportunity to get photos! Would recommend doing it at night for the better views!

Very cheap . It's cheapest and fastest medium of crossing the harbour from central to tsim sha sui or vice versa. For approx 5-10 min ferry ride you pay less than hkd 3. View from ferry is just awesome particularly in evening /night time.

Used to be great ... Not anymore. This was one of the best things to do in HK. Now it's shocking. It takes 2 and a half minutes (used to be 5 minutes) now due to all the reclamation and as a result the currents through the harbour are stronger so it's not as smooth and once you arrive on the Island, there's nothing there. It's a good 12 minute walk to the MTR. Shocking decision to change what was once a great ride.
Star Ferry. An iconic must do harbour trip. If you go at night you'll be privy to the 8 o'clock lader display where the skyscrapers on the island and on Kowloon swap coloured lights. Dirt cheap.

Best way to visit Victoria harbour. Any visitor to Hong Kong should not miss taking a ride on the Star ferry to visit the Victoria harbor between Kowloon peninsula and Hong Kong island. During this ten minute trip, one can take a lot of beautiful pictures of the city before going up the peak via the cable car.

The best valuable boat trip in the world !. Star ferry is one of the must do attractions of Hong Kong: In a price of less than 0.5 Dollar (much cheaper than the metro) you can cross the harbor, the views are magnificent and it doesn't take too long. I recommend to do that both at day and night.
Best ride in town. Take a ride on this ferry before they fill in the harbour!! They keep reducing the waterfront from both sides and soon there will be not much left!!

Cheap, a great way to see the harbor! . We took the ferry a few times, it's cheap, quick and always on time. I think it's every 15 minutes! It's a great cheap way to see the Harbor and get from one side to the other! Recommended! Tickets are cheap and easy to Purchase either side.
HK Spirit. This is the classic ferry that connects HK Central and Kawloon area.Very easy to use and extremely cheap and there is almost no waiting time between departures.

Spectacular view of the Pearl of the Orient. A brief 10 minutes ferry across the harbour is too short. I did it at nite. The skyscapers intertwined with local buildings at both sides of the harbour with mountains hosting endless homes tell something about this buzzling city. But do it at nite. As it is summer n gets quite hot there. The Star Ferry is ample n nostalgic but not modern n chic.
Harbour boat tour. Took the harbour boat tour as part of the Big Bus tours package, a nice leisurely view of the harbour. A great way to spend an hour.
Well worth the money. Used the star ferry a couple of times and really enjoyed the views around the harbour. Really cheap and easy to use.
Old style trandportation. Love the ferry. I often go out of my way to take it. Fabulous views and easy way to travelling between Central and Kowloon. A must do for visitors.

Major cross harbour transport and Victoria Harbour tour cruise. It provide cross harbour service over 100 years in Hong Kong. Fares are so economy for everyone and ferries are wonderful. I feel happy when I see with them. If I see no Star Ferry ferries at Victoria Harbour, I will very upset and cry.Another hand, it provide Victoria Harbour cruise sightseeing tour which serviced by the cruise "Shining Star". She has open top deck provide best view for visitors sightseeing Victoria Harbour day and night.

Highly recommended to take the ferry to see the top five scernery of the world. Highly recommended to take a ferry if you are not in hurry and would enjoy the beautiful view of Hong Kong harbour, different feelings in day time and night time. The most important thing is it is very cheap, for just HK$2.5 for upper deck and HK$2 for lower deck of the ferry, you can see the top five scenery of the world, though the duration is only 8-10 minutes

water trip. the cheapest trip I have ever taken in the most interesting city in the world. they say the Staten Island ferry is the cheapest ride in the world, but I say the trip on the Hong Kong Star Ferry out beats anything.

One of the best ferry rides in the world!. The Star Ferry is the best way to travel between Tsim Sha Tsui and Hong Kong Island. They're talking about increasing the fares but it's still the cheapest way to cross the harbour. The ferries are frequent and the views are spectacular, especially at night. It only takes a few minutes but it's a wonderful opportunity to take photos.

Visiting. It is a very leisure ride on the ferry although it is very short nowadays, only less than 10 minutes. Remember it's the only connection from Kowloon to Hong Kong for a long time. It's free for seniors (65+) nowadays.

Best way to get across the harbor . I love the Star ferry . It is do quick & efficient to get across HK harbor from Central to TST . They run very frequently ( around every 5 mins) and it is so quick . Whilst I use it to get from A to B I love the experience and feel like I'm a tourist...

cheap and nice way to commute. Hong Kong Star ferry is a cheap and good way to travel between kow loon and Hong Kong Island, have a nice view of Victoria Harbour and surronding tall building compared to using MTR

Best for touring Victoria Harbour. Taking a Star Ferry from the piers at Central or Wanchai to Tsim Sha Tsui of Kowloon can enjoy a short trip to enjoy the view of the Victoria Harbour. The cost is cheap and it takes only several minutes, so it saves you the time and money.

Unmissable. Quite simply, this is one of the attractions that everyone who visits HK should do. It is cheap (between HK$2.5 & HK$3.4), only takes about 10-15 minutes and offers some breathtaking views.Tsim Sha Tsui to Central (and vice-versa) is the most popular route. Obviously avoid rush hours to miss the crush/rush. Much better to take a more relaxed trip and grab a great seat for the views.As a travellers tip, if you want to enjoy a longer trip, take the Tsim Sha Tsui to Wanchai (and vice-versa) as this journey is approximately double the distance.

Value for money, relaxing, beautiful harbour at day and night. You cannot believe it costs less than HK$3 and show you the beautiful harbor views in Hong Kong. It is not a luxury cruise but it gives you a million dollar harbor views. Either taking the ferry at day or night is also enjoyable. I would suggest both.
Old Skool Classic. I love the star ferry from the penny slots to the wooden flip chairs, the experience of sailing across the harbour at anytime of day is one not to be missed!
Great quick ride across the port. Great way to get across the port in Hong Kong. Total trip took less than 10 minutes. Quick easy affordable ride.

A great ferry ride. I like to ride the ferry from Wan Chai to Kowloon especially late at night when it is less busy. The city lights are amazing an the 10-15 ride shows you the best of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon

Renewed association with one of Asia's great ferry trips. I made my first trip on a Star Ferry from Central (HK) to Kowloon back in 1970 and the old world charm of this method of getting over to Kowloon side has not diminished in the past almost 50 years.

Star Ferry tourism strategy. Star ferry route: Zhonghuan, wan chai, Tsim Sha Tsui and Hung hom，you can go on board form these marinas, the charge of Star ferry is very cheap. Tsim Sha Tsui is the beginning location and the ship will pass through Central, Wan Chai and Hung Hom. And then, the ship will return to Tsim Sha Tsui.The passage of Star Ferry is very cheap, you can go on board by costing 2 HkD. You can buy the ticket from vending machine or use Octopus.A crossing of Victoria Harbour on a Star Ferry has been named by the National Geographic of Traveler as one of the "fifty places of a lifetime". If you wanna have a good trip in a reasonable trip you can book with hulutrip.com , the price is reasonable. It's reliable and take responsibility for their customers.

The Iconic Star Ferry - best at night. For many the Star Ferry is how they get to work each day, but for many more it is a nice tourist activity. Payment is easy with an Octopus card, a little more challenging if you have to use cash or change. It is cheap and the ride is great. The back on the seats on the ferry can be moved to either side allowing you to face whichever direction you want. If you can choose go at night as the skyline is amazing. Be ready for lots of people and vendors selling you watches, suits and more on the Kowloon side.
I got seasick. I wonder why people still take the ferry across the harbor considering the MTR, but the journal was quite fast. I did get seasick, unfortunately.
Smooth Move. Easy, cheap and fun. Very efficient and very convenient! Spotless, quick and very charming. It runs 24/7 so there's no excuse for not trying it!

Great harbour cruise at cheap price!. You can enjoy the beautiful view of Victoria harbour comfortably if you avoid rush hours. Though each trip is less than 10 mins, it's worth doing it at least once in Hong Kong.
Short trip. A good way to get across the harbor for cheap. No big attraction, just a short way of getting across from one side to the other.

Super cheap and effective way to commute. Can you believe this? a Taxi from Kowloon (Harbour city) to Central will cost you more than $150 dollars and a short walk to Pier 7 and a star ferry will cost you $5 for two :)Must try. Plus you get such an amazing hong kong skyline view in the night.

Best way to cross the Victoria Harbour. Star Ferry is probably the most famous way to cross the Victoria Harbour and operates two commuter routes from Tsim Tsa Tsui in Kowloon to Central and Wan Chai in Hong Kong respectively. It is part of Hong Kong history and has been operating for over a Century.The services are frequent with a maximum of 20 minutes between ferries - less than 10 minutes at peak time. The ferries offer great views of the Hong Kong Skyline and Victoria Harbour especially from the upper deck.The ferries operate from early morning to late night and are cheap, fast and convenient with an adult ticket on the upper deck costing less than 35 cents (US) on weekdays rising to 50 cents (US) on weekends and holidays. Lower deck tickets are even cheaper. In addition to the regular services, Star Ferry also operates day and night Harbour Cruises each lasting about an hour and a Symphony of Lights cruise covering the famous sound and light show of Hong Kong. Being tourist oriented, these services are unfortunately much more expensive.Not to be missed if you are in Hong Kong.
Good one time experience of the old ways. Try it Try it..You would not repent ...good mode of transport and view of the city scape without pinching your pocket

Best value and one of the best experiences in Hong Kong. It's a cliche but the Star Ferry is a slice of Hong Kong's history at historically cheap prices. Throw in a view and you get a few minutes of perfection in Hong Kong!

Even if no need to cross harbor it is worth every HKD!. Quintessential public transportation excellence combined with views that are unmatched. One tip - remember the seats are reversible so you do not have to ride backwards as some tourists tend to do!
Best form of transportation. The Star Ferry is a great way to travel across the harbor. I really enjoy the views and being out on the water. The ferry is clean and has AC if you need it.

The best ride in the world. No one should leave hkg without riding on the Star Ferry. One of the iconic trips in the world. Amazing views day and night and an incredible bargain at under 50p a ride. Beautiful old ferry which sooner or later will be taken out of service and replaced with a newer sterile version, as is the current theme in hkg and China. Go on it while you can.
Great way to see the harbour. A great way to cross the harbour and see both sides at once, especially at night when everything is lit up. Very cheap and runs very frequently.
Good way to travel. Good way to get to the placed and much cheaper than the metro. Be prepared to walk the distance to get to the piers
Great crossing. Amazing views both ways. Cheap as chips. Upper deck costs slightly more. Better views. Buy tokens before boarding. Cheaper on Weekdays @$2. Sat, Sun and bank holidays $2.80 one way.

Fun experience! Fast trip, fast ticket purchasing!. Given this is such a well known Hong Kong attraction, I expected it to be a bit of a wait purchasing tickets and waiting to get on the boat. It actually was just as seamless as riding the metro, but much more fun!
good method to view the Victoria Harbour. this is the best way to review the buidings aside the Victoria Harbour. Ferry is one of a cheapest transport to travel.

Lovely old ferry boats.. We had visited Hong Kong in the 90's and I was pleased to see that the Star Ferry was the same.It is easy to use. Go to the ticket machine ,it changes notes. Put in what you want. It will give change and a green token.The token is put in a slot in the turnstile and walk to the seating area. There is a red light that turns to green once the ferry is ready for boarding.It was never crowded when we used it . It is a lovely calm way to cross from Kowloon to the Island. You buy single tickets for each crossing.Don't go to Hong Kong and miss out, especially at night when the light show is happening.

Best view of the Victoria harbour. Love the nostalgic Star Ferry! It is the LEAST expensive transport (beside the tram on HK island). The ferry runs frequently and efficiently. It offers wonderful view of the buildings on BOTH side of the Victoria Harbour. I have even taken my stroller on it, but I don't recommend doing it if you aren't nimble with the stroller). Not to be missed for tourists! Highly recommended to take it between Tsum Sha Tsui and Central (IFC) or Wanchai (convention center). My kids loved taking the ferry and remembered it quite fondly after our trip.

Friendly. In this town there is very good human mood. Lot of programs. There are not just big buildings. Fantastic culinary delights. Michelin 6 restaurants 3 stars! ; 15 restaurants 2 stars ; 36 restaurants 1 star ;+ 23 street food sectionJust now 2016.

Pleasant way to commute in HK. Star Ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui has two routes, one to Central, another to Wanchai, on HK Island. The views from the ferry is always breathtaking, both day and night. This is one of the pleasant ways to commute in Hong Kong. Single ride is HKD2.3 on weekdays and HKD3.4 on weekends. The pier in Central is adjacent to other piers for going to the outlying islands, namely Lantau, Cheung Chau, Lamma and Discovery Bay.
Great value, regular services. These ferries take you to all sides of Hong Kong. They are so cheap and even though they take a little loner, they offer superb views of the surrounding islands.

Why wouldn't you go on this?. We never went on the Victoria Harbour tour but used the Star Ferry frequently for crossings – for 2.5HKD why on earth wouldn't you? It's cheaper than going between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui on the Metro and gives you absolutely stunning views across the harbour. The journey between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui was always my favourite.

Kowloon - Hong Kong ferry transportation. If you are a tourist in Hong Kong, you need to try this Star Ferry to across from Kowloon Island to Hong Kong Island or vice versa.You can cross the island using other transportation such as MTR, taxi and all other land transportation, but you have to try this ferry also and enjoy the sea scenery during the trip.The ferry has 2 deck, upper deck and lower deck. Usually tourist will choose to seat in upper deck to sea that offer more open scenery.
Value for Money. Most economical form of transportation if you have to go from Central to Kowloon side. Also allows you to get a great view of the skyline on both sides.

Enjoy the ride. The most old kind of transportation in HK. Been seen it on many movies for years. Only cost a few dollars. Very reliable because they only stop when typhon occures. Schedule every 10minutes with approx 5 minutes ride
Ferry across the bay. Took this very cheap form of travel ine way across the bay. Travel takes 10 minutes each way. Plenty of seating on board and great scenery of the bay.
Why pay for a chartered boat ride!?. This is is delightful enough and the best way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. Never busy, great views and plenty of space on board. Cheap too. :)

From Hong Kong island to kowloon. A nice way to get to Kowloon and the shops and markets. And inexpensive. Although does get busy most days, it's a good way to see. Hong Kong and Kowloon from the water. I enjoyed travelling this way

Star Ferry a Must Do !. In my opinion no one can go to Hong Kong and not take a ride on the famous Star Ferry and it's so cheap !!! This Ferry service is the oldest and most famous in Hong Kong, it's as much of a status symbol of having been to Hong Kong as anything else. Good views for photos during the dte or night.

Star ferry . Great trip & experience , did multiple trip for $2.50 hk good both night & day . No waiting as there is a ferry every 5 or so minutes . Watch the city lights or better still time it for 8 pm to watch the laser lighting show.

One Hundred and Twenty Five Years Plus History. This part of Hong Kong history still continue, the ferry started service in 1888 and going strong, carry local folks and tourists everyday, if looking for history of Hong Kong, don't miss this ferry, the 1960 film The World of Suzie Wong, story unfold here, 1988 miniseries Noble House also feature here, for feel part of the British colonial era bygone years, this is a good way, fare for one way $2.50, weekend $3.40, this about ten minutes ferry ride, best buy in Hong Kong, beside you see the best view on Hong Kong and Kowloon, best still take one in the afternoon and take one in the evening,you will be fully enjoy the moment and take your best Hong Kong memory shot to take home.
Cheap and efficient.. Buy an Octopus card, which can also be used on busses, it saves standing in line to buy tokens, and you can get a refund for unused credit.

Cheap and quick. Took the ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to go back to Central. It was quicker than expected and a short walk from the ferry station to IFC mall. It was nice to see the view of Central from the water.
Sweet ferry ride!. Very quick and efficient, yet gorgeous views. Definitely worth the price, and then some. The ferry runs every 15 minutes or so, and the ride is about the same amount of time.

Iconic Hong Kong . Any visit to Hong Kong should include a trip on the Star Ferry even if you just go there and back . If the weather is good you also get a great view of the harbour as well as the shoreline of both Kowloon and the Island . You can also savour the smell of the harbour and the noise of the engines in the lower deck whilst the upper deck offers better views .

Joy ride across the Harbour . A must for visitors that comes to HK.The HK Ferry is an institutional service and steep in history.Beautiful ride and marvel at the journey across whilst it's only a short ride but well worth it. Feel the place

Cheap as chips for a great harbour view!. It took us a while to find the place walking, but it was worth it. We went in the evening and it wasn't too crowded. It was very cheap and the night harbour views were amazing. The ferry was very basic and old, but comfortable enough and certainly great value for money in a very expensive city.

Unbeatable price!!. A fun way to travel from one side of the harbor to the other. The ferry is very clean and sturdy. It costs less than $1USD each way and of course you can use your octopus card to pay. Make the trip at night to get a spectacular view of the lights of Hong Kong.
Cheap, fast and efficient.. We took Star Ferry to Kowloon to see Pulse and walked around the shops which had a Smurf Art Display. Worth a look if it is still there when you visit.

Worth it. As it was a rainy day my husband and I booked the 1hr Star Ferry tour ($100hk). It was good as there was narrative explaining each building as we went around the Harbour. We had decided that if the weather was fine we would have just jumped on the ferry to go across to Hong Kong Island for $2.50hk. Either way it is one of the activities must do's.

Bets show in town. It is cheap and cheerful. If you are a visitor just turn up pay a couple of dollars and have a short but amazing journey across the harbour. Best at night from TST to Hong Kong. The lights of Hong Kong Island are amazing. Why not go back and forward a few times to get the best views. Go upper deck of you want to get good snaps. But beware getting up before the ferry docks, it can get rough and there are always tourist bouncing around. Just sit and wait to leave it is much safer.
Iconic ferry. The Star Ferry is quoted in many sources as Hong Kong's number one attraction - definitely worth a ride, and at 2.50 dollars is exceptional value for money.
Star ferry a must! . This was a must during our trip. Cheap and good for sightseeing allows a great view of Hong Kong. Ferry runs regularly to and from central and wan chai.

Good view of city. Great way to see the city and skyline for very little cost ($2.50HK) an absolute must. You can pay by Octopus (pre-pay travel card that you can use on other travel) or cash but automatic machine will not take notes larger than $20HK.

A Hong Kong must. A wonderful experience that everyone visiting Hong Kong should undertake, it's legendary and the views of Hong Kong and Kowloon are something to behold on the short harbour crossing.

Cool and cheap transportation . Much cheaper transportation than the MTR, a cool boat ride, maybe ten mins at most between Kowloon and Central Hong Kong. It gives you a nice view of both islands, a must do while in Hong Kong!

Always a great ride . I always like to take the ferry while I'm in HK, this time was at night so we could see HK island all lit up. The ferry ride is $2-3 and you can pay by octopus card.Even through the rain the view was stunning and well worth it. The journey to cross the harbour is not long though. We took the ferry from Tst to Central as the Wan Chai pier is surrounded by construction work right now.

Cheap Way To See The Harbour. It only takes a few minutes to cross from one side of the harbour to the other but this is the most convenient way and it surely is the cheapest. The ferries look old but they are comfortable enough. You may have to push and shove a bit to get on, especially in rush hours, so it is probably best to travel in the quieter periods if you are a tourist.

Iconic ....and its freaking cheap. Truly an iconic way to cross the harbour....you can choose lower and upper deck as well but please be aware the entrance for both is different but still freaking cheap. Definitely an experience for a 1st timer HK especially children

The least expensive feel for The heart of Hong Kong.. Firstly, if you are staying on the Kowloon or Hong Kong side of Hong Kong and must travel to the other side this is the best way to go. You are apt to see a battleships next to a Chinese Junk. One as wonderful as the other. Just soak in all the views both in and around HK Harbour. An adventure you will never, ever forget.

Visit to Macau . We buying the ferry ticket from hotel 290HKD return - open ticket ( cotai water jet) .. our hotel in nathan road.. so we take MTR tsi tsam tsui to go to ferry terminal from red line change to blue line ( forgot the line name). MTR station, one area with the ferry terminal.. MTR in basement area.. and ferry terminal in 3rd floor.. because we already buy the open ticket so we return ticket on Cotai water jet desk for choosing the time. After get the ticket.. you entering the Cotai water jet area and queue up for arranging the seat.. i recommend you to choose the seats next to window. Dont forget to bring your pasport. Will be checked by immigration.
Amazing experience. Enjoy the view and the smell of the sea. It is a cheap and nice way to cross the sea. You can also buy magnets of the Star Ferry.
Short trip. Short trip across the harbor the Kowloon from the port on the other side of Hong Kong.Great views for the short trip - but everybody pushes so get ready!
Wet day. Fun way to introduce HK good sightseeing from the harbour. Quick easy and so cheap! Everyone who comes to Hong Kong should do this !

There is an upper and lower deck!. Ride the ferry to experience it. There is a lower and upper deck. Upper deck being more expensive and less crowded. you may use the octopus card to pay for it. More convenient.

I don't like boats. My Son takes the mickey out of me because I don't like going on the Star Ferry because I hate boats but I have to admit it's very calm & cuts down your journey so much it's worth it.

Cheap price for a million dollars view. A short trip on a Star Ferry is always pleasant. The view is spectacular no matter day or night. It's a preferred choice of travelling from Hong Kong island when we wanted to go shopping in Kowloon.
Must try. We took the Star Ferry twice to go to the mainland. Very very cheap and it was more for an experience than anything else. Everyone enjoyed the trip. For lower deck the seniors go free.
fun ride. This is cheap transportation and fun to go across the bay. Going under the bay is not as fun because you do not where you are but the farry is fast and fun

cheap travel. We used this ferry quite often. Its very cheap to get over to the other island . You must pay by either oyster card or a tokens before you get onto it. It is very regular every 10 minutes .The only downside is they are uncomfortable seats ....but for a short cheap journey it doesn't really matter.
The trek over the harbor . Not really a amusement kinda thing, just a way to get across the Harbour, but the view you get is ofcourse really nice! Can use octopus card on this as well :)

Nice experience during harbor crossing..... This is one of the best way to transfer from one shore to another. fees too cheap. Must enjoy trip recommended. Day trip plus late evening trip recommended.

Best travel value on earth, bar none. Crossing Hong Harbour on the Star Ferry takes about 10 minutes.The boats are seriously old, seriously decrepit, totally dependable and historically important. Don't expect comfort, nor air conditioning ..... just enjoy the ride and tell your friends, children and grandchildren when you get home.The one way fare, for tourists and those without the ubiquitous Hong Kong Octopus Travel Card, is an astonishing HK$2.50 ...... no, that is not a typo ...... 25p in UK money, 35c US. Those with Octopus cards pay considerably less
Must do in HKG. very easy to take from Hong Kong to Kowloon and cheap.nice view on the city, it takes 5 min to arrive in Kowloon next to a huge shopping center!

Cheap option of transportation between islands. Tourists and locals alike take the transportation to travel betwen the islands as an alternative transportation. Fares are rather cheap compares to the MTR option. Great view during clear sky. Frequent intervals of ferries a plenty. Non air con.

Fantastic. What a great trip we had on this beautiful ferry went over to macau for the day the staff were so helpful had a 2hour wait but a very nice man told us about the stand by line thank you we only had to wait 15 minutes will ride this ferry again .for sure
Good time. Very cheap way to get on other side. As a tourist, it is worth to do it once or twice. The water is a bit dirty, but the view on HK and other furry are lovely

Cheap and fun way to cross the river. Since it was my wife's first time to Hong Kong, we wanted to hit the water just to check things out. It's a great cheap way to see both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. I highly recommend this option.

Convenient, but not a tourist attraction. You can definately visit Hong Kong without going with the Star Ferry. Sure it's an historic event, but it's not worth extra effort just to take this 9 minute ride. Use the subway instead!

Cheap transportation. Instead of taking the MTR all the time which is expensive, try out the ferry for a change! It provides a cheap alternative and only about 7min from Hong Kong Island to Tsim Sha Tsui. Pay a bit more for upper deck and you can enjoy air-conditioned seats! Enjoyed the rythm of the ride!

Quick trip over to Ladies Market. Once you get to the pier, it's an easy and pleasant way to take a ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui. It cost less than 3 HK$ and once you leave the ferry area, there are taxis and buses to get around.

Great View of Hong Kong Island skyline. Very clean and comfortable ferry ride for such a small price.
You can even say it was a relaxing escape from the manic pace of Kowloon!

Old World Transportation. This is the best way to See Hong Kong Harbour. The Star Ferry brings you back in time to the days before the MTR when the Ferry was the main means to move people between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. It is a great way to traverse the harbour, take in the see air, enjoy the sights and mingle with the commuters. It is a timeless relic of bygone days. Fares remain a bargin.

Easy access from Kowloon to HK Island . Easy access, great to see city, friendly helpers to get in queue. Easy with children. A lot of shops to grab drinks at entrance. Street performers at exit at night and even current smurf village set up we loved
Must try. U must take the ferry, it s cheap and you have a wondeful of the hong kong city , it s take almost 10 min to cross the river

Convenient and enjoyable!. Loved using the Star Ferry. Extremely convenient, cheap, and enjoyable. Great way to see Hong Kong! Only costs about 40 cents (AUD) to cross the bay onto Hong Kong island from TST, and we never waited more than 2 - 3 minutes for a departure, so you can just turn up without planning. Trip itself only takes 5 minutes so can even be done by those who get sea sick! I though it strange how highly rated the Star Ferry was before I used it, as it was rated high as an attraction in its own right over just transportation, but there is something about it which makes it such an awesome experience! It is just very satisfying to use due to how efficient they run, how convenient they are, and how ridiculously cheap!! Only drawback is that it is a bit of walk from the docks to the busy part of the island, but is an enjoyable walk as it is all through raised walkways.

Awesome ride and cheap to boot. Its a really fun way to get from tst to central and vice versa. I really enjoyed the ferry and ended up using the ferry a number of times. its a must do if you are in HK
A must for any visit. Fast and easy transport back and forth to Hong Kong from Kowloon. A 4- 5 minute ride. Seats adjust with backrest so you can always be facing the direction you are travelling.

Interesting. As far as I can remember this was a really affordable trip and it gives you a view of the Hong Kong Skyline from one island to the other. Was an interesting experience. It think this was the ferry i boarded going to LKF and the style was quite Bohemian.

You should definitely use the Star Ferry at least once on every trip to Hongkong. The star Ferry is a beautiful alternative to the subway Connection between Hongkong Island and Kowloon. With only 2Hnk$ you will get a lovely 10 min boat trip and a perfect Option for making great Pictures of the Skyline. You should definitely do it at least once!
ferry. Used this to get from Kowloon back to central, very much locals mean of transport but no probs organised etc
Always a joy. Just the best way to travel between Kowloon and HK island. Be a local, and enjoy the breeze as you serenely traverse the harbour.

A different way of seeing the both harbors . The star ferry is A different way of seeing the both harbors.
For some it is goos idea because it is so cheaper than taxi and faster the busy MTR
For me i liked it for taking photographs of Victoria harbor and the other side
Its good for once
cheap and easy. A perfect way to travel form Kowloon to Hongkong island and vice versa. Buying tickets is easy and the views from the ferry are stunning.

Favorite way to cross to China / Macau. I've taken the ferry from the airport to Shenzhen and also from HKG to Macau. If got to admit I love riding the ferry. It is so much better than the train or a limo/taxi. Only thing I could think of is of you need to go to Lohu shopping first or after, then take the train.
A tourist must. There are faster ways to travel buy you must do this at least once just to experience a bit of old Hong Kong and to get a view from the water. And it is so cheap!
Fantastic and cheap!. This is a great way to cross over to Hong Kong Island. The views day and night are spectacular just be aware when typhoons hit - they close the ferries.

Star Ferry Symphony of Lights. It was a pretty ride but we were expecting a much more dramatic light show. We saw an amazing one in Toronto and this did not come close to comparing so we were underwhelmed.

Weend Away Hong Kong. What a great way to get over to TST.
Hassle free and a great way to cool off from 38c on Nathan Rd.
Cheap and far nicer than a taxi.
Great views at night and great to see the light show

Virtually Free. The price for using this is so negligible as to make it one of the best value for money things to do in Hong Kong, if not the best.
Even it was triple the price....it is a "must do".
Why Not!?. Something you only general due once - part of Hong Kong's History! for the Difference of $1, go upstairs.
A Must. Just to say you've been on it. Like the Mersey or Staten Island ferry's. It's very quick so not much time taken from your day.

Very regular, clearly signposted and great value.. As a speedy, cheap means of crossing from one side of the harbour to the other the Star Ferry is just perfect! The views are stunning both in the daytime and evening, however it is a shame it shuts so early, at about 8 pm (especially since crossing under the water on the metro is 4 times the cost!)

Cheap, fast and effective. After just coming down from the peak tram which was crazy and had long waits the star ferry was like heaven. It was cheap, fast and done well.
Got a short feel for the harbour, maybe if you really want to take in the views do one of the cruises but this was enough for us.
Cheap and pleasant ride across the harbour!. Great views, affordable (cheapest route to get across the harbour), and quick. If you're a tourist, you must take the Star Ferry at least ONCE.
Handy, cheap, pretty views. Wanchai to kowloon $2.50HKD ONE way. We took it at night, lovely views both sides, and took about ten minutes.

Nice. Not sure if it's cheaper than crossing by subway, but it's worth it, especially at night. If you get seasick (like me) try not to do it on a windy day. The trip is short but it will still make you feel super uneasy.
Must have !. Someone who don't take star ferry is like someone who don't take fly boat in Paris. Essential to enjoy the landscape.
Great for sightseeing. The Star Ferry is a gtreat way to see the skyline and the harbour. It is always crowded but is good value for money and is really a 'must do' activity.

Best view. Nice boat with an outdoor area or indoor air conditioned with tables and chairs. The view of the harbor is unmissable. Even if you see it from afar, the view from the boat is a memory maker. Don't miss.
Cool. The oldest ferry running effortless regular journeys connection HK island to the mainland. Quite nostalgic operating since the beginning of British rule.
Very continent to travel. This ferry service is very convenient those who want to travel to Maccau island. Ferry is available from Kowloon.

Hong Kong Star Ferry. I used to ride the ferry when I was a child and now had the a great time in sharing this experience with my 5 year old niece who was traveling with us. On that day, my dad went with us and from our hotel we walked to Wanchai Ferry Pier, about 5 - 10 minutes of walking (depending on your pace). We paid for our ticket via a vending machine but you can also use an octopus card to pay. For upper deck, on Monday to Friday, adult fare costs around HKD 2.50 and child fare HKD 1.50 while on Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays, adult fare costs around HKD 3.40 and child fare HKD 2.10. For lower deck, on Monday to Friday, adult fare costs around HKD 2.00 and child fare HKD 1.40 while on Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays, adult fare costs around HKD 2.80 and child fare HKD 2.00. For Hong Kong residents who are over 65 years old, lower deck is free Monday to Sunday. The view is amazing and thankfully the water was calm that day. We rode the ferry during the day but I have yet to experience it at night. I bet the view is more spectacular though. Highly recommended for visitors.

A nice quick cruise. When in HK, don't miss the cheapest and quickest cruise of your life. 15 minutes travel between HK island and Kowloon. You can sit and relax, take pictures admiring the wonderful view of the bay. The skyline is really nice and it deserves to be admired. The price is really agfordable: HKD 3.40 per person...not even € 0,40!

Kung Fu Schools . A taste of old Hong Kong ! You can never say you have been unless you have crossed on the Star Ferry. Excellent service , view & cheap . Octopuses card or buy your ticket from a machine .
Hot spot of travel between different placed. Cheap, affordable and easy to manage. Used it for moving to and fro from TST to party town of Wan Chai and central. Easy to manage
Fun way to get to Kowloon. Used the ferry as a quick and cheap way to get to and from Hong Kong Island. Enjoyed the view of HK at night.

Cheapest boat ride in Hong Kong. If it's your first time in Hong Kong and even if you are a regular,there is nothing more nostalgic than a trip on the Star Ferry for the magnificent harbour view of Hong Kong. For literally 25c USthis must be one of the travel bargains in Asia.

Very nice tour. This is really a very nice tour. It helps to view the whole Victoria harbor. The boat is very nice air conditioned with WiFi. The tour will allow you taking a very nice pictures of Hong Kong from the other side of usual pictures.

A 'must' while in HK - best to go around sunset. Living in this buzzing city of HK...the ferry across the harbor is often a great escape. I suggest for any tourist to take a ride from the Hong Kong Island side to the Kowloon side and best during sunset to see the amazing skyline. Enjoy and take it all in.

Cheap Kowloon to Island with a great view. A must do.. No visit to Hong Kong can be complete without using Star Ferry. Cheap frequent ferry from Kowloon to Central or Wanchai.
During the crossing you get great views of the harbour thrown in.
Last ferry to Central about 11.30pm, to Wanchai about 40 mins earlier.
Iconic Must do when in Hong Kong. Cannot come to Hong Kong and catch the Ferry to the Island. Been to Hong Kong a number of times and this is always a great experience

Riding the Star Ferry. Riding the Star Ferry is one of my favorite things to do when visiting Hong Kong. At night it is amazing as you can see the building lit up and you can also view the musical show (the buildings light up to a musical arrangement). It is very inexpensive and gets you from one side to the other in a relatively short time. I highly recommend it.
Iconic. If you're in Hong Kong, you have to ride the Star Ferry! Plus it's a super cheap and fast way to get back and forth from HK to Kowloon. Also enjoyed the Symphony of Lights Harbour tour.

The best and cheapest way to see the harbour. At HK$ 2.50 a ride this is an excellent way to see the two waterfronts of Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. We took the ferry from Kowloon to Central twice and thoroughly enjoyed the short ride. We also took one trip from Wanchai back to Kowloon which was equally enjoyable. Be aware though that it is currently a bit of a trek to the Wanchai ferry pier because of building work. The trips are a bit more expensive at the weekend but still next to nothing.

Sailing through time... The old school ferry sails between TST and Central in a jiffy making it not only a quick trip but one that is on an old piece of history. The ferry is well maintained and with all the safety features of modern ferries. It's always fun to watch the sailor men throw the thick ropes to moor the ferry add it arrives at the pier. Seats are pretty cool looking too.. Worth a trip with family and friends alike!
affordable. a fast and affordable transportation from the victoria harbour to central, i truly enjoyed the ride and the view

The cheapest way to grab picture amazing pictures!. When a trip from one side of HK to the other costs less than £1 it is amazing. When you add some of the best views of a city to that, it is worth travelling back and forth!! Don't miss out on this when in HK and go during the day and night.

Slow down and breathe...... The star ferries are a beautiful way to draw breathing such a hectic city. Find a seat, switch off, listen to the harbour and gaze at the city skyline. A trip across the harbour costs next to nothing (<$HK5) and gives pause and inspiration for a meditative moment or two. :))))))))

Very nice boat ride. I really enjoyed riding on the Star Ferry. You can get on the Star Ferry by going into Wan Chai or Central. It's very cheap only HKD 2.50 from Wan Chai ferry station. You will end up in Tsim Sha Tsui on the Kowloon side. While you are on the ferry, you'll see fabulous views of the city. Try to go in the day but also be sure to go at night so you'll see amazing lights.
Marvellous. This is the must do thing while you are in Hong Kong. The views are incredible and so is the information provided about all the key buildings around the harbor
old world charm. I love the Star Ferry. yes, its slow and becoming less convenient but its not their fault. Blame the Harbour reclamation...

Beautiful Evening.. Its walking distance from Main Queen's road to Blake Pier which overseas the whole view of Ocean with ferries plying to & fro to Kowloon, Wanchai. Its a peaceful place to sit & watch the beautiful HK from every angle. Too Good & Memorable.

Highest ROI on a Cross-harbour Ferry. Where in the world could you invest less than / about a $ in whatever currency and reap a million $ return -- that's the Star Ferry in Hong Kong. The cost is woefully cheap and yet you reap a million $ in return for a view of the world renowned harbour with one of the best skylines of assorted densely packed skyscrapers day or night. Yes, indeed, after riding it in the day, ride it again at night -- the nocturnal view with neon signboards as the harbour's backdrop, though not quite environmentally friendly, is worth multi-million $ !!!

Different and rare way in the world as a public transportation. Ferry between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon is definitely the MUST for the tourists coming to HK. The Ferry is still using the traditional wooden boat with open spaces allowing the passengers to enjoy the sea breeze during the 5 minutes ferry trip and feel the Hong Kong like the movies of 60's/70'sFast, simple, efficient, cheapest and most interesting way to cross the harbor.

Lazy Harbour Ride. I love boat cruise when I'm on trip cos it is not very common to have one back in my home town Hong Kong. We don't have rivers in such a small city of Hong Kong but we do have a internationally renowned harbour. Star Ferry is probably the oldest official public transport to connect people across the harbour. But it is not a very popular public transport nowadays. There are only from routes left, two start from Tsim Sha Tsui and one from Hung Hom. All three routes travels to either Wanchai or Central. Star Ferry may not be an efficient transport comparing to MTR (subway or metro) but is is the best way to appreciate the harbour view of Hong Kong. It costs around HK$2-3 per trip. I would recommend the Tsim Sha Tsui to Central route and the best time to take it is a little bit before 8 pm as you can enjoy the Hong Kong Symphony Lighting Show. It is better to get in the upper deck from Central for the best view.
Fantastic Ferry. Used by many for their daily commute back and forth from Central, this a very cheap way to see the harbour or to cross over it.

Cheap and Fun. Traveled from Central on Hong Kong island to Tsim Sha Tsui on Kowloon. A journey back in time, but a great experience, great views , and only HK 2.50. A short journey but one not to be missed

Cheap. Great cheap way to travel over to hong kong island. Sunway is more expensive so i cought the ferry alot. 3 hong kong dollars to cross over. If you do the trip in the dark the view is a million dollars. I enjoyed the journey. Open air down the bottom. I will post a picture. Its a recommended way.
nice, but honestly, it's just a ferry. yes the views are nice and sure the ferry is kind'f cool but honestly, it's just a ferry. not sure what all the fuss is about

Omg!!!. What an experience! Real china on waves. Must take a trip not only for a sake of a trip and experience of real life but also to experience extremally cheap transport. It cost only 2.5 hkd which is unbelivably cheap for hk

A great and cheap way of getting aroung!. Used the star ferry to get around while staying at the Renaissance Hong Kong Harbor View Hotel. Very convenient and cheap! Make sure you get the right one though! we took the wrong one on the way back and ended up having to walk for 20 min :-)

Every one should go!!!!!!!. Everyone who goes in Hong Kong should try at list once, I suggest at the sunset!
It's the oldest transportation and the cheapest way from Hong Kong island to Kowloon!
A must. You can't visit Hong Kong without a trip across the river on the star ferry. Then visit the district of Nathan Road to sample some of the amazing restaurants.
Cheep and cheerful. Great way to get from hk side to kownloon and back.... Only 2.00 hk$ amazing. Definitely beats the subway + you get a nice view

Best way to enjoy the views of both shores of victory harbour. Less than 50 cents US each trip from kowloon to hk island or vice versa and you can spend 10 mins ride at victoria harbour. It connected the most famous shopping center of kowloon to hk side iFC, highly recommended.
Cheap and Good. A perfect transportation to take from the island to Kowloon. It allows you to take in all the lovely views of Hong Kong in the most affordable and no fuss way.

A Bucket List Item. A "must do", especially from the Dark Side (Kowloon) to Hong Kong. Either take the lower deck for the closer-to-nature experience or go upstairs and find an air conditioned section (where, hopefully, not too many tourists have opened the windows to let the cools air out while they take photos!!).
Alright. The star ferry can be taken to see the symphony of lights show in HK harbour. Buy tickets beforehand. If you queue up early you can take the best seats.

One of the great old traditions left in HKG!. Use the star ferry for a scenic river-crossing ride. Feel the atmosphere of a remaining english-chinese colonial melting point. Make sure to take your cameras!

Great views for a cheap price!. You pay 2 HK dollars to sit on the bumpy ferry without aircon but the view is absolutely divine! Do this if you have the chance! Plus its a way to connect your shopping too!

Short cruises in kolonial era. Going on these ferries will take you back to the kolonial days whilst offering you a smooth crossing for very little money. And if you're lucky, on a bright day you'll have great views on Kowloon and Hong Kong island.
Amazing views!. Really nice views and very convenient way to get to the Central area and the Victoria peak. It was very cheap too, only HK$2,50 for one way trip.
Great easy transportation. It was a part of my tour but a great way to get between Kowloon and Hong Kong and see a great skyline.

unique way to see the city. While the harbour is getting narrower the trips are becoming shorter, but this is something that I enjoy to do every time I visit HK. Great experience and nice way to view the city.
A must do, especially at night. Beautiful and cheap way the enjoy the Hong Kong harbour and the spectacular skyline on both sides, Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.

Great ride. It's hot, it's sweaty, it's not glamorous, it's old, it's always crowded, but it's a must do in Hong Kong. It's one of the cheapest ferry rides on the planet and it's great to cross from Kowloon to HK island, with the amazing skyline getting closer and closer. Well worth it.

Average visit. Paid 3.2 hkd per trip im not wrong. U can pay using token or octopus card. U get to choose lower or upper deck. Personally prefer upper deck. Took from central pier to tst pier. To and fro. However u have to alight and re-board. Worth visit in both day and night times. Very proper queueing and the chairs are retractable. Can sit either side. Do not confuse with the harbour tour. There are food shops at both pier. Central pier is near HK or central pier, via the bridge. HK is nearer, in my opinion. About 10 mins walk to the central pier from HK mtr.

Crossings from Kowloon to HK. Not really much to say. It's cheap (can use octopus card), has great views, it's reasonably quick and it's an historic icon of the city. Beats the metro and takes you from just outside TST to central in HK.
easy way to experience harbour. 10 minute ride, and have the nice whole view for the harbour no matter day or night. I do do twice. be care your camera LOL , dont drop to the sea, oh sorry harbour XD

A step back in time. This is a lovely way to get across from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and gives you a beautiful view in both directions. You can use your Octopus card (travel card) to pay for your journey.

Star Ferry. Absolutely love the Star Ferry. I just love the short crossing to Hong Kong island and watch the beautiful skyline on both sides. I love the fact you can choose to go to Central or Wan Chain.

A must, but nothing special. A ferry ride across the bay is a must-do in Hong Kong. But don't expect anything special. It's really simply a ferry. Good was to cross the bay cheap but the ferries are better photographed from the water-front and from within.

Easy and Cheap way to see HK from a different view. Loved travelling on this ferry - was really cheap and got to see HK from a different viewpoint. Went during the day but can see the attraction of timing it for the light show at night. A must do.
nice ferry ride. very affordable price for an experience. nice to feel the old tradition. easy access. fuss free.....

Inexpensive HK experience. Fun quick experience across the harbor. Fare can be paid with Octopus card.
One cool feature is that the seat backs for the benches can be flipped, depending on which directions the ferry is traveling.

Cheap and cheerful. Quick way to get over to Hong Kong island from Kowloon.
With a cheap price of HK$2.80 (£0.28p) (weekend price).
The view from the lower deck was incredible, I can imagine the upper deck being even nicer. The skyline, the boats and the smell of the engine is quite an experience.
It's a must do, just for the experience.

Inexpensive and good views of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Very easy, efficient and cost effective way to navigate between HK Island and Kowloon. Great views and frequent ferries back and forth. Even fun to take on a rainy day.

A Must on the TO DO list while in HK. Having lived in China and visited HK many times, there was one thing my family never tired of - taking the Star Ferry! I highly suggest it. Easy way to get to one side to the other instead of taxis. Plus a whole lot more fun!

Great way to see HK Lights. Must take it - day or night. Cheap and you get to see beautiful HK
You arrive at convenient pier on both sides of HK. Better than MTR if you are not in a hurry.
Trolley and wheelchair friendly.

Inexpensive and safe, nice view f you take a night ride. We took couple of rides when we were there, much better view than subway rides.
Very efficient staff, moving people in and out fast
Quick-comfy. Really quick way how to get second side of harbour,use the card or tokens,enjoy every minute there! Very nice sunset pictures!

A superb way to see the city from the water and a quick way to get around. Only 2.50 HK$ to travel from Kowloon to Central and a fabulous way to get out on water and enjoy superb views of Hong Kong in all its splendour! also very cool when it is so hot here!
Must do when in HK. This is a must do when in Hing Kong taking the ferry from TST to Central, especially on a sunny day as it gives you a good opportunity to take pictures of the skyline.
Nice experience and views. For 2KHD each way per person the best option for harbour views in Hong Kong. Go late afternoon to see start of Symphony of Lights at 8pm sharp

Best way to travel in Hong Kong. I took 4 return trips on the Star Ferry during my 5 night stay in Hong Kong in April 2016. We were staying in Kowloon, so the ferry dock was close to us. For what amounts to dimes, you get to cross Victoria Harbour with stunning views of Hong Kong from both sides. Add to that there's a vintage element to the boats that adds some whimsy to the ride. Even though it was a long weekend in China, the ferry wasn't full. It was busy, but there was plenty of room on each trip. My favourite form of transportation in Hong Kong!

great alternative to the metro. Not only that it is more fun as you get a view, the ferry is way cheaper than the metro. Also, sometimes walking to the train and from the train itself lasts longer than the ferry ride.

Very Efficient and cheap. I dont know what you can say about a Ferry that crosses the harbour - if you arent cruising the Harbour it is a cheap way of seeing how it all works. Like I say Very Efficient and cheap

Fast and cheap way which offers a great view. Using the Star Ferry is a good way to get a nice and cheap transport from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and Central/Causeway Bay area. The view on both sides of the skylines is awesome. The fee for the Ferry is really low. If you have the Octopus Card: just go ahead and use it, it's working here!Enjoy!

AWESOME view of the FAMOUS Victoria Harbour. HONG KONG is named the Pearl of the Orient.
If you are in Hong Kong, a ride on the STAR FERRY is must.
It is just a ten minutes ride from Kowloon to Hong Kong side.
The scenery is extraordinary. You will see nowhere in the world.

Wave as you go. This is quite fun, we've taken it a few times. It's a good and fast way to go across. There's only a bit of motion, and the boats are clean and in good condition. Be sure to get a seat and if you can, go near the window. Kids enjoy it.

Great Views and Cheap. The ferry isn't beautiful, but it's been running since Hong Kong began, and it's a very inexpensive way to get on the water, see the skyline, and get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island in just a few minutes. You should do it at least once!
Pittoresque . Nice and cheap to do. Very pleasant for a break and for taking pictures. The trip is not very long but offer a nice view

Very nice view friom both side and convenient. Taking the ferry is an amazing experiance in Hk duo of the skyline background which is astonishing.
easy, fast and cheap
Cheapest and best view!. If you want a trip on the harbour with an amazing view, then you would be silly to pass off the opportunity to travel by star ferry.

Cheap, efficient and beautiful. The star ferry is part of the MTR of Hong Kong, then OCTOPUS is allowed to be used in this vessel. Do not mistake and take the 1h tour! Except if you want to make it, The counter of this tour is in the extreme of the dock. The star ferry joins Kowloon with Hong Kong Island in a ~10 mins travel with the excellent views from both sides. Be fast and take a window seat :)

Good to experience. I took the old fashioned green Star ferry from Central Pier 7.For lower deck one way token cost $2 while upper deck $2.50. There are machines on each level before gantry gates. They take $10 and $20 notes.It is a pleasant 10 minutes across Victoria Harbour. Sit on the right side so you can see Wan Chai and Tsim Sha Tsui.
Enjoy awesome views from both sides of Hong Kong. Ferries are inexpensive and frequent. Great views from both sides of the harbour. Sit on the top deck for the best vantage point.

Pride of Hong Kong. It's pretty weird for a local to review the star ferry/ share about this public transport, but anyways I'm loving it! Taking a ferry ride across the Victoria harbour to have a look of the stunning view is one of my favourite acts! And it def made me proud of being a Hongkonger!

Fun All Day But Especially At Night. Staying in Central, getting to the harbor is very easy. An easy trip to Kowloon, day or night the ferries present stunning views. Never miss a chance to cross Victoria Harbor, walking the pathways in Kowloon for stunning views of Hong Kong at night!
