Must try in Hong Kong. A cheaper and shortest way to go to and from Tsim Sha Tsui and Central areas plus you get to see the promenade. This is also the best way to see the Hong Kong citylights at night.
Best view of Hong Kong. I loved going on the ferry and the waterside view was amazing and surreal. The ride is smooth and excellent way to get across the harbour.

dont miss the star ferry..... If you like cabs or the MTR and you've got a 24 pass, still make sure to take the star ferry, its an iconic part of HK. You can use your octopus card too and it costs peanuts. Great views of the island and Kowloon from the water.

A great way to get around. We enjoyed using the Star Ferry numerous times while in Hongkong traveling to Hongkong from Kowloon or out to the other islands close by. We bought an octopus card which enabled us to travel on the trains and buses as well. We bought ours at the tourist bureau at the Kowloon ferry terminal area. Similar to a multi rider for Aussies. If you are a bit unstable on your feet the ferry isn't the way to travel as it is a bit unstable when getting on and off the ferry.
Star Ferry is Hong Kong. You may not have been in Hong Kong, without crossing the harbor with Star Ferry. Old worn boats, but just as charming as they have appeared in every year

Cheap and lovely, use your octopus card only $2.50. This was a lovely trip across the harbour to Kowloon Ialand and back on a rainy day in Hong Kong but also lovely due to the older form of transport. Quite nostalgic in many ways. Got some great shots of the harbour even on a cloudy or rainy day post monsoon. On the Hong Kong side the Star Ferry leaves from pier 7 at the central station. In Kowloon you can take the A1 bus on Nathan Road down to the terminal to come back to central station. Its only 8 or 20 mins each way across the harbour and at $2.50 its a really cheap attraction.

Great for both transportation and views. A nice way to go over the water and meanwhile you will get a great view over Hong Kong! Since its very inexpensive you should really take the trip even if you don't need to cross the water just for the experience and the views.

Water transport hub. Water transport hub Off the coast of Hong Kong To the Kowloon side of Hong Kong, Macau and other islands with affordable costs. You will experience a slow journey. The view from the island on a boat.
A Must in Hong Kong. An easy to use ferry across to the Island. Quick and cheap and regular,used by all. Buy tokens before getting on. A must
very cheap. you really don't have a choice but this was just the average and ordinary ferry to take if you wanted to cross the harbor

It's a must do activity when going to and from Kowloon. My group wanted to take the authentic Junk's but the line was fairly long and we needed to get back to our hotel as a Typhoon was approaching and we needed to pack up and check out. Still it was a great way to travel to and fro, and would highly recommend it.

A Hong Kong icon. A must do!
Not only because it's a very cheap and efficient way to cross between Hong Kong island and Kowloon but because the views are spectacular.
The boats aren't luxurious - it is very much a working ferry - but that adds to the charm of this Hong Kong icon.

Quick and Cheap!. Being a tourist in HK, this is a must do.Travelling from Central to Tsim sha tsui via bus or cars takes a lot of time.but this ferry only takes approximately 10 minutes to travel. therefore it saves up a lot of moneys and time.I'm loving it!You can either travel from North point to Hung Hom. or central to tsim sha tsui

Fantastic Views. Crossing Victoria Harbour on a Star Ferry is one of the best ferry rides in the world. It takes about 10 minutes and costs only like one dollar one way. Use your Octopus Card for easy hopping on and off. Spectacular and unforgettable views of the Hong Kong island skyscrapers. A must-do while in Hong Kong and a much better way of crossing the harbour than by subway. Even better by night when all the lights are on.

Best way to experience Hong Kong. Victoria harbour is stunning anytime!You can take star ferry from central or wan chai to tsim sha Tsui or the way back from tsim sha Tsui to Hong Kong island at hkd2 only! The city view is cool with sunset or at night!
Theonly way to travel to the Island. Travelled to the island on 3 occasions using the Star Ferry. Its really good value for money and the timetable is great Well worth using in in Hong Kong
best way to cross Victoria harbour. Use the star ferry to get across from Kowloon to mainland. Get tokens from machine before boarding instructions in English

Sight seeing.. We had to have a trip on the Star Ferry to Hong Kong Island from Kowloon without that no trip would be complete the Shops and Buildings are incredible with restaurants that are second to none fantastic food from all over Asia and using the ferry couldn't be cheaper, 2.50HK$ per Adult to make the crossing,Great value!

Effective way of getting across to and from HK island. We took both the upper and lower decks to get across to and from Hong Kong island, and this is a very cheap and cost effective way when compared to the MTR.Lots of locals use this as daily transportation, as it takes about 15-20 minutes to get across. For tourists, this is quite a pleasant ride, and it is possible to take pictures from both decks. Offers lovely views of harbors and skylines on both sides.Weekends are a bit more when compared to weekdays, whether you use an Octopus card or just buy tokens.

Quick, cheap experience of history. The Star Ferry gives you a feel of the old Hong Kong and is still being used today by commuters. The terminals are a bit of a walk from the MTR stations and it's not the most efficient way to travel (the MTR takes you directly to and from Hong kong island anyway). However, riding it at least once gives you a short experience of ferry travel and a cheap sight-seeing view of the HK coastlines. For the price of the ride, it's well worth it. But if you're not into the history and experience, it's not something you'll miss.

The Authentic Cheap And Cheerfull Way To Cross The Water. I wanted to get on to the water to get some pictures of the spectacular views of Hong Kong Island. I also wanted to be able to experience what lay across the water. These ferries were the best way of doing this - cheap and full of character!. The fare across is only about £0.25 each way and a token to get through the entry turnstile is bought from a nearby machine. The journey across the water only takes about 10 mins, but you do get great views of the harbour traffic and of both Hong Kong Island - and of the other side. I did get off at the other side - you almost immediately walk into a large shopping centre (But only after being approached by loads of guys trying to whisk you off to secret shops to sell you fake watches.. or suits).Did I enjoy the trip over - YesWould I recommend it to friends ? - Come on.. how else would you want to cross the water?Would I do it again - Yes

awesome!. being a tourist,for me,its a must to do it! its so cheap and payable also by octopus card..its a 10 min ride..its another choice if you dont want to use the mrt avoiding stairs and long walks..but ofcourse,you have to come prepare,study the maps so you find its route..the fare from one station to another like wanchai to tsim sha tsui is 2.5 hkd....if you get lost upon embarking,you can go to mrt station..mrt provide many english directions..but as a tourist i highly recommend that you use a ferry if you can squeeze it in your schedule because its worth it!
Great view!. You can enjoy the view of Kowloon as well as Hong Kong Island! The only problem was it was hard to find an entrance/place to buy the token.
Unexpected comfort. Ferry service is so nicely maintained and made comfortable for the tourist that it is hard to believe unless seen. You feel like as if inside an aircraft. Great experience.
Back in time. Can t be in hong kong without a ride on the star ferry. Very easy and cheap to use. There is a section with air cond.
The best activity at HK. - easy to ride to go to many islands by reasonable price.- you can choice between ordinary or speed AC .- lantau islands is the best of all followed by Discovery island.
Something to do. Very cheap about $2.00 one way across the harbor can see the city as you travel frm the mainland to Hong Kong island

Must do in Hong Kong. Take the Ferry to or from Kowloon. Visit Ladies Market, bird market, goldfish market and just cruise. When coming back from Kowloon and your hotel is west of Causeway Bay, take the appropriate ferry directly to Causeway Bay.
Never disappoints. I love the ferry - although I ignore the sea worthy, or lack of aspect of them. So much rust..... There are so original, and such a cheap way to cross from HK, give them a go.
A must do. Star Ferry from Kowloon Island to HK island took about 10-15 minutes. What a great experience and very easy to find.
Fun way to cross the Harbour. A enjoyable way to cross the Harbour. Its a fun, cheap and quick. Its a great way to see the Hong Kong Skyline on both sides.

Cheap and Fun. The Star Ferry is an icon of Hong Kong, it has been ferrying people across the harbor for around 100 years. It is also the cheapest transportation other than the Ding Ding in all of Hong Kong. I suggest using it to travel from the island to mainland as much as possible. They also offer cruises around the harbor to see the city. I suggest going at night to see the "symphony of lights" which is the world's largest light show. They light up both sides of the harbor and you get to sit on the deck and watch the skyscrapers come alive all around you.
Just for experience. Very cheap (2.50HKD during weekdays), ride is around 10mins from Wan Chai to TST. Nice to see the buildings from the middle of the sea.

Vintage and romantic. Very convenience, travelling from HK to Kowloon in 3 min.Very vintage, with staff wear sailor uniform.Very romantic, to see the night view of HK, especially if you with your husband.

Hong Kong tradition. This is an HK institution and you should take it at least once just for the fun of it. It is very cheap and offers a nice experience. The views are actually better from the shorelines as most seating is inside

A must do in HK. I live in HK and I love taking the Star ferry. It is the cheapest way to cross the harbour, takes less than 15 mins and it's always a joy to watch the skyline and busy waters. Great for photo taking and to enjoy the breeze. I can't remember how many are in use but I always look for the name and see which ferry it is. They all have different names.

Iconic and one of the must do's in Hong Kong. The iconic Star Ferry is the best way to go from Kowloon side to Hong Kong Island or vice versa to experience the HongKong harbour seeing all the new modern buildings whilst on the old ferries. It is beautiful during the day, an extremely busy harbour but it is equally gorgeous travelling at night looking at all the lights of the mainland and island.

A must!!. The Star Ferry is not just for tourists. Locals use it because it is convenient and a great way to appreciate the beauty of this special city. You can use the Octopus card, too!! Try to be in the ferry around twilight. The harbor was bathed in a pink glow.
Organised and efficient ferries . The ferries run quickly and often. I am not a good sailor but I felt very comfortable and calm on these ferries. We used them every day and had no issues at all.

Great must do little trip. Our Hotel was based at Jaffe Road (Mira Moon hotel) during our 8 day city trip in Hong Kong we have often taken and enjoyed the little boad trip from New Wan Chai Ferry Pier (8 min by foot from the Hotel) to Kowloon Point, Tsim Sha Tsui. The trip itself takes about 10 minutes. The Ferry is comfortable, not crowded, you barely have to wait when you miss one i believe every 10 minutes, its cheap and effective and gives you the great view on both the Kowloon and Hong Kong Island skyline view. Must do when you are in HK and do it minimum twice...different experience during day time and night time!

Simple solid and good. It stands for simple , solid , reliable , short transfer between the two sides- Kowloon and Hong Kong island - while having the opportunity of unforgetable views of both sides . Did i say it was cheap ? -2.5 h$
Holiday . Cheap and one of the best views. Always sit on the side so that you can see Hong Kong island, a much better view. Also try at night at 8.00pm when they have the light show.

2.50 HKD across Victoria Harbour. Very happy I took this. From Kowloon I needed to go to Harbour Street on Hong Kong Island for my Chinese visa, and fancied a scenic trip across Victoria Harbour. It is actually cheaper than the rail line which would involve two Subway trains and about 12 HKD. At 2.50HKD this is a bargain, more convenient and the ferry's are every 10 minutes or so. Would recommend certainly for the convenience, photo opportunity and price.

Hong Kong old fashion. If you're not in a rush and don't want to cross the harbour underground, but feel the moist from the sea and warm sun on your face, the Star Ferry is one of the best options. You can take wonderful pictures of both sides of the harbour and relax on the old fashioned (yet 100% reliable) ferry cruise for the next 15 minutes.for only 4 HKD, you can go back and forth as many times as you want!
Star Ferry. Great way to get around, very dependable, reasonably priced, and who does not love being on the water? Made several trips on this ferry and others in Hong Kong. Highly recommended.
Cheap, easy way across the harbour. We found the Star Ferry service cheap and very efficient...moves big numbers with ease and minimal waiting. We used many times during our week.
Nice view on Hong Kong. The best way to go from Hong Kong to Kow loon if you have time, and a very cheap cruise. The star ferry is part of the must have trip for any fan of Wong Kar Wai movies.

Loved the star ferry. Got to board the ferry from the Hong Kong side. It is beautiful. The boat ride gives you great views and we got to ride in the front air conditioned part of the boat. Thought it was going to be crowded, but was perfect in the afternoon hours. This is something not to miss.

Hong Kong must!. When I first visited Hong Kong in the 60's the Star Ferry was the way to get between the Kowloon side and the Hong Kong side. Times have changed but I enjoy the memories and the views from the ferry more than the crowded underground subway. I hope the ferry never goes away! It's a fun touristy piece of Hong Kong's history.

' A must do'. A lovely way to travel across the harbour.
Used our octopus card and it only cost us 14p (seniors rate) But it is still very cheap for everyone.

A great way to cross the harbour. I took the Star ferry every time when I cross the Victoria harbour. It gets you from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central or Wan Chai at a very cheap price. On the ferry, you could get a great view of Victoria Harbour and it's a good opportunity for you to take stunning photographs of Hong Kong skylines.You must not miss it if you come to Hong Kong.
Love it all the time. Best way to take photos of Victoria bay. Cheap and fast, much better than the metro. I never take metro to tst, star ferry is the correct choice .
Must do in HK. Used the star ferry to get across. Easy to buy ticket and fast service across. Good photo opportunity.

A bit of a disappointment. We took the evening Star ferry which lasted an hour and costed us 400-500 per person..You get to see the city all lit up from the Ferry but the tour commentary was inaudible and $500 for an hour long ride along the harbour didn't seem great value...Our ferry ride later on in our trip to a fishing village was much more fun.

Perfect Way to Experience Harbor. You can sail the harbor privately or just hop on the Star Ferry at minimal costs and enjoy a similar tour. One criticism is that the ferries seem a bit old and dated. In need of a bit of varnishing and paint.

Connecting Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. We took the Star Ferry during the night and travelled using the Octopus card. In the night it gave a great view of both the Hong Kong island as well as Kowloon island from the middle of the sea. Must try to get a flavour of local sea transport.
harbor travel. you get to see everything from a different perspective and if you pick your times right at a much more relaxed pace
Iconic Hong Kong. The ferry is cheap, runs constantly and a great way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong. They did recently move the ferry on the HK side but its still great.

Beautiful Night View. Traveling from Hong Kong to Kowloon via Star Ferry at night. Nice views on both Hong Kong and Kowloon. Traveling by Star Ferry is not expensive. However traveling during summer is a little hot. Probably a better experience if you were to travel during winter.

Nothing special. We were a bit disappointed with the cruise.
A lot of money for little to see.
Just take the ferry to go from hong kong island to kowloon is enough and gives you a fair idea of the sihtseeing.
Short ride, free wifi. Decent seats for a 20 minute ride to Hong Kong. They do offer free wifi but it is good enough for messages and not for downloading / sending pictures or facebook.

Wow!. This is an experience that everyone should do. Costs hardly anything, a great pleasure, and a great way to view the harbour's skyline. Easy to get tickets, board and the journey is quite gentle ( or was whe we went ).
Do it at least once. cheap and cheerful with amazing views, do it at least once and experience the cheapest boat tour in the city!
A nice way to finish our day.. We used the ferry on our way back from Kowloon to the city. Efficient, clean and different from the train.

Great way to connect between Kowloon, HongKong island and other places. A cheap and easy way to get between Kowloon and Central - great views and so quick and efficient - use your Octopus card which works on buses and trams too .

It's a must go. Cheap but excellent.. It doesn't cost much but you can enjoy the skyline and the view of Victoria harbour in a leisurely way.
Also, the big shopping mall near the pier in Tsim Sha Tsui at the Kowloon side is worth a visit.

Not to be Missed!. If there's one thing every visitor to Hong Kong must do then it is to have at least one crossing across the Harbour on a Star Ferry!My first ride must have been 30 years ago and - whilst the boats themselves haven't changed at all - the areas around the piers (which are located close to the respective International Financial Centres (IFCs) - certainly. Indeed, so much construction has not only taken place - but is still ongoing - that the piers are not exactly easy to find. Call me sentimental but I, for one, preferred the way it used to be!Important to add that - although you can now opt for the more expensive one hour Star Ferry Harbour Cruise (book well in advance to avoid disappointment!) - the regular crossings from Central to Kowloon are not going to break the bank. My crossings today - upper class going and lower class back - were HK$3.40 & 2.80 respectively. Even at Brexit exchange rates you can't really complain although I suspect some of the locals still do!Not to be missed and don't just take my word for it!

Cheap river crossing for light show!. Took the ferry to see the HK light show and very cheap, $9HK for 4 of us total! Takes about 10mins and very calm ride. Walk from Central to HK station and it is just there.

Star Ferry is a must do. I have traveled to Hong Kong for work and leisure may times during the last 20 years and have always made a point to do at least a one way trip on the Star Ferry. It is the cheapest and most relaxing thing to do in Hong Kong and the constantly changing view of both Kowloon and the island makes it so enjoyable. Relax and enjoy the gentle chugging go those old engines and watch the world go by
Best & Cheapest Boat Ride. A must if you're in Hong Kong without breaking the bank, cheap boat/ferry ride with spectacular views of the city, not to be missed

Definitely worth trying. Meant to take one across the bay between Hong Kong island and Kowloon, this is a attraction and a joyride in itself! Must try if crossing over from one side to the other is not part of your sightseeing route anyway.

Comfortable ride. The ferry was very clean and the ride was not rocky at all. I enjoyed the ride very much. When riding the ferry, I did not fell dizzy at all. The whole journey was very comfortable. As it was winter, when I stand at the side of the ferry, I can feel the cool breeze blowing on my face.

Good service. Cheap and iconic Star Ferry from Kowloon to Central or Wanchai - or the other way! Use Octopus card or cash - very cheap. They also do separate harbour tours. Upstairs or what used to be years ago 3rd Class - either has great views of the harbour. 10-15min crossing. A bit longer to Wanchai.

Great Harbour View. This is a short ride across the river from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui (and vice versa) and great opportunity to see the beautiful HK Skyline whilst your on the Ferry (both HK side and Kowloon). Another good news is that it is so value for money, under HK$5 per ride.
Must see. A tourist legend. Definitely worth waiting in the queue for. Worth getting an octopus card upon arrival as public transport is cheaper

10 nice minutes: boat for commuters. I am Italian, totally trustworthy.There are two types of star ferry boats: the touristic and the one for commuters.I've been only in the second one.This is the best way to go from a part to another of the bay.They are nice, fast, cheap with a nice view.But they are meant to only to go from a side to another: if you want to relax with a short sailing, take the bay tour.

The best view of HK at the cheapest price!. For the price of a bus ride you can enjoy the stunning view of Hong Kong from the water! Sit at the very front to enjoy the view best (take the upper deck) and have your camera ready. When you ride from Central to Kowloon have a look at the old railway clock which is visible on your right and when you return from Kowloon to Central enjoy the seafront with IFC Tower, Exchange Square, and all the main buildings which are shining with different lights. Gorgeous view. An absolute must!!!

Star ferry is a nice way to travle from HK Island to Kowloon side. Chip and fast .A lot of hk citizen use Star ferry going to work and its running very often. It å nice way to see the boat life in inner harbour

Top on the must-do list in Hong Kong. Star Ferry used to be the connection between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon before the cross harbour tunnels and MTR were built. Now, it has become a must-go tourist itinerary. From TST to Central, the trip takes only a few minutes, but you will see all the iconic buildings by the both sides of Victoria Harbour, not to mention the ferry fare is only a few HK dollars. You don't have to join expensive harbour tours. Isn't it a good news for budget travellers? If you want to go to one of the outlying islands, most of the piers to those islands are just an arm length to Star Ferry in Central. Pop in one to see the beautiful authentic countryside of Hong Kong.

Not really worth. We tried this to see the laser show, waste of money. It just stopped in the middle of two islands but not really worth to see the laser show from this ferry considering the high prices. Better see it from Victoria harbour,

Must be done, . The Star Ferry is a tourist legend, it's one of the many things that was recommended before I went to Hong Kong. It's classic in it's simplicity and that's why it has worked for so long, cheap efficient and quick, pay, get on, enjoy get off it's simple. Providing great views of the harbour, this is something that every visitor to Hong Kong should experience.
Best ride in Asia !. The best and slowest way to get across the harbour and enjoy those views ! A bit cheaper if you go on the lower deck, all in all a great experience !
A must do in Hong Kong!. Short ride between Hong Kong and Kowloon, some great views!!! Super cheap, easy to use and not overly crowded!!!
Still the best. Decades old, it's cheap, efficient and still the best sight seeing trip of the harbour. A bargain. Sit upstairs and near the front for the view and the cooling breeze

A harbour tour for almost no money. A pleasant way to go to Central or Exhibition centre from Kowloon. Almost free of charge (Or, if you stay att HK Island, go to Harbour city for shopping. Take the upper deck at the slightly higher price (2,5hkd) for better view and a nice breeze
Kowloon to Hongkong island. The ferries are very clean. Run frequently so no long wait periods. Easy to acess, signs up to direct you. Ouite easy to find near the Harbour shopping centre.
Always a highlight. A must-do for tourists. Lovely views of the harbour as you travel in either direction. You never have to wait very long for the next ferry to arrive.

Interesting, cheap, great view. All tourists have to try the ferry. It is running from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui crossing the Victoria Harbour. Just HK$2.5 for a ride, which takes less than 10 minutes. Enjoy the great view of Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. There is a big shopping mall just next to the Tsim Sha Tsui pier.

An experience for sure. A different kinda of boat ride if ever there was one. We rode the upper deck one way and inside on the lower deck for the return journey. The view of the H.K. on one side and Kowloon on the other was delightful, particularly as both were observed after dark.
excellent. this is the best way to travel between the Islands...easy to use and very regular..wish al ferries were this good
Must do in HK. Have used this many times during our travels to Hong Kong. Great way to cross the harbour with stunning views of the skyline, especially at night

Boat ride for 26 cents? I'll take 100 !!. Granted, it's a very short ride, but where on earth can you board a ship for that price? Token machine is fast and easy. Takes coins or paper and gives change! It's a ferry, so expect it to smell like diesel and salt air. Have fun.
a must in HK. it take not more than 20 minutes to get to the station to cross the harbour and then take off. but it's very nice trip, the view is also great there.

Must see & do. This is quintessential Hong Kong and a must do whilst visiting HK.. take the ferry across either way or both to enjoy great view of the skyline (especially HK island side).. underdeck is more noise with the machinery.. but both decks are truly fine..
Amazing paramagnetic view. The most inexpensive way to enjoy Victoria Harbour view and breeze with double deck ship and air-con seat area is available on upper deck.

high quality to view HK Vortoria Habour with cheaper price. You can have great view to seeVICTORIAL Harbor by taking Star Ferry from Central (Hong Kong Island) to Kowloon side (Tsim Sha Tsui) OR versa.It only costs around USD0.64/trip. This is a local ferry and only take 15 mins. Everyday is with different view,especially sunday day without wind. 1)You can take around in Kowloon side (with map ) for shopping in shopping mall and go to Jardon area to visit local maket, see local life stlye2).From Central,you can go to thePeak (by taking a bus which is just out of the ferry terminal) or tram to overview the beautiful harbur view both HK Island and Kowloon side

Best way to enjoy the views of the Victoria Harbour. Let's enjoy the sweeping vistas of the Hong Kong skyline and the pulse of the city and in the most inexpensive way to cross the Victoria Harbour. The Star Ferry's ferry crossings are acclaimed as an important part of the commuter system between Hong Kong Island (Central and Wan Chai) and Kowloon (Tsim Sha Tsui). The National Geographic Traveler named the ferry crossing as one of 50 places of a lifetime. The ferry ride is also well known as one of the world’s best value-for-money sightseeing trips.

View for Victoria Harbour. Only Minus need to buy the ticket across the counter and not available online . It has hourly cruise across the Victoria harbour . The best to to take the evening cruise where you can see the laser show was well ..
Worth doing at least once . Famous attraction which is one the list of must do while in HG. It's cheap and views are spectacular. Do yourself a favor and do it.
From Kowloon to the Peak. As far as I could remember, I got the Ferry to central HK then I rode a taxi to the Peak. Nice journeying and sightseeing around Hongkong.

Three of the best and cheapest things you can do in Hong Kong. 1. Take the Star Ferry between Central and Tsimshatsui. Go at night for maximum effect.
2. Take the Peak Tram to the Peak. Take in Central but don't forget to look over the Southside of the island as well.
3. Take a double decker bus from Exchange Square in Central to Stanley. Sit on the top deck. Obviously.

Night tour. Two three hours after sunset, take the ferry to cross the Victoria harbour is a amazing experience. You can watch the night scenery on both side of the harbour. And the fare is real cheap. L
Top experience . Great cheap experience. Not to be missed on any visit to Hong Kong island. I've done this many times and enjoy it every time. Use your octopus card
Simply a must try when in Hong Kong. Cheap, fast and unike way of travel to feel the Hong Kong's icon. Easy way to get from Kowloon to the Convention centre or Hong Kong central.
Cheap and amazing view. An inexpensive way to go on a 10 mins cruise, though its not a luxury one. The view of the harbour in the evening was amazing.
Great way to go from TST-Central. A low-key "must do" of HK. Great harbour views on good weather days. Sit upstairs for best experience (small premium) and look for the "star" on your seat.

Easy and authentic . Easy for foreigner to buy tickets, no waiting time, old boat. You feel like in the colonial century. One of the cheapest attractions in Hong Kong. Amazing view from nothing both side of the bay.

Leisurely and inexpensive eay to have an impressive of the Hong Kong harbour. A ferry journey which I enjoyed since I was in the youngster age. Best take the Ferry at evening to have a view of the fabulous illuminated coast of the harbour. The cost is minimal. The pace is slow, as contrast to the fast and anxious crowd of Hong Kong. Take it from the Hong Kong island side to the Kowloon side, so that you can enjoy the shopping malls after boarding.
chea^pest way to see the harbour. It is like the traghetto( public gondola) in Venice. I think seniors are free. beautiful view of harbour.

Nice and cheap . The ferry is a very nice and cheap way to travel, and I highly recommend it. It's quick, and the view is definitely nicer than what you'd get if you took a bus or the metro. It's even worth taking the ferry for the view and the smell of sea only.
Cheapest way to get across the harbour. Enjoy the day or night scenery of the famous Victoria Harbour at a very affordable price, less than HK$3 one way.
The Best Way to see HK harbour. The ferries are a remnant of original old Hong Kong. Loads of character and the best way to get up close and personal with the harbour.

Went over to Hong island on it.. Great at night to see Hong Kong all lit up.
Easy to get to and very efficient.
Loved every minute of it.
Trip to Kowloon. Took the ferry over to Kowloon nice way to get some good photos of both sides. Ferry service very old but that's what it's all about.

Cheap, quick and authentic way to travel. Used this a few times to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Very regular service, toilets on the piers are clean and easily accessible. Great views as you travel, the crossing takes about 5 minutes or so and costs about 20p downstairs, 25p upstairs.

Love this taste of old Hong Kong.. We crossed on the star ferry from Kowloon to central on a single fare and we also went on the hour harbour tour. There is something quite magical about being on a star ferry. Highly recommend especially the hour tour.
Very nice trip , the employees were dressed as sailers!. It looks a bit hold for a Hong-Kong service but very pontual and secure. Poor comunication in inglesh
Must do. I don't think there is a better way to see the the amazing shore line of Hong Kong Harbour than aboard the world renowned Star Ferry

Cheapest means of local transport for tourists!. Strongly recommended to get this for taking photos of the harbour, especially at night! Just about US$0.3 only!! Probably "Guiness cheap" in the world now for tourists, how can you miss it?! Don't be taken into the tourist ride of another prettier ferry which costs you more than US$20! No need at all! Save the money and enjoy more local snacks on the streets! Even as a local Hongkonger I would not need you to spend money unwisely at all, although the more you spend the better will be to our economy.

Quaint reminders of an old Hong Kong. Probably the most iconic ferries in the world which have been crossing Victoria harbour since the late fifties.
An efficientservice as well as an experience these beautiful old ships have a character of their own .. I only hope that as everything else from the Colonial past is destroyed the ferries continue for many years.
Good view of Victoria Harbour in all time of the year. Connect the two busiest districts of Hong Kong, very convenient way to start exploration of the city. Great fun for kids.

Overrated. A quick trip on the ferry. People run and push as if they're jumping on a roller coaster wanting the front seats, when in fact, there are more than enough seats for everyone - even good seats. No need to run people. Relax.
cheap mode of transportation.. it is a cheap mode of transportation between hongkong,macau ,schenzen,mainland china.ride is comfirtable and good.

A Must Do in Hong Kong. Being a local, I still found it very relax to be on the Star Ferry. Trams and Cross sea ferries are really a cheap and good way to explore the city with spectacular view and cultural experience.
Crossing from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. A cheap and fast way to visit Kowloon. Easy to purchase 'ticket' at the machine and about 15 minutes between ferries.

Best Local Experience. Even for a local, this is the best yet inexpensive experience to look at both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island sides on a boat ride. Instead of taking the MTR, Star Ferry offers a much better option to cross the harbour with a view!

Good way to cross the river. This is an easy and VERY cheap way to cross between Hong Kong island and Kowloon. The prices vary from weekday to weekend. I paid 5 HKD (less than 1 USD) to go round trip on a weekday. There are simple machines that give back change to purchase a ride token. The trip across the river takes about 10 minutes. The ferry itself seems quite safe & it is clean.

Great Service. Conveniently located on waterfront on Kowloon side of harbour. Cheap way to get to Hong Kong island, Week days a couple of $HK, weekends $3HK. Offers at least 2 places for drop off on island side, the convention Center and near the IFC mall, right by the Apple Store and the large Ferris wheel.Great service and cheap.

Must Do on an early evening ride across the harbour. take the ferry after after sunset, meet fellow tourists around the world on the ferry (local considers the ferry too slow to cross the harbour, but that is exactly what tourists want to do). After arriving on the other side of they harbour, exit and pay for another trip to return to your starting point. That will be an inexpensive way to enjoy the most beautiful part of the city.
TST. Good to have a full and excellent view of Hong Kong harbour, you may try to ride the ferry in the day time and in the night time separately.

For the experience of HK's trademark. Its still nice to experience Hong Kongs famous Star Ferry. Its cheap fare is fair enough to experience jut going to the other side of the island and have a glimpse and take a pic. The ferry is a little old but its still nice for it to stay just like that to maintain its trademark looks. Its safe, don't worry. It's just a few mins away from the other side as you can see it.
Fast and Cheap. Fast, fun and a really cheap way to get around Hong Kong. Amazing views of the city skyline at night.
Sheer wastage of time and money. Nothing but crap. Ferry at Aberdeen village cost HK$ 60 Per Adult and is waste of time. Nothing to see.
traditional and inexpensive experience to cross the harbour. take the ferry in good weather, sunset ride this the best!one of the kind experience you can't find anywhere in the world.

Never loses its appeal. I have lived here over twenty years. This was one of the first trips I ever took in this city. To this day, it never ceases to impress me what a great way it is to view the harbour. It is worth doing several times a day, not least for the fact of its cheapness. By day you get excellent vista of the city scape, and by night there is the sparkling forest of lights from the illuminated buildings. The leisurely nature of the trip also adds value to the experience. Watching how the crews and the staff on the shore skillfully dock the ferries is another plus.
Cheap with good view!. Veeeeery cheap and you also get a nice view of everything!!! You can ride both on top or bottom if you're going back and forth.
Ferry ride. You can see best view of both Hong Kong island and Kowloon at low cost, crossed the harbour in just 10 mins from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central CBD.

Leisure and Beautiful Views. It was amazing that I took the star ferry to cross the harbor. It was around 9 at night. The views are very beautiful on both side of the harbor. I enjoy the breeze and the lighting on the shore.
What more is there to say?. Essential part of the HK experience. Cross one of the busiest harbours in the world, feel part of the local scene. Not to be missed!

never fails in delivering. The Star Ferry takes you from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island in minutes while you enjoy views of the famous skyline sights of the city on both sides. It cost almost nothing and it connects the busiest and most tourist friendly districts - where you stay or need to shop, eat or do business. And the Star Ferry has been there since anyone can remember! Itself is a nostalgic experience and part of everyday life for some locals.
HONG KONG ICON. It is a short, inexpensive ride which takes you back to Colonial Hong Kong. As the land gets reclaimed however, the trip gets shorter and shorter.
Unique. Do think there is any other place in the world with this kind of view - and it is very cheap.Different experience during day time and night time.

romantic trip. It's very cheap to take the star ferry, cost only less then $4 HK dollar.It would take around 20 mins, best time length to enjoy the Victoria harbor with super cheap price and best view.

Cheapest way to enjoy the night view. You can cross the harbour by Star Ferry at evening to enjoy the night view. Just go and back is only spend you less than HKD10.00. Both side have shopping mall like IFC (Central), or Harbour City (Tsim Sha Tsui).
Efficient and frequent passenger service.. Efficient and frequent passenger service. Great to get around between islands. If on the Big Bus Tours you'll get tickets for Star Ferries too.
Useful & interesting. Handy crossing and also interesting bit of working history. Used it when going to some jobs but also took visiting tourists on.

Travel by the Star Ferry across Hong Kong harbour is a must!. The Star Ferry crossing provides a means to grasp the inclusive Hong Kong core, from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island central (the government and long-time commercial hub). Travel during the day is a mix of a variety of boats in transit -- and above all provides a moment of tranquility away from Hong Kong's busy streets and density. Night travel has become something special, as as dusk there are light shows that include lighting up buildings and a variety of spotlights -- that reach a peak in a roughly 15 minute musical display that is spectacular. Seeing the show from the deck of the Star Ferry is well-worth the minimal transit fee -- as an alternative to the more expensive boats that provide harbor access to the light show. The Star Ferries have two decks that offer their own variety. There is ample seating as also opportunity to walk the more-or-less open decks. The ride takes roughly 15 minutes one way. You must leave the ferry at either end, and reembark with another ticket. There are two destination points in the Central district; a single on the Kowloon side. .
Fast and hilariously cheap. Essential to cross the harbour for a bit of orientation and world class views of a unique urban area. Do it both ways for both views. Do it at night! A must-do.

Great and inexpensive trip. A great way to have an inexpensive view of Hong Kong from the water. There are a few different trips across. I've done from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui to and from Tsim Sha Tsui to the Convention centre. The trips are frequent and very inexpensive. Only about $2.50HK.
Traditional Experience. It is the cheapest mode of transport from the Hong Kong and Kowloon side. A traditional MUST DO activity for tourists.

Best way to travel to Hong Kong Island. When deciding how to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island, there really is very little competition. The train is entirely underground, always incredibly crowded, and costs upwards of $90 one way. The ferry, on the other hand, costs more like $20-30 depending on the day.They run about every ten minutes until 23:30, and the journey across takes a similar time. During this journey, you are treated to great views of the approaching part of the city, the harbour, and some of the islands in the bay. If you sit in the middle section there is a nice breeze on a hot day compared to the sticky end compartments. You can even buy your ticket via Octopus, for those using public transport regularly in the city.Given the clear advantages of the ferry, including the price as well as the experience, why anyone would go via MTR is beyond me.

Ferry Ride. A must ride across the fragrant harbour.The views are spectacular in both directions but I always prefer looking towards HK Island.Take the upper class for best views.The whole trip is an adventure.

Wonderful & Relaxing - A must do!. A great way to relax and soak in the city and it's skylines. We used the Star Ferry to get back-and-forth from Hong Kong to Kowloon often. Inexpensive, relaxing, fun, historical and convenient. We also took an hour long Star Ferry ride around the harbor (it was included in the hop-on / hop-off Big Red Bus tours) and enjoy the beautiful sights on Hong Kong & Kowloon. We also gained historical perspective of this gem of a boat. I suggest the hour long ride - it is relaxing, spacious, In-door air conditioned and outdoor seating, provides amazing views of the active and bustling harbor, is narrated with facts and landmarks during the tour and they serve snacks, beverages (including beer and wine) and souvenirs. To us, after a day of chasing down the various sights, sounds and must see things in and around the city - this was a great way to unwind and unplug. We grabbed a beer and a snack and drank in the sights of the city around us with a non-over burdening narrative about the historical sites of the city and the landscape that makes up this beautiful city. After bouncing from sight to sight all day - this was a relaxing way to soak in the city from a different view point & perspective. Beautiful tour during the day, around sunset and or in the evening. All provided a beautiful view of the surrounding sky lines with an informative historical perspective. Great for family, couples, friends and or solo. Great way to catch your breath and see this beautiful city. Enjoy & CHEERS!

A cheap and fun way to see some of the best views of Hong Kong (and experience something of old Hong Kong). The ferries have been plying this route for many decades and are historic relics (but kept in great condition). For small change you can ride the ferry from the Island to Tsim Sha Tsui (Kowloon side) or the other way and if you sit upstairs you can see all of the spectacular vies of the island and the huge buildings going up Kowloon side plus the busy water traffic of Victoria Island. For my money, best done at night when the views of the epic buildings are all lit up and at their best.
Not to be missed . A sunny July day on Hong Kong harbour what a great way to spend about 15 minutes. All the sights sounds and smells of Hong Kong - not to be missed.

Excellent easy way to cross over to the water to HK from Tsim Sha Tsui. Took the ferry across over the water to explore the other side. Ferry was old but quite large and an easy journey. Not at all crowded when we took it, plenty of seats, easy to buy the tickets etc.

Love this.. This is just the best thing to do in hong kong. So cheap and you see so much, you can go from one pier to another and back to a different one. I cam spend a day on this. Day and night, see different views, the nights views are amazing, better than the peak. I simply love the star ferry and the fact that they havent tried to be greedy and overcharge is even better. Top deck amd bottom deck can provide different views too. A much see.

Great attraction - Must visit. For only 2,30 Hong Kong Dollars you will have an opportuníty to enjoy the see inside Hong Kong. Journey takes about 10 minutes, ideal for tourists, especially for children. Both sides are great :)

Leisurely trip across Hong Kong Harbour. A cross harbour ride on the Star Ferry should be a must on any one's itineraries. Not only is it the cheapest option, it is far more picturesque than other transport. Take the lower deck for HKD 2 (USD 0.26) or "splurge" for the upper deck premium. Either option gets you one of the most scenic boat ride of your life.

Cheapest Attraction. This is possibly the best attraction in the city center as it's most bang for your buck at night. You can ride between TST and either Central or Wanchai to see the lights after dark, but also the light show at 8pm every day.I loved riding this home when I lived in Hong Kong. I would oftentimes bring a cold drink or even some snacks to enjoy with the views, even for just the 10 minute ride.
So little cost for so great an experience. We loved the star ferry and used it several times between our hotel on Hong Kong Island and Kowloon Island. Especially great at night during the light show.
The best Ferry. If you visit in HK, please don't use only MTR when go from TST to HK side, please try the Star Ferry, it's just nice to see the HK in different way.
Transport and a Great View . Awesome ride across Victoria Harbor. Great view and the quickest way from Kowloon to Wan Chai. Avoid the MTR and get some sea air!

A fun way to see some of the sights on Hong Kong. While much faster to go to/from Hong Kong Island/ Kowloon by MTR the Star ferry is more relaxing and the sights are a bargain. Have only journeyed twice this way but neither time was I disappointed. Beware though you cannot use the Tourist MTR card for the ferry - you must buy a token instead. This is no real hardship, just something to be aware of.
Harbour cruise 95 HKD. A good way to get a quick tour of the Hong Kong water front. The tour read relaxing and worth the money. The boat is air conditioned. You also get a little snack and a drink.

easy to get across the harbour . used the ferry as part of our big bus package and it's easy to figure out and get around. great views and. quick trip, the one hour harbour tour is worthwhile. there is a separate gate if you are using the tickets from the big bus tour

Inexpensive, great views, easy. This is a review for the actual ferry not the Star Ferry tour. The ferry simply shuttles you across from one side of Hong Kong to another for a very small fee (maybe 50 cents, can't remember because it was so cheap!). You will have a great view of the skyline, can choose to sit in an air conditioning with many of the locals, sit by a window and take pics as there always seems to be plenty of space.
The cheapeast cruise in the world!. The cross-harbour trip from Kowloon to Central is quick and easy, and offers spectacular views of the cityscape. Not to be missed!

Worth trying at least once. We went on board of the star ferry on our way back from HK island to the hotel, which was located in Kowloon. The experience is nice, the boat is old but very well maintained. The ride is short (less than 10 min). You can also use your octopus card, similarly all other transportation options (MTR, buses, tram, etc).
Essential travel - star ferry. Only a 10 minute sail across the harbour between Hong Kong and Kowloon, the views are amazing and you usually get a nice breeze to enjoy the ride

Ferry Transport is Excellent but Signage could also Help non-Chinese speaking Travellers. Some ferry has air conditioning.
Good clear emergency instructions just like travellers taking a flight.
Helpful if ferry staff could speak some English. If not, please provide easy to understand signs as guidance.

A bit of history. These little ferries go back and forward all day, its a short ride from Central to Kowloon but you really get a sense of the history that these boats have seen. They are remarkably unchanged (except for a bit of air con on the upper level) - made in Hull apparently!
Its a must do trip.
Absolute convenient, efficient service.. This is absolutely dfficient and reliable transport available in Hong Kong. And it is really cheap. Loved it.
Fast and easy. You can't miss the star ferry ride from hongkong to kowloon. It gives you great views of the city and is very cheap and a efficient way to quickly travel between the two.

Ferry Ride hasn't changed much. The actual boat ride itself hasn't changed in 30 years - lovely.
The only shame is that it's not convenient at HK side anymore due to reclaimed land. What a shame. Still a lovely experience, especially at night.
Practical and cozy ferry trip. Great way of going to/from Kowloon/Hong Kong Island! It provided tradition and is cheap and goes frequent!
Great way to see the Harbour from Kowloon to Hong Kong Is.. Always a nice pleasant way to get across the harbour at a cheap rate.Quite scenic and nostalgic and will go again next time in Hong Kong.
Good ride . Its my first time in hongkong so its good experience for me to try star ferry , iam very enjoyed this experience and would back to try more for my next visit
Cheap but worth it. So what was the price 50p return trip absolutely amazing experience. We bought a egg tart from the cafe on the way too and it was like my mum used to make so tasty
must do!. so cheap to do, took us a while to figure out how to use the ticket machine, but as always easy when you know how!

For 25p it's a good way to cross the river. . This is a few minute journey in a boat across the river commonly used by commuters. I'm unsure why its recommend for tourists, but if you need to cross and don't use boats frequently go for it.
It's only 25p (UK) so use it.
Boring . The ferry was a short boring trip. The view can be had from the shore. And it's so crowded pretty average nothing exciting

Don't miss it. I first visited HK in the seventies and then lived there for 6 years in the nineties. Visited plenty of times for business in the 21st century. Every time the harbour gets smaller as more and more reclamation takes place. Indeed, once the MTR was built there is no rational reason to take the Star Ferry, except that it is probably the greatest value for money of almost any public transportation ride. It also has the greatest view - the HK skyline. So take a few extra minutes. Jump on a boat and take yourself to Tsi Sha Tsui or Central - remember to flick the seat backs to face the right direction - and remember how HK used to be.

The number 1 thing for tourists to do in Hong Kong . Cheap activity that offers great views of the harbour. Should be on every visitors to do list for young and old. Air conditioned malls at each end provide welcome relief to the heat.

Iconic. an absolute must to travel on this iconic ferry between Hong Kong and Kowloon. The age of the buildings and ferries just add to the experience. Tokens are purchased by a machine but change is given - easy to work out.
Quick and easy with great views. The ferry is a quick and efficient way to move between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. It gives you great views of the city and is very cheap.

HK$ 3.5 buys you this amazing tourist attraction. This is one of the best tourist attractions in the world, and such value! The star ferry runs continually between Hong Kong and Kowloon all day and at night time , carrying residents workers and tourists. The views of the skyline and the land beyond and of the harbour are brilliant, whether it is broad daylight or after dark when all the lights come up.
Classic Hong Kong!. You cannot say that you have come to HK without riding on the Star Ferry. This is war HK is. A classic mode of transportation not to be missed!

When in Hong Kong.... The 10375th review of the Hong Kong Star Ferry! It is what one does when visiting Hong Kong and answers the question of why the chicken caught the Star Ferry; because he wanted to go shopping on the other side.

DEFINETELY a must see... and its a qurter.... It is one of Hong Kong staples... they are OK, the ride is short but, you get to see the skyline of Island AND Kowloon from various angles.Go to central for Hollywood, the mid-level escalator.....place to eat, shop on the street PARRALLEL to Hollywood, downhill..Or, to Wanchai for the bars/restaurants/convention center...AND , don't forget to ride the tram.. the Ding-Ding they say locals call it...

Worth doing. . What a great way to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. It doesn't take long to do the journey, but a nice way to relax and travel at the same time. The ferries are clean, reliable and very very cheap. Tickets can be purchased at ticket machines at either end or just scan your Octopus card. They operate day or night, early till late. These ferries are a big part of Hong Kong's history, and these vessels are old. They are beautifully built and even the ferry men still wear traditional clothing.

A trip down memory lane. A definite must experience as there are opportunities to take lots of pictures of both sides of the harbour. Although I live here, I love taking the ferry as it gives a moment to sit back and relax.. Inexpensive way to travel!
Transport. Iconic to Hong Kong a must do, very cheap very frequent way of crossing Victoria harbour to Kowloon.
A piece of "Old HK". Just a must do while in Hong Kong which is a great way to see the Harbour by night and day on some aged but well maintained ferries!

Excellent and reasonable prices - worth using this service. Used the Star Ferry to get across from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Prices are very reasonable and ferries are always available. A wonderful way to take in the surrounding sights.
Star Ferry Trip. Went on star ferry which takes you over to Kowloon , it's a short journey but you can see all around Victoria Harbour , we had a walk around Kowloon before heading back to central .
Amazing View. Get an amazing view of the city at a cheap price (2HKD). Would recommend going at night because of the bright lights and cooler temperature outside during the summer.
The best way to go to other islands. Even the local people prefer to take the Star Ferry (low cost) more than the metro. It is a local way to go to Kowloon. I loved the experience
Great. This is a great way to cross the harbour. Just a short 10 minute trip. Ridiculously cheap at around HKD2.5. Take the upper deck for the best views

A must. Ridiculously good value and lovely views across the harbour. A quintessential HK experience - note upper and lower decks have to be chosen before you go through the ticket gate - there is standing room but if you want a seat near the windows (all open decks) get on quickly

Fast & felt like a local. Cheap, quick and easy, run really frequently up to midnight. There is also an air-conditioned section if you are feeling the heat. Drop off point is right in the action, for the museums or shops, shops, shops!.
Fun and easy to travel around.. What a fun way to travel. Get change for the tokens, very cheap! We travelled back and forwards to central but the harbour tour came recommended too.

Short and hot. "A must" when in Hong Kong some claim. I think not. Views over the harbour equally nice from ashore and the subway quicker and above all, cooler. If it is hot as when we were here, walking to/from the ferry is sweaty and since the harbour on central side is a but from where you're likely going, it's a walk.

Great experience! Will do it again . This was a great little trip! We enjoyed crossing the island and the price isn't too bad at all. We took the ferry in the evening so were able to see all the lights, etc. Will recommend this activity

Iconic trip across the Harbour. This is the best way to cross the harbour for views of HK island and Kowloon too! Catching it is easy and cheap too, just make sure you have enough change to pay the fare, or buy an Octopus card if you are here for more than a day as travel around HK mounts up.
Brilliant!!. Cannot go to Hong Kong without going on the Star Ferry - trip one way for 4 of us was so so cheap!! Such an easy way to get around!!
Cheap, quick, local means to catch views of the city. Great way to go across the harbour to Central HK. And cheap! Nice views of the city, and a convenient way to travel.
Day n Night view. Hong Kong view from star ferry was fantastic. Day and night view gave different feel of Hong Kong. Especially at night, Hong Kong buildings full of lights.
Easy and Cheap. The staff ferry is a cheap and pleasant way to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. Easy to purchase tickets and cheap.

Average but still worth a go for first timers. Be careful with the weather as it can be choppy as it was for us. However it is one of those things you have to do in Hong Kong. Use your Octopus MTR card that you buy at any railway station.
Must do. Any visit to Hong Kong or Kowloon must include a trip on the iconic very practical Star Ferry journey. Beware it's more expensive at the weekend - ha ha ha. A few pence more. Well worth it.
Smoke on the water!. No smoke - but the smog that sometimes stays over the Hong Kong area. However the boatjpurney fro Knowloon to Central is a really nice and refreshing trip.

Cheap and convenient transport. Public transport on water. Clean, punctual and reliable.
Toilets at Tsi Sha Tsiu are appalling-can smell them from a distance. Truly taking your life in your hands if you use them. Use the loos ONLY IF DESPERATE!!

Nice. It is the fastest medium to connect yourself from tsim sha tsui with the main hongkong city. It was too cool and breezey night to enjoy the fairy more. One should once use this fairy for sure to experience the travel.
Good ride. Had a good ride, something worth doing while in Hong Kong. The day we travelled the water was a bit choppy, but still a very comfortable ride.
Good plan!. Good and cheap way of visiting HK and have a great view of the island bay! Really easy to buy tickets and well located.

Don't miss the last ferry. The ferry runs timely between Kowloon and HK island. Very cheap mode of transportation with great views of the city. I missed the last ferry going back to Kowloon and hooked a ride on a Sampan which made for an interesting ride.

Great fun!. This is a good way to see the Hongkong skyline from both sides.
Use your Octopus card to get on board.

I don't get the fuss around a ferry ⛴ . I have read this is one of the 50 must see places in a lifetime by national geographic.Either I went on the wrong one, or I really dont get it. It's a ferry. Takes 10 minutes. You go from the island to the main land or back if you would like.Best to sit on the top floor but note that in order to do that, you have to queue on the top floor of the peer.There are about 8 ferries but I believe they are all modern.The real attraction seems to be the Aqua Luna, the old fashioned fishing ship. I can't comment on that as I haven't been yet, but it's the one in all the street paintings and seems to portray the essence of HK.
Practical AND touristy. We used this as a mode of transport and enjoyed the experience. Top deck ofcourse . Avoided the MTR rush in peak time .

One of the cheapest ferries in the world. Great to get out on the harbor for HKD$2.50 on the lower level a bit more on top level between Kowloon and Central.
Enjoy!!
Worth the experience. Took the ferry just to try out a different mode of transport in Hong Kong. Worth the experience but if you are in a hurry just take the MTR.
public transport octopus card. Great way to see the harbour and get around cheaply on the public bus. Very efficient transport system.
cruise. Beautiful cruise to cross the harbour. Especially in the evening, you can feel the breeze see the beautiful shoreline.

Must Must Must ride. You can't say you have been to HK without riding the Star Ferry. Many visitors take the ride for an up-close look at Victoria Harbour, one of the world’s most photographed harbours. Although the distance between HK and Kowloon is getting shorter so as the Star Ferry ride, it's still amazing to get on the Star Ferry and amaze yourself how beautiful HK is. The adult fare is just HK$3.4 during weekend and public holiday. Yes it's in HK$. The ride takes about 10 mins compares to taking taxi or bus which may stuck in the cross harbour tunnels. This activity is suitable for all ages.
Must do. Iconic boat trip from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon and back. Included free with Hop on Hop Off bus tours. Lasts about 10 minutes each way

Star Ferry Magic. You have not been to Hong Kong unless you have ridden the Star Ferry. At HK$2.50 (About 50 cent Australian) it is a great deal.Star ferries have been crossing the harbour for over 100 years, and it is still a great way to see the city. Crossing at night is an amazing spectacle, with the city lights reflecting off the water as well.This is a great way to fall in love with Hong Kong.
Boat ride. A quick cheep boat ride from one side of the bay to the other. Plenty of room and good view of the bay and buildings worth a go once

convenient and easy to travel. This is a great way to travel between the two island, it is very convenient way to travel and it is spacious. You can see the view of both island and the type of boat is quite unique. You can pay at a machine or you can use Octopus card which is more convenient as most public transport use it.
Part of the history. Great short ferry ride across to Kowloon. It's costs nothing and at night the views back to the island are just stunning. A must do for anyone who visits Hong Kong

Great passenger service in air conditioned ferry that runs between Ma Wan (Park Island) and Central/Victoria Harbour. Easily accessible terminals either in Central or Victoria Harbour in Kowloon. I stayed in Ma Wan this trip and took the ferry for my trips to Kowloon and Central. The seats are comfortable. The cool air-conditioned passenger compartment is a great relief from the stiffing summer heat and humidity. The trips were pleasant and scenery spectacular.

Step back in time. Views from the ferry at night looking back to HK skyline amazing, if not exactly 'green'. Illuminated sky-scrapers offer a unique light show. Travelling on this ferry is like stepping back in time, a reminder of how far this City has come. A must-do in HK.

cheap, comfortable and great views. A great way to get across the water and enjoy some scenery. Either buy a ticket on the go or use your octopus card (which you should definitely invest in if you are in Hong Kong longer than 3 days). The trip is short and sweet and allows you to enjoy some impressive views (somewhat hampered by widespread construction right now). The low cost makes it excellent value for money.
Unique experience. This ride takes you back in time machine. very sweet experience at cost of only HKD 2 !!!! Strongly recommended
My wife loved it and I love the price !. Cheapest harbour ferry in the world still abs no matter how many times you go across , it's always amazing to see that skyline , night or day ..

Quite good. 1. It was easy to reach the (mall) having the port. There are multiple ports, so this point may not be valid.2. It was not pleasant and easy to find where the ticket window is, what the queue was for. So, we lined up, and they asked for ticket. They instructed us to get ticket from other location (same floor, in the mall).3. The people selling the ticket, intentionally gave us costlier ticket. That's bad! 4. We showed them ticket they said it is after 1 hour! The current (fast, costly) water-jet is about to leave. We cannot board the cheaper (ordinary one, which runs at 10-20 minutes frequency). We had to wait for not mistake from our end. There were no instructions anywhere.5. After 1 hour we queued up again, and asked for window seat, they affirmed it is window seat. We were the tourists over there, we wanted to SEE places, and you intentionally gave us a wall-facing so-called window seat? Terrible! Other people didn't care if it was window seat or not, as they were regulars/locals - they weren't looking outside at all! This was worst, and only bad experience in Hong Kong! Tourists should be given good seats.[No Window seat, no photos to share!]
So cheap and fun!. Costs only 2.5 hongkong dollar. The views are great! Really fun to do. Must be even better in the evenings.
Lots of Fun, staple of HKG. Would Hong Kong be HKG without the Star Ferry? It's a staple of the city and you would be missing out if you skipped the experience.
Hong Kong to Kowloon. Sail with Star Ferry and find gorgeous scenery, Hong Kong skyline, beaches, the ferry starts from morning till midnight and its cheap.
A real treat. No visit to Honk Kong is complete without a ride on the Star Ferry. Take the 10 minute ride to Kowloon and the 1.5 Harbor Cruise. The views are stunning.

Star Ferry. We took the ride on MTR from Tsimshatsui to Central station. On our return to Tsimshatsui we took the Star Ferry at half the cost of the MTR. On the ride of the Star Ferry you can catch a good glimpse of the Victoria Harbour.
Cheap and efficient way to get over to the island. A must thing to do when you are in Homg Kong - cheap but so easy to do and a great way to see the harbour

Good experience. We travelled to the central ferry from the star pier and the ferry was the fastest and cheapest mode to reach there.
We can use the octopus card and it was a good experience. Can enjoy good views and take good snaps.
good old days. it's a great way to cross the harbour. and it is so cheap that actually i have taken twice. the view is really spectacular.
Convenient and accessible. Can use the Octopus pass on this transport. Sit on the upper deck to get best views. Clean and reliable. Great way to get across from one side of the island to the other.

Iconic and cheap. Great way to travel and take in the iconic scenery of Victoria Harbour. For the 15 minute journey, you can forget the hustle and bustle of the crowded streets and just enjoy the view of both sides of the Harbour. Bus / taxi hubs on either side to take you to your next destination.

Always pleasing. A trip on the Star Ferry is an iconic moment for all visitors. From the slightly wobbling gang ways to the views of Kowloon and Victoria Island this is quintissential Hong Kong. It is so cheap and the boats so frequent it is a real pleasure to use.

Relaxing inter-island transportation. For people without motion sickness, this is one stress-free ride that you'll enjoy when crossing Tsim Tsa Tsui and Central/Wanchai. Specially at night during the symphony of lights, no any other best vantage point but the middle of the victoria harbour to enjoy the light show.

A great way to travel!. The Star ferry offers a very efficient service, no sooner does the ferry arrive it's loaded up quickly with passengers for yet another quick trip.
Excellent viewing of the harbour and shoreline from the ferry!

Great way to get across the bay. We decided to take the star ferry on our way back from Victoria peak. It was a manageable walk from the tram station and there is really good signage along the way so you don't get lost.This really was the cheapest way to get across back to Kowloon at only HK$2.50 per person to get across. You pay more for the harbour cruise.Can get a different view of the HK skyline from the ferry as well as get to feel like a local. It's quite quick too with the trip lasting about 10mins.
Hot and crowded. Taking the star ferry sounded like fun, until I realized its super crowded and humid. The 10 minutes it took from Wanchai to Kowloon felt like forever. View is incredible from ship.

One to tick off the list. Very cheap and a great way to get to Kowloon, plenty of seats and clean, also a gre tway to see the skyline and gst some pictures for the album. Buying tickets is easy and be prepared for crowds at rush hours., plenty of pushing and shoving
Must try if you visit Hong Kong. you can cross the harbour in a relaxing way and cheap price . When the weather is good or at night time, you can enjoy amazing harbour view with sea breeze.

A must! . I live in Hong Kong and still love traveling on the ferry from Central to TST. The crossing takes about 7 minutes and the Harbour is usually calm so a great trip even for those motion sickness sufferers like me! Plus it's really cheap around USD0.38 for a one way trip, can't get better value than that!
From Hong Kong Island to TSIM Sha Tsui Kowloon. The best ride from Hong Kong Island to TSIM Sha Tsui, Kowloon. You have not been to Hong Kong yet if you never go on the Star Ferry!

Relaxed way to see the Harbour. The Star Ferry goes from Central ( further out from IFC) to Tsimshatsui on Kowloon side. A great place to get some nice photos of the skyline of HK. A more relaxed way to cross the Harbour when the subway is full of people. I prefer the upper deck where I can't smell or hear the engine. The whole journey takes about 15 min which I find very enjoyable and is the shortest way to go to Ocean Terminal, Harbour City and the Gateway which is a very big shopping area.

Enjoyable. A short trip across the bay, it takes around 10mins. Cost 2 Hong Kong dollars, (20p) in British money. We used our octopus card. Plenty of ferries running constantly , so short wait. Plenty seats.
Best ferry ride in the world . You won't find a ferry with a better view than the Star Ferry. And at HK$2.50 for a ticket it's the best deal in town. Locals, tourists. Everyone loves the Star Ferry.

Amazing Value. This is a great way to view HK from the water. The ferry ride is short but long enough to take a few pictures and the pier is centrally located providing another opportunity to take in the amazing skyline.Its also incredibly cheap.

Nice trip. Pity about the commentary.. We went on the 1 hour cruise around the harbour. Price was good, $18.00 Aud per person. You get a complimentary sift drink and biscuits. Star Ferry should change their commentary. They tell you about the landmatks but unfortunately dont tell you where to look. Would have been grestif they told us port or starboard.Overall well worth the money. Great way to see how huge Hong Kong is.

Worth a trip!. The Star Ferry is an icon in Hong Kong and definitely worth a trip across the harbour. We timed our trip to coincide with the Symphony of Lights and it was a great view. I would highly recommend that you buy an Octopus Card and use this to get on the ferry. That way, your not lining up to buy a ticket and you can get on very quickly. Departure times vary and the trip its self is only around 8 minutes. There's no air conditioning so try and be near the windows...
Quick and Easy Transport. Quick and Easy transport to travel from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon or vice versa. Nice view of the icon buildings of HK.

Any visit to Hong Kong MUST include the Star Ferry. Any visit to Hong Kong must include a ride on the Star Ferry. I have been coming to Hong Kong for over thirty years now, and riding the Star Ferry between Kowloon and Hong Kong is something I can never get tired of doing. Every visit to Hong Kong will see me ride the Star Ferry multiple times. Like the Trams on Hong Kong Island (another must do) the Star Ferry is a dirt cheap mode of transport that offers million dollar views as your cross Hong Kong's famous Victoria Harbour. Tip: Ride upstairs and sit at either end to get the best photos.
Lovely old boat. Well what can you say ... It it didn't sink during my trip so 10 out of 10, the views of Hong Kong and Kowloon are amazing so grab a few pictures..
Good service . It's a nice service for the residents and tourists alike. Convinient mode of transportation from Kowloon to the harbor front.

Nostalgic crossing . You can just walk up to the vending machines at the Star Ferry in Kowloon it's located at the bottom of Canton Road and on the Hong Kong side it's near Hong Kong mtr purchase a token with coins but I think now you can use your Octopus card it's a nice was way to go across Victoria Harbour with the family but if your pressed for time catch the Mtr it's quicker.
Fun on the water. It was a short walk from our hotel to the star ferry, hassle free travel on the harbour, great for a photo or two with family & friends.
Perfect. I regularly use the star ferry when i travel to Hong Kong and its perfect. Always on time, very cheap (28p) and only 8-10 mins journey.

Dirt cheap mode of transport .. A must if you are visiting HK. Super cheap and fantastic views of the shore and city line. Try to go to both ports to enjoy the full view of the city skyline. Evenings could be nice ti explore here.
Ferry day!!!!. Cheap fare with matching fully mesmerizing views while on boad...great rides i have experienced;nit just once but many times

Dollar for dollar, no better value. Nothing can match the views of the harbor--the Star Ferry is basic, efficient public transportation that doubles as a tourist attraction! Best bargain in Hong Kong.

A must when visiting Hong Kong. My first trip back to Hong Kong in 41 years - and the Star Ferry is still a favourite.
7 minutes to cross the harbour - and each time something different to see.
I recommend sitting upstairs - and if you can- take the ferry both ways at night around 8pm - when the Symphony of Light show is on.
CHEAP. You can easily find the Star Ferry terminal. its near the KCR clock tower. Ferry's are very clean. but they leave on time. though you miss your ferry you will get next one in 5 minutes.

Fun on your own or with company. I used this ferry to get from kowloon side to central and back again a few times.. I am not good on boats but the ride is short and for sickly travellers it might even be better as you get a welcomed breeze on the water (unlike the MTR).. the view is lovely and i would recommend doing in the day or night time. v easy to use.

Cheap and easy way to see Hong Kong's Victoria Harbour. The Star Ferry is a great way to get across the harbour if you want great views and are not in a hurry. The piers on both sides are easy to get to and the signage is simple to navigate. In terms of the ride, the ambience is fun.

A nice way to introduce water taxi to the family. A short journey between the island and mainland really a nice way to introduce HK. We took the Central to TST ferry, had our lunch @ the Harbour City, then take the ferry back from TST to Wanchai. Really nice to cover all area.

One for remembrance.. Nostalgic trip across harbour to visit Victoria Harbour. Classic and cheap mode of transport.We went on Sunday and boarded the ferry as as on as we arrived. Use octopus card for convenience.
A nifty and Inexpensive way to travel from the Island to Kowloon. In a bustling, busy city; this was enforced chill- out time. Nice breeze on the harbor. Plenty of seating. Use your Octopus card.

Cheapest and most scenic way to cross the harbour. Riding the ferry is the cheapest method to cross the harbour. In the summer, it can be quite hot to take the ferry but I recommend standing by the side to take photos and enjoying the breeze. The upper deck is slightly more expensive but not necessary much nicer of a few. You can usually take nice photos standing in the lower deck.
Sit on the top deck for the best views. From Central Pier sit on the right and from Tsim Sha Sui sit on the left to get the best views of the Hong Kong skyline
Shopping trip. Very easy to use and so cheap!! Efficient service, I would suggest they stuck very well to their timetable. Loved their sailor uniform.
No trip is complete. No trip to Hong Kong is complete without a trip on the Star Ferry. Crosses Kowloon to Hong Kong every few minutes, and costs pennies!

Excellent connectivity to Macau. Star Ferry terminal is a terminal to catch ferry to different islands one such is Macau. You can catch Turbojet to Macau from this terminal. It has a immigration counter too.Try to avail online tickets for ferries to avoid waiting in queue and to get a good price.
Breezy. really cheap. took it from wan chai to tsim sha shui and it only cost me 3HKD. quite an old boats but I guess that's what's great about it
Fun to do. The difference between the traditional boats and the super modern skyline is just big. But it is a nice way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong island!

Cheap, reliable. We were staying very close to the ferry so it only took a few minutes to walk from the Sheraton on Nathan Rd in Kowloon to the ferry which zips you across the channel to Hong Kong in minutes. It was nice to do once, but then we usually took the underground after that because it was air conditioned and faster.

Cheap and quick way across the harbor. Star Ferry is much cheaper to cross the harbor that the metro. About 2.8 HKD on weekends, 2.2 on week days, service every 15 minutes or so. We used it twice- no concerns. Metro will also need lots and lots of walking.Facilities were very similar to what I say in Sydney's Circular Quay
A short ride, but inexpensive and fun. This was my favorite kind of boat ride, short and sweet. Great views going in both directions. It costs less than 1 USD.
fun way to cross the Harbor. very fun and cheap way to cross the harbor. I recommend it to everyone as it gives you a view of the skyline on both sides.

Great Way to See the City. This was a surprisingly fast mode of transportation and a great way to see the skyline from both sides of the harbour. Absolutely cheap, and a bit of a throwback to the past, you need to take this at least once during your stay. A hint would be to take it around 8pm, so you can get a close up seat for the light show.
A must if visiting Hong Kong . So cheap at 60 pence per person each way and provides spectacular photo opportunities at night . A very short crossing so be quick with your photo opportunities.
Best Value. Still the best value for your money, a family of 5 can get across for cheap compared to MTR and take pictures along the way.

Only if you have time to go inland (or for photographs). The ferry ride is really nothing special, fortunately departures are frequent and the trip is short. We had free tickets but not enough time to visit Nathan st. or the market, so we only spent a short time in the mall at the Kowloon side - an extremely expensive brand name mall. If you're into photography then I would recommend the ride, the views of the Hong Kong skyline are great even when the weather is not perfect.
