Free Ride for Senior Octopus card Holders. You can ride the star ferry for free if you have a senior octopus card. When you enter the ferry terminal gate, you still need to tap the gate sensor with the octopus card but it would show a zero charge on it. Any foreigner can purchase senior octopus card by showing the proof of age.

Cheap and great. Just as said above its a great and cheap way to get from a to b while observing some amazing sites at the same time :) didn't go on it at night which I regret but in the day it was a great experience

Winter Family Breakaway . Extremely impressive efficient Ferry service. Simplified booking process via coin operated machine for tokens.Stunning views of Hong Central from the Star Ferry deck. Excellent views expecially in the late after showcasing Hong Kong Central By Night! "I would this over and over again said". Victor Sibeko.

Awesome - The Charming Star Ferry Pier at Tsim Sha Tsui Kowloon. It's humble Star Ferry of Hong Kong which many Tourists take a ride for an up-close look at one of the World's Harbours. I purchased the Ticket in $HK cash at the Tsim Sha Tsui Star Ferry Pier and the ride was excellent to Central HongKong. One must take a ride when visiting Hong Kong.

Relaxing Evening - Star Ferry. One should not miss this fun of taking 2 hours magnificent view of Kowloon side and Hongkong side island. One should try this during the winter time as the summers are quite hot and humid.
Great way to travel. An interesting way to travel. Great way to see the harbour and the waterfront. It's a very busy service.

The coolest and cheapest way across . The star ferry is a "sea" mark of Hong Kong and serves you a great way to admire the skyline at a very modest price.Traveling above is nicer and the view wider. There are outside and A/C seats for everyone to choose.You can cross from Kowloon to HK or Wan Chai and back and will find tourists and locals going backwards and forwards.Really nice trip not to be missed.

Cheap travel. The Star Ferry is a quick way to travel between areas of Hong Kong for a very cheap fare. The Octopus card will get you in and there are wonderful views of the city while you move between areas.

Cool. Nothing special. AC good. No attendants I found. May be I missed them. System well organised. No hiccups. Pre book n travel hassle free. Ask hotel people specifically n they will help u there. Before travel , ur travel agent will help u. Ask all details clearly to avoid troubles

Great fun and amazing views. Views both day and night are worth the trip, but also a cheap and easy way to cross over to Kowloon or HK island. Buy an Octopus car when you arrive at the station.Reliable, frequent and fun to use. Recommend.

Great way to travel if you're not in a rush. The ferry is great for getting across the harbour if you're not in a rush. They run on time and are really cheap. They also offer a great view of both the Central and Kowloon skylines. Seniors ride free I think.

Such an Experience crossing with Skyline View. Using star ferry is my first option when i want to across from Kowloon to Hong Kong island and vice versa. It is cheap and only take around 5 mins to go from one point to another point. When you are on board, you can see Hong Kong's skyline in the both island which is so spectacular especially in the night.

A short tranquil ride in an otherwise busy city . We did this journey 3times on our stay as part of the big bus tour and it was a peaceful and beautiful crossing to and from Hong Kong island. Unsure of the individual price but the MTR would be a much cheaper option which we did on one occasion to experience something different. However, it is an efficient way to travel and also gives you beautiful views and a taste of peacefulness in an otherwise busy city.

Fun, cheap and amazing. If in Hong Kong travelling by star ferry is a must, a trip to HK without is a trip thats not complete. Great way to get from Island to TST and back, much preferable to underground

Best Value Way to See Hong Kong and Kowloon. Get across the harbor in style on the Star Ferry! For only a few HK dollar you can take this 5-10 minute ferry across the harbor and enjoy the views. It's especially nice at night when the skyline lights up spectacularly.

The charm is that it DOESN'T feel toursity. So authentic. The boat are OLD (that's another charming angle) but so well maintained. After the hustle and bustle of either cities, it such a refreshing break.

Very nice and cheap trip between the Hing Kong Island and Kowloon. We took the Star Ferry to reach to our hotel in Kowloon from the Hong Kong Island. Going on the ferry we wondered how come such a tourist attraction (view of the HK shoreline - both the Island and Kowloon) can come at a price of just a few Hong Kong Dollars. I recommend taking the Ferry to everyone visiting HK.

It is a typical ferry. Caught the ferry from Central across the harbour - supposedly a 'must do' but, whilst not unpleasant, I must have missed the magic feeling with which I was supposed to be imbued

We took our grandson for the experience to Hongkong Island. It is a very efficient form of transport to get from Kowloon to Hongkong Island & backThe view going both ways is pleasant & they run frequently. It is worth a trip to have the experience. Unfortunately the Ferry itself is not modern. There is also a rush to get on & off & sometimes people push you

A great way to see the city. Was super cheap by simply using our octopus cards. The swaying, history heaving boat was a fun way to see the whole city with a 360 degree view, its felt like an adventure! It was a short ride on the waves and got us to the other side on time.
Quick, easy and cheap. The ferry is the only way to cross the harbor, very easy to access, quick, easy to board and very central. Its a basic ferry, but well worth the trip

The wonderful Star Ferry. A must thing to do when in Hong Kong. At Christmas take the star ferry to view the towns Christmas Lights. The Star Ferry is a cheap way to get to Kowloon side and it never gets boring. One of my favourite modes of transport in Hong Kong.

Efficient and Easy to Use. The terminal is a long walk along a bridge from the city, but the ferries are incredibly efficient just like the trains. Go out to the islands or just between the city and Kowloon and use the one card on all transport

Fantastic way to get around. The only way to travel in Hong Kong. Very inexpensive and the experience is one to remember, once you travel on the star ferry you'll want to do more trips to experience the journey from different angles.

Short trip but worthwhile. We used our octopus card which costs around £2 each for the trip, which we thought was great value. You get a different perspective on the city and is a great and efficient way to travel.
Better than Subway. Better and cheaper than subway, allow great view on Hong Kong and very quickGood at nigh or day light

Love using this ferry. You just have to use this ferry when you want to go between HK and HK Island! It gives you a time to just sit, relax and enjoy the view! HK can be a busy place - so take the ferry and just watch.....it's always cheap and reliable!
Star Ferry. This is probably the best deal In all of Hong Kong. The ride and view across Victoria Harbor is one that you will never forget. It is a must when visiting Hong Kong.

Great view of city skyline. This is my favorite mode of transport in Hong Kong as it offers a great view of the city's skyline both day and night. I like to ride it from the Tsim Sha Tsui ferry terminal to Central terminal and always opt for the lower deck. The cooling sea breeze was very relaxing too.
Brilliant and cheap. For 20HKD (adult) you can't go wrong. Regular, quick, easy and fun. Lovely views of the city and very simple to hop on. Our toddler loved it!

A MUST for all visiting HK!. This is a ride that is memorable for all visitors of all ages - try both upper and lower decks. Personally like the lower deck because it's so cool being close to the water! If you take it at around 8pm, you'll get to catch the light show on the water, which is pretty spectacular!

feel the breeze. we tried the MTR from kowloon to hong kong island..it good if you know where you are going and fast..but most times we used the STAR FERRY..about 2.50/adult crossing and i got concession for over 65..it better of course if the weather is mild..once on the island we either walked or used the tram..get a seat on the top deck for a better view and make sure you are on the correct ramp for boarding....the ferries leave about every 10 mins both ways..so there is no long waiting...siting on the ferry after a hard day shopping is very relaxing

Still the cheapest way to cross the harbor with best view!. Rode this when I grew up and now being back, it's still great; fare the cheapest to cross the harbor with unbeatable views of Central and the Island when going to Wan Chai. Boarding is easy and I recommend trying both upper and lower decks. Not air conditioned though but the breeze is good enough. Have spare change for fares since no bills accepted unless you use Octopus the transport card

good, cheap and fun way to cross. easy to reach, fun ferry to cross to the other side. must try it at least once. try it independently rather than as part of a package by some operator. you can use your octopus card here

Always Take this ferry at least once every visit. Again, not my first time taking this ferey, fast, cheap and fun... what else you can ask. My wife will ask me to come and take this ferey no matter what... quite fun except... i can get sea sick easily...

Fire Work on Star Ferry. It worth you all if in Hong Kong you go seeing the fire work on Star Ferry at 8pm. I grade it one of the most spectacular night view in the world. Besides, it is also the cheapest ferry ride with the most great night scenery .

As easy as breathing. Star Ferry is very convinient and costs almost nothing. Buy an Octopus card at every MTR station and go by ferry to cross from Hongkong Island to Kowloon side...do in the morning to watch the city getting up, go during lunch time to have a look at the busy boat traffic and go at the evening to enjoy hundreds of lights from the skyline - just do it!

Efficient, cheap, comfortable and fast!. Took the star ferry when travelling between HK side and Kowloon side. This is a much better transportation ride than using the MTR as it cost much less. It has very efficient system and provides comfortable ride too!!!
Cheap way to go across the harbour. It is a lot cheaper to take the ferry than to use the MTR subway. A little bit slow but it is a long Hong Kong tradition that anyone should try.

A must do!. If you have the privilege of visiting Hong Kong you definitely must try the Star Ferry. It costs very little and gives wonderful views of both sides of the bay. It's fast, easy and a joy to travel in. Even in bad weather the views can be amazing.

Classic. Classic way in crossing the TST and Central, love seeing the views and enjoy the ride. Cheap, reliable, only 9 mins. You can use Octopus card to pay, the signs are easy to follow. It's worth to try when you're visiting HK, board it at night for citylight views.

Convenient!. Like all other public transportations in Hong Kong, traveling via the ferry is very convenient and reasonable. With quite a few nice small islands to visit, the ferry is another wonderful addition for Hong Kong tourists/visitors.

You have to take the ferry. No visit to HK is complete without a ferry ride. It's old, banged up, slow but charming, cheap and the views are beautiful. Join the queue before boarding to make sure you have good seats.
Amazing view of HK skyline. Perfect view to go either during the day or night, easy access through the metro. Also in a crowded area with lots of shops and restaurants. Truly recommended

Excellent way to see the harbour. Great trip across the harbour without having to pay tourist prices on tourist ferries. Note the ferries at 8pm are absolutely packed as people time their journey with symphony of lights.

Nice Ferry. This ferry is a cheap and convenient way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong Islands. This is a very popular route with tourists and both stations are in popular tourist areas. It is usually crowded as it is cheap and frequent. The tickets are 2HK$ and there are many self service machines. It provides beautiful river views on clear days.
Tour with the locals!. We did this and had a great experience. It is the way of the locals and perfect for little harbour tour.
Quick trip back and from Hong Kong Island. Ideal to use if you want to get to the island. We used it a number of times as part of our hop on hop off bus ticket.

sightseeing. you must catch a ferry over the harbour
they travel to numerous places and out lying islands
is a great way to see the sights from the water

Great mode of transport. This is a great and very inexpensive way to get around between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. tickets very easy to buy at self service machines and self explanatory. especially at night taxis are not keen to transport you to place on Hong Kong island if originating from there and the same with Kowloon. So may be worth hopping the ferry to get your taxi. Also a cheap alternative for a river boat with great views in the day

Cheap, Crowded, Smelly But Authentic. If you have read some of my other reviews, you will notice that I am a stickler for authenticity. I love cultural experiences - The Star Ferry is just another cultural experience. The fishy ocean smell; the crowded people on their way to work across the harbour; the smell of diesel smoke pouring out of the ferries stacks. This is what I expect in Hong Kong.

Star ferry. Fantastic way to experience Victoria HarbourAt 2.5HKD an inexpensive ride from Kowloon to Central on Hong Kong island. Ferries run regularly (every 15-20 minutes), are clean and efficient.
Cheap and convenient way. Great way to travel between kowloon and hk island. Both side arrived at the heart of the city. Also a great view along the way. And a quick ride as well
Easy transport. Great way to travel when you are constrained by time. Provides sight seeing opportunity for the first timer to get across the two islands. Reasonably priced.

Beautiful Skyline Views. Always do this when we have visitors to HK. It is the best way to see the sky line and cross the harbour and it only costs a few dollars as well. Hong Kong has one of the best Public Transportation systems in the world and once you have crossed to Kowloon you can get a bus to practically anywhere from the TST bus station by the star ferry. The same on Central too coming the other way. We advise crossing at different times of day to see the buildings in a different light...

Great way to get a different view of the harbour.. Made a couple of trips on the ferry during our few days in Hong Kong. Day and night trips should be on everyone's agenda to get two different perspectives.Inexpensive and efficient way to get from the Island to the mainland.
Nice old fashioned ride. Fast and cheap way to move. I used it a lot between Kowloon and Central. Highly recommended. Great view to the skyline and Harbour
Best way to see both sides of the harbour!. Love taking the star ferry! It's a fun, leisure 5-6 minute ride across the harbour! Love watching the BEAUTIFUL skyline!

Must!. It is enjoyable to travel by star ferry between Tsim Sa Tsui and Central and spectacular view shouldn't be missing! I found all the stars in chairs this time, which are quite well fit in the ferry interior. Highly recommended at least once in HK.

Coffee on Star Ferry: cool way to start the day. From Kowloon to Central, Star Ferry is the coolest way to cross the bay. Early morning, grab a coffee at Starbucks just across from the ferry terminal, buy a token for a few cents, and embark on 1960's old wood and brass boats.
Sipping coffee while enjoying the most beautiful view of Victoria Harbour: way to start the day !

Quick and hassle free getting around HK. My family enjoyed their trips with the ferry. A very cost effective way of getting from Kowloon to HK Island... with an added bonus of splendid views over many parts of HK. We used the service around mid day and late at night and found the ferry ride equally pleasant and efficient.

Cheap n Uncongested Travel. This is the best way to travel across from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island if one is not in a hurry, wants to avoid the crowded MTR and at the same time take in the view along the habour. There are also plenty of shops at the Star Ferry Terminal and its linked to Harbour City too.
Star Ferry. HK Insitution. This is the best and cheapest way to travel over water to the other side. It is nice as the breeze from the harbour is a nice respite from the heat and humidity

A relaxing hour. . Recommended. Nice air conditioned boat. Friendly staff. We sat inside and outside but the interior was very comfortable and quite upscale we thought. Only issue was the recorded commentary on our boat was always having issues. We did the $95HK ride which was a great way to see the city.
Relaxing. I enjoyed he trip and the views were very interesting, it is a good way to get to Lanteau Island and relaxing on he boat
Alternative moda transportation . Tried it once, another means of transportation in Hong Kong, nothing special though. Very short distance from IFC Mall to TST.

Must do. Traveling on the star ferry is just so relaxing, I can spend a long time just going back and forth. Make sure you sit on the upper deck(just slightly more expensive) If you can't stand the smell of fuel. Breath in Hong Kong day and night, avoid if it's foggy, pretty scary, took 30mins just to get across and usually takes less than 10mins.
Beautiful and calm. Every visitor to HK should take this trip over to HK island its a must and the view of Victoria harbour is great for photos!!

Nice and Cheap Options to Go to Hongkong Island. Should you want to travel from Tsim Sha Tsui to Hongkong Island, you may choose this transportation option with very cheap price. It also providess very nice view from the boat.

Best way to travel from Kowloon to HK Island. Definitely my favorite way traveling between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. A must on any trip to Hong Kong.The Star Ferry is an iconic service in the city. The ferries are traditional with wooden benches and open air. No air conditioning here. Usually not to crowded. Can though get a bit hot during sunny summer days.

A Must Do in HK. We caught the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Central at night. Ferries are regular, it's easy to do with an Oyster card, it's cheap and the skyline at night was breathtaking! A great change from the MTR
Cheap and quick. The ferry is quick, cheap and easy to cross between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Regular and constant departures makes it so easy with minimal waiting time.

Fun and easy trip to see the harbor.. The ferry is easy to find and use, and a fun way to get between Central and Kowloon, with good views from the boat. It takes a little more time than the train so only if not in a rush.
Great experience!. A nice change from the hustle and bustle of the MTR or bus bus when needing to get across the harbour- allows a great view of city skyline and Victoria Harbour.
A Definite Must in Hong Kong. This is a Hong Kong tradition going back for a long time. It is a great way to see the city from both side of the harbor. Make sure you also do it at night.

Love the view of the harbor from this boat. This is a photographer's dream to be on this boat. The view of the harbor from the water is excellent. Obviously, planning for good weather is important. I recommend sunscreen when riding due to the open air nature.
Great way to see the city!. Inexpensive and fun - was never crowded the few times we were on and we were able to walk right on the ferry each time.

Great scenic way to travel between Kowloon and HK island. Hong Kong has changed tremendously since my first visit in 1980 with the exception of the Star Ferry. Although the fares have increased in that time they are still less than A$1.00 per trip. You can sit back and enjoy the skyline of HK island or Kowloon dependant upon the direction of travel. The ferry has an upper and a lower deck once seen to be upper and lower class. Different fares apply. A trip of the ferry should be a must for every "first time" visitor to HK.

Great ride!. It's a nice way to cross Hong Kong island and Kowloon. You can use the octopus card to board. make sure you take the upper deck for a better view. The smell of gasoline can be discomforting on the lower deck.

Reliable & Fast & Convenient & Hong Kong Best. With the MTR as an alternate option the Star Ferry offers a true Hong Kong experience - views, breezes and great people-watching - inexpensive too! Ferries run often and until late in the night. Tourists and Daily Commuters all use the Ferry.
Best way to see hong kong. The cheapest way to island hop around hong kong for hkd$2.50 you cant go wrongA must do park of hong kong

love the MTR but this is my favourite way to cross the harbour. I love the ferry. Last time we visited we didn`t take it but this time, we took it as much as possible. So easy to navigate and quick little ride.

An easy way to travel in HK. It is quite easy to take the Star Ferry in Hong Kong when traveling from Kowloon to the central island of Hong Kong. The ride is inexpensive and relaxing as the ferry goes across one of the busiest harbors in the world.

Super cheap thrill. A charming and kind of romantic way to cruise HK waters. And super cheap way to do so too.Do it twice: once in the day and another at night to appreciate the beauty of HK city at different time of the day.
A bit of history. Such a great way to see the Hong Kong skyline. Remember to take change to buy a token! Directions are clearly given so no problems finding your way on board.

For a very minimum amount of money, the Star Ferry is a great way to see HK harbor, day or night.. The ride is comfortable. The rocking effect is fairly minimal compared to what I've experienced from other ferries, which should come as good news to our friends who are easily sea sick.Sit upstairs on the ferry, enjoy the views and sea salt air. It is a quick 10-15 minute ride. TIP: Come during Sunset and Night to enhance the Romance.TIP: Hold onto or strap on your phones/camera while snapping pictures, don't lose it in the water!If you have an Octopus Card (highly recommended to get around all of HK) you can use that here to pay.

Stunning Hong Kong Landscape From the Ferry. From Tsim Tsa Tsui MTR exit E and walk to art museum then you will see Hong Kong Sky Line. Don't miss the ferry to Hong Kong Island. It is great view and landscape. Walk down straight and follow the signage to get the pier. There are two ferry from the pier - one to Wan Chai and one to Central. Either one is nice and the fee is pretty low. Be caution, they will close at 11pm. Nice ride and will try again when visiting Hong Kong
simply beautiful!. do it when is just heading down and be amazed with spectacular view ...also the transformation from day to evening with lights switched on is amazing!
Cheap and easy. A very cheap and easy way to cross the bay and enjoy the view at the time. You get a good view of the skyline.
Good price, good view. The Star Ferry is super affordable and offers unforgettable views of Hong Kong from the harbour. The trip was surprisingly quick and unexpectedly bumpy. A great experience.

A Must. This is one of those activities that everyone should take part on their visit to China. The rides across the harbor are cheap and relaxing. I will caution people who get motion sickness. Passengers are usually loaded on the top level of the ferries and the boats bounce around a bit when going across the harbor.
Interesting Ride. A good way to get from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central. The ride is pretty smooth and you get a nice view of the skyline. Very cheap to ride as well.

Cheap way of exploring the City. According to me, if one hates travelling in closed vestibules of the MTR, then the easiest and cheapest way to travel is the Star Ferry. I used the ferry to cross from Central to Kowloon/ TST. It cost me less than the MTR fare. Further, as the time was around 8 in the evening, I got to see the sound and light show "Symphony of Lights" from the ferry.Instead of taking the MTR to Tung Chung, I took the Ferry from Central to Mui Wo. The time taken is marginally more, but it provides a very different perspective to understand the city. Some boats have upper deck to avoid the fuel smells.

Great views of HK and a short hop over. Great way to travel between HK and Kowloon side, only HKD2.6 per trip across the bay. The ticket machines do give back change so you don't need to have exact coins for the fare. The short ride is worth doing both during the day and night for a different perspective of the city from the water.

If you like the Sea and clean air and some fun?. Star Ferry is crossing this wonderful Hong Kong harbor and is one of the best way's to see the skyline of this magnificent city. Hong Kong's Star ferry service crosses the harbor from Kowloon delivering you to some of the Hong Kong's exciting and wonderful mysterious islands.

View of Hong Kong. A short ride to-and-fro Kowloon side to Hong Kong side and vice versa. It's an economical way of sightseeing in Hong Kong. The ferry and station is fairly old, but it remains very efficient.
Eugene Chia . Cheap transportation and a splendid view of HK skyline in another perspective. Try how local travel from HK island to Tsim Sha Tsui
Good value . Super cheap and historic way to cross the harbour. Safe and fast,lots to see and go at night when skyline is illuminated.

Simply Must Do. No trip to Hong Kong is complete without the short trip across Victoria Harbour on a Star Ferry. As well as easy iconic transport between downtown Hong Kong Island and downtown Kowloon, the trip offers another view on the Harbour and downtown Hong Kong and the classic vista of the commercial hub, complete with towering buildings. The ferries are well run, timely and clean. If you're not used to this mode of transport, its an inexpensive treat.

STAR Ferry. If you go to Hong Kong you have to go on this Ferry. You will see the sites with an open view at a leisurely pace; you will experience something of the past whilst gazing at the present and the future. The sights and sound will never be forgotten.......
Worth a visit. Lovely to see from the ferry. Very clean ferry and staff friendly. Cost also includes refreshment which www nice. The day we went it rained on and off but didn't spoil the experience.

Strongly recommend this!. I could sit on the Star Ferry going back and forward for ages! Always plenty to watch on the Harbour as well as the efficiency of the crew loading and off-loading so many people. I also went on the one hour Harbour Cruise which was a slightly more up-market ferry with bar. Excellent way to spend time, especially in the 34C heat in June.

A must-see. Best way to travel from Tsimshatsui to Central or visa versa. Great views of Central and Kowloon, even though with the new Central ferry piers on reclaimed land some of the old charm has gone lost. There's a lower deck (cheaper and more 'real', but stench of fuel might put you off) and a higher deck. Experience it now before the harbour gets concreted over!

So cheap.... We made a return trip on the Star Ferry to and from Hong Kong Island. It was so cheap - HKD10 for 4 adults and only HKD8 on the way back. It was a quick journey across and very enjoyable. Great way to see the harbour.

Such Fun . Cheap and cheerful !A great way to go from Kowloon to Hong Kong island and back again. Super quick, frequent service and the added bonus of great views of the exotic skyline lit up at night.

Love love love. Everyone who goes to Hong Kong must try the Star Ferry. It is a shuttle between Kowloon and Hong Kong island. The ferry is clean and well-maintained. I love how it moves across the water and how the engine sounds. Best of all, it only costs $2.50 and that is HKD not USD!!
Convenient and cheap. I always like to take the Star Ferry when time is not important to get to places, it's always more relaxing and it offered great view of the harbor

Heritage touch in modern city. It's just awesome that HK still preserving this precious and original HK transportation way to connect HK island and Kowloon. It's cheap and provide open air with great scenery Especially in evening when skyline of HK comes out with shower of lights.... It's just a symbol of ancient time. I love it.
Nice trip. The ferry ride across the bay is pleasant and provides a great photo opportunity for the cityscape. Definitely worth at least one go.
Nice tour of the harbor. Wish the tour would have extended a bit more on both ends..also the information was not synced, and could have been much more informative.
good to view HK sky. Good to use all the ferries just avoid the peak hours for a more relaxing journey. Try some of other ferries use the tourist map to link with the MTR or bus services

Charming Star Ferry. A memorable and charming ride on the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Central and back. Some of us, senior tourists I.e. 65 and above holding the Octopus cards travel free on the Star Ferry. The ride each way takes about 8 to 10 mins. I particularly enjoyed the ocean breeze in my hair. A word of caution: do not travel during the rush hour.
Star Ferry ride. A small ferry ferry ride. can enjoy as its less expensive also have some attractions and a mall close by visit.

Star Ferry Ride. Although this ferry ride is quite short, however, one can enjoy the beautiful scene of the Victoria harbor and can see the nice coast of both the Hong Kong Island and the Kowloon side. This ferry is the oldest ferry route of Hong Kong, although not sure of its first operation date but the fact is that it starts its operation since 1880.

Catch a view for 2.5 HKD. Take in all of Hong Kong's skyscrapers on the Star Ferry going to and from Central and TST. Relax for a good 10 mins on the Victoria Harbour. I recommend going on around sunset or at night!

Nostalgic. It's quite amazing how little has changed about the star ferry side my first visit to Hong Kong in 1978, whereas everything on both sides of the harbour has changed so much including the actual width of the harbour itself! It's still a great way to commute between Central or Wanchai and TST. The trip is safe and pleasant and great to get out of the concrete jungle on both sides, not to be missed for first time visitors! To think that this was the only was to get across until the first tunnel opened in 1972 is unfathomable!

What's Not To Love About The Starr Ferry. This is from our Asia Travel BlogWe took a short walk to the Star Ferry terminal for the short journey across to Hong Kong Island. The Star Ferries are small commuter boats that have been plying the harbor since forever – they run every few minutes and are the best deal in Hong Kong; for a couple of bucks you get to travel across the busy Hong Kong harbor and take in the spectacular waterfront scenery. Defiantly not to be missed.

Casual but nostalgic. Never thought of this as the cheapest transportation between Hong Kong and Kowloon, but it is real worth your time if you want to see the harbour that HK is famous for. Why not take a stroll along Tsim Sha Tsui harbour side, visit the Science museum or cultural center then take the ferry to Central. I took this walk with my American visitor and ended up with Yum Cha at the IFC, not bad to spend 3 hours before their flight back to US!

Always take the Star Ferry. For the 'real,' experience, I quite often ride on the lower deck - it's less expensive, not that the upper deck is expensive, and one gets to watch the crew dock the boat. All the time I lived in Hong Kong, when traveling on the Star Ferry, I would keep in mind that many people saved up for a long time to visit Hong Kong and take a ride on it. A very special experience if one can keep from getting complacent!

Such an iconic part of any Hing King trip. I know the MTR is quicker but nothing beats catching the Star Ferry across to Hong Kong island from TST. Such good value for money ( tip: invest in an Octopus card for this and MTR travel - so much easier). Go just prior to sunset and catch the skyline as the sun drops.

Cheap and authentic way to travel. This is a great way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island if you have a little longer and don't want to be in a tunnel using the MTR. It is very cheap and easy to use and has a very frequent service so you don't wait long for a ferry.
Nice experience. Nice view of the harbor and sky scrapers of Hong Kong and Kowloon from the historical ferry , I will take this ride again and again
A must do!!. It was a well organised transport system across Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. We were on board within minutes and were off it with ease. We enjoyed the spectacular views!

Star Ferry. Star Ferry is not the quickest way across Victoria Harbor, but it is the most scenic. For more than a century, Star. Ferry has been shutting passengers from Hong Kong and Kowloon. The ferries are modern and equipped with modern safety equipment and features. On the open sided ferries, passengers can view the modern high rise offices that dominate the business districts of both islands.

On Time. Was rushing to catch a theater performance at TST from Wan Chai. Running late and it was raining. This seemed the quickest way to get there, so tried it for the first time. It was dependable, clean and right on schedule. I can imagine it's also a good way to see views of the bay on a clear day.
a must. the historical ferries to cross the Victoria Harbour. Very nice landscape on the central and Kowloon skyscrapers. Good pctures during the Sunset;

Relaxing Sightseeing. I enjoyed our Harbor Tour and it was great to see the harbor, the buildings and enjoyed the sea breeze. We saw the city by sea.
In an hour, it was an relaxing sightseeing in this busy city.

A scenic way to cross from Kowloon side to Hongkong island. A must when in Hongkong a cheep and scenic way to cross Victoria harbour on a bit of history, some fantastic views of both sides, do it after dark to really appreciate the skyline and the lights.

The Star Ferry of Hong Kong. The Star Ferry operate between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.
Its the top destinations to go at least once when you are in Hong Kong.
Even after a century of service, Star Ferry still the best transport between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.

Great to experience this local form of transport.. A great experience where you get to view the city from the water. The lovely old ferries provide an inexpensive and enjoyable way to dash across the harbour. Well worth the experience.
cannot miss in HK. really cannot miss. 10 min expreince gives a nice view of the bay. and it's only 2-3 HK dollar. really worth of trying

A quick & breezy ride!. From Tsim Sa Sui Ferry Pier - A quick Star Ferry ride! Completely value for money. Took the ride after sunset, enjoyed seeing the nicely lit up buildings in Hong Kong from the boat. Infact one boat ride offers a view to more than half interesting sights of Hong Kong. A cool breeze added to the entire experience!
Harbour view. Easy and cheap way to travel from Hong Kong to Kowloon. Directions are easy to understand and , at times, this ride doesn't seem to be as busy as the Metro.

no doubt one of my favorites!!!. this very cheep amazing attraction is one of HK best attractions both day and night from the HK side start ferry station to TST and back, we have traveled it so many times and never got sick of it

Best way to see both sides the harbour. It is cheap to see both sides of the harbor. It is not that close to MTR. You have to walk about 5 to 10 minutes from MTR station. Enjoy the breeze at night as well as the spectacular view of the harbor and the peak and of course the neon light.

a "must do" in Hong Kong. this is really scenic.. sights from ferry to both sides of Victoria harbor is really enjoyable. sea breeze.... sun shine or dawn.... it is especially romantic when u cross the harbor by ferry....
Must try. A very good and short trip with comfort and must see harbour view of Hong Kong, It is cheap and special. I would highly recommend this to tourists.

cheap way to across the Victoria Harbour. nice view of Victoria Harbour day and night.
downstair is good for eyes while upstair is more good for nose.

A must for all Visitors. This has to be the cheapest attraction in Hong Kong. For just HK $2.50 you travel across Victoria harbour viewing the tremendous Hong Kong skyline. Worth doing twice, first in the day time and then at night when the view is even more majestic.

Must Do. Great fun. However, DO NOT go across on a Sunday. The Island side is full with thousands of Phillipino maids who congregate in the area on Sunday. Not at all relaxing if you are suffering from a bit of jet lag. Who knew there were so many Phillipino maids in HK??

A nice way to travel across the bay. The old ferry has been kept traditional and was a nice easy low cost way to travel between the islands.
Runs regularly and provides relatively good access for anyone with walking disabilities or in a wheelchair.
Rough Seas. Sometimes good and sometimes bad. The seas were rough and this was the worst area of Hong Kong that I experienced as many people trying to entice people to go on the gambling ship.
Shortest Ferry Ever. Great local ferry that is very cheap and fast. I think you stay on the boat for less then 5 minutes.

Must do. Easy way to cross the lovely Hong Kong harbor. Only costs about 2.50 HKD, so it's cheaper than the MTR and much more scenic. Only problem is they are doing construction on the Wan Chai side so it's a little hard to get to the entrance.
Good novelty at first. Good novelty at first but in the end it's a very handy way to get across the place. Very cheap too and well organised. Good place to watch the light show as well.

Cross the harbor at watch ships sail by.... The best way to experience Hong Kong harbor...
Grab the Ferry from Central or Wanchai to Kowloon.
Exact cash or octopus card...

Not just a transport, but an atraction in itself. Although Star Ferry is mainly a transport used by locals, it also is a very convenient transport for tourists. Furthermore, the journey crossing Victoria Harbor is full of interesting views and becomes an attraction in itself. Finally, as it is for "locals", the price is very low.
Nice night ride. The ride from Tsim Sha Tsui Ferry Pier to Central only cost HK$2.50 for the 15 mins ride. Very nice and value for money. I really enjoy the sea breeze and the sky line.

A must when you are in Hong KOng. Hundred year old traditional ferry across Victoria Harbour. One of the cheapest ferry ticket in the world. Smooth professional crew. Charming view of Victoria Harbour, Hong Kong Island, Kowloon Peninsula. One ferry crossing, you see more than half interesting sights of Hong Kong. Very traditional, very civilized. Her Majesty Queen Elisabeth took the same ferry when she visit Hong Kong 40 years ago.
ferry. Pay attention to the lanes to make sure you get on the right boat!I thought i did and ended up on a different island for several hrs before getting to the right one with the large budha.

a scenic (and cheap!) way to move around. For people staying in Kowloon, and wanting to get to busy busy downtown HongKong or to the fun Soho area, this is really a great and fast way to move around. Take advantage of the upper and underground passages, and do not forget to take the scenic hour around 8,30 pm , a great way to see the skyline and light show of HongKong
Easy and cheap!. Wonderful way to see the Harbor. It was very inexpensive. The boats leave continuously. Its so easy.
Ferry Ferry. This was my 1st ferry ride, late in evening dark all around but enjoyed the ride a lot. Excellent mode of transportation and enjoyable

the icon of hong kong. no one leaves hong kong without the traditional ferry ride. every time I am with someone new to this place, I always put the star ferry in my itinerary. i've noticed that it has been refurbished recently which is quite good.you haven't been to hk if you haven't rode on the star ferry!

If you go to Hong Kong you have got to ride the Star Ferry!. Not as quick as the MTR, but a very charming way to travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.Seems to be a ferry leaving every 10 or 15 minutes. Very cheap, I think it is less that US$1 to go one way.World class views of the Kowloon and Hong Kong Skylines, and you get to see the bustle of ships in the harbor.I often stay in a hotel with a view of the harbor, and just watch the ferries go back and forth.
Simple but effective and cool. The star ferry is an easy way to cross the harbour in a traditional way. Its cheap, effective and really cool with kids.

Great view of the bay at both ends.. For those who are planning to go for this trip. I suggest to go during weekdays and also at night. Try getting tickets online or via hotel and book the night ferry. At night you can see all the buildings in Central of Hong Kong light up. The night ferry is always full so do get your tickets early! Have fun!

Iconic trip. A first time visitor to Hong Kong should definitely make this trip. Great views of the harbor and quick link between central and Kowloon. Very clear directions for English speaking visitors. Buy your token and board.
A must do. Go for the experience and the views. Not particularly comfortable, but fairly short--15 minutes--and cheap--less than HKD5.

Star Ferry. Don't miss it if you are in HongKong.I suggest you to take the ferry ride at night when the lights are lit up.You can use your octopus card to pay the fare.I recommend you to get one at the Airport MRT station itself.Its very convenient Just swipe and go,saves your time standing in the big line to purchase tickets.it can be used to pay for your train,bus,ferry rides and also in 7 11 outlets.And also I strongly recommend to get a HongKong SIM card with Internet data for tourist at the Airport itself.Have your own map app in your smart phone to get your directions and locations than counting on locals to show you the way.

A lovely bit of History. Founded 1888. This is a great piece of history to travel on. Cheap , in UK currency about 20 pence a trip, frequent service.You can smell the diesel, watch the crew tieing up to the pier. Great opportunity for pictures of Victoria harbour.Access for wheel chairs.
A MUST !. This shuttle boat is really emblematic of HK. A very efficient and nice way to cross to the other site.
Star Ferry also Octopus Card . Nice old boats. History on the water. Quick way TO cross the water. Cool wind in your hair on a hot summer day. Not that crowdy As the metro. Cheap.

Traveling to Macau made easy. To travel to Macau you have to take a local Ferry. I recommend Star Ferry. Although there are 3 Ferries you can take Star seems to be get it done and its process to board made easy. Coming back is seamless even if you don't purchase a round trip ticket.
Great ferry . Does what you need in a ferry service . It's fairly priced to travel across the harbor. I recommend it over the taxis that will get stuck in traffic and cost much more.

Great day for a ferry ride. Hongkong is hot in June but you get the best view while heading to the Star Ferry terminal at Pier 7 after shopping at IFC Mall. The sky is clear and blue. You can pay with your octopus mrt card. It was an enjoyable short ride to Tsim Sha Tsui where you alight near Harbour City, another great mall.

Crossing harbour is so nice!. I think taking the star ferry is always enjoyable, specially during sunset. I do recommend to take it from central as from Wan Chai pier is in a messy place at the moment due to construction of a bypass

Cheap ferry providing great views. Star Ferry is worth taking for the views alone.
It's very cheap and doesn't take long so a very simple way to get views of the city from the middle of the harbour.

Old School Harbour Crossing. Some things remain the same and after 30 odd years it was wonderful to ride the one and only Star Ferry again. As a child it was how I commuted to and from my school on HK island and our accommodation on Kowloon. Quintessential experience of an amazing city.
A piece of history. Such a lovely old boat. The star Ferry is an original. Beautiful harbour crossing giving fabulous views of the city.

Stinky ferry with great views. This is an old ship with strong Diesel fumes and little comfort. But that's charming for a few minutes and the views of Victoria Harbor are great. Worth the few pennies it costs,

Cheap Excellent travel. Best way to get over the harbour. It is what it is so don't expect first clas travel. Do the night cruise of the harbour. Again no frills but if you just want the sights its the way to go.

Cheap and easy!. What a great service! Cost was around 20p for one way trip to Kowloon from Hong Kong island, great views and easy way to get across the other side while taking in the breath taking scenery!
Nice ride. Nice ride cheap easy and a great view of the harbour. Not much else to say about it other than just do it .

Retrospective means of transport. If you are in the mood to get a good look of the Harbour - Kowloon and Island, take the ferry and enjoy the 15-min trip. It reminded me of the ferry in Shanghai when I was a kid. Everything was deja vu including the pier, the interior of the ferry and the way it boards. The piers on both sides in close proximity to modernity. So the ferry ride itself is like 15-min of passing through the memory lane.
Cute. A nice, and cheap, way to cross the harbour. The ferries are well maintained for there age and the trip only take 10 mins.

Idealic. Part of any sightseeing, its a must!
Its nice to be able to step back in time when our grand parents came to use it and we can still enjoy, pretty much unchanged!

Star activity. a must during your stay. You can travel to and from Kowloon to Hong Kong island or do day or night cruises. You can use your Octopus card on the ferry. You can use the ferry to various destinations and it is a lovely way to travel and inexpensive.
Easy and fast way to cross the water. For me the best way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Cheap, easy boarding, and you can use your Octopus card.

Water Ride. If you dont like sitting in a water ride and if you are prone to see sickness..this is not for you than...most of the people in HK travel though Star ferry, it quick and fast to near about destination in CHina. I liked it and enjoyed!!

Not to be missed. Ahoy!!! The BEST THE CHEAPEST N THE ONLY WAY any tourist should commute from Kowloon to the island or vice versa. From the jetty to the sights of the sampans, cruise liners, skyscrapers it's all gorgeous! We did not miss a single opportunity to sail away!!!
simple and efective. this ferry run does a 10 min sail to cross from wan chai to Kowloon. its a clean and very efficiently run. Preferred this to the train to get to Kowloon.
crossing from hk and kowloon islands. its a 10 min ride to cross from Hong Kong to Kowloon Island. The ferry is really old.Cheap ride. Located beside the big ferris wheel.

Super. Excellent ....Must do. A trip in the star ferry gives you in a very short time a real taste of Hong Kong.
Beside, the view of Kowloon and Hong Kong sky Line is just sumptuous
Spectacular way to travel. We couldn't believe how cheap the star ferry cost for a 10/15 minute ride. We worked it out to cost approximately 20p (sterling) per person for a single journey

Fun Way To Travel. I've ridden for the light show and for regular transport across the water. I'd not recommend paying the extra for the light show tour but do make sure you have a regular hours ride.

Beautiful views from the Harbour! . We ride this ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong every time we're here. It's super cheap and a beautiful ride over with the best views in town. The boats are old but have charm and it's never too crowded. An excellent way to travel!

Very fast, very convenient, great views & unbelievably cheap. This is a must to do, regardless of whether you're staying on the Island or on the Kowloon side. It links with the best areas of Hong Kong and the views from the water are great. It was a very painless experience getting on and off and I think the rate was HKD $2.50, so about 50 cents Australian!!! And it takes Octopus Card if you already have one of those for the trains and trams etc. Do it!

One of the Best ways to see Hong Kong. I love the star ferry, it's the cheapest transportation you can find in this expensive city to cross the habour.It's quick and efficient as well, travelling from Central or wanchai to Tsim Sha Tsui only takes 15 minutes. It makes it so much easier to travel to the dark side of Hong Kong compare to taking bus or the metro.The view you can see on the ferry by day and by night are completely different and they are both wonderful in their own ways; romantic, nostalgic and almost surreal. I have lived in HK my whole life, and I love it dearly. It never gets boring and it makes me feel so much feels every time.

Fantastic, cheap & fast turnarounds. Stayed in the Kowloon Hotel on Kowloon side which was a 5 minute walk to the Star ferry terminal. Most efficient service, very low cost and spectacular ride to Hong Kong Island. Would have to be the absolute must on a holiday trip to Hong Kong
Cheap and great views. Cheap Ferry ride over to Kowloon - easy to navigate on to and a quick journey from Hong Kong. Not too busy.
The Star Ferry IS Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is part and parcel to any trip to HK. It's a charming and inexpensive way to cross the harbour and see the majestic view.

Old but well managed. i use this ferry when i go to central from hongkong ferry terminal, its old ferry but its well managed, they are on time and clean.you could use your octopus card for this ferry.its take about 30 mnts from kowloon to central by this ferry and in front of the harbor you can find bus terminal that will bring you to your destination.my little tips1. this ferry was a slow ferry so you could take good photo as the view was nice, you can see HK from the other angle 2.some times when we cruise we can see some hongkong traditional boat their color and lamp was nice3. i think the best scene to see Hk from the sea is at night the light of the building was amazing

quick and very cheap. the ferry operates consistanly through out the day, we bought senior tickets which was about $1.10 each way, the trip over to Kowloon Island only takes a matter of minutes, The seats are wooden benches but for the few minutes they are okay. Life jackets are on board and they run to a strict time table
A great way to see Hong Kong. Our two young kids love the Star Ferry and we do not miss getting a ride every time we visit Hong Kong. It's an inexpensive but unique way to see Hong Kong.
Night ride with family. Great service, although the establishment is a bit old and tired looking. Very economical way of getting some breeze in this stuffy city.

So Cheap!. What an efficient and well run ferry service and so cheap too!! The trip across the harbour is quick, with ferries leaving constantly so very little waiting time. Well worth hopping on and exploring the otherside of Hong Kong!!

BEST VALUE IN HKG. You must not leave Hong Kong until you have experienced the Star Ferry. It is just wonderful and all ages can enjoy it. Go from Kowloon across to the Island and vice versa. Use your Octopus Card for the fare - very cheap trip. Do the ferry at night and enjoy the spectacular lights of the city.

One of the must-do items in HK. Aside from expensive cruises, this is probably the best way to view the Vitorian Harbor. 3 HKD (about 50 US cents) will get you a 10 min ferry ride aross the bay. If you stay away from the rush hour, the ferry is suprisingly empty so you will be able to move around and have all the views as you cross. Highly recommended.
Way cool. Use your octapus card and avoid the ticket line. Its a rolling ride so a challenge to take photos. Avoid the pre/post 8pm light show rush.

Nice short cruise on harbour. The star ferry was a great little ride across the harbour. Good views of the harbour. And easy to find and get to. Nice way to break up the train travel as well. Would recommend a ride on these old boats.
Cross Harbor. The Star Ferry is a fun and relaxing way to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong. We took the ferry at dusk and the views were spectacular.
Best transportation deal in the world. Super cheap trip across a historic harbor. Runs every 10-15 minutes each way. Take your camera for photos of the skyline fom the ferry.

"Been There and Loved It". We have All seen it on TV/Films and its a must do.Do it,its a great Experience and so Easy,to find and purchase tickets which is incredibly cheap.Been there and Done It - Yes!!!!

No easier or cheaper way to cross over between HK island and Kowloon.. It cheap, fast (lots of ferry's all day and evening) and scenic. Case closed, use it! Make sure you check what time the last ferry crosses so that you dont get caught on the wrong side! Also, make sure you dont end up in the bowels of the ferry; there's two entries to each ferry- top side and inside. Avoid inside.
It may be old, but it gets the job done.. It was easy to use, efficient and got us back and forth.just no hassle using the Oyster card. Wait a few minutes and another arrives.

Relaxing harbor tour!. Though there were a horde of people waiting for the ferry, we didn't find that the ferry felt crowded at all. Somewhat confusing getting a ticket and finding the waiting area, but the pace and views on the harbor tour were well worth it. Very reasonable cost in an expensive city and terrific views of the city. Recommend it especially for first time visitors to the city!

Cheap transport to enjoy the beautiful habour view. Just around $4 HKD (0.5 USD) you can hop on the ferry and enjoy the beautiful view of harbour. You can have 360' views around Tsim Sha Tsui, Central and Wan Chai. A must do when you visit hong kong.

Cheap and chic cross-harbour transport loved by tourists and locals - must-do. The Star Ferry needs no introduction. It's been long running and everyone seems to love it (apart from the unfortunate sinking accident a couple of years back). It's the cheapest way to get across the Victoria Harbour from TST to Central and vice versa. Give a go and take in the view while on the ferry. You won't be disappointed.

Old mode of transportation. My first time in Hongkong was probably 30yrs ago and the ferry terminal did change a lot compare to before. The ferry still looks like that but very reliable. Its a convenient way of crossing from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui. Also, it's cheap its only HK$2.

Interesting ride for kids!. We took the Star Ferry ride from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui. The ride is a short one but it is indeed an interesting one for the kids. The view is also wonderful. Young kids will definitely enjoy it, especially if it is their first ferry ride.
Great way to appreciate the harbor. Turned out to be one of our favorite type of public transportation in the city. Great way to enjoy the amazing skyline on both sides of the Victoria Harbor.

Cheap, Relaxing Ride. Good way to see the city and travel from Hong Kong island to Kowloon. Only costs HK$2.30. A bit confusing how to get to MTR station from the port at HK island though. A lot of buses get pass there, but if you ride the wrong one, you might find yourself a long long way from where you're supposed to go! The bus drivers can't speak English either and you are prohibited from talking to them.

Best avoided during typhoons but brilliant the rest of the time.. Yes we crossed during a typhoon, but we are seasoned ferry travellers and used to lumpy water. The rest of the time it's really handy to get from one side to another. After a nice walk down the Avenue of Stars it's a nice way to see the city from the water. Some ideas: Go on the service to Central because you can get on to the upper deck for 50c more, less crowded, better views. When you get to the Tsim Sha Tsui terminal just follow the signs, there's a ticket office on the way. At the other side you can just turn round and go back, or explore the shopping, or walk along to Wan Chai terminal - it's over a kilometre but lots to see.Access to the metro and bus routes is easy, there's also a taxi rank if you are so inclined.It's really a must do for a visitor, evenv a fairly regular visitor like me.
Cheap great boat ride. Great to see night skyline enjoy a ride in the water great event with kids. Very inexpensive. Be sure to squeeze this into your plans.
Definitely have to try it. The train is easier but this was pretty fun. Its an open air ferry so its a bit windy but its a must at least once.

Brilliant experience on the Star ferry. Easily accessible , amazing views of the city. Takes you across to the Nicer part of Hong kong. You need to go on the star ferry to get across upto Victoria Peak which is amazing.

A must ride!!! . A must ride everytime I'm in the city. A great mode of transport across the islands, while taking in the landscape of the city.
Escaping the jammed pack people jams in the MTR.

Excellent Views!!!!. Nice view while on board.. Star ferry was free to our Big Bus Tours tickets.. And we really enjoyed it a lot.. One of the good transportation to cross.. And while crossing.. You can enjoy the views of the skyscraper in Hong Kong..

Traditional boats. nice and quick way to move from HK kowloon to HK island. very cheap and offers nice view of the town.
it can be overcrowded though, but definitely worth the experience

An absolute must. If you want to see an awesome light show that showcases a city like Hong Kong then the Star Ferry is a must at night!A quick an easy way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong island with plenty of vantage points on board to takes lots of nice photos. Try it at least once especially from Kowloon to get the best views of the light show.

Star Ferry Worth a Ride. For the first time traveler it is a good experience. Actually, this is a ferry service from Victoria Harbour, between Hong Kong Island & Kowloon. Instead of buying Ferry Tickets on your own, you can arrange the same through your Travel Agent who would also include your pickup and drop from your hotel.
Trip with a beautiful view. It's a good way to cross victoria harbour. I think it's faster than walking to stations and all. Plus you can get a good view of the harbour. A-must!

Always a treat. The Star Ferry is a superbly efficient connection between Hong Kong and Kowloon and worth going out of your way to get on it. If you ferry in the late evening you will also see the lights lit up.

The merry ferry!. The crossing was a little rough but we made it across safely. The tying up was a bit difficult due to the conditions and once tied up the locals stampeded their way off and up the ramp. It seems a popular service and runs on time which was encouraging.
Different view. As it takes you away from the piers, you'll experience different view of skyscraper on both side, Kowloon and Hong Kong. Really fun to get into it, back and forth :)
Old School & Efficient. Efficient, organised and Just plain Simple. Do what you need to do with the Hong Hong Efficiency. No Wasted time.

Cheap and fast transportation between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. I'd totally recommend using this mean of transportation at least once, when in Hong Kong. The views are spectacular, and the price is very affordable, too.
you want to get. an idea on how it was crossing the harbor before the metro was built ? Great way , great views and great atmosphere.
Do it once. It was cheap to use, easy to use but nothing mind blowing. You can do it once or twice, maybe at night to see the skyline as well.

Best way across! (When it's clear).. I had to share these pics, when it is a clear day, (read no pollution) you can't beat it! Keep in mind it is a rare treat for the air to be this clear, but a few times a year you can enjoy views like this...

Easy crossing . Excellent ! Valley for money also ! Fast and convenient . Highly recommend this so organised .
Fast way of crossing island
Old fashioned ferry. Easy on & off. Inexpensive, quick, convenient and clean. It was like going back in history, really interesting & quite comfortable
Good service with nice viewa. The ferry is fairly cheap and very efficient. The views of the harbor were amazing. We really enjoyed the short ferry ride.
Fantastic Service. The famous Star Ferries offer a speedy and very regular service from Hong Kong Island and Kowloon and it costs very little. Great scenery as well.
Great!. I love the star ferry, I know it's old but sitting on the ferry watching Kowloon drift off is quiet a lovely sight. I think it was only $4 HKD which was great.
Jessie and me.. The ferry ride was a delightful way to view the skyline of Hong Kong. Even though it was raining we still enjoyed our trip.

kids will enjoy. Easy to go to hong kong side and kowloon side by riding star ferry. Using our octopus card we chose upper deck part for only 2.50hkd. The kids enjoyed riding the ferry and even for 10 minutes you will feel relax with the great view of the harbour..

A must. A nice and traditional way to go from Kowloon side to the Island side. Also very cheap. Check first, which is your target place, so you go to the right port - there are a few in the Island side.
A must when in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is an institution in Hong Kong and the best way to travel from Tsim Sha Tsui to Hong Kong Island.

Should be on everyone's to-do list.. If you're visiting Hong Kong, this should be on your to-do list. It's the cheapest way to cross from Hong Kong-Kowloon and vice versa. It takes only about 10 minutes to cross but you'll get to see an awesome view of the city skyline.

Must do in HK!. Take the inexpensive Star Ferry from Victoria to Kowloon for an awesome view of the fast & furious harbour. Twenty minute crossing joins two of the best sightseeing and shopping area if the city. Fun for the entire family.

Keep the tradition. I love crossing from HK island to Kowloon by star ferry.
Comfortable and quick. You can pay with your octopus card.
We have to keep it going and keep the tradition !!!

Great way to take in the harbour view slowly. Star ferry is a great cheap way to enjoy the harbour view slowly. I prefer going to the lower deck at night as it has warmer lights and a more romantic feel. MTR is probably a quicker way to cross the harbour if u are in a hurry.

Good for short trip. If you purchase the Big Bus tour, this ferry transfer is included...adds to the excitement of the tour. The duration is very short...8 minutes only. But if you are taking the evening tour, its worth the views and some opportunities for excellent shots of the skyline.
Star ferry. A quick trip from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Easy and cheap. It's much faster than taking a taxi. You don't have to worry about traffic.
Fast and funny crossing . It's a good experience to see Hong. Kong from the water and an easy way to get across. Ferries have good signage and good service.

Super cheap form of transport with fabulous views. Used the star ferry to get back to Hk island after watching the light show one evening.
Great way to see Hk from the bay. It's not a luxury but for the sake of about 10 minutes who cares
Great way to experience Victoria Harbour . Be sure to take Starr Ferry to Hong Kong Island, great way to see the harbour area and sights over on HK island.
Brilliant. A great fast cheap way to across the habour. The views are fantastic and it runs so frequently that you do not have to wait to long to get across. Must do.
A must do HK experience . This is a must do for any visitor to Hong Kong. It's also terrific value at $2.30 HK. It takes about 15 mins to cross the bay and the views are just sensational.
Transport. Very efficient transport to Hong Kong island. Regular ferries run. Smooth crossing . Well organised and cheap. Would use regularly

Once in a Lifetime - another good experience in Hong Kong. With a stunning Habour scenery, every trip to Hong KongI always find an excuse to cross the habour with the Star Ferry. To view the Hong Kong skylines from the TSTpromenade is another story which we usually do. For me,it is always a one way trip from TST to Central as I rather use an MRT back to Kowloon after a long day in Hong KongIsland. I would suggest anyway that you find some timetaking one more ride in the evening too as it is a fantastic view while crossing the habour at nighttime even though you watch the Symphony of lights on the TST promenade. But to cross the Habour via the Star Ferry at night, this is something different . Daytime and nighttime crossings make perfect.

Must try in Hong Kong. Victoria harbor separates Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Three ways to cross the harbor: buses, subway and ferry. I think the most interesting way is ferry for all ages. The fares are cheaper compare to subway. The Star Ferry connects the two important business districts: TST(Tsim Sha Tsui) and Central. There are two stories, the upper level is a bit more money than the lower level. In the upper level, the two ends are enclosed with air conditioning, which is a great relieve from the steamy hot weather! The lower level has no air conditioning, but you will be closer to the water and have good feel of the ocean breeze. It may be cold in winter time, and more noisier. On the boat, you have another view to see either sides of the island and Kowloon.

Beautiful and must go if not from sea area. Ferry in itself was something new to me and I always wanted to sit in one. I used star ferry while going from tsim shai tsui to hong Kong island. At first it is exciting but then it becomes monotonous when you have to use it daily.
Super!. The star ferry is the perfect way to cross the habour. It is efficient, good priced and sensational views are guaranteed.

a fun way to cross different parts of HK islands. I used the ferry to cross from Tsim Sha Tsui (star ferry pier) to Central area (leading to IFC mall via the pedestrian bridge). I took the upper deck to get better view during the short trip, only around $3 using the Octopus card.. It can be a bit difficult to find the right pier to get on the ferry from at first, just make sure you read all the right directions or signboards. Nearby the pier, there are small shops selling things such as bread, cakes, snacks, newspapers, etc. I enjoyed the experience of getting on the ferry.

Old school transport in a modern city. The Star Ferry serves several locations on the Hong Kong Island from the Kowloon Ferry Terminal. It cost only HKD2.50 to travel one-way from Kowloon to Central. If you are not in a big hurry, this old school ferry service takes you across the scenic harbour in a leisurely manner.

Amazing value.. I was over the hong kong sides and needed to get back to kowloon. I got on this ferry and was shaped how cheao it was. While watching the city go by I saved straight across to the kowloon side. Very fun and cheap

On the way to mainland China. Easy to use and not expensive.... We used the subway from Kowloon to access the cable car from central station on the island. Then we took the ferry back to Kowloon...The best of both worlds
reliable and nostalgic tour. beautifully maintained old vessel. Very easy to use and quick to get across the channel. inexpensive and reliable. nice to get across in the open air.

Good views, but really showing its age. I know these ferry boats are a piece of Hong Kong history, but they are smelly and noisy. The views are fantastic of the skyline and they are filthy cheap, but don't expect any comfort.
Fun. In order to get to Lantau Island you must take this ferry. It was fun and fast. I enjoyed the short ride to the island.

Easy way to move across Victoria Harbor. We found the Star Ferry to be very easy to use and was very quick to move across Victoria Harbor. First couple of days we were traveling across the harbor on the train system. We found out the Star Ferry is not only a tourist attraction, it saved us quite a bit of time not having to go find a subway station especially if we were down near the harbor.

Fun and efficient . A must do for any visitor to HKG. We used the octopus card to pay for our fare and therefore extremely efficient. There was orderly embarkation and disembarkation. Take the upper deck. The view is better and in the Aircond environment. Love the ride from Kowloon to HKG.
Very effective. This is very effective and functional between the three main islands in hong kong. Makes commute very easy
Fun Ferry Ride. Caught the ferry to Hong Kong Island from Kowloon and it was great! The short ride was around 20 minutes and the departures/arrivals were frequent so the wait time was very minimal.

A must go, to view the spectacular Victoria harbour . A must go or must take type of transportation when visiting Hong Kong. The ferry ride is especially best to take during night time, to view the beautiful Hong Kong skyline. The ride from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central has a better view. You can see the Hsbc building, IFC etc, very unique night view compared to other cities. Definitely worth to spend that 15 minute. And there's a section with air conditioning in case it's a super hot day. You can see the sign once you board the ferry, it's one of the ends of the ferry with the air conditioning machine hanging on the top which you won't miss it.

Cheapest most romantic thing to do in HK. Quick efficient and super cheap way to travel back and forth from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. Makes you feel like your living in a bygone era. Highly recommended!

As usual very good.. We have been to Hong Kong many times and always stay on the mainland side but always take the Star Ferry across the harbour. For about AUD$0.70 cents it is well worth it. Also great to get pics of both sides of Hong Kong.
Star Ferry Lower Deck. Another classic 'must'. For a far more visceral and more comfortable experience, take the lower deck. I've taken this trip hundreds of times, each time is unique.

Cheap way to cross Hong Kong and Kowloon. This is a reliable and cheap way to cross the Hong Kong river from either HK side or Kowloon. You will also be riding on a historical boat. Thus, benches are made of wood, and there is no air con area. Anyway, this only takes a few minutes and you are on the other side.
a quick trip to macau. we went to macau with my family the crew are polite the ferry itself is clean . our sailing is smooth congrats to the crew and management even the restroom is clean

Don't Miss This Ride. This is the cheapest bit pg sightseeing you can do in Hong Kong. The 12 minute ride between TST and Central is incredible whether day or night, but especially at night when you can see the illuminated Hong Kong skyline in its full glory.

Busy. We used the star ferry quite a few times on our trip to get to the Kowloom side..the Four Seasons Hotel over look the harbour..we were also impressed with the fact that we were senior citizens and we travel free..if confused by the ticket machines there is always someone to help you out..the star ferry is always busy and every to and fro journey is packed but still fun..

The Same after all these years. I first went on the Star Ferry in 1963 - then in 1972 and it has not changed a bit. Very regular with a sense of originality. With the new THREE tunnels under the harbour the ferry is still used to it's full capacity.We also went on a "NIGHT CRUISE" on the Star Ferry - this is a must - stunning skyline with a commentary of all things in view.
Great service across the bay. We used as transport across the bay, rather than metro underground. beautiful views and very easy ticket purchase process. Amazing ice cream shop as you exit.

Iconic Commute on Hong Kong Harbour. No visit to Hong Kong would be complete without a trip across Victoria Harbour on the Star Ferry. Many of the ferries still in service were built nearly 60 years ago. The lacquered wooden seats, brown with age and use, provide a bargain-priced perch from which to take in the sights on both sides of the harbour. The gentle pulsing of the old marine diesel engine offers a rather oddly unhurried soundtrack, in stark contrast to the frenetic pace of Hong Kong, on land and water. The cost of the trip is still less than one tenth of a cup of Starbucks coffee, but the views from the middle of the harbour will linger in your memory much longer than the coffee. For comparison, do a return trip, one leg on the upper deck and one leg on the lower deck. This is an experience in Hong Kong not to be missed!

Cheap and cheerful, but "real Hong Kong". We got our tickets via the "Big Red Bus" company, which amongst a raft of other stuff, gave us unlimited ferry crossings.I know it's already cheap, but for a tourist heading towards Kowloon, it's just a great site to be mixing with the locals on this oldest of crossing vessels. Costs a few pence and runs regularly, give it a go !

A must have experience in HK. This ride on Star ferry is the best way to enjoy the HK amazing skyline. These ferries are a HK icon which you see in many HK movies or tourist promotional materials. I never miss taking this ferry when I visit HK for work or leisure. Each ride cost less than Usd1. Please make time for this ferry ride when You are in HK.

Best Value Tourist Attraction (except the free stuff). It costs almost nothing to cross the harbour in this way and you can have a nice view of the skyline. It doesn't take long either so it is really worth doing if you are crossing the harbour.

A great way to see Victoria harbour; day or night. A fast and frequent service to get to Kowloon to Hong Kong island (Central). You never have too long to wait as there is a constant stream of sailings.I have never had a bad crossing in the many times I have used it, so it should be okay for people with weak sea legs.It takes approx. five minutes for the crossing.

Can't imagine HK without it. Star Ferry made the trip. Our hotel was across from HK island so we took the ferry every day. The price still amazes me. Less than 1 USD to get a nice ferry ride across the water and view the skyline at the same time. Plus, it's always on time and if you miss one, you don't have to wait long for the next one. Thank you for your service!
Great way to see the skyline at night. We took the Star Ferry from Kowloon across the harbor. This was a super inexpensive way to get a great view of the skyline at night!

A MUST when visiting Hong Kong and the islands. Incredible value, soooo cheap and a MUST experience. A great way to travel and to see the Hong Kong skyline from the habour. The service runs very frequently and is clean, efficient and has a very easy and natural payment and boarding process. Get on and enjoy!

A special mode of transport that must visit. Even though we can use the Octopus card to enter the ferry, the token can be bought at a reasonably cheap price and keep as a souvenir. There are two levels in a ferry, which the upper floor is more expensive. For me, both floors are equally enjoyable.

Best way to enjoy the harbour!. What a cheap, easy, and quick way to enjoy the views of both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island, wether it be by day or by night. For just $2HK there is no better way to cross bustling harbour.
Great way to cross the harbour. We were staying at Kowloon so made a trip to HK island a couple of times on board the Star Ferry, great way to see the harbour, especially at night, very cheap too!
Great service.. Cheap and efficient. Easy way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong. We've used it a couple of times this trip.
Cheap and quick. The ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui is very cheap, and fast... takes maybe 10mins to cross but worth it for like 2HKD!

Nice and cheep. Its a great way to go around, from central to kowloon, or do island hoping. You see all the water front beautifully, it costs very little and there's A/C in the front and the back.
Highly recommended!

Very aged & crowded yet I felt safe!. This ticket was included with my big red bus 48 hour to transport myself to Kowloon.
The Ferry is dilapidated however I felt safe on my journey, the speed was moderate and it was a great experience to ride efficiently from the mainland to Kowloon.

Cheap cheap cheap!. Can't beat the value for money on this. While it may be a means of transport, its also a fantastic way to see Hong Kong from the harbour for not very much. Must do while in Hong Kong

Necessity as well as an attraction.. I really enjoy getting on the star ferry, it really is the best way to get between Hong Kong and Kowloon, especially in rush hour. You get so see fantastic view across the Victoria Harbour as well as the Hong Kong Skyline. The ferry is cheap, about 25pence to get across, is fast and frequent. You also get to see a piece of local life, especially if travelling at rush hour.. its good fun!
A pleasant 7 min ferry ride . Took a nice Star Ferry ride from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui, love this experience! Great way to enjoy the nice Victoria Harbour skyline!
A must. use it as often as you can. its cheap and simply stunning. just a fantastic way to see the skyline and get across

Still the best value transport in the world!!. The Star Ferry remains a must-do experience when visiting Hong Kong...transporting people every few minutes between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. apart from the awesome scenic trip it is still so cheap!
Slow pace traditional ferry . If your feeling the need to slow the Hong Kong pace down a notch or two and take in the HK skyline this is one cheap way to do it.

Very Cheap, Very efficient, Good view!. As they say, you have not been in Hong Kong if you have not tried riding the Star Ferry. From the Central Pier Station, I and my wife decided to go to the other end of the Harbour via Star Ferry. I was surprised to have known that the fare is mere HK$2.5 from Central Pier to Tsim Sha Tsui Harbour Terminal. While the ferry is coursing its way to TST, I must say that we loved the view so much. You get to see HK Island's Skyscrapers and TST's buildings. BTW, I used my Octopus card for the fare in Star Ferry. I think in about less than 15 minutes, we were already at TST from Central Pier. This is a must-try, really!

Must do. What sums up Hong Kong more than the Star Ferry. Quick and efficient way to get from the Island to Kowloon side using one of the most iconic transport methods in the world. To experience the real chaos which this ultra dense population creates, take the ferry to the island during morning rush hour. Huge mix of passengers from every walk of life, heading to the city offices. The same route in the evening provides the perfect view of the Islands breathtaking waterfront.
Enjoyable. This ferry ride is one for the locals but everyone uses it. Only 2 dollars a ride and worth it at night
Cheap but good enough.. Really fast between ferries, and is good enough to reach the other coast. Is really cheap and the views from the ferry while travelling to the other side are priceless.
Great way to travel . So cheap and so regular !!! We used this everyday and used our octopus card for our journey . Very easy to navigate. Great views of the two sides of the city.
