Star Ferry. Super fun. A ride that should not be miss. Despite there are MTR from TST to Central, we will purposely took the Star Ferry as this is a cheap transport which cannot be found locally plus the Beautiful Hong Kong view which can be seen on the ferry.

Cheap, regular and amazing views. A couple of dollars gets you a ride to Kowloon, great views of HK island and Kowloon skylines. Easy to use, regular service, used by locals to commute. Great experience which is cheap and remains authentic - not a tourist attraction but attracts lots of tourists.

Cheap way to travel, interesting and great view!. I decided to cross Victoria Harbour on the Star Ferry. Yes, I could have used the MKR, but this is one of those things that is fun to do (and I had a bit of a laugh on the way). The view is lovely and although the ferries are quite old, I felt safe at all times. The weather was not too bad so it was quite a smooth trip but I was amused by a few people struggling to find their "sea legs". :)

5 mins ride from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central. the ride is very cheap and the price ranges from 2hkd to 3.8hkd depending when you sit on the lower or upper deck and whether if you go to Central or another port. I took the ride to central which lasted about 5 minutes.And don't be fooled.When it says Central, the closest MTR station is actually Hong Kong. To get to Central MTR, you need to walk in the long underground passageway connecting the two stations together.

Cheap river crossing. This is probably the quickest way to cross the river. It's not only affordable but fast. As a tourist you don't have to do this, but the views are very nice from it. We had to get back to Kowloon so it made sense to use the ferry. I feel like we got to the other side as fast as it would with the subway.
Go Back in Time. So easy to pay for this experience with the coin obtained after paying your money in the machine, and cheap! Go back in time with these old boats.
Star Ferry - quick trip across the water. The star ferry is a quick trip across the harbour and worth doing - its only about a 15min ride and its very cheap HK $2.50
A special treat!. Took a nice relaxing ferry ride after dinner. I didn't really want to go but to see the sites from the water at night it was really special. Glad I did.
Ideal way to see Hong Kong's skyline at night. Efficient service, on time and cheap. Bring a camera to take pictures day or night time. The skyline changes at night with all the skyscrapers lit up.

Often, you will use. It is a Linking transportation between "Kowloon" & "Hong Kong" Islands ...... 24hrs. ...... Ticket fee/ 1 trip= 2-3 HK$ due to operation time ...... v. frequent ..... Duration about 10 min. and, you can take many attractive photoes during especially in clean sky (No clowdes: many time, it is clowed).

Inexpensive and fun way of crossing Victoria Harbor. Carrying a legacy of over a century, Star Ferry still is popular among locals and tourists alike for commuting between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. They operate ferries from Central and Wan Chai (Hong Kong side) to Tsim Sha Sui (Kowloon side) with a frequency of 6 - 20 minute depending on the time of the day and day of the week. Fare is pretty cheap- HKD2.0-2.5 on weekdays and HKD3.4 on weekends for a one way trip.Victoria Harbor is the most photographed harbor in this world and Star Ferry offers best opportunity of framing the harbor and the famous Hong Kong skylines all around, that too for a very cheap fare. A must do for anyone in Hong Kong.
Yeh it's cool. It's like a step back in time taking a ferry across a stretch of water, but there's something serene about being on the water. This is a really cool way to see both sides.

5 minutes of epic scenery. Use your Octopus card to get from Wai Chan over to the Kowloon side on a boat instead of the MTR. It's the way to go....You can never get bored of the skyline here. Never. It's just outrageously positioned against the backdrop of huge hills. You can use this ferry as a simple commute (which I did) or as a 5 minute sight of the harbours.
Great choice of ferries. Used the star ferry piers many times. The crossing to Kowloon, Harbour cruise, Lamma Island and Discovery Bay. All great fun.
Different Experience. If you go to Hong Kong, do not miss this attraction. Be alike a Hong kong people from the past who across the island with ship called Star Ferry.
Efficient, reasonably cheap, and on time. We took the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong side and back. For public transportation, it was clean and there's enough that come by frequently enough.

The magic is gone. Over the decades, I've been taking the Star Ferry since the '60s.While the old ferries are pretty much the same (some safety improvements such as the gang planks), the magic is gone due to the terminus move. It's a long walk to the Hong Kong terminal now and the tide is that much shorter. The mismatch terminal designs don't really hold the same charm. Not to mention the ride is about 200-300m shorter with the long-ago move and land reclamation. Not as much time for the sights. Blink and you're at your destination
Must-Do in Hong Kong. Hong Kong is surrounded by a lot of water so there's no better way to check out some of the sights than on an inexpensive and short ride on the ferries.
Charming piece of HK History- a must. This was a romantic trip on an icon of Honk Kong- I followed in fathers and grandfather footsteps and drank in the amazing vies of the harbour- a must.

Okay as daily life . The lowest means to cross the harbour.Love Wan Chai - Tsim Sha Tsui Especially back home with that You can enjoy beautiful sunset That Worth!Um... Did catch my boyfriend there Seven years ago ...

Nice Experience. Took it when going back from the peak to TST. We took the upper deck and it wasn't too crowded. The view was nice but it was too cloudy to make nice photos. The ride didn't take a long time. Nice experience :)

What a view. Hard to beat the Star Ferry when you are in the mood for a mini-cruise with amazing views of HK and Kowloon from Victoria Harbour. A classic HK institution since 1888; you can even pay your fare with your Octopus Card! Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui for HK$2.5 on Mondays to Fridays; HK$3.4 on Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays. A bargain even at twice the price! Not to be missed.
Don't miss it. The Star Ferry is iconic and you really can't travel to the city without having at least one trip on it.

Great sights, great price. The ferry is a must do. It's a great - and cheap - way to see the skyline and the harbour. Plan for a coupke of trips to see different parts of the city and waterways. Always a good rest after walking aroiund town.

It really is a must-do activity for visitors to Hong Kong. Like many things in life or when you are travelling, some of the best things are free or really cheap. A ride on the star ferry is a favorite, nostalgic pastime for many tourists and locals alike.The view from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui is really awesome and you can see so much. The view in daytime and night time is also completely different, my favorite is sunset time rides and watching the sky turn dark.

Always a treat. No matter how many times you take the Star Ferry you never tire of the view as you take the short journey from Kowloon side to central or visa versa. It is one of those iconic journey that you must take. It is so cheap,convenient and so much fun.
HongKong to Kowloon. The fastest , cheapest , and sightseeing way to get from/to HongKong and Kowloon , as well as other places on HongKong island .

Always a nice way to experience the Hong Kong skyline. a cross harbour trip is on the star ferry is always like a step back in time but good way to experience a nice way of experience the Hong Kong skyline

A great way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. This is an iconic part of Hong Kong and should not be missed even if you take the MTR subway to get around. Great pictures to be taken of the amazing skylines of Kowloon and Hong Kong Island.
The Best Way To See The harbour. Most are old and fairly packed at peak times but they are a low cost way to cross the harbor from Kowloon to Hong Kong and they provide a unique Hong Kong experience.

Star Ferry is a must do thing in Hong Kong!. It is with out doubt the best way to take in Hong Kong Harbour!!The Ferries go to various locations around the harbour so take the time and go explore,and did I mention its super cheap:)

A simple pleasure of Hong Kong. Whilst in Hong Kong you've got to catch the Star at least once. A simple 10mins boat ride gets you from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. Take in the view of both sides. Take the ride at night to see all the lights if you can. The trip will cost you approx. $2.5HKD.
a cheap but nostalgic way to enjoy HK. It really literally costs nothing, but a ride from one side to another just gives you the joy of HK, that you will cherish.
Enjoy view of Hong Kong Island and mainland. Enjoy Hong Kong Island and mainland view by taking a ride on Star Ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central.

The ride had seen better days!. Childhood favorite activity. But due to aggressive land reclamation, the harbour is getting narrower and narrower so the ride between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon is taking shorter and shorter time. Just when you get into appreciating it, you have arrived at the other side! Pity.

Star Ferry Crossing. It was great after 40 years to see that Hong Kong hasn't totally altered. I remember chugging across from Kowloon to Hong Kong and back every other day for my Japanese Karate lessons.
Great times and an excellent company (Star Ferry) :)
Mike

The iconic green and white ferry. The green and white Star Ferrys can be seen crossing the harbour all day and are certainly an easy and cheap way of crossing the harbour. Your Octopus card can be used for the ferry and it is all easily sign posted. We used it during the day but I think it would be at its best at night with all the city lights on view.

Excellent, different . The best and only way anyone should travel between Hong Kong and Macau is by ferry, even if it's just for the experience. Good value and fast. Plenty free shuttles to various hotels on the Macau port.

The ferry ride is a tourist experience in itself.. Ultra cheap and a convenient way to cross the harbour. Just be sure to have correct change for the machine, if you are not using an Oyster(?) card. For slight premium you can sit upstairs, just enter the top deck ramp at the terminal.
Cheap Activity that will totally impress!. This is great especially at night! It's costs so little and it's a beautiful view! Don't miss it! Also, a great place for pictures!

For leisure or commuting. I am a regular to HK and there is no better way at rush hour than to take the ferry across the harbor. In addition, every chance I get, I take visitors on the hour long harbor cruise that even comes with a voucher for a non-alcholic drink and snack. The ships are all well maintained and the cost of a crossing is extremely reasonable. They take the Octopus card for those regular MTR users making the transaction fast and easy.

Fun and cheap ride. If you have time, try taking the ferry between Kowloon and the island at least once. This was the main mode of transport back in the day when the MTR did not exist. Sure, the MTR whisks you away quickly to where you need to go but you miss out on the sights between the two ports. It's nice to go at night and a cheap way to get from point A to B (only 2.30 HKD vs at least 10 HKD to go underwater on the MTR). Might be an alternative to the mini cruise they offer You have the choice of going from TST to Wan Chai or Central. We had a bit of a mess to get through at Wan Chai as there is construction going on there (redoing the port). Perhaps Central may be a better choice? It took us another 20 Min walking around to get to the MTR to go towards Causeway Bay.
Cheap, great scenery, must try. Always worth a ride whenever in town. Its cheap also. Can get to Central/HK Station MTR via Tsim Sha Tsui Star Ferry /Harbor City

Slovenly view of sunset from starboard leaving Central Pier 1. We caught the Star Ferry to Kowloon as Pier 1 is very close to Pier 4 where we arrived after our Lamma Island walk (see my separate review). We saw the sunset behind the smog, which actually was quite beautiful.

Its Cheap and its fun. I took a tram from Causeway Bay to Central District and then took a ferry from Central Pier to Tsim Sha Tsui. The ferry is very cheap (~2-4 HK$) and last about 10 minutes. You get to see the HK Skyline during the sail and its a quick way to get from Central to TST.

Ferry of Choice. The perfect environment to sit back, relax and enjoy a cruise in Victoria Harbour amidst a busy sea highway of ocean going vessels of shapes, speed and sizes. You never feel rushed, yet the distance travelled changes the city views quite quickly. Best in late afternoon and sunset to view the changing skyline transition of day into night.

Nostalgic Way to View Victoria Harbour. What's there not to like about The Star Ferry's iconic green-white vessels? Its owners offer daytime and nighttime harbor tours. You can even hop on the ferry to watch the Symphony of Lights show at 8pm. Pickups from Wanchai, Central Pier and TST.

A Must Do!. Not only is this dirt cheap but is a great way to see the city. Even though the Metro is quicker we used this many times just for the experience. You must do a night time crossing! I think it was roughly about 20pence in british money for a crossing.
Famous ferry. Went on the ferry a couple of times, it is so cheap as to be unbelievable. The actual ferry boats are nothing special but the views are unforgettable.

Not to be missed when in Hong Kong. It takes about 7 minutes and costs cents. The best way to cross the Harbor. You can sit and watch skyline on both sides. If you travel at 8pm, you can see the light show.
Typical . Star ferry is a must in HK. So cheap, so fast. You'll go to Kowloon or HK island very fast with a unique view. For once you'll enjoy your trip.

If you go to HOng Kong, you must go on the ferry across to each side,. Really good fun, cheap way to see HOng Kong from a different prospective, if you are staying on the Kowloon side, go over to Hong Kong Island, then catch a bus up to the peak for lunch. The views are mind blowing.
Iconic. I've always loved short boat rides and the ferry does not disappoint. The ride is smoother than it looks. It is an awesome way to take in the sites at Victoria Bay and at a minimal cost.

cheapest and fastest way to cross over. The ferry is the cheapest way to cross over from kowloon to hong kong other than the MTR.... Ferries run every 10 mins and takes 8 mins to cross over ... a bus station and taxi stand at both the ends of the harbour helps

A journey worth taking. I travelled on this ferry a couple of days ago. Unfortunately the weather was not the best and the views not the most impressive, due to the misty conditions. However, I could see that,on a better day, it would provide great views of the Harbour and the HK skyline. It is a must see attraction.
Great!. A great option to travel between hong kong island and kowloon. This service comes with a very reasonable fare. Enjoy the night views, and also the cool breeze.

Must must must. Must do if you are a visitor - absolutely. Possibly the best value tourist attraction in the world and a chance to to appreciate the poetic juxtaposition of glass, concrete and nature. Must be one of the best ways to go/return from work too. 10 mins of tranquility, off peak, and a chance to meditate and relax in an otherwise frenetic city.

Cheap way to travel.. The journey is pleasant and very cheap but I wouldn't get too excited about this being a 'must-do'. The views are nice but no different to standing on the harbour front.I imagine this would the trip would be more scenic in the evening.

Best transport to commute Tsim Tsa Tsui and Central. Old but best way to commute between Tsim Tsa Tsui and Central as you get a great view of Hong Kong's skyline no matter day or night and the cost is cheaper than bus and MTR. Must experience at least once while in Hong Kong.

efficient and inexpensive. shuttling to and from Kowloon and Hongkong can be scenic and need not be boring and crowded as the MTR. If you want to slow things down a bit in Hongkong's hurried life, this is a simple joy to have. You can use the Octopus card as well.

A must do while in HK. Even when it's raining it's a great thing to do.Skyline was grey but beautiful with the lights of the buildings just starting to switch on.Looking forward to going back for another trip at night. The ferry itself is great too, and spacious.And cheap!Use the Octopus card on it
Best scenic water transport deal!. Don't be in too much of a rush. Take it. Enjoy the harbor like the days before the mtr. The ferry is incredibly inexpensive.
Just perfect!. At 25 pence for a single crossing, on a piece of history, with amazing views, what more can you ask for? Experience China the way you are supposed to :) Pictures attached.
Atmospheric. Extremely cost effective way to see HK harbour, A bit like taking the Staten Island ferry in New York instead of paying a fortune for the ferry to Liberty Island.
Classic. This is a must for visitors to Hong Kong - the subway is fast and clean, but the Star ferry is an icon - I love that this service survives in spite of the modern completion.
Excellent and cheap, fast service. Brilliant, great service , it ran all times and was a real experience across the harbour. Its also a great opportunity to take photos, and cross on an evening.

Star Ferry offers a good view of the Harbour and of Hong Kong Skyline. . While an old form (and sometimes slower) of transportation, my girlfriend and I found ourselves taking the Star Ferry several times over our 9 day trip to enjoy the skyline of Hong Kong (both in the day and the night). It offers a more scenic route across (compared to the train) and a cheaper way to get across (around 2-4 HKD compared to 6 - 10 HKD via the MTR). Not tough to integrate this into your travel itinerary and use it as a form of transportation in your day to day activities in Hong Kong, I urge you to consider doing so.

A must-do for tourists. The line most useful to a tourist is the [Central <-> Tsim Sha Tsui] line. Here are the reasons. [1] It is 1 of the 2 fastest way to move between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui, both being popular places for a tourist to visit. The other way is to use the MTR which puts you underground with nothing to see. [2] The view in daylight is very different from the night view so it is a good idea to take the ride once before sunset and once after. [3] It costs only HK$2.50 one way during the weekdays and HK$3.40 during the weekends. [4] It is a quick 10 minutes ride so you don't have to worry about getting seasick.
A great experience. A great experience and excellent system worked perfectly, We took it several times and there is always room.
Still a lovely way to cross the harbour. A bit of nostalgia. Still a lovely if not a little warm way to cross the harbour. The view is phenomenal. A bargain if not in a rush.
Love it!. Very short ride, very cheap and great views. Very quick to get from Hong Kong Island to the shops and cruise ship terminal at Kowloon

Still excellent!. So convenient to cross over to Hong Kong side and back and RELAXING too. It has been 30 years since I came to Hong Kong and whilst a lot of things have changed, and HK has become more populated and denser, it is pleasing to the find the good Star ferry remained as efficient and endearing!
Highly recommend!. Very interesting little trip, cheap and available all the day. Good view to the harbour and lightning show in the evening.

A low cost harbour cruise. The Hong Kong Victoria Harbour is one of the busiest and scenic harbours in the world. Viewing it in the middle of the harbour is highly recommended. Take the Star Ferry from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon peninsula, or the other way round costs less that HK$5.
Fast and freindly . Alway a quick ferry trip and a must todo on your visit .they run so frequintly you slmost never have to wait .

A Fun Tradition. Fun and cheap way of crossing the harbour - nice to experience how the island and Kowloon were connected pre-MTR and tunnel. It's quick and efficient, and connects up to the island piers and Tsim Sha Tsui promenade. Useful if you are in the area!
Seniors deal. Best reason to be a SENIOR citizen as this is a free service to anyone over 65 and who has an oyster card. These can be bought at the underground information counter at Tsim Sha Tsui

Ferry experience at practically no cost. When come visit Hongkong this is a must try.The ferry ride is about 15 mins at a price of 2.3 HKD.Enjoy the beautiful scenic Victoria habour surrounded by skyscrapers and hills and mountains all~IN~one.

Starferry. The strawberry is a great vintage right that every tourist in Hong Kong should take the great views provided a Victoria Harbour with this breathtaking skyline is memorable and even though I'm traveling to Hong Kong for more than 30 years I always enjoy this ride
fun. we took the ferry across the harbor to the hong kong side. it was a fun way to cross...very easy to do...

Star ferry review . Always a must do on a visit to Hong Kong
Ferries are so frequent never much waiting time
Always a fantastic view of the harbour most peaceful way to spend a few minutes
Lots of destinations served
Catering on ferries limited
Seating not comfortable wooden benches all in character
Easy and inexpensive. While in Hong Kong, you have to take the Ferry at least once! The MTR is faster but without the harbor views. Enjoyable way to cross the harbor and take in the scenery.

Cheap, easy, quite relaxing, great views. Took the Star Ferry a couple of times, simply as it was fast a direct to where we wanted to go.
Comfortable, efficient and a terrific view, both daytime and at night
Recommended
A must do in HK. Easy to use and cheap. Lovely way to get to the main island and Tsim Sha Tsui. Did it during my last visit and again this time. Need to do every time you are in HK!

A cheaper way to cross Central and TST!. If you are at Tsim Sha Tsui and you want to go to Central, the best and budget friendly-way to cross the two islands is through the Star Ferry. It's cheaper than the MTR plus you'll get harbor view of the two islands.
cheap, efficient and nostalgic. imagine before the tunnel they've already been using this mode for don't know how many years. it is a great way to appreciate the Victoria Harbour too. must try.

great moment. we had splendid journey, so authentic as if we were in old time... but viewing modern architecture buildings with led lighr decoration of Hong Kong & Kowloon. do this at night is a must, & to have octopus card.
Take an evening trip for great skyline views. Star ferry is another super efficient public transport service in Hong Kong - its so easy to get around this city!

Nice Trip. From Hong Kong International Airport directly to Macau, without having to checked-out the luggage first.
From Macau back to Hong Kong via Tsim Sat Tsui.
Nice sail with nice view.
Must do in HK. This is one of those iconic must -dos in HK. The journey is only short but provides some of the best views in Hong Kong. Try taking a journey at night as well as during the day

Such great value. Took Star ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. Only 2.5 HK dollars each way. Pay at machine to buy token. Great trip. Swell quite high so getting on and off was interesting. Seats are reversible so you get great views wherever you are seated

Must ride!. If you are the first time to visit HK, I highly recommended STAR FERRY! Must ride once! It's cross over from HK island (Central or Wanchai) to Kowloon side (Tsim Sha Tsui). Which is fast and cheap fare, but you can see the day and night of different from both sides of view.

Great chance to see both sides of the harbouWe took the ferry from Kowloon to Central and the sites wowed us.. Easy to do and gave lovely opportunities to see everything. We returned in early evening and saw the lights. Nice and economical way to be wowed.
A must do in Hong Kong. This is the cheapest harbor cruise you will ever do. In my opinion it is a must do in Hong Kong as it is an Iconic attraction.

The Star Ferry - part of Hong Kong's modern history. Take a ride between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui, not only does it connect some of HK's favorite tourist destinations on both sides of Victoria Harbor, it also provides 8 minutes of sea breeze and busy look around on both coastal lines. Just before the end of the sail, go quick to the side of the ship and see how the sailor crew, for over a century, uses a billhook to moor the ship. You may be lucky to see the crew member wearing a Rolex watch which was awarded to him for his long service at the ship company.

Not as expected. We were really looking forward to the ferry ride and the lights show but it wasn't as great as we expected. The food served was just OK. Overall it wasnt a great deal but could be a 1 time watch.

A Must experience for all tourist. Catching the "Star" couldn't be easier. It can be boarded on either the Kowloon or Hong Kong side of the harbor. It is an excellent way to see the history and if you can schedule a night crossing... the view of the skyline is magical.

iconic part of Hong Kong. No trip to Hong Kong is complete without a trip on the Star Ferry.Befote the MTR and harbour tunnels this was the only way to get across the harbour.If you wanted to take your car you had to catch the car ferry from Jordan Road. It's a great thing to do and the views of both Hong Kong and Kowloon are great.You can choose to sit up as there are 2 decks but I think you must choose before you buy your tickets which are as cheap as they wete back then. Every ferry has a name with the word Star in it ...see how many you can find ?

An iconic event. Taking any of the Star Ferry services on Victoria is a convenient and enjoyable way to cross to and from Hong Kong Island.The traveller is close the busy hive of activity that characterises the harbour.

Evening Meal at the end of a tour. I had been on an afternoon tour taking in the sites. and we finished it of with a mini cruise and buffet on board the ferry. before we sat down we all went on deck to see the light show. The food was good but not very Chinese it caters for everyone. also we had a disco to round off a lovely evening.
Quaint but efficient. We loved the sailor uniforms of the staff, who were more than happy to be photographed by the tourists!

Cheap, neat and amazing!. Visiting Hong Kong for the first time is an extraordinary experience. The skyline is beyond any expectation and the landscape makes one wonder how the skyscrapers keeps from sliding of the enormous mountains. One of the best views of this is seen from the harbour between Kowloon and Hong Kong island on one of the Star ferries. But don't just stop there! get your hands on an 'octopus card', which is the Hong Kong equivalent of the British Oyster card, and visit one of the hundreds exotic islands in the area for close to nothing!

Good, cheap, easy to use mode of travel. We used the ferry to cross over from near the Clock Tower point on Kowloon side after walking from Tsim Sha Tsui station, to Wan Chui and tickets were just HKD 2.50. And it offered a great ride and experience to do it on one's own without any guidance and it was easy to follow

Easy and must do. Like the Staten Island Ferry in NYC, this has to be done. While it is a part of the commuter network, the short trip is pleasant and the views of both sides of the harbor are great. It is very cheap, and a convenient way to cross the harbor.

Efficient, cheap and beautiful. Best way to travel!. The ferry is much cheaper than using the MTR to move between Tsim Sha Tsui and Hong Kong Island. It's only $2.50HKD during the week and $3.40HKD on weekends and public holidays.You can catch the ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui, Central or Wan Chai. It's a quick trip across the water, so take your photos asap. The crew are efficient and polite. It's a lovely way to get around.
Easy a Pie. Easy to use and efficient. Great views to take pictures BOTH ways! Make sure to go to the front of the both for great photo opps.
Star ferry. A great way to get across Victoria harbor.I s also nice way to meet other travelers from all over the world.
Fast and fun. A very easy way to get back an forth from Kowloon and Hong Kong. IT was very easy for us to catch as we were staying in Central. Not expensive either.

Slow but beautiful . The Star Ferry is an institution. It has been there perhaps 40 to 50 years ago, or even more. The ferries seem old. It takes several minutes for the pilot to dock. Perhaps new, inexperienced pilots. But the trip from Hong Kong side to Kowloon and back is the most relaxing trip. A cheap ride to feel the sea breeze, wind that relaxes your soul. It is a journey that stills you mind as you set aside your meeting, activities of the day. Well recommended. On the way back, you can also opt to taking the MTR. A fast but crowded trip that always remind you of New York.
Super Harbor Transport. A great way to get from one seaport to another and avoiding street traffic. Great view of the city especially at night.

Pretty skyline . This is simply a ferry - a way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. But the skyline is pretty, and it's very enjoyable spending some time on the Kowloon harbour watching the boats coming in and taking silly photos.

Wonderful views, brings back memories. There are several origin/destination pairs. For the visitor, it's good to look up the pairs on a map to find the points closest to one's origin and destination. The views are spectacular, and it brings back memories from many years ago traveling to and from the two sides.
Must do!. Best time to go is at dusk when the city lights are coming up and the sun is going down. Better if the weather is clear. Cheap too

Cheap Way to Cross Over to Hong Kong & Beautiful Scenery. Star Ferry is one of the cheapest way of crossing over from Jordan to Hong Kong Island and vice versa. It costs $2.50 on Monday - Fridays and $3.40 on weekends and public holidays. The ferries are wide and spacious, be sure to get a window seat so that you can see the beautiful Hong Kong cityscape.

Good way to see the beautiful Victoria habour. Different scene at different time. Personally I'd enjoy the night tour. Because you can see our famous night cityscape of Victoria habour. It's fabulous. I suggest you to go from TsimShaTsui in the evening to Central. It takes 10-15 mins across the habour. After the ferry tour, I'd give you 2 visit options: 1)check out the night of HK at another angle at the Peak. 2) Or you can go to enjoy the night life of HK in Lan Kwai Fong. Both are great experiences to take in HK.
Icon of Hong Kong. A must do, although it is just a ferry ride. A short trip across the harbour was about NZD1, so very cheap transport. They are running all the time, so hardly any wait at any time.

Experience the Star Ferry. The Ferry starts and ends in two exciting places. When leaving from the Kowloon side you are steps away from the Ocean Terminal. The Terminal as many shops if you can think it you can find it there. You are also near one of Main Land Chinese shopping centers. Once you get on the Ferry it is a short trip on some of Hong Kongs oldest Ferries. The ferries never turn around they can run both frontwards and backwards. The seat back flip so you are always facing in the forward direction. When you arrive on the Hong Kong island side you are in the heart of some of the most exciting shopping Hong Kong has to offer.It is enjoyable for families and anyone who likes riding on Ferries. The price is excellent also.
Old time HK STAR Ferries. Now this is an excellent way to experience HK through the years, with most ferries dating back many years...terrific experience
Efficient and fun!. This is a really fun and efficient way to cross the water. Pick up the ferry close to central station. Quick ride and you can enjoy both sky lines!
Hasn't Changed. Need easy transport from HK to Kowloon or back. The ferry hasn't changed. Still basic board seats and pretty non-descript transport with gorgeous water views. Worth the experience!
historical and cheap. Lovely old ferries, easy to figure out even if you don't read Cantonese, clean and an unparalleled view of the harbor
Cheap, reliable ride with a great view.. It's a quick ride and an enjoyable view. You should definitely take the ferry once if you visit Hong Kong.

Trips on Star Ferry. I saw this in the HK guides and it is good fun, takes about 10 mins to cross from ' Central' to mainland. (or vice versa). Easy to find with street signs showing the way. We stayed at Sha Tin and took the MTR which is very low cost by UK standards; it is also very clean and usually packed with standing room only - very punctual too. HK suffers quite badly from poor visibility on some days due to air pollution, so if you go on the Ferry and want to see and photograph the view, pick a clear day if you can. Good for your lungs too!

This is a must for everyone. It's been around a long time shorter trip now first time for me was back in1966, anytime of day is good but I love crossing at night when the light show is on, top deck is best for photos.

Nastalgia. This use to be the only way to get from Kowloon to the island but now there is the subway. If you want to go back in time and ride the ferry it is safe, reasonably clean but still old. The subway is faster but the Ferry is free to those over 65.

No trip to HK complete without several ferry trips. By far and away the best sights in the world for a mere 2.5HK$. A frequent and very convenient way of getting round. Still one of the great attractions to be experienced,one of the best ways to begin a time in HK.
great way to see the city. great way to travel across the harbour cheaply & to see the skyline, also good photo opps. Be prepared for a large step down on some crossings due to water conditions
Sudden Trip. We had a nice unplanned boat ride across the harbour. Nice way to see the city. Really good way to have a relaxed and quite time.

Best boat trip for little kiddies. Took my boys for a couple of rides on this star ferry. They love transport! Under 3's are free and 3 to 12 year olds are $1.50 on week days. Best view of Hong Kong. Also spent some time boat spotting along the Avenue of Stars. Brilliant way to spend loads of family time together for a couple of dollars!
Must do. You must take the star ferry in HK. Pay the tiny amount extra and sit upstairs. Great views of the skyline and harbour for next to no cost.

Good transportation. Well, there's nothing much to say. It's a ferry, it runs smoothly and always on schedule. Very cheap and the best way to get "to the other side". There's nothing else and nothing else is needed.

The local way. Very cold and draughty waiting for ferry with the locals.food drink etc at shop available..boat ride calm, TV on board advertising local events quite interesting.a must do trip, like the back street markets. Join the locals.

Great experience . We Love the star ferry, it's very cheap we used our octopus cards to pay which are the most convenient was to pay for all your travel and even a McDonald's (should u want one), great experience it wasn't as busy as I expected but most people use the mtr
back in time. Not the fastest way to cross the water but certainly the most authentic one..2.80 hong kong dollar..a must do..

Old School Charm. Went from Kowloon to Hong Kong Central on the Star Ferry for the first time. It's a short but scenic ride across with bits of old world charm, laced with fumes from the engine :)
I would recommend this to anyone visiting Hong Kong. It's cheap and fun.

Value for Money. Our family decided to visit Tim Ho Wan in Central. But instead of taking the MTR, we tried the Star Ferry. We had views both of day time and night time. For a very cheap fare, you will be presented with another view of Victoria Harbor (Island side and Kowloon side). You may also use your Octopus card for added convenience.Highly recommended!

On the water. We used the Star Ferry a few of times when travelling to/from Hong Kong Island. The view from the city is great and it is a novel way to travel. Much more interesting than the MTR and there were plenty of seats. Cost is also minimal.
Star Ferry. We have a very good time, nice view of the city, the best time at night, love it very much.Ferry it self old, but we have good experience.,
Quick & Cheap. The crossing between HK Island and Kowloon is around 2 minutes, costs around 25 pence each way, the top deck is slightly more but has much better views

ITS A FERRY!. Pretty plain really for one of the most famous Harbours in the world. But you have to remember this is a working boat, not a sightseeing cruise per se. Its clean and timely... as always with Hong Kong.Still worth the money..
Standard ferry . It's cheap, it's quick, it's scenic. Take it across to get to Victoria peak tram. Walk down from Victoria peak (huge queues to get downward tram) and take the ferry back at night.
Super Easy. Great way to cross the harbour with our the hassle of the MTR, and super cheap. Even better at night for the lights show!!!!
Best way to reach HK Island. The ferry service is located very close to Victoria Harbour. You can catch nice view of the city's skyline from the ferry.

Iconic!!!. Try this 10 minutes ride for going from one island to another. A small ride wherein you can see the whole skylines of HK and have that nostalgic feel. Just a touristy thing now but one could imagine the importance of the same in pre MTR era

u got to do diz when in HK , cheap n nice. convenient to go across either direction bet HK island n Kowloon. cheap n u can use your Octopus card, nothing bets seeing the HK landscape by ferry. better view at night with the lights on . HK at its best. upper deck is best and u r not spending a fortune to go upper deck. easy to access to both sides of HK and Kowloon. my stop took me all the way to IFC center in Central. quick a walk to MTR even with elevated walkways as HK can be humid in May. take the ferry to experience HK
Another view of the city. We decided to take the ferry to view the skyline and city along with Victoria Peak from the other side. The ferry itself is pretty old, but the view didn't disappoint.
Along with the tram cheapest and oldeest way to travel in HK. Tremendous experience to cross from HK Island to Kowloon or vice versa only HK$2.20 to HK$5 depending if upper or lower deck

Relaxing Ride & a Great Way to See Both Skylines of Hong Kong. Another icon of Hong Kong the Star Ferry has been transporting locals and visitors from the Kowloon Peninsula over to Hong Kong Island for well over a century. Inexpensive to ride you can choose either the lower deck or for a little more you can travel in the upper deck, both have good views.Again you can either pay cash, purchase a token from a machine near the turnstiles, or use an Octopus Card.

Worth a trip. This is a short and fun way to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. It is really easy to find and very cheap to use. Use your octopus card. The crossing gives you great views up and down both sides and you can get some really good photographs. On the Kowloon side you are right next to a large shopping center and nice promenade area and on the Hong Kong side it is a quick walk to the street markets. On the Kowloon side, it is an easy walk to underground station for further travel. A must do in Hong Kong.

Nice views and great way to travel. Took the Ferry over to the Island of Hong Kong. You could take the Underground, but this is nicer venue to Travel. It was an old boat and wasn't large. To me the trip was too short

Best way to cross the harbour. Boarding on a charming boat, you can already feel history surround you. It's definitely one of the best way to enjoy the magnificent view of both sides of the Victoria Harbour.
Decent sightseeing. The ferry is quick and transfers in about 10 minutes. Early evening and at 8 pm is a good time to travelPretty cheap for pricing I personally feel the star ferry is over rated

Amazing!. All of the transport in Hong Kong is amazing. The Star Ferry is a must do and takes you between Kowloon and Hong Kong. The Ferry's are clean, plenty of room and go every 10-15 minutes. It makes travelling around so much easier! Love it.

Try it for nostalgic feeling.. You might want to try out the star ferry which is 1of many modes of transport for the locals. With an octopus card, just tap and go either to central or wanchai or sheung wan or back to kowloon.
The ride is pretty smooth and you can see many acitvities on the water way.
Fun way to cross harbor. Quick, easy, and enjoyable way to cross the harbor. Get octopus card if you will use ferry and metro more than a few times.

A Wonderful Ride. Just want to remind all tourists that the last ferry leaves the terminal on HK side at 11.30p.m.. I got there at 11.32p.m. and just watched the ferry pulling out. I missed it !!
I took the ferry every time I was in HK. I just have to go next time and make sure I get there before 11.30p.m. !!!!!
"Splurge" for upper deck. Was a wonderful ride. Too short! Better views from Kowloon to HK island. Even the views from the star ferry terminal were something to admire!

Cheap and good, but no AC. The Star Ferry is a great way to get nice views of the skyline of Hong Kong but just be aware the boat is not air conditioned. On a super hot day it is sweltering. But quite cheap, pretty quick and frequent service. There are two decks but you have to board on the correct deck- you can't switch decks during the crossing.

Lady in Green. This old lady is a fabulous way to travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon - it cost us all of HK$2 or R4 to get across the harbour and was a great way to rest our legs and enjoy the views of the skyline and harbour. Do not expect luxury seats and fancy food aboard - this is an old-fashioned and authentic ride - founded in 1988 and carrying around 70,000 people each day, 12 ferries are currently in operation. It is so worth the ride!
Excellent fun. A really fun way to travel . Frequent and very inexpensive and a very good way to beat the traffic jams as well.

Ferry trip over to the mainland. We went late afternoon so that we could see the buildings lit up at night on our return - really lovely. They also do a light show across the buildings to music at 8pm
Great Foto Opp. It is a short ride - but very inexpensive ($2.50 HK$) and easy to do. On a decent day can take lots of great photo's of the downtown from the Ferry.
Definitely. Worth every cent. It doesn't cost much of anything and the most scenic way to Hong Kong island from Kowloon (or vice versa)

Best view of the city.. Cheap, cheerful and well worth a trip at night. We used the ferry service to return from Lantau and toyed with seeing the harbour on an excursion but ran out of time but after going on the Star Ferry I'm not sure a night cruise is entirely necessary. We chose a crossing from Wan Chai to Kowloon to catch the 8pm light show as we travelled, it was great fun and aside from the Ding Ding i'm not sure there's any better value to be found in Hong Kong.**Apart from Dim Dim Sum or Tim Ho Wan.
A must for a HK visit. Offers a very good opportunity for taking pictures of the HK skyline. You can use the octopus card. From Kowloon to Wan Chai it takes 20 minutes.
Best central kowloon connect. Its economical, easy and comfortable. At $2.50 HKD, I consider it best transport from central HK to Kowloon (Tsim Sha Sui).

A Throwback to an Earlier Era?. If I was an Ex-pat working in Hong Kong Central, I would live in Kowloon so that I could ride the Star Ferry everyday as a commuter. Even though Hong Kong Central has a car tunnel and the MTR serves Central from Kowloon, somehow the Star Ferry continues to operate. Service to Hung Hom was dropped a few years ago, but you can still travel to Central and Wan Chai from the Kowloon terminal.It is not at all luxurious; the upper deck fetches a fare of $2.50HK, which is about 35 cents US, and the lower deck, with the engine, is $2.00HK. There is generally an air conditioned portion of the upper deck, but lower deck is open to the elements. All of the seating is wooden benches. There is no dining salon or luxury bar... Nonetheless, I could spend the day riding the Star Ferry, if only as a photographic platform, trying to capture the vitality of Victoria Harbour. Nowadays you need to have an Octopus Card to ride the Star Ferry, but the Octopus Card is now a must have for easily riding the buses and historic trams in Central. You can get or recharge an Octopus Card at 7-11 stores, and there is one near the Kowloon Ferry Terminal.

A good break!!. Whenever u need to slow down, take a round trip... I like to start from Wan chai pier to TST, get an softy ice cream from the ice cream struck, then take another ride to Central, now I am ready for anything now ;)

Quick way to get across harbour . We went across on metro...buy an Octopus card. Seniors get 50% discount and you can use the card on metro, buses and on the ferry. We enjoyed using different types of transport. The ferry is quick and easy and has reverse direction seats..I. e. You can change the back rest to face different directions. Seems to run every 10-15 minutes.

Authentic decent no frills ferry . It's the iconic star ferry you see in movies, since you are a kid!Nothing beats actually riding on it, with the bit of shaking greeting from point A to B.Pretty cool to see old uncle wearing sailor uniform. Well worth the 3HKD to enjoy a short ride to enjoy piece of HK memory in your travel!

Cheapest ferry rid to Hong Kong!. If you are senior citizen... It's free. You can enjoy the ride back and forth day and night and enjoy the beautiful harbor view for nothing! You find a better deal... let me know!
Great experience. Was good to go over to Honkong island on the ferry with locals and tourists The ferry is basic but does everything you need it for seating with good views
Economical ferry rides. Economical ferry rides. Can take to various places. Get a window seat or higher level seat for a good view while travelling

Nice and efficient . The ferry is a nice, cheap and efficient (not fast, of course, it take 15-20 minutes) way to cross Kowloon Bay. It's not a tour, it's a mean of transportation, so it not costs much and don't have any amenities to buy during the ride, but the view will be great anyway.

Beautiful view of Hong Kong Skyline. The ferry moves between Central and Wanchai On Hong Kong Island side to Kowloon side .. the view is just fantastic from the ferry, please use the upper deck for a better view..

Still the cheapest trip worldwide . We stayed at the Four Seasons, which was a 5 min stroll to all the piers. We took the Star ferry (less than 30pence) to Kowloon to watch the 8pm light & music show.
The experience of the Ferry is not to be missed.

City view from the Sea!. Another means of transportation, tranferring from Tsim Sha Tsui going to Central Hong Kong. Been there in the afternoon and the view was just okay. Cheap ride, it only cost 2.30HKD

Low cost way to enjoy the view of Victoria Harbour. The fare is only HKD $3.40 (about USD 44 cents) and you get to enjoy the spectacular night view of Victoria Harbour.
Oh yeah, we also took some of our pre-wedding pics on a Star Ferry.
26 Cents US Ferry Ride. Make sure you use the ferry at least once during your visit. Previous reviewers were right to rave about this activity.
Good to see. Its really cheap and good commuting mode for travellers. Tourist must experience at list once. Buy a ticket for the upper deck

Best views of the harbour, best value in town. I can't get enough of the ferries - only HK$2-3.50 to cross the harbour (less than 50 cents!) The MTR trains, by comparison, cost HK$10! Views are beautiful, especially if you get a night sailing. They're remarkably efficient and even carrying luggage on them isn't a problem. The top deck has an air conditioned section, hence the higher cost, but the lower deck is fine too.
Very convenient way to go from Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui. It costs HKD 2.50 each way and is a great way to get across the water. It takes no longer than 15 mins. The view is fantastic.

Cheap way to see the night view. only cost a few cents to travel between Hong Kong Island & Kowloon. only less than 10 minutes but you will see the best view of the island. Highly recommended to take from Kowloon to Hong Kong side during evening

Excellent, low cost, clean. These ferries are fantastic for low cost movement. They are clean (Especially compared to our previous visit some time ago), clean and are very regular.They are open to the elements so if you are travelling when its windy or raining be aware that the cabin is open and you can be exposed.Conditions are basic but the trips are generally short and the seats although basic are comfortable.Peak hours in the mornings and evenings can mean crowds but if you organise your travel between the island and mainland around this you'll be OK.Be careful getting on and off as the gangplank moves against the terminal when there is wave activity.Otherwise take the metro .............. excellent but more costly

Very cheap, regular service across the harbour. A common sight on the harbour is the star ferries crossing. This is a very regular service with the options of sitting on the lower or upper decks. For a very low fare you get some great views of Hong Kong Island. Very easy to use, especially with a oyster card. A must do in Hong Kong
Stopover. So easy and reliable you forget your not crossing a river !! You can't compare to woolwich ferry !!! 20p each way and we had 4 crossings each included in Big Bus Tour tickets
Best views of Hong Kong. An inexpensive way to experience memorable views of the Hong Kong and Kowloon skylines. In fact, one of the last authentic remnants of historic Hong Kong.

Star Ferry tour. It seemed like a must do in Hong Kong. It was enjoyable and there was some interesting information given on the sights. Had record breaking cold weather while we were there though so was a bit chilly.
BACK TO THE PAST. This ferry journey is an experience of living history and when you sit on board you will never the forget experience

A MUST DO when you are in Hong Kong. This iconic ferry is a must du when you are in Hong Kong. It is a cheap way to get the best views on the Hong Kong skyline. Always a great way to travel in the city.
A must-do activity!. Memories of old Hong Kong come to mind. Take a trip (ferry ride) down memory lane! We took the ferry from Hong Kong island to Kowloon. The ticket is inexpensive.
Charming way to cross the harbour (and very cheap). Charming way to cross the harbour, and very cheap. At sunset you can take beautiful pictures or both sides (Kowloon vs. Hong Kong island).

at the evenig when light is on,romantic view crrosing by star ferry... bild long time ago and still verry beasy day and night.crossing the harbour with star ferry and enjoy the remarkeble view to HKG WAN SHAI ,,and opposite...pay little money,for great view.

A MUST DO IN HONG KONG. What an amazing way to travel across the harbour. The ferry is cheap and efficient and the most amazing views of Hong Kong and Kowloon and the harbour. It is a very quick trip and it would be nice if it was longer. Can be a little crowded but there is enough seats for everyone to sit down and it is all part of the fun. Highly recommend. It is a must do in Hong Kong
Easy. What's to say. It's about the only way across the bay. Frequent and fast. Great way to go back and forth between Hong Kong and Kowloon.
Excellent Views on the city. We really enjoyed our cruise around the harbour, the views of the skyscrapers were fantastic. We were given a soft drink & biscuits included in the ticket price.

Harbour tour is nice. Dont go for Symphony of Lights Harbour tour. Waste of money and no proper view. Watch Symphony of Lights from Ferry Pier. Night tour in ferry could be good. Nice facilities, 1 hr ride

Handy way to move between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. There are a few ways to get between Kowloon, where we stayed, and Hong Kong Island. The Star Ferry is definitely the most enjoyable with lovely view of either the Island or Kowloon, and of course the boats and junks on the waterways.
Cheap and fun. Hopped in the ferry when I was heading back to my hotel from Tsim Sha Tsui, you can ride the ferry for only 3HKD.

You need to see the harbor FROM the harbor. Traveling from the mainland to Hong Kong Island and back was a great way to see this active harbor and have a better appreciation for the city on both sides. It is inexpensive and refreshing and is a great time to photography the skyline.
Easy transport, cheap harbour trip. Very low cost (HK$2,50) ferry accross Victoria Harbour. Efficient, and a nice view over the harbour and Kowloon/Hong Kong.

Nice view, but felt like cattle. We did the tour in time for the Lights Show. It was nice to see the skyline, but the tour consisted of a lap of the river without too much value add. The soundtrack and commentary providing a history lesson got in the way, rather than added to the experience. Staff getting people on and off were a little over zealous, but the on board cleaner was lovely. Don't eat the free refreshments!Would not go out of my way to do it again.

Cheap and easy- caution for motion sickness. I get motion sickness easy and yet did notthink the short trip across would make me feel ill. It was the sway of a smaller ferry waiting to depart and waiting to disembark...my kids loved it.Super cheap and easy to access. Peoplesay it is a "must do" in Hong Kong but for me, I did not love it.
A Must Do!!!. Everyone should ride in the star ferry, great experience and a bargain. Gives you the opportunity to enjoy HK in a different new way.

Beautiful and Cheap!. Although the ride was very short (some five mins), I enjoyed every second. It was night and you could see both coasts of Hong Kong burning with skyscrapers' lights. And the ticket for adults is very cheap - 2.5 HKD (~ $0.32, €0.29, 0.44 AUD, 1.18 AED). I definitely recomment taking this one.

Old Hong Kong charm. We usually stay at the Tsim Sha Tsui area and the fastest way to get from Harbour City/Ocean Terminal to the HK Convention Center will be through the Star Ferry. With an Octopus card in hand, all the traffic is avoided. It also arrives and departs on time. The Star Ferry has retained its "old Hong Kong" charm and is a must-see for tourists.
Star ferry convenien. The access to the Star Ferry is good from the Sheraton in Kowloon. Use the top deck to avoid diesel fumes. Short trip across the harbour to Central.
Best view of HK. A cheap and breezy way to see HK or Kowloon cityscape. Take it at night for the view of magnificently lit buildings.
the occasion to spend some time on the water.... The lines are reasonable,not too long.Best done at night for the super-lit skyline.Best way to cross from Kowloon to HK
Great views. I loved this, so cheap and the views of the harbour as night was setting in were amazing. Can't wait to plan my next trip and taking my children.

Lovely ride specially at night. Crossing by ferry from one side to another from the island is really amazing you can see the great view of the city, big buildings and other constructions that are worthy to see. This ferry is really cheap and is really interesting to make this trip at night where you can enjoy the beautiful lights of the city for a great price.
Excellent way to get around Hong Kong. Ideal way to move from one side of the island to another. Ferries run regularly and are from my experience always on time. Cheap and easy to use
Great way to see the harbour. Excellent way tho cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong. It can be a bit bumpy but still a great experience
Awesome boat ride. Dont miss the star ferry. Totally worth it. You should take the star ferry from taim sha tsui to hongkong island. It is a must.

FUN!. I tried the Star Ferry as my friends are highly recommended it to me. This is awesome, it only takes 2.3 HKD and you could travel from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui. It is full of fun to view Hong Kong from a different sight, and does save time. If I travel via the MTR, it might take 20 or more mins to get to my destination, but with the ferry, it is much quicker.

Cheap & good. You can use your 'octopus' card for the ride. It cost only HK2 to cross over frm Kowloon to Central. Dont expect comfortable seats (cushion...nah) but the seats were clean. It only takes ard 10-15 mins but i enjoy the view very much.
A golden oldie. The Star Ferry IS Hong Kong. Reliable, clean, cheap and oh, what a view from all sides. Beats the subway for the WOW factor.
Crossing the Hong Kong bay.... The Myth on the bay... The Star Ferry...At night, just breathtaking view of Victoria Harbor and Kowloon...A must see!!!And price valuable!!!
Good Ferry service. Good and cheap transfer from central and Wanchai to Kowloon. Very frequent regular reliable service...Good views
FUN. This is a must do when in Hongkong,experience the views and the people.Its cheap and a really fun way to get from Kowloon to Hongkong island.

Skip the subway, take the ferry. The ferry is super cheap (2.5 HKD) and it's quite fast (schedule wise and transit). So, if you just missed the ferry, another one will come along in a few minutes and you'll be on the other side in about 15.This experience is a must by night being that the island is lit up and the view is beautiful, it's great for pictures.I feel as if it's a HK classic being that the ferry has been around for so long and there's even pictures so you can see how it's progressed over the years .. Still, it has an old school feel to it. It's something I look forward to every time I go to Hong Kong. Also, when arriving to Hong Kong island, don't go through IFC, make a left and stroll through the park, watch people jog and take pictures of the skylines.

Very organised and dirt cheap. Our group of friends used this service to get to Hong Kong central. Pleasant and short journey. Works out around 30p! Lots of seats are available and a good view of the skyline.

Great experience!. Since people always seem to choose the subway, this is a nice and very cheap alternative to cross over from TST to Hong Kng Island. You will have a great view of the Skyline especially when your kids like a short boat trip.
Scenic crossing from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. These ferries operated frequently and provided a remarkably cheap and scenic way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island.

Best and cheapest thing to do in Hong Kong. Costs pennies, no need to book. Still gives the best view of the Hong Kong skyline. You never have to wait more than a few minutes to catch one. It only takes 10 minutes to cross, but you get to see the harbour in all it's glory.

Most scenic way to cross the harbour. The ferry has been operational for a very long time and it is one of the most convenient and scenic way to travel from Tsim Sha Tsui in Kowloon to Central or Wan Chai on Hong Kong Island. Definitely a must do during any trip to Hong Kong.
Scenic and cheap. No trip to Hong Kong is truly complete without a ride on the Star Ferry. Super cheap, and convenient routes.

Must do in HK!. We took the ferries alot during our stay, (even when the MTR would have been more convenient) for two reasons, its incredibly cheap and its such a nice way to get across Victoria harbour.

Historical experience. Just a fun thing to do. Its a Ferry but the history of the Ferry is the fun thing and to say you have done it. You also get some pretty good views outside. If you want to cool off the AC was quite cold and felt amazing!!!
Runs fawlessly. For such a cheap price, you get to ride on a ferry that gets you across the harbour no fuss. Very clean and efficient. Nice change from the MTR. Enjoy the views!
The best way to get from central to kowloon. This iconic ferry ride is a must in Hong Kong. It's cheap and it comes often. It's the best way to from central to Kowloon or vice versa.

A little piece of history, and good fun too. Star ferry has been running back and forth across the harbour of Hong Kong for many years transporting millions of tourists and residents during that time. Now it has been shortened in its journey, and its quicker on the MTR, but you cant beat the romance and history of the trip on the Star Ferry. Its a very cheap way to travel and the sights from the ferry as it chugs its way across are priceless. Two classes, with downstairs being ordinary and upper deck first class. Better views fro upper deck, and not as noisy from the engines. Is you're in Hong Kong, you have to go on the Star ferry at least once, and who knows, you may be hooked and use it all the time if you've got time to do so. Highly recommended and is my preferred way of travel, as I can revel in the views rather that the sterile underground environment of the MTR.
Convenient!. It's so convenient to cross on the Star Ferry between Kowloon and Central. It's a free trip for Senior Octopus cardholders.

Go upstairs. From Hong Kong to Kowloon sit on the right hand side for the best view. Pay for a token with cash it's only 35hkd so really cheap.
From Central station take exit C and go through the mall to the far end then wslk down the elevated walkway for the easiest way to get there.
Best ride in town. A fun and very cheap way to cross the harbour. Easy to use, great views and interesting people on board.

A cheap way to see the Harbour from both sides. To travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon use the ferry. It a quick, cheap relaxing ,fun way to cross the Harbour.A trip to Hong Kong always should include a ferry trip.

So cheap you won't believe it.. This ferry is a vital part of Hong Kongs infrastructure . It is used by 100s of 1000s of people everyday but it cost a few cents per trip. The trip across Hong Kong island is a must do when in HK. Great way to view the city scape.
Fast!!!. It only took less than 8 minutes , and you will be arrived from Kowloon side to Hong Kong side!!!! It's very fast and you don't have to wait in line!!!

Best way to see the skyline. Rather than booking expensive harbour tours , for 7 HKD ( return) you can enjoy the same views. Isn't that worth it ? Plus good service, reasonable seating and the piers on both sides have vending machines. So go ahead save money

Reasonable price. Should take the ferry at night so that we can see skyscrapers of Hong Kong. The ticket per person is quite cheap, less than 5 HKD (I kind of forgot the exact price per person, if I am not mistaken around 3,7 HKD). There are 2 bays which can go to the central and the other bay is Wan Chai (Hong Kong event and convention centre).
Quick and easy transport. Regular transport system between the Island and the mainland, use your oyster card for ease of use. Great photo opportunities.
Star Ferry. cheap way to get between Kowloon and HK Island..............and view the city at the same time. Mix with tourists, locals and experience the hussle of HK
Best entertainment in town . This is what hkg is. Enjoy the breeze back and fourth between hkg island and Kowloon Possibly the lest expensive thing to do in hkg.

Easy access to cross over Hong Kong Island. If you want to try other form of transportation to get over to Hong Kong Island, this is the other alternative. You get to see the skyline and the highrise buildings of HK. Just a short ride and you'll reach! No harm trying.
Fun for all. It was just a simple ferry ride, but all of us from age 3 to 50 enjoyed the boat. It had alittle bit of culture, views of the bay and all for a small price.
Extremely quick!. I used the ferry twice more for fun than anything else however I couldn't get over how quick and efficient the service was! Not like public transport in the UK!

Must do. A touch of the 19th century amidst the 21st. HK is such a 'new' place, yet the taxies (ancient toyotas), buses (second-hand in 1970) and this ferry are working links to the previous century. All great cities have a ferry and if you've "done" the Staten Island Ferry in NYC then you'll know why you need to hop on this one for the astoundingly cheap crossing.Great views, great people-watching. It's the Orient Express of HK.Gets very very busy on the 8pm sailing (since the ferry slows down and chugs in the bay so that you can see the free light experience).Make sure you have an Octopus card - you can just swipe and board without queuing for tickets.

So cheap you can do multiple rides. Great for business travelers with limited time on their hand. From Hong Kong station it's a 5 min walk to the ferry. The crossing takes less than 10 minutes (and only 2.3 HKD) and is great for some photo ops of the skyline, so do a ride in the afternoon and one at night, as you desire.
Back to old times. Would recommend to try this. Refreshing air, cheap, and you get a good view of the skyline. Would recommend to try at least one trip during the evening.

traffic jam proof!. a great way to step away from it all and let your daily worries drift into the harbor as you float between HK & KL. The Ferry has a magical way of easing your daily pressure... and it cost much less than therapy! Just check your weather as extreme conditions will halt services. And like all rush hours, it will get crowded on certain hours.

Heart of Hong Kong. The Star ferry is the essence of Hong Kong. A very quick and inexpensive ride between Kowloon and the island, it can be lost among all the other sites. But it is always a quick fun ride and sets the tone for experiencing this lively city.
Hong Kong. The trip could not be easier. Frequent shuttles across the harbor with plenty of seating. On nice days the middle of the boat is where you want to be for photographs.
Waste of time . Very boring Monotonous Nothing special Boring songs played Never will recommend to anyone Outside fish market was worth a watch

Bad value for money. Not worth the money. You'll have to pay HKD95 for an hour trip, just to sit down and watch the harbour, with little explanation whatsoever of what is around the harbour. You don't even know which building they are referring when they play the recorded guide.
Just $2. A must. Frequent service; upstairs enclosed in case of rain and fresh air downstairs. Great seeing all the other boats of all shapes and sizes going past. Fantastic
Must travel.. Wonderful views of harbour and city, costs very little aprox 25 cents . You must travel both day and night for different views.

Everyone's Bucket List. A trip on the Star Ferry should be on everyone's bucket list. The equivalent of 40 cents (US) for a one way trip across the Harbour from Central or Wan Chai to Kowloon is a trip I never get tired of. Ferries leave every 20 minutes or so during peak periods.For a special trip, travel at night from Kowloon to the Island. You will have a picture in your mind forever.

a different way to travel. whenever I bring my friends or relatives to HK, star ferry is always included as a mode of transportation. It's cheap, efficient and a different way to get across the harbour in just 10 mins. Nice scenery and great experience. Reminds me of the scenes in HK dramas. Relaxing and not as busy as the city itself is.
Just another Ferry ride. The ferry service for visitors to experience the nigh lights. Although the experience might be same from the shores of Kwaloon. Nothing great about this service.

Charming and old world commute, in an ultra modern city!!!. This ferry transports you back in time, but keeps reminding you about the future. It is just a short ride from Central to Tsim Tsa Tsui, lasting some 10 minutes, but the feeling of moving in water, in something that is so traditional and rustic, makes it so special.The short ride gives you the most spectacular views of the Hong Kong skyline. Truly breathtaking.The wooden benches, the information about the ferry on the upper deck on the wall, and simply the way they way conduct their business is so fascinating to watch.And before you know it, the ferry ride comes to an end, and that's the best part. Short, sweet and very cheap.With all the wonderful means of public transport in in Hong Kong, I would say that this one is the most charming, nostalgic and also comfortable.Just do it, even if its for the kicks, its well worth it and you wont repent.

Charming ferry. It does not take much time to go to Hong Kong Island from Kowloon by ferry, but it is a very charming ride, reminding you of of the slower pace of days gone by. Not particularly comfortable, but that is part of the charm. Great view of the skyline of Hong Kong Island. May the Star ferries sail for many more years!

Wonderful and inexpensive. When in Hong Kong we constantly use the Star Ferries. It only takes 7 minutes from Kowloon side to Hong Kong Island. We also use it to visit Chung Chau island which is like the old China and great for seafood and shopping. Use your Octopus card as it's easier that purchasing a ticket. We always take the line to Top Deck which is a few cents more but less crowded. And believe me these ferries can be crowded. There are several terminals all clearly marked.
Fair price with a view..... This Star Ferry had never changed it's token price ever since it was founded...i guess if nit mistaken...only cost 50 cents..with a view...

Great little trip to see the skyline. We went on this s couple of times. It's used by locals as part of their commute, although I don't think it's cheap compared to their metro. It's really easy to find and a great view in the day or evening. We tried to time it to watch the laser show but ended up using a viewing platform. It's about a ten minutes trip and goes every ten minutes
Iconic HK. The only way to travel from Central to TST is on the Star Ferry! Great way to see the HK skyline especially late afternoon and sunset. Great for kids as its a short journey!
Good way of getting across the harbour. Takes 2-5 minutes to get across, they sail very frequently and a ticket costs 2-2.5 HKdollars. Iconic boats

Amazing views, amazing price!. The star ferry is a must do when in Hong Kong - it's very cheap and the views are outstanding!You can hop on the ferry in Tsim Sha Tsui and it'll take you across to either Wan Chai or Central ferry piers, and in doing so it gives you incredible views of the cities impressive skyline and huge skyscrapers! I would highly recommend taking the ferry at around 8pm - this allows you a breathtaking view of the buildings all lit up at night, as well as being a less crowded alternative view of the Light show.
Ferry across the Harbour. Very efficient and well used ferry across the harbour. Cheap ferry tickets and a choice of arrival points.
Quick Ferry with some decent views. Ferry came quick and was easy to board. Ferry was old and dilopadated and a bit dirty. however it did take us from point "A" to point "B"
Relaxing 15 minutes. Take ferry from Wan Chain to Tsim Sha Tsui, it take around 15 minutes, enjoy the wonderful Victoria Harbour view and only cost you a few dollars.

Ferry. The ferry system and the harbor in general offer a more cleaner experience than 27 years. From The Renaissance Hotel to Kowloon is a very short journey and of course offers you a skyline view that is not available in the subway. We took a ferry while out at Aberdeen and found it be a good experience.
Convinient. Very convenient way to cross the water in Hong Kong and it has certain positive feel to it. We went in the evening so nice views all around.
Cheap Harbour Cruise. A great way to see all of HK - Cheap and quick, fantastic photo opportunities. Everytime I visit a must!!!

The Only Right Way to Get to Either Sides of Hong Kong. First and foremost, it costs almost nothing to get on the Star Ferry. I loved that I only had to walk a bit to the pier. Waved my Octopus card and hopped on the ferry. The view of gorgeous Hong Kong from the upper deck was amazing, at any time of the day, even when it rained. I would recommend this as the 1st must-do in Hong Kong, the Ding Ding second. If there is one thing that I will never get bored doing in HK it would be just getting on the Star Ferry to get to either sides of HK.

Cheap scenic memorable travel with a view. Probably the best way to travel across the harbor. The ferries travel frequently, so they're easy to catch, and generally not crowded. They ride well on the water, so no sense of motion sickness from any of our party. The ferries give a great view of Hong Kong and Kowloon, and you get to see several areas of the harbor fairly up close that you wouldn't see otherwise. An old school method of travel, with old but well maintained ferries, it's hard to beat this extremely cheap way of travel to get across the harbor.
Cheap and Overated. Make sure you have your walking shoes on because on arrival at HK island you have a mile to walk to get anywhere apart from an Apple Store.

"Lovely Harbour''. This is a great way of viewing the harbour the tour takes around one and half hours from one side of the Island to the other with commentary in English pointing out the many places of interest on the way.

A Nice and Cheap Way to enjoy Victoria Harbour. Being a Hong Kong resident, I have taken Star Ferry numerous times but still I enjoy every trip. With the fares less than US 30 cents, it’s the cheapest method to cross the harbour, very relaxing and a great one to enjoy the sea breeze and the harbour views. Not to be missed by any one visiting Hong Kong.
Cheap and fast. Very cheap (2,5HKD) way to cross the river while seeing the skyline. No need to wait more than 10 minutes to get a boat and it takes 6min to cross it.

Never lose the Star Ferries. These lovely old ladies of the Harbour are a part of Hong Kong. Every time I go there are so many changes that having some lovely old constants are a must keep, went back and forth 3 times this trip
Cheap, short, fun. As this is a form of public transit, I wasn't expecting too much but it's great! It costs less than 1 usd and is a fun way too see the skyline.

Basic, but does the job perfectly.. These ferries never seem to change, but reliably do the job, year after year.The transport is basic, but very efficient and in my opinion, very good value for money. It is more fun than going by train.
Superb. These charming boats are a regular and cheap way to travel between Hong Kong and Kowloon! The services are regular and great!Using them is a must when visiting Hong Kong!

Sit on the East at night . The Star Ferry is always a joy. The lozenge shape ferries are reminiscent of a bygone era. If you are travelling from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui (TST) then sit on the right. You will see the skyline of Admiralty, Wan Chai and Causeway Bay more effectively. Similarly, if you are travelling from TST to Central, sit on the left. Sit on the Eastside. From TST you can also go to Wan Chai and this is a great trip at sunset and breaks the Eastside rule. The other rule is do it more than once and then it doesn't matter. After all it is a bargain!
Good way to cross the harbour . Is a very good and cheap way to cross the Victoria harbour, with the lovely skyline view the whole journey only take less than 10 mins is truly worth the ride.

Enjoy it while you still cancan.. No trip to HK is completecomplete without a ride on the Star Ferry. It takes 7 minutes from HK Island to Kowloon. Yes the MTR (train) is much quicker, but you see nothing travelling under ground. Sit back on the ferry and watch as the harbour boats and occasionally huge cruise ships pass by. Take some excellent photographs or just let your mind travel back in time when most of the ferries were made and visualise old HK, where Coolies plied their trade pulling rickshaws, street vendors sold their wares and pollution hadn't been invented.
Cheap and cheerful. Most charming way to cross the harbour, probably the cheapest too! There is also a ferry to TST from Wan Chai/convention centre , although covered in construction at present

A Must when in Hongkong. The Star Ferry has been operating for well over 50 years and before the MTR and tunnels was the main way to cross the harbour. The MTR has taken away a lot of the patronage but it is still a must for tourists to cross the harbour. It is cheap and you get your harbour views as you cross. The ferries are old and not air conditioned. On a rainy , windy day the weather sheets may be down to block your view. Pay the extra few cents and travel on the top level! Handy also if you are staying in Kowloon near the harbour. On arrival on Hong Kong Island side it is only a short walk to other ferry terminals if you are planning to visit other islands ( eg Lamma)

Nostalgia. An iconic way to travel. Easy to board as a tourist but you need approx. HK$3 per person in coins.If on business stay in Kowloon and commute via the ferry....better than riding the bus, taking a train, tram or driving home.
Love it. So this little ferry will trasport you between Kowloon and other islands. It is pretty cheap, but prices are higher on the weekends

Characterful ferries!. No trip to Hong Kong is complete without a trip on the old Star ferries. Even a short hop from Kowloon to Central for about 30 cents, is worthwhile to experience transport from bygone days. They have names like Twinkling Star and so on!

the romantic alternative . love the Tsim Sha Tsui to central or wan chai routes. day times or night rides are both refreshing. a good way to view the skyline and shoreline of both HK island and the Kowloon peninsula. recommends try it at night around Xmas to see the lights. otherwise around 8pm daily when we have the light show involving lasers and building lights on both shores of the Victoria Harbour.a much economical and less congested way to cross the harbour (cf MTR) provided that time is not a big issue.

Holiday with family. It is a good transport from Kowloon to Hong Kong island for tourist who want to experience the ferry. I use it to travel to Central then took bus to the peak which is quite convenient.During the ferry journey you can enjoy the central business district skylines. It is a old and classic ferry which is good for sunny weather not for rainy days.Try it if the weather is good.

Simply a must. Nice little adventure to get to and from island to Mainland. Quick, easy and good value for money. Great views.
Pay for ticket at machine. Enjoy shops but watch out for street sellers!!!
1 of the best journey In a life time. Every time it blows me away...it reminds me of a book called 'Siddharta'.... It's definitely a must experience when hitting HK...enjoy the journey:-)

Night Harbour Tour. Take a 1 h ferry ride on a replica of a 1920s boat. Runs every evening twice 7 and 8 PM. Great views of the city lights when the boat drives along the strait.Tickets are bought from Star Ferry ticket offices at Central Pier 7 (easiest access via MTR Central and IFC mall and pedestrian walk close to Apple store) or at Tsim Sha Tsui (end of Salisbury Rd). Price is 175 HK and incl a snack.You can also do it daytime at a lower price (98 HKD if I remember correct).And of course you can take Star Ferry as a nice boat ride between Central pier and Tsim Sha Tsui as a public transportation (Octopus card works) for a few HKD. Lovely mode of transport!
