The star ferry is a must for any visit to Hong Kong.. No matter when you visit Hong Kong, the Star Ferry is a must. It provides an overall look of the city from the water.

Great way to shuttle between Central & Kowloon. Hard to beat the price (2.50 - 3.50 HK depending on time, I think) & great views during the 5+ minute traverse. If you go around 7:45/8 pm, you get a free light show. The relocated pier on the Central side is a little less convenient (fairly long walk to get back to Queens Road), but not such a big deal if you're not in a rush and don't have mobility issues.
A lovely way to travel from Kowloon to Central or Wanchai.. We found it relaxing travelling by Star Ferry to Central, but it was a long walk to get to the shopping district.

A short boat ride. Was fascinated to find out that this heritage ferry was started by a Parsee Dorabjee Naorojee in the 19th Century. Once the main connection between Hong Kong Central and Kowloon this is now a tourist attraction with good view of Central and Kowloon. What I found interesting about the boats was the reversible seat design. Again, the ubiquitous Octopus card enables you to get on board without having to purchase a ticket.
cleaner version of gateway. the ferry is good way to connect between kowleen and hk citi. the boats are ok ok like gateway the price is normal

Cheap but Memorable. I took the Ferry from Central to TST and vice versa, as well as the hour-long Symphony of Lights Tour. The usual Ferry costs only 3.4 HKD if you use the top deck and the octopus card. There was no line to get on, and it was easier to ride the Ferry than to take the metro (at least for my itinerary). You can feel the breeze of the harbor and see the highrises on both sides.The hour long tour cost 200 HKD, which is alot, but you get a can of soda and a pack of cookies. You also can listen to recorded narration about Hong Kong and the Light Spectacular. It was a good way to spend a rainy evening on my own. The evening tour leaves TST at 6.55 pm and 7.55 pm. They make you line up, but I sat and waited for the line to clear, since it was not busy. There were enough seats on the boat when I went. Service staff are bilingual, so that was also a plus. I'm glad I visited this attraction.
Cheap and good. Don't miss the Satr Ferry on your trip to Hong Kong.So gentle and low cost travel from HKI to Kowloon and back.

Simple and lovely. For a few pence you can travel, alongside locals, tourists and business folk, across the harbour on this little beaut. What's not to like? By day or night it is a must do jaunt and takes only a few minutes.
easy service. Easy regular service and still great value, no trip to Hong Kong is complete without a trip on the Star Ferry!
Enjoyable . Cheap to ride. Amazing views. Sat on the lower deck without problem. Great access with a pram. Rode both directions. A fun experience.
Inexpensive and great views . Title says it all really. It's about 25 pence one way, goes regularly, good views of the city enroute, arrives in central locations

Cheapest Harbour Tour in the World. No trip to Hong Kong would be complete without a trip on the Star Ferry between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.
It only costs a few coins as a scenic alternative to an expensive taxi through the tunnels.
Chris M
Great cheap experience . Great experience. Coolest way to get from kowloon to business centre. Take the bottom deck - it's 50 cent cheaper and way more fun.

A good way to see the city. The Star Ferry Harbour Cruise takes just one hour and is a good way to get a perspective on the city and harbour. At $HK100 which includes an on board refreshment it is also good value.Unfortunately on the day we travelled the sky was overcast and grey but on a clear day it would present opportunities for photographs.It stops at three piers: you get off where you boarded the ferry
good fun nice view. Loved this simple night shuttle across the harbour kids could see all the lights and buildings and enjoyed the whole experience .... 2 HKD a token so a simple easy fun thing to do

Great International Experience. Travelling to Hong Kong frequently in the 80's & 90's but very rarely since, this in my view still captures the essence of a Hong truly Kong experience for the international tourist!!Travelling from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island either day or night is just so different for westerners. Offering cheap prices for upper or lower deck seats and a very regular timetable you can put it down as a great international experience, with the sights, sounds, and fragrant odours all screaming Hong Kong!!
great transport. we used the star ferry on many occations and found them excelent , they run every few minuets and are very cheap, easy to buy tickets

Worth taking a trip. Fairly painless process to get on the ferry, they run frequently and are very clean. Not to mention you get a great view of HK Island or Kowloon depending on the way you are travelling. Enjoyed using this mode of transport.
Amazing. What a find this was, we decided to upgrade to the upper deck..............the fare went from 28 to 34 pence!! It's brilliant and you are on the main island in about 10 minutes

Seeing HK's Beautiful Skyline. If you are in a rush, better ride the ferry. If your hotel is only around Tsim Sha Tsui and you are from HK island, then better go with the ferry. See HK's skyline in the afternoon and the dancing lights in the evening.

Opportunity to have an authentic harbor experience and view. We definitely enjoyed our rides on the ferry. It is used by people who live in Hong Kong for their regular commutes and gives the tourist a way to see the harbor that is authentic and fun. The boats are old - this is not a luxury cruise! However, its a great way to see all the traffic in the harbor and participate in an experience that has been around for years.

Easy, efficient & effective service. We used the ferry often b/w Kowloon & Hong Kong Island & had no problems or delay. The safety & security measures taken were appropriate & first class, the ferry is comfortable & clean & the timetable was always adhered to.
Great way to travel. How exciting to be on Hong Kong Harbour, going so conveniently from one side to the other. Most enjoyable.

Do it!. Easy quick and convenient harbour crossing. Inexpensive fares ($3.5HKD if I remember correctly). Great views, history and fresh air. A crossing takes about 10 minutesPay the extra dollar for the upper deck.

Fun ride. The ferry is great for a cheap ride across the harbour and so easy to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and back. There are good views - so much to see, and a very comfortable ride. Even waiting for the ferry is interesting - there are lots of souvenir shops around so you can browse while you're waiting. There is not much time between ferries though, so be quick. We also took an hour long ferry ride around the harbour. This was awesome, but we didn't realise when it was our stop, so the trip took an hour and a half, oops.

Tranquil and enjoyable . When you have lots of time to travel cross island and peninsular i.e. Hong Kong and Kowloon do consider the Star Ferry! It is the iconic ferry that only takes about 12 minutes to get you across excluding waiting time so do allow 40 minutes to leisurely wait for the ferry and to walk around some of the shops and mini food stalls around as well!

Star Ferry = a must. What can be said other than a must when visiting HK. Have been coming for 25+ years & always try & get one ferry ride in even if to just give me time to ponder & think over business.I have clients who swear blind they won't go on it but it's totally safe & impossible to fault the way it's run.

fun way to get acorss the bay. These Star Ferry boats have been trekking across the bay in Hong KOng forever, and they look worn out but charming. It was interesting to see locals using the ferry too, so a great chance to people-watch.

Best Start to your Trip with Great Views of the Harbor!. An amazing attraction and an essential trip to take when in Hong Kong. With so much history, the ferry trip across the harbor is a perfect way to start your trip. The views of the harbor and buildings surrounding it are an awesome site with the trip on the ferry giving you a very nostalgic feel. Ferry ride is very cheap and centrally located near Fenwick and Wanchai PierSuggest that you get on the Ferry early and start your trip off right!
has to be done. it is an experience, I think it cost around 40p .... so cheap and lovely at night .... get some great photos of the harbour

I loved the star ferry. It was ace! We used it pretty much every day and a couple of evenings too. Costs about 2.5HK dollars (25p) to sail across the harbour and the views are just as good as from a proper cruise. Dead regular, pleasant breeze in the stifling heat and excellent views.
Worth a trip. As a tourist a trip on Star Ferry is a must. It travels from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. You can pay for the trip at machines at the port.

Easy route back to HK island for the Exhibition Centre from Kowloon. for just 2.50 HKD this was an ideal way to get back across to HK island and back. Ferries seem to run ver regularly and you just turn up, buy a token and on you go. Very simple.

Brilliant. This is a good way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island or visa versa. My husband is a wheelchair user and we both love to go on this ferry when we stay over in Hong Kong on our way to New Zealand. There are ramps to get on and off and the staff will always give you a hand if you are struggling, also it is a cheap way to travel.

A tourist must.. Only negative it was too short. Good views of the city during the day or at night. Watch out the chair backs are reversible. We saw an accident because a tired tourist braced herself using these seat backs.

Fantastic way to cross the harbour.. It is so enjoyable to cross the Hong Kong harbour by thr Star ferry.It costs less then Aust.$ 0.50 and you can enjoy the beautiful viewof both sides of the Hong Kong harbour.

See the beauty of HK at night. Last minutes,we decided to stop by at the star ferry for a night ride around HK....boy we glad we did.....We manage to get on the last boat....it was very beautiful especially at night.....note this is the private tour star ferry we took and it's around 1hr.....highly recommended...
Nice place must visit everyday you stay in Hong Kong. Nice place I suggest to visit every evening you stay at Hong Kong at 7.30 to 8.30 pm nice symphony light show
Good. I read in the book guide that these is unmisseble. I don't think that way. Anyway it has its charm. Do it just to see the town from the see.
So Easy. Catching the Star Ferry across Victoria Harbour is so easy and one of the best ways to view the beautiful surrounds of Hong Kong, a must for all travellers.
Night Ride. Night ride is an economical way to see HK skyline. Do this during the lighting show between 8 to 9. Its quite a fantastic experience
amazing view. I loved riding the ferry whenever I get the chance! amazing view and you get a chance to take good photos. I recommend taking the ferry twice, in the morning and at night.
great way to travel. cheap, frequent service. i loved taking this ferry, the view is awesome and the ferry itself is a piece of history

History Lives. We went on the Star Ferry multiple times. It is so cheap and reminds travelers of the amazing history of Hong Kong harbor. Sit on the top deck for the best views. The seats have a back rest that flips over to sit the other direction.

A classic journey. This is one of the great ferry crossing routes of the world and you just have to do it sometime. Great green and white ferries all with xxxx Star names. Buy tokens at machines as you enter the stations - get two tokens at a time, one for the return.

Cheap and definitely worth doing. The ferry is probably not the most efficient way to get from Central to Kowloon since there's a subway line, but it's definitely worth doing at least once for the view across the harbour. It's cheap, about HK5, and a pretty short ride of about 10-15 minutes. Do take note that the ferry terminal is quite abit of a walk from Central station so do factor that in if you plan to head there.

A must do in HK!. The Star Ferry is probably the best value-for-money activity you can do in Hong Kong! It's a cheap & easy way to cross the harbour and best of all you get to enjoy some amazing views too. Make sure you take at least one journey in day time and one at night to see the lights.

Efficient, cheap & easy access.. Always enjoyed the short crossing ( due to reclamation ). In the 70's the ride was longer! Star ferry itself is iconic. Glad that the ferries are still operating. Keep it up.! Whenever i visit hkg, i always make a couple of trips on the ferries. A must DO for me whilst in hkg!!

Fun, work-a-day and a taste of history. Not long, not expensive but something to say you've done. Fun to be on and off; kids fascinated by the flip seats (so the bench faces either direction). Get the octopus card--you'll be glad you did as this is easy peasy using that.
Always a great Citytour!. It is Always a pleasure to take The ship to Hong Kong Island or Vice Versa to Kowloon. The best form of transportation, especially the quickest. And it costs Nearly nothing!

The old good ferry-line. O hi o hoi. Still there after my last visit 25 years ago :) The ferry goes between Hong Kong and Kowloon. It takes about 15 minutes and you can feel the history onboard. The history of this ferry line is over 100 years....so it´s a must t visit.

A tick box attraction but nice change to MTR. Most guide books tout this as an authentic experience and a form of transport used by locals daily. In all honesty it is mainly tourists now, particularly the Central to TST route. It is cheap as chips and certainly something to do. MTR is faster but that said it is nice to slow down a little every now and then.If you really like these little ferries then head to the tourism office and book a 45 min harbour tour on one of them instead

Dependable transportation. We took the star ferry when we wanted to cross to the Kowloon area. The ferry was pleasant reliable. However it can be a bit troublesome to have to get to the station by taxi from the hotel. We enjoyed the view very much and would recommend it just for fun. The ferry arrived right besides the Harbor City Mall so that was super convenient! We enjoyed it!

A great and cheap way to see Hong Kong. On my visit to Hong Kong I used the Star Ferries to ramble from place to place getting off and exploring for an hour or two then a different ferry to an other stop.At the time of my visit there was two classes in fact two different decks without access to each other, being naturally stingy I always used the cheapest one but it was a perfect way to do a lot of sightseeing at a very low cost I would love to return and repeat the experience again.

Ship me across mateys. Once you arrive in Hong Kong try to get an Octopus Card. You pay fifty HK dollars for the deposit of the card (which you get back once relinquished back) and we topped it up with a further hundred dollars. You can then use this on many modes of transport whilst travelling around. In this instance we used ours for the Star Ferries, which proved a brilliant way to get across the bay from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Quick and efficient and a good way to cool down at the same time as you gather in the scenery. As they bob across at regular intervals you wont have long to wait. Also it proved a pittance of a fare which in this day and age was most welcomed. Fun way to travel.
That is great. Very first time to travel, but that is great, and fun.You can take a lot of nice photo during the trip specially the price is very cheap.

Simply a HONG KONG must do. I found this simply a classic way to see Hong Kong from the harbor. There are various points to cross from Harbor City TST / Central / Wan Chai. It's very cheap, good time to go on the ferry is 8pm when the city light show is on as you get the best view from the water of both sides Kowloon and the Island. You can also use the ferry for a harbour cruise which i did with family. try to avoid the ferry during rush hour times if possible. You can pay either cash or prepaid card

Yay! Something cheap in Hong Kong!. Something cheap in Hong Kong. Yippee! If you were clever a enough to get a metro card use it here. 2.50 hk to and 2 hk back when I went. In the front you even get air conditioning if ya want it!
Loved this little short boat ride. 8-)
Nice and peaceful. Great sunny day today. Recommend visiting this place early in the morning. You can take a ferry ride to central, wan chai etc.. also you can hop on aqualuna as well from here.

Cheap and Excellent short cruise. The cruise just a short distance but it's not expensive and we did went at night so the view is HK skyline. Nice experience but it would be better if you managed to combine it as transportation. We do travel from HK to Kowloon where our hotel located.

Have exact change. It's a lovely way to see the city from the water and get around. It's a very well functioning service like most of the public transport in HK. When I went to Lama Island there was quite a wait to get back. Everything is pretty simple to figure out and google maps will give you reliable directions about which ferry to take and where.

Go just to say you have been. Locals tell me the ferries are a shadow of their heyday before the MTR and the harbour crossing us half a far due to land reclamation. Still, it us a good short and cheap ride for the nightly son et lumiere starting at 8pm across on the CBD visible from Tsim Sha Tsui. Get there early to get a good spot.

Jump in the past?. It is not easy to comment this attraction: from a functioning standpoint metro is quicker and the ferry it is an average quality connection with very poor service and not so clean as you may expect; but guys it is so romantic to breath the sea wind in a boat that looks like the same since 100 years and almost touch the many big and small boats crowding the branch of seas between Kowloon and the finance center, with an amazing relax and slow view of the many architecture detail of the wonderful Hongkong skyscrapers. If you have time and enjoy thinking while traveling, take the Ferry!
A joy, as always. A must do in Hong Kong! Love going from tst to Hong Kong. Such great views. Good any time of day but rush hour, as it is the cheapest way to cross the harbor
Easy and inexpensive. Definitely the best way to get from Kowloon to Wan Chai and vice versa (forget the Cross Harbour Tunnel) - effectively a brief free harbour tour thrown in.
Nice but not as in the past.. When HK was under British control, the ferry had 1st and 2nd class tickets. Now only one. Much less busy than before. Nice way to get to Kowloon.
real vibe of hong kong. if you in HK then you have to take the star ferry to or from hong kong island, its cheap and quick but long enough to soak up some HK nostalgia!
Cheap, charming and memorable.. Only cost about 20p to cross, get great views of Hong Kong on board a really novel ship. A must for anyone visiting Hong Kong.
Great way to travel between the island and mainland. Definitely the best way to cross the water. Try and make the crossing when the light show is happening to get the best view

Trip to Hong Kong Island. Basic travel but a tourist must if you're in the Kong.
Very cheap! $2 HK. Swift trip & plenty of scenery
Excellent way to get around between HK & Kowloon.

Convenient transport with great views. We stayed at Wan Chai and Star Ferry terminal was a stone's throw away. It's clean, convenient, cheap and offered a great view of the harbor with beautiful lights at night - ferry's wheels, Times Square, junk boat & a helicopter!

There and back again. For only HK$2.50 one way ride from Tsim Sha Tsui to Wanchai is a great experience to try if you visit HK. We rode the ferry at 8:00pm in time to see the light display which is as incredible as the ferry ride.
Old Time Stake. nostalgia, enjoy the sea breeze, fun for bring children for a enjoyment, children can hanging around freely,

Nostalgic Ride. Great way to see the harbor at night in the old fashion boat ride that takes you back to the old way of getting around. Expect large crowds on the boats but once you get passed the crowds, it is a fun way to see Hong Kong.

cheap and fast transport. if you want to cross the harbour from central to Tsim sha tsui, it's a very good, fast and cheap transportation. They leave I think every 15-20 min and it's a short crossing.

Hong Kong's vaporetto . Venice has the vaporettos to shuttle you around the surrounding islands, HK has the Star Ferry. Great way to travel to Kowloon and other islands. Excellent view of HK island, and very cheap. Tip of the day: You can get an Octopus Card and use it for the MTY, HK Express, buses, and the Star Ferry

Wonderful for sightseeing and transportation . The Star Ferry is a HK gem. It is great for sightseeing along Victoria Harbour as well as functional transportation between Kowloon side and Hong Kong side. You can take sightseeing cruises for a fee on a separate ferry than the regular transportation ferry. I highly recommend both.

Fastest way to cross island. Hands down its the fastest, cheap and most convenient way to cross the island onto tst. Plus u get amazing harbour views for free.
The ferry service is quite old so the ships are not up to Date. But it's a five minute ferry so not much of an issue.

A quintessential HK experience . Taking a ride on the Star Ferry has got to be one of the best ways to appreciate the HK skyline and at $2.50HKD a trip (top level) it's a cheaper option than the MKR. I'd recommend going across during the day as well as at night to see the different views. The ferry terminal at Central is very easy to find and accessible from the station via an elevated walkway. The Kowloon pier is a little more out of the way, but follow the helpful signs and you'll soon be on Nathan Road.

Very simple and cheap to use. It was very simple and cheap to get. We stayed at the Renaissance Marriott Harbour View Hotel and we just walked some minutes to get there. There were two ticket machines and we got our tickets from there. Clearly signed (as in the photo) and very clean station. The ferry was very big and clean as well. You get great views of Central as you are going to Kowloon so get your cameras ready! The chairs can be adjusted according to what direction you are heading to. Pretty cool!

Must Try if you are in HK. I really enjoyed the ride. It is very cheap, could be the cheapest transport in whole HK! it also provides you the unique opportunity to view the HK skyline in its full view.
A must do. Iconic ferry crossing is a must do. Dirt cheap and great views of Kowloon and Hong Kong Island especially at night. Crossing takes 10 mins and the ferry has departures every 10 mins or so.
It's a must. If you visit HK, you must go on trhe Star Ferry. Fantastic views of both the island and Kowloon when mid-harbour. Very cheap and a must-do !!

Touristy, but a different way to see HK's sights. The star ferry may be a bit touristy, but its a great, hassle free and quick way to get between Central and Kowloon - while taking in one of the best city skylines in the world! Easy to find and navigate to, and very reasonably priced too (a little over HK$2.5 per head)
best little cruise in Hong Kong. A must do for any visitor to Hong Kong. Take the ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui terminal to Central for only HK$3.40 and enjoy some of the best views of the city.

A Fun Ride. It seemed fitting that we should pay for the ride on the Star Ferry with our Octopus Card (transit & cash card). I had always heard about the Star Ferry, as a child. Each time I take it now, I feel a link with my family's Hong Kong history. Two observations. First, as you board, watch out for the moving gangway. It really moves a lot! Second, the backs of the bench seats move, so that passengers may face the direction the ferry is moving. Although it is just a few minutes between Hong Kong and Kowloon, there is plenty of time to take pictures and take in the harbor sights. One of the best ferry rides in the world!!!
Definitely old skool. Went because of recommendations and so glad we did. Went Kowloon to Central- great fun and so much better few than MTR.......
Ride full of History. We really enjoyed to ride the Star Ferry. It was part of our private tour and we enjoyed the story behind this ferry.
Old charm. You have to try this at least once when visiting Hong Kong. One of the many old charms of Hong Kong!

What views!. Coming from Sydney, we harp a bit too much about our Harbour. But it seems this one leaves other way behind. The best way to see it STAR FERRY!
Nice and easy , entry and simple ticketing.
Must do whilst in Hong Kong

A mustang !! . A great way to get views Of Hong Kong. Simple to use , just a quick tap of your octopus card and your on your way. Plenty of seating and offers a great view of the skyline. Definitely a must for anyone visiting Hong Kong
Cheap, quick, accesible for tourists. Very easy to use, accessible for non chinese, cheap (50 cents a trip) and very nice harbour views. Full of old character.
A fun way to have a closer look at the harbour. This is lovely and inexpensive way to see the harbour up close. A very pleasant way to travel across the harbour. Not to be missed.

Nice and interesting. We used the star ferry to cross for the mainland part of Hong kong and I also used after to Zhong shan. It was good and convenient. Nice to use the ferries while in HK as a nice experience.
A Honest Review. A great way to travel to Hong Kong island.Very cheap and a great view of the island.Well sign posted,easy to find your way to.

Need to improve on queing system. We took a ferry from central to tshim sha tsui.normal view,many said the view from TST to central will be nicer.We have no problem in reading the signs n ensure u have small notes or coin to purchase the ticket.Sad that there is no queing system there and whoever is fast n strong will gets first n manage to seat at the side.I dont know what happen if the crown is big during peak hours or festive season.But my kids enjoys it

Ok. Watch for mouthy Australian dads.... Went. Recorded a promo video bit. Some random Aussie dad embarrassed his whole family by yelling at us for doing our bit. Feel bad for him. Still ride now and then... it's cheap. Enjoy it while it lasts.

Cheaper alternative . A cheaper and fast way to cross towards HongKong island from Tsim and experience the old Hong Kong way of travel with teenage kids , lands directly at the convention and exhibition center

A ride through history. We took the ferry from Central to Kowloon. Very short ride think it was only about $5hk each way. Boats are original, some of the crew wear the traditional blue sailor costumes which just adds to the atmosphere
Pleasant trip. Took the ferry across to the markets. On time and quite comfortable. Nice change from the train. View was lovely and the waters calm. Good photo opportunities.
Very convenient . Very convenient mood of transportation between the Kowloon island and Hong Kong Island , used it twice.
Easy trip between island and Kowloon. The ferry was handy to the hotel and provided wasy acess between tge island and Kowloon. It is cheap and easy. Not unkike a Sydney ferry experience but shorter.
Easy access. The is was walking distance from our hotel and took us to the main area of Hom Kong central. We also took the harbour cruise which on a hot muggy day was a treat.

Simple, efficient and picturesque (on a clear day!). The ferry is an excellent way to see the beautiful harbour views. It is inexpensive (I think it was only HK$3.40 per person) and efficient, running every few minutes. The trip is short, taking about 10 minutes and the ride was pretty smooth. Although the air was quite foggy/polluted(?) on our visit I imagine on a clear evening the views would be stunning.An excellent, affordable way to enjoy the scenery of the harbour.
Great view. We took night ride and it was fun. You need to buy your ticket/token from the vendo machines that cost $2.50hkd from TST to Wanchai ride.Very nice experience:) you should try too!

Not Essential. This is one of those things you are supposed to do in Hong Kong. It is pleasant to see the waterfront and doesn't cost much. I hear it was more exciting when tanker traffic passed through this part of the harbor. Now, it merely is a quiet boat ride.
Nice view. The View from the ferry is gorgeous! We enjoyed view on both side of the island, and more importantly, its not smelly
Classic way to travel.... If you visit Hong Kong and stay in Tsim Sha Tsui you must try this way to across the sea to Hong Kong Island.
Great value. Very very cheap to do and excellent value for money. Great way to get across the water and spectacular views!
Inexpensive way to visit Hong Kong from Kowloon. It was lovely to be out on the harbor, to be going the way people all over the city go between the mainland and the island.

Hong Kong's best. Together with the trams, this is by far Hong Kong's most memorable experience. A few HK dollars and a few minutes of relaxation as you cross the harbour. Turn your phone off and just experience this. You won't regret
Star of the Harbour. Best and cheapest way of getting around on the Hong Kong harbour. The ferries run constantly and are a charming and easy way to see the Hong Kong skyline.

Worth every penny!. Bang for your buck experience (2.50 HKD or 50 cents CAD). You can take it to either side of Hong Kong island (central or wang chai) and the view will be amazing regardless (or do both). The ride across is only about 7 minutes one way, so you only need about 1.5 hours for this attraction. Come here during sunset hours for awesome photos!

A must do, especially at night.. The star ferry is an absolutel bargain and in my opinion is a must do in Hong Kong. The cost of using the very is very low and the views it gives you of Kowloon and HK Island during the journey are fantastic.

The Cheapest way to enjoy the Hong Kong Harbor. The Star ferry is a classic way to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and back. I would recommend riding it in the evening (especially at Christmas time!) Make sure you take a peek at the name of your ferry, they all have 'Star' in their names.
Good night trip. I don't think one person I know who has been to Hong Kong hasn't recommended this. It's a great and quick trip over harbour and good light show at night.

Cheap as. took the ferry from Hong Kong island to the other side and it was a quick journey and very cheap - it was easy to travel on and we took this in the evening when the harbour it lit with hundreds of lights - wonderful experience
ferry lovers delight. I'm a regular ferry commuter in Sydney and I thoroughly enjoyed being on these older style HK ferries. very frequent service
Good fun. Great way to see Hong Kong. Just be ready to be pushed out of the way as people try to get the good seats by the window.
Star Ferry -. easy to negotiate and very cheap to use - interesting to watch the locals going to and from their work on this feerry

Harbour Views.. The Star ferries provide a cheap , frequent, reliable,and above all picturesque way to get from Hong Kong island to Kowloon. It was a fun and worthwhile thing to do during our stay in HK.

Good way to see Kowloon and Honkong Island from the river. Very easy and cheap way to see both Kowloon and Hongkong Island from the river by ferry. It takes only about 8 minutes to get to the other side of river. Worth visiting.

Out of date, slow and completely essential. A long time ago, I guess that the Star Ferry was the only way to travel to and from Hong Kong Island. Of course, you can now use the MTR or one of the tunnels in a Taxi / Bus etc.. The MTR is faster and will take you to where you actually want to go.But, speed isn't the only consideration is it? The Start Ferry is simply a wonderful way to travel. Anything that slows the pace of Hectic Hong Kong life for 10 minutes is worthwhile in my opinion and if you are going to the convention centre from Kowloon, then the terminal is very close by.

Great view of Victoria Harbor at night. Bring your camera. I did not and now I must return. Easy to get tokens. Once you cross, take the walkway to the mall. You will walk past the Apple Store, one of the largest I have seen. Lots of great shots on the way. Trip back is just as good as the first.Bring your camera!

A nice and cheap way to enjoy the looks of Hong Kong from the waterside with a fresh wind to cool you down. I only used the ferry between Tsim Sha Tsui and Causeway Bay. On old boat with not very comfortable seats, but quick (10-15min). Also the waiting time was no more than about 15min between the ships. It was only 3HKD for a single trip, and that was even the expensive rate as it was Sunday...I didn't have the time for it, but I would advise to use it for a longer trip like to Lantau Island. Great way of relaxing and enjoying Hong Kong as it is.

ok transporation. i do not take ferry much, because it is a bit slow. You can take subway instead. But it is worth for you if you want to experience when you want to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong side.Best regards,Dr. Vorravee PattaravongvisutMan on the move

A Classic--Don't Miss It!. No trip to Hong Kong is complete without riding the Star Ferry across Victoria Harbor. Go mid-day to miss the rush hour commute and enjoy the short boat ride on these classic ferries. One of the best bargains in the world!
Classic & cheap. Was a great, classic way to feel Hong Kong harbor. Old boats were just the thing to capture the old feel (lest the armada of junks). Lots of fun

Agreat afternoon walk along the promenade. Very hustle and bustle and a lot of activity going on. Some nice restaurants that serve a late lunch but pricey because of the view and location. Still a great afternoon or early walk to see the Star Ferrt and the skyline across the harbour

Very cheap and great views. We took the star ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Central to get back to our hotel. It is extremely cheap, under $1. It isn't a long ride but I would say it is a must do while you are in Hong Kong. Doing the crossing pretty much acts like a cruise of the harbour. It's pretty fun riding the classic old ferries and getting out on the water to see a different perspective of the skylines and getting amongst all the boat traffic. I highly recommend riding the ferry at least once during your stay.
Fast and nice. Getting from Hong Kong to Kowloon is easy and fast, and cheap. Good ride. Sometimes you may meat interesting people.

It's a travel cliche but it's a must do in Hong Kong,. Victoria Harbour has great views and is impressively deep as a result of all the land reclamation around the edges - the Star Ferry is a great way to see it, very cheap and actually a very quick way to get from Central to TST.
Classic Ride. A must try if you are in HK to experience the local rides and its just so cheap and very straightforward. It will bring you the Wan Chai side instantly.
Enjoyed the slowness. had great opportunity to take picture for sunset. It was nice view because the ferry moved slowly. Be ready to sit in the best chair to get the best view..

Easy to use for fun and transportation . Only a couple of HK dollars, but you do need coins to purchase the token for travel. Alternatively use an Octopus card. I used it for work but if I had the kids with me it would be a cheap and fun 'attraction' with great views of the bay.

Star attraction of Hong kong. This has to be one of the best in Hong Kong. A trip on this ferry allows the most amazing view of Hong Kong all round the harbour. Best value for very little money, it is only a short trip but amazing day and night when all the lights are on.

Great way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island for such a low cost and what a great view. The Star Ferry has been around since the start of time it seems, its a great way to see Hong Kong and if you travel at night at 8pm you will have a fantastic view of the famous light show, every night at 8.00pmThe cost of the ferry crossing is so inexpensive and at peaks times of the day it beats a taxi crossing which is painful due to traffic congestion and the away that some of the taxi drivers drive, I have been in so many taxis in HK that at times I feel the drivers think they are in a police chase or and its a 50/50 shot weather the driver speaks english or not.I would highly recommend the Star Ferry and use it as much as you can whilst in HK as its fun, frequent and low cost.

Quick transportation and good views. The price of this ferry is shocking, e.g. Victoria harbor to Central - 2.60 HKD only. The views are spectacular! These ferries operate every half an hour, you can also find schedule and routes on their website.
cheapest trip with the best view!. I live in hong kong, and made the trip between central and tst hundreds of times. Never can get enough of it. Amazing way to cross the harbour.

Ferry. It is a must for a ferry trip whenever I go Hong Kong. Especially like to get a night trip because I can view Hong kong's night view in whole. Amazing, it made me calm and soothing as well during the journey!

A must in HK. All the views at a very low price. Wonderful in the day and at night. Clear or cloudy weather. Even in overcast, the lights from the buildings reflect off the clouds, for a surreal effect.

Great service. The Star ferry is such a convenient and quick way to cross the harbour. You never wait for more than a couple of minutes and it's cheap and easy to find your way. Everything is well signed and there are staff available to help.

Must do when visiting HK. Economical and quickIf you only have 1 or 2 days, instead of taking the mtr at Tsim Sha Tsui take the Star Ferry to hop to/from Central/HK StationGreat experience for 25pence per person!From airport take the train (25min £8) to HK Station, take the lift up to the ground floor turn left go up the escalator thru the glass doors to the pedestrian bridgeLook at the ferris wheel and hotels in Central Photo op of the wheelWalk 10min to the Star Ferry Buy a ticket Tap in Take the Ferry to TSTWalk around the Cultural CentrePhotos of Peninsula HotelStroll into Sheraton Hotel for tea (or Peninsula if you are inclined to part with more money!)All in less than 2hEnjoy

Paint Smell. I have been riding the Star Ferry for the past three years I have been in HK and the ferries still smell of fresh paint. I hope they can do something about this.I make it a point to ride the Star Ferry so that my first timer family members get to experience it.

Super inexpensive way of getting the best view. We found that using the ferry to get across the harbour from Kowloon was a great way of getting great photos of the landmarks. Its cheap, regular and reliable.

Essence of hk. Yes - it's just a ferry from central to Kowloon and back but it so iconic. You get a great view of both sides. It's dirt cheap (2 hkd) and really pleasant. Also while on the Kowloon side around 8 pm watch the light show over the harbor and maybe catch some random street musicians playing outside the star ferry station.

A AA must do as well as being a practical way to cross Hong Kong Harbor. If oare in central taking the ferry is not only a trip back in history but is also a very practical way to get to the tip of Kowloon. and takes you back in time to an earlier slower pace

Alternative transport from Hong Kong to Kowloon . It was a bit tricky to find these port where the ferry leaves from as it is being renovated but it was worth the effort. It's a super cheap trip but full of atmosphere on the Old ferry. We did it at night and there was Hardly anyone on it. The lights of the city were very pretty. Afterwards we watched the light display from kowloon
Fast and efficient. This is a great way to quickly cross the harbor/river to get to Kowloon. It's cheap [$.90] and runs every 15 minutes. It provides a great view of both skylines.

It's a boat. It's just a boat, convenient for crossing the water and it didn't sink so that was a bonus. If you don't t like boats, avoid. I do like boats so was pleased to sit in it for the 5 minute crossing.

A must to get to the Island. Loved the 1958 boat we travelled on. Loved the 'reversible' seat backs, to face either way. Other routes available to get to the Island but for us, this was the authentic one

One of Hong Kong's unique experience . It's a tourist thing that I like to do whenever I visit the city and I never get bored of it. More than a cheap way to cross over to the other side of HKG if you do not want to squeeze into the MTR, I like the experience of commuting on a mode of transportation that has a long history. Pace of the city seem to slow down those minutes you are on board the ferry. A must do in my opinion!

A good experience!. I have heard that the Star Ferry is full of Hong Kong's feelings,this time i was really experiencing the life of Hong Kong which is different and wonderful!The night scenery of the harbour and the sea breeze ,they were so beautiful and such fascinating which made me be free of mind and happy of heart.I enjoy this experience~~

Must do!. A trip to Hong Kong has to include a ride on the Star Ferry and we have done it so many times and it is still great! Not so much to do with just crossing the harbour or saving money or time; it is an experience and a fantastic way to view and appreciate the Hong Kong Kowloon relationship. Also one of the best ways to take some brilliant photos of both sides! Make sure you continue through the IFC Mall on the Hong Kong side and to the mid level escalators. Really worth it!
Love it. Instead of taking taxi, underground or bus I would always prefer the short trip by boat to the other side!
Absolute must. I never miss a trip on the Star Ferry whenever I'm in Hong Kong. It's incredibly cheap, and nothing beats the view.

Cheapest mode of transportation in Hong Kong. This is the cheapest mode of transportation in Hong Kong plus you get to cherish the magnificent view of the Hong Kong Island and Kowloon Island's at the same time once the ferry get's in the middle of Victoria Harbour. Your Hong Kong trip is not complete if you don't take the Star Ferry trip.
You have to try it. The ferry itself is really nothing special, but the experience of riding it across the harbor with the views is something else. It's covered by Octopus card as are most things
Nostalgie on sailing. They have very old boats to carry people from the island to mainland. You may feel the nostalgie and enjoy the sailing. Recommended.

Pretty essential part of the visit if you've never been to HK. It's a pretty essential part of your visit if you've never been to HK. Not as fast as going via the MTR, but you get some great view of both sides of Victoria Harbour for a tiny price. Speaking of tiny prices, pay a bit more and get on the the upper deck, your Octopus Card will barely notice the difference. Use it during daytime and evenings (last one is about 11:30ish, I think). It's a busy harbour, so the waters can get a little choppy at times.
Couple with infant. Feb climate was good so we don't find problem in humidity issue. Ferry speed was good. Enjoyed no sea sickness but movements
Used as transport. Use the star ferry along with your octopus pass to get to and from Hong Kong island. The easiest and fastest way.
Ferry has a nice old charm to it :). Spacious! Safe and cheap. We used our Octopus passes to pay for our ride. Definitely worth experiencing.
Quick and cheap. I took the ferry almost every day during my stay in HK. Not only is it quick , but you also get the bonus of the wonderful view of the harbour.
Relax time. Ride on subway will be much quicker but I rather take the ferry. Only cost you a few dollars with around 10 mins relax time in Victoria Harbour. Enjoyable

Has to be done. Great value, a brilliant way to get to Kowloon. Cheap, and gives a flavour of real life - as well as a brilliant view of the bay. We came back as the laser show was going on in the evening - lovely way to view the night skyline.

Hong Kong Icon. I first came to Hong Kong in 1967 and the same ferries are now still going....I can almost tell you all their names-but its the ONLY way to go between Kowloon and Central-or the other way.. Forget the MTR..sadly with all the reclamation of the harbour the journey is much shorter now than it used to be,but the views from the ferry are still great..

Easy way to cross the harbor . Easy as pie to cross the harbor and more scenic than the metro. Can use the octopus card or buy a token.
From the Hong Kong side other piers to catch ferries to more locations.

Classic Hong Kong Transportation. Ride the ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong island, or vice versa. This is not the fastest, but definitely the most classic and scenic way to get to one side of HK to the other. Also, one of the cheapest methods. Plenty of seats, and the view is great! Enjoy the ride and get your pics of the Harbor and the HK Skyline.
Cheapest to transport from city to island. This is one of the memorable experience with a great view from the star ferry. Cheapest mode of transport for local and tourists
A must do in Hong Kong. I always take a ferry ride each time in Hong Kong to enjoy the views of both sides - TST and HKG island. It is very interesting as the skyline changes all the time.
Economical way to get from Hong Kong to Kowloon. The ride is cheap and provides one with vistas of the shorelines of Kowloon and Hong Kong, dominated by soaring skyscrapers and soaring mountains.

A Great way to see the sights. With your Octupus Card, obtainable in the airport arrivals hall or any subway station, travel on the ferries is a breeze.Why people still buy tickets from the machines never ceases to amaze me...unnecessary hastle.Get your Octupus and travel on the ferries anywhere in the harbour area with little fuss other than the short wait to get onboard.We travelled extensively on the ferries and enjoyed every trip. A must....but get the Octuous Card and take the hastle out of the experience.

Great ride to Kowloon.. The short ride over to Kowloon and back is a must on the Star Ferry. The fantastic views of the city and islands from the water gives one a whole new perspective of the complexity of this great city. This should be on the must do list.

Must be on anybody's ten things to do in Hong Kong. The most direct way from Hong Kong island to Kowloon side.Really cheap - you can buy tokens or use Octopus card.Very frequent service from Star ferry pier in Central.You disembark into the noisy and very populated Tsim Tsa Tsui (TST) with lots of interesting things to visit and view. Examples include the Space museum, Clock tower, Nathan Road and the Peninsula hotel.The ferry ride is really enjoyable with great views of the spectacular Hong Kong skyline.I would recommend two separate trips - one in the evening when you can see the exciting lights across the island.For those who prefer a longer boat trip, the Star ferry offer a harbour cruise option. Tickets and information available at the Star ferry pier.
Old fashioned Ferry With a Good View. Cheap price. Beautiful view and old fashioned! A must try thing when you travel in Hong Kong. Subway to the Central and take the Ferry back to Tsim Sha Tsui

Star Ferry Hong Kong. The National Geographic has stated that: Riding a Star Ferry is one of 50 things to do in one's lifetime. They are almost free and IF you go to Hong Kong and you do not ride a Star Ferry you have really missed out on something wonderful. My first Star Ferry ride was in October of 1990.

Cheap & Fast with a great view. why don't you try a different mode of transport such as this ferry ride between Central & Tsim Sha Tsui instead of MTR.. Lots of view around the Victoria Harbour & surrounding skyline.

A must-to-do in Hong Kong. I always like riding the ferries between Central/Wanchai to Tsimsatsui. It’s much better than taking other public transports, as it’s really a relaxing and frequent way for crossing the harbor. I really enjoy the views and sea breeze. But the trips are too short :(

Quick and Easy Ride to Kowloon with Great Views. This was a lovely trip for almost no money. The views were great both from the boat and the walk ways along the harbor. If you're in Central heading towards Kowloon, or even if you aren't, this is a wonderful ride.
Linking Lantau island to downtown. Basic ferry, but runs on time. Plenty of seats, clean and vending machines if you need something. Sit on the upper deck to enjoy the view.
A lovely cruise by night!. A lovely way to see Hong Kong by night, so pretty with the lit up skyline. The cruise hoes for an hour and well worth the $175/- HKD
Fun and easy to use. Great little view of Hong Kong harbour . Get an Octopus Card to make transit option in Hong Kong even simpler!
Cheap, easy, convenient. Very convenient, yet cheap transportation between Hong Kong islands. Great views make this fantastic deal.
A must do in Hong Kong. If ever in Hong Kong this is a must do. At HKD2.50 very cheap to get from Hong Kong to Kowloon and back. Nice ride and lots of history. Recommended

Cheap and quick, nice view. We ride this 2 times, once at night and once at the day. My mom enjoys the view of the harbour so it's not only a method of transportation between the Hongkong island and Tsim Sha Tsui area, but also for sightseeing. You can use Octopus Card here.After passing through the gate, there will be a crowd lining for boarding the ferry. If you want the seats on the side with the good view , make sure you line up first so you can choose you seat.

So cheap and quick. The fastest and cheapest way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. Used the octopus card tap on system and about 5 minutes later we had arrived. Great view coming into Hong Kong.
best way to Kowloon. loved this ferry, great view of the harbor, very speedy, affordable, clean and the stars in the seat bottom were super cute.

3.50 hkd for a view of the city and 10 mins ride weekend rate. cheap tourist boat ride. 10 mins ride. ride on the boat see the hk view., Nothing special but you can stay on the boat as long as you want and just see the view.
Cheap and convenient. For the equivalent of about $2 US, you can get to or from Kowloon to Central. Ferries depart about every 15 minutes, and the view is lovely.
The one trip you must make. Great cheap way to see the harbour, price is next to nothing and the views of the harbour are second to none. A must do for all tourists!
Fun to do. Offers great view of Kowloon harbor. Short trip. Well worth the effort. The history is overwhelming.
Classic Ferry Ride. Back in the '60's, (Viet Nam War R&R destination), the Star Ferry ride was a nickel, now about 30 cents, but well worth the short trip for the experience.

Only way to see the Hong Kong Harbour. Even though my visits to Hong Kong exceeds 7-8 times, a trip across Victoria Harbour on the Star Ferry is still a must.So easy using either the Octopus card or cash to pay the small fee of HK$ 2.50 for the ten minute trip .. from either Hong Kong Island's Central or Wanchai piers over to Kowloon's Tsim Sha Tsui or reverse. Not only is it a great way to cross the harbour .. even though the train MTR system is quicker it is an experience every traveller should do at least once to enjoy the amazing view and ocean breeze.Night time travellers can have the added bonus of the 8pm light & laser show..

A low cost ride across the sea. if you wish to go the hongkong Island or go to Kowloon from Hongkong then star ferry is a really a low cost and a good option to cross over and enjoy the lovely view of hongkong SKYLINE.

Good transportation . It is fast,clean and it is an alternative to the train. You can enjoy the view and it takes only 10'! You can do the ticket in the machine before the entrance and for any problems the stuff is there!With children is fun!
Great value and great fun ... plus it gets you to the other side.. I always use the Star Ferry when in Hong Kong. Its fun, relaxing and a great way to see the skylines of both Hong Kong and Kowloon.
Quick and efficient!. Not really much to say about this ride apart from the fact that it is quick, efficient and you can see the Hong Kong skyline. You must do this when in Hong Kong!
Good ride. Take the ferry. It's cheap and a nice way to see the harbor. Doesn't take long and there isn't a wait for the next one as they're always running.
Must go in HK. This is one of the unique places you have to go while in Hong Kong. In a couple of years this will be replaced for something modern and you can say: I used the old one!
Experience the history. Star ferry and Tram are the unique must have experience while in hong kong. Amazing to see such things in an ultra modern city. Very well maintained and inexpensive

Fun and Easy. Since we stayed on Hong Kong Island, there were many times we needed to cross to Kowloon. The Star Ferry is easy to access, and views are expansive of the harbor and skyline. We rode both in daylight and after dark. A must do when in Hong Kong.

Oh what a lovely memory. Locals take this as transport mode. I take it especially near sunrise or sunset to take photos. Love the sound and the slowness. you can admire the views of both Kowloon and HK Island
Star Ferry. Great experience, you get a great view of the harbour as you cross, I should try the lower deck one day, very automated since 1980
Great way to see things. I always love ferry trips and this is no exception. Worth a trip every time Im in Hong kong. Get an octopus card and swipe away.
Nice view & cheap to travel. Its a nice & cheap way to travel between hong kong & kowloon. Its costs only hkd 2.5 one way. Bring your camera along
So affordable!. You can use the Octopus card. This is a very affordable way to cross the Bay and get a very nice view from the city.
Star Ferry. It's great to use the once for the experience but probably not worth making your way to the ferry terminals every time you want to cross over. It does tend to get quite busy too.

Fun very short boat trip. The star ferry is fun to ride at night great way to see the hong kong lights at night.
I wish I was abit longer. Gives you alittle short break to sit watch hong kong sail by

You have to do it.. How could you visit Hong Kong and not take a trip on the Star Ferry. Even if you have no were you particularly need to go just go and do the crossing from Kowloon to the Island just to say you did it. The ferry service is older that Hong Kong itself. It cost almost nothing to do and you'll get some great photos.
Short Trip to Kowloon. Well worth taking. It is easy to buy ticket at machine, easy to board. You get views of the harbour and HK.

Provides an opportunity to see another aspect of Hong Kong. Whilst the MTR provides a quick passage between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, Star Ferry provides a more leisurely mode of transport which also gives you the opportunity to look at the Hong Kong skyline and its waterways. 15 mins well spent, always something different to see, and for only a small sum of money. Sit back, relax and observe Hong Kong at work.
A touch of the old days. . The cheapest and most comfortable way to cross the water between Kowlon and Hong Kong Island. Classic old Ferrys. The tour takes about five minutes.
Fantastic experience. At 20 HK$ you just can't go wrong with this. Great local ride, which anyone visiting Hong kong should have experienced.

Brilliant, just brilliant. . This is a great, old, ferry service. The cost from Kowloon to Hong Kong is just $2; same as it was ten years ago. If you're wondering whether to use the train or ferry STOP. Get the ferry!!
Iconic. You must experience this iconic form of travel which is also fast, efficient and cheap. You can use your Octopus Card instead of buying a ticket each time.

Different way to see the bay. Visited July 2014. We used this to cross from one side to the other instead of using the metro and it was really worth it. Think its more of a one time use however as the metro is far quicker! Worth going on if you're in Hong Kong!

Classic Hong Kong. If anything could be called a historical part of Hong Kong, this is.
Don't miss it for neither love nor money. Cheap and very convenient way of getting transportation between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon..

Good view of Victoria Harbour. It's very convenient to take ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central with good view of Victoria Harbour at reasonable price. You can choose between the upper and lower deck. But I prefer the upper deck.

Fabulous way to see the sights - particularly the night lights. Only thing you must do is see Hong Kong by night preferably just after dusk to catch the light show. Very cheap, easy to access, cab or bus to Star Ferry and bus ranks and taxi ranks outside for return to your accommodation

Step back to a simpler time. Riding on the Star Ferry is like stepping back in time to a day when society was not as intense. It is a relaxing ride across the harbor. Best yet, it is not the least bit crowded.

Neat Experience. The star ferry is a neat experience.
Finding the ferry from the MTR was a bit confusing, but there are signs and English speaking people everywhere.
There were crowds of people. It was a bit overwhelming to get on the ferry, but it is a must do when you visit Hong Kong.
Good fun and quick. This is a good service and also a bit of nostalgia. Well worth doing. You can pay by Octopus Card, so links nicely with other public transport paid via this method.
good service. Good ferry service, very cheap and pretty fast also. Nice to use it after dark to see the city lights on both shores.

Keep this historical icon going.. I always make the effort to cross Victoria Harbour on the Star Ferry.
The ferry across the harbour offers some great views of Hong Kong and Kowloon skyline. It's also a chance to relax between the the busy streets of Kowloon and the Hong Kong island.
Please don't let this icon fad away.

superb TST < > Wan Chai transport. If you need to travel between Wan Chai and Tsim Tsa Tsui, you could take the MTR subway underground - OR you could have a mini-adventure and take this Star Ferry. You'll get to see the coast line of either Hong Kong Island or Kowloon (depending on which way you are going). Try this once during the day and once at night for two totally different view experiences.

Cheap and cheerful. This is an amazingly cheap and convenient way to cross to Hong Kong Island and back. It runs every few minutes, is very efficient and is a good tourist alternative to taking the MTR as there are plenty of photo opportunities.

A Must Do in HK!. The Star Ferry has to be one of the cheapest forms of public transport in the world and one of the most scenic. For HK$2.50 you can cross HK harbour and be treated to the spectacular panorama of HK island and Kowloon. This is a must do for every visitor to HK.

Quick, cheap, and fun way to cross the harbour. The ferry costs about 30 US cents, which is crazy cheap in such an expensive city, and I waited two minutes total for two ferry rides. I sat in the air-conditioned section the first ride (it was super humid and I was in a suit), but the second time I sat near an open area on the side and soaked in the breeze and the view. Super easy to use and gives you a different perspective on the city. Highly recommended for visitors of all ages.

Absolute Must. This is a fantastic service that takes you from Central to Kowloon in about 5 minutes for HK$2 (about 20p). The service is very frequent throughout the day, but only runs until about 11:30pm. The ferries are traditional old boats which adds to the experience, but it's the incredible views of the skylines on either side that makes this trip special.

Overrated.. There is not much to this. You get on, wait a little and then get back off. If you want to tick it off your bucket list then do it. If you don't, I wouldn't recommend it. Do something else. Tickets are easy to get.

Have to take a ride on the Star Ferry. If you want one of the best views of the Skylines of Hong Kong and Kowloon you really need to take a ride on the Star Ferry. We had taken the MTR to Kowloon and done some markets, had a good lunch and then made our way to the Ferry. Don't go below decks and enjoy the view and the ride!

Star Ferry. Our cruise ship docked right alongside the ferry terminal where the ferries cross over to Hong Kong island and other places of interest. Buy your tickets at the machines on the ferry port so you need Hong Kong currency. The machines give change.

Fantastic cheap way to move around HK. Whenever I have been in HK have made a point of using the ferry as it is a great way to see the islands and is a very cheap way to travel.The ferries run regularly, quick way to move between Kowloon and the Island and depending on the weather you can great some great views.

Cheap ride across the island. Took this ride from HongKong central to tsim Sha and costed $2.80 hk.Loved the evening bright lights across the channel , the digital banners were like bright stars shining across . The ride was not a fancy one but needs to be experienced once . It was crowded but we were able to secure seats . If you are afraid of crowd ,better to avoid it .
cheap iconic!. you have to do it more than once.It was the must do thing I was most glad that we did.Its not posh or plush but has to be done, shame it is so short
A must do. Fun to cross the harbour. A must do for visitors. Just follow the line of people as it is busy. Quite nice at night. No outdoor seating so don't be disappointed. Get a seat near a window.

My favourite activity in hk. Best way to see kowloon and the island at the same time. ...short journey. ..amazing value. ...worth every dollar.
See hk life as it should be.
Cheap and relaxing. As with everything in Hong Kong it is busy and the ferry we went on was very busy, its convenient but its just a transfer not a really an attraction
A unique Hong Kong experience. Still only about US50c to ride across Hong Kong's famous Victoria Harbour on Star Ferry (and that's on the upper deck!). A must do in HK
Good view. Lovely old ferry with a good view on the skyline on both sides of the water. Extremely cheap also. Go at dusk and see the lights turn on.

10 minutes & you are there!. This is the easiest way to go to and from Hong Kong. Located very near the Harbour City Mall on the Kowloon side & next to the convention center on the Hong Kong side. Only 2.5RMB each way it is a steal!
Getting around Hong Kong . Very cheap and easy to get between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. The ferries run very frequently from early morning to late evening. Highly recommend

Still Great. It's been over 30 years since I made my first trip on the Star Ferry, but it's still has the magic of my first ride. It's especially good in the evening when one can see the lights on both sides. Take a few trips back and forth. One of my best rides was last year watching a couple take wedding photos on it. Smart couple. Wish I was that creative. Along with the tram (ding ding) it's one of best things to see in Hong Kong. Enjoy!!
Short Boat trip. Although it is well known, it is a short boat trip and nothing startling. I would not be rushing to do it again!

Planes, trains and ferries?. Today we started out with no plans. Took a double decker bus from our hotel in Kowloon and ended up at the Star ferry docks. There we decided to ferry it to Hong Kong island. We normally cab or subway it. What an awesome and unique way to experience Hong Kong. The fair was cheap. The boats were clean and timely. We saw tons of jelly fish and we docked just a few minutes walk to the IFC mall. This is a must do in my opinion. Happy Travels.
Trip will not complete without experiencing this ride.. You're trip is not complete without experiencing sailing from Victoria Harbour to Hong Kong! Must be!

Nice Ferry. It is a short ride with a fabulous view of the Hong Kong skyline. The ferry service is very regular and so easy to use. A quick and easy ticketing system and regular ferries meant virtually no waiting time

The Old Star Ferry still going Strong. The day after our arrival at Kai Tak cruise terminal, we took the MTR Metro from the Novotel Citygate Hotel, to visit the Star Ferry area. It was pouring with rain when we came up from the metro but eventually we walked to the Star Ferry pier. An esplanade adjacent to the pier has been built since our last visit in 1996 and, despite the rain, there were plenty of people sightseeing. The old clock tower erected in 1915 is still a memorable landmark, despite the weather, and many people were jostling to be photographed by it.The Information Office at the entrance to the pier was a very useful source of maps and advice.
Never feel disappointed. Short and interesting journey that can enjoy the best of Hong Kong harbour view, in only a few dollars.

Short trip across the harbour. Old school way to cross the harbour in HK. Cheap, relaxed and good way to see both sides of the harbour. Easily accessible from TST, definitely take a ride to complete your heritage HK tour.
Old memories , amazing vue. Its amazing to see the vue from the water in middle of the harbour, to both margins. And remenbering all the movies seen and all the books read. A must do.

A good way to get to the other side ....... An efficient service and very cheap. Safety is evidently a priority as safety message given at the start of every trip (5 to 10 minute trip). Life jackets strategically placed everywhere.

free for oldies. It is a good thing that hong kong keep all these ferries in service, a fun way to travel to hong kong island, it is free travel for elderly and low low cheap for everyone, the sailors wear traditional navy uniform.

Take a Ferry Across Hong Kong Harbour. But the ride doesn't last very long. On the other hand, it doesn't cost very much (2.8 HK on a Saturday). Ticket vending machine is very complicated to sort out. Ferries are coming continually, so you needn't wait very long. I thought it was a rather routine affair.

Nice!. My first time taking the star ferry, after more than 10 trips to HK. It was a very pleasant 10 minutes experience. You will need to make your way to the central pier, behind ifc building on Central. follow the signs, ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui. You will get out at harbour city pier, canton rd TST. Very good experience, kids loved it! And it is dirt cheap too lol.
Efficient service. Star ferry offers cheap and efficient transport to Hong Kong islands. Would recommend using this service

It is a must do thing in HK. I grow up in HK and I still take the star ferryfrom time to time, it may not be the quickest transportation in town but it will show you one of the beautiful harbourin the world , Make sure you find a seat on the upper deck andtry to go at daytime and nighttime, 10 minutes ride will give you two different experience !

Always something different to see.. A must do on any trip to Hong Kong and the view differs all the time.On this journey we had a close up look at an ocean liner departing for a cruise.Well worth the very cheap fare.

What's the fuss about?. I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. It's usually rated a 'must see'. But literally it's a 10 minute ferry ride across the harbor on an old boat. Nothing special to see here folks. Move along.

Old jewel. We has heard of the ferry so on the last date we decided to take the ferry from Tsmi Tsa Tsui to wan chai and that was such s interesting journey very enjoyable, these are old styled boats but the speed is good enough was very safe.A must if you are in Hongkong

5-minute ferry to Hong Kong Island from Kowloon. The ferry is very efficient, running every few minutes, around the clock. Easy enough! Loved the benches with the movable backrest which change your view.
Star ferry ride a must. I took the ferry from tsim sha tsui to central ferry station about 20 mins,and bus15C to Peak Tram station up to Victoria Peak is a breeze.
A must do. The star ferry in Hong King is a must do. A great way to get across from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon and see the harbour sights at the same time

Fun ride. . I try to ride the Star Ferry every time I visit Hong Kong - even if I'm just riding it back and forth. It is a short ride with a fabulous view of the Hong Kong skyline. Much more fun than going on a Junk tour and a lot less expensive.

Convenient transfer.. Cheap and fast transportation. The ships are old for sure but it's not really an attraction in my opinion tho'. Good alternative to the MTR subway between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui.

Quintessential HK Experience!. The Star Ferry takes just a few minutes to cross spectacular HK Harbour. It's great for tourists because of the vistas of the harbour and both sides (HK Island and Kowloon) - but also because it is a part of many Hong Kongers' everyday commute! So it's part of our local lifestyle.It leaves approx every 10 mins but frequency varies according to the time of day and day of the week.And it's so inexpensive at around HK$2-3 or less than US$0.40 between Central and TST!It's a must if you're visiting Hong Kong!

A must in Hong Kong. As a young lad and son of a serving Army Padre in 1966 , I first travelled on the famous Star Ferry ! In those days it was the only way to cross the harbour apart from a car ferry which ran seperately. This evokes memories of traditional Hong Kong,I can't say more . Wonderful !!
Easy ride. We traveled on the ferry in the evening for nice views of the area. It was an easy ride since the weather was pleasant.

Old Fashioned Perfect Hong Kong Experience. I first took the Star Ferry between Tim Sha Tsui and Hong Kong Island in 1962. Though it is fractionally more expensive now, it is the least expensive and best experience in Hong Kong. Take the lower level and cheaper regular class and be with the locals and the food they are carrying and people of all ages from all walks of life. Plus you can stand at the gates right at the water's level on the short ride across the harbor. Enjoy the simple things in Hong Kong along with the more upscale things available in the ever more expensive city.

Ten minute ferry trip. It gives us the opportunity to travel like the locals for a minimal price. It worked out around £0.25 each way which I believe is great value for money. If getting on the ferry at Hong Kong Island, you will arrive close to the Tsim Sha Tsui promenade which is nice to walk around.

Workhorse now a tourist attraction. You haven't been to Hong Kong unless you have taken the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. You need only spare change for a fare. Once it was the only link across the harbour. Most people these days take the metro or tunnel, but nothing beats the Star Ferry for atmosphere.
Good fun!. Good to use the ferry to get across the Harbour. Very quick and effective. Lots of ferries so not much waiting
Always excellent. Cheapest and best ferry ride in the world. Quick, efficient and reliable. A HK must-do. I never miss it and recommend it to everyone

Good transport. A great way to get to the island and back. The ferry service is very regular and so easy to use. A quick and easy ticketing system and regular ferries meant virtually no waiting time. Cute old fashioned ferries.
A must do in Hong Kong. Such a pleasant way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and a must do whilst visiting Hong Kong.

iconic ferry journey. its an excellent way to travel to Kowloon, its cheap, iconic, and never gets boring regardless of how many times you use the ferry, very unique experience, different experience at different times of day, impressive in evening.
A must for any visitor to HK. The cheapest way of seeing the Harbour and getting a feel of the City. Lots of routes to choose from covering different areas of the Harbour
Great ride...cheap too. This is a must for all visiting hong kong..it is frequent and wait times are short. The journey and scenery is simply great.

Ferry Nice. The Star Ferry takes about fives minutes to cross from Hong Kong to Kowloon. Ownership of an OCTUPUS MTR card means that the ferry is free. Try to time it to see the Light and Sound Show at 8 pm/20 hours. It is a smooth ride across Victoria Harbour. There are steep ramps to and from the boat. The boat rocks when docked.
a very cheap way the watch the skyline of HongKong.. Choose the upperdeck, you only pay 0,50 HKD more but have a great view over the skyline of Hong Kong.
Cheap cheap cheap. It costs pennies to cross the harbour! 10 min journey no issues a must to do! You can make multiple crossings it's really good!

A Hong Kong gem. We loved using the Star Ferry. Staying in Kowloon, we chose the Ferry rather than the MTR. Our 2 day Big Bus pass enabled us to use the ferry as many times as we wanted and it is a great opportunity to see the HK skyline.
Best Transport in HK!. For a few HKD, you can step back in time and ply the often busy downtown harbour between HK and Kowloon. It's a hoot!
habour glory. Take this ferry when it is dark and enjoy HK habour in all its glory. iIt is a light show all by itself. Also cheap. you will not be sorry.

Great service from a historical company.. We used the Star Ferry at least 5 times while in Hong Kong as it was in a great location to get us to the places we wanted to go in Kowloon.The sailors know their jobs and will get you to the other side safely. The history can read on the walls of the boat you will be riding on.
Very Convenient!. The ferry leaves often and this is much more convenient than taking a taxi...and its cheaper as well!

Wait for the lights. If you travel to Hong Kong, take the ferry to Kowloon around the dusk and from this side of the river enjoy minute by minute the way how the buildings start being "bright", the city starts to turn on all lights...

As iconic as it gets. Whether you are Hong Kong for 1 day or several weeks, carve out some time for the Star Ferry, a must do for any visitor, and an experience unlike many others. Trips in either direction (Central to TST, or visa versa) land you at transportation hubs well connected to the rest of Kowloon or the island of Hong Kong. If possible, make the trip after sunset. The extraordinary HK skyline lit up is a sight you will never forget.
Interesting experience. Great alternative option to cross the ocean without being crowded. We got plenty of time to enjoy the view and didn't cost us too much of waiting time.

Cheapest way to cross the Victoria Harbour with great views!. A must for tourist in Hong Kong. One of the oldest type of transport in Hong Kong and is cheap. You can get to the Star Ferry Pier from IFC Central, there is a long bridge connected to the ferry. Just walk towards the big ferries.Especially get a great view in the evening when the building lights are up. The journey itself takes less than 10 minutes.

Better than across the Mersey. This is a must do experience for any visitor. Still very cheap and can pay with the Octopus card. The ferries are frequent and the views are magnificent. Whether during the day or in the night, this is a must do experience for all visitors.

Iconic Star Ferry. This is a must do in Hong Kong. It doesnt matter how many times you go on the ferry its an enjoyable trip.A must do either in the day or night. At night its spectacular to watch when the light show is on as well.Easy ticket machine to purchase the token.Ferries run regularly.Highly recommended
Good experience . Is an experience that you must to take. Easy to transport between the both sides, but definitely a night crossing experience is the best.

Star Ferry. Best transportation buy in HK. Cheap to sit on the upper deck and even less to sit in the lower deck, plus a wonderful view of HK and Kowloon from the ferry. Beautiful and romantic in the evening. My whole family loves it during the day as well.
Quick and Easy. We use this Ferry 4 times during our stay . The price was great and the staff was very friendly . The boat were older , But they were very clean.
Best boar ride for about USD 1. I have loved the Star Ferry forever. It's a great way to cross the harbor and enjoy all the amazing views and so cheap!

Star Ferry. One of the least expensive rides you will ever take!!!
This is an iconic part of Hong Kong and can highly recommend it as part of your Hong Kong Experience!

Great views, saves the train and tunnels under the water. We had a ticket through the Big Bus Tours we did. It was quick, easy, staff epwere not all that friendly, but neither are a lot of people in Hong Kong we found.....pretty smooth ride, great views/photo,opportunities. Massive shopping complex to the left when you get off in Kawloon, you could get lost very easy......if doing as part of Big Bus Tour. It is about a 15 min walk to where the bus starts and make sure you ask directions when you get to Kawloon how to get there.

Great to go from Wan Chai to TST. Always use the Star Ferry near the Renaissance hotel to get from Wan Chai over to TST for the day. Cheap cheap cheap and a pleasant ferry ride. Never have to wait too long because of the frequency they run. Air conditioned area available for those really hot days, but otherwise sit and get some fresh air.
Nipback and forth. Easy boarding, quick trip across the bay. Pay by Octopus card. we used the ferry loads as we stayed on Kowloon.

Fantastic experience-Take the top deck. Delightful old ferries taking 5 minutes to cross the water whilst you sit back and enjoy the skyline of both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.Ridiculously cheap, simply swipe the Octopus card or pay at the turnstyle. WOuld advise to sit upstairs for the fresh air.
Not recommended. So so old. With all these tourism money HongKong is getting why can't they have newer fleet? It is scary and will not ride in it again. I would rather train it.

Nostalgic experience, favourite moment in HK. The Star Ferry is a really special way to cross Victoria Harbour. It is a really nostalgic experience and brings back an old Hong Kong that has been lost to time. With the manually reversible wooden seats, romantic view (especially at sunset), and cheap price (about 3HKD), this was one of my favorite moments in Hong Kong.

Affordable . Whilst it is only a short ride across the harbour you wouldn't be surprised if you were ripped off.But no this was $10 HK return for two adults. The boats were clean and the staff were pleasant.Can't complain with that.
A must do experience in Hong Kong. It's a bit of fun with great light city views at night, make sure you get a window seat so you can watch the busy harbour.

Unmissable. Regular crossings across the Victorai ha our from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. Buy a return token, near the slip way for 10 HKDollars , costs £1 return . A 10 (ish?) minute journey that affords excellent views , Use the token at the gate to gain entry. Many different passengers: tourists, suited businessmen, families, local workers.

A Ride that symbolises HK. Take the ferry from TST to Hong Kong Island to get the best view. This is a must ride in HK, and you will get a sense of what it was like before the tunnels and MTR was built.

Fun!. Its cheap and fun and depending on the weather the view would differ
Can also be used as a regular substitute for the MTR
Fun quirky trip across the harbour. Lovely quick trip across the harbour. The ferries are in beautiful condition and the best way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island
