Cheap, great views. Best view of Victoria harbour for very little money. Go on the upper deck for the best views and have your camera ready.
Fun experience. A must for the experience. Very convenient and very cheap. It carries 220,000 people every day.Fun experience
Always good. Every time I come to HK I always take the ferry to Central. Relaxing and excellent views particularly at night time.

Great way to explore Hong Kong & Kowloon. The Star Ferry is a Hong Kong institution. We stayed in Kowloon and hopped across to Hong Kong a few times. This is the best way to get across and offers magnificent views - day and night. The Ferry runs continuously, so there is no wait. It is also a bargain and an excellent way to travel like a local. Definitely worth the trip!

Great transit plus fun just to do. We took this often from Central to Kowloon; it's not as fast as MTR, but way more fun, especially at night. Also did the Star Ferry harbor tour, which was fun, but actually not all that much better than just the regular ferry and about 20x the price. There's a tour guide, but kind of hard to hear them.

Best way to island hop. The Star Ferry.. Hong Kong most iconic way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong island.It cost about £1 for a one way trip. You can see the wonderful building as you cross the waters.Tickets can be bought at the station's vending machine, it is easy to use.It is a definite must try when in Hong Kong.

Best part of going to Hong Kong!. Used the Star Ferry every day. It is $7 each way (70pence). Best value attraction in the world! Great views, great photography and great fun. Don't miss it. Use the token machines at the entrance its really easy.
Star Ferry. great way to travel across the harbour, exciting, convenient and easy to use, and cheap xxxxxxx to make up characters !!!!!!

Best Experience of Hong Kong. When you visit Hong Kong, make sure you make your way to the Tsim Sha Tsui or Central and take the Star Ferry. It is a "Wonderful" experience to take the ferry across the Victoria Harbour for less than a USD 1!!!!

Great way to see hk. There is more to hk than high rises and shopping centres. There are little islands that can be accessible by these ferries and are certainly worthwhile a day. They took us to Lantau last year. Efficient service and yesterday took us to Cheung Chau island and no problems there. The islands should be a must for all tourists

Loved the old ferries, real pic material. The ferries are included in the big bus tours, take your time reading about their history and seeing the different ones with their English names, combine it with a visit to the maritime museum

A must do in HK. Very romantic but also very useful, those old boat are one of the last signs of the British empire in HK. I recommend to use it with the octopus card for the payment : faster & easier than to buy each time a ticket. The octopus card is a must have in HK. With tis debit card you can pay ALL your small expenses (7/11, coffee, ice-cream, MTR, boat, ...)

A "must-try" item. This 10 minutes ferry ride is relaxing and entertaining. You would be amazed by the beautiful harbor view and skyline of Hong Kong island & Kowloon peninsula. The best thing is that the ferry fare costs less than 5 HK$ per head. That is the most money worthy sightseeing spot in town. By taking the Star Ferry you will find yourself end up in Hong Kong Central or Tsim Sha Tsui , the 2 most popular and exciting areas in Hong Kong.
Beautiful Hong Kong. It's a must to get on the Star Ferry and take a look on both sides Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. It's only a short ride but it's a nice experience. I enjoyed it very much.
Very cheap, and views are great!. You have to use the Star Ferry if you are visiting Hong Kong. Extremely cheap, one of the chepest transports available in HK, quick, and the views are great.

Short way from kowloon to hong kong island. Star Ferry boats have been carrying passengers from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon and back across Victoria Harbour. I like take the ride for an up-close look it at night.
Great way to get across to the Island.. The terminal where the Ferry leaves is a step back in time. Ferry crossing is so che and it a quick interesting ride.

Must do in HK. Easiest & cheapest way to go across the Victoria Harbour. Highly recommend take the ferry at night time so that you can see the lights come from the buildings located at both sides of the harbour. Also recommend take the lower deck as there is no window and you can also feel the sea breeze when the weather is cool. Besides, it is easier to take picture without any barrier.
Cheap and fun to ride. These are a great way to see the harbour and are fun to ride. They are very cheap, only $3.50 and are very frequent. Do it just for the experience.

Economical way to travel from one side of Hong Kong to other side. It is one of the most quick & economical way of travelling from one side of Hong Kong to the other side of Hong Kong. Its a beautiful experience...
Ferry Transfers. Used it once to cross to Tsim Sha Tsui, a good and economical mode of transportation and a very convenient mode

The greatest way to view the Victoria Harbour. The ride is within 15 minutes, a bit short but quite relaxing. Fare is extraordinary low, only costs you a few HK dollars. A must-try activity in Hong Kong, especially for 1st time visitors.

Victoria Harbour Water Front. It is my great pleasure to invite all visitor who come to Hong Kong should visit this scene. It is a great place to see the city of Hong Kong, The living style of Hong Kong people who rush to work and people who relax while using the ferry as a transportation from Hong Kong to Kowloon and vise versa.

One Must Do thing in Hong Kong. What can you do in less than 20 minutes which is historic, unique, memorable, inexpensive, a bit nostalgic, romantic and an experience you will remember? Start Ferry - do it!

nice view. we were a small pack family with young kids.. were there for first time.. easy access (by uber, not taxi - they will insist to use the taxi service for crossing the island thoo).. Kids happy, nice view its end of winter may be..
Convenience. A great way to get to HongKong island. Frequent time tables and great views while onboard. The ferries are clean and tidy not usually too crowded.

Cheap and Effective. This is maby the cheapast way of getting from Kowloon side to Hong Kong Island (vice versa) and still have a beautiful view of the harbour and surroundings. When you reach Island side step out and look for the taxi stand to your right. There you can catch a minibus taking you up to the Peak for less than $15. When you reach the Peak enjoy the views and go down by either using the Tram for a great experience or take a Big Bus around the corner from the Peak. Go to the top deck a get a great seat for the drive down to Central. While in Central/Mid Levels, you can walk up the longest escalator in the world and eat a lunch/ snack at one of the many restaurants in that area.

It is fast. It is cozy. And it is beautiful.. It is fast. It is cozy. And it is beautiful.You can see the stunning skyline in day time and the romantic night view in the evening. It is not only the fastest way to go between Central the TST, it is also the cheapest.Tip: You don't need air condition on the ferry. Pick the seat on the side to enjoy the spectacular view.
Absolute a must do in HK for Victoria Harbour crossing. Absolute a must do in HK for Victoria Harbour crossing. Do it at night for the night scene. Choose the upper deck for better views.
Iconic trip. Iconic trip best taken during twilight or dawn....get a beer onhand and savour the salt breezes on the upper deck. get cam ready for spectacular shots of the skyline from sea level...
Simple and efficient.. Used it several times to get great photos of the skyline. Especially at night time it's perfect! Really cheap as well.

Amazing trip. I work in Wan Chai and after office hour, I will join dinner with my friends in Tsim Sha Tsui. Though MTR is easy to get from Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui, many people transit in Admiralty station which I cannot breathe air so that I wait the 4th train to squeeze in the train. Therefore, I prefer take a ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui. Take a breathe and appreciate the beautiful skyline in HK. Also toursts can take pictures for skycrapers and neon lights. So fantantic!
Ferry. Brilliant mode of transport fast & cheap would recommend. Purchased an octopus card to use on ferries bus & mtr

Most spectacular ferry ride anywhere. It's so cheap, it's almost free, and you are treated to probably the most fantastic urban views in the world, with mountains for backdrop. Any tourist who misses out on theis one doesn't deserve to be a tourist!

Excellent trip. Great little cruise around the harbour. Informative commentary, loved it! ***A little tip*** - Refreshments were part of the ticket cost but it was only when I queried the 'refreshments' printed on the ticket that I was given a pack of tasty almond biscuits and a choice of soft drinks from the fridge, towards the end of the trip. There was soon a queue of people ready to claim their own refreshments!

An inexpensive quintessential transport mode in Hong Kong for travellers. For any tourists travelling between Tsim Sha Tsui and Causeway Bay, the star ferry provides a more scenic and pleasant mode of transport both in the day and night. Can't complete your stay in Hong Kong without a ride in this iconic institution.
nostalgic. any time with starferry was perfect sail between HK island and TST.. perfect view of skyline from both sides.. also take video during sailing you can catch interesting attractions
Must do in Hong Kong. You can't really visit Hong Kong without taking a trip on the iconic Star Ferries. Cheap, easy and brilliant views of the harbour and skyline.
Old Ferries. Star Ferry is very famous and when you travel between Hong Kong island and Kowloon view is very nice, also using ferry is very cheap.
Good way to see the Kowloon and HongKong Island. Old fashioned ferry, but really great views of the harbour - you have a choice of decks, we chose the top deck
Quick, efficient and cheap. The Star Ferry is a very direct way to get from Kowloon to Wan Chai but the destination itself is not much fun for tourists.
Cheapest harbour trip available. Regular, frequent service. Dead cheap. Worth doing it multiple times just for fun. Don't look like a newbie - the seat backs flip from one side to the other.

Great view of HKG and Kowloon. We used the ferry crossing four times using the historic ferries which are a great way to see the two very different skylines in HKG and Kowloon.
We also took the one hour harbour cruise which I highly recommend for the commentary and the views.

Great Option. Great way to get across Victoria Harbour and get a nice view of Central Hong Kong. Very inexpensive as it was $2.8HK one way. Don't expect much besides a lot of people, but the ride is fast and they are constantly moving across. You can buy tokens the the machines before you board. Very easy and very cheap.
"Great way to cross the harbour". We used the ferry three times during our short visit. Tsim Sha Tsui to Central, Central to Tsim Sha Tsui and Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui.
Pretty and convenient. Best views of Victoria Harbour! You are able to use an octopus card on the ferry. The ferry is also convenient for transferring between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.
A wonderful and inexpensive treat!. A wonderful and inexpensive treat! - A must do for your visit to Hong Kong. A beautiful way to see the skyline and visit Kowloon.
Took a trip for a view. I took the Star Ferry to see HK island from the other side. The trip was pretty cool and efficient. The view was great from the boat and once we disembarked.

Iconic and insanely-cheap way to cross HK Harbour. For the experience alone, you MUST cross HK Harbour on Star Ferry.
You pay for your token with pocket change, it's that cheap. 10 min or so between ferries - comparable to many metro lines.
Experience the smell of the harbour. Get great views of both waterfronts.

Must do, cheap way to see HK Harbour. We walked to the star ferry terminal and booked the one hour harbour cruise, they run several times a day and night. Embarkation was easy, plenty of room onboard, with lots of tables and chairs inside and outside. Included in the price is a drink eg coke and a packet of chinese biscuits. It does a circuit and stops at a couple of other stops. Great photo opportunities and a very pleasant way to spend some time.

Nice and cheap little boat trip with views across the river. A nice way to travel between kowloon and HK island. Kowloon - HK island has better views but its so cheap ($1.5 ish) you could do it both ways! You get some nice views across the bay and its quite quick. takes only around 10 minutes for the commute and boats are very regular so no fear of queing. A must do, as its so convenient, easy and a nice change from the MTR.
Cheap tradition. It is a cheap but traditional way to cross the HK bay and enjoy both skylines of HK island and Kowloon.
Star Ferry. The best and only way to get around in the city. It is part of the tourist scene and something that all visitors should do, ideally by night to enjoy the city skyline.

nice ride. the star ferry costs about $95 per person and the ride is for about an hour. it takes you all the way down on either side of the river so you get good views of the mainland and of central on the other side. along the way it docks at two other points as well. the star ferry can also be used to commute or if you just want to enjoy the sights. the day we went the weather was rainy and foggy so we had the ferry mostly to ourselves allowing for uninterrupted picture taking. the ride was smooth and serene and you really got to see and appreciate the skyline. the best time to go is the last or second last ride as you get to experience it in the daytime and see the lights come on. i would not label it as a must do but its a nice experience.

Delightful boat ride across Victoria Harbour. This humble cross harbour service has been served the community for over 100 years. It is cheap and efficient and the best way to see the both side of the Victoria Harbour during the day as well as night time. Sit back and enjoy your ride.
Keep going . I like it that it is still serving as a mode of transportation for local to some extent. It will be a shame and loose the colour if it becomes a pure tourist realm.
Must do in Hong Kong. Great budget option to see the Harbour and get across to Hong Kong Island. Return trip is around $2 dollars

Just one of those things you HAVE to do. If you're in Hong Kong, how can you not use the Star Ferry. Authentic old ferry boats giving great views of Kowloon and the splendid island skyscrapers. An absolute must at very little cost. Use it to view the 8 pm light show from the Kowloon side. fantastic sights of various ships in a very busy waterway.
What a great view. What a great view we all of our friends enjoy a lot i would always suggest go with friends or family defiantly will enjoy.
Must Do. The ferry is a must use for anybody visiting HK. They are so efficient and cheap. One of my favourite things to do in HK

Simply a must do for the view. Cheap, fun and an essential part of Hong Kong. It offers good views of the skyline and the boats themselves are great. We tried to see how many we could ride. They all have star in their name eg night star, northern star etc
Highlight of Hong Kong. For me the Star Ferry is embedded in Hong Kong iconography.I cannot come to the island without enjoying it many times. Highy recommendable.

Traditional sxperience. One of the cheapest things you will do in Hong Kong.
If you are staying in hk a while get an octopus card otherwise you need cash.
Get upper deck seat near front.

best at night. the waterfront in Hong Kong is lovely and the lights from both sides of the river are beautiful and romantic at night. Also it is not as crazy busy later in the evening. They have amazing fireworks every night and the watching by the clock tower is the best site.
Excelent views of Hong Kong. Cheap way to get a waterfront view of both Kowloon and Hong Kong. Boat pauses mid-water to allow you to take pictures. Single journey about HKD6.50.
Cheap and worth the ride. It takes you between Kowloon and the financial district. Regular intervals. Buy tickets at the vending machine at the entrance.

Must do. If you are in Hong Kong you must take the Star Ferry.
Cost almost nothing.
View from the boats are nice, specially the Hong Kong side.

A must for all Hong Kong visitors. It's the Wandering Yank here. Mrs. Yank and I recently spent 4 fun-filled days in Hong Kong, staying in Tsimshatsui, so the Star Ferry was a natural way to cross the harbor. We took the ferry 6 times, and each time was a blast! Open air, salt breezes, incredible views, historic vessels - it has it all.The highlight? When docking, look out from the docking side of the boat and see the ferry worker hook the mooring rope. I probably took a hundred photos. Don't ask me why - maybe it's just seeing a technique that hasn't changed in 130 years. Very cool!2 thumbs up!

The best and cheapest treat in town!. It costs virtually nothing, runs frequently and offers quick and easy access between HK and Kowloon islands - plus a fun experience and great waterfront views. What more could you want?

Very cheap and quick. I travelled by this from kawloon to hongkong island twice.The ferry has a station easily approachable by walk or taxy,quick intrevals,very cheap just for 1.7 HK$ AND CAN CROSS THE BAY IN JUST 3-4 MINUTES.QUITE ENJOYABLE FOR KIDS FOR FUN,SPACEOUS TO SIT.tHIS IS THE MOST IDEAL WAY TO CROSS THE BAY AND HAVE FUN.

Easy to cross the Victoria habour to Wanchai or Central pier. If you want to cross from Kowloon to HK central pier or Wanchai district. You have to choose star ferry for a better choice with a great HK city view with a cheap.
Fantastic view. The Star Ferry is a great ride in HK. The view is fantastic and is very cheap. I would definitely recommend it, especially in the night time to enjoy a spectacular view of the city.

The best place to be when you need to slow down. With its long history of serving in Hong Kong, Star Ferry is one the best transportation that represent Hong Kong. Taking you between Tsim Sha Tsui and the Hong Kong island with less than HK$3 each way. It may take few minutes longer than MTR, but most of the time, you can get at seat. This is the best and the cheapest way to enjoy Hong Kong Victoria harbour.

A Must. Although the weather is not the best, it is a pleasant ride as always. This not only brings back memories but also give a chance to see the skyline of HKG. Every time we came back as a family, we bring the kids for this ride. Always a great experience!
Great adventure!. Star ferry is the perfect ride for island adventure,while on the board you can see and take perfect shoot to all the nice views around the island...it is awesome!
Not luxury but cheap. Took the ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island, it was about 15 minutes walk from the hotel but be aware that there is a lot of building work going on around this area.

A must do thing in Hong Kong. For a pittance (like around 30 U.S. cents or something), this is an attraction everyone can afford. Not to mention the fun of doing this ride from Kowloon to Central across the H.K. harbour with great views and real smells (acceptable), it is a bargain when compared to MTR. Your Octopus card can be used as well as HKD cashDon't waste your money paying for first class. The view is the same and the ride is fairly short (about 10 mins.) so no need for it. Don't miss it!!!!

Fun, cheap and refreshing. We crossed the harbor three times on the Star ferries during our week long stay. What a bargain...especially if you pick up an Octopus card. There are a couple of Star ferry options. Atleast two different docks on the island side. You get a good views of the harbour buildings and some of the interesting traffic on water (from red sailed junks to cruise ships).
Refresh my childhood memory. Great experiences to see Victoria Harbor, but if you can't stand the diesel fuel smell, stay on the upper deck. Else, you are very close to the water

Beautiful ride across the bay. The star ferry is a cheap, reliable option to get from the mainland to HK island and vise versa. Especially beautiful at night for sightseeing of all the lit up high rises. Like all transportation in HK, it's easy pay with an Octopus card or buy a ticket, get on, and enjoy. They go across frequently so just show up and there will be one shortly. It's a great way to view both the mainland and the island's beautiful skyline.

What a pleasure that You are still there!. What would be Hongkong without the Star Ferries? Sure You can't smoke any longer in them and people have stopped spitting but they are still the same as decades ago and offer the transit from Tsimshatsui to Central in a continuous service highly frequented at ridiculous prices (about US-$ 0,30 per trip). Impossible not to find them and improbable not to love them

Amazing. Great place to see the city water side during night very busy area with many tourist. Nice short ride on the ferry and u will have a great spot to chill and rest before exploring the city by night
Great service and cheap! . Brilliant way to see the skyline of both sides of the harbour and a quick efficient service! The massive perk is that it is super cheap! 2.50hkd!!
Great Ride in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is a great ride in Hong Kong. We love taking the ferry from Lantau Island into Central Pier at dusk. It makes for a great sunset ride without the big costs.

Charming 10 minutes sea trip. The ferry charge is cheap, $2.5 one way at upper dock, but truly a fun small transit in HONG KONG. Recommend take as a night tour a crossing between HONG KONG ISLAND and KOWLOON.
Cheapest and best. It must be the cheapest fares to see one of the most famous habour views of the world. I love Star Ferry❤️

A little choppy at one stage. Ok, I went on this with my sister (after a night of cocktails) and a business friend. The weather was a little choppy at one stage and I was feeling below par! My business friend actually thought it was a good time to open the laptop and discuss an Excel spreadsheet (in size 0.4 font) whilst i was focusing on not being ill. The ferry was very good and actually a lot better than I thought it would be however, I wish I hadn't drank so many cocktails the night before

Two day visit. The Star Ferry is one of those things you have to do in Hong Kong.
To speed things up though, the Metro is much quicker return trip.
But worth it. The Octopus travel card workd on all forms of public transport.
Simply one of the best ways to see Hong Kong. Great guided tour lasting for about 1 hour cruising through Victoira Harbor and get to see most of Hong Kong.
A required rite of passage for every visitor.. An experience not to be missed and by far the least expensive purchase during our time in Hong Kong.

A must. A great way to cross from the island to the mainland, it may not be a fast as the MTR but the views alone make it a must. It is very frequent and cheap to ride and makes a relaxing little break from the busy city.

Cheapest way to travel between Kowloon & Hong Kong Island. If you want to see a bit of the harbour on your way from or to Hong Kong Island and travel aboard a traditional ferry which has been around for a very long time, then you can't beat this ferry ride, and it's cheap too.

Wonderful way to explore city view from waterside. This is a not to be missed excursion for an incredible low fare!
Absolute stunning views from the water and giving a great idea how wonderful Hong Kong was built, stunning!

must try!. the ferry take you across from HK Island (Central, Wanchai etc) to Tsim Shar Tsui & vice versa. You can use the Octopus card to deduct the fares (a few HK dollars). Star Ferry terminal is convenient, about 5" from MTR, no fuss, from the ferry, the views are so beautiful, as you see it from the harbour view. Like a 'water taxi'
The star ferry is a must when in Hong kong. Easy to use to get from Kowloon. To the islandVery cheapRun frequently The views are amazingA must when in Hong Kong
can't beat it. The best ever short trip to experience the glamour of Victoria Harbour. The ferries are old dames for sure but it adds to the charm.
So cheap!!!. Such a nice ride and amazing views and it only costs about 30 Euro cents! Take the Star Ferry every day!
Has to be done. Get an octopus card, great for using on the ferry, MTR & trams great value for money. Makes travelling very easy.
the ferry. we went to macao from Tsim sa tsui , enjoyed the ride in ferry built like aeroplane with good relasing seats clean cabin. airconditioned chamber , enjoyed the 1 hr ride

Well you have to do it at least once in your life. I cannot imagine a cheaper and more spectacular ferry journey than this. It's a living legend so enjoy it before it loses its "manually" operated charm. Take a seat near the side and have that camera ready. Why not do two trips - one in the day and one at night. You can do the return by MTR as its a short walk to Central or TST station.

Victoria harbor cruise in a cheap way. Price is cheap and it's the best location to take picture of the Victoria habour. Better to sit in the lower deck as there are no windows to block your views.It's the fastest way to cross the sea, you can visit either Kowloon side or Hk island half day and take the ferry on your way back, it's a fantastic experience.
A must do when in HK. Cheap, very frequent and a tradition - exciting short trip over to the island or to Kowloon across the harbour
Good times. We had good time in the ferri with good music. I found different variety of good in the ferri with delicious dessert. The city view from ferri was amazing.
Easy reliable transport. You can always rely on crossing the bay for HK $2.50. Bit chaotic at the moment during construction but not a real challenge. Just makes crossing the roads difficult

Cheaper and More Fun Than MTR. If you have the time during a visit to Hong Kong, Star Ferry is the way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong or vice versa in an enjoyable way that is 1/3 the cost of taking the MTR.

Best for a quick travel!!. It saves time and is very cheap. One way ride from Wan chai to Tsim Sha Tsui is for 3 HK dollars only. It just take 15 minutes to take you at that side of city. Ferry is clean and service was good.

A must. This is the cheapest and best way to view the Hong Kong skyline. It is beautiful at night and for less then $1 USD each way. Sadly, the ride is very short. The Hong Kong Harbor has been land filled so much it is now more like Hong Kong strait then a harbor.
A nice ride in the harbor. It can seem a little touristy, but was a nice trip back to the Kowloon side after a lot of walking. Got to see a lot of other boats up close, and the city view was great.
Short ride but fun. Despite problem with continual reclamation, it is great fun to take a 5 min ride across the harbour, especially at night when you can enjoy the skyline of HK.

What would Hong Kong be without the Star Ferry!. Clean, fun, relaxing - unique! A wonderful way to see the fantastic skyline of Hong Kong and be part of the frenetic harbour where big ships and small are always passing through. For a real treat consider travelling downstairs - too many tourists travel on the first class upper deck missing the action downstairs - take a look at the engine room and perhaps witness the crew splicing thick rope or carrying out other routine maritime chores.
One of the top 10 sunset view.. Almost sunset, board the ferry at Star Ferry Terminal at TST to Wan Chai, you get to see one of the best sunset view for a few HK dollars!
Great way to get around.. Great way to get from mainland to HK Island. So cheap and easy to use with a great view of the skyline.
a must do. what is hong kong without the star ferry, cheap as chips, runs continually cant be beaten, it has been running for about 60 years maybe more but is an institution
Great. Best 25p I ever spent. A must just to see the views unobstructed from the river. Easy to find and buy a token from a machine. Signs and instructions in English also.
Good value for money . It's a good value for money, the ferry was clean and you can enjoy nice views of Hong Kong . We went to Lantai Island and the crossing took about 1 hour.
Star Ferry waterfront. The outside looks a bit shabby but the interior was beautiful and offered a great tour of the harbor and all the sights

Ferry across the bay . Hard to rate a ferry ride but the World famous Star Ferries are a must whether you're staying Kowloon side or on HK Island .... way more interesting and way cheaper than a taxi. They run from early till late so makes the harbour crossing inexpensive and an experience you won't forget.
Avery to Macau. Easy to get to the Kowloon side ferry to Macau but for .50cents u can take the star ferry across to honk Kong side and have many more time slots to get to Macau

Great views, cheap!. The best and cheapest way to see HK Harbour!
Well worth the sail across, or return, and a great way to get another perspective of this awesome city and it's brilliant skyline, day and night!

Great way to cross the harbour. Very easy to use public transport (use Octopus Card). Our weather was drizzly but calm, so had some good views of both Kowloon and HK island. Boat has open sides. Tourists should definitely do this trip to cross the harbor instead of the car tunnel.

Glorious commute. I had one day full of meetings pencilled in for my trip to Hong Kong and as our company Hotel was in Kowloon and the meetings in HK Island a, I was looking forward to this commute most... Never said that about work beforehand! It didn't disappoint .. As jet lagged as I was, it was a fog-turned- sun soaked morning . The view coming into the island from Kowloon, Gently riding the harbour, army of local workers for company ( not a westerner in site which I was surprised about...) , really was special. Depending on the what's and where's of your trip, I thoroughly recommend. Truly magical.
Efficient, cheap and scenic . This service is only 2.5$hkd per person to cross the bay.Service is fast, efficient and safe. The view is also fantasic.

Short Ride but not worth it.. We rode to and from the Start ferry twice. It was fine but not worth it when you can just take the MTR under the water if you are trying to get to another part of Hong Kong.
Great frequent service. Amazing service for the price was quick and simply to use, regular and clean. Staff very friendly, and cheerful.

Must Do Thing in HK. Best view on all sides of Hong Kong is from the water. The cheap public transport ferry ride is all this takes. If you want a longer experience, you can also buy a ticket for their harbour tour of about an hour.
Easy, efficient and convenient. Took this because it was included in our 2-day city bus tour but really enjoyed it. Convenient schedule, easy access to ports.
Ferry Crossing. This was an averagre ferry crossing from one island to another.Luckily there was inside seating as we travelled in March and it was very cold.

A Short Ride on the Star Ferry. The Star Ferry at Kowloon Point came in very handy on our recent trip to Hong Kong. It was handy to our hotel (The Butterfly on the Pratt) and it gave us many options for seeing a good amount of Hong Kong for a reasonable price and lots of times to take the ferry across! The open air ride was nice and relaxing! A fun way to see Hong Kong from the waters edge! Don't miss it!
Nice Heritage Carrier. We enjoyed the ferry service and its olden ways of operation made it more interesting. Surprisingly, octopus card helped us in making a quick entry.
Cheap and easy. This a cheap and easy eay to get around. Cost us $2.50hk to use per trip. You can also use your octopus card to pay. Good photo opportunities as well.

A pleas and tour around the bay.. Having had a hectic 3 days at the Hong Kong sevens we decided a nice pleasant boat tour was needed to slow down the holiday. We boarded the ferry we paid on board you get a free soft drink and some cookies it was 95 HK dollars. We then travelled down the Hong Kong island side before returning with commentary on the mainland side all very pleasant.
Try it. Cheap (2.50) and takes you about 10 minutes to cross the harbor. You have to try it at night as you have the entire skyline in your view and is quiet the photo opp.
Nice ride. Guess this is something you have to do...ride the Star Line Ferry. Been operating forever...yields a nice view of city.
travel. A fantastic way to get back and forth from Tsim Sha Tsui and the convention center. The trip is very inexpensive and affords great views of the harbor.
Short but sweet. There is some old world charm about this ferry. This is just solely a 15 mins experience of an age old means of transport!
Every time!. What better way between Kowloon and Hong Kong - for about £0.25p! :) The Star Ferry is iconic in Hong Kong.
Star Ferry tops. Hong Kong Star Ferry provides a great service at a very reasonable price. Sailings are very frequent which means very little waiting.
Always A Must. You cannot visit HK and not take the Star Ferry. The views never get old and I don't get sea sick with this for some reason?

Fun Way To Cross from Kowloon to HK Island. Use your octopus card (same as on the MTR) and take a trip across the water. Great views of HK island as you cross. Boats go at regular intervals. Also there is a one hour trip around the harbour to do.

Use an Octopus card again . Free if you are over 65. The ferries are quite old but are always on time. You are usually only in them for a short time going from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island so you will not get seasick

Cheap and Fun, not touristy. Unlike ferry rides in other cities that take fervent photo-snapping tourists skyline-seeing on an expensive river/harbor cruise rides, the Star Ferry functions more like a public-transport for Hong Kong - everyone takes the ferry, from elderlies crossing the harbor, businessmen and women going to and going home from work between Tsim Sha Tsui and Central (financial district), kids, tourists etc.Its a fun way to see Hong Kong's skyline, take in some fresh air and also avoid the crowds in the underground MTR.

Super inexpensive, no ce quick trip to see the harbour.. At $2.80 hkd this is a cheap ride. It's a nice way to see the harbour without spending a fortune and they leave so regularly there isn't much of a weight. Make sure you have coins to purchase a plastic token to get on.

Incredible Value, More Pleasant Than Metro. This is the cheapest form of transportation in HongKong. It is also awesome! You can ride in a boat, in the harbor, and take in the sights day or night for less than a dollar. It is pretty no frills but it's great.

Cheap and efficient. I have never been on a ferry like this as in the states usually they transport cars as well and don't sway a lot. It is a super easy way to get across the bay. I was on it at least 12 times or more when I stayed for the week. You should definitely get an octopus card for ease of using the ferry and the MTR.
Something to do and see in HK.. A must for every visitor even just once!. Its cheap and fun on fair to good weather days. Walk around central or Kowloon and go back the same way!

a must. and cheap. there is not much to say about. this is just a must. and you can do it more then once since it so nice to see the whole skyline from an other point of view. and it is cheap since you can use you card from public transport.

A must do in Hong Kong. Crossing the channel on a Star Ferry is a must in Hong Kong. It is cheap, fun, and all of a sudden, you find yourself on an old ferry that seems to have been there for a century at least. I would repeat the experience whenever I can.

Ferry Ride Brings Calmness. Taking the Ferry is a much cheaper way to get from different points of the islands of HK. Through the hustle & bustle of the city, there is a old world luxury of transport. The calmness and simplicity of taking a boat to cross from HK side to Kowloon side as you are rocked by the waves & the wind hits your face is a stark contrast to crowded noise of a bus or underground train.It allows you to have a bit of time to contemplate & get lost in random thoughts while waiting for you to reach the other side.

Must Do!! . We've taken the Star Ferry a couple of times using our octopus cards! It's a very short ride between Hong Kong Center and Tsim Shai Tsu but definitely worth it! Very beautiful at night to see the Skyline!

Every visitor to HK has to travel on the Star ferry, it is as simple as that !. At any time of the day the star ferry is the way to travel, the sights the sounds the people watching cannot be beaten, the service is also efficient and inspiring as you gaze at the HK skyline

Fast, Cheap, and Easy with a View. Hop on the Star Ferry which departs every few minutes to get across Victoria Harbour. It's just a few HK dollars, and if you have an Octopus Card, you can use that, too. The view from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island is especially stunning.

Easy way to get from TST to Central. Got an Octopus card first and then used the ferry to get from Kowloon across to Central, it's only a few minutes to cross but a good way to view both Kowloon and Hong Kon Island.
"Must do" in Hong Kong. It's the longest operationg 'water-taxi' here, so experience the trip. Easy to use with Octopus card!

Quick and Cheap. Really nice to do once and get the view. Easy to get a ticket, they run all the time and even met some nice tourists along the way. Once you've done it, I would recommend using the subway.

Best short ferry ride . Payment: Octopus pass or buy a token. Get free tix from bigbus package.From/To: From Kow Loon Star Ferry to Wan Chai Terminal.Duration: 20 min or shorter.Cleanliness: The boat is clean. But dont expext much for the toilet in Kow Loon. At Wan Chai terminal. The toilet is outside the terminal. About 1 min walk away.

Star ferry ride to Wan Chai. Watched the Symphony of Lights and decided to go by star ferry to Wan Chai instead of using the MTR. The ride was short and because it was in the evening the city lights were beautiful. My travel buddy enjoyed the ferry it being her first time in Hong Kong. Very cheap too and a nice change to the crowded MTR.
Star Ferry ride is a must do in Hong Kong. A ride on the Star Ferry is one of the must-do activities when in Hong Kong! Beautiful day & night, on sunny day or rainy day.

An icon of Hong Kong. Very old ferries but it works in Hong Kong, plying the harbour, taking boat loads of travellers every 10 minutes across the harbour. You can't possibly go to Hong Kong and not have a ferry ride.

Good old faithful. The crossing from Tsimshatsui to Hongkong island on the iconic Star ferry is always spectacular and mostly quit bumpy. Make sure you sit down!The ferry boats are the same as they were when I arrived in Hong Kong nearly 40 years ago, which is rather nice in a city that destroys everything or nearly that has a whif of heritage! An enjoyable ride.

Star Ferry Hong Kong . Excellent way of travelling between Hong Kong and Kowloon. Cheap as chips and what a view. My sons and I were there for the Hong Kong 7s and used it regularly including the night which was fantastic with a laser show at 8pm from the high rise buildings on both sides. You won't be disappointed.
Excellent view of the harbour. This is a great way to view the harbour and take spectacular pictures of the harbour all at reasonable price

A must when in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is a must to do when in Hong Kong. As we were staying on the main land we did this journey several times to reach and visit our friends on the island. The ferries are constant so waiting time is minimal although it can get very busy during rush hour. Cost is very cheap for the journey across. Make the journey at night when all the buildings are lit up,fantastic sight to see.

Star ferry : Lifeline of Hongkong. It connects two islands and ferry is available every 10min (if I remember correctly). It acts as a lifeline for locals and tourists as well as travelling across islands becomes no brainer. With our 48hrs pass, we got enough ferry tickets that lasted us during entire trip and made our stay pleasant.
Iconic Mode of Transport. A must experienced travel medium esp to 1st time traveller which offers an alternative transport to the MRT.

A highlight of my trip. As a regular visitor to Hong Kong crossing the harbour on the Star Ferry is always a highlight of my visits. In the crazy pace of modern Hong Kong time slows down and you can really appreciate the beauty of the harbour and skyline.

Exactly as expected . This is exactly what you expect and for the price (pennies) I have no complaints, I would just say it's not thrilling, it's just a ferry across a harbour with a view of the Hong Kong skyline. We did it both in the day and at night and it was nice to see the contrast.
A Must if your in HongKong. You haven't been in HongKong if you didn't use this ferry at lest once. And the price is really cheap. Probably the least expensive tourist attraction worldwide.

Cheap and fun. The star ferry is a cheap way of getting to the other side of the city. Instead of the modern and crowdy MTR, you can take the old star ferry with an interesting history. You can pay with your octopus card.
fantastic. a great service - gets you from A to B very quickly and efficiently. only costs a few cents to travel

My favourite thing to do. You can't go to Hong Kong and not take the star ferry , it is quintessentially Hong Kong, take the upper deck and buy an Octopus card to pay for all public transport in Hong Kong

Still the same. First used this ferry in 1969 before the tunnels, Underground etc were built. So many changes in Hong Kong but the Star Ferry is just the same although not so crowded. Brought back so many memories

Convenient and cheap. Went across to Kowloon. Was a bit intimidated in the beginning working out which line to go down and how to get a coupon. It was pretty painless no huge crowds and the ferry seems to come and go quite frequently. Quick and easy

Quick. Fun. Cheap. Memorable.. A must do when in HK. Great way to see the skyline on the way to Central. It was so delightful, we took it several times. Best to purchase a convenient octopus card for this and many other small transactions around Hong Kong.

Has to be done in Hong Kong. We used the Star Ferry to travel across the harbour. Leave Hong Kong Island by Pier 7 at Central to get to Kowloon. Were travelled both ways using our Octopus card for an unbelievable price of 2.30 HKD on upper deck (one way) and returned on the lower deck for 2 HKD. Great phot opportunities from the Ferry

Colonial Era Boat Ride. For what is effectively a very cheap public transport link from one side of the harbour to the other there is something cool about the old wooden ferry ride with its ancient (but reverseable!) seats. Running near nonstop you never have to wait long and can enjoy great views of the city while you cross.
Just ok. It worth to go for a short sail. You can see both sides of harbor same time together. Use your Octopus to pay.
Easy Transport. Easy way to cross harbor from Grand Hyatt, and it is in walking distant. Nice ride on a warm day. Also nice to ride at night during the light show.

Fun, easy and cheap sightseeing. Super fun, spur of the moment decision to take the ferry around the harbor. We went at night and had some beautiful views of the city, both sides of the waterfront. Not crowded at all on a Friday night. Easy connection with the subway for access to everywhere in the city.

What a great mode of transport!. Star Ferry is a wonderful mode of transport to get from Kowloon over to Hong Kong island. Why waste time sitting in a taxi when you can get the most amazing views on the water, and for only around 3 dollars! Journey takes less than 10 minutes and is so quick and easy. Highly recommended.

Great step back into the past. Take a step back in time with a ride on a Star Ferry from either Hong Kong Island to Kowloon or the other way. The trip lasts only 5 minutes but its a treat to get from ibe part of HK to the other on an old fashioned ferry. If you are wanting a longer trip you can book a Ferry harbour tour which lasts about an hour. I did that on my last vidit to HK in March 2015. It was cold in March so take a jacket. Enjoy.
Quick and no hassle. A quick 5 minute ferry ride across a very busy waterway. Beautiful sights of Hong Kong when you look back or return from Kowloon.

DO NOT MISS. If you do only one thing in Hong-Kong, that's it ! Take the ferry and enjoy the skyline on both sides. Do it while it lasts, as land is reclaimed at an amazing rate you might soon walk from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central...

Great transit ferry. For locals and tourists this ferry service is the main transit from Hong Kong to Kowloon and return across Victoria Harbour. The entire trip lasts for approximately 5-10 minutes. Nice views of Hong Kong skyline and harbour.

Nice little trip. This is a classic HK must do and due to land reclamation it will only take a few minutes out of your sight seeing day. Its cheap its easy and it the best way to enjoy that wonderful skyline.

Must do. Anyone going to Hong Kong this is a must do, the Star Ferry across Victoria Harbouris the best way to see the skyline day or night. Ferry has 2 decks try both 2.50 for upper deck & 2.00 for lower deck view from both make sure you have change ( coins) for token machine.
Amazing Views!. This is a must in Hong kong! You should try both upstairs and downstairs. A classic experience in Hong Kong!
Great mode of Transport. This ferry is so cheap and easy to access. Also a good way to see Hong Kong from a different angle. The passing river craft are also interesting!

A must!!. The Star Ferry was once the only route across the harbour but still used widely by commuters - it is a must. Do try and go "First Class" about 50p!! Best time to go is at 7.45 - 8pm and enjoy the light show from the harbour.

Good views. It is a good service and you see far more than using the MTR. A quick way to get across the Harbour and very cheap. We used it both during the day and at night when the skyline was lit up - worth a trip

The best (and cheapest) way to see Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is a great way day or night to see the skyline of Hong Kong it's much cheaper to do it in the day rather than the night but both experiences are great!
Simple, quick, cheap ferry across. Star ferry has other trips and dinner trips. We simply went over and back to go to the orchestra. Use the octopus card for just a couple of us . bucks.
Super quick and super cheap!. Every trip to hong kong should include a trip on the Star ferry. 20p to get across the harbour - best value for money in hong kong!
Give it a go. Very cheap way to get across harbour to HK island from Kowloon. A bit of an adventure for the kids. Great view of harbour. Took about 10 minutes one way if that.

Trip on star ferry. Really enjoyed this ferry trip. Landing at pier was a bit rocky so make sure you hold on tight. Very good way to see Hong Kong. Went on ferry tour of harbour as well as crossing from Kowloon to Hong Kong island.

Affordably transport. Use the mtr to get to the pier and then take the star ferry across Vic Bay to Kowloon... Simply, affordable and enjoyable. Enjoy the scenery from the ferry as the cool breeze blows through your hair.

Slow boat to TST. A lovely trip across Victoria Harbour on the Star Ferry. It's only a short journey from Central to TST but some lovely views to both sides of the city. A super affordable trip HK$2.50 with first class views. Perfect for families, or romantic transfers across the water.
Easy way to cross harbour . Join the locals crossing the harbour. Great fun being so lie on the water. Make sure you have plenty of coins for the token machine.

Daughters 24 birthday trip. The Star Ferry was truly the perfect way to cross over from our hotel in Kowloon to Hong Kong!!!! Very inexpensive and comfortable with amazing views from every side of the ferry

Best way to get on and off the island. Or wake your way to Kowloon side where u can see the avenue of the stars, great shopping options and enjoy the famous skyline.
It's a cheap and fast trip (about 10 min) and you can grab a quick snack or make a quick visit to the maritime museum

Cheap, efficient and so iconic!. Riding the Star Ferry should be a must for every traveller while in Hong Kong. It's cheap and easy to use and the views of the Hong Kong skyline are brilliant. If it's the first time using it, the seat backs move to allow you to face the way you are travelling!!

Easy, fairly inexpensive. This is a much more beautiful way to transit between HK Island and Kowloon than the subway. The fee is fairly nominal (about 3 HKD). It is a quick ride, so not a great sight seeing tour.
Quick and Easy. We used the Star Ferry as it was included in our two day ticket package on The Big Bus. Frequent and quick service. A must do if you are in Hong Kong.
Nice views of the harbor. Nice views of the harbor. And a cheap way to get across between Hong Kong and Kowloon. City lights look great if you go across after sun down.
You should do this at least once. It's inexpensive. I think it cost less than two dollars. The skyline on both sides of the river look beautiful. It's a great place to take pictures from.

Cheap and great. If your traveling between Kowloon and HK Island or vice versa, then take the ferry rather than the MTR
Some great views and a nice cool breeze to cool you down and only 25 pence each way !

Fun Easy Transportation. The Star Ferry is a very easy way to cross the Harbor. It is cheap, fast and enjoyable. It goes back and forth all day long so we never had to wait more than 5 minutes for the next one to come.

Crossing the Harbour . Located close to our hotel we used the ferries to commute between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.
Ferry every 10 to 20 minutes and cheap as chips. The view incredible particularly at night.
A must do

Legendary harbour views and low price. I can dig it!. The Star Ferry costs $2HKD on weekdays for adults and $2.8HKD on weekends/holidays. That's cheap as heck! Plus it's quick and you have a nice view of the harbour in true traditional Hong Kong style!Departs at pier 7 about every 5-10 mins arriving at Salisbury St pier within the same time frame. These things are fast, though they don't look it!Budget for a nice dinner instead and take the ferry, it's worth it. I promise!
Loved the old . Character and efficient service top level cost hk$2.50 and downstairs $2.- amazing to see and like stepping 50 years back in time

Cheapest site seeing view of Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. The best way to see the city from the water, especially during the evening light shows. Hop on the ferry and cross over between different parts of the city
Great affordable service. We used the ferry several times on our visit to Hong Kong. It was easy to get to, very affordable, quick, and clean.

Great ride across the harbor. don't expect anything fancy but for the cost its a great quick ride across the harbor... note that once you get to the dock on hong kong island, its a quite a walk to the subway

The best value most visual public transport in the world. I just have to take this trip on every visit to HK , even if I don't need to cross the harbour it's a jaw dropping bucket list journey by day and night. If it was ten times (no one hundred times) !! The cost , it would still be worth the experience.the smell the view the history is priceless

Great ferry. It's another amazing transportation we got the train from Kowloon over to the other side of the island,,the train service is the best around but a lot of walking to connect to other stations,,,on our return back to Kowloon we got the star ferry back it cost us 25 pence English money me and my son couldn't believe the price to cross the harbour great value for money...the trains are also very cheap to get around

Harbour Tour. We thoroughly enjoyed our hour tour but the pre-recorded commentary was a little disjointed and did not always seem to correspond with where you were. For example, when we were guided toward the inverted pyramid building we could not find it anywhere, but we did come to it about 5 minutes later. A live commentary as you have on the Thames in London would be better.
Quick ride over the harbour. Very in expensive ride over and very quick !! Love the harbour good bakery's and street food down there and Quick way to get to Stanley market !!

The trip of change. I love boats and I have loved this Ferry!I took the Ferry that connects Kowloon with Hong Kong Island. A 10 minutes trips that connects two very different worlds. The world of immigration and asiatic-muslim poor people with the world of white-skins and very good and nice business suits!Two differents worlds in the same place in a 10 minutes trip by boat! I was very shocked!

MUST TRY!!!. A MUST TRY for traveling to and fro Hong Kong island and Kowloon.. Super cheap (Mon-Fri HKD 2.50, Sat-Sun/PH HKD 3.40) Can be deducted by your Octopus card (a MUST HAVE in HK coz it is a card to every thg). No need to rush for the ferry if u missed one coz in a few mins the next will arrived. The cheapest tourist attraction in HK. There's upper and lower deck; so u can try both during ur trip.

Really cool, great view with a good view from the bay. Really great view of the bay, with the ferry going slowly from Shueng Wan to Tsim sha tsu and back in the night with the over hyped laser light show - symphony of lights at 8:00pm, was really cool just to be in the ferry and cross the bay slowly with a great view all over.

A MUST if you visit Hong Kong. Harbour of Hong Kong remains one of the best harbour view in the world. Star ferry is the cheapest way to explore the harbour. Piers at both sides have lots of shops and tourists attractions.
Hopped on and Hopped off - Very Quick. Just a stones throw across the harbour from Kowloon to Hong Kong, very quick and nice views of the harbour.
Great way to get a feel for the city. Quite a long walk to the ferry terminal but worth it. Cheap too. This was a short journey but a great way for us to see the city and get our bearings.
Day Trip to the Madness that is Kowloon. Had a day out in Kowloon and used the Star Ferry to cross Victoria Harbour in little over 5 minutes. The views from the ferry are breathtaking.
Be a part of Hong Kong history. A basic part of Hong Kong life for decades very inexpensive and fun for the whole family. The only thing in Hong Kong not under construction practical yet alluring
Convent and efficient . The ferry fare was included in the big bus ticket. Very convenient for us to use because we stayed in Kowloon. Ferry clean and ran on time
Overated. Nothing special. Paid HKD 200 for the Light & Sound cruise and could've done it for free from the harbour. They couldn't even syncronize the audio with the lights on the show.
The cheapest way crossing the harbor with the best Victoria Harbor view. This is cheapest way watching the best Hong Kong island side and Kowloon side Victoria Harbor view in Hong Kong.
Great experience!. Really enjoyed travelling on the star ferry multiple times. It's really easy to get the tokens and board. The views of the city are great as well!
Best means of travel . If you are visiting an exhibition or just want to cross over for shopping.. Nothing is cheaper and convenient as the star ferry. At HKD2.50 per trip it's almost free...

Easy and quick . Very easy way to get from the center to TST...
You pay 3.40 and get the black coin.
Very nice. Try it.
Note that if your hotel is in the east side of TST, you will have a 25 min walking when you get TST.
Bargain! . Got the star ferry from central to Kowloon for the princely sum of 20p each way! It's only a 3 minute ride across the water but it was a fun way to do it rather than using the MTR.

Well worth it and amazingly low price. We had a weekend break in HK so we had to go on the ferries. Really easy to use and a great way to see the Harbour.
We just went across the Harbour but if you had more time you can travel further on them

Must do HK highlight. Having been to HK many times it is always good to take quick trip across the harbour on the Star Ferry which has to be the cheapest and easiest way to get across harbour. Wonderful views and time to soak in the amazing HK atmosphere with the locals and tourists alike. Iconic activity which is unique to HK.

Pleasant way to travel from Hong Kong Island to Kowloow.. A very pleasant way to travel from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon.
The journey is fast and you get a great view of the harbour and the skyline.

Fast, efficient.. Just like the metro really, fast and efficient. You can pay with an Octopus Card too which is handy. We found sitting at the front, left hand side when going over to Hong Kong island as the best spot for photos of the skyline (and we were on the lower deck.)
An alternate way to cross the Hong Kong harbour. Excellent way to cross the Hong Kong harbour. Great view, not crowded, cheap, a bit of nostalgia. Experience Hong Kong commute in a bygone era.

The life blood of Hong Kong. Ferries are an important part of life in Hong Kong and a trip on them should not be missed. We took their tour of the harbour which took us around pointing out the various buildings and sights.
Well worth a trip.

The life blood of Hong Kong. Ferries are an important part of life in Hong Kong and a trip on them should not be missed. We took their tour of the harbour which took us around pointing out the various buildings and sights.
Well worth a trip.

Just a great way to cross to the island. I have always loved this service from Kowloon to the island. Very frequent and cheap. Even better the views while on the water are great, especially if the island.
Elegant. A short and comfortable boat trip between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, besides, it is cheap. Good to try.
A 'must' for any visitor !. These fairly old ferries have been plying to and from Hong Kong / Kowloon for decades but continue to be well maintained with an apparent emphasis on safety.

Picture taking . A great place to take photos, the good thing is when we visited the place weather is so cold so you feel the air breeze coming from the sea.
The group enjoy having selfish and group pictures. Shopping malls and restaurants is near the area too.
But quite crowded
Efficient. As long as you know were you are going, it is a doddle. Go to the waiting area, take a seat, wait for a green light and board. We took upper level which was great.

Nice trip across to Kowloon. Cheap but very busy, a good short trip across to Kowloon which is a must do on any trip to Hong Kong.
Plenty of interior space if it's raining...

Cheap as chips and a must do . Loved the star ferry since first trip in 1997, it's a must do mode of transport to hop to Hong Kong or Kowloon, have done numerous trips and always torn from upper or lower deck but love he lower deck, love watching people get confused by the seats with the reversible back rest, $2.80HK each way for 10 mins of nostalgia can't be bad

A must do Hong Kong experience!. If you travel to Hong Kong you really must pay your less than a dollar fare to cross the harbour on the Star Ferry. It is a wonderful way to see both sides, especially at night. The Star Ferry is a classic HK fixture. Not to be missed!
Excellent service. As always this service is basic but greatExcellent value & frequent servicesWe used this service between Kowloon & Hong Kong on many occasions

60 Minutes to see the Honk Kong. Taking ferry is very comfortable if you want to see the most of Hong Kong in very short time. Ferry takes the round trip around the bay. It will be better if you have local with you to explain which building is what.
Nice sightseeing by the ferry. Great way of getting from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Perhaps it is enjoyable on a bright sunny day when it is clear and dry

Hong Kong icon. It harks back to past era. The ferry ride is such a nice experience. Nowadays they use electronic button to draw the gangplank which until a few years ago was still manually done by the attendants. Perhaps that explains why they are all male.

Excellent. Nice experience with the ferry, you have the opportunity to discover Hong Kong from the water, but avoid rush hour. The Star ferry is an excellent transportation of Hong Kong. It shouldn't miss !

Very good service and so straight forward.. Great way of getting from Kowloon to Hong Kong, Clean, good benches to sit on, nothing much to add good time table on the move all the time so not much waiting about.

Its just a ferry. "Must do the Star Ferry" they say - not sure why? suppose is better than a ride on the metro (which is just like the Tube in London) Perhaps it is enjoyable on a bright sunny day when it is clear and dry, maybe I was just cold and disappointed and there was not much to see, but hey ho it was a very cheap crossing and the box has been ticked. So go ahead and cross it off your list too- but don't get too excited. (quite a lot of Hong Kong was a let down, especially the light show but if you are there you feel it has to be done just don't expect much.

The best value tour going. At only 50cents (Australian) each way, it's a great way to cross the harbour. We took about 5 trips while in Hong Kong. The subway is probably quicker, but this has the views and sea breeze

Must Do. It is only a short crossing but I feel it is something that all tourist to Honk Kong must do. It is only a short journey but go on the top deck and take in the views. It is a cheap cruise and only takes 10 mins.
Cheap Activity. Star Ferry is not only a mean of transportation between TST and Central, but also a cheap activity to view wonderful Skyline in HK.
Great way of seeing Hong Kong. For 50p you can travel on the ferry across the bay seeing all of the skyscrapers. Great at night when they are all lit up.
Cheap and Efficient. So easy to get between Kowloon and Island especially as we only stayed five minute walk from TST terminal
Good experience. The old Star Ferries are an iconic Hong Kong attraction. Cheap, comfortable and functional for a trip from Kowloon to Hong Kong island and back. A must for any trip to Hong Kong.
nothing special. disappointed that it was just a quick ferry, nothing special. also did the hour river tour but got off at the first stop as it was so slow and boring

Cheap and interesting way to see Hong Kong harbour. A more scenic alternative for crossing to, or from Kowloon. The journey takes about ten minutes and you can see all along the city coastline and take in any other commercial or traditional shipping happening in the area.

Great Trip. I used the ferry to travel over and watch the nightly light show, great we ferry to travel on.
Would recommend a trip

A pleasant way to cross the habour.. A cheap and very pleasant ride across the habour.
We sat at the top deck,and the views off the Island were breathtakingly.

Star Ferry. The Star Ferry at Kowloon was very reliable, there are so many people use it. It was great as you could see so much whilst on it. It wasn't very expensive. You have to purchase your tickets before you go on. It gets very busy when people come out of work.
Good way to explore. It's not expensive and convenient for exploring different part of HK. It is also pretty down to earth and probably close to every day commute life of HK people.

Short Trip with nice view. The ferry was well seated with plenty of room
Just a quick trip across the Harbour. Plenty of things to see especially if a Cruise Ship was moored.
This is a service that heads off every 10 -15 minutes so no need to wait
Star ferry to Wanchai. Excellent ferry ride. Pleasant and comfortable. Cheapest means of transport across the Victoria harbour. Highly recommended.
Took a trip. Noisy, crowded. Not really what travellers would want, but the end justifies the means. Took us to Hong Kong city to get on a bus to Stanley markets

Iconic old world charm from yesteryears. Star ferry is an icon of Hong Kong. Started in late 1800s and some of the current fleet that plies from TST to Wan Chai & Central are at least 60 -70 years old. Travel back in time with a ride to be experienced both in daytime as well as after the sunsets. Look up to the hills of HK, mid-levels and the Peak and marvel at the galaxy of lights that sparkle form beyond. A typical tourist board photo of HK's Victoria harbour would have s Star ferry chugging across the harbour, watch out for it in the famous movie World of Suzie Wong

A great way to see the Hong Kong harbour. This quaint but timeless ferry service is an often overlooked gem. If you want an inexpensive evening experience, take a trip on one of these. The Shining Star is a great way to watch the evening light-up of the buildings around the harbour and you can get a glass of wine on board or coffee if you prefer.Its a magic way to view the harbour.
the best way to get a feel of Hong Kong. take a seat on the Star Ferry and take in the Hong Kong skyline, the smell and the bustling activity. Take the trip by day and by night!
Old Hong Kong. Good way to travel and also just to do as sight seeing activity, very cheap and perfect day or night.

Very Good One Hour Harbour "Cruise". Inexpensive harbour cruise with an audio commentary. Light snacks and drinks ( including beer). You can buy a round trip or use the ferry to get to the Hong Kong side. You can wander on deck or sit inside an look out the open sides.

Use your octopus card for quick fast ride. We wanted to get to Victoria park and riding the ferry was just across the street from our hotel. However, it was NOT easy to locate a bus to get us up to the Peak once we were off the ferry.
Ok. I used it to cross river to get to peak. There was no problem in both ways. It is fast but ferry is old. They should think to buy new one for better feeling.

Bring back the memory. Before the transbay tunnel, the Star Ferry is the only means to connect the Hong King Island with the Kowloon peninsula, the ten minutes ride offer you great view of the Victoria Bay.

Must-do in Hong Kong. It is a very convenient mode of transport for the locals and the tourist with short waiting time. At the same time, enjoy the breeze and views from both side of the islands (Hong Kong to Kowloon or Kowloon to Hong Kong). If you have only want to choose one ride during your stay in HK, must do the evening/night ride back from Kowloon island to Hong Kong island. The coastline of HK island is one of the best city view I have seen so far. If you have the octopus card bought for the MTR rides, it can be used for Star Ferry ride too.

A good wee trip. We got the ferry from TST to central. A good wee trip! Definitely fun to try. Good seating and feels safe :)
A fun way to travel if you have a little more time. Takes you right to the crossing over to the ifc building which has super good coffee.

Cheapest way to see the Skyline. This really is the most cost effective way to see the Hong Kong Skyline. For around 25p you can travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and get a superb panoramic view (both ways). Always recommend as part of the HK experience.
Another must do whilst in Hing K0ong.. The best value for money in the world? This much written about trip connects Kowloon with the island. Magnificent views and weel worth the effort. Just do it!

a bit boreing. a 1 hour tourist journey on the river is a bit boring & with the smog it is hard to see the sights some days However you cannot get off along the way when the ferry stops at other jetties which is a shame as it would be more interesting.
A true bucket list experience. One of the legendary bucket list experiences and arguably among the least expensive. Tip: do avoid the morning rush hour.

Old transport . The Star Ferry has carried locals and tourists across Victoria Harbour for many many years so it was good to experience something that probably won't be around for ever & gives you a closer view of the Harbour.
A must experience. Takes 7 mins one way- a must do if your in Hong Kong. The way they are filling up Hong Kong Harbor better experience it soon. Very nice right about sunset.
Hong Kong experience. A must for any visitor to Hong Kong is a trip on the Star Ferry across the harbour. Travel with the locals on the Star ferry and enjoy the views from these wonderful old boats,

The best way to see the harbour up close. Friends took me on a ferry ride, I beleive it to be one of the cheapest attractions in HKG. Gives you a real rustic feel on Hong Kong, This is a must. Good access for prams and wheelchairs, ride takes about 15-20 mins each way.

Best Deal in Hong Kong. We stayed on the Kowloon peninsula and took the ferry in the evening over to HK island (takes you right to the ferris wheel). Super cheap. Great way to see the city at night. Quick and easy.

Recent visit . It is the Star Ferry! Go! Well, it is easy to get on and off the ferry, and the ride offers great views of both sides of the bay. Get an Octopus card when you first arrive, and you can then use the card to access the Star Ferry.
Family visit . Very busy area but lovely to use to get to the Peak. Views from the ferry are fantastic of the harbour. It's a quick journey for those that don't like boats!
Not the bargain it once was. Still going strong, even on a wet cloudy and windy day, you can't beat it for a view of Hong Kong. Not many passengers.
fun ride. beautifull view over Hong Kong and easy to access. Perfect sightseeing and the kids liked it will do it again.
Iconic. The Star Ferry is cheap, clean, speedy, convenient, iconic, great views with good pier locations and is perfect for hopping between Kowloon and the Island.
It's a ferry. So what?. It takes you from point A to point B but the MTR is way cooler. Do the ferry once, just to check it off...and then the MTR after that.

What's Not to Like about the Star ferry. I haven't seen an unfavourable review of the HK Star Ferries and am not surprised. They are cheap (about 50 cents Aussie) per crossing and run every few minutes. You can choose to sit on the Upper Deck with other tourists or the even cheaper Lower Deck with the locals. The efficient deck-hands resplendent in their Daffy Duck style blue uniforms add to the colour. If you have a bit more time their is a one hour harbour cruise available that leaves the Tsim Sha Tsui terminal at five minutes to the hour. Even on a smoggy day when the views are not as excellent as on a clear day this is a fun activity

Best way to see the city. Apart from the practical considerations of the ferry, it is a wonderful throwback to a slower time. The views of the city are great and totally included in the very cheap price.
It was nice Ride. i love it we enjoy too much specially when we are in middle of the see and moving around all area you can have a nice look to all city from that ride
Best view in the world. I have visited Hk many times and this is still a must do on every trip, cheap as chips, great photo opportunity and brilliant that there are 2 classes of travel! Enjoy
Still very reliable. Always a ferry to get on as soon as you get there. If you miss one, there is one 2 mins away. Quick trip, best view of the skylines if Kowloon and the island. A must do in HK.

Lovely old ferries.a great experience. These old ferries travel from one island to another.every 5 mins.One gets in at the pier,and settles sown on benches,soaking in the lovely scenes on both sides,and the two islands too. A smooth ride,except for when rain the the ferry is rocking a bit. I love the breeze on my face,the beautiful scenry,the camera out to capture the clouds,skies,other boats,ships areiving into the dock,tall buildings,etc etc ...its beautiful.and at night the lights twinkling,and its so picturesque.and its a wonderful experience and a cheap way to travel accross.

Quaint Way to See Harbour. Travelling on the Star Ferry is a great experience. It is a totally relaxing, short ride from TST to Central for only 2 HKD. We used our Octopus Card for ease. We didn't have long to wait, and standing on the pier watching the ferries come and go is part of the experience. Out on Victoria Harbour on a beautiful day, watching the Hong Kong skyline pass by - there is nothing like it. You feel like a local.
Scenic Route between HK & Kowloon. Such a pretty way to get across to or from Hong Kong Island, especially at night time!Fresh air and lights! Why not?!
Just like our Mersey ferry. Very efficient especially if you have an octopus card! Made us feel quite at moe as Kowloon to Central was a bit like Liverppl to Seacombe!

Wonderful atmospheric ride and views. Very cheap, very easy, great views, very fast, always an atmospheric view of Hong KongA walk to the bus stations at Central but a great way to travelStop in at the Maritime museum while at Central

A Must Do in Hong Kong. This was my Nth time to visit the marvelous Hong Kong. Hong Kong offers countless diverse tourist attractions from getting immersed culturally by visiting its numerous colonial and religious sites like temples and nunneries to modern places of interest like the Hong Kong Disneyland, the many skyscrapers and the abundant modern and chic malls as well as the various unique transportation modes like the Peak Tram, the Ngong Ping Cable Car, the Hong Kong Tramway and the Star Ferry. In my every visit to Hong Kong, I see to it that I take a cruise across the famous and scenic Victoria Harbour via the Star Ferry. Anytime of the day is a nice time to ride the Star Ferry but a night time cruise is the best as you are filled with wonder by the lighted ultramodern architectural marvels of Hong Kong. At the start of the Star Ferry in the Tsim Sha Tsui is the Former Kowloon-Canton Railway Clock Tower or the Tsim Sha Tsui Clock Tower or simply the "Clock Tower" which another remnant of Hong Kong's history when it was still a British settlement in Asia. Although, the Star Ferry has a couple of routes, for me the is still the one from the Star Ferry Pier at Tsim Sha Tsui which is adjacent to the Clock Tower across to the Star Ferry at Central, the location of the principal business and economic district of Hong Hong that houses the international headquarters of companies and financial institutions. Before I end my review, it is the most inexpensive and most picturesque way to cross the Victoria Harbour that splits the two main areas of Hong Kong which are the Kowloon Peninsula and the Hong Kong Island. A one way fare is less than HKD $3. Enjoy your stay in Hong Kong as much as I am delighted with my stay there and be sure not to forget to do a Star Ferry cruise.

A very cheap way to get across the water to other side and offers fantastic views !. Stunning view and easy access to stay ferry, very little waiting time and fast action from staff. Plenty of seats available which change direction. Boat never needs to turn

Down memory Lane. I have been taking the ferry as long as I could remember. The only change was that it no longer ferry cars across. Many people forget that Hong Kong was an island all by itself . There was no cross harbour tunnel connnecting it to the Kowloon Peninsular. We relied on little motor boats to take us across if we "missed the boat" literally. We called those motor junks Wah La Wah La. Having said that, the Star Ferry is not much different from its early days, at least not outwardly. It is comfortable, cheap and convenient. It is hard to imagine that there was once a riot due to a raise of 0.5 cents(HK). It shows how hard life was barely one generation ago.

Great way across the harbour. For 2HK$ for the lower deck & 2.5HK$ upper deck - Monday to Friday & at the weekends 2.80HK$ for the lower deck - slightly more for the upper deck.Cheap, convenient way to travel, used it numerous times.

More than worth the Experience!!. The star Ferry is the best and cheapest way to reach out to Kowloon from Central Ferry Station. The Ferry station is 5 minutes walk from Central Railway station. The Ferry takes about 15 minutes to cross the channel.
I love this 'old time" ferry!. We rode it a few times this visit and it bought back memories from earlier visits. Efficient and cheap! YMMV

Inexpensive view of the Hong Kong skyline. Popular way to travel between Hong Kong island and Kowloon. Boarding and disembarking was handled efficiently without delays and plenty of opportunity to take photos on board.
Day and night trips are both enjoyable.
Cheap, fun, excellent transport!. Its cheap. Its fun. It is a great way to get from Hong Kong to Kowloon. One of the most fun parts of Hong Kong visit!

Good transportation!. We took star ferry just to go to hongkong central island.
Good transportation while taking pictures of building's colorful and magnificent lights.

travel from one side of hong kong to the other. Old ferries that travel every 5 minutes from Hong Kong side to the island cost 2 HKD p.p. each way takes about 5 minutes if you go upstairs on ferry cost extra 50c by far the easiest and cheapest way to travel across the harbour

Always great. Took the family this trip at night time. Always beautiful any easy quick way to see the harbor. We rode from the Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui. We walked around a bit on the pier and rode back to the Central Pier. Perfect two hour adventure the my two boys loved it. Especially the young group of workers who were getting finished with happy hour and heading to the Lan Kwai Fong area for more drinking. Their drunken antics were a hoot to watch.
Great ride!. The Star Ferry is a throwback to the Hong Kong of the 40's and 50's! We love using it from TST to Wan Chai or Central!

Back to the past. This is the most wonderful and the cheapest experience in HK.We used several times this boat and that is really great, it is like a tourist attraction but it is real life. Completely different than the experience of the peak tram that is made only for tourists, crowded and full of rude and impolite people. Enjoy this short break between HK island and Kowloon!
Star ferry Hong Kong. 2 hk dollars or less if over 60 - 40 pence uk, for a ferry ridefrom Kowloon to HK island. Just keep going back and forward it is brilliant especially at night. Mix with locals!
A way of to see both sides of Victoria harbor. Nice alternative for Mtr. Even cheaper!!! Can see view of both sides of the Victoria harbor. Just a bit crowded sometimes.

Nostalgic ride on the Star Ferry. Enjoy the beautiful skyline of Hong Kong. It is just short ride but so lovely. Just stand back for a moment and take in the view of Victoria Harbour, the beautiful Hong Kong skyline on a clear day and the people. I think I will never get tired of it.
I recalled the cross river ferry on the Choa Praya in Thailand.

relaxing escape from city. The ferry chugs along at a leisurely pace, so sit back and enjoy the ride from the island of Hong Kong to the Kowloon side. It's a great opportunity to get unique photo ops of both skylines. The price of admission is dirt cheap.

Great Ride for a cheap price. This is a great way to cross the bay and get a view of the skyline. Slightly better view from the upper deck. From the Kowloon side look for the blue signs to find the upper and lower deck entry points, they are a half block part. To see what the signs look like use the street view on google maps.
