To board you can pay by using your octopus card otherwise we need to buy a token.

Star Ferry. Cheap and convenient way to get across the harbor. We took this several times just for fun. So much to see and do on both Hong Kong island and Kowloon, we had to ferry across at least once a day.

A Hong Kong must. Everyone that comes to HK must go on the Star Ferry. Once is not enough! If the railways were run like it we'd never be late. You see the amazing harbour and building on both sides but watch how well oiled the 7 minutes are. Do it in the day and then again in the evening. Its one thing you'll be able to afford in HK!

What a Legend. This is something that every visitor to HK must experience. What an iconic ferry, even the male staff all still wear the navy sailor suits! The best and cheapest way to get from Central to Kowloon for only HK$2. The ferry's ply the waters constantly with very little or no waiting.

Iconic Star Ferry across Hong Kong harbour. In a city known for its expensive shopping and iconic top brands it's a great surprise and pleasure to cross the world famous harbour on one of its most iconic transports - the Star Ferries. And the cost in March 2016 is only HK$2.50 or approx 50 cents Australian to ride the upper deck under cover. Great view of the harbour. Easy to use. Simply find the token (ticket) slot coin machine near the entry gate and purchase your token to use t the turnstile. Must do activity and worth it.
Great views and so cheap. We travelled both during the day and night. It's really quick and you get amazing views. An absolute must when visiting HK
A Must. We took the star ferry so we could tick it of our list and and a must when in Honk Kong at night. Try and get a seat near the front or any side for some good photos.

A piece of history. I love crossing the harbour using the ferry!
It is very cheap and a lovely relaxed 5 minutes in the madness which is the busy city!
Very romantic!. It's very romantic and it is not too much expensive and it is fast and comfortable. I like it very much.

Iconic must-do. This is a must-do everytime I visit Hong Kong. The short ride gives a great view of both sides (when it's not hazy). The boats and the old dudes handling the gangplank in their unchanged uniforms from the 1950s are real Hong Kong icons.

Romantic. Fabulous. Gorgeous Views. Nostalgic.. Night or day - Riding the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island or vice versa is a bucket list experience. You traverse Victoria Harbor in a small ferry boat that has not changed much since these ferries were put into service in 1888. It's a short ferry ride but one that is filled with so much color, sounds, splendor. I love riding the Star Ferry. Every time I am in Hong Kong, it is a must-do for me. The Star Ferry has been featured in many movies - probably none as prominently featured as in The World of Suzie Wong (William Holden, Nancy Kwan). Robert Lomax (Holden) meets Mee Ling (Kwan) on the Star Ferry.
Convenient . Very convenient to hop across to Kowloon side of Hong Kong. Cost also quite reasonable and takes only 10 mins or so. Well appointed close to IFC mall and Four Seasons hotel.
A must do for Hong Kong. It's a real experience on the Star ferry, they are cheap, regular ad a great way to see the harbour.

Cheapest Best Value Cruise Around. What great value. See the sights of the Hong Kong and Kowloon Water Front for just a couple of Dollars. Don't miss this excellent and historic piece of Hong Kong transport. Be aware of the unusual ticket/ token machines, not easy to use the first time around.

Simply great!. Amongst the skyscrapers and hustle and bustle is a bit of history. Cheap as chips its a great way to see Hong Kong and the 10 minute crossing gives you a chance to look at the view and take a break.
Nice . We enjoyed this little trip amongst the locals. Nice way to see the harbour. Lots of construction going on around though.
Fun experience. Fun experience to ride the famous ferries from downtown to Kowloon. Gives you a great view of the skyline and is extremely cheap.

Must try to do the local way. We enjoyed the ride, and to see how efficient it was, and to share the local people their daily way of transportation. The kids were amazed with trip and see the lights at night from the other side

Easy way between Tsim Sha Tsu and Central.. Not as easy as it used to be as they move the Central Pier but still a good way to get between Kowloon and the Island. It is now closer to the Outlying Island piers and Exchange Square ( to get the bus to Stanley). As for a attraction, you have to take a Star Ferry trip just to say you have done it. I have used the Star Ferry since the 1960's and the ferries are still the same now as they were then. Just updated with air-conditioning in the upper deck front and rear compartment. Don't know what the current cost is as we used the Octopus Card on the last trip but probably still the same at HK$2.20 for the upper deck. Lower deck is cheaper.

Cheap Fun. We rode the ferry from HK island to Kowloon. It's cheap and efficient. We paid 2.50 HK, so about $.50 US? for a one way ride. Some nice lunch spots near the cruise ship terminal so you don't have to eat at McDonald's!
Easy transport. Fast and cheap way across the bay. Especially for the night city light show and shopping. Avenue of stars on the mainland.
Iconic. Not to be missed even if you just go & come back! Hong Kong is fab! Great for eating & shopping. So friendly with its own identity

The fading away Best transport in Hong Kong.. Star ferry is a romantic place. Every time if I am going to Central or Wanchai from Ocean Terminal or Star House or the Culture Centre in Tsim Sha Tsui, I will take the Star Ferry. But, recently, Star Ferry has been killing by the greedy Hong Kong Government because the city is keeping on reclamation. This pushes the ferry further away the centre from Central and Wan Chai and makes it not convenient. Although there is a pedestrian bridge leading the passenger from the Central to the pier, however, there is 10 minutes walk required. Whereas Star ferry is still a romantic place to visit especially during the sunset where you can watch the sunset in the middle of the sea. This is still the cheapest cruise we can enjoy the both sides of view of the harbour in Hong Kong. So, I still think that this is a must go places in Hong Kong if you have been there before.
A good tourist spot. Place of interest for photographers. Go there during a clear sky for a sun set. It provides good picture spot.
Must do. Ferry service was great and reasonably priced. There are very comfortable seats and drinks are available for purchase. It's a great way to relax from the busy city walk.

Great ferry company, . Use a lot of this Star Ferries to go between Island and Mainland. Also a good combination with BigBus Tours. Harbor Cruise is nice for the younger people, I.e. we saw "Queen Elisabeth "

A must do in HK. The Star Ferry is a must do for anyone visiting Hong Kong for the first time. It is a fun ride between TST and Hong Kong Island. The cost is next to nothing and the views are priceless.

Like the dodgems in water. Used the ferry to go from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. Really efficient service, use your octopus card and its simple. Views across the harbour both ways are amazing. As the ferry is going across the harbour all the other boats are going up and down the water way. Adds to the fun
Short cheap trip worth doing.. Got the ferry. Saw some grand views. then i was off. It moves at a calm pace but it was a very short journey for me.

Nice way to watch the sunrise from the city. It was Saturday, around 8 or 9 in the morning. Walked from my hotel to the TST ferry pier. Took a ferry to the central pier. A very cheap one around HKD 2 i think. It is weekend and only a few people was taking the ferry with me. So a good one for me to feel the ride. Even just for a few minutes to cross to the central, but it is really a good thing to start my day with. Enjoying the view of sunrise even it was actually a bit late but yet the view were still amazed me. Of course it is safe. Take the upper deck, it will be better. Try to ride it for a few times, it wouldn't make you feel you are wasting your cash.

Not to be missed part of the Hong Kong experience. This is a true Hong Kong experience. It is so much better than taking a subway between Hong Kong and Kowloon. It is cheap and quick and your get a great look at Hong Kong harbor.
Quick transfer to Hongkong island. Easy and quick, cheap tickets, just buy a token or take the general octopus-card. Good option to a transfer. Its recommendable

Really good. We used the star ferry to get from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon.Easy use machines to get your travel token, was really cheap.Enjoyed the short journey and took several pics of skyline of both sides.
Interesting. Cost effective and interesting attraction to see and use when visiting Tsim Sha Tsui just for the sake of interest.
very cheap for such a good experience. a little bit take more times than the metro, but more valuable experience, cheaper and absolutely better view (unless you prefer the wall)

Great way to cross the water. Excellent and very cheap (25p!) way of getting between kowloon and the island. Great views both day and night on the original old wooden ferries. Only down side being that due to yet more reclamation on the island the piers are now quite a walk out compared to what they used to be
Star Ferry is tops. I love to take the star ferry back to Kowloon when I'm in Central. It's old and not for the motion sick but so much fun and great views of the harbor and junks on a clear day.

Interesting Ride to get into the Victoria Harbour. Its very local and traditional type of transit. Being in the middle of the harbour is kind of a must-do in HK, especially at night, the view is magnificent. The ride is pretty short so best to plan something around the the two spot (either Central or Wanhcai on the Island) and Tsim Sha Tsui.Fare is average, reasonable to me. Some people will go crazy for getting the window seats but indeed, that's a key spot for taking great pics. or alternatively, if you are physically capable, also depends on the weather of the day, you can walk out to the entrance area to take photos.
HK view at a glance. 3 min journey on the vintage boat to see HK skyline. Great place to take photos especially at night.
Experience the Ferry Ride at Pier 7. it is fun Riding in Ferry from Pier 7 to Central Pier ...one can feel the thrill and experience the Ride if not done Before
A must in Hong Kong. What a great way to get between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Cheap, easy, convenient and you can't be the views. We could have taken the subway but this was just too much fun.

Nice ride!. Worth and must experience while in Hong Kong .Beautiful view from the clunky double-decker and a nice ride leaving every 10-12 minutes .You can choose lower or upper deck and just under 10 mins ride .Fare :Adult $2.50-$3.40Child below 12 and person with disabilities $1.50-$2.10.Senior citizen above 65 years is free!Lower deck slightly lesser .You can used tourist ticket and you need exact change for the turnstiles .From MTR TSim Sha Tsui exit L6 to TST Star Ferry Pier.From MTR Hong Kong station exit A2 to Central Star Ferry Pier.From MTR Wan Chai Station exit A1 to Wan Chai Star Ferry Pier .Star Ferry One Hour Harbour Cruise is HKD $90 for a day tour,HKD $170 for a night tour .2 hours Symphony of Lights Harbour Cruise from Central and Kowloon costs Hkd$195.Star ferry Harbour Cruises include a light refreshment and taped commentary that is hard to listen to .
Amazing!. It was an amazing experience! We got beautiful weather and my daughter loved the ferry ride! It was memorable and wonderful!

Nothing worthwhile here. The cruise was ok. Nothing impressive here. They said there would be a laser show but we didn't find anything except straight laser lights. Food was bad. Vegetarians don't even hope that you will get food here. Ferry was over crowded too and as a result very dirty
A must do.. Went over to Kowloon and back during our stay. Unbelievably cheap and excellent views of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. If we return I want to do it a night
Kebab and Curry Takeaway Halaal . Tasty food to eat at Star ferry terminal Kowloon. Best part it's halaal and they don't sell Alcohol. Cheap ride .

Must do in Hong Kong . We stayed across the water from Hong Kong so used the star ferry every day. So cheap and you get views of the skyline from the water. A strong ongoing tradition in Hong Kong must have at least one ride while in Hong Kong

Best way to travel. Great inexpensive form of travel. Great way to view Hong Kong and Kowloon. Regular service, we used the octopus travel card which can be topped up at any 7 eleven store easily with cash. Best way to travel between islands so cheap and so frequent.

The best value boat ride in Hong Kong. A fun way to finish a day trip to Hong Kong Island. Cost us $2 AUD in total for 2 adults and 2 children. Highly recommended. Great views of both sides of the Harbour from the boat.

cheap transport. you must do a trip with star ferry. even though we mostly used the mtr we tried out the star ferry. use your octopus card for entry. sit on upper level. we did the ride from tsim sha tsui to central.
It's a Boat. While it was fun, ultimately it was a boat that got you from the mainland to Hong Kong Island. It is definitely quicker to go via the MTR, but via boat was a pleasant change.
look up the histoy of this ferry. The views at night from Hong Kong island to Kowloon at night are amazing and it's cheap too recommend

Great option. The ferry is efficient, frequent and reasonable. The easiest way to get over to Kowloon to see the sights there. Do the trip there and back in both day and night time for the amazing harbor views.
The best way to travel.. Cheap, cheerful and historic, I recommend this, without any hesitation, as the way to get across the bay.

Great quick access to Hog Kong island. Great way to get to Hong Kong island. Take the ferry at least once during the day and once at night on a clear day during your trip. Get to the front of the queue before boarding to ensure a seat on the left front part of the ferry and experience spectacular views of the Hong Kong skyline (if headed to Central). The terminal building and boats give a great sense of the history of Hong Kong. It's a must do for any trip.
A change from the underground. Wonderful as the mtr is sometimes it's nice to do your travel above ground. The ferry is cheap and you get a lovely view of the city as you chug across the bay.
Quick trip across the Harbour. Who doesnt love a ferry ride especially a quick clean and efficient one. The star ferry is a fun way to get to hong kong island.

Really fun. Great way to experience "real" Hong Kong. Like so much else in Hong Kong it works and is efficient. The little shopping center was also worthwhile - unlike do much else it seemed relatively inexpensive.
And go at night!!
Cheap, Easy & Relaxing. Great Alternative for Public Transportation. Not much more to say than try it, go onboard, sit down and use the crossing as a reflection of your (sightseeing) day.

Quick and efficient. They have been doing this for a while and it is an easy to access transportation that runs every 5-8 minutes. If you are living close to the Central Pier it is better and more fun than the subway.

Cheap, quick, easy.. The Star Ferry is a must for getting around. It's very cheap and quick and a good way to take some nice photos. They run constantly and its easy to buy a ticket from the machine situated near to where you get on.You don't need to have the correct fare as it gives out change.
Fun to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong . Buy a token at the machine before you board .. And enjoy the short ferry ride - nice views and takes you back to times before re-unification
Quick and easy. Very cheap and easy, only cost $0.60aud. Worth taking the ferry instead of the train, sit and relax and enjoy the view
A short fun trip!. This is a cheap fun thing to do at night to get a quick glimpse of the city lights. Definitely something to do :)
Cheap, fast and fun. Not sure there are many places in the developed world, where one can use 2.3HKD (0.30USD) to travel or do anything else.
cute old ferry. nice story behind these ferries, and they are a bit more convenient than subway (usually not as crowded). cheaper than subway too.

Classic experience. Excellent, but only for the experience of riding a ferry which has to be original 1910's era. Takes you back to the old colonial era. Unfortunately, you still have to look at all the ugly skyscrapers.

Don't miss this experience. It's cheap, convenient and part of the history. What more do you need. If you are visiting Hong Kong, don't miss this experience. We took a ride to central. You can use your octopus card or buy a token at the entrance

Cheap and great views. Definitely worth several rides. The ferry from Central is probably the best to take since the Wan Chai ferry terminal area near the Convention Center is currently undergoing heavy construction. Great views and costs almost nothing. Takes the Octopus card.

Confusing . To be honest, it's a great cheap way to get to the other side but it's so confusing, nothing is labelled well and ticket counters or machines are a puzzle to find. We've asked people and they weren't really helpful but once we found it, it was quite simple from there.

Must do whilst in Hong Kong. Star ferries are a Hong Kong legend, although the journey itself is only 5-10minutes all in you cannot leave Hong Kong without doing the crossing. It is also an excellent way to see both sides of the harbour without taking a longer/ more expensive boat trip.We stayed in Kowloon during our trip and this was the perfect way to pop over to the Island. Recommended.

來感受一下香港吧!. 價錢便宜,沒有擾民的人在拉高價錢叫你欣賞維港!來香港一定要坐!只是不到5塊,你盲可以感受到香港人的平常生活~放慢一下吧!也用不到你10分鐘!! just few minutes you can enjoy one of the famous view in hong kong and feel the HK style! just below 1 US !!!! haha!!

Must do HK experience. Historic Star Ferry is a must do in your HK itinerary. Very cheap tickets. Take the ferry to HK island so you can enjoy the skyline view. The ferry to Wan Chai is way quicker than using the HK metro if you want to get there from Kowloon island. But if you want to board the metro at Wan Chai again, its quite a long walk from the ferry pier.
Slow but scenic.. Although the MTR will get you across the bay in less than half the time, this boat ride is totally worth it at least once during the day and once at night. It's also really cheap.

Star ferries, Easy, cheap and fun. When in Hong Kong you have to take one of the 'Star Ferries' across to Kowloon Peninsular.They are cheap, easy to access and fun, also they run about every 1/2 hrAlthough it is a quick 10 min ride you can still see many things on this journey and they run quiet late into the evening although not 24 hours I think

Rustic..nostalgic...just as I imagined. It was a short trip between Hong Kong and kowloon. Beautiful view a it it has no glass. It was an old ferry...rustic..and nostalgic. You seat on wooden benches. Open air place and no windows. Open to beautiful views..Take it at night..you won't be disappointed. .beautiful views even in foggy nights.

Same as its always been - brilliant. The last time I was in the Star Ferry was 34 years ago and it has not changed at all. It's very British, quaint, historic - almost moving and there is nothing else like it in the world. The seats still have swing over backs so you can always sit facing forwards just like the old trams did. One way is less than 30 p apart from bank holidays when it is 34 p. It must be the best value ride still in everyday use anywhere in the world.
Best deal in town. This is a great place to go with people visiting or just to go with the kids across from central to Kowloon side. For visitors, make sure to bring your octopus card.

If going or coming to Central /Tsim Sha Tsui this saves money. The star ferry saves money as compared to MTR as MTR cost around HKD 9.8 (same on all days) compared to Ferry HKD 2.1(It increases little bit on Sunday & holidays) still less than HKD 3. Time wise MTR is fast than this but still within acceptable range. Not much rush even on holidays and quire frequent service. The Star ferry Central is close to MTR Central station and walkway is there. So also Tsim Sha Tsui star ferry and MTR station are also close by.
This is a must. Very cheap to go from one side of the harbour to another and a very pleasant trip.Great photos.Going on again later for the harbour cruise

Best Way to Cross Hong Kong. The Star Ferry offers one of the Best Value Functional Trips in Hong Kong or The World. Basic and the same as 50-60 Years ago but it works and the quickest way to Cross the Harbour. It is great to do Wan Chai to TST and after looking around TST catch the Star Ferry to Central. Better than a Basic Harbour Cruise for under HK$ 10 ( Less than £1).

A nice alternate to the MTR. A quick way to travel across victoria harbour, cheap (£0.50) and frequent - every 10-15 minutes. Especially good to travel at night, allowing you a great vantage point to observe the magnificent skyline HK has to offer.

Beautiful sightseeing . For a few dollars get more than a simple crossing between Hong Kong and Kowloon... The panorama is truly breathtaking and the ships bring back nice memory of the old colonial time. Take an upper deck passage to avoid the crowd and best view. A must
Good Option. The MTR is underground and the Star ferry in on the water. It is more expensive to cross the harbour but a nice change of pace and its good to see the sights.
Atmosphere . The star ferry costs pennies. They ply backwards and forwards across the bay all day. The ferries are old full of brass and wood. Thoroughly recommended.
Fun. You can't come here and not go on the ferries! The octopus card can be used on the ferry and it only takes about 10 minutes to go across to Hong Kong island a fun way to see the city .

Classic old ferries. Great way to see Victoria Harbour. Use Oyster card to get on at any of the terminals. We went across to Tsim Sha Tsui from central pier and returned to Wan Chai pier.Ferries can become crowded during peak hour so leave it until later when things quieten down.Weekends and public holidays are busy times.

Cheep and Cheerful! . Great way of crossing between Hong Kong Island and Tsim Sha Tsui. It costs around 2.50 HK$ and is a brilliant way of seeing the harbour views night or day. We have never had to wait more than ten minutes for a ferry.
Very efficient. Using the ferry is a cheap and efficient way to travel around Hong Kong. These ferries carry lots of travellers to many destinations every day and the timetables are endless.

Essential Transport Across the Harbour. We were lucky enough to be staying in a hotel within a few minutes walk from the Kowloon terminal of the Star Ferry, and found it essential to get across to Hong Kong. The view is probably best from the top outdoor deck, and you'll have to choose which deck you are going to use at the terminal. Remember that you can use your Octopus Card on the ferry, although it only costs HK$2.

The best value for money in Hong Kong. Forget the HK$80 ferry tour of the harbour. For HK$2.50 (about 25p) you can jump on the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Central, or the reverse, and ride across the harbour. If you feeing homesick there is even a Fish and Chip kiosk on the HK Central side. Old and battered and needing a coat of paint, and accompanied by the smell of the engines, the Star Ferry should be top of the list for all visitors. We used it several times during our 10-day stay.

I like this mini cruise!! . Being from Amsterdam, where we also have our own star ferry of course we had to take this form of transport to get from HK island to Mainland, even though the Amsterdam ferry is free, this is fully worth every cent we paid, if you really want a special one, wait until it gets dark, go on the ferry from point a to point be, and go back again, and again and again, you will see something different every time you go :)

A cultural icon of Hong Kong. There's not trip to HK complete without at least one ride on the iconic Star Ferry. It is as close as it gets to what life in Hong Kong was years ago. And it's such a nice way to have a awe inspiring look at the Hong Kong harbour. Take your time and enjoy the slow and "back in time" ride!

Unique Experience in HK. Every tourist to HK should take the Star Ferry from HK island to Kowloon island (or vice versa). It's a unique experience in Asia as not many countries have such a beautiful harbour to separate two key land areas.
A fun evening bumpy ride. took a ferry from star avenue in the evening time. was a short bumpy ride,but fun nevertheless. these ferries are very frequent,so you wont be wasting anytime waiting.

Easy travelling. It was a lovely way to get across the harbour especially on a really nice day. The outlook across to all the buildings is cool. Easy to get token and very regular so not a bother at all
Economy seat is just so comfortable. . Went to Macau by this ferry and back to Hong Kong, I'm glad I didn't buy the business seat as the economy seat is comfortable and spacious. It's also clean.
Atmospheric. An essential component of any visit to Hong Kong. Excellent value. A great introduction to this great city.

Nostalgic . Had some people with me that have not been to Hong Kong. While the Tsuen Wan (red line) is much faster a ride on the ferry to Central or Wan Chai is a memorable one
Cost now is HK $2. I remember when is was only .50 cents.

A Must Do.. Possibly the cheapest ride in town and what a view. If you have an Octopus card and you are over 65 it's free!Even when it's not free, it is so cheap you can do it more than once while you are there. PS all transport in HK is so much easier with an Octopus card....get one at the airport when you arrive.
must do. Either by evening or day a trip across the harbour on the ferry is a must. The harbour and lit up skyscrapers are brilliant.

A quaint, quick way of nipping across to Kowloon . The roads & MTR may be linking up more of Hong Kong but this the ferry takes you minutes to reach Kowloon. As with many things one can pay with the Octopus card.

Overrated. Right... what's the big deal?! Why is this the nr 1 attraction? A mystery to me. Harbour view, skyline, yes, but you will see the same from almost any point of the harbour. An old ferry boat for a 5' ride... Overrated.
They might be old but they are great fun.. Its like the Staten Island ferry in NY.......no trip to H.K. is complete without a return trip on the Star Ferry. Great views.
great trip. The Star ferry is only very short in terms of time but really is a must if you are going to Hong Kong and very inexpensive
Memorial ferry. Memorial place to use hongkong ferry. Nothing special here. Not more than five minutes to stay here. If you want more experience just try to use the ferry
Cheap and cheerful. A short boat ride to cross from Hong Kong to Mon Kok, great views, a relaxing ride and its extremely cheap!

Nice sail.. I had been told that this is one of the travel bargains of the century and it certainly is, can't remember the exact cost but it certainly wasn't very much. I'm not sure how old the boats are but they are certainly old style which adds to their interest and character.Unfortunately weather wasn't of the best when we made our crossings but it was still an interesting and worthwhile short crossing.

Lovely way to cross the harbour.. We love to go across the harbour this way and do so many times when we are in Hong Kong. It is not the quickest way but we enjoy looking at all the buildings along the waterfront and having a few moments peace before we go back into the hustle and bustle again.
An experience for kids. An experience for the whole family, nice touring and seeing Hong Kong harbor view, get to relax enjoying the harbor breeze even tho a bit crowded.

Brilliant service. The Star ferry is a fast and inexpensive way of crossing from Hong Kong to Kowloon. The ferry runs often and only cost a few dollars. One of the ferries we caught was as the light show was on and it was a brilliant way to get another view of the lights.
Relax . Nice hub to Take The ferries to The Other side Of The island. Several per day . very well organized. Cheap option too. Nice to see several vessels on the way with cntrs.

Very Fun, Very Affordable . I'm uneasy about boat travel due to motion sickness, but this is a short ride that should be okay for anyone. The whole ride takes about 6-7 minutes, just enough to take in a quite-amazing scene in both sides of the harbor. Also costs next to nothing.

The cheapest view of the harbor imaginable. For a US quarter you can journey from Hong Kong to Kowloon (or vice versa) and see one of the most spectacular urban views in the world. Highly recommended.

Another must do. We first used the Star Ferry 35 years ago and nothing much has changed - except the terminal, which has been moved. It was a very cold and windy day and when we got to where I remember the terminal was we had to walk a lot further to the new terminal, which nearly did for my wife. The boats are just the same, with our being built in 1959. Using an Elderly Octopus Card meant the trip was only 20p.

Cheapest way to see the Victoria Harbour. The Star Ferry is a fun quick way to cross Victoria Harbour. The tokens used for entrance are a nice souvenir if you're into little takeaways. Pro Tip: Use your Octopus Card to avoid the lines.
Experince the Water. Although we could use the MRT as the alternative, you should not give this a miss, the view and the experience is simply fantastic.

Memory lane. This little ferry ride takes you across faster than the bus. It is very cheap and you can use the Octopus card for the trip. The view of the HK harbor as well as soothing sea breeze make this a really enjoyable diversion. Shopping on the other side of the terminal is full of shopping opportunities; as is the whole of HK. Some claim specialty restaurants are better than others etc but to me everything taste fantastic and every shop has their own attraction. Tsim Sha Tsui is particularly popular because many like myself likes to linger in those little shops and walk around in Nathan road to see the shops and eat Steam Boat or visit the Mosque. There are many Arabic people on Nathan road. The cheapest ie best exchange rate for money is in Chung King Mansion. Cheap hostels are available for ultra cheap accommodation but you have to be careful because some of them have unwelcomed guests like roaches coming into your room and luggage. Most if not all are quite safe. Money changers downstairs are usually pretty honest but still be on the lookout for pick pockets and some unsavory characters around. Police patrol this area regularly. Holiday Inn and other hotels with stars surround the area so if you are tired of roaches then just move next door and pay about 3x more in price. I love this part of HK because everything seems to be cheaper especially breakfast dim sum---- fantastic. My favorite hobby is EATING so my past time is to go into all the tiny little restaurants to taste their dumplings and noodles and and and Please dont forget to try their tropical fruit ---- durian. A bit like blue cheese but taste FABULOUSLY fantastic. Star fruits, jack fruit, dragon fruit etc etc etc. Fruits and veg you never dreamed existed can be found here. In life, try everything the earth has to offer. Dont stick only onto MacDonalds or cheese burger. Going to Asia, esp HK is for the purpose of widening your horizons and experience everything. This place offers simply ANYTHING that you desire and also EVERYTHING you dont even know about.

遊香港指定節目. 香港是一個漁港發展成為大都會，小輪見證了海岸兩邊的發展，短短線5-10分鐘船程，感受到這個特式城市，尤以夜晚坐船，香港的燈光是它美麗及傳奇的理由之一（不計光害。。。。）遊客們必定要享受的指定節目！費用只是不足港幣4元Hong Kong is a fishing port developed into a metropolis. Star Ferry is one of the witnessed of the development on both sides of the coast. Its take a few moment( 5-10 minute) ride. Highly recommend at night. Thats the reason why Hong Kong is called the Pearl of Easter . Although beautiful lights and legendary cause light pollution ....Visitors are sure to enjoy this designated program! Cost just less than HK $ 4.
You must go on this to taste hk. Great service. Adult ticket is less than the cost of local newspaper.Prompt and fast service if you want to get accross. If you dont want tobger accross do it anyway

A bit of history. What a bargain' penny's to get a front row seat of Hong Kong harbour in all its glory. The boats themselves are full of charm and history yet practical taking you to the other half of HK. Highly recommended.

Time to breathe. Nice cheap way across the waters with a beautiful view. Closer to the Victoria Harbour views than the MTR so convenient. Just slower so we got slightly lazy after the chilled ride although its still fast. But will definitely do it again on our way back
Great way to travel!. It was a nice ride over the bay. The ferry goes very quickly and it is not expensive at all. The signs make it easy to find the right one to take. Definitely recommend it!

Surprised How Quick and Easy. We took the ferry from Kowloon to HK side just for the experience of it and were surprised how quick and easy it was to access. We used our Octopus card which made it a snap. it's always an interesting perspective to see a city from the water and we enjoyed the quick ride across from shore to shore.
Quick, frequent and low cost crossing of the harbour. Very quick and efficient crossing from Kowloon to HK. Tokends purchased from machines at the embarcation point are HK$ 2.50 one-way.

You cannot visit Hong Kong and miss this. Years ago, this was the sole means of public transport between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Today, there are bridges and tunnels. But the Star Ferry remains the best way to make the crossing. It is for pedestrians only. It is really cheap and it is also cheerful.Visiting Hong Kong and not travelling, at least one way, on the Star Ferry is like going to New York and not taking the Manhattan-Staten Island ferry. It is best to travel on the upper deck - note that the upper and lower decks each have their own access and exits routes at the terminals. Once you are on-board, I don't think it is possible to change. Especially in good weather, the crossing offers excellent photo-opportunities.

Nice way to cross the bay. We used the ferry to go from HK island to Kowloon. It was a nice experience. The trip is very cheap and fast. While you cross you can enjoy the view of the island skyscrapers! Nice especially on a sunny day.

Fast and convenient. Best mode of transport which we used extensively during our 7 day trip to commute from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and back. There's a ferry departing every 10-15 minutes during the day. Peak hours are crowded though for us it was easy as we are used to Mumbai suburban local train travel.Travel time is just about 10-12 minutes hence it was faster than the MTR.The good part was that the MTR Octopus card is accepted for these ferry rides instead of using cash and managing small coins. For those who do not mind the change, there are a couple of token ticket vending machines in the pier itself.Do not miss the fruit yoghurt stall on the Tsim Sha Tsui side (last stall on the right side during arrival, as you exit from the pier). They have mind blowing fresh fruit yoghurts, recommended two fruit combos.
Cheap and Fun. Cheap, fun, easy access, take the Central and Wan Chai ferry routes and have a cheap harbour tour.Top Deck is the best.

A must when in Hong Kong. Loved these old ferries. Reminded me of those in Istanbul. For only 30p you can cross to Kowloon. We managed to get the 8pm ferry and got to see the light show from the water - better than paying a large amount for the privilege from a cruise boat.

HK Star. A ride on the star ferry is a must for anyone visiting Hong Kong. It is a relic of colonial Hong Kong. Each star ferry is named with star, which is written on the side of the boat. The star ferry from TST to central has 2 floors, a noisy bottom floor and a slightly more expensive top floor. I recommend going during the daytime as well as the night as the experience is different. It is very cheap at around 2.5 hkd, which is only 30cents usd. It takes around 10mins from one side of the harbour to another. The central station is close to other ferries which go from hk island to outlying islands in hk.
Convenient cheap and efficient.. Convenient cheap and efficient. Lovely experience. View of harbour amazing. Relaxing way to cross from Hong Kong to Kowloon.

Great. Loved this ferry we went on this on route to Tao O and the Big Buddha it was nice to take photos from the other side looking back to Hong Kong Island. We came back via the Metro which goes back over the water great day out.
Cheep. Fantastic public transfer from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon, runs regularly . This transport is part of HK establishment. Hats off to the Chinese for not getting rid of it.

Nice and breezy night ferry ride.. My friend asked us to tag along to use the ferry to cross to Hong Kong Island after dinner. The experience is really fantastic. The night lights and sea breeze makes you cant stop staring at the night scenery.
Must do. This is one of the must do's in Hong Kong just get on one of the ferries and ride it to one of the destinations

Iconic ferry ride. Crossing the water from Kowloon to Hong Kong on the Star Ferry is just one 9f those things that has to be done. It costs about 25p and just takes a few minutes, but in that time you get the wonderful views of the Hong Kong skyline, especially at night.
Great. A good way of getting very quickly from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. you can use your Octopus card on this as well as the metro.
A Hong Kong must. Great views of the city, plus the vessels themselves have a lot of character. Also, at HK$2.50 a ride, it has to be one of the best values anywhere on earth.
Cheap way to visit outer islands. We used the star ferry to watch the light show. We also visited Chen chow and moi wen to go to see big Buddha. Cheap and easy to use total cost for return was £ 4.60

Oriental Experience for The ONCE upon a TIME in HONG KONG. The boat trip is a good one, specially take it at night.IT is a public memory of HK citizens.Seeing HK at night is a romantic experience, the oriental city.Many stories, many couples, many daily life stuff, and many tourist.HK is a very special place.Everytime I sat on it, I recalls the old days 80-97. No good or bad, but HK has been its different age. 70-80. 80-90. 90-97. After 97.Things are changing. World is changing.Take a walk after the trip, walk the different places, central points etc. behind the mainstream. once I thought that hk is fading out. another time i visit, still lively,.

Fun, Great Views, A Bargain. This is one of those things you can do several times - whenever you feel like it, really. The views of Hong Kong and Kowloon are awesome, day or night. And, it's only 2 dollars or so - basically free.The ride is only 5-10 minutes but it's fun. There's harbor tour offered from right next to the Kowloon Star Ferry pier which is EXCELLENT. It last 50 minutes and goes all over the harbor. The ferry itself is very nice, well maintained and sells snacks and drinks for reasonable process.Have fun!

Leisure and relax. Find a time after those rush hours, spend only 50 cents(USD) to ride on the 7 minute ferry trip, My recommendation is try the lower deck, which you are more near to the sea, and sometime you can smell the sea water scent.The best time is get on the ferry is always evening or night time, the scenery is fabulous. Of course, you will sea lot of travelers . If you really want to enjoy some peaceful time without too many people, try 14:30-16:30.Enjoy! It is really worth for money.
another bucket list item. only 25 cents to ride, quick trip across the harbor from Kowloon to central but they also have other routes, but definitely a must to experience a true hk tradition!

For a romantic and scenic trip across the harbour. The Star Ferry has been operating for years, and is still one of the nicest ways to cross the harbour, if one isn't pressed for time. You get to see the views of both sides of Hong Kong. And the ride is very cheap and you can use your Octopus card which makes things even more convenient.

Cheap Transport with Great CIty View. A cheap, economical and recommended transportation for people with much time to spend. If you are in a hurry, better take MTR. Kids also enjoy the nice view, airy wind. Seats are plenty and clean. If rain, I suggest taking train or bus rather than ferry unless you want to get wet.

Cheap and efficient ride in HK. 5 days in HK almost everyday I took a ride of Star Ferry from Kowloon to Island back and forth, only hkd 2.xx and only need 5 mins to reach the central pier. Also we can enjoy the surrounding hk view which the metro couldn't give us. I love to ride it at night because you can see hk island view of rainbow lights skyscrapers. Love it❤

Great Views of HK Harbour. A terrific way to get a different perspective of bustling Hong Kong . Especially good at night when the harbour lights show is on about 7PM. Absolutely amazing harbour views.

Classic Transport. The whole world is changing fast, sometime too fast. However the Star Ferry remains the darling of passengers crossing the Victoria Harbour the classic way. The routine and dependable schedule of the ferry with familiar faces and sceneries give such comfort to daily life on top of the other hectic world of Hong Kong. Riding the Star Ferry whenever possible.
So relaxing. Every time I am there I use the ferry I find it so relaxing and the views are stunning better than the train
Star ferry . Cheap and different way to go from Hong Kong to kowloon... On a clear day a real pic opportunity. Worth doing when in Hong Kong.

Excellent service. We took this ferry frequently for over a year. The service is good and very cheap. Depending on the time of day the ferry runs every 15 - 30 minutes. Part of the boat is enclosed with air conditioning, which is very good during the hot summer. Most of the time it does not matter. The ferry takes about 10 minutes to make the crossing. The boats are old but in good condition. The complete service is covered so you are out of the rain. It is not very wheelchair compatible. Even with a walker it is challenging.

Nice cheap transport with a view. I'm not sure what other way you could get views out on Victoria Harbor for about $0.40 U.S. Ferries run from about 0700 to about 2330 and run constantly back and forth to a couple of destinations. Takes maybe 10 minutes to cross. Great views fun trip.

A must do. Two level boat - rather neat as the seats are reversible meaning the back rest can be alternated for the direction.Leaves every 6 to 8 minutes and takes approximately 10 minutes to cross.If you don't have an Octopus (transit) card you can purchase tokens at the station. Adult is approx 2.60 concession (senior) is a little cheaper. Price for upper deck is slightly more ie .50 but it is more comfortable, you can get a lot of spray from the water on the lower deck.You decide which deck you want to ride on before you buy your token but if you mess up as we did on the return trip you can just pay the difference to the attendant.The token machines take coins or $10 or $20 notes and THEY DO give change back.
Great View. Super cheap and fun for the kids. A must while in Hong Kong - you get a great view. It's very old school.
Great ferry . Does what you need in a ferry service . It's fairly priced to travel across the harbor. I recommend it over the taxis that will get stuck in traffic and cost much more.

Fantastic boat, real history in action. I love old boats, trains etc and the Star Ferry doesn't disappoint. I don't know how old it is, but it's all made of wood and has a fantastic historic feel. Add to that great views of the harbour and the skyline and it's hard to beat.

Affordable harbour trip. I always ride the Starferry and the nostalgic effect on me is priceless. The walk to the ferry is now longer but it was just as I recall. The lower deck is aged but still cheap and appeared sturdy. The upper deck is still priced reasonable and have the same seats to choose from like wooden reversible seatback ( like lower deck), glass windows at front end, or benches near the entrance. Watching the seaman tie the large rope as the boat docked to the pier is always a scene. A quick way to reach Ocean Terminal.

A “MUST do” in HK. Not only the travellers, the locals like me also love take a ride on Star Ferry which is cheapest transportation between Hong Kong Island (Central or Wanchai) & Kowloon side (Tsimshatsui) , whilst you can enjoy the beautiful scenery of Hong Kong.
You have to do it!!. When in HK you have to have a trip on the star ferry. It's a must. You get views from the sea. Take a return trip to see great views.

Easy Trip to HK Convention and Exhibition Centre on HK Island. It was very simple and easy to use the Star Ferry to cross the harbour from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. We were going to the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre in Wan Chai on Hong Kong Island from Kowloon. We used our Octopus Card to access the Star Ferry which was very easy and simple. Just be sure to choose the ferry for Wan Chai and not Central.The ride to Wan Chai was quick and we got a great view of the harbour during the ride. The HK Convention and Exhibition Centre was just a short walk from the ferry terminal.
Cheep mode of transpot. Very easy and convenient way to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Star ferry leaves both ways every 15 minutes. Journey takes less than 10 minutes.

Hong Kong Harbor. We spent four nights in Hong Kong and moved several times across the harbor to Kowloon. The Star Ferry is on time and reliable. The boats are functional for the 15 minute ride. They are a commuting ferry for the City.

Quick Trip. As long as you don't use the ferry at peak times this is a great way to get a view of the city from the water at night. It's cheap and easy to do and worth using to cross to Kowloon or back to Hong Kong

A must visit place for HK tourist. A must visit place for HK tourist. Make sure you take the ride from both sides (i.e. from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui, or from Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui) and vice-versa.TIP: Best use the Octopus Card/Pass to avoid keeping change.
Free shuttle bus from the Hotel. Easy to access since there is a free shuttle bus from the hotel and easy to go to since the shuttle bus stop at the carpark
Easy to use. Perfectly located in both Kowloon and on the Hong Kong Island. Cheap and very convinient to use. Runs frequently and is a quick choice of transportation.
Best way to travel between the two islands. Not fancy but its the best cheapest way to travel and enjoy the looking at hong kong island waterfront skyscrapers

Not to be missed if you have the time. It's cheap, historical, and you can enjoy views of the city from the water. Your best bet would be to take a nighttime ride and watch the light show during your trip across the harbor.
Hong kong stopover. Great value trip with views across hong kong harbour. Went several times on both upper and lower decks. Highly recommended.

"Lovely nostalgic experience". My each visit to Hong Kong always includes the Star Ferry crossing from Kowloon to Hong Kong Islandat least once...purely nostalgic,fun and the Hong Kong Is & Kowloon skyline is beautiful from the crossing of Kowloon Bay.I believe the ferry has been operating over +50 years ..the design of the ferries has not been intentionally changed.It is very cheap and the fastest means to go across Kowloon and HongKong...if in Hong Kong don't miss it please it is an experience to be remembered ..
Great system. Have used the star ferry on each ocassion that I have been to Hong Kong. It is a really good system. They run very frequently and cost next to nothing.

a quick very cheap way to cross to the main Island from HK. caught the Old Star ferry a few times & found it getting older each time we travel on it so if you have never traveled on it i would recommend trying it once say not on a long trip ( the best one is across the Hong Kong Harbour & then maybe catch the MTR back if you are staying in Kowloon or visa versa if you are staying in Hong Kong Central ...

Unmissable. If you do nothing else in HK take the STAR ferry in the evening so that you can view the amazing HK skyline and light show. Efficient, cheap, quick and quirky. It's a bit of history. Do it or regret it!

It actually pays to be 65+ !!. Armed with an Octopus Card, an 'On Loan Elder Octopus Card" to be precise, travel on the Star Ferry is free for those 65+, yes free! You cannot get better than that. Anyway, the fares are remarkably cheap for younger adults who can buy a standard 'Adult Octopus Card' or buy a token at the pier. The iconic little ferries are a must, not just for tourists but also the many residents and workers who use them to travel the short journey between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Two routes, both starting at Tsim Sha Tsui cross to Central and Wan Chai. The upper deck is more protected from the weather and sea spray whilst the lower deck (slightly cheaper fare) gives uninterrupted views for those using cameras. This really is a great way to cross, not just for the convenience but the views of Kowloon, HK Island and the boats and shipping that use the waterway night and day.

Simple and best way. Easy way to get at the other side.Its the first entrance if you walk towards the harborJust buy a coin at the machine before the entranceIts mainly tourist on board if you have a hop on hop off card it freejust show your card at the guy who is standing there
Must See. No visit to HK would be complete without a trip on a Star ferry. The trip with locals from the island to Kowloon for a few pence is one of the must do experiences of a visit.
A "must do". Wonderful journey back in time as well as between Kowloon and HK Island. Never a dull moment either on the water or people watching of the passengers. Fascinating.

Cheap and cheerful way to see HK harbour. It's a nice way to see HK harbor and all the tall buildings on both sides. You would be amongst locals as opposed to just tourists because it is a cheap and efficiently way for locals to get across the harbor. It runs frequently so not much wait. And duration of the ride is not long so can easily fit into day plans.Suggest to go twice, once day time (if the weather is clear which is not always the case in HK), and once night time when all the lights on the buildings lit up (night ride is good even when weather is not that clear).
Interesting!. A escape from the MTR rides. Though slower, it gives us a different perspective of Hong Kong views from the harbour. The night ride is a beauty esp. during the light shows.

A must to do while in Hong Kong. We used the Star Ferry several time to cross the Victoria harbour between central and Kowloon. It was a combination of a short efficient ride combined with a nice viewpoint.

Quick and efficient. Great way to get across from one place to the next and very cheap. Ferries run frequently and till quite late In the evening if you take the ferry from Hong Kong island to Tsim Tsa Tsui in the evening about 8 pm you will catch the light show

Never changed!. Been using the Star Ferry since I was a child (over 50+years) and it's never changed. The only difference is the two sides of the harbour are now so close, it takes less than 10 mins from Central to Kowloon and it used to take 20+ mins. Been away from HK for some years so it was a real thrill to climb aboard again and travel back in time. The smells and engine noise, the clang of the gates and gangplank and the patience of people getting off, transported you to a long forgotten place. If you only do one thing in Hong Kong, do this (and several times!)
It's a boat. It takes you across some water to get to the other side. You mat have been on one before? Cool that it does this though, otherwise you'd have to swim
Efficienct, cheap and on time. Always a charming experience, always on time, and great way to see Hong Kong from the harbour - the kids love it.
Easy to use and cheap. I used the star ferry to get back and forth from Hong Kong to Kowloon and to Lantau. Can't fault the service or the price.
Simply public transportation. The seats are small and it isnothing more than a public commute. Do not ride for sight seeing. Use for transportation only.
Easy and convenient. Easy, relaxing way to cross between kowloon and hong kong island. Nice views in all directions. Could be difficult for people with mobility issues.

A must-do that lives up to its iconic status . At only $2HK a crossing on the star ferry is an excellent way to spend half an hour. Great views of both Kowloon and Hong Kong waterfronts, and a quaint historical boat. Worth the trip.
Transport, what else?. Reasonable price and brings you where you want. Is an alternative to the MTR because you can see a bit of the harbour.

Quick cheap rides across the bay. The ferry between mainland Hong Kong and Hong Kong Island only takes about 5 minutes to cross and leaves every 10 minutes or so, depending upon the time of day. 2 ferries operate most of the time. It costs 2 HG dollars to cross on weekdays and 2.8 dollars on weekends. There are vending machines to insert money to get tokens.
Quick boat ride. If you need to cross the bay, this is the quickest and cheapest way of doing this... Costs 2.8 HKD$ and takes about 2-3 minutes... Not the nicest looking boats but it does the job...

Cheap and a great way to see the Hong kong skyline. Convenient, Cheap and a great way to see the Hong kong skyline. Only takes 9 minutes to cross and therefore there's a ferry every 9 minutes. It's only hk$ 2.50 for a single ticket (£0.25)
Nice view from the water. Recommend if you want a view from the water to take a star ferry ride across the harbour. Takes about 10 minutes and you can use your Octopus card.

Fun, easy , no worries. $5.00 HK for a token for a trip across to HK island (50c Aus). Not a long wait for the ferry, there's a few running. Plenty of seats available and you can capture some great photos either side.

Iconic - Don't miss it out!. Tourists, locals and ex pats, they all use it. A step back in time and perhaps one of the few remaining parts of the Hong Kong heritage, particularly the ferries themselves; simple but positively memorable. The best way to travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. National Geographic rates it as one of the '50 places of a lifetime - they aren't wrong!Only a short trip, 10 minutes or so, but you get a fantastic view of Hong Kong Island while chugging across Victoria Harbour - great for photos or wallowing in the ambiance of the past from the Upper Deck 'First Class' (HK$ 3.40) or Lower Deck 'Second Class' (HK$ 2.80).The better route is Central - Tsim Sha Tsui, as the Wan Chai pier is a bit off the main drag and can be confusing to find. The TST pier is right in front of the Ocean Terminal shopping Mall and within minutes of the museums. Only thing to beware of are the many touts (watches, tailors and bus tours). Alternatively get the next ferry back to Central. The Star Ferry is worth it just for the experience ... Don't miss out on it.
Quick and easy. Our Star Ferry tickets were included in our Big Bus tour but it did not cost much at all to get one of these ferries across the harbour from Kowloon to Hong Kong.

Wonderful short time on the Harbour. This is a great experience and we paid a few cents more to be on the upper deck. If you are over 65 as we are then you get a concession ticket. Great fun to be on such an old ferry.
Cool way to get across the bay and enjoy the views.. Get the ferry ride as part of the Big Bus Tour package. If you are in town for a couple days, the deluxe package is worth it.

Best harbour view of Hong-Kong . You must come down here if you are ever in Hong Kong. The views at night are just magical. Not far from the Hong Kong version of the Hollywood stars of fame..
Grab an ice cream and camera cause you would want to take some of the lights display from the buildings opposite.

Quick, clean and cheap. This ferry is very efficient and very frequent. Use the covered area at the front and rear if you want shelter but do not hesitate in using this service, Tickets are available from machines on the wharfe.
Great view of skyscrapers. For only.$2HK you get this amazing cross harbour trip on the Star Ferry. It is similar to the Mersey ferries and very characterful.

Best view of HK. I absolutely love the Star Ferry, its like being in a picture postcard. I have taken this many times and it just doesnt get old, cheap , enjoyabe but only downside is it is over too soon.

Harbour Tour with some interesting commentary. Learnt several details about Hong Kong architecture and recent history. The tour boat is more luxurious than the standard ferry with seats and a bar. Tour takes around an hour.

Super way to cross from Hong Kong to Kowloon. Use the Octopus MTR card and tap on tap off to travel across the bay or, buy a ticket at the ferry station. Great views of the bay and a really enthralling way to cross it.

cheap, fast and convenient. The ferry crossing between the HK island and Kowloon is certainly worth trying for the tourists. The price is ridiculously cheap (less than a third of the MTR ticket) and it runs every few minutes even on weekends. The view is magnificent and it takes about 10 minutes which one will spend making pictures and will not realize how they few away. It was a misty day today, and yet, we made spectacular photos.

Efficient and clean. The ferries run like clockwork. Safe, prompt and everyone takes their time when getting on and off. Using the Octopus cards which can also be used on the underground, buses and trams makes it great value for money

Visit to MACAU. Took the Jet boat across to Macau to see the old Port buildings and the ruins of cathedral, which is a World Heritage Site, and the Citadel, very impressive. We also experienced what must be the largest gambling area in the East. Casinos built as integral parts of hotels and restaurants side by side with all the most expensive brands you can think of.

The Only Way. Brilliant fast regular service. Staying at the nearby YMCA Hotel it was just a 5 minute walk to the wharf. Extremely efficient and low cost. Only way to get to HongKong Island and see the city at the same time.

A lovely way to get around!. We caught the star ferry across the harbour and it was a lovely experience! The staff were lovely also! We were heading to watch the symphony of light show so we grabbed takeaway fish n chips from white beards fish and chips and caught the star ferry across! It's so cheap too!! Only 2 dollars

Affordable and very efficient. We travel to Hong Kong regularly and always use the star ferries. They are immaculately clean, very comfortable, quiet and efficient. They run regularly and we have found they almost always run on time. We would highly recommend using this service to all travellers who visit Hong Kong. The fares are very reasonably priced.
A welcome break. Very cheap to cross the harbour. Not great if wet but OK most of the time. May be quicker to use the MTR but no where as romantic.

Efficient and effective. The Star Ferry is a MUST for all visitors if only to enjoy this iconic transport system.As would be expected, the ferry system us both efficient in transporting many people comfortably and quickly across the water between the islands and the mainland as well as being very cost effective and well scheduled.Either day or night trips will offer the passenger a great view of the HK water ways.Easy to use and a great photo memory opportunity - don't overlook this experience.

Ferry. Good way to experience Hong Kong harbour, however they stop running at 2300. Convenient to get from Hong Kong island to Kowloon. Takes about 3 mins with a lovely view lots of seats and very affordable.
A Good Morning Ride To The Other Side of HK Island. If you don't want to use the MTR then hop on the ferry. It's a good experience with a beautiful view of HK.

Easy way to get across. I'm quite fascinated that the ferry is part of some people's daily commute. The ferries are not much to look at, but it's a great way to get across and at night, when all the buildings put on their little lightshows, it makes for quite a view.

cheap and rewarding. Must do. A small investment of money and time (~30' total). Get a beautiful view of Hong Kong -- both originated from Kowloon and from Victoria island. Also get a taste of what it was like living in Hong Kong a few decades ago when the only means of transport to cross the harbor was by boats -- before the tunnels and before the MTR.
Cheap travel.. A great way to cross the bay, a fare of 2HK$ wont break the bank. It only takes a few minutes and you get some lovely views as you cross the bay.

An inexpensive way of crossing Victoria Harbour. These boats ply across the harbour with such frequency if you've missed one the next one will be along in a few minutes. Push me pull you boats, two bows and no I stern, they don't even have to turn round when they set off. Choose which deck you want before you get on, there's an upper and a lower and remember the seat backs are hinged to allow them to face forwards whichever way the boat is going. They can be a bit bounce at the dock but are wheelchair accessible.
Macau . Been hydrophobic; this ride was a relaxing You can enjoy a coffee here : read a book : and simply watch the scenic beauty of Hong Kong and yes just enjoy the ride

Comfortable and cheap way to see the harbor and get to Hong Kong Island. Star Ferry gets you comfortably and fast to Hong Kong Island. The ships are cute and we found it a nice and really cheap way to explore the harbor.

Cheap transport that offers beautiful view of the Harbour and Skyline. Star Ferry offers a cheap yet excellent way to transport from Victoria Harbour to Central (and back). For only HK$ 2.8 per adult you get a short ferry ride and a beautiful view of the Skyline and Kowloon Bay. Must try!
excellent value for your money. We enjoyed the ferry rides as this form of transportation is different and we are close to water.TO TOP it off the ride is very reasonable .

Must do . This is a lovely thing to do when visiting the city of Hong Kong. After we went to visit the peak. We walked 20 minutes to the pier in order to board the ferry to Kowloon. We used our octopus cards for payment - quick and easy. Very quick ferry ride to Kowloon but a nice way at catching a glimpse of the sky line
Great experience. A Hong Kong icon, and one of the cheapest activities in Hong Kong. You definitely should experience this if you visit Hong Kong.
Fantastic value for money!. The star ferry us a must if you are in Hong Kong! Brilliant value for money and a great way to see the island!
Fun trip. This is a must. Travel over to the other side to see the skyline of Hong Kong from a different side. The harbour is a lot of fun.

Best way to cross the harbour. The Star Ferry is something that is very rare in this world, a historical mode of transportation that is still better than anything modern.
The ride is pretty short and very direct and incredibly cheap. It's a pleasure just to experience the history, the fact that it's efficient and inexpensive are icing on the cake.
Quick and cheap. I'd recommend going on here at night. It's a very quick ride over to Kowloon. When the buildings are lit up it's really pretty. I forget the exact cost but it was very inexpensive.
Atmospheric. Lots of locals and tourists on the boat. Good value as were got tickets as part of Big Bus Tours. very regular sevice
A must do in Hong Kong. a quick ferry trip from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Great to see the skyline. The weather was awful but still was a great cheap experience. Highly recommend.

A really great deal for seniors. Make sure you buy an OCTOPUS CARD as soon as you arrive. Getting around in Hong Kong becomes even easier when you have an Octopus Card and if you are a senior (over 65) oh, so much cheaper. As a senior, it cost me HKD50 for the card and a deposit of HKD20 so about $15 Aussie all up. Bus fare sectors fell from $4.2 to $2 and the convenience of not having to buy tokens or carry cash made it all so much easier. You can even buy your Starbucks on the card too!! It costs more to set up for an adult, as the card is still HKD50 but the deposit is HKD100Star Ferry is such a great way to get around, quick easy and convenient. Give it a go with or without the Octopus Card, it really is a great way to travel.
view the harbour from the ferry. beautiful experience, amazing views, even with the rain & cold, loved it. would have liked to do a longer trip but ran out of time

Hong Kong History. A trip on the Star Ferry is a "must do" on a visit to Hong Kong. It is inexpensive and it connects the busy CBD (Central) to the Kowloon side (TST). One still sees Victoria Harbour with Chinese junks and sampans and the ferries themselves are remaining from previous decades when the Harbour was wider and the Central pier more conveniently situated. It would be a pity to miss the experience.
Fantastic. From Tsim Sha Tsui to Central, the most convenient way with very reasonable fare. Meanwhile can enjoy the night scene and Christmas illumination of the harbour. Highly recommend!!!
Ferry between Hong Kong and Kowloon. Cheap ferry ride less than 1 usd = 5 HKD round trip. Awesome way to travel on the Victoria Harbor! Great way to transport between the two islands

Best sea level view of Hong Kong. Great views and nearly free, at 2.50 HK Dollars, that's about 25 pence for UK folk!Running every couple of minutes, why would you not?Star pier, Kowloon, to Central, Hong Kong island, was our route.The views are especially brilliant in the dark, with many lit up buildings

Very good service. We have taken the star ferry to go the Macao . It took as just one hour 45 minutes to reach there. It's a very big ferry where they can accommodate more then 150 people. They are always on time so, you should reach there at lest 15 minutes before departure. Otherwise you might miss it. The ferry terminal is quite big and organised just like an airport. They have designated area and gate for different ferry. Tickets you can but from the airport any tourist information Center or from the ferry terminal. If you buy tickets from the China tourist information Center which is little cheaper. They have snake item available to on board to buy. Better to carry cash they don't except card in most of the places .
Good Transportation for the Victoria Harbour. Can see the both side of the Hong Kong Victoria Harbour, if you take it at night, you can see the wonderful night view of the Harbour

Cheap Ferry to Hong Kong. Surprisingly clean and painted ferries considering their age .Seem well maintained .2.5 Hong Kong Dollars ! Cheapest ferry ever.Regular to Hong Kong from Kowloon and back all day 10mins trip.Gaze on the Hong Kong Skyline .Been going since the 1800s
fantastic. star ferry is great.always on time and runs even when the weather is bad.we went many times to and from discovery bay..you can sit outside or inside.always clean and efficient.
Hello sailor. Good fun and very cheap way to get about,recommend the big bus tour you get plenty of tickets for the ferry included in the ticket price.

cheapest public transport in developed cities. - for the price of USD 0.30 or so, on the lower deck, feel the sea breeze, smell the diesel fuel- if you can't deal with that, the upper deck is partially air conditioned. what more can you ask for?- the only drawback is that you have to walk 10min or so fr Central to the pier
Ferry voyage. Most suitable and exciting means of transportation between HK and Kowloon Island. It is prompt n traffic jams and no long walks at subway stations.

Quick Scenic Inexpensive Ride. The ride on the ferry costs virtually nothing (I think it was 2.50 HKD). It is a quick little ride (about 5 minute) across the harbor to Kowloon and the Old Clock Tower. Here is the thing: you need smaller HKD bills...like 5 and 10 dollar bills. You find a little "vending machine" on the pier. You put your bills into the machine and out pops your change and a little blue "token". It is that token that you put into the turnstile. Once out in the harbor, the skyline unfolds for a great view of the city central.
Nice experience. Star Ferry is definitely Hong Kong style! It is a must to enjoy the hobour view on a ferry. It only costs HKD $4. So worthwhile to try!

Travel the old fashioned way, it's romantic. This is really cheap, it's old and grotty but totally wonderful, you also get great views of the skyscrapers all lit up at night. We have found it almost as regular as the underground, a boat every 5-10 minutes. Take care to choose your entrance correctly there are 4 from tsim sha tsui. Wan chai and central, and a top and bottom deck entrance for each. Enjoy it

Star Ferry Harbour Tour. If you have the time (and money) to spare while in Hong Kong, and if you find the regular Star Ferry rides too short, I recommend the Star Ferry Harbour Tour, which makes a 1 hour detour around Victoria Harbour. The ticket counters at the respective piers only open around 30 mins before each departure. You can choose to board from Tsim Sha Tsui, Central or Wan Chai. To maximise your time on board, alight where you boarded the ferry. Each ticket entitles you to a small packet of biscuits and a drink, you can pay extra for alcohol. You may choose to have a full picnic but really the main point of this is the views you get as the ferry traverses Victoria Harbour. Passengers are confined to the upper deck, where there is a central air-conditioned area with the snack kiosk and plenty of seating. The stern and bow are open air, and the ferry does not reverse direction during its journey. There is a running commentary of various landmarks, but it is often not in sync (or the landmarks are obscured by newer buildings). Focus on taking photos instead.
a quick refresher.... take in the view and enjoy the short ride...it's worth beyond the money you pay for this, even if you have no reason to be on either side of the boat ride.

The Shrinking Journey. This route gets shorter with the in filling of HK harbour. Traffic is very busy and the journey is probably not as enjoyable as in days past. Still a novel way to cross the harbour and one of the best viewpoints for admiring the HK skyline.
Everyone should try this. Great mode of travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, it is only 28p each way, approx every 10 minutes.
A great experience!. It is a really cool way to get to another part of the city. Plus, you get the chance to see a great view of the skyline.

Nice way to spend a few hours. We chose to do the one hour round trip. It wasn't the best weather conditions to see the harbour but definitely worth going on. If you sit inside there is a narrator for all the buildings that you see, providing you with interesting information. Great opportunity for some pictures and generally a good way to sight see
Cheap and classic. Cheap (2,50 HKD for upper level and 2 HKD for lower level on weekdays) and classic transportation over the river. A shame that the last one leaves at 11.30 PM though

Useful form of transport. We were going for a meal in Kowloon and this was a good way to travel. The ferry takes you right into the heart of the shopping area and walking to the right takes you along the waterfront.

Using the Star Ferry. I love this old original ferry. It is iconic in Hong Kong and is well worth using it to have great views from its decks. A tip for " Elder " people, if you ask for the " Elder Octopus Card" you get free travel on the Star Ferry.
The Views. The vessels themselves are a historical attaction and are part of the cultural fabric of Hong Kong.It's well worth the trip across Victoria Harbour just for the skyline view.

Good trip. We used this on a daily basis as we stayed out side of the main Hong Kong it's great considering how old it is and how long it's been going. It gets packed and the boats run frequently, quite cheap as well. There is a museum near the dock which gives a history of the ferry well worth it

A must do!. One of the first thing to do in Hong Kong is travel on the ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Make sure you do it on a clear day to get the best views! It is very cheap at around 2.50HK dollars (around 20p) for a single trip and can be paid for using the octopus card.

Enjoyable journey. My boyfriend and I really enjoy Star Ferry. Sitting near the window can have a closer look of Hong Kong's harbour view. I think both local people and tourists will enjoy Star Ferry.

The cheapest way to see the Victoria Habour. I like to take ferry to commute between central and tsim dha tsui rather than by MTR as this is so relaxing watching the skyscrapers with breeze. The view would be great if the sky is clear.

Must do on your Hong Kong. If there is one single thing you must do on your Hong Kong trip is to take the Star Ferry across Hong Kong harbor...anytime is great but night-time is special. You get an old world feel for Hong Kong in this short, inexpensive trip. If you are on the Kowloon side, combine it with shopping the Ocean Terminal complex (unless there are a bunch of cruise ships) and if you need something to do in Hong Kong, visit the mid-level shops and markets.

Great, cheap service!!. Iconic ferry service which you just have to do!! It was a cheap tourist excursion too!! I went over to explore Kowloon and I'd recommend a walk around the quayside and some of the iconic tourist attractions.

Best way from Kowloon to HK Island. A very pleasant & economical (Seniors Oyster card) way to travel between Kowloon & HK Island. Provides unique views of the HK skyline & Peak during the day & at night.
Don't see what all the fuss is about. I'm not sure why this is classed as an "attraction" in the guide books. It's a 10min trip across a river on an uncomfortable seat with fumes to breath.

Great way to get a look at BOTH sides of Hong Kong from the water!. Not only is the Star Ferry a bargain for crossing from the island to Kowloon, it's pleasant to be able to enjoy the fresh air and the view.
Amazingly cheap. You must go on the ferry, even just for saying you went on a ferry for about 10 cents!! Other than that, it is just a necessary thing to use to get to the other side.

Cheapest thrill in Hong Kong. Can't say it's overly convenient but it is an easy way from Tim Sha Tsui to both Central and Wan Chai. The big selling points though are how cheap the ride is, and on good days, the views from the ferry would make great pictures.

Do not miss this!. Im a local and I take the ferry to work every day.
The breeze and glamarous view make my morning stress free...i love it
Price is HKD 2.5 only and you can get a close look to hong kong's best harbour view, no reason not to take this ferry ride. Recommend to all visitors.

Awesome with relax feel. No other cities like HK , have a ferry with city feel n relax style to enjoy ferry :)
Although air pollution , but everythings are excllent . HK is the BEST city in the world.
Relaxing transfer from HK Island to Kowloon Island with a view. Enjoyed riding this ferry, as I transfer from HK Island to Kowloon, especially with a view, very relaxing in the waters.
Great ride. These ferries are a delight and have been running for years almost unchanged. A quick, cheap and picturesque way to get across the harbor either from central or Wanchai
We all like it!. It's really convenient to take the star ferry. And I think the ferry is a symbol of hong kong's public transport.
Enjoyable and practical. The cheapest way to get from the Island to Kowloon. It is very quick and gets you easily from Central to Tsim Tsa Tsui with a nice view.
Classic Ferry for a Very Short Trip. Cruising with Star Ferry make us experiencing HK interland transportation in 50's. Cheap ticket, and opportunity to capture HK Island Citylights from the decks.

Riding the Star Ferry in Hong Kong. I'm a Hong Konger by origin. As my work took me to different places, I'd visit Hong Kong for business and visiting family and friends. Star ferry is one of the most original means of transportations that connects Hong Kong island and Kowloon peninsula. It's also the cheapest way to cross the harbour from dawn till midnight. For seniors of 65 or above, you can ride for free. I find it relaxing and refreshing to ride the ferry. It's probably the sound of the water or the breeze I smell, I just love it. I really hope that this service will stay forever and ever. Every tourist must try it too. For as long as it's available, I'll take the ferry at every opportunity.

Paying US$0.5 for a billion dollars view.. It is a must for anyone who visit HK. One should try at least one in the daylight and another round at night. If the weather is clear, one would have the chance to enjoy a view that one would not forget. At 8pm every night, there will be a night show in the harbour and one would have the best view from Kowloon.

Great view. This is the cheapest way to get a great shot of the HK skyline. Other than taking photos from the TST pier, you can get get shots uncrowded and up close. Also boats are awesome... So there's that.

minutes' leisure ride with view across the harbour. the ride takes only minutes with a good view of the harbour on both sides. It is a convenient and economical means of transport from Central to Tsimshatsui - both are popular districts for tourists. The piers going to different outlying islands and Macau are also in the vicinity.

A classic old world activity. Taking the Star Ferry is a must do activity while in Hong Kong. They operate on a regular schedule and have both indoor seating and some outdoor seating. Great for taking photos of the city. Cheap transportation too. The Ferry terminal was next to our hotel so we took the ferry several times across to HK Island.

Very cheap cost for a valuable memeory. This is the cheapest transportation to cross the harbor and you can have a wonderful views of Victoria Harbor in either day or night! Even lots of HK people will take this ferry as transportation and also can enjoy with a good views of HK.
Best way exploring HK. Cheapest & quickest way to travel between HK island and Kowloon and closet way to look at the Victoria Harbour.

Easy to use. Easy way to get from one side of the bay to the other.Simple, clean well run and also very cheap.
It is great to take the evening one to see the fireworks at night. But can be full at times

A piece of old Hong Kong...... A ride on the Star Ferry is an iconic experience of old Hong Kong. As well as being a fun way to cross the harbour it's a great sight seeing trip in itself. Ride on the Upper Deck for a better view. Remember to have change or small notes handy for the ticket machines or use your MTR Octopus card. Cost is HK$3.40 each-way weekends, HK$2.50 each-way weekdays.

Piece of History. If in HongKong, you must ride the ferry. The boats are over 60 years old, made of wood and slow. It takes you back in time. Very cheep. Only about 50 cents US to go across the Victoria Harbor to Wan Chai.
