You get to see Hong Kong !. I use star ferry almost everyday when I worked in Hong Kong. It's almost the cheapest and most quiet transport in Hong Kong. If you want to relax and really see Hong Kong, take a ride. The ride is best from Tsim Sha Tsui to Wan Chai. You got amazing view. At night, around 8pm, it's great to have it from the Wanchai or Central side back to Tsim Sha Tsui when you can see the light show as well.

Get an idea. The Star Ferry is a great option to get an idea of the magnitude of Hong Kong. The Harbour Tour gets you through all the bay and you can watch how all Hong Kong is packed with huge buildings. In the meantime, a recording walks you through the main landmarks of HK and you get to learn more about the buildings.
star ferry. Its almost a waste to use your Octopus card on this. I kept using my loose change to buy the tokens. Its only $HK2.50 to go over to Kowloon!

Cheap tourist attraction. Good transportation for cheap with a nice view. We did the upper deck for $2.50 HKD which amounts to something like .33 cents one way across. Sure it's a short trip but it's just something you have to do if you're visiting.
Inexpensive and great views. This is a great way to go between Hong Kong and Kowloon, see the sky lines, and explore both cities. Don't miss this.

cheap, quick and enjoyable. A ride on the star ferry affords great views of Hong Kong and the harbor traffic for around $2.00 (use upper deck) while taking you to Kowloon. It runs frequently, is easy to use and reasonably comfortable. There is lots to see at each end (Hong Kong and Kowloon) without a car so a nice day's outing.
Great experience. One of the truly inexpensive things in Hong Kong. Short trip the the island with wonderful views of the harbor...

Beautiful Views. Taking the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong is like taking the Staten Island Ferry from Staten Island to Manhattan. Very inexpensive way to see the city from the water and take beautiful pictures of the skyline. A quick, easy way to relax and see both sides of the harbor.

Haze is an issue but ride's worth it.. The good: it's fast, timely and a bit of fun for a short ferry ride.The terminal is easy to find, and the boarding and deboarding process is quick and convenient. At Tsim Sha Tsui, you might see one of the giant cruise liners, which are always impressive.The view is good, but the haze shrouds most of the Hong Kong skyline. Though I suppose if you like that kind of murky ambiance, that could be a plus :). The air is a little fresher on the water than it is onshore and the water looks clean.Tips: 1.Use your Octopus card. The alternative is to line up at the machine to buy a token. You then slip the token into the turnstile to board. 2 Don't rush. If you miss a boat, there's one coming in minutes.3. I didn't see anything for wheelchair accessibility.4. In one case, there were some mild waves and the boarding ramp jiggled up and down a bit, when we were disembarking. Not a problem for me, but might be for those with mobility issues.5. The benches can be rearranged easily to face the other direction (You'll see what I mean when you get there) so you won't have to face backwards on the trip.

Best way across Victoria Bay. According to me this is the cheapest and quickest way to travel across the bay from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. The ferries run on a regular basis, and you are spoiled with some magnificent views all around. The ferries have an upper and lower deck so can take a lot of people. Visiting the Maritime Museum on the Hong Kong Island ferry terminal is recommended.
Went over to Kowloon to explore. . Great fun. Need to include on the must do list. Inexpensive fun needs to be done. Gives you a great platform to take pictures of both shorelines
Star Ferry. This is not an attraction by itself as the Ferry is used as a public transport. However it might be a nice (and cheap) way to cross and enjoy the view of the harbour.

You really HAVE to experience this loved icon!. The Star ferries criss-cross the bustling Hong Kong harbour from their two piers where Salisbury Road meets Canton Road in Kowloon, adjacent to the iconic Clock Tower and near the Hong Kong Cultural Centre, the HK Space Museum and the HK Museum of Art. The ferries run continuously throughout the day, and for much of the night, about every eight minutes either to Wan Chai (and the Expo Promenade) or to Central for the Peak, Stanley Market and other tourist attractions like Lantau Island. Believe it or not, there are two fare structures depending on whether you opt for the upstairs or the downstairs parts of the ferry. The boarding and disembarking procedures are down to a fine art and with a minimum of fuss. A benefit is also offerred to students and seniors in the form of even lower fares. For three Seniors we paid a grand total of HK$7.50 for a one-way fare to Victoria Island, upstairs. The seats are in serried rows with back rests that can be swivelled in the direction of your travel. The actual crossing of the Harbour takes less than 10 minutes. It's an unbeatable way to appreciate both the beauty and the history of this fascinating relic of Britain's far-flung Empire.

A round trip. A must indeed, even if it remained often unclear which skyscraper the tape was referring to to at a certain time. Attractiveness rather weather depended thou. Well worth the few dollars. But as a water sight seeings gon you need to take a sampan tour in the dark too!

Couldn't Hear Much. We paid for the "harbor cruise" which is an hour-long boat ride around the harbor. Not sure it was worth the cost, as the recorded information kept cutting in and out and was difficult to understand. The tour was advertised as including food. That turned out to be some kind of inedible packaged cake. Oh well. You do get a very good view all around the harbor, and there are maps on board to help you figure out where you are when you can't understand the recording. Possibly a better choice is just to take the reasonably-priced ferry to one stop, walk around, and return.
Fun. We enjoy boarding the Star Ferry to get from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central on the Island. With a Octopus card travel convenient - and so inexpensive.
A HK "must do". Probably the cheapest public transport ride anywhere. You get a great view of the harbour and it's worth doing for the ride alone.
Star Ferry. It's not the ferry itself that's impressive, but the views of the cityscape FROM the ferry. A staple of any trip to HK.
No traffic!!. Stress free, no traffic and fastest way to reach Central from Marco Polo Hotel! Even kids enjoy taking the ferry every time. A must-do when in HongKong! :)
Star Ferry. Love the Star Ferry. So easy once you get your Octopus card. Beautiful old ferries in great condition. Great & very cheap way to see the Harbour.

One hour boat trip in the Hong Kong Harbour . Took a one hour boat trip around the harbour listening to all the history on the buildings in the harbour front. Ok, trip if you are really interested in architecture and The history of buildings - otherwise you can save a lot of money by just taking the star ferry to Hong Kong island. You can use you Octopus card to pay.
Cheap and traditional way to across the bay. We took the ferry from Victoria harbour to island. Very easy to find the harbour and entrance to the ferry. You can pay with octopus-card!
Good experience. Went across the harbour - fun experience - old boat - only did it once since the subway was much easier and faster but would recommend for a first time visitor.
Very poor . We took star ferry night tour with buffet. Food was awful. Music for life was awful. They put us at a rounded table with many people. It is absolutely not attraction for couples.

Must do - bring coins . Must do because this is Hong Kong. Ferries require a token which you buy from a machine located at each pier. But the token machines don't take paper money, just coins. They do give change. Prices vary by destination, time of day. Your hotel concierge can explain.

always great fun. No matter if used for transport cause you have to, or you want to. it's fab! similar to the Tram, it's a Hongkong classic. Our kids love it. we often only go to ride it from hongkong to Kowloon & back again and it's fantastic. good fun with kids.

COMFORTABLE AND RELAXING EXPERIENCE ON ICONIC WATERS. Even though it was a dull day the One Hour Harbour Cruise on the Star Ferry was First Class - clean, comfortable, scenic and affordable and a great way to take in the great views from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Not to be missed.

Always on Holiday. I have been living in Hong Kong for six months but I never get tired of taking the star ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island or vice versa. It is the cheapest way to cross the harbour and you really feel like you are in Hong Kong. Take the upper deck for a slightly more luxurious trip or the lower deck if you want a more authentic ride. I feel like I am on holiday when I take the Star Ferry. Take a trip at night time to see the skyline lit up. Beautiful.
Excellent service. Good quick service to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Runs on time and you get the Harbour views as a bonus.

Cheap and Cheerful. The Star Ferry is a bit of an institution in Hong Kong and its a great way to get across the harbour for a fraction of the price. The boats run constantly back and forth so you are never waiting for more than a few minutes
So many memories flooded back. It used to be a case of catching this to school and back every day, the only thing I noticed was that the trip was much shorter due to reclaiming the land
Only way to get around from Kowloon to HK. Very efficient and of course pleasant way to get across the water. Three stops on HK side get you wo most places.
Iconic Trip. A fantastic service, great views for next to nothing - an iconic little journey that is well worth doing.
Great way to see the HK skyline.. We went to Kowloon during the day and returned at night. Great. Cheap and easy to use with the Octopus card.

Star Ferry. The star ferry is a nice cheap way to cross Victoria harbour on a nice day and it makes a change from the MTR which cane be a little crowded at times, we always got a seat on the upper deck which has some nice views of Hong Kong and Kowloon especially at night.
Lovely Harbour views. Using the Star Ferry is a great way to see the Harbour. You get fine views, it's cheap and there's always lots to see. Not quite as good as Sydney but close.

Cheap single ticket. Single ticket/token from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central or vice versa 2HKD per person. Run roughly every 10minutes even quicker during peak times. Buy a token at machine and put token into turnstile to get through.
Or can pay around 90HKD for harbour cruise that takes 1 hour these leave at various times during the day.
star ferry. great way to travel from Kowloon to HK island,authentic and relaxing cheap convenient and for tourist's a must do
Good cheap service. Travelled numerous times on the star ferry. Ferry is clean, comfortable and exceedingly well priced. Thoroughly good service
Cheap way to travel . It's very easy and a nice way to get to and from Hong Kong Island , it's cheap way to cross , but very pleasant and the views are lovely
It is on the HK check checklist of things to do. at a cost of peanuts this is the best way to see the HK sky line from the middle of the harbor. GO in the evening after 8pm to see the light show.
Good service. The transport system in Hong Kong is second to none. Star Ferry is a part of this and the ride was pleasant

A Fabulous Service. Quick, cheap, stunning setting, what can be added?
Positive, great, delightful etc. and more of the above.

A must experience. It is recommended that you get a MTR Octopus card with at least 150 to 200 HKD. Star Ferry has not changed over the years. The routing help the traveler experience difference modes of transportation while in HK. Fare has increased to 2.3 HKD.

It's the Star Ferry!. We stayed at the Marco Polo Hotel, so the Star Ferry terminal was just behind us. Very convinient for getting over to Hong Kong and back. But the best part is feeling the history as you cross the gorgeous Victoria Harbor. It's really a must during any visit to Hong Kong.
A must surely . You can't come to Hong Kong and not do the night star ferry. It was just as we imagined, did what it says on the tin, the view was great, really enjoyable.
No Fuss Travel. A wonderful way to cross the bay to Kowloon , A legendary way to travel. Lovely friendly staff and frequent crossings , no wonder the locals use it so much
Fast enough and efficient. Tickets included in the Big Bus tour for several crossings the ferries are old but seem safe enough you get over in minutes and the views from the water are worth the ride.

a must for HK first visit. A must do for first visit of Hong Kong. The skyline of city will be appreciated.
For better photos, use low deck.

Enjoyable short ferry ride with city views!. This is a great thing to do. I went on the Star Ferry twice, once during the day and once at night. It is really cheap and the ferry wasn't full either way. The ride only goes for about 10 minutes, and it was great to contrast the old Hong Kong with the new. Would recommend doing it as its very cheap.
Commuting with Star Ferry.. During our visit in Hong Kong we traveled a lot with Star Ferry. Ferries where always on time and there's cosy benches inside.

cheap and lovely. theres only old ferry not a speed boat(not necessary in that short disance) but you can feel breeze nothing complicated(just buy ticket and jump on!) if you dont need rush i definitely recommend to take ferry to cross that little channel. chill and good view at night too. you can really enjoy a feel of tourist.

Short joy ride. This is an excellent time to spend a couple of hours. Took a bus to Pier and hopped on to Ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui. Its was an enjoyable 15 minutes of short ride. Recommended time is evenings, you get to see illuminated HK, its a treat to your eyes!

Old times. This old ferry really represents the heart of Hong Kong. So many souvenir !
It still works as in the old times, though it is a bit more expensive, more fancy for the payment.
The journey has been shorten because of the land used for buildings.
Such a nice journey for 2.2 HKD !!
Sensational Star Ferry. This is a great way to travel quickly across the main islands. Very cheap, and lots of friendly locals on board.
What a treat!. So cheap! The best way to get across the water. Very little lineups and still a piece of history. Also very central and easy-to-reach station in Kowloon.
Only 50p for best experience. Only 50p you can cross the most popular harbour in Hongkong. From TST to central, it takes only 5 min but save you 2/3 if compares to MTR.

Iconic and cheap. Star Ferry is an iconic and atmospheric way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island.The ferry gives splendid views of the skyline ,particularly on the journey from Kowloon.Frequency is excellent and you never have to wait long .Moreover,the short trip is very cheap(c 20p).You pay by buying tokens which allow you to proceed through turnstiles.The machines are clearly identified and provide change.
Nice Ferry. A great easy way to get across the bay, good views and definitely a time saver to get from one area to the next

Take the Star Ferry and travel back in time. Take a Star Ferry and experience traveling back in time, to British colonial times, specifically. The Star Ferry was the way people crossed between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon which was connected to the Chinese mainland.

You must take this ferry at least one in Hong Kong!. The famous Star ferry that connected Kowloon to Hong Kong Island, before the MTR & tunnels, is a must travel when you are in HK. It only costs two HK dollars & is time taking a trip back in time. A great way to see the Hong Kong skyline too.

Fun and cheap. It costs about $2 aud for a nice boat ride not a brand new boat but still good. Nice wooden seats. Fun and cheap can't complain. Better and more fun then the train and obviously cheaper.

Excellent view, the best way to cross the harbour. An absolute must-do while your in Hong Kong. We stayed in Kowloon on our most recent trip, and this was our primary mode of transportation to the city and back. It also works out to be the best deal (especially compared to taking a taxi through the tunnel). On top of that, the view is fantastic. Even if you aren't staying in Kowloon, it is worth the trip over and back for the fantastic view of Hong Kong.
fun trip across harbor. convenient, fun and easy. Also a nice way to see the harbor and also see local business. Short ride .
Quick & easy way to travel. Our hotel was situated in Kowloon so we caught the ferry to visit the main attractions of Hong Kong. Cheap & efficient way to travel,

Easy, Cheap, Fun!. Even if you have no real reason to cross to HK Island, a fun way to spend a little bit of time, beautiful views. Sit on the right if you're leaving the mainland for the best views/ photos.

What a Great Experience. I remember the Star Ferry as it was when I was a child back in the '50s. I swear it hasn't changed much/ The ferries look the same but they have been improved. They run every few minutes and it is worth the wait. There are two decks - upper and lower and if you want the upper deck you make sure that take the right entry for there are no stairs aboard. The ride across is about 15 minutes.

Love these. I thought I was only using these for a bit of history but actually they are a great way of getting from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island offering great views of the skylines. We always seems to just walk on one just as it was about to eave so think they run very frequently.
Cheap with the Star Ferry. We went with the Ferry from Kowloon to Victoria Harbour business district, the connection is fine. And a very beautiful views while cruising. It costs about 25 cents.
Brilliant view, brilliant calue. For the equivalent of about 30 pence, you can travel easily between HK and Kowloon, taking in one of the world's great cityscapes. Great in the day, amazing at night.

Best value harbour experience. Do yourself a favour all you non public transport travellers, go on the star ferries. They offer awesome value and you get a great view of the harbour and the buildings that surround it.

Ferry System still The Best Way to Cross.. Use Star Ferry and use Central MTR to get to it, not Wan Chai which is in the middle of huge building works at the present time and it is a nightmare to get to the Harbour from Wan Chai MTR station. Remember that over 65s go free if you have ID or passport with you. Simple payment system, you can also use your Senior Octopus Card or Ordinary Octopus Card to check in - very inexpensive. Try to get on first for a good seat near an open window or where there are no windows.

Just got to do it. The Star Ferry is on most people's "must do" lists when visiting Hong Kong - and it wasn't hard to understand why. Fast, punctual and efficient and a fabulous introduction to the heart of this incredible city.

Different perspective of the Hong Kong area. Using the ferry to get from TST to Hong Kong Island is not the cheapest way to do it but it is a lot of fun to get on this old style bay ferry. The views are great and the smells and sounds add to the sensory perception of what Hong Kong used to be like.
Ferry. Very handy transport between know loon andHongKong island. You never have to wait to long. You can also have a nice view at the both sides of the river.

Good place for sightseeing and take photo. Near Star Ferry have drink store Hui Lau Shan you can buy a mango drink and selfie with it. There is dessert store LadyM New York inside Ocean Terminal, you should try the dessert very good, soft and expensive price but must try
Runs like clockwork. Like out first visit in 1970 except now it's free because we're so old. Great way to see the harbor and skyline.

Excellent, different . The best and only way anyone should travel between Hong Kong and Macau is by ferry, even if it's just for the experience. Good value and fast. Plenty free shuttles to various hotels on the Macau port.

Best way to see the harbor. Taking the Star Ferry during the day and then again at night is the cheapest and best way to see the harbor and the skyline. The ferries are a little like museum pieces and there are plenty of wonderful opportunities to take great pics. No matter how many times I ride them I still get a thrill.

Why ask Why? Just do it.. The ferry is simply a must do while in HK. For starts it is super cheap and secondly it has a view you've maybe heard about? If you have to limit yourself to one crossing make it an evening HK-Kowloon/TST crossing. The views really are something else. Also after alighting the boat in TST the park by the ferry terminal with the raised viewing platform overlooking the City simply can't be beat.

Easy To Use , Great Value For Money. We travelled on the Star Ferry a couple of times each day. Its cheap - at around $2 CDN per adult, is very frequent, and offers great views of both sides of the harbor as you travel from one side to the other. Language wasnt an issue - all signs and ticket machines were in English.
Brilliant way to travel. Great to cross from one side of the harbour to another, very cheaply and great at night as you get the most amazing views of the HK skyline.

Very convenient and cheap.. If you want lovely views of Hong Kong island, and a cheap way to go to Kowloon, this is it. 2.50HK$ Per crossing gets you to see a beautiful and stunning area of Hong Kong which mixes old with new. From Chanel and Armani to a little side street market selling traditional food and souvenirs in the Mong Kok district. It's a must see for any tourist.

cheapest way to get from HK island to Kowloon ..or visa versa. It's an iconic thing to do in Hong Kong.. Upper deck or lower deck.It doesn't matter.Ttourist and locals alike enjoy the silent trip across the harbour.

While in Hong Kong, a must!!!. A trip to Hong Kon would not be complete without a ride on The Star Ferry. We purchased a package along with the "Big Bus". Found out later that you had to pay extra to ride on the upper deck. No big deal but given the option we would have happily done that.

Super!. A lovely inexpensive way to get from Hong Kong island to Kowloon. Sit upstairs and any enjoy the view. The ferry docks in convenient locations on both sides of the harbour. Always a favourite means of transport and great for photography.

Hong Kong view from the water. Never seemed to wait for a ferry there was always one there within a few minutes if not immediately. Cost effective swift great way to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island.MTR is great also but you miss the view of the water.

A Must-Do for all tourists. No visit to Hong Kong would be complete without a ride on the Star Ferry. Doubling as both a method of transport for commuters and a tourist attraction, it is a great way to experience a bit of old-school Hong Kong as well as enjoy the fabulous views of Victoria Harbour.Surely one of the cheapest methods of transport in the world, it is worth the mere pennies it costs to ride and I definitely recommend taking a trip at night when the weather is clear to enjoy the iconic Hong Kong skyscrapers all lit up.

Practical, historic, cheap - a must-do. Who doesn't know the images of Hong Kong with those old, green-and-white steam ferries commuting across the harbor?They're not steam powered anymore, but historic nonetheless. The ones I've taken were all made right there in Hong Kong in the late 50s. The ferries are a very efficient way to get a cross the water to Kowloon - either from Central or from Wan Chai. A single-trip token is HK$ 2.50Riding the ferry offers great views of the skyline. You get different perspectives than you do from just being at the Kowloon waterfront. One thing to be aware of is that there's currently lots of comstruction going on on both side of the HK convention center, which can make it a bit of an adventure to get to either of the two ferry terminals on the HK side.
Different. A lovely way to travel across the harbour, and to see the sights from a different angle. Try one of the harbour tours well worth it.

Iconic experience in Hong Kong. Any visit must find time to do the simplest of things and cross the harbour; take in the vista of both HK Island, Kowloon side & the expansive harbour itself busy with commercial & pleasure traffic.

You can't be in Hong Kong and not do this.......... It may "just" be a 10 minute trip across Victoria Harbour from Hong Kong to Kowloon (or vide versa) but this must be one of the world's classic "been there and done that" rides. These days, there isn't quite the bustle of heavy commercial shipping sharing the same harbour as there was 30 years ago, but it's still a busy area, with all sorts of ships criss-crossing with the ferries. Stunning views of the HK & Kowloon skylines, and if you want a special treat, do the ferry run in the evening, between 8 & 8:30 and take in the free light show, when some of the most iconic buildings in the world put on some amazing animated illuminations. HGML
Most efficient.. Cheap and functional. A great way to cross the harbour and see all the boats, large and small. Aerial Walkway at Central over the busy roads.
What's not to love?. Virtually free, great views of HK island and Kowloon, fun and practical. Shame it only lasts a few minutes.

Cheap priceless experience. Going to Hong Kong island? Skip the MTR if you're not in a hurry and enjoy the magnificient view of Hong Kong skyline. You will enjoy this anytime of thw day. This ferry travels from Victoria harbour to Central and other locations. It only cost around 4HKD one way for the upper deck which I highly recommend for the view. The lower deck cost 3HKD. You can pay woth your Octopus card. It only takes 10-15 mins to cross the sea from Tsim Tsa Tsui to Central.They also offers harbour tour which cost around 100HKD. They have this tour even for the Symphony of light!The ferry station is very accesible via MTR Tsim tsa Tsui station.
Best view of the town. This short trip between Hong Kong and Kowloon will cost you close to nothing two and a half Hong Kong dollars and allows you to have the most beautiful views of the skyline

Catch the ferry, not the harbour tour!. At 3.5HKD the Star Ferry is a picturesque way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. The ride is a little longer than catching the train, but the view is great.

Easy transport. Like everything in HK, it's hustle & bustle, but very efficient & the easiest & cheapest way to cross. Good views. Slight feeling of stepping back in time, these ferries are real workhorses

A great way to see the light show. We were staying on Hong Kong Island and jumped on the ferry 20 pence lower deck 25 pence upper deck , if you go around 19.00 the laser light show starts at 20.00 , you can get the best views from the key side and pay silly money for a harbour cruise.

Cheap, efficient and beautiful scenery. Wish the ride lasted longer.. From the first time I rode it in 1972 until today, the Star Ferry has got to be the most efficient, reasonable and scenic ferry boat ride in Asia if not the world (OK, the Staten Island Ferry is free and has some pretty good sights, and the Swiss lake boats are superb, but you'll seldom wait more than a minute or two for the Star Ferry). The cost is next to nothing compared to everything else these days, and the scenery (especially at night) is gorgeous. And, it seems the clean, well-maintained ferry boats haven't changed in nearly 45 years (probably 75 years). On this visit to Hong Kong, our first since 1988, it was Chinese New Year. I don't know if the crowds were related to that or if it's always that busy these days. But, if you're buying tokens, get them for the round trip (or all future expected trips) at one time. The lines to the token machines can be quite long. If you're staying for a while and are a senior, look into the Octopus Card for this and other transportation discounts. Forget the subway. Go the old way.

No visit would be complete without a trip on the Star Ferry. This is part of Hong Kong history.We are not talking luxury here but as an experience it is not to be missed.This is particularly true if you are staying in Kowloon as it is by far the easiest way to Hong Kong Island and services are every few minutes

Great views of Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is the least expensive way to go from Hong Kong to Kowloon or vice versa but it's also a great way to get some great views of Hong Kong from the harbor. In the end, you'll get some bucket list worthy views of Hong Kong while getting the practical benefit of going from Hong Kong to the other. The ferries are in good shape and run like clockwork. Considering how inexpensive and quick the ride is, hop on take some great pictures and enjoy the ride. You'll save some money on getting from one side to another while enjoying some incredible views.

Love it. Star ferry is a great way to get across/from HK island. It's part of the HK heritage but use the slightly more expensive upper deck as you don't get the diesel fumes. Loved the views and the breezes, don't miss it.
Fun trip. Fun way to cross the harbour and really cheap - no queues and easy to find the crossing point. All the boats have cute names!
Small ride. Definitely worth it! Short ride to get to the island. Panoramic skyline view. Very impressive. It only cost 2.3hkd. What else?

Fastest ferry ride in my life. Pretty efficient and cheap compared to MTR. The overall trip only took 5 mins. The ferry was a bit old but it gave you a very good historical feel and it provided a very good view of the city lights at night.

Really shouldn't Miss. Chugging across harbor in one of the ferries for 2.5 HK ($.30 American) is one of the steals of the century!
And a great way to travel.
Win win

Great fun! . Great day out for families and couples. It was very quiet when we were on board. Fantastic adventure for children. Spectacular views. It didn't finish without drama as my husband lost his wallet on board. Star ferry only stops to get the passengers off and take new ones on board. We thought we are not getting it back but when we contacted star ferry's staff at the dock they have managed to search the boat and found the wallet. We were very pleased and greatfull to everyone on board.
Cheap and easy to get to point of destination. We took star ferry from tsim sha tsui to central, very affordable mode of transport and took us 10 mins at most.
Bucket list. One of the things to do on the bucket list, booked the harbour tour cost next to nothing for a great trip plenty of room on the boat

HK Boat ride. The harbor doesn't smell like a seaport and crossing to the other side doesn't take very long. The ride doesn't cost much but if you get a Big Bus Package you only get to show the attached ticket to the guard to let you in. I think there's a ride every thirty minutes so you need not to wait long since they don't actually wait for the boat to get full to leave. They follow a schedule.

Cheapest and best view of HKG. The Star Ferry is the cheapest and scenic way to get from HKG Kowloon to HKG Island. It's also a great way to see Hong Kong from the water/harbour perspective & never too crowded due to crowd control- always a highlight of any trip to Hong Kong as its a great way to spot new buildings too!

cheap way of going to another island within HK,. although is takes a while to go to another island thru ferry, its cheaper, relaxing because of the coolness while travelling, feeling Chinese when i took the ferry going to Kowloon side of HK.

No matter how many times..... I have worked and vacationed in Hong Kong and at least one trip on the Star Ferry is always on the itinerary. Unless you have a particular reason to go to Wan Chai from Kowloon I would suggest the Central terminal as there is so much construction around the Wan Chai terminal at the moment.
A ride on the ferry. Had to experience this ferry and it compares to the Staten Island Ferry in NY or is better. It certainly is cheaper!!

A must Do. This a good local way to cross the harbour. Does not last long but is interesting with all the locals. I had read that it is free for seniors but one has to have an Octopus card for this - the fare is very cheap though.

a slow boat to China.... in a word - brilliant.You must try the Star Ferry when in Kong Kong. It’s quick, clean, well run and affords some amazing views. Pay with your octopus card (like a London Oyster card, but with 8 legs instead of a shell)and it’s $2.5HK - that’s approximately 26p....pity it doesn’t run all night...personally, i think it’s fabulous.
Easy and comfy way for travelling. Do not hesitate - it is lovely and very cheap. Goes every 10 minutes. Perfect. You just need cash for buying buttons (coins or 10+20 HKD banknotes).
Travel with the locals. Easy way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong.Very cheap way to travel.Share the experience with locals and tourists.Runs very frequently from early in the morning until late

Symphony of lights night tour with Star Ferry. This is something you must do if in HongKong. We booked this night tour at the STAR ferry pier which was near our hotel. It was a much more reasonable price than doing a tour with another group. I think you can book online with them, too. We did an hour long ride in Victoria Harbour. The lights are amazing & beautiful. It Was very peaceful on the water and we got a good look at all the tall buildings and amazing architecture. There is a very nice walk around the waterfront right beside the Star Ferry pier. It is also near the Chinese Cultural Center & the Space Museum.
Cheap and charming. It´s the cheapest alternative to go from the Insland to Kowloon, it´s charming, and you get to see the beautiful HK skyline. Win-win-win. Do it.

AHongKong Must Do. This is something you simply must do if you visit Hong Kong. The ferry runs continuously between Hong Kong and Kowloon. It is really nothing special in terms of the ferry ride but it gives great views of the harbor. You get to see both Hong Kong and Kowloon from the bay.

Still dependable. We were in Hong Kong in 1983 and loved using the Star Ferry. The ferry is still dependable. The old junks that used to grace the harbour are no longer there, so the experience is slightly less exotic than it once was.

Great Views. We used the Star Ferry on several occasions over 4 days, and with our Octopus Elder Card it was free. The views as you go across were great and it never stops running so perfect for getting to Kowloon and Hong Kong Island and back.

A trip To HK Isn't Complete until You go on the Star Ferry. The Star Ferry is a quick and inexpensive way to travel to and from Kowloon to Central. It provides great views of the harbor and the skyline. It runs regularly back and forth. There are plenty of seats but the trip is short enough to enjoy standing and walking around the ferry as well.
Cheap and great experience . You must go to Central with a Star Ferry! It is only 2 HK dollars per ticket but you get great views. Highly recommend this

Good fun. The cheapest and most iconic way to cross the harbour! Ferries are very frequent - plenty local colour and excellent views on a clear day. We thought the upper deck was better for views and photos.
(Elder Octopus card holders travel free)

Great experience, cheap thrills. Best way to see the night skyline. And cheap way to entertain the kids. We rode the ferry back and forth multiple times just so cross the river and back to TST. People also were very conscious about the small kids so it was a nice experience. Ride on the top though!
2.50 HKD for best boat ride in the world!. Great views of Hong Kong skyline on the 5 minute Star Ferry, don't miss it! Mix with the locals on the scenic journey.
A ferry boat trip not to miss. So cheap, you have to get a token which coverts to 20 pence. Sterling. Does not take more than 10 minutes.

A must for tourists. When you want to cross over the water separating Hong Kong island from the mainland this is a must for first time tourists.Although not as quick as the MTR is does give you a wonderful view in both directions of the city skyline. Do this crossing during the day and at night for a different city perspective, the neon lights are wonderful.
Even after 15 years of using it, I still love it.. The feeling that one gets riding this ferry is pure nostalgia. I never tire from it no matter how many times I ride.

A fun and easy way to traverse Hong Kong harbor. This was an affordable, efficient way to get across the harbor while in HK. It drops at an easy location on both sides from which to stage out by foot, cab or subway.

Great water transporation. easy in and out and inexpensive transportation between Hong Kong and Tsim Sha Tsui.
you can enjoy beautiful harbor view with good breeze during the ride.
Steeped in History. If you are a tourist in HK, definitely try the star ferry once instead of taking a cab from the island to Kowloon. Fantastic views of the city as you reach your destination.

Good to try to once in a while. 2.5hkd per person to cross the river and the queue isnt as bad as in the train. Best to take it on sunny days if you have a tendency to get sea/motion sick. Rode it on a monday mid morning and it was a breeze.You can use your octopus card here too, no need to buy the single-ride plastic coins from the machine.
Quintessential Hong Kong. This is a must do when I'm Hong Kong. It's a classic dirt cheap ferry ride across the harbour with beautiful views. What better way to get to the other side?

View at cost of £0.20. This is something you simply have to do if in Hong Kong. It cost you next to nothing but the photos and experience are pricelses. Free has lower open deck and open and close section on top deck, so no matter the weather just do it, you won't regret it
I ride it back and forth! . Sometimes when I am staying in Hong Kong I ride it back and forth reading a book! I love the people watching and the views from the star ferry!! And it's sooo cheap!!!

Great service . We used the ferry yesterday to get us between islands as we were using the big bus hop on hop off tour and needed to get across the water to switch lines.The staff were good greeting you at the ferry entrance and directing you to the correct pier. We didn't have to wait long at all to leave once we were on board and the journey across was good. A necessary way to go from one island to the other.

Best way to see both sides!. Funny story to tell. I lived in HK in the 80s and loved the tranquility of the Star Ferry at rush hour getting to/from work!! Last time I visited was in October 2007. Of course, I was on the Star Ferry... my favourite transportation mode! So, this 2016 visit, I head to the ferry from Central. So... where is the pier??? After a while of scratching my and and google mapping, I found that it was relocated!!! Anyway, it's worth the ride and one of the cheapest "tours" in Hong Kong.
Hop on Board. So much fun to take the ferry to the island. Fare is not expensive and tickets are easy to get. The ferry runs frequently and this is a great experience when in Hong Kong.

Great way to travel to Macau. Star Ferry was easy to find from our hotel. Ticket purchase and departure times were readily available. Glad that seats were assigned. Do ask for window seats especially for a day trip. Snacks and drinks can be purchased on board so have some cash. There is WiFi available but was a very slow connection. A must do if you plan on going to any of the other islands.

On a sunny day, an alternative to the subway. Enjoyed a ride on the Star Ferry to cross to Central and see the views. it was a short ride and enjoyable. it reminded me of taking the Staten Island Ferry (very cheap)

Star price. Go for the upper deck as the lower deck stinks of diesel. Cheap way to get across and back from Kowloon to Hong Kong central. If you don't mind the rush and the grab for the best seats star is the way to go.

The biggest bargain in transportation anywhere. You just have to do this! It isn't a visit to Hong Kong without a ride across the harbour on the Star Ferry. With weekday fares of 25₵ on the lower deck and a whopping 33₵ on the upper deck it is the best transportation bargain in the world and a wonderful, relaxing way to cross Hong Kong harbour from Tsim Sha Shui to Central. DOn't miss it.
Better to take it at night. it's far more beautiful to take the ferry during the night. It's magnificent.also have your octopus card ready.

Don't Waste Money on Light Show Ride. Honestly, it is not worth your money ($200 HKD) to take the special boat ride for the nightly light show. Especially considering that a normal ride costs $2 HKD, it's a pretty big price jump for very similar experiences. I did it both ways, and the special boat ride is a nicer boat and they stop in the middle to see the show, but the normal boat has basically the same view. I'm not convinced a boat is the best way to see the lights anyway, so my suggestion would be to spend the money on a nice dinner on the harbor instead to get the most of the beautiful skyline
Star Ferry. Feb.2016 . If you visiting Hong Kong , this is a must . It is a Pleasure to go by Ferry to Central and back , dont forget your Camera . It is very cheap and funny

I'm a huge fan for shows at the Cultural Center. If you need to catch the HK Phil or the HK Ballet this is a great option to get there. You get unbelievable views of the harbor on the way to and from. It is dirt cheap and drops you off in a much better location than the MTR line. Make sure to ride on the top level you aren't sucking on diesel fumes down below.

A quick trip across the water offering great views. You don't have to sit in the seats while the ferry is in motion and they move in and out of the docks pretty quick that this operation would never fly in the litigious United States but thankfully it thrives in Hong Kong. I quickly made my way to the open area in the middle of the ship allowing for a clearer view of the bay and skyline than the plastic covered windows. The trip will cost you a few dollars and if you don't have an Octopus card you will have to buy a token to get through the turn style. The trip is quick, probably less than 10 minutes but they are constantly running and I don't think i waited at the dock for more than 10 minutes.

Less crowded and relaxed way to go around. I like to take the Star Ferry to go around as this is a less crowded and more relaxed way than using the MRT. On Top there are stunning unparalleled views to experience during the short cruise. Recommend that as a must do for everyone visiting Hong Kong

Must do for trip back in time and great perspectives of Hong Kong harbour. Star Ferry has been running for over a century using the same vessels. They run continuously between Hong Kong ferry terminal and Kowloon (TsimTsaChui). It's about a 10min ride across the water - providing wonderful views of the Island and mainland from the water. Costs almost nothing - HK$2 (about US$0.3) one way for the lower deck.Tip: do this both in the morning and evening - the lights of Hong Kong are spectacular from the water.
Just another ferry ride.. The synchronized light show isn't very appealing, the ferry isn't really needed to watch the show. A tour around Hong Kong would be a better choice.

Historical. The Star Ferry has been running before the bridges connecting Hong Kong island and Kowloon island were build. Must enjoy the ferry at least once, though MTR is faster and more convenient way to travel.

2 HKD well spent. We used the ferry to get a nice view of the harbor without having to go on a cruise. Perfect for those picture moments. No big difference between lower deck and the 50 cent more expensive upper deck
Sailing on a piece of history. Taking the Star Ferry is like traveling back on time. Is more than a mean of transport, it is a must do if you want to experience 100% of Hong Kong.
A classic enjoyable trip!. For few HK$ you can enjoy a beautiful view of the bay and look at Kowloon and Hong Kong Island from the ferry. 10 minutes trip with a stunning view!

Now this is a ferry!. It's not fancy and we all have seen these iconic ferries in movies and tv ( Bruce Lee anyone?) but you have to go on the Star ferry when in Hong Kong. Like other harbour cities like Vancouver and Sydney, you have to get on the water to really experience the city. This ferry gets you out there at least for a little bit. And oh those views...the city skyline on both sides are spectacular.

A must do ride while in HK. So there are many ways to travel across Victoria harbour from central to TST but if your going to do it, I can suggest doing it on the wonderful star ferry. If travelling to HK make sure you get yourself an octopus card and then for a very small fee (around 3-4 HKD) you can travel on this historic ferry (founded in 1888)It is a short trip, only 10 mins but gives you wonderful views of the harbour and if travelling at night an amazing view of the light show (8pm every night in HK)A great little trip for all ages.

Star Ferry. Star ferry is affordable and gives an amazing view of both sides of the harbor. Not to be missed! Avoid taking during peak commuting hours as it is a main stay for regular commuters! Ferry's run frequently and generally you will not have to wait more than ten minutes for the next to arrive. When you are among the first to board, be aware that the seat backs shift so that riders are always able to face the direction of travel. Great views~Not to be missed!

Old world, new city . There was a biting chill in the air when we took the starferry across to Central, but that didn't dampen our enjoyment of the trip. The entrance, location, system of entry & boarding - all very convenient - and for the cost! Talk about value for money! It was relaxing and hassle-free. And who doesn't like the seawind in your face for a few minutes? I recommend this for anyone in Hong Kong who has the time. A beautiful, relaxing, a division most unique experience!
It's a ferry and nothing special. This is a ferry for getting from point a to point b. That's it. Don't make a special trip to take the ferry.

Charming. It was a good way to cross from Hong Kong island to the main land. Not only you see the water front from both sides its a good way to get away from the hustle and bustle of the busy transit system.
Great way of transport. Good and cheap way to see both Kowloon and HK Island, especially during sunset! Just take about 5 mins from one side to another. Must do

Cheapest, most beautiful way to get around!. You can't go to Hong Kong without riding the Star Ferry! The price is SO low! And the views are great! Besides, it's an easy way to get from Kowloon to TST, or vice versa. Everyone needs to do that at some point. Why not do it with a great view?

Great View of the Skyline, Much Too Short. The title kind of says it all. It seemed that as soon as I started to really appreciate the view of Hong Kong's skyline, the trip was over. If you're short on time, definitely skip this.

Its an old ferry. Not sure what's all the excitement about this. This is perhaps the oldest ferry and apart from the old iron chair. It runs every 10 mins (from Pier 7). So you can ride any time of the day

Great trip across Hong Kong Harbour. A great way to cross the Harbour in good old fashioned style. The Kowloon to Central trip is only HK$2.50 rack so a bargain price for some great sightseeing.
Sit indoors or on an open deck and enjoy the breeze. The ride is particularly fun when the water is a little choppy!
Ferry Cross The Mersey ?. A great trip across to Hong Kong Island and at $2.80 on a Saturday a bit cheaper than the Razzle Dazzle on the Mersey. Quite an experience to use the famous Star Ferry.

Cheap and convenient. It's so cheap and the views are nice. Only downfall is that it can be hard to find the ferry piers.you buy tickets there and it s about 3hkd on weekends. It's first come first serve. You don't get customer service... But I mean for the price you can't expect to be ushered to your seat

Busy and pushy. Once you get passed the fact you're pushed along with the crowds, once seated for the short ride it's fun, there is no such thing as an orderly line it's a free for all, but like most transport it's cheap.

Upper deck. Well if it's only 5 HK dollars for two seniors ,take advantage and its first class travel on the upper deck,much better than saving a dollar and travelling cattle class,well it only takes 5/10 minutes to cross between Kowloon and Hong Kong island.

Unusually fun mass transit.... A must do in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is cheap, convenient, and a splendid way to take in the fragrant harbor. The views of the city from this vantage are awesome. A most relaxing form of mass transit.

iconic slow boat across. Hadn't ridden on the ferry for a couple of decades, but my partner had never before visited HK, so we took the Star Ferry. She enjoyed the leisurely ride across the harbor from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central side, and, I must admit, so did I. We just used our Octopus cards to pay the nominal fare. Very convenient. A picturesque and nostalgic "slow" crossing. A slice of history and "old" HK. On our return, we just took the MTR from Central to TSim Sha Tsui. Fast & efficient, but of course nowhere near as picturesque.

One of the main reasons for visiting Hong Kong!. Seems strange, but if you have been on the ferry since 1990, you tend to develop a certain fondness for it! I first visited Hong Kong a quarter century ago (man!), and used the ferry for the first time then... since that time, I have been to HK with my wife a couple of times, and have fallen in love with the super-efficient, relatively cheap and lovely Star ferry... some days we have gone back and forth on it 4-5 times, just to experience it again!!

A great value. I love Star Ferry. It is part of long Hong Kong tourism tradition, and I highly recommend every budget tourist to try it. The fare is cheap, and the view of the Hong Kong skylines from the ferry is breathtaking especially at night!! It is very beautiful, romantic, and almost magical!!

Typical Hong Kong transportation. An effective way to move between Kowloon and Central and back. The short trip is worth experiencing especially since it provides the opportunity to observe the local Hong Kong inhabitants and communicate with them.

2nd #1 sightseeing venue. The Star Ferry is considered as must do. The ferry ride is OK; nothing special. It is very inexpensive. Again, buy a Pasmo card and use it here to. You can see both sides of Hong Kong, especially at night when the lights are putting on a show on the tall buildings.

Extremely cheap. Not very fast but we ended up at the ferry watching the light show at victoria harbour and decided to go over instead of (walking to a subway to go) under the water. The cost is ridiculous, I can't remember what it was but it was insanely cheap. It's not very fast but you still have a nice view from the boat and the distance is short so it doesn't take long anyway.
A BLAST FROM THE PAST. One of those things you must do. It takes 10 minutes, is cheap and offers great harbour views which dwarf these ancient vessels.

Riding the Star Ferry is a MUST!. HK's Star Ferry is iconic! They have been operating for many decades, connecting Kowloon (Tsim Sha Tsui and Tsim Sha Tsui East) with HK Island (Central and Wan Chai). The ride is fantastic and offers spectacular and dramatic views of the iconic HK skyline, both in Kowloon and HK Island. The price is cheap and a ride takes approx. 10 minutes. Additionally the Star Ferry offers dedicated harbour cruises which take around 1 hour. Don't leave HK without riding the Star Ferry!

The chipest way to cross the Victoria Harbour. The Star Ferry is chiperr than the MTR subway when you need to go from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island.
We took the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Central. It took only few minutes, and you enjoy the skyline of both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island.

People still using it. Can’t believe Star Ferry has been serving HK for over 100 years. Till now it still faithfully carries passengers between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui. Although the harbour is crossed by railway and road tunnels, but people are still taking ferry. Maybe it’s cheap for the locals but not fast. For the tourists it is the thing to do. For me it’s for a sentimenta reason. Happy Travelling!
Similar to Staten Island Ferry. Costed $2 HKD and the ride offered the view of both Hong Kong and Kowloon. We took the ferry from the Kowloon side and metro back to our hotel.
Great in every way! . Star Ferry is a useful and cheap way of transportation between the two islands and at the same time a great way to enjoy views of the beautiful harbour and the skyline.
Fun must do in HK . A must do on a visit to HK. Travel with the locals back and forth from kowloon to HK island. Included in big bus tour price
Good transport. Star Ferry is a great, cheap transport option to get across the Bay. I wouldn't say it was a sightseeing highlight. But good clean efficient and quick.
Hong Kong Star Ferry. Probably the most relaxing mode of transportation in Hong Kong. A bit far from everything on Hong Kong Island side unfortunately.

A must do whilst in Hong Kong. Like most visitors to Hong Kong, we had seen images of the waterfront and the ferries on various films over the years, so whilst in Hong Kong a trip on the Star Ferry was a must.We crossed from Hong Kong island to Kowloon. The price was very cheap, two HKD from memory. The crossing is very short, but it does give some excellent photo opportunities of both the Hong Kong and Kowloon skylines.
Querky but useful. The Star Ferry is an unglamourous but functional way of commuting between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island.

Great and cheap, but harbour tour is better. We did the ferry several times, as we lived near the ferry dock on the Kowloon side and often visited the Hong Kong side by foot. The star ferry is reasonable, somewhat charming (though extremely crowded at times) and gives a great view of the two sides of the city. We did, however, also do a harbour tour (1 hour) which, though a little pricey, give a much calmer and comprehensive experience and view of the larger bay area. Obviously the star ferry´s task isn´t to be a sightseeing boat, but I´d recommend "adding" a sightseeing tour to your harbour experiences. The ferry is frequent, reliable and efficient, though. A must do.

A beautifull view at the skylines. When you want to go to Hong Kong island you have tontake the ferry.
It is cheap and you have a wonderfull view on the skyline of Hong Kong island and the skyline of Hong Kong.
If you can do it by night.

Quick and easy from Kowloon to HK island. $2 HK per adult. Ferries leave every 3 minutes. During the trip you have a terrific view of VIctoria Harbor. Word of caution, if you want to sit in the upper deck you will need to buy a $2.50 token. Still a bargain!

Magical experience. Truly amazing experience. Yes it will be recommended by every single tourist guide in the world but this is one of the attractions which really doesn't disappoint.
Seeing the skyline of HK from the Star Ferry is a must do, highly recommended!

Quickest & Cheapest Mode. Around 2.5 dollars from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central pier in 10 mins! Must try for every traveler. This will give you amazing harbor views and opportunity to click great pictures. I do this every once in a while :)
A must use. You cannot go to Hong Kong without using the star ferry between Kowloon and Hong Kong island. It only takes about 5 minutes
A Must. everyone has to ride the star ferry once during their trip to HK. It doesn't matter whether you go upper or lower deck its just the nostalgic experience

The most experience for a little. The Star Ferry ride between HK island and Kowloom is a 'must do' as the least expensive but most experiential ride with views of HK that is breathtaking.Looking back at HK island, one sees the waterfront lined with skyscrapers crowned by the Peak whereas views back to Kowloon sees a diverse waterfront surrounded by the 'nine hills' which gives Kowloon its name.
How can you not?. How can you visit HK and not go on the star ferry.....Central to TST (Or vice versa) it's an absolute must do. (And it's cheap!)
Great value . Used this to take me over to Hong Kong Island . Cost 20p ! (2hkd) efficient and a great view of the sky line at night . Not too busy at this time of year .

A HK gem. The ferry is so simple and easy to use. Friendly for tourists, no frills, reliable. There isn't really anything more you could ask for. The price is cheap, the boats are vast with well designed seating to make the most of the view on the crossing. Advice for travellers: the ticket machines only accept 10 or 20 HKD notes, so make sure you take small notes or change. Have a camera handy too to capture the view.
Nice Ride. We just rode the ferry for experience... It was very fast and cheap I must say... Take the upper deck for a great view :)

Great Mode of Transport. The historical Star Ferry is one of the simple delights of Hong Kong / Kowloon. My wife and I used it numerous times on our holiday. Easy to access. Two decks to choose from. For a ride not overtly strong in diesel fumes go for the top deck at a cost of $2:50 HKBottom deck is ok and cheaper at $1:70 HK, but the diesel fumes and engine noise obviously make it the budget option. I always found the short hops across the harbour to be full of interest and colour.Can be used with the Octopus public transport card or tokens can be purchased just prior the turnstile.
I'm on a boat!. It's weird to write a review about the ferry but I will say that they are cheap and allow for great views and pictures to be taken.

must have HK experience. The Star Ferry is both an inexpensive travel means and a nostalgic experience for locals. At the cost of only 2 hk dollars, one gets to cross the Victoria Harbour in 10 minutes, absorbing the amazing cityscape on both the Kowloon and Hong Kong Island sides.

Quick and easy. This ferry is dead cheap, 2.5HKD for an adult, and Seniors can go for 1.5HKD, so 25p or 15p, can't get any better than that. It takes about 10 minutes to cross the harbour and there is plenty of room on the boat. The run about every 10-15 mins so you do t have to wait long if you miss one.

Great quick way to get across the harbkr. This was a pretty cheap and quick way to get across the harbor. It's also a great way to capture a different view of the city. Just be sure to have some change or an Octopus card ready

wonderful and very inexpensive. Take this ferry at night after dark. The lights of Hong Kong are dazzling along the harbor. It runs between Kowloon on the mainland and Hong Kong island. It's hard to find so I recommend a taxi to get there on the Kowloon side.
History. You simply must take the ferry from Hong Kong island to Kowloon. Its history and a very iconic very as well. Cheap and as must do is perfect
Star Ferry. Very cheap and convenient! It's a great alternative to cross the river. The metro is faster but you won't see the beautiful scenaio you will enjoy from the ferry. Highly reccomanded.

Best Harbour view. If you want a legendary HK experience take the Star Ferry. Ferries run frequently. Only cost less than a dollar and you get to ride across the Harbour with a hundred or so of local Chinese. It's a classic Hong Kong experience you shouldn't miss.
Super Star Ferry. Cheap and easy must do experience, use your octopus and avoid the cash hassle, day and night great views.

A great cheap way to see the skyline and lightshow. The Star Ferry is a really cheap way to see the amazing skyline of Hong Kong on both sides of the harbour. The journey is quick and cheap and you can travel one way, then get off with enough time to walk through the gates to get back on again. They will not let you stay on the boat (well they didn't both times we went on it anyway).If taking the trip at night time when the light show is scheduled, get there early as the ferry fills up quickly.
Feel like a part of history.... Jump aboard the star ferry and cruise Victoria harbour on this amazing old ferry and you feel like part of history!Reasonably priced, beautiful experience

A must. We "did" the Star Ferry as it is a must for Hong Kong to see the traffic across the busy harbour. Don't know if it was the hype or the misty day, but it wasn't that special a ride. You couldn't really see the buildings and there weren't that many boats passing. It is very inexpensive at 25p each way. Getting the token was confusing. We had to watch others and then a kind Chinese lady explained what we had to do. The machine isn't in English like the MTR. A quick and inexpensive way to cross the harbour and the walk from the landing stage on Hong Kong Island takes you into The Landmark which leads to the cleanest toilet (all marble) I've ever seen, so it was worth it for that! The walkway takes you over the 5 lane road and into various locations. Brilliant idea. Like a walkway in the sky.

Quaint yet efficient. A very inexpensive way of getting from Kowloon to the Island. You could take a train or go underground which would be quicker but the view would be disappointing! The ships all date from the 1950's but feel (and look) older. Since the container port has moved these little boats have fewer objects to avoid and for HK$2 per trip cannot be faulted.

Unique and Cheap link between Hong Kong and Kowloon. We made 4 trips between Kowloon and Hong Kong during our short stay. We used the Ferry 3 times (leisurely with great harbour views and ample seating) and the MTR once (a rush hour nightmare).

Fast, cheap, beautiful view and historic. The Star Ferry is a very fast, very cheap, historic and stable tool to cross over the Habour. You can enjoy the beautiful sea view and the high building along the coastline.

A must try if it is your first time in H.K.. Another convenient mode of transportation between H.K. Island and Kowloon. I always make it a point to take the Star Ferry every time I am in H.K. It is one of the must try if it is your first time in H.K.It's cheap, efficient, and scenic!
A Memorial Ride. This service is the life line of Hong Kong joining Kawloon Bay with the Central , it is one ride no one must miss, its memorable and a must visit.

Romance on the budget. I have been riding the Star Ferry as a tourist as well as resident and each time, it feels the same. There is something about the rides that suggests the dreamy romance of HK. The skyline is spectacular. I feel like a tourist everytime I commute on it.It's the best tourist attraction on the cheap. Go on....

Reasonable cruise. I enjoyed Victoria Harbour cruising at a fare of 2.5 HKD.
Before riding, you must buy egg tart at the pier.

Best way to see harbor and skyline. Inexpensive, simple, efficient, not touristy. We only used the Star Ferry to cross from Kowloon to Central, there is a slightly longer route, or you can opt for a long tour at a much higher price. Highly recommend this. Ferry is mostly open-air, so be prepared for the weather!

Turbojet to and from Mainland/Macau. It was an easy walk from The Luxe Manor Hotel in Kowloon to the ferry terminal. We arrived before 9:00 AM and the line up for standard fare tickets (about HK$150) was quite long; 11;30 for the next Turbojet. We paid the Super Class fare (about HK$325) and took the 9:00 departure. Reserved seats second level and a snack came with the hefty price but was worth leaving earlier by 2.5 hours. If possible, suggest you reserve in advance to avoid the long wait and extra charges. Getting around Macau was really easy with all the buses provided by the hotels. Seemed each hotel had its own bus so was fast and a short ride. Tons of people on Macau and some of the hotels/casinos were EXACTLY like the sister hotel in Las Vegas. We experienced the same delay on our return so paid the higher fare to avoid the wait.

A taste of the old Hongkong can still be felt in the Star Ferry. I love this ferry. It just does not transport people but transports me back to when the harbour was still very wide and took 30 minutes to cross. Now with all the reclamation in the harbour, its only a 3 minute journey. I wish they would just stop all those reclamation to keep the Harbour still feasible for the star ferry.
Ferry to the Stars 10/10. The best place to travel to the other side of Hong Kong. Very historical, can bring peace, relaxation and comfort.

A ferry that is both inexpensive and enjoyable!. Star Ferry is a great mode of transportation between Tsim Sha Tsui and central Hong Kong. It only takes about 10 minutes and allows the passengers to enjoy the harbor view for a fraction of the cost of MTR.
Nice way to get around. I really enjoyed taking the ferry around town in Hong Kong. They were clean and offered a picturesque view of the city. Good if you don't have a specific time to be somewhere.

$2 HKD is a great bargan. You can get almost anywhere on the ferry system. This is a great way to get around. The only downside is that getting on and off is a rush of people so if you have small children you have to keep them close.I recommend this to anyone and everyone
Cruise at star ferry. It's an excellent view for travelers who intended to watch famous & gorgeous city in the world. Hope you will like this.

Harbour cruise a must do. Took a harbour cruise with star ferries late in the afternoon, not many travellers on the ferry so we were able to move about freely. Ticket price included soft drinks and biscuits. Cruise lasted about one hour and the commentary was very good and informative although on two occasions it was out of synch with the sights described but no great problem. We really enjoyed this cruise and would recommend it. Travelled on the normal star ferry from Kowloon terminal to HK island several times and each time the journey was easy and quick.

Quick, cheap, hassle-free. You can buy the tokens for crossing from the machines just before the boarding docks (HK$2 for adults), no long lines, only a couple of minutes across the water. And on a clear day you get a nice view of the Hong Kong/Kowloon from the water.
A must. It's a 'must' experience of Hong Kong and it provides a breathtaking first view of Hong Kong island and Kowloon on the return
Must do in Hong Kong . Great way to cross the harbour and it costs less than 50 cents usd. Great view of the harbour at night time too

Great fun!. Star Ferry is great fun and easy to access! If you want to cross the Harbour it will cost approx 28p (when converted from HK$) each way. We had great weather the day we crossed the Harbour, Blue Sky's and Sunshine. The scenery is amazing, the view of the Hong Kong Skyline is excellent. I Highly recommend using the ferry when in Hong Kong!!!

easy to use. clean and friendly service - they dont announce when a ferry is arriving or leaving - so if your looking out around the the harbour on one side you have no idea a ferry has arrived on the other..

Quick and Cheap travel. If you want to cross the channel between the two islands and the weather is nice, why not grab the star ferry. it costs practically nothing and gives you some great views of the skyline. I loved hopping on and off this little ferry. You can pay via the travel card (Metro Travel Card) and there was rarely a queue.

Just Great. It am not amongst the youngest and the star ferry in hong-kong is just a great and probably the best way to cross the bay. It has not changed for at least 40 years (first time I took it) if not more. Its just a part of the Hong Kong heritage and lets just hope they will not change anything with this Ferry.

Absolute must do in HK.. No trip to HK is complete without at least one trip each way on the Star Ferry from Kowloon to HK Island.The view of HK Island is stunning.Ideally go on the upper deck.We had bought Octopus cards at a metro station so we could just pass them over an electronic reader (also for the Peak Tram) rather than having to supply exact money for tickets.
Old world charm. Always a pleasure to ride on the star ferry-- hasn't changed s bit over the years. Plenty of old world charm. Great views of the Kowloon and HK island skyline. Absolute must do.
A Classic. Best way to move between Hong Kong and Kowloon, unbelievably cheap, classic and a pleasure to use, a great travel experience
Quick, regular service, but.... These boats are showing their age. However can't beat the $2 US fare for the 5-minute crossing between Hong Kong and Kowloon.
Evening cruise to watch light show. . Interesting way to see the light show. A bit pricey, but then the boat is not crowded at all so no problem getting a "front row seat."

Ferry to central Hong Kong . I was struggling to get over to the central side of Hong Kong as the time I was returning back to the hotel was peak time for traffic and taxi drivers were being complete and utter *€$ess. So I decided to take the star ferry across the water. This however was a kind of blessing as the crossing was dirt cheap compared to the prices charged by taxi drivers. But I got to see the the harbour closer than I would have liked. So there's a nice tip for you guys if you want to save money and CEOs the waters ;)
A piece of history. No journey to Hong Kong is complete without a trip on Star Ferries service from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Regular service and with a fare of around HK$3.40 you can't go wrong.
another must do. Star ferrys are a part of Hong Kong they have been there 100 years they are a great way to see Victoria Harbour you dont need to pay for an harbour tour
Even better than the Staten Island Ferry. Cheapest way to cross the harbor, with great views of the skyline thrown in for nothing. Avoid the rush hour crowds, unless you want the genuine atmosphere.

It would be great if it will be improved. The fare is cheap, travelling time is quick. My only negative comment is that the ferry is old and dated. I don't understand why they are not improving the Ferry considering how modern HongKong is.

Great experience. Fun and excitement. Nice view on day and most especially at night. The space was big that you can have a good seat while looking around. Very convenient way to travel from Hongkong to Kowloon and vice versa.
A must when visiting HobgKong. A trip on the Star Ferry is a must when visiting HongKong. Great views of the magnificent skyline of HongKong Island and Kowloon. Inexpensive and timely service.

Gave this a 5 star. I love this simple transportation that conveniently takes you from TST to Central. It's super cheap and fast. The ferry has been running the same route since forever and I think it covers an important route in most people's itinerary.

What Amazing Views. We returned to Kowloon on the Star Ferry, having gone over by the MTR and were very impressed by the views. We made sure that we outside the 'Rush Hour' and though the boat was by no means empty we had plenty of space. We went on the upper deck having purchased the tickets from a machine ($2.10 each or £0.20) selected a seat on the starboard side and marvelled at the views. A must for any visitor to Hong Kong.
Great way to see the harbour.. Easy to use and a quick cheap way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. Fun way to see the harbour.
Great views of the city and harbor. A nice inexpensive trip that gives really stunning harbor and city views. Definitely worth doing! also found decent egg tarts at the ferry terminal.
Nice view of harbour. Caught the ferry to Kowloon and back, inexpensive trip on the harbour with great views of Hong Kong skyline.

Should be at the top of your list when visiting Hong Kong. This ferry traveling from Kowloon the Hong Kong Island is a part of Hong Kong's rich history. It is extremely cheap and a great way to get views of both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. I would even suggest doing it day and night as the view is special at these different times. Cost is about 50 cents USD.
A must for every visitor. So cheap to do and gives you fabulous views in both directions.Great way to cross over from Hong Kong island.
Quick and inexpensive. For 2 Hong Kong dollars per person you can cross the harbour from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Ferries run frequently so don't worry if you miss one.

Great transportation of crossing between two island. We chose this method of transportation due to our stay at Marco Polo hotel. He dock from tst is within walking distance from the hotel. It is also a good scenery especially during evening times. Overall it is recommended to use this method if you are planning to cross between these two islands

Harbour tour good value . We went on the Star Ferry Harbour cruise on one of the old Star Ferries at HK. Started at Kowloon and it then called at the HK Island Central stop before travelling the full length of the north shore of the island and back along the south side of Kowloon. About an hour in total for $86 - good value

Enjoy Hong Kong stunning views at cheap fares!. Hong Kong's fantastic night view is famous. Instead of joining local cruise tour, taking Star Ferry is another good way to enjoy at cheap fares, just few HKD. It's a ten minutes boat ride from Tsim Sha Tsui to Wanchai (the best route). If there's exhibition held in HK Convention Centre, you can visit at the same time. This is a way a lot more easier/ nearer than to walk from Wanchai MTR station. Recommended to travel in the evening! : )

Ferry across Victoria Harbour, Hong Kong. Day time or Night Time, taking the ferry from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon make my journey more enjoyable. There is 360 degree view of one of the world's famous harbour at very low fare price. The trip is less than 15 minutes. It is relaxing and ventilated by breezes, there is an air conditioned compartment for passengers in Summer.At both sides of the harbour, connections to many popular places are available. For instance, connection to Victoria Peak (Tai Ping Shan) by bus or peak tram are within walking distance on the Hong Kong Island Side. As one go up the peak, detail picture of the city down under is quite fascinating. On Kowloon side, there is Tsimshatsui where Space Museum, Art Museum, Ocean Terminal and waterfront promenade leading to History Museum are enough for a day's exploration. This is always wonderful for visits again and again.

My favourite quality 10minutes. Having lived in HK for a few years I love this journey-such a shame it's moved from its original place however, such a lovely journey and an interesting one in a rain warning.

Star Ferry Harbour view. Best to take it at night from Tsim Tsai Tsui ( after shopping at Ocean Terminal) to Wanchai instead of Central. The Ferry runs along the harbour longer along the water front, sit on the left side with better view for photos.

Short Harbour Trip. The Star Ferry offers a quick trip across the Harbour to Hong Kong Island, giving access to The Peak Tram, Hop On Hop Off bus trip to Repulse Bay and the Causeway. Hong Kong Island has two very large shopping areas. One near the Star Ferry Terminal and the other down the other end of the Island at the Causeway. I could have spent a week on the Island going through the shops.
Organized. Fast, clean and organized. But if it's a Chinese Holliday book/buy your tickets a day before. We were there at Chinese New Year and we just found ticket at first class.

Cheap, Easy and great views. Very cheap ($2-3) way to get between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. The Ferries are vintage, clean and comfortable. Gives a great view of the skyline and the pulsating harbour. From Kowloon you can go to central or wanchai and takes about 15 minutes to cross. There are taxi and bus services at both ends if you want to go somewhere specific. The train is quicker but if visiting you need to do it at least once.

Take the ferry at least once. I love boats! And the Star Ferry is still very much primarily a functioning cross-channel ferry for HKG residents. Lovely harbour views, good seating, cheap, well worth the experience.

Never get tired of the crossing. Feb 8Despite the newly constructed underwater crossing, there is a real romance everytime I take the Star Ferry to and from Hong Kong Island. It never gets old. Though it has been over 10 years since I took the ferry, it felt fresh and exhilarating. The price is so reasonable especially now that I qualify for a special rate for those over 65, or disabled. It continues to be efficient in embarking and disembarking while staying on schedule. The interior is clean with freedom to move about and enjoy the stunning view. This ferry crossing is a must when visiting Hong Kong.
A Hong Kong icon. An iconic part of Hong Kong, the trip across the harbour and back is not to be missed, particularly around sunset/early evening.

Amazing. Perhaps the best and most economical ferry journey in a first world city.This is efficient and reliable way to cross the extraordinary Victoria Harbour.Must do for every visitor at any time of day, but best to get on at night at between 8 pm and 8:10 pm so you can enjoy an extraordinary laser light show.And oh... It cost less than 50 US cents!
Iconic. This is a must #1 thing to do as a visitor and a regular to-do if a local. Historic and beautiful with amazing views of HK.

Great trip and a small price. For a spectacular view of both sides of Hong Kong, a ferry trip is a must. The 7-minute trip for only around $2 Hong Kong is great value-for-money. And don't forget your camera as photo opportunities will abound.

You just have to travel on the Star Ferry !. A trip on the start ferry is a must, and has a great atmosphere. The crossing to Hong Kong is less than 10 mins and is very cheap. I forget how much, but remember it was extremely cheap.The old ferries have a lot of character
Great way to cross the water. We enjoyed the ride, even though it was very short. Wonderful way to cross from HK Island to Kowloon.

Classic Hong Kong. If you want to experience true Hong Kong, take your time to cross the water on the star ferry. It might not be the fastest mode of transport available but it's by far the most beautiful.

A must. A visit to Hong Kong would not be complete without taking the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong. The only way to see the magnificant skyline. Even better to do it in the evening when all the buildings are lit up.
Best value in HK. Punctual, safe, comfortable and the best skyline in Asia. Buy tickets/coins at the machines before you get on.
Great view at night, for a cheap price. Great view of the hk skyline at night, I recommend taking the star ferry while in hk. It is only 2HKD.
Quick cruise. It was prompt and timely. Had ample seats and clean surroundings. Nevertheless, due to the construction site at the Wan Chai Ferry Terminal, it was confusing to locate its entrance.

Cheap and essential. For less than 25p per person for the upper deck, less on the lower deck, this 5 minute crossing on ferries from the 1950s is the best way to cross between HK Central and Kowloon. The frequency is such that there is little waiting and the ferries do not hang around. Coins are best in the machines and change is given.

Love the Star Ferry!. Just love the old fashioned Star Ferry!
Costs equivalent 25p and takes all of about 5 mins and runs backwards and forwards all dat from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Very busy and bustling and so authentic! A must on your bucket list!

Do the top deck. Great to do at night with a partner. Best attraction to see if your also in HK for just a few hours or a day.
