Take the top deck for ease of taking pictures.

Enjoy the skyline and being on the water. Skip the subway one or two times and take this public transport ferry. It's cheaper than the subway, but you can only take the ferry on a few places. Pay with Octopus card. Especially at night the skyline is breathtaking!

Hong Kong to Macau by ferry. It's a must to stay at least an overnight in Macau to see the lights and casino. Star ferry is a good choice to see maintains and buildings surrounded by Hong Kong. Length of the trip is approximately 45min to 1 hour with good clear weather. Try to visit during weekdays to avoid being crowded and big line in ferry queue plus in Macau. Also the price is lower in weekdays.
Loved it. So cheap. Around 30p each way. Used it a few times to travel between Hong Kong and Kowloon sides. Really fun. I reckon kids would enjoy this too.

Star Ferry. When in HK one must try taking the StarFerry. Its very convenient not to mention very affordable. I also would strongly suggest you try it at night so you can see the beautiful lights that both HongKong & Kowloon side has to offer.
Fun Ride. This was a fun ride across to Victoria. Very efficient and cheap! Quite busy at "rush hour" for those going to and from work, but there is plenty of room.

Hong Kong history and memory!. The boat is just a great memory of old Hong Kong ferry history. Old ferry but newly painted. Only 5-8 mins from hk island to Tsim Sha Tsui - super convenient! Best place to see skylines on both hk island and Kowloon too.

The Best, Cheapest Ride in the World. As long as I live, I'll always pine for a trip on the Star Ferry. I know the MTR is faster, but nothing can describe the view or feeling when pulling into Central or Kowloon.
Cheap cheap. Great way to get across the river and its cheap cheap!! Fastest way is the mtr though so in true who wants to be a millionaire style, the choice is yours!

Cheap and a good cheap way to get a good perspective. Great trip, very cheap, good perspective of the city. Interesting seeing all the river traffic from the waterline. people in suits going to work etc.

You haven't experienced Honk Kong without taking a ride on the Star Ferry. Catching the star ferry always makes me feel like I am part of this great metropolis.
It gives you a sense of participating in a daily local experience.
It's a great outing at very little expense, and is easy as the ferries run regularly.
Take a long ride or short it's up to you.

Typical Way from HK to Kowloong... Hi guys, we went from HK to Kowloong using the Star Ferry the first night we arrived in HK for our honeymoon. In my imagination this ferry was only a touristic attraction but I was really surprised to see a lot of HK people using it to go from HK to Kowloong. It is a good experience and a typical way to go form the island to the continent...enjoy your trip and be careful from the big birds... ;-)!!
Good Experience. Crossing from Kowloon to Hong Kong island and vice versa. A different experience compare if we are using MTR. It is cheap with a great view.

charming old hong kong experience. It take the star ferry on a regular basis. it always a pleasure to see the HK skyline at any time but I feel it is be viewed at night. make sure you sit on the upper deck if you want to enjoy the aircon.

A Must Do. Simply a must-do, the historic ferry is cheap as chips, gives you amazing views across the harbor and takes you between Central Ferry Piers on HK Island and TST and its shopping and the views of HK Island. Take the ferry over for a sunset stroll gazing at the skyline. It is superb.
best tour of the harbour. Cheapest way to get the best view of the harbour.You can grab the ferry from Harbour city mall a great shopping spot on the way to star ferries

This is a 'can't miss' in HK. If you even have only a few hours in Hong Kong, don't miss out on this beautiful ride across Victoria Harbor. I was able to go a round trip after dark, and the lights of the city and Harbor were spectacular.
The Iconic Star Ferry. Not much to say here other than if you are visiting Hong Kong you just have to board the Star Ferry for a trip across the water.

Fun and Cheap. The ferry runs about every 10 minutes. The ferry has an upper deck and a lower deck. The upper deck is 2.50 HK$ and the lower deck is 2 HK$. The upper deck has an air-conditioned area. There are machines at the entrance to obtain a token for the trip. Seniors (over 65) are free.

Affordable, fast and efficient.. A very historic thing. If you go to HK you cant say you have been there if you havent been on Star Ferry. You can ride upper deck or lower deck. Lower desk is half price. Lower deck can have some bad smell from the engines.
A must for any visit. Try both deck, upper in slightly more expensive but lower you can see the wheel house and the engine, theres no connection between decks once you're aboard.
A Hong Kong must do. Cheap and cheerful the Star Ferries travel across Victoria Harbour from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island on a regular basis.
Cheapest Harbor ferry ride. Always a pleasure to ride the ferry between Hongkong and Kowloon with fantastic view of the harbor and the skylines of both sides.

Simple and easy to use. We took the TST across from the Island to the mainland. It was easy to use and very cheap 25pence to go one way and 20pence on the way back! Very regular crossings.. Old ferry's but it only takes a few minutes and they do the job well.
A must do when in Hong Kong. No trip to Hong Kong is complete without a trip on the Star ferry across to HK island, great views only takes 10 minutes plus very cheap.
WORTH DOING. Nice taking the ferry across. Beautiful views and very smooth. Easy way to go from one side of the island to another.
Great experience in pennies.... Very good and economical connectivity between 2 islands. It is a great feel with nice views of both the islands. A must experience for travellers

You have to. Really, you can't go to Hong Kong and skip the ferry ride. Besides being a cheap and easy way to cross the harbor, you get a fantastic view of both sides. Ride early in the morning for a misty view and ride in the evening for the best view of the buildings and lights. Bonus: in July the sea breeze is refreshing.

Great value Great photo opportunities. We traveled both from Wan Chai and central piers to TST piers in Kowloon.Used our octopus card for fast and effortless boarding. Chose the upper deck to get good views as we crossed the harbour .Excellent views to be had and we made the journey in the both the day and night . Fantastic photo opportunities to be had on the classic ferry.

A good way to see the bay and cross the channel to central. Easy to take and fast, it is a good way to have a view of the city.
The 2 stages are ok even if the seats on the low floor are hard.
Never get tired of the star ferry . Whenever we visit HK we love using the star ferry. It's old fashioned basic travel that is magical, particularly at night to sit back and take in the magical neon!
Iconic trip for any visitor to HK. With tunnels and MTR, the Star Ferry should have disappeared years ago, but well done to HK for keeping it running. Cheap and great fun to do.

Just a must in HK. Old the boats may be but they have a turn of speed and are well run by the crews. An icon of HK and must on your bucket list. Look for the signs and take the upper deck entry ramps for a better view of the harbour. And use your oyster card for 'speedy boarding'.

Old times feeling. Come on, don't go to HK and skip the channel crossing by the Star ferry.The boats are build just after the WWII and they give you a taste of the old times.Please notice that everything is designed to be bi-directionals, including the seatbacks of the benches (you must have a look).A cheap way to cross from TTS and Central.
star ferry. Brilliant and cheap service across the harbour from kowloon to hong kong island side that works a treat. Cheap quick economicle and pleasant

10 minutes of pleasure. a must do whilst in hong kong is to travel on the ferries across the harbour, oldish but still comfortable. your trip will take 10 - 20 minutes depending on your choice. fabulous views. clean and friendly service and cheap. make sure you have an octopus card for quicker access and to avoid having to buy tokens.

very nice experience. Of course, when people want to go from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central, they now use to take the MTR.But before everybody was taking the Star Ferry, still in use.Don't miss this experience !!!It take just a few minutes from Kowloon peninsula to Central, on Hong Kong Island.And the short ride through Victoria Harbour is so nice...

Great Way to See the Harbour. It was our first time to Hong Kong so we decided to take a cruise on the Star Ferry. It wasn't expensive and in the ticket you were given a drink and biscuits.It was raining while we were on the ferry but it was still a great view over the city. Occasionally the sky would clear and we caught glimpses of Victoria Peak. There was plenty of seating inside and out, some of which was under cover. The commentary was excellent and very informative.

Wind in my hair. Ahh it was lovely crossing on this charming ferry. The breeze was refreshing and the view awe inspiring. Definitely experience this mode of transport it's worth it, not only for the experience and photo opportunity, but also the price 2hk $...
Has to be done as iconic to Hong Kong. You need to do this at night to see all the lights across the harbour. Great photo opertunities as cross to kowloon.

Star ferry. They are Terry's built in the 1950 onwards era and operate between Hong Kong and Victoria harbour. I recommend getting an octopus card from the nearest underground terminal and loading about £50 to £100 onto it then all travel most purchases in food shops is just a swop away brilliant system
ok-ish. Not that fancy. It's nice to get across but it's not that special and metro is available and faster.

Same great service. This is the best value in asia $2hk for a trip across the water to or from the island. Great fun lots of hustle and bustle, has been the same for 50 years that I have been doing it.

The Star Ferry......brilliant, ever since 1888.. A tranquil moment on the water in the heart of bustling Hong Kong is warmly recommended. Great views of the fast changing Kowloon waterfront and, in reverse, the inspiring skyline of Central. On a sunny day, beneath a clear blue sky, the dragon slumbers.

Must do it if in Hong Kong . This is a traditional long standing way of travelling to Victoria harbour but we'll worth it. It's quick and provides great views of the city. You get a chance to mingle with the locals. I do it every time I'm in the city. Only cost 2.5 dollars.

Very Efficient and Easy Way To Travel. Star Ferry is an inexpensive, fast, and reliable way to travel between Central and Kowloon. There's no frills for a less than 5 minute ride but is located in the prime area on both sides of the harbor.
Cheap, fast, cool views.. Love the ferry. So nice to sit back and feel the wind and take in the views. Crosses the harbor in 10 minutes or so.

A fun crossing of Victoria Harbour. This is a quick ferry ride, but a longstanding tradition on very old man but well maintained old ferries. We chose the upper deck (costs more) but appreciated not only the view but also the well preserved wood detailing and benches on the Star Ferry. When you step off, step into Harbour City for a taste of Hong Kongers' penchant for super luxury brand sand shopping. Quite a contrast to the traditional ferry. The Star Ferry, a must do when in Hong Kong.

Travel with the locals. A great way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. A busy ferry where you mix with the locals. Great at night for taking photos of water front lights. All for the bargain price of £0.20!
Great way to see the harbor!. Very relaxing and way to see the entire coastline. Recommend the night tour in order to see the HK skyline at night!

Cheap and efficient. Gets the job done.
Cheap and efficient way to get across, and you can use the Octopus card.
Comfortable seating and smooth sailing end to end.

Great experience. I visit Hong Kong regularly and always make a point of riding the star ferry from central to Kowloon. The ferry is a rare bit of history in a city where there are very few historic buildings etc. Also it is very cheap and has excellent views of the harbour.

Still as good as it was decades ago. A quick and slightly nostalgic way to cross between HK island and Kowloon. Regular, traditional, and allows you to take a short break from life as you cross the straight. Super cheap.

The way to go!. This is an iconic way of crossing from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and back and the views are amazing!You need to buy a ticket from a machine or have an Octopus card and the fares are very cheap do go upstairs rather than the cheaper option of downstairs because of the views of Hong Kong. If coming back when its is dark sit at the back and face Hong Kong Island as you then see all the buildings which are lit at night.A great way to travel and such fun a must for any visitor to Hong Kong!

Definitely a must try mode of transportation. No visit to Hong Kong will be complete without trying the Star Ferry. It is very cheap and easy access from Kowloon to HK Island and vice-versa. It feels so nostalgic and relaxing at the same time riding on the Star Ferry. Definitely a must try for every visitor of Hong kong. Don't miss this cheap mode of transportation.
Must do in Hongkong. Whenever you are in Hongkong at least one ride with the Star Ferry is a Must Do! Old but well maintained ships, fantastic view - feels really historic.

nice views, easily accessible. comfortable ride across the victoria harbourthe ferry is kind of old, don't expect much in terms of luxuryone-way for 3.4HKD on a public holiday, cheaper at 2.5 if normal working dayshort ride across the harbour with good viewsgets crowded sometiems with people rushing and pushing for the window seats
Fun cheap way to get on the water. A slower way to cross than the subway, but also cheaper. If you have the time, why not cross in a ferry. No frills but some good photo opportunities along the way.

Hong Kong's Old-fashioned harbour transportation.. The Star Ferry is popular with tourists to see the skyline of HK Island from a different view and great to feel the bobbing up and down on the water. It is also a cheap means of transportation for locals to ride across to and from Tsim Sha Tsui(TST).
Brilliant! Must do. Absolute must do for a first time trip to HK. We went at night and loved it! price was fair and included one free drink - stay out on deck for best photo oppertunities
Cheap way to get to Hong Kong Island from Kowloon and vice versa. Not only is this a practical way of travelling between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon but this is the most scenic way as well.

Iconic Hong Kong Transportation. Star Ferry is an inexpensive and efficient way to cross Hong Kong Harbor from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. It is the iconic mode of transportation which has been in existence for more than a century. Adult fares are about 2.5 - 3.5 HK$ depending on the day, seniors (65+ with ID card) are free. It is a popular way to cross the harbour for the locals because it is cheap, efficient, and fast. The 10 minute trip to HK Central district starts from the Star Ferry Terminal or pier next to the Kowloon Clock Tower. Try out the Star Ferry for a relaxing way to cross the Hong Kong harbour and back. It is a must see and experience for anyone visiting Hong Kong both during the day or at night. Absolutely recommendable attraction.

A rocking experience!. I was supposed to say a rock n roll experience but, hey, the rocking of the boat is the usual. I'm a fan of the sea so it really doesn't bother me. But for those with sea sickness, better observe the waves first before riding. It's only a 20-minute ride or less. Enjoy it for a change... And literally change in terms of the fare from Kowloon to the Hong Kong CBD and back.

Wonderful experience. We took the Star Ferry twice, while at Hong Kong. From Tsim Sha Tsui to the Central area and back. Having the Octopus card helps. Even though we were there during Chinese New Year and there were tons of people, I was impressed with how well they have organized it. One doesn't feel the crowds and it is managed very efficiently. The ride after sun set was particularly scenic and I would say do this at least once while at Hong Kong

Cheap and very effective!. Visited HK a few times before, and like everyone else, used the Star Ferry to get to the Island and back from Kowloon. It costs HK$2.50 a trip (on the upper deck), so is very cheap; it runs every few minutes, so you won't have to wait long; and although it's pretty basic, as the ferries were built nearly 60 years ago, it's atmospheric, and it's fun!
Star Ferry. It was our first time taking the Star Ferry from TST to Central. It was a great experience! We cant wait to do it again!!
Safe and efficient. Used this ferry as part of the Big Bus tour. Hardly any waiting even though we used the ferry during Chinese New Year

A must do whilst in Hong Kong. Lovely day out on the water, really enjoyed the ferry, so easy and cheap, it really is a must when you go to Hong Kong, gives you such a different perspective of the lay out and the many many high rise apartments. It takes about 7 minutes to get from the Exhibition building over to Kowloon, super quick and a great photo opportunity.
.. Cool views and very cheap way to cross over from HK island to Kowloon side. Also a great fish and chips restaurant on the central side I thoroughly recommend! White Beard fish and chips!

Cheap way to see the best harbour views of Hong Kong. Hong Kong is a city built around the beautiful Victoria harbour. the best way to get a real feel for it is to take the Star Ferry from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui. For about $0.50 US the trip takes about 10 min to cross from one side to the other, amazing value!

Convenient way of crossing the harbor.. We tried to catch the light show using the ferry but made a mistake estimating the time it takes for the ferry to cross the harbor. That being said it is a short trip around 5-10 minutes from the star ferry harbor to the other side, so it is a fast and cheap way of getting from Tsim Sha Tsui to the other side (Central I think).

Just makes sense to cross this way. We (group of 5 20-somethings) used the Star Ferry 3 or 4 times while in HK over Chinese New Year and it is just the best way to cross between HK island and Tsim Sha Tsui. The ferry is cheaper than the metro, offers great views, and is easy to access. The trip only takes about 10minutes or less and we never had to queue longer than 15 minutes to get onto the ferry even during New Year time. In contrast, the metro was far busier.
Best at night. Cheap and by cheap I mean 2 HKD cheap you get the best view in town, go at night and see Hong Kong in all its glory!the lower level is cheaper and less snobby tourist

Life on the open waves. Great way to cross Victoria harbour. The little Ferry with old world feel and it's flipping seats is a great way of getting from central/wan chi to TST and great photo opportunities.. Worth it

an institution. Ok its a '5' minute ferry crossing, but its a must to do when in Hong Kong. For 'no money' you get to ride on an institution and see the incredible skyline of the city. It hasn't changed in years! In this world of technology ands sophistication this is a simple, pretty basic vessel with low level comfort but that's part of the attraction. Even the chugging old engines are wonderful to hear.

Best thing to do in spare time. The star ferry has been one of the major means of transportation for citizens between Hong Kong island and Kowloon Penisular for years. With now 3 cross Harbour tunnels and MTR train, the ferry has repositioned and caters more for tourists and leisure seeking citizens. It sails from early morning to midnight between the two major CBD, namely Tsim Sha Tsui on the Kowloon side and Central on the island side. For a small loose change it takes you for a 10 minutes sail and you can enjoy the slow and short ride on the old but properly maintain ferry boats. Scenery along the sail will be spectacular especially during early evening when all the lights of the skyscrapers in the CBDs are switched on.If one has more time to kill there are big shopping malls ( IFC ON Hong Kong and Harbour City on Kowloon) next to either end of the ferry where you can spend a full day or two shopping, dining and / or even catching on movies.

Best nickel I spent since Staten Island ferry was a nickel. This is a spectatular ride for the view and people watching, make sure you buy a octopus card which brings cost down to pennies.Check out Maritime Museum on Hong Kong side, but enjoy the view of ship traffic you will see ever thing from Huge cranes, junks to ocean going cruise ships

Cheapest sightseeing in HK!. The locals and tourist alike, can enjoy the leisurely crossing of Hong Kong bay from Kowloon to the island. For just a couple of HK dollars this 10-15 minute ride will give you a good view of the HK skyline and a refreshing breeze. On both sides the ferry docks in the heart of the city near all the tourist sites. The ferries come and go very frequently, so barely any waiting time and it is easy to find your way around and get the tokens from the vending machines. If you are crossing the bay, this is the way!
Great one day 1. take your camara and absorb the great views of the bay. Great way to start you HK trip! Not exprensive at all, buy your tickets near place you board on the HK island side.

Great way to see the harbor. Really enjoyable to cross the harbor on the old ferry. Most locals take the faster, more efficient MTR. But for a relaxing inexpensive ride across the harbor, the ferry can't be beat.

Easy and fun. We used the Star Ferry to get to Hong Kong from Kowloon. A fun trip for a few dollars. It's easy to get the ferry on the Kowloon side and it brings you directly to the Central District on the Hong Kong side. It should be noted, that you can also take the subway which is much faster but with a different sort of view.

Only way to go. Star ferry is a very convenient way to cross the bay. You can see all the famous buildings for a very reasonable ticket price. Senior citizens travel free. Take the top deck and sit anywhere. You can tilt the seats to suit which way you want to sit. Foodies and shoppers can disembark into the fabulous shopping malls on the island.
The cheapest way to discover the HK bay. Every time we go to HK, we use the ferry as often as possible and enjoy it every time.Really cheap, fast and efficient with a great scenery!

Views of Amazing Skyline for less than a Dollar. For just 3 HKD, one can take the ten minute ferry ride from one side of the Hong Kong Harbor to the other. From these vintage ferries, one views the gorgeous Hong Kong skyline during either the day or night(suggest sampling both!). There's little not to like...views, ocean, interesting people-watching. Shopaholics can catch or take the ferry to Central(shops galore) or to Tsim Sha Tsui (more shops and malls). In the latter, one can extend the view and walk along the facilities outside of the Cultural Center. If wishing to avoid the shops and commotion, one can catch the ferry to Wanchai and enjoy the exhibits at the Convention Center.

Just try!. I just wanted to experience the ferry in Hongkong! So I took Star Ferry from Hongkong Island to Kowloon (X plus harbour city). There were a lot of people.It took about 15mins to get to another pier. It moved slowly. I wish I took it at night! I felt a little bit sick, because it was rocky ride! However it is good to try in Hongkong!

A must try for all . When traveling from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon there are many ways of transportation, but none with the views of the harbor like Star Ferry. If you get sea sick easily I highly don't recommend taking this ride as the harbor is usually very rocky. I also recommend taking this ferry at night verses the daytime because of the famous night city views. Oh yeah, one last thing, Don't forget your camera... Have fun!

The Star Ferry . This is one of the best ferry trips in the world. It's super cheap, only about HK$3! It's great at any time of the day, giving you the most spectacular views of one of the world's best and most famous skylines. Amazing at night, especially if you can time your crossing for eight in the evening when you'll catch the evening light show. This is a wonderful light display using lasers and floodlights from the tops of the buildings around the harbour and farther afield.
Tours and trips. This ferry services does trips between the mainland and the island . Such trips are regular , fast and cheap . They also do a tour of the bay in English . It's ok .

A highly cost efficient and nice ride you should have. Using the Star Ferry to cross the harbor, you could see a very very nice view with only a few bucks. The scenes during sunset and night are totally different but you can enjoy two different feeling! Except train and tram in Hong Kong, Star Ferry is another most valuable ride to have a snap shot in Hong Kong. Go enjoy it!

Forget Disneyland!. Hong Kong is a living breathing Disneyland, and the Star Ferry is one of its best rides; and for roughly a couple Hong Kong Dollars at that! Day or night, I enjoy taking the Star Ferry not just to get across Victoria Harbor, but for the pleasure of it. The views are great, there are always interesting things to see in the water, from Dinghies to cargo ships. It's a nice neutral zone between Hong Kong Island and Kownloon, too. Sometimes, I'll just go back and forth for the heck of it.Aside from the exhaust coming from the engines, there is nothing I'd change about the Star Ferry.
Crossing Victoria Harbour by ferry. I didn't know that the upper deck was priced higher than the lower deck but nonetheless, it was an enjoyable alternative in going back to Tsim Sha Tsui.

A must when visiting Hong Kong. The old traditional way to cross Hong Kong harbour, just awesome. With all the new tunnels build in the last few decades and the MTR this ferry service is more a nostalgic way to go from Kowloon to the Island and vice versa, you will not regret.

best kept secret-cheapest ride with great view of Hong Kong Harbour.. AN Absolute must in HK- Costs 30 cents US and gives you a nice view of Hong Kong Harbour. No need to take the tourist cruise rides. as you sail you will appreciate Hong Kong skyline. Also the best way to travel between Central, Hong Kong Island and Tsim Sha Tsui, the most popular tourist areas in Hong Kong . Easily accessible with a ride every 15-20 mins.

Best way to see the harbor. Almost free, this short ride between Kowloon and Hong Kong is a must for anyone visiting the city. The panoramic views of the from the water are breathtaking. Best on a sunny day.
A must at night. Part of the Hong Kong experience.Quick on off at each side and a good view of the lights on the way. cheap!

Quick way to get over to Kowloon.. We found the ferry to be a quick and easy way to reach Kowloon from downtown HK. It is open to the weather with no windows or heat, so the unusually chilly weather made for a shivering ride. It was FAST though!
Yes, yes, yes!. This is amazing and the trip across the harbour is a must do in Hong Kong. It's so cheap. About 20p each way! The trip is just out of this world at night time.
Worth Trying. An interesting experienve in Hong Kong. You don't need tp buy a cruise, can feel a bit of sailing. Authentic or old.
Great experience. Good way to get to Kowloon and very reasonable, very well organised and good timetables would defiantly recommend it.

A must-do for all visitors, but getting a little less attractive. The Star Ferry services from Tsimshatsui to Central and Wanchai on the Island side - particularly the former - have been a must-do for all visitors to Hong Kong for decades. The recent extensive land reclamation on the Island side not only made the ride shorter, but also made the walk from the pier to the business area much much longer, to the point of being a little boring: a lot of people find the underground a lot more desirable for efficiency for crossing the harbour. That said, it's as much of the heart and soul of Hong Kong, much like Time Square in NYC, and has to be experienced.

old ferries new views. after reading about the ferries and the way it worked it was a surprise how quickly we were able to get around on the harbour as well as under it the air was fresh and views interesting

Worth it!. We travelled between Central Hong Kong and Kowloon. We took a cab from the hotel to the pier. The token for the ride across was 3 hkd. EXTREMELY reasonable. And once out on the water, you get a great perspective if the Hong Kong skyline. The trip was also very quick and dropped us right where we needed to be. Great way to transport around the city.There is somewhat of a gauntlet you have to traverse through once you exit the ferry of vendors hawking tailoring and watches. So beware and watch for pick pockets. Lots of crowds on this beautiful day.
So cheap and easy!. We used this to pop across the bay and it really is cheap, easy and very pleasant when the weather is good!
Cheap as chips. Don't take taxis from HK to Kowloon, this ferry costs about 20p to cross. It only takes five minutes. Bargain!

Travelling back in time. This has to be one of the best attractions in Hong Kong that is never impacted by all the development going on around it. A great way to get a view of both sides.MTR is a lot quicker but the Star Ferry takes you back in time.
Relaxing . This is a relaxing and nice way to get from one side to the other. It's cheap and you get a good view of the city. It's easy to use

Must try transportation. It was a short but fun ride, my daughter enjoyed it. Tickets are included once you avail the Big Bus tour plus there's special line though normal line for passengers are not that long.

Something Different. Its convenient and not as crowded as the MTR. Something a bit different to your regular travel method so it will be a bit interesting. You d come across good photo opportunities so it might be interesting.

cheap to kowloon and hk. you can go in few minutes from Kowloon to hk and vice versa very nice , cheap, a and easy way to cross with a nice view you can also cross by metro, but here you get the view of the city from the water

Good alternative to cross from one side of HK to the other. There is a special charm to taking this traditional way of crossing from one side of Hong Kong to the other. If you're crossing over from the Kowloon to the Hong Kong side and the IFC is your destination, the ferry will take you right to the IFC's doorstep. Enjoy the view of the HK skyline while you make the crossing. Don't forget that your Octopus card also works for this mode of transport.
Must see . It's a good ride from Kowloon to Hong Kong side and it's super reasonable and doesn't it too long. The view is great and it barely takes 10minutes. You cut the traffic!

Very good service!!. The Star ferry service from Hong Kong Central to Tsim sha sui is a must for tourists visiting Hong Kong. The ride is pretty cheap 2.5 HKD per person. The ride is like 10 minutes long and gives you wonderful view of Hong Kong both the sides.
Wonderful trip. I loved the star ferry it was more than wonderful.its really very cheapFor a trip like this.we payed 2.5 hkd for adult and 1.5 hkd for the kids.
Wow. Star ferry in Hong Kong is a must!!! My boy really loved the boat ride across and the view is spectacular! Was very cheap and fast, but not too fast that you couldn't enjoy it.
Easy to navigate. This is an easy way to see both Kowloon and Hong Kong. Inexpensive and clean mode of transportation. It is very scenic. Lots to do around the harbor city where you catch the ferry

A great way to travel. This is a really enjoyable way to get around the city. The view of the city you get from the ferries is just breathtaking. We took a ride during the "symphony of lights" and that was a lot of fun too.
Excellent transport. Excellent, efficient and very cheap. Definitely a must do in Hong Kong. However, we went over for the light show which was not very good.

Convenient & Value. What a great way to cross over and return from Kowloon to HK Island. For just a few coins you get a harbour cruise to various points of embarkation depending on where you'd want to go. Choose the upper deck for just a little more bang for buck. Insert your coins in the machine, press a few buttons and it spits out your token. Fantastic views.

Fun & Old. This old boat service is fun. Touristy but well worth the 2.5 HKD price. Be sure to ride on top deck to avoid the smell and fumes from the old diesel exhaust engines. Wonderful views at night!

Fast, smooth, nostalgic and good price to sum up this means of transport. It takes not more than 10 minutes to cross the Victoria habour with very good price which has 2 catagories as for the upperdeck and the lower deck.Unfortunately, I forgot the exact fare cost, but absolutely fantastic price. Just comment on the inconvenience on the walking distance from the Central to the ferry pier takes a little bit time.

An extension of the excellent transport system. Very efficient as all public transport is, it's a great way to travel between HK island and Kowloon. With our Octopus cards we went by subway there and the ferry back to get a different perspective on the skyline.
An iconic trip. Has to be done inexpensive way to get a great view of the city and to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong.
Cheap way to travel across to Kowloon. We used this most days. Very frequent and ideal. Cheap way to get across to Kowloon. Lovely view of harbour at night

The Star Ferry experience. When I last visited Hong Kong in 1969 the Star Ferry was the only practical link for visitors and residents alike travelling between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon and vice versa. In those days the ferry was invariably packed. Now with car, bus and subway options available the Star Ferry is hardly crowded but it offers spectacular views from the harbour. The crossing barely takes 5 minutes from either the Central Pier complex or Wan Chai. In tourist terms the Star Ferry represents significant value for money ie it is very cheap!
Good. Its one of the oldest way of getting to Kowloon from Hong Kong. Its really cheap and gives good views of the city. I saw Star Cruises Pieces Docked.

Nice crossing. It costs HK $2 per person to ride this 10 minute ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island, and the same back again. It provides lovely views and a nice breeze and is insanely cheap which we loved.
Getting around. So quick. Beautiful ride across Victoria Harbour. Very cheap. We frequently used the Ferry. My mother of 77 travelled with us. Seniors travel free on the ferry.
Go at Night. Star ferry is a lovely way to get across the river. Go at night for beautiful views (see photo) and enjoy!
How can you not take the Star Ferry?. This is an iconic trip across Victoria Harbor. You get the best views of the harbor and the skyline on Hong Kong side as well as Kowloon side.
Cheaper alternative to subway with more views. Whenever we can, we take the starferry. Its cheaper than a subway and more scenic. Great way to travel across victoria harbour
Great view of the city. A short ferry ride to Tsim Sha Tsui was great. There two decks and we got to sit at the upper deck with good view.

Good way to see the harbour. If you want to see Victoria Harbour this is the best way to do it. Not expensive because the locals use it to get from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. Very good way to get across and see the harbour at the same time.

Safe Ride. I love riding the Star Ferry crossing Hong Kong and Kowloon. I am scared of riding ferry's except this one because you can see the other side of your destination, its not far only a few minutes on the ride and you're there. even if the weather is not good the ferry can stand winds and high waves. this is a fun and quick ride and you get to enjoy the scenic views while you wait.
Interesting way to see how the locals commute. Great view of Hong Kong Island arriving by boat.It is inexpensive and more pleasant than the train.

Short break. Very good and interesting rides to and from kowloon island. The ferries are vintage which gives the island hopping a sense of history. The trips are always on time and a pleasure to take.

no trip to Hong Kong is complete without it. this is one of the "must do"s" - a step back in time, the ferry boats are old and used, but well kept, and even the seats have a star drilled into them, and the back's fold, so you can always sit in the right direction (the ferry doesn't turn around)
Star Ferry. Always fun to take the ferry across Victoria Harbour. A must day or night to see the sights and mix with tourists and locals.
Star Ferry. The Star Ferry is a great way to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong. The ferries were very reliable as far as time and they were very clean. Easily accessible as well.

Check It Out. It's not as fast as taking the MTR from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island, but I think this is a "must do" as part of your Hong Kong visit. The Star Ferry has been featured in several movies plus it will give you some nice photo ops during the crossing.
Hong Kong in a minute. I love taking this. I go back and forth a lot of times just to let myself drag along. The skyline, the life on the water, the sky, the weather and the people...

Ferry. We used star ferries to cross from Hong Kong to Kowloon and back. The ferry was on time and a good frequent service. Very helpful member of staff on hand to help us get tokens from the machine which was very good. Ferry basic but very short crossing.

Great view fo the harbour. You must take the Star Ferry at least once when you are in Hong Kong, especially night time. This will give you a fantastic view of the harbour with all the lights on. It's cheap. The crossing is relatively short.

To meet my friend in Tsim Sha Tsui. I suggest to extend the sailing time during peak season/holidays. Overall, I enjoy it. I sailed from Central and knew that it's only until 11:30pm. I don't understand why they wouldn't extend it when there were numerous people who needed a ride.
Great old ferry, full of history. Great old ferry, full of history. Must be the best and cheapest way to see Hong Kong. Don't visit Hong Kong without a ride on the Star Ferry.

Charming views. Definitely a must do in HK. Stunning views over HK scyscrapers and the bay. The price is extremely low and definitely well spent. It is also a charming way to go from Kowloon to HK island and vice versa.

Cheap & efficient. You can use your Octopus card to travel on the ferry as well as trams & MTR subway. Great to get to Kowloon on the train at dusk & get ferry over to Hong Kong Island. The night time views across are awesome!

Loved this Trip. I love the idea of jumping on and off a ferry and this is great. It is obviously used by locals crossing daily form Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. It is really cheap - I think it was less than a euro. You get a great view of the skyline and also the passing boats make this a well worthwhile way to travel in Hong Kong
Its a Must. just a great experience for what is 25p... we did it at night and the views across the harbour were fantastic
Must do this!. A quick inexpensive trip between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. A contrast to new buildings and expensive shops. Good fun and views
Short trip across the bay!. Short cheap boat trip across to Kowloon from Central. Worth it just for the views of Hong Kong island from the water!
traditional, and quite scenic. For $2, how can you go wrong. Departures are every 7 minutes in peak hours, and it is worth the adventure alone.
Efficient and safe transport . Highly recommend using the ferry - very easy to use and very cheap. Best way to travel to and from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Minimum waiting time.
Cheapest way to heavenly view . Who says that best things don't come cheap..just ride a star ferry and enjoy the Hong Kong skyline.. For $2.5 this is the value for money!!
Create Your Memory in Hong Kong. Timeless, efficient , local, and gives you time between meetings across the harbor to see the area as a local.
Atmospheric ferry ride. Part of visiting Hong Kong so a must do - cheap fare to Kowloon and back - ride with the locals and the visitors

A trip across time.....and across the harbor . The price is right, the sights are great, the ferries are from another era, the crossing is pleasant, the schedule is unbeatable.....we loved the Star Ferry!

Delightful. having been on the MTR at rush hour being squeezed into a small space this is an utter delight in a method of transport to get you over to HK Island. Make sure you get an upper deck seat to enjoy the journey.

See Hong Kong from the harbor. Easy must do in Hong Kong- traditional old ferries between Central and Kowloon, you travel with local commuters and see a lot. Better I think than a programmed tour but same company also offers that, and the night tour is interesting. If nothing else just take a quick round trip on the ferry to better understand Hong Kong. Clusters of small shops at each end, Kowloon terminal is next to art museum and space museum
They do what they say they will. The boats are old but they work and you feel safe and I even went on the harbour tour as well as going to and from Hong Kong island.
Easy and fast. Very convenient to go and return to the Hong Kong island. Safe and cheap. Just some coins. Day time or night time you can take some beautiful pics from boat.

Cheap, convenient, and great views.. You really should make time to see the light show whilst in HK, and this ferry provides a quick, easy, (and cheap!) way across the Harbour. Some great views are to be had here (better than the MTR). It runs until almost midnight I believe, with ferries bring very regular.
Quick and easy. Great way to travel between kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Cheap and easy. Great views. Friendly staff to help purchasing tokens and to get on and off.
Bay tour. This is the best and cheapest way to see Hong Kong harbor. An informative narrative on a historic ferry. Great value

Travel like a local. Convenient and cheap way to get across between Kowloon & HK Island.
Run at regular times so don't have to wait very long if you find one has just left.
Inexpensive way to cross the harbour. Fast crossing of the harbour using historic ferry. Cheap by Hong Kong standards. One of the terminus is high end fashion mall in Kowloon.

Once or many times. Take the Star ferry to visit the other side of the Harbor or just to ride and enjoy the view. Mornings and nights are great times to see the harbor waking up for the work day or coming alive for the night and what it may bring. Yes this in not the big harbor of the 60's and 70's when I first saw it but it is still a sight to see. No longer to you land down the side of a mountain when you fly in but instead land at the new International airport. Many changes but still an adventure.

Lots of Fun, Local Color. We really enjoyed the views and comfortable short ride, and it's almost ludicrously inexpensive, but even more than that, the star ferry is used by numerous local commuters and provides a revealing glimpse into the heart of the city and the people who live there.

A delightful way to get to Hong Kong from Kowloon. Best to avoid rush hours when the ferries become the domain of the locals. A great platform for photographing the spectacular skylines of Hong Kong and Kowloon.
Fun trip. It was actually October 2007 and was on it for a night ride to see the skyline. Fast transportation and loved the system they have of using the octapus card for everything
Iconic. It's a must. A beautiful (cheap) way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong. You could take the subway, but why? The views are magnificent. Do it.
Quick and Spectacular. Wow, great views during this short ferry ride. And the. Price is right at HKD2.80! The Kowloon side has great photo taking views back to Hong Kong. So very worthwhile. Do It!!

World best ferry. Ive always loved this ferry between Kowloon & HK Island, the bottom deck is only $2 HKD which we prefer as the sides are open and you get a more "unique" experience. The upper deck is only $2.5 HKD its a closed deck with windows, no wind,rain or petrol smells, usually plenty of seats too.

like home. taking the ferry from Kowloon to hong kong reminded me of the ferry from Birkenhead to Liverpool a short and enjoyable journey with the fantastic skyline of hong kong in the distance athough only a short journey one that I would recomend

The best way to see the harbour. I must first confess to loving old boats,they chug across the harbour and sound magnificent, the seats are rustic and the ferries are ancient but very safe and all for $0.25 Australian

Cheap, frequent, relaxing. Taking a star ferry is always a good way to explore HK, it's bormally pretty relaxing and quiet and you would have a seat most of the time. Whether it is in the morning or evening. The view from HK side or from Kowloon side are both nice. It's quite frequent that you don't need to wait for a long time. And If I have time, I would take this to go across the harbour than a Mtr

One hour cruise, relaxing. Took the one hour cruise with star ferry on a cold rainy day. Was a nice way to spend some time out of the weather, cruising the harbour. More comfortable than the normal ferry and the commentary was informative. Would recommend for first time visitors.

One of the last bits of history in HK. And therefore a simple must. While the harbour is increasingly looking like a pond given the landfill projects and the skyline is ever changing, the Star Ferry still shuttle people back and forth to the island from Kowloon. The HK skyline is best appreciated from the water and/or the other side of the harbour. Yes you can take the MTR of a taxi but where's the fun in that?! Seeing the traditionally dressed staff jabber in Cantonese as they throw the lines is much more fun. The unique two way technology that allows these boats to go back and forth without turning is also interesting. As a result, the deck chairs flip back and forth depending on the direction. Note: Oyster cards work. Take the upper not lower deck.

Best tourist attraction in the world. Nothing beats the Star Ferry. For 3 HKD you get the best view of one of the most exciting cities in the world. A skyline better than Manhattan, at a price of nothing! Fantastic. Both day and night.

Bargain transportation!. For approximately 40 cents U.S. you can take the ferry across the harbor. The ferry runs often, the boats are clean and efficient. It's the least expensive water tour I ever taken!
Smooth Sailing. This is a cheap and easy way to get from Kowloon to HK Island. Make sure you have exact change. At rush hour it can get a bit busy.

A brief but interesting ride. The Star Ferry operates between Central on Hong Kong Island and Tsim Sha Tsui on the other side of the harbor. It is a short ride, but interesting. People with a seniors' Octopus Card travel free.
Original Hong KOng. One of the most tasteful corners left in Hong Kong. Don't miss the opportunity to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong

So cheap to travel and so rewarding. This is one of the shortest journeys you might experience in HK but its is so steeped in history the occasion feels special and the views of HK and Kowloon are breath takings. You could go back and forth all day and never get bored.
Just another ferry. Just another ferry, did not live up to expectations. Try the ride at night to view the skyline lights.

I hate this when I was a child; love this now. Riding a ferry really made me so dizzy when I was still a child so I really hate this mode of transportation. Until when I grew older when I enjoyed every trips I took with these ferries. I love sitting near the windows and having fresh air. This is a great experience when you're a tourist.

Good transportation, great view, faster than mtr (in my case).. The star ferry is convenient if you travel from wanchai to Tsim Sha Tsui. From the Hong Kong convention and exhibition Centre to Harbour city, it will only take 20min. That's faster than going up and down the subway for the same destination. It's also a good touristic experience (central-Tsim Sha Tsui). I recommend the upper deck, because there is no gasoline smell.

Ray Ride. We were on the Star ferry twice, but not on the same day. We were on the Kowloon side, so we took a ride to Hongkong to meet some friends and the another day when we went to Macau, both trips were very nice and smooth, and the view was breathless.

Great way to see the city. We took the star ferry on our first full day in Hong Kong and we're happy that we did. It gives you a great perspective on how vast the city is and how it is laid out. It takes just under an hour and was very reasonably priced. Included in your admission is a canned beverage and a snack. You may sit inside or stand out on the front or back deck. We took the 12:15 ferry and there were only about 8-10 other travelers on board. They play a recorded informational to point out the major buildings along the way so you know what you are looking at. Very informative and a great view, I would definitely recommend!

Best value in Hong Kong. With 5 days in HK and lots of rain and drizzle while walking through seas of people all the time we needed a break. We boarded the star ferry in HK took it across to Kowloon then rode back. Positively delightful and great value! Cheap cheap cheap only the cost of your usual public transport ticket. We used our Octopus cards ( get one they great!). We went across at dusk, warm dry and comfortable and were treated to a fabulous show. The concrete and steel jungle of HK turned into a glittering twinkling show of lights! Simply delightful and lovely relaxing break. Take a snack and a drink along and enjoy. Get a seat on top deck by a window and pull out your camera for a dazzling show of color. It's a lovely and different perspective on HK, Kowloon as well viewing from water and as night descends. Easily one of top ten hk must do's!
Traditional ferry ride. This is an age-old ferry service between Central Pier and TST .....old fashioned but quick and frequent ferries transport loads of commuters daily across Victoria Harbour.

A Must go. Extremely cheap tickets to commute from TST to HK. Get to know both IFC and ICC. Great views of Victoria Bay crossing in an old fashioned steamed boat with rivets and everything. Over 120 years old heritage from the British

Simply loved it. Old-fashioned and sweet. Simply to use with Octopus card Old ships but reliable.
Easiest and picturesque way to cross the harbour (if you are in Central Hong Kong).

Enjoyable Experience. The Ferry ride was very short and it was very quick in embarking and disembarking. The minute the drawbridge drop for passengers to embark, the ferry leaves the port. With this speed, it feels like a bus, a water bus that is. It was an enjoyable experience and the view from the board was beautiful. Its recommended for families and for those who wants to experience some of the old surviving mode of transport in Hong Kong. Its also a romantic ride...

Good service . The easiest way to get from Hong Kong to Kowloon. The ferries run very often from early morning to late at night and the price per trip is very reasonable. You can also get good views of the skyline.
Worth a try!. Probably the cheapest and one of the beat attraction in HK. At night time, you may enjoy the lights of the skylines. A must do in your first HK visit!

Cheap and fun way to see the skyline. Use your Octopus card and take a trip over both during the day time and at night to see the city from the water. For only around 20-30 pence a ride its a bargain. Used by tourists and locals alike a Hong Kong must do.

Best deal in town. The ride seems to get shorter every time but it is the best deal in town . If clear day, great views during the short ride! Suggest sit downstairs always...unless storming outside. A must do in HK

Transportation not destination. . The Star Ferry is simply a way to get from the Kowloon side to the Hong Kong side. It does this very well, but it's not n attraction in and of itself. It is nice because you don't run the risk of being stuck in traffic from one side to the other - plus it has a nice view of the bay of course.

Cheap, with a good view. One can argue that one of the most iconic sights in Hong Kong is the city skyline. With that said, from the Star Ferry, you get a great view of all the lights and excitement from the Hong Kong side. It's a convenient, fast, scenic way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong or vice versa. I would definitely recommend it. Having to live in HK for half a year now, I still get a rush of excitement when taking the Star Ferry.

One of the best view of the city (day or night). Hong Kong urban area is very dense and makes it a wonderful place to explore on foot, but one of the best views is on the water. No need to take a tour though. Instead of taking a cab or MTR (their subway system), take the Star Ferry. It will give you an amazing view of the city. Best time to go is when it's not rush hour, so that you have more chances to move about and take photos, videos or sit back and take it all in. Go during the day, but definitely make your way at night as well, as the city lights up and the reflection off the water is just gorgeous.
Great views. Cheapest and fastest way to cross from Hong Kong to Kowloon or vice versa. Plus you see great views of the city. Just didn't like the fuel smell when sitting close to the motor.

Great way to cross Victoria Harbour. The historic Star Ferry is a cool way to crossVictoria Harbour, it takes about 10 minutes to make the crossing from Kowloon to HK Island (central) and about 15 to Wan Chai . The price is cheap at $2.50hkd and they run pretty much every 10 minutes.

Cheap and affordable . It is definitely d most cheapest way of communication between the Hong Kong Island and Tsim Sha Tsui. The ticket is super cheap, it's around 2 HKD for adult and 1.4 HKD for children.If you need to visit any place on the other side of the water, use Star Ferry to cross and then from there you can take a taxi, bus or MTR else just to cross over; the toll in a taxi is around 55 HKD.
Obligatory. Symbolic of old Hong Kong, the Star Ferry's basic boats offer the cheapest and most scenic ways to cross the harbour. A must-do for every tourist.

A cheap way to view the stunning skyline . If you want to view the magnificent skyline of Hong Kong, there is no cheaper, easier way to view it from the water than the brief fun trip on the Star Ferry. And whether you are staying in Kowloon and want to visit the Island or vice versa this is the most interesting way to travel. More fun than the (clean and efficient) train.

Easy way to travel to Kowloon . Took the ferry across the harbour to Kowloon on the weekend, it takes about 10 minutes. Nice relaxing way to travel and is a nice aspect to take a few photos from harbour. One way for adults costs HK$2.5 on Mondays to Fridays; HK$3.4 on Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays.

Quirky But A Must. For only .25 USD how could you not do this! It's a quick ride, the boats are historic, and on clear days the views of the skyline are phenomenal. Make sure to select the upper deck for the best views.

It's a boat ride across the harbour. There is not much about HK up close that is lovable. The view from a distance is significantly better. And seeing the skyline from the middle of the harbour is best
Nice ride. First of all, its one of the tourists' attraction, and secondly, you have to here to ride if you want to go to Hongkong or Macau.

Fast and Efficient. This is a fast cheap nd efficient way to commute between Kowloon
and Hong Kong Island
The ferry leave every 5 or so minutes so there is never much of wait.

No trip to Hong Kong is complete without a quick trip on the Ferry. The MTR may be faster and often more convenient, but a Ferry ride is amazing, especially at twilight/night. Nothing will provide as much experience for the cost of a Ferry Ride.
The view of the skyline from the ferry is amazing, especially when the buildings are all lit up.
Nice. We took the ordinary ferry ride, not the tour. It is short ( about 10 min), nice ride. Can use your octopus card to go.

Short trip to enjoy hongkong heritage. Take this ferry short trip to enjoy the hongkong heritage and feel the oldies style of hongkong ferry. its cheap and worth to try just tap your octopus and take only $2-3 hkd for single trip.
Always great fun. Always good fun to ride on the ferry and see Hong Kong Harbour. A great HK tradition and so inexpensive. A "must do" in HK.
Convenient. Nice & easy option to get across the Victoria Harbour from Harbour city to Central (or vice versa)...

A must for anyone visiting HK. Great, cheap and convenient way to see the Harbour and visit Kowloon. Easy to get on and off. Nothing special as ferries go if you grew up in Sydney, but it is quaint and it works.
A must. Fast and efficient an iconic must. Travel between Kowloon and HK island. The harbour view is spectacular day and night the ferry is cheap and effective
FRom HK to Zhuhai. About a 70 minute trip from HK to the mainland - Zhuhai . Affordable , clean, staffed by courteous crew that spoke good English.

Classic Image of Hong Kong. No trip to HK can be complete without a trip on the Star Ferry. The historic boats will ferry you back and forth to the islands for just 2.50. Used by the locals to get from the mainland to Central Island for work. Plenty of potential to people watch and take photos of the Central Island skyline.
Great mode of transport. Best to take given the short time required to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. Especially if you're visiting the AIA carnival.

It's a must and it's quirky!. Every time I come to Hong Kong I always make sure I take a trip on the Star Ferry. These quaint little boats traverse the harbour approximately every 10 minutes. Whilst they may now now have been superseded by the MTR as the principal means of commuting between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island, they have lost none of their original charm. Travelling on the top deck from Kowloon to Hong Kong admiring the wonderful view is an absolute must for all tourists!
Another must do. Got to do at least one Star Ferry trip each time I am in Hong Kong, cheap and easily accessible both in Kowloon and on the island, great fun and some good pics can be taken.
Quick trip to Kowloon. We caught the ferry over to Kowloon from HK Island very easy to board and easy pay with your travel card. Nice view of the harbour too.

Cheap, quick and beautiful. The MTR is so easy to get and so cheap, but you must make time (it only takes 2 minutes to cross) to take the star ferry at least twice - once during the day and once when it's dark. The views are absolutely stunning and it's so cheap anyway! I would say get on early for a seat by the side though, and maybe avoid the rush times!

Amazing Relaxed Ride. A great view to see the Harbour. I have been on this cruise seevral times at diffeernt times of the day and must say that the best time is at dusk or anytime after dark as one can see the Harbour lights and the famous Laser show all from the boat. There is now an onboard commentary which talks about the relevant landmarks and histroy of some of the iconic buildings along the Harbour making this an interesting ride.

The best value, view and experience on the planet. You have to take the Star Ferry anytime you visit Hong Kong. It is efficient, historical and the cheapest thing you can do. There is also no better view of the ever changing and growing skyline

A must do to fall in love with the city . Taking a star ferry across the straight from Kowloon to HK or reverse not only gives you a short moment of peace and fresh air in a city where both are highly scarce but it also reconciles you with the city and might even make you fall in love with it. It's indeed imprinted in nostalgia but above all it gives you sensational views on the city and plunges you in the sounds and smells of Hong Kong. Don't consider it a waste of time compared to the ferry. You will not regret the extra time it takes as the rewards are big. Best time to do it is at night once the peak traffic and passenger flow is over but while all the buildings are still lighted up. On all my business trips to HK several times a year I always try to do it once.
Lovely trip across the harbour.. Greatly enjoyed the trip across, would love to do it again in the future. The ferry itself looked quite old but that added to the pleasure.
Make sure to do it once. The MTR is so good you'll have to make time to take the ferry. Make sure you do. The views it affords are great and the value is terrific.

Convenient & inexpensive. Coming from TST to go to Central, this is by far the quickest & cheapest way to get to HK island plus quaint timeless atmosphere. At night it's a treat to see all the lights along the harbour via ferry. If you time your landing at TST each night you will see the light show along the harbour and the light show on the wall of the Cultural centre as well as the lit up bell tower. Tip: the cultural centre has public washrooms & they stay open late. Signage isn't the greatest at the TST ferry terminal & but there is a tourist centre there if you have questions. If you do research ahead of time you will know which ferry to board to get you where you need to go. It's older form of transport so not sleek or new but it does the job. Ferries are tidy and we felt very safe. It can't get crowded at rush hour. Kids enjoyed the unique experience.
4 minute ride to central. Takes just 4 minutes to get to Hong Kong island costs HK$ 2.50 each way on week days and HK$ 3.25 on weekends and public holidays.

Cheapest ride in town . The Star Ferry is an excellent way of getting between islands. At only $2.50HKD the ride is cheaper than any other mode of transport between islands. The ferry is very efficient, with hardly any waiting time.
Great to take pictures from. I prefer taking the star ferry to subway. The view on the hk skyline from the harbour is stunning and it's a tourist must-do. You'll get great pics!
Great And cheap. A great cheap way to cross over from HK island to Kowloon and henceforth. The Views are amazing. Get on early and catch a seat by the side.
Fab view for pennies. This is a must-do and the best view of both sides of the harbour. Pop your two dollar coin in the slot, get a token and off you go...

Fantastic views. One of the iconic journeys in the world. Just 10 minutes between Kowloon and the Island across one of the busiest shipping lanes. The views of the city are fantastic from sea level and it's the best bargain in HK. I love the fact that it's not just a tourist service but is used by thousands on their daily commute.

Must try it for the experience of a bygone era. This used to be the preferred mode of transport to cross over from Central to Kowloon and back... Now there is the metro (MTR) and under the harbour road crossings. It is though still a thrill to cross offer using this charming old method.
A 'must' to do when in HK. Quite simply - The Star Ferry does exactly what it is designed for in an ultra efficient way at an outrageously low cost
Super cheap, nice way to cross the river. Took the ferry almost every time I crossed over to Kowloon. Really relaxing, touristy but also practical. Definitely travel on the ferry at least once
Experience Hong Kong at slow-motion. Using the ferry off-peak, one has a good view on the harbor. It's inexpensive, use Octopus card for quick entry.

The view is good at night.. It was nice to get the ferry at night with all the lights from the buildings.
The ferry was cheap and frequent. The crossing only takes 5/10 minutes.
The MTR is better to get from A to B, but the ferry is nice at night.
Very cheap and quick to cross. An experience I can say I have done but isn't too much to say. Skip the queue by using your Octopus card. This was helpful.
Most convienient. Its the most easy way to kowloon & the habour city shopping centre. Amazing view of the hong kong city skyline of highrises.
Still a great ride.. Yes this is slower than the subway, but it still a really fun thing to do. The views are good - even in ok weather, and walking by the clock tower is fun.

Terrific way to get from Hong Kong to Kowloon!. Easy and inexpensive, the Star Ferry is a great way to get from Kong Kong to Kowloon. You can use your Octopus Card! In addition, the views from the ferry are gorgeous so take it both day and night!

See HK island lights at night. Convenient way to travel and the best way to see the HK island lights at night - especially at Christmas/NYE. Simple to use with regular ferries so you don't have to wait long. HK harbour can be rough so if you get seasick, bring a bag.

Beautiful, but Could Be Even Better. We so enjoyed our inexpensive ride (less than 50 cents American. It offered great views and was a quick activity - much nicer than taking the MRT because of the scenery. I gave it a four rather than five because they could really enhance the ride with a live commentary or even a taped on that could inform riders what they are seeing. That would really make the experience all that much richer!

Staple diet as good as ever. I first travelled on the Star Ferry when visiting Hong Kong for the first time in 1984. It has always been a great ride, giving a wonderful view of the harbour from within it. It still provides the same service and views.
Great value. Fast and cheap. A bargain at about 30p to cross to the island.It's a bit run down looking but at the price you can't complain.

Punctual transportation. So convenient to go and back from Kow Loon to Central Hong Kong .
You can use the very practical Octopus pass and the price is really reasonable, two Hong Kong dollars one way!
Is very recommendable to take it at night then you can enjoy the amazing illuminated Skyline of Hong Kong.

Fast and easy . Took the ferry from Tsim tsa sui going to IFC central. Costs only 2.5 HK dollar. Very good schedule. And the ride will provide magnificent view of the Habour from both sides.
An efficient transport service in HK

A must when you are in Hong Kong!. This is definitely one of those experiences to do when you are in Hong Kong. It is so easy, short crossing between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island and only costs HKD 2.50. A great way to see the skylines, both day and at night and has been a tradition in Hong Kong for many years, not to be missed.
Traveling like a local. Enjoyed cruising through the busy harbor and seeing everyday things that would be missed if your on the subway. Sight and sound is cool to enjoy.
We didn't sink. What else do you want from a boat? It has comfy seats, too, and runs pretty much on time. They should allow wakeboarding off the back of the boat.

Brilliant. Brilliant. For $HK20 is a 15m trip across the harbour in a lovely little ferry. Read the 'Terrible' reviews. They're all Muppets. Great views. If does what it says on the tin. Didn't try a Tour.

Great trip across the Victoria Harbor. If you looking for a fun afternoon thing to do in Hong Kong take a ride on the Star Ferry. Make sure to bring your camera. Night trip are great when the city is lit-up and the skyscrapers are displaying their evening light shows!
Never gets old. I love the Star Ferry.. It is one of the number 1 attractions in HK and everyone should use it at least once.

Wonderful experience. The Star Ferry is the best way to go from Hong Kong to Kowloon and vice versa. These old ferries are wonderful and it is gives a point of view that we cannot have otherwise.
And the bay of Hong Kong is wonderful.
Evokes nostalgic memories of a bygone era. Short cruise by ferry evokes nostalgic memories of my childhood trip. Enjoy the scenery on board and feel the old wooded seats.
Unique and efficient way to travel. You can pay with the octopus card or cash at the gantry. the schedule is always on time and the ferry is pretty clean.

No trip to HK is complete without a ferry trip. It's a great way to cross the Harbour - The Star Ferries have been part of Hong Kong for so many years, it's a must do. They're cheap, efficient and a good way to see the Harbour

Star Ferry Nostalgia. I never miss taking the Star Ferry when visiting Hong Kong. It's a low cost transit from Taimshatsui to WanChai ... Kowloon to Hong Kong Island at HKD2.50. Also perfect to view the Victoria Harbour sight of skyscrapers on Hong Kong Island. Great for family trips!

A great way to see the skylines. The star ferry is a must do when you are in Hong Kong.
Very easy to access on both sides of the harbour and you can use your octopus card on it to pay,
You get fantastic views all round of the harbour and Kowloon and the island.
A must when you are in Hong Kong. This is one of the last "old things" left in Hong Kong so enjoy while it is still there. You can take amazing photos from the ferry

Two journeys in two days. Great experience. You don't have to wait long for the ferry to come. Wonderful views upstairs, also worth a downstairs trio to sit on the varnished wooden benches and see the driver. A great experience for anyone of any age visiting Hi g Kong or Kowloon,

Local Trasportation.... Its basically traditional transportation between Hong kong and Kowloon. Its 15 to 20 min ride. you can have a good view of both the islands. Recommend this ferry at least once, good experience.

Easy, cheap and FUN!. The most convenient and fun way to cross the water between Kowloon and Victoria harbor (Hong Kong). With just a few coins buy the ticket from terminal automatic machine and hop on. Pier 7, the green-white ships. Takes just a few minutes, brings you to shopping heaven in Kowloon (Harbour) and Avenue of Stars (closed tho until 2018!), the. Bell tower etc, and in Hong Kong side to IFC mall and central. Great fun and convenience combined!

Star Ferry Hong Kong to Kowloon. This is a wonderful old institution in HK as well as being a great alternative tothe subway or taxis to get from one side of HK to the other. The ride offerswonderful views of the bustling harbor and both skylines. When you board, it feels as though you've stepped back into HK's more mysterious and exoticpast.
Cheap Ride. Million Dollar View.. A must do to get across harbour from TST/Kowloon to HK side in minutes with one of the most amazing views on earth. Do it.

The best ride on the planet for the money!. On my first trip to Hong Kong I kept riding the Star Ferry back and forth across the harbor shooting rolls of film. Today it's still my favorite way to get to Hong Kong Central. Quick, efficient, immaculately clean, this is one of the best "rides" in the world!

One of the Worlds' must do travel experiences.. When in HK it would be silly not to travel over to Kowloon and back using the iconic Star Ferry.
They are frequent, cheap, simple and easy to use. As always they are operated super efficiently by the locals.
Remember to take a selfie with the HK skyline behind you!
Star ferry. This is a great way to getting around Hong Kong. Our grandchild love taking the ferry going to see the Big Buddha.

A great way to see the magnificence of HK. This is one of the best ways to truly appreciate how awesome HK looks. Get the ferry from the WanChai Ferry Pier and for a few HKD head across to Kowloon to the Peninsula or (Avenue of the stars, which is sadly currently closed) however you can walk along the waterfront for a great view.

Big View, for Small Money. The name alone is a institution in HGK and if you haven't encountered the recommendation to take a ride in your tourist guide, here is another one from me. Absolut must as the trip is cheap, offers a great view and is very convenient and quick.
Enjoy!

So conveniant. An easy way to get back and forth, very reasonable and beautiful views to enjoy.
Far easier than taking a taxi or a subway, and in close proximity at the Kowloon side to the Ocean terminal or Harbour shopping malls which are magnificent
It is what it is. Just a ferry, OK it has iconic status and it can be ticket of your bucket list but it has nothing special about it

Always fun. I used to tak the star ferry everyday for work and always enjoyed it. I love taking the bottom level because you see "more action" among the crew and can check out the engines of the boat. Whether it is cold or hot, I still enjoy taking the ride.

A Classic Piece of Hong Kong. A must-do attraction for any visitor to Hong Kong. Cheap and easy to use, with fantastic views of both the Island and Kowloon side. Take a trip across at sunset / night for extra special views. Choose from lower deck (cheaper) or upper deck. Interesting fact - the seat backs tilt so you can easily adjust any seat to face the correct direction of travel.

Star Ferry. Best way to see Hong Kong from the sea is on the Star Ferry, plus the cost of travel is about .25 cents. Efficient and safe travel from Victoria back to Kowloon Island. I never tire of riding this iconic landmark.
Less crowded than the train. This is a cheap, fun way to cross to the island. Just remember that your oyster card covers the cost or pay as you go.

Essential Part of a Hong Kong Visit!. the Star Ferry company was founded over 100 years ago by an Indian (from India, not Oklahoma) who had a successful bakery. He reinvested his money in a couple of small hotels, and then into the business of taking people back and forth across the harbor on a regular, scheduled basis, competing with the small independent taxi-junks. Take a ride on history, bring your camera, and smile!

The most inexpensive cruise tour!. Whenever I travel to HK, I'll get on these ferries and taking photos to the beautiful sunset along the shoreline of HK Island and Kowloon. When compare to the cruise trip in S'pore and some other cities like Tokyo, this lovely boat trip is really inexpensive and more friendly which you don't need to book in advance as they are the means of transport to locals as well. You can even use their MTR store value card to pay the fare. Suggest to get on ferry around 6pm and see the magic moment of sunset, but pls don't drop your handphone down the sea when taking photos!

Easy, scenic way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. This is a great way to travel in Hong Kong. It's easy to find and offers a great view of the city in each direction. Use your Octopus card to ride. This card is a must in Hong Kong.

Relaxing and Inspiring. Hong Kong is a city that is always vibrant and in motion. The hustle and bustle of the city is tremendous but sometimes you need an escape.The star ferry comes as a pleasent, relaxing option. Definately a must try...

For the cheapest and best views of Hong Kong and Kowloon. The ferry is extremely cheap at just 2HKD but be aware change will be needed for the ticket barriers. They run to schedule more of the time and offer good views of Hong Kong and Kowloon.

Low-Cost Victoria Harbor Tour. Star ferry is one of the best choices to enjoy the beautiful Victoria Harbor view. It connects between Hong Kong Island and the Kowloon Peninsula. It operates ferry services between Central / Tsim Sha Tsui (TST); and Wanchai / TST. An adult single ticket fare only costs less than US$1 (weekdays HK$2.50; weekend HK$3.4). I'd strongly recommend to try the upper deck for the best view and take it at night to enjoy harbor light shows at 8pm daily, around 13 minutes. Don't miss it!

Short but sweet. A must do in many lists. Do it once to expierence the water, the view towards the island and to feel the nostalgia. Is is a good one, not too long 5 to 10 min, goes often and costs alomst nothing
Best Ferry value in the World. The views from this short(10 minute) ride are incredible. Do it if you don't even want to go to the other side. Ride back for under $1 U.S. Must do if in HK.
nice trip. it was nice ferry trip between the two islands and you can see the skylines of both the islands and its also very cheap.
Iconic Harbor Crossing. How can you come to Hong Kong and *not* ride the Star Ferry at least once? Wonderful views even on a cloudy day. And a transportation bargain as well.
Cheap and fun. Great way to get around whilst not really spending any money. Ferries are easy to work out and regular and give you a view from a different perspective.

Part of Hong Kong`s History. A trip to Hong Kong is not complete without a trip on the Star Ferry.
It is not what you would call a flashy ferry however is part of the fabric that makes Hong Kong special

Must do!. I understand now why people said this is a must do if you're visiting Hong Kong. It really gives you perspective on how everything is laid out and how Hong Kong is a bunch of little islands. The view is great and the air is fresh, so I really felt the specialness that you feel when you travel and you are in the moment. The price is right too and it's not too complicated to figure out.
Great experience. A must do in Hong Kong. Incredibly cheap. Easy for a visitor to use. Great views of the harbour.Not to be missed.

Cute!. In the movie "The Man with the Golden Gun" James Bond escapes a boat and boards the sunken Queen Elizabeth in HK Bay where there is a secret MI6 HQ. that´s why I took this ferry, just to go around the Bay. Cute, cheap not really comfortable but it´s a Hong Kong Experience.
Cheap, great tourist activity.. Best way to get across harbor. It's incredibly cheap and we took it a few times. Great to see the island and Kowloon in daytime and at night.
great way to get across the harbour. A great way to get across the harbour that isn't as boring as the MTRTry travelling at dusk to get the best views of the Hong Kong island skyline light show.

A Good $2 Ride. Took the ferry from Kowloon to HK Island. This I think is the cheapest way. Its a very "local" experience, and folks who visit HK should at least ride it once. The view from the ferry is great, and its a cheaper alternative to the more expensive harbor cruises
The cheapest boat trip anywhere!. This has to be the cheapest and best water trip on a ferry anywhere. Best done at night where there are lights galore and please bring change for the fare.
Excellent . Great views of Hong Kong island and Kowloon. It costs HKD $2 for a one way trip. Make sure to get seats on the bottom of the ferry if you get sea sick (it helped me out).

A must do. I spent years using the Star Ferry going to work and a recent holiday to HK reminded me of how lucky I was. It is a wonderful way to cross the Harbour and at 20p a trip, a real bargain.Forget the Harbour cruise option aimed at tourists for about £10 a go. Get the ferry from Central to Hung Hom and sail the length of the Harbour, a great way to see the skyline, especially at night.

Harbor cruise on a budget. For less than 50 cents you'll enjoy this 7,8 min harbor cruise, crossing from HK island to Kowloon, or vice versa. And you'll catch all the sites, as those offered in a pricey sampan harbor cruise. Besides, this is a century old, iconic crossing that locals do and should be felt. Buy tokens which serve as the tickets at the machine at the terminal entrance, very easy.
