Great way to see the Harbour. This is a cheap way to see the Harbour - a longer cruise would be worthwhile. Ask for local knowledge as we were there in the rain and can be accessed under cover from some places.

Cheap, efficient and convenient. You can take the star ferry after descending from The Peak, the bus is just right outside of the Peak tram exit. It is very convenient as you do not have to walk back to the MTR and the bus will bring you straight to the ferry terminal. After alighting from the ferry, look for the direction to the TST MTR and be on your way. Recommended for the convenience and also the experience! Awesome skyline/city view on the sea too!

Star Ferry to Kowloon. This is a good way to travel from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon and be on the harbour. There are several buses on Kowloon side at the ferry terminal to take you to your destination. We went to the Ladies Markets then caught a ferry back to .HK Island.

A must do for all new travellers to Hong Kong. A must do experience for all travellers to Hong Kong and experienced travellers will use it a lot just for travel. Very cheap prices and takes octopus card. Upper deck best for views.

Love crossing the harbor . It is really lovely to cross the harbor but still I am a fan of Kowloon side which seems that all the fashion is going on in this side more than in the Hong Kong side . Also a night I found more fun in Kowloon where we party on Saturday night till 4 in the morning ! Very nice

Great mode of transportation. I was staying on the Kowloon side but had to get to the convention center every morning. You can get there by subway but I found the Star Ferry to be efficient. It's a comfortable ride and you cross the water in less than 15 minutes. They run frequently and I believe it cost less than $.50 US each way.

Spectacular! Incomparable!. Sailing across the harbor at night is a fantastic way to appreciate the amazing City. There are faster ways to go to Hong Kong from Kowloon and vice versa. For those with the time, this is a must do event. It's endearing to see the crew at work, much as they have always done, in this ultra modern and fast paced city.

Excellent . A great way to get between Hong Kong Island & Kowloon. Regular as clock work all day & into evening.A step back in time, making it a great way to experience the harbour. Our preferred way across the harbour. As part of the cities transport system it's handy that the Opal card payment is accepted. A must when in Hong Kong.

An efficient, cheap and enjoyable institution. The ferries may be old but like me they are still fit for purpose. You don't wait long, the crossing doesn't take many minutes, the view back to Hong Kong Island is splendid and it only costs about 25 pence each way.

Classic Ferry. Use Star Ferry if you borring with MTR (Hong Kong subway), bus or Taxi. Star Ferry serve from Central Pier to Tsim Sha Tsui. The ferry is classic, not equipped with aircon, but very cheap.
Must do in HK. A really must do to experience HK. Try also the ferry to WanChai instead of the one to Central. And enjoy, sit back and relax!

See the city from a different angle. A jaunt on the Star Ferry is a quick fun way to add to your Hong Kong experiences. Great photo opportunities of the surrounding skyline and a bit of fun along the way.
Cheapest cruise. Quick and efficient. There is some walk to do to get on the pier and from the pier. Nicer on the upper deck, would be perfect for kids too.
Star Ferry. We used the Ferry most days. Busy yes, safe yes, a great way to get across the bay. Clean yes. Very reasonable you can get the tickets once you get to the ferry terminal.

Shuttling between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. A great perspective of both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island from the water by this world famous mode of transport - the Star Ferry . We have always stayed on the Kowloon side of the water and to access Hong Kong Island taking the ferry is a highlight I wouldn't miss . All cities are great to see from the water if possible , HK even more so as it's such a hive of activity .

Ferry across the harbour. 10 years ago I was in Hong Kong with my son and we spent hours going back and too to Hong Kong from Kowloon yesterday I did kwung tong to north point it was a terrible day but for $5-00 Hong Kong dollars it's a lot of fun I love the ferry rides and there the best value for money in Hong Kong. On a nice warm day there's nothing better than exploring Hong Kong on the ferry

Nice quick stop on the way to Tsim Sha Tsui. We happened to take this across on a free Star Ferry day, which was awesome! It's usually extremely cheap anyway and a nice way to get some views and pictures in. Central Harbourfront and Tsim Sha Tsui are both nice places to walk around and look at stores or eat food, so it's a nice place to go and relax. The view at night was really amazing.
A must-do for first time visitor. What is more timeless than the Star Ferry? It's like going back in time, and a very economical way to see both parts of Hong Kong.

Peace in the Bustle. The top route for travellers to enjoy the skyline of the Victoria Harbour is the Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui service. Do look for a seat to enjoy the skyline at night, where Hong Kong Island-side is more enchanting. Also special service for the lightshow “A Symphony of Lights” on every 8pm will depart about 7:55pm in both direction. The ferry will stay amidst of harbour for a few minute.
Very cheap - nice view. Costs virtually nothing and gives you 9 minutes of fantastic view. We did it at a cloudy day time, but can only imagime it as spectacular at night time.

Easy. Easy cheap, fun way to cross between Hong Kong island and Kowloon :-) don't bother with the tourist pass unless you know you are going to cross several times a day. Not an exclusive mistake but...... :-)
A Hong Kong must do!. A star ferry trip on a fine day is one of the cheap delights of life. The views of both Kowloon and Hong Kong are stunning - just do it!

Quick and easy. The starferry is great way to get between islands kowloon and hk island. You get the view as well. By night you get to see the buildings lit up and if you make the right time the light show too. Sometimes it's better by ferry than going underground on the mtr. I recommend the ferry any day. Even when the weather is a little miserable it's still nice to go. Also from central it takes you to TST by avenue of the stars which also a nice walk along the promenade.
A must do activity. I have travelled on the Star Ferry many times and have always enjoyed it for the lovely views of Hong Kong. Well worth doing in daytime and at nighttime.
Most economical way to cross the harbor.. The star ferry is the most scenic and economical way of crossing the harbor. It is fast and efficient.
A bargain. At approximately 22p a trip this is amazing value. Great views of Kowloon and HK island. Took one trip just to get photos of Christmas lights on the buildings.

"Efficient & reliable mode of transport". Whilst on holiday in Hong Kong recently, we used the Star Ferry several times and found it very convenient to travel back and forth from Central to Kowloon. The fare is very reasonable and the ride takes only 10 minutes. Besides, the journey allows you to take in the amazing views on both sides of the harbour. Definitely an experience not to be missed when in Hong Kong.

Back to the 60's. The short ride between kwoloon and hk or backway is a trip journey, riding on these boats built on the 60 years very well conservated as everything in hk...you fell like in that golden years...

some of the best HK Island shots from here. It's quaint, cheap and offers some great photography moments. I don't always enjoy the crowds but it is something everybody who comes to Hong Kong must experience!
Good view . Cheap price to take a short trip cross Victoria harbour and enjoy the night view of HK. Must do list when go to HK. Bring my family next time.

How can you not ride the Star Ferry when you visit Hong Kong.. We never miss the chance to take the Star Ferry. It's a great view of the harbor, fast and frequent, and it is absolutely the best deal in the city. Less than USD$2 for two adults and two kids, cannot beat that. If you coming from the HK side with kids, it drops you off at a huge shopping center on the Kowloon side with lots of activities for little ones.

Iconic HK!. No trip to HK is complete without a trip on the iconic Star Ferry, even though the distance is half what it was once upon a time. If it's a (rare) clear day enjoy the views of the HK skyline and the cooling breeze on the water. It is very cheap, and you can pay a few dollars more to sit in less crowded area upstairs.
When in Rome..... Basically I prefer the Metro in Hong Kong but this age old method of transport is a must when in Hong Kong PS you can use your Octopus card for all major transport during your stay

Cheap and efficient.. We took the star ferry frequently during our stay in Hong Kong. It is not only the cheapest way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island, but it is also extremely efficient with several ferries crossing per hour. Not to mention that the view of the skyline is beautiful! This is our preferred method of transportation between Hong Kong and Kowloon.

Lovely way to get to Kong Kong Island. For a very small sum (less if you are over 65) you can watch the water traffic and see the impressive buildings on the Hong Kong Island (or Kowloon when you are going back) and be transported across the channel. Definitely a must for every visitor to King Kong

Still the best mode of transportation in HKG!!. When you say Hong Kong, you say Star Ferry - who could not love this way of transportation (or it's actually a bit of very cheap site-seeing as well!!).You can't miss out when visiting HKG!

Cheap, easy and quick to get across. We decided to take the ferry as it was one of those things you read about and decide to do because it is there. A few dollars and you're on board. Sit by the window and the breeze comes in and you're in the middle of the water before you know it. Great views of the city behind you, easy to get on and off and well worth the ride.
Good way to see the harbour and the light show. Good option to travel between HongKong island and Kowloon. and if you time it right, good place to see the nightly light show.

the best way to cross harbour in HK. Been travelling to HK since my childhood year and this 8 minute trip is simply enjoyable.
The HK skyline and the breeze will make you keep coming back to this wonderful city.
Great trip across the harvour. This was such a nice way to see the city. We went across from wan chai and then back. They run very frequently and you can use your octopus.

It is like going back in time. I think this was one of the original ferries plying Victoria Harbour. Old, noisy, cold but very nice to be able to use a piece of history. Much more interesting than taking a subway under the harbour.

A must ride when in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry has been around as long as the ferry service in my hometown in Penang, or maybe much longer. It resembles a large boat than a ferry, yet still comfortable, convenient and very affordable. A great way to enjoy the refreshing view of Hong Kong island and its surroundings under the mix of warm sunshine and cool breeze

A 'must do' for Hong Kong visitors. No visit to Hong Kong is complete without a trip on the famous, historic Star Ferry - the ten minute crossing between Kowloon and Central (or Victoria Harbour as it used to be called). The ferry pier was moved some distance away from its original spot in Central a few years ago and this has been to its detriment. This said, the journey itself takes in the stunning views of the two sides of the harbour and on a clear day (or night) they are amazing.The ferry is used by regular commuters and costs only a few Hong Kong dollars. The ageing, yet safe boats (all with 'Star" in their names) have two decks. The Upper Deck is slightly more expensive and will give the better views but the lower is more interesting for watching the skillful seamen speedily berthing and casting off. Take your camera and hope for a clear day and you will get some memorable shots.
Travel back in time. Still has that 'old Hong Kong' flair I hear about- for the equivalent of a few pence, you get a spectacular ride with glorious views!!

Water transport. Enjoyable trip across to Kowloon although must say the boats are quite old, trip between Hong Kong island and Kowloon took about five minutes and you certainly great get great view of Victoria Harbour and all the boats

A must to do in HK. It was not crowded when we took this ferry around 4 pm. It was cheap and you could buy a return trip. I suggest you have coins ready on hand because the lady would not accept a 50 HK bill. There is a kiosk nearby which you could buy small items to get coins.

Worth a trip. It's probably the cheapest fun you can have in Hong Kong at around 17 pence (GBP) definitely the best way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. I would recommend taking the journey day and night

Love the Ferry Ride. For only HK$3, I took the ferry across the island in the evening. The breeze was nice, the views were amazing. A must-have experience if you travel to Hong Kong. I boarded this at the Star Ferry Terminal in Tsim Sha Tsui and got off at Central to go to the IFC mall.
Fun. Always have to have a ride on Star Ferry when in Hong Kong. A fun way to travel to the Island as opposed to the MTR. So cheap as well.
Cheap. a must for visiting Kowloon and all points served by the ferries a good plentiful form of transport very efficient.

Death of the Star Ferry. To Hong Kongers growing up in the seventies and eighties, the Star Ferry was a big part of their lives. Taking the Ferry was not only convenient but relaxing and romantic. Not anymore. With massive reclamation, Queen's Pier was dismantled and the old ferry terminal was pushed so far out into the sea that taking the ferry was no longer sensible. Now walking to the pier means a ten to fifteen minutes walk from Queen's Road Central, not a joy under the hot sun and wearing city shoes. I only do it for nostalgic reasons. With the narrowing of the harbour, the currents get stronger and the crossing is more bumpy. The journey ends before one realizes. Who is the killer? The stupidity of the government？The greed of big business? Civil society remonstrated but to no avail. What a shame and tragedy!
Cheap and cheerful. Just a lovely inexpensive way to cross between the Island and Kowloon. Great to be able to put your feet up and enjoy the view.
A fun ride. A round trip ride by the ferry to Kowloon is a cheap way to travel with the locals. The ferry is big and safe sovwe alwayscenjoy the ride

Cheapest prettiest ferry ride. It's the cheapest ( US$0.20-$0.35 ) and most scenic, relaxing ferry ride that no one should miss! Take it during the day and then at night for completely different WOW experiences !
Best way to cross Hong Kong Harbor. Its the prettiest way to cross the harbor and when compared to hiring a boat, its as cheap as chips !

Easy, clean and chesp. From our Hotel in Kowloon, it's only 10 minutes. 50 cents during the week one way or 70 cents on weekends and public holidays. Can take great pictures on your trip over to Hong Kong Island.

If you want to see the Victoria Harbour, Star Ferry is the best choice!. The best and cheapest way to see the beautiful and famous Victoria Harbour. The ferry has its history and has been the main transportation for locals to travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon before the cross harbour tunnels were built. However, with the MTR (underground train) and cross harbour tunnels, only a few locals take the Star Ferry, instead more tourists love to sail on it. Some locals even want to shut it down. I think it can be a shame and loss a wonderful attraction for tourists in Hong Kong if it is shut down!

Inexpensive and fun. Cab from Kowloon to wan chai $120. Ferry trip $3.40 one way on a Sunday. No air con so need to do it on a fine day. Walking to the ferry on the Hong Kong side can be a bit confronting with some of the streets but worth doing. Locals do this every day to get to work.

Star Ferry....star attraction!. You must take the journey across Victoria Harbour on the Star Ferry. How HK used to be before the Beijing Govt., the MTR and the internet. A frequent and cheap service- great chance to view the HK skyline. A bit tricky to get to from the Island side via the overhead walkways but just follow your nose down to where it seems to dock. Much easier to locate on the Kowloon side.

Hurrah for the star ferry wanchai terminal. I left a new pair of runners on board and the ground staff at wanchai terminal were amazing in getting it back within 30 min. Kudos to the operations and team
Old faithful. My Star Ferry trip brought back happy memories. I was delighted to see this attraction virtually unchanged in a rapidly changing Hong Kong.
Good for transit. It was cool to see the old boats, the views were ok, good mode of transportation, I'm not sure if I took a longer ride to other spots, it would have been a better.
A classic experience. One look at the Star Ferry and you know where you are in the world. A wonderful way to experience the sights, sounds and smells of one of the best cities on the planet.

Convenient way to see the HKG Harbour. I love the ferry, it's a nice and easy way to see the harbour (if you choose the tour) or if you need to get from between Kowloon and the island. It's slower than the train, but cheaper, $HK2 per person one way, and i always like it.

Convenient, affordable ride. Just 5 minutes to get across, its such a lovely way of travelling - love the wooden lacquered seats and the crew in their traditional uniform. Would recommend this experience to anyone
Two dollar nice few minutes ride. I see no point in why not to take the ferry. No long waiting, not crowded, nice view over both sides.

I used to pay 2 cents for First Class crossing. I have been taking the Star Ferry for more than 50 years and it is still my favorite Harbor transit. My wife thinks it is romantic and we watched a young couple getting married on a crossing. Great for everyone, including families.

Best corner in Hong Kong. It connects the Hong Kong island to the Kowloon side and it's at a major attraction of Hong Kong. Often you have the light show at night on either side of the Harbour and with the newly developed entertainment park along the Harbour on Hong Kong side, you have a plenty of activities and restaurants nearby. Really recommendable!

Cheapest way to enjoy Victoria Harbour!. There're different ways to view Victoria Harbour but the cheapest way is to take the Star ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to/from Central. It takes about 10 minutes to cross the Harbour and the cost is $3.4 Hong Kong dollars. Avoid to take it from 5:00 pm to 6:00 pm because it's the time for most people to travel back from office to home.

You can't NOT do it...!!!. Obviously the Star Ferry is a must for locals and visitors alike. Locals use it because they, well, must. It's their way to work or play. Mostly work. Those who "play" on the other side of the harbor typically take cabs. They can afford them. For visitors, it's the most fun and authentic way to get across the harbor. And you get the most amazing photo ops, not just the breathtaking Hong Kong skyline but the "real" Hong Kong that surrounds you. For some added authenticity, take the lower deck on one of your trips!
Photogenic . Classic way to enjoy the view. Recommend to take the ferry from TST to Central during sunset. Upper deck has a cabin that's air-conditioned.

Good way to travel ! . All the cool kids travel on the star ferry ! Go on the top deck to enjoy good views and read the rules on board - they are pretty funny . The staff look really cute too in their uniforms - good photo opportunities and its cheap !
Easy way to travel. Caught the ferry from Kowloon to Wan Chai, 80c Aus. Have a ticket office and machine for change. Pier was undergoing construction so just keep an eye out for the signs.
A must. Do. Don't leave Hong kong with out a trip to the city great trip another view of the amazing skyline and mix in with the locals coming and going about there day

Iconic ferry transportation. We took the Star Ferry several times and enjoyed the views. You can purchase a ticket or use your Octopus card. The crossing can be rough crossing, so keep that in mind if you tend to get seasick. The terminal at TST was well-marked so you could easily tell which dock went to Wan Chai and which to Central. The terminal at TST had some shopping & food kiosks, and the one in Central had a produce market at one point when we were there.

Best deal in town; smartest company!. I love the Star Ferry and have for about the last 20 years I've visited HK. Had another great visit today. First, it is the cheapest thing you can do in town that is both functional and touristy. My son loved it, for the 3 of us to cross one of the most famous bodies of water, see the amazing skyline and Chinese growth for less then $1USD each way is crazy! This is a great service!!
Skyline !. To view the Hong Kong skyline you have two options : the tourist trap cruises or the Star Ferry that will take you across the bay for a few dollars !

It is one of the must in Hong Kong. The voyage only takes you for five minutes but during this period you can see the whole view of the coastline of Tsim Sha Tsui and Central. I recommend you take the ferry in two different period, one at night and one at the day time. Because you can see the the whole picture of Victoria Harbour.

Convenient travel on the cheap!. Star Ferry offers a great view of Victoria Harbour! Beautiful vantage point for both the Kowloon and Hong Kong sides. Easy to use, convenient and fast and very cost effective.

Still worth the ride. Even though there are now several fast tunnel crossings nothing says Hong Kong like a photo from the Star Ferry of the Star Ferry as you pass on the smoky slow crossing.
You havent been to Hong Kong without a crossing
The classic Hong Kong experience. No trip to Hong Kong is complete without a trip on the star ferry. Fantastic for photos especially at sunset. Don't leave without doing this.
Cheap and runs often. The ferry is a quick and easy way to get across the harbor. It takes about 15 minutes and runs until about 11:30-12:00 at night.

A must for all visitors. Still a great way to get from the Island to Kowloon and cheap. Great views too. Hasn't changed in all the years it's been.running. interesting to see the Wanchai reclamation area too.

Cheapest and nicest way to cross!. Incredibly cheap to board the boat, and really easy to buy the token. 3,5 HKD per adult. The boats are every 7 to 8 minutes and it takes about the same time to cross. The view on the Island is superb, I strongly suggest the upper deck.
A great way to see the Hong Kong sky line. An enjoyable way of seeing the Hong Kong skyline. The Ferry is really quick too to get from Kowloon to the city.

Star Ferry during the day and NIGHT !!. We stayed at the HARBOUR VIEW Hotel, Wan Chai so the Star Ferry was very close to the hotel. If you buy an Octopus card it is so very convenient and quick to catch a ferry across to TST ,
there ARE BREATH TAKING VIEWS AT NIGHT AS YOU RETURN TO Wan Chai on the Star Ferry .
go mad pay the extra 50 cents for the top deck. Used it several times and found it fun, cheap and a good way to get about .Found it also a good way to get some great photo shots especially at dusk
Average. The only thing interesting about this ride was the history behind it. It lasts a couple of mins. Fun to mingle with the locals while doing it.

Nostalgic !. The most inexpensive way to traverse between Kowloon and HK.
No hurry, just take your time as the crossing is done within 5 mins.
Fare ? Upper deck HKD2.50, lower deck HKD 2

Ferry. Splendid experience, go for the lower deck it's cheaper only 2 HK $ that's 20pence in UK money!
Great views of both sides of the harbour

Must do in HKG. The starferry is an iconic mode of transportation in hkg. Must do it both ways. Day time do a hkg island to TST and during night time the other way round to observe the lights on the skyscrapers. It is stop in time mode of transport. Recommended they are high frequency of service every few minutes

cheap and inexpensive to see Hong Kong from the water. If you get the chance to catch the star ferry, it is a great and inexpensive way to see Hong Kong and Kowloon from the water. The trip fro one side of the harbour to the other takes approx 10 minutes and offers great photo opportunities of the skyline.

It is what it is.. A little boat that takes you from Point A to B at a ridiculously cheap price. You could ride the ferry the entire day from Port to Port. The rides are short and lines move quickly during rush hour. I much preferred this mode of transport during my visit. Also, the view of the sky scrapers are beautiful and much better at night.
Romantic. The Star Ferry is one way to absorb the 'history' of HongKong. And undoubtedly the best way to experience what is,to me,the most beautiful harbor in the world.
Ferry. This very is an experience not to be missed you don't appreciate just haw much sea traffic there is until you are on the ferry and the Back drops are great.

Love the Star Ferry!!!. Take to Star Ferry to Kowloon from either the Central Pier or the Wan Chi Pier on the Hong Kong side. Top deck 2.50 HKD, bottom deck 2.00 HKD, buy the token before the turnstile. To buy the token, select the passenger type (adult or child) by pressing the button (green light) BEFORE adding your money or else it will roll down and out of the machine! I always help a dozen tourists with this, they forget to select the passenger first! The ride is a lovely short cruise across Victoria Harbour and the views of the Hong Kong and Kowloon coasts is to die for! Enjoy the trip!

Amazing views. Great experience you have to try it.Worth it and cost pence. The water Can be choppy and if windy depending in the time of year it can be chilly. The views are absolutely breath taking. Make sure you do it though when the smog is at its lowest so you can fully appreciate it.

Relaxing. I have taken this ferry many times. There's something so relaxing about the trip across the water, looking at all the buildings in the distance. It's cheap and efficient, with boats every few minutes.
Great way to cross to HK island. The Star Ferry is very cheap and very convenient, seem to run all the time so no waiting around. Buy your tickets from the ferry terminal. Excellent value.
Quick and scenic. Quick and scenic route to Kowloon. Starbucks and cafes were in the close proximity. Close to Big Bus tour stops.

Cute and historic way to see the city. We used the star ferry twice. Once at night going from Hong Kong to Kowloon and the other time in the afternoon doing the same journey. Both were equally enjoyable experiences! On arriving on the Kowloon side make a right along the water to the avenue of stars (currently under renovation - but the walk is scenic nonetheless). Using the ferry is really cheap as well, we paid about HK$7 for the two of us.

Interesting but not impressed. Everyone says you should do this, it was fine views of both Kowloin and HK Island impressive from the water. Couldn't find much to do in other side and never did find somewhere to get coffee! Maybe best to do at night and take in the laser light show which I guess would be exciting to watch.
CENTRAL TO TST. Very short, pleasant ride from island to island. Cheap, efficient, other than that it isn't much of an "attraction".
An Icon n travel. No visit to Hong Kong is complete without a trip on the Star Ferry. Preferred the old Hong Kong Island side terminal. Don't use top deck to travel, travel on lower deck with locals.

An experience. Before the reclamation the journey was much longer, but I think it is still worth the experience. It is great to see how the 'sailors' still use the traditional rope and pully system to lift the ramps. However, it is very interesting to see how technology have made other parts of the process more efficient. When the bell is ringing, noting that the gate is going to close soon, you still see people running down the path to catch the ferry.

2.50 Worth a Lifetime. It only cost you HKD 2.50 from Kowloon to Central, can't imagine a better scenic option to see Hong Kong like a true local. Founded in 1888, adopted the name Star Ferry in 1898, this is truly an experience to behold. Over 70,000 passengers a day, do try to catch the 8.30pm ride and watch the Hong Kong laser light show during the journey. Very impressed with the efficiency on how the ferry is handled for getting on and off. The crew is ever so supportive and ready to help. Just hit the deck and smile at the crew when you land. The ocean breeze, the Hong Kong skyline and the smell of sea water, what more of Hong Kong can we ask for?
Worth using just for views. Even if you do not have any reason to go across the harbour, it's a worthwhile trip just for the views you get - plus it's extremely cheap!

Takes only 5 minutes to cross the harbor!!. If you need to get to/from between TST and Central, take the Star Ferry is the way to GO! It costs only $2.30HKD one way and takes only 5 minutes! If you missed one, it will only be a few minutes wait for the next one.This is a good way to get to IFC from TST as there is a foot bridge (covered) between the Central ferry terminal and IFC.You can use Octopus card to pay for the fare. It's also a great way to see the skyline on either side of the harbor.

Easy and efficient mode across the harbor. Highly recommend you take the Star Ferry when in Hong Kong. It's an efficient method of transportation with beautiful views in any direction. The price can't be beat!
Great for travel from HK to Kowloon. Took the Star Ferry from Hong Kong to Kowloon, and wondered why I hadn't done this in the past. Great and easy way to Kowloon.

An iconic HKK experience. Often quicker than the MTR in the mornings and a HK institution, the Star Ferry is a must. It's a quick 15 min trip across the Harbour and you get wonderful views. Octopus cards accepted. Other than as an actual transport option, no need to do more than once.

nice ferry. it's good and nice experience to go by ferry from one to other part in town, i like it very much :) it's fast and you have great view to everything around, it's better to do it at night :)
Ferry ride. Fun with kids. Go slow. Real fun ride to see Hong Kong harbour area. Wrap up warm. We saw few people and it shows what locals use as a means of transport. Quite affordable.

Best way to relax. After whole day walking in either TST or Central and thinking about relaxing about 10 minutes, ferry is the answer you r looking for!Cheap and relaxing plus you can enjoy landscape of both Kowloon and HK side!Pay with Octopus card is a bit cheaper

Cheapest inter island mode of transpo. If you dont mind stretching legs then the cheapest inter island mode of transpo from kowloon tsim sha tsui to Central or Wan Chai is definitely the Star Ferry. It is rather very safe but be sure to buy the upper deck for around $3 hkd or .40 cents Usd you will busy seated comfortably and arrive in your destinations in less than 10 minutes. Before the subways or the trains 40 yrs ago this was the most popular and crowded mode of transpo. Definitely worth the tourist experience!

A good way to travel with amazing views of victoria harbour!. We took the star ferry from TST to Central at night after the light and sound show and the views were amazing and Octopus works with it too! Its the way locals travel!We did not take any particular tour, we just took the ferry for a routine trip frm TST to central.
Short but enjoyable trip. It doesn't last long but it doesn't cost much either and it is all very orderly and well organised - so well worth doing
Old Style HK. Don't miss a trip on the star ferry. It's been around longer than I have and will not be gone when I have. Colonial experience carried into the modern day.

Cheap, great views, convenient connection . Always loved the star ferry and will take it at least once when I'm in HK. It's cheap and good. Why pay for a ferry cruise when there's the star ferry? Don't miss it. A sunset ride is also a good way to see the harbor views. You can pay cash or just simply use your octopus card to pay. It's convenient!

The quintessential Hong Kong experience. Quite simply, you haven't really been to HK until you've been on the Star Ferry. Probably the best value must-do experience a tourist can get in the World today.
Lovely ride. Must do !!! The ferry ride is one of the best thing in Hong Kong and it is really cheap. For three tokens less than 1 dollar.

Fun local experience!. The Star Ferry is a delightful step away from the city's hustle and bustle. We make sure to take any and all visitors for a ride on the ferry. It's also a wonderful way to enjoy the beauty of the Harbour!

Take it from the Kowloon side. If you can only take one way on the Star Ferry, then take it from the Kowloon side as the Hong Kong skyline is prettier. You can either end the few minute ride in Wan Chai or Central. Take the upper deck for a few cents more and enjoy the fresh air and one of the world most beautiful city view

Make you relax in this busy city. The star ferry is an excellent way of transportation between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. You can forget about all the traffic and people in the busy city - and relax as you enjoy the short boat ride. The boats are old and full of charm. The views from the ocean is fabulous. Highly recommended.
Its a Ferry. What else is there to say. Clean enough. Its a short ride. It moves in and orderly fashion and gets you where you are going.

Good travel experience. Travelled on here to go to Kowloon. Only cost a few pence for the four of us to cross the water. You experience brilliant views of both sides of the harbour. They run on time very regularly and easy to use for the inexperienced traveller. We got tickets for the top deck to be able to see the brilliant views.

One of the best things of Hong Kong. One of the best things in Hong Kong. Although the trip across th harbour only takes a few minutes it is well worth the small amount of money paid as fare. We took the ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong on a wintry day and it was still enjoyable.It is used by both locals and tourists alike. Try for a seat in front - it is more comfortable.
Exhibition Centre . Ferry is easy way to go to exhibition Centre. It is very cheap to travel, also a good experience to travel in ferry. Less time consuming option to travel.

Great little ferry.. Can't go wrong with this ferry. Takes you from A to B (more specifically from TST to HK Island) and you get a great view of the city along the way.The ferry itself is very cheap. We paid using the Octopus card, which you should get if you come to HK as it will pay for the trains too.The ferry itself is basic enough, wooden ferry, strange benches that you can push left or right depending on which way you want to sit.It's very good taking this at night and seeing the city lit up.Though it's not as charming as the Aqua Luna, it's still a nice little ride across the water.

Brilliant part of old Hong Kong. Thesse ferries are part and parcel of Hong Kong's colonial past and are very pretty and practical. Use your Octopus card to travel on this transport or buy a ticket. Much more fun than the MTR but MTR better in Monsoon conditions.

An amazing way to appreciate the spectacular skyline and harbour. These ferries are unbelievably cheap and entertaining. Far more interesting than a subway and more relaxing too. They leave regularly and I think are the best way to go between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island.

Nice way to see the harbour. We took ferry from Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui and return. Fares very reasonable and easy to purchase tokens from terminal. We were 2 adults 2 children and baby (in baby carrier). I did see people with prams using but looked like two persons required. Lovely views of harbour and comfortable quick journey.
Harbor view. Cheap and good ! You don't have t pay much money to enjoy the view at night time on a clear day ! Don't forget to bring a carmer with you when you taking a boat ride !

Quick, cheap and convenient. The ferry is a great way to get from one side of the harbour to the other. It only costs about HK$2,50 per trip.It gives you an opportunity to see Hong Kong from a different view point. I'd recommend taking the ferry at night because then you can see all the buildings with their lights on

Wish it were a longer ride. This is about the most relaxing thing you can do in Hong Kong. For a few golden minutes you can gaze at one of the most interesting harbors in the world. Let your mind wander to what it must have been like for your relatives to grow up here, what the uncertain future holds for your friends living here, or just ponder that most basic of questions "where and what am I eating when I get across". Wish it were a longer ride, but that's what the Dukling was for, or any of the ferries to the outer islands.
Not to be missed. Do the evening sailing at 19:30 for the full light show.Value for money without doubt and you can get a seat at the front if you get on quick!

Go back in Time, with Star Ferry. Getting on Star Ferry reminded me of my 1st time in Hong Kong, almost 2 decades ago.Sitting with cool breeze, feel the old style engine, a very classy transportation.

Easy and cheap way to get around . We used the ferry a few times this trip.
Cheap and easy and very regular services!
Much cheaper to travel from Kowloon to Central than the $30+ can ride.

Star Ferry. We took the Star Ferry at the suggestion of some friends, thinking of it more as just transport to Hong Kong Island and back, but it turned out to be a nice little sightseeing experience at the ridiculously low cost of HK 2.5. They run often and get you to the other side pretty quickly, and they're fun because they are boats. Reversible benches make it possible to face forward even though the ferry itself doesn't turn around.
Excellent service so reasonably priced............ This is an excellent service, comfortable and very cheap 2.30 HKD so approx 25 pence sterling.The service is available throughout the day & evening.

Very fast and efficient no need for big bus. I saw this included in the big bus package ( which we didn't get because it seemed like way overpriced ) and decided to give it a try. The boat was very clean, fast , effective and the waiting time was minimal ! The best part ? The price !!! Dirt cheap , less than 1 usd per trip :-) highly recommended if you need to move from one part of the harbor to the other. The view at night is really nice and the fresh air feels wonderful.

Efficient service. One of the ways to explore Hingkong, the ferry services supplements what you can get from buses and the MTR but with a different perspective - on water. Always impressed by the efficiency and safety of this service. Mostly on time and staff are helpful from ticketing to crew on board. If you have not tried it, you should. Could be crowded during peak hours though, like most traffic on land.

Star ferry not to be missed. Visited and book a ticket star ferry and do the round trip of victoria harbor while sitted there will be a an introduction on every city we passed by such as kowloon, central ,causeway bay and many more..

Affordable Fare with good service. You can take this ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central or vis-a-vis with less than 10 minute at HKD2.50. Suggest to take this close to 7.45pm so that you can watch the 3D lighting show which starts at 8pm everyday.

You haven't 'done' HK if you've not taken the Ferry. A must for any visitor. Not just a tourist attraction, but one of the calmest and best ways of crossing the harbour. And for only 20-30 pence per trip, hardly a bank breaker either!
Nice ride. Fast and comfortable. Very cheap for Hong Kong rates. A quick trip across Victoria Harbour. Recommend
Very good service. Very good service cheap and fast , very nice view of the bay , and very typical way ti criss the bay !
old run down jetty. a small and old run down jetty. But a good and cheap experience to cross the strait in an alternative way. cheap ticket using octopus card...

Most scenic way to get from Central to Kowloon. Take the Star Ferry for the most scenic trip from Central to Kowloon (or other way round) with best picture Spots of the Hobg Kong skyline.
Despite the fact that MRT is much faster, the Star Ferry is still the most historic and beautiful way to Connection HKG
Simply a short ride across. We took a 10 min ride from TST to Central instead of taking MTR, just for an experience and since it is cheap. Great view at night.

Fun and Relaxing. I was contemplating on doing a Ferry Harbour Tour, but my friend mentioned the Star Ferry is a cheaper alternative if I just wanted to see the views from the water. Well, my big bus tours tickets offers a free ride back on forth HK Island and Kowloon on the Star Ferry, so we skipped the Harbour tour. It was really relaxing to cross back and forth and I saw the tickets were inexpensive, too. I was telling my friend that it must be a treat to have this commute. Hong Kong is such a beautiful city and this ride is a perfect reminder.

Star ferry. It does not take long to get across to the other side. The ferry is so cheap and well worth the money. You walk onto the ferry and there are plenty of seats. The ferry runs every 10 to 15 mins.
Easy. Easy to use, cheap and on time. It really ships often (around every 10 Minuten). What else should I want? Ah, the view.

Quick to Use. A fun, cheap and efficient way to cross the harbour and a must at least once whilst in Hong Kong. Beware exiting the terminal at Kowloon...you will be approached by hawkers. Look ahead and don't interact!

Good views all the way. You just can't visit Hong Kong without going on the Star Ferry between Kowloon and the Island! It only takes about ten minutes to get across and there are good views all the way. The cost is only 2.5 dollars for an adult and only 1.1 dollars for seniors with an Octopus card. The use of the Octopus card removes the need for trying to have the right change for the fare as well.
Visiting Dong'ao Island in China. Great mode of transport however the crew speak very little English. The seating is very organised and very comfortable.The bathrooms on board is clean.

Great inexpensive way to cross the waterway between Kowloon and HK. It is an inexpensive ($2.5HKD or <$0.50USD) to cross between Kowloon and Hong Kong. Ride is about 10 minutes, and the ferry is very frequent. The views of the skyline crossing the waterway are nice. It is something to do when in HK.

fun ride!. if you are planning to go to macau, then better opt for ferry ride. its cheap and fun. the ferry itself is very comfortable with a bar of its own, toilets and spacious comfortable seats. dont go during monsoon season though, ur in for a tough ride.

Interesting, Comfort. I take the ferry from Koloon side cross the sea to the Island. Why I take this method, because it is cheaper and can see the view of Victoria Harbour. Unlike the underground train, everywhere is the same running inside the tunnel.The ferry is quite efficiency, only wait for 10 minutes and the journey about 10 minutes crossing the harbour. The ferry seems so old, but many people enjoy to take it. Cheers^^

A ferry boat trip for all seasons. For you get wonderful views of Victoria, Kowloon and the Habor all for a 2.80 HKD ferry ride across Victoria Habor. You pay into a machine and receive a token good for a one-way trip, but choose upper or lower deck on this lovely old ferry before you board as there are different boarding areas.
always the best way to get a little view of hong kong. best way to get out of the city for a better view of the city. night or day this is always so much fun. short but just perfect .
Just a simple ferry ride. This is the other mean of transportation to HK Island.Nothing much to say.Maybe improve the condition of the ferry station-quite sluggish

Great and cheap way to see the habour. This must be one of the cheapest way to see the Victoria habour and HK skyline. For HK$2.50 a ride on the Star Ferry, you can enjoy a wonderful ferry ride from TST to Central/Wan Chai or vice versa. Go for the upper deck seats for a better view.

Stunning views... anytime of the day!. We love crossing Victoria harbour on board the Star Ferry especially since traveling with a toddler. It's so cheap and offers stunning views. We've taken it during the day and evening, even during sunset and foggy day, and loved it every time. If you just missed one ferry, no worries another one will be leaving in 10-15 minutes. It's easy to pay and the boarding is done very efficiently, every time! We were debating if it was worth the hour long night cruise. It's so expensive at HKD170 that we couldn't justify the spending: what more would we see? Same price as taking the ferry 60 times across!

10 minutes of joy. From the efficiency of obtaining the (reasonably prices) tokens to go on board to watching the classic green and white ferries with their starred funnels arrive; to the 7 or 8 minutes of awesome urban scenery against a beautiful rural backdrop; to the equal efficiency of docking In Kowloon - complete with the hooking of the ropes - this is a local institution not to be missed....And at a third of the price of the MTR to do the same thing it is one of the best bargain tourist experiences in HK
HK Staple. Day or night, you need to experience it. Very easy and quite useful in exploring other parts of Hong Kong island. Sit at the front.
An interesting ride. We took the Star Ferry because we had tickers from another tour... it was a quick and enjoyable ride.
Cheap way to travel between places. The star ferry is a cheap and great way to travel to islands which are not connected by underground.
Stopover . Great way to travel from Wan Chai to Kowloon and good value. A great piece of history preserved and providing good service.

Good trip. We got the star Ferry form the harbor in Kowloon to Hong Kong simply to visit the attraction park which was in front of the the Star avenue.. The trip was so short and cheap: 10mn for 1,5$.. Nice experience..

Reliable and Cheap. Regular and reliable and cheap, amazed they can run this ferry so effectively at the prices they charge. Using the Octopus card we hardly noticed the charge, it was so reasonable.
We used this every day during our visit, and do t forget to take a look at the view on your way across the harbour.
Good way to view the City. Good alternative view of the city with a commentary along the way. Always helpful as it means you get to learn what you are looking at!

Cheap, reliable and full of character.. The traditional way to cross to/from the island and back. Simple, regular, really cheap (cash or octopus cards) and still plies the couple of routes to decent start points for exploration, hotels, shopping or food.

A must. This ferry is a must when visiting Hong Kong. Its fast, cheap (2.5$ during the week) and gives you a good perspective of the city from a one of a kind vantage point. I would say it's highly recommend!
What great fun. What could be better than a trip across the harbour in the old fashioned star ferry. The atmosphere is unbeatable. Love this place

A must do. Every time we return to Hong Kong we take a trip on the Star Ferry. It is one of the constants in an ever changing city. What else costs so litle and provides so much in the crossing between
Kowloon and Hong Kong island. The day we went the weather was perfect and the views spectacular.

Yet the best way to cross the Victoria Harbour!. An iconic symbol of HongKong, the star very still remain the fastest and cheapest way to cross the harbour while enjoying the skyline from a different angle. Worthy!!!
Yeah...a ferry. Thats it.. The journey takes 8minutes and costs 2.5HKD. You can use Octopus too. Its nice, however, I prefared the MTR. But it was nice to get the feeling of see and touch of history.
Briliant. Amazing service. Very frequent and whilst in the waters the views are amazing. Easy to use and very convenient way to get to certain places

A must do when in HK. The trip across the harbour in the star ferry is one of the most inexpensive experiences available , although the architecture of the harbour has significantly changed the ferries remain the same. A visit to Hong Kong is not complete without a trip on the ferry,

Access to utter HK Islands. Great way to see HK coastline and the surrounding islands are fantastic for a seafood feast if you are a fan, also great for those whom like to keep fit and don't mind a little hiking/walking.

Cheap but delightful. This a Hong Kong icon that is symbolic of the city itself. No trip to Hong Kong is complete without it. The main ferry plies between Central and Ocean terminal in Kowloon and takes about 10 minutes. Fare used to be HKD1.00 but was recently increased to HKD2.00 - how do they do it? Buy your tokens from the vending machine and join the Q which moves very quickly. The seats are reversible so just swing it the way you are heading - the ferry itself does not turn around but goes back in the opposite direction.
A Must Do. You cannot visit Hong Kong without a ride on the Star Ferry...Great views of both sides and a slice of local life. Fun, reliable and cheap.

So much Hong Kong. It's just a short ride but almost historical. No matter how old you are, the ferry is older than you. I always think about how it must have been here 50 years ago when I take this ferry. You can actually take the subway, but the ferry is so much fun and cheap as well. At night, this is even more amazing.
What is not to love. The essence of Hong Kong, amazing views, local flavour, great for people watching, costs nothing much, gives a feeling of reality to your stay in HK
Cheapest Ferry in the World. Fast way to travel the famous Victoria Harbour of Hong Kong.Very Cheap, Get an Octopus Card from anywhere (7 Eleven)
Great View of Skyline. Need an octopus Card or have exact change in hand for the kiosk. Great view of the city and very cheap to move between islands.
Fun ride. A very cheap way to cross the harbor, old school ferry boats, with a great view of the skyline. Maybe best to try at night to get a view of the city lights.
Fun. These are a cheap and easy way to get about. Lots of fun and interesting sights. Lovely out on the water and good views of the harbour, island and Kowloon.
How could you go to HK and not catch a ferry?. Would recommend you try this. Great experience out on the harbour. Easy to use and good value for money.

Cheap and simple crossing with a view. This ferry is the best way to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. It is a much better experience than using the MTR.
Its cheap, have a great view and regular.

On time delivery every time. Not once was the ferry late, for a few old vessels transferring their cargo across the waters hour after hour they do their job perfectly and its far more scenic than the metro. You can even use your octopus card here.
The Star Ferry is cheap and also convenient.. The Star Ferry is cheap and convenient for travelling from Kowloon Ferry terminal to the Hong Kong island side.
You simply have to do it once. The Star Ferry is a Hong Kong must do. It might not be as fast or effecient as the MTR but the views are much better.

Highly recommend taking the ferry at least once if you go to HK. Ferry was great, very cheap, fast - maximum waiting time for a ferry was probably ten minutes and the ride from Kowloon to Hong Kong takes less than 5 minutes. Also offers great views of both sides of the harbour at night. Every visitor has to take this at least once.

Scenic View of Victoria Harbour. This ferry can take you across the harbour or to the far lying islands in Hong Kong. It is quite slow, but good for taking pictures and feeling the sea air. There are convenience stores and restaurants near the stations.

View Hong Kong Skyline. Travelled with family. Did not like the ferry even though the Hong Kong skyline was a good to look at from the ferry. It was a bit crowded and the guides misled us into purchasing premium tickets which were not worth.
Rustic and Cheap. If you are not in a rush, this is a good way to appreciate the skyline of Hong Kong. Gets you between TST and Central.

convenient transport Hkg-Kowloon when boring of subway MTR or buses. It's dated back in 1970 when there was no MTR and bridges, the Ferry was the only transport from/to Hkg-Kowloon side and to Macau or China Guangdong province. It's still a good to ride, clean, convenient and easy to ride on and off, and cheap.
Easy and nice way to cross the bay. Easy to take and typical for Hong-Kong. Only 15 minutes to cross the bay and to have nice view from both side.

A must do in Hong Kong. Experience the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong on this 10 minute Ferry ride from HK island to Kowloon.
It is also well worth taking the harbour tour and seeing the magnificent Docks and ships being loaded with freight.

Nostalgia. Why would you embark on a short trip using and old ferry. Call it nostalgia or vintage, there is a special atmosphere the first time you take the star ferry TST-central.
Take a date and a camera!

Star Ferry still the Highlight of a HK Visit. I can;t imagine coming to HK without my usual lucky trip on the Star Ferry - just go back and forth for an hour and you will see all of the best views of the Harbour day or night. It costs around 25p each way...

Always fun -- for the true HK experience. A must -- you get a sense of the great views on both sides and a bit of old HK. Unless you really want to fight the Kowloon crowds I would not spend much time there (could have been the time of year)

HKD2 for a tradisional rides. What a way to get to Kowloon area from HK island. Its cheap, fun and short trip that brings you back to the old time. The sailor are old man wearing sailormoon costume! Bring a cup of coffee ( starbuck available in the station on the way to the ferry) and enjoy the very short trip on an old wooden chair.
A great experience. A great way to visit Kowloon and experience some exciting views of Hong Kong.Be sure to add to your itinerary
A nice way of looking at HK. Gets you a nice and closer view of the HK skyline. However, to actually see HK the Big Bus trip is advisable.

Star Ferry. This is a cheap way to get out on the harbor. Other than that I am not sure why it is a main attraction. I would suggest having someone with you who can point out the significant sights otherwise, it is just a boat trip.

Cheap Ride - Great Views. This was a really cheap way of going from Central to Kowloon. I took this while going to the Ladies Market and other attractions. If I am not mistaken it cost me about $2 USD for one-way. Its worth it just to get a view of the harbour from that perspective.
Old fashioned transport. Lovely oldie worldly ride across the harbour for virtually nothing!. Great to see the local people going about their daily business

Average Ferry infrastructure . Good to visit in night
We went on 31 dec night so it was having amazing views
Ferry structure is not to the mark and can be made a more luxurious
STAR FERRY. The ferry is a convenient option for travelling across the bay. It is quick and cheap way to travel. it only takes about 10 minutes to cross.

Light on the pocket . Best way to commute between the hong kong island and TST provided ur ready to walk a bit... It's not very clean but it's the most ancient way of commute in Hong Kong.. It's a great thing that they have still maintained the ferry s so well... The view while on the ferry is the feast to the eyes
Great Transport Option to Hong Kong Island. Regular trips and pretty cheap to travel. It can get chilly if you're on the open ferry so make sure you have your layers. Otherwise, fantastic!
Nice way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong. Easy way to travel between kowloon and Hong Kong with a view. Regular 10 minutes service. Use your Octopus card.

Best way to travel between HK Island and TST. This is the cheapest and most pleasant ride one can experience in HK. The ride may be shorter now with the land reclamation but nonetheless still a very enjoyable way to cross the harbour.
Cheapest transport of hongkong. Really good transport and cheapest . Found it amazing. It takes little longer than in mtr. It goes to wanchai and central.
Affordable and beautiful . At 60 cents AUS, it was a very affordable activity. It's a nice 10 minute journey across the harbour. Amazing views. Recommended!
Cheap way to see the bay. Do the journey one way or both ways for top views of the bay. It only take 10 minutes and you can get some great pictures and videos of the either side of the bay.
Fast and Fun. This was a fun, fast and easy way to go across the harbor. The views are great and I liked the open air. Snap some pics and get on to the next adventure!
Great fun. Great way to get around...very cheap and when you throw in the photo opportunities and a harbour cruise this is the best value thing you can do in HK....great fun

Good way to see Hong Kong . If you are going to visit Hong Kong then a trip on the star ferry is an absolute must
There are several routes but the most popular one is from central district to Kowloon the trip takes about 10 minutes and costs very little

FANTASTIC view. What a way to travel! Top up your Oyster card and travel in the star ferry for next to nothing. It's a quick trip but there's breathtaking views. Try and get on the ship during the light show and watch both sides of the water light up.
Hong Kong Tradition!. Great journey across to the main island, cheap and reliable. The kids loved it and is a very authentic Hong Kong experience
Must do when your in Hong Kong!. We highly recommend riding during the day and nights if you have a chance. The views are stunning. The star ferry is very affordable for an entire family.
Pleasure . Very efficient ,fast and economic ferry,easy to get ticket on spending machine ,check the running time if you will spend to much time in Victoria island.
Cheap thrills. For $0.30 US, you get a fantastic view of both sides of the harbor. Can't get enough? Splurge on another ride.

Must try. Ferry was used in the old day as the only mean to cross the Harbour. It's so affordable and the frequency is only a few minutes. It also takes a few minutes to cross the Harbour. In the night time, we can even see the beautiful lights from the buildings on both sides of the Harbour. Star ferry maintains a very low fare to their service. Awesome!

See HK and Kowloon from the cheapest seat in town!. I have two favorite ferry journeys in the world - The ferry to Mull from Oban and this one. They are somewhat different! However the only way to see the HK and Kowloon skylines is from the Star Ferry and for the price it is just amazing. One of the real wonders of the world

Must do. This is just a must do. It´s a beautiful ride that doesn´t take more than 15 minutes and the price is negligible. Sometimes it can even be the fastest route from Hong Kong to Kowloon and vice versa depending on where you are.If you happen to be in Tsim Sha Tsui (Avenue of the Stars or around) or in Central, just hop in and skip the MTR for a station.Very well worth it.
Nice trip. It is an average tour around the harbour. Something which you must do while in Hong Kong but not anything special.

Nice HK harbour views and convenient travel. We like to use Star Ferry to cross the channel from HK and Kowloon and vice versa if time permits. It is a reasonably cheap means of transport, and you get great views of HK and Kowloon skylines.

Harbour cruise in vintage ferry. We took A Symphony of Lights Star Ferry so that we can watch the light show from a closer point. The waves were unexpectedly strong so folks with motion sickness should avoid this. The tickets were pricey for the hour long ride and comes with refreshments. The interior of the ferry was warm so when we got too cold from the night wind, it provided great comfort. Overall quite a decent experience.

Magical. Victoria harbour is one of those beautiful places that make you glad to be alive. Jumping on theatre ferry for a quick trip over for the price of nothing is both greet fun and simply magical, especially at night when its all lit up. A not to be missed part of the whole hong kong experience.

Efficient and safe ferry boat. The trip between Hong Kong and Kowloon is only about 10 minutes in heavily-trafficked shipping lanes, and they travel on a frequent schedule many hours daily. Star Ferry is easy to find, amidst the public piers, because it is clearly marked and well-known. I don't know if there is any relationship in the names, but the Star Ferry is near the popular Star Avenue (currently closed for renovation). Use your Octopus card for quick easy boarding, rather than buying separate tickets from the booth (and possibly standing in line). The actual ferry boats aren't 'new' but they are sturdy and large enough to be quite safe even in the occasional rough seas. This is a great transit that's just long enough to enjoy a breeze on the water, and fast enough to handle commuter traffic angst. Great way to cross ...
historic ferry. well worth a trip across to Kowloon on one of these iconic ferries. public transport is cheap in Hong Kong

Old, smelly but full of character. This is a unique and worthy mode of transport and an attraction itself. At roughly 50c cents Australian it is a journey affordable for all, great views of the harbour and people from every walk of life and probably every country. Get on it.

Nice experience. This is a great way to appreciate and admire Hong Kong's Skyline. The trip might be a little bit pricey but it is worth trying especially if you are there for the first time. If you intend to see the light show, make sure you get the tickets early during the day. Sometimes they might be sold out by noon.

Worth Trying. Been to Hong Kong a couple of times already but yesterday was my 1st time to ride the Star Ferry. A scenic, cheap and fast ride to get to the other side of the island. Way cheaper than bus,mtr and taxi. 2.00 per adult on regular days and 2.80 on fridays til sundays and public holidays.

A must do. We took the round the bay trip, not the across the bay, as it was just for the experience.
Very well priced attraction, and the area around is also very nice.

A Must. A very cheap way to cross between Hong Kong island and KowloonThe fare is 2.5 $HK which is peanutsThe crossing takes 10 min and there is a great view of the skylinesThe lines look very long but they move very fastYou can find taxis or double decker "hop on hop off" tour buses at either sideGreat to do with family
Fab views cheap journey. Caught the ferry back at night and watched the last show Cheap ticket and good views of a wonderful skyline

Great form of travel across the harbour.. Been on a couple of times since arriving in HK both upper and lower deck. For less then 50 cents Australian is a cheap and fun way of travel across the harbour.
A HK must do. An public transport experience which is a must see and do while in HK, a stunning view for a cheap price (less than 0.5 USD).

Cheap with a nostalgia feel. I really enjoy taking the ferry every time especially in the evenings. The lights over the harbour are spectacular. The nostalgic feeling on the ferry without airconditioning really makes me feel cozy.
Fabulous . Hey why not? Fantastic why not yake harbor cruise for all most nothing! A total must for aĺl of us checking out HK :)
Cheap as chips.....cheaper actually. Great value 6 hkd to get over to the island. Clean and easy.Great option for something to do. Something for everyone on both sides. Can be crazy busy or not.

The most cheaper way to enjoy Hong Kong Harbour view. I always travel Star Ferry across from Hong Kong Central to Kowloon Island, as this is cheaper way to enjoy the Hong Kong harbour view and very relaxing and never too crowding if you travel after 9am.
Cheap efficient way to cross to Central. Especially with an Octopus card, very easy to cross between Kowloon and HK Island. The ferry runs very often and provides great views on the way.

Great harbor tour for cheap!. Sure, there are other ways to tour Victoria Harbor, but for a couple of bucks, this seems like the best way to view the city from the water.
It's a no thrills kind of ride, but boarding was quick and the ride across was enjoyable with great views of the skyline.

Simply not optional. You must do this , particularly if staying in Kowloon. It is a very cheap and quaint way to cross the harbour and offers a great view of both sides of the harbour on the crossing, particularly at night.
Fab. Great look out place for a budget price. Gets to see the whole harbour and the Hong Kong in a green/close to nature ways.
Decent view . Went for a ride around sunset. Great view on the boat. Both the vehicles and the ports are pretty quaint. How come it was only 2.5 HKD a ticket?

Best Bargain in HK. For $2.50 HKD each way (about 35 cents USD), you get to experience Hong Kong's iconic 5 star ferrry ride. It comes every 10 minutes and takes you right in the center of the city and has great views of the skyline. What else can you ask for ?
Cheap & Best. One should board the star ferry at least once between WAN CHAI FERRY PIER/or CENTRAL to KOWLOON which is very cheap at HKD 2.5/pp, it take around 15-20 mins to cross.

What can I say ? Best to experience. Absolutely enchanting Central to Kowloon and vice versa I do this
Evenings have the bonus of a view you will remember always
Star ferry Barbour tour. We took the 1 hour star ferry harbour tour. Nice and relatively cheap way to see the harbour. Worth doing a day and night trip as it certainly looks its best at night.

Nice, practical and inexpensive. That's just a simple way to cross to/from HK Island while enjoying the view. No hurdle, especially if you have an octopus card. Even if you prefer MTR, the ferry is worth at least one trip (most people will say two for day and night views).
Ferry trip. Good, regular service. Virtually no waiting as service is very frequent. Facilities are average. Seating could be improved.
Definitely take the ferry across the water. We were staying in Causeway Bay, but we took the star ferry to Kowloon. The trip is easy and the views are great. A must-do.

Nighttime crossing. We caught the Star ferry across the harbour at night time and have to say that out was definitely worth it. It's not free, but at the price, it just as well have been. The views from the ferry were fabulous and I'd say it's a must do even if you're only in Hong Kong for a short time!

Great fun and practical too . The Star Ferry is a Hong Kong institution. For many, many years these reliable little craft were the only way across the harbor, way before the various tunnels that are available to us today. The Star Ferries have to be on your 'Must Do' list. The crew still wear the traditional sailor tops and the short ride only takes a moment but let the wind blow in your hair and enjoy the sights and sounds of one if the world's busiest harbors and squint just a little as you imagine what it was all like 50 or 100 years ago.Magic happens when you do.

Great views of the city. Whenever in Hong Kong I like to do one or two trips on the Star Ferry. It is generally less crowded than the MTR and a great way to unwind. You really appreciate the switch between Kowloon and the Island when you travel this way.

Old school transport. The legendary Star ferry. Delivers you from the mid levels of Hong Kong Island to the hustle and bustle of Kowloon. And don't forget the watches and suits the hawkers try and smash you with as you start your walk on the Kowloon side.A great way to get around!
Walking Back In Time. What a great way to get from one side of HGK to the other... great views from the old ferries and cheap as chips to boot!

Trip is worth it for the view. What a great historical boat ride, we came from the Kowloon side and crossed to the central pier on hong kong island, the ferry is a short ride but so worth the view it gives you of the skyline. A must just to say you rode the famous ferry, and the octopus card makes it really easy from MTR to ferry.
Pleasant experience.. An absolute must to try in HK. Cheap ride across the mainland. Good fun with the kids. Used the Octopus card.

A cheap way to see the HK skyline. The Star Ferry is an absolute must when showing off HK to a first time visitor, or when visiting HK for the first time. I still remember my first trip on it more years ago than I care to state here!! It's an incredibly cheap way to spend 20 mins and when you get off in Kowloon and look back at the Hong Kong island skyline, the only word that you'll utter is.....stunning!!Taking the MTR back to the Island is my preferred route, simply for the variety and speed, but taking the ferry back would afford some great views leading all the way up to the Peak......Most likely the next venue on the itinerary!!

Cross the islands cheaply. The ferries look old but they are perfectly fine, extremely cheap way of crossing Victoria Bay between Kowloon and Hong Kong to different points. Gives you great views as well.
Old world charm. Slow compared to the MTR or Bus but its the icon of HK and a must try. Cheap for tourists to cross between Kowloon and the Island. Just like the trams of HK.

Easy way to duck across Hong Kong Harbour. Convenient and frequent way to cross the harbour and avoid the traffic! The experience depends a lot on the weather but the city view from the water us always enchanting. Inexpensive mode of transport.

Convenience and fun. Have been using the ferry to get across every day during our sightseeing. It is very convenient, affordable and a great way to unwind in this busy city. A must if you are in Hong Kong.

Needs Improvement. It was ok. However, on our trip from Macau to Hong Kong an old couple were seating at our chair! Although there were available seats, I feel that they should seat at their designated seats.. I was just lucky that there were available seats nearby but if the ferry was full it would be really hard to look for a seat of someone took mine and it would be really awkward if a young adult like me would tell the old couple to transfer seats when they're already settled. Someone should man and lead people to their seats. The Star Ferry also didn't have much food to buy that we can eat while traveling.
Fast, clean and we didn't drown.. Fast, clean and we didn't drown. Also cheap. Covered at the sides so you don't get too wet. Nearly got hit by a trawler though.

So much Fun for so little!!. One of the most fun public transportation in the world. For a small fee, you get to ride the famous Star Ferry and go back in time with boat over 50 years old! Get one of the best views of Kowloon and Hong Kong island to boot!

Best way to cross the bay . Something you just have to do. No matter how short your visit to Hong Kong you will need to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong, and you just have to take the Star Ferry. You can buy single journey tokens from machines at the entrance ( that give change) and then just enjoy the journey. Lower deck tickets are slightly cheaper than upper deck, and as long as it's not too choppy I would recommend this deck as it is open so you can lean out and get even better views.

Great trip . This is a superb way to see Hongkong. Cost HK $2.50 for a one way ticket. Very organised system of boarding and they have well sign posted directions going on and off the ferry. Would recommend a night trip as well as during the day.
Great and cheap way to take in the sights. As the title suggests, the Star Ferry is the best and cheapest way to take in the sights of the city and the harbour.
Classic. Simply a classic everybody has to try whilst in HK, works very effective just like the tube, nice for pictorial too.

A Star Attraction. Holidaying in HK again this Christmas and of course we used the Star Ferries to get across the harbour. They are absolutely reliable and a real treat. Great for photos but you'll need to get your sea legs. Octopus cards make it so easy to travel.

Cheap with GREAT views!. If you want to see the view and stay above ground, one way to get across the Harbor is to use the Star Ferries! They are very affordable, clean and quick! While MTR's are quicker, this is a nice way to see the sights as well!
It was convenient. We took this ferry from HK to Macau. The journey was long but it was comfortable. I had a bit of sea sick but I can say this sea trip was ok.
An enjoyable ride!. This is one of the best way to see the harbour. Highly recommended to those seeking a relaxing tour of the harbour. The fare includes refreshments for each paying customer.

Good public transport. This is a great tool to get around as you see HK. But it is just a boat ride to get between HK and Kowloon. Nice and must-do, but not anything exceptional. To read the reviews, one would think that it is a destination-type activity. Build it into your itinerary as a transport option.
Always fun to take the ferry. the ferry is always an efficient, clean, safe and fun way to get from one side of Hong Kong to the other.

Fast and Pretty. We rode from Mongkok to Hong Kong Island (Central) at night. It cost the four of us 13 HKD total (around $1.60 USD). It is a short ride but the sites are amazing at night as all the building on both sides of the water can be seen as most are lit at night. Highly Recommend.

Star Ferry a MUST in Hong Kong. You can't visit Hong Kong and not enjoy a trip on the iconic Star Ferry! Our kids loved this old style trunk type ferry ride. It all adds to the excitement of this bustling city! It's cheap and gives a fantastic view of the harbour!

Cheapest way to enjoy the harbour views. For 2.50$ this must be the cheapest cruise in the world! Getting your ticket is very easy at the vending machine. We had time during the quick cruise to snap a few pictures of both Kowloon and Victoria harbour. The engines emit quite some smoke when you stand on the deck but it's worth it.

Vintage Hong Kong experience. I could takes these ferries all day long - enjoy the people, the views, the harbor traffic, any time of day and evening. The ferries go between Hong Kong and Kowloon and cross the harbor. I preferred the top deck (at a marginally higher price), and taking the ferry in the direction of Hong Kong.
Enjoyable little trip. Used the ferry to cross over to the other side of the city, using the octopus card. A short trip across but a nice experience.

great view and $$ saving. The most $$ saving public transport option in HK. I always take it to get across from HK island to Kowloon; helped me save heaps on the road. Plus, great view from both side on the sea.
Great fun!. Nearly missed out on this must-do experience. Glad we didn't, it was great. Beautiful view crossing from the Kowloon side - we were lucky, the weather was good. Short but essential.
Just a ferry. Nothing extraordinary here. Basically allowing you to see the city skyline from the water. It is a good cheap option to move between the different districts.
Famous old boats have to be done. We used the ferry a few times and you get great views of the harbour. It is only 10/15 minutes across and has to be done

Convenient and cheap way to get across the harbour. If it is your first time in Hong Kong, then you need to ride the Star Ferry. It is also a very convenient way to get to and from Kowloon to Central or Wanchai.

Nice views. If a good seat can be selected, the view is worth the trip across. At the moment there is a lot of construction work in progress on the island side pier, which means that the access is a bit inconvenient. The subway is a convenient alternative.

Very convenient and great value for money. As part of our Big Bus delux tickets, we got tickets to take the Star Ferry. We got off Big Bus close to the harbour and the Big Bus representative directed us to the harbour where other representatives directed us to the ferry. We boarded the Star Ferry and it took about 20 minutes from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. The trip was very pleasant and the scenery was great. We returned later to take the ferry back to Kowloon. On the harbour in Kowloon and on Hong Kong Island harbour there is a halaal restaurant that sells reasonably priced food. We ordered the chicken wraps and chips.

Views at a bargain . Quick, cheap and a great way to take in the night lights. It's a Hong Kong must do! Try a wonder up to
Temple market after...
A must for tourists. Efficient, reliable, cost-effective way to travel between hongkong and kowloon side. A visit to hongkong is not complete without riding Star Ferry.
Travel into one port and out of another for maximum enjoyment. Ride into one terminal and go into another one to truly explore the city. Worth seeing more than one port, and a great way to travel.

Skip the Harbor Cruise, Ferry instead. This was a fun way to get to HK island, and a great value. Only an 8-10 minute trip, but a nice view and fun experience. Skip the Harbor Cruise--we tried this one night and its just a crazy-expensive version of the ferry!

Pleasant little journey . It was fun taking the star ferry, especially in the evening time as we are able to enjoy the night view of Victoria Harbour.
It's a bit crowded though during Christmas Festive season, but as the trip is just a few minutes, it's not that bad.
Great cheap option. Only 2.8HK per person (one way) to travel from Central to Kowloon for a nice day trip. Leaves from pier 7

Great value sight seeing. For a couple of Hong Kong dollars you get to see one of the best views in the world as the ferry makes its way across the harbour at a central point. Queuing can be challenging if you don't like crowds and pushing and shoving.

Sure.... Part of me wants to give the Star Ferry a bad review because it seems to be a little overrated everywhere and certainly there must be better things to do in such a large and fascinating city. Truth is, it is ah honest, fun and inexpensive glimpse into Hong Kong life offering a unobstructed view of HK's iconic skyline. In fact much of Hong Kong's public transport make memorable moments to your stay. The double decker trams and buses, the subway, the midlevel escalators, Victoria peak tram, jetfoil to Macau and airport express train all all worth doing as well. It's the journey not the destination they say, and you should make the Star ferry part of your journey, but there are some cool less-visited gems to seek out: like the Monestary of 10,000 Buddhas or a hike along dragon's back that are both a journey and a destination to experience.

Brilliant experience . I went of night tour and light display show. It was fantastic to see but the publicity says about the music but I struggled to hear but and also found trying to get a good space to see the show a bit of a task.

Star ferry. Easy and affordable way to travel between HK and Macau or between HK island to Kowloon (approx 20 min). To Macau the ride takes about an hour, no need to upgrade to first class. Basically the difference is you get to board / get off first and you have access to some snacks, not worth the premium cost in my opinion.
