Good transport . Very easy to use and a part of MRT best to have a octopus card for payment nice journey across the harbour boats are a bit rustic but all part of the of the experience

cheap way to get across the harbour. What better way than taking star ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central / Admiralty. You get the view, the cheap price and transportation heritage all in one. A must-do if you are in Hong Kong.

Cheap, Great View, Enjoyable.. Very enjoyable short ride to see the skyline. Very cheap in price. And is something that is very local. A contrast between the busy city life, and a slow boat ride, but helps to really take the view in. For the cheap price, riding in the day time and vs. night time really give total different experience of the city.

Free and Great Experience. I didn't know the star ferry was a kinda attraction before I came to Hong Kong. One local friend suggested me to try. I was lucky enough to have a free journey (the price was cheap though). Good view for Victoria Harbour.

Must do!. It's a must do, only $3.50 which is about 35p or 50 cents. We loved the views from the boat and the whole experience. The ferry has been running for such a long time and you can see that in the experience if the staff. Great experience! Enjoy
excellent trip. I went on the Star ferry to go and sea a show at TST and I would recommend taking it at night because the harbour at night is so nice.

A must in Hong Kong. Even if you have no reason to go to the other side of the harbour, you must take the Star Ferry. And even if the MTR seems better, at least once choose the ferry. This is Hong Kong.

Very cheap and just great. No words can describe how great is the Star Ferry. A small trip between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon ( and viceversa). You have the choice of two peirs in Hong Kong Island (Central and Wan Chai) , in Kowloon only one (Tsim Sha Tsui). The view, the feeling, the peaceful ride that offers Start Ferry (yeah, peaceful), is a must in Hong Kong. Our hotel was in Causeway Bay, and after discovering the Start Ferry, when we had to go to Kowloon, instead of the subway MTR, we used Start Ferry ( cheaper, much cheaper).

Image of Hong Kong. If you only have one day in Hong Kong this is one of the things you have to do. Great view of the skyline and the ride is really cheap. Try either the Tsim Sha Tsui to Wan Chai or Central route.

A very non-expensive way to cross the harbour. The boat ride is approx. 10 minutes and cost around 3 HKD when buying tickets at the pier - which in my book is very cheap.The boat itself is not that much worth mentioning, however the views towards both sides of the bay is what you want to focus your lens on, so to speak.Worthwhile taking this ferry when in Hong Kong.

Slow but nice. Took the Star Ferry from TST to Central. It is surely slow as the MTR will take me there faster but... this is cheap. 2.5HKD. It's also enjoyable to feel the Victoria Harbour breeze and imagining that this is the way of transport of Hong Kongers when MTR is still non-existent.

Rustic and affordable ferry ride. A tradition ferry which is heavily used by the local to get from mainland to island, it provides both convenience in getting across the straits, but also to join the hordes of locals in the transit.

Good deal for $2. Excellent view.. When I lived in HK in the 60s, it costed 20 cents to take the star ferry, now it is $2. The area around the Ferry terminal has changed a lot, but they are still using the same boats. It is a 15 minutes ride and the view is pretty good especially at night. You have a chance to see the Hong kong side and the Kowloon side.If you are a tourist, you have to try it.

Cheap and excellent transport with great HK skyline view. It was so cheap that we pay only $2 per person. The transport is very efficient, but with great view of Hong Kong skyline. It is really worth a try and experience how the Hong Kong people move from one island to the other.

Don't leave HK without a ride. This is an icon of Hong Kong. Don't leave Hong Kong with at least one ride. It can get crowded up to 9am and again in the evening rush hour. I prefer the lower deck to watch the old 'sailors' in their cute outfits handle the ropes.

kOwlon. When in Hong Kong we took Subway to the the station that was close to the star ferry. A very nice gentleman helped us with the right subway and showed us where the star ferry dock was. The ferry runs frequently and is only a very short ride to Kowlon. The cost is only about fifty cents Canadian.

Must do when in hk. You haven't been to hk if you haven't crossed the harbour! Can pay with octopus cards to get on the ferry. I suppose that the ferry wasn't that clean, but pleasant ride otherwise. The view across the harbour is great. Recommended and would probably go there again.

Great service . Cheap and quick. Cross over from the main land to island quickly and cheap. No better way to get across and worth it for the price. You should take this service even if your using a cab on one side vs the other.
Efficient and excellent views. Takes no time at all and offers excellent views of the harbour and the skyline on both sides. Very regular service. Can be accessed with an Octopus card.Recommended.

Cheap alternative to cross from Kowloon to HGK. It's a cheaper alternative than metro to cross between the two main islands in Hong Kong. With the added bonus that during the night you can get some magnificent views of the Hong Kong skyline from the river. Do it at least once during your trip to Hong Kong, it's an experience worth having! Just make sure you grab your camera, or else the waves can make you drop it by accident!

A must do cheap attraction. Great vies of the harbour where you get a real feeling for Hong Kong. Go top deck one way and the with the locals on the bottom duck and check out the engine. You would be mad not to do this. Worth doing at night and during the the day

Quite nice. On the whole, it's average. The cleanliness is bad. The ferry was dirty with a lot of stains on the seats. We did not buy fist class tickets. However, the ride itself was really pleasant. I would recommend that you stand near the water, not too far off, and enjoy the breeze.According to my experience, it would be better to ride at night as it would be more cooling as you ride and more colourful. The skyline would be nice at night. The ride would cost around 3HK$. It would be better to buy an Octopus card when travelling in Hong Kong. It can be used for trains, the star ferry, airport express trains, buses and even trams. There are different types of Octopus cards, specifically for children and adults.
Great way to see the harbour. Its a quick way to see the skyline of both sides. Take it at night and the hong kong side will come alive.

Must do in Hong Kong. With easy access from either Central or Wanchai on the Hong Kong Island, the Star Ferry ride to Tsim Tsa Tsui was definitely a most enjoyable part of my recent trip to the bustling city of Hong Kong. Wonderful view of the city landscape both during the day and after dark. Also a great vantage point for the light show every evening starting at 8pm.

Must do activity in Hong Kong. A five to ten minutes ferry across the harbour will take you breathtaking views of landmarks buildings in Hong Kong. Entry can by via Tsimshatsui MTR station or Central station.
A quick trip across Victoria Harbour. We caught the Star Ferry a couple of times and loved the experience. The views from the ferry are wonderful!

Great value. When I read that this was a "must do" experience in Hong Kong, I was doubtful. However, now that I've done it, I agree wholeheartedly. It's a short ride and inexpensive, and provides fantastic views of Hong Kong's incredible sky line and harbor. Include this in your itinerary. Here's a tip - for an authentic Hong Kong Dim Sum experience go to Lin Heung Tea House for lunch after getting off the ferry.

Off to Heshan. From Hong Kong to Heshan, for work. We got first class tickets and sat up the top. Bags was checked in however on the way back we will keep them with us.You get a bottle of water.They also have private cabins.Trip was quite enjoyable, 2.5 hours really cool seeing all the scenery.
Perfect trip from hk Island to kowloon!. Take THE Ferry at 19.45 , just before THE symphony of lights start. Then You have magnificent view of THE lightend buildings on hk Island . Very cheap !

Some things havent changed! Love the Ferry.... I remember Hong Kong in the 1970s and 1980s. Well so much has changed! These Star Ferries though are the very same ferries that I rode back then though! The area around the Ferry terminal has changed a lot, but the actual boats, just the same! I like that. Back them they were used a lot!! Other options like over water and under water transport didnt exist them. The ferry was the lifeline! Now people can get aross on metro and other ways so use of the ferry system is way down. Fortunately we still have them, and in the original form! The cost is 2 HK$ a ride for the shortest and most popular route just across. You can use your Octopus stored card, or buy a token from a machine and then put the blue plastic token in to enter. The ferry runs frequently and its a nice ride across the bay. You should do it at least once, as your card you use for the metro is the same as for the ferry.

What a star the ferries are!. Loads written but will give my take from a good half day trip to take in the sights that eeks out the budget but still a great experience. I started at the big wheel and along the new waterfront park past the monumental Chief Executives building and Legislature. The waterfront park being created is superb, go there. Carry on to the other side of the HK conference centre to the Wan Chai Ferry Pier over to Tsim Sha Tsui terminal , Kowloon and the promenade and Cultural Centre are right there to see the views of HK and later the light shows at 8pm Sail back direct to HK Central easy crossing 5 mins, cost is minimal.

A Must Before It Disappears. Lovely old ferries, soon to disappear, mostly due to the lack of ingenuity of the owns and of course the Underground between the islands. A pity if it does disappear as this is one of the things that Hong Kong was most famous for and one of the few links to its past
Quick way across the bay. Easy to use and inexpensive way to get across the bay. Great views - way better than taking the subway.
It Wouldn't Be Hong Kong Without IT. A visit to HK would not be complete without a ride on one of the Star Ferries. A cheap way to see the skyline additionally.
Okay excursion. Good to do if you have not done before, but afterwards, such as in my case, it would be just a mode of transport I use when suitable!

Top priority in your things to do list. Such a romantic short ferry trip between Tsim Tsa Tsui to Hong Kong Central around 10 minutes in an old rickety ferry with names like morning star and fantastic view of Hong Kong at night. With cost of transportation so cheap, around 3HKD per trip, it is one of the best gems of Hong Kong to forget the hustle and bustle of city life and enjoy the great view of harbour any time of the day.Use Octopus card, it will coat you around 9HKD to rent available at HKIA train ticket office. Very handy card to use for buses, airport express trains, subways, star ferry and even the peak trams. Ensure that balance in the card is less than 500HKD to get your cash back smoothly otherwise more complex procedure....you have been warned.Only few minutes walk from Hong Kong Central station to pier 8 star ferry, the train travel from airport to Central station takes around 30 minutes. From same pier you can take bus to lower terminus the peak tram, another great Hong Kong experience but without the timing certainty of Star Ferry.Sit on the right side of the Ferry from Tsim Tsa Tsui to Hong Kong Central to catch view of Hong Kong skyscrapers.Truly memorable experience and if you only have 1 or 2 things to experience in Hong Kong, this should be one of them.
loved the star ferries. really enjoyed travelling to outer islands and short trips on star ferry, Despite weather not being too good, the sail was enjoyable, and cheap too.
Good for night views. We went last Sunday n was really crowded but at night the weather n view was really amazing Will come next time but definitely not on Sunday
Average. Cheap and a good way to get to Kowloon, but pretty mediocre. Beware of the men hacking suits on the street outside of the ferry terminal.

It is a TAXI!. Don't get your hopes up. That's its sole purpose; to transport people from one side to the other.It is for that purpose very efficient I have to say. Don't worry about time, consider it there and ready for you, and as soon as you hop on board, it goes. Enjoy the scenery and soon enough you'll be on the other side. It gets 4 stars because it is very quick and efficient. Though it's not really an "attraction".
Star ferry. Its a 4 minute or so trip. What is there to comment on ? The ferries are seem to be well maintained and are clean with adequate seating for such a lengthy trip.

Cheap!. Whether you have an Octopus card or buy a ticket it's a cheap, easy, fun (and very quick) way to cross between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. I think we ended up on the ferry about five times in one day just because it was more convenient than taking the train at that point.
travel with it. its my first time to go from city to city was inside this ferry, i like it so much, thanks for my dear friends whom told me about.

A short hop from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui. Star Ferry is another one of those essential Hong Kong experiences. It is not touristy and is used by the locals as much as visitors, sort of a water taxi. It is cheap and in no time, you have crossed from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. Some nice views of the Hong Kong skyline as you cross too.
Worth it!. Super cheap, super quick and good view! It's worth a return trip, the view is even better at night with all the city lights.

Bargain trip. A must if you go to hong kong is a trip day or night on the star ferries cost approx 18 pence a bargain ..take the one to kowloon and have a drink or afternoon tea in the fantastic Period penisula hotel ... The staff on the ferries are gelpful polite and wirth a photo in their traditinal sailor outfits , great photo opportunity's as you cross at night to take of hong kong lighted sky line..
A must do in Hong Kong. For $HK2.50 which is about 50c AUD this is a great way to cross the harbour between HK Island and Kowloon. It's frequent, easy to buy tokens and a true HK experience.
Holiday . Well worth the ride, it's a must do if in Hong Kong of only once. It is still used by locals revelling for the island to Kowloon and is always busy, but that ads to its charm

Must travel on. You can't visit Hong Kong without going on the Star Ferry, though the view along the dock side is spoiled by the land reclamation and building that is going on. It is a cheap journey, you're better arming yourself with a prepaid card which covers the trams and buses too, Octopus Card.

Cheap and fun. Cheap and fun way to travel between Hong Kong and Kowloon. At this time of year, the the harbour-side buildings are illuminated with additional lights and the ferry offers a great view of them.

Romantic. Great little ferry. Water taxi really. Gives wonderful perspective of Hong Kong.
Nice to be on when the sun is going down to see the change in light around HK.

A short hop .... Not much to say about this other than we caught the ferry at Hong King Island from Pier 7 to Kowloon. The crossing was uneventful and did not take too long. On returning to HKI we caught the metro which was quicker.

Ride from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central. Having a short ferry experience from Tsim Sha Tsui Star Ferry Pier to Central Star Ferry Pier. The price for a single trip is as low as HKD 2.50 during weekdays , HKD 3.40 during weekends. The waiting interval is quite short as well from 6 mins to 12 mins. There are Harbour Tours available as well if you wish to catch the multi-media laser show (last for around 13mins) during the night.

An Essential Hong Kong Experience. A good way to just get around in a very busy city. Great views. Cheap. Sometimes very crowded, but boats are frequent so waiting times are usually minimal. Some of my best photographs of Hong Kong and Kowloon were taken from the Star Ferry.

Invaluable. Weather you stay on Kowloon island or Hong Kong Island you will want to explore both opposing sides as each have exciting things to offer and the Star Ferry is a very inexpensive, reliable and regular form of transport used by locals and tourists. The added benefit is that you get amazing views of the harbour & skyline during your daily commute.
Must go. A must go ride if your in HK. the trip will take you about 15 minutes, maybe even less. The tickets are about 50 cents.
STUNNING VIEWS. So easy to use and cost effective. A quick and beautiful way to get to dinner and soak up the lights.
Vibrant and busy. Great way to cross and feel like a local and the views are the best . fast efficient and so Hong Kong

Wonderful and historical. i travelled every day (apart from the mtr) from Kowloon to HongKong using the Star Ferry. Only takes about 5 minutes and the views are outstanding. Costs $2.5HKD about £0.25 each way. Easy to use and helpful staff.

Fun ride :-). FERRY!!!!!JK. It's just been a while. The ferry ride was excellent! From the middle of the transit, you have beautiful view of both side of Hong Kong (the island and Kowloon). The only annoyance is the windows: I can't take pictures, because the light is behind the model (aka my fiancee). Even HDR could not resolve.
Comfortable ride. Took a star ferry to Lantau Island. The view that accompanies the ride was scenic and the ride was safe. We also reached the destination on time. Overall, it was a pleasant ride.
Nice. Stunning view in the evening. Quite cheap. But it is to short trip. Take upper deck. More good view from here

View and value. What a great way to travel from island to island. A very inexpensive way to travel. Top deck is best for view. Use Hong Kong coins or small bills at kiosk. Doing the harbor view trip is great fun.

Cheap way to see a great view of Victoria Harbour. For less than a US dollar, you get arguably the best view of Victoria Harbour (from sea level anyway) from this 15 minute ride. Along with the tram in Cental, great cheap way to see the city.

Ferry between Kowloon and HK. This is the given way to travel between Kowloon and HK island. At Kowloon you reach imediatly shopping and reastaurants and you see typical chineese fishing boats on the way over.

Great views and very quick . Very simple and way to use but the subway can get you to and from the same places so it really depends if you want to take the time to see these sites above ground or you just want to get from place to place
Classic HK. The best way to travel between the Kowloon and the island. Only 2 HK dollars and great views of the city as you quitely cross

Cheap way to travel from HK Is. to Kowloon. A very short trip. It is a nice view of the skyline at night if the weather is fine. If you are travelling by train, the Star Ferry Pier is about 10 minute walk from Hong Kong station.

Chow chow. Best and cheapest way to see the day and night view plus laser show on water. The oldest water transport in Hong Kong. 2.50 HK one way, senior over 65 free of charge, best way to travel from one side to another side of Victoria harbour, especially during peak hours.

The Iconic Hong Kong Ferry Ride. The iconic Star Ferry is wonderful symbol of Hong Kong, everyone who comes to Hong Kong should use it. A great opportunity to takes some photographs on the harbour. It is fun to take and also cheap!
Trip to nowhere fun. we took the star ferry, cheap to access and gives you a great view of the skyline. We used the subway to return. We enjoyed the trip

The best ever. If you use this service be sure to get the best deal, as free to people over 65, but you must get special pass available at desk on pier. The octopus system works very well here as just swipe your card and you are through, Octopus is a must for visiting Hong Kong. Used everywhere on the public transportation system, topped up at 7-11 or stations, when you leave you can redeem,or save until next visit The actual ferry service must be one of the oldest left in the modern world, but well worth travelling on, views from it are worth taking photos of. The service has two sections, ordinary and upper deck, both very cheap.

Our Family Favorite for 30 years: Great way to affordably see this fun city. Quite affordable 20 min ride from the mainland to the central island of HK. The boat is old fashioned and offers excellent views of the city. Take it in the morning and the evening and you'll get a different experience. Costs only 37 US cents per person.
Can't visit Hong Kong without a trip on the Star ferry. A very cheap, quick and enjoyable way to cross the Harbour (stay at the Marco Polo Hotel in Kowloon - which is very close to the Star Ferry)

One thing you must do in HK. Time it for sunset and bring your camera, you'll never experience a more stunning skyline. Its not the most efficient way to cross from Kowloon to HKI but thats not the point.

Nice way to go to kawloon or hk-island. Very cheap way to travell and great view. Short ride, about 5 min from HK island to kowloon. Also awesome solution on the seats so you can sit in the right direction.

So many trips but still something special. In Hong Kong for a conference I crossed the harbour on the Star Ferry once more. The lights of Hong Kong Island were spectacular as ever, with Christmas lights to add to the color and movement.So many trips across the harbour by night and day and still a buzz! A must do in Hong Kong!
Great views, so cheap and easy.. An easy way to see the views .Very cheap ( 50 cents ) and a good option if you dont have time for a cruise.

Cheap access to great views. Like the staten Island ferry in NY, the star ferry is a public transport that is cheap and gives you an exceptional access to great views to hong kong Island and the main land. Jump on and enjoy!
Great Experience!. A true experience of a bygone Era. Try the upper deck for better view and city scape clicks! Tsim Shah Tsui is the best location to stay as the Ferry is walking distance.

Easy to do. You have to get a jeton to get on the ferry.
It is very easy to find and it is worth all the money and experience

Must do No 1 in Hong Kong. The biggest bargain in Hong Kong . So cheap and so pleasant. The crossing is very short but gives such an insight into this wonderful city. In some ways it is like a visit to the past but is so efficient and refreshing.

Fun at a bargain price!. For a low-cost, fun ride across the bay at a pace reminiscent of times gone by, a trip on one of the White Star Lines ferries is just the thing. There are good vistas of the city too. Sit downstairs for the best views!

Classic Harbour Crossing. How long will this survive? The best way to cross the harbour, and the crossings get shorter as the years go on! It is something that just doesn't change and is an experience for any visitor, even if just the once.
a must if in HK. This is always a must for me. Travel the harbour for 2rmb... Just great. Do it and enjoy the smell of sea, diesel and the flair of old HK...

Still a big kid at heart...!. I lived in Hong Kong for 12 years and still return for business and holidays. I used the Star ferry six times this last visit, did not need to but it still makes me feel full of life for the experience.

Probably just about the best and least expensive way to see the water front of the city. For a mere $2.50 Hong Kong that is about $.50 Canadian you can have it extremely pleasant 15 minute trip across the harbor to be able to see all of the water front of the city  It was always so pleasant to be able to just sit down after walking so many kilometers and be able to watch the water front of a wonderful city

Take a zig-zag course on the Star Ferry rather than expensive harbour cruises. The Hong Kong harbour is a busy yet very picturesque representation of this famous city. You don't need to book and pay handsomely for a harbour cruise. From Hong Kong Central, take the 5 min ferry to Tsim-Sha-Tsui, then take the one back to North Point or Wanchai on the Hong Kong side. If you are a photographer, you will not need a seat as you will be running from side to side to take in the sights and pictures! Take the upper deck for just a few cents more. There are a lot of buses and taxis at all the piers.
Not worth missing. If you visit Hong Kong, going on the staff ferry from Tsim Sha Sui to Hong Kong island is a must, only HK2 on the lower deck
Very nice experience . Walked a fair bit to get to the habour just to try this out. Children enjoyed it n fare is cheap. Night view is great especially during Christmas season.

Still retains charm. Last visited HKG in 1997 so a lot has changed. Gone is the amazing arrival into dear old Kai Tak - which I viewed from the Cathay flight deck back then in a safer pre-2001 world - and, as a visitor rather than a resident, I miss the sight and sound of planes threading their way across Kowloon in today's city. Completely understandable though, Kai Tak had outgrown its limits and I am not sure it would pass any risk assessment these days, ho hum.Anyway, back to the Star Ferry. On Hong Kong side, the terminal is now reached by a rather dull walkway that goes on just a bit too long. One of the joys of the ferry was its accessibility, it brought you almost to the door of the Mandarin Oriental. Now it is about a quarter of a mile distant and I am not sure why you would choose to use it over the MTR to get to Kowloon nowadays if time is your focus.It is worth the effort though as the journey across one of the world's great harbours for a couple of dollars is good value indeed. The ferries themselves are as they have always been, with the addition of a hydraulic ramp or two, but built to last.
Cheap cross harbour ride. Great way to cross over between Kowloon and Hong Kong Central. One way cost was equivalent to only 40 cents Australian. Frequent departures. Quick ,safe and comfortable.

Not to be missed . You just can't miss this if you are visiting Hong Kong. The trip across the water is wonderful. The clear green water is teeming with boats and the views are amazing, even on the rainy day we were there. The boats themselves are beautiful too and the trip is cheap as can be. You can use your octopus travel card to pay too.

What's not to love . Always loved the star ferry, only it is much further away from Central than it used to be as they made new piers. As always great value for good view of HK Skyline and Kowloon skyline

Super loved it. For 2HKD you'd have a majestic view. We initially wanted to try the cruise but was appalled by the hefty price of 195HKD so we just rode the ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui. It was a very quick ride but I enjoyed every second of it looking at the view. You can pay with your octopus card to ride the ferry.

Quick and Easy Way to See The Bay. Take the Star Ferry at night if you can...soak in all the beauty of the Hong Kong Sky line and easily get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island in about 10 mins. Cost is very affordable about $0.50usd. You can even use your Octopus card from the MTR on this ferry.
Easy and very affordable travel around Hong Kong. You cannot beat the views and the ease of using this method of public transport. It is a great way to get around and very convenient.

A Delightful Way to Cross Victoria Harbour. It's charming, it's inexpensive, it's service is frequent, and the views are spectacular. The Star Ferry is a "must" for first-timers just for the novelty, but it's also a dependable and enjoyable way to get from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon, or vice versa.

Pay few coins for a million-dollar view. It is a best and cheapest way to enjoy the Victoria harbour view. I recommend to take ride from Kowloon side. No matter day or night, it just beautiful' and I believe you can't find the same view in anywhere else in the world! You may take it during the laser show at 8pm, so you could be a part of the show!
Fun trip, good place for photos. It just takes 10 minutes but worth doing just ones. Beautiful old ferries full of character. Use your octopus cards

Cheap, Easy and great views! A must Do!!. Great fun and the only way to cross the Harbour! You just have to do it and it is one of the greatest and cheapest ways to see a city from the water anywhere in the world!

Best way to cross over . It is the best and cheapest way to travel between Kowloon and Hongkong Island.
Also the grand view to both sides of HK you wont miss!

Old landmark but still has its charm. The Star Ferry is probably 100+ years old. But it still provide good services for a very cheap price. You can see the entire shoreline of the Victoria Harbor from the Star Ferry. If you have an elder Octopus card (age 65 and older can purchase at MTR stations) you can ride the ferry for free.
enteresting. nice, ancient, rapid, good views of the city on both of sides, windy, smoke of the diesel engine but tolerable.
Cheap and a great view!. We got the ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to central. It is really cheap and a great way to see the Hong Kong skyline especially at night. It only takes 5-10minutes, it's a must!

On the board to Macau. We went to Macau with Star Ferry. It has been a good trip though there was not much view on the way there. Star ferry was quiet clean and well maintained. We took the same ferry on the way back from Macau to Hong Kong too.

Affordable must do!. It's a short journey and use it several times during our stay in Hong Kong. Nice overview during the Chinese New year, as there are different light displays on the building.
Simple and effective seat from the past in the ferry!
So cheap and great views. We travelled on the ferry a few times as it was cheap and a convenient way to get across the harbour. Spectacular at night and never too crowded. Must do.

Cheapest form of transport in Hong Kong.... .... along with the ding ding trolley buses...Take a trip across the harbour if you have a few hours free.On the upside: You can purchase your tickets from an Octopus Machine, prices on a couple of dollars!! About a 5 minute ride. Ferry was surprisingly well maintained and offering great views of the city.On the downside: It was pretty busy.Highly recommendedEnjoyP.s. Try and get the top deck (it is enclosed) and had great views through the windows

A must if your visiting hk. A cheap alternative to travelling on the congested roads of HK. Very reliable and with great views of the harbour around HK and Kowloon. The vessels are two Deckers made in Birmingham and imported and constructed in HK.
Fun ride. Whether you use the ferry to get from Kowloon to Hong King island or a tour of the harbour it's a great way to see the area and very inexpensive

Another must do. Great value at HK$2.
So many things in HK involve a view of the harbour so it's nice to actually be on it and see the the views from the water.
Affordable and saves you time!. Opted for the Ferry instead of taking MTR a few times and was satisfied with our trip every time. Seems to be faster (of course), easier, and definitely a lot cheaper.

cheapest mode of transport .. enjoyed travelling from tsim sha tsui to central. cheapest mode of transport .. enjoyed travelling from tsim sha tsui to central .. approx. 10 min ride .. must experience

Great short trip. A quick trip across the harbour is a must. Very easy to get tickets through he Octopus Machine, only costs $3!! About a 5 minute ride. Ferry was clean, smooth, good views of the city. Can get quite busy. I really enjoyed it! We were on the top deck (it is enclosed) and had great views (windows open for photos!)

A must do. The star ferry from Kowloon to Central on the upper deck..this is recommended..... costs only HKD 2.50 one way using a Octopus Card . .. do it in the evening when the buildings are lit up. Do a trip back too
2$ very easy to use, got us there in 5mins. Went to HK island from city cost 2HKD you can use octopus card too. It was super fast & had great views. Cheaper than MRT. Not sure on departure hrs.
What's not to love about this. A quid return trip what's not to love about this service, it's a bit rickety, but it's an absolute must
Best value of all Hong Kong. Christmas lights were over most of the buildings facing the harbour. They looked stunning. Such a cheap easy trip with great views.

Night time ride was great. We decided to take a ride when it was already dark and were pleased with our decision. The ride was fantastic, the views were beautiful and with a decent camera you can get some really good shots of the city.

A must do list. I had been to HK three times but dint get to take the Star ferry until my last trip recently. It was great. The ferry cost HK2 and you can use the machine to buy a token or you can also use your Octopus card. The view was beautiful and the ride was smooth.

Free if you are over 65. Did you know that if you are 65 or over then you can get a Octopus Card for Elders? For HKD$70, you get a card (deposit HKD$50) and HKD$20 credits. Most of the MTR travel is for HKD$2 per trip, but it is free on Sundays. Travel on the Star Ferry is free all the time.So this old time favourite is even better if it is free!

A surprise awaits at the terminal. The star ferry terminal is an old but well kept port. The boardwalk which is paved and wide is a good path even to jog to do brisk walking and to sit by the ocean walls to admire the skyline is just amazing. There are food and paper shops in the area but what is surprising is when you go up two levels on the view deck is an open bar for some snack and cold beer. The only place the comes front and center seat to experience hk sunset. Prices are very reasonable and is run by local so expect hk food selection and hospitality. Try visiting at 4 or 5pm.
Cheap and fun. Excellent way to see the lights of the island for a few pence! Don't waste time going to the waterfront for the evening 'lightshow', very disappointing!
Easy to do.. Just buy a ticket out front,many people selling trips and tours over to island.You can easily make a full day doing this.Take a bottle of water with you.

A must do and so cheap. The star ferry is a simply must do in Hong Kong. We used it numerous times to travel between the island and the mainland.Very effiecient ans super cheap service, plus amazing views whilst travelling the 5 minute journey.
Make A Point Of Taking The Star Ferry. This is a must do when in Hong Kong and for a better experience go second class which is a water level view of Hong Kong

Very econmical and a wonderful ride!. With just unbelievably price of HK$2.50, this boat ride is a must-try in Hong Kong.Star Ferry is a mere 7-8minutes ride between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. It offers an amazing view of Hong Kong from the water. It is a smooth and short ride. I've never had motion sickness from taking it. But it would be good to bring a plastic bag, just in case.You may pay for the ride with your octopus card or purchase a token to be slotted into a machine at the entrance.

Got to do it. One of the attractions of HK is absolutely the Ferry across the harbour. Different directions and stops make it ideal to help explore both sides of the harbour. If you don't get off, then you can enjoy the return just as much.

Slow Down A Bit. In the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong, the Star Ferry (Kowloon to Central esp), feels like a breath of fresh air. Even if you do happen to sit right by the engine and end up getting a few diesel fumes - don't let that deter you. It's a beautiful way to slow down a bit, take in the skyline and just reflect on how amazing a city Hong Kong really is. Definitely work in a ferry ride if you happen to visit Hong Kong. It's truly worth it.

Star Ferry is the best way to appreciate the harbour view.. Taking ferry in-between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui is the best and cheapest way to appreciate the view of Hong Kong's Victoria Harbour. Better to see it at night with the beautiful metropolitan skyline.

Public Transport Treat. The star ferry is cheap, clean, and the best way to go to the other side of the Harbour. It is quick and not too crowded. It leaves on time and is very well run. However, I found that the star ferry was better treated as public transport rather than a way to see Hong Kong at a different angle as it is popularly used by tourists. Undercover seats mean that even in rain this is a great way to reach the other side of the harbour waters.

HONG KONG STAR FERRY. Take a five minute ferry ride across the Hong Kong harbour for a minimal fare and you can enjoy one of the greatest view of the world. The ferry runs every 5 to 7 minutes . The ferry is open on both sides and one can take in sights from three sides. If you go at dusk, you might catch the sunset and do not miss the harbour lights at night. It is breathtakingly beautiful.

Gotta love the Star Ferry. convenient, quick, cheap...with a view! What's not to love? It's a bit of a long walk out to the pier on the HK side, but not bad. Gives you great views of the harbor and all of the harbor activity.
Nice to try. Good experience and you get to try it for cheap. We love the wind on our faces but the route from TST to Wan Chai was only a few minutes long so will try other routes next time.

Affordable and worthy transport ever. You can take the ferry from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui or vice versa. This is much much cheaper as compare to MTR and you can experience how the locals travel with different kind of public transport. You can enjoy the windy ride and nice view along the journey. The waiting time is short and i feel that it is quite fast.

Amazing to cross the harbor. Crossing the Hong Kong Harbor with the Star Ferry is certainly a MUST. Service is excellent and convenient just to use the Octopus. It is so beautiful to see the buildings on both sides during day and at night you will see all the Christmas and New Year festive lightings. After crossing the harbor, only a few minutes walk one can try the Ferris wheel, wonderful experience.
Cheap as chips!. Where else could you catch a ferry for around 20p or even free if you are over 65?This is the best way to travel between North Point & Kowloon and a fun way too.
best way to get from HK island to TST. I love this ferry Its fast and has a beautiful view, the ferry departs every 7 mins so you never need to wait

Great and inexpensive way to crossover. Getting from HK Island to Kowloon or the other way around can be easily done with the MTR. But what's the fun in that? Going from TST to Wan Chai or Central by ferry is a great experience. And it's fairly cheap (cheaper than the mtr). Take the upper deck to have a nice view of the skyline while crossing, or if you like the smell of diesel engines (there are some that do) take the lower deck. It's noisy, the wooden benches are not super comfortable but it's a good experience, and pretty quick.

This is a bit of "old school Hong Kong". The harbour is shrinking due to land reclamation but this is surely one of the highlights of a trip to Hong Kong. If you want a view, try the upper deck and sit near the windows. Coming from Central, you can get off in Tsim Sha Tsui and walk through the shopping arcade. There is a good shoe shop there which sells western women's size shoes. Avoid the touts outside and take a walk along the pier which gives you a good view of visiting cruise ships.On the return journey, you will land at Central. Take a walk around the General Post Office and buy souvenir stamps .

Kowloon to Hong Kong Island practically free. Runs frequently. Have to buy a token in the machine only $2 to cross the bay... great value and an experience in itselflive musicians at Hong Kong side were very good

Woooooow. Used the star ferry to travel across to Kowloon from HK island, it's just a ferry, maybe a quaint experience however personally, to me, it was just an old ferry. I took the trip during the daytime and could not access top deck of the ferry, maybe it's better at night when you can go to the top deck for the view.

Cool ride, with a purpose!. I last rode the ferry in 1989, and it hasn't changed a bit - which is actually a good thing, because it doesn't need improving!Fantastic old, sturdy boats, well organised system to embark and disembark on both levels, and really cool old decor/fittings.Gets you across the harbour safely and regularly, with the locals.Cheaper than chips too. Use the octopus card.
A must in Hong Kong. If you're visiting Hong Kong, this is a must, it's cost nearly nothing and the view on the harbour is unparalleled!
Great value. Easy to access and use as a foreigner. Extremely cheap mode of transportation and we never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for a new ferry to arrive.

Beats taking an uber/taxi. Had it not been foggy the day we were in Hong Kong I bet we could have seen some amazing sites. But this time around the ferry served as a cheap way of getting from one side to the other. Make sure you have change as you cannot buy tickets with card or large bills.
A trip on the Star Ferry is a must. It would be foolish to visit Hong Kong and not use the Star Ferry. It's cheap, quick and a very pleasant way to cross between the island and Kowloon.

A breath of fresh air. I seldom miss a ride on the Star Ferry on my trips to HK. It beats the cramped ride between TST and Central on the MTR. Every ride gives you a great perspective of the everchanging HK and Kowloon metropolis skylines. It was quite fun for our little boy too! Pity it is such a long walk to Central Pier from the MTR, otherwise it will be a more regular affair with the kid. A unique experience of HK to be appreciated by both visitors and locals, don't let anyone close it down. An upgrade with baby changing rooms is sorely needed.

A great View. We took the Ferry early one evening in order to appreciate the amazing skyline view over to Hong Kong Island. We were not disappointed and we would highly recommend this trip even if you do an immediate return.

The best cents you will ever spend. This is the best value tourist scenic trip you will ever take. Victoria Harbour is magnificent, however seems to get smaller each time I go to Hong Kong as land is reclaimed.
Do it at night and see the light show.

Cheap, well organised. The star ferry is cheap, organised, clean, best transportation to go to the other side. It is quick and usually there isn't to much crowd. The ferry leaves on hour and is reliable.

Cheap. It's a cheap wat over the river. The cost on a normal day are 2.5 hkd. In the weekend and on hollidays its 3.2 hkd. There are 2 entrances. 1 for the top of the boat. And 1 for doenstairs. When you enter the dock you can see witch one you are entering. For a good view take the top and go sit looking on the river. The ferry doesn't turn but the captain is going to sit on the othere side.

Very interesting ferry ride with spectacular views. Ensure you go to the correct dock. Clearly marked but it's important to go to the right one, especially returning or you will end up in wrong place. Reasonably clean and comfortable. Safety video shown upon boarding. Be careful getting off as locals rush and jostle. Tip.. Wait until nearly last to get off. Compared to Australia, safety is a bit lacking but it is ok.

Easy, cheap, great views, gotta do it!. Whether you are staying on Hong Kong Island or in Kowloon this is without a doubt the best way to get between the two. It's just $2.50 for an upper deck seat and you can just jump on using your Octopus Card (this is super handy by the way- if you haven't heard of it yet its like an Oyster card in London but you can also use it to pay for food and stuff in lots of places to!). If you don't have an octopus card you can buy a token from the automated machines. The ferries run frequently and are easily signposted and easy to get to. The trip between the two ports is really quick. Only a couple of minutes. The view of the skyline is stunning and a great way to get a couple of photos.
Cross the harbor with a view..... This is the easiest, least expensive option to cross the harbour in Hong Kong. I recommend sitting on the top deck for better views.
A must for anyone visiting HK. Great way to get a decent view of the harbour, day or night. Short ride from Kowloon to HK island with an amazing outlook. Grab a token and hope on.

Best way to see/experience Victoria Harbour. There is no better way to get from Hong Kong Island to Tsim Sha Tsui than the Star Ferry. It's less than 10 minutes, costs only HKD$2 and comes with a great view. An icon of Hong Kong .

A short n valuable ride. Star Ferry: Quickest and cheapest way to travel Central from TST and back. The Ferry runs at regular interval and fare is quite cheap 2.8 HKD per trip. You can have nice view of Victoria harbour. Board at upper deck to have nice view.

Great experience. Very cheap and so easy! It has to be a must do activity whilst in HK, it only take 10-15 minutes to cross the harbour and they leave every 15 minutes. They are very traditional and great fun! If you use them at night it is a great opportunity to see the lights which are spectacular... The only down side was the fumes were bad at times and we witnessed oil leaching in the water..
Cheap and great ferry ride!. The ferry will take you to the other side in less than 8 minutes. It only costs you 3 HK $ and gives you a nice view on the Skyline.

Brilliant and amazingly cheap.. A must when in Hong Kong, whether you are staying in Kowloon or Hong Kong Island. Probably the best time to cross is at Sunset, when you see Hong Kong in its glory both in daylight and when the lights come on the magnificent skyline.
Consistent. I've been to Hong Kong 5 times now and have taken the Star Ferry each time. It is the most inexpensive way to see the skyline from the water.

Quick trip to Hong Kong and back. This is a great way to look back at mainland China when you stay in KOWLOON. GET TO KNOW THE REAL PEOPLE OF CHINA on this little trip. Everyone uses it and everyone is there. People are kind of pushy but that's ok. They like tourists.

Great views for 20p!. It's well worth riding the star ferry from the Kowloon side to Victoria harbour. The views of the Hong Kong skyline from both the ferry terminus and the actual ferry are great.The ferry is also a quick and cheap way to get across the harbour, although the metro might be more convienient depending on your destination.Even just for fun, the ferry is well worth a ride!

Quick hope to the other side. Health and safety out the windows ! LOL Get a token.. then hand it to the ferry man and hope on.... if you don't crash into anything on the way over you can just hope off again.. MIND THE GAP !!

Legendary Star Ferry - Do not miss it. It is a memorable 15 minutes to travel in these historic boats. We have visited Hong Kong several times but to repeat this boat trip is a number one must on each trip. Take a coat it can be windy. Buy the ticket from the automate outside, walk in, sit down and enjoy the scenary when the skyscrapers from the departure side get smaller and arrival side get bigger. It may be even best in darkness as all the high buildings are lit up.
A nice trip, easily worth the 50c!. It's quite simple - modest entrance and exits and reasonably modern boat, but a great place to take a cheap ride across the harbour and take in the sights.

The best value tourist attraction in the World!. Where else can you ride a ferry across the most exciting stretch of water in the world marvelling at the Hong Kong skyline for the princely sum of 35 pence ( and that's Upper Class!)If you visit Hong Kong this is a must do

Hong Kong Essential . The only way to cross the harbour quickly and cheaply and a must to take in the view and get that great photo day or night. Runs from early to late and waiting time is minimal. Obviously gets busy at peak rush but crosses in a couple of minutes.A Hong Kong institution.
Cheap and efficient. We used this and it is cheap and easy to use. you get a agood view of the city and a look around Kowloon

Neat, Cheap Experience. Easy to find this very old restored ferry is a neat thing to do. You get over to Kowloon quickly (about a 10 minute crossing) and its a pretty and cheap way to see Victoria Harbour.You can either enter from the top or bottom deck via the terminal but are stuck on the level you board on. We did one deck each way. In good or bad weather its a good activity (we went in a rainy day) and the shopping on the Kowloon side is nice.It is a 1940's restored ferry and has been nicely restored. We don't get sea sick but it can be a little rough so if you do get queasy on boats we would not recommend you do this. Definitely a must if you have the time.
Very Good Service. The ferries run frequently,are comfortable and take about 15 minutes to cross to Hong Kong Island. Lovely views enjoyed during the crossing.

Ferry nice. I've always wanted to ride the star ferry, but never ever got round to it before, but i managed to do it this time, we took the ferry over to central pier for only 3.50 hong kong dollars, a very cheap ride for great photo opportunities

Absolutely The Best Way To Cross The Harbor. While in Hong Kong in early December 2015, we used the Star Ferry to cross from Central terminal to Tsim Sha Tsui in Kowloon and again from Tsim Sha Tsui to Wanchai terminal on Hong Kong Island…both during the evening. Both routes cost the same. Said cost is minimal for a breezy 10 minute-or-so ride…about 32 cents in USD. There are two decks – the upper with closable windows and bench seating and the lower with open sides and bench seating as well. The water-level views of the Hong Kong waterfront are spectacular, especially after dark and with all the buildings sporting holiday lighting akin to Las Vegas or Times Square in New York City…quite a spectacular view. The ferries run so frequently and carry a large enough number of passengers that, in our experience, crowds at each boarding facility are very small. Getting aboard as well as getting off is smooth and efficient. We liked riding on the lower level with the breeze in our faces. On inclement days, the upper deck is clearly the best option. Use the Octopus card for your fares. The Octopus card is an essential part of moving around the city whether on the ferry, MTR, trolley, or bus. It can also be used for small purchases in the convenience stores located throughout Hong Kong (Yes, there are lots of 7 Elevens there). Monetary value can be added to the cards at 7 Elevens as well. Besides being a quick and inexpensive way to cross the Harbor the Star Ferry is a fun, iconic way to see the city. Don’t leave Hong Kong without this great experience!
fun and easy. The ferry was easy to us and fun - it provided fantastic views going both ways. Well worth the trip just for the experience, if not the transport.

Land transport is faster. We took Star Ferry twice, windows are dirty so it's hard to see outside and it kind of had weird smell in ferry which did not help during a windy ride. Recommend to take MTR when possible instead or take the ferry when there is an open deck and warm weather.

Must travel transportation BTW hk island n kowloon. Victoria harbour is the well known Port which the star ferry has been working for 100yrs.It is the cheapest way to cross harbour n it is the best means to admire the wonderful view the buildings on two sides. You can visit on both day n night to have different views of Victoria harbour.

More interesting than taking the MTR. Taking the MTR from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui would have been faster, but it would not have been as interesting as taking the Star Ferry.The pier on Hong Kong island is right next to the observation wheel. Pay using your Octopus cards. For best views, choose a seat on the upper deck, eastern side.Have fun!
Ferrying many times. Ènjoy the ease with which one can cross to and from the main land. Also worthwhile viewing the museum on the island side.
Cheapest harbor boat ride in HK. Nothing beats a boat ride on Victoria Harbor and hopping on the 25 HKD star ferry to ride from central to TST is a great way to do it.

Functional Ferry. From Hong Kong island to mainland Kowloon and back a cheap and basic method of sea transport taking about 10 minutes. Gets very crowded in the rush hour so for the visitor use off peak

So cheap no excuse not to do it at least once. Glad we took this ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Very straight forward process. Hardly cost anything. And was a quick journey. Throw in the scenery of the HK skyline - well worth it.
BEST VALUE IN TOWN. Not to be missed. Inexpensive and a fun ride to HK Island or Kowloon. Great views of the skyline on both sides.

Star ferry Harbour trip. This is ~HK$90 for about an hour trip around the harbour, you can join from several places either on the HK or Kowloon sides. The trip from Kowloon side takes you round the harbour out past the Ritz Carlton and beyond then back along the HK Island side past all the waterfront sites and out to near Kai Tak, then back along Kowloon waterfront. It gives you a great view of the sites and good photo opportunities close up especially if the weather plays ball. You need to have tickets about 15 mins before departure as the ticket office closes 10 minutes before the boat goes.

Easy to use, Quick and Cheap!. For only a few yuan and the frequent ferries, you may as well experience how the locals do it! To cross to/from Hong Kong Island is around 10 mins! My partner and I used the Ferry more than once, recommended!
Nice riding. Forgot the price just remember it is very cheap. The ferry is quite big,most interesting is the chair. You will get it when you take a ride.
Best night view. Made use of the ferry from Stanley market and to Victoria Harbor. Best staff and very comfortable with the best night views
Good for Day or Night. It worths for a ride no matter during day or night time, but you will defintely love the night scene.

Quick -Cheap - Great Views. I took the ferry from Central Star Ferry pier Hong Kong Island to Tsim Sha Tsui Star Ferry pier Kowloon. It was a quick inexpensive way to travel across the water. I was able to pay via my visitor octopus card which was very convenient. I definitely prefer this mode over the MTR.

Most old fashioned way to travel from A to B. I hope the star ferry will be stay forever and ever as it's been going on for soooooo many years. Even my grandma who doesn't use public transport will use the star ferry like 'back in the day'.
Something you just have to do!. Did the ferry and big red bus tour which also included fees for the Peak. Very reasonable and avoids multiple queues.

Do try out both the upper deck and lower deck of the Star Ferry. The ride on the ferry is comfortable and scenic. Do try out both the upper deck and lower deck. Do take care of your belongings as I was engrossed in I lost my umbrella after forgetting to bring it along as I disembarked. Probably another tourist took it.

Fast and cheap ride . Personally, I will like to travel how the locals travel to better understand their culture. This ferry encompass what Hong Kong is all about. Fast and efficient. Do give it a try for its efficiency and nice view along the way.

recommend as well!. I really enjoyed the ride from one to other side! You can use your metro card for this. It is an experience and its very quick. I thought I will feel sick, but didn't feel anything!

Cheap Thrill. If you need to cross from HK Centre to TST Kowloon, or vice versa, do consider using the Star ferry. It may require a bit of detour but it is definitely worth the trouble if you have not done this before. The ride is cheap and give you an opportunity to view both the HK and Kowloon skyline. Try to avoid the rush hour crowd and you can practically have the ferry to yourself. In the winter, it can be chilly but the ride is short, stand by the window or near some opening to enjoy the wind in the your face. What a feeling! The ferry leave very frequently so there is no need to worry about waiting. Must try.

one of my favourite ways to travel in HK. this is the fastest and cheapest way to get from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui. the ride is pleasant (especially if you sit next to the railings and the breeze blows through your hair), and the views are wonderful (especially at night). don't think this is a gimmick for tourists, lots of locals use it, and as a Hongkonger this is my favourite way to head to the Cultural Centre to catch a performance!
Star Ferry. Went to Macau from Hongkong airport through the ferry.great experinec and must do atleast once . kids anjoy and elderly too!

Best way to cross from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon at night time.... The trip from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon took me back to my school days in Turkey when we enjoyed the breathtaking views of the Bosphorus and Istanbul from the sea and the freshness of the seabreeze on the openair deck of the old Istanbul ferries. Cost effective, frequent, fast and nostalgic, Star Ferry is an experience not to be missed when you are in Hong Kong.
Timeless attraction. Probably on of the best known attraction in HK and most loved by the Hongkongers, it is also the cheapest way to travel and get great photos of HK skyline!

Great way to get across the harbor. This is a great way to cross the harbor from Kowloon to Hong Kong. It is cheap and quick with a continues number of ferries running all day. For those who want to get away from the crowd pay a little extra and sit upstairs or sit down stairs with all of the locals. It is a very scenic ride of a night and especially when the laser show is on. Make sure you have your Octopus Pass for convenient public travel in Hong Kong.

Quick and efficient transport mode. I love the Star Ferry! First, Star Ferry is a quick and efficient way of travelling to Hong Kong Island. Second, it is cheaper than MTR. Third, it is free for elderly! And lastly, it's very stable - I don't even feel like I was on a ship. Must try when you are in Hong Kong, just for the novelty of it.

A workhorse that is also the most romantic way to view the Hong Kong skyline. In 15 years in Hong Kong, I have never tired of the trip across Victoria Harbour in these beautifully maintained antiques, spotlessly clean, with teak panelling and wooden seats that can be reversed depending on which direction you'd like to face. Never over-crowded, the only annoyance is the occasional crush of people at the windows taking photos of the view. Even if you have no need to travel from one side of the harbor to the other, you should do it for fun.
Cheap views of the city!. Very affordable way of viewing the city from the river. Good views both routes - I would recommend taking it from Wan Chai - TST - Centeral to make the most of the trip.

A great way to see the skyline's of both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. If you go to Hong Kong, you must ride the Star Ferry! It's a short ride between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island, but some of the most spectacular views in all of Hong Kong!

Wonderful service - quick cheap with a view. Cheap as chips as they say in Yorkshire - great view of the lights and great views with a breeze! A short trip but runs frequently - with bench seats and interesting entry exit points! We laughed all the way over and it was fun!
Very good service. We were only in HK for 4 days, but we always tried to take the Star Ferry from Kowloon to HK island and back - a much more romantic way of crossing the sea. Good views as well.

A Shuttle Service with a Difference. Great way to cross from the Hong Kong Island to Kowloon with great views across the Harbour, worth a trip at night to see the Light Show. Very cheap to cross via the Ferry and again you can use your Octopus card

Very interesting and lovely view !!!. Its a very low cost travel between the greatest view points of Hong Kong. We had gone there with the kids and they really loved this ship ride. This will also save lot of time and cost in your trip.

Fast Service & Great Views. Took the ferry from Hong Kong Island to the Kowloon side, and it was great! It only costs 2.5HKD for an adult ticket, and takes less than 10 minutes to cross the harbour, but on a sunny day is offers a relaxing ride with some first-class views of the skyline and mountain ranges. A must if you are heading from one side to the other!

Great Views of Kowloon & Hong Kong Island Skylines Along Harbour. This is a low cost way to get great views from the water. We went on the ferry in the daytime and at night. Very difference experiences and both wonderful.

A must do in HK. You must take this ferry at least two times. One during the day and once during the night. The ride is almost for free and offers great harbour views. Lots of great photo opportunities during the crossing. It is just one of the 1000 things to do before you die :-)

Cheap and Fast. Took the Ferry from Hong Kong to Tsim Cha Tsui. Spent a long time locating the Star Ferry Terminal. Look for pier number 7 if you are going. From IFC, there is a sheltered walk way or overhead bridge that leads towards the terminal beside the Ferris Wheel. Did not know that I can use the MTR card instead of digging for coins in front of the machine. Free sitting and nice view. Must try.

Good Choice. The Star ferry is a classic thing to do in Hong Kong. It's a practical way across the bay and very reasonable. You get good views of the Bay and Hong Kong Skyline. Get yourself a Octopus card (which you can use for subway, 7/11, museums and the ferry) and you will travel like a local.
Good methoeds of transportation. Cheep, quick way to get to your destination. runs frequently and on time.We preferred it to taxi, and good chance to see the Harbor.

Worth doing during the day and then again at night. Great harbor View of HK.. I love ferries. It's a great way to commute. The Star Ferry is a great way to see the skyline of Hong Kong. Inexpensive. A pleasant experience. Get an Octopus Card!

A ferry like no other. Yes the trip is short, yes it's just a ferry, but if you wan't easy transport between Kowloon and the Island that is never packed like the metro, has photo worthy views and offers the smell of the fragrant harbour then this is what you need.

Cheapest way to get around Hong Kong. The star ferry is a great way to get from Kowloon to Central Hong Kong or vice versa. It's inexpensive and quick too. You can also enjoy the view HK skyline while riding the ferry : )
Great views of the skyline. Cheap way to cross between sides. Ferries go very frequently and it is a quick ride. The views of the skyline are lovely, especially at night.
Must do at least once. A part of Hong Kong History. Cheap and easy and quick. It is still the cheapest and most efficient way to cross the harbour. And better views that the MTR.

Classic experience . Fun and a trademark of Hong Kong! It's also affirdable, like cheap, and the best way for casual travel between HK island and Kowloon. It can also be used for travel to other local islands.
Relaxing Trip on the Harbor. Loved taking the ferry each day. It was such a pleasant experience and looking at the skyline each morning and evening was amazing.
You got to do it. OK it's a ferry ride nothing special here but what is special is the view. It's great. It's been operating since the1800's and is cheap and very efficient. It's a Hong Kong must do.
Travel. This is a nice short trip to get to and from Kowloon into Hong Kong city is a fun thing to do if you have children and if recommend any tourists in HK to do this also very cheap
Nice view. A comfortable short ride to see the Victoria harbour. Very economical, should try both ways, Hong Kong to Kolwoon and Kowloon to Hong Kong. From TST to Central I think is nicer.

Best ferry ride on Earth!. Day or night, the tremendous views of the harbor and soaring skylines are a marvel! The ferry costs practically nothing and would be worthwhile at $ 50! Especially breathtaking at night when the light show is playing on all the tall buildings on both sides of the harbor!

Pleasant trip. An interesting, low-priced ride! Much cheaper than riding a taxi or MTR. Nice view of Hong Kong Island and the Tsim Sha Tsui promenades. If you can ride it at night or the harbour tour, dont miss it.

Great Way to Get to the Island. It is so cheap and probably the most direct way to get to the island.
It is super fast, it is a bit choppy so i advise sitting on the top deck

Inexpensive, short ride across the water to Hong Kong Island on a historic ferry.. Something you probably want to do once. There is lots of history surrounding the ferries and you get an interesting view of the waterfront skyline.
Sail away with me. Jump on board, dream a little dream, this is the boat to take you from A to B and on the way, switch off and take in the majestic scenery.
Transportation. This a fun, cheap transportation! It is easy to use. Great way to be like a local. Cost was under $1 USD for three adults. Busses are right out side both exits. We used Uber!

Best HK transportation....with a View!!. I take the Star Ferry back and forth from Central to TST as much as I can. Very relaxing and you can enjoy the harbour view and very cheap (only HK$2.5/one way). Vert dependable and clean. Highly Recommended

Stunning night view of HK. You can see the signature night view of HK. But that really depends on the weather and air quality on that day. If you are lucky enough to see the clear sky, you can see all the buildings in HK island or Kowloon
Good cheap way to cross the bay. Regular ferry across for 25 cents each way ! Nothing fancy but try to go across when light show starts at 8 pm for different view. Runs to very late evening
Experience history is Hong Kong . An excellent way to experience the history of Hong Kong! Faster than cab during peak hours to travel to Hong Kong island.
Quick, easy and cheap way to get around. You get to travel with the locals, see the sights, pay basically nothing and get around very quickly. A great way to see HK.

Great way to travel from HK Island to Kowloon. Used this a few times on a recent trip to HK. Easy to buy tickets from the counter or self service machine and only 2 HKD per trip was a bargain.
The view during the day is great, at night it's fantastic.
Frequent and efficient services only compliment this great ferry service.
Must do in HK!

A lovely little Ferry. Star Ferry is a historic ferry which allows you to see Hong Kong from a different view
The ferry is easy to access, very cheap, clean & is a relaxing journey. Hop on & off with no stress.
I would highly recommend taking a trip on the ferry, there are some nice photo opportunities.

Very Cheap Transportation. Very Cheap transportation compare to their MTR..love taking the ferry to the other island... the transaction is easy.. just purchase via the machine or tap it wit octopus card.

A cheap but worthwhile thing to do in hong kong. Instead of booking the expensive cruise, me and my partner decided to go for this cheaper option. Yeah, the trip only last like 10 minutes tops, but you get to enjoy the famous hong kong skyline with a light budget. Try to get the schedule around the laser show time. It is better than just sitting on one side of the islands for the ahow. You get to see both sides.

A Good Way to Cruise the Harbour. Still a cheap and interesting way to Hong Kong from the water.
Doesn't seem to have changed since I last used it in 1988.
quick and efficient, HK$ 2.80 one way. excellent and especially fast way to go from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island - if you are into the view, go on the upper deck

Forget the MTR, the ferry is the only way to cross the harbour. If you've visited Hong Kong then you know how stressful and busy the MTR can be. In the past, the number of confrontations I've had with rude passengers pushing in line became a joke. This time round we opted for other modes of transport system such as the "siu ba", bus (often ridiculously busy), the tram, and, of course, the ferry.The Star Ferry is a breeze, for about 20p each trip we went from TST to Central and back, and TST to Wan Chai and back, with each trip lasting no more than about 8-10 minutes.You get stunning views of the harbour if you sit near the sides, but it's also fun to watch the ferry staff go about their business of mooring the ferry and setting off.

Overrated, but still nice. The Star Ferry once was rated as one of the 50 places to be in a life. Well, in my opinion it's not that maginicent, but I still recommend to go to the Kowloon side by this ferry, rather than taking the MTR. It's cheap and still much nicer than just go underground.

Star Ferry . It's a historical method of transport which enables you to look back at the city from a different set of eyes. It's easy to access, cheap & relaxing. Hop on & hop off with no stress. Destination Kowloon - enjoy. Boats themselves clean & orderly. Nice service.
A classic. There's nothing special about this ferry other than it's a classic! Nice way to cross from the mainland to the island!
History. I always love the feeling I get when I am riding on the icon of th city. Old, a bit fumy and greasy yet it gives a bit of the old hong kong charm.
great experience. I reached Hongkong island from the Marco Polo hotel with the ferry at sunset and i really enjoyed this experience. Actually the best experience in Hongkong.

Nice short ride across harbor. Star Ferry offers an inexpensive scenic ride across the Victoria Harbor. It costs about 30 U.S. cents for a 15 minutes ride where you can see the both sides of the harbor. A great photo opportunity. Highly recommended.
experience with Star Ferry crossing the harbours. you just need to spend HK2 to experience the ride crossing the harbours, from Kowlon to Hong Kong Island. Enjoy its spectacular view around!

Star Ferry - Hong Kong to Kowloon in just 5 minutes. Can use your Octopus card for Star Ferry. We took Star Ferry from Hong Kong's Central to Kowloon's Tsim Sha Tsui. The ferry ride took just 5 minutes. We sat at the upper deck. Had an amazing view of Hong Kong illuminated at night. Right side view is better when heading to Kowloon. Once we alighted at TST, we were just in time to head over to the nearby Tsim Sha Tsui Clock Tower to watch the 8pm "Symphony of Lights" laser light show along Victoria Harbour.
Should visit at night. You should take Star Ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui side so that you can see the night view of Hong Kong harbor.

Timeless Classic And Enjoyable All The Way. Cheaper than chips. Stunning views. Fresh air in your face action. The ferries are well maintained for their age and maintain their charm. This is a must do trip. In fact - you should try and take several rides when in Hong Kong! When arriving in Kowloon there are shops and restaurants right away so you can just continue on foot.

Most fun to use just any time you have an hour. I always ride the ferry when I have an hour and want to smell fresh sea air and enjoy the cheapest boat ride n the world. Its a great deal and i relax and meditate as to how lucky we are.
Boring. These tours get a bit long-winded. Its fun to go out on the water, on a historic boat, but the tour itself is boring.
Memorable experiences .... This is the easiest transport to and from Kowloon and new territories.Fare is cheap and although the journey is about 6 minutes, the views of Hong Kong are spectacular ...
Wonderful Experience . I have so much fun inside the Star Ferry.I am able to see the beautiful scenery only Hongkong can offer.It was indeed a beautiful experience.

Must do. . Get an octopus card. Top it up. Come on the ferry. Enjoy the view. It's that simple. On really hot days, head towards the air conditioned sections at either end - don't suffer in the middle. A return trip is so cheap and the photos you get will make great memories.

Cheapest transport!. Took the Star ferry to Kowloon side to view the light show couldn't believe how cheap it was 2HKD one way! It's so regular and you get a nice view of the city especially in the evenings with the lights.
Crossing to Hong Kong Island . Best and cheapiest way to move around between Kowloon and Hong Kong Islands, the trip is short yet so relaxing! And the view is amazing and majestic!

Where transportation also becomes an attraction. The Star Ferry's fame and noteworthiness place it into the same category of historic forms of transportation that have also become an attraction in itself, similar to San Francisco's cable cars. However unlike the cable cars, the Star Ferry is much less a tourist attraction and much more of a fun way to get from A to B. There are ferries departing from Kowloon to Hong Kong every few minutes or so, tickets can be bought at the pier or using an MTR Octopus card for more convenience. A crossing costs something less than $0.50 USD? They take about 7 minutes and you can enjoy the voyage either on the outdoor lower deck, indoor cabin upper deck for some great views of the skyline. The ferries themselves are all more than 50 years old, they have wooden bench style seats and are built reminiscent of the old ferryboats that use to cross rivers and bays in the early 20th century before modern engineering allowed steel bridges and tunnels to connect people over water. Ride the ferry if your in Hong Kong, even if you don't have intentions of going anywhere across the harbor, just take it back and forth for the fun of it.

Good fun. We used the ferry several times to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. It's a great service providing wonderful views at a very cheap price. Go upstairs for the best views but take a few seconds to look at the details on the ferry - like the seats that have stars punched in the wood.

Easy efficient transportation. the easiest way to do this is with an Octopus card (like the NYC Metro card or London's Oyster card). These are easy to buy at any MTR station and can be redeemed before you leave HK (minus a paltry service charge of about $1US). Want to go to Kowloon? Just run down the gangway, flash your Octopus card by the reader and jump on the ferry. 10 mins later you are there. Easy!
Amazing transport. During a recent visit to Hong Kong I used the ferry every day, as it is convenient and cheap, plus it gives an amazing view of Hong Kong island and Kowloon at the same time.

Still my favorite mode of transport as a visitor. I never miss taking the ferry on every visit to HK. It's slower than other modes but I like that you get to see some view and appreciate the place. It also reminds me of my childhood and has been a HK icon. I'm actually quite surprised that they have maintained it really well, given that it's been running for decades now.

Another Great Way of getting around. Took the advice of a fellow Trip Advisor and took the Central Mui Wo Ferry to get on the bus to get up to the big Buddha. Such a better way to beat the crowds on the cable car and the ferry ride was nice as well.

Worth it ! . Ferry ride in Hong Kong consider very cheap even only few minutes . Personally I felt that it's better than Avenue of stars lights. Night time especially able to enjoy nice view of Central . Weekdays hkd 2.5 and weekend hkd 3.4 , cheap and worth.

No trip to HK is complete without a ride on the Star Ferry. I've ridden it many times before but I love being able to factor it into any visit to Hong Kong as it is a great way to see the iconic night time lights of Hong Kong Island.Only a short walk from the Hong Kong MTR station so easy to connect to the more modern transport options. Can use your octopus card to pay for the ferry so is very easy.
Cheap. Cheerful. Efficient.. A fun way to cross the harbour with great views. Only HK$2.50 per person per crossing. Lots of seating and you feel connected with the past to some extent.
Nice to cross harbour on Starferry. Cheap way to cross Victoria harbour. Nice view. Do it once and the other times take the MTR. Travel on upper deck for best view.

Timeless . This is a must , when visiting HK very cheap and run many services per hour you will be never waiting long for your trip across the harbour
. Don't forget your camera !
Very Scenic . Not fast but nostalgic...with a great view. Best things to Do when you have never been in Hong Kong before
Well Organised. It is a great mode of transportation - lets faec it there is a lot less traffic on the water. It is also a pleasant ride on a good weather day to enjoy the scenery.

Good choice to admire the harbour. This is the budget sightseeing ferry without tour guide. One of the cheapest and oldest transport in hongkong. With low price, you can enjoy he nice harbour view in 15 minutes way~~ But during winter, may not be the good choice, at least put on more clothes

No Excuse Not To. At the cost of $2 HKD or around $0.25 USD, you can't beat it. It may be the best quarter I ever spent. I took the ferry from Hong Kong Island (Pier 7 I believe) to Kowloon at night to see the light show. It gives you a great view of both skylines and may even be a better view than Victoria Peak. It is certainly a more intimate view. The ride is fairly quick, maybe 15 minutes (or maybe it just seemed so). It lets off on the Kowloon side very close to where you would watch the evening light show. On the way to Hong Kong Island, it lets off near the Central MTR station. Don't miss it and I recommend doing it at night.

Must do in Hong Kong. We rode the Star Ferry every time we visited Hong kong, except this time we came as parents. The cost is cheap and the view is great. In my opinion , the view from Kowloon side to the Hong Kong Island side is better. We would like to support this landmark transportation before it become obsolete.

Great service with long history. We used the Star Ferry boats several times during our Hing Kong visit to cross between the island & Kowloon, and also for the harbour tour.The ferry service was efficient & inexpensive.... Basically does what it says on the tin, with old character filled boats.The harbour tour was interesting, informative & very reasonably priced. There was an excellent commentary provided in both English & Chinese.A great service, well worth a visit.

If you do noting else, Do the Star Ferry!. The Star Ferry has been transporting both residents and visitors of Hong Kong for more than a century. Each day, this beloved ferry system makes its way gently across Victoria Harbor cheaply and efficiently. The original Ferry in 1888, traveled from Pedders Wharf (Central) to Tsim Sha Tsui (Kowloon), a vessel known as The Morning Star! This trip took about an hour on the early coal-powered ferry, which was owned by a company originally known as the Kowloon Ferry Company. For the greatest part of it's life, The Star Ferry (4th generation) was located at Edinburgh Place and is only way to see the intensity of this amazing city, as you step out of the hustle and bustle for 9 minutes gently floating across the water, allowing you to take in the spirit of the harbour from a far.

Cheap and easy. If you're fed up with crowed subways the star ferry is the way to go.For hkd2-2.5 (one way) you can buy a token at the machine or you can use your octopuscard.Original and efficient with a view to die for. Even better if you go back to Central! Subway fast and easy from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui (hkd10), but underground and you miss out on the harbour view.
