Cheap and easy crossing. The star ferry does exactly what it's supposed to and has been doing for years. It provides a great, quick crossing from Central to Kowloon. We used Octopus cards during our time in HK and I really wish they were worldwide, so easy and hassle free, just swipe and go.For a couple of dollars for the crossing the ferry is very good value for money for us tourists too. Add in the view on each and every crossing and we probably had around 30 trips during our two week holiday.
Great way to see the skyline. What an easy, efficient and cheap way to get between Kowloon and Hong Kong island. Get an octopus card to make it even easier.
Star Ferry. A very economical way to get to/from the islands that make up Hong Kong, whether it be day or night. Especially I think at night when the lazer light show is done on the buildings.

Free and Easy. Star ferry is affordable,convenient and quick.Ticket price are cheap . The ferries run very frequently and its takes 10 minutes to travel across .Do not miss taking a ride .It really worth.When we were there ,we took a few ride just to enjoy the view and ride.You also can view the magnificent Hong Kong skykine.Spend 1 day around the star ferry area.You can visit Clock Town,1881 Heritage,Avenue of Stars..etc.Remember to bring your camera.

Best way to get around the islands. Quick, runs regularly, and very efficient. I only bothered with upper deck tickets once since I could get a lovely view from the lower deck. You will need cash and to buy a token from a machine before entering the turnstiles (there aren't tellers, only a machine and signs.) Follow the people and it's a very, very simple process.

Good experience. The star ferry is quite convenient way to travel across the harbour. Its fast and nice experience to go through. The Hong Kong skyline too looks amazing while on board. Its 10 min fun ride.

Not too good not too bad.. We took the Symphony of Lights Harbour Cruise on the very first day we arrived. This is the only thing that I couldn't book in advance as they don't have that facility. You have to book tickets at the counters on the same day. We had to wait in the sue after ticket purchase for a while. The ferry wasn't crowded much. The ride was okay with all buildings lit up nicely but didn't find it very great. Not too bad for just an experience and the view but. They offered some cookies and selected soft drinks. Overall ok. Would suggest if you have couple of hours spare then no harm doing this for experience.

Reliable, cheap service and great views. The Star Ferry is soooo cheap, we were really suprised at not only how inexpensive it was, but also how easy it is to get a ferry back and forth from Hong Kong Island to the mainland. Being on the ferry also offers great views at night!

The cheapest transport in HK. Instead using MTR to Hong Kong Island, we took the Star Ferry. Nice view and cheapest ride in Hong Kong. It's only cost us HKD 2.5 ( upper deck) and HKD 2.00 ( lower deck)
Good way to cross the harbour. We travelled on the ferry a lot and being 65 and over it is free even to visitors wonderful. It is a nice way to get from Kowloon to Central.
Excellent value. Costs about HK$2.30 for adults, free for over 65. Still held the old magic from 23 years ago when I used it. Nice views as you travel across the harbour.

Efficient and easy . Efficient and effective. Even if you missed one, the next will come in few.
Efficient and easy (this is really summarize it)

Star Ferry is the part of Hong Kong History. Since I was young, there was no MTR, the ferries were the only connection with Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. I had traveled with Star Ferry all the time in between Hong Kong and Kowloon. It is my favorite ferry, I liked to travel at the lower part of ferry as I could watch the sailors' working, watch the sea and it was a very good experience.When I came back to Hong Kong and stayed at the Marco Polo Hong Kong Hotel (this is the part of reason I stayed in this hotel), it is just a few steps from the hotel to Star Ferry and I enjoyed to travel it when I went to Hong Kong island. It has fresh air and relaxation. Better than travel by MTR to encounter a lot of travelers and felt suffocated.Anyone visits Hong Kong should go to travel with the Star Ferry and enjoy the journey.I can guarantee you will enjoy every minute.

a great way to travel. The Star Ferry has been operating for over 100 years; I recall, years ago, when it had several classes and as a student at the time, I chose the lower floor. Not so now, still convenient and a wonderful way to see Victoria Harbour

A peice of history. This is a must on any visit to Hong Kong. A piece of history and great views of both sides of the harbour from the sea. Cheapest ferry in the world and now no longer crowded as more locals take the MTR to cross the harbour when they commute. The short journey is a good clean and safe experience for any visitor wanting to get a feel of this historic city.

Best Way To Travel between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui. In my humble opinion this is the best and most cost effective way to travel between Hong Kong Island and Tsim Sha Tsui. At a regular week day you can travel for measly 2 HKDs while enjoying a great view of the Hong Kong skyline while doing so. A great way to travel for both locals and tourists.
beautiful. Took ferry to kowloon,what a great view of Hong Kong.staff very helpful.will do it again,loved the harbour.

A special ferry trip to enjoy the Honk Kong bay. We took the ferry to reach the Kowloon side, and we took the ferry around 8 pm when there is an amazing light show in the Victory Harbour. It costs less than 1 pound and it is well worthy. Highly recommended.
Fantastic . A must place to visit if you go to Hong Kong..boat the ferry at 7.55pm and saw the lighting show at 8pm..unforgetable memory..

Great Trip, part of Hong Kong's History. Whenever I can I take the Star Ferry instead of MTR or Taxi. Only sad part is the journey has got shorter over the years with reclaimed land, but that's HK. With the shipmates in the old uniform it's a great part of HK's history and a true way to really feel and see the city.
Its a boat. As the title says...its a boat. Still fun and everyone has to try it...but its still just a boat...?............

Star Ferry . Love the ferry! So much more fun than taking an MTR across from Kowloon to Hong Kong (or vice versa). Not as packed either and only $2.50! Great views as well. Definitely a must if you're in Hong Kong.
The Star Ferry Hong Kong. A pleasant experience. Basic but reliable. A good regular service that works very well. A real piece of history still operating, as it must have in the past.
Star Ferry. A must for all travellers to Hong Kong.Go upstairs and travel in comfort - tongue in cheek. Part of the overall experience.
Bets value tourist cruise!. For a very cheap price, you can view the beauty of Hong Kong and Kowloon from the water. Christmas lights were up when we sailed across in the evening--magical!

The ultimate HK transport..... Its cheap and swift, what more do you want? On top of that you get some of the best views of the city no matter which direction you travel. This is simply a must do rather than getting the metro.

Got to try. The ferry is a great way to view Hong Kong and to go to Tsim Sha Tsui. Huge shopping centre there which you should visit. Just a short ride on the ferry to the other side, extremely cheap. They've been using the ferries since the 60's still used by the locals and a great attraction for tourists.

Lovely trip. Very easy way to get around on the water. Good value for money.
I am used them to cross the harbour, tour the harbour and sail to Lammas Island

Cheap way to get a great view. Appart from being a Hong Kong classic atraction, the cheap ride, the good service and the great views make this transportation option one of the best ones to cross from Hong Kong island to Kowloon.
You can pay with your Octopus card.
Worth the $2.00HK to see the bay with kids!. We had a good time with our kids using Star ferry. Cheap entertainment for our kids. They loved the experience and would have liked to ride both ways.

Classic ferry between Hong Kong and Kowloon. We took the Star Ferry from Kowloon to the main Hong Kong island. If you have a public transportation card (Octopus) you can simply tag it at the entrance to the ferry and off you go. You have a choice of upper or lower deck so pick the boarding ramp entrance based on your preference and simply follow the signs. It's only a few minute journey but you'll get great views of the skyscrapers on both sides of the water. At night time, you might catch the light show that starts at 8PM.

Wonderful way to cross from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. I love Ferrys, and this is an iconic one! The Star Ferry dates back well over a hundred years, and probably hasn't changed that much for a very long time. At a cost of $2.50, it is an absolute bargain, and simply the best way to travel from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon, with great views and a real sense of history. It only takes about 10 minutes, and is commonly used by the locals. I am sure the MTR is a quicker way to travel, but if you have time my suggestion would be to take the ferry. And whatever your preference, I would recommend at least taking the Star Ferry once during any stay in Hong Kong!
Colourful old ferry. We loved this old ferry that quickly took us to Kowloon. As a senior I paid zero. My wife had an overdraft on her Octopus card and had to get a token.
very necessary form of transport. very easy cheap and quick. best way to move around the islands of hong kong. not crowded during hours outside of the rush hour
Can't beat the price. Cross harbour ferry is good day or night. Of course aside from offering an economical way between kowloon and HK island, views of the skyline are top notch!

Fun Way to Travel. I traveled with my 5 y/o boy for his first time, he enjoyed so much and was smiling all the way until we finished the ride. I guess he liked the fresh wind while on board.Make sure you pay a tiny bit more to stay on the upper deck for a much nicer view!!Great experience!!~

Iconic ferry ride. I first took the Star Ferry over 30 years ago. The price of the ride across the bay is so cheap I can't believe the price has increased very much since my first visit. It costs the equivalent of 35p.There's no luxury here nor does there need to be. Just a great inexpensive way of getting from A to B.

Best way to get across the harbor. From Kowloon Island to Hong Kong Island via the Star Ferry can't be beat! The short ride showcases a fantastic view of the city skyline for only HK$2.20 (.25cents – 44cents USD). We combined this ferry ride with our visit to the Peak Tram. Once you get off, you will be able to find different food vendors/shops incase you are in the mood for a snack. After we snacked, we took the bus no. 15C from the Star Ferry to the Peak Tram Station.Cheers!

it's a legend, but that's about it. The Star Ferry is a legend. Every visitor to Hong Kong should try it once.The views of both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island are spectacular.That being said, by the time you get to the pier and wait for the ferry, and take the ride;it all adds up. The trip is rather short, and simply goes from Central to Kowloon's museum district. Do it once, then use the MTR. Much easier. Much faster.
relaxing ride. The ferry fare is low and the ride is enjoyable and relaxing. It is short by refreshing. What a great way to enjoy the harbor views!
nice service... if you are coming in Hong Kong the ferry is basic for enjoy the place and skyline from Kowloon or back to see the Island ............................................

Quick and efficient. Cost is around 3 Hong Hong dollars to travel across, very cheap. Takes you from Kowloon to Hong Kong and back. Very quick journey and nice to see the views while travelling across. Good views at night when everything is lit up.

Cheap and fun!. Loved the Star Ferry, a dirt cheap and fun way to cross from Kowloon to Central with brilliant views along the way. Make sure you do it both by day and night. A much more pleasant way to travel than the busy MTR!

Cheap way to get across the harbour. It's a far better option than taking the MTR across the harbour. At 2.50 (weekdays)/3.40 (weekend), I would recommend the experience if only for a view of the HK skyline.

The best way to get your night breeze. A less than 20 mins journey from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui will gives you a night breeze unlike other(if you ride during the night). It is definitely the cheapest way to get across. The only minus point is the journey to the ferry pier which requires some walking for both sides. My recommendation is of course to take the ferry at night where it is cool and the Hong Kong Skyline will wow you.
Time Machine. These ferry's are great not much changed from when they were built. Great engineering and design. Cost of travel around 30 UK pence, very cheep.

Best tourist bang for your buck in HK.. Whenever we go back to Hong Kong, we always do one or two trips on the Star Ferry. It is cheap, convenient, and a much more scenic way to cross the harbour from Kowloon side to Central. The alterative, the MTR misses te view.
Cheap, easy and quick. Great cheap way to cross the water and get a great view of both sides! Very easy to access, and you just can't get lost!
Fancy. The fanciest way to travel from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central and back, specially on sunny daysTrip os fast and quiet and is used by many locals, as well as tourists.

Great view of the harbour and the city. We took the star ferry on both occasions. During the nighttime, we were visiting the tsim sha tsui and took the ferry across to admire the Hong Kong skyline. Unfortunately we couldn't find the entrance to the lower deck so we settled for the upper deck. I find the lower deck to give better views and since you are closer to the water, it is much better experience than the upper deck, which feels enclosed. The view of the HK skyline is fantastic. During the day, we managed to take the lower deck. A cheap and great way of experiencing Hong Kong.

Relaxing hour seeing the harbour. Got to sit back and relax add wer cried around the harbor. They have a narration in both English and Chinese and also have it printed out to follow along. You can enjoy the view from either the front or back of the ferry. .. or indoors if the wind gets bad. Arrive early. . They don't wait for anyone!

Cheapest and most scenic route. No matter how many times I have taken the star ferry, this journey fails to amaze me. Different times give U different views.
Quick way to cross from hk to Kowloon side . Very scenic.

The only way to tarvel across the harbour!. The star ferry is such an icon of Hong Kong that it is a must do. Cheap, frequent and full of character. You must do it at least once to say you have "done Hong Kong!"

Its cheap and frequent service. When in Hongkong you can miss the star ferry .. specially at Victoria harbor . Try to take it twice once in the day time and then in the dark . Its cheap and doesn't take much time... ! Apart from skyline view , its like normal ferry ride
Star Ferry. Basically a 3-4 minute boat ride across the harbor. Good view of the city. Octopus card accepted. If you don't want the view, take the MTR.
Fun ride HK to Kowloon. Fun, inexpensive, and frequent times to travel. It was very inexpensive maybe $3usd for 4 adults. Sit on the top for best view
Romantic boat. They may be old, but you will fall in love with these boats. Go at any time of the day or evening for spectacular views.
The iconic symbol of Hong Kong. A short ferry ride across the harbour saves you from a crowded MTR and gives wonderful views. Definitely something worth doing!

A cheap thrill -- cheap, and a thrill!. Easy to use, cheap to use, goes about every 5 minutes between Hong Kong and Kowloon, and other ferries go to other islands (check them out, too), ferries are covered - so you're out of the rain and sun - excellent views of the water and the shorelines up close and personal -- a definite must for the visitor as well as the local.

Wow amazing night trip. It was amazing night round trip. Lighting was amazing and it was full moon. Indeed an unique experience. Round trip includes refreshments. Carry jackets as it gets colder due to old wind.

Local sight seeing in HK. Its the oldest method for crossing the Victoria harbour sea in HK, it is also the cheapest method for going to Island from Kowloon side. It took 8 min to cross the see the total journey may take 15-20 min. You may experience the spectacular view on both side of the ferry while enjoying the south china sea.
Its cool. Cheap way to see Hong Kong and get to take some great rtes photos of the boats and HK from Kowloon side.
A fun way to travel. This is a good way to see the city and travel like a local. The cost is minimal and the ferries seem to go about every 5 - 10 minutes.

Convenient means of transport cheap and fast to get to the central island. Convenient means of transport cheap and fast to get to the central island
Very high frequency of sailing

Ferry essential. You really can't say you've visited Hong Kong properly without trying this iconic ferry. It shuttles between Kowloon and The Island every couple of minutes for a paltry fee. And the scenery is breathtaking.

BEST WAY TO TRAVEL. For $2 second class and $3 first class this is most convenient way to travel in Hong Kong. Then a simple walk to the metro and your home for $5. It comes very frequently and you can buy a beer in the little shop before you leave cheap. It is comfortable and only takes five minutes or so, good fun and a must do.

A Great Experience. This ferry runs like clockwork. The public really do use it to get back and froth between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, so it's not just a tourist attraction. Amazing to think, in this day and age, that a ride on the Star Ferry still costs the equivalent of about USD .50 cents!
One of the Must Do things in HK. Convenient, absurdly cheap ferry across to HK Island. You will want to do it and it is a good way to see they skyline

Star Ferry. This is a short 10 minute ride from Hong Kong island to Kowloon or the reverse. We obtained our tickets as part of our Big Bus tour. I recommend using the upper deck. You cannot access the upper deck from the lower deck. The boarding for each level is separate and well marked.

One of the must do in Hong Kong. Victoria Harbor is arguably the most beautiful harbors. Taking the Star Ferry is the easiest, cheapest and most convenient way to see this harbor.Make sure you do it during day time and also for one clear night. The views are both magnificent :)

Business trip to convention centre from Kowloon.. Great way to get from one side of Hong Kong to the other, definitely beats the subway. The ferry is frequent and delivers you right to the convention centre's door almost.

The best way to cross the river. A short ride on the ferry is the best way to cross the river, cheap and easy to get to the pier. Watch the daily 8 PM light show on the way, buy a token or use octopus card. A must do in HKG.
Cheap, convenient, and a must do if only once. We took the ride from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. A nice way to see the harbour and a family quick ride across.
Great fun. Very cheap and cheerful way to cross over to Kowloon for a change from the MTR! Lovely views of the harbour, too.

Just a ferry. For a 5 HK$ you get from one point to the other. Very old style with nothing impressive about it other than its authenticity. I couldn't find a ferry time table anywhere. Good as a method of transport but won't call it a tour.

Great way to enjoy the harbor and enjoy the views. If you visit HK you have to do a ferry trip. Its a beautiful way to take in the harbor views at a leisurely pace. Its a cheap way to get around and quick way to get around the harbour area.
Incredible Value/Best way to cross Victoria Harbor. Super cheap and boats constantly running, this is the best way to get across the harbor from HK Island to Kowloon.
Fast efficent way to cross two islands. Got to ride 3 times twice in the upper deck and 1 in the lower deck. If youre in a budget try the lower deck. It was fast clean and fun way to travel. :)
Relaxing way to travel. Worth the experience its cheap to use and on a sunny day gives you great views of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.
Cheap and cheerful. The only way to cross the harbour. Very frequent, very easy to use and really cheap at about 30p each per trip. Lots if photo opportunities as well.

Lovely experience typical for HK. If you are in HK of course you can take a bus, MTR or taxi to travel between HK island and Kowloon. I can however recommend the ferry services of Star Ferries to experience the 10 minute crossing of the bay and to see both side from the water itself. Pay with your octopus card a few dollars to experience this fun travel method.

Iconic ferry and a must for a Hong Kong trip. Travel first class on the upper deck to get better views and air conditioning, it costs about hk$2.50 which is c25 uk pence or US$0.40!!
Great views, short trip and something you have to do when in HK. It only takes 10 minutes or so and is a great experience.

You CANNOT visit Hong Kong and not take the Star Ferry.. You can absolutely get from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon using the MTR train, or in a taxi by one of the three tunnels under the harbor. But the Star Ferry is a remnant of the past, and you can't go wrong taking the trip which takes less than 10 minutes. There are two classes of service, with the "first class" cabin upstairs, and the "second class" cabin downstairs. By the way, if you're over 65, and you have an MTR Elder Octopus card, the ride is free. The departures are frequent, and the views of the harbor are great.

Four days in Hong Kong . Crossed once on this wonderful ferry. The harbor views on either side are beautiful and we happened to see that red sail junk in action. Took one from the pier just across the Hong Kong observation wheel. A hassle free ride and nice experience.
great day out. best way to get across to Hong Kong Island from Kowloon. Very cheap with great view of waterfront. Best links with local public transport which is also cheap.
Pretty foggy that day.. It was a cold and rainy day on board the star ferry. So although the lights were playing, couldn't see much. Nevertheless, it's something worth trying, as a tourist.
Relaxing. Although the ferries are a bit shabby I love them. Less crowded than the train and also less walking.

Better way to enjoy the amazing city view. They charged HKD 2.5 for weekdays and 3.4 for weekends for an adult from cental to main Island. Octopus card can be used. The view from upper deck was cool. Enjoyed the ride.

A few HK dollars? You cannot go wrong on this ferry ride!. Great views across the harbour, you will get plenty of photo opportunities for a very cheap price... And you get to see the locals commuting too....

Quick, cheap and easy.. This long established ferry runs between Hong Kong City Central and Kowloon. The boats seem quite old but are frequent and reliable. The ticket price is very cheap anyway but we had Seniors Octopus Cards and the crossings were free with this card. What more can you want??
Always take it to cross Kowloon to Central. Just the nice old transport , superb way to see HK and Kowloon. Very cheap and very authentic . Just love it.

TO DO LIST. If you come to HK... you've got to cross the bay... just to enjoy the star ferries, and also to go from the main Island to Kowloon side...
Typical, cheap, nice...

This is a Must - Just Do It. This is a must when you are visiting Hong Kong. It gives a great view of both Kowloon and Hong Kong island and cost literally pennies.Its principal routes carry passengers across Victoria Harbour, between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. It was founded in 1888 as the Kowloon Ferry Company, adopting its present name in 1898.The fleet of twelve ferries currently operates two routes across the harbour, carrying over 70,000 passengers a day, or 26 million a year. Even though the harbour is crossed by railway and road tunnels, the Star Ferry continues to provide an inexpensive mode of harbour crossing. The company's main route runs between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui.

A must do in Hong Kong. A ride on the ferry is something that every visitor to Hong Kong should experience. The upper deck is better as the views are less obstructed. But it's the overall experience and just the fact knowing you're out there on the sea between the 2 main parts of this destination, that makes this a special event. And strangely, it's so very affordable - which is so un-Hong Kong!

A must do!. The Star Ferry is a throwback to a bygone era but still an integral part of getting across the harbour. It's cheap and runs efficiently. The ride across doesn't take long - that's the only disappointment to me - as I enjoyed so much just sitting in it and checking the harbour views.
Always great. The Star Ferry is synonymous with Hong Kong and is a must do. For pennies to travel, it's always worth doing.

pay the extra money and travel on the upper deck!. efficient and extremely cheap at 2 HK dollars for the trip across the harbor, had to buy a token and I chose the lower deck but wished I had selected the upper deck!

Hong Kong The Best Transportation.. Moving with ease in Hong Kong. Traveling and moving around in and out of Hong Kong is very easy. You need to get the Octopus Card. The best and most convenient card when in Hong Kong.
Got to be done!. Regardless of whether you have to use the ferry, you should! If you are crossing the harbour, then this is the simplest way to do it, and the views are a real bonus

Best way to see those lights at the harbour. We took the ferry from IFC to Ocean Terminal. It was cheap only 2 HKdollars ( I think) . We were able to see the lights from the building along the harbour. It was fun but at night the waves become bumpy. Nevertheless, It was a good experience for my kids who rode the ferry for the very first time.
Vintage!. The pleasure of being on a vintage ferry is here. At just 2.5 HKD its a pleasure which should not be missed. Lovely views of the harbour can be had sailing in this age old Star Ferry.

Ferry service every 10 minutes. Star ferry operation is very convenient from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon running every 10 minutes, ferry trip takes about 6 minutes and provides great views of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon for very little money (about 40cents each way AUS Dollar) and reduces any road transport time immensley.All ferrys named star and after close inspection near the engine room you will find the date the vessel was commissioned.Two decks offer great views for photos especially in the evening when the Victoria Harbour Laser show commences.

Short but sweet!. The Star Ferry across the Kowloon Bay is a true tradition and a must-do for first timers to Hong Kong!You can use your Octopus card to cross and boats run regularly throughout the day. Expect it to be busy during peak hours and the Symphony of Lights show.

Best value in Hong Kong. I've been living in Hong Kong for over 28 years now, and it's always a pleasure taking this 7 minute trip between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. The boats leave every 5 minutes or so, are always clean, and in the summer, the front cabins on the boats are air-conditioned. All this for a princely sum of HK$2.50 on weekdays and HK$3.40 on weekends and public holidays. That's US$0.30 - 0.45 per passenger for 1st Class! It really is a MUST DO when visiting, or even when you live here.

A step back into history. While you don't necessarily need to take the Star Ferry between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon (as you can simply take the MTR), it is a lovely experience that is definitely worth doing at least once (although I would recommend going at least twice - once in each direction). The ride is short but the ferry's long history makes it feel special and genteel. Cutting out across the busy harbour also gives you a shiver of excitement as you see boats coming and going all around you. And of course the views are absolutely fantastic, especially on the return trip from Kowloon, especially at dusk.It's easy to find the ferry terminals and you can use your Octopus Card (from the MTR) to access the Star Ferry for convenience. It's charming, historic, not too bouncy and the benches on the boat are reversible so you never have to sit backwards. Oh, and be sure to sit on the top level!
Convenient & Fun. Convenient to visit Expo Promenade area from Wan Chai Ferry Pier.Bus stop to The Peak just outside Central Ferry Pier No.7 (Star Ferry Pier).

Going back in time. This is how Hong Kongers used to commute between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Nowadays with MTR, this has lost its lustre. That being said, it's still being used by by both local people and travellers alike. Yes, Octopus card is being accepted here too. For the cheap fare that it's charging, you won't be able to get a better view than this. This is a must-do, to take a ferry ride from here in the evening. The night view is simply spectacular or breathtaking. Highly recommended.

It's a must do when in Hong Kong!. I've been in Hong Kong many times and I usually go at least once by ferry.It's pretty cheap to go on, roughly $4 HK at most.It brings back memories of me as a child and traveling back and forth with my mother as one of the sole sources of transportation between Hong Kong and Kowloon.Diesel smell can be annoying.View is great
Average boat rided, not much too see. I'd say that if you are buying on it's own it's not worth the price - as inclusion in the big bus it's a good idea.
Convenient, fast, refreshing. Great to move around between HK island and kowloon side. If you are in central or tsimshatsui, take it rather than underground subway.

A Must-do!. Took the ferry over from Central to Kowloon (good to take it after you come back from the outlying islands). Use your octopus card. The Star Ferry used to be an important mode of transport for people crossing HK-Kowloon before the MTR was built and it still is used widely by working people. I enjoyed the view and how the seats were reversible, you could change the direction of the backrest.

Fun way to get to Hong Kong Island. The Star ferry is an experience not just a means of transport.
From the ferry you get a look at Hong Kong Harbour, you see the water traffic and life and you get a different perspective - so worth a try if looking for a cheap something to do.

Cheap & Easy!. Great alternative to MTR.
You get to beat the traffic too.
Cheap way to transfer across the bay with a great view to relax.

Quick, inexpensive and good views. . Enter central ferry piers and get a token at the vending machine as this is your ticket.
Runs constantly and needs 10 minutes to cross

Blast from the past!. These ferries are full of character and are so cheap it is unreal! The service is very frequent (from Kowloon to either Wanchai or Central). When we visited the Wanchai ferry terminal was being located about 100 yards from it original location to facilitate a new building, the corridor they built through the building site was quite narrow and did get very congested, but that is all part of the charm of Hong Kong!Definitely do the Star Ferry harbour tour and see these ferries in all there old glory of marine lacquered wood and air conditioned parlours!

Great way to cross from Tsim Sha Tsui to HK island. We took the star ferry across the water and it was an extremely pleasant ride. Very little crowd as compared to the MTR and just a short nice walk to IFC via an overhead bridge. The ferry also allows you a nice view of the skyline and the breeze instead of the crowded stuffy subway. Highly recommended way to cross the water.
An Absolute Must. The best value transport that I've ever experienced at just $0.50 for a ten minute harbour crossing. Have whatever you use to take pictures at the ready.

A must do. This is still the fastest way to travel between Hong Kong Central and Kowloon. However, the Victorian-style ferries and their terminal buildings are a tourist sight in themselves, like the Staten Island Ferry. And cheap too.

A fun way across the water. . I am happy that we chose to take the ferry across. Currently they have lots of renovations going on at the Kowloon side, so expect not to be able to walk anywhere but to the main street. The ferry gives you a spectacular view of both sides. It's under $4 he and absolutely a must for any tourist. You get out next to the intercontinental hotel, that has a bar with the most spectacular view at night. This is a winning combination in my mind. Expect a crowd when you get on, but you will be surprised where they dissappear to on the boat. It's bigger than one might expect.
Old Hong Kong. The Star Ferry gives you a taste of old Hong Kong. While you can accomplish what the Star Ferry does using more modern conveniences, it has its own charm.
Refreshing, Nice Breeze. It's cheap to travel on and its refreshing. Don't like the bustle between TST and Central on the MTR?, take the Star ferry :)..Cheaper too

Great ride. Costs hardly anything with the octopus card. Views from the bottom deck are better. Great views of both skylines. Drops off on the main line in a really convenient place to walk along the promenade etc. Safe and comfortable trip.
Would of liked to of done the trip again at night time - especially when the light show is on!
A fun and super cheap sightseeing trip. It's a very quick ride across the water, but it is really nice...the best way to take in the water and the view at least once while in hkg

Must do. One of my favourite things to do in the whole wide world. The vista of skyscrapers on a crystal clear day is truly magnificent. The wooden benches, wooden sash windows and brass everything are tres cool. But the whole experience brings a smile to my face every time. Love it.

Cheapest way to see the city from the water. You have to do this if you are nearby. You get to see the city from a great vantage point. It's just too bad it is so short a ride. They do have a longer sightseeing voyage at somewhat higher cost, but I have not tried that before.
Easy Commute. We used the ferry most days as it was cheap and quick to get between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. They leave regularly and is easy to find. The added bonus is you get the view.
Cheap as chips and efficient. Buy a token before you go onto the ferry to pay for your trip from one of the machines.enjoy the ride!
Fab. Its cheap, clean with a great views. We loved it. We took the hour tour as well and found it really interesting.
Lovely ferry ride. The ferries run very frequently and are a great way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Wonderful views of the skylines of both.
Great views and sooooo cheap. Definitely worth doing once! tickets are really cheap and you get a great view of the skyline etc. would certainly recommend

Local. Nice way to move from kowloon to hongkong island aside from mtr. Just go to the harbor there is a line for the upper and lower deck. Upper deck would give you more view. You can use octopus card. After the trip you can take shots of the hongkong ferris wheel and proceed to IFC

A Hong Kong Tradition You Must Do. As the title says - this is one of those Hong Kong traditions that you must do when in town - although the ride is getting shorter as they expand the coastline...Take a short trip to the Island then ride up to The Peak if you want a simple and enjoyable day to see Hong Kong or take a ferry to one of the islands for a great escape... This is nice to do with friends as it is a fun way to explore the region...
A must do. A cheap way to commute between Kowloon and Hong Kong at only HKD 2.30 per trip. Ferries run every 7 minutes or so.

Just a ferry ride..... We included the ferry ride in our itinerary as it was a rated must do while in Hong Kong. It was simple to add into our plans, was fun to cross on the water, but other that that it was just a ferry ride.

Good for commuters and visitors. Taking the Star Ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central, or vice versa, can give you a good harbour view of Hong Kong and its skyscrapers, and the activities of the harbour

Unchanged, still the only way to cross the harbor. The Star Ferry is one of the great romantic bits of HK, an easy and cheap way to get from one side to the other, with views of the harbor, people watching and ease, downtown to downtown.
Star attraction. Great views and photo ops. Quaint ferries. This gives a very relaxing ride across the harbour in a small green and white craft.

Cheapest tourist attraction in the city. Although the crossings are fairly short the star ferry is a tourist attraction in itself ,you can feel the history and tradition when you board the vessel,the ferries still have their old fittings and paintwork.The short crossing allows you to see Hong Kong from a different perspective and the best part is how incredibly cheap it is

Right on schedule. You will never have to guess if they will be there or not, right on time all the time. The ferry is clean and convenient. My two younger kids loved taking the ferry instead of the subway. Fantastic views at night. The only disappointing thing is all the trash in the water!

Travel between hong kong and Macau . It was a little difficult to understand how it worked because there are two ferry companies side by side but we boarded and enjoyed the ride to Macau it was many sites looking out the windows,the on board service was good,entering and exiting was annoying people were very rude as the pushed and cut right in front of you.

Very efficient and inexpensive to navigate back and forth from Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. From downtown Kowloon this seemed to be the most efficient and very inexpensive way to transfer back and forth to Hong Kong Island. The ferries run constantly. There is never a very long wait.

Old and still going. Just returned from Hong Kong after several trips on this old original Star Ferry. It must be the cheapest trip in the world. You buy your ticket from a machine, very easy to use. The prices vary at weekends and busy periods but in the day it's about 20 pence each way. Even cheaper if like us you are an OAP (15p) Probably not as quick as the MTR but cheaper and the views are better!
City stopover. A 'must do' whilst in Hong Kong, and with the 'Octopus Card' it is the cheapest way between HK & Kowloon.

Do it!. This is a great way to see the harbour without having to make it a big tourist stop on your visit to Hong Kong. It's inexpensive, it gets you across from Central to Kowloon, it's an iconic part of HK and you don't have to spend 45 minutes plus on the water...
Super cheap ferry!. Cheapest way to cross the river! You can also have a look at the city as you cross. Definitely worth taking!

Enjoyed it I would go again. I was so glad we bought out the time to do the Star ferry it just shows you how beautiful Hong Kong is. it was very affordable 68 Hong kong dollars it only took about 1 hour of our time and was relaxing. After we got off the ferry we bought some big bus tour passes that included the star ferry so I would highly suggest getting the big bus tour package because it includes the Star ferry, Victoria peak ,Stanley park and much more its the better deal for 240 hong Kong dollars a person.

A must do part of any trip to Hong Kong.. A slow boat to China comes to mind. These are push me pull me ferries launched half a century ago. A cheap and cheerful way of getting across and around the harbour. Operate a good timetable and as they don't have to hold far they don't take too long. May not be good for someone who experiences motion sickness.
Hasn't changed for 40 years. At $HK2 a trip it's a great experience. Just watching the crew go thru their routine that they have done 1000 times before. Great views and fresh air. A must do!

Great value, nice way to cross the harbour. Not the best weather the day we went, very overcast, but can imagine ride is great on a sunny day. Very fast, efficient way to cross the harbour, inexpensive and something different with kids

Best and cheapest way to get on the harbour. I have been living in HK for over 10 yrs now and i still love getting the star ferry! Its a great way to see Victoria Habour and for the price its unbeatable - i always tell our guests to take it
Needs to be tried. Rather than crossing from HK to HK Island by MRT, bus or car - you should consider to try the Star Ferries. Its cheap and offers good views.
Good way to go from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Good way to go from Kowloon to Hong Kong. During the trip, you can admire the skyline. It is very cheap (2 HK dollars) one way.

Convenient. This is definitely a convenient way to go back and forth from TST to Hongkong central/wanchai. No pushing/shoving/running to beat the doors and the crowd. The ride is comfortable and breezy!

The only way to travel between the island and the mainland.. This is so simple and yet so brilliant. 8 mins across the harbour , hardly any waiting time for the next ferry and a very relaxing journey , even if you dont need to travel across to the island, you should just to experience the ferry.

Easy way to go between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. The ferry is an easy and inexpensive way to go between the two islands. It is a short 5-10 minutes ride that allows you to appreciate the beauty of Victoria Bay and the many beautiful buildings. They run very often so there is not long wait and we never found it to be overcrowded.Our fare was part of the Big Red Bus ticket but it is pretty inexpensive anyway.
A classical experience. Still the best way to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong and back. Inexpensive, beautiful. Cross by night to enjoy the full effect of the skyline and I.M. Pei's building.

Great value for money!!. A ride on Star Ferry is a MUST for all visitors to Hong Kong!! The short crossing costs only HK2.50 (about 20 pence). It's clean and airy. The views are wonderful on a clear day and at night!
Easy and fast. Between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon is the Star Ferry. You take it like you would take a bus in London. You can use the Octopus card payment system.
Do it at least once!. This is a must at least once to see the view and live the experience, you can also cross between HK and Kowloon using the mtr, but the view from the ferry is very nice.

A FLOATING MUSEUM. Hong Kong's Historic Star Ferries are the perfect way to relax after a day shopping and view the spectacular skyline of Victoria Harbour.Its a very short journey across this magnificent harbor and it costs next to nothing!!!! $2.50HKD which is about 50c AUD.I made the trip across about 3 times and each crossing was different.I really felt privileged to be sailing on a floating museum piece and I couldn't think of a better way to experience Hong Kong.* This is a must do in Hong Kong *

Very authentic.. Taking the Star Ferry system is always a treat if you are the kind of person who enjoys history. Inexpensive way to travel between Hong Kong and Kowloon and these ferries have been in service for quite awhile.
Inexpensive and Scenic. The Star Ferry was an inexpensive way to quickly get across the harbor while also seeing both the island and Kowloon skylines.

Scenic and cheap way to enjoy the Hong Kong cityscape.. I usually take the Star Ferry from Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui whenever I visit Hong Kong. The view especially at night is just great and it is a less crowded transport. You can enjoy the sea breeze, relaxing few minutes and convenient terminals near major shopping and convention centers.
must do it. the star ferry is great for you to use for seeing the lights and laser show in the evening, starting 8 o clock its a must and have you camera ready.

"The best deal in Hong Kong". This is what I heard a father tell his young son today on the ferry - and how right he is. For a mere HK$2.50 you receive the most astonishing views and a cooling breeze to blow away the heat and humidity, for a few minutes at least. Priceless. There's nowhere in the world like Hong Kong and nowhere in the world with views like this except for the Star Ferry. A must when you're in Hong Kong.
Best way to crss the harbour. Great idea, well run, cheap and easy to access. recommend this be your transport cross the harbour.octopus friendly and can obtain passes through other activities

Nice and cheap. This was a nice experience to have while in HK as you get to ride a boat for little money :).I guess it's also practical if you walk otherwise I would suggest the MTR.The ferry runs every 10-15 minutes and it's a boat with a small part in the front with window glass and behind without glass.Overall it's more fun then practice as I end up using MTR.
Convenient!. Quick and convenient way to get across the bay. Enjoyed the views and the ferry was easy to figure out how to use.
Do it. I love riding on old history filled ferries and this is a classic ride with great views at both ends. Very enjoyable way to travel.
It's just a Ferry. The ferry gives a quick way to cross the harbor, but it's just another ferry service. Nothing special.

A must do. Land reclamation on the Island side of Hong Kong has made it a longer walk to the ferry, and a slightly shorter trip across the Harbour, but this is so cheap it's worth doing - several times. Try it during the evening light show.
Fast cheap and easy. This was a great way to get from kowloon to Hong Kong. I love the old fashioned boat and the lovely views.
Nice way to catch different views of the Harbor. The views at dusk from the ferry are just great, it is an easy way to get from one place to another and explore the harbor area.
Convenient and perfect for tourists. Great way to cross the harbour, view of both kowloon and hong kong island shoreline. highly recommended
Iconic. The best way to cross Victoria harbour, cheap and efficient, relax and take in the sights as you cross
Easy, cheap boat ride. It's only $2 to ride this boat. The view is great, the air fresh and only slightly breezy - perfect! Much easier than taking a taxi, bus, or MRT across Victoria Harbor
Cheap trip. Quick and easy and very cheep way to cross the bay. No messing getting on and off. would use it again if we went to Hong Kong

Cheapest ride in town. I stayed in TST when I first arrived in Hong Kong, and got the star ferry every day when I went to central. It's not even $2 on your octopus card, and saves you the faff of wading through the MTR stations. You also get a great view of the skyline :).
Marvellous ride. Had a trip from the island to the mainland within 15 min.very nice ride with a great scenery of hong kong.must try!!

A necessity in Hong Kong. When you visit Hong Kong, this is a way to capture great views of both the Hong Kong and Kowloon sides. If you time it right, you can even see the nightly light show which lasts about 13 minutes.
Nice ride!. This is a very touristy way for transportation. We visited in november and the weather was very nice for this ride. You can see the city with lights and it is a great view.

Amazing HK heritage. A very cheap and quick way to get across the harbour. These boats go backwards and forwards all day and evening. Costs buttons. Can you believe they recently tried to shut them down and force people down the MTR? Support the Star Ferry!

Wonderful experience. The Star Ferry is a genuinely wonderful experience in all aspects, nobody should leave Hong Kong without crossing the harbour at least once on Star Ferry. Everything about the service is both charming and efficient. It's a very memorable way to travel.
A must do. Free is you're an Elder holder of an Octopus card and fun to do at all ages. Get to see a lot for a little in a short time.

Scenic viiews. The Star ferry is an excellent way to cross the harbour, they run regularly so you are not waiting long at all and they are cheap. The harbour tour is a lovely way to get photographs of both sides of the harbour and excellent views of Hong Kong. We got our tour ticket in with the cost of The Big Red Bus tickets so we did the day tour, however you can purchase a night tour ticket which gives you great views when all the lights are on which is amazing. Well worth it.

A Hong Kong Institution. No one should visit Hong Kong and not go on the Star Ferry to Kowloon . Buy an Octopus travel card for travel on all public transportation in Hong Kong . A great system that really works !
Quick and Convenient. This ferry made it easy to get back and forth. It is super cheap (less than $2 USD per person) and it comes often - so we never had to wait more than 10 minutes.

Bit of a Boring Trip. Made the trip to and from Zhong Shan which takes 1.5 hours each way. The ferry is easy to find and board but there is not much on the ferry to keep you amused. There is not much to see out the windows. There is a TV with not much on. The kiosk has pretty limited supplies. I'd suggest you take what you need with you - smart phone, ipad, drinks and food.
Cheap. Another good and cheaper option to go to Hong Kong Island. You can even pay the fare with Octopus. Ride will take around 10 minutes.

Lovely ride from Kowloon to Central. We enjoyed the 10 minutes ride from Kowloon to Central as an alternative to the Subway.Cheap and easy access from Star Ferry termnal, nice old ship and lovely view.We would recommend using it at least once when in HK.
Best sightseeing value in town. The Star Ferry offers convinent frequent crossings of the harbor, offering splendid views at a very affordable price.
A must do. Great experience, so cheap (about 25p!) and views of the skyline are outstanding whichever way you do this. Also great to do at night time

Great views @ night!. The star ferry is the star attraction ib HK. Just go for a $2 ride from kowloon to central, sit back and enjoy the view. Totally worth the visit. Would suggest going in the night to enjoy the best views of the skyline.

Hong Kong Harbour Ferries. You cannot visit Hong Kong without a trip on the Star Ferry. It must be the cheapest habour ride in the world. With ferries that have stood the test of time. Check the beautiful wooden decks.

A must do on your checklist - try to go at night. Star Ferry is the classic way to travel from TST to Hong Kong like a local - efficient and inexpensive. Try to go in the evening to enjoy the light show and different view of the harbourfront.

Great views of Hong Kong Harbour, especially by night. Hong Kong Harbour is one of the world's great harbours. Do yourself a favour, if visiting HK and take a night Star Ferry for small dollars, but a fabulous view. It was one of the first things I did with my second husband on his first trip to HK. We just took a return trip to "drink in" the views of the HK skyline. Enjoy!

When in Honkers.... Not as quick as the metro under the bay- but a genuine Hong Kong experience. I walk down to the pier follow the crowd really... Use your octopus card - choose up above for better views or down below to save a little... Great fun
Great ferry compamy and cheap to travel. If you get the chance take the ferry from Hong Kong terminal to Discovery Bay, such a beautiful part of the South China sea
Nice!!!. Its so nice to take picture. But if you need to go somewhere fast use subway. And take octopus card. Its so usefull. You can see hong kong and kawloon islands. Nice trip try it.

The best cheap tourist attraction on the planet. Amazingly, the Star Ferries are still in demand, despite there now being two tunnels under Kong Kong harbour. Cross in the mid-morning or at dusk to enjoy the amazing Kong Kong sky line for just a few pennies

Star Ferry plastic tokens. When you board the Star Ferry, you can pay by using an octopus card or cash.At the Central Pier there is a machine where you can buy tokens if you don't have an octopus card.Just for fun, I got a token and the machine gives you change as well.I was expecting a metallic token but it was a plastic one.The ferry journey to TST was pleasant..
Nices Hong Kong Views. Cheap and very nice city view. A Must if you are in Honk Kong for the first time. Make sure you get a good seat.
Fun ferry in the city. We took the starferry from Kowloon to Central. Fast and efficient and cheap! Even had a/c. Definitely must try

Easy and cheap. We used the ferry often on our trip to travel between Kowloon and Central. At HKD 2.80 one way, it really is a good option. The ride is quick and the ferry clean and efficient. Great views along the way.
Use your Octopus Card also for a ferry.. You are not in Hong Kong when you do not get into ferry. Enjoy the view for the skylines and fresh breath from the water.

Quick and efficient trip to the mainland. We rarely had to wait more than 10 minutes for a ferry. They docked quickly, and were kept lovely and clean. We found that we could travel free with our Senior Octopus card, so that was a bonus. However, the trip is not expensive.
Fun activity. The Star Ferry was a fun ride, economical, however a very short ride. The ferry was very clean and employees were nice.
Must do. So much fun so little money great way to get a feel for Hong Kong and get around a real classic experience.The ferry runs all day is easy to use and at night is magic

Star ferry. Quick, convenient, and cheap way to get across the bay and enjoy the view. There are nice shopping places around the harbour area on both Hong Kong and Kowloon sides with nice restaurants, coffee places, supermarket and brand name stores.
Harbor Crossing. Terminal facilities, payment. And taxi attainment after the disembarkment were all wonderful. No issues. Safe and clean ferry with very acceptable cost.

Pleasant way to see Hong Kong from the water. We had a couple of hours to spend and decided to take the Star Ferry Harbour cruise. It took an hour and was very pleasant, including the complimentary soft drink and pineapple cakes. The commentary was useful. We did not pre-book however it would have saved time if we had. A ggod experience

BEAUTIFUL, CHEAP & CONVIENIENT. I've taken the HK Harbour ferry from many different locations in HK.
Simply put. It's the best. Most reliable. Cheap and convenient form of TRANSPORTATION in HK.
DID I MENTION THE VIEWS? Do it!

A must do in Hong Kong. Its so cheap and crowded but that's the fun
Do it at night and see the skyline from the sea. Dont bother paying for an overpriced boat ride

Best Secret Bargain in Hong Kong. When we have to go across the Harbour from the Island to Kowloon we always try to take the ferry. Aside for the few minutes of quiet you relax and simply enjoy the sights. Arriving in Kowloon you can walk everywhere and on the Hong Kong side you can walk or gram the MTR

Star Ferry Harbour Cruise on Victoria Harbour. Enjoyed the Sunset Cruise along Victoria Harbour on this affordable & comfortable cruise. During the hour long cruise, you can chill out with a drink & snacks inside or outside. Also listen to the piped in audio history of the Buildings & Sites along the Harbour. What a lovely evening in Hong Kong!

Easy to Use Ferry. Once we figured out how to buy tokens, use of the ferry was very easy. Access to the ferry only accepts tokens so you need to purchase your tokens at one of the kiosks. They are all around the ferry entrance. The ferry boards timely and is easy/cheap.

..rickety old ferries and run down tired looking jetty.... The tickets came as a complimentary by the Big Bus Tours,so we sailed across which was about 10 minutes to hong kong and back.The ferries are quite old and rickety but well maintained,they need a fresh coat of paint and so does the jetty.The seats on the ferry are rather old and hard canvas,but the ferry ride lasts around 10 mins only.

Short but good. Everyone should try the trip from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. For 2,50 HKD (0,32 USD) you get a 10 minute ride with an exceptional view on the skyline on both sides of Victoria Harbour. Be careful to choose the entrance for the upper deck.
Fun. Cheap. Fun. Clean. Easy to use and navigate. Great experience. Must do when in Hong Kong. Great experience.

Love the Star Ferry!. I realize that the Star Ferry is public transportation but wow, what a way get around! We took this almost everyday while in Hong Kong and I really enjoyed it! It's cheap and a very scenic way to get to/ from Central and Kowloon. Also, the ferries seem to come about every ten minutes and it's quite efficient. Definitely take the Star Ferry if you need to get to Central/ Kowloon!
Must Do Tourist Activity. Must Do Tourist Trip : 2.5hk$ trip each way was a great way to to get perspective on the city.Recommend a day and night trip
You must ride the ferry in Hong Kong. The boats are just like the pic suggests: old and clunky. But the views of Hong Kong are spectacular!
A Beautiful Ride. Try this for a taste of old Hong Kong.A beautiful harbor tour on a clear day. Be sure to sit or stand in the bow for the best views.
Easy mode of Transportation. Easy to use and enjoyable, short ride to get across the water. Love the movable seat backs, "Why didn't I think of that!" :)

Take the ferry to Kowloon - just because you can...... We took the ferry to Kowloon - there are two entrances, one upstairs, the other downstairs - you pay more to go up, and a bit more again at weekends, but you get a great view of the Hong Kong Skyline - a popular spot to view the nightly 8pm laser show (although imho that bit wasn't worth it - well overrated!)Just a pleasant way of travelling on public transport using your Octopus Card....

Nice trip, to see the skyline. Its a nice trip, where you can see the skyline of both parts of the city, 10 minuts and it's a good price, where you can take the star ferry one way and then go back with the mtr. Tip: leave 1 minut before or 10 min later, so you dont walk with all the people to the mtr

Everyone has heard of it. Although it is incredibly famous the ferry is in real danger of being lost for the locals. As bridges and tunnels open there is not the demand that there used to be. So if you are visiting HK please make sure you use the ferry to help keep it going. Plus it's a perfect way to get across the harbour!
Reasonable and great. Cheap (only 2HKD) and gives a beutiful view of the bay. Nice view at night. U can goto the business district fastest by this route and it enjoyable too.....

Enjoying the HK waterways . The Star Ferry is a must experience for any visit to Hong Kong business or leisure especially in the evenings with all the lights illuminating from the buildings of both the Hong Kong Island and Kowloon sides. It is also a relaxing ride away from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong city life!
Lovely way to cross the harbour. Easy to use, and lets face it in Hong Kong what is difficult? Great value and a wonderful way to see the stunning shoreline.

Hongkong ferry. It is the most economical and cheapest mode to cross from Kowloon to hongkong island..it is age old and was used when the tunnel,bridges were not built.even before the metro became operational. One should experience it once

Super cheap and great fun.. These ferries rock. They are super cheap, I think it worked out about 40 cents AUS. They offer a great chance to mingle with locals, see the harbour, Hong Kong buildings, which look great at night. It wasn't a flash boat but comfortable seating and easy to navigate makes this a must do activity whilst in Hong Kong.

sea breeze, the night view. just a few minutes ride at night and you can feel the sea breeze, see magnificent night view and get away from the crowds .......
the fare is also cheap....
I'm from Hong Kong and I absolutely love taking the ferry. Not only it is the cheapest way to cross the harbour, the view you get from taking the ferry is invaluable.
Quick and cheap. Great way to get across to HK island and not expensive. You get a cool breeze and you can see the sites
Old times!. Everyone in Hong Kong has to have Star Ferty ride. Cheap and exciting! Great views from the water of the Harbour.

It's a must in Hong Kong, yes it is a ferry ride but with great views of HK. Everyone tells you to take this ride and yes you should, but my top tips are do it at night when the view of HK is lit up by all the skyscrapers and try and get on the top deck as it has better views, is usually less crowded, has nicer seating, usually a better breeze (with a closed in section too if for some amazing reason its cold) and you don't get the smell from the engine. To get to the top deck though you have to take a different entrance so when you get to the pier look for 'upper deck entrance', it's not immediately obvious, you will also need to take the stairs so not good for strollers unless you can carry them. The cost for this trip is ridiculously cheap and you can get up and walk around and take photos but hang on when it comes into dock! The ferry runs regularly throughout the day but I believe the last one is just before midnight. There is usually a lot of life going on around the Star Ferry piers and at night you will find many buskers on both sides of the water. On the HK side you can easily grab a drink from any of the piers (Pier 3 has the best bar for outdoor drinking, and has a bar on top of the pier too serving food & sometimes live music) and then relax on the steps watching the ferry and listening to music, its a great place for a sundowner after a long day:)
cheap price and nice. The price of the star ferry is cheap. The view would be lovely even the journey is shorter and shorter. I love feeling the wind during the journey. Very refreshable !

A cheap fun ride with a view of Hong Kong and Kowloon. Take the ferry from TST or Central and amaze yourself at the skyline of Hong Kong while this public transport ferry takes you across Victoria harbour.
Must Do in Hong Kong. try to catch the light show while aboard the Star Ferry at 9 pm between Kowloon and Hong Kong islands. One of the best views while on the water.

Nostalgic ride from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Sweet nostalgic way of travelling between Hong Kong and Kowloon. The ride is short as the harbour has been land filled over the years. This ferry used to be the common way of travelling between the two places, other than junk boats. Now most people ride the MTR subway system that runs via underground tunnels.

As great as ever. What a lovely way to cross from Kowloon to H Kong island...
Quick, very scenic and great value only $hk2.
Much better than the MTR

Pleasant way to cross the Harbour.. Travelled at night from the Hong Kong side to Kowloon. It's a quick but enjoyable ride and a chance to take a breath from the hustle and bustle of the city. Enjoy the watery views and spectacular skyline.Cheap as chips, use your Oyster card.

cheap way to see Hong Kong from a different perspective and to cross the famous harbor. Make sure to travel on the bottom deck where you can stand just above the water you are crossing to the other side of the harbor and view the busy traffic criss-crossing in front of you everywhere and yet almost never an accident ever.
Great views. We had fun taking the Star Ferry to Kowloon. We had great vies from Hong Kong Island on the boat and then we experienced the more local flavor during the night markets in Kowloon.

Classic. Please use the ferry
One of the best trips in HK to travel from HK Island
Despite taxi & MTR to take you off the island you will never see both views if you dont go by star ferry
One of the busiest waterways in HK you will never forget a trip of a life time

classic must-do. Instead of taking one of the expensive harbor cruises, you might consider going back-and-forth with the star ferry. It gives you the classic, famous and impressive Hong Kong harbor view. And you get to travel with a mixture of local commuters and tourists. The crossing is fast, barely a five minute ride but a MUST DO when you are in Hong Kong. Highly recommend it!

Certainly not the 3rd best thing to do!. The Star Ferry or ferries are older style timber boats that take passengers from the pier (near Central on the water) across to Tsim Sha Tsui).- the trip is between 5-10 minutes- no entertainment or drinks on board.- the walkway you chose heading towards the boat determines what level you are on (you cannot move from either the lower or upper decks whilst on board)- if it's the view and photos you are after take the ramps to the upper deck- more functional / novelty travel than anything else and certainly not number 3 on things to do!- worth using the ferry as your means to get across but not a top attraction in its own right (my view)If this review helped you, please do let me know.
Good views, great prices. Must try!. It is an easy way to across between Hong Kong and Kowloon in a very cheap price. You can see beautiful views of Hong Kong both Day time and Night time.

Bit Disappointing. We did this as it is another iconic piece of Hong Kong's history but we were left a bit disappointed as its over very quickly. We did it in daylight and at night I would imagine it would be more spectacular.It costs very little so it is still worth doing.
Quick and Cheap. These Ferry's are reliable, quick and cheap. Easiest way to cross between the islands and there is no fuss.

great fun. Really great service and so cheap only a few minutes and kowloon to exhibition centre and just a few dollars, night views are stunning with all buildings all sides lit up like blackpool illuminations
Cheap and cheerful way to corss. Quick and cheap way to cross between TST and HK, the view of the HK skyline in the evenings is amazing

Best 50 cents you'll ever spend. The cheapeast tourist attraction in hong kong at about $2.50 HK for a one way trip. Undoubtedly the best way to see both sides of the HK skyline. Don't come to HK and not go on the star ferry!!!

take it at least once. this is the fastest and cheapest way to see HKG from the water . Unless you arrived on a cruise, or plan to take a cruise event for lunch dinner. The star ferry is the perfect trip to cross from HKG to Kowloon. It is still original, a highly recommended attraction
always fun even after 25 years. I´m coming to Hong Kong for almost 25 years now and always enjoy taking a ride on the Star Ferry from Central to TST and return! The view is spectacular!
Nice way to see the harbor. Although this is always considered one of the top sights/things to do in Hong Kong, I think the view of Hong Kong is actually better from the promenade in Kowloon.

Open air, great view, surprisingly cheap. Traveling by Star Ferry is definitely the experience you should take when you visit HongKong. It is cheap and gives you chance to enjoy the view of the two sides of Hong Kong. If you go on a Sunday, please visit the local fruit market at the Central end of the Ferry to enjoy the 'local' feeling and local fruits. There are public view points inside of restaurants and cafes there, so you can walk inside to reach the view point, even if you do not dine or drink there.

ride it before it goes away.. there is really nothing special of the star ferry except it takes you from point a to b except that this star ferry may go away soon. This is truly a Hong Kong treasure. Try it before it goes away.
A must do .... One of the cheapest and greatest ferry rides in the world. Short, easy, day and night, always great! Don't miss it!
Nice Old Fashioned.... Cheap and easy way to travel between Hong Kong island and Kowloon Point. I think every few minutes there are these shuttle ferries between the two ports.Ticket is required.
Cheap ride. Great old boat, get a window seat for the view. You can use your octopus card. Make sure you try it at least once.

love love love the star ferry. the star ferry is a great way to see the skyline of hong kong from either side. this is a great mode of transportation to and from Hong Kong Island and Kowloon...i took it as many times as I could fit into my trip, it is about 5-minutes across, at least seems that fast. the ferries come often and its a fun way to meet people and chat about whatever. love this ferry and i could go back and forth all day on it...

Best to take from Wan Chai . You can't miss on this experience! I always take the ferry when in HK. But took it from Wan Chai for first time this week. For a better experience, take from Wan Chai. Reason is ride is a bit longer and less crowded.
Very cheap and historic atmosphere. I heard this ferry has been the foot for the people in HK over the sea almost for 100 years. Awesome! Recommend you to feel the everyday life in Hong Kong!
Fast, easy. Nice, old fashioned ferry. Easy to find/use. Takes you to Central for good walking around. Definitely go if you can! Worth it for .25 cents!
old fashioned style. The crews still wear traditional sailor uniform. It's a quick and traditional way to get between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. And it's so cheap, it's amazing one needs aticket!
Best way from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Great fun and very inexpensive and fun way to cross the harbor from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Must do at least once while in Hong Kong

Cheap and Efficient. Whenever in Hong Kong I usually stay on Kowloon side (Tsim Sha Tsui), but have to visit Hong Kong Island (Central) I always take the Star Ferry because of its fresh air and scenic view. You must buy a token prior to boarding. Discounted tokens for seniors are only valid for those living in Hong Kong.

What a bargain. If you buy the Octopus travel card this ride is a few cents. Even without the card it is a couple of dollars. The ferries are clean, frequent and give you an excellent way to view Hong The form the water. Take you camera.
Fantastic Experience and Cheap Way to Experience the Victoria Harbour!. A lovely historical experience and great experience to sample Victoria Harbour, well worth the modest charge.

Enjoy a ride across the harbour. Old fashioned, cheap and delightful. You don't have to be going anywhere. The maritime workers in their sailors shirts, the people coming and going and a trip on one of the world's great harbours.
This is Hong Kong. Please do use star ferry. At the least cross the harbour or visit an outlying island. They are reasonable and fantastic service.
Crossing the water. amazing experience. This ferry service to several destinations is cheap and runs regularly. Amazing views of Hong Kong and has reversible seats so you can face the way you travel.

Great transportation method. I used the star ferry twice today and I have to say that this is such an easy way of transportation! When I arrived I didnt know where to buy my ticket (called token), but in simple English one of the employees explained it to me. After I figured out how it worked it was very easy. The star ferry is available from early morning till night.When you want to go to the HK Island, make sure you use the ferry; it is easy, cheap (only 3,40 HK$) and fast. And you have a great view! ;)

Best Deal in Town. At HK$2 pp, a great deal. Runs every 5 minutes and crossing is brisk and practiced (they have been doing this since 1880's). Good way to see the harbour. Connections to the Peak tram on the HK Central side if you are looking to go up to the lookout.
Excellent way to travel to and from HK island and Kowloon!. Taking the ferry at night is the best way to view Hong Kong's Harbour. You can take lots of great photos on the ferry! Not to miss!!
A fun ride. A very convenient and inexpensive way to travel between Hong Kong island and Kowloon, especially enjoyable for children who would find ferry travel a novelty.
Very easy way to cross the harbour. We used the star ferry multiple times each day during our recent 7 day visit to Hong Kong. Affordable way to get from Kowloon to HK Island and back.

It's a ferry. Not sure what the fuss is about. It's a quick, cheap way to cross between kwoloon and hk island. Yes the views are good but they're the same as from the shoreline. Tip - the seatbacks move so that you can always sit going forwards - don't sit facing another row - there isn't the legroom.

Great views and nice way to get to Kowloon. This is so easy and cheap to do why wouldn't you?! We took the Star Ferry over to Kowloon when we wanted to go over there for a day looking around. The views were lovely, we got to see the skyline in all its glory and see some of the other places we had been such as The Peak. Great photo opportunities also.
Haven't been to HKG if you didn't make a trip on the Star Ferry. Still gives you a reminiscent of the old times . "Decelerating" in our accelerated world. And cheap too

Always a fantastic little ride.. Beautiful journey across Hong Kong harbour. Cheap, fantastic views.
Choose from either Central on HK Island, where all the inter island ferries leave from, or Wan Chai.

Nice ferry trip! but you need a sunny and shiny day in order to really apreciate the landscape.. Not much to add from the title. Everything works perfectly and it is very low cost way to spend the afternoon.
cheap and cheerful. One of the things to do. 29pence to travel across to Kowloon. Great experience to see the river traffic and waterfront on both sides
veryyyyyy cheap. the cheapest ferry I've ever taken! you get a wonderful view during the day and an awesome light show in the night. definitely worth the trip
ferry. these ferries run like clockwork so efficient and clean they run about every 10 minutes the cheapest and best way to get between the mainland and island.

A must do in Hong Kong. Star Ferry plies between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon since a century. Its a must do in Hong Kong.
The octopus card works here and its really cheap. Take a ride in the evening so that you can enjoy the beautiful Hong Kong Skyline.
A small but memorable ride indeed

Iconic Ride but Once is Enough. This is an iconic thing to do in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is a genuine tourist attraction and cheap. It is not an efficient means of getting around Hong Kong but that is not why you would take the ferry. An evening trip back from the Kowloon side to Central is a spectacle sight. Even more so if the night is clear. The cost of the journey makes this a must do on your list of things to do in Hong Kong. There is no doubting the smell from Diesel engines can be pungent but it is a short ride so bearable. You would be disappointed if you got back home and said you had been in Hong Kong but had not done the Star Ferry.
nice and cheap option. another authentic travel option between the 2 main island; else you can take a cab through the tunnel.

Cheap views of the harbour. Star ferries have been going for so long it's amazingThe price of about 2aus to cross the harbour with regular voyages makes this a fantastic way to get around and also grab great views of the harbour and surroundsA must do in Hong kong

Very affordable way to cross the islands in Hong Kong. There are some ways to cross the islands in Hong Kong. Getting on a boat at star ferry port is the cheapest way and I can say the best way to enjoy the trip because we can feel the authentic and old-fashioned way of transportation of local people. It only takes about HKD 2.5 per person one way instead of about HKD 25 per person one way by MTR.

A Ferry.. Took the famed Star Ferry from HK island to Kowloon, could not quite fathom what made it worth my while - the upper deck was not reachable from where we boarded, and after a short and uneventful crossing we were deposited on the other end. Views were not any better than they would have been from the shore in Kowloon, might as well take the subway.
Easy to use. Great way to get back and forward to Hong Kong island never much of a wait to get on the ferry. You can use the octopus card to pay or get a ticket before you board

Great views.. The Star ferry is a great way to cross over between Hong Kong and Kowloon.The underground railway is hot and sticky, the ferry on the other hand has a cool breeze and spectacular views of Hong Kong from The sea, especially at night.
throughly INSPECT habour's view. Even though I've took ferry many times, but since the buildings on both sides of Victoria harbour keep constructing , it can't get boring (I'm talking annually)
This is very cheap sightseeing!. We had bought an Octopus card with seniors discount which made each crossing HK$ 1.5 or say UK£0.12. Not bad for an amazing 10 minute sightseeing trip.

Only if you are in the area. Its a nice way to cross the harbor from TST to Central, but I wouldn't go out of my way to just ride the ferry. But if you are walking/shopping near the Star Ferry terminal at TST, taking the ferry is much easier than walking all the way back to the train station. And the cost is CHEAP. Just swipe your Octopus card and wait to board. A bonus is IFC is close by in Central after debarking the ferry.

A must do in Hong Kong - and good transport option too. Quick and easy way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island, and fun and cheap to boot. Cruise over to Central or Wanchai - the ferries are clearly signposted so it's easy to know where to go. Take some change so you can buy a token at the ticket machine - and then immediately us it to go through the barrier. Good fun.

No need for harbour cruise. On top of the fantastic view, you can get a genuine feel of the harbour, the hustles and bustles of life in Hong Kong. By far the cheapest ferry in Hong Kong. Use the Octopus Card to save time going through the turnstile. I prefer the upper deck to avoid the strong diesel smell. It goes from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui, in 5 minutes and is very frequent. Do avoid the peak hour as it can get very crowded. It is still one form of public transport and is not exclusive to tourists. The best value for tourists to Hong Kong.

Not a Must. You're in a boat for a short period of time. If that's all you want then this is perfect for you because it is fairly cheap. The boat I was on was covered, so you could peek through the windows or around bars to see the city, but it kind of lost its appeal to me fairly quickly. The HK island side is pretty spectacular, but you can see that from land too... and not worry that you're about to drop your camera in the water.

Great experience!. We heard that this was the best way to see Hong Kong and it didn't disappoint! It was a great value, HK$5 each way for two people ($2.50 each person each way for a token) on the upper deck. Beautiful view of Hong Kong, very authentic. We took our round trip on the ferry at night, which was absolutely amazing!

easy and inexpensive. If you want the harbour tour, that doesn't start til 11AM. Otherwise, regular ferries to stops run frequently and kiosks for tickets are not hard to use, though often someone helps you.
Practical. This is the best way to go around Hong Kong. Easy, fast, clean and cheap. No need to pay extra to book a tour. You can easily go on your own.
Cheap, charismatic & frequent.. Got to be done - they're iconic. Its an easy way to cross the bay, you can pay on your Octopus card, & the system is easy & obvious - do it!

A great classic. It is very convenient with ongoing crossings every 15 minutes, great views and a comforting breeze. Brought back a lot of memories as it was my means of transportation at the end of last century.
Best valde For money. For just 10 hkk (just over 1 Usd) you can cross over from Hongkong Island to kowloon. The trip takes about 10 minutes and offers a spectscular view of Hongkong from The sea.

Efficient way to cross!!. Cheap and easy way to access both sides of the island!!
