We bought our tickets through the Big Bus tour company and it was slightly difficult to work out wether we needed to wait in a designated area for the boat or not, but we were let through with the rest of the locals, great to see the city from boat!!
Comfort and quick service... Best and fastest way to get to Wan Chai or Central from Kowloon side - my daughter love this trip so much...

Cheap and cheerful. This is the best way to cross the Harbour. Cheap and easy to use these boats cross the Harbour in just a few minutes. The boats have an upper and lower deck which are not connected so you need to decide which deck you want before you purchase your token from the token machine. The entry points are clearly signed. upper deck is marginally more expensive to ride than the lower deck, is more open and most popular with tourists. Locals tend to use the lower deck. This ferry is a great way to see the Harbour and skyline.

A classic in HK. I love ferry rides and the HK star ferry together with the ferries across the Bosporus in Istanbul are my favorite ferry rides. Star Ferry is a classic in HK, a short but enjoyable ride across Victoria Harbor. Easy to get to, it is definitely worth taking the ferry instead of the MTR. Also great for picture taking of both sides of HK.
Great View. You can travel between HongKong side and Kowloon side, using Star Ferry, or if you just need to see nice view of harbour, you can also take the boat. Cheap price but great view!

Cheap Trips. Took the ferry from Kowloon to Wanchai then walked to Central for the ferry back to Kowloon. Cheap at $2.5 for the first trip and $2 for the second and gives great views of the city and island. Will give their harbour cruise a try soon.

Good transportation . Easy way to go from place to another. Nice views you can see and very good price.
You should try it in the night time .. you will be amazed.

Great Experience. We are just back from Hong Kong and the ferry was on my to do list! It was a great way to see the city from the water, very cheap and clean, good signage. We traveled both day and night, a not to be missed experience.
Crowded with a long wait. Yo cannot go to HK without takng the ferry at least once.nt is however very crowded and the wait is rather long. For transport, MTR is more expensive but much more practical
Better than using MTR. Good way to see skyline for both Kwoloon & Hong Kong Island, of course little bit slower than subway and you have to walk at both ends little bit more.
Local transportation in Hong Kong. Take the ferry near Bauhinia square, not too far away and childrens love it as another local transportation they can explore with.
Easy Public Transport. The Star ferries are the most convenient, economical, fast and enjoyable mode of public transport in the city.

Great views and relaxing. I once again have used this ferry many times on my trip. It's a very relaxing way to get from one side of the harbour to the other. The ride is about 7 minutes and it affords you good views of both sides of the harbour.

Do not go near the local ferry to Macau. Wanted to visit Macau from Hong Kong and all said to take the local Ferry! It is a disaster!!!! 10000 people around making a lot of noise, almost no one understands English, after an hour an a half waiting on line without A/C in such a crowded not organized place we decided to return the tickets we bought and take a taxi back to the hotel. It was really a very bad experience and you should try and see if there is a better - normal - civilian way to cross to Macau! Without reaping you off:)Hope it helped you to decide.
Well organized and reliable. Its easy to get on, the harbour views are fabulous. Reasonnable price. Good signage. Comfortable ride.
Star Ferry. We took this a couple times while we stayed in Hong Kong. Its a very short maybe 15 minute cruise accross the Harbor. Never crowded, and I dont think it was very expensive.

HOLIDAY /VACATION/LEISURE. We board the star ferry from Kowloon Pier to Hongkong Island.We actually paid cash although you can use an octopus card if you want..We normally waited 30 minutes to an hour for the Ferry to arrive and then we boarded the Ferry .It was my second time to board the star ferry and the experience and the atmosphere was amazing.I got a little bit of a fright when its windy or when there is big waves but the Ferry is safe although recently I have been hearing about Ferries crashing from Hongkong, the Ferry is the safest to explore the City and to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island.This was my best moment which I will treasure in my whole Life.I recommend anyone that is going to Hong kong to try Ferries , and they are available and they go to different places.If you are not sure, ask the Tourist information at the Victoria Harbour or Hongkong Tourist information in Hong Kong
Must do in Hong Kong!. Take the Star Ferry by night for a spectacular view of Hong Kong - it's amazing to see the view of the city from the harbour

One of the bes things in Hong Kong. It still amazes me how this ultra modern and high tech city still respect and treasure its history. With state-of-the-art subway system, you still can have a chance to cross the bay by old-fashioned ferry. It is fast, convenient and fun way to get from one side to the other. I hope it will stay that way.

Great way for first impression to see the city. I love the star ferry. It's cheap, efficient and runs often and gives the best view of kong kong island and kowloon, especially at night. While it's not the fastest way to travel, i used it every Time to cross the harbor because I like being on the water and it'sNot Crowded. A must for first timers .

A pleasant ride!. We took Star Ferry from Kowloon Pier to Central. Just tap Octopus Card and go. An inexpensive way to see the beautiful skyline of Hong Kong in the evening. We chose to be in the upper deck.

Cheap and cheerful way of crossing the harbour. A 6 to 8-minute journey across the harbour to Tsim Sha Tsui from Central ferry piers and vice-versa (crossing also available to/from Wan Chai ferry pier). Best time to travel is around 8pm to see the daily "A Symphony of Lights" light show emanating from the major skyscrapers, predominately from the island side of the harbour. Worth paying the extra 50 cents (HK$2.50 on weekdays) or 60 cents (HK$3.40 on weekends and public holidays) to go on the upper deck so as to avoid the worst of the noise and diesel fumes encountered on the lower deck.

Star Ferry for the win!. We purchased our tickets for the night tour during the light show. They only take cash. It can be a bit confusing because there's an hour long tour and there's just the ride to Central (HK Island) so make sure you get the right thing. It was super crowded upstairs, so we went downstairs and had the whole thing to ourselves. It's like Manhattan on steroids and the ferry was great way to see the laser light show!

Cheap and excellent. Perhaps the cheapest mode of crossing the harbour with a swipe of the octopus card and the best way to enjoy fascinating views of the harbour. Vessels here and there, speedboats roaring their way,airplanes approaching the airport and symphony of lights right from the ferry. Don't miss it.
The good old time at present!. What a peacefull trip from HK to Kowloon! Unique experience...just look around you. you have to do it (for some cents!)
an old form of transport. the ferry used to be the only possibility to get between Kowloon and the Hong Kong Island in the past, now you can take the subway, but still it makes a great adventure
Do this very inexpensive ride. The Star Ferry is a must do if you are in Hong Kong. It is very inexpensive, relatively short (~20 minutes) and provides an excellent view of the skyline.

Must do. The Star ferry is a Hong Kong icon. Visitor to Hong Kong must experience the short ride between Kowloon and Hong Kong island. The ferry hadn't changed much over the years except I notice the gate now opens and shut by electrical motor and not by hands as it used to be. It's a great way to see Victoria Harbour and the skyline of Hong Kong island. The fare is reasonable and is worth every cent.

It's a boat. Every body look at me cuz I'm sailing on a boat.Seriously, it's a ten minute ferry ride across the harbor, 400m away. Not that much to expand on. You can use the Octopus for it, which is nice.

A quick and fun way to travel.. The ferry is a short ride (8 minutes) across the harbour which gives you great views of the harbour and skyline. The walkway to and from the ferry is a bit long but worth it. More...I also did the Star Ferries one hour harbour tour. The commentary was a little sparse and outdated (some sights are hidden by new construction) but it was a pleasant way to spend an hour. And it was not expensive ($15 Canadian I think).

A real Star – Ferry Good!. A must do if travelling from Kowloon to HK Island or in reverse. Love these old Star ferries which really have a history and atmosphere about them. More expensive – a few pennies – on a Sunday, but some super views of the harbour and the skyline. They say National Geographic say a Top 50 World must do. Perhaps don’t agree with that statement, but worth doing never the less.
Best enjoy in the evening. I suggest ride this boat in the evening where you can see Hong Kong until lightning show , upper deck maybe better for taking picture.

Ferry cross the Harbour. Having been brought up in Liverpool on the banks of the River Mersey,the ferry in Hk brought back so many childhood memories :the smell of the oil and diesel ,the wooden planking.It costs next to nothing 2HKD -20p A must Do!

Nice Harbor Tour & Quick Passage Between Hong Kong Island & Kowloon. We took the harbor tour, as part of our Big Bus package. It was a very pleasant experience, as it gave us the chance to see muck of downtown Hong Kong Island and downtown Kowloon from the boat. The boat was very comfortable.We also took the Star Ferry across from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island & back. The trip was about 10 minutes and inexpensive. It is the easiest and fastest way to cross Victoria Harbor between the islands.
Cheap and saw lots. really good view from the ferry of Hong Kong skyline. Cheap to go on too and quick to get to the light show and frequent trips available too!
Across the harbour. Cheapest way to get to different islands or in particular Hong Kong & Kowloon. Took the ferry at night so I am able to see the night skyline of Hong Kong.

Nothing special but a nice way to cross. Pleasant but average . Nice way to get downtown good price . Easy
Good way to get to tour city on big red bus

You Have to Experience the Star Ferry. This is a super cheap way to experience Hong Kong as it should be. Even if I do not need to get across the harbor I will take a trip back and forth just to see the skyline, watch the ships and feel the HK experience.

A cheap way to get Hong Kong with a view. We stayed on Kowloon side and travelled over to the Hong Kong side to catch a ferry to Tai O - took about 50/60 mins on the slow ferry and got the fast ferry back 30 mins
Highly recimmend this trip we saw the rare pink dolphins over in Tai O so breathtaking.
Easiest way to cross the river. It costs about 50 pence to cross the river, getting a ticket is a simple process. Nice crossings with all the glory of the hong kong river front.

Interesting short cheap trip. I tried this kind of transportation from Kowloon to Central. It only took around 10 minutes.
The fee was so cheap, less than 3 HKD.
It was a pleasant short trip where you could see Hong Kong Sky Scrapers. The scenery at night was beautiful.
It is one thing you should do when you were in Hong Kong.
Relaxing and quick. Great, easy way to travel between the districts we caught the ferry easily when we went to the peak and again to get the nus to Stanley market
Must Visit. Sit on the upper deck to enjoy the beautiful view of Hong Kong Skyline especially at night. Cheap way to travel to Wanchai or Central Hong Kong.

Easy and fun way to see Hong Kong from the water. You can take the Star Ferry from four different points: Central and Wanchai on the South side and Tsim Sha Tsui and Hung Hom on the North side. The Star Ferry isn't expensive as you can take the upper deck ride for around HK$ 3,40 which gives you a nice breeze and beautiful view on the harbour. The rides are very short 5 to 10 minutes which also means you don't have to wait long if on a next ferry of you miss one.

Very efficient way to go back and forth. Thank God for this ferry. With so much construction going between Hong Kong and Kowloon on bus or car is a nightmare. Ferry has you there quickly and comfortably and gives you a great view of the harbor in the way.

Dirt Cheap Great Views. We used the ferries over a dozen times during our stay as it offered great views was always busy but never manic, never had to wait more than five mins for the next one. An absolute joy.
Very practical and cheap. A very efficient, well organized and cheap way to travel between different islands or in particular between Hong Kong and Kowloon.

Reliable and fun crossings over Hong Kong Harbour. The Star Ferry is a fantastic service. Reliable safe crossings plus a great harbour tour service too. The night time crossings are a great way to capture the amazing light shows from the skyscraper buildings. Love the way the seat backs can change direction to match the direction of the crossing!Look out for the multicoloured boat - a bit different to the usual green and white ones!

Great way to see the harbour from the ferry . We travelled on ferry a few times day and night . You get to appreciate the harbour which the underground doesn't offer. The fares are cheap too. Great way to see harbour by night
Hongkong visite with Star Ferry.. Have a quick visite of Hongkong by sea. Good service, the ticket are not expensive ans the ship a clean.

conveniant and cheap transportation from Tsim Sha Sui to Wan chai. The star Ferry service is my regular mode of transportation for going to HK convention centre from Tsim Sha sui. It is clean, neatly maintained and perfect timing. too convenient.

Public transport at it's best, experience a moment in history.. These ferries are famous the world over and well worth the time to cross the harbour on. Very cheap and always efficient for passengers getting on and off. We only had 24 hours in Hong Kong and were very pleased we included the Star Ferries as part of our stay. I would recommend them to everyone.
Classic must do. Easy to use - octopus card can be used. Great view of city from both sides. Its a have to do. Love the way the seat backs flip.

keeps on going. This is an amazing form of transport considering it is many years old the ferry comes every few minutes it is not built for comfort but is fast and reliable make sure you purchase an octopus card which will get you on all transport and u can purchase goods at 7up stores
Good mode of transport...with a view!. The Star Ferry is the best way to cross the harbour. Very cheap, safe & clean. Also a very fast way to cross the harbour without having to go underground!

Pleasant Ride with Great Views. The ferry ride have 2 decks, upper decks cost little more the lower decks are close to the machines - nosier. The ride is very pleasant enjoy the great city view near the harbor. The ride take less than 10 minutes easy travel between Hong Kong and Kowloon island.
Simple.... Simple, easy to use and very frequent. Price is cheap also i think maybe 2HK$ for lower deck. Takes no time to the other side either. Very efficient

Iconic Hong Kong. A trip on the Star Ferry which travels between Central and Kowloon piers is a definite must do. The fleet of ferries with interesting names have good big old fashioned diesel engines and one really gets the feel of the harbor when on them.

The Harbour Tour is a must do!. With an afternoon to spare an hour's trip round the harbour on the iconic Star Ferry was an excellent way to see the Hong Kong skyline and have the most important sites identified. A night trip would have been even better!

Simply a must do whilst in Hong Kong. Whilst on business recently, I was staying in Kowloon and the exhibition I was attending was located at the Hong Kong Exhibition Centre. It allowed me to enjoy the delight of using the Star Ferries on each of the three days I was there. Each trip was a new experience as the busy harbour always has different and varied traffic to see. The Star Ferry is always efficient and bustles back and forth. For HK $ 2.5 for a single trip must be the best value for money in the World.

Nostalgia Ride. A Nostalgia ride using the Star Ferries to commute between Kowloon & Hong Kong area.Among the oldest means of transport in Hong KongFerry rides can be taken during the symphony of lights in the night.
Breathtaking . The skyline is absolutely stunning at night and this is a great, cheap way to see it. Definitely recommend this.

A must. If you come to Hong Kong, aka the coolest place in this crazy world, you can't really miss a trip on the star ferry. It connects kowloon to Hong Kong island in less than 15 minutes at a very competitive price, plus the sights are unique both during the day and at night. Laser shows start at 8 pm every day.

Fun and refreshing. As our hotel was in Kowloon we used the ferry every day during our brief stay in Hong Kong. It was a quick walk from our hotel, fairly easy to navigate and gave a refreshing break from the heat as there is a pleasant breeze during the crossing. All in all an enjoyable way to commute.
Cheap and fun. You have to do this, it is so inexpensive and it is fun. The view from the water is great and it is so efficient to go from one side of the harbour to the other.

Delightful. Ended up at the star ferry and took a trip to Hong Kong island. Lovely trip beautiful view, a lot of construction happening at the moment but will look amazing when finished..... Worth a trip definitely if in Hong Kong. Octopus card and signage quite good

Fantastic quick view of Hong Kong Harbour. Another aspect of Hong Kong's amazing, efficient public transport system. The ferry is a good way of getting an insight into this busy harbour. The deckhand uniforms are cute - hello sailor!
Recommend you take this ferry around sunset and early evening if you want to get some great photos

Iconic ferry link. You have to ride this ferry from Central or WanChai to Star Ferry terminal. Mingle with locals and tourists and snap a few photos of te people and the views. A mere hk$2.50 one way (more at weekends) it's a fast way of getting around.
It's part of Hong Kong. Don't leave without the experience.

Must do in HK. We took the ferry in evening to return to Kowloon from HK... firstly its just 2.5$ ... thats it... the ride is very smooth and quick... even though there is rush but its managed well...
wanted to try the one hour tour but didnt have the time... saw "Symphony of Lights"...
a very good transport option for daily commuters

Iconic Hong Kong attraction. Iconic Hong Kong attraction and not to be missed on any visit to HK. Probably the best value for money trip in the world at <HKD3.
Great fews of The Hong Kong skyline.
Must Do activity. Great way to get from Kowloon to Central. Go on the Upper Deck where part of the deck is covered and air conditioned. Very cheap way to cross the water.

Cheap and fresh Air! . I know sometimes subway can be convenient, but for HK, please! Get the Ferry. For 2.2hkd and only 15 minutes.. You are at the other side of the Island! Even get the chance to take great pictures and admire the beauty of this lovely Bay.

Nice reasonably priced thing to do. With many of HK tourists attractions being rather expensive this was I feel a value for money alternative to MTR travel. Giving a lovely view of the city from the water. Was really nice we enjoyed the ride.
Night time experience. This is a lovely experience at night. You can see the all the buildings lit up as you cross the harbour . A real must do experience.

Star ferry at 8 pm. Music & lights. you may call it sound and light show.The music and the lazer lights were very good.One is amazed at the amount of electricity used to beatify the city. It is at 8 pm HK time.

short ride, but spectacular view. A must do thing in Hong Kong. Crossing the Victoria Habour with the Star Ferry and enjoy the short ride (not more than 10 min). Spectacular view on both sides of Hong Kong and a very cheap way to get on the other side of Hong Kong. If I remembered it correctly around HKD 4.00 per trip.
Cheap way to view the harbor and waterfront. Not the fastest way to get to the other side, but its a very cheap and great way to see the waterfront of HK.

Great transport. I love the Hong Kong river transport. Catching these ferries around are a great way to experience life in the city.
Very easy to work out the times etc. I think there a must do when in Hong Kong and cheap.

Must do, especially if travelling from Island to Kowloon. Most efficient way to get across to Kowloon as well a great sight seeing trip of a working harbour and the overall city scape of Hong Kong. Great value and would recommend using the Oyster Card here too.

relaxing trip. The ferry ride between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon is a quick relaxing way to get from one island to the next avoiding the traffic. The scenery is impressive with high rise buildings on both islands. The 8PM ferry allows you to see the laser show on Hong Kong Island while on the water. No worries about sea sickness. Cost is 2.5 HK dollars.
You don't visit Hong Kong with riding Star Ferry. Sure it's a tourist thing, and one you need to do. Lot of history with the ferry, and you get a good view of the harbor too.

The best value transport in the world. So for a little over 10pence you get a 6 minute journey across the harbour.It is a great service and you get he most stunning harbour views. Take the ferry at 8pm from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central and you get to see the best part of the light show
Fun sea ride. For a short, cheap sea journey this is a must. Viewing Hong Kong from the water for a different perspective.

Nice views of both HK & Kowloon skylines . Take the ferry across from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui & back to get nice views of both parts of Hong Kong. The cost is cheap, only HKD 2.50 per trip (approx 30 cents USD). We went at 10 am and there were only a handful of people on the ferry with us there & back. The night time trip is also worth it for the lights.
star ferry is nice ferry. its cool ferry,fast to move & arrive fast & we use to move around hong kong ,more comfort & service is good & cheap tickets & cheaper than train,its recommended to use it .
comfort and cheap ferry. The service is good and comfort. The ticket also cheap. We can go to central from this harbour. And the ticket also cheaper than train
Star Ferry. The best way to travel between the islands, be it day or night. Preferably travel during the night as you get an amazing view of the Hong Kong Skyline.
A bit of a museum of transport in modern Hong Kong. The view is of course exciting, but there are faster ways to transport in Hong Kong.A certain charm, it is to crush strait with all its traffic.

A quick and relaxed way to view the travel between hk and kowloon. The ferry is a direct and relaxed way to feel the favourite victoria hurbour. It is cheap and in hugh frequency and stability, which you do not have to fix the schedule of taking the ferry which leave you room of flexibility! However, if you asked which is the best time of taking the ferry , i would strongly advice you to take if in the EVENING , so that you can enjoy the beautiful SUNSET!
Easy. We stayed in Tsim Sha Tsui and sightseed in Central. It was fun to take the ferry. Fast and easy.We bought an octopus card, maybe not the cheapest, but the easiest.
Must do at night!. For only a few cents you can take this ferry and enjoy fantastic views of both central & TST. The trip takes 10 minutes and even after 50 rides still amazes me.
Public transport at its best. Can't believe how quick and inexpensive. 25 pence to cross and it goes out every few minutes for 9 minute crossing to Kowloon
Cozy way of getting around. You use you octupus card to pay. It's a nice and easy way to get to the other island. Nothing too special, but nice!

From tst to central, take this instead of the MTR!. Took this star ferry from TST to central, as we were heading to central to take the ferry over to lamma island. It was a nice experience to take this ferry over and enjoy the breeze, and enjoy the view of HK's skyline.
Great for viewing the harbour. Water crossing between Kowloon and HK island, well worth the trip and certainly at night to see the HK skyline

Great deal. I've been told the ferry ride is much shorter than it used to be now that the harbour has more landfill on both the HK side and the Kowloon side. Nonetheless, the view of the skyscrapers with their nighttime lighting is incomparable. And, with an Octopus fare of $2 HKD (about $0.25 USD), you can't beat the price for the view and the ambience! Just beware of the rise and fall and forwarod movement of the gangplank as you get on and off. The Hong Kong Station is about a block away from the Central Star Ferry Pier (although getting to the Central station requires a long walk through the inter-station connector tunnels).

Best way to cross between places in a good weather day. It is pretty cool, easy, safe and affordable ride the ferry to the places it can reach. Easy do use and nothing compares to feel the see breeze in a sunny day !

Great Ferry Ride. We used this to get to HK island from Kowloon and its a lovely trip across the harbour. Its a 10 minute ride and they keep to time perfectly. We did not experience it in rush hour which might have felt very different. You purchase your token beforehand which saves time in boarding.

Classic experience; cheap yet great views of Victoria Harbour. I take the Star Ferry everytime I'm in Hong kong just for the historic significance of the ride. It's an inexpensive way to feel like a local travelling back and forth. It's a fantastic venue to get great photos of both the Kowloon and Hong Kong shorelines
วิวดีๆๆ. It made for a nice trip around dusk and you could get some decent photos of the buildings closeup at night over the waterfront.
Amazing History. Had an awesome scenic view of both side whilst crossing the island both ways. And insteresting fact and history of the ferry.
Another HK must. This was a great way to see HK. The boat ride was fun. The view was awesome. You really can't go wrong with this activity.

Pleasant hour on the water. This is a good way to see the shoreline around some of the key areas of HK. The commentary is in Chinese & English and you get a drink and snack as part of the ticket price. Pretty good value overall.

Straight and to the point. This ferry is a no frills affair! You pay HKD2.50 during the week and HKD3.40 or thereabout on the weekend to use the ferry, Be sure to have coins for the token machine and be prepared to just walk on board, have them raise the 'gangplank'and zip across to the other side in about 10-15 minutes, It's a no frills affair but is entirely suitable for its purpose.

Should be Mandatory for any Tourist !. We were only in Hong Kong for a few short days but loved every minute of it. One of the iconic tourist experiences we were told we had to do was take the Star Ferry to/from Kowloon to Central on Hong Kong Island. It was a fantastic trip, used the metro card. People who were apparently locals seemed to be taking in the views as much as we were!

Amazing. Another (along with the Hong Kong island tram) quintessential Hong Kong experience that is inexpensive and easy. The ferry boats are right out of history and you can easily imagine what is was like to have these as the primary mode of travel 50 years ago. A must do, and dirt cheap.
A HONG KONG MUST DO. Such a simple pleasure to do whilst in Hong Kong ! Cheap and quick transit from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island

A Great and Cheap Way to Get the Best Views of Hong Kong and Kowloon. Just take one of the historic Star Ferries for the short ride between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon or vice Versa, you get the best photo opportunities ever for peanuts.
Ferry to Macau. We used the Star Ferry to & Fro Macau and it was great !. The location was easily accessible and instructions were clear how to reach the venue

Cheap and great harbor view to cross between Kowloon and HK Island.. I always like the Starr Ferry trip, I never go bored about it. The lower deck is HKD2.70 per trip, and the upper deck is HKD3.40. The lower deck is more dynamic, and you see how the sailors work to pull the ferry towards the harbor. The upper desk is quiet, plenty of seats, more stable. I like the lower desk better when I am not too tired to stand. The Starr Ferry harbor once you docked at Kowloon is just amazing. If I am not in hurry, I don't mind sitting there for hours. The night view is pretty excellent, but most of the time it is crowded.

Not to be missed. A journey on the Star Ferry, or 'Stir Fry' as it's affectionately known,is not to be missed. It's always packed with people going about their daily lives, as well as throngs of tourists. You get a real feel for just how busy the harbour is when travelling on the Star Ferry.
A must do, relaxing trip across the water. You should do this at least once, go during day and night to get different views. Probably one of the best value attractions in the city.

Cheap and great way to see the harbor. We rode the Star Ferry a couple of times since our toddler loved it. It's a really great way to see the harbor and it's relatively inexpensive. I think each ride would have costed us a dollar. This would be really worth the time and since it departs regularly, there isn't a long queue or anything. Highly recommended!
Always fun! And cheap!. A must if you are in HK and want to get from one side of the harbor to the other! The Star Ferry is an icon in Hong Kong and the quickest way to avoid traffic.

A good cheap way to see Hong Kongs skyline. Definitely worth doing but as we did this in August of a nighttime, just felt like a big puddle of perspiration upon arrival on the other side! Can only catch the ferry one way before disembarking and then I presume, lining up to get another ticket to return on the ferry if that is your plan.
Hong Kong water view. Hong Kong, as was, as is, and ,,, as the skyline changes ever constantly, and the harbor becomes modern, water way narrower, hopefully something will stay the same.
A must. You need to try this and I still think this is the only kind of its own in the world. Buy a 1 class ticket and closed your eye and think back in the time under the english
A must. The fare is very cheap. The boats seem old and left over from colonial days. After walking too far we did also try the harbour tour. Not as good as the one in Shanghai but still worth a trip.

Short and sweet. The trip is nice, but coming from a sea nation, we are used to boat trips. What's special about this one is the view of the Hong Kong skyline. You can probably get better photos if you take them from the Tsim Sha Tsui promenade though.

Cheap and Nice view of waterfront. This is the cheapest transportation mode between HK island and Kowloon @ $2.5. Departures are at regular intervals from both the sides and it provides one of the best vistas of the HK waterfront at night. Otherwise the boats are very basic and there is a perpetual stench of oil.

Super quick amazing views and we didn't end up paying a penny. The ferry came super quick its so cheap literally pennies, the gate was open and we walked through not knowing we had not paid until we got straight on, sorry we will pay tomorrow. Great views well worth the trip.

It's a must!. Cheap way to get to HK island from New Territories at 2hkd, I believe. Also a good way to go sight seeing, you'll see the buildings used for the light show from The Avenue of Stars at night.

Easiest way to cross the harbor. The Star Ferry is not only a great tourist attraction, it is also a cheap and easy way to get from Kowloon to HKG. I used the ferry about 6 times in one week to travel across the harbor from my hotel in Kowloon to HKG. I never waited more than 5 minutes to board and it costs only approximately $0.45US. Most of the reviews focus on the views and what a great experience the Star Ferry is. I agree completely but thought that the reviews needed to mention that it is also a great means of transportation with a beautiful view and nominal price. Some say to do the Star Ferry at least once when in HKG. I say use it as much as possible. Why drive though a tunnel when you can ride a boat across the water for nearly no money?

Star Ferries. One of life's highlights and well worth the experience and views that are provided by the various crossings. All available using the Octopus card and a very reasonably priced way to cross the harbour in both daylight and night time.It does shut quite early in the evening with the last ferry about 23:30.
One of hong kong traditional transportation. Tried ferry crossing from kowloon to wan chai. You can pay the ferry ticket buy octopus card. And enjoy the view.

Cheap views. It doesn't get used much nowadays as the MTR gets you over quicker and it's straight to a station but it's still nice for first timers. Having been quite a few times and it has been relocated we have fond memories of the old jetty and walkways but typical HK there one day gone the next but still enjoyable for the few extra cents go by the top deck it's less smelly from the diesel fumes.The only down side when you step out from the Kowloon side is the hawkers trying to sell you anything from a suit to watches to anything they are peddling.

A great place to view the harbour or see the extent of the pollution!. A great way to cross a famous harbour, so convenient, the best way to get across! A great view if you can see it, nice on a clear day, but unfortunately there aren't too any of those.

Best way between Kowloon and HK Island, fast/cheap/scenic. It's a quick trip and for ~$3.50HKD (you can use your MTA/Airport Express Octopus card) you get a nice fast ride with lots of window seats for photo ops of the skylines. On a Saturday night traveling over to the Clock Tower to see the 8 pm city lights show (nice but underwhelming) there were scant crowds on the ferry, windows were open, and views were great.

It has to be done! . Our hotel was minutes from the Star Ferry Terminal at Tsim Sha Tsui so we went back and forth to Central several times a day but even if you're in a location where it's more convenient to use the MTR you must try the Star Ferry at least once. It's an iconic piece of Hong Kong history and the lovely views across the harbour make it a must do activity. It's cheap, it's frequent, the perfect and picturesque public transport. We also did the hour long harbour tour on the ferry which I would recommend.

Don't miss (on a sunny day). If you are visiting HK, do not miss this iconic transport between New territories and HK island. It is slow but great (take pictures or just sit and enjoy) and for 2.5 HKD very cheap. MTR is of course faster, but this old lady has some charisma...
Excellent view of Hong Kong, go to Tsim Sha Tsui.. The Star Ferry is a nice way to get great photo's of Hong Kong! It is a very clean and relaxing mode of transportation. Our children loved it!

Cheap and amazing view. The best way to cross the harbour. Scenic. But if you arena tourist just take the one to central because if you go to wan chai and the convention center you arte stuck in the business area. Not worth!
Short but sweet. This ride is a must when you visit Hong Kong. It's cheap, it's short and worth wile as it gets you from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island.

A must on every trip.. A visit to HK isn't complete until you've sailed on the Star Ferry. This historic ferry system would cost the earth anywhere else but here it will only be about 25p. I know it only takes a few minutes but darting between the shipping in Victoria Harbour is a thrill of it's own.
good ferry. i go there from tsim sha tsui to central, it is another ways to see hongkong, go there at night for better views.

Worth one try. Despite this being the cheapest possibly way to transfer between Kowloon and the HK island, i would recommend it only as an attraction, given the old charm that it bears. Otherwise the MTR is the best means of travel within HK.

Little Delusion. We took the ferry from Victoria Harbon in Hong Kong Island to Tsim Sha Tsui in the evening to see the light show buildings but the ferry is not open upstair so you can see few and the trip is so short, so maybe not so intresting

Nice Views of Hong Kong at Dusk. Old Ferries used as public transport by locals and a fun trip for tourists. Good views especially at dusk. Ferry itself is not unusual for me as I live in a harbour city but it would be a very much - must do - if you haven't been on a harbour or a boat before

A little disappointing. An hour's trip which could have been done a little quicker. Obviously stunning views of the harbour and there was a commentary but when you sit outside you have no point of reference so for actually no what she's talking about when she is identifying buildings!
Best $2.50hkd. The star ferry is quick and easy. Not really possible if you're in a wheelchair. Really good view of the city on both sides and for 50c australian (2.50$hkd), it was a bargain!

Still going after all these years. When we first moved to HKG 31 years ago the journey almost twice as far, but with all the reclamation so nice the island it has reduced to a few minutes. It is still the best way to see the harbour at the price. Take the Wanchai ferry for a longer journey.
Camera moment!. Great way to visit Kowloon. Camera is a must, the views tremendous and costs next to nothing. Great indeed.

Trip to the island. This is the best and cheapest way to visit the Island of Hong Kong.The ferry is ancient which adds to the fun. For the locals it is probably a bore but for tourists on their way to the Island or the Peak it adds to the fun.

Probably the most famous ferry in the world. . .. You just can't visit Hong Kong and not cross Victoria Harbor on a Star Ferry! Unparallelled views from onboard of both the Hong Kong and Kowloon skylines, plus it's safe, fast, and cheap. There are also other private ferries that offer harbor cruises with snacks, drinks, even meals, but you're going for the trip and the view, not the party, right? There is also a subway route under the Harbor, but that has absolutely no character or charm, so unless the weather is typhoon-like on the surface, don't use it. The Star Ferry Company goes all the way back to the 1890's, and was founded by an East Indian businessman. From it's very beginning, all Star ferries have been built with both bow and stern having the same shape, allowing the boats to move in either direction.

Fun perspective to see HK. This is a must while visiting HK.
Cheap attraction and good way to see some old major transportation between main land and HK island.
Amazing and fun. Well worth it had a fun time :) was quick and easy way to cross back and forth to Hong Kong and see sights while on the water

Quick, Historic, Full of Character, and Inexpensive. A wonderful treat.. I was in town for a week to attend trade fairs, and I intentionally stay on the Kowloon side of the harbour away from the Conference center because I like the shopping and I _REALLY_ enjoy the commute across the bay in the Ferry. Top deck or lower deck - both are splendid. My only complaint is they've painted one ferry from the traditional green & white to a garish multicolored design. Hopefully, it's just temporary.If nothing else, it's a splendid quick tourist attraction that must be seen by anybody going to Hong Kong harbour.
Best in the evening. The ferry affords a great perspective on HK Island. The view in the evening with the skyline lit up is especially beautiful and striking. During the day, not so much.

Economical way of crossing over to Hongkong side. Excellent way of criss crossing between HKG and Kowloon side. Great views on both upper and lower decks. The prices are extremely cheap compared to MTR, Octopus cards also accepted. used it for 2-3 times during my 4 day stay.Night times offer good view of both sides of the harbour especially the Sky 100 building.

Cheaper than water :). Actually you expect digital screens and high tech vehicles everywhere.. Despite of that, STRFERRY gives you the soul of HongKong..First of all, it's the cheapest way to go across to the other side, and also the fastest one becauseyou do not have to go down with many stairs and up back.. Amazing view is also fee..If we consider a (cheapest) bottle of water is 6-7 HKD, Star Ferry definitely cheaper than water :)
Must do in Hong Kong.. No visit to Hong Kong is complete without a trip on the Star Ferry. Best views of both the City and Kowloon. And CHEAP!!
Cheapest way to get from Kowloon to Central. Its sometimes a Hassle to use the Ferry services, but its so cheap and reliable that it is worth it!

Wonderful way to cross the harbour. Star Ferry is a fantastic way to cross the harbour between HK island and Kowloon. The ferry is very economical compared to the MTR which costs nearly 4 to 5 times as much for the same journey. However, the ferry does take longer.It would be best to view the HK skyline by hopping onto a ferry. The ferries also ply to the outer islands such as Lamma and Lantau and a few others. Do note that the ferry terminal for internal ferries is different from the centre that takes you to Macau.

What a busy place! . we went over to kwowloon a couple of times and thoroughly enjoyed using the star ferry from wanchai. 3 dollars 40 at the weekend and 2 dollars 50 during the week. beautiful at night and very efficient and on time. the staff know their stuff! rush hour is a bit exciting! so avoid unless daring. don't forget to check the time of the last ferry. good way of using up those coins. don't make the mistake of going to the wrong pier on the way back. ...it is a long walk!
GREAT RIDE. Travelling across to Hong Kong and back on the Star Ferry is an excellent way to see the sights both in Kowloon and on the Island it offers great opportunities to take some great pictures

Great ride. Must take ride .We can enjoy our boat trip from Hk island back to kowloon.Its very cheap and you will enjoy all the great views.It is very nice and fun to take photos
from the ferry.

excellent. You cant miss a trip on the famous star ferry. Cheap as chips the max I paid one way was 3 HKD (about 25p UK!). The views and experience are not to be missed, both day and night. Don't forget to try both decks, on the lower deck you can see a little of the engines, better view of docking etc. It only takes a few minutes to cross from TST to Central

Star Ferry a must do!!. We have visited HK many times and anyone visiting HK should always experience the short trip across the harbour on the Star Ferry. long may it continue to be there an fantastic tourist attraction
Cheap option to travel to Central. Short trip from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island was so cheap and more interesting than travelling in the tunnel
cheap as chips. fare 25p each way, used it all the time to get from Hong Kong island to mainland, runs frequently about every 15 mins or so
The ferries. Cheap and fast transport. Great to be on the water. Better to take the ferry than train accros to main island, cheaper.
Great for a budget travelers. Highly recommended both on nights and days! Must-see!! It's very cheap and you'll enjoy all the great views.

Cheap way to discovdr. We have enjoyed our boat trip from HK Island back to kowloon. A nice trip for 15min and we were at the evening so we have seen the lighted skyline, very nice! Its cheap and fun!

Not a fancy boat, but great ride across the Bay. You can get help figuring out how to pay with HK money. Very quick walk down the gangplank and stay seated until the boat docks. Fun to take photos from the ferry.

Must do while in Hong Kong. This iconic ferry is a must do experience while in HK. The boats dates back to the late 1800's. the views are amazing, the boats are so cool with old wooden floors and reversible benches. All this for about US$0.35 cents !!

When in Hong Kong, you must ride the ferry. We rode the ferry to cross the harbor and also to enjoy the beautiful view along the way. Easy to access with the Octopus card and a quick and easy mode of transportation.

Best way to see Victoria Harbour. The Star Ferry gives you the real experience to view Victoria Harbour. Very cheap, only about 2:50 HK for the lower deck and 3:50 HK (20p / 30p Sterling), for the upper deck which is recommended as you get a better breeze and further away from the engine noise.There is surely no need to pay for a Victoria Harbour tour boat when you can soak up an atmospheric and memorable journey like this so cheaply. Just go back and forward using the Star Ferry every time you cross the harbour. Daytime and evening crossings both have the different aspects of the harbour.Highly recommended.
Star ferry. Great way to travel between the islands. be aware you pay more to sit upstairs. Seems like a very Chinese experience, thoroughly recommend it.

With the eyes of a kid. It is with the eyes of the 6 years old kid who travelled to Venice and spend hours on the "vaporetto", a local ferry on the Venice lagoon, watching through the porthole of the engine room oblivious of the incredible panorama outside absorbed in mystic contemplation of the comfortingly large naval engine propelling the old vessel, that one day by accident I boarded the lower deck of star Ferries and across Victoria harbour I discovered in the middle of the deck on that vessel from other ages a porthole open on a little magic mosaic of my childhood: the throbbing engine, the smell of machinery and fresh painting, the overwhelming heat and the ring of the command bell to mark the changes of the calm and powerful heartbeat. Since that time my crossing in Hong Kong have become trips on a time machine, in a suspended atmosphere enclosed by the breathtaking landscapes of the southern pearl, surrounded by discrete presences of old seamen, really creatures from myths of the southern seas, and lulled by the old wood made alive by the benign sea giant of my child dreams in the engine room.Take lower deck next time you board Star Ferry ;-)
Enjoyable. Took the ferry from Kowloon to central at night ,included on the metro ticket. Night lights beautiful. Ferry clean and comfy easy to get a good seat
great ride.. If possible time your ride after dark, the city lights up in wondrous ways. It will be a unforgettable ride, bring a camera!
Cheap and amazing. The price for the ferry ride is cheap and provide an alternative route to MTR and bus. The view is amazing and stress free too.

Best Harbour views anywhere in the world.. And the most economic way of seeing the skyline in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is the history of Hong Kong captured in one place. The boats all have their own personalities and regularly chug back and forward between Central, Tsim Sha Tsui (Kowloon) and Wanchai all day and late into the evening. If you want to see the harbor (the very essence of Hong Kong), the skyline and avoid shopping malls for a few minutes then the Star Ferry is ideal.

Very busy. This is s good form of transport to get photos from either side of the island. We did have some difficulty with the ticket machines and caused a long queue. It felt very safe but wasn't our favourite way of transport in Hong Kong.

Another great way of seeing the skyline. Crossing from Hong Kong Island to Tsim Sha Tsui or visa versa thru the ferry is a lot more iconic and beautiful than getting on ferry or a bus, albeit it is slower. But at a very cheap fare (no more than 5 HKD), I think this transportation mode is such a steal. Day and night views are both good, too.

Boat ride and wonderful views.. THE Star Ferry is definitely a must do attraction. Theres a ticket you gotta purchase but takes you back and for on where you need to be. When you go from side to the other normally the kowloon side you will be able to visit the shopping malls and be on the side of the famous Peninsula Hotel. It is a beautiful boat ride during sunset and I encourage you all to do so, you won't be disappointed.

Cheap,cheap,cheap!!!. For just $2.50HK you can ride the Star Ferry across Victoria Harbour. The ferries run very regularly and the embarkation and disembarkation process is simple and quick. Enjoy the views and get some close up shots of the old junks sailing on the harbour. If you time it right you can get some amazing "sunset" photos from the ferry. Use it as an alternative method from the MRT to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island.
Cheapest ferrry ride ever. You get great views of both Hong Kong island and Tsim Sha Tsui and for HK$2.50 (22p) second class or HK$3.40 (29p) first class it is the best value crossing of the harbour.

Surely cheap but it's amazing. One of the ways to go to one island to another is by using Star Ferry. Sure, you can use MTR or bus if you want, but I recommend taking the Star Ferry and get the experience! You can feel the fresh air and enjoy the sea for only around HKD 2.50. I took the Star Ferry from Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Shui and it was awesome.
Good tour of the harbour. We did the 1hr tour which was great as it wasn't too long for the kids. Great views of the skyline and not too expensive.
Part of the experience. A must for fresh air, good harbour views, HK ambience and to get to Kowloon. Very cheap experience - have a look around both ferry piers for more

Just a form of transport. The ferry is made it to be an attraction where I found it to be just a form of transportation. Only cost $2.50 and I enjoyed the ride. Nice way to get across to Kowloon instead of subway

Great mode to Kolwoon. This is a great way to travel to, from Hong Kong Island, it was fairly clean and not very packed and a great way to see the skyline from the water. Pretty quick method of transportation, no complaints

Trip across the harbor to Kowloon. Very inexpensive way to see the harbor and to visit Kowloon. Easy to access and has very convenient hours. Recommend the top deck for the best views of the harbor as you cross.

Who woudn't like a boat ride. with great views on either side of the waters. There is good bus connectivity on ferry terminals. There is lower deck and then the upper deck which is only marginally higher priced for muffling the noise of the engines and sitting a couple of meters above. If you are lugging luggage or with a baby stroller, you can walk into the lower deck with far more ease than to the upper deck. You will have stairs both sides of the ferry if you opt the upper deck.
Fun way to skim across the harbor and see the skyline. Join the Hong Kong locals as well as tourists. A quick, fun way to see the sites and to move from Central to other parts of this famed city.
Efficient service. The Star Ferry gets you across from one side of the island to the other very quickly and efficiently.

Star Ferry is the best ride to enjoy the Victoria Harbour. Star Ferry is a historic transport across the Victoria Harbour. You can view both sides of the Harbour in a good pace. Best time of ride is the sunset time.

Short but Fun Ride. This is also a must do to do while staying in Hong Kong. The ferry ride is short but a mice view to get a different perspective of the city landscape. It is very easy, and inexpensive, to purchase a ticket.
Peaceful way to travel. If you do the Hop-On-Hop-Off bus tour you get the ferry transfers included. It's a great way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island!
Good crossing. This is a nice way to cross from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. It is quite fast and a smooth trip. You can use your Octopus Card. Better than the train or bus.

A bit of real Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is an institution in Hong Kong it is so good to see them still operating as a regular ferry service between Kowloon and Hong Kong island, sturdy old boats, cheap as chips and very friendly staff who obviously love their jobs in this giant, glass towered and mostly unfriendly city. Who needs a harbour cruise for $20 with jaded old tour guides when you have Star Ferries.
Fun way to see the sites. Best Deal to enjoy the skyline at night on a budget. They go back and forth all day long. Nice way o catch a breeze
The best thing ever!. Star Ferry ist the best way (not the fastest) to cross Victoria. Do it at night, sit on the left side (from Kowloon to HK Island) and enjoy the great view.
Great views and lovely experience. This is a fun night activity you can do with friends and family when in Hong Kong. Gives you a nice view of the sky line
Great views and great for seeing the light show at night. I love catching the ferry at night to see the light show no matter which side you catch it from there is always lots to see.

Nice for a change, but inconvenient for most. When people come to visit I always take them on the ferry once, but never more than that! The MTR is just way more convenient, but the views are top notch

Cheap way to enjoy the Victoria Harbour. I go for river cruises when I travel to other cities. But in HK, no one need to take an expensive cruise. Simply take the star ferry which costs you only US$0.5 per trip to go between HK Island & Kowloon peninsular. The ride gives you fabulous view of the harbour and the city.

One Of My Most Favourite Thing To Do In Hong Kong. No matter how many times I go to Hong Kong I still love to take a ride on the Star Ferry over to Kowloon it is one of my most favourite things to do in Hong Kong. It is fast and very efficient way to get there and is the most scenic and a must for everybody visiting this great city.

MUST DO !!. Star Ferry is a cheap and good way to see HK. Try to do it at night (even better with a clear night). I would say it is the best way to see HK night view and it is so stunning. You can even take the ride for a few times (as it is so cheap and each ride only last for 10-15 mins).Don't miss it.
Take at night from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Enjoy a 20 minute ride from Kowloon to Hong Kong after dark. It costs pennies..... or should that be a few HK dollars !

Fast and efficient and still very cheap. The Star Ferry continues to ply between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. The service is fast and efficient and a "must do" whilst in Hong Kong. There are two decks, lower and upper. The lower deck has a cheaper fare if you are short of cash!
An experience! . Old , uncomfortable, noisy, rickety, and unmissable! You haven't done Hong Kong if you don't do the star ferry!

Fantastic way to get to Tsim Sha Tsui!. The Star Ferry is a Hong Kong institution, costs absolute peanuts and is a really exciting way of seeing the harbour- it's also a really quick way of getting across the water! I won't say that this is something you should specifically seek out to do in HK because it's over and done with so quickly, but if you ever need to get from one side to the other you should definitely hitch a lift of the Star Ferry! Great to take visitors on too!

Meh. This attraction is pretty gimmicky and overpriced. I'd say most would feel slightly happy or neutral after having seen it. You wouldn't severely regret going, in other words. Having said that, if you like river cruises I would recommend something like a river cruise on the Huangpu river in Shanghai. It is a beautiful ride and a much more natural experience. I've done it three times and have yet to become bored with it.

Great way to see the river views. Great way to see the river views. The views are spectacular during the night because of all the neons. Should experience both ways. Very pleasant way to get to and from Hong Kong island.

Old Hong Kong. This is a must when you visit Hong Kong. Every time we visit we just have to have at least one trip over on the ferry. It's such an institution and has been around for such a long time you just should not miss it.

Synonymous with Hong Kong. You cannot say that you've been in Hong Kong without riding on the Star Ferry! This is a must visit attraction for Tourists as you will feel the vibe of day-to-day living in Hong Kong.

An experience for all ages...... Use the star ferry any time of day - experience for both young and old...sit on upper deck and by the windows for best views. Use the oyster card (MTR) for your payment....nicest way but not quickest to go from HK island to Kowloon.

Fantastic in either direction day or night.. Take the Star Ferry from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon across Victoria Harbour and enjoy fantastic views for a few HK$ , you will not be dissapointed day or night, fantastic in either direction . Travel on the top deck for best views.

Atraction you cannot miss. Star Ferry is running between Hong Kong Island and Kowaloon. Better than any metro and takes about 15 minutes to cross. You should take the Ferry just for the view.There are also Star Ferry harbor tour.

For that special HK moment. Take the lower deck level. Polished wood and cliché like vent outlets lend this trip a bit of 'how HK used to be'- better. The ferrymen display levity- they even call you sir. Now that's something you won't find upstairs.

Star Ferry service Victoria Harbour Hong Kong. Hong Kong is known for its Victoria Harbour and backdrop of skyscrapers to the south on HK Island. The Star Ferry, also iconic to HK has been carrying passengers across the harbour since the 1880s. It is a great & inexpensive trip for visitors to HK who want a leisurely journey to either side. It is picturesque and slow enough to take ample photographs.However for regular commuters, this service has unfortunately declined over the past 10 years and this is especially evident in the berthing where once it was extremely fast and efficient, now the process is painfully slow and erratic. This is a pity for an attraction that shows off Hong Kong at its best.

Cheap thrill. For only $2 / $2.50 for a ride across the water it is well worth it. Quite peaceful good views towards central. Quite peaceful infact.Terminal easy to navigate and not a long wait to get on. Tip: go For upper deck -better views and no smell of engine fumes.
Ferry Ride. this is the best way and cheapest way to get over to the Island they have soon old ferry's that they use then get a bus to Victoria peak.
Icon of HK. Haven't been to Hong Kong if you haven't jumped on the star ferry absolute icon. The price to ride very cheap great way to get different perspective of harbour lights at night.
Lugard Road. Take the walk around the Peak on Lugard road. The views are better than the viewing area, and no extra cost.

my favourite way of traveling in HK. Have used it numerous times to cross the harbour - and still every time I think it is over too quickly. So cheap as well! Don't miss it if you are here on holiday!

Five minutes out of the rush. The Star Ferry is a very pleasant way of crossing the harbour, away from the rush of Hong Kong. The fare is very reasonable indeed comparing well with other modes of transport. Bring your camera.

Must see and visit icon of Hong Kong. The star ferry is besides the Tram and the Peak Tram one of the longest existing means of travel in Hong Kong. Whether at night or during the day always stunning views of the harbour and the skyline. First ferry around 6.30 a.m. and last one around 11.20 pmWhether sitting upstairs or downstairs it does not matter, but choose before boarding because the floors are not connected. And there is a one hour star ferry Barbour cruise with two options as far as I can recall. Nice to seethe Barbour from the partly open roof/deck.

A short but iconic trip. Catching the ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central or vice versa is time honored tradition for both locals and tourists alike. If you have an octopus card - the amazing stored value card that lets you ride all public transport and even purchase food and other items with the tap of your card - then the trip is easy. Just turn up at the ferry pier at any time as the ferries run constantly. If there is not one there then you can see it coming across the water. Tap your card at the entrance - there are also coin machines and a ticket window available - and on you go. For small change you can enjoy one of the best views of Hong Kong with a pleasant breeze even on the hottest days.

The Old Star Ferry. My husband had been to Hong Kong 30 years before and he remembered the Ferry exactly as it was in 2015. So quick and ferries going all the time. Historic and picturesque way to get to the city.

My favorite thing in HK. I have travelled on the Star Ferry so many times over the past few years, both with visitors and on my own. It remains, for me, the no.1 thing to do in Hong Kong. Sit downstairs, enjoy the unbelievable scenery, take in the vintage sailor costumes, the thick ropes, the closeness of the water, soak it all up! Do it day and night. Just don't miss it!
Great transportation and cheap. These ferries run very regular and to time very cheap and a very easy way to get from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon easily
Travel back in time. From the pier to the crossing itself, this is like travelling back in time. I use this transport method whenever I can when visiting HK.

Slow cruise around the harbour. We took the ferry for a trip around the harbour to see the sites of the city. The trip was what you would expect, fairly basic, with minimal comfort and even less food and drink. It was a way of filling in a wet afternoon.

Best harbour view.. and cheapest!. Taking the Star Ferry really should be mandatory for all visitors to HKG. I lived there three years and took it as often as I could. It's an amazing view, day or night, ridiculously cheap (use your Octopus card), and a way to slow down and get a glimpse of old Hong Kong. Especially recommended at Christmas time when the harbor is lit up with 80 foot tall neon Santas! And even if you're not looking to go to Kowloon (or the reverse): take the ferry and just... don't get off. Stay on the ferry when it docks and it will turn around and take you back where you started.
Star Ferry. We took a Star Ferry for viewing the Symphony of Lights show. It's an average show. Can give it a miss.

Different experience during day & night. An old fashion romantic way of getting from Tsim Sha Tsui to Hong Kong Island.Just a few short minutes minutes to get to either side, but a nice way to see Hong Kong.Different experience when taking the ferry during day and night.A good deal just for HKD2.50 - HKD3.40 (adult) and HKD1.50 - HKD2.10 (child).
Must Ride. No words to describe, a short ride between Central and Tsimshatsui, no matter it is a morning or evening ride, give it a go, just experience it !

Do this when you come to HK. It is one of Hong Kong's main attractions and this is something that you have to go to when you come here, it has a really local feeling although it has been modified a lot since the past

Cheap and cheerful. You have to do a trip from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central or vice versa, to appreciate the beauty of Hong Kong. You can use your Octopus Card and costs less than $1AU. Be sure to purchase an Octopus Card on arrival to HK they are usable on trains, buses,ferries, McDonalds,7/11 etc. you just cash them back in when you leave.
Not to be missed.. The best, and one of the cheapest, activity in Hong Kong. Sit back and enjoy the sights and smells of Hong Kong.

A must do thing for your first visit to Hong Kong!. Old, smelly, uncomfortable seats, steep ramps and wonderful!! This one of the remaining attractions to the old Hong Kong. It hasn't changed forever and if you visit Hong Kong and don't ride it....you have missed a great experience. Even if you don't want to get to the other side, ride it over and then right back again...and don't forget to take some pictures of you and family inside the ship. Enjoy!

Very cheap and convenient !!. The star ferries are a great way to cross Hong Kong harbour, they are exceptionally cheap and they leave very frequently. The ride over is comfortable with seating and only takes a few minutes whilst allowing you to take in the breathtaking views of the harbour. Worth it even if you just go over and come back !!

Quick, efficient way to cross over.. If in Hong Kong, the star Ferry is s must to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong. It runs regularly, boards and unloads quickly and is very inexpensive. Nothing fancy but very efficient.

Star Ferry. By using the Star Ferry I fell like in the old times of HKG. Everything becomes more modern but using this old Ferry gives you a fantastic view onto the skyline of HKG. During the normal business hours they go very 5 minutes without a fixed timetable. A single ride costs 2,5 HKG $.

Lovely Star Ferry. We used the ferry twice day and night , the views are fantastic we took lots of photos. It is very efficient and very cheap , it is only a short trip but we all loved it , must do while in Hong Kong.
A must!. Even if you don't have to cross the Victoria bay, take a ride on the ferry, especially at night time, when the city is lighted. Very beautiful!
fantastic value. These ferry's are fantastic for a trip to either side costing around seventy pence one way. There are several ferry's going across to different locations.
nice view. nice place and view , near by the shopping mall , and museume of hk , good place to take picture in hong kong

A must attraction in Hong Kong. This remains one of the best bargains in Hong Kong. You can choose to travel on either the upper or lower deck, the lower deck being slightly cheaper but at only about 30 pence a ride, it is a superb bargain. On the upper deck there is a section that is air conditioned which is great on hot and humid days. The ferries go about every 10 minutes so you never have long to wait. The best way to get around on public transport in Hong Kong is to buy an Octopus card. It works similar to the Oyster card for public transport in London. You pay a 50 HK$ charge for the card and 41$ of which is refundable (along with any top up value remaining on the card) when you surrender it for refund at the end of your holiday. You can buy the cards at the Customer Service desks in the MTR stations.

Great way to appreciate Hong Kong. Frequent services and cheap to travel on - only HK 2,50 for the upper deck Really worth doing as you get to see the buildings and skyline in perspectiveDid not have time to do the return trip at night - a must for next time

Romantic old school must !. Sadly it has become a short trip now but still an old HK favourite ! Romantic old ferries still plough up and down all day , worth the journey as it takes you back in time. When in TST there are many things to go and see in clouding the heritage site and space museum and the walk along the harbour before coming back by ferry to HK island !

Lovely views of Hong Kong skyline . The Star Ferry was on our list for most of our holiday and I regret that we only got to do it on our second last day. Unlike the MTR the trip is a bit longer if you take into account the walk from the station to the pier, but the views were breathtaking both at night and during the day. The photo opportunities are endless and it was a great treat for my children.Like most things in Hong Kong it is a very efficient and we'll run operation.

Star Ferry a great way to get from TST to Central. Every visitor to Hong Kong should take at least one journey on the Star Ferry. You get fantastic views of the city and Victoria Harbor. Star Ferry is easy to use and very inexpensive, easier still with an Octopus Card.
Star Ferry, cheap and easy access between the islands. A great way to get across between the two islands. Cheap & easy and use, much better than the train.
Great harbor trip. This is a great way to see Hong Kong from the harbor. Boats leave very frequently and you have a choice of the upper or lower deck. Weather permitting, upper deck is great

The charm of Hong Kong..especially by night. If you come to Hong Kong and you do not have a chance to cross the Victoria Harbour with this legend ferry, you have not been in HK yet.I used to live in HK and the traveling back and forth vs. Kowloon and HK was real good memories! You can walk along the promenade on the Kowloon side and reach Tsimstsui.Been back again and again, I MUST go there and cross this ferry everytime. PS. buy Octopus card for traveling in HK. It is very convenient!!!
Fun and Practical. they have frequent schedule connecting HK and Kowloon with beautiful views along the way. Love it a lot riding on it, especially at night.

How is this a "must do"?. I Don't really understand why this is a must do in every guide book we looked at. It is just an old ferry taking you from one side to another. The view is great, but the ferry is nothing special.

Hong Kong Institution. No visit to Hong Kong would be complete with a trip on the star ferry.6HKG each way - bargain.You never have to wait long until the next departure. Grab a seat by the sides for the best views of the harbour and skyline.

Well worth while. This reminded me a little of the Sydney harbour ferry trip...Our octopus ticket got us on the ferry too. You can even pay at some restaurants with it.The ferry is a great way to have a quick trip across the harbour and take in the sights. Highly recommended.
Love Star Ferry of Hong Kong!. The best ,classic way to go from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon size,and viceversa. need to do this at least one time or more !! good to take pictures at nigth..!
fun way to see the skyline. These are about the easiest way to make it across the Harbor. It doesn't hurt that the views are amazing and the ferry is very cheap.
nothing special. efficient but nothing special, can take MTR which is quicker and most likely closer to your hotel rather than getting to the dock

Take a boat ride. A great way to get a feel for the City without the hassles of traffic--great value for money--access to both HK and Kowloon streets and shopping--a real insight into the business side and activities of Hong Kong
Star Ferry September 2015. Excellent ferry service that is so cheap, 2.5$ and provides the best views you can imagine for such low cost.
Hong Kong view from the bay. Great views of Hong Kong and very cheap, again use early in the morning before it gets too busy. On arrival head for the Heritage site well worth a visit

Get the full harbour tour. The Star Ferry is great. However, one of the the boats is modified (you and stand in the open on the rear deck) and leaves from pier 9 and does a 1 hour tour of the whole harbour for just 90 HKD! I was flabbergasted that it was so cheap (same thing on the Thames would be about £30) and gave truly awesome views of all of Hong Kong. It doesn't seem to be well known so you have to hunt out the ticket place near the Maritime Museum. I think the first ferry departs for the Island at 12:15pm. They also do two evening cruises around 6:30 and 9pm (roughly) at a cost of c.180HKD. You get a free soft drink included - bonus!

The first thing to do after checking into your hotel. Be part of history when riding this ferry. Splurge and go First class, i.e., riding the top deck. Prices haven't gone up over the decades; its only $.25The ride gets you back and forth HK and Kowloon
Hey Macau !!. great service ..... best thing is on time services ....... neat and clean ferry to travel to and fro macau
Great way to get around. This is a great way to get from Kowloon to Victoria island and so inexpensive. The ferry runs every few minutes so if miss the first one it only a short wait until the next.
Must go icon in Hong Kong. Obviously, there is no better thing to take an economic and comfortable ferry ride across Victoria Harbour during the sunset or at night to enjoy the magnificent views.
Great connector - Star Ferry.. Just go upper deck for 2.5 HK Dollars. Watch out - the benches are convertible. At night it is a cheap, impressive boat trip. Enjoy your ride.

Tourist Must-Do: Will Help you Orient Yourself Pun Intended. I think this is the most basic tourist touchstone in HK: If you don't do it your friends who have been here will look at you funny. It's a nice ride around the harbor, about an hour in duration, for a cost of about $15. The fare includes a soda and some actually pretty good cookies.
Cheap!. Although the price increased by pennies, it's a great way to get to and from both islands for super cheap vs the subway or bus or ding ding.

great place to vist. we went to discovery bay which was a 25 min away which boats come very close to each other rather scarey it has its on man made beach there are 2 free trips to do or you can just relax on the beach and see hong kong and the flights come in there is a mcdonalds there if you like or they is plenty of restaurants to choose from which sell beer ooo by the way its only around £8 return for 2 adults so its a great day out
Another 'must do' in Hong Kong. Great fun--run very frequently,cheap and the best way of crossing over the water between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.

Love it. We took the ferry for 2 nights everytime going back frm hong kong to.hong kong island. Its cheap and efficient. And a short ferry trip.It will stop at central and u can continue ur mtr journey after that.Use octopus card for ur comvenience.
Fantastic ride. The visitors to Hong Kong must not miss it. A beautiful ride with more beautiful views of the Hong Kong sky line.
Ride the Star Ferry. For the greatest fun this is the ONLY way to cross the harbour !!! Mingle with the locals and arrive on either side in the midst of shopping heaven, and it is cheap as chips !!!!
Historical gem. Very economical way of getting across the city with an amazing view! I would definitely recommend travelling at least one direction from HK to Kowloon

Historical transport..........a must do.. A brilliant experience.........a must do when in Hong Kong. For a few 'pence' you are transported across one of the most famous stretches of water in the world. The ferries run non stop and are busy most of the time. Can't advise on best time to travel but must try both daytime and nighttime crossing.
Cheap and authentic. A cheap and authentic way to see the Hong Kong habour! I stayed in Kowloon so used it instead of using the subway.

Good memories. Always enjoy to travel on ferry than MTR when we go other side of the harbour.
New ferry terminal with bit far than the old one and the distance of thr harbour seems shorter due to land reclaiming.
Highly recommend the visitors should try when you are in Hong Kong.

Excellent...... We used our Octopus (MTR) card for the ride to Lamma Island. Get there on time because they are very puntual although the ferry was half full. Wonderfull views of Kowloon as the ferry sails across the sea on its way to the Island.
Fast and efficient. Very fast and cheap between Hong Kong island and Kowloon. A lot of trips everyday, so you are sure not to wait for a long time when you are there.

The Star Ferry, even the name is wonderful!. My favourite form of transport ever. Even the name is romantic. Don't bother with the Upper deck - more money for less air. Views of the harbour on the left going from Kowloon over to HK. Could sit on it all day.
Amazing experience. Amazing experience and cheap way to see the harbor. The top top deck for is your choice for better photos.

You just have to do it. You just have to do it, you cant eave Hong Kong before you do.
Best value for money anywhere in the world for its scenery and efficiency,

Nice relaxing way to see hong kong. Catch the local star ferry for a cheap and authentic way to see Hong Kong. Better at night (or perhaps go late afternoon then have dinner then return when its dark?). You have to buy single tickets (no return available) so either way you have to exit to make payment. If the weather is warm try to get a seat at the middle where the sides are open to get a breeze. Tip: the back of the seats can be moved across so you can always be facing in the direction you are travelling.

Enjoyable ride. Star ferry has never changed. They are able to maintain their standard with nominal fare. The staff are very courteous & helpful. The excellent view from both lower & upper deck is breathtaking. A well affordable ride!!

A MUST when you are in Hong Kong. When you are in Hong Kong make a trip with Star Ferry. FIRST CLASS only cost 2.5 HKD. Take photos during the trip. Enjoy these old ferries. You can even pay less by using Second class below.

Must experience!. Star Ferry from Wan Chai Pier to Tshim Sha Tsui is the best option to enjoy Hong Kong skyline, especially during the evening hours. It is also an ideal way to enjoy the Light and Music show!

A must do with kids . This would have to be the cheapest activity to do in HK. Use your octopus card to go aboard. Kids and adults will love the trip across the harbour for a unique view of the city. Goes between Central and Kowloon. It's super efficient and no fuss. If anything, the ride is a bit short. Plenty to do and see no matter which side you're travelling to and from. Don't worry about a ferry timetable as they run about every 10-15 minutes both ways. We did it by day and night.

A real Hong Kong must do. A trip to Hong Kong is not complete without a ride on the Star Ferry. Classic ferry ride between TST and Central/Wan Chai. One of the best ways to see the stunning Hong Kong skyline. The boat ride is cheap and the boats leave frequently throughout the day. I would recommand a ride during the day and also in the evening when the lights are on. TST to Central has longer daily operating hours than TST to Wan Chai.
Unbeatable value. Short but lovely, we went across at night and the views were stunning. So cheap, you can't beat it for value.
The best show in town. A must do when visiting Hong Kong. Fantastic views and photographic opportunities by day and night. The best value for money attraction.

Beautiful night. Magical. We decided to take the Star Ferry at 8.00pm so we could watch the nightly Sound and Light show from the water. We booked in the morning at the Pier - (Kowloon side). But you could probably book just before - around 7.00 pm. The ticket comes with a drink and a biscuit snack. It was a beautiful night and the light show was magical. There was a bit of hustling to get the 'best' views - but everyone could see. We all really enjoyed it. The Star Ferry did a harbour tour and it was great. An excellent way to spend part of an evening.

Cheap iconic transportation across the bay. The only way to travel across the Bay! Quick and cheap (a taxi will add HKD70 for a cross bay trip). Just for the pleasure of using these old boats it's worth the trip and at HKD3.60 good value for money
The only way to see HK.. Whatever else you do take the Star Ferry across the Harbor while the evening light show is on at 8.00 pm. Stunning.

Worth it for the views. For only 2.50 HKD you can get on board the ferry for a trip across the harbour. The views are amazing and this would hands down be the best value visitor attraction anywhere in the world. It worked out to be about 40c NZ for each person and you get to see so much. We went from Hong Kong to Kowloon and it was only about 10 mins but a great trip.
