Fun water trip to Kowloon.. The ferry is a quick way to cross the harbour from Hong Kong Central area to the waterfront in Kowloon. Trip is included in some of the travel packages sold by Big Bus Company (the Hop-On, Hop-Off bus in Hong Kong). Great picture taking opportunities.

Cheap and beautiful. For me, taking the ferry is one of the best transportation possibilities. If you have the chance to take it, do it.
I was lucky since the weather was nice too. And I love the color of the sea in Hong Kong. You should definitely take a ride. Unfortunately, it was way too short.

Relaxing way to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Very cheap and relaxing way to cross over from Kowloon to Hong Kong on the classic Star Ferry, which runs every 10 minutes or so. Best views are from the top deck (which costs $1 more, but worth it).

A HK must do!. Simply something which makes Hong Kong such a great city. It's a mini harbour tour for a tiny price. Great fun on a night as you get great views of all of the lights. Love love love the Star Ferry!

Not worth going out of the way.. Very short ride and you don't get to see a whole lot more than you can normally see from the HK island. The way this was hyped up, I expected a lot more. It's only really good for is just to say that you've been on it. Not worth going out of the way for this. But it's cheap and you can do it just to say that you did it.
Nice harbour. Busy harbour with amazing light. One of the best way to catch the special HK sea view night with stunning lights.
Cross the Water. This was a beautiful ride and you can use your Octopus card for it! There is hardly any waiting and you are across in a jiffy!
Simple and efficient. very simple ,rock up, flash you Octopus card $2.5hkd jump on the next boat and transit across ,5 minutes, done and done.

A classic experience in Hong Kong.. A must experience when in Hong Kong. Travel with the locals across the bay between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Ride on the upper deck. Seats have reversible back rests so you are always facing the front.
Take the Ferry for the experience alone.. The ferry is the best way to travel from Kowloon to Central.It is an ideal way to see the water traffic up close & personal.

Fantastic cheap way of seeing the harbour . I have gotten the star ferry multiple times on my visits to Hong Kong just getting to and from Kowloon/central and love it. It's such a great way to see both sides of the harbour very cheaply. Upstairs is the way to go
Atmosphere. Star Ferry is essential Hong Kong. All the atmosphere of the city is concentrated here as it connects the island to the mainland.
Make like a local - take the ferry!. This is worth taking simply to experience the simplicity and tradition of taking the ferry across the harbor.
Octopus Card. Tourists should buy an Octopus Card which is very easy to use, and any money left on the card can be refunded easily.

Super Value Harbour Crossing Ride with Spectacular Views - Especially around Dusk. For just HK$2.50 per adult (weekday fare; Sat, Sun and local public holiday fare is HK$3.40 each), one can observe and appreciate the spectacular views of the Victoria Harbour and the packed high rise buildings on both sides, as well as the fabulous neon lights on top of the buildings, with the Victoria Peak and mid-level apartment buildings as the back drop. Yet, anyone aged 65 and above can ride for free. The best time for such harbour crossing is around dusk, while the visibility is still helped by the fading sunlight and infused with the numerous lights coming from the buildings on the shore and further up the peak. Highly recommended.

great hour. 1st timers in HK did the hour long Star Ferry Harbour tour.great to spend a hour out of the madnessDon't forget to take your ticket to the refreshments bar onboard and they will give each person a cold can of drink and some very yummy biscuits. All included in very small print on your tickets.
Bargain History. The star ferry is something akin to the Staton Ferry.inexpensiveSafe ride that allows one to mingle with ,common, folkGreat sight seeing
Star Ferry. cheap and good, plus full of heritage~~~ nothing short of value for money and enriching experience onboard... fantastic experience~~~
You have to use these. It's about 6 minutes and costs around 30pence (GBP). It's efficient and good fun. It's a must do in Hong Kong.

Harbour Cruise. The harbour evening cruise is well worth taking. You will enjoy every minute of it, taking in all the views of HongKong island to one side and the Kowloon on the other side. Drinks and snacks provided on the pre-dinner cruise before being put on a bus that takes you to where you will board another ferry that takes you to the Jumbo floating restaurant which again is worth the experience. Not cheap, but well worth it.

The fantastic Star Ferry. I love the Star Ferry. I make sure I cross the harbour in them at least once whenever I'm in Hong Kong. The short trip is always pleasurable with good views of the harbour. And it's cheap.A lot of visitors of Hong Kong don't realise, from the Kowloon side, this is the cheapest way to get to the popular place called Nan Kwai Fong (a very popular place for tourists) on the Hong Kong island. Many in their ignorance spend hundreds of dollars in Taxis. Instead, you just cross the harbour in the ferries. Then, follow a long and continuous walkway for about 5 minutes and cross a couple of main streets, and you are there.Different weather conditions naturally give you different experiences travelling on the ferries, from calm sailing in good sunny weather to rocky journey in stormy weather. The lower deck is exciting because you are nearer the water and you breathe the fresh sea air. And if you are lucky, you can even get splashed by the waves when the ferry hits them.

View from the Star Ferry a World Class View. Starr Ferry is very easy to use, fares are very reasonable and the crossing is one of those experiences that you will remember for a lifetime. At night you get the see the whole 360 degree view, the lights of Hong Kong, Central, Kowloon, its all there for your eyes to feast on.
You must do it !. Those old ferries are exactly like the image of Hong Kong : modern and old. It's not expensive and this is the best way to cross the harbour. Highly recommended to do.
So convenient. Often more convenient than the metro system for some journeys. Worth considering for that alone. It's also just a lovely novelty of course. A really cheap bit of touristy fun.
Great Way to see Hong Kong. Just a great way to view Hong Kong, see the harbour and the city from the water. Really enjoyed the trip and seeing the city from many angles
Dissapointment. Nothing special during daylight & evening time you probably enjoy the skyline better from the waterfront walk. Seasickness comes as a fee bonus :-)
Fun Trip. We caught the Star Ferry and had a huge wander, its a great way to see the magnificent city day or night !
Great Experience At Little Cost. What a fantastic and cheap experience. It is a must...travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon is fantastic.

The best way to see Victoria Harbour. Inexpensive. Quaint. Must do!!!
The Star Ferry is iconic. And it really is the best way to see the Hong Kong waterfront.

A must when in Hong Kong.... These old ferries are a Hong Kong icon and it is a fabulous inexpensive way to cross the harbour like a local. Beautifully kept original features like the chairs and windows. Highly recommended to do.
Be like a local. The best way to get across to HK island. Very cheap and the trip is quick. Great views as you sit in the ferry.
Old school ferries are amazing.. I loved these ferries. Chugging around on the harbour was a great experience and such an inexpensive way of getting around.
A must do. When a tourist in Hong Kong you just have to ride the Star Ferry. So cheap and great views of the harbour.

Good public transport across the harbour. I catch the star ferry as much a s I can while in HK. It's easy to buy a token from the machine just before you go through the turnstiles. You don't need to know the times, as they are quite frequent. Also filled with tourists ( like myself, who have to take a photo every time ) and locals. On a hot day, it's nice to get a breeze off the water as you are crossing.

A Must-Try Experience. Going on the Star Ferry is an awesome way to see the city's skyline. A must if you are a photographic enthusiast. It is only about a 10 minute ride. You will experience the essence of Hong Kong, it's vibrancy and sheer pleasure that makes it Asia's gateway. Take the upper deck for comfort and view, but for the adventurous try the lower deck and feel what the locals experienced during it's colonial days. A new route has been added from Wan Chai (beside the Convention Centre).

Gentle push towards the beautiful Hong Kong . Amazing views on the ferry at night. Totally worth paying the cheap fee to take this ride to or from Hong Kong island. Ferries are very frequent and is perfect for tourists and everyday users.
very inexpensive and worth it. Star Ferry is an ideal way to travel from one side of Hong Kong. We used it almost every day. So so cheap great value.
Cheap and quick way to get across the bay.. This is a very efficient way to get across the bay, enjoy the sea breeze and the local ambiance. The only way to go!
Nice view.... Very efficient, you can use your octopus card. Not a long wait and a nice view of the harbour. Sit in the top deck for a better photo spot.
Wonderful views. Inexpensive way to travel & get a great view of the city. Excellent photo opportunities. Quick & iconic mode of transport. Thoroughly recommended.
Wort taking. I took the ferry to Macao and the trip was confortable and with nice views of the Hong Kong skyline. As with everything in China there are long queues and it is very crowded
Star Ferry - part of the HK experience. Ferry's run every few minutes, are cheap, reliable and a fun way to move between Tsim Sha Tsui and Hong Kong Island

Marvelous!. Easiest and cheapest way to go from Kowloon to Hk island, nice, clean, very efficient and it's 2.50HKD (from HK to Kowloon it's like 3.50HK i do not understand why)
Take it from HK to kowloon by 7:40, that way you arrive to Avenue of the starts just in time for the light show
cheap and cheerful. cheap and cheerful way to get from kolwoon to the island, no human interface to buy tickets now...take small notes for ticket machines..20.10 hkd notes
Iconic beauty of Hong Kong. It is a short ride across the harbour by Star Ferry but it is the old way to cross the water. Brings back the days gone by.

Everyone should take the Star Ferry!. Highly recommended! I love taking the Star Ferry going from TST to Central and back. Hong Kong's skyline is one of a kind and this is a great way to see it all! Watching the Hong Kong Island from TST is not the same anymore. A lot of Mainland China tourists camp out and hog up the area now. Taking the Star Ferry is a great alternative!
it is the history of Hong Kong- don't miss!. A must do in Hong Kong. Perfect for crossing to other side for a late breakfast, or a night ride to see the night lights.

Awesome Service. This is one of the thing that I like in Hong Kong. Very reasonable priced and great sailing experience moving from one island to another.I personally would recommend one should try this sailing experience, it reminded me ferry service between New York and New Jersey.

A Delightful Ferry View!. The Star Ferry is a cheap and quick way to get from Kowloon to HK Island. For only a few dollars you get a quick and scenic trip. While it is a bit of a walk from the MTR stations, I recommend making this trip at least once during your trip! Make sure to chose the upper deck for the best views.
A MUST when in Hong Kong. At least once, during a visit to Hong Kong, you must cross from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central; by the Star Ferry. It was and still is a great experience.
Trip with a view. why higher a yacht when you can ride one of these and view the amazing HK skyline or in the evening ride one of these and watch the sparkling lights of Asia's Financial Centre.
A must for just 50 cents. Fantastic for a short 15min calm boat trip to or fro from the Hong Kong island. Simple to use with plenty of easy to follow signage.

A Star Turn. The sturdy little Star ferries, with names like Twinkling Star, Morning Star, Silver Star, Solar Star, have been making the crossing between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island for many, many years, and are so much part of the Hong Kong experience. They are an effective, quick, convenient and very cheap way of getting from one side to the other, and they are really fun. Don't miss a trip or ten!

Worth it!. Cheap. Ferries leave often. Beautiful old wooden boat. Just get it across and back... I am not a fan of Kowloon. Great at night. The Star ferry is one of the things that I love about Hong Kong. Embrace the beauty of antiquity. The simplicity of this boat with its wooden seats and reversable back rests. It's only a short journey either way so do it a few times over different hours of the day.

VIEWS OF HONG KONG, ROMANTIC. This really felt like a step back in time. We liked the old ferries stopping at the old historic piers, they just scream Hong Kong and are a great photo opp. All very clear and understandable to the tourist and not difficult. They swish back and forth all day long and are a part of the Hong Kong experience indeed. I liked the shops on the Kowloon side of the ferry pier, they were handy for shopping and had nice things.

Cheap and Cheerful Hong Kong Harbour. The cheap and cheerful way to see Hong Kong harbour. Spectacular sights on a good day / even a rainy day is pretty. Don't take the train, jump on the ferry. It does get busy in peak times !!
A must try :). Easy to get in and good way to enjoy the beautiful nightview of Hong Kong. Must try at least one time.

Iconic and awe inspiring urban vista. A must for any visitor to Hong Kong, gone are the days when arriving at Hong Kong airport was at Kei Tak, the view of the Hong Kong Skyline was first visible from the air, Nowadays by far the best way to see Victoria Harbor is take a short ride on the iconic star ferry. Nothing like seeing the looming buildings at bigger as you approach the terminal in Central. Its also a very quick way to get to Central from Tsim Sha Tsui. It should be a no brainer for any itinerary to try to fit in.
Nice view transportation. It showed nice view nearby 7 p.m. I recommend star ferry as a transportation. Facilities in the ferry is not that good but I liked star ferry because of the view.

Not to be missed.. The Star Ferry is an old standby that is not to be missed. A great "old school" experience that has been around for many decades. I first went on it 35 years ago and it has not changed much since then.Cheap way to get between Hong Kong and Kowloon. A short ride that provides great views of both Hong Kong's and Kowloon's skylines.
A must do in Hong Kong. Excellent - a landmark that everyone must try while in Hong Kong. Cheap and runs constantly so easy to fit into a schedule.

Easy and efficient. The Star Ferry is a pleasure to ride. It is punctual and quick and such a time efficient way to access the two sides of Hong Kong. We had only been in Hong Kong a day and we felt like 'old hands'. My top tip is to get a position near the entrance gates so that you can get onto the ferry quickly and get seated together with your family or friends otherwise the seats get snapped up fairly quickly.

Panoramic views. This is a cheap way to see the panorama of Hong Kong (weekdays is even cheaper than on weekends). The ride is short, 10 minutes or so. But it is enough to be able to take few pictures and to enjoy the views.
Luci. The best way to cross the harbour. Beautiful no matter day or night. Soothes your soul in this short 5 min ride. In love with every part of it.
It Never Gets Old. Regardless of how many times you ride the ferry, it still makes you smile as you enjoy the view. And, its cheap.
Great way to get around. Frequent crossings although they do get busy during rush hours. Relatively inexpensive. You can use your Octopus card at the gates.

Take a trip across the harbour. You have to take a trip on the star ferry across Victoria harbour when in Hong Kong. It's cheap and regular... About every ten minutes and easy to use. 70,000 people a day use it. Avoid peak hours

Great Views. It only costs a few cents to cross the harbour on the Star Ferry Service and it is well worth it, their is a crossing every few minutes so you won't be waiting long to board, evening crossings are spectacular because it affords you the opportunity to see the magnificent light show on display every evening.

Nice and Cheap. First time we used this ferry because all Taxis in Hong Kong refused to drive us to Kowloon and one nice lady advised us to try this ferry and it was really nice; it takes you to both directions in less than 5 minutes and it only costs around half a dollar. the ferries are little bit old though

Stunning and easy to use. We took the ferry from Kowloon to Central. Was extremely user friendly and we used our octopus cards. The views were stunning and the cool breeze such a relief.Highly recommended.

The Cheapest Ride in Hong Kong. I made it a habit when i am in HK to use the Star Ferry service to cross the harbour as it is a great ride, and cheap too. If I am in a hurry I would use the MTR everywhere. You can purchase a tourist travel card at the HK Airport or at any MTR Station.
Cheap with a view. As an "Elder" using my Octopus card I pay nothing on the Star Ferry but even at the minimal price of a ticket it is good value. Never a longer wait than 10 minutes and the view.
a great HKG tradition. Nice for site seeing and / or access to amenities at either end like Ocean Terminal shopping mall etc but MTR is quicker and better for longer trips.

Great way to experience Hong Kong harbour at almost no cost. Whether you are staying on HK Island or Kowloon, the Star Ferry shouldn't be missed. It connects to nearby MRT Stations and is was to get to from anywhere, easily and cheaply. If you have time, don't just go between Central and Kowloon, but go to one of the further locations.
Views. the best way to see the Hong Kong sky line. An institution. You haven't been to Hong Kong until you have done the Star Ferry
Great views of skylines. Not expensive and beautiful trip to get to Wanchai or from Wanchai. Definitely nicer than MTR, as you get the view.

Must do when in Hong Kong. Very easy to use and inexpensive. It's part of the history of Hong Kong and provides an excellent view of the entire harbour. Short waiting time and convenient to access. Something we do every time we are in Hong Kong.

Magnificent views but very short. Nice views
very short
at night its magnificent
at 8pm you can see light show
Boat is old but clean and spacious
Good fun! . Does everything the guides tell you and no surprises. had good fun after the outward journey running around to catch the same ferry back! Felt like a kid again!

A fun alternative to the MTR. If you're looking to really enjoy the HK Harbor, take the Star Ferry across. Especially on a clear night, you won't be the least bit disappointed. Gorgeous views of the HK skyline and a cool breeze to the otherwise typically hot weather.It's not as fast as the MTR but what it loses in speed, it makes up for 10x in sights!
Unique tour of Hong Kong. good way to get around in Hong Kong and a cheap way to get view of Hong Kong from the water. Clean and safe

Ah the old ferry still going strong. Yes the old ferry is still going strong and it is still just as enjoyable to travel from one side of Hong Kong to the other, mainland to island and back. The only problem I had was that it is really too short a trip. You get great views of both sides, mainland and island, during the trip and the skylines are great especially at night. Well worth the trip and it is very cheap also.

Best view of Hong Kong is from the Star Ferry.. Unless there is a bad storm this is the most enjoyable way to travel from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. On the ferry you can fully understand the development that is going on in Hong Kong. Plus, if you are over 65 the ride is free!
Hong Kong Efficiency. The Star Ferry is another example of the Hong Kong transportation efficiency. Cheap and on a tight schedule.

Iconic Land Mark. We used this to pop accross the water from TST.The ferries are frequent quick and inexpensive.A great form of public transport great to use in the evening and experience the HongKong skyline

Must do excursion. We always make it a point to take at least one trip across the harbor on the altar Ferry. Grab a Starbucks before you board on the pier, you won't see vending machines onboard. Payment is very minimal and so convenient when you have an preloaded Octpus Metro card that is good for the subway, airport train, even at 7/11's and KFC! The trip from the HK side to TST is very scenic, relaxing and puts you right in the upscale Harbor Mall where you can grab a bite, shop pr people watch while being on the Kowloon waterfront,
Cheapest tour around. Day and night don't miss the $2rmb ride across the bay. Its what the locals and visitors do. Easy and fun.

Cheap way to move around. The ferries run very often so waits are short. Cheap and fun way to see the harbor and to move back and forth from Kowloon and Hong Kong. Well used, some look tired but still fun and a great cost effective way to get around.
It really is a Star Ferry!. Just take a ferry over to Kowloon to experience this fabulous, famous Ferry. Day or night, the views are spectacular.

Star Ferry: Beautiful way to Experience HK. A beautiful way to see Hong Kong from the water. And it's transportation, too. I took the Star Ferry over to Kowloon for the evening where I had amazing Indian food with live music @ Gaylord's.
Easy trip from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. A cheap easy trip from Kowloon to HK Island and back. Very scenic views coming in to Central pier on the Island. Great view of the skyline leaving Kowloon.
One of the world's great crossings. A must if you're visiting Hong Kong - catch the ferry, especially at night, for iconic views of the city. Cheap & great fun

CEO. Star ferry is one of the fastest, cheapest, convenient and scenic centred views of sky scrapers will connect you between Central Hong Kong and KowloonIt's a great Experience and you must try it and you will go back again and again . you will love and enjoy one of the finest connectivity and mode of transport in Hong Kong and if you haven't done it , then you will regret it As a tourist you must take this route and the easiest way is to buy an octopus card and keep using back and forth as you can also use the same card for various other mode of transport as well some shopping tooEnjoy the life time experience while in Hong Kong is my advise
Fun. It's not something beeautiful but it's quite fun and you get to see Hong Kong's landscape... It's an interesting trip.. I recommend it!

A cheap trip in Hong Kong. It's a very cheap way to get from Hong Kong island to Kowloon and gives great views of the city. It runs very frequently and there's little waiting time and only takes minutes to get across. There's more than one route so you can choose where you want to go.

Just great & dead cheap.. What fun! Easy to use, cheap, great views. We went on the top deck & lower deck, both were fine. Very little waiting time for the next ferry if you just miss one. If you go to Hong Kong a trip or two on the Star Ferry is a must.
A good way of spending some time on Victoria harbour. Average looking ferry, but can be used in place of the MTR metro. A good thing to experience when in Hong Kong

Serenity at Sea. Boarding at Kowloon’s Tsim Sha Tsui ferry terminus, I sat on the Star Ferry’s Solar Star, one of a fleet of eleven operating ferries, each with a Star themed name, to Hong Kong Island. The cheap first class upper deck fare is the ultimate in value for money. Ornate wooden signs remind patrons in hand-painted white English and Cantonese characters Please Do Not Spit that enforces the sense of ambient comfort. As we gently bobbed, rocked, dipped, and bounced our way across the harbour, coolies balanced themselves with precarious ease, honed from years of experience, atop the Hong Kong Island quayside, their long bamboo poles held outstretched to hook the seeped mooring lines thrown fore and aft. The Star Ferry has preserved its original look, feel, and smell since the 1960's when the ferries were the main form of transport to cross the harbour between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. To gaze up from a ferry crossing at Hong Kong's majestic skyline, an erratic stretch of skyscrapers, hotels and apartment blocks, transformed at night when Hong Kong glitters like a diamond, is the cheapest therapy in town; few people disembark in anything but the lightest of moods.

Great way to see the Harbour. A great way to see the harbour and it costs next to nothing for the trip. An enjoyable experience, we did one trip during the day and a return trip at night. A must do in HK

A must in HK. Star Ferry is one of the must do when one is in HK. As one crosses the harbour, the skyline is just breath taking. I always enjoy the Star Ferry, whether it is from Kowloon to HK(Central) or from HK to Kowloon. One can see the activities of the Harbour as the ferry makes its way across the harbour. It is just a wonderful experience.

Discover Hong Kong Harbour. Rather than taking the subway to go from Kowloon to Hong Kong, the best way to enjoy Hong Kong is to take the ferry, and benefit of a great view on the Hong Kong Harbour, at a very cheap price!
Still brilliant. ...and only HKD 2.50! The journey is shorter these days as the waterfront on The Island has encroached further in to the harbour, but it's still an icon!

A must do when in HK. Catching the iconic HK ferry between the island and Kowloon is a must do when in HK. It's a cheap and quick way of getting from one side of the harbour to the other. It would be a shame to see the phased out through lack of use.

quick trip from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Used this couple of times to get across to Hong Kong; which we don't like as much as Mongkok/Kowloon area. Cheap and little waiting means to get to and from Hong Kong Island

Cheapest thrill on HKG. I take the ferry from Kowloon to the island whenever I'm in Hong Kong. Favorite time is early evening and you can see all the buildings lite up. Only $.50 a trip for the upper deck.
Best water-skyline night view . They charge a VERY nominal charge! You get to see Hong Kong from a whole new dimension! Plus they have an AC section too in cas you are irritated with the hear!
Too cheap not to do.. Incredibly cheap way to travel and you can use your octopus card. Just hop on a ferry and enjoy the view from the water.
Must do.. These ferries have been running for years and are a big part of Hong Kong. It's one of those must do things. A great experience, with lovely views of Hong Kong. Very reasonably priced.

Floating Bus. This was an easy service to use. Very efficient and great fun. I caught the Start Ferry from Hong Kong to Macau and back. Only a short hours trip and cheap too. I upgraded to first class on my return to see the difference in service. I had a better seat, first to board and exit and a meal with drinks. I felt this was excellent value at circa £15 more. The boats are so clean and all staff are professional and helpful. A great 'bus' service which ran on time - and fun.
Star ferry. fantastic experience travelling on this ferry. quiet trip to the Island but return was start of rush hour, what an experience.

Just love this!. This must be the cheapest picturesque boat ride in the world!! the view is so great and the whole process of getting on and off so efficient and interesting. Its timeless, absolutely Hong Kong! A must for all visitors.

Seen so often in a Movie!. This is great. The Star Ferry runs every few minutes between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island and very cheap. It only takes about 15 minutes across the harbour and a real treat day or night. Good views of both sides and boats.
Great way to see Hong Kong. Nice view and the best way to see Hong Kong. Friendly staff. It's really cheap, quick and easy. The train will more expensive though.

You have to try it. A little bit of history / nostalgia all wrapped up these old ferries which ply across the harbour. My usual route is from Kowloon to Central and not only is it a great experience it's very cheap and reliable and still possibly the quickest way to cross the harbour. Long may it continue.

A great ride. A "Must" do when you visit Hong Kong. I wouldn't be surprised that these boats are as old as the beginning of the Star Ferry in 1888. Probably not but not that young either. The Star Ferry crosses the Victoria Harbor between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. You leave Tsim Sha Tsui in Kowloon and end up in Central on the Hong Kong side. The cost is very low. 2 HK dollars. With that in mind I read that their revenue was close to 42 million dollars a year up to the relocation of the pier and now has fallen into big loses.It is still very popular but not as crowed since 2011. Even though you could take a cab much faster I recommend you use it. The token you use to get on board is distributed at the entrance and it looks like a plastic coin. Enjoy.
Only way to cross the water. A wonderful service to speedily transport you between Hong Kong Central and Kowloon. at about 16p per trip (24 cents) it is a giveaway
A nice way to cross Victoria a Harbour. Cheap and efficient. A classic. All good...old world, no mod cons a delightful way to cross Victoria harbour. It is very cheap and the ferry guns often.

Everyday the best. Cheap. Great views. Best way to cross the harbour. What more could you want? Could be a hassle for people with difficulty walking (getting on and off) but staff we saw were very helpful.

Cheap and Efficient. easy way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island (or the other way) - good view of the skyline on both shores and only takes about ten minutes. Not luxurious but definitely fit for purpose

Cheap yet exciting ride!. A must try for tourists! You can enjoy the scenic beauty of the harbour line when you take the ride in the evening. It cost me 2.4 HKD to take a ride from Tsim Sha Shui to Central.

The best, and part of HK history. You can't go to Hong Kong and NOT go on the Star Ferry! It's such an historic part of the city's transportation network. Frequent and incredibly cheap, I will always try to cross the water by the Star Ferry unless I am in some great rush...can't beat it!

Star Ferry with beautiful skylines. Pleasant ride with beautiful skylines in the early evenings. Interesting to people watch as most of the locals use this mode of transport.
A great way to sight see

A day delight. Gives you a chance to see the skyline in the day which I enjoy. The haze makes it difficult on most days but the ride is a must do. The cool breeze and the number of nationalities on board is an experience like no other.

Must Try. One of great and unforgettable ride in Hong Kong must try it
The prices very nice and cheap and they organized nice trip with great view
See the HK Skyline!. Choose at least one trip and take the ferry across Victoria Harbour! enjoyed the breeze and the brilliant skyline of Hong Kong

Exciting Ferry Ride. The Star Ferry is a passenger ferry service operating company in Hong Kong. It's main route carries people between Victoria Harbour, between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. It was founded in 1888 as the Kowloon Ferry Company, adopting its present name Star Ferry in 1898.The fleet carries thousands of passengers each day, even though the harbour is crossed by MTR (underground railway) and road tunnels. The Star Ferry offers breath taking view of Victoria Harbour and one of the tourists attractions of Hong Kong.It has also been rated in top 10 most exciting ferry rides, poll by the Society of American Travel Writers in February 2009.
Cheapest ride around?. A must, if only for the history! Ride it in the evening and enjoy the view! Ride it during the day and enjoy the view! Price wise, it can't be beaten.

Who doesn't love the star ferry?. So easy to use the Octopus card to travel between Tsim Tsa Tsui and the city. We also did the harbour tour included as part of the Big Bus Package which was ok- probably most interesting from the perspective of getting a closer look at some of the watercraft on the harbour.

Star Ferry ride was Fun.. You must at least take the ferry ride and experience how people used to cross the harbour using this ferry. A nominal fee and required but the experience was fun. The ride is about 10 minutes and you can take many pictures of Hong Kong landscape.
Good Intro of Victoria Harbour. It was an hour trip approximately it was a good introduction of Victoria Harbour.I do recommend this first time who is visiting Hong Kong.

Must try . For 2.5 HK dollars between Kowloon and HK island this is a great inexpensive way of getting across Victoria harbour. It takes about 8 minutes to go across and gives a fantastic view, pizzas he boats are like something out of the sixes going on forties but look safe and sturdy the crew are very smartly dressed in old style Royal navy in forms my wife thought they looked cute. A great experience followed by a great day in Hong Kong

Fun means of transportation. If you're not in a hurry and want to view Hong Kong from another perspective, then the ferry ride is for you. We enjoyed crossing from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui while taking in the beautiful sight of Hong Kong. Alas! The ride was too short and before we knew it, we were alighting from the boat. Fare is very inexpensive too-just a bit over HKD2.00. Pay either in cash or through the Octopus card.
Very Efficient. Use this like you would a bus, frequent, on time and a wonderful experience. Tap in using your Octopus Card, very cheap. The history of the Star Ferry makes it quite an iconic ride.
Great view of the City. Easy way to get from Kowloon to Central or vice versa with a great view of the city. Very easy to use.
Great way to see the harbour!. The Star Ferry is a great way to get from Kowloon to Central. A lot of history, great to see it still operating and at a cheap price.
Very easy to reach hongkong conventional center. Just pay 3.5hk$ and reach wan chai with in few minutes .If u stay in Tsim sha Tsui.Air conditioning ferry

On time, efficient and fun. Similar to Sydney in Australia, ferries darting everywhere and on time.We even caught one to Cheung Chow island, which is an hour ride, by standard ferry from the Hong Kong side.Cheap and worth it for the cooling breeze and the view of both sides of Hong Kong.We used the Octopus card, which we purchase for $150 HKD with$100HKD credit for travel on anything other than a taxi.Cheap to get around by bus, train and ferry.
Star Ferry island hopping is great. Easiest way to island hop..fast and affordable,and they run every 10 minutes so no rush if you miss it! Only about $2.50 AUD

Excellent value; Fabulous way to appreciate the skyline & harbor for tourists.. Wilst theres nothing in particularly stand out about this Ferry service, it has 3 distinct things going for it.1: Price. It is extremely cost effective to get from one side of the harbor to the next. Unbelievably so when compared to other densely populated global cities.2: Night Time: As it approaches dusk - its one of the super best ways to appreciate the HK skyline. Sensational.3: A great all round tourist introduction to the harbor, skyline.
Awesome . A cheap quick scenic route over the water, it's an old ferry aswell, so that adds to the excitement, I suggest going at night, as you get to see the light show from the water.

Cheap cool way to get across. Ridiculously cheap, less than 50p for a stunning ride across the water taking in the skyline of both sides of the Harbour whilst savouring the cool breeze and enjoying the few minutes of relative peace away from the mayhem of Hong Kong's streets.
The cheapest and the best.. Costs absolute peanuts to see one of the most amazing night time skylines in the world. Very efficient and romantic for less than 1 U.S. dollar!

Perfect transportation. Easy, cheap, quick to cross over. Ferries leave every 10 minutes.
Upper deck tickets are a little bit more expensive but offer more spectacular views of the bay.

Still on the 100 Things that you must do before you leave this world. I find that the short (five minute?) journey from Kowloon to Central washes away stress for me. I am not sure why... maybe because is ti a throw back to earlier times? But, it is always a must-do when I am in HK.

Have to do once during trip. We traveled quite a bit in Hong Kong for business in the 1989s and lived taking the ferry from work to hotel. So this trip we took the efficient MTR but found ourselves by the ferry station and hoped on(with octopus card) and remembered how fun it was to travel on the ferry with the wind in your face. Over the years the ferry ride has become much shorter/in the old days the journey was 15 minutes. Now it is around 10 minutes as Hong Kong is building out and has more reclaimed land. But still a fabulous way to travel!
Cheap, easy to use.. The cheapest way to get across the ba, easy to use ticket machines also in eEnglish, and the ferries run quite often to a number of docks either side of the bay.

Interesting history and experience not to be missed in HKG. 2 ways to take this from HK island, central terminal gate 7 or wanchai terminal. Both stop at Tsim Tsa Tsui. The one from central station is kid and stroller friendly. You can pay with octopus card.
A must. For just over $2hkd this is a must tourist attraction. Go at night when the lights are on. It's just beautiful and historic
Enjoying No Rush. The Star Ferry is a leisurely way to travel from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. Cheap and lovely to be on water. Do not go during peak hour but the rest of the day really leisurely
good fun. its simply a must do when in Hong Kong and never crowded and for tourists its the best way to get to central if you stay in tsim sha tsui

Tourist must. Great scenery. Cheap. Nostalgic.Can't miss the ride! A lot of history here including a riot in 1967 when they raised the lowest class fare by five cents. One silly guy even made himself an effigy! For what? Think it was a communist motivated action!

Nice View. Every one seem to be in a hurry in Hong Kong, always on the move and always fast pace. But if your a tourist, slow down a bit and include a ferry ride and a tram ride in you schedule specially at night. The tall building, the light from either Hong Kong or Kowloon was just magnificent.

Cheap and quick way to cross harbour. Well worth it. Very cheap and efficient way to cross to and from Hong Kong Island and TST in Kowloon. Frequent and comfortable. Cost varies from $2.50HK (weekdays) up to $3.40 (Sunday). That still only equates to 30p though.
Highlight Attraction. The Star Ferry is the fastest way carrying passengers between Kowloon and Hongkong Island. Boats are ery reliable and atmosphere is very authentic.

Romantic view from the waterfront in the evening. I think it is a must to take once or more the Star lines, old romantic feelings, special in the evening at 20.00h with the view from the Waterfront to the skyline with the lasershow.

Recall my memories . This is one of HK's histories which still alive in this 21st century. Star ferry brings a lot of memories to people in HK. Those ferries, I believe at least 30 years old and still carrying people between Kowloon and HK Island, so amazing. Although today's ferry mainly for tourist purpose and local people won't take it as main transportation to cross the harbour but when you know that it was the only way to go between Kowloon and HK before cross harbour tunnel was built it really means a lot and a signature of HK's transportation history.Frankly, today's traveling time is mush shorter than the old days because the landscape has changed due to coast development on both sides. Taking her ferry at different times in a day will catch different views of Victoria Harbour.

Enjoying the Harbour view. Taking the ferry across the Harbour is not only allowing me to relax but also to watch the Harbour views from another perspective. The Harbour views are quite different at the day time and at night. The fare is inexpensive. A must try for tourist in Hong Kong. Don’t forget to take the seats at the upper deck.

Worth every cent and more!. 1. Even if on a 1 day trip you must do this.2. If on a 2 day trip : you must do this twice!The trip only costs 2.5 HKD and slightly more on a weekend. It only lasts 10 minutes but in that 10 minutes you can enjoy the famous skyline of Hong Kong Island and its refelection on the water. After riding from kowloon to HK island take the bridge to the mall and on the way you can get some great views and clicks of the bank of china etc. towers. Also if coming from HK island towards kowloon you can check out the promenade and see the hollywood stars etc. Also the "symphony of lights" which is put on at 8 pm is also much better viewable when on the ferry...of course much better enjoyed at night but even in day time its a delight. Its hassle free and cheap and enjoyable!..what more!

Where are my sea sickness pills?. I mean I love the water and have been on plenty of boats all around Thailand but this rickety old boat was just a bit too much. Star Ferries are rated as a must see and I just don't get that. Once you survive the choppy ride there is nothing to see or do expect for yet more shopping. It would be better to see the historical importance of the ferry or the island but no. I really don't get it at all and likely never go back without sea sickness pills. Skip the rickety old boat and spend your money on something else. Where do I get my 20 minuets back plus the incredibly long walk to actually get there. Cannot say enough what a waste of time that was.
Fabulous!. Just a great lil view of the city. One time isn't enough. A must see in Hong Kong. Relaxing way to view the big bright lights of the city.

Still going strong. Truly the best way to see the skylines of Hong Kong and Kowloon is taking the Star Ferry ride. For mere pittance, you get the sea-breeze in your face, the smell of the Fragrant Harbor and a ride in history. One hopes that the Star Ferry will never be taken away from the public. And if you want to be real nostalgic, rent Nancy Kwan's old movie - The World of Suzie Wong. You will notice nothing much has changed for the ferry except the skyline.

take a water adventure around the island of HK. it is well worth the time to take the train and pic any ferry.
Its the most beautiful way to really see surrounding areas of HK.
Its perfect for the warm weather months in July.
The adventure is well worth it.

Must do trip. Hong Kong star ferry is a must while you are in Hong Kong. Think about it. Millions of people have been taking this ferry through out the years. And its cost: $2 HKD. Trip itself is only about 10min. I suggest you take the ferry at night time with all the lights of the building. Amazing and unforgettable experience!! We stayed in Tsim Sha Tsui and everytime we would go to the financial district or to central, we would take the ferry.
A nice touch of HK's past. If you go to Hong Kong, you have to ride on the star ferry to experience a relic of the past. Even though it is now spotless, there is still a feeling of HK's past.

A Must. You cant say that you have visited HK if you don't get on one of these oldies but goldies ferries. Absolutely cheep are the best way to cross the harbor avoiding the surcharge tax of the tunnels that you will have to pay (i.e. With Uber) or crowded Metro.
Easy Travel. Easiest way to get accross the harbour than taxi or bus. it's also alot cheaper too. ferry is not over crowded with passangers during the day.

Cheapest Boat Tour Anywhere. The Star Ferry is a must for any visitor to Hong Kong. You can take a harbour tour in one of these ferries but for a couple of $HK, you get the experience at a premium discount. In fact, if you need to shuttle back and forward between HK Island and Kowloon, I don't know why you would go any other way!

Easy hop on hop off service. We used Star Ferry to travel to Hong Kong Island from Kowloon. The ticket process was automated and quite easy to use. Boarding and exiting the ferry was simple and the voyage was nice with great views. Good value for money.

A must. The Star Ferry is a must to experience the glamour of Hong Kong. You can experience the business of Hong Kong during day time with the ferry or you can enjoy the sunset and glittering Victoria Harbour. It is also the cheapest way to cross the Harbour in Hong Kong.

Inexpensive way to travel . Great way to travel that doesn't require waiting for long periods of time (as pickups are frequent) or paying a lot of money (plus you can use the octopus card). About a 10-15 minute journey & if you sit on the left side going from Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui you can get a better view of the harbor.
Pleaant journey. We used this to cross from Tsim Sha Tsui to Hong Kong Island . It was a very efficient and enjoyable trip allowing us to see all around us.

Un-missable cross harbour transport. A must do.. The Hong Kong Star Ferry is un-missable. Even if you've done it before you should do it again.
It's fast, convenient and undoubtedly the most scenic way to cross Victoria Harbour.
Ferries leave so frequently you don't need a timetable.
We rode it every day but never bothered with the upper deck.

Best value ever. Not to be missed
One of the most iconic ferry trips in the World
The train is quicker but the ferry at night or day is the way to go from TST to HK Island
Great way to see bits of Hong Kong . This is one of the traditional ones. Worth a round trip if you have never been. Novelty for tourists and essential for commuters.
The only way to travel. Go early and plenty of room - go later and enjoy the bustle of the crowds as you travel the habour. A must do!
5 Stars For The Star Ferry. Super efficient and very inexpensive way to travel! Good fun too! You get great views of the Hong Kong skyline for next to nothing. Just avoid peak travelling times!!

View Hong Kong and Kowloon at their spectacular best!. More than a means of transportation, I think the Star Ferry is best to enjoy the coastal view of the Hong Kong and Kowloon islands. It is SUPER cheap, frequency of the ferries is good and the Kowloon end of the ferry is a tourist's dream. You get great views of Hong Kong skyline (Manhattan-esque)! Not to be missed!

Simple and Awesome Transport. Fun and affordable transport. Great view of the city skyline. The pier area is full of other places to visit like the Space Museum or the Avenue of the Stars (similar to Hollywood). Be careful of plenty of people trying to sell you fake watches.

A real piece of Hong Kong history. Just join the constant stream of locals and tourists and use this to get from Kowloon to HK island or vice versa, a great experience and very cheap. Upper deck tickets are slightly more expensive, but still less than £1.
Its a ferry. It was a nice way to go back and forth from the island. I get the nostalgia, but don't understand the five star rating. Relaxing ride.

Quintessential Hong Kong Experience. I have been to Hong Kong dozens of times over the years and I always make the point of taking the Star Ferry at least once on each visit. There's something very special about crossing Victoria Harbour on one of these old ferries. Not to be missed!

Old style & icon ride!. Taking the short ride from Kowloon to Hong Kong island must be in your to do list when you visit HKG, the stunning views to the city and the Victoria Harbour, make of this ride very pleasant and spectacular. You should take the ferry at sunset time and during the light show!
Cheap scenic way to cross over to Kowloon and HK Island. Nice views and a great way to cross over to HK Island / Kowloon side. It's also really cheap as well and very pleasant.
Great views of the stunning high rises great photo taking. Very good pricing great for sightseeing. Friendly staff. Even though it is very humid in Hong Kong...bring a light coat with you.

Good trip. Travelled by star ferry to go to Kowloon, was a very quick trip from Hong Kong Island , about 5 mins. Easy access and you can use your octopus card which makes it very easy. $2.50 HK very cheap.
A HK Icon. Used this for years going to work - it will be there long after i am dead and buried. An institution and a must if you visit. Slum it and go down stairs

Beautiful skyline and beautiful at night. Nice experience using the star ferry the one problem we had was that we could not find were to purchase a ticket, there were no clear signs to follow or should I say they were confusing. Staff kept on sending us to the wrong places to buy ticket. The ride on the free was nice with interesting commentaries and complimentary snacks.

Definetly a Must Try Experience When in Hong Kong. This is the cheapest way to travel between Hong Kong Island to Tsim Sha Tsui. These ferries run a regular and frequent schedules between the two islands. Make sure to go on the upper deck to experience the great views of Hong Kong from the Victoria Harbor - don't forget to take pictures while you are at it.
Lovely views. A nice way to get across the harbour, quick and easy. Also very cheap! Only $2 for adults and $1.40 for kids. Nice views of the city.

What's to say. It's cost about 20 pence one way from pier 7 over to Kowloon and runs every 5 minutes buy a token for the boat at the entrance from the machines nearby. Beyond that there is not much else to say some photos when crossing the bay. Says a lot for HK that this is the second best attraction!!

A true HK icon . This used to be a genuine mode of transport, in fact the only mode to cross the harbour. Now purely a tourist attraction with the introduction of the MTR etc. not a quick way of traveling so if you want to cross just train it. But a really great way to see HK and feels like your going back in time if it weren't for the picturesque skyline you have a front seat for! A true HK icon and a must do for any tourist.
Cool Breeze service. Good ferry service for 45 mins ride , you will enjoy the breeze and lighting effects on building near the sea

This is a real winner. Many years ago, when I first visited Hong Kong I had one day. I took the Star Ferry on the lower deck one way and the upper deck coming back. It is the cheapest scenic harbour ride you can get. It was awesome way back then and it is just as fun (and cheap) now.Yes, the train through the tunnel (which didn't exist way back when) is faster and more convenient. You also don't assaulted by the suit tailors and dodgy watch sellers when you get off the ferry in Kowloon - but that is half the fun. The train is more expensive though. This is a must do! Enjoy it. Try the upper and lower decks.

Marvellous old style ferry. It's quite an experience to travel with this ferry. These very old ferris bring back a time already gone with traditional old machinery, polished, reversible wooden seats and slower life space. The machinery is noisy as working hard, but the fresh sea air and nice views make it up for this. I would never chose any other means of transport to take this short trip between the two points.
Star Ferry Doesn't Disappoint. It's a must-do in Hong Kong. It's amazingly cheap and will give you some stunning views. It's a great bit of old-time Hong Kong.
You're the star at SF. Cheapest but one of the best rides in the world for its views of both Kowloon and Kong Kong! I prefer taking the ferry over MTR when going to TST.
Easy travel. Convenient way to cross the harbour and great view of the city from the ferry. Ferries run very regularly and reasonably priced.

Very nice view, but also very short trip. The views are really good, but almost as nice as from the shore. The trip is not long and it is done in a few minutes. I was expecting more. However, notice I did the trip just during the day. At night, you may have another view.

From a local's point of view. I haven't used Star Ferry as a means of transport for long. It is because I don't work or live in Tsimshashui / Central. But I think it is a good means to explore Hong Kong Victoria Harbour in consideration of the price and its location. You will feel relaxed onboard although the journey is short. There are shopping centres on both sides. Not much choice but shopping. It is Hong Kong ~ Shopping paradise. You just cannot resist especially during the summer or winter sale period. Come to Hong Kong in July or December and you could enjoy these amazing experiences!

You absolutely have to experience the Star Ferry when you go to Hong Kong.. You will want to travel on the Star Ferry more than once during your trip to Hong Kong. So relaxing and so much to see. take lots of photos. This was at the top of my list of things to do after researching Hong Kong prior to our trip.
Great city view.. A different way to see the city. Definitely do it if you have time. Actually a very simple way to cross the harbour. And a much better view than you get in the MTR.
Functional. Good to experience for once, but otherwise it's functional with decent view. Better views can be had along Avenue of Stars.
Fun. Nostalgic and cheap. Great views. On time. Clean. Going across quite often. Not for the traveler that's in a hurry

A Front Seat View of the Harbor. The Star Ferry is a must experience while in Hong Kong. It is a vital link between the two sides of Hong Kong and you get to ride it for small change.
Don't miss it.
nice way to travel around the harbour. Used the star ferry to get across to hong kong island to then catch ferry to Lantau Island. Quick and efficient and cheap way to get around.
Crossing the bay. Probably the only inexpensive thing in HK. Crossing the Bay is arguably one of the most enjoyable experiences in HK. And it only costs 2,5 HKD (0,3 Eur).

Must Do In Hong Kong. My wife, kids and I stopped in Hong Kong on the way home from the Philippines in April 2015. We stayed two days. I also have made about 30 business trips to Hong Kong over the years. The Star Ferry is a key thing to do and it is always a lot of fun to take the ferry boat between the Hong Kong side and the Kowloon side. It is very cheap and a Hong Kong institution. It is a must do in Hong Kong.
Cheap way to cross harbor. An exciting and cheap way to cross the Hong Kong harbor. Beats the MTR anyday if you are a tourist and not in a rush.

Must try. So cheap!! Transportation in HK is really good, from buses to ferries, so this one is a no brainer. Everyone should try riding Star Ferry, there's not much to see but it's convenient and fast, and well, you'll love the breeze.
harbour crossing. You can't visit Hong Kong without crossing Victoria Harbour on the Star Ferry. It's a Hong Kong institution!!! A must do!!!

Go aboard just for the harbour view. Poor old Star Ferry getting less and less distance to travel now that the reclamation and new pier has been finished HK island side. Pleased to see they have retained the old vessels, must be nearly 50 years old. A must for a ride across the harbour if you are in HK

Fascinating harbour voyaging.. This is a great favourite of ours although the passage between the Island and Kowloon is now somewhat shorter than my first trip in 1972 due to the constant foreshore development!
Quick trip to Central, Hong Kong Island. I saw much of the Hong Kong view from the ferry. I would recommend to others since it's inexpensive using your Octopus card.

Enjoying the breeze. Cheap and enjoyable transportation between Kowloon and Hongkong island. Short walking distance from other places of interest on both sides. Token vending machine is easy to operate and payment is possible with coins, bills and card. The fare is very reasonable. HKD 3.60 on upper deck which has a small A/C lounge and 2.80 on lower deck.

A historic ferry that one must do when in HK. Its really cheap and best done at anytime during the day. Loved the old boat and the ferry terminal. Its only 25 pence ! and its been running for a long time across the harbor .
Must be the night ride.. The Night ride on Star Ferry of Victoria Harbor and the sky line of Hong Kong with the mesmerizing lights is just great.
Carmel & Ross. These Ferries are good way to see Hong Kong also the fare is cheap $2.50 HKD aprox 45Cents AUD. I think it better way to get to Hong Kong or vice versa harbour is beautiful

Best way of Transport to see Hong Kong.. When I am in Hong Kong I always enjoy boarding the Star Ferry to cross to Kowloon which has the best shopping and great views of the skyline.Very cheap prices good service This is a great way to see the islands of Hong Kong
No hassle. Very convenient, no hassle travel to-fro Hongkong side and Kowloon side. No long waiting time for the next ferry

Cheap!. Want a cheap option for sightseeing in Hong Kong? Catch a star ferry from Central Pier to Kowloon for only 2hkd ( 40 Aus cents) You get a great harbour view , lots of photo ops and it doesn't cost anything to stroll along the boulevard or streets.
Never fails. A must-do for any visitor to HK - cheap, easy, fast, convenient and great views, especially after dark

Cheap and Beautiful way to see the skyline. Cheap and convenient way to view the great skyline of Hong Kong, especially impressive if you time it right and are on the boat when the skyline light show is taking place (think it was sometime around 7-8pm)
Very good and cheap. Very good and cheap. Ensure early arrival for the evening light show if you want to get a seat. The boat is also good at other ties.
A fun way to travel in HK. Definitely a fun way to get around Hong Kong Harbour - do the trip during the day and at night to take advantage of the views.
Great way to get around Between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. A great way to get to Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Leaves frequently. Nice views on the way over. Reasonably priced
This is a must do in Hong Kong. This is a must do in Hong Kong. Take a trip from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island especially at night. The cheapest way to go there.
Can not visit HK without a ride on the star ferry. we travelled on the ferry many time and loved it I don't know what it is about the ferry but it has something very special about it
Star of the Journey Ferry Experience. Well Managed and professional service from ticketing to managing crowd all was seamless, would give a 5 star rating to the experience.

Something to experience. As it was too early for us to walk around (shops were not open yet) we decided to bring the kids on the ferry to experience this transportation and our older boy was slightly scared at first but warm up soon after. We took a short ride to central which was only a couple of minutes ride.the cost was HKD8.90 for 2 adults and 1 child's fare on a Sunday. Good experience though.

Excellent Value. I wanted to go to Victoria peak. The tourism board suggested that I go by ferry to get across the harbour. The ferry terminal was easy to find, easy to access. It was quick too. This was a gem, I found! The National Geographic Traveler named the ferry crossing as one of 50 places of a lifetime. It was a great historic experience. I did during the day then at night to see all the lights.

A must do in Hong Kong. You will regret if you did not catch a Star Ferry during your visit in Hong Kong. Costing just around £0.50 and it will being you a great view of the Victoria Harbour as well as sunsets if you are lucky!Also this is the cheapest transportation if you want to cross the ocean to Central or TST.
Amazing view of the night skyline!. We took the trip from Kowloon to Hong Kong and were delighted with the amazing view of the city skyline. Truly spectacular!
Really cheap and fast. A much better alternative to taking the metro from HK to Kowloon or vice versa. It's also home to a beautiful view. Expect to pay 2 HKD.
Fast, cheap, great view. Took the ferry across to Kowloon and back, no fuss, easy on and off, a must do when visiting this city.
You have to do it at least ones. The best way to move from one side from enother. Just something about $2-3 and you can cross the harbour and enjoy the view at the same time
Good way to see the sights. The ferries run all over the harbour and are cheap. Great to see the sights and watch the laser lights at night.
Fun way to see Hong Kong skyline. Fun and cheap way to get a great view of the Hong Kong sky line - should definitely be done during your stay in Hong Kong

Interesting and alternative mode of transportation. Alternative to sitting on the MTR to get across. Good to take in the views and see Hong Kong's skyline. It's inexpensive and cool because a lot of TVB series were shot at the ferry terminal.
Fun Trips. The Star Ferry glides across the water between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Lovely views from all areas of the boat.

Hong Kong ferry. In just 10 minutes the Star ferry will take you from the mainland (Kowloon) to Hong Kong island .Crossing the harbour, one gets a totally different view of this part of the city. Taking the crossing in the evening gives one a superb atmosphere when seeing the huge range of coloured lights on many of the buildings.

short, crisp and breathtaking. when you travel what all you look for- good return for your money and here its "almost" free. a 10 minutes drive which can you go mad about the two islands, do they have any other place like this in the world? It is beautiful on both the sides. Please do not miss it, I took an evening ride between the Central Star Ferry Pier to Tsim Tsa Shui, and believe me the pain I took to reach to the ports were worth it.

Return to a childhood delight!. I first went on the star ferry some 20 years ago and was very excited when Mum said we were going first class.... little did I know! Back this time with my kids and great to share the experience and see the city from the water. Ferry was clean and easy to get around.
a classic , almost for free!. one of the must do's in Hongkong, it does not mather whoch direction you take ... it is like in good old times and does not seem to ever change ... soooooo nice!!!!!
A must see and do. A trip to enjoy. Best way to see both Kowloon and Hong Kong skylines best value in the world for ferry crossing. Feel the breeze and take in the night air

Much More Than A River Crossing. This seafaring experience is now more functional than leisurely. Whilst appreciatively dated and still history tinged, it seems more stark, more spartan - with an inevitable loss of charm and grace. The lower deck still reek of fuel that seem to defy the deafening noise. All in, a practical way to transverse to Hong Kong Island/Kowloon in full view of panoramic waterfront views.

CHEAP!!!. One of the what to do things in Hong Kong. The view was also amazing. The price for the star ferry from Central to kowloon is cheap. A nice way to get through to the star avenue and watch the symphony of light.

Never fails to inspire. Nothing quite like a trip on Star Ferry at duskThe lights start to come on in both Hong Kong side and Kowloon giving you an unforgettable view of both sides of the harbour and all for 2.50 Hong Kong Dollars

crowded with tourists, but still cheap and stunning views. has been better in the past, sometimes long waiting times and crowded. But its still cheap and gives stunning views of Hong Kong Harbour. A must do for every Hong Kong visitor.
Highly recommended!. For about 25cents you can go from Kowloon to Hong Kong. A short and comfortable ride that gives you a great view of the harbor..

An absolute must when in HK. The NYTimes has called this one of the experiences you should do before you die. I agree. This brief crossing of the Fragrant Harbour is one of the supreme pleasures of life. Do yourself a favor and come during the dawn on weekends. There's nearly nobody here. But service continues with better regularity and more frequency than a NY subway. At less than 50 US cents, this is an unbelievably cheap way to take in a bit of the colonial air.
Cheap and efficient. And lovely view.. I love cities by the sea. It reminds me of the ferries in Instanbul. This ferry is clean and efficient. An institution for Hong Kong!

The best way to view the Harbour. It is always nice and cool to take ferry to and fro between Wan Chai/Central to Tsim Sha Tsui. You can see how beautiful Hong Kong is.
The fare is extremely low. You should spare some times to experience the ferry trip.

An Iconic Harbour Crossing.. One of the most historic ways to cross the Victoria Harbour between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Its cheap, offering magnificent views, and its a very iconic way to cross the harbour in Hong Kong... not to miss for anyone new to Hong Kong.

Cheap tour guide. If you are looking to take that special someone out for a tour of Hong Kong look no further than the star ferry. For about two dollars U.S. you can experience the Hong Kong skyline and impress your date on the cheap

Too pricy for the experience. The boat is really nice but I went on the night cruise combined with the Symphony of lights. For a 190HKD a ticket. The round trip was nice but it wasn't something special, you can't really see the Symphony of lights show beacuse you are in the middle of it and have to turn your head constantly to every direction, also the speakers that actually makes up the music sequence where so low volume that you couldn't hear anything. I had a nicer experience sitting on the dock on the Kowloon side with a couple of beers where you can really watch the light without the hassle of boats.

Can't beat the price for a great view.. This is the most affordable travel for anyone who visits Hong Kong and must ride. From Wanchai in Hong Kong Island to Tsim Sha Tsui in Kowloon, less than a US$1 to cross the habour in 5 minutes that runs almost every 5-10 mins. If you travel in the evening, you can even see the lights on both side of the harbour.Reliable transportation unless there is a typhoon that most traffic will call a halt.
Highly recommended way to see Hong Kong. Great way to see Hong Kong, with nice views; and at an AMAZING price which was less than £0.50. Can't beat it...
Family with young children. Great view of the sea..beautiful lights from the buildings around n its an experience though a 10mins ride.Kids enjoy it!

Such fun on a rolling ferry. This is such fun. Get an octopus card or buy a token and take the 5 min trip. Spectacular views going from Kowloon to HK . Rock snd rolling ferry but the history behind star ferries us do interesting
Enjoy the view, make sure your bring your camera!. Taking the ferry is always nice and cool, can see the beautiful Hong Kong skyline, can see the Peak in a clear fine day.
So cheap and great views. Worth doing when in HongKong, it's convenient, cheap and offers great views of the city. The wooden seats aren't the comfiest but it adds to the charm of the boat
So cheap and great views. Worth doing when in HongKong, it's convenient, cheap and offers great views of the city. The wooden seats aren't the comfiest but it adds to the charm of the boat

Convenient and Efficient. The best thing about this Ferry is the owners never over charged or ever changed the fare for the last decades ever since it was founded....amazing sure to enjoy all round views of Harbor and especially the beautiful view of skyrapers.
Take a Star Ferry. Frequent, cheap with amazing views, heaps of life jackets, enjoy the sunshine and fresh air in traditional ferries

One of the world's best ferry rides. Considering it costs only 2 HKD for the lower deck and 2.5 HKD for the upper, this has got to be one of the best value boat trips on Earth. A token can be purchased from one of the machines in the ferry waiting area at each stopping point. The view is one of the best in Hong Kong, and you're surrounded by locals. The MTR may be quicker, but it will never have the style of the Star Ferry.

Merry old Star Ferry. Being in Hongkong you should not miss the ride across the Victoria Habour on the Star Ferry. Nice to do it during day, but also in the night. Magnificent views of both Kowloon and Hongkong Island.
convenient in HK. It was very convenient, in time and a great opportunity for a great view. Modest built but very clean.

Never ever lose this cultural icon. I am so glad the Star Ferry is still around. It is such a lovely throwback to the less globalised Hong Kong. Yet it is efficient and full of atmosphere. A wonderful (sometimes smelly: good and bad) journey across the bay on a ship with old wooden chairs, decks that hark back to a time long forgotten by Hong Kong's modernization. I would sit on the ferry and go back and forth non-stop all day if I could!

A Hong Kong must-do. I love crossing the harbor by Star Ferry. Regular as clockwork, these vessels offer a wonderful view of the Hong Kong skyline and that of Kowloon. It is a cheap and fun way to travel, especially for families.

A must do in HK ( for the price) !. this is probably one of the last remnants of colonial Hong Kong (alongside the peak tram) which withstood the test of time. As a local, we have a lot of attachment to this slow but nostalgic mode of transport. The ride not what it used to be after further reclamation in the harbour and the elevation of the ire on the Hong Kong side to its present day location , but it does offer the best view of the harbour. The price is still cheap and for that price I would recommend it. You can start by paying a visit to the harbour city or ocean terminal if you need shopping done, or visit the Heritage 1881 mall and have lunch at the hotel, then saunter to the pier. I normally take the upper deck, but the lower deck feels more romantic, I suspect it hasn't changed much from day 1! The ride is pretty short nowadays (about or under 5 mins) and I often take a return journey back to the kowloon side to soak in the sights again. It rob ably doesn't matter from which side you start, although I always preferred starting from kowloon to see the magnificent skyscrapers of central .On the hk side, follow the pedestrian walkway to ifc and then through to hang seng bank all the way up to the escalator to the mid levels - great exercise and good views of the toothpick buildings in that dates. The expats have done a great job with the ambience by setting up bars and eateries .
Cheap transport on the water. Must do at least once. Even on a public holiday day it was not full, and cost HK$3.40 (about NZ$0.70).
Iconic. No visit to Hong Kong is complete without a star ferry trip - not the tour, just go back and forth. Really clever people can time their trip to coincide with the light show at 8pm

My kids love it. This is our traditional transportation in in HK. I must let my child experience it. But the journey is getting shorter due to the construction extents from HK side. If u are a tourist, it's a nice try
View both sides of Hong Kong. Catch a ride back and forth between the island and the mainland. A quick trip but gives you excellent views and some great photo opportunities

Highly Recommended!!. A trip to HK would not be complete without journeying on the Star Ferry.......150yrs old and still reliable to this day! I did the crossing in the morning and evening and to be honest the night was more fun with the beautiful skyline glowing away in the dark!! Great experience!!

Hong Kong of another era.. Experience the " old" Hong Kong. A Hong Kong of another era.
Decide whether to go on the lower deck or the upper deck. Watch the traffic crossing the Harbour as the Ferry heads across the water.
Cheap and fun travel. An absolute must. So cheap and such an easy way to get from one side to the other. Just be careful to catch the right one. There are 3 different routes
Legends and life saver. Loved the Star ferry back in the old days, many a day it saved me from the Sgt Major - simple, cheap and a must fro the views both ways day or night.

Pleasant, Quick and Cost-effective. "Star Ferry" is a passenger ferry service operator and tourist attraction in Hong Kong.
Its principal routes carry passengers across Victoria Harbour, between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. We had booked a room at Mingle Wing Hotel (HKG Island). So it was a cheap, nice and fast (15 min.) mean for crossing Victoria Harbour.

Efficient, low price transportation. Very quick and efficient transportation between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island with beautiful views. Very low price (about 50 US cents) and runs constantly back and forth. A must do.
great value. An awesome experience with great with value and views, Very covenient and easy to access from our hotel by a red taxi.

The best way to get across. While the metro might be slightly faster, the star ferry is a great way to cross between Kowloon and Hong Kong. It's cheap, you get to see the outside with all the amazing buildings and it's very relaxing.
trip to Macau. We traveled to Macau from Hong Kong. It is a good ferry service with nice interior and seating. it was a short trip and there is arrangement of little snacks in side.
Easy way to go. The Star Ferry was a great way to get back and forth across the harbor. It was easy to find and easy to get tokens for the trip.
Do it twice. This is on the Must Do list for HKG. For about 10p you get to view one of the worlds most dramatic skylines. Do it by day and then again at night for two completely different views

The Star is a Star. The Star Ferry linking the two parts of Hong Kong, Kowloon and Hong Kong Island, is a convenient way to travel. Traveling in Victoria Harbor, you'll be able to take great pictures of all the tall buildings on both sides. On a hot day, going by the Star Ferry is preferable to the MTR.
Y to see the sights. A great way to see some of the area. Ferries were clean and on time. Toilets on the ferries are cleaner than the wharves.
The Ultimate Hong Kong Experience. For less than $3.00, you get to cross this world-famous waterway and view the skyscrapers of Kowloon and Hong Kong - impressive to say the least.
Nice view and very cheap . Great view of both sides of the city. Cheap fare. However, no are conditioning so not the most pleasant journey during the summer months. Also a quick trip!

Great Local Service. A great and inexpensive way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island - super sights on route that you would pay a lot for on an organised boat tour. The ferries were frequent and efficient, you just need to know the timetable to make them work for you.

Great way to travel. We stayed in Kowloon & caught the ferry a couple of times across to HK central. We used our Octopus cards. Also used the octopus cards to get drinks from a vending machine on ferry.

A Cheap and Pleasant way to cross the river. Whenever I have time and need to travel from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui I will definitely choose the Ferry. It is cheap ( less than 3 HKD per ride), clean and away from the crowded MTR . It is a nice way to see Hong Kong from the harbour. It is a must do if you visit Hong Kong but also if you live in HK and want to take 10mn to stop running and to enjoy the view...
Inexpensive way to travel with great views. A quick, inexpensive and pleasant way to get from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon and back in a very short time.
A must for tourist. cheap, nice view transportation. maybe should try for a night ride for the spectacular hong kong night view. but the walk to Central is a little bit far..

Star Ferry Great Value. Take this ferry instead of one of the harbour tour boats. It is a fraction of the cost and you get a great view of the harbour. We did it on the spur of the moment and I wished I had a better harbour map with me to pinpoint a few more sites but definitely worth the time and money.

Must do once, MTR after that!. The Star is definitely something one must do in Hong Kong, just for the experience. But it is not refined travel by any means. It is not air conditioned and the boat can be really heaving up and down as you get on / off, but that is part of the experience. The views of course are great, but if you want a decent photo through the grimy windows, forget it. (Take the aqualuna Junk for that!) The MTR is much cleaner, faster, there's A/C and it costs only a wee bit more.

Star ferry. I visited hongkong many times but every time I will be using taxi to cross to the other side of the river and charged 400hkd .The star ferry is only 2.50 .I crossed many times to have my breakfast and dinner without hassle.
Worthed!. It's a 10 min boat ride across the water, it is totally worthed, especially since it's 2 hong kong $/person.
A must do. A must do if you visit Hong Kong. Not only is it a great way to travel, but the views are spectacular.

Inexpensive. Took the trip with the others in my family on our trip to Hong Kong, it was a short journey that gave a good view of the harbor. Took a few pictures on the ferry and of the view that you can get from it. The trip was smoother than I thought it would be so that was a relief to my mother who had trepidations about the ferry. So to the doubters it is safe and fun.
Few things that are cheap in HK. Best way to enjoy Hong Kong's famous skyline. It is the most cheapest way to cross the harbor. The view of skyline at night is one of the best you can get.

HK FIRST VISIT MUST DO EXPERIENCE. Taking a trip back and forth to HKI is a must do experience, whatever the weather. You get a great view of both skylines and its a very practical way of seeing a lot in a short time.
The boats are spacious and very basic, but just what is needed for such a 'experience'
History every day. Its a part of the old Hong Kong. Fascinating that it still runs the same as it did years ago. love this and always go on it just for the thrill of it.
Ridng a legend!. The Star Ferry is a legend, and so cheap and easy to use. It was not too crowded, and is nicer than going by MTR. Loved it!

An inexpensive way to see Hong Kong Harbour. One of the most famous attractions of Hong Kong is also one of the most used by locals. It is very cheap to catch the ferry across the harbor. It's also one of the best ways to view Hong Kong and it's beautiful harbour!

Something very different!. Coming from South Africa where we do not have this mode of transport it is really an interesting way of getting around Hong Kong. The ferries are clean, and punctual and offer a visitor some good views of the city.
Quick and good value. Used the Star Ferry to go to TST - it's great value and is a good way to see Hong Kong from a different perspective - I would definitely recommend as a change from the MTR.
Star Ferry a mustdo!. Brilliant ferry trip, short but sweet and cheap. We travelled in the daytime to Kowloon the view of Hongkong island is amazing and lots to see at Kowloon

As Good As Manhattan !. Breath-taking views of the Picture-postcard view of the harbour. Impressive sky-scraping buildings of Banking, Electronic, Hotels, Insurance 'Giants'. The walk on the 'Star' boulevard is relaxing with the usual array of artists and performers along the stretch. There are evening mini-concerts by new acts. There is a nightly display of lasers across the harbour and sky-scrapers. The trip on the ferries is so cheap, that you can save yourself a lot of money compared to going on the 'tourists' boats.Careful of the people who try to lure you onto the 'Gambling' boats and the 'Property investments' tours !
