Cheap and very efficient ferry service . This is a very cheap and affordable way to cross the harbour. It takes about 5 mins on the ferry, costs like $8 for 3 people. Its popular with the locals.

Must try at lease once. One of the cheapest alternative to cross over. Take the ferry at near sunset and enjoy the view in the process. Make sure to play the reversible seats as i find it really smart of them to design it as such. Must try at least once.
Hong Kong - Macao. My trip from Hong Kong to Macao on the ferry. Hong Kong and Macao the very beautiful city from ferry.

The lifeline of transportation across the different islands in HK. Cheapest mode of transportation in HK, allows you to cross Central to TST. You get a great view of the HK skyline. It takes 8 minutes to be precise to complete the journey from Central ferry to TST. Star Ferry of course organises trips to a number of other islands also in HK.
A not to be missed transport. A lovey ride, takes you back in time. The Star Ferry has not changed in years except for the price!! Routes have been reduced. Fun! Really not to be missed

Cheap, charming and unchanged for years. It is a ferry service but also offers a great way to cross the Victoria Harbour whilst enjoying the Hong Kong skyline views. The fares are very low and service is frequent making it a memorable yet practical experience to enjoy Hong Kong.
Clean reliable and short journey. Good way to pop over to Koowloon for a walk around the shops and an amazing history museum, worth seeing.

Easy to figure out for an American. I have used the Star Ferry to travel to Hong Kong from Kowloon as well as into China for business. I have visited Cheung Chau island using the Ferry as well. Highly recommend using a fast ferry whenever possible. Clean and reliable

Best views of Victoria Harbour. Regular and quick crossings between Central Pier and Kowloon with lots of photo opportunities - better to travel on lower deck if you plan to snap lots of photos! Crossing over to Kowloon just before Symphony of Lights show begins (8pm) will leave you near the Avenue of Stars which is a great place to watch the show from and attracts many street performers and food/drink stalls.For serious photographers, the 1 hour harbour tour is a must!
Like the old days. As much as you can use the subway you can't miss the ferry.You see the city from the water which is a different approach and very nice.

Wonderfully unchanged, in spite of the competing routes.. The Star Ferry was once, long ago, virtually the only way to get from Victoria to Kowloon. Then came the first road tunnel, the MTR, and it is now only one of many crossings - but it still has more atmosphere than any of the other options, with the view of the harbour and the skyline on both sides.It is cheap itself, but even cheaper using an Elder Octopus card.
Star Ferry. Great way to view the skyline of Hong Kong. Runs every few minutes and can use Octopus card. Takes less than 15 mins to cross the harbor
clean & safe. one of the most popular means of crossing the bay , easy, clean ,safe and fast . Also possible to enjoy a relaxing view when you crossing HK bay... Worth it!

Quick, efficient, cheap and fun wrapped into one. The best way to get across the harbour and enjoy beautiful views of both sides. A fraction of the price of the MTR (don't even think of taking a taxi across!). They are even more efficient than they look
Star Ferry - Must do in Hong Kong. Fantastic way to see the skyline and so inexpensive. The cost was only 2.50 HK$. So easy to use and highly recommended to get across the harbour..

Nice and affordable. It was really nice and very cheap. You shouldn't miss the ferry experience when your in Hongkong. Which gives you the summary view of the city and the mountains. If you are going to Macau it will only take you 45 minutes from Hongkong

A must do. This is a must do in HK.
The most beautiful way to see HK from the sea.
Try it at night, it is wonderful.
It cost nothing and kids love it.

Great view of hong Kong - part of history. Nothing to dislike, as it is part of Hong Kong history. Getting from Kowloon to Hong Kong, a nice steady 10 minutes of peace and quite in Hong Kong harbour. Do it twice, morning for getting to The peak and evening for a great view of Hong Kong harbour.
The best cheapest thrill in the world !!!. First crossed by the star in 1996 it's wonderful . The seats backs slant both ways and they were made in the uk !!! Brilliant !!'

A HK Must Do. what a great way to get perspective of how big and beautiful HK is.
the star ferry is a must for any trip to HK

HK Ferry Service - great mode of transpory. The HK Ferry service is the best way to get to Hong Kong Island from Kowloon & vise versa, ferries are frequent and reliable traveling approximately every 10 mins. The best way is to use an octopus card for payment, we always purchase our octopus card at a train station office. If you are wanting to go to Stanley Markets or Ocean Park, you can get a bus from the HK ferry terminal, which is well sign posted. The ferries to the outlying islands & Macau are on HK Island & again well signed. The view of the Harbour is spectacular especially in the evening.
Must visit in H.K.. Must visit the star ferry once you visit Hong Kong. Symbolises Hong Kong. It was an unforgettable experience for me. Highly recommended
A must do trip. Everything you expect, the view the waves and the feeling of bobbing about in the harbour. A must do ....

The cheapest way to see the skyline. A friend told me to do use the ferry after it is dark and he was right. The round trip is unbelievable cheap and you get one of the best views on the skyline. It is simple and cheap. Take the ferry over, have some dinner and take it back. Worthwhile.

Cheap little adventure across the water. This should be a MUST DO for everyone visiting the region. It is practically heritage. Even when I lived in HK in my younger years I still used to get the ferry rather than the MTR (when not in a hurry), to regain some solace and sanity from the hub-bub of Hong Kong
Best value transport in HK!. You cannot go to HK and not go on the iconic Star Ferry. At about 20p a ride (slightly more if you go for the upper deck) it has to be HK's best value ride!

An absolute must see. Star Ferry is a moving monument
It is to HK what Big Ben is to London and the Eifel Tower is to Paris
A simply delightful way to go to work in the morning and a stunning one to get back in the dark.
An absolute must and costs less than 20p /30 cents
Superb esp at night . As a hongkonger tram and ferry are my fav ride in HK!! I love the ferry ride particularly at night and you can see the magnificent night view !
must do the Star Ferry. very affordable way to visit Hong Kong island from Kowloon. Services are frequent, regular and in-expensive.

Best way to cross the bay. It's mandatory to cross the bay with star ferry when you come to HK. Take the upper deck and enjoy the view. Star ferries are boats that are sailing in 2 ways so you can switch the way you are seated

Try at least once you will like it and found why so cheap !. cheapest way to cross between kawloon and central. Locals do use
this as they know they are saving a lot from this.

Star ferry history. A nice way to cross the harbour if your into boats and shipping. The vessels were made in 1964. The crossing only takes about 5 minutes and departures are regular (about every 5- 10 minutes.

just take the ferry. at least once you should take the ferry ride through the channel.
the first reason is the city-seeing from the water points
the second one it's quite fast and regular
typical. typical and not expensive with an incredible view on the Hong Kong Bay and the sky scrapers. not to miss
Great way to get across to Kowloon. We went across for the day to Kowloon, this is a very cheap and easy to use, it cost 2.50HKD each, for one way
Must try. Cool way to cross to mainland. We used out Octopus card. Enjoyed the fish and chips on the other side

Don't ignore Starr Ferry when you visit Hong Kong. It is very cheap for one time sitting on Star Ferry (2.5 HKD for adult). We can see the sight of Victoria Habour, but I think it would be better if you take night ferry.

A nice relaxing and cheap way to get to avenue of stars. I absolutely love this mode of transport, especially when i was staying at causeway bay, i just walked to the ferry and paid $2.50 at weekends which is 25p, yes that cheap. 35p on weekends. It's fast and easy, the interior is nice varnished wood with lots of seats and space to walk around

inexpensive and scenic. why take the subway under the bay when you can get some great pictures riding on the star ferry.
the ferries are quick and not too expensive

Visit to Hong Kong Island. An easy walk to the ferry terminal from our hotel. Regular ferry service with on time departures. Excellent views of the harbor whilst crossing. Lots of facilities near ferry terminal in Hong Kong Central. Staff in ticket office able to give good directions to enable us to do some exploring.
Boat trip to soak up the views. Had planned a hectic day and knew a boat trip would force us to slow down and look round. Enjoyed the commute and the ferry was really convenient.
Good and cheap way to go from Kowloon to HK Island. Star Ferry is not expenxive, and it is a good way to go from Kowloon to Hong Kong island enyoing in the meantime of the skylines.

The Star Ferry is a Hong Kong institution. Once it cost cents to take the Star Ferry between Kowloon and Hong Kong island. Today, it's no longer essential transport but it's still chugging along. And it's still the best value attraction in Hong Kong.

Enjoyable Transportation . If you're crossing between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon be sure to take the Star Ferry. It's cheap, convenient and easy to use. Plus you get much better views than the subway!

Worth the effort - beats the MTR and with a view. Well worth the trip across the water from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island or vice versa, very cheap and makes a nice change from getting on the crowded MTR. Great views in all directions and very efficient staff who get you in and out really quickly.
Great for Tourists. A cheap, fun way to cross the harbour and see the towering power of HK in all her glory. Fantastic in the evening when the sound and light show is on

Best trip in Hong Kong. It's a piece of living history and incredible value. Worth taking even if you don't need to cross the harbour. I've been using it for 15 years and it always cheers me up. From the 1950's colour schemes of the ancient but well maintained boats, to the staff uniforms, there is always something to look at. The trip is getting shorter and shorter due to the reclamation of the harbour, but it's just such fun. My tip, go to the cheaper lower deck. There's a better view on top, but more going on lower down.
More fun than a barrel of Monkeys. Great afternoon event crossing the harbor on a boat for 25 cents what a fun thing and only in hong kong.

Enjoyable rustic commute across the harbor. Last time I travelled this was maybe 20+ years ago and the experience is still as fun then as now. It is actually a better way to cross the harbour than in an underground tunnel packed with commuters.

There's no HKG visit without a trip on the Star Ferry. The unparalled beautiful sights on either one of the Star Ferry routes are worth the trip!Evidently MTR might be quick, but Star Ferry has its nostalgic sense of time, worth everybdime - and, it's a very economic panoramic view of HK and Kowloon!
Cheap. Good fun for one trip. Really Really Cheap (20 pence). When we were there the river and hongkong in general was very polluted.
Fun Ride. Had a ride from Kowloon to Central. Well maintained ferry. Great view of the city sky like. Nice expereince

Excellent way to see the full city. Very nice way to cross the Hong-Kong bay and to have the view on both side of the bay. This ferry is the symbol of Hong-Kong even if it is old style, but really charming.
Go for it!. It's cheap, it's fast, and you will get to see both sides of the harbour at the same time, which are both magnificent, day and night. For 2-2.5 HKD you can't really miss it.

Cheap and a good way to view Hong Kong at night . The star ferry is a good mode of communication between the two sides of Victoria Harbour. The fare is pretty low and allows photographers to have a good panaromic view of the landscape. If you board from Tsim Sha Tsui and alight at the other end, you can also visit the Hong Kong observation wheel. Closest station is Central station

Fun and Cheap. It's an easy way to get around and see the sites and costs next to nothing. Sure the boat bobs and rocks and smells like diesel, but it's an authentic old school ferry ride. The views up top are great but the rocking action is amplified there too.
Day trip. You have to do is trip to experience Hong Kong in full. Is an experience going across and glad we did it but came back via metro!!
Nice wind and good view. It is very easy to ride on the ferry. Quick access to the other side. I could enjoy the views and winds.

Worth experiencing, fastest way to central from Tsim Sha Tsui. Best way to connect Kowloon to Hong Kong Central. Ferry tickets are 2HKD and even further discounted for kids. Fastest way to reach to the other side other than MTR.
Must Go!. I did this in the morning. the weather was a bit hot that day. tats it, otherwise the whole experience was nice. I enjoyed it.

A charming old-world trip. This old fashioned ferry is a step back in time to 60s Hong Kong - a charming remnant of a bygone era - take it across the bay at 7pm to enjoy the full glory of the evening laser show.

A Hong Kong Classic!. Since I had not been to Hong Kong for quite some time, I relished our first ferry ride of our trip! While every guide to Hong Kong recommends to ride the Star Ferry, it is mostly used by locals. Reason being that the Star Ferry costs less than the MTR. While MTR is great transportation, the views from the Star Ferry are unbeatable! The fare is $2.5 HK M-F and $3.4 HK weekends and holidays. For about .30 to .40 US$, you can ride this ferry, cross the harbour, and sightsee, all at the same time. Also, the Star Ferry Company is over 135 years old!

Star Ferry is a must try item in Hong Kong!. If you wish to experience the life of Hong Kong people, get a ride on Star Ferry and enjoy the sea view while taking one of the most Hong Kong style marine transportation!
Easy to take a ferry in the city. Even the boat is so old and cheap look, feeling great cross the harbour. Hope Hong Kong can re-make it to simple/ clean/ modern like airport express.

A bit of difference to get across the harbour. Took the ferry across the harbour instead of the MTR for a bit of difference. It was enjoyable, and more laid back the the MTR. That said its slower, older & somewhat nostalgic, doesn't have air-con nor the crowds but it was not particularly special. It was a nice change from the MTR. If you HK island to Kowloon you get off right near the avenue of stars.
A must see. Living history.Take at least one trip upstairs and one down - the price and the entry point is different
Take a ferry ride with skyscrapers on your side. A must try in Honkong. Its a traditional service to commute between kowloon and hongkong island. You can use your octopus card to buy ticket.

Don't miss this while it is still going. Use this to travel to and from the Island and Kowloon. Bottom deck is slightly cheaper both have good views. This is a must. Evertime I am in HK I use it and l love it!
Fun ride . Great way get across harbour specially during rush hours, avoid crouds in subway and is cheaper as well
Not worth. It completely not worth its money, i think its much better just to walk along the river, free and nice

Vintage Charm. The Star Ferry is an efficient way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong, but it's also a destination in and of itself. The boats have a nice patina of age on the wood and a general feeling of nostalgia. The price cannot be beat! I rode on a rainy day and had the upper deck (covered, dry) nearly to myself. It was so pleasant to ride back and forth and take in the unparalleled views of Hong Kong. Must do!
Old World Charm. It's a great way to travel to Central from TST by ferry. Lovely, charming experience. One of the things which makes Hong Kong special.

Spectacular views. Good time to rest your legs from all the walking!. Of course the ferry is slower than taking MTR or using the under sea tunnel, but taking the ferry gives you time to sit down and stretch out your legs while taking in the view.
Ideal skyline views . Fantastic iconic ferry service, ideal for viewing the Hong Kong skyline. Cost effective and a must on any visit to Hong Kong.

Fun ferry ride across Hong Kong harbour. Quick, fun way to get across the harbour and only HK$2.50 per person. We walked down Nathan Rd to the ferry terminal and only waited a few minutes before a ferry arrived. Plenty of seats although that may not be the case at peak times.

Nothing matches the ride on the Star Ferry. It does not matter how much Hong Kong expands and improves, be it tunnels or transit systems or even bridges, the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Central District, across Victoria Harbour beats the lot. I have used this form of transport each time I visit HK, to travel from one side to the other and I never tire of it. As the green and white double decker boats readies itself, the bell goes for the seven minute journey, weaving its way through large and small craft, while you admire the Hong Kong skyline.Now thanks to land reclamation the Star Ferry piers are closer together than ever. On the Hong Kong side, Central Pier at Pier 7 opened in 2006, close to the Airport Express Hong Kong Station and the IFC. On the Kowloon side the terminal is at the beginning of the Waterfront area. There are 12 boats in the Star Ferry fleet all with different names so take note each time you use it and note down the names for fun!

hongkong fares well in star ferry don't miss it!. It is not only an option to reach central station to and fro but also a traveller's attraction saving some busy moments in the peaceful waters sailing through this ferry .the service is excellent and pricing very reasonable.hk people still use it to save some crazy moments to save in their kitty to the central and from the central.you see the whole city through your journey the beautiful developed city with the marrks of heritage emprinted through the times.
Nice ride across the harbour. Utilising an octopus card it was easy to jump on and very clean, runs regularly and signage is easy to follow

The best and cheapest way to cross over . If you are on HK side and need to get over to TST, this is fast and cheap about 2.4 HKD to 3.6 depending on day and time. Takes all of 15 min. On really hot days maybe better to take a taxi but still very economical. Plus the skyline views are amazing especially at night. A must do if you are visiting.
Great way to see Hong Kong!. A quintessential Hong Kong experience. A total must on anyone's itinerary (local or tourist) and a great way to see the city.

Take the Ferry. No matter what you do when you come to HK, you MUST take the Star Ferry.This iconic symbol of HK has a short journey now across the harbour. It's been going since the late 1800s, and the latest vessels are from the late 60s.The journey is cheap at less than a US$1.But a fun way. Imagine how many people have used this service on the ferry you are on now.
Star ferry.. The child friendly ferry was enjoyable and clean in side. Good frequency to from island. Reasonable in price.
cheap boat ride but enjoy a breathtaking city view. A cheap 20 mins ride to enjoy a breath taking city view. It is a relax boat ride in a busy city. Must go attraction.

Practical Cheap Taxi Across the Rive With a Beautiful View. Decent taxi across the river from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Very cheap, pretty comfortable. Can even be more convenient than the metro if you catch it at the right time during the day,
Star Ferry. The Star Ferry remains simple, charming, practical and softens this great city rhythm. No commercial gimmicks
Great Value. The best value trip between Kowloon and the mainland. Don't miss the light show looking from the mainland back towards Kowloon.
cheap and easy. the star ferry was easy to get to and only 2 HKD one way. It is a short but sweet trip and it is a nice ride along the harbour.

seeing all the comings and goings of the harbour. We used the star ferries on numerous times travelling between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island , and the most obvious thing you first notice is how very cheap it is . Luxurious no but very efficient and always on time .

Silor b. Don't miss a trip on the Star Ferry. It is over too quickly because you spend so long looking at the view from either side. Always seats available whether on the upper or lower deck, and all for less than $3,

Hong Kong - Macau. Whoaaa.. what a fast Ferry.
I went to macau bay using this kind of transportation.
Amazing trip to Macau by star Ferry !
Recommended. Away from the subway which can go everywhere in Hong Kong but just try to cross the island with Star Ferry and gain new experience while traveling in Hong Kong. You will love it.

Classi Hong Kong. One of the world's most famous ferries- a must both day and night. Very cheap too!
It has hardly changed unlike most things in Hong Kong.

love love loved it. Great service on these ferries , quick , cheap and reliable . I travelled daily on these and enjoyed every minute . they get busy at peak times but you can always get a seat or wait for the next one to follow very quickly behind
A cheap ride with awesome view. The Star Ferry is a steal at HKD 2 a pop, you get a relaxing ride acros the famed Victoria Harbour (unlike the HK MTR) with awesome view to boot!
Easy n convenient for inter-island transfer. Affordable n with aircon for inter-island transfer especially MTR is always pack with peoples' and no place to sit

Cheap, Convenient, Efficient and the Best Views of the City. Cheap, convenient, clean and the best views of the city. We decided to take the Star ferry which was right across the hotel - to Central station on our way to Victoria Peak. The trip was comfortable and it was a quick and easy way to go from TST to Causeway bay or Central.

Still a favourite. I left Hong Kong many years ago but I visit my hometown regularly. I would make a point to do two things every time I am there - ride the star ferry and the tram. I went on the star ferry twice this last trip. As usual, it was a relaxing ride, very few passengers and economical compared to going on the MTR, in addition, you get to see the Victoria Harbour and breathing in fresh air. The breeze made me forgot the hot humid summer we are in.Strongly recommended!
easy travel. We used hop on hop off bus so had tickets 4 times to use the ferry, easy get on get off. Short journey, great way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong island

Hong Kong Skyline from Victoria harbour for under AU0.50c. The best and cheapest way to see Hong Kong's skyline either by day or even better at night! Its great to see some old school engineering still operating in a high tech city! Just as good as the Hong Kong Tram at the same price!
Star Ferry is Great!. This is a quick and easy ferry to get to the mainland. Entry way was close to our hotel and it was Incredibly CHEAP.

Pair with Harbour Cruise. The Star Ferry ride was enjoyable. Pair it with the Victoria Harbour cruise to watch the Symphony of Lights at night! The ferry cruises slowly across the harbour and you get an opportunity to see the whole harbour, right as it begins to light up. Comfy benches that are reversible, so keep that in mind when you get on. You should figure it out quickly since it would be harder to switch as more people sit in your isle. Take pics and/or sit back, relax, and enjoy!
Regular, cheap and efficient. We were given 10 tickets as part of a big bus tour. A very easy way to get to and from Kowloon. Not crowded.
Fun. The star ferry is fun and very cheap. Its a fun way to enter Hong Kong Island from Kowloon. Sit on the upper deck and watch the ferry come into Central

Star Ferry - don't miss it. We travelled from Hong Kong Island to mainland China via Star Ferry in the night. The journey was so nice and we enjoyed the beauty of the harbour in its entirety. The ferry is cheap and thrilling as a mode of commutation. So don't miss it...

An easy and fun way to cross the harbour. You must do this when you visit Hong Kong. It's very cheap and you get great views of the skyline. The ferry has 2 decks, the upper deck has a small air conditioned section so most people choose that.

Never tire of this attraction.. We always take the star ferry when in HK.
Go foR the upper deck, still ridiculously cheep, but the view is just that much better.
Ferry runs every 10 minutes or so

Great . The best way to cross the harbor
Very cheap - only a few Hong Kong dollars each way
You can pay cash of you don't have an Octopus card
Cool breeze - even on the warmest days
Love the Star Ferry
A must whilst in HK. I love the Star Ferry at night! It's a great way to travel, is cheap & efficient & gives another great view of the impressive skyline.
Not to be missed!. A great way to get from one place to another and see the harbour at the same time. Easy access and cheap.

Cheap Thrills. The Star Ferry is an absolute must on any trip to Hong Kong - it only cost a couple of quid and gives you that whole HK vibe ! It's easy to get to , signposted from Central District and operates regularly. It offers great views of the harbour and just sitting in it and it's mix of nationalities is an experience not to be missed Word of advice -if you are on HK Island to either shop or get the number 6/6a bus to Stanley Market you need to stay on the public walkway once you get off the Star Ferry which takes you directly to both shops/ bus station. About 5 minute walk. A must on any itinerary !

More than a means of transportation. One of the cheapest but the best ways to see the famous Victoria Harbour. The ride from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central just takes a few minutes. Do it at night so you can see the magnificent and the best-in-the-world night view of both sides of the Harbour.
Harbour ride . Classic ferry ride from Hong Kong Island to the main cbd. Not as beautiful as Sydney harbour but well worth the ride

Nice Trip across an iconic waterway. We took this ferry a few times during our stay in HK. It is cheap. It is good. You get some fresh air and the views are pleasant. You cannot come to HK without crossing the waterway by ferry. That would be rude and silly.

Lovely way to see the Hong Kong skyline. What a nice way to cross the harbor. Interesting views in both directions - or for something a little different take the ferry to Wan Chai instead. In Wan Chai, there is a shopping eating complex with interesting restaurants. Don't bother paying the extra for the upper floor unless you must have the air con - you are taking the ferry for the views.
Wonderful. Wonderful ride between HK island and Kowloon. We always take the ferry when moving around HK and Kowloon. Just wonderful....
give it a go. easy to use and much cheaper than a taxi. Runs about every ten minutes. Only $2.50 HK one way. Watch for new construction surrounding the wharf.
A must when in Hong Kong. This has to be a must for everyone when coming to Hong Hong even though the MTR is a better way to get to and from the Island.

Just a short distance...=]. It is just an alternative to travel between between Kowloon and Hong Kong Islang in Hong Kong.The day and night view can be very different. Of course, i prefer the night view which is nicer and not very hot.The fee is affordable (HK$2.5 on weekdays, HK$3.5 during weekends).
nostalgia. Offers a nice nostalgic short trip where you may have the chance to take photos of the tall buildings set on both sides.

Do the harbour tour.. The tour takes about an hour and gives a great views of the city. With the harbour shrunk from its former glory the standard crossing is now a lot shorter. Well worth the few dollars it costs.

Old Ferries rock you between Hong Kong and Kowloon. Ferries are old and simple but it help with millions in transport between Hong Kong and Kowloon. Very short ride but it gives you the best view between two islands.

Great old world ferry. A fabulous classic old world ferry.....feels unchanged from early last century. Our boat was built on the 1950's & still felt reliable & seaworthy.Partly air conditioned upstairs with classic timber benches that can be reversed.Two journeys available I think ......we went to Kowloon taking about 15min.

Cheap way to see Hong Kong skyline. If you don't experience sea sick it is a cheap and interesting way to see Hong Kong skyline. You can go from 中環 to 灣仔or 尖沙咀.and all those places have a lot of places bars and restaurants to explore!

Should be part of every visit to HK. . What's not to like? Inexpensive, great views, and gets you across the harbour almost too quickly. Make sure you take this trip at least once after the sun has gone down.
Visitor. Very conveneint method of transport and cheap. Kids enjoyed the ride which was very pleasant. Great way to travel and view Hong Kong from the sea.
A must for any visitor to Hong Kong. A must for any visitor to Hong Kong. Really cheap and regular service. We had our tickets included with the Big Bus tour.

Cheap and fun. Beats the mtr... fun ....we never waited. .. getting off at harbor town is a bit annoying because u get hit straight away with people trying to sell u stuff. .. i saw one seller spit in a guys hair for walking away. .. but the ferry itself. .outstanding.
Must do in Hongkong. I'm glad Hongkong preserved this Star Ferry service. It's a respect for heritage. Next time I'm there, I plan to take the Star Ferry as the Symphony of Lights commences.

Easy, quick and iconic transport in Hong Kong.. We have taken the ferries many times when in Hong Kong. HK is very much about the water and Harbour so you must get on it. The ferries,like all transport in HK are inexpensive and easy to use. Sit up or down, the view is magnificent from both. Make sure you take day and night trips. So quick and enjoyable.

A must. Cheap, readily available and a great way to see HK and Kowloon.
Riding at night gives you one of the best views you'll find.
An icon and not to be missed - a must.

Cheap way to see the bay of Koowlong and HK Island. For ppl traveling to HK island. . Better View cheaper than the MTR. It will stop at the harbor of HK IFC mall . Lower deck is cheaper than upper Deck

A great view of the harbor and the skyline!. We boarded the Star Ferry in Kowloon early in the morning. Everything was outlined and very easy to understand. We bought the tokens in the machine and boarded the ferry. The harbor was very busy but beautiful. This is a wonderful way to see the skyline and also to get across the harbor to other sites. The ferry had a lot of space and restrooms were available. The Star Ferry must be one of the wolrd's least expensive cruises!

Great views, even better price. For being one of the best Hong Kong attractions, Star Ferry is certainly much cheaper than some of its other Hong Kong must do buddies. Easy to find and cheap to get on (plus you can use your ever handy octopus card to pay), the actual ferry ride is fairly short but at night it provides one of the cooler views of the city and the water. Cheapest thrill ride ever. For 40pence you get to see the view of a lifetime. Hong kong lit up at night what an experience one i will never forget and should be on everyones bucket list!
Relaxing 5 minute ride. This is a must to do when in Hong Kong. We have done it several times and still find it enjoyable. It is a relaxing 5 minute ride

A cheap option to enjoy HK skyline. We took Star Ferry from Central terminal to Tsim Tsa Tsui and back (as opposed to the tour); it's a cheaper option to look at HK skyline and the ferry will drop you a short walk to the Avenue of Star.

Cheap and fun way to cross the Harbor. The Star Ferry is a favorite among the local people because it is affordable, convenient and quick. Still a good ferry crossing. Had a return trip to the Kowloon side of Hong Kong and although old vessels the on/off system was extremely quick.Great views of the skylines at night.
view the harbour. prompt service, very cheap ticket price - easy to use. get tickets by the departure pier good cheap way to see Hong Kong harbour.

Beautiful Experience and most convenient way to go across Victoria harbor. Most amazing experience and most convenient way to move across the Victoria harbor and awesome way to enjoy Hong Kong view surrounded by best architecture of Hong Kong!!

Stepping back into history. This has been transporting people across the harbour since 1888 so is pretty iconic and a great way experience old HK. It's only 20p each way for the short hop across. The pier is still in its almost original state.

fun!. This is a great way to entertain children and get from Kowloon to HK side. Every trip to Hong Kong includes this excursion. Try to get on at dusk and you will see the magnificent changing of the colors of the sky and the city. Its magical.

A must do. If you have visited Istanbul and used the marine taxi then you will understand how important is to use the star ferry here as well. it is not the fastest way to pass from Kowloon to the island of hong kong but it is the best way to do so. amazing views and great opportunity for a lot of selfies :-)

Fun On a Ferry. A cheap and fun way to cross the Harbour. Get the cheaper ticket and travel with the locals or spend a few cents more and travel in style, up stairs. Not much different. Good views and there are great shops near the Star Ferry on Kowloon side. Make sure you have a map so you know where you are going when you disembark there are many tall buildings and you can get a little lost, this can be fun if you are not pressed for time.

Great way to see the Harbour.. A must do on a trip to Hong Kong. You'll want to aim to get on the Ferry between 10am and 11am, and 2pm-4pm. These times are when it is least busy so you have a chance to fully take in and appreciate the magnificent, iconic Hong Kong skyline.

A must: Peaceful, Great View, Classic Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is a must for any visitor to Hong Kong. The trip takes only around 10 minutes and is around 3 Hong Kong Dollars. Of course, the Star Ferry is old so the seats aren't comfortable, but this is authentic Hong Kong and the ability to see the skyline from the water is magical. Hop on in Tsim Sha Tsui and travel to Wan Chai or vice versa after a long day of travel and relax.
Great!. Using the ferry is a great mode of transportation in Hong Kong. It was a lovely experience. My wife and i enjoyed it.
Do it. $2HKD on the lower deck, $2.5 on the upper deck from Kowloon to Central, cheap as chips and free harbour viewing
Back in time.. It's like going back in time - wooden gang planks, wooden benches and very cheap. Great way to get across the harbour and travel with the locals.

Pleasant and easy way to commute ,. An easy, cheap and effective way of getting from one side of Hong Kong to the other, fast, efficient and enjoyable,. Nothing better than this. Star Ferry was the cheapest and easiest way to enjoy the amazingly view of Victoria Harbour. This fun and lovely boat ride would probably the only thing could actually make you slow down and put down your cell phone for 5-min(approx) to enjoy life.

Perfect. I think this is probably one of the best value pieces of tourism in the world. For less than 50 cents American you get a tour across the harbour of one of the most vibrant cities in the world. Especially at night going from Kowloon to the island, the view is hard to beat.

looking at the Peak. The Star ferry is a very relaxing jouney frm Hong Kong to Kowloon or visa versa; very reasonable priced for the journey

Great skyline views. We did the 1 hour harbour cruise, plenty of seats inside and outside. Good slow ride around the harbour viewing the skyscrapers from thee water.

Hong Kong . Star ferries are excellent for island hopping , easy to use and travel time to each island is smooth and fast . Loved hong kong

Put It on your list !. This is a quick , easy and scenic way to travel between Tsim Sha Tsiu and Hong Kong Island . At night is the best trip - gives you a feel for the harbor and the impressive Hong Kong Island skyline at water level . Cheap and worth doing

Taxi anyone?. Star ferris is the equivalent of the harbour taxi or bus considering it caters for many commuters traversing the water ways across Hong Kong harbour. If nothing else it's fun but take a ferry to Macau instead of you have the time, the same thrill with a bonus entering a new SAR of China the bus is quicker and easier from HK to Kowloon. Fun erry ride. A fun ride in an old ferry. Cheap and easy transport the is relatively quick and on time. This is a good way to see Hong Kong from the water.

Star Ferry is Fun. I just took a quick trip because I had nothing else to do and was glad I did. It's just fun to be on the water. I went to Tsim Sha Tsui and just walked around. A Hong Kong "Must Do". We were based right on the harbour so did the Star Ferry harbour tour on our first day and then used the Ferry to get to HK Island and back on a few different days. The old Star Ferries.. Have been to Hong Kong several times and notice the changes each time I visit. However, one thing that never seems to change is the Star Ferry. It's cheap to use, you can cross the water free if you buy a hop-on, hop-off bus tour. You could imagine one of the Hollywood stars of the 1940s hiding in the shadows, whilst trying to escape from a Foreign agent !Apart from that, the ferry gives you an impressive view of both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. When you're next in Town, try it, you won't be sorry.

Iconic Hong Kong ferry ride - but do it after dark. This is the best £0.25p trip you will buy. We did it twice. Once during the day and once at night.During the day, it's a nice ferry ride, but at night...... Wow!Here is the way you MUST do this trip:1. Wait until it's dark.2. Take the ferry from Kowloon to HK Island.3. Sit at the front of the boat and take some of the most spectacular photos you will ever take with your camera.You will not be disappointed. Pleasant and short seagoing voyage.. Good fun for a short trip across the harbour. See my MTR review and you can see why this was the preferred option for our excursions. Doing the jump across the harbour is definitely worth doing. Its a short efficient jump across the pond and therefore makes for a lovely jaunt on the water, rather than being crammed in a subway.
Nice crossing over the harbour. Do it on a clear night and enjoy the lighted buildings on the island shore. It's beautiful and cheap too!

View Hong Kong's Skyline from a different angle on the Lower Deck of the Star Ferry. Not the fastest, but on a clear day if you're not in a rush, probably the most enjoyable way to travel between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui for just a couple of HK$. Along with the trams, these are some of the remaining historic sights of Hong Kong. Some of the ferries are 60 years old, which - by Hong Kong standards - means antique! Most people sit on the upper deck where there is an airconditioned cabin, but all the action takes place on the LOWER deck (open air) where you experience all the harbour smells, noise and activity of a working ferry. (It's also a few cents cheaper on the lower deck.) You need to board from the lower level of the ferry pier - follow the signs for lower deck - once on board you can't move between decks. The best views are towards Hong Kong Island, so leaving Central Star Ferry Pier (take the elevated walkway from IFC or Exchange Square), sit at the stern, and vice versa from TST side back to the Island, sit at the bow. The view on a clear night is also spectacular, and it's easier to take photos from the lower deck as there are no windows to cause reflections.
Good travel option. A great way to travel between Kowloon and the other islands. It is very cheap and quick. The ferries run every 10 minutes or so .
Great way to see Hong Kong. One of the best attractions in Hong Kong. It's cheap, you get amazing views, and you can do it whilst travelling to the other attractions in Hong Kong
A Star Service. an incredibly cheap way to get around the harbour and enjoy the sights of the city. Thousands of photo opportunities during the day and night.

A nostalgic remnant of times gone by. Sadly the charming old ferry terminals on tne island side have been long since torn down and their uninspiring replacements relocated to new strips of never-ending land reclamation around Victoria Harbour. Still, on the short shuttle from one side to the other, perhaps you too can, just for a moment, feel as if you were transported to a byegone era. Oh, would that we could turn back the clock 50 years!

Amazing and Inexpensive Trip across the Harbor. It is very cheap and it is a very short trip across the Harbor between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island but it is well worth the time. You see the grandeur of Hong Kong. I highly recommend it.
The way to travel. Good way to travel using your octopus card more regular than buses were I Live and much better views day or night

An absolute must!. Highly recommend way to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island in 5 minutes.Very cheap It only cost a dollar or two to travel back a forth between Hong Kong and Kowloon.Ggreat views especially during the sunset always on time.

Lovely views, give it a try!. The star ferry ride across the harbour is incredibly cheap. The ferry itself is a little bit worn out and dirty, but it is an extremely easy mode of transport and the views are lovely. Worth a try!

A nice way to travel. I used the Star Ferry to get to The Avenue of Stars in TST. It's a very short journey of about 10 minutes either way. The ferries are very prompt and very clean. It was a lovely way to see the city and I'd recommend it for any visitors.

A Must-do in Hong Kong. HK Star Ferry is a must-do for all tourists. It is an authentic throw-back to times of olde. The ferry is a very economical and efficient way to get from HK island to mainland HK and only takes 5 to 10 minutes. There are lots of eating places at both piers. A very good Indian food stall is found on the HK Island side.

A ride on the star ferry is the biggest bargain in Hong Kong. If you have nothing to do and want a cheap experience take a ride across to Victoria Island on the Star ferry. At between Hong Kong $2.50 and $3.40 depending on the day of the week this is the biggest bargain you will find in Hong Kong and the views are great.
A Must-do in Hong Kong. Not the fastest nor the longest feryr ride, but you get the iconic Hong Kong harbour view along for the ride. Get a seat near the railings and have your camera ready.

Must take Ferry. very convenient to travel cross the bay, take a night trip, very beautiful view to the skyline and usually you get a free ticket after you arrive at the airport as a welcome hongkong package.
Easy to use and great views.. We used the ferries several times. We didn't have to wait long, there were plenty of seats, and the views of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon were great.
Star Ferry. Got a free ride for using star ferry, from central to tsim sha tsui. for me using the ferry is more convenient then the mtr and more cheaper it cost only HKD 2.5.

Essential to do. This is a must-do for Hong Kong. We took the Star Ferry from Central to Kowloon which cost $2 HK (20p UK money) but be aware that the ferry back to Wan Chai is an extortionate $2.50 (25p). I'm joking of course. Very regular and a 5 minute journey. We did it at night in order to see the 'light show' (5/10) but the skyline is amazing anyway.

Hong Kong must do. Got to do it it old smelly and a short ride but it needs to be ticked off your list of things to do in Hong kong.The views / contrast looking back across to the skyscrapers is great

So much fun!. Take a star ferry across the water and take in the views of Hong Kong. They are old styled ferry's with tons of character and a huge MUST for tourists when visiting the Island. It was my first time on a ferry and I had great fun!

Must try ferry ride!. Short trip across the charming Victoria Harbour! Extremely reasonable price and frequent schedule! Good to have a ride to look around the harbour side spectacular view! Different feel for day & night ride!

Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and Back. What an awesome transportation mode to see the Hong Kong Skyline from Kowloon and the other way around! Took less than 10-minute ferry ride with good view from both sides of ferry. Very cheap, easy boarding and convenient. At Kowloon, the Star Ferry Terminal is to the right of the Clock Tower when facing Victoria Harbour, pass the Harbour Tour companies. We didn't find this easily in Kowloon because we were distracted from all the tour agents marketing their packages to us. At Hong Kong Island, the Central Terminal is a joy to visit prior to riding the Star Ferry. There are lots of interesting shops such as Buddhist book shops and activities like parks and Ferries Wheel rides. Must try to do when in HongKong. Cost us 5 HKD for two way ride per person. Kids had a blast as well as adults! Great for family.
Iconic ferry journey. About 20 pence each per journey, frequent and quick, what is there not to like about this iconic ferry ride
Very cheap and a fabulous view!. Very cheap and a fabulous view. Well worth doing. Buy a ticket when you get to the terminal on Victoria Harbour.
An Icon of Hong Kong. It is a must to visit while in Hong Kong. Easy to find & they have very helpful people to get you around

The charm of Hong Kong. Whether you are a holiday traveler or for business, take the Star Ferry whenever you can.The short journey from Hong Kong Island to Tsim Tsa Tsui brings you immediately in a different mood.You can enjoy the stunning view of the Hong Kong's skyline. You feel immediately as if you are on holidays.And do you know that there is a lower level with even cheaper price. That comes along with the sound and the smell of the engine. Believe it or not, but it has its own charm !
Very comfortable ride. A great way to cross the picturesque harbour and very cheap. Plenty of room and you can take time to talk to the locals about the sights.
HK by night. WOW. Night time trip is well worth. It to see both HK and Kowloon lights.We used the Big Bus option which included extras.

Best and economic way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Great way to travel between kowloon and Hong Kong island. Not only it is very economical (cheap), you also enjoy the beautiful harbour view during the ride. Forget about taking MTR to Hong Kong island, take the star ferry instead. I loved and enjoy the ride.

Lovely view of the city. Its a great experience to board the Star Ferry and ride between Hong Kong and Kowloon. The ferries are quite basic but very inexpensive and are a great way to see the city, particularly at night.

Get the Best Skyline View of Victoria Harbour!. I recommend Star Ferry ride for anyone that want to enjoy the spectacular skyline view which Hong Kong is famous for. Bring your camera or just a smart phone with camera to capture the ever changing skyline of this amazing city! The ferry fare of approximately 50 US cents per head for a 10 minutes slow and relaxing ferry ride will be a great break for anyone living in this busy city! For the first time visitor, take a return ride at night around 8pm when the city puts on a spectacular 15 minutes laser light-show with laser beaming and bouncing from one tall sky scrapper to another along the harbor water front. Take the upper deck with less crowd, with air condition running in summer and quieter. The fare for lower deck is approximately 30 US cents but that is where engine room is located.

Not the Fastest, but Definitely the Best Way of Crossing Victoria Harbour. There are faster ways to get across Victoria Harbour, but none will be as charming or as scenic as a ride across in a Star Ferry. Ferries may be old, and can get warm and stuffy in the summer, but the views of Hong Kong and Kowloon as the little boat chugs its way across the water is an experience that simply should not be missed.

An Essential HK Experience. I know it's just part of the public transportation system, but the Star Ferry is a very romantic part of the city.Hong Kong means 'fragrant harbor', and the ferry gives you that mixed with hurrying crowd and the laconic dock workers tying off as you reach the other side. Go at night: For five minutes, you're out the city and riding on black water between two walls of neon. My wife and I always ride it, and always take 2 beers for the trip.
Relaxing way to view HK.. Doesn't matter how many times you go on the Star Ferry you can never get bored of the views and allthat for HK$2.20!!!!!

A colonial functional vestige. If you want to experience what it was like crossing the Fragrant Harbor one hundred years back, there is no better way than taking a ride from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central on the Star Ferry!Either upstairs in the traditional seated area or downstairs next to the engine rooms, both are fantastic experiences. Personally I prefer downstairs as you are in closer proximity to the water and feel really to be part of this amazing floating metro!
The only way to travel!. Perfect way to cross the harbor. Very efficient, very cheap and great views of the harbor and the Hong Kong skyline.

Must go for hong kong Habour view. It is One Of must do activity when You visit hong Kong. Taking this ferry From tsim Sha TSUI To central, You CAN See The Nice scène Of HK Habour view, especially The night view.
Star Ferry. I have been going on Star Ferry for many years. It is a shame they moved the terminal a bit further in Central. The views are incredible, especially at night time.
A Hong Kong MUST. No matter how long I stay in HK, one day or three, I make a point of getting on the Star Ferry, giving me a chance to take in the cityscape, and the harbor. Always a must.

A must. Great way of seeing the skyline of Hong Kong and the hustle and bustle of the water. If you are using the service in the evening then just be conscious that the service finishes earlier than it might in other major cities.

Must do, if for the view. Its a Hong Kong tradition, boats are old, but perfectly safe and comfortable enough for the short journey. The photos opportunities on the boat are great with the ability see both sides

Cheap and fantastic for travelling the short distance.. This is a must when visiting HK. Its a very iconic part of hong kong and very very cheap.Really well manged and timely.really nice relaxed way to make the crossing.

Beautiful view of the harbour front. We bought big bus tickets and gained 8 single ferry tickets to cross the harbour as we were staying on the island rather than mainland we used the ferry regularly. It's such a historic part of the city and well maintained and staff know what they are doing. We also had the opportunity to have an hour long harbour cruise, where the ferry takes you further up the harbour with interesting commentary. Unless you really distest boats and cruises, then the star ferry is a MUST on the list to do!

Star Ferry!. Evergreen means of transport between Kowloon and Hong Kong, previous visit was in 1980's, this was the only means of transport, though the underwater road and rails were being built. Still as efficient as it was then!!

Enjoy the view and the breeze. A little solace of travelling in public transportation system of what otherwise would have been jostling elbow to elbow with the locals and tourists alike. On a good day, the city skylines offer a chance to do selfie or much anticipated photo opportunity for tourists.

Easy going between Hongkong Island and Kowloon. We used the ferry 2 times. Easy board and deboard. Star ferries seem to run the whole day till late night.As we got the tickets included in a package, i cannot tell anything about prices. No long waiting time. One is leaving after the other.
A short pleasant cruise. You should go at night just before sunset. The weather in the summer was excellent. This was one of the things on my list to do with my girlfriend.

Avoid the lower deck. Cheapest way to across the harbour and admire the great seaview. Avoid the lower deck because of the pungent smell (from engine or from people) and the risk of getting wet (if you stand near the edge).

Great and Cheap!. Great way to n get around in HK! You can go to so many places on these boats. Just across the water between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon or Lantau Island to see the Big Buddha which will leave you in Awe or to Lamma Island where you can tour the island and enjoy delicious local seafood. Highly recommended
Easy and fast. Fast and clean. The ferry runs every 15 minutes and it doesn't take much time to get to the other side. We enjoyed it but wished they sold cold water or beverages.

Sanctuary. From frantic Tsim Sha Tsui to ectic Wan Chai, one can enjoy a santuary of peace on the star ferry.
The best way to travel from Hong Kong to Kowloon not to mention a great way to see Victoria Harbour for an umbelievable price.

a must do attraction in hong kong. Star ferry apart from the scenic crossing, it is the cheapest mode of transportation between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. It is must do attraction for Hong Kong visitors.

Best way to cross Victoria Harbour. Even though I grew up in Hong Kong I will never get bored of crossing the harbour with Star Ferry. People had to use star ferry to cross the harbour for going to work before the Cross Harbour Tunnel was opened in 1972. People had to rush home from work when there is a typhoon, otherwise they will get stuck on either the Hong Kong Island or the Kowloon side.Now there are other ways to cross the harbour but star ferry is the most relaxing one, especially on a sunny day or in the evening. On the Kowloon side get out of Tsim Sha Tsui East exit and there's a tunnel that leads you to 2 blocks away from the ferry pier. From the Hong Kong Island side there's a footbridge from the Star Ferry Pier to International Finance Centre (IFC), and from there you can get down to Hong Kong Station which is connected to Central station underground.Tip: Go to the upper deck. There's air con at one end, the view is nicer and there's more sea wind.
Harbour cruise. Did a daytime harbour cruise. Was quite good with informative commentary and a complimentary drink and snack. Plenty of room inside or out.

Star Attraction. At the end of the day, the Star Ferry is an icon. It's a short ride you pay from a token machine or the Octopus card. It's a short ride for a quick snapshot. We walked here from Avenue of the stars and Tsim Sha Tsui

Hong Kong, again, with a modern view and old world charm. Star Ferry is one of the traditional pieces of Hong Kong which can't be missed. The wooden seats, the open air, the quick, cheap ride across Victoria - you have to do it at least once during the day and once at night for the view

Best way to view Hong Kong. If you love the sea view, its the best to travel at night time between Central and TST. And there is a laser show at 8 pm. (meh...) but the better parts is the buildings will transform into a giant LED. Price: $4 bucks.... Not USD... that's about 50 cent....
A step back in Time. This is a must see/do tradition for HK. Its so nostalgic of a bygone era. dont miss this treat, it wont be here forever!
An iconic tourist activity!. A must-do to cross form central Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. Very easy and quick, a much nicer way to get to the other side than sit in traffic in a taxi.

One of the best rides in the world.. The star ferry between kowloon and Hong Kong is one of the best and cheapest rides in the world. It is a must if you visit Hong Kong. The journey across the Harbour is one of the most exciting journeys you can make and the views of the skyline are fantastic. Upstairs is for first class passengers and downstairs is for second class passengers but enjoy the experience of both.

Scenic view. Tried this route to cross the islands out of curiosity. To be honest, this is not the fastest route, it entails a lot of walking, but it is the most scenic of them all. It was relaxing and one of a kind experience.
Cheap convenient transport. By far the value for money transport and you get to see the harbour which is a bonus, and they run frequently it's Costs about $2:50
Great views.. A cheap price for the ferry crossing with lots of great views. Well worth a trip while your in Hong Kong.

Star Ferry is Hong Kong. A Star Ferry trip is an absolute must if you visit HK. It is surely the most glamorous ferry ride in the world. I first saw the ferry in a classic movie with Orson Welles starring and promised myself one day to take the trip. Not disappointed! Serving the needs of both locals and tourists alike it is not only ridiculously cheap but also incredibly atmospheric. I always make a point of using the ferry when visiting HK.
Take the star Ferry to kwoloon by night and thank me later. Very cheap Ten minutes ride which gives an opportunity to see the amazing hong Kong skyline from many angles. Most recommended.
Love it! So retro. Fast, efficient and regular : a great way to see the sights & cross the water. A little piece of peace in the midst.

This is a must for all tourists!. For such a low price and you can traverse the famous Victoria harbour and enjoy the amazing skyline.I usually take my guests to TST and walk along the waterfront to the TST Ferry Pier. Then we will go take the Ferry from TST to across to Central and see the harbor in the daylight. Then I will take my guests to the Peak at about 5pm to catch The Peak in the daylight. Afterwards we'll have dinner at one of the restaurants at the Peak. We'll finish at about 8pm and then look at the Hong Kong from the Peak at night time. And then we will go back to Central and take the Ferry again to see the harbor at night time also.
Classic Hong Kong Ferry Kowloon to HK Island. Classic Ferry Crossing, a must experience to be front and center on one of the world's most beautiful harbours

I love love love the Star Ferry!. The Star Ferry is one of my favorite ways to feel welcomed and reacquaint myself to Hong Kong. Great views, tourist-watching and is sometimes the only place with cooling breezes!
Iconic!. Such good value! Iconic activity for tourists. Great views as you go across the harbour. Very convenient as we were staying in Wan Chai.

Economical way of exploring HK. Very Economical
Time efficient
Great view of the HongKong Harbour
Tip: The upper deck has AC on the front portion and the cost difference isn't too much
Cheap and Convenient. Its a beautiful ride across the HKG harbor..its also cheap and fast. you can enjoy the HKG skyline from the ferry and at night see the light and sound show across the harbor.

Good service and a chance to see the harbour. everything was good except the commentary on the boat as we had no idea which building or feature we were looking at. Had to ask a crew member who indicated that we had already passed it.

one word "classic". best way to enjoy hong kong skyline.
an unique and classic ride. You would be regret if you missed this ride.

Inexpensive, great way to see the city. For a normal form of public transport, this is one of the best ways to see the skyline of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. The workers still wear old English sailor suits, which adds to the charm. Use the Octopus card for ease.

Good basic service. Both the ferry and the harbour cruise were great but the commentary on the cruise could have been a bit more precise. I found myself wondering which building was being discussed....and on which side of the boat

The number one Hong Kong experience.. A great experience and an almost inevitable form of transport while you're in Hong Kong. The boats are old fashioned covered in layers of paint and varnish and give excellent views of both sides of the waterway. The cost is about 25 pence on weekdays and a bit more at the weekends. On the Kowloon side you have the Avenue of the Stars closeby where you can see the handprints of local stars such as Jackie Chan as well as memorials to Bruce Lee and other celebrities. On the Island side look out for the covered walkways which give you protection from the sun/rain for several hundred yards into the city centre.On the Kowloon side you can sit on the walkway at dusk (19.00ish) and watch the lights come on in Hong Kong Island. Possibly the best free show in the world.
Must to-do in Hongkong. Must to do in Hong Kong while enjoying the view of the City skyline.It is better to sit at the upper deck to get the better view.

A cheap and excellent way to enjoy Victoria habour. I was told this is probably the cheapest ferry ride in the world. For a nominal sum (you could buy a token or use the Octopus card), you have a choice to ride on the lower or upper deck from each side of the Star Ferry Terminal. On a lovely day, you could see the magnificent Victoria habour. Catch the ride in the late evening to see the beautiful neon lights on the buildings along the habour.

Unique to Hong Kong. Best HK$2.20 ride you could ever imagine - suggest one goes at sun down time for Hong Kong's best views. I recommend it so much that I suggest even go and come back and make it a standalone thing to do! Upper deck and lower deck have different experiences - try both!
Nice ride across the harbour. if ŷou have never had a ferry ride before you may find this ineteresting. Very cheap and something dofferent
Good. I think it is a perfect way to go from Hong Kong to Kowloon or vice. It's fast and cheap. It's convenient ;)
Splendid. Taking the ferry is fun, cheap(2.50 HKD), and you get a magnificent view of the skyline with it. So why not do it?
Use it. Cheap and easy way to cross the harbour and the locals choice of cheap quick travel. highly recommended with your octopus card
good view ate the HKG skyline from the water. Punctual, speedy, safe ferry. Tokens you buy to cross the harbour are only HK$ 2,50 per person. The view from te ferry is already worth the money.
Must go. Must take it. It's easy to take n just 10 mins ride. U can travel from IFC central to Harbour City Tst.
Cheap alternative to MTR. Very pretty at night. A nice system to use if you want to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. And it's pretty cheap as well.

floating history. Not just an easy way to cross the harbor, the Star Ferry is history. It's cheap, which is fitting for such a short ride. But the highlight is exploring the ferry boat or watching the best skyline in the world float by.
Start Ferry ride a must. Cool to ride from Kowloon to HK and take in the skyline. the boats run really regularly and are a must when visiting HK

Def a must when in Honkers. A must do to fully appreciate the Harbour. A great view day or night and a great insight into normal HK commuter living. Each time I go to HK, I always like to take a trip...
a MUST in HK. Excellent! This is a must while in Hong Kong. It's cheaper than the metro and the view is so beautiful.

A cheap yet terrific way to cross the sea. If you want to use Star Ferry (and I think you must! :D), do it after 10am because the busy hours in the morning has passed so there aren't too many people on board and you could relax and enjoy the trip and of course the view.

Best way to Chill for 10 minutes in HK. I love the Star Ferry and feel it is the best way to cross the harbor. Great for chilling for 10 or 15 minutes. If you have just done the Avenue of Stars and want to have a little rest, take the Star Ferry across to Central and then come straight back to TST. Remember to swap decks on the way back.

Don't leave Hong Kong without crossing at lest once with the Star Ferry. Although the MTR is the best way to move around Hong Kong, my favorite remains the Star Ferry.It takes you from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and vice versa. For me it's a symbol of this amazing city.

Star Ferry...terrific views day or night....and simple to use.. Signage in English and the kiosks are easy to use. The Star Ferry from Central or Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui is easy and a terrific way to see Victoria Harbor day or night for about 35 cents US. Really...that cheap. You can use tokens or the Octopus cards.It's even half price for seniors. This summer on the Tsim Sha Tsui side is a laser light show on the half hour from 8 to 10 PM, called Pulse. The LEDs in nearby buildings are also synced.http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g294217-d2482919-r293698889-Hong_Kong_Skyline-Hong_Kong.html#
a must do in HK. On our regular trips to HK we always try to include a crossing or two on the Star Ferry - is provides wonderful views of the skyline on both sides of the harbour

Star Ferry Jewel. Love the Star Ferry, still running after all these years. You can use the "Octopus Card" or use the machines near the entrance to obtain a token that is needed to enter the turnstile. The view either direction from the middle of Hong Kong harbor is worth the effort, go more than once. With the massive increase in the population and commerce of Hong Kong, I'm not sure how long these will really be in existance, use them to cross the harbor while you can.

My favorite ferry trip). The best way to get from HK Island to Kowloon. So traditional and fast..I took it in the evening and morning and it feels so different! Very cheap and people are so respectful that it makes it my favorite ferry in HK
nice way of travelling. good service all the tourist attraction cities like macau, shenzen, etc can be reached through it but not good for water phobic cause you may get sick.

Must go when you travel Hong Kong. The best way to explore Hong Kong harbor at a very reasonable cost. The better time is during sunset... or at night. Take the lower deck so that you can have a close contact with the sea.

Really Quick . We decided to take the star ferry after getting free tickets for a ferry the airport, we really enjoyed the crossing ,there was an air conditioned compartment and the seats were very clean.We missed the ferry by a minute but only 5 minutes later there was another one.Good way to get to HK island and good view of the harbour
Great way to see HK views especially at night. Great way to get from HK Island to Kowloon - cheap and use inside if not as air conditioned very regular
Always. A great way to travel over to the island at sunset - nice view as the lights are coming up, and a chance to catch a bit of a breeze tholepin cool down!

Must see Hong Kong treasure, great for kids and adults and even if boats make you sea sick. Something not to miss in Hong Kong and probably the cheapest attraction you will find on earth - for just $2 HKD you can cross the bay from Tsim Sha Tsui to Hong Kong Central station. Covered pathway from there takes you to much of the central Hong Kong or you can enjoy the air conditioning at the mall. Peak Tram is also quite a short walk from there as well.There is also a 90 minute tour of Hong Kong that you can take but I haven't done it. Even if you're sea sick and cannot tolerate bouncing on the waves this quick journey is for you.Don't let the look of the facilities on Tsim Sha Tsui turn you away from this treasure, it's absolutely worth it. Just make sure you bring some small change because I believe that the biggest currency the token dispensing machine takes is $20 HKD.

Fun transportation. I stayed in Kowloon side... walking distance from the ferry.. it is a must to take the Ferry to Hong King side.. it is definatly an interesting and fun experience. with a taxi from Kowloon to HK side it's aprox. 30 minutes. with the MTR 15-20 Minutes. with the Ferry 15-20 Min. no traffic.. and great view.Enjoy..
A Must HK Attraction!. It is a must when you visit Hong Kong for the first time! A walk on to the avenue of stars and sipping starbucks at the harbour afterwards is very refreshing!
Take 7pm ride you can see also the Laser Lighting Show. Try this traditional HK ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Wan Chai around 7pm. You can see the Laser Lighting Show

Great way to get around. If you are tired of squeezing into packed trains, consider using the ferry as your means of crossing Victoria harbour. This is an icon of HK much like the streetcars of San Francisco. It is also remarkably affordable and a great way to get around Victoria harbour

Time poor? Here's a quick fix.. So many things to see and do in Hong Kong, however you can't miss a trip on the Star Ferry to absorb this amazing city. We were fortunate to catch the sunset, which can be stunning (depending on the smog level). But it also lets you see the city come alive with all the thousands of lights in the buildings - for me makes the bustling city so much more attractive at this time of day. For a few dollars, purchase a token at Kowloon and hop across the Harbour. Stay for a drink, or have a quick walk along the island waterfront near the wheel. Great photo opportunity and good way to relax after hectic day of shopping.
Great views from the sea. We went on the 1 hour cruise option which was just enough to be able to get great views of both Hong Kong and Kowloon skylines. There is an English commentary too.

Love the Star Ferry. As we travelled in May/June, it was very hot and humid so it was nice a relaxing to travel across the harbour on the Star Ferry. Don't have to wait too long for a ferry and it's never full so you always get a seat. You can also use your Octopus card on this which is really handy.

Great historic boats. These are very old boats and a very inexpensive way to travel in hong hong. I would choose this over a taxi in a heart beat. The first time, allow a little more time to find the ferry and purchase the ticket, it can be confusing the first time

Excellent. Always worth he trip on a Star Ferry. Gives you the great feel of Hong Kong as you sail on a old Chug chug boat not sure your going to arrive.
The vies always spectacular.

Cheap way across the Harbour. It only costs a couple of HKD to take the ferry compared to HKD 10 for the MTR. The trip itself only takes a few minutes but you get a nice view as you go across.
If you travel from Central to TST, watch out for all the people trying to flog you cruises, tailored suits, fake watches etc.
Easy trip. easy and quick trip across the harbour. Good idea to have your octopus card before hand which can also be used in a few outlets

Quick and Easy. Very quick and easy, a fantastic way to get around and really be apart of the culture. It can get pretty busy, but it is a great way to be apart of the busy Hong Kong locals coming to and from work as well as spending a little time admiring the city sky-line from the water.

INTERESTING AND CHEAP PERSPECTIVE OF HONG KONG. Although the Star Ferry is now only a shadow of its former self due to reclamations, it still offers a new perspective of Hong Kong, or rather, a perspective that brings back the past. It IS better to take the upper floor option, not only for the better view, but also to get away from the diesel fumes and the like.Well worth the few cents it costs.

a cheap way to cross to the other side and have a 360 view of hong kong in 8 minutes. a great way to see a 360 degree view of hong kong city and waterway .... in 8 minutes ... and cheaply ... departs from really central locations on both sides, the hop on hop off bus stops are really close which provide an extra great way to see both sides
Sensational. Oh my goodness, the cheapest, most sensational boat trip ever. To travel from island to mainland, itd THE way to go, the views are sensational.
Great transportation from kowloon to central. We stayed in Marco Polo Hongkong, so this is great way to go to central while being able to enjoy the view from the boat.

Great views of the island from the harbour. Really cheap fares and a great way to cool off, by cruising across the harbour. Simple vending machines and a regular efficient ferry service is used by tourists and locals alike. Must do when in Hong Kong.

It is more than just a boat ride. Inexpensive way to people watch, see the harbor, feel the culture. Be sure to sit at the upper deck. If you have time, try one in the morning and one at night. The cool breeze and the neon lights made the evening/night ferry ride worth your time.
Star ferry. Hong Kong institution. Took each day as staying on Kowloon. Lowest cost ferry and scenic ++. Frequent and easy on and off.
Lovely!. Try and travel at both night and day. Don't be afraid to stand up and walk to the edge - it's well worth it.
Relax and enjoy. The best way to travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Take a step back into last century's style of travel. Relax and feel the sea breeze on your cheeks.

Take the ferry from Wanchai to tsimshatsui. With the rate HK city authorities are reclaiming land from both water-banks of Victoria Harbour, it is getting shorter for Star Ferry to reach the opposite ends. For a longer Star Ferry ride, and to see more of the city-lights of Victoria Harbour, board the one which connects from Tsimshatsui to Wanchai. One can walk to the nearby watering holes/pubs situated along Wanchai - connected by overhead walkways, bypassing the busy highways along Hennessy Road.

QUICK RIDE AT A REASONABLE PRICE TO SEETHE HARBOUR. Having taken a 48 hour package with The Big Bus Company we were provided with several free tickets to use the Ferry several time. Most enjoyable, does not take long and the views on both trips were great. The ferries run regularly and we did not have to wait for any of our trips.Highly recommended.
Hong Kong Must Do. Every trip to Hong Kong must include a harbour cruise on an iconic Star Ferry, to take in the spectacular harbour sites

A must when visiting HK - good option for photoshooting. You get great views from the boat to the city on both sides! In general the boats are a good option to travel between the island and the Kowloon side.

Ferry Ride. I'm not sure what the hype is about - the #2 best thing to do in Hong Kong? Really? Let's be honest it's a 10 minute ferry ride. Should you take it? Sure - it's cheap, it provides good views of Hong Kong and Kowloon and the nighttime light show adds some sparkle.

Perfect cheap way to see the harbour. At only HKD2 and every 10 min or so this has to be the best way to get across the harbour! We did the trip both ways, bottom and top deck, I couldn't really tell the difference the price difference is negligable though so it doesn't really matter which deck you are on.

Such a beautiful experience. Every time I land in Hong Kong, the very first thing I do is hop on a ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui and head to Central. The ferries are clean and efficient. They are so charming, with names like Morning Star and Twinkling Star. Some of these ladies are 60 years old and are very well-maintained. They are an important aspect of HK life. Don't miss out on the unique perspective of the HK skyline.
Best value activity in Hong Kong. Fantastic fun. Any time of day, always something to look at. You must ride upstairs (with the tourists) and downstairs with the locals.
Nice way to get across the river. It was pretty cool on an older feeling type of boat. Try to go across at sunset it had some amazing view across into the mountains

Romanticizing old Hong Kong. This is one living thing (attraction) that every visitor can do to be part of the Hong Kong experience. After all HK is surrounded by water. Every time I am in town, I make it an effort to ride the ferry. Just have your Octopus Card in hand and enjoy the breeze and view, sunset and night views are the best. Kowloon to Causeway bay or Central is equally as stunning. Oh did I mention it is cheaper than riding an MTR.

A must when visiting Hong Kong. This ferry voyage take som ten minutes. The ferries are old, but very charming. The view from the ferry is very good. One can decide if you want to stay on the upper or lower deck. A bit more expencive on the upper deck, but the prices does not ruin the budget anyway.Good facilities on both of the ferry terminals.

Like the Victorians did before you.... No frills needed this is a satisfying almost Victorian experience little changed over the year and every trip provides stunning views of the harbour, what more could you want. You can use an Octopus card to get through the turnstiles or purchase an adult ticket for a little over 2 bucks which is dirt cheap.Best 15 minutes of your day.

Enjoy the Ferry ride - HK to Kowloon very very cheap!!!!. An excellent service to and from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Only HK$2.50 single journey (one-way). If you have the HK Octopus card the single journey (one-way) HK$2. Amazing value!Great opportunities for plenty of pictures day or night.
something historical to preserve!. So characteristic I hope HK doesn't stop to use this kind of ferry, so historical and evocative! Cheap and in a way, romantic!
Hong Kong ferry. Great place to embark to HK island. regular trips run most of the day. Be careful of the Tailors trying to vye for business as the always seem to be hassling you.
Iconic HK. Always worth a trip across the harbour. Cheap as chips and gives a great view of harbour life. Often fairly crowded but they run at regular intervals so access is never a problem.

Star Ferries across Victoria Harbour - cheap, easy, kids love it!. The Star Ferry group run one of the public ferry services on the Victoria Harbour. There are two other services, however these operate from other areas on the harbour and also serve the long trips to outer islands and also Macau. Star Ferry pier at Tsim Sha Tsui has a number of jetties where you can catch the ferry to Central, Admiralty, North Point and more on Hong Kong island. The service is cheap and fares are one way - make sure you go to the token machines to buy your fare before attempting to gain access to the pier as the gates can only be opened once you have inserted the appropriate token for either concession (senior, child etc) or adult. If you are travelling with more than one person, you may press the "multiple" button on the machine, so you may buy all tokens at once.... a great help when you have not got the correct change !! Each pier/ferry has its own platforms. There are two - one for upper deck (take this one if you want to sit on the top floor of the ferry!!) and one for lower deck (don't worry - the lower one is just fine too - in fact not as crowded and it is not closed in, still really good!) You need to choose which one AGAIN BEFORE going through the turnstiles ! ALSO beware that if you choose upper deck platform, and go to the ticket machine here - it is more expensive than lower deck. If you buy your token on the lower deck platform, and try to go through the upper deck platform turnstiles, you WILL NOT GET THROUGH.

Star Ferry Trip. The Star Ferry is a must do in my opinion at night time. I found it magical. Hong Kong is fabulous at night and you will experience the city at its best from the sea. The "light show" starts at 8pm and for little money on the local ferry you will see all its splendour. Definitely do it and I think you will not be disappointed.
Old school experience to do. It's a must do in Hong Kong, for the boat, the experience and the view. It's super cheap, nice for photographers, and you'd really feel you're in the "old" Hong Kong
