Good enjoyable transportation. Star Ferry is one of the good experience that is in hong kong it takes you from the Kowlon side to the city side(central).You will enjoy seeing the sea and the buildings around.

Convenient, but dirty, smelly and not a good choice in rough weather. Most convenient way to get from Kowloon to HK, but dirty and smelly. Everything else is great in HK--government needs to invest in improvements in this service.

Cheap!! Cheap!! Cheap!!. Star Ferry terminal is easily located near the shopping mall, Habour City. For only HKD2 (which can be paid by the Octopus card) we can enjoy another form of transport to Central! A great first-time experience indeed!
A must do - ferry across the Harbour. This is a great way to experience the harbour with out it costing much at all. Can use your MTR card to travel across.

Good, efficient service. I've been in Hong Kong for a week and have used the star ferry several times, the boats are relatively fast, efficient, cheap and clean and there's always been plenty of seats available. I particularly like the journeys at night when you get to see both skylines lit up.

A Must Do. The old girl is over one hundred years young and still full of superlatives. First of all; it's cheap. For retirees, young children and handicappers it's almost free. The boats are so well maintained and staffed. I love the heavy ropes they use to moor the boats at both ends. Victoria Harbor is wider than it looks; maybe that's because the buildings are so high at each end. Whether it is day, night or Christmas the ride is always a treat. A visit to Hong Kong without a ride on the Star Ferry would be like a day without breathing...
Ride for picturesque view of both sides of Victoria Harbour. Convenient transportation between the islands and also an experience that is a must for al visitors!

good experience. They are just normal ferries, but good for an experience.
We took ferry back from central to Tsim Tsia Tsui after going to The Peak. Had a nice view of both banks.
HK from the water. Brilliant way to get across the water at a very small charge. Gave us a great view of both islands..

Cute boats, so cheap!. These boats are kind of old fashioned, as well as the queueing system. They are efficient, on-time and provide a beautiful view of the HK skyline. Definitely worth a few trips for the cost I would say.

Nostalgic crossing of Hong Kong harbour - beautiful. Use your octopus card here to cross the most beautiful harbour in the world! Cheap as chips!
Stunning views!
Do it by day & by night!
Why would you want to do it any other way!

A must in Hong Kong. Wonderful ride in time, very cheap, you will have great photos, great alternative to using the metro. And you do not really need to take an expensive habour cruise with this, especially if you are short of time.

A Hong Kong Icon. Both an everyday part of HK life and a fantastic tourist attraction. While the MTR and 3 road tunnels are now the easiest ways to travel between the Island and Kowloon, the Star Ferry is by far the most fun! Additionally, there are various harbour tours you can undertake on a Star Ferry, with the night tour being the most spectacular as it takes in the fantastic light shows on the buildings surrounding the harbour. Undoubtedly the number one thing you must do in Hong Kong1
Great views of the city. Fun trip across causeway bay. Very cheap and allows excellent views. A must for any trip! The boat was in good condition and felt safe.
Nice trip for small money. To overview Hongkong and Kowloon you should travel with the Star Ferry. From here you have nice views on the town and the harbour.
Iconic. You can't go to Hong Kong without a ride on the star ferry it us included on hop on hop off bus tickets and tourist card for transport on buses and trains
A must do in HK.... I will always take the Star Ferry every time I'm in HK. Although it's much easier to take the MTR but it just to re-live the experience.

Participate in the history of Hong Kong. For only 2 HKD to cross it's the cheapest way, and take part in the history of the Hong Kong. Also if you do it at night you get to enjoy the skylines of Hong Kong (both sides)

Star Ferry. One of my favourite things in Hong Kong. A little bit of yesterday, this gentle and charming way to get across the sea to the main land. They also do a Star Ferry tour which is well worth it.a different way to see some of the sights!!

Awesome way to see Hong Kong and so cheap. I used the Star Ferry on numerous occasions during my visit to Hong Kong. They run every few minutes offer fantastic views of both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon and the harbour itself for hardly anything cost wise. This is one of things anyone with a bucket list must have on that list. Coming to Hong Kong is awesome and something I would recommend to anyone and to visit without travelling on the Star Ferry is a no brainer.It takes just a matter of minutes to cross the water (hence my frequent use) but it is a fabulous experience.

Classic hong kong harbour trip. The star ferry is great, and takes you ask to how things were in th e old days in what is now such a modern city. Open air ferry allowing you wonderful views of the harbour. It's a quick trip, but so easy and cheap, my favorite way to cross the harbour.
Cheap transport. Cheap transport.My toddler loves using this ferry We can sight seeing Hong Kong from harbour side

A breathtaking view for $2 HK. Go at night. The lights of HK and Kowloon's buildings reflected in the harbor are mesmerizing. I first learned of the Star Ferry as a child, more than 50 years ago, in Nancy Drew book which took place in HK. "Nancy took the Star Ferry to Kowloon." I though this was the most exotic thing ever. Well, a half century later, it did not disappoint!
Awesome short trip for almost no cost!. I love this short boat ride for the unique view of the city from a boat on the water! It costs very little, and definitely worth it!

Quick, smooth sailing. While waiting for the ferry can be cramped and hot, once on the ferry you can choose to sit in the air conditioned section. The ferry is a quick ride from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon or back.

cheap and regular. We got to the terminal and a ferry was waiting so we got straight onto the ferry, as we were pulling out the ferry on the opposite side was just pulling in, we had the correct fare to put in the machine.we were also lucky as there was a cruise liner docked, right next to us, the water way was very busy with great views, a worth while journey.

Excellent Service. It is so very convenient and a very reasonable way to get across the Harbor to the Hong Kong side from Kowloon. It has been running for over 65 years, I know because I lived in Hong Kong as a child and was born there.
good transport. very clean toilets, would love to travel, good service,friendly staff, ready to help, it is a local transport and cheapest too.

Excellent. The ferry service for 2.5 HKD is excellent value for money Under 10 minutes from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon.
I also took their one hour tip which was very good.
All the boats are clean and staff is very good.

Fun but choppy !. Really enjoyed this trip and we got lots of pictures around the trip.
Would say that I took travel sickness tablets as a precaution before the trip , as it was a bit choppy at times.
This made the trip really fun for me and my husband.

Just a quick ride. Everyone said I needed to try the Star Ferry that is was amazing. I paid, I stood in line, I got on board, we crossed the water. The views were nice, but it was nothing special. Worth one trip, but not a tourist attraction, just a mode of transportation.

The place to go for Macau. The only way to go to Macau is through ferry. In Hong kong, there are 2 ferry ports, one in Hong Kong Island and the other one in Kowloon island. The Hong Kong ferry terminal is 24 hours so when u don't want to stay over at Macau, u can take ferry back to Hong Kong at anytime as the ferry leaves at an hourly basis. So if u stay at a Kowloon Island hotel, u can take a cross harbour taxi from Hong Kong island ferry terminal. Be sure to look out for cross harbour taxis or else u have to pay for their return cross harbour toll fees. This is the only way to go to Macau from Hong Kong

Nice experience. We got Star Ferry return tickets included in our Big Bus Tours tickets. The Ferry itself was very clean and very comfortable. Its a new experience for our daughter. Anyway if you want to buy tge ticket, its sold over the harbour tour ticket counter at Tsim sha Tsui. Prepare your money in HKD. A single ride day round day ticket costs HKD 90.

A most try attraction and enjoyable mean of transport. The Star Ferry is one of the cheapest form of transport you could enjoy in Hong Kong. Very nostalgic and romantic journey from Tsimshatsui to Central. The ferry is virtually the same in appearance for over fifty years and as efficient as ever.

Cheap Ride. The cheapest tourist transport anywhere...although there is of course also the HK city tram. The ferry is neither modern nor entirely comfortable, but it's intended as a means of residents getting across to and from work, and for tourists it still provides a fantastic and inexpensive opportunity to take a trip across the harbour, with the magnificent views on each side!

Cross the harbour with a view. The Star ferry has it all, the smells of the sea, the feelings of an ancient cross before the subway and the under sea tunnels, feels more an island and a peninsula... Do it after sunset. If by 20:00 then you'll also enjoy the HK buildings lights and colours show.

Nothing special. Well I dont know about anyone else, but I think it's really nothing special. I use it in the morning and at noon and it's not more than just a ferry ride. Try use it at night, since people said that it's much better since you can see the beautiful skyline of Hong Kong in both side.

Worth every Hong Kong dollar. We decided to do the Day Harbour Tour on our first morning in Hong Kong. The ship was comfortable ,with seats both indors and on the deck . We went around 11:00 o'clock expecting a long queue, but there was no queue at all. It was a wonderful tour aboard the Shining Star.
Bargain Harbour Cruise. Great to get away from the crowds and enjoy a cross harbour ferry trip. Only a few dollars and a quick and enjoyable trip.

A must-do trip for any visitor to Hong Kong. This is probably one of the World's best ahort ferry trips - either from Central or Wanchai to Tsim Sha Tsui (Kowloon). It can be appreciated both during daylight hours and also in the evening, particularly when the Light Show is on.Another plus point is that the trip is very low cost - in fact for anyone over 65 it is absolutely free!

Rickity Fun !. A quick trip between Kowloon and Hong Kong, fun to be in the middle of the mash of water traffic in 'busy town'. Boats are ancient but seemed safe. We got a bunch of free passes for this from our Red Bus tour agent and so we hopped on and off with lots of freedom.
It's a good experience!. This ferry will take you from HongKong to Kowloon or vice versa. It's nothing special but it is good to experience it, just once.

Interesting way to get around in HK. The octopus card can be used to travel on the Star Ferry and is a great way to see the Victoria Harbor lights at night if timed well while traveling from Tsim Sha Sui in Kowloon to Hong Kong.

Cheap transportation, priceless experience. You can enjoy the great view of the Victoria Harbour at maximum HK$3.4 (US$0.5), with the breeze from the sea in winter or cool air in the air-conditioned part of the ferry (on either the front or the back part of the upper deck) in summer. The only bad thing is the ride is too short (around 5 -10 min).Tips: take a ride at the sunset and another at night for the view of skyline of Hong Kong.
the harbour views. used only once - as the trains suited our needs more. it is noce to sit back and enjoy the views of the harbour. It was bit of calm before we had to deal with all the people around

Best way to travel in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is a great way to travel around Hong Kong. It's fast and affordable and you get fantastic views of Victoria Harbor. The best way to travel while in Hong Kong in my opinion.

A must-see experience. No visit to Hong Kong can be complete without some kind of ferry trip to somewhere. There are multiple ferry terminals with hundreds of ferries sailing to dozens of short-hop destinations, many used by daily commuters. Try to site by the window. Rear seats also seem to have a smoother ride.

Really cheap with great views. Fast, very cheap and with great views.
From Central to Tsim Sha Tsui (Kowloon) for 2HKD, and from Tsim Sha Tsui to Wan Chai fro 2.5HKD.
Iconic ride. Great ride across the harbour and you can use your Octopus Card. On the ferry it is easy to see the vast array of sea going vessels as well as the amazing Hong Kong skyline.

Higly reccomended transportation means.. Fantastic easy fast and safe transportation from one island to the other. Don't miss it's service. If you missed one , wait few minutes and the next one arrives fast.

Best way to see the skyline cheaply. This five-minute ferry ride is probably the best value-for-money you will get in the whole city. For $2.50, you ride across the harbour and see the skyline on both sides. Definitely worth doing at night, but also interesting in the day.

An experience not a must try. The view was quite nice and luckily it was not crowded.
I would say, this was an experience but not a must try for tourists though.
Cheap and Iconic. There isn't much to this other than an average ferry ride but it is cheap and when the weather is right, some great views on Hong Kong!
EFFICIENT CLEAN.. This is a good way to see the area as well and with the Big Bus Tour Fee night Tour well worth to see night lights

Fantastic view for cheap!. It's a very short ferry ride but the view is absolutely outstanding! Someone else recommended going to the lounge on a pier 7 to enjoy the views. Skip it! The views are better on the ferry and public piers, and you'll avoid high priced drinks. $8 USD for a club soda....c'mon!

Best way to see skyline for virtually nothing. Ploughing back and forth between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon the price of the ticket is well worth it. Great opportunities to take photos and to see Hong Kong. Only pity is that with all the reclamation it is a much shorter ride than in the past.

A little bit adventurous trip across the bay in Hong Kong. Just if You start to proceed from the corner of Nathan Road and Salisbury Road, first glancing at the extravagant Hotel " Peninsula" with its characterstic green ornaments on the facade( the landmarks of the famous company Rolls - Royce -Bentley), and all the time in direction of the west, before long, You'll get to the Star Ferry Pier.Here is located the "Star" Ferry Company, that is, the passenger ferry service operator.It carries You every day, several times during the day, across the Victoria Harbour, from the Kowloon to Hong Kong Island.There are twelve ferries in the fleet. What I suggest You, is to be on time for departure or returning from Island ,with proper bought tokens, since it might be a confused situation, if You've got by mistake some other ticket and go to some other place,also across the waters of the Harbour.Whole thing is in the fact, that exist the two Piers, from which the Ferries undertake their voyages toward the Hong Kong Island.Usually, they ( the ferries) are the green and white coloured, also the red ones are in the traffic. They have got two decks, upper and lower, and naturally all the tourists rush, if they only could take the places on the upper deck. And when You get to the goal,either on the Island or at the Piers of the Star Ferry, there is a crew, that is in the charge to moor ferry at the metal deck on the shore ( the piers) with the billhooks.The views around You, while You're floating on the ferry, are fantastic, specially in the evening hours, with all these scintillating lights, coming from the skyscrapers on the Island and from buildings in Kowloon, as well.So with some light drink and camera to take shots for the memory, we have had really good time.

nice, cheap, but preferred MTR. Star Ferry is something visitors should experience, but not have high expectations. This is still very much a form of public transport. Views are great, but ferry's don't compete with MTR for convenience and speed. Nor are they in the shape that would compete with other, more modern ferry services in HK. So something to experience, but no desire to repeat.

Lovely way to travel or just take in the sights. I'd gone on the 1 hr Star Ferry cruise which was excellent. You can go out on deck or sit inside the air-conditioned surrounds and take in the sights of never ending skyline. The cruise also entitles you to a snack and a drink. I found it a really relaxing and enjoyable trip.

Never tired of it!. By far my favorite mode of commute in Hong Kong. I love it and I know I'm not alone! I've lived in Hong Kong 3 years and I still take it from time to time and enjoy it. Upper/lower deck is not really different in terms of the view you get, so it's not necessary to pay extra for upper deck.Also, having an Octopus card helps - ticket is cheaper and you don't need to wait at the ticketing machines to get tickets.
A little hop. A little hop across the water. Brilliant service, on time a very interesting journey from the harbour, it also services other stops up the river. Scenery is great.

Character filled ride!. I really like taking the Star Ferry when I am in Hong Kong. The ferry's are full of character down to the deck hands wearing the Star Ferry uniform. It is very cheap and easy to use. It is a nice way to cross the Victoria Harbour.
Simple. What a simple cheap and easy way across the water.Many tourists and locals alike use this .Water not as as choppy as it looked .

Cheap Cruise. A highlight of the trip jump on a ferry at any time and enjoy one of the best harbour cruises of all time. The views of the Kowloon and Hong Kong are outstanding. Make sure you do a night crossing.

On Sail. I am very much inlove of the service that Star Ferry accommodated us during our recent trip. It was close to a real cruise seeing the beauty of the facade of HK's best architectural crafts along Tsim Sha Tui. It was also well organised from getting onboard the ship from ticket booth and upon boarding. Thumbs up to Star Ferry! :)
yes its historic but. Very nice touristy things to do and cheap, but would recommend a sunset junk boat ride instead, you set the city's lights come alive

Spectacular scenery and cheap. A cheap must do activity in Hong Kong. Grab a coffee and sit back and enjoy your trip across the Harbour. It is great fun, especially the seats which can turn around in one quick flick of the hand. A must do.
star ferry. Must visit it. Combines the Central part hong Kong Islkand an the Kowloon island. Views are great. Must not miss it.

Excellent value!. This is a very cheap and convenient way to cross the harbour. It costs under £1 return which is amazing value and far more interesting than the train. Take the top deck at night to get some awesome photos of the waterfront. It can be a little busy as it is popular with locals and tourists alike, but it is definitely the best way to cross the river!

Beautiful views . If you can get a seat on the upper deck close to a window, you'll have gorgeous views. We did the Tsim Sha Tsui to Wan Chai at sunset, went and had dinner, and then did the Central to Tsim Sha Tsui at night. Both trips offered great photo opportunities and time to take in the harbour views.
An Absolute Must Do!. Beautiful old boats! An absolute must do and as with everything in Hong Kong, they run like clockwork!

excellent way of transport. I always use the star ferry when I'm going from Kowloon to otehr side of the bay. You could always use the subway or taxi but this is the quickest, easiest and cheapest way to go. You also manage to do a little sightseeing while crossing the harbour. Also quite easy to go with a baby in a stroller. Some stairs, but just ask someone for help. Remember to bring small coins as the trip is arund 2,5HKD

Truly a Must Do. The Star Ferry has been around a lot longer than I have (i.e., a long, long time). Although transit between Wan Chai, Kowloon, and Central district is just a few minutes in duration, the views are spectacular. Do this one.

Star Ferry Wonderful. The Star ferry is an excellantt way to travel across the bay to Hong Kong Island, There are a lot of people who use this mode of transport you stand waiting for the gate to open there suddenly everyone runs to get on. My husband and I kept laughing as they were like fleas jumping from one seat to another, when we got to Hong Kong (there was a line like you use at races where it rises up and horses go), Star Ferry stops gate on ferry opens people start to stand and walk over to get off when suddenly line raises up and everyone runs like wild horses.we thought it was. Very funny. The crossing was very quick and smooth would do it again.

Great sea ride to Kowloon. A Star ferry ride back and forth during the day and at night provides completly different perspective on vibrant HKG. This is an absolute, easy and cheap must to discover HKG. You cannot go wrong !
Good value!. An amazing ferry service for less than a £1 return! You get to see the harbour and mix with the locals!
All aboard!. This is one of the things that made Hong Kong so famous in the first place. Its a must to, and its penny's to ride across both ways. Make sure you do this!!

Simple and quick. This way of travelling is cheaper then taking the subway and it is a very simple and well organized. If you have a Octupus card (travel card, where you can buy at all the 7 elevens or at the Customer Service Center at the subway stations around Hong Kong) it is even more convenient I think, especially if you need to catch a boat quickly. If you are in Hong Kong and need to get to either Kowloon or Hong Kong Island, then you definitely need to try this ferry.

Cost effective and scenic. It is a less than 10-minute boat trip.Great scenery of Victoria Harbour.Suggest you to take the boat at 8pm. Then you can enjoy the light show at the ferry. Very cheap price for one trip. Just 2 to 3 dollars.If you are afraid of the noise and smell created by the engine, take upper deck.Otherwise I suggest you take lower deck for better view.

Nice view. Nice view and very easy to go by. The price is also good. The way to walk to the pier is also very easy. Take this as 1 option transportation during you visit in Hong kong. No need to use only MRT

Really inexpensive way to see the Hong Kong Skyline!. You can't beat a trip on the classic Star Ferry as a cheap and fun way to get great shots of Hong Kong and TST skylines. Make sure you board to go upstairs and sit near an open window for the best views and all for less than $1 USD!

Great alternate way to cross between TST and Central. A must try for all visitors! A cheap 10 min ride brings you from the Central Business Area of HK to the glitzy area of Tsimshatsui. Nice view of the harbour instead of taking the subway with no views.
Cheap, Fun and Easy Way to Transfer Between Hong Kong and Kowloon. The ferry ride only costs about $2.50 HKD each way and it offers great views of Hong Kong Central and Kowloon. Even better at night.

Great way to travel in HK. Wonderful service to Hong Kong - they run on time and give beautiful views of the city. Be sure to buy an Octopus Card (Metro Card) as it makes travel on the Ferries and MTR much more convenient.

Another way to enjoy Hong Kong skyline. The ferry offers another way to cross Harbor of Victoria and costs far less than MTR. At night you can see the skyline on the Hong Kong side, just like what is put on the postcards.On the arrival side of Hong Kong, there are a few public transportation options available close by. If you are familiar with the area, you can find bus. The other side of the ferry line is in Tsinsatsui (TST) and just next to the popular shopping district in Kowloon.However, it would be a quite hot ride in summer because lower deck seats are not air-conditioned. Diesel smell might be another uncomfortable experience if you are sensitive to it.
Good service.. A good way to cross them harbour. The ferries run regularly and are efficient. We never waited more than 10 minutes for one.

OLD FASHIONED CLASSIC EXPERIENCE. Feel like a blast from the past? - then jump on the Star Ferry - an ancient ferry, that has been an icon of Hong Kong for many years. As the ferry slowly ambles across the harbour, you have many opportunities to photograph the skyline of Central.

Nice experience. You can take other vehicle to cross, but this slow boat will give you another unique experience. It is located near 'the happening' area in HK, so it must be not too hard for foreigner to find it out.
Great Ferry Ride!!!. it's the absolute best way to get from Hong Kong to Kowloon. Never traffic, short and incredible view!
Fun!. So fun and easy to take and just 4HK$. The front of the ferry is closed off and has A/C, but having the breeze was nice as well.
Must do, cross the river with Star Ferry... Must do, take the upper de k for good viewing. Don't sorry about the cost, only HK$ 2,5 for an adult. Elderly/children enjoy a discount.

Take a ferry instead of Taxi for the beauty of HK. Its much cheaper and better view if you use the ferry than to use road to explore the beauty of HK.
Close to nature and locals, you get to see it all in a small time and price.
Go for it.

Iconic. If you come to HK and don't take the ferry , I don't get it. It has always been the best view of both skylines at once, cost a few cents, and always has a bit of atmosphere. The ferries have been here forever and have changed little over my forty years of coming here. Lots of things change in HK good to still be able to capture a little of the history here

The best skyline view. A ride on the star ferry costs next to nothing and will give you the best view of the Hong Kong skyline you can get. You may also catch a glimpse of the cultural heritage of the city with the odd passing fishing boat.

Great ride for couple of yuans. It is amazing how you can experience such a nice ride with lottle money. This is a MUST!!! You get to see the skyline and cross to Kwoloon area for shopping and fun! Make sure to stay by the harbor area by 7 and wait to see the skyline lights show...just incredible and for free!!!!

Stary Ferry is a star of Hong Kong; be sure to take a few rides. In the few years we have left before they pave over the harbor completely and we're walking from Central to Tsimshatsui, make sure you do a few trips on the ferry, which just costs a couple of HK dollars. Everybody is on there, from the violinist drinking a beer after his concert, going home, to the executive, to the door man at the Marriott, to the students holding hands, and so on. The Hong Kong skyling is striking and this is one way to see it, nearly for free. The ride used to take seven minutes, now I think we down to a reduced 3.5 minutes, but however short it is, you must do it -- several times if you can. A Hong Kong top ten thing. Related: on the tsimshatsui side, take a walk on the raised walkway to the east of the ferry station: good views and photo ops for shots of the harbor. Enjoy.

Perfect view on skyline. A cheap way to chanhe the side with a great view on the skyline.
I prefer the star ferry to any tourist boat it just feels more real.

If not to cross over, experience it for amazing views. Star Ferry ride is an experience by itself. It has amazing views of the skyline. Even if you don't need to take the ride to cross over, this ride is a must experience. Best done at night where the lights and the reflection in water add to the scenic beauty,

old hong kong. I remember taking the Star ferry in 1994 during a typhon. What an experience! Today, things are more modern and efficient. the boats seem a little bigger and the harbor seems a little smaller. Still I cannot imagine going to Hong Kong and not taking the ferry at least once. The views to both banks (HK Island and Kowloon) are magnificent and you are continuing a tradition that I hope will never disappear.
Nice experience. Easy and nice! It is easy to get on and off and cheap as well, much better than cabs and you get to see the beautiful water as well!

A cool ride. Friends visiting from Honolulu took the Star Ferry's hour-long Harbor Tour. But my friends and I took the Star Ferry from Central or Wanchai to Tsimshatsui and back whenever we had the chance. Not only is this the cheapest way to cross the harbor but it is a good way to avoid the crowded MTR and the cool breeze beats the freezing air conditioning in the cross-harbor tunnel buses.
Star ferry. The Star ferry was very close to the Royal Pacific Hotel.You never had to wait for a ferry. The trip from Kowloon to Hong Kong island was very quick.

Best way to experience the Harbour view !. Should take the ferry between Tsim Sha Tsui to Central, upper level is better, the near our view is stunning and ferry fare is very cheap, no need to take tourist cruise for the harbour view, those cruises are just for tourist, too way expensive !

icon of hong kong. Highlight for adults and kids alike. Note that there are 2 classes - upper deck which costs more and sometimes has a air con room (closed windows) and lower deck which is all open. Actually prefer lower deck - can only access if you enter at right place- check before you buy your tokens. Great views, short ride.
What a view!. We went on the ferry in the middle of the day. There were no crowds. The skyline views were spectacular, but the trip across the harbour was over far too quickly.

must do ferry ride in Hong Kong. The ride between Tsim Sha Tsui and Central in the Star Ferry is a must do for visitors to Hong Kong. It gives you excellent views of the famous HK harbour for about 40 US cents. Even if you are not heading to the other side of the harbour, it is worth taking a return journey just for the views. You don't have to join the expensive harbour cruise to have similar fun and enjoyment.

Do it when in Hong Kong!. Loved the Star Ferry service. Efficient, scenic and yes, the thing to do when in Hong Kong. Took our best pictures from these boats. I hope the weather is going to be as nice for you as it was for us!
Speedy and Cheap. It only cost us 2HKD to cross the sea from Hong Kong Island to Hong Kong. What really impressed me was that we could use our Octopus card to pay for our trip.

Must try. Cheapest way to get to HK island. Very nostalgic and old. Very calm ride. Not bumpy. The view is definitely breath taking. Don't worry abt no seats. It's safe to even stand through out the ride.

Fun!. The cheapest way to go from TST to Central. Moreover the fastest, I think. The ride was a breeze. Really very hard to believe an old boat is able to function so well. It cost HKD2.5 only! Must try if you wanna go to Hong Kong Island!
Harbour view. A great way to take a ride, 10 ~ 15 mins cheap way to go across the harbour, and to experience the british hong kong

Waste of time and money. Went on the hour tour round the harbours. It's an hour of my life I won't get back. The 'tour' consisted of going round in a wide circle to the other bank, do dock, drop off/pick up and finish the wide circle, except today the ferry was in collision with a smaller boat .....this then ensued a 10 minute discussion ( I think) about who was in the wrong. It was comical at best, annoying at worst. The crew weren't really interested in the passengers and like me look like they didn't want to be there. From a purely sight seeing interest it's ok but anything more than that it's horrible. The boats themselves are 50 yrs old or more and not really comfortable to sit down on for more than 10 mins. A great disappointment for such a hyped attraction for Hong Kong

Too fast at first!. A boat shuttle service plying between Central and Star ferry Pier.For a few HK$s jump on the ferry boat and cross the harbour, 10 mins(more or less) The view of HK shipping is visible, but the sites along both sides of the harbour is WOW at first, but this diminishes after a while. Go upstairs for a better view. You will be awe inspired at first look!
Cheap and great views. Try the journey and enjoy. Do a video of the harbour, you won't be sorry. Would go on the ferry again tomorrow, if given the chance and cost - not a lot.
Convenient travel across to Hong Kong Island. The ferry is a convenient, cheap and quick way to travel across to Hong Kong Island. The view was great of both sides looking from the harbour.
EZ. Great views and very inexpensive. Great way to cross the harbor. Quick, easy and fun. Figuring out the ticket machines is a piece of cake. A must do on any visit to Hong Kong

Great fun and a bit of jistory. For les than £0.50 travel across on one of these iconic ferries. Mixed with locals and tourists, the hustle and bustle to get and and off is part of the fun. The turn around time is so quick you could. It's one if you blink, but it's ok they are so regular and reliable you will be across soon. In less than 10 minutes and with great sky line and harbour line views take your camera, a must for all.

A beautiful way to start a day even if it is crowded. When visiting Hong Kong it is a must to take at least one Star Ferry ride.It is not expensive and very pleasant and faster than a Taxi to go from one side to the other of Hong Kong. It takes around ten minutes to cross but you do have to wait for maybe five or ten minutes for the Ferry to land and off load so you can board

Convenient!. We rode the star ferry every day to get back and forth across the Hong Kong harbor (5 minute ride). It was very easy to purchase an "octopus pass" which allowed us to easily use the ferry and the train at any time.
Travel like a local. I first used this by mistake and found it a great way to see Hong Kong from the water, cheapest deal in town and well worth it eveyr time.

Cheap, Good, Efficient and Convenient. Excellent way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong island. Regular service and cheap. Quality of ship is poor but value for money and the journey is too short to cause any concern. Ship is double deck and boarding at two level. Nice view of water front while on board. A must visit to understand daily life of HK people.

Cheap travel. Very cheap whether you are just crossing the harbour or going further afield to outlying islands. Basic but what do you expect for a £0.20 ($0.30) price -and that's the more expensive upstairs.Approximately 12 trips an hour for the basic journey from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui
The classic Star Ferry Ride accross the harbour. I enjoyed doing this classic Hong Kong Adventure. I was solo and I found it easy to jump on, see the harbour and return for very little money!

A bit of history. The Hong Kong Island to Kowloon ferry has been carrying passengers since 1888. It is a really short ride, probably around 10 minutes, but is fun and cheap and the breeze from the ocean is a welcome respite from the heat. An evening trip will give you great photo ops with all the lights........

A must do when in Hongkong. Everyone who goes to Hongkong for the first time goes across to Kowloon or vice versa on the Star Ferry. It is cheap and if you have an Octopus card it can be used to pay, great view of the harbour and the Island for a photo session
Holiday. At the ferry. Super cool we are at the super class with food.very nice. we have internet too.that when we went to macau
Iconic. Great way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. And so cheap!!! Good way to view both skylines - both day and night.

Cheap, quick and efficient. Used the ferry to get from TST to Hong Kong Island one night rather than getting the MTR. It is ridiculously cheap (under $2AU), clean and comes very regularly. We went as the light show was on too so got a great view from the top deck.

You must try otherwise u will absolutely miss it!. Star ferry is one of the famous attraction in HK. The ferry is operate everyday between Tsim Sha Tsui and Central or Wan Chai area. During the short journey, u can feel exciting as u can see the beautiful sightseeing of Kowloon & HK island side. Especially the night time period. Of course , don't forgot to ready your camera and pose to take the picture.
Cheap!!!. I use it always if I can't get a taxi or my friends are to busy to catch me up somewhere.It is very good for travellers too. I recommend it!
Priceless. Scenery was amazing. We went on right as the light show was going on and fetched some amazing pictures. Recommendation: sit on the open upper deck on the right side

Never changes. Star Ferry is as it was and probably ever will be. No frills, just an efficient ferry service. This visit we took a habour tour which was very worthwhile and you slowly progressed around the harbour with full commentary. Very good.
Quick and handy. A great way to get back and forward between Hong Kong island and Kowloon. It's relatively cheap and is fast and regular.
nice way to get across. The boat itself seemed old but trustworthy and a nice view of Hong Kong. We sat on the bottom deck. The ride would've been about 5-10 minutes. -not good if you get sea sick.
Unusual. We are used to Fullers and found them unfriendly and although there were drinks available no food. Views were great despite smog
Must do. This is so cheap to do yet gives you both a taste of old Hong Kong and amazing views of the city. Do it during the daytime and also at night when the lights are dazzling.

Cheap and efficient . Used the star ferry nearly every day on our holiday, never had to wait more than 5 mins for a ferry. People got on quick and same getting off, so no delays and the pice was so cheap !! Recommend using between TST and Central, plus you get great views

Great fun and really inexpensive way to travel and see the sights!. Great fun and really inexpensive way to travel and see the sights! Get a great view of both sides of the river. We used it several times during our week's stay, both during the day and then at night to see the lights of Kowloon and the Island, and also the light show. Highly recommend.

is this the best value journey on the planet. ive used the ferry hundreds of times over the years and the views still excite me day and night. arguably the best value ride on the planet. in summer use compartment on upper deck at front. you will enjoy the a/c.
Alternative way of crossing a harbour. Not the best but alternative way of crossing a harbour. Some of the ferries might take you to the your chosen place on the island quicker than metro system

Hong Kong Icon. You have to take a trip on the iconic star ferry. Easy entry with your Octopus card and yet another great photo op in Hong Kong.
Lovely around sunset and must be the cheapest transportation in Hongkas.

Cheap and iconic part of Hong Kong - a must do!. We travelled a couple of times using the star ferry crossing from the island side to the Kowloon side. It is cheap and provides a fantastic view of the harbour. It is a short ride (around 10 minutes) and everyone races on to get a good seat - so when in Rome.....A very enjoyable part of your Hong Kong experience - not to be missed.
Best value in Hong Kong. A must to do, ride from Central or Wanchai to Kowloon, take in all of the sites and see the bustle of the harbour and the amazing skyline

Leisure moment. There are several routines travelling by the ferry, the shortest will be between Tsim Sha Tsui to Central, another one will be Wanchai to Tsim Sha Tsui. Both take around 5-10 mins or less due to the Victoria Harbour becoming narrower.It is nice to enjoying another boat trip to other islands, eg Lantau Island, Lama Island and Cheung Chau Island etc. The travelling time is around 30 mins - 1 hr approx.

Nostalgic. Very much the same nostalgia as traveling in Bus 28 in Lisbon: it has just about always been there, it does its job well and a modern replacement will never offer the same experience. And it costs almost nothing to use.

Ferry Ride. If you are staying in Kowloon and want to go to Victoria I advise taking the Ferry. There are traffic jams getting in and out of the tunnels and stuck in traffic can be costly. There are views up and down the Harbour for photos. Buy a token and board stand back and you won't be pushed around. It's only a very short trip and the Harbour is quite choppy and the ferries are not very stable.

cheapest scenic ride i ever took!. ok this has got to he a HK highlight, its been featured on films. you get the best views for an enjoyable quick ride across the harbour from central to tsim sha tsui. i have tried this so many times hehehe

The Silver Star. When it was possible I liked taking the Star Ferry to destinations. Being so hot in Hong Kong it was a nice way to casually travel between Hong Kong island and Kowloon, and travelling to Lantau Island was delightful both day and night, giving a different perspective of the islands inbetween, and an opportunity to see things that you would otherwise miss if you only took the trains or buses. The breeze you get from this open travel makes the journey so refreshing. I think its important to try out everything when on holidays. All the star ferries have their own names, and its fun to remember the journey as something particular to each ferry. I love how the backs of the seats are interchangeable so that you can always face whichever way you prefer to. The star ferries are always on my to-do list when I am visiting Hong Kong. Remember to put it on yours.

A short but important ferry. It was a short but pleasant journey across the harbor, from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. It is a system that has been used for years and although there is now faster ways it has to be experienced if you visit Hong Kong.

Scenic 5 minute ride at Victoria. This is a regular scenic boat trip around 5 minute trip to Hong Kong side from Kowloon. The other direction is towards Wan Chai where the HK Convention and Exhibition Center is located. Wan Chai area is more office shops than shopping like Nathan in Kowloon. Cost of the trip is very cheap and the boat schedule is very regular and frequent. Never miss to take this iconic HK ride.
Hard to believe it is so cheap!. At $2.50 HKD, really amazing how cheap the ride is considering the convenience and views of the harbour and skyline - a must do!

A Hong Kong Icon.. Did you ever see The World of Suzie Wong?The opening sequence takes place in the ferry, from Kowloon to Hong Kong.It is a beautiful ride. The experience is timeless and the opportunity to see this magnificent city from the water is something anyone visiting Hong Kong can't simply let go.
Fun relaxing ride. You can take the Star Ferry across the bay for just about .30 cents. It's about a 15 minute ride and nice breeze and great site seeing. Night time is fun there.

Cheap, Fast and Efficient!. This was definitely the cheapest form of transport which I encountered in Hong Kong. Just $2.50 HKD per ride and takes you to all the key areas in a short space of time. It’s excellent for relaxing, people watching and sightseeing and I would highly recommend it. No wonder it’s rated as the #2 thing to do in Hong Kong!

Very relaxing trip from Kowloon to Hong Kong. I like to take the ferry across the harbor if I am not in a hurry, It's a Very relaxing trip from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Enjoy the harbor view. It's quite inexpensive, quite an experience.

Star Ferry ride to Avenue of Stars. For just HKD2, one gets to enjoy the beautiful coastal sights of Hong Kong, which are particularly beautiful and spellbounding at night. It is a short ride but so delightful.

The best way to cross harbour!. It is cheap! Just around HKD3 per trip from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central or turn around ( which usually costs at least HKD9 by MTR or Bus ). Taking ferry is always enjoyable!

The way less traveled way but definitely the most fun way.. If you want to go to Kowloon from HK Island or vice versa Star Ferry is the best way to go. A short trip but the historic Star Ferry has operated since 1888. If I recall correctly they also do a short tour of the Harbour. Take it at night for a really amazing experience.
Experience. Went in for the experience. It's a bit slow and by that, you can enjoy the view and the experience. It's really cheap. Must try, if you're in HK.

Nostalgic!. We last caught the Star ferry in 1980. We looked forward to doing so again and were not disappointed. We were outside peak hour and used the crossing to photograph the city skyline. The change was amazing but the ferry was the same.

A must see in Hong Kong. If you are in Hong Kong make sure you at least take one trip across the harbour. It is such an amazing experience and you will have brilliant photos. The crossing is very cheap and totally worth it. Obviously no need to worry about seasickness as it is only a 10 minute ride. It's very much fun and on both sides there is lots to do!Take a camera and be prepared to take some awesome shots of Hong Kong

The cheapest harbor cruise in the world. Star Ferry is convenient, cheap (USD 0.30) per way for around 15 minutes trip and consists of both out door and air conditioned indoor. Smoking is not allowed in both cabins. It is a great way of experiencing Victoria Harbor from a boat and also free the breeze in your face. You can board from either the Kowloon side or Central side. Highly recommended for people who wants to feel the harbor breeze but do not want to stay too long on a boat.
A short ride but a historical one. Great views as your sail across the harbour. Something quite romantic about the whole thing. I always take it at least once whenever I visit.
Inexpensive and fun trip. Great views of skyline and of Harbor. Ferry terminal on Hong Kong side is in walking distance to subway for additional transportation needs
Slow boat to Kowloon/Hong Kong. whether you're staying on Hong Kong Island or on the Kowloon side, a trip across the harbour on the Star Ferry is a lovely way to see the city skyline.

Don't miss. Just got to do this. Cheap convenient and fun. Take your cameras. The top deck has an air conditioned section at the front at no extra charge if you need to cool down and still enjoy the view.
Its the Star Ferry!!. I could ride it all day! The kids loved it, infact we took 2 or 3 trips to places we didn't need to go so they could have another ride!
Traversing the sea. These are water crafts available that will take you to the different side of Hongkong or even to Macau. A convenient way to travel- sailing!

Best way to see the Hong Kong skyline and harbour!. The Star Ferry is easily the best way to see the Hong Kong skyline. It's cheap, convenient and a true piece of HK history!If you're familiar with Bruce Lee movies or any HK movie from the 1970's, you'll recognize the Star Ferry's iconic green boats plying the harbour. With all the land reclamation projects, the harbour has gotten smaller and smaller, and the MTR has taken all the commuting traffic, but the views are still amazing, and sitting by an open window during sunset and at night is really the best way to see the skyscrapers of HK Island.You won't find the rows and rows of Chinese junks anymore, but the Star Ferry still holds a place in the imagination. It's romantic, it's historic... it's perfect!
Fun Trip. A Hong Kong tradition for many years. The ferry is easy to reach, inexpensive and takes you across HK Harbor. A great photo op.

Quick Transport - Nice Skyline View. The ferry was super cheap - like HK$2, and I felt sooo much faster than trying to take the MTR if all you want to do is get from one side to the next. The skyline is also pretty fun to look at during night (and the day probably too).
time. quick across the island. for me height restriction, so be careful if you tall. on schedule, and no delays

Definitely worth a ride. One of the most traditional, unique, and cheap mode of transport. I'm surprised some tourists don't know about this Star Ferry ride or choose to skip this. I would say if you don't have time to go to The Peak, at least take a trip with the Star Ferry!Wan Chai to TST, or Central to TST, are both nice. I suggest take once during the day and once at night. Really nice view and a great short ride.
Nice boats!. Part of mandatory sightseeing in HK! Go by Star Ferry to the HK Island. It cost only few HKD. It can be counted as attraction but at the same time this is part of public tranportation

I love getting on and off of the old ferries that plow the harbour between HK and Kowloon.. There is something so special about the old ferries that exudes a squirt of yesteryear in this city so firmly wedged in today and tomorrow that I find them refreshing. Maybe it's just the 20 minutes to sit and look as it crosses. I've done it every chance I get when I go there.

Beautiful skyline views. Stunning view of the Hong Kong skyline - and incredibly cheap! You can use your octopus card for the ticket, making the trip incredibly easy, and much more pleasant (... but also slower :) ) than taking the MTR.

Unique boat experience. Very basic and simple way to travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. There are more options nowadays to travel this route but for me this is Hong Kong with the smell of the sea and the travel experience in whole. Highly recommended.
Traditional style-transport. It's a very old-fashioned way of crossing Victoria Harbour, but still a must-do! It's also cheap, and the crossing takes only about 10 minutes.
Great way to view the harbour. Best way to travel to view the harbour, can also sit inside the air conditioned area of the ferry, very affordable!

Love this :). it's a very good alternative transportation to MTR when you travel from Tsim Sha Tsui ( Kowloon side) to Central or Wan Chai ( HK Island); the cost is less than 3 HKD while the MTR cost you 9 HKD.It's really relaxing and you can view the victoria harbour..Highly recommend as it's one of the oldest transportation in HKG.
A must in Hong Kong. Every trip to Hong Kong deserves a star ferry ride. The hustle, the harbour, so cheap. Fun. Iconic star ferries.

Best option for cross harbour journey... The ferry is mode of transport used to travel different places in Hong Kong. Also best for view of Hong Kong island. The Star Ferry is the best and cheapest mode of transport from Kowloon to Hong Kong island and return. It is just 10 minutes ride to cross the harbour.

must try. one of the HK old way to cross harbour. A unique experience, ferry only last less than 10mins but you got to see both Kowloon and HK Island on ferry. Suggestion: take one in daytime and one at nighttime.
Just love to go for a ride. During weekends I love getting on the Star Ferry from HK island to TST just to see the light show from the harbour. And at only HK$3 is a bargain!

a taste of old hk. it is a must to take star ferry in hk, particularly the journey between Tsim Sha Tsui and Central (it takes around 5 minutes). It is one of the signature vehicles in HK. It is relaxing journey, gives you chance to feel the breeze in the middle of the harbour.You can choose to take the upper or lower deck. Personally, I like the lower deck because it is not air-conditioned and you can go to the sides to take photos or get closer to the sea.

Iconic part of historic Hong Kong. Taking the Star Ferry every day is one of the nicest ways to unwind from the bustle of Asia's biggest financial centre ... and it goes way back ... I remember my school friends in UK talking to each other about the ferry, so crossing the harbour the slowest (and cheapest!) way is very nostalgic. Not many cities offer the opportunity to cruise across their downtown area, Star Ferry does just that. It's a short excursion, but a must-do, connecting some of the prime shopping areas in HK. Going from TST to Central gives you the best access to other areas you'll want to visit. However going between TST and WanChai gives you a longer ride with a clearer view of the impressive harbour front and the new WanChai Exhibition Centre. If you're lucky you might see the traditional sailing junk run by the HK Tourist Board, to give you the iconic old-and-new photo that you have to take home with you.

Sea better than land.... Love to travel by ferry. less people, beautiful environment, cheaper fare, and convenient if you need to get to Harbour City..hate MTR so I usually take ferry to kln
recommend the upper deck..and there's air con in one cabin..good for hot weather
Quick efficient transport. The Star ferries in HK are a great way of getting across Victoria Harbour. Easy to get on and off and can carry many people.

One of the oldest n traditional transport in hk. Worth to take a short trip to experience HK Victoria Harbour.
The boat is a bit old, but it gives the vintage feeling of the old day. I'd particularly suggest to ride it at the night time to enjoy the specificity of HK lighting

Peaceful Ride. What a great way to get from Hong Kong island to Kowloon. The price is relatively inexpensive; but the true value of taking the ferry is the sites you will see. If you are looking for panoramic photo opportunities, take the ferry...you won't be disappointed.
Cheap ride across Hong Kong harbor. Can't beat the Star Ferry ride for HK$2. If you are slow getting off, the return is free. Best at night with an unobstructed view of both sides of the harbor.

It was Included in the Tour. We would not have taken it but it was part of the tour package so we took it for transportation between Kowloon and Hong Kong. Otherwise, we would have maybe taken it once and used the MTR for transportation.

Star Ferry Experience. When in Hong Kong you MUST travel between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui on the Star Ferry - in preference to the metro
The Star Ferry is probably one of the "must do's" when visiting HK .
The ferry's go back 40 50 years and still bring back those golden days of travel -- they must be preserved for ever

Old Hong Kong. If you are a tourist or have the time, crossing at the star ferry has been a tradition since time immemorial. In the 50's after a certain hour people had to rent 'putt putts' small boats to cross over. Today, with the tunnels to the mainland, this has become more of a tourist attraction. But the two terminus, on the HK and the Kowloon sides, have shopping centers, movie theatres, entertainment centers and restaurants, where someone could spend the whole day.And the pictures will remind you of old HK. Try to capture a Junk crossing if you can. And the skyline is also another photo subject.
Tour Guide. Highlight of any visit to Hong Kong Cheap and easy to use with you Octopus Card. A Must is a trip at night from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and return.

A must for each trip. Taking the Star Ferry is the cheapest mode of transport to cross from Kowloon to Hongkong island and vice-versa. In addition, it gives one a comprehensive appreciation of the bustling harbour and financial hub of Hong Kong - the skyscrapers and ongoing construction. The ride is under 10 minutes and it's enjoyable in the day or night. Try both!
a short and confortable short trip on the sea.. I like the boats to travel to and fro Hong Kong island and Kowloon. Its a unique kind of travel just to have a short sea trip experience.

best means of transport to travel between HK & kowloon island. star ferry service is the best means to travel between hongkong & kowloon island. it takes less than 10 mins to reach either way. it is also very cheap.
Fun way to cross over. A fun alternate way to travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Views are great, if not a bit smoggy on certain days.

a taste of the past. The Star ferry has survived as its worth going on it. The trip over the years has shortened as the harbour is filled in so have a drink and go backwards and forwards a few times to get the full feeling

convenient and cheap way to go. very cheap, and very frequent to come and go between Kwoloon and Central. breeze on the face, lights on both sides. you can not only experience the local style, but also the modern look around.
recommend place to enjoy lighting show. By taking star ferry ,is a good way to cross to other side of HK, and also a perfect place to enjoy the lighting show at 8pm, most of all, this is very cheap.
Could be better.... if the Central pier was closer to Central. It's a bit of a walk to Central. Otherwise, excellent ride!

An historical treaure. Nothing better than a ride for pennies across one of the most iconic harbours in the world. The charm of inlaid wood on the ferries, coupled with wonderful views of both sides of the harbour, make it an important part of any trip to Hong Kong.

Easy to use, cheap, and the best views of Hong Kong. I used the Star Ferry several times, and quite enjoyed it, especially at night, which gives a great view of the skyline all lit up... definitely work the price of a ticket... which was cheap.

easy to use and a must do its super cheap and efficent. The price was right. The ferries run every 5 mins or so. No long wait. tickets can be purchased via machine. You mix with the locals and people are friendly. Taxis available on either side and are very reasonable.

Star ferry. The star of Hong Kong, used it everyday, cheap and always on time. The ticket machines are in English and while old very easy to use, no credit card accepted but at about 25p to cross the water nor worth worrying about, sit at the front of the boat for the best view and in front of the engine rather than behind!

cheap way to get across. The Star Ferry is one of those things that you have to do in Hong Kong. It is very cheap and easy to take the ferry across. You get a sense of history and see a nice view of the central harbor.
Great experience!. Great trip, with great views. Travels from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon and back again. Really cheap. Do it, preferably more than once!
Cheap and Cheerful. At about HK$5 for a single journey, a nice thing to do to see the harbour and enjoy the skyline. Ferries are very frequent and the trip is under 10 mins
Recommend. We travelled on the Star Ferry at night and really enjoyed the trip and got a good view of Hong Kong at night which was very memorable.
Cheap, often and quick. While we didn't use it in rush hour when it's probably very busy, we saw fabulous skyline views in both directions. You must do this!

Always on the top of anyone's HK to do list!. What's not to love about the Star Ferry?! Seriously?!Always go for the Upper Deck and enjoy the view!I always make sure I go on the Star Ferry at least once every time I go to HK.
Overrated. I think this ferry ride is overrated as you get a much better view of the Hong Kong skyline from Kowloon.

Good Ride. Its a saying that visit to Hong Kong is incomplete without Star Ferry Ride. It is rightly said so, because though it is a one hour ride but during the one hour you get to view the beauty of the city from the sea. Always advisable to take ferry ride post sunset and if budget is not a constraint then go for Symphony of Lights ride which is at 19:55pm everyday.
Cheap way to n fro central hongkong -Kowloon. It's the oldest n cheapest mode of transportation for people of hongkong , even the larger passenger cruise docks at the side next to ocean terminal
Great skyline trip. The most in-expensive way to travel around the harbour and enjoy the fantastic Hong Kong skyline. The ferry makes me feel relaxed after every (5 minute) trip
Kowloon. Clean,Easy and quick.Been on the ferry every year since 1969 and no holiday to Hong Kong is complete without tavelling on the ferry at least once
legendary transportations from hongkong. star ferry is a legendary transportation from hong kong and very cheap, that make us want to try it to the central pier..

I rode it everyday. My hotel was in Kowloon and i used the star ferry every day, and it was my favourite part of the day each time.
It is cheap and also very useful. Its probably the best way to see the skyline of Hong Kong

Shopping. At the start of a 5 month trip to see my wifes family in the UK after an absence of over 40 years.
Great place and a shopping Mecca

The Way to See The Harbour. There are many ways to tour the harbour and marvel at the skyline but none beat the frequent Star Ferries which are an institution in themselves. Cheap and used by tourists and locals alike, definitely the best way to see the harbour and skyline

Older form of Transport. As a visitor to Hong Kong, you ride travel on the Star Ferry. It runs between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island and their ships have very varied paint schemes. You can use the Hong Kong Octopus card to pay for travel. If you are over 65, get the Elder Persons card.
Great no matter how many times you ride. Dont forget to travel on the bottom deck with the real people at least once - especially in winter when the chimney stacks warm the deck!!

leisure trip. This could easily be the shortest distant between Tsim Sha Tsui and Central/Wanchai without the usual traffic jam.Suggest to go top deck rather than the lower deck. Due to the design of the ferry, engines are located in the lower deck, hence, inevitably you can smell the exhaust fume coming out of the engineer and tolerate noise of the engine all the way. You won't have this problem going top deck.When the ferry is docking in Central, the first sight coming up is the Maritime Museum located at Pier No. 8. Worth a visit because the museum cleverly makes Star Ferry part of the exhibits by making this side of the museum into a ceiling to floor glass window so one can look out into Pier No. 7.

Fast cheap breathy and good sight. You have to take a ferry just once for your experience. Comfortable cheap and you can enjoy the beautiful sight of HK harbor but... I wish to take them after midnight....

A must when in Hong Kong. This is a great and cheap way to get a great view of Hong Kong. It was around 2 dollars each way for the five minute journey across the harbour. Both sides have plenty to see and do.

Very Cheap means of Transport .. A very effective & cheap means of transport between Whanchai & TST . Very Fast & Punctual . At night you can enjoy the beauty of Victoria Harbour while travelling in the same .
Awesome boat ride. Favorite way across the harbor! It costs pennies. Arrive before 8 pm to catch the show from the boat.
Great service.. Great, quick regular service that is cheap and easy to use. great for tourists to get around Hong Kong. Its a must if you are visiting Hong Kong.
Do not miss. More than the peak tram this is part of the real Hong-Kong experience. Incredible value reminds you this was the main way to go across for the long time, not a luxury item. Nice views.

Do it when u r in HongKong. This is a nice, short, cheap boat ride to see the Kowloon and Victoria Harbour. The sprawling skyline of HK is best viewed from the ferry and the water and wind make it a worthwhile journey.
Star Ferry. You may find yourself taking the ferry several times in your stay in Hong Kong. Easy, cheap and dependable, makes you feel just like a local.
Cute. Best way from Kowloon to HK, its super cheap, and great photo ops. Its just a cute little ferry. Plus its a nice time to stretch your legs and do some people watching lol
wonderful crossing. Wonderful relaxing crossing from Hong Kong to kowloon. Cheap convenient and always available. Great sights on eitther sides
Easy and Relaxing. This was a nice way to go from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Lots of ferries, and no problem getting on and off.
Pre cruise stayover. Good fun and a fabulous way to sight see Hong Kong and Kowloon. It really is a must when you go to Hong Kong!

Makes the most of the harbour. The ferry across the harbour is the best way to travel if you just want to get from one side to the other rather than taking a longer journey which needs the MTR for a few stations as well. It runs constantly, takes no time at all and is very cheap.

A cheap means of trasportation across the bay. While Star Ferry is an iconic symbol in Hong Kong, there is nothing much special about the boats themselves, aside from being cheap and offering a relatively fast and comfortable way to cross the bay. There is however, some nice photographic opportunities from both the ferries and the docks on both sides of the bay.
Great findview of Hong Kong. This is both a cheap and exciting way to get across the harbour. The ferry leaves regularly and gives you views of both sides showing the old and the new
Value. Older style ferries which gives the atmosphere of old Hong Kong. Frequent & a great way to travel between the islands. Cheap eay to get around.
Excellent views, best way to cross the harbour. Much better than a bus or the subway. Avoid rush hour crowds and sit on the right side of the boat for the best photos. Enjoy!

Star Ferry during the Night - Exceptional!. One of the best and oldest relics of the british colonial times, is the Star Ferry between Central Piers and TST piers. Costing 5HKD you can use your Octopus card, same as for any other public transport, or buy a ticket, and enjoy the 10minute ride through Victoria Harbor. I usually recommend people to take the trip once during the day and once during the night as the scenery is different and definitely worth it.

its a must do. The ferry is just one of the must do things when you visit Hong Kong. You get to queue with the local commuters, get a good view of the bay and remember the trip when you telling your friends while you get home.

The Star Ferry at Night: Best Thing to Do in HK!!. I lived in Hong Kong for 10 fantastic years and never tired of the Star Ferry. The view at night is unparralelled in the world. Make this one of your top priorities! Bonus: it is the best deal in town!

Amazing value. A ride on the Star Ferry is awesome value. Cost is only couple of HKD (2.50) and you get a short 15 min trip between HK Island and Kowloon. we took the train one way and the ferry the other.
Star Ferry offers Wonderful Historic Experience!. "Old is Gold", you must travel on this Ferry when you Visit Hong Kong!! If offers memorable historic experience with beautiful views of HK harbors.

Cheap way to see another part of Hong Kong. Great way to get around and pretty cheap. They also have some tour and harbor rides. I found it was a good way to hope from place to place (island to island) in Hong Kong. The view of the light show is different from either side. Take the ferry and check it out.

Must do for any HK Visitor. It's history, tradition, landmark, monument and much more. Cheap, cheerful and simply wonderful - beats the MTR any day and gives you an unbeatable, moving view of HK Island and Kowloon.
Cheap but amazing. We took the star ferry from central to go avenue of the stars. We paid only 2 HK $ and that was very cheap in a very mesmerizing view of skyline of hong kong.

One of the Hong Kong must do's. There are 2 ferries going to and from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island - a cheap way to cross this busy waterway with great views of the business district and Kowloon - the simple drop coins in the slot has been replaced with tokens from a vending machine - a ride each way is HK$2.50

A must in Hong Kong. One of the best experiences in Hong Kong. Great view of Hong Kong skyline, very attractive at night with the lights of Hong Kong buildings glowing. Great place to people watch, inexpensive transportation across Victoria Harbor, and one of the must-do experiences in Hong Kong.

Ferry is the best transport to cross over the sea. It's amazing...The place like Hongkong...so developed...you are amazed is still maintaining old classic ferry to transport. But when you see its working its cost and number of passengers it carries...how quick it is and how convenient it is...you find this is one of the best transport solutions in given conditions and it works so well with perfectly laid down systems from decades that it's almost flawless.I love to go on it and it worth it.
A definite "Must DO". Not only is this ferry trip a delightful taste of history, but the views of the harbour are superb. We went over on the upper deck, and back on the lower deck.

good option to get around. this was a great ferry, easy to purchase tickets, regular trips to the other side and was clean. staff knew what they were doing so always felt safe. tickets are cheaper weekdays than on weekends but still not expensive
Cross harbor ferry.. Must do part of trip. Crossed over from Hong Kong Central to Kowloon. Great views of skyline. Short ride but comfortable.
Cheap View of the Harbour. Very cheap way to get across the harbour which gives an amazing view of the skylines of both Kowloon and Hong Kong island. Runs every few minutes so is very convenient.

History still steaming away.. It was great to travel backwards and forwards on the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong each day as we explored Hong Kong. This Ferry does not seemed to have changed since we were here 20 years ago.They could do with a few Lifts for "oldies " like us but perhaps that might remove some of the mystic and romance from the ride.

Cheap Travel. This is a cheap way to travel between Kowloon to Hong Kong Island.Our Hong Kong friend took us on it.The entry can be tapped with your octopus card like any other public transport in Hong Kong.
Must do. It is a 15min journey across Victoria harbour and it only costs around 40cents (Aus). It's a functioning/surviving bit of history.
Experience traditional and new Hong Kong on a USD50 cent ride. a must-do for first time Hong Kong visitors. Suggest to take during non-business hours for a more relaxed experience.
how cheap !. 25p (or near enough) for a great ride across the harbour. No wait, no fuss and an excellent set of views of all the main sights.
Must try during day. Star Ferry still exist. I actually though they have stop operation. But to my surprise the price is quite high and no worth for the Symphony of light at night

Star ferry is a star. Star ferries ply their way from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. The ferries are traditional and basic but at almost no cost take you in a fun and exciting way from one shore to the next in a matter of minutes. Anyone who does not go on star ferries at least once or I would recommend 10 times will miss an important reason for visiting Hong Kong. If you look on the website they also do harbour tours at a very reasonable cost and these also should not be missed.

Cheap and great experience. Really worth the ride. And its very cheap. It is actually a form of transportation for the people in HK to travel between the islands everyday. The night view is really great too!!
Perfect way to travel. This is the ideal way to travel from Hong Kong to Kowloon, it is very cheap and you can snap some great pictures from the ferry. They are very frequent and easy to navigate

Stunning harbour crossing. There is nothing like public transport on water! Hong Kong, Sydney, Malta, wherever.
And the Star Ferry is one of those at the top of the list for excitement and fascination - and value for money!
superb experience. The most impressive sights of hong kong island and kowloon and it costs nearly nothing. Every visitor should take the star ferry several times !
Great way to check out harbour. Would recommend using by day and night. Inexpensive and quick way to travel between Hong Kong and Kowloon.
Old style and still the best. Old style travel in HK and still the best - you have to love chugging across the harbour and enjoying watching the deck hands - great fun for all the family!
Essential. Yes, every tourist simply MUST travel on the Star Ferry. It's an essential Hong Kong experience, and gives incredible views of both sides of the harbor.
Always on time!. When we are in Honk Kong we use the ferries to travel to the islands. They are always on time and the staff pleasant. The time are always on displace and easy to understand.

Historic Ferry. Great way to get across the bay! Dont miss this Ferry!
Easy to access and offboard!!!
Hong Kong has many ways to travel from one area to another, this is a great choice!

Great for seeing the harbour. We went on one of the Star Ferries the see the harbour and were not disappointed. You get a great look at a lot of the waterfront from the ferry and the commentary was in English and very understandable. Worth the hour you are on the ferry.

not to be missed. A trip to HK without a ride on the Star Ferry is almost unthinkable. Not only does it connect HK Island with Kowloon (and very cheaply, may I add), but it also takes you back in time to the late 1890s, when their services started. The Ferry Terminals on both sides are also a great starting point to other ferries that criss-cross Victoria Harbour. All sorts of sightseeing cruises and ferries to other islands leave from there.
Star Ferries. Used Star Ferries in 1983 on my last visit to Hong Kong. Still the same. So cheap and easy. Great view of the Victoria harbour. Take one at night and see the light show.

Perfect transport. Great way to get around HK. Really cheap and efficient service. Much nicer way to cross over than the train. My Two young boys loved using the ferry. They always waved at other ferries and talked to other passengers.
Green Star Ferry ride. a short vessel ride between Hong Kong and Kowloon, now is mainly the tourists' must-do thing more than a essential transportation
Star Ferry. The star ferry is like a land mark and it is a must see and do. It runs about every 2-3 minutes. and only costs about .50 cents one way. The view on the water is unbelievable

An essential part of any trip to Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is an iconic experience for any visitor to Hong Kong. It is inexpensive and a convenient way to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island (and back). It is especially nice around sunset and at night when the lights of Hong Kong come alive.

Excellent value for money. I would highly recommend the ferry from HK to Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon. It is only a few pence each way and the lights are best viewed from there in the evening. Really nice promenade at TST, albeit a distinct lack of bars. I found one towards the end of the promenade if you turn right when coming out of the ferry terminal, at which you can sit outside with a good view of the river and lights..

A break from the MTR. During my evenings wandering around HK I would usually end up on the kowloon side and with my hotel being near Causeway Bay I would need to get back. Generally I would find walking down through Mongkok to the habour and taking the Star ferry one of the best things about the night. Even though it's a small trip across to HK island, it's still a respite from the often crowded MTR.Definitely worth taking the ferry across between the different stops now and then for a break of pace and some fresh'ish sea air.

A must for Hong Kong. Star Ferry should be on one of your must to do's in Hong Kong. Part of H.K's history. Such a quaint mode of transport. You haven't seen H.K if you haven't been on the Star Ferry. Very Cheap and very worthwhile.

Cheap and Fun. This is the cheapest way to cross from Hong Kong Island into Kowloon and back. It has a lovely view of the harbour and definitely a novelty for visitors as you can see the skyline of Hong Kong. Definitely a must-do!

A nice way to go shopping!!!. To go to Tsim Sha Tsui by Star Ferry is one of my favorite attractions in Hong Kong. A panoramic view in the central & harbor, especially at night, is definitely a must see in Hong Kong. Beyond that is still the most economic way to reach Tsim Sha Tsui, and the most beautiful too. I totally recommend it, for all reasons a tourist or a shopper have.

The most enjoyable way to cross the Victoria Harbor. It might be nostalgia but even if it is not taking ferry to cross the Victoria harbor is quite enjoyable, the particular smell and the breeze of the sea, the skyscraper of Hong Kong In every moment of the day. it is always dfferently beautiful and it is just simply too short, before you notice you are already arrived at the other side .....

What a bargain. One of the great tourist trips for almost no money. I love ferries. Staten Island in NY. Larne to Islandmagee. The Thames Clipper. This is the best. Absolutely the best.This is a commuter ferry used by many thousands of people every day, but for a visitor it's a real thrill. At night, HK is lit up on both shores, in the day you get views across the harbour, dodging freighters, tankers and sampans (what's the difference between a sampan and a junk? Not sure). Life is going on all around you, kids, commuters on phones, every language under the sun being spoken. What more could you want?

A daily essential. The Star Ferry is a 'must do' activity for any visitor to Hong Kong. It is a short 5 minute ride across the harbour and the service is frequent. If you want the best views and less crowds, enter the upper deck at the ferry terminal as you can't climb stairs to change decks once you have boarded the ferry. The Big Bus ticket includes a return ferry fare each day.
Interesting. I used this star ferry to watch the light show at Hong Kong Skyline. The buildings lit up with wonderful color display. It accompanies with the music. The ferry itself was comfortable.
A must do in HK. A classic bit of Hong Kong history. Ferries leave every few minutes, it is a great way to see Hong Kong and Kowloon
Sea breezes and amazing panoramas. Whether by day or by night, crossing Victoria Harbour never gets tired. One of the most scenic harbor crossings on the planet, and so cheap. Beats taking the MTR.

hongkong local tour. We took a ferry from hongkong to shenzen, china. The ferry is really world class. However, you should travel light. Otherwise, carrying heavy luggage to the ferry may be an issue, as there are stairs to be negotiated. No proper ramps.

ferry boat. very nice ferry systems form wanchai to tsim sha tsui and wanchai to central.only in 2.5 HKD you enjoying the ferry riding and also staring point is near star of aventu at TST so easy to tack two place quickly.
Economic. An economic way across the island, but nothing spectacular. A bit uncomfortable during hot/humid season.

Iconic and a must do.. Very cheap, very simple to use and simply a must do if you are in Hong Kong.The boat is split on two levels and you should opt for the more expensive upper deck for the best views.
Vital Link. Travelled on the ferries as part of the hop on hop off tour pass. Nothing special apart from being the link between Hong Kong and Kowloon. The ferry is simply a means to an end.
refresher trip. Great way to see the city and islands from the water alway really priced well and very well organised

A must for tourist. It is cheap transport to get across the harbour. A must for all tourist. Takes you back to a heritage experience of Hong Kong. Only down is that once you get to the central side, it is not in close proximity of MTR, you'll need to work out the bus system or go on the foodbridge to work you way amongst the landmark building of central or to get you in to the shopping district. Hope the Star Ferry will never stop running.
A must. An absolute must and also a great way to get around above ground, don't even think of the water, th fragrant harbour is very fragrant.
A Fun Ride. A cheap fun ride. Get a feel of the olden days. Great taking photos of both Hongkong Island and Tsimshatsui. Easy access from both Star Ferry terminals.
