Just Do It. This is a must do cheap as chips and another easy walk from the hotel passing many of the other sights of Hong Kong

Smooth sailing. This was the method of transport we used to visit Macau, great seating very comfortable fore the one hour trip Refreshments available on board with toilet facilities The lead up to boarding was a bit of a wait as you have to show oyur passport, but once through all ok. departing once docked in Macau was again smooth process. We went late in the day, but still able to see some lovely beaches and waterways along the way. a great mode of transport well recommended

Super. $2 HKD! Superb views, the best way to get across the harbour. Nothing not to like. If you have time rnough to get familiar with the city, then you will find this even more useful to travel to key areas like Tsim Sha Sui etc.

A ferry ride you'll remember. Star Ferry has always been one of my favorite mode of transports of crossing between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. It is a unique way to enjoy Hong Kong skyline, especially on a clear and windy day. You can also use the Octopus card to pay for the fare as well. Do note that there are two ferry services that depart from Tsim Sha Tsui Ferry Pier:1) Wanchai / Tsim Sha Tsui Service2) Central / Tsim Sha Tsui ServiceYou can find the prices and ferry frequency here: http://www.starferry.com.hk/en/service
Fun ride. This is a nice trip and worth doing, We saw a junque with red sails on the way across so got an awesome photo. The ride is shorter than I expected, about 7 minutes.

Might as well go!. Just the typical ferry experience - convenient form of transport, slower but more fun than the metro. Fast enough, fun to do with the locals, easy to board and pay for with the octopus card.

OLD FASHION LADY. You still can perceive the subtle charm of this old ferry crossing the bay- Yes HK has changed, a lot! But the atmosphere, the colors, even the uniforms of the crew will remind to you of ancient times.
easy, efficient hop across the harbor. the ferry offers a quick way to cross over the harbor. The wait is not long and the fare is quite cheap. The crossing takes 15 mins and is mostly smooth.

Star Ferry Transport. We used this to cross to Hong Island - it cost about 20p and took about 10 mins. These go back and forth all day long - not long to wait as they cross in the middle, so maybe every 20-30 mins.

better than MTR for crossing from TST to Central. If you have kids, don't bother with the MTR for crossing the Harbour, just take the boat...it is the cheapest entertainment you'll give them and you'll get amazing views! The upper deck is the one with air con and only cost 50p euros more than lower.

Always a great way to enjoy HK skyline. 2nd visit to HK and still taking Star Ferry to cross-over from HK Island to Kowloon! Great way to enjoy HK skyline... Fast and convenient! Octopus card accepted!

Always enjoyable!!. Have been taking the ferry on most of my trips to HK in the last 15 years, and enjoy the short rides. The ferries have not been replaced and are the same old ones, from the British times. The Piers have been upgraded though. Whether crossing to Central or Wanchai from Tsim Sha Tsui, the ride is very enjoyable. The Kids would love it too.

A public transport icon in Hong Kong. While the Star Ferries are neither modern nor particularly comfortable, this long running ferry is an icon in Hong Kong.My trip took almost exactly six minutes.One of the two token machines on Kowloon for lower deck passengers was rejecting notes.Because Star Ferry is not run by MTR, Octopus tourist tickets (mine was a three day plus a return Airport Express train trip) are not accepted. This was slightly annoying and could be rectified by talks and agreement between operators as the minimal Star Ferry fare could be incorporated in the cost of the tourist ticket with little loss of revenue to MTR.The Harbour was quiet on a Saturday afternoon but is often bustling with maritime activity.The Star Ferry is one of many British legacies to be commended.

Crossing Victoria Harbour. A short ride across the harbour on Star Ferry will give you great views of both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon skylines.Used by local commuters and tourists it only takes around 10 minutes and costs very little. If you time this around 8pm you will be able to see the lazer light show every evening where the skyline buildings light up every night.

A must do attraction in HK. A great way to get between Kowloon and Hong Kong island. Cheap and efficient as boats run very regularly (weather dependent). Also a great way to see the skyline of the island from the boat. Tip: Don't sit in the front or back sections as they have restricted views so sit in the middle section, on the top or bottom level.
An experience not to be missed. Fantastic nostalgia crossing to Hong Kong Island and back daily at very minimal cost. Do not miss the experience!

Ride it often. No other major world city has a transportation system lie HK. the Star Ferry is an economical and scenic way to get between HK Island and TST/Kowloon. You can grab a beverage for the ride and sit to enjoy the vie of the skyline at night or harbour activity by day..

Absolutely the best deal in Hong Kong. The ferry boats go all day long across the harbor. The cheap fare will get you wonderful views of the city on both sides, other boats, and it's good people-watching too.

Got to do this. Leaves every couple of minutes and it was easy to use. We got a "token" for about 25 US cents out the token machine. The boat was right there and it was a quick trip across the bay. Beautiful ride and so easy to do. Don't hesitate and take the ride1

Ferry trip in Hong Kong. Star Ferry journey within 15 minutes between HK Victoria harbour is worthy to enjoy both day and night. you can experience some quiet time when travel in the ferry among the busy HK transports.
The Best way to cross the harbour. Great way to cross the harbour, so much more fun and authentic than the tunnels. Great sights of Hong Kong during the crossing.

A most pleasant ride. Great value for the ride esp if you are seniors. The front section is air conditioned in the summer. If you are not in a rush, it's a better alternative to the metro.Enjoy it while it's still here.
Cheap and nice. Regular services, really cheap (costs even less than the MTR) and airco provided in one part of the upper deck (which is nice to cool down for a minute or 5)
best ride in town. Cheap transport between the islands.. fast.. great view..comfortabl seating.. HK needs more ferries and stations

Great views. An experience you can't miss. For iconic views of Hong Kong, you must take the ferry. You'll see the harbour, the sampans, the skyline, all for a cheap fare. It's also a convenient way to go to Kowloon from Hong Kong Island. You'll experience how some of the locals commute from one side to the other. From Kowloon, upon exiting the ferry terminal, you'll get great views of the Hong Kong skyline and the harbour.

Iconic system. A great way to see the skyline of the Island and Kowloon. It is no longer heavily used for HKers, because the Island side terminal is located quite a (covered) walk from Central - a consequence of yet more land reclamation on the Island harbour front. But still an iconic trip.
40 cents US for a scenic ride. How do they do it? Go to the kiosk, insert you HK$ note, get change and a token, and soon you're on board for a smooth ride with sweeping views of the HK skyline.

Another must do in HK. Our hotel was 2 minutes away from the ferry stop in wanchai and simply is a must do when in Hong Kong. Costs virtually nothing and is like a blast from the past. Quite busy most of the time but worth it.

It's just a ferry.... but. Seriously, it's just a ferry, and people use it daily to cross from HK to Kowloon (vice versa). However, as a vantage point to view skylines of both sides of the waters is brilliant. Star Ferry is a daily necessity for many, but for us tourists, a lovely (and very cheap) experience. Our kids love it.Highly recommended. Note: it's a transport, take to go to TST Promenade, or to HK Central for more sight-seeing!

We had to try it!. We had to ride the star ferry but only had one chance during the day getting back from Hong Long Island to the watchtower near the Intercontinental. THere is some great shopping here!
A good short ride. Ferry runs on time. The views are fantastic while crossing the harbour. The boarding and un-boarding arrangements are good.
Great views and a cheap fare. I think the fare for the star ferry is around $2 which is a bargain. The ferry ride is quick and reliable and the views of the Hong Kong skyline are amazing.

Endangered. As the harbour is reduced by land reclamation, it is only a matter of time until the harbour is gone and no ferry will be necessary. The star ferry is old but steady. It gives a bit of tranquility on the water. But now boarding takes longer than the trip itself.

Nostalgic way of transport. The star ferry is fun way to cross the harbour. Of course is the MTR a lot quicker, but it doesn't have the view the ferry does. To bad the location on the Hong Kong side is not as convenient as before but go for it and enjoy the ride

Harbour Cruise. Pay the extra fare, approx $A12, for an hour cruise, with a free drink and snack thrown in, and you will be surprised. Some of the older Star Ferries have been transformed with table and chair seating, renovated inside with lovely timber cabinetary , so its like sitting in your lounge room cruising around the harbour. There is an informative commentary on the harbour buildings and shipping, so is very interesting. Worth an hour.

Another Hong Kong bargain - 20p return!. Quick and easy to use. Cheap! Great views of Hong Kong from the ferry so well worth going on. A good alternative to the underground if it is the area you are going to

Scenic, Nostalgic, Effective & Inexpensive. Not To Be Missed.. The boat ride itself is a treat – with full panoramic views from both sides of the habor. One should do it at least two times – once in the day and once in the evening when the lights are on. You won’t regret it.If your destination happens to be around the oceanfront of Central/ Tsim Sha Tsui, the ferry is actually a better means of transportation than the MTR or driving. Usually it’s just a short wait for the boat (~5-10 min) and the habor-crossing takes another ~10 min or so. Especially during rush hours, it can beat land travel.

Very Cheap and Awesome Views. To cross over from Kowloon island to Hong Kong Island and vice versa, this is a very good option.It is very timely, quite cheap and offeres excellent views on both sides.
A MUST DO. The star ferry from goes from Honk Kong island to Kowloon and back. Two class ferry upper and lower deck. Take the upper deck. Great views and very easy to buy tokens a must do.
reliable and low cost travel. the ferries are old but very reliable and prompt- low cost just 2.5HKD to cross each way do get very packed in rush hour as you would expect

Best way of communicating between kowloon and hong kong city. The Ferry service is very frequent and it does not costs you much. On the both sides there is a regular bus service to take to your destination. The ferries are not in bad shape they are Ok and provide a quick mode of communication

Lovely and romantic night. Taking the Star Ferry is one of HK's iconic experiences, and should not be missed. We took the night ferry from Central to Kowloon, and the view of the skyline from both sides of the harbour was absolutely breathtaking.

Star Ferry still a 'star' attraction. For years I've heard about the Star Ferry, and seen it on movies, so when I made my first visit to Hong Kong early in May, I couldn't wait to ride across the harbor on one.  I was staying on the Kowloon side of the harbor, and wanted to go across to Hong Kong to take the Peak Tram up to the Peak, so I boarded the ferry at Tsim Sha Tsui. My mistake was getting on the ferry that goes to Wan Chai. I should have boarded the ferry that goes to 'Central', which is closer to the Peak Tram. I ended up having to take the subway to Central, and then still had quite a long walk to the Peak Tram ticket office.The Star Ferry, though, was most enjoyable. It has real old character, takes about 15 mins to cross the harbor, and the cool breeze that blows across the harbor was most welcome as this was a very humid time of the year.
A must at night time. Still one of the highlights of Hong Kong for me and the most incredible night time view of the skyline. Highly recommended

best way to go from Kowloon to Hong Kong. This is another classic iconic Hong Kong must do. Take the ferry from Kowloon to Hong kong. Great views. Quick ride to the other side. Do it in the day for great views. A must do even if you just go back and forth!

Short ride with fresh air. Advantage of taking the ferry instead of train to cross over is that it provides with nice view of the city, the skyline and some fresh air. I did find it hard to get information of the time it took to get across (which is actually fast 10min or less), and if I could use the octopus card (which you can) or needed to purchase something different. Definitely worth a ride. Also note - early morning should be nicer for photos of HK skyline (I went in the afternoon and the sun was on the back so not ideal).
A must for Hong Kong visitors. Great ride across the harbor. Super value. Worth it for going either way from island to Kowloon. A must see the land from the water.

A Scenic and Historic Ferryt Trip. Having lived in Hong Kong for a number of years till July 2014), I know very well that the Star Ferry which started in the late-1800s, is probably the fastest and most efficient ferry in the world. For those who remember the opening scene of the movie, "The World of Suzy Wong", the same ferries traverse Victoria Harbour! You have a choice to take the ferry to Kowloon from Wanchai or Central (depending where you are staying on Hong Kong Island - the hotels around Wanchai are cheaper than Central). If you are taking the ferry from Kowloon (Tsim Sha Tsui) and plan to head to Mid-levels and the restaurants of Soho, take the ferry to Central...But for the cheap price and the awesome view of Hong Kong Island, there is no better mode of transportation. Try to take the ferry at night, so you can view the beautiful skyline view of Hong Kong!
Oldest mode yet so nice. If u r in hk , then take a ferry from hk island cenrtral ferry pier to tst , and enjoy the view on ur way.

Not what it was but still a good way to travel. I go on the Star Ferry every time I'm in Hong Kong and I love it. It's quick, easy and gives you a brief but really pleasant look at both sides of the harbour.

Faboulus view of the harbour. The Star Ferry is the best way to travel between Hong Kong and Kowloon. The boats are well kept, charming old fashioned ferries, I would recommend taking the trip at night.It is useful to have change ready to pay for the ride. Keep in mind that the entrances to the different decks are on different floors at the terminal.
Best views either side of the harbour. The best way to travel between two sides of the harbour imo; scenic, relaxing, and cheap. Only complaint is that the trip's too short!
Relaxing. No faults. Very quick, I never had to wait more than 5 minutes. It is loads of fun. Wonderful photo opportunities as well both day and night.

The best way to move between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Instead of using MTR try the old way and switch between both sides of Hong Kong with a boat trip over Victoria Harbour. Also try the route from TST to Wanchai or Central during the Light Show in the evening.

Brilliant. Riding the Star Ferry along the Victoria Harbor is brilliant. It is a Hong Kong classic and a must ride transportation. We enjoyed the Hong Kong & Kowloon skyline while riding it from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central.

cheapest and best view of the harbour. get yoursel an Octopus card, you WILL use it and it makes traveling around the city so easy.Go to Star ferry terminal and go on the ferry, either direction for about $1 Aust. The ferries are old, but reliable and run ever 5 or so minutes,so don't run to catch it as one will be along before you know it,crossing takes only 10 mins.for a extra view take the trip whilst the light show is on( 8 pm ever evening) gives a whole different prospective of both sides. Cheapest fun you will have in Hong Kong.
Too easy.... I have been using the Star Ferry since my first visit to Hong Kong in 1979. I use it every time I go to Hong Kong and love the smell, the locals and the crew in their blue sailor suits.

Efficient, easy passage to the Island. This is a great way to cross the harbour and is an institution not to be missed! Best to have change to buy tokens. The whole process is easy and very quick as the ferries run constantly.

Easy ride across the harbour. My girlfriend and I decided to make our maiden trip across to Hong Kong Island on the Star Ferry. Could there really be any other option? It is a fabled HK institution. 2 dollars one way. That has to be the best value for money mode of transport you can get. Great panoramic views of the city and its famous skyline can be enjoyed on the short journey over. Must do when in HK. Central MTR station located near to drop off point.

Easy to catch and a fun way to see Hong Kong. We caught the ferry from Central to Kowloon and it was great, really easy and cheap way of getting from one place to the other. It was a nice, easy ride and it gave us a chance to see Hong Kong from a different angle. If you're going to Hong Kong you really should catch the Star Ferry at least once, if for nothing else than the experience.
Star Ferry. The entrance to the ferry was dirty and aged, the people on the rude side. Compared to when I lived in HK 10 years ago, Star Ferry has started to slide.
One-hour to Macau. Terminals are pretty clean and organized. Ferry is clean as well. Perhaps they can be more tourist friendly rather than cold...
Value for Money. The Star Ferry is one our favourite things about Hong Kong - so cheap and a wonderful way to cross the harbour with an amazing view.
Must do!. Nice, quick ride across to Kowloon. Front of upper seating has A/C. Great way to take in the harbor.

Pleasant Ferry Ride. Was great to use the Star Ferry to travel from Kowloon to HK Island. Was very well priced and I think we could have used our Underground day pass on it. Short waiting time and a quick trip across.
Do not miss this. Buy a token and cross the harbour on the star ferry. The view is incredible of the Hong Kong Skyline especially at night time!

a must for HK visitors. It's almost a must for all HK visitors to go from TST to Central or Wan Chai by Star ferry. The old style of transportation gives all visitors another view of the skyline and it's a cheap ride to the other side ;)
A must do ride. Hong Kong skyline morning noon or night. Best view of Hong Kong is on the ferry and for less than a $, Best Bargain in Hong Kong

Nice crossing. Took the ferry from Hong Kong Central to Kow Loon. Cost two HK dollars each way. Must get the token to get on the ferry from a machine on the quay. Watch out, the machine is old, and it ate my money without giving me the token once!The ferry was old but in good shape. The crossing was quick and the view was beautiful.

Cheap way to view HK by the bay. Its really a cheap way to take a ferry and enjoy the scenery of hongkong by the bay. The only thing which I disliked was the engine smell and it was really hot in the ferry !

Expected More for the Price. There are a number of tours that you can take. The ferry ride is about an hour long and includes a snack and drinks. On a cleat night the skyline is really good. The symphony of lights was quite disappointing.

Iconic and still puttering along.. This was the only form of transportation between the islands and the peninsula until the tunnel was built. It remains one of the best bargains to see the Hong Kong Harbor. Much of Hong Kong has evolved with time especially since the departure of the Brits and one can only hope that this ferry will remain an icon of Hong Kong for decades to come.
Pleasant ride. Fortunately there wasn't a crowd at the time of my ride, so that helped to make it quite pleasant. It was breezy and quite scenic.

Cheap ferry crossing. The ticket is cheap, comfortable and good photo taking scenery with sea and high rise building as backdrop. Just HKG2 per trip. Can use octopus card to pay, very convenient. Good experience. Look out and careful on those touts selling boat yacht trip outside the ferry terminal.
Iconic Hong Kong Experience. When I worked in HK I used to take the Star Ferry several times a week. It still gives me certain peace when I take it for leisure now.

Perfect for what it is. Want a slow and easy way to cross from Hong Kong to Kowloon? This is a great and scenic option at a budget price. Choose upper or lower deck before you board and get in the correct cue. You can buy tickets with an easy vending machine system at the dock.
Must do when in Hong Kong. Great views and cheap way to ferry out from central Hongkong. The best time to be on the ferry would be at dusk when the lights come on and the HK skyline comes alive.

Used to be exciting. In the 1960's crossing HK Harbour by ferry was exciting, exotic and fun. It went with taking tea at the Peninsula Hotel. The Peninsula has gone snobby pseudo-ever-more-upmarket and the ferry has gone the other way. Blame the new freeways.
Nice part of Hong Kong. It's old. It's simple. It's not very comfortable but OK. It's just part of every tourist visit to HK that I would recommend, especially to all first timers like myself.
Quick trip from Central to Kowloon. The boat ride was quick, clean, and uncrowded. And not to mention very inexpensive! Highly recommend the Star Ferry for a quick trip across Victoria Harbor.
Okay. Don't quite understand the hype. Sure it's an easy way to cross the river and the lights are amazing but I found the views from the Kowloon river bank much better.
Great By Night. Very cheap way to cross-over, especially good at night - great views! Buy your token from the machine and place the token in the slot to gain entry to the Ferry.

A peaceful interlude. Taking the 18:55 trip meant that I saw the harbour go from dusk to the magnificent dazzle of multicoloured high rise buildings, all of which were reflected back in the calm waters of Victoria Harbour. This was a lovely way to start the evening, arriving back an hour later at the start of the laser light show. The Harbour and Esplanade are busy with locals and tourist alight enjoying the balmy evening air - a stroll along the Esplanade to and from the ferry is highly recommended.

Great way to cross from Hong Kong to Kowloon. I enjoyed a nice ride from Hong Kong Central Star ferry pier in the evening while enjoying the food on the ferry. The staff is very friendly and you can enjoy the coast line of Hong Kong and Kowloon islands while cruising along and sipping your drinks.

A must. The Sta Feerr is a must and needsno recommendation. If you haven't crossed the Harbour at least once on the ferry, you haven't been in Hong Kong. Unfortunately, land reclamation makes the trip shorter and shorter. Maybe you should try one of the other ferries, like the one from Sai Wan Ho to Sam Ka Tsuen (for the Lei Yue Mun fish restaurants).
Night Ride. Ride this at night, the lights are spectacular. Also its a cheap way to travel. The place is clean and the night air was nice.

One of t he great experiences. I have used the Star Ferry many times over the years when visiting Hong Kong and still today it is a highlight of anyone's visit especially during the night hours. Whilst it can be very busy with many locals it holds such great memories as it did last month - you must try it especially at night time.

very cheap transportation in hkg. you can catch the ferry from HKG island to Kowloon there are 2 ticket prices upper deck and lower, the cost is so cheap and you get a good view of the city from either port, they also do a night time crusie when they do the light show which is a must, the port in kowloon is at tsim sha tsui which is right near the shops/shopping centre and the many hotels

The iconic transportation in HK. I love taking the star ferry because it is cheaper than taking the MTR. If possible, I would rather take MTR to TST and then take the ferry to Central if I was not in a rush. I saw lots of travelers around the world taking the ship so as to have look about our beautiful Victory Harbour. In fact, ship was the only transportation connecting Kowloon and HK before 1972. As I remembered, the Victory Harbour was much wider with lots of sea gulls when I was a child i.e., more than 40 years ago.
Great to see the skyline. The ferry itself is nothing special.. it's a standard form transport. But the opportunity it gives you to see the skyline at night can't be beaten
Hong Kong Skyline. Great opportunity to see the Hong Kong sky line especially at night and Kowloon is worth visiting especially on an evening

HK$2 for a lower deck ride. It is excellent value for money. HK$2 for lower deck travel from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui. The MTR is much faster and has airconditioning but it is HK$9 for the same trip.Best to take the Star Ferry at night for a scenic view of the harbourfront and the Hong Kong skyline.

Authentic HK experience. Definitely worth taking the ferry across the harbour bay. A great experience, super cheap with frequent boots going back and forth. Amazing views of the HK skyline from different angles.

iconic transport. love it the old star ferry. It has been running for what seems like a lifetime. I was on it all the time when I was a child. It is a great way to see the harbour and take pictures of hong kong island.

Cheap and efficient. I took the star ferry with my friend. The ferry is really cheap, quick to load and unload and really gives for great views. I went during the evening, when the city was all lit up - really beautiful!
Easy to use and so cheap!. If only we had public transport this cheap and reliable all the time!Easiest way to hope across the water to HK island.

Good fun. We took the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. It was an enjoyable ride with amazing view. It's really cheap at $2 per ride and it is also stroller friendly. We also did not have to wait too long for the ferry.

Most romantic ride in the world. The Star ferry service is over 100 years old, is in regular use by many visitors and locals and must be the best value for any short trip in the world. The ten to fifteen minute journey across Victoria harbour is scenic, especially at night, and is an absolute must for anyone visiting Hong Kong.

A Hong Kong Classic!. Star Ferry is a cheap and fun way to pass through the harbor, enjoying some fresh sea air and beautiful views. It's a definite for visitors, whether single or in families.
One suggestion if you are a tourist: avoid rush hour, because a lot of locals still rely on the ferry to get them to and from work.
A nice alternative to the subway. Took the ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central. It was a nice and slow ride perfect if you're going on sightseeing and don't want to sit in a dark subway.

Really nice !. We used this ferry to and fro Kowloon and Hongkong Islands during our family's trip on June 10-14, 2015 here in HK. This is an extremely efficient, cheap, and fun way of making it to HK side of HK as we were booked in the Kowloon Side. Fare is only $2 per adult which is extremely cheap - sort of like 25 cents per ride !
One of the Must Dos. No trip to HGK would be complete without a trip on Star Ferry. It is awesome the skyline as you approach HGK. If you have an Octopus pass this can also be used.

unique short trip with amazing views. take the very old traditional ferry, it worth it! The view is totally stunning on both sides. The trip is short and very cheap, it is also a travel back in the past! must try.

A fun, scenic, and cheap ride across Victoria Harbour. I love riding the Star Ferry! It's fun, it's cheap, and it gives you a great view of both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. And you feel like you're experiencing a part of Hong Kong's history. Don't miss it!

Cheap and Classic. What can you say about a ferry ride you have seen in the movies?? We all channelled our inner James Bond and Bruce Lee... as we floated over the bay.. We were staying on Kowloon so we used the ferry daily and never lost the sense of excitment. At times it gets a little crowded but its a busy place so thats to be expected .
Best value. Took the star ferry across the harbour from Hong Kong pier, captured some amazing photographs of both side of the harbour. Quickest way to cross the harbour and would highly recommend it.

Do it at least once, preferably at night. For all the trips you'll take between Hong Kong island and Kowloon, make sure to ride the ferry at least once. It takes a bit longer than the metro, but it's worth the ride to see the skyline up close. Night time is the right time for this.
Takes you across the water. View amazing but rather ropey boat but ultra cheap at 20p to get across the water. You have to do it but after once I took the MTB
Cheap and efficient. This is a good and inexpensive way to cross the river. Dress warmly if the weather is coldish as it can get freezing on the ferry.
Cheap and cheerful. Easy, fast, clean. Not air conditioned and not exactly in a prominent location to get on the ferry at either end but otherwise a cheap and cheerful way to get across the harbour.

Star Ferry a classic ride. Cheapest and fastest way to travel around hong kong, and its been in operation for almost 100 years.. its only a 10 minute ride, but try to get on just as the lasar show is starting and thats your best view of the lasar show.

Its a dump boat - nothing starry about it!. When i read Tripadvisor reviews I thought this must be a special boat and a "historic" trip.. something like taking a cruise on river seine in paris.. but sorry this is a dump boat (very much like ferry's in any developing / poor country). Plus its such a long walk from the hongkong MTR station - with a kid you are better of to cross the waters by MTR to TST station.

Easy. Take a cab from hotel only less the HkD 30, fast and near. Walking distance is about 20 minutes. The lift assistance is very friendly and nice. Assist us to the place where sell ticket. No problem at all
MUST see. Took the last ferry of the night and boy was it beautiful. I got the most incredible view on a gorgeous night. It's quite inexpensive and very enjoyable. Definitely must do this while in HK

Iconic trip across the harbour. A fun trip from Kowloon to Central, only took about 10 minutes and it was cheap cheap. Only problem was that we could not figure out how to get on the top deck. You have to do this before you board, there are no stairs once on deck. We had bought our tickets via the machine and then asked how to get up top and were told we would have to go back out and buy tickets again for the top. Strange but true.
Kowloon and back. Plenty of ferries back and forwards to Kowloon. Quick, cheap, clean and efficient with brilliant views!

Hong Kong or Not Hong Kong ppl must go la. Hong Kong or Not Hong Kong ppl must go la
Nice view from day to night
Walk around here feel the romantic views with anyone also amazing
A fun bit of history. For a change of catching MTR this is a fun way to travel across to the island. Everyone should do it at least once

Best way to travel across the harbor. The star ferry is one of the best way to travel from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui. The ferry terminal is located near central metro station. These ferry's are working back to back and thus even if you miss one you'll not take more than 5-7 minutes to get next one. During the ferry travel in evening hours (post 7 pm), you even get to capture beautiful pictures of both the sides of harbor (refer to pictures I've taken). Also just to update this ferry services are also connecting other areas of Hong Kong as well and the fare is quite cheap (one way 2-3$ ) for most of the location.In case you're in Hong Kong and need to travel across the harbor (either side) then do not miss the opportunity to travel through Star Ferry
Going to Macau. book your tix online ... it will save you a lot ! trip was fast, easy and convenient. No frills. Just what you need...

You have to use the Star Ferry at least once!. The Star Ferry is probably as famous as Hong Kong itself, moving thousands of commuters across the bay every day for less than a $1.A double decker well oiled machine that works like clock work.Use it !

The only way to cross Victoria Harbor. The best connection between Hong Kong and Kowloon. A real classic, well organized, clean and safe. No waiting time. Provides a great view of Victoria Harbor and Hong Kong Skyline. Cheap fares.
Best tour in Hong Kong. This is a basic ferry service but is a must for every visitor across one of the busiest and spectacular harbours in the world. What a bargain!

Timeless pleasure. One of the best and certainly the cheapest way to take in the panorama of Hong Kong is to take the Star Ferry. It is primarily the manner which the populace have crossed the harbour from a time where there were no MTR lines . The terminals on the Hong Kong side have been renewed, but not the Kowloon one. I first used the ferry in 1981, and the simple pleasure of the ride is as strong as ever.

It's a ferry.. Everyone makes a big deal about the Star Ferry, and it's definitely cute. A cheap way to get a harbor cruise. But it's a ferry - maybe I'm jaded because I live in Seattle, and we have bigger ferries with amazing views. That being said, I do recommend taking the ferry for a closer look at boats in the harbor, and a different view of the city.

Cheap and easy way to cross Victoria Harbor. If you are going to Hong Kong proper, this is the way to go. Kids will love to ride the boat. My husband loves it too. Doesn't cost to much. Pretty short ride.

Amazing Views. Got only is this unbelievable cheap to get across to Hong Kong but the views of both sides are amazing. Like any city with a River seeing it from the River offers a unique and different view. Don't get the Underground you are missing a treat!
Nice View. The ferry was a highlight for our trip! My kids enjoyed it even though it was only a less than 10 min ride. ;)
excellent. Great way to see the harbour of HongKong. Take the round trip which takes about one hour and you get a free cold drink with a snack whilst on board.

Easy way to get from Central to Tsim Sa Tsui. Quick way to get across the harbour for a nostalgic experience. Also you can get a good (different) view of the harbour, Kowloon and Hong Kong through the 10 minute ride.

star ferry is indeed a star ferry. star ferry is one of those experiences that u must have, especially if u come from a land locked place.its is super economical, quick way to go across to and fro from Hong Kong island to Kowloon and near by places..

Commuting with a twist. Super cheap, easy and regular the star ferry is a great way of getting across the water. Grumpy staff they probably don't take kindly to being the subject of endless tourist photos.

For the view!. It is inexpensive, you get a great view of both sides of the harbor, and you can say you've ridden the Star Ferry! What else could you want!
You can also cross the harbor via MTR, but where's the fun in that?

Step Back in Time. We loved riding the Star Ferry. It's super easy, inexpensive, and offers a quick and easy ride from TST to Central, or vice versa. Aside from the convenience, the boats themselves are historic. Ride them and enjoy a step back in time...

great way to travel. A quick but interesting way to cross the water. Very cheap, could sit in or outside depending on the weather. Terrific views all round. Went on MTR on our outbound journed but much preferred the ferry.

No wait,just board..travel across..!. This is an excellent service to travel to and fro from Hongkong to Kowloon.Hardly a few minutes wait and you are ready to board,comfortable journey and spectacular views across,looking over the Hongkong observation wheel.
A must do!. Archetypal Hong Kong - all of life is here! From the Star ferry terminal on the mainland you can easily walk around the business district and take in the sights

Peaceful crossing in the midst of bright lights :). this is such a nice way to go from point to point - we did the crossing at night time. It was so peaceful getting away from the chaos of 1000s of people around - to get on the ferry and just chill out with wind in your hair going over to HKI on our last night in HK. Definitely worth a trip on this :)

No easier way to get from Tsim Sha Tsui/Kowloon to the other side. The ticket for one trip is with 3 or 2 HK dollars quite cheap, also the ferry is arriving and leaving from each point every few minutes, so you won't have to wait long to board one ferry. With each trip, you are offered a beautiful scenery over the Victoria harbour, which you probably won't see taking the subway. The platforms on both sides, where you can board from is also really interesting to see. So it might be nice to arrive a little early for your planned departure to the other side, to have a look around. When we visited HK we had this 48 hour sight seeing ticket with a double decker bus and by foot. There are usually also enough tickets for the ferry included.

Nice alternative. The Star Ferry is a nice alternative from the MTR to get from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. it runs regularly and offers a nice view of the harbor. If you have an octopus card while in HK, you can use it to get onto the ferry or you can buy a ticket at the gate.
Cheap. Tickets from a machine and wait to board. Great view heading from Kowloon to HK Island. Very relaxing.

A must thing to do in HK. the best way to view both side of hong kong - kowloon and HK island. It also the best way to beat the traffic jam to cross the sea and it is rather cheap too, 2.50HKD.It also a good way to reminisce the old way to travel.Perhaps it is a must thing to do when visiting HK.
A little piece of history. Still a great way to travel, I used these the first time I was in Hong Kong 25 years ago and they haven't changed a bit
Good transport. Really easy to travel with if you have an octopus card (travelcard). And you also get to see a lot from the boat. No problem at all to bring the kids :)

Cheapest way to enjoy scenery of Victoria Harbor. This is a must for visitors to take Star Ferry as the transportation means to cross the harbor from Tsimshatsui (Kowloon) to Central (Hong Kong Island) or the other way round. The trip is short that it only lasts for about 15 minutes but it is enjoyable especially in the evening. For visitors living in inland at home will definitely like the experience for the ride. It costs very little and it is over value for the money you paid.

A must do expeience. From a viewing perspective it is the best way to make your way from Kowloon to Hong Kong island (and vice versa). There are some great photo opportunities as you make your way across. On the seven times we used the crossing the trip was always smooth.The whole journey takes 6 minutes approx. Don't worry if you miss the ferry, they are very frequent and you will not have long to wait for the next one.On Hong Kong island you are dropped off at Central. The location could not be better as you have a range of bus stops within a short that will bring you to other parts of the island. This includes the Nr.15 to the Peak and Nr.6 to Stanley and many other routes to key locations.It would be advisable to invest in a small (A4 size) laminated map - you will find yourself consulting it a lot as you navigate the streets and walkways. The free maps are useful, but they are too big, loaded with gawdy adverts and cumbersome to refold on a busy street.

Must-do in HK. This is one of those things you just have to do in HK. The short ferry ride between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon peninsula has been here since for more than a century. The fare is cheap. And the view stupendous.

Such views. This is still the best way to see Hong Kong and Kowloon. Absolutely the most awesome ways to see both sides.
Make sure you have a good stomach if a squall kicks up

Nostalgic Star Ferry. Great way to enjoy the harbour scenes with superb photo view.
City ferry to Kowloon, then Kowloon to Wan Chie was great for sightseeing and shopping - soooo cheap to ride too.
The boats and terminals will remind you, or make you feel, of the bustling colonial early years of H.K.

Iconic Hong Kong experience. A marvelously quick and easy way to cross the harbour, with fabulous views to boot.Drop the correct change into the turnstile slot as you enter the pier, or follow the simple English directions on the self serve vending machine to obtain a turnstile token. Cash and card accepted. Ridiculously cheap, but make sure you make your way upstairs to the upper pier BEFORE you buy a ticket to ensure an upper deck ride.Visit the Pier on a Sunday to see how the Filipino maids entertain themselves on their day off - big groups of them congregate around the pier terminals with celebratory birthday cakes, makeshift nail salons, mini Next Top Model competitions and line dancing classes.
cheep way too cross the harbour. It cost 2.5 hong kong dollars per crossing and it is a great way to see the Harbour sky line great for photos
Excellent & very cheap = best views. For just a couple of dollars you get a great 10 min crossing to Kowloon and the views are tremendous - make sure you have your camera at the ready

My favorite thing to tell visitors to do!. I tell my buddies they can skip the peak, but they must ride the ferry, because the ferry ride is an experience. You are with the crowds, you smell the harbor, you witness the skyline, you hear the waves and the water traffic...It's too good to skip!

One of the best way to see HK. The star ferry has a long history in Hong Kong, it shuttle between Hong Kong Central and Tsim Sha Tsui every 2 minutes a ferry. It only cost you HKD 2.5 per trip. (20 pence) On the upper deck, you can see both sides of the Victoria Harbor and high-rise buildings around both sides. If you want to more closed with the sea water, lower deck is another choice.
An icon. Cheap, quick and provides great snap-shot opportunities of the harbour. Runs until midnight (I think).
Must see, do not miss!!. Amazing, every thing about it. From buying the token to setting sail!!Views galore!!!Do not miss this attraction! Comfortable seats too

Great way to get around. The Star Ferry is an ideal way to get around the harbour in Hong Kong. For a nominal fee, you can quickly get across the harbour and if you are lucky take the nighttime tour of the harbour, a spectacular show when the buildings nearby have synchronized light shows set to music.

The best $4.00 worth in Hong Kong. Simply a great way to see the harbour in Hong Kong. $4.00 each way to Kowloon (and then a bus ride to Ladies market for your new watch/handbag/anything!!!)
The best way to view the night skyline as well.

Lovely 20 minute ride. It is only a 20 minute ride, but the views are spectacular. I rode it on the evening of a very sunny day and I could see the sun setting over the river with all the boats on the horizon. Truly amazing. May be slower than the MTR but the views are worth the time.

Memorable experience on board of Star Ferry.. We took a ride with Star Ferry from Kowloon to Wan Chai HK and paid HKD12.50/ 5persons.It didn't take us long to wait for the ferry to come and took us to our destination.From the ferry we managed to see the beauty of Kowloon and HK skyline.It was a beautiful experience that we can never forget.The services rendered by Star Ferry is absolutely fantastic,in future should anyone of you out there wish to have a terrafic and memorable experience at sea i suggest you try Star Ferry and i am sure you will love it.

Great way to see the Harbour in an hour!. We took the Star Ferry tour from Ting Tsha Sui and really enjoyed seeing the sights from the Ferry. We were really lucky to have great weather on the day and bought the ticket from the booth when we arrived. If you don't have much time, its an excellent option for taking in the view. The ferry wasn't busy at all so we sat on the deck for the whole trip - a great way to take lots of photos. As part of your ticket, you're treated to a refreshment (drink and a snack).

Amazing experience. Very cheap - get your ticket from the machine 2.5 dollars (20p) or 3.5 dollars on a weekend. Take in the fresh air and the sights as you breeze across the harbour. A must do event when you are there. Even if you just turn round and come back!

A must ....... It's been the same for years and never disappoints. Every visitor should make the crossing (several times) and enjoy the ever-changing skyline, with the older (and shorter) building hiding amongst the newer skyscrapers. The ferry moves thousands every day and is a wonder of smooth operation.

Efficient ferry. Star ferry is a 9 minutes ride from Tsim Sha Tsui to Hong Kong island. We used the Octopus card and the ride across cost Hkd 3.50 upper deck seat on a weekend. It was a good experience to cross through the river the old fashioned way.

Star ferry. Star ferry is great. I think the longest we had to wait on one was about 4min. Run at regular intervals and hardly cost anything! Well worth the trip to get the views of Hong Kong skyline and Victoria Harbour. We got one about 8pm when the light show was on and got fabulous photos!
Ferry tour. I usually take ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. And this is the best way to view the hourbor, especially at night time. A ferry tour only takes 10-15mins.

Star Ferry. This is one of the must do things when visiting Hong Kong. Very advanced ferry takes you to Macau is no time at all. Did several trips on this BUT do not travel on this during rough weather as it is quite frightening. Seasickness bags are distributed immediately as the ferry tends to do unexpected highs and lows.
Hong Kong Harbour cruise. The Hong Kong Harbour cruise is fantastic. The views are second to none. The Metropolis at night is magnificent.

Old Heritage. it is one of the older transport in HK. it is convenient, sightseeing and cheap. we use to to travel from HK side to Kowloon side going to Harbour City Mall from IFC mall. good view and relaxing.
one way to get across town. Every tourist should at least catch the ferry once they are quick and cheap and do a harbour cruise too
an iconic piece of history. Every visitor to Hong Kong should take a trip on the Star Ferry - a bargain experience! Only 10 mins max each crossing, but soak up the views on both sides of the water.
Ferry Cost.. One way was about 20 p the other way was about 25 why the difference I don't know . cheap at the rate ,Takes about 10 minutes .

Fast easy AND RELIABLE. get an Octopus card at the MTR station and Hong Kong is your oyster.Or buy a ticket at the Ferry station - Less tha $10 HK The Ferry is easy fast and convenient - great way to get to Hong Kong Island from Kowloon -
You can go once. Once you can go but the subway is faster... if you get a window seat so spectacular views of skyscrapers, especially when twilight descends...

Getting around Hong Kong by ferry. Star Ferry this is such a great system very easy to hop on hop off we did a day trip to Lantau Island then another day to cheung chau.over to the main land and caught the bus to stanley markets
very cheap to travel
Star Ferry. Very exciting experience for my 2 young boys as we took Star Ferry from Wan Chai Ferry Pier to Tsim Sha Shui to watch the Symphony of Lights, started at 8pm.

Yesteryear to Today. It is unimaginable to think about visiting Hong Kong without taking the Star Ferries. They date from the 1950's (I think), but they are well maintained, very efficient and cheap - many destinations around Hong Kong too!
The most pleasant way to cross the harbor!. This old ferry is just a perfect way to cross the harbor. Not fast though! It is also the cheapest. Take a ride and enjoy the views!
Cheapest charging tourist attraction ever!. Must-do when in HK. Gorgeous views, purposeful boat trip, professional operation and for such a low price.
Star ferry. catch a bus or train depending where you are coming from to the ferry terminal it's so easy get your token from the machine at the terminal and board the ferry

Great fun and a real "must do". If you have time buy an Octopus Card and work out how to use it on MTR, buses, trams, Star Ferry, tourist sites and snack shops. You'll save a few bob and have a great time exploring - don't forget yopu can walk or get a taxi as well - and don't forget to cash in your card for the return of the $50 deposit!

This adds spices to you HK trip. The ferry trip is just great, especially in the evening, when you can see Hongkong skyscrapers at night, awesome view and awesome ferry. After the ferry you may wish to get a chilled drink from a nearby 7 seleven store, and spend hours in HK victoria harbour loooking at the skyline or just people watching.

Nothing special. It was fine but nothing special. Having been on a large number of ferry trips in my life and my favorite thing to do is going on a ferry ride in Sydney Harbour, this was nothing special. It provide a good view but was a bit smelly.
Great ferry ride. Easy to access. Very inexpensive to ride. Run very efficiently. Also runs very often. Nice view of Hong from your seat.
A Great Service. Very well maintained, very professional, and a good service. Will get you across the water efficiently with no fuss. Comfy seats, so very good for a snooze.
Very cheap and efficient. We were in Hong Kong to 2 days and loved the water travel and this was very economical and destressing.

Most convenient. The Star Ferry is the most convenient apart from the Under ground train to cross the Victoria Harbour to Hong Kong Island. It is a short 7 minute crossing but very pleasant and relaxing with beautifull views of Hong Kong and luxury cruise liners. For 2.5 HK dollars it is the cheapest mode of transport in HK.
An absolute must. If you travel to Hong Kong you must travel on the Star Ferry to Kowloon. Great service and very reasonably priced.
Fun way to get to and from the Island. rather than go by underground or through the tunnel, take the ferry - it is inexpensive and runs frequently

Budget Tour. Excellent budget tour the Victoria Harbour by star ferry which connecting Hong Kong Island and Kowloon ... Beautiful harbour view and skyline it is unique in the world ... Highly recommend to get a ride in the morning and one time at night .... you can see the splendid 'Eastern Perl'

Best way to cross. We used this everyday, see the sights across the river and so cheap
They cross frequently so it's so easy to use
Recommend over subway or taxi

A "must do" when in Hong Kong! Evening trip...upper deck..... Please read through to the end for why an evening trip across on the Star Ferry is "must do".While this was my wife's first visit to Hong Kong, I have been here many times. The first were as a young U.S. naval officer in 1978, conning a ship into this busy port on several occasions....pretty exciting and lots of great memories of those times.The most recent time was as part of a trip through China with my Mom the year before she passed. In 1993 mainland China had just opened to tourists, so we opted to go on a 3 week tour, ending up in Hong Kong. Accompanying our group throughout was a very bright young American man, completely fluent in both Cantonese and Mandarin, and very knowledgeable.When we reached Hong Kong, he made us promise to take an evening Star Ferry crossing and enjoy the city views by night from the water (it cost only about 25 cents then, and is the same today). He was quite persistent about getting us to do it.Later he told us this story.Many years ago there was an American ex-pat businessman crossing back over from Kowloon to the Hong Kong island side with his dog, enjoying the view and breezes from the upper deck. A young American woman, who was temporarily teaching English in Hong Kong asked if she could pet his dog.They fell in love, and our young tour guide was their son.It is still just as beautiful and special to once again experience and remember this romantic situation....with my best friend and love of my life.Highly recommended
Great View. Took the star ferry to go to the Island. The service is convenient, affordable and a great way to have a view of Hong Kong Island.

Fun little ferry ride. The Star Ferry is hyped beyond belief. It is a pleasant little ferry ride, and the view is lovely - try going at sunset from Central to Kowloon (this way offers best view). I am happy I did it but it should not be on your top-three list of things to do!

Cross to Kowloon. A short journey at a reasonable cost ferries cross every 15 mins or so. I travelled over to Kowloon to have tea at the Peninsula Hotel and stroll around the huge shopping mall at the dock where the Cruisers stop to let passengers shop.

Cheap and historical way to cross the channel. It costs just 2$ and you cross the channel in 10 minutes, avoiding the MTR and city tunnels. One pier is close to Harbor City TST and you arrive in Central under/behind ifc. Nice experience also if you have some colleagues in visit and u are bored if taxi. Cheapest and nicer

A classic timeless laid-back journey. Taking the 10 min cross-harbour ferry is a wonderful experience in every season and time of day. The late evening crossings are particularly nice, once the skyline is lit up.
asia trip. If you cross in hazy eather you will be in what seems like another worl-The Central. Ithen had the opportunity to have coffee at The Mandarin

A pleasant ride. For about US$1 per direction it is an easy choice
A pleasant crossing, day and night - there is even an air conditioned section if you really feel the heat

Exceptional value for money way to go from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island (and back). Can't remember the cost exactly, but it's English equivalent was a few pence (under 50p I think). Frequent crossings mean it's a great way to go from Hong Kong (Central) to Kowloon (Tsim Sha Tsui)
Very Cheap. Easy way to cross the harbor and it's very historical. Wasn't full every time I used the Star Ferry and is a short ride. Worth doing at least once due to its historical value.
Worth Doing. Make sure you do this, like others have said, very cheap, runs all of the time, and an affordable way to see the city from the water.

A Free Ride. A great way to see Hong Kong. The ferry is very cheap and very frequent. It is easy to find in Wanchai and Kowloon. Although the ferries look a bit dated they reflect a rare look into the past for this twenty first century city. I would say a must do.

What a Boat Ride!. Takes you to & fro from Kowloon to the other part of Hong Kong (Causeway bay/ etc.). Its convenient, enjoyable & a very short trip. The frequency is good. Generally used by office employees (its a mode of transportation for locals). Overall, ride is an experience in itself. If you are in Hong Kong, you have to do it atleast once.
best value. if you have never used a public ferry (or even if you have) Star Ferry is the cheapest experience you can have in H.K.the short trip is a good time to get the camera out

An Iconic piece of Hong Kong. The Star Ferry and "Ding Ding" (The Trams) are the two iconic and historic forms of transport that have survived through the ages. They are not just a tourist attraction but also an everyday part of Hong Kong life. They are unbelievably cheap so treat yourself to first class upstairs on the ferry and enjoy the airconditioned cabin and an improved view from being on the upper deck. At the Hong Kong Island end there is also the maritime museam which is also worth a visit
Exciting and cheap!. The Star Ferry is a part of Hong Kong Hstory and is a must for every visitor. Very cheap tickets, very frequent. Make sure you take your picture aboard!

Convenient and cheap. Must try when you are in Hong Kong. Price is only 50cents. Ride is about 10 minutes.Cheap, easy and nice view. On top of that you should visit both Hong Kong parts (Kowloon and Central) when you are here.On Central you will find IFC Mall with lots of brand shops and fast food restaurants. In Kowloon you have more expensive brands and restaurants. Both piers are worth visitting.
Fabulous evening view. Rode at night, was absolutely spectacular ! A full view of both sides of HKG and a great way to visit Kowloon.

Best way to see Hong Kong. This is a must so if u are going from Central to Taim Sha Tsui. The ferry has air condition area . Very comfortable and easy . There are plenty of taxi outside the pier the fare is less than us $1 . Usually the harbour on Hk is very claim. That's make the trip pleasant! No matter day time or night time. This trip is always enjoyable. Try to avoid 8:30-9am or 5-6pm. It maybe crowded. But not too bad.
Nice short ride. If you need to cross the bay anyway, take this ferry for some nice harbour views. It's cheap too. Ferries leave every 15 minutes even if they're empty.

Best way to see the Victoria Habour front and feel the grande metropolis atmosphere. Best, easiest and cheapest way to see the water front. The ferries themselves are antique on their own... At least 50 years old. Most relevant route for tourists is the "Tsim Sha Tsui - Central". Both sides are tourist/ hotel/ shopping areas. Tsim Sha Tsui side has the Space Museum, HK Art Center, Harbour City shopping mall (cluster) while Central side has the IFC (Int'l Finance Center), HSBC, Four Season's, etc. Both ferry terminals are walking distance to Metro station.

"A Cheap Thrill" any time of the day or night. But especially at night. Take either the Star Ferry from Central or from Wan Chai at 7:30pm, arriving in TST (Tsim Sha Tsui) just before 8 for the light show. Yes, there'll be people lined up along the waterfront, but you'll find a place. The light show lasts about 20 minutes and it's well worth the time.
Easy , cheap and fun. Use the Star Ferries as often as you can to go between Kowloon and Hk or visit any one of the miriad of islands.Cost is negligible and the experience is great
Get amongst the locals. Leaving every few minutes it is easy and efficient.Go across to Hong Kong Island. Make sure you get a sit facing forward on the upper level.
Must visit.. Best value for money trip in the world. A must do when in Hong Kong. Sit outside and enjoy the view.

How can you not like the Star Ferry?. Only issue is the really long lines at just two ticket dispenser machines, mostly used by tourists each of whom (naturally) has to figure out how to use it for the first time

relaxing. calming. . I love the star ferry! it's best to take out of town guests on an easily affordable mode of transportation. the view is gorgeous, especially on a sunny day, and on top of that, it's very calming. =)

Its a must ride tradition. At roughly $1.35 Canadian to go across the harbor it is one of the least expensive attractions in Hong Kong and coupled with the fact they are as much of a tradition as the old Junk's you have to do it. Very convenient to catch as well.
Mercury Direct Wonders of China and Hong Kong. worth doing if only to mix with the locals, great for getting from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island, if in a group always stick together.

Star Ferry... HKs Star! ;-). Even after visiting HK for more than 20 times, I never get tired of using the Star Ferry. It's such a nice and convenient way to cross the harbor.
There's no way to visit HK and not take the Star Ferry! :P
A must do when in Hong Kong. It is a must to go on the Star Ferry and truly live like the locals. You have the choice of sitting inside or getting the sea breeze in your face.
Best way to cross the sea. An attraction for tourists which is also used a lot by locals. Rides are very cheap and about as same as quick as the MTR.

Everyone Should Do it.. Catching the Star Ferry is a Hong Kong institution. It is the link between Kowloon and the central HK area. Very busy in rush hour with residents getting to work. Great way of seeing real HK life go by and to get some great pic's.
Best views of the harbour. DO not leave HK without a trip on a Star Ferry. It's a breeze over to Tsim Sha Tsui and a wonderful way to see the harbour and watch HK island get smaller before your eyes.

Nice way to travel. The star ferry is a lovely way to get across the bay and quite inexpensive
May is a very warm and humid time of year to travel, so it was warm on the ferry but there was a slight sea breeze
The ferry experience was fantastic at night as you can experience the beautiful hongkong skyline in lights!!

GREAT WAY TO EXPERIENCE HARBOUR. I found this is an excellent way to both get around and experience the harbour in all it's glory. At night the harbour lights up and the light show is spectacular, provided you have good weather. Either way it is an experience you won't forget. It's very affordable and it connects you to other part of the great HK.

A real must do, still feels like old HK. Love the harbour ferry, efficient and gives you a real been there feeling. It's cheap and you get to see both sides of the harbour and all the different boats passing by and across.
Regular Service. Easy to use, again with an Octopus card. Lovely mini cruise accross the harbour. Would suggest the front part has air conditioning, a lovely way to keep cool in the heat.
Great view of both sides. Another very cheap attraction. I took this almost every day. And the wind can be very nice on hot days.
Romantic. For less than 20p, it's a must. It has history, and a great view. You haven't been to HK without a trip on the star ferry.
Star Ferry. Great way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and return. Very cheap, ferry every 10mins or less. The views are fantastic in both directions.
view the city from the Star Ferry. take a trip on the star ferry to the island, make sure you are on the island for the 8pm laser light show of the city buildings!
Fun. It was fast and cheap with great views. Went from Hong Kong island and docked right at the bus depot in Kowloon.

Simple way to see the harbor from both sides. Hong Kong Harbor is beautiful both day and night. The easiest way to see both sides id taking the Star Ferry across. The price is cheap and the views are spectacular. Ride it both day and night just to see the sights. It is also a great way to get to attractions on either side of the harbor.
Very nice and cheap!. I really liked the ferry, it doesn't take too long to cross, the view is amazing and I think it was really cheap!!

Great frequent service.. A great way to get across from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island with sights of the sky scrapers on both sides. No waiting as ferries seemed to simply arrive, let passengers off, get passengers on, then return!
Great views. Cheap and cheerful. The views were great and its like stepping back in time in a pretty modern city.
Ferry. Decent. Nothing out of the ordinary. Could pay with Octopus card which was convenient. Got us to the island timely w/o incident. Clean. Comfortable.
A must ride icon. A great place to see the harbour views and to take photographs during the day and night.Good value travel.A must do for any visitor

A romantic way to travel. There is nothing like travelling on the star ferry. It is an experience that is amazing. The views, the buildings, the open decks.
Just great

Was a great way to see the city and learn some history. It's an easy way to see the city especially with young children. Would definitely suggest a night cruise to make the most of it but any time of the day is great.

Just transportation. It is a way to go between Hong Kong Island and Kowlong, besides that there is not much more to say. I personally preferred the Metro after our first couple of trips, primarily because the trains are faster and much more frequent.

Cheapest Transport in Hong Kong. Going from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island, this historical ferry built by the British is worth a ride for the view, and above all the entire experience is nothing like you have seen before....
Cheapest and best attraction in Hong Kong. For less than a dollar, the twenty minute ferry ride between the Hong Kong island and Kowloon was real value for money. The view from the ferry is amazing.
Classic. You just have to do it! Its a Hong Kong Classic. Go on the upper deck for good views, go in the evening for the night lights

Unique way to see Hong Kong's Skyline. Love the Star Ferry. Stunning views of both the Island and Kowloon and is still very much used as everyday transportation. Try and take the ferry both during the day and at night.

A must do in Hong Kong. We crossed from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island on the Star Ferry. If you have an Octopus card whilst in Hong Kong you can use it to pay for your Star Ferry ride, which was very reasonably priced. Even on a busy Saturday the waiting time was short and the ferry was not crowded. We were able to choose a seat which gave great views whilst crossing. It nice that the ferry is still an option because the alternative for getting between Kowloon and Hong Kong island is the Mtr, which required a change of lines and long underground walk between the two. The ferry is a much better experience as you get fantastic views.
A must to enjoy. Well worth inexpensive the trip across the Harbour, for shopping and eating out to enjoy the cool breeze and views across the harbour

Fun way to cross from Kowloon/TST to Hong Kong Islnd. This is by no means the fastest way across. If you aren't looking to see the views and try something different then stick to the MRT.Costs next to nothing and offers views of the skyline on both sides as you go across.
good and cheap. It's a good way to see Hong Kong and is so cheap. You can even pay by cash if you don't have an Octopus card, but must have the right change.

Best value attraction in the world. I just love the trip across the harbour on Star Ferry. I take all my visitors on this trip. The best time to do this is in the early evening when all the lights come on. A great thing to do is to take the ferry from either Central or Wan Chai, once in TST catch a bus up Nathon Road to see the lights. Once you have seen enough just cross the road and catch a bus back to Star Ferry and then catch the ferry back to the island. This way you get to see the best of all the beautiful lights of Hong Kong.
Cheap fun .. great views. Awesome cheap fun .. Some of the best views that you can get in Hong Kong. Its also a really quick way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Throughly recommend it.
A piece of Hong Kong tradition. What else gives so much pleasure for such little price. I love the Star Ferry to get to and from the Island - a super way when you are in TST or Central...
Great way to cross from Tsim Sha Tsui!. Many trips over many visits to HKG over the years; I always choose Star Ferry if crossing between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui! - A nice break from subway !

Must do. A must do thing when you visit Hk is to watch its skyline. Though i think the skyline is a bit over-rated, the best way to see it is through a ferry. So hop on it and watch the breadth-taking views of Hk from the majestic Sea !

star sparkles. The regular services are great and the 1 hour harbour cruise is really good value. You cruise leisurely around and enjoy a complimentary refreshment while listening to the English description of the harbour and its surrounds. Best value out.
Very cheap and reliable. First class service at extremely low fares. Available from early morning until late at night. Boats are kept clean and apparently most reliable.

historical ride. Riding the star ferry is indeed one of the things you should try in your lifetime. With the hustle and bustle of modern hongkong the star ferry ride will give you a sense of the old yet meaningful and useful necessities in life.
It's a must. Ride the star ferry whether in the morning or evening to experience different style of Hong Kong versus Kowloon view. It's a must try for affordable ride
Shoestring awesome . Can't beat cheap and great views. If you have a octopus card just walk on straight from the covered walkways onto the ferry, pick a window view and enjoy!
Nice way to cross the harbour. Frequent service from Wan Chai or Central to Kowloon. You get a good view of the Hong Kong Skyline on the way across.

This is the place to see hk. There is nowhere else better than this place to see Hong Kong! The scenery differs with diff season diff time of the day and weather. The ferry ride was short but it is leisurely and u can always get a seat. Go to the upper deck for more spacious seating .
What a star. Really a fun and beautiful experience. An inexpensive way of traveling to and from Hong Kong island and the mainland. Quite efficient, wouldn't recommend if you suffer from seasickness
Star Ferry. It is rather expensive to use it for everyday.Just to try it once is ok.It takes quite a short time to travel.It is better to choose metro instead for crossing the water each day.

You have to do this.. We went on the ferry just for the ride. We got on at Wan Chai Ferry Pier but this was very difficult to get too with all the major road works in the area. Once in the `terminal` the process of obtaining a ticket was a bit of a mystery, not just to us, but to others seeking transport. Luckily a very helpful local girl acted as ticket person and we all got on! A misty trip across and quite mysterious views. My father would have gone on the exact same ferry when he was based in Hong Kong briefly in WW2.

Wonderful cruise. You cannot find any cheap way to travel across the harbour, in a old ferry, with superb view of the buildings on both side of the harbour. It is more than just a mode of transport. It is also excellent for sightseeing. Take it during the night and sure you will enjoy.I don't think you need to take a cruise after you take the ferry.

This is a must. If you visit Hong Kong, a trip on the Star Ferry is a must. During the 5 minute trip you can marvel at the Hong Kong skyline. This is also where you can appreciate just how fast Hong Kong is changing. I have visited over many years and evry time I take the Star Ferry I am amazed.

Always a favourite. Seems to have a timelessness about it which is reassuring and if you have the time to smell the flowers or the harbour, definitely get an Octopus Card and use it on both the MTR and the Ferry. Don't panic if you miss one, another is on the way. The Wanchai entrance is a bit of a mess at the moment with construction.
Feel Hong Kong. Few minutes only but what a pleasure ...iconic Hong Kong bayCross the hong bay Kowloon to Hong Kong island

Great Hong Kong experience. Ferries are frequent and well run. They are smelly and safe, they are a must do during any visit to Hong Kong. The downside is that you are left with quite a long walk when you arrive in Central.

It's Still Fun. The Star Ferry ride is still one of the top attractions in Hong Kong. It had been more than 30 years since we had first rode the Starr Ferry and it hasn't lost it's charm. Actually, it's also a pretty efficient transportation resource and a good value
A cruise and a dinner.. An evening spent on a cruise boat with a marvelous back drop of the Hong Kong skyline, followed by live music and good food.A trip etched into memory.
wonderful ferry. cant believe it is so cheap and essentially provides a travel lifeline to so many. the best way to cut cross the islands and such an impressive sight from the boats.

Quick way to cross HK harbour. Having used the MTR extensively to cross the harbour underwater we tried the Star Ferry which is an efficient walk-on walk-off service - nothing plush and very cheap - a bonus is that they take Octopus card too
Fast and service oriented. Well, its fast and they have got reasonable stuff in the bar and ride to macau for us I think took less than an hour. It was a year ago but I remember it was fast..
Best value on HK. If you have the time - there is an MTR which is far quicker - take the Star Ferry as often as you can..best value and best views in HK.

Real Star Ferry. The Star Ferry is a most charming yet practical way to get fro, Kowloon to Central. It is extremely affordable and very efficient. Try a night time crossing and experience the impressive HongKong skyline and other activity on the water. An experience not to be missed
Good fun. Good local flavour. A sense of the old Hong Kong. A must and very cheap. You can use your Metro Oyster Card.
Super easy and convenient. Service is great, ferries, neat, you never wait more than a few minutes. This is definitely the way to go to Kowloon.
Great way to travel. Love these little ferries!! We stayed in Kowloon and used them frequently to get over to Hong Kong. Use your Octopus card. Cheap and fun
ORIORDANT. These ferries are great to travel on, they are not very expensive. The operate long hours, its a great way to take in the views.
Everyone must ride this at least once... One of my absolute favorite things to do in HK. Be sure to ride in day and at night. Nostalgic, Fun, an absolute must for anyone who visits Hong Kong

Ferry to Kowloon. Definitely a must. One can enjoy a short (about 15-20 minutes) ride over to Kowloon. Just take a look back at Hong Kong and you see it from a totally different perspective. The shopping is lots of fun.

Great way to get to Kowloon. I stay at the Renaissance Harvour View and the Star Ferrry is a stones throw from the hotel. The price for a one way is $3.40 HKD - so inexpensive and you get to enjoy the sea air and the view of the waterfront. The lights are great on both sides but particularly the HK side so the trip back from Kowloon is beautiful in both the day and night. It is a fun trip amongst the locals and you are right in the tourist district on the Kowloon side. Of course one can also take the Star Ferry directly to Central on the HK side so you are right downtown as you disembark at central to. I prefer this to the MTR although if you want to be up higher on Nathan Street - you have an interesting walk - about 800k to get up to Cameron Road

Return Ticket. Maybe it was a long weekend, but the return trip from Macau to Hong Kong was sold out. Had to purchase a higher price ticket if I want to get back. Purchase a return ticket at the same time.
A must for every traveller. Instead of getting our tour bus back to hotel we disembarked and took the iconic Star Ferry great views a must to do when you are in Hong Kong.

Great View of Hong Kong skyline. This is a great way to cross over from Kowloon to Hong Kong and vice versa if you are not running for time. The fare of HKD2.00 is very cheap for such a pleasant ferry ride. I recommend all to give a try as you can see how beautiful Hong Kong tall buildings are as you cross over. The ferry are old and though not spotlessly clean, it's ok for the short trip.
Riding history. Definetley a must do. It is quite easy to find, down the lower south west of Tsim Sha Tsui. The ferry runs about every 10 minutes and you get a fantastic view of the local coastline.
Impressive Transport. It is the most convinient way to cross over for Kowloon. The Star Ferries are there for more than 100 years.Simply loved the experience.

Very cheap and very reliable. I rode on it from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central and Wan Chai (and back), for something like 6 times. I must say that it was very safe, fast and very cheap.The view of Hong Island Island and Kowloon was also very beautiful, both during the day and at night.As could be expected, those who were glued to their smartphones were very probably locals while those whose smartphones were glued to the buildings on Hong Kong Island or Kowloon were the tourists. LOL!

All these ferries are Stars. For just a token amount enjoy a pleasant ride on the classic Star Ferry across Victoria Harbour. Waiting anxiously for the gate to open, scurrying down the ramp to board and sorting out the swing-back seats are all part of the experience for a visitor. Then sit back and absorb the impressive panorama and skyline of Hong Kong while the ferry manoeuvres around all manner of shipping on the harbour. By night from the water the lights of Hong Kong are spectacular - don't miss it. And to linger longer on the harbour there are Star Ferry Harbour Cruises. I have been enjoying these services for the past 30 plus years as a visitor or part time resident.
star ferry trip. Enjoyed this ferry ride once again. Value for money, interesting ride. Wonderful way to see the Harbour.
Cheapest majical trip across the harbour. Simple and easy to use- the star ferry remains one of the best ferry trips around -and its still the cheapest first class ticket you can buy.

Star Ferry.. What a great way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and thern back again. You get a good view up and down the harbour while the ferry is crossing from one side to the other. I would recommend the Star Ferry.

Symphony of Lights Harbor Cruise. This was a great way to see HK at night from the water. The light show was OK, good to see once. The best part was being on the water and seeing all around HK and Kowloon area from the water with all the lights sparkling. Great pictures! The boat was nice we went to the front which is outside, as is the very back. There is plenty of table seating inside (A/C) in case it rains or you are hot. Good thing to do at least once for sure!

Best View of HK. Do yourself a favour if you are new into HK. On your first night in, don't catch your sleep get yourself to the Star Ferry for the best value and best view of HK there is. This is an institution

Great value for money. Hard to find-- so many ferries going to so many places! Once on , having bought ticket quickly , sat back and enjoyed crossing. Could see all this from hotel room , but finding it was hard. Asked a couple of people the way (on raised walkway) and they just pointed-- not a friendly town.If you want to go to Kowloon this is the ferry to take-- quick and frequient.

Nice!. Fast, reliable, out of the city on the water, cool wind, the ferry is a nice escape from the city on a hot summers day. Several lines connect mainland with the islands and it is fast way to move around ....if you have to be there!
The magic of the Star Ferrty. I ahem used the Star Ferry for over 40 years, and I still enjoy taking the Ferry from Central to Kowloon-side. Its cheap and easy and is iconic.

A Great View of the City. For a cheap way to view the city skyline take a regular commuter crossing of the harbour on the Star Ferry. It's a regular service and is used by locals to cross between the city and Kowloon. Don't be tempted by the tourist tours operated by Star Ferry. Overpriced and you don't see anything more than on the regular service.The only pain in the neck are the guys accosting you at the Kowloon side plying knock off watches or tailored suits. We all need to make a living but back off guys.
Just O.K.. A little dirty, Fast trip for $$. Try the MTR. I liked it better. Otherwise a kitschy well known mode of transport that lasts about 5 mi
Cheap and Nice Experience. You could sail across the strait of the Island and Mainland. It costs very low, around HKD3 and the ship is constantly available within 7 mins.
