Iconic and a must do. For a cost of 2 to 3 Hong Kong Dollars the ferry offers the best view of the Hong Kong skyline as well as a welcome breeze on a hot day. They run regularly and the token machine is straightforward to use. There are small shops and food outlets in the ferry terminals on both sides.

Great Experiance Fantastic Views. Its a Ferry Short trip low cost what more can I say , if you have the time experience it Great views of Hong Kong ,You cant go to Hong Kong and not do it . And the cost is a arm and a leg . Well I lied its something and nothing . dont know time table but they seem like every 10 min

Great 360 views! $2.50/50p return trip!. A must do at night. Time it right and you can take in the light show that is every hour or so. Great to get a different perspective of the skyscrapers and great way to get over and experience Kowloon!

A floating museum at less than 20p each way.. I was fortunate enough for this to be part of my daily commute for a while. The views from the boat are astonishing any time of day, and the inside of the boat is just as fascinating. Most of the current boats have been running since the sixties and have been maintained rather than refurbished, so they look just as they would have done back then. As at October 2014 the Hung Hom Star Ferry was not running, but there are regular crossings from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central and Wanchai for HKD2 each way (HKD2.5 if you go on the upper deck).
Ferry trip to Kowloon. Perhaps we were fortunate in our timing , but we embarked both ways with no waiting.A great way to visit Kowloon.
Unchanged in 25 years!. One of the highlights of Hong Kong that has not (we were there 25 years ago), and hopefully will not ever change!
Must Try 1 hour tour ... good and cheap. I tried this one hour tour from central ferry, its good and cheap as well can have good views in day as well as in night.
The best $HK2.50 you can spend. Brilliant. You won't get better value for your HKD than a Star Ferry ride (currently HK$2.50/USD0.32 as of May 2015). The views are fantastic.

Iconic mode of transport.. Still cannot believe what a wonderful way this is to see the island and get from A to B. And so cheap, about £2. Make sure you go on the upper deck. Take your camera. A functional tourist attraction.
Not very clean...Stinks of harbour and fish.... People do not sit and travel..no order..they stand and create confusion...Very difficult for tourists to locate the place of boarding..
Every day travel. It's every day for the locals but every trip on the Star ferry is a tourists dream - tip keeps away from engine room in middle of ferry as its hot and smelly

Iconic ferry with great views. The Star Ferry is a very inexpensive way to see the night lights of the city. While I enjoyed the ride, the views from the lower deck which were relegated to, where somewhat obstructed. I recommend moving to the front of the boat for the best views. For the price, well worth a round trip!

great experience. amazing views of Hong Kong skyline. Small nice ride across the bay. Very reasonably priced. Frequency of trips is quite good. Should definitely do this once at least on a visit to Hong Kong. Easy to locate the pier as well

Tourism on a budget. I travel to Hong Kong frequently for business ( over 25 yrs) and still get a buzz from crossing the harbour on the Star Ferry ...not only is it the cheapest tourist attraction I have ever found but its a throw back from by gone days ....if you get a sunny day the views to both HK side and Kowloon side are magnificent .

Classic Hong Kong, great views of bay and buildings!. This is like the old streetcars in the European cities, which have long since vanished, the Siss lake steamers and teh San Francisco cablecars, rolled into one. They are safe and easy to take and you arrive at the far side, too soon. The views are great of both sides of the bay, with towering sky scrapers and surprisingly heavy boat traffic. Nothing is digital, except the young Hong Kongers with their smartphones. Everything else is turn of the century... last century, not this one. The chair backs flip by hand, so you can reverse them back and forth with the direction of the boat. There are tires on the sides for bumpers and life savers (the real full sized rings) tied onto the railings. Everything is wood or brass or under layers of paint with stenciled messages on the boat. Mind the gap on the gang plank. This is the single most important little piece of a Hong Kong visit.
Just fun. 5-minute ride across Hong Kong Harbour from Central to Kowloon. What's not to like? One of the great skylines of the world... check out the light show from the Kowloon side at 8pm...
not fancy by any means but your riding Hong Kong history!. not fancy but it works and its for real in all this hub bub! If you have a handle on English the signage is hilarious

ferry star harbour. we can buy a ticket to Macau by turbojet at ferry star maritime harbour. the price is 150 HKD at Hongkong city mall 2nd floor at canton street. the ferry is departure every 15minutes.

A 'Must Do' for any Trip to Hong Kong!. I have been on a star ferry endless number of times but it is something that never fails to please and delight. Even the HK commuters who do it every day still get a buzz from it. Take the ferry from Kowloon to Central at least ( or the other way) or take one of the ferries to the outlying islands. It's incredibly good value, (about HK$0.30 for Central to Tsum Sha Tsui ). There are lots of other ways to see the sights and lights of HK, but none quite from the position of the Star Ferry. A must do for any visit to HK!

very nice view. i took the ferry with hong kong 101 tour - so it was very nice to hear all the stories and check out the stunning view. but i have heard stories from other friends that the government may try to renovate and suspend the ferry from operation. I hope they would reconsider before anything.
World's best value cruise. For a few dollars, you get to see one of the best skyline in the world. Given a clear night, It'd be the best 7 minute trip ever.
yeahhhhh. this is a you have to do and the more you do the more you fall in love with the past. Fast and friendly system for travelling and essential

Its an icon. The Star Ferry is an alternative way to get from Kowloon to the Island, (Hong Kong). It does advertise that there are concessions for people over 65, but try to pay it! I don't think that it applies to Tourists. Otherwise its like any other ferry - serves a purpose.

Overhyped, but it grows on you.... Well, reading the reviews and travel advice tends to "over-romanticize" the scenario. It's an old boat with old piers that offer extremely affordable transportation and a great chance to take photos. That said, it's much more fun to take at night and one should ride it a few times to appreciate it.

A must do for Hong Kong. Even if you are only there a short time you really must do something on Victoria Harbour - and the Star Ferry manages to capture some of the history of Hong Kong, provides a great service across the harbour, gives you a spectacular view, and gives you a place it sit down and avoid the crush - all for a tiny price.We rode the ferry twice and loved it both times - would highly recommend it.

A cheap ride to cross from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui. If you are looking for a cheap ride this is probably it. The journey takes about 30mins or less. No frills ride and plenty of hongkongers take that to cross over at the end of the day.

if you do one thing in hong kong, this should be it. Star Ferry is Hong Kong! sure it looks old, smells old, feels old just like a lot of us but we and they keep on going. for 2HKD, about 27 cents US, you can ride the lower level. the machine gives you a plastic token (long gone are the metallic tokens) that you slip into a slot at the entry gate. the price hasn't risen too badly thru the years as i remember riding it for 5 cents back in the mid to late 70's. done the upper level thing too but the lower level is my choice. love the benches with the reversible backs so you can always face forward (or backward). the views are stunning night and day. the transport from the Star Ferry terminals on the Kowloon side takes you to pier 7 in Central District or to the Wan Chai District depending on which terminal you enter. if you exit pier 7 in Central District you have easy access to buses including the 15C which will take you to the Lower Peak Tram station or the 15 which will take you all the way to Victoria Peak.

It costs next to nothing so just do it. The cheapest way to see the HK skyline and with the bonus of getting you between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island.The trip depending on currents takes 5 - 6 minutes and costs almost nothing.Take the Upper Deck for the best views and just enjoy

It is not just a boat!!. I took the ferry and I simply loved the tradition. The boats are luckily not replaced by modern boats,... As these boats have real charm. It is not just a way of transport but also an icon! I went in the evening which was even nicer.

Brilliant view and experience . This is an absolute must if you are coming to Hong Kong! It's really cheap to get across, and the views are fabulous. It is a short ride but well worth it. You can also have a lovely walk along the harbour and along Stat Avenue before you cross to the island. When you get to the other side there is a lovely park called Tamar Park about 10 minutes walk to the left when you get off the boat. Or you can take a ride on the big wheel!

Reliable, Good Views. We always go somewhere on a ferry each trip (often several times). The ferry is on time - but get there early to get a window seat or sit outside if weather permits. Nothing fancy but it carries a bit of Hong Kong - local folks, tourists, business people.

Easy transport and cheap. Runs regularly. Cheap. Great views. Use it!! Sign posted well. We also took ferry to one of the islands once on central. The ferries are very good. Don't overpay for a tour. This is cheap and you'll see the same stuff

EPITOMISES Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is almost a tradition as its been going for close to 150 years , if you are over 65 its free if not it will cost the grand sum of about HKD2:60 for the upper deck , you must try it the view is great as you cross the harbour .One catches the ferry at the Star Ferry terminal on Kowloon just near Ocean Terminal if you are staying on Kowloon which is the mainland and if you are staying on the Island the ferry terminal is in Central you can't miss it.
Ok. Cheap fare to take a ferry cross to Kowloon or Hong kong around 5-10 minutes. Nice view to take a photo of Hong Kong. Big ferry.

A hint of the past amid the modern skyline. Everyday some million people cross the Vitoria Harbour between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island by car, bus or subway. A few thousand choose to time-travel this short stretch of water by boarding one of the Star Ferries that cross from one of the several piers both on the island and the mainland.The most used access to the Star Ferries are the one in Tsim Sha Tsui, the Central Pier in Central Hong Kong and the renewed Wanchai Pier (recently moved of a few hundred meters from the original place). The inside of the Ferry Piers is bare and functional, but still with the flavour of the past.The crossing itself doesn’t take more than 15 minutes, but the experience is one of the best in HK. The best direction, in my opinion, is from TST to Wanchai because the ferry crosses the harbour in diagonal, showing on the right side (starboard) the wonderful skyline of HK slowly unfolding in front of your eyes.Every time of the day has its own charms: the morning with the neat, cold colours, the sharp shapes, the bright reflections; the sunset, with the golden sparks of the glass surfaces of the skyscrapers and the warm shadows. Every time I cross with a Star Ferry I’m compelled to take some picture.The Ferries have been all built in the ‘50s / ‘60s and maintain the feeling of some of those Amazonian discovery expeditions. The funny shuttle shape, with bow and stern that share the same shape and function, the old fashioned green and white colours of the hull, the chimney on the top are one of the most characteristic and familiar views of HK.They offer some tourist rides as well, with the Harbour Tour both from TST or the Central Pier and a special ride during the Symphony of Lights at 8pm.
A must Do!. The Star Ferry is historical, inexpensive, great views from the water line and is a fun way to visit the mainland of Hong Kong.

Star Star Ferry. Make sure you have the correct change, buy a token and get on board. Ten minutes later get off. Super cool way to cross the HK harbour. From Kowloon to Central Pier and Wan chai. History in the present day!

No better way to experience the skyline of Hong Kong.. Taking the Star Ferry is a great way to not only get between Central and TST areas, but also to take in the gorgeous skyline. It is a must during the day or at night when the buildings are all lit up. You can use your octopus card or buy a token-and it is not expensive. The ride is only about 5 minutes.
just for fun. to go from mainland to Kowloon or visa versa the star ferry is a fun and cheap option. its fast and you get to see a bit more of the harbour.

Best way. Star ferry is best way how to get from Kawloon to Hongkong downtown. It the fastest and the cheepest way to get there.Ferries goes every apx. 10-15 minutes. In the night you have also amazing view on Hongkong

Must try!. Cheapest public transportation in Hong Kong. And the best way to enjoy the Victoria Harbour. It only takes around 15 minutes for the whole journey, but can enjoy the view of both Hong Kong side & Kowloon side.

Quick and easy. A great way to cross the harbour from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon with good views of the city and it is very cheap. If you want to avoid the ticket queues it is best to have an Octopus card

Star Ferry Harbour Cruises - Great way to spend an hour on Victoria Harbour. One of our favourite ways to enjoy Victoria Harbour is to take the Star Ferry Harbour Cruise, spending an hour slowing making our way around the harbour, enjoying views of skylines and just being on the water in one of Hong Kong's historic Star Ferry vessels. Star Ferry Harbour Cruises depart from the Star Ferry Pier at TST from 11.55-4.55pm (HK$90 per person), 5.55, 6.55,8.55pm (HK$170 per person) and the Symphony of Lights departure 7.55pm (HK$195 per person), with different departure times from the Central (20 minutes later) and Wan Chai (35 minutes later) based Star Ferry Piers. The cruises are slow, leisurely and come with a drink and packet of cookies. There is indoor seating if you want to escape the sun, heat or rain and you can spend as much time as you like at the two open ends of the ferry, taking pictures of the skylines, harbour and boat traffic for up to an hour when you the Star Ferry finished circling the harbour. The day cruise is best if sky conditions are favourable, Night trips are great as they show the Hong Kong Skyline at its best but they come at a much higher price. The Symphony of Lights show is not as good as it should be so we actually prefer to take earlier or later night sailings, saving on the higher price required to take the Symphony of Lights sailing. If you don't have time for a Star Ferry Harbour Cruise experience, you should try to take the Star Ferry crossing between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island at some point in your visit. The crossing takes no more than 10 minutes and is dirt cheap at HK$2.5 per adult, HK$1.5 per child passenger.

Short and scenic ferry ride. Cheap and cheerful! Be it a regular transportation means or a tourist sightseeing activity, it will give you the best experience at the harbor of the pearl. Even better at night.

Don't leave Hong Kong without riding on Star Ferry. This is the best and cheapest way to experience the Victoria Harbour. You can take the ferry between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui, both are tourist districts. You can ride in during the day time or in the evening, both will give you a very different feel of Hong Kong Victoria Harbour. If you visit Hong Kong, this is one of the must see attraction.

Star Ferry in Hongkong Harbour. Simply the best and cheapest tourism in the world. About a 15 minute ride from just outside the Peninsula Centre to Hongkong Island in a double decker ferry (First Class on the top deck--for about US$1) you get a spectacular view of the Harbour and the Hongkong skyline--both sidesKowloon side and Hongkong Island side ( where a taxi to Victoria Peak and the Mid Levels isa MUST add on-smog willing) , or catch the local bus to and from the Stanley Markets-great scenery ! Simply a must and a great way to while away , wait time for flights.
Another essential for HK visit. Simple, but well worth it, great views, weather was perfect in January. Unbelievably cheap..best bargain for an over priced city!

Lights!. The ferry is a fun way to cross the harbor when you're not in a rush... or sometimes when you are and the traffic is terrible. The best time to ride is at 8:00pm when they do the light show in the harbor.
Nice harbour view and modern buildings. This is a fantastic journey, the way is short from TST to Central. You can enjoy the breeze and complex building. Wonderful Metropolis.

a nice trip on the ferry. you can have the full scenery of Victoria Harbour while travelling on the ferry. it is just perfect wherever on board the ferry you are sitting. the ferry is clean and tidy though it is a bit old. yhe crew are nice and helpful.

A simple pleasure. The star ferry is a treat. In theory it could not be more boring. You catch a ferry from one Kowloon to Hong Kong and back. In fact these push me pull you ferries and a simple delight and cheap as well. Its a must do.
Star Ferry. Gotta be the most famous ferry trip in the world, remarkably cheap, clean and safe with Victoria harbour resplendent weather permitting, a must do if you visit HK

Great History, still very practical. The Star Ferry was first initiated by a cheff (he came from nowadays Iran) that decided, in the late 19th century, to transport people to and from Kowloon and Hong Kong Island, using an old tag boat; later it was acquired by a transportation company, that built the first one deck ferries. Years later the second deck was added. The ferries have no stern, rather two bows, so they don't turn when they leave either the Kowloon or the HK docks, so pay attention to the simple chairs' back change of direction, making passengers always face the direction of sailing. Pay close attention to the old woodwork and the preservation. The Star Ferry is a very practical way of crossing from Kowloon to HOng Kong Island and backwards, only HK$2 per ride, you can use the Octopus card as well. Locals and Turists use it and it's very frequent.

Excellent prompt service. I just love the star ferry, there is something very romantic about it and its history, you cannot help but get a sense of its past and respect these beautiful rustic old boats.It is so cheap too! Pennies to travel across to HK Island and they run every 10 minutes. I love the fact the crew are dressed in blue sailors outfits and each top is embroidered with a little white star at the rear.You purchase tokens from the ticket machine (which does give change unlike the buses in HK) - it was 2HK DOLLARS per person - down the gang plank, board, quickly find a seat and you're off. Great cool breeze which is great to escape the humidity and heat of the city in May.We always travelled in economy which is downstairs, it's only pence more to travel top deck - however depends how much you want your hair ruffling!I like to see the different walks of life on the ferry, people in business dress, tourists, locals - fabulous.You can get a bus which uses the tunnel in minutes but then why would you miss out on this great experience and see the skyline at the same time!
Is is a must. It is mandatory if you go to Hong Kong.For very little money you can see the beautiful view from the bay.
Noah's Ark. Got the ferry to Park Island and visited Noah's Ark (fascinating place) then back to beach side restaurants (great inexpensive meals)

Harbour view. The boat itself is pretty standard, but crossing the harbour is a good idea in order to get a view of Hong Kong from the water. It also drops you off where tour companies offer excursions and where you're near museums etc. Its a good short trip that keeps you in the heart of activity on both sides of the Harbour. Definitely something worth doing!

Iconic ferry. Even if they moved it. Treat yourself to first class, or ride with the people. These old ferries carry you back and forth across the harbor. It's a good way to see the astonishing buildings.

A must do in Hong Kong.... 5 minute crossing from Hong Kong to Kowloon and back...less than $1historical and practicalIt is one of the few things that has not changed in Hong Kong. It is well used by locals and tourists. Very convenient way to got from Hong Kong to Kowloon and back.
Great Value. The frequency of the ferry was unbelievable good, again, great value, great the way the backs of the benches are reversible, once you fined out!!

Classic HK at its best! Do not miss this..... An amazing HK experience at a ridiculously cheap fare - do not leave HK without having had at least one star ferry experience. Like most things, I'd recommend doing this during the day and at night for maximum effect!
best ferry. I have been a few times from tsimsha sui to central and back the spectacular views of Victoria harbour its a high feeling in day and night both

over 100 years old and still going strong!. They're simple, effective and on time - if only we could replicate that in a lot of other places! This is one example where Hong Kong has effectively blended history with modern demand and efficiency.
Iconic. Cheap and regular service to cross the harbour. Easy to use for tourists to get across and provides some great views of the both sides of the harbour
Quick and cheap. The service is quick and quite cheap. The time table is twice an hour. A little bit overcrowded during fairs.
Good tour!. Travelled on star ferry for the harbour tour during Symphony of lights. Found it to be very nice introduction on first day to the HongKong skyline.

Star Ferry, Hong kong. The trip over to Macau or around the harbour is certainly pleasant when you travel on the Star Ferry. No problems to speak of, clean, tidy and standard class is fine for the journey.
Highlight. Crossing on the Star Ferry is a must while in Hong Kong.Its fun ,cheap and authentic.An amazing view of Hong Kong!
A Classic Not To Be Missed. A quick and cheap way to get across the harbour. Ferries run on a regular basis from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and back.

50 cents for a harbour cruise. Well $A0.50 cost or $HK2.80 lower deck or $HK3.80 upper deck which is pretty cheap for a boat ride - well similar to the Dubai abras - creek crossing. Time it right and you can see the light show at night. But good day or night if you not in a hurry.
Lovely trip. Love to be in middle of Victoria Harbor ... must travel to reach beach and enjoy Sun Bath and lovely food around .

Laser show wonderful. It is a great experience. Take the ferry just before sunset so you and see the sunset as well as the lights on the harbour at night. The laser show is work a wait at the harbour after the ferry trip.

Ferrying on the harbour.... Had a great time on the ferry going from Kowloon to Hong Kong and back a few times. The views were just amazing be it night or day. The fun thing on these ferries was the reversible back support which swung both ways!
Cheap!. Equates to $0.25 USD and is a fun way to get to/from Hong Kong island, great views of the skyline, definitely do it!

Super affordable and relaxing ride. It was my first time taking the Star Ferry and I am shocked that the ride was only 2HKD. That is too cheap. You may view the Victoria Harbour too. It is such a nice ride even though it was just getting from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui.

Amazing and typical . Lovely ferries, very typical and very convenient if you want to visit the most important islands around Hong Kong, like cheung chau, lama island and plenty of others islands surrounding Hong Kong! Where you could find hotels or houses for rent near the seaside! 😊 😊
My Opinion. The Star Ferry is a fun way to cross the harbor. If the weather is nice then you can see some sights. Not as fast or air conditioned as the subway but worth doing at least once.

Star of the water way. I used the Star Ferry to get between Hong Kong and Kowloon Islands. Both from Central pier and Wanchai to Tsim Sha Tsui.
The top deck gives the best views, while the bottom deck gives a ride close to the water. When the sea is rough, you do get splashes of water!

Absolute must. And so cheap. Make sure you get the octopus card on the airport as a first thing after arriving HK.
It allows you to pay all public transport. Dont try cash. You get no change anywhere.
The ferries are old but the short ride to kowloon is an absolute must.
Must do. The star ferry is a cheap way to view the harbour 2$ Australian For a one way trip to hk central is good value
Star Ferry. Famous way to cross into Hong Kong Island. Offered great views of the city of the mainland, Kowloon and business area.
Ferry. Very convenient and inexpensive to use, plus great views of Victoria Harbour, best way to commute between Hong Kong and Kowloon

Fun way to get to and fro Hong Kong Island. It used to be the only way to get to the Island, nowadays it's just a fun gentle ride and alternate transport to the HK Island, still very cheap but don't expect luxuries, the journey takes around 10 - 15 minutes, at rush hour, it's like cattle being herded, definitely not the time to use it.

What's not to like?. A cheap (2.5 HK dollars) and easy and completely fun experience. I rode it to work each day instead of the MTR and enjoyed the relaxed pace of the ferry to the madness of the MTR. Great place to get skyline pics.
Quick, Fun and Efficient. Great way to get across Harbour and fun view! Easy to access and inexpensive way to see the skyline.

A must to experienc on your visit to Hong Kong. This ferry is soooo cheap! It is a must to experience on your visit to Hong Kong and will get you from Hong Kong island to Kowloon quickly and efficiently.

A fun experience and a good way to see the skyline. I enjoyed a quick ride on the Star Ferry - got on up front and stood at the side of the boat close to the front on the bottom level. Went at dark so I could see the skyline at night all lit up. Really enjoyed the ride and was easy to find and take this ferry. Also a quick and efficient way to get from point A to point B.
Fast and cheap . Took the ferry from wan chai to TsT - fast and prompt, felt better than taking the crowded mtr. Each adult ticket on weekends costs $3.40.

It's a mode of transport not a big deal. Not sure why the other reviews are talking like this is some tour cruise. It's a ferry to get from Kowloon to the other side. Not a big deal really. You either take the ferry or take the mtr..

Cheap as Chips. The Star Ferry is easy to use and at $2.50 a token, is cheap as you can get. The ferry is a bit grubby, but really has an old world charm. The MTR is quicker but the Star Ferry is definitely more fun and the price gives if 5 stars.

A good harbour hop. This is a convenient and cheap way to get across Hong Kong Harbour. The views are good. The system of getting passengers on/off is efficent anger ally orderly.If you're visiting Hong Kong on holiday, do this trip a couple of times, it's as good as a harbour cruise.
The old fashioned way to get across. I first used this ferry in 1977 and it still looks and operates the same. I love it, feel the waves, the comfort of the old days. Always full, always welcoming.

Love Star Ferry. Love Star Ferry with trams cheapest form of transport.Go to Maritime Museum and learn its history and learn how to tell bow from stern.That it was commenced by I think an Indian (Pakistan) Trader of the highest ability.Look at the seating no one else does.The seats are innovative and can be adjusted to face both ways.Nothing ti dislike.Once again use Octopus Card to avoid queues.
Must do. We took the ferry from Kowloon to central after a one way junk trip. It was an easy and quick way back. Be sure to get an Octopus card for use in transport around HK. So simple!

I will never forget. I took the boat one evening just after the light show.
Lights are fantastic, the harbour is frenetic, lively and unforgettable. Seeing people taking this boat as a normal transport after work was really interesting. Fortunately a lot of local people uses this way of transport between HK Island and Tsim Sha Tsui.
Best way to see HK. This is a great very inexpensive treat. Beautiful views crossing the harbor in these great vintage ships. Very cool way to get back and forth. An absolute must.

Riding the Star Ferry is part of the Hongkong experience:). Star Ferry is easily accessible, inexpensive, and a very pleasant ferry ride, albeit old. Totally identifiable with Hongkong---one sight of a photo of the Star Ferry crossing the harbour and a light bulb flashes in one's mind, "Hongkong!!!" It's like riding history.I find the best view from the Star Ferry is the one that originates from Tsim Tsa Tsui, Kowloon side, going towards Hongkong Island. The Hongkong-side skyline is more impressive than the Kowloon-side skyline. I'm saying this so you can plan accordingly. Trust me, riding the subway from the Hongkong-side to the Kowloon-side is faster and entails considerably less walking. Take note: Red taxis service Hongkong Island. Green taxis service Kowloon and the new Territories. Blue taxis service Lantau island. Usually, the taxi drivers are very pleasant, but would rather not cross over.

A Nostalgic trip. Before the MTR the Star ferries were vital as a rapid route between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Now they still run with hardly any waiting and provide a relaxing way of viewing the harbour and its diversity of boats, ships and tugs pulling platforms.All this for the bargain cost of 2.30 HKD each way.
A Star has been born for over a century. A classic Hong Kong experience that takes you back and forth from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Don't miss this historic treat.

Iconic. No trip to Hk would be complete without at least one trip on this iconic ferry. It's cheap. frequent and can cut travelling time around the city dramatically. Take a trip at dusk or in the evening to fully appreciate the skyline especially if you can time it to coincide with the regular harbour light shows. I sincerely hope they never update these lovely old boats.
Star Ferry. This is a traditional way to navigate Hong Kong harbour so really is a must do experience. It takes only a few minutes to cross but a visitor can see a lot of the Hong Kong shoreline

calming ride. awesome travel mode in Hong Kong. Takes a little time but is absolutely calming and peaceful. Winter trips are the most desirable. the sun on the deck and the chilly wintewr breeze... is awesome!
A must do. Star ferry is a great way of crossing the harbour and enjoying the view from both sides, it is cheap, fast and very convenient.

Star Ferry. Great way to see the city and get some super photos of the skyline. Dirt cheap, roughly 20p to 30p to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. Very efficient and regular service, every visitor to Hong Kong must use the ferry even if its for the fun factor.
Lives up to its name. Efficient and enjoyable. Seems to run like clockwork. Has a retro feeling which is pleasant, almost nostalgic.

Nice ride!. We took Star Ferry to go to Kowloon a few times. The ferry is a nice way to see the islands, nice view looking back at Hong Kong island. Kowloon has a lot of things to see, such as parks, museums and authentic streets.
A 'must to do' in Hong Kong. A visit to Hong Kong would not be complete with out a trip on the Star Ferry; it is so inexpensive and such fun in all weather.

Cheap and easy. A cheap way to get across to Hong Kong Island and beautiful scenery to look at, you'll get lovely photos. You can catch MTR to Central, get on ferry then you'll be able to catch a bus from the Exchange or do the peak tram, or just sightsee

Cheap means of transport and good views of Harbour.. We went one way from HK side to Northern side with the intention to go to Mong Kok and Tsim Sha Tsui. The star ferry route was well signposted, much like other attractions, upon leaving Central MTR station at Exit A. The ferry trip was fairly short and offered great views of the harbour, and didn't cost more than $4 on a weekend rate, so even cheaper during the week. The ferries are so frequent that the boat was not filled to its full capacity. Get a seat on the top deck and sit on the right side (starboard) if facing the front of the ferry to get a great view of the harbour and city skyline (when departing from HK to Tsim Sha Tsui).I'd imagine doing the trip at night would be excellent for the views of the cityscape are better with all the lights on.
Great view of the skyline at night . This is a short trip that never gets old. Such an amazing view on a clear night and super cheap. One of my favourites memories of HK.
Nice view. The ride is cheap and you have a very nice view of the skyline. I would highly recommend to take the ferry.

Convenient for Island crossing. It was convenient to cross from HK central to Tsim Sha Shui ferry terminal. At that point of time I was holding the Octopus Card for transportation and I utilised it for the crossing, I was surprised that it takes less than 15 mins. I also took some nice photos shot on landscape. The journey was a smooth ride.
small ride to kowloon. at hong kong ferry cost hk$2 will let you enjoy a small 5 min ride without squeeze in mrta habour view and sea breeze

Quick cheap and fast. You get a different perspective of Hong Kong from the ferry. It's worthwhile taking the 10 minute trip across the harbour between Tsim Sha Shui and Central. Ferry's run every 8 minutes and are easy to use, cheap and clean. If you travel in the evening you may be lucky enough to see the lightshow which is on every night.

Far from the madding crowd. As a long term resident of Hong Kong one of my favorite things to do is to take the ferry from Central to TST (or vice versa). Whilst as busy & bustling as the rest of Hong Kong, the few minute trip across the Harbour affords a brief respite from the traffic & some wonderful views of both sides. I recommend a crossing at sunset to watch the lights come on on Kowloon side & then a look back to the stunning HK Island cityscape. All transport is good value in Hong Kong, but no amount of money could buy the peace, serenity and glimpse to the past that this crossing brings.

One of the best and cheapest rides in the world. A MUST.. This has to be one of the best places to look at the skyline views of Hong Kong both of the island and mainland. So cheap and amazing that these boats have been moving across this stretch of water for so long.A DEFINITE MUST DO.

Traditional must ride across the harbour. This is a must ride to experience Victoria Harbour, one of the oldest and cheapest ways to cross from HK island to TST. Still used by Hong Kongers as well as the tourist. The bench seats with the directional backs just flip them to change with the direction of the ferry, always a giggle when a newbie or tourist finally works it out. It's fun at anytime of day :)

Do it! Just don't allow a day!. This is often people's highlight of Hong Kong - riding the bay with the lights around. It is pretty special and really should be a 5*. I just get a tad annoyed when the top thing to do in a city ends up being a 15 minute filler :)

A relaxing trip. For tourists, I recommend taking the ferry from TST to Hong Kong side for the skyline view is much better. Do it in the evening. For locals, although I dislike walking such long way to the terminal (I usually board on Wan Chai or Central), I think the 5 minute boat ride is very rewarding for its nice view and relaxing pace. It's one of my favorite cross-harbour transportation.

Easy, efficient. Much like the short ride ferry from South Perth into the city, its a quick ferry ride from Tsim sha Tsui (TST) to Central. Very affordable and cheap.We used it to get to Central and to see the skylines of HK and experience a ride. Cheap and efficient. Took approx 15-20 minutes. Bang for your buck, and a two for one for us- mode of transport and to enjoy a quick view of HK.

Hong Kong Passing through. This is an experience of HK, the old school ferry the smells the pier etc. You can not visit HK without going on the star ferry. I have been passing through HK for 20 years and the experience of crossing the harbour on the star ferry never fades. This is not glamorous or clean it is to experience how HK use to be and how everyone use to cross the harbour before all the tunnels where built. Best views of the city
Best value transport in the world. Wonderfully scenic journey. Ferries run like clockwork easily the best way to travel across the harbour.

Traditional budget way to enjoy Victoria Harbour. Here is my review on Star Ferry from TST pier to Central Pier: - Attraction Highlight: A cheap and traditional way to enjoy a short cruise across the Victoria Harbour from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central pier. It just cost HK$2.5 during weekday.Attraction Tip: Plan the ferry while visiting the Peak as the Central pier has direct bus to the Peak (bus no 15) or Garden Road Peak Tram Lower Terminus (bus no15c). Traditional way to enjoy HK Island
It's a ferry. We used it as a mode of transportation to cross from HK to Kowloon. With that in mind, I wouldn't go out of my way just to ride the ferry.

Boring. This boat is old, it desperately needs to be refurbished and the food was horrific. They have really steep stairs that lead up to the dining room, they have really bad karaoke as entertainment, the decor is outdated and there aren't any chairs on the top level to see the sights. We had a buffet dinner on our cruise, but the food was horrible. They have better food at fast food restaurants if that's any indication of how the food tasted! They don't know about customer service. I asked for a Sprite and the bartender opened up a Coke and expected me to pay for his mistake, not a chance. Trust me, steer clear of this scam.
Nice for the money. The ferry trip is nice for the small amount of money it costs, but if you crunched for time its probably not something you would regret not doing.

Cheapest way to travel between the Islands. The Star ferry is the cheapest and the most scenic way to travel between the Kowloon and HK Island. At HK$2, there is no other ride which is even close to the ferry rise. It gives you the best view of the city, especially in the night. You might want to grab a jacket in the night as it tends to get chilly.

Iconic cheap and cheerful. Best way to get from HK Island to Kowloon - cheap , regular and reliableThe crossing takes about 10 minutes and is a great way to start / finish a day of sightseeing ( or work in the locals case )

Cheap and a must do in Hong Kong. Cheap transport across the harbour. A quick trip but worth it, especially at night with lovely views of HK. A must do. Ferries are iconic which can mean old and uncomfortable to some. If you want top deck look for separate entrance and additional cost. Use Octopus card or tokens obtained near turnstiles.

Beat the traffic. We found this easy to use from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon, simple to get tokens, they run approx 10 minutes apart so no huge crowds or long waits, get great views from the seats and staff are quick to get you on & off.
Dusk ferry crossing. Lovely quaint boats. Still cheap about 50p to cross and of course beautiful skyline.Seats on the boat are reversible so no one has to sit on the wrong side.

An iconic ferry ride.. A lovely way to see the harbour and skyline. I have wanted to go on the Star Ferry since I was a kid and it didn't disappoint. It felt a little like stepping back in time. Still popular with the locals and a real Hong Kong experience. A must do.Cost around 30p in English money. wonderful.
Not good smell. It is one of Hong Kong's symbol, every visitor should have a try. Also it is a traffic mean for local people if you want to save money and do not in a hurry.

Nice views, nothing special. Nice views around the sea line of Hong Kong. However, it is nothing out of the world. Infact, its just a usual inland transport way utilized in HK. Cannot be called as an attraction as such

Nice View of the Harbour. Great View
Although a bit dizzying
Small boats make me dizzy
Looks safe enough
Great for Photos and the experience was nice
Took it in the morning
Harbour cruise. Paid $90 hkd for the 1 hour cruise during the day. Very old world and worth the trip. Gave information on the buildings around the harbour. Just takes you back in time

I never miss a ride in the night when I am in HK. This is in my opinion a must for every tourist in HK. Take the Star Ferry by night between Island and Mainland. It is a perfect start for a great night in HongKong. The view to the skyline and the feeling on this Boat is great.

Quick, scenic and cheap.. This ferry is a quick cross (not as quick as the MTR) and offers a scenic view. Be aware that seats are hard wood and the boats feel a little dated, but we had a nice trip all the same.
Excellent Views. Go by night to really take advantage of the incredible views the Star Ferry allows you...it's so cheap you just cannot miss it

just like another ferry to cross a body of water.... it was suggested by a colleague, so i took the ferry to central. the ferry was fine, but nothing major to write about. left on time and had an uneventful journey

Timeless transportation, way worth its price. Star Ferry has been around for decades. It remains a tourist attraction and necessary means of transportation for people to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong. The price is low, and you can use your octopus card for payment. One should not miss the experience.

A must when you're in Hong Kong. It's fantastic to experience a piece of floating history, still working after all these years (well, it was built by the British after all). And it's really cheap at around $2.60. The trip only takes a couple of minutes, but it's much more fun than taking the MTR. If you have time, also do the star ferry harbour cruise (this is a separate tour from Star ferry, it takes about an hour and you get great views of the HK skyline)

You NEVER get sick on The Star Ferry!. It's true. On the Star Ferry, you're so awestruck by the man-made wonder-of-the-world in front of you - the Hong Kong Island Skyline - that the only thing you can possibly think is: "this is the best fifty cents I've EVER spent!"

Ferry to Lamma Island. I didn't know that I could use the octopus card until I was returning but, you can use this so you could carry less cash with you. The ferry is clean and when I was there they were on time.

You know you've arrived in Hong Kong when you ride the Star Ferry. We've been coming to Hong Kong for decades and so much has changed, but the Star Ferry is a constant. It is always one of the first things we do - no matter which side we're staying, to remind us of the Old Hong Kong. A short trip across that busy waterway with all the associated sounds has so much atmosphere and is incredibly inexpensive. Just put the coins into the machine, get your token and you're away. The boats are regular and there's only ever a few minutes wait for the gangplank to come diwn
enjoyed the trip. we took the star ferry one afternoon and enjoyed the trip. It is always fun to take a boat tide and this one is very scenic. This is an easy, inexpensive activity.
Stop over in HK. The best way to see harbour and HK skyline both during the day and night. It's very cheap as well, only 60p I think.The best way to visit downtown if you stay in Kowloon.
Quick, easy & super cheap. Easy to understand timetable, very cheap and efficient service. Ferry was clean and was fun to travel with the locals.
Hong Kong. Easy and fun way to get back and forth between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Take the time to see the skyline from both sides, especially at night.
Good View. The weather was excellent in April, enjoyed rides everyday, very convenient , easy to ride on. feels fesh
A great way to explore the Harbour. the day tour and especially the night tour is just great! can see all the lights and glass towers around the harbor area... just fantastic! great fun !!!

A must visit. We reached there around midnight. It was a packed ferry station. Shocker was though tickets were full u could easily buy tickets in black.Once in it was a bumpy ride as they try and cover the ride in the shortest time possiblet.Tickets become costly at night.
A great service. A great way to see the HK. waterfront. The Star Ferry is full of character and the passengers are part of the entertainment.

A good way of getting the big picture of one of the best city views in the world. Travelling in an old Hong Kong ferry is almost iconic, a must do really. Travelling on the Star Ferries one hour harbour tour was a great way of getting a big picture perspective of Hong Kong Harbour in a relaxing way. $90HK got you a one hr cruise with 'light' commentary in Cantonese and English as well as complimentary drink and snack. This worked well if you were OK with the swells and movement of the ferry as it inevitably occurred. Not to bad though but it is something to consider if you know you are susceptible to sea movement. A good value trip worth doing.

Worth doing at least once. It's a HK icon, and worth a trip at least for the experience. I prefer to take the MTR across the water most times, for efficiency, but on a nice day it can be fun to hop on a creaky old ferry and take in the skyline from the water.
as they say - you have to do it. great view on one of the most famous sky lines in the world. Choose teh upper deck, enjoy fresh air and the view.

Beautiful at night. We enjoyed taking the Starr Ferry at night, as the skyline is magnificent. Enjoyed the light show on the 8pm ferry. It's a fast and easy way to travel, and also inexpensive. Much cheaper than a taxi!

A great way to view the waterfront. Enjoyed our journeys across the water from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island.Efficient service which allows you a different perspective of Hong Kong. Travelled with the locals which was an interesting experience.

Nice view and atmosphere by ferry. It is nice to cross from one island to another by this ferry, especially at night, when you can see the lights and the skyline of central Area and Tsim Sha Tsuei area. I wouldnt recommend it if it s too windy or rainny, but apart from that, it was a good experience!
Fun little trip across the water. Enjoyable, cheap and just 11 minutes so you don't have time to develop sea-sickness! I enjoyed it quite a bit.
Lovely way to travel. We love taking the Star ferries in Hong Kong. A lovely and inexpensive way to travel, and the children have such fun playing spot the jellyfish!

Cheap and quick. We used the Star ferry to get from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon...it took 9 mins and only cost $3 on a public holiday and that was for the top deck.... Its definetly worth while getting an Octapus card from the MTR station and loading it up with cash to travel on buses, MTR, Trams and ferries...also some shops take them as well and they are refundable at the end of your stay
Smooth Sailing. It was so relaxing and comfortable. Great to just sit back and relax. The seats were comfortable enough and a great way to get across.

Still brilliant value. For under HK$3 you can still ride across the harbour, although the moving of the Star ferry pier in Central is a massive inconvenience. Still, you can't get better value for money and you have the world famous views for free!

The best and cheapest way to Cross to HK. It is a very nice way to reach HK from Kowloon, nice and authentic feeling and very cheap as well.
As a tourist you must take the ferry from Kowloon to the convention center in HK and take some nice pictures when you are on the way......

Star Ferry is a must do. This is something you must do in Hong Kong. Cheap way to cross from mainland to Kowloon and vice versa. Inexpensive - about 50p per person. You can admire the spectacular skyline on both sides whilst relaxing and taking in the most amazing views particularly at night time which becomes a free light show. Spend as much time on the water to really appreciate the island.Make sure you have your camera ready!!
a very authentic experience in HK. Easiest way to cross creek and noting that this ships started in 19th century makes you feel it. loved it.

One of the best over-water rides!. Plan your trip with a ferry ride at night and one in the daytime, Though you see the same buildings, the different views are just breath-taking!If you take the night ride, time it so that your ferry moves out at around the time of the Symphony of Lights. Wonderful light show on display!Don't bother to find a seat. Stand so you can take photos and enjoy the views.A bit bumpy but well worth the trip! Around 10 minutes long.
Lovely way to get across from the island. Tried the tunnel and spent over an hour either way stuck in traffic, horrendous, the ferry was quick, relaxing and worth it for the views
Worth a trip to view from the harbour.. Easy & reasonably priced so why not take a trip. Plenty of photo opportunities when out on the water.

Star Ferry. Carefree way across the Kowloon Bay. Unfortunately wooden seats,for those with tender bums luckily the trip is not long. And of course the crossing is worthwhile, with so much to see in Hong Kong.

Want to get HK Island? Take the Ferry!. The star Ferry is a great way to go to Hong Kong Island. It's cheap, easy and very clean. If you time your ride, you can even catch the lightshow while you are on the boat.Also take note, the boat itself doesn't turn. The captain and the seats switch positions. The boat itself is bi-directional!
Nice trip. Used the star ferry twice and it was enjoyable, quick and hassle-free. We just swiped our octopus card and jumped on. The kids loved the trip and we got some great photos
Cheap, quick and excellent. I only wish the trip between the Hong Kong and Kowloon areas lasted longer. Getting to the terminal on HK side is somewhat challenging.

Star Ferry. One cheap way of getting to see the Hong Kong Skyline up close and to get those all important Photographs. Also a much quicker way of getting to Kowloon rather than being stuck in traffic in a taxi
Working piece of history. Cheap with an excellent view of the building and light show. A little crowded but it's a short trip. A cool addition to any day plan.
Spectacular view!. The Star Ferry is the best and cheapest way to enjoy the Hong Kong skyline....it runs frequently between Kawloon and Hong Kong Island....clean and well-run...a must-take!

Enjoyable experience in Hong Kong Harbour. The ferry ride across Hong Kong Harbour whether Kowloon to Hong Kong Island or vice versa is a thoroughly pleasurable experience especially on the sun-soaked blue sky day we were given to experience this recently. Easily accessible and very relaxed and enjoyable
Star Ferry Hong Kong. A fast and good way to cross the harbour. Unfortunately the crowds are typically the push and urge in common in all China. Must be aware that pickpockets operate.

The best way to travel to and fro HongKong Island and Kowloon. Whether as a tourist, on business, as a family, or off to see a concert ... the best way to travel to Kowloon from HongKong (or vice versa) is by the Star Ferry. The ride is about 5 mins to cross, cheap, and clean.You get to appreciate the view of both HongKong and Kowloon from the ferry. The Star Ferry terminals are easily accessible by foot, or by a taxi. It's an experience worth taking ... and you won't regret it.

Hong Kong from the water. The Ferry ride is an essential activity for your visit to Hong Kong. It's cheap, easy, and you get to see the city from a new perspective. Try riding during sunset and you'll have some excellent shots of the harbor. There is also a big painting on the wall by the Ferry station on the main island which is a great location for a souvenir.

One of the cheapest attractions you are going to get in Hong Kong!. Dont bother with the harbour cruises, use the Star ferry.Remember to take some small change for the token machines and there are 2 seperate loading gangplanks. One for the upper and and one for lower decks.
Cheap and fast. Best choice to cross from Wanchai to Kowloon. Fantastic view of HK skyline. Wonderful at sunset. Very convenient when moving from Wanchai (expo area) to Kowloon south.

MUST TAKE FERRY. The Star Ferry chugs merrily between Kowloon (mainland) and Hong Kong island. It is frequent, well run and costs almost nothing, approximately 25 UK pennies! It runs from 6.30 in the morning to after 11pm at night. We took the short rout from Kowloon to Central but there is another route to Wan Chai close to Causeway Bay Metro station further to the east of the city. Both services run approximately every ten minutes and take less than 20 minutes to make the trip over. A great way to see the wonderful Hong Kong skyline.

Best way to see the harbour.. A must. Take the ferry to Hong Kong Island and enjoy the harbour view. Clean and dead cheap. There is a tourist office just under the departure lounge. Staff are very helpful in explaining sights on both sides.

Still not bored of the Star Ferry. I have been living in Hong Kong for nearly three years now and whenever there is an excuse to do so, I always take the ferry across from Tsim Sha Tsui to either Central or Wan Chai (or back). People will tell you that the Star Ferry is one of the things that you simply must do when you are in Hong Kong and they are right but I can tell you that even after the many trips I have taken on it, I am still not bored of it.The cross harbour trip only takes about 10 minutes and is remarkably cheap but if you are lucky enough to board it on a clear, haze-free day, the experience is breathtaking.

An efficient as well as beautiful way to cross the bay between Kowloon and Hong Kong island. Hong Kong skyline is spectacular. Taking the ferry is a great way to do a mini cruise, for a cheap price, and enjoy the scenery. They are very frequent ferries, so that you never have to wait very long for the next one.

More of a "Been there, done that". It's a good feeling wading through well-lit skyscrapers on a ferry cruise...I took a short trip between Kowloon to Wan Chai. It's a lovely short trip of 7-8 minutes. From an absolute uniqueness standpoint it's nothing new- you can take a ride like this in may places, but definitely a good trip for ticking the boxes when you are on a maiden trip to HK....nice!

Best views for a ferry service. I must say that reviewing a ferry service is a strange thing to do, but this ferry service has the best views in the world !Travel it day or especially at night.The Star ferry also runs a harbor tour which we took a few years ago and found it a nice way to cruise the waters one night
An Absolute MUST In Hong Kong. Unchanged for a hundred years it is genuine in every respect, not just some tourist trap. The views, sights, sounds and smells are unforgettable.

Must do experience. I was admittedly rather reluctant to hop on the Star Ferry, but I learned there is nothing to be afraid of, and it's such a local icon, it should not be missed. You haven't had the full Hong Kong experience until you've seen it from the harbor.

One for your bucket list. It is worth going to Hong Kong just to ride on the Star Ferry. These little push-me pull-you boats shuttle back and forth from one spectacular seafront to another. Great during the hours of daylight - spectacular at night. A unique ride for just a few pence.

Great way to experience the harbour. The ferries are a very cheap way to travel across the harbour. If you buy a Hong Kong tourist train pass for 3 days, this does not seem to include the ferries. However , you just buy tokens before getting on the ferry at the booth, before the turnstile. It is a most enjoyable way to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island just before sunset when the light is very good for photos. Then it is fun to wander up the steep streets to the Soho area and enjoy a drink and the atmosphere. If you can make it back for a ferry around 8 pm, you get to see the light show. This lasts for about 13 minutes. A great way to travel between Kowloon and the Island.
Easy way to cross the harbour. Cheap easy way to cross the harbour. Boats are a little old but it adds character, it's a good way to get views ok HK.

A cheap way to cross the harbour.. At only 2 HKD each way this is a cheap and fun way to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Running frequently its efficient too.
If you want to travel on the upper deck, buy your token upstairs as this is 50 c more expensive and lower deck tokens wont work upstairs.

useful, efficient little ferry boat. Enjoyed jumping on the Star Ferry whenever we fancied, ran regularly and easy to use. Cheap and efficient form of transport from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon and many other surrounding islands.
A great experience. A long walk to get onto the boat Hong Kong Island side.and being disabled found this hard. But the trip is worth it for the views alone.
One of best boat trips in the world and the price is right. Love this boat ride any time of day or night. Have been on it many times over the years and it always breathtaking

Tickets. With bigbus Tickets You geht as much Star Ferry Tickets als You Need - all are valid for ohne Month !!!!
In Case You Do not use bigbus - just buy an octopus Card and Travel with Ferry, MTR and Busses

BEST TIME WHEN CROSSING THE BAY. I have mostly been in Hong Kong for work. So once finishing work after a hard day, and getting into the ferry to cross the bay from the island to Kowloon or in the other way, is one of my pleasures in HK, which i cannot miss. The nice wind in your face and the sun setting over the bay is the bes way to calm and take away all the day stress away.don't miss it , by any reason you need to cross the bay do it, it is a highl good experience.The view of Hong KOng Island from the ferry is something that you will keep in your eyes forever.

Fast loading/unloading - must do activity. This is a must do activity when in Hong Kong which I've used regularly during our trip.I would've given 5 stars except for on our first visit I asked the Star Ferry Ticket Attendent what was the best way to visit The Peak and he gave me the totally inaccurate information with an attitude.Otherwise it's a nice 10 minute trip for $2.5hk
Best at night . Beautiful skyline views and a quick easy crossing. Buy a token before boarding, I can't remember the exact chat but certainly less than £1. A must for all visitors in my opinion.

One of the best views in Hong Kong. it offers one of the best views of Hong Kong Harbour, for the sum of $2.50 HKD, (about 45 cents AUD)The service is fast, efficient, and gives a very real connection to Hong Kongs past.A fantastic cheap mass transit service that doubles as a tourist attraction
Connecting Kowloon and Central Hong Kong. The Star Ferry service is an enjoyable way to move across the Harbour and is free for senior citizens.

Great views for cheap. A must on your trip to Hong Kong.
On a nice day, theres nothing better than the star ferry which is about $3.5 and gives you great views of the hong kong harbour.

Both public and harbour trip. We did both trip as public transportation as well as harbour excursion.harbour trip Cost 90hkd during day, 170hkd evening.We did day and need to say value for money in terms or relaxation, views for one hour trip.drink and cookies included.no cues,no husstle.public travel with one stop was just 5 minutes, cannot get much.

A must-try in Hong Kong. I live in Hong Kong and I strongly recommend any visitors to take a ferry ride. Victoria Harbour provides one of the top three night views in the world. You can take a look at either side of the harbour but you can also watch it from the Star Ferry. The ride takes 10-15 minutes between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui. All you need to do is to find a seat on the side of the ferry (don't choose the air-conditioned space). Then you can enjoy a magnificent view on the ride and take photos if you wish. There are a lot of sight-seeing spots in Central and Tsim Sha Tsui, so make sure you take a ride when you travel between these two places. In case you really find nothing interesting to do on the other side of the harbour, you can take another ride back. It takes only a few Hong Kong dollars for one ride.

Star Ferry. How can you not go to Hong Kong and not go across to Hong Kong Island via the Star Ferry. It is a timeless institution and costs virtually nothing. Lovely way to see the sites of Hong Kong particularly at night
beautiful. excellent view , can't express it , beautiful view , lights all over the hongkong , best thing to do , should be once !
Mobility Scooter will travel. Excellent support from staff on the ferry. Staff helped us to get on and off the ferry with little fuss. Value for money and fun!

Classical Hong Kong journey. A visit to Hong Kong is not complete without take a Star Ferry ride. The ride is short but very scenic. There are ample seating area, I recommend you go in the morning (on a weekend) to avoid the crowd. They accept octopus card.

The cheapest highly recommended excursion. For a few HK Dollars just take the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Central or vice versa. It is one of the cheapest unforgettable experience you can have in Hongkong; best view for the skylines. Take the upper deck to ensure that you have the maximum experience.

5 Star Ferries!. The best and cheapest way by far to travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.The fare is HK$2.50/US$040 for a ten minute trip across Victoria Harbour and is well worth it just for the experience as well as getting to the other side.

Very fun to do with the kids!. It's a fun way to get to see the city from the sea! Another great thing is that you can use it to get to your destination and have a fun ride along the way. Instead of taking a taxi or subway, you should take the star ferry!
Very inexpensive travel. Regular service between HK and Kowloon and so very cheap. Well worth using. Plenty of seats and no pre-booking, just turn up.

The best way to combine commuting between Hong Kong island and Kowloon with enjoying the skyline. Very efficient and cheap way to travel between Hong Kong island and Kowloon. The trip takes just few minutes. Well organized and easy to use.
short boat ride, historic and .........thats it. ok, 5 minutes total on board, a must do at least once in hong kong, try the harbor trip at night as well.

Enjoy the breeze. I always have a thing for boat so when I found out I could use ferry from Wan Chai to Tsim Tsa Tsui, I immediately picked this option. it was a bit too short but I enjoy every second of it.The boat wasn't too large but it was enough to accommodate people. I used it in the morning and night and when I was there in the morning, lots of people using it as a way to commute to work.

One of the Must Do's. If you visit Hong Kong and don't take a star ferry ride you can't say you've really been. It's $2.5 HK for a one way trip across the harbor. The views are just amazing. Day time or night time it's a quick easy ride.

Great cheap transport between the island & the mainland. Great cheap transport between the island & the mainland. Quick & easy with great views at night. Old fashioned ferries add a touch of nostalgia to your trip. Catch the ferry from Wan Chai or Central Piers to view The Symphony of Lights from Tsim Sha Tsui at 8pm.

Short but sweet. The Star Ferry runs between Kowloon and Hong Kong every few minutes during the day and evening. While the ride is only 7 or 8 minutes, you get great views of both cities' skylines which are very impressive including the 9th and 4th tallest buildings in the world.
several crossings after far east cruise. The well used ferry from Kowloon to HK. Fast,efficient, character filled experience for the visitor. Just does what it says on the tin with no fuss.

A great way to see the views. Took the ferry over so we could get the tram to Victoria Peak. They are very quaint and run very efficiently. No hanging around, they dock and then load very quickly a then they are off again. The staff wear sailors outfits to complete the atmosphere!

Very inexpensive. Only a short trip from Hong Kong Island to Kowlong but it's one of the few places I know that you can make such a journey. We really enjoy the ride, we were able to see both side of Hong Kong and Kowloon skyline.

Always fun. I enjoy the convenience, and great connection of the two very different 'downtown' sections of HK.
There is nothing to dislike
nice. easy to find and nice to use, really cheap. Enjoy the view of Honk Kong from the middle during a short across way.
Way to go. This is an excellent way to travel and works in well with the Big Bus Tours. Fast and reliable with regular boats so very little wasted waiting time.
Good public transport. Good way to travel at a very reasonable cost. The ferries are regular and most of the time on time. You can choose to go upper or lower deck.
Great by night or day. cheap way to see the city, a must do when visiting Hong Kong. The city is best viewed from the water

My favourite thing to do in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is the cheapest tourist attraction in town. Enjoy spectacular views of this beautiful harbour and city in the short ferry trip across. The ferry ride gives you a great opportunity to take amazing photos of some of the iconic buildings including the IFC, ICC and the Hong Kong Convention Centre. Watch out for the Aqua Luna, a traditional Chinese junk with its red sails billowing as it sails around Victoria Hoarbour.

Cheapest tour available. The ferry and the trams are a great way to see the city, use the Octopus card. On ferry at night and wonderful views on all sides. Excellent value and a great way to cross between mainland and island, can always start and finish journeys with taxis

It's a boat. The idea of the Star Ferry may be better than the actual ride itself. I'm sure it's more impressive during the nightly Victoria Harbor light show, and it's more picturesque than the subway at any time, but it's really just a boat ride. Advantage: It's cheap, so you can easily do it more than once if you like it (and have a need to get from Kowloon to HK Island or vice versa).
lots of fun. was great to take the ferry back and forth to Kowloonfelt like a step back in time from the 70's when i was there

Cheap and cheerful great ride to see the most beautiful skylines in Hong Kong. Star ferry is an excellent choice for locals and tourists for commute between the Hong Kong island and Kowloon. Not only that it's very cheap, it's a nice short ride that you can see the most beautiful skylines and harbour view of Hong Kong. I highly recommend it!
Star Ferry. Star Ferry service is best one. In just 2 HKD you can go from TST to Central or Central to TST. It gives best view of Hong Kong Harbour and Hong Kong's skyline also.
Easy to ride. Rode the ferry like the locals. What a quick way of getting from one side of the harbor to the other.

Best Value Transport in Hong Kong. Cheapest and best value way to spend a few Hong Kong dollars to actually feel and breathe Hong Kong scenic landscape. You can view in 360 degrees of Hong Kong harbour. Highly recommended if you have an hour to spend. One of the cheapest way to cross the habour as well. My choice!

A must if you are visiting Hong Kong. An inexpensive and effective way to cross the Harbour. A must for anyone visiting Hong Kong for the first time. Much more enjoyable than the MTR. Suggestions for first timers: *If you don't have an Octopus card you will need to purchase a token. There are machines where you can do this at the entrance area at the top of the steps. Weekday is more than weekend. *Crowds may be large during peak commuting times. If you keep moving with the flow of human traffic you will be much better off. Don't stop suddenly.
excellent. Excellent service fast and efficient with regular boats across the harbour great value when bought with the bus tour
It is history.. You have to take this ferry both ways just for.the experience, it is so cheap too, about 30 pence each way.
FERRY RIDE. Personally I enjoy the ferry ride. I love to watch Hong Kong by Night. The fare is reasonable,too. No complain, just enjoying myself.

An institution. If you visit Hong Kong then you have to go on the Star Ferry, it's dirt cheap and a great ride, best to go at night and enjoy the light show of all the island's buildings being lit up.
Star Ferry across the bay. A must for any visitor to Hong Kong take the star ferry across Kowloon Bay...A Hong Kong tradition plus great views on both Kowloon side and the island.
Quaint, cheap, excellent.. Lovely trip across the harbour on an old boat. What more could you ask, this is old Hong Kong at its best.

Star Ferry return to Kowloon we used our Octupus card for subway and ferry.. We went to Hong Kong Island via subway and came back to Kowloon on the Star Ferry.
We used our Octupus Card for both forms of transport. You can also use this card for Peak Tram. Always a delight to travel by water when possible. Took about 10 minutes.
Very quick. Runs very smoothly.

Ferry Trip. A leisurely way to cross HK Harbour in 10 minutes, from HK Mainland to Kowloon. Great views of the skylines and of other harbour traffic You can pay for the ride by either purchasing a token at a machine on the pier or by using a pre-paid Octopus card (also used on the MTR).Ferries leave every 10 minutes so no large queues evident,

cheap and easy to use.. Instead of taking an expensive taxi, which can sit in traffic for a very long time - take the ferry to go between Kowloon and Hong Kong. The coin machines are easy to use and if you can't figure it out, a local person will help you. Long bench seats on board and often busy - of course, it's clean - it's HK.
love the ferry. very inexpensive way to travel - not luxurious - but i love the water, enjoyed been on the water with the locals many times

The 'old girl' not a grand lady. Traditional style of ferry reminiscent of Sydney ferries. Good cheap service from Hong Kong island to Kowloon side, can purchase a token or use an "octopus card" as used also on trams and buses. Don't have to wait too long and ride lasts for 10-15 mins across the Harbour in clean old style comfort.

Travelling with daughter who lives in Shanghai. Brilliant! From to and from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon or visiting Islands. We went to Lammu Island and did theNorth to South Hike. Brilliant Sign posting and Star Ferries from both places.
fun rocky ride. The star ferry is a great cheap trip you can take when you visit HK. It doesn't cost much, for those who suffer from motion sickness this can be too rocky for you.
useful Ferry. easy to use, very cheap and if you have time it is also a nice view when crossing the bay. it will take you less than 15 mn with 300 other passengers on the boat
Must do. Go by Ferry as often as possible. Its everytime amazing and you can meet friendly people. I love it!

Fun way to smile in lots of photos!. We went on the star ferry to cross the harbour and see the skyline, but found we caused a lot of amusement to the local children. We suddenly became very popular as a backdrop to photos of children (and some adults)! This is a very cheap method of transport and lots of fun. At 8 pm there is a light show across the harbour, which can be seen from the ferry or from the harbour edge.
Traditional picturesque transport. The Star Ferry takes you from TST to central in about 15 minutes. On a calm, clear night it is a perfect place to sit and take a break from the big city.

IF IN HONG KONG THIS IS A MUST!!. Until the advent of the subway and automobile tunnels to Hong Kong island THIS was the main transit way to the island. Just for the view alone and after dark the lights and activity of the harbor, the trip is worth !!

Great Views, Inexpensive, Historic and Pleasant. A leisurely way to cross HK Harbour. Great views of the skyline and of other harbour trafficYou can pay for the ride by either purchasing a token or by using your Octopus card (also used on the MTR)
Easy to use. This was such an easy form of transport, use it. We bought an octupus card which is convenient to use, so I do recommend this.

we used the feries to get about to the islands and mainland cheap and efficient way to move about. buy a travel card at the airport and use for all transport and basic shopping. The ferries get you to lots of places both on the tourist side and quite side
Got to do this. Every visitor to Hong Kong should ride the ferry to the other side Kowloon just for the amazing skyline and because it's part of Hong longs character

If you only do one tourist thing in Hong Kong.... Do this! It is the most beautiful ride across the water. It is so inexpensive. There is hardly a more beautiful place to be at night when the light show is going. It is SO Hong Kong. Oh, and did I mention, it is such a great way to get from TST to Central. Just jump on it!!!
Nice trip. This ferry ride is a definite must do when visiting HK. Very relaxing and pretty scenery of HK. Make sure that you bring a camera!

hong kong star ferry. if you need to cross the harbour this is the way to do it you get to see everything from the ferries so get you cameras at the readythey are quick aswell it only takes about 10 mins on the short route, you can go upstairs if you want it costs a little more , i guess it must cost about 30p a crossing now ( uk price) very very cheap.its one of the oldest transport in hong kong, its old non luxery but just great and full of character so just do it again and again, the ferries are regular on the popular routes ( every 10-15 mins) you get a great view at night aswell and the kids will love it aswell.

Inexpensive Transportation. We had read that this was a great way to see the city from the water. It is definitely not a signtseeing boat - just a quick trip across the bay between Hong Kong and Kowloon. It was fine since we were using it for inexpensive transportation and another "experience" while in Hong Kong.
great way to see the skyline. A very nice way to explore the harbor and enjoy the view. The star ferry is cheap and very convenient to move around.

A scenic alternative to cross the channel. If you in Hong kong and never tried the star ferries then you are missing something.IT is a must try attraction for a very less fee. You can use Octopus card to pay the fare and next moment you are on the star ferries, ready to cross the seas... This the best and cheap way to enjoy the Hong Kong Skyline during blue hour.

A Nice Way to See HK, not just get to Kowloon. This "commuter" ferry takes one from near the CBD over to Kowloon. However, it really is a great way to see HK from a different angle and a lovely short ride on a good weather or even a balmy evening. Time the Star Ferry around 8pm for the light show and be sure to pay a bit extra to take the top tier of the ferry boat. It's less fumes to from the engine.
Hold tight. Gotta love the Star Ferry. Very handy to get from Kowloon to HK Island. Staff very helpful to me as I walk with a stick.

A must do whilst in Hong Kong. A ride on the Star Ferry is so cheap and the view is priceless. It is definitely worth doing even it is just to go across to Kowloon and return again. Of all the ways to go between Kowloon and Hong Kong this by far the best and quickest!
Cheap ride experience. It costs you $2 to have the best view of Hongkong skyline. You can ride day time or night time, it's still as breath taking both time of the day.

Best ferry in the world. Cheap, views that are amazing, easy to go from mainland to HK island. Worth going at various times of day to enjoy morning light, sunset and evening light show and the buzz of HK harbour.
The coolest public transport on earth. Really, just skip the taxi and tunnel and take this one of a kind gem. There is no skyline view like this or any better way to see it

Can't miss the ferry!. How can you go to Hong Kong without going on the ferry?? It is a very good way to see the harbor and actual use it as a mode of transportation. Can't beat it for $2.50. We took a cab the first night and it was almost $20 to get to the island because of traffic. Definitely easier to take the erry and the. Grab a cab if you need to...

Who needs a subway/metro/underground with this service?. No-one, except perhaps on stormy, rainy days as the ferries are open on both sides and not that big. I love these English types of boats with their slow running diesel engines moving one fast to the other side for a minimal amount (HK$2) Any day, when back, I'll will take at least a ride once a day. Just for being 'out' of the streets og Hong-Kong/Kowloon for a little while

Just do it!. It's one of those things you have to do, Get a photo of yourself with the hong kong skyline in the backdrop and soak up the history of the place. Like stepping back in time. Cheap and brilliant.

What a view for less than a pound!. I only had three hours in HK, and thanks to the forum on TA, I was advised it was a ' must do'. It didn't disappoint. It was dark, a wooden-beamed boat across the river, with all the huge buildings lit up and the peaks in silhouette in the background. Wow!And for HK $ 2.5 single.

A little cruise for HK$6.50. Low cost , reliable service , not crowded . Clean ferries with competent staff . Waiting rooms with big fans to cool waiting passengers . Nice views of the harbour as you chug across .

Worth the time. Not really an attraction per se. It is more of a commuter ferry. It is an inexpensive way to see a bit more of Hong Kong. If you don't live near the water, or spend time near boats, it is a bit novel. The kids will probably love it.
fantastic value. Very very cheap trip for one the best views of Hong Kong and Kowloon sky line.Went in the morning thought it was great cameback at dust ,fantastic when all the buildings are lit up.

I love the Ferry!. The Star Ferry is easy to use, efficient, inexpensive, fun and a great way to get back and forth from Kowloon! The harbor is beautiful and this ferry is an easy way to get yourself on the water to see the pretty views.
VIEWS. Quick ten minute ride with some of Hong Kongs best views. Pleasant break from the hustle and bustle of the city streets. Seniors ride free.

great for pensioners!. Across the harbour at no cost because we're oldies! Nice little trip and got us to where we wanted to go - a few more directions would be appreciated - or even a road map with a "you are here" to let us orientate ourselves on disembarking. But we found our way okay
Great Transport. Great way to cross the harbor. Cheap to travel (a few HK dollars) takes about 15 min, enough time to check email, stalkbook etc
Cheap way to see the harbour. A lovely trip with authentic feel to it. A 5-10 minute journey across the waters from Kowloon to HK with brilliant views both day and night. Cheap as well!

Fun! and cheap.... Fun and cheap way to travel either Kowloon to Hong Kong Island or vice versa.
