Make sure to get a window seat for best views! The whole process if just to easy and efficient. If you have an octopus card you can use this to pay. Once you arrive at the destination, debarking is so easy and quick!

Cheap, relaxing, Hong Kong classic. If you come to Hong Kong it's probably a bad idea to miss the Star Ferry. It's really easy to hop between the harbour on the ferry, you get to feel the breeze as you sail across to the other side, and it's a nice place to take some photos of this urban jungle too. I loved it as a kid and still love it now.

a interesting trip to Hong Kong. The service offered here is easy to access and cheap, a great way to get around Hong Kong. We used the ferry on a number of occasion. It you want a cheap trip to see the Hong Kong at night use the ferry its great

Best way to see the Harbour. I was fortunate enough to be shown around HK by a relative living here, so got to see all the insider things! The ride is about 5 minutes and costs $2.50 HKD. Fews of the Harbour are simply breath taking!

Nice ride, well done. Great way to get around, organized, understandable, quick, convenient.And who hasn't been told, ride the Star Ferry for good views, which we would have had, but for the fog/haze!
Timeless. I first travelled on the Star Ferry in 1968, little has changed since and it is a very enjoyable way of crossing the harbour for only a few pence.

chug chug. its challenging times for the old ferry but still it plods along back and forth across the harour day and night and yet it still hasnt lost its attraction or romance and is well worth the money.
Worth a ride. We took the Star Ferry back from Hong Kong Island to Kawloon. There are lots of photo opportunities. It was easy to get a ticket and the ride was smooth.
Excellent and frequent service. We used the Star ferry to get back and forth from Kowloon to HK and it rain frequently and was easy to use.

Cool ride on a cool Saturday.... Thought of getting into a lavish harbour tour but changed my mind. I joined the locals. Best journey ever! From Central Pier to Tsim Tsa Tsui's pier will take about 8 minutes and you may want to stop there or other option proceed to Wan Chai pier.
Nice experience. Took the night ferry, it will be packed but you will get seats so no worries. You can get a good view as you can see the Hong Kong night scene while on the ferry.

Local experience. Whether you are a local or a tourist, the star ferry is always a good commuting way of crossing the harbour - connecting you from Central or Wan Chai the two main commercial and shopping hubs of the island to Tsim Sha Tsui in Kowloon in the cheapest possible way. Enjoy the sunset and the wind at the right time if you can!

Trip across the bay. The Star ferry has a variety of boats of varying ages but they are clean. You can travel across Hong Kong harbor from a few different areas on the Star Ferry and it is a pleasant way to travel. The departures are very frequent, about every 10 minutes, so you do not have to wait long.

Don't miss a great way between Kowloon and H-K island. This is classic, I like to go in the morning, I grab a coffee at the 7-11 and a egg custard at the stand entering the ferry berth. Breakfast and a view of the bay. It is cheap and reliable. Please don't miss this. Forget the subway and never take a cab in the tunnel, the pollution and traffic are terrible. I normally stay next to Hong Hum station and walk to the ferry terminal. Once on the island I go to the subway. Enjoy and Savor.
Best way to cross the Harbor. This is a nice inexpensive way to cross the harbor. The ferries run often enough there is really no waiting. Must do it at least once.

A good way to visit the Victoria Harbor. You should at least take the ferry twice. One in day time and the other in night time to capture the beautiful scenery views of Victoria and the landscape of both Hong Kong and Kowloon.
Star ferry. Cheap 2$, fast feed through of passengers,and amazing views, do it at night we went from hk island to Kowloon - fab
Good for sightseeing. There are lots of way to across Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, star-ferry will be the cheapest way among MTR and bus.

Easy, classical and cheap. Catching Star Ferries make for an easy harbour crossing with great views. Cheap at $2HK, just make sure you have low value notes or coins to buy the token required to get through the gates.
A piece of history!. We took the ferry back and forth in the evening prior to the Symphony of Lights and loved seeing the buildings all lit up! Do not miss the experience.

A fun thing to do!. A nice, short harbour cruise. Old style 'cattle car'; it will get you cross on wooden benches. However, you will probably want to walk around and sight see/take pictures on the two level craft. Regular schedule that is convenient and efficient. Well worth the time.
Good memories. Just enjoy the old worldly side. Takes one back over 30 years before the MTR and for the price......nice ride over to Kowloon, have a walk around the Ocena Terminal and back to HK

Cheapest way to get from Hong-Kong lsland to koloon. Cheap and pleasant way of crossing from Hong-Kong island to Kowloon, a definite thing to do if in Hong-Kong. Beautiful at night and not bad during the day.

love the ride to the island. refreshing feeling to the take the ferry from TST to Wan Chai. It feels (and it probably has) like the ferry been operating since the 20s. Touch of the Old HK.. and it's dirt cheap
Quick and easy sightseeing. This is great service as you get terrific views of HK and Kowloon skyline and also ideal way to travel between HK and Kowloon. Easy access Nathan Rd and harbour promenade.
Fun Way Across. This is a more interesting way to cross the harbour than the MTR. It is worth doing it at least once.
Cheap and efficient. Great way to see Hong Kong from the water. Very cheap, always on time, and if you just miss your ferry, there will be another one coming soon!

Basic old school ferry fun quick harbour crossing. Comfortable and clean, cheap and good way to cross the harbour.
Was not a very rough day on the water so very pleasant crossing.
Great views.

Does what it says on the tin !. Cheap and efficient service from HK to TST
Although used by locals it's great for tourists as you get a great view of the harbour
Worth it if you are not tied to time

Nice way to see both sides of HK. In every harbour city you should endeavour to get out on the water and take on the view. The star ferry is an icon of HK and a cheap and easy way to see a little bit of the harbour and the view to each side. Try and see it at sunset if you can and or take in the light show (not super spectacular but worth a quick look).
Iconic trip across the bay. Cheap and special for the view. As everyone says you cannot go to Hong Kong without taking at least one trip on the Star Ferry.

Best 50 cent boat experience in the planet. You have to love the Star Ferry. Take one of the world's finest natural harbors and these great ferry boats - the main HK ferry terminal to Tsim Sha Tsui in Kowloon is a good way to start. The upper deck is fine but pay less for the lower deck where you're 10 feet closer to the water, get to see the engine room and the crew do their work.

A " must do" for amazing views of the harbour, both day and night.. We had heard of the Star Ferry before our visit, and it didn't disappoint! Very well organised, efficient boarding procedure on this traditional ferry crossing. Views of the harbour are stunning, particularly at night time.
Always quick and handy. Cheap transport with a ferry every 10 minutes, great service with great views. Pay with your Oyster card.

Fun, easy to do.. Just a fun and easy thing to do on a pretty day.. A 15 minute boat ride over to Kowloon, walk around a bit, maybe go to the Hong Kong Museum of Art if you like Chinese Art, on the dock 200 meters from the boat. Eating a lunch is easier and more fun on th Hing Long Island side, where the mall by the pier has numerous choices, all affordable, with outside shady seating. We found a nice Turkish kebob type place.The boat is basically almost free. Seniors are $1.5 HKD, (about 25 cents) regulars are $3HKD each way

Nice short trip. Cheap fun way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong side and vice versa. Remember Star Ferry does not leave from China Ferry building which has ferries to Macau etc; Star Ferry is about a 15 minute walk from China Building.

We saved HKD 390!. We took a regular Star Ferry from Central Pier 7 across to the Tsim Sha Tsui Pier, starting point for the Harbor Lights Tour. Paid HKD2.00/person..and that got us thinking...why does the hour-long Harbor Lights Cruise cost HKD 195 each (incl. one drink)? It sounded wayyyy over-priced, a real rip-off. We walked around the area and then realized that if we sit on the al fresco terrace at Almolo Italian Restaurant, we would still get a great view of the Harbour Lights show when it came on. So we put the HKD 390 towards a great Italian meal!

Basic but functional. Reliable and cheap - 20p each single from mainland to HK island. It gave us the opportunity to mix with the locals and get good views of the island and the mainland for photos during the crossing. There is a ticket machine easy to use that takes up to 50 dollar note. If you only have larger notes someone is on hand to change the note for you.

Excellent ferry ride. We did more than enough rides with the star ferries and is always a fun experience. Getting to HK island is also nice and going back the other way is the same. They all accept the Octopus card which is easy enough and cost you next to nothing.

Great way to go from Hongkong to Kowloon and see the city.. We couldn't believe how little it costed in comparison to everything else in Hongkong tourism! There is an upper deck which is being loaded separately. Look for a different loading zone. We did not know this at first but we had the opportunity to come back on the upper deck (much better). We took the ferry over to Kowloon to dinner and to view the Festival of Lights show. We thought it was going to be much more crowded but it turned out to be perfect.

A timeless, romantic commute on the Victoria Harbour. The Star Ferry and its several boat crossings on the Victoria Harbour connecting Central with Kowloon are one of the most romantic, enduring features of old Hong Kong so much so National Geographic puts it down as ‘one of 50 places of a lifetime’. The ferry’s origins go back to an Indian cook, a Parsee, in the late 1800s who commercialised a steamboat operation, up and down from the Kowloon peninsula to Central island. The Star Ferry’s single deck and double-deck boats run from the Kowloon clock tower to the Central pier and Wanchai and back from early morning to late evening. The commuting charges are nominal and free for seniors (producing age proof). On our visit we also took a cruise to see the various sights from the historic harbor.
Ferry. Nothing much to say, it's a ferry that serves a purpose, this service has been going for many years that crosses the harbour to Kowloon side
Verry Good. Great way to see The the Harbour ,staff were lovely, a little bit confusing to find the way on ferry but did not take away from a nice trip

convenient and great fun. Star ferry was easy to use, convenient and great fun. A traditional way to travel in Hong Kong we used the ferry service to cross from Kowloon to Central on Hong Kong island. a great way to travel

Must make the trip on the Wan Chi Ferry. Costs almost nothing for the ride. Hong Kong is not visited unless you use the Hong Kong Ferry. Take a bunch of pictures as you will always want to remember.Can be romantic and surely picture perfect. Sight seeing at it's best.You will always remember this moment.

Star ferry revisited. I had heard so much about the Star Ferry from my partner , who had spent a lot of time In HK as a teenager , when his father was Crown Solicitor over 50 years ago.. He said it had hardly changed, over the years except for the chickens etc on board !! It was a great way to Get from HK island to the cruise port on Kowloon
Great way to go to Kowloon forget the MTR!. If you want to travel overland then this is a must - the MTR could be taken but a great and cheap way to see the harbour highlights

Great way to cross the water from Kowloon. We took the ferry from the Kowloon "Star Ferry Pier" to Hong Kong Island's Central Pier. It was a fun ride (a short trip, but can be very rough for those prone to seasickness), but be careful of anyone without excellent balance as even getting on the ferry was tricky due to the waves.This ferry accepts the "Octopus Card" - HKG's universal travel pass. I suggest you load one up & maximize it. The pass is good for ferry/trolley/subway/bus and more. Pretty awesome.

Quintessential Hong Kong. A cheap way to cross over between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon in an old style ferry of times gone by. Stunning views of the harbour and skyline and though it may take longer, it beats the MRT hands down!
Fun!. Easy to use, convenient for crossing the harbor or reaching the out islands. Clean and comfortable. Great way to see the area for very little expense.
Scenic trip. Nice scenic way to cross between the island and mainland to watch the city laser lights display between 8.00 and 8.15pm.

5 stars for the Star Ferry. It was easy to get tickets, we had a beautiful sunny day, the ride was quick and efficient - especially compared with a taxi.
On the down side we could not get a taxi once we got off. All the taxis at the designated taxi rank on the Hong Kong Island side were out of service.
Value. Such a cheap way to cross to Central and win spectacular views too. It's free to the over 65s and only coppers to all others.

An expensive way to see the harbour.. Try to time it for early evening to take in the light show. No reason to take an expensive tour. The ferry runs from Central to Kawloon. It only takes 5 to 10 minutes.

You have to do this. According to a sign next to the ticket machine, it's one of the 100 things to do before you die according to National Geographic. And they're right. Travel across to Kowloon by day then back across at night to witness the amazing light show from the water.

Easy to use the Harbour. A great way to see the harbour, go to Central/return or Wanchai/return from TST. Very inexpensive, can use your Octopus card. Upper deck is great for taking photos of the harbour
cruise. Star ferry is the refreshing mode of transport to view the beauty scenes of South china sea covering the HK island.

Speedy and Fun way to get to Kowloon. Star Ferry is a 10 minute ride from Pier 7 to Kowloon and there is a Ferry leaving every 10 minutes or so. Be sure to take the ferry from Kowloon back to Hong Kong in the evening as the lights on the Hong Kong side are not to be missed ... just gorgeous. when you arrive in Kowloon head up the stairs to the left into the mall. Ask at the customer service desk where the ice cream shop is located that creates the ice cream that looks like a flower. You will not be disappointed. Get back to the ferry terminal as this is a great jump off point to take the MTR to Mon Kok for the Ladies Market or Sham Shui Po for the fabric district. One of the best purchases you can make is the "Octopus Card". You can use this on the MTR, buses and the Ferry. You can get at the MTR station as well as 7/11 store.

Super transportation. The ferry is a fun way to get from Kowloon to HongKong. Views are spectacular and a good way to see where you want to go. It can be windy and hot (or cold) on the top deck. The bottom is fine with good ways to get your pictures.They are very frequent and comfortable.

Great view of the Hong Kong Harbor. Considering the cost of the Staten Island Ferry, this was a very inexpensive way to see more of Hong Kong. It does cost more to be on the upper deck than the lower deck and there is no going between the decks.
Real Hong Kong. A real experience of Hong Kong , travelling with the locals , amazingly cheap and fast link between Kowloon and HK island.

Godd Transport Area. Apart from it being the main Bus Stop, it is also the harbour to cross over between Kowloon and Hongkong Islands. It is also the port for cross country cruise liners and ferry terminal for neighboring Islands. Short Harbor cruises also start from here.
A must do.. These old boats are a fantastic way to see the harbour and skyline of Hong Kong for almost free. Do it !

Great fun. This is an epic activity, just sailing on one of these ferries from Kowloon to HK Island, and especially if you like people watching. In fact, my other half said it was one of the highlights of our entire trip! Cheap as chips to do, full of unique noises, smells and sights and you can see lots of sights as you move across the water. Highly recommend.
Great harbour views!. Best views of the harbour for a very minimal cost! Make sure you sit on the upper deck and enjoy the stunning views.

Again! Apart from tramway, this transport is worth to take. With a very cheap price can enjoy the Victoria Harbour view in different angle, this is a must take transport in Hong Kong. Nice journey though sometime too many people inside. A very cheap price with a wonderful journey!
A must. This ferry has been around forever. It's worth hoping on to visit the other side. We took the ferry from Hong Kong to Kowloon. It only cost .50 cents.
Best sightseeing value in HK. Either direction or both about 50 cents each way. Great views of the HK skyline. Runs about every 15 minutes. Cheaper than MRT.

Fantastic way to see HK. Excellent ferry system used my many many commuters. We took a bit of a triangular trip between the main terminal, Lantau, and the stop nearest the Royal Yacht Club. The boats are very clean, lovely and old.
best quality price attraction in Hong Kong. This ferry ride is not only convenient and relatively fast, it also provide a great view on the HK skyline. Don't miss it!

Beautiful Must Do for Every Visitor to HK. My Favourite . Short Ride of 10 Mins . Very Quiet and Very Economical
For City Dwellers I recommend a Must .
Best Way to Travel from Tsim Sha Sui to Wan Chai / Central
For Indians there is a Very Good Cafe at Central Pier : JO JO
Must try there Tea . A Complete Masala Chai
A must in night. A must when visiting HK....its romantic in night and convenient if crossing to HK from kowloon. we tried in the night to reach central station of MRT.

Efficient and offers great views. Outstanding link to HK island.
One of the "must do" items in Hong Kong.
Best to get an Octopus card charged at the airport and use it for all the public transport, including the Star Ferry.
Fun!. It was easy and fun! Great way to travel without walking too much. Different locations to go to. Just make sure you know where you are stopping.
Best in Hongkong,. Cheap and history alive in Hongkong! A must to slow you down in this busy city, we love it. What a contrast to all that Hongkong offers!

Living History. A must do for anyone visiting HK.
Great photo opportunities for both the island and for the mainland.
A very cheap way to capture the spirit of Hong Kong and become involved in an institution.
Good. Part of the hop on hop off tickets. Fast well organised and clean an easy way to Hong Kong island. The museum is well worth a look.

Amazing experience of Hong Kong backwaters. Whilst you are in the ferry, you enjoy the ferry ride, pass through the great buildings at the harbor... overall experience of the ferry ride is just great...
Manage your time and reach the ferry on time. Ticket prices keep on the increasing as it gets late in the evening.
A great cheap way to get across the harbour!. Old school and authentic... and an extremely cheap way to get across the harbor. Beautiful view of the skyline at night.

a beautiful iconic ferry ride. a very iconic mode of crossing the bay, it was never closed despite the subway linking both islands. its a very romantic ride and you get to see both sides of kowloon and hongkong. they made sure they preserved this as this has been the traditional mode of transportation to cross the other side.
Great way to see Victoria Harbor and the Hong Kong Skyline. Passage was included in our ticket from the Big Bus. Really a great way to get a look at Hong Kong's skyline.

A charming way of transport. It s a great way to see Hong Kong and Kowloon landscape from the harbour. The ferry is easy to take and very cheap. As tourists, we avoid rush hour and the trip was pleasant. Round trip took us less than 1 hour. You can plan your day to go one way and continue with adventure on another side of the island.
Great way to see the harbour. Great way to see the harbour and the fantastic skyline. My fave way to travel in Hong Kong. I always travel on the upper deck.

Fast, cheap and great free tour. Always a good quick trip, lots of local color, and grea views of the city. Ride it at night for wonderful color. Ride the lower deck at least once for real local experience.

Cheap and cheery way to travel. A fantastic cheap way to cross from Kowloon into Hong Kong city or vice versa. You can buy hop on/off bus tickets by the star ferry in Kowloon - a great way to see all the sights. I love it!!!

Nostalgia at its best. Superb service between HK Island and Kowloon - cheap and perfect for seeing the skyline. Yes it is old fashioned but it reminds me of the ferries on the Mersey which run between the Pier Head Birkenhead and the Vegas of the Wirral - New Brighton.

Really nice boat trip and not expensive. I prefer the boat over the subway to go from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon or vice versa. With a good view over the skylines of both sides, the wind, sun and the smell of the sea make it a nice experience!You can pay with the Octopus card!
Great fun. It's a must to use the star ferry either from the pier or wan chai. Use an octopus card to get around as a 65 plus traveller just 20c pet trip.
An experience. Loved the frequency and dependability, I was helped on,( I walk with a stick) . Good photo opportunities while travelling. $2.70 HKHave to like that

Best form of transport in HK. Atmospheric, clean, frequent and super cheap. Brilliant! You can use your Octapus card or buy a token. Take your camera for lots of pictures on the crossing. If you go in the evening you will catch the laser show,

Great way to see Hong Kong skyline. We were staying in Wan Chai walked down to ferry port. Construction confused us and if we had followed the signs to convention centre we would have found it faster. The ferry terminal is near the convention center so if your looking for the ferry follow the signs for convention centre in Wan Chai. Cheap and efficient takes you right to Kowloon and the shipping mall.
Nostalgic. You feel went back 60 years in time and very nice view of the Island and Kawloon. Very easy location on both sides.

Star Ferry - A Hong Kong Institution!. At least one ride, if not many at different times of the day, is a must do in Hong Kong. It's cheap and cheerful, you get to marvel at this magnificent Harbour at any time of day or (most stunningly) at night. Try and have some small coins handy for the token machines and avoid peak hours if you can.

Very cheap. Star ferry is a cheap ride between Islands in HK. Costs only 2.80HKD one way from Central HK to Kowloon. Star ferry is very friendly for families with kids using stroller. To get into Star ferry with stroller is very comfortable.
A must do in Hong kong. A great and inexpensive way to see the city skyline morning and night. A great trip, and lovely to watch the children get excited as you cross the harbour.
Very useful picturesque way to travel. Quick, easy & efficient plus a stunning view.. We loved getting to the island by ferry & then catching a bus from Central.

Best Ride with Views. Can't beat the historical and cheap Ferry rides. Cheap and run constantly. You can see Hong Kong and Islands in a way you can't from land. Makes you feel like your in a Agatha Christy book...romantic and mysterious...

Reminds me of the Staten Island Ferry!. Big slow boats, pretty frequent departures, you can drink and eat on the boat, fares are beyond cheap! What's not to like??? Yes, the Central - TST route is too short to enjoy but is arguably more predictable and convenient than the MTR - at least if you want to go to Harbour City.

One of the World's Most Iconic Boat Rides. The Hong Kong Island skyline and the Harbor are absolutely the most stunning sights of their kind in the world, with the possible exception of downtown Manhattan seen from Brooklyn or the Staten Island ferry.If you have to cross from the island to Kowloon (and as a tourist you will have to, probably several times), on at least one crossing skip the MTR and take the ferry. It's an experience that you'll remember as long as you live. Bring small coins, as the queues to buy tokens can be long. All the seatbacks on the Upper Deck (first class, about US 30 cents as of this writing) flip. Many people go to the front section, but better views are had on one side or the other (you have to try to figure this out as you board), and the center is a bit more stable in rough weather.

A nice experience and a must do in Hong Kong. A very inexpensive way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong. There are not as many boats as the MTR, but it is a far more unique experience than the subway.Not sure that I would pay the money for a 1 hour harbour tour that leaves from the main ferry ports as this 10 minute journey gives you 80% of the experience for a tiny fraction of the cost.Tip- small change is King with Hong Kong transport. It costs around 50 cents each way and you can use small notes and coins to buy a token at the entrance to the terminal. Carry a small amount of $5 coins with you ($50 is enough) to make transport easier for you.
A piece of history. When in Hong Kong, this is a must. The harbour tour on the star ferry was a highlight of the trip. Do it.

Cheap!!!!!. I think we paid the equivalent of 40p each to go over to Hong Kong island so whats there to moan about!!!!! Takes about 10mins sailing and goes on late into the night. You HAVE to use the star ferry to get over there, you cant get cheaper!!!
Fun. Great way to travel across to the island. Stunning views for a few cents. Can't go wrongGet the Octopus Card
Cheap and easy. The ferries are fast reliable and offer brilliant views of Victoria harbor. Tickets cost $2.50 at the time of travel.

Hong Kong History. The Star Ferry is a good part of Hong Kong history that still remains an efficient way to cross between Kowloon and Hong Kong island. It's noisy and hot but provides stunning views of the city skyline and Peak. Highly recommended as a tourist attraction otherwise stick to the very effficient and comprehensive MRT system.

Annniversary holiday. What a great way to see Victoria harbour by day & night, no frills, very cheap, runs every few minutes. Being a senior citizen, it costs just over HKD1. did not find it over crowded,jump on and enjoy the views.

Lovely views of the skyline...great experience. The lovely Hong Kong skyline is best seen at night, from a venerable Star Ferry. This is just a cool way to cross the Harbor. You're transported back in time and the lights at night are to die for! Don't miss this totally cool Hong Kong attraction. Especially during the Christmas time. Wow!
Efficient. Great ride for a great price. Very efficient as with all things in honk kong. Great views from upstairs of the harbour and skyline. Easy to commute with an octopus

Stunning Views, Stunning Value. The Star Ferry is the best way to see the Hong Kong and Kowloon skylines. At a one way trip cost of just HK$2.50 (US$0.32, GB£0.22!) it is also one of the best value trips in the world. Even the 50 minute long harbor cruise on the specially modified Shining Star only costs HK$90 (US$11.61, UK£7.89) and includes a drink and snack on board.
Great fun at virtually no cost!. Probably one of the cheapest and most enjoyable things to do in the whole City - upstairs or downstairs.

Best Way to Cross. Cheap and really fun way to get across to the island but once the gates open to board the boat be prepared for a sprinting competition. Just hold back and drift on when the commotion is over!

Great Ride. Its really cheap and a quick ride across to the other island.. only costs approx HKD3 per adult.. pity we went on the last day as we realised that food and drinks half the price on the other side

Best Free Harbour Tour. When I used to live in HK I sometimes just took the ferry to enjoy the lights at night around Victoria Harbour ... In other cities this would be considered a 20 USD harbour cruise ...

Nice views and value for money. A nice trip in the Victoria Harbor and great value for money. Not something easily found in HK. The only drawback is maybe that it does not last very long. On the other hand it is not mainly for tourists but part of the local transportation system.

A must in Hong Kong. One of the cheapest and slow ways to move around (actually from HK island to Kowloon and vv) but this makes it so previous to me, in addition to people watching, all the world travels on the Star ferry and you can see all kind of people there.
Don't miss it, it is cheap and fun.
A must while in HK. Easy way to see the city by water! Quick efficient travel to and from HK and Kowloon! Great for taking city landscape pics! Loved it. Cheap way to travel in HK.
Great little ferry trip. Worth a trip. Great views lovely traditional boat and very cheap to do. A good photo opportunity to capture some of the typical views of the city
Bucket list. One of National Geographic's '50 things to do before you die'. A brilliant (and extremely cheap) way to get a view of one of the most stunning harbours in the world.
Easy, Cheap and Convenience. The must ride in HK, it is cheap, easy to use octopus and very convenience to cross between HK and Island. Dislike about the on-going construction at certain station.
Great Service. Worth taking the ferry to Kowloon. Quick and convenient and great views of the Hong Kong skyline. Loved it.

FIRST CLASS IS HARDLY THAT. They charge more to sit upstairs in "First Class". But you are still sitting on wood benches. It's pretty cheap fares. I think it might even be more fun to try steerage on the lower deck and experience what Hong Kong residents experience.

Must do. No visit to Hong Kong can be complete, without at least one trip on the star ferry. Its cheap at 2HKD to travel on the lower deck or 25HKD to 'upgrade' to the upper deck (20p or 25p). There is no transit between decks once on the ferry, you decide at the pier which level to travel.Although the view is great it is the reliability of the cheap, long standing and iconic transportation system that is the draw.

My favourite thing to do in Hong Kong. Take a trip from Kowloon to Central on the old star ferries and see fantastic views of Hong Kong on both ways. Go shopping at IFC in Central (just at the end of the walkway ) or in Kowloon directly left from exit go to Harbour City Shopping.

fun and cheap. This ferry only costs about 20p (UK pence) a person to visit HK island! a must do and very pretty at night! dont go into the star ferry terminal, that's for bigger ferries, walk instead to the water edge and you'll find the 'water taxi' there.
Great value trip. Excellent service and value on this Ferry which is both quick and efficient across the water. No queues either way, even on a bank holiday.
Gorgeous. That's a great experience. It takes 9 minutes to go from one side to the other.You can pay it with your octopus card, and it costs like 2 HK dollars.The pictures from it are amazing!

A "Must take" ride when you are in Hong Kong. I make sure that I ride the Star Ferry each time I am in Hong Kong, and I did that the last time I was there in Jan 2015.It has a nostalgic air and the ride across the harbour is wonderful in good weather.
Ferry to Kowloon. I prefer the train to Kowloon. Cheaper and more in tune with regular ppl of China. Ferry was a bunch of tourists, but was OK.
Visit to The Peak. The peaks brilliant. Great tram ride. Wonderful views of HK. Unfortunately quite misty the day we were there.

Iconic harbour crossing. The Star Ferry crossing is iconic and a 'must' for any visitor , at least once. On a clear day the view in both directions is fantastic and it is lovely to enjoy a trip which is used by locals and tourists alike. A very cheap and enjoyable way to cross to or from Hong Kong Island.
to the island. still amazingly cheap and gives a great view of the city. Much better value than the cross harbour tunnels by taxi .
Great trip on Meridian Star ferry. Quick, slick and a step into the past! Loved it. Not crowded at all and clear view coming in to landing stage.

Cheap as chips and great views. Worth doing and very cheap - max 34p per crossing.
Great views of the area and have a trip across at 8pm when the light show is going on
Hassle-free. It was easy to purchase tokens from the machine with coins, stand in line without a long wait and speedy, comfy journey to the other side.
A must do. Taken the star ferry is a must when in Hong Kong, and do it in the evening, the skyline is amazing from the water
A Must. The Star Ferry is our favorite. Day or night you see the beautiful city views. It cost almost nothing. Take the ride, just for the views.

it costs less than a dollar. The ferry is so fun. It takes around 10 minutes to cross the river. There are lots of people waiting and it is a little crowded but its so fun to see the city from the opposite side of the river.

Great view of City at Night. If your visiting Hong Kong and want to go to Kowloon to do some shopping at the markets or high end store. Take the ferry as its an experience and you see the amazing lights of both sides of the river in Hong Kong.
All part of the experience. Why take a cab when you can travel like the locals ? A great view from the water and an inexpensive trip.
Excellent. Very very cheap with 10-15 minutes frequency. Ferry accommodates around 400 people. It's clean and service is excellent. Sightseeing is superb through ferry.

Great value for money, exciting ride. The walk up to this ferry terminal is filled with pieces from the museum of arts and lined with quite a beautiful skyline. You get to travel across the bay for 2.3 HKD as on 5th Apr 2015 with the Octopus card, which makes the deal even sweeter. A very picturesque ride where the ferry is almost empty after about 11AM up to 4PM on a Sat.
View of the city. It was very easy to cross one island to another, the ferry offered a great view of the skyline of the harbor and a nice way to cool off. It was fast and cost very little.

Great cheap way to travel. Quick and easy to get over to the mainland where you find markets everywhere! When I say Markets... I mean, random stuff that you need but may only use once, as it will break if used twice. Still a lot of fun and a good place to try speaking all that Chinese you have been practising. The boat taking you there is easy, I highly recommend getting a octopus card as they can be used everywhere. The ride at night is great for photos of the city.

A Tourism Must Do. I do not think a trip to Hong Kong is complete without at least one crossing on the Star Ferry. The old ferry provides a perfect view of both Central and Tsim Sha Tsui. From the ferry, it becomes possible to really appreciate the enigma that is Hong Kong, with its mix of old and new.

Old Time Of Hong Kong ...... This is amazing and so many year it still running across to Hong Kong. I love the ride ... Fast and the ticket is cheap .... When I get aboard , I was like back to the past ..... Wow is a very memory ride !! If it's rain , hohoho we can get real wet too. But is worth it. Please keep this boat running for another 10 year. The kids love it so much.

One of the MUST do and SEE in HK. One of the MUST do and SEE in HK , the cheapest attraction you will find here , I recommend to take the star ferry from Central to Tsim Sha tsui during evening time , will be the best if you manage to take it at 8:15pm to combine it with HK lights show , the view of both harbor sides is awesome ! GO FOR IT !

Nice and convenient way to travel between the islands.. I took the Ferry on my way to Victoria Peak from Tsim Sha Tsui.I loved the experience. It gives you the opportunity to see both of the islands from a different perspective. It is also very convenient. The ride takes approximately 15. minutes. Beautiful views and official way of transportation.

The best way to travel between islands. For a tourist is the nicest way to travel between islands, you can see the big buildings near the bay, it is very cheap around 3 HKD and much nicer than the subway.
Cheap Experience. It is a cheap experience on a ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui (Kowloon side) to Central (Hong Kong side). A short and a fun trip. A must try for any 1st time tourist to Hong Kong.

Good. Take the ferry to Cheung Chau Island and you will be pleasantly surprised. Such a lovely place so near to Hong Kong but far from the maddening crowd. Great fish Restaurants and a visit to the Temple is recommended. Hire a bike and go around the short seafront. Very friendly people. Highly recommended
A 5 cent ride!. Quick, easy and convenient! So much nicer than fighting the crowds underground. The sights and sounds are amazing and it's practically free. A "must do" while in Hong Kong!

The real Hong Kong. An excellent way to people watch and to take part in a long esablished HK transport facility.
It costs pennies to use (just get a token from the machine for the barrier) and you will get to experience a little of the magic.
You could go back and forth all day for about a pound!

Bit bouncy but what a view. Nice old ferry which you must take at nightfall when the lightshow starts to enjoy the fullest. Depending on the wind if this is a good match with people who get seasick quite easily because the boat tends to bounce a lot on the water. trip only takes a couple of minutes though.

Old world charm mixed with modern day convenience. The best way to travel across Victoria harbour (and the cheapest too)...Please do not waste your money and time on expensive harbour cruises...Just take the ferry across the harbour for less than HKD 3.00 each way...Fantastic views and no-fuss service...

Do it. Fun. Cheap. Simple.. You're travelling when you're on a boat, it feels like you are on a real voyage... A ten minute voyage. Easy to buy ticket tokens just before you board at the machines, if you miss the boat another one comes quickly. A little bumpy at times makes it feel like you're on water, but not uncomfortable. It celebrates Hong Kong by being on the water.

Don't miss this expecially if you're a senior. We had bought Octopus cards but weren't aware for seniors over 65 (ie qualifying for the Octopus Elder) the Star Ferry is FREE! So we took it four times, twice in daytime and twice again at night to see the light show. Its really great, although only 7 minutes.
City Travel. City Travel through the ferry is awesome. Even when you are on a business trip, this 8 min ride de-stresses you.
Must Do. Every visitor to Hong Kong must do the Star Ferry. It is a very cheap means of transport across the Harbour between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Be sure to travel on the upper deck.

Fast, efficient and cheap!. You haven't experienced Hong Kong until you have ridden the ferry. Have seen men in formal dress (kilts) on St. Andrews day taking it to some festivities. All classes ride it.
Just an old ferry. Cheap and nostalgic way to arrive on Hk island but otherwise just a ferry current price is 25hk$ so only 25p each way.
best view from the sea. it is so cheap, how can you complain: the people working there are also kinder than in some shops and restaurants!

It's a "must do". It's more the history than the ride itself....The 10-minute (or so) ride across the HK harbour is not particularly remarkable in itself, but the fact that you're making a trip which has been around forever (well, 117 years), and that you're making a trip which tens of millions have made before you - locals and tourists alike.Weather permitting there's some nice view of both Kowloon and the Island. Sit on the outside if you can.

Convenient and economic ride across the harbour. We always take the Star Ferry when we go to the Cultural Centre for performances. We also always recommend out of town visitors to take the short ride at least once. It is cheap and efficient, costing HK$2.5 for a single ride (free for passengers over 65 years old). It is also best combined with a visit to the Avenue of Stars in Tsim Sha Tsui (as well as to watch the Symphony of Lights from TST area).Ferries ply regularly between Central (near IFC) and Tsim Sha Tsui. They have another route going between Tsim Sha Tsui and Wanchai as well. There is a tourist package costing HK$25 for unlimited rides over four days...

Great way to relax and reflect. 99% of the time I always commute to the island via MTR, but sometimes I decide to go by ferry. It's always nice to slow down and it really makes you appreciate the city. I love feeling the wind in my hair and taking in the beautiful views of the skyline. Makes you feel so grateful!
An exellent service. A very nice ulternative way to cross the harbour, Slower than the MRT but a much nicer view and often not as crowded, A beautiful thing to do in the evening.

Worth the fare - great harbour views . For the amount you pay for a trip across the harbour, it's certainly worth the cost and more. The view of Kowloon and Hong Kong islands are amazing - I would recommend catching a ferry during the light and laser show (evenings between 8-8:15pm) to see a special experience!
Cheap fast fun ferry ride. Very quick trips accross Victoria harbour, never have to wait long for ferry, nice views at night it really is a lot of fun
Nice Experience. Nice ferry and nice view of HK.The ferry was cheap, clean and safe, perfect for families, couples, friends and soloist wanted to travel HK. Nice city, Nice views...

Experience the past. This is one of the best mean to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong island. Its quick and cheap. Try to ride during day and night as well to enjoy the Hong Kong's skyline view at both the times.
essential Hong Kong experience. travel back in time with these lovely old ferries. cheap.efficient reliable. best views and way to cross the harbour

Enjoyable ferry ride with beautiful scenery. Every now and then taking the ferry between the Hong Kong and Kowloon islands is a treat. The scenery of the skyline with the boat traffics make it a enjoyable journey.
25 pence for upper deck. ferry or subway train? not much of a choice if you are a tourist, not sure what they do if you dont get off and spend the day going back and forth!

best deal ever. i am a big fan of chinese movie and this boat is like one of those that will take you back to 60's. i thought it was an attraction that needs ticket but it is actually common people's transportation

Cheap and efficient. It is very convenient to travel between HK Island and Kowloon on the Star Ferry. You can take the ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui (Kowloon) to either Wanchai or Central on HK Island and enjoy the great harbour view. The ride is cheap and fairly regular.
A whole new view. A different view of Victoria Harbour. It runs 'til late, so you can even get a nice view of the illuminated HK skyline. At only $2.3HK, it's a steal!

The best way to travel.. The star ferries are speedy and frequent, and cheap. We stayed in Karloon and travelled to Hong Kong Island by star ferry, the ferries from Hong Kong Island also go to to more rural islands so an excellent way of seeing the area ! And avoiding the traffic blocked streets!!!

Beautiful views at Night. We took the star ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong after the 8 PM light show ended.The HK skylines were beautiful. We paid with the Octopus card. The ferry was cheap, clean, and safe.
Historical Journey. We loved taking the Star Ferry on a lovely warm day. It gives you one of the best views of Hong Kong Island or Kowloon. Go to the upper deck to avoid the fumes.
take a ride through history. Ride the star ferry as many times as you can. When you say no to the star ferry you say no to life. Best way to get from HK to Kowloon hands down. Cheap too.

Efficient and Cheap. Its probably one of the best way to move from Kowloon to HK island, especially at night where the night view was excellent, process is fast and cheap.
2 thumbs up
Glad it is still going.. Historic and Fun. top deck views are great. this service has been a Hong Kong must do for years , nice way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong island and return, Nostalgia plus.

Good fun.........silly cheap. The ferries go backwards and forwards all day. There are various destinations between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Two adults single fare is about. 25 pence. They also do a harbour tour which is about £1.00. Good fun.

efficient travel with great views. Star Ferry was convenient to Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. The views across the Harbour were excellent and made for great photos.Easy and cheap to use. Major attraction in Hong Kong.

Fantastic !. Amazingly cheap. Made in Hull. Quaint. Used by all locals. Great way of seeing Hong Kong. Easy paying system where you buy your plastic discs at machine then into turnstile slot to get onto dock.

Best way to get to Kowloon. So inexpensive! Easy and just fun to experience crossing to the other side by waterway. Yes, you can take a taxi..and they are a dime a dozen in HKG but take the ferry.. just something different.

Old time favorite. Just something I grew up with when I was studying here. Love the view and the ferry itself is really cool to ride. Loved it as a child and I still take my children to ride it when ever we visit hong kong.

Star ferry efficient. Started on time and arrived on time. Typical ferry - nothing too special. The old ferries have some character but are not particularly comfortable - but the crossing is only 5-6 minutes. Fun way to cross.

Well preserved throwback. There was a time not long ago when Star Ferry Terminal was the literal heart of Hong Kong transportation. Time has changed its role but the romance is still there if you want to find it.
Great way to see the city skyline. Costs next to nothing o use the ferry, very busy waterway but great wy to see what is going on in this bustling port

Value for Money. It was the cheapest boat tour I ever had. I would have spent more money just for fuel, to do a ride in my own boat in Negombo Canal. The boat ride and the service was excellent. I never expected such a budget service in TST area.

Fun way to go from Kowloon to HK Island. We took the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and it was a fun little journey. It only takes a few minutes and you get a nice view of the skyline as you're traversing the harbor. Cheap too.

Still the cheapest ferry ride in the world. A lovely way to get from one side of Victoria Harbour to the other, as one ferry leaves another pulls in. There aren't many comforts on board the seats are hard, but it such a short trip they don't become an issue.

Don't miss this classic. Still only a few coins to travel to and from Kowloon & Hong Kong Island...this Ferry Service has been running since 1890. Each Ferry has a unique "Star" name..see if you can ride them all...!

Great Ride, Great Views. I love Star Ferry. It is a 10 minute ride from the Central to Kowloon. It is a great ride with wonderful views and really cheap. Take one ride during the day and one during the night.
Simple but so fun. We stayed in Kowloon but wanted to spend a day in Soho, so we hopped the ferry and it was such a neat experience. What a wonderful view of the entire harbor.

\a gem. Caught the ferry to Hong Kong Island on the way to visit The Peak.If you don't have a travel card, you will need a 2HK$ coin in order to obtain a token from the "ticket machine" (which you then use to go through the barrier to get on the ferry). A memorable ride on the ferry, which is a real gem.

An old favourite. I first travelled on the Star Ferry when I visited Hong Kong in 1972 on R&R. Not much seems to have changed. Definitely one of the things you have to do on a visit to this fascinating city.
Great cheap way to see the skyline. We rode the Star Ferry several times, just for an uncrowded, relaxing way to cross the harbor. You should do this at least once during the day and once at night.

Must do, great experience to see the Victoria harbour. This is a must if you visit HK. Is $2.50 for upper deck travel and sit at the front to get a great view of the harbour on either side of Kowllon and HK. Weather permits you get a great view and the journey is only 10mins if that and frequent service so you don't have to wait long to hop on the return journey. We cross over from Kowloon to HK then do the Tram 'ding ding'. Great day out.

A Wonderful Interlude to a Hong Kong Day or Night. This is a classic Hong Kong experience. There are shops in the ferry terminal buildings on both sides that sell models in various sizes of the ferry and its ancestors and related maritime souvenirs. I still have one from my first visit to Hong Kong years ago. Its still enjoyable to cross the beautiful and famous harbour and arrive on the other side. Its also a nice picture taking opportunity. And its a gentle moment in a day and a reminder of better times.

Best way to explore the bay. The rides from HK Island to Kowloon Island on the Star Ferry are the best ways to explore this exceptional part of HK. If you are interested in just crossing over, the MTR is a much faster option, but for tourists the ferry rides, offer a unique and inexpensive experience.

A good place at the beach. From this place ferry service is available. Enjoyed ferry ride up to Central and back from this place. Many high rise buildings are situated on both sides of the Star Ferry. A nice place on the beach to spend some time in the evening. Light and sound show is held daily in the evening here. A never to miss place.

An affordable iconic trans-island transport. We used star ferry as our transport between our hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui and the Hong Kong Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre. It is a cheap, fast, convenient and traffic free transportation option, I think this is a must at least once when visiting HK.

Star Ferry Offers Classic Hong Kong Skyline View. Kowloon to HK via Star Ferry is what one really must do when in Hong Kong. It's quick, reliable transport in a couple of ways (both nostalgic as well as a convenient and cost-effective crossing).

Best to view the Panasonic Hong Kong skyline!. Short interesting ride from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central - 8 minutes!! And you see the Victoria harbour and also Kowloon skyline. Night ride absolutely cool especially if you are taking one when the Symphony of Lights is staged!
Romantic trip. Romantic trip, a romantic trip short trip,event just a short trip, but you can see the beautiful view in the middle of the sea

A MUST DO. The Star Ferry has been running for more than 125 years and takes millions of passengers a year between Kowloon and Hong Kong. It costs roughly 30 US cents or 20 UK pence so is an incredible bargain. The crossing takes less than 10 minutes and the views are stunning. Dusk is a great time to go. Ferries go between TST (Kowloon side) and Central or WanChai (Hong Kong side)

By far the best way of getting across the harbour. Costs next to nothing and runs so frequently that it is a no brainer if you want to enjoy the experience of travelling between HK (Central) and Kowloon (Tsim Sha Tsui). Great views at night. Takes about 10 mins to cross.

An absolute must do trip. The ONLY way to travel to and from Kowloon! Not to be missed - the hustle and bustle of everyday life mixed in with tourists and business executive - great way to see the skyline and experience HK way of life

Still a great way to travel between HK and Kowloon. If you're crossing between HK and Kowloon, chuck the train/taxi and give the Star Ferry a shot. Damn inexpensive, plus you get a great view of the HK skyline as a bonus.

Best value thing in HK!. Brilliant value at around 25p per journey ( they take Octopus cards)
Best value thing to do in all of HK and a little piece of history too!
Upgrade to the top deck for fantastic views of the HK skyline as you go across the bay. Great fun, a MUST do thing!
convenient and very cheap. we tooked the ferries to cross the harbour everyday and once to get to Lammu island, it was convenient, always on time and very cheap

Don't book this attraction as part of a tour...fantastic view and great experience for just a couple of HK$. This really is a must do, especially if you are visiting Hong Kong for the first time. Buy an Octopus card and use it for travel on the MRT, buses, Star Ferry etc.
If you are sightseeing, you'll get the most out of the crossing if you can pick a clear, fine day. Take the camera for some memorable shots.
A must do in Hong Kong. A Hong Kong institution, it's a cheap, easy way to zip back and forth across the Harbour. We used it a lot during our stay.
Love it. Always pleasure to cross from main land to different locations. Beautiful old fashion feel. Love the uniform of people who work on Star ferry. And very low fare HK $2.00

A US $0.32 Ferry Ride. For US$0.32 between Tsim Sha Tsui and Central Ferry Terminal, it's value is best in the World. About a 10 minute ride across the Hongkong Harbour with unrestricted view of both waterfronts and the Surroundings, it's a must do for HK tourists.
Good view of Hong Kong from a boat. It was an exciting boat ride from Kowloon to Hong Kong. It is a must when you are visiting Hong Kong. Inexpensive.

Need to experience. I understand that this ferry use to be packed but now with the underground train and roads between Hong kong and Kowloon, this ferry is a good way to travel and spend a bit of time admiring the skyline and harbour.
125th celebrations. A really easy experience to get from one side to the other. Very frequent crossings. Lots to see on the river and very cheap to cross
Love it. one of the best attractions in Hong Kong you see a amazing skyline on board of a legacy ferry that is so embodies Hong Kong
Great!. We never got tired of crossing the harbor on the Star Ferry. What a wonderful way to see the beautiful views of Hong Kong and Kowloon.

Convenience beyond compare. I am no fan of public transport of any kind and expect the ferries to be visited upon by a mad crush of people. Instead, this ferry line is clean, order, timely and utterly convenient and pleasant in all respects. Get the Octopus card and hop on!
For Better view of HK and Kowloon Island. Its old style ferry ride that connects HK Island and Kowloon Island. Its short 15 mins ride and gives nice view of HK island skyscrapers.
Great Way to Travel. Easy accessible from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. The oldest ferry still running. Cheap and very clean and fast. Service from staff and crew great. No problems at all.

A must. It is a must for tourists and you have great (though shot-ride) view of the harbour at almost no cost. There are two routes, central to Tsimshatsui, and Wanchai to Tsimshatsui. This used to be the fastest crossing of Hong Kong harbour but the tunnel and MTR now take over and while the Star Ferry no longer serves the purposes for which it was built long ago it remains a sight that you should do at least once, like the HKG tram.

Go on a sunny day. The color of the water on a sunny day is a beautiful blue. You get a wonderful view of both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. It's the best way to get from one to the other. The boat itself is nothing, but the view is so pretty.

Hong Kong icon. The Star Ferry is a must do in HK. It's been there forever and still costs about HKD2. There is wheelchair access to the lower deck and staff will help you with a push, and get you off the ferry as the ramp is a little cheap. You also sail across one of the best, most spectacular harbours in the world.

How to have a perfect view of HK. I think I always take the Star Ferry when I'm in HK : just to spend 5 minutes with my eyes wide open to savor the beautiful view during this short trip.It's as well a great and cheap way to join the other part of Hong Kong.(Obviously better when it's not foggy...)

It is a must. This is not a pretty ferry, and not that clean and it is no luxury but it is amazing to experience this historic ferry ride between Hong Kong and Kowloon.Try and avoid peak hours.This was once called the most romantic cruise in the world.

So Convienent. We used the ferries several times and fund them so convenient with ferries running ever 10 mins of so, we were also very surprised on the number of people each ferry carried- there always seemed to be a crowd waiting no matter the time of day. The price is also ridiculously cheap as well.

Mass Transport or Museum. If you are visiting Hong Kong, it is an obligation to use the Star Ferry between the Island and Kowloon. The boats are old, very old, really very old, and the wooden seats simple. the service is simple as well for the few minutes trip, but the view on Hong Kong is great. and it is - depending from where to where you want to go - faster than subway maybe, faster than taxi: definitely, and cheaper by any means.Do it on a sunny day best before sunset, and at night as well. Take your camera with you! And enjoy like me travelling like a hundred years ago. I do it almost as often as coming to Hong Kong and like it still...

Without the Star Ferry it wouldn't be HKG. Hadn't been back for a few years, but this is still quintessential Hong Kong. The mix of age, nations and status - it's all there, and you also get to enjoy the view.
Fast and efficient. Took the ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Fast and efficient service on this historic mode of transportation.
Cheap fun.. the Mir is fine and clean, but do yourself a favor and cough up the few cents it takes to ride this old school transport across the harbor.

Great Way To View An Amazing Skline. Hong Kong has arguably one of the most dramatic skylines of any metropolitan city and one of the best ways to truly take it all in, is the Star ferry ride from the Kowloon. Taking not more than a few minutes I definitely recommend having your camera ready as there is no shortage of amazing shots. It is a great ferry ride for those visiting HK for the first time.

Basic but Useful. The Star Ferry was a bit difficult to navigate at first, but as we stood in front of a ticket machine very puzzled, a lady approached us and ushered us towards the clerk on the side of the ticket gate where we purchased our tickets for about HK$2.20 I think. The ferry had indoor and outdoor seats and was more or less a mode of transport. (not necessarily a tourist attraction) Still a very easy and comfortable way of getting from one side of the river to the other.

Efficient. Just a few minute trip across the water from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Very self-explanatory to buy tickets at either entrance to the Ferry. On the Hong Kong-side there is an elevated walkway that can take you to or from various sites in the city.

A must when you've the time. Tickets are about HK$10 (ie very little!) or use your Octopus Card. Fabulous views all around one of world's most spectacular harbours. No, probably the world's most spectacular harbour! You can cross from Central to Kowloon in a fraction of the time on the subway, but do that and you miss the whole point...
great piece of history. Amazing piece of history...take a break when you're here and take a ride. The beauty of the harbor is worth it!

For the perspective from the water, this is a quick trip across to the other side.. This is an easy and fun thing to do. Don't miss it. We took this through the mist and rain which added to the experience.

A touch of the past. The underground railway system has made the Star ferry almost obsolete. No longer do hundreds of commuters jam into the second class area downstairs while the rich ride in some comfort upstairs. But it is still a must for first time tourists.

Good service and inexpensive. An easy way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Cheap fares and a quick and reliable service. Once on the Island, you can walk the long walkway or opt for a taxi to explore further.
Great for night harbour views. Another piece of nostagia that has to be done on a visit to Hong Kong. Do a night visit back across to the island to see all the city lights.

An ideal way of seeing the cityscape of Hong Kong and Koweloon.. The Star Ferry which has been running for over 100 years is an ideal way of seeing the cityscapes of Hong Kong and Kowloon, Furthermore passengers who are 65 and over with an Octopus card car travel free all day!
Be a tourist.. Couldn't wait to take my son on the Star ferry, Its iconic and hasn't changed a bit. Act like a tourist and laugh at everyone trying to pretend you don't exist, hysterical.

Just Love the Star Ferry. This has to be the best and cheapest Ferry ride in the world, the crossing from Kowloon to Hong Kong cost only 2 Hong Kong Dollars and takes about 10 minutes but in that 10 minutes you get the best view of Hong Kong Harbour
Iconic Transport. Free if you are a Senior, or free if you buy a Hop On Hop Off Bus Tour. Fairly cheap if you pay. Much more fun than the MTR.

The best, cheapest and most scenic way to cross the harbour. It's a bargain whether you choose the lower deck (HK$2) or splash out and take the upper deck (HK$2.50).
The service is always punctual and gives great views from the harbour.
Good service and punctual. Harbor tour aboard the Star Ferry was a great way to explore the harbor and learn about the history of Hong Kong. We had just around 15 persons on board.
best free ride in HK. I am a senior so the ferry was free with my octopus card but I would have happily paid for the trip.

Fantastic way to cross the harbour. So cheap being only a few dollars and some of the best views of the harbour. Very convenient and easy to travel. Used it on 2 separate days during our visit - from Kowloon to Wanchai and from Kowloon to Central.

Cheap way to enjoy Hong Kong from the water. Take the Star Ferry to enjoy Hong Kong from the water.
Upper deck ticket is around 2.5 HK dollars using Octopus card.

Star ferry. It's great experience to take ferry traveling between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, especially in the evening, the buildings with remarkable lights! The ticket we paid was HK$2.3/person, cheaper than taking metro, at the same time, enjoying the breeze! This transportation is good for family, couple and friend even by yourself is very sentimental and romantic.
Like this place. Love the way how they keep the historical place parallel with morden transportation. We can see the beauty of Hongkong island from the ferry view.
Star Ferries cheap and easy. About $2 A to go from Kowloon to Hong Kong. Buy the Octopus card and you can use it on all transport in Hong Kong. Very easy to find places and travel cheaply.

Must Do. No trip to Hong Kong is complete without riding the Star Ferry. This is the cheapest way (2.50 HKD upper deck and 2 HKD lower deck) to cross between the HK and Kowloon islands, and it doesn't take more than 15 minutes to cross. The view of both islands is amazing on the ferry. You'll get a real appreciation of the sights, the weather, everything!

Truly memorable ferry ride. What a terrific way to travel across from Hong Kong to Kowloon.Comfortable, inexpensive and nostalgic with wonderful all round views.Definitely one more thing to put on your 'must do' list!
One of the best trips ever.. For the UK equivalent of what... 15p? A wonderful boat ride across Hong Kong harbour. A great view wherever you look.
NIce trip. The star ferry is a nice, cheap trip to and from central, on a nice day its a very pleasant ride. I've taken it a few times now and it does everything I need, cheap, quick and enjoyable.

A great way to see the city's neon lights. The facilities have been modernized so it lost a bit of the heritage charm but the view from crossing the harbour and seeing the city's neon lights is still amazing as ever. If you can take it both ways, try both upper and lower decks - very different experience.

Nice and cheap ride. Very economical and good service.
The whole system is very well planned which adapts to peak rush while not compromising on service

Convenient and unusual public transport. The Star Ferry is a normal means of public transport for many people living in HK. It gives an interesting and different view if the city, but basically it is a convenient and pleasant way of crossing the harbour. Use a octopus card for convenience.

Must for any tourist . Brilliant!! So cheap!! I got on random boats taking me to different locations and wow was i impressed. Specially coming back at night watching the Hong Kong sky line. This is a must for any tourist visiting Hong Kong. We took one boat and we ended up on an island which had its sandy beach and all sorts it was awesome!!

Quick cheap and really authentic HongKong. Far and away the best way to get from HK island to Kowloon. Very cheap and easy to use ticket machines, we never had to wait more than a few mintes to board. There is a brilliant view of the harbour on the way across. A must do in HK
Do it!. It's fast, cheap and fun - to go from Hong Kong to Kowloon in a nice ferry.I didn't have to wait long and you have a nice view from both Hong Kong and Kowloon while crossing.
Cheap & Easy. Great way to get from one side to the other but fairly old boats. However they were clean and tidy and came very regularly.
Easy way of connection. Easy, cute and impressive view of Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Nothing more to say more than it only costs 2.50 HKD!

Fast and Ferryous. For $2.50 you can cross the water between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. It's very quick and very atmospheric, the ferries run almost continuously and you seldom wait more than a few minutes.Try a longer trip to outlying islands also, its a great way to travel. Tip:- buy an Octopus card to use on ferries buses and MTR. $150 gives $100 dollars of travel and the $50 dollar deposit is refunded when you leave Hong Kong - Terrific value

No Complaints if the Water Is Calm. It is very easy to find the ferry, very cheap to ride the ferry, the ferry has frequent departure times, and it doesn't take long to cross the harbour (isn't this really more of a channel?). The mid-day ride was calm and fun. The evening ride was fun, but the water was getting pretty choppy and the gangplank was jumping quite a bit as we were boarding. The ferry moored on the opposite side of the terminal (which was not in use at the time) was getting the brunt of the waves and jumping and dropping over a meter with each wave.Cheap way to cross the harbour, especially if you are staying on Hong Kong Island and want to see some of the sights by foot in Kowloon/Tsim Sha Tsui.

Scenic Fun Ride. Decided to ride the star ferry on our way to Central going to Ocean Park. It was a way for us to relax from the hustle and bustle and at the same time using the MTR most of the time. Our 4 year old was excited to ride a boat. It was just for about 10 mins and just outside of central star ferry is the bus stop going to Ocean Park. Very convenient and not a lot of walking needed.

Great cheap rides around Victoria Harbour. Even those who suffer from sea sickness should be able to manage the short and pretty smooth trip across the harbour. Great views; cheap prices and quite a few routes that you can travel. Highly recommended for a view from the water of both the Island and of Kowloon.

Dont miss the ferry ride!. My brother in law, who has lived in HK for more than 10 years and was there on business helped us a lot. He had arranged a private boat for all of us and we went around the harbor for 2 hours. Saw the laser show and the entire skyline of HK. It was a very nice experience! One must not miss the night view of the HK skyline, from the sea! Its a beautiful sight!
great arounf this area. this is a must visit, try to visit at dusk if you can it is truly breathtaking. the photo opportunity here is amazing
Efficient ferry service. We took the ferry from Lantau Island to Central. trip took approx 30 minutes due to sea fog. Boat was stable and a calm sailing

short fun ride.. You can feel the history of Hong Kong as you ride across the Harbour in these vintage boats. Close your eyes and imagine the past riders, from the Victorian times, through the wars,and occupations to todays tycoons, going from Central to the new financial center in Kowloon. Even the smell of the water,and fuel brings back images of past times.

You must do this. Been to HK a few times now and each time I have at least one trip across the Star Ferry it's the best and cheapest thing to do there, doesn't matter if you don't need to get to Kowloon or Central it's just a brilliant thing to do so make sure you give it a go.
Ferry Star. it is the busy harbour also in Hongkong, you can start your destination from here to explore the beautiful hongkong city with the highest building at your side

Experience this for sure in Hong Kong visit. This is clearly a must do in Hong Kong. For only 5HKD $you can cross over with a ferry, regular interval. Perfect to enjoy the skyline (day and night) and make picture.
Brill. What an experience, a lot nicer than taking the MTR which is always manic but efficient, no matter what time of day always very very busy

Great way to cross from Central to Kowloon side. Fast and cheap. Nicer way to get across than taking the metro.
Go with oyster card or just buy with cash the ticket. Cost a bit more than metro but you get a great view of the coastline!

Very nostalgic. The ferry ride and the surrounding has a very nostalgic feeling – even though the ferry pier has moved. The rides are a lot shorter than they used to be. Very comfortable and cheap still. The upper deck has an air conditioned section which is a must during the summer. The evening nights offer a great view on both sides of the ride.
Star Ferry.Hong Kong. Nice way to get between Kowloon and CentralNo matter how many times you have been there. Star Ferry is always a must. Easy to use and quick to make the crossing, try it.
So Glad it's Still Operating. Anyone visiting HK and has not crossed the harbour on a Star Ferry should do. It's even a greater experience than the King Harry at Trellisick!

A trip back into history. Star Ferry dates back to the late 19th century HK. This was once upon a time the only significant means to move between HK Island and the Kowloon Peninsula until the cross harbor tunnels arrived. The ferries are vintage white (top) and green (bottom). They are double deckers. The upper deck has an open air section in the middle, windowed and A/C-ed chambers at both ends (or fronts since they are symmetrical) in case of really bad rain and winds. The lower deck is all open air. You are at sea level, can smell diesel and see the engine room below. For best view, take the upper deck open air section, stay on the left side of the boat if you are heading towards Central on HK Island, and the right if you are coming towards TST Kowloon. Reason? Virtually all the scenic attractions are on one side. The ride is about 5 minutes or just a tad over. Together with the island trams and the Peak Tram, the Star Ferry is one of the three oldest (historic) mode of transportation still operating regularly in HK. The fare is really, really low. The Star Ferry is one of the very BEST way to experience HK. BTW, every boat in operation are more 50 years old!!

all about Hong Kong. This in my opinion is the number one must see and do whilst in Hong Kong, Mixed with Locals going about their day and tourists alike this short very cheap form of public transport is the best way to view both H.K. Island (central) and Kowloon. Must do

I love the Star Ferry. Where can you go and ride a ferry across one of the most amazing harbours in the world? Hong Kong of course, and it is the world famous Star Ferry, in operation since 1898! I have been to Hong Kong and Kowloon five different times on my travels, and I always go on the Star Ferry. If you want to take some amazing photos of both sides of the harbour, this is the way to go. It only costs you 2HK dollars to ride it. That is a little more than 25cents in the US. Do yourself a favor and ride the ferry. I must have ridden it back and forth 6 times my last day in Hong Kong back in November, just to keep trying to get some different shots with different boats cruising along beside us. It is a short trip, but one you will remember for a lifetime!

Lovely experience, especially at night.. This is a great way to get to Hong Kong Island. We had an Octopus card which allows you to use the buses, Star ferry and metro trains. You load it with some money and scan it as you board any transport - so easy and it's a cheap way to travel. The night journey (even just to see the lights across Victoria Harbour) is a very nice experience and some of the hotels give a laser show for a few minutes - check out the times. Go for it!

Fast and efficient transport around Hong Kong. The Star Ferry terminal on Kowloon & Hong Kong is extremely busy with passengers (Chinese & visitors) but the service schedule is regular even during the hectic period during the Chinese New Year. The ticket kiosks are manned by helpful people which makes life easier especially not knowing exactly what to do, when to or where to go. The harbour is so busy with ferries and general craft zig zagging the waterways. The ferries are comfortable and embarking / disembarking easy.

Didn't disappoint!. After booking our visit to HK, having a trip on the Star Ferry was definitely on the 'to do' list and it did not disappoint. The ferry runs from Kowloon across Victoria Harbour to Hong Kong Island and costs 2-50 $hk (22p) and takes around 10 minutes.  The views from the ferry are excellent and is definitely the best way to get across the harbour. Make sure you have a trip if visiting HK!!

A must for all visitors to HK. This ferry service has run for over 100 years from HK Island to Kowloon. Great for getting Skyline photos of both sides of the harbour. Avoid the traffic and cheap as anything. Takes less than 10 minutes.

easy to use. Cheep and cheerful about 50p each way, worth a trip accross just for the experience.
Easy to use and quick to make the crossing, try it.

Everlasting History in one of worlds busiest cities. Star Ferries are a Hong Kong institution. The constant criss-crossing of the green ferries between Kowloon and HKI is worth being part of. Hard to see how they might have changed over last 30 years and hope they still going for another 30years

Crossed it off the list.... We saw a recent travel list of 50 "must do's" in your lifetime. One of them was to travel the Star Ferry that transports you between Hong Kong and Kowloon.Crossed it off the list. It's an eight minute ride and was exceptionally inexpensive (less than 50 cents from my "in head" currency calculator).Kids enjoyed it and with all the walking and bustle of Hong Kong, it was a welcome time to sit down and relax.
Must do!. This is clearly a must do in Hong Kong. For a very small amount you can cross over with a ferry, regular interval. Perfect to enjoy the skyline (day and night) and make pictures.
Awesome views.... The Star Ferry is a cheap way to get to Kowloon and allows you to enjoy the beautiful skyline that Hong Kong has to offer.A must try if you visit the city
Harbour tour. Brilliant harbour tour was very inexpensive and the ticket includes a drink and snack. Excellent value for money
Always the must do in HongKong. No matter how many times I've been there. Star Ferry is always a must. It's convenient, comfortable and always bring you the different side of HongKong.

A not to missed HK experience. if you buy a BigBus Tour, unlimited passage is included on the day(s) of your tour, Other wise the cost is HK$2.5 (US$ 0.32), Can't be beat. You become an expert ferry rider (like the locals in 3 trips, or less!
Awesome!. The star ferry is super cheap and the best way to travel from Kowloon to Central and vice versa. The views are incredible and the journey is very quick. I had lots of fun!

Great views of skyline. It is great fun to cross the harbour on the ferry and the views are great. It is worth doing it both at night and during the day. It is cheap and if you have a senior Octopus card it is free.

iconic cheap thrill. great way to see the hong kong skyline and victoria harbour action. the ancient ferry itself lends a nice window to imagine how hong kong was before it got super busy. did i say it's cheap?

An exciting place. The Star Ferry terminal in Kowloon is a busy frenetic place. We loved the atmosphere and getting the ferry across to Hong Kong island. We also took the Star Ferry Harbour Tour in the evening.
Don't miss catching the ferry across the channel whenever you can!

a must do. One must take this cheap more then 100year old ferry to kowwloon to hong kong island and back again.It is only a 10 minute ride but worth the experience in crossing the harbor in theold ferry.Try it.
perfect. love the night view, all the way from Avenue of stars to TST clock tower n Pier. there is a mobile sofee van nearby and so yummy.

okay. the star ferry pier is ok ,the best time to visit is obviously at night between 8pm and 8.30 pm as the view back towards HK and the light display is worth the visit, there are some good restaurants close by, as there are shops and malls.

Go back in time. When you take the Star Ferry across Victoria Harbor from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon you will be experiencing history. This has been the transportation method for over 100 years. This is a MUST for anyone visiting Hong Kong.

Where to ride the historic Star Ferry. The pier itself is just that. Not much on it in the way of good treats or memorabelia, but depending on which side of the bay you are on provides a great view of either the Hong Kong or the Kowloon skyline. Cheap and fun to ride and a great way to get across the bay and sightsee at the same time.
Accessible. From the different piers you can travel to various points. The piers are very well signposted and the transport safe and accessible

Ferry across harbour . Very convenient and cheap way to travel.... U get to c the harbour.. Stunning views... So many boats,ships,....the ferry is frequently on the move... A must if u are you in Hong Kong...

Cheapest first class transport. What is there to say that has not already been said very many times over? It provides a smooth, regular, cheap, dependable transport between the Hong Kong island and the Kowloon peninsula. The view, especially at night, is second to none in the world, when neon lights from both sides of the harbour blaze and lighten the night skies with gaudy reds, yellows, and everything else. If you sat outside, the breeze, sometimes a bit muggy, blows through, and during wet seasons, tarpaulins are lowered, otherwise the rain comes at you horizontally. It used to be a vital means of transport for people rushing to go to work or to go home, across the harbour. Since the availability of the underground train, and the construction of a long park on the Hong Kong side, its uses for office workers in the central business district have diminished, and the Ferry now provides rides for people with lots of time on their hands, and tourists.
