Awesome experience, must see, if you love the sea, and Hong Kong.. Sure, there is the smell of the old diesel Engines. But there's also the mist of the Hong Kong sea, and the view. Knowing this ferry is over 100 years old, you have just got to try it! There is also a really unique beer store in the terminal, which sells brews from far and wide.The old ships leave their destination, your heart starts pumping faster. You look at Kowloon's urban sprawl, the clock tower, the Peninsula, the Art Gallery, and then turn your head in the other direction, Central harbour. What an island view!

Kowloon to Hong Kong and back. We took the ferry as part of the big bus tour in Hong Kong. It takes about 10minues each way. It is easy to access and runs every half an hour. It is well worth doing and I would say take the top deck for better picture opps
star ferry. Nothing great, specially after Bahunia cruise this was not worth. Ordinary cruise from one end to another
must do. Cheap public transport and a great way to see this incredible city from the sea.Go at 8pm or just before and see the light display from the water.
okay crossing. it's safe, clean, organized, but so-so. well it's a public transportation anyway. Tie your long hair cos it's gonna get messy!
Great views, nice experience. Nice way to get between Kowloon and Central. A fresh breeze on the water in muggy HK feels nice as way. Great views. Cheap and fun for one who likes to be on water.

The Must Do Experience of Hong Kong!. Take the Star Ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui and back. It costs about 50 cents USD one way (cheaper during the week). It offers incredible views of the Hong Kong skyline. It also has services like Starbucks, Subway, and other reasonable places to eat or get basic necessities. You can recharge your Octopus card at 7/11! This is one of things that you must do in Hong Kong.

The cheapest way from HK to Kowloon. The very cheapest transportation between Hongkong island to Kowloon island. Very convenience and safe. you will love to close to local peopel. Seeing the nice views along the journey.

Not to be missed! See HK from the water!. There is no better way to see both Central AND Kowloon than from this ferry. 10-12 minutes, $3.00 VERY WELL SPENT! If you can time it right, take the 8pm ferry to see the light show as well, which is unique only to this city!

Nice view, great experience. It was not a usual thing to do for me and my family to ride a ferry. So we decided to ride one, during the night for the Symphony of Light show. We enjoyed the view of city lights reflection on the river, and the ambience itself was relaxing and nice. It was not difficult to buy the tickets and ride on the boat. We did it ourselves, and for the record, none of us speaks mandarin, so yes, language is not an issue here in Hong Kong.I recommend to take the ferry during the night for the Symphony of Light show, as it would be prettier than during the day.Enjoy!
Good Experience. Try to original local transport you will have new experience. Best time on 8 pm. when Symphony of light show.
History on the Star Ferry. The Star Ferry is a MUST on any Honk Kong itinerary. Language is not a barrier, and it's perfect for taking in the sceneety, while relaxing in a seat onboard the ferry!

Great way to get to Macau. It was easy to find as the hotel shuttle dropped us off. It is about 1 hour to Macau, our day was very foggy and we were unable to see anything. The draw back is we paid one fair to go and the return trip was more expensive. It would be nice to not feel like we were being taken advantage of.
Best ferry trip ever!. A must if you visit this vibrant city the cost? $1.20 - the best way to get from Hong Komg Island to Kowloon - a 10-15 minute trip and the people watching is amazing!!
Can go wrong.... It is a must do. Great photo opportunities, cheap and super convenient. It seems that during the day and most of the evening the ferries never stop running.

So Typical of Hong Kong. This has to sum up Hong Kong at its best - crossing by this ferry from Wan Chai to Kowloon and back. The views where you have come from and where you are going to are all fantastic (particularly at night) as the ferry and and all the other craft try to go about their business and do their best to avoid each other! Fantastic!!

Great place for coffee. I found a small coffee place on the way to the pier to get on the Star Ferry. I don't remember the name, but they wrote on their sign: 'Don't rush to catch the ferry, just stay here and have a great coffee!' - and this is exactly what I did! It is a good place to sit down and watch people walk past. Highly recommended and very friendly place.
Love the ferries. Nothing different but I just love being near the water and this allowed me to get into the water for the across the islands. loved it.

An experience if you've never done a ferry ride before. It's very different from taking BC Ferries. For one thing, it's a lot more crowded. For another, it's not the wide expanse of ocean that we would get at home when we take the ferry. If you haven't done it before, try it.
Great little water trip.. Easy, fast and cheap. We took the trip at night to see all the lights in time to see the light show at 8 on the Avenue of the Stars Kowloon side. Very fun.

A must try!. A fun way to get across from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. The ride from Tsim Sha Chui to Wan Chai is less than HK$3 and free for seniors. You can pay using the wonderful cash card called Octopus which can used on buses, trams, the MTR, convenience stores, some shops and eateries. Used by locals and tourists alike, it's a fun and convenient way to see a bit more of Hong Kong by day or night. Get your cameras out to snap a few photos.
Clean but crowded. Lovely spot to walk along the Avenue of the Stars. Even though it was very crowded, there were many photo ops.

Favourite way to get to the other side. Definitely must try at least once! The boats are classic and the ride is filled with a beautiful view. Plus, it's so cheap too! Its definitely one of my favourite ride in HK. Great way to sit back and enjoy the view and get away from the crowded MTR

Brilliant. A Hong Kong institution. It's such fun to get out on the water, especially when the backdrop is this good. And it's absurdly cheap. The lesser-known route from Tsim Sha Tsui to Wan Chai provides a nice alternative (to the more familiar TST-Central) and provides a better view, if anything, of the Hong Kong skyline to the south. Do both!

Get a nightly view of the Victoria Harbour. Best to take the Star Ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui (TST) to Central. Lovely night view after a day of walking around TST. I was there during the Chinese New Year and got to see the lights on the buildings change colours and display festive Chinese texts. Very pleasant ride. I didn't have to pay for the ride as I got tourist office promo "red envelope" with tickets when landing at the HK airport. If I had more time in Hong Kong, I'd pay to take another ride. The fare is not expensive at all.

Don't miss this classic attraction. The Star Ferry is one of the constants is an sea of continuous change that is Hong Kong! Amazingly well kept boats are their classic pier. History on waves and not expensive. While not the fastest way to cross the harbour, it is the best!

You'll only cross by ferry once, the rest will be on the MTR. This review is for the Star Ferry crossing.Face it, it's ticking a box and gets you from point A to point B. A good way to cross the river after seeing the harbour views and a great way to or from the Peak Tram.100% non-smoking so the typical backpackers (she's blonde in a lazy pony, he's trying to grow a beard) won't need to fake cough.It's quick, pay by Octopus for less fuss and offers a different viewpoint. Plus it's kinda nice for the tourist to see they're crossing to the next island which you don't get on the MTR. Romantic types may prefer this mode of crossing and it doesn't take long. In fact it's a bit quicker to cross this way than make your way to the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR from the harbour.Wheelchair and stroller accessible and I went on a Sunday with clear weather without any queuing using my Octopus.
Clean and Fast Service. Clean and fast in service with professional staff also clear guidance or information about the ferry schedule and etc

Short and convenient. So easy to access from Central Hong Kong pier 7 and take the Star Ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui and Kowloon. Short walk to Nathan Road and the Golden Mile, Jade market and Temple street market.

Tsim Sha Tsui Ferry Pier. Construction of the first pier on the present location started in 1904, after the great land reclamation which extended Salisbury Road. It was of a "finger design". The pier opened in 1906, but was destroyed by typhoon in September 1906.[2]Its replacement, which was designed to accommodate two ferries, was completed in 1914. In the early 1950s, construction of the present twin-piered terminal commenced on both sides of Victoria Harbour.

Easy, efficient with great value. This is the easiest, fastest, cheapest way to cross from Hong Kong to Kowloon and vise versa. Also a great way to see the panoramic Harbour while sailing. It is great that they were able to maintain this efficient traditional mode of transportation. Very popular to the locals and tourist alike.

People watchers paridise. The Star Ferry Pier ether Kowloon or Hong Kong side is a great place to sit or stand and just watch people and the harbour. There are the young and old seeing Hong Kong for the first time in wonder of the bussle, there are the protestors complaining about any and everything. the group of young office girls giggling at every thing. The wharf area has life and just being part of the crowd is great

Easy transportation to and from HK-Kowloon. The ferry was quite convenient to our hotel.and we used it often. It is a lot faster to go shore to shore on the ferry than the underground or a taxi. The MRT pass takes you everywhere including the ferry. in Hong Kong the bridges from the ferry make getting around easy. If you get confused, there are many customer kiosks swhere you can ask for directions.
Best way to see Hong Kong Harbour. Old fashioned, cheap and easy and the quickest way to cross the harbour.You get the feeling you have travelled back in time to the old Hong Kong.

Smooth sailing!. Many years ago when different modes of modern transportation were developed for transportation to the island, there was an outcry to maintain the old ferry route- what a good move!! The Star Ferry Port is an efficient, well maintained exit to the island! This trip is a throw back to the "way way they were" and smooth sailing today. The bus depot is at the exit point where you can catch busses for access to points on the island!Enjoy!,
Simply the best. It does not matter where you stay in Hong Kong as this ferry system is efficient, cheap, easy to use, and runs 7 days a week. Quick way to hop from side to side.

Star Ferry ride is a MUST when in HK!. The best way to get to Central Island from kowloon is through the Star Ferry ride. Though you can go straight to the Island via under the sea MTR but the star ferry ride is still the best. For a cheap fee @ 3HK you can see the best view of both harbors. Their are lots of bus awaiting you at the pier which can take you either at Victoria's peak or around central. I suggest take the MTR when going to Hong Kong Island then take the Star ferry when coming back. The night view is amazing! or If you wish, you can take a double ride to get enough of pictures and videos! LOL!

Nothing changes ..... My sister and I met up in HK (she from the UK and me from Aus.) She used to be a Wren in the Royal Navy, and was stationed here in the late 70s. The Star Ferry is about the only thing that hasn't change beyond recognition. And long May it be so.

A great Ferry terminal. The walk there from Central was great, to see the Super Star Cruise ships in dock, complete with water slide and more. The pier was completely self guided and automated with purchasing tickets. Clearly signed to enter the upper or lower decks and all wheelchair & stroller friendly too. And a ferry ride is only $2.50

Iconic. Star ferries are useful, convenient and cheap - and are an iconic image of HK - the ferry pier also contains Maritime Museum (and inevitable gift shop), gift shops and cafes - and a buzz of activitiy
A must. Something you have to do in HK.mreally cheap and a great place for pictures. Even if it's cloudy or raining it's still worthy the trip

Tourist trap. I am sorry I didn't like it that much. We stayed just minutes literally. Took a few pics and selfie and we left. I suggest to spend your time exploring the town or even visiting several of the neighborhood towns. We went to Sha Tin by train.
Star ferry. Looked forward to a trip on the famous star ferry , badly spoilt by a theif stole wife's purse and went on a spending spree. Beware chip and pin not used here so spent freely .
Stress free.. Easy to travel on the ferries, once you've found the right pier. Very cheap. And you'll need your camera out. Walk the coast path past the museums for a panoramic view of Hong Kong.

The most practical and economical viewing of Victoria Harbor. Once you figure out the ticket machine, hop on board to get across the harbor day or night. The ferry is the most practical way to travel between the Central Business district and Kowloon. The ferry is historic, and a beautiful 10minute ride across. For less than a US dollar (0.35) a person, you can't get a better view. Depending on traffic, a cab ride across can take 30 minutes or more. They run every 10-15 minutes depending on day and time.You feel perfectly safe. Not practical for women in heels. A lot of the locals use it to commute, the subway is 2 city blocks from the Kowloon side, and if you are staying at the Peninsula hotel is about 2-3 blocks away as well. On the Downton side there is a cab stand in easy walking distance, just have your hotel write your destination, as the cab drivers only speak Mandarin. The ferry is clean, but not fancy,,,part of the charm.

A Ferry good service. The Star Ferry is another must whilst your are in Hong Kong, very cheap to travel to and from Kowloon, no plush sets just the wooden seat and the back rest that can be turned so that you can travel forward which ever way you are going, this reminds me of the trams we used to have in Sheffield, very simple but very affective. I do not know just how many ferries are running at the same time but you do not have to wait very long before you are on your way. It is very interesting to be on one of these ferries and sit amongst countless different nationalities all very interested in their journey most taking photographs others just sat looking at where they have just left and then looking at where they are going to. Just brilliant, if you haven't been then you must go.
Great cheap entertainment. What a great way to see Hong Kong and the Harbour. For a measly $2.50HKD you get so much for so little. Must do in Hong Kong

The best way to cross the harbour. Here once again as for the tramway. You must have time. In a fast moving city as HK sometimes it's better stop, breath, exit the MTR, walk to the ferry pier and relax on the harbour crossing ferry.

Love the ferries. The ferries run all the time and are inexpensive. We traveled across Victoria Harbor many times. It is cool to see the boats in the Harbor as there is everything from small canoes, sail boats, ferries and barges.

It is a ferry service!. It is a ferry service after all! However, it is another tourist must when in HK, take a trip on the Star Ferry across the harbor. If weather is decent, sit up top for better photo's.

Best ride in town. Cheap, great location, old boat, and fast, is for sure the best way to get to central avoiding traffic and getting a nice fresh air... or whatever is in the air at that moment.
Lovely ride which is convenient for tourist and locals.

The Hong Kong/Koowloon ferrry. The ferries a real blast from the past. Most of them were built around 1888 to 1898 by the Star ferry company.
Its well worth a trip on the old queens as its very relaxing moving slowly across Victoria Harbour. Bring along your camera with you as the views of the skyscraper on the island and Kowloon are spectacular!
Cheap to go over "sea". Only $2.X, adult can go through HK victoria sea ,from Central to TST. Compare to MTR, it is much more cheaper!

Fun Ferry Ride acroos the harbour!. It is a grand ferry ride, short but fun! I really enjoyed it and would recommend it to everyone who visits! Great to walk along the promenade, Ave of the Stars! A must!!
Easy breezy and coast effective. The best way to cross kwaloon to Hong Kong side it's amazing with cool breeze and serene view of every thing

Cheap and Efficient. This is by far the best way to gt across the harbor. The price is right, the frequency is wonderful, and the ticket system is easy to use. You can take your time because they appear to come every 10 min. at the most.
Irs just good to be here. Just feeling curious and excited to be here......i really am enjoying it ....but i think i need somehing more to see...

Economy on the Harbour. Forget the pricey harbour tours and try the ferry. This is the best bargain in Hong Kong, cheap, fast, easy access and ticket machines that are easy to use. It seems like a ferry departs every few minutes, no need to rush there is another one every few minutes. Once we crossed from Kowloon to Hong Kong Central there was lots to see and do (city buses available, Big Bus tours, a pedestrian walkway to shopping).

constant and efficient. there are two levels to the seating, and 2 prices. There is no service, so save money and take the lower. The harbour is always busy, so the ride is busy. Those who get seasick will not be happy. The boats are historic, so fans of older boats will like the ride.

To do if you have time. For 90 HK dollars, nothing extraordinary but nice if you have time. You should stop at the pier of the opposite side, where the clock is. You can then go to the Ladys market. A taxi will bring you back to the pier and it will cost you less than 3 dollars to take again the star ferry and return to Hong Kong Island.
Toilets need some TLC!. Oh dear.....these toilets are an embarrassment, they really need some work done to make them useable.....the stench was unbelievably bad!
Fun, cheap, easy way to travel.. Easy to use, nice and cheap, regular crossings. Probably best used when the weather is dry. Seems popular with locals and tourists alike.

Star Ferry. Has to be done. We caught the ferry from Kowloon one evening just to say we had been on the Star Ferry over to Hong Kong Island. While we were there we had a ride on the giant ferris wheel in the harbour area and got great views of all the buildings lit up

Great service. Stayed in Hong Kong for 8 Days and used the ferry every day to visit various islands and to and from Kowloon, service was reliable and cheap , staff helpful and informative , very good tourist info at start of piers

An icon of Hong Kong. Just like the trams (ding dings), the Star Ferry has a rich history taking passengers to and from Hong Kong Island (Central / Wanchai) to Kowloon.Have travel on this 100s of times and I guess I take this for granted.A cheap way to get across to Kowloon and back. At night, you really can't beat the beautiful night views.Go on the upper deck - the smoke and smell from the lower deck can be overwhelming.

A great way to get to Kowloon. Such an institution , and very very cheap, a short journey and you are across in Kowloon. We ate lunch at the star ferry restaurant which was very nice. A buffet with lots of choice.

Best ride. For a few cents you can cross between Hong Kong island and Kowloon and get a million dollar view. We took this trip, both day and night, several times while we were there for 9 days. We rode on both the upper and lower decks. The photos you can get from the Star Ferry are wonderful.
Star ferry. Fantastic way of getting across the harbour, quick, frequent and cheap, also great views of both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island

Just simple and easy transport across the water. I liked how convenient and easy it is to use. You just pay the really low price and you hop on the boat and it takes you across the water. It's like they've been doing this for many year! Oh wait...they have! It's a great service...and a must do in Hong Kong.

A must do!. The Star Ferry never disappoints! It is fantastic value for money and the views are amazing. Despite it being rather foggy, we were still able to enjoy this trip across Victoria Harbour. We used our Octopus Cards which meant no queuing for tickets. Very simple and quick. The seats can be reversed too, so if you like facing the direction you are going in you can do so. The journey is very quick; an efficient and traditional route to get across from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Everything is just as I remembered it nearly 50yrs ago!!

This is one of those things which should never change.. Just loved it. Travelling across the Victoria harbour from Hong Kong island to Kowloon or other way. A must do. Don't miss it. Better than even the peak tram.The rolling boat, the licking waves, the Hong Kong sky line, the cruise ships docked up on Kowloon side...... I wax eloquent.And it is dirt cheap. The seniors travel free. Their elder octopus card is not charged. It is the most convenient way to travel across the harbour, A colonial experience, which gives you a good idea of what nostalgic Hong Kong was about. The back rests can be adjusted so that you are always facing the direction of travel. Some things in life should never change, this being one of them.

Star ferry pier. Star ferries are brilliant ,takes about 5 minutes to cross the harbour,,I could ride on them all day.If you want to see the Symphony of Lights at its best then catch a ferry just before 8.00 pm or during the next 15 minutes and get a seat next to the water.They are very cheap in fact with a senior oystercard tht are free

loved it. I could travel on this ferry every day. You must do it if you're in HK. Really cheap, great to see the harbour and Hong Kong skyline from. Gets you away from the craziness of the crowds for a few minutes. Loved it!

Easy way to see the harbour.. We've travelled many times on the Star Ferry. So unbelievably cheap and the trip is fast and smooth. The boats are pointed at each end - no need for them to turn round - they just switch the seats to face the other way. So sensible.

Cool older style ferry. Nice wooden finish with benches inside. The Star Ferry Pier was a cool experience as it felt like I was stepping back in time. The Ferry I was on was old and seemed to be preserved nicely. It is a wooden boat with the wooden bench type of seats. It was fun to go on a trip across the water. It was a great place to take photos of the city.

way to travel across. Cheap efficient and if you walk down th entire pier you will find something or place you want to visit by boat we used it a lot to get to the other side of the harbour once you get over the other side theres lots of buses that take you every where cheap
Just fantastic. There is something very nostalgic about star ferry pier - quite colonial - a trip to Hong Kong would not be complete without a trip across the bay
nice trip on the night. good view of the town and nice people (really helpfull)Really convenient trip and good trip for making beautifull pictureDo not hesitate to take it !

The best sightseeing cruise in Hong Kong. Dirt cheap, authentic and a fabulous view, rain or shine. Taking the Star Ferry (there are 12 nearly identical vessels) across the harbour is a 'must do' attraction for anyone visiting Hong Kong.
Summer Dream. Take a ride across on the upper deck, feel the breezes. Taxi to Lan Kwai Fong, stroll among the young and beautiful, then ride back, being lulled to sleep by the waves and warm air.
nice view. the ferry pier is where u get the real feel of hong kong with the fantastic view of sky rise buildings

Ferry always on time!. It is a great way to get from the Kowloon side to Hong Kong Island. The waves are not that choppy and if you want to visit Lantau Island or Lamma Island it is only a 30-45 minutes trip. The inside is clean and spacious and you feel safe!

A must fo HK visitors. I highly recommend taking the 'Star Ferry' cruise from Kowloon to HK Island. Better in the evenings for the best vistas of the iconic Hong Kong skyline. A must whilst in Hong Kong.
The Ferry goes every 10 minutes and it takes around 10-15 min to cross the harbour.
Costs : 0,30-0,35 EUR (depending on the day).
Have to take Star Ferry. When visiting HK you have to take the Star Ferry. Was one of the highlights of our trip to HK. Don't miss out. It's so cheap.
Stunning Views. Cross the harbour on star ferries and you will not be disappointed, cheap clean and efficient and what a stunning view

An Iconic Hong Kong must. I'm a Hong Kong expat having lived here for over 20 years. I thoroughly recomend taking the 'Star Ferry' cruise in the evenings for the best vistas of the iconic Hong Kong skyline. The experience and views obtainable from the open sided ferry are excellent. A Star Ferry ride is iconic in itself,and beckons a bygone era. A must whilst in Hong Kong. I would recomend the night tour for the best views but the day vistas are nothing to be scoffed at either. I hope you enjoy your stay.
Easy to use. This is a very practical way to get the star ferry. Its spacious and lovely staff there to help you.

Easy & Convenient. The iconic Star Ferry is a a great way to travel across Victoria Harbour. The facility is easy to navigate and relatively inexperience. The trip from Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui was under fifteen minutes and provide an unobstructed view of both Kowloon and the Hong Kong skyline. The ferry is a must do for any first time tourist to Hong Kong.
Always nice to enjoy. It is just a mall trip with the Star ferry but always nice and to be recommended. Sitting on the deck and see the remarkable sky line of Central and other ships passing by.

Great way to see the HK skyline and Kowlong for pennies. The star ferries run between the Central ports in Hong Kong to numerous destinations within the various islands. We took the trip from HK to Kowlong to take advantage of the shopping on the other side and to get a beautiful view of the skyline. While you can take that same trip via the MRT (subway), you certainly don't get the view or the ability to trek around the Avenue of the Stars for some nice peace and tranquil down time. With a cost of only $2HKD!, the ferries should be a part of everything you do while in HK. Be aware that the ferries have two loading platforms (top and bottom) and you cannot move from the bottom to the top (or vice versa) during the trip so make sure you choose the right loading platform

Star Ferry Ride...okay!!. We starting from Tsim Sha Tsui pier to Wanchai...Just using your Octopus card to ride Star Ferry and you can enjoy the gorgeous Victoria Harbour.My kids very enjoy while sailing over the bay..Good value and have a pleasant experience.Please, alert of the departure schedule since not every minutes the ferry depart in the same pier.
Great. Clean travel with English speaking tellers to purchase a ferry ticket. Worth the extra money to upgrade to premier seats.
Hong Kong lay over. The only way to cross the harbor, great photo op, travel like a localProbably the only thing that hasn't changed on HK
Chinese New Year. What can I say? Colourful, noisy and crowded but entertaining. The views at night were stunning and the ferrys ran like clockwork. It was a fun way to see the harbour.

Most value-for-money tourist activity. The Star Ferry ride - a must do for any tourist to Hong Kong. It is a beautiful, though short ride, during which you can see both the harbourfront of Hong Kong and Kowloon. Your ride will take you from Central, the hub of the city on the island to Tsimshatsui, the hub of the city on the other side of the harbour. You may see a lot of tourists on the ferry, but you will also be surrounded by locals as it is also a common and convenient means to cross the harbour for locals. The best part is you will not run into traffic jam which is not uncommon in Hong Kong. Last but not least, the fare is very low. At less than 50 US cents per trip, it could be the most value-for-money tourist ferry ride in the world!

Travel with the locals. We enjoyed our ferry rides between Kowloon and Hong Kong Central, travelling on the upper deck with the tourists going out and on the lower deck with the locals on our return. The ride is great fun whichever deck you use, although you do see more from the upper deck. We were lucky that the weather was so warm and sunny during our visit.
Just a Ferry. Not much to say. Food and services available. Ferries regular and on time. Sad if the weather is misty but still worth doing
Better at night. Great walk at night, but harder to read the plaques and different photo options, so do both day and night.

Not to be missed. The star ferry is great and even if you don't want to be on the other side of the harbour it is worth taking the ride across and back again. It only takes a few minutes and is a joy to be on the water taking pictures of the island or Kowloon side.

Very easy to navigate. There are great views of the skylines from the Pier! Also on the Kowloon side you are near the walk of fame and the famous Bruce Lee statue.
There are a couple of shop such as a tour office where you can book the big bus tour and also a subway fast food shop.

See HK movie Stars. Taking the Train is an economical way to get to this site. You can see the famous statues of HK movie stars. The promenade is a lovely walk for the family and restaurants and Hawkers are everywhere.

Fun and easy on the wallet!. The star ferry costs about $0.44 USD (it was a holiday) and is a fun easy trip across the bay to get in the skyline view from the water. For the money its a great fun value in the city.

Easy, Scenic and Cheap way to cross the Harbour. The Star Ferry is a very accessible and reasonable way to cross the harbour from Kowloon to the island. The views of the skylines of both sides of the harbour are excellent harbour especially at sunset. Please note that if you want to sit on the upper deck, it loads in a different entrance than the lower deck does. Also, if you plan on taking the Big Bus Tour of the city, the 48 hour option allows you unlimited passes to cross the harbour as well as a free Harbour tour.

Good view of the other side. I was here during the day as well as the night. It is a different experience each time. You can just spend an entire day, sitting there and reading a book. Liked the view.

Great Journey. I only took the star ferry to get across to the walk of fame but it was worth it. I especially loved looking out and seeing all the pirate ships. Even if its just once I would recommend taking the ferry.

It's not a complete visit without it. Can't come to HK and not go on the Star ferry. It's like going to the beach and not getting your feet wet. Even if all you have time for is jump on it to go across the harbor then come back again- it is worth it. Not for the ferry, per se, but for the views. And to experience some local atmosphere. Now that Wan Chai is open, a great route is to jump on teh ferry in Central then take t he return to Wan Chai and walk back to Central if you need to, through Admiralty, Hong Park, etc. You can get a sense of the city in just a few hours.

Must see!. This is really nice and also cheap attraction. Really must do if you are at Hong Kong.Remember they wont take bigger notes at ferry terminals, so make sure you have change with you when travelling.
THRILLING RIDE. For those who are thrill seekers, take a ride on one of the high speed jet ferries to get a different kind of thrill.

the famous star ferry. it's by far the quickest and cheapest way to cross from the mainland to Kowloon and great fun. Taking pictures of both sides is extremely easy with the open back end and the huge windows that open and the odd assortment of boats crossing in front of you are wonderful.
cheap ferry. everybody has to cross over on the star ferry when in HK. The walk along Tsim Sha Sui waterfront is very pleasant.

Living history. I always jump at the chance to ride the star ferry, it is one of Hong Kong's traditions. The view of the harbour and foreshores from the middle of the harbour anytime of the day and night is another way to experience this city. The best time to cross is at sunset.
Ferry across the harbor. Great views of Kowloon going from Hong Kong and vice versa on the return trip. Rather difficult to access from Hong Kong side- a long walk from the street.

Star Ferry. The Star ferry is accessible and easy to use. Do not expect anything fancy as they are old and loud! The ride is very short and for a most reasonable cost. Great to take just as the 8:00 light show is beginning.
Convenient. Cheap way to get across the harbor. Take it during the night and you can get a great photo of the night harbor.

Enjoyed the trip to Macau. The process of purchasing and proceeding onto and off the ferry was reasonably straightforward. The trip across was smooth and pleasant. Macau was little more than casinos with only remnants of the Portuguese heritage remaining. Great Museum housed in the old fort.
Something very original.. For sure, this is easiest and quickiest way for reach H-K island from the main land. Is also very cheap.

A piece of history. First went on the Star ferry about 40 years ago and it hasn't changed at all in that time. What has changed is the traffic of boats in the sea around the area and the surrounding building works together with the land reclamations. It's still unbelievably cheap, and certainly quicker than car or taxi if you get your timings right.

A great step back in time.... What a wonderful way to cross the Harbour. A great step back in time with the old wooden benches! And a closeup of the spectacular view of the skylines with a cool breeze blowing through your hair. The best way to cross the Harbour!

Great views at a low price - doesn't get any better than this. Ferries have been commercially plying the passages between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island for nearly 150 years. The Star Ferry, painted a familiar shade of green, maintains that tradition and remain an iconic symbol of the territory. Indeed, some of the ferries have been in service for over half a century. From a local's perspective, it's a convenient and extremely affordable means of daily transport. From a visitor's viewpoint, it's a very good way to feel the pulse of the city. Coupled with dynamite views of Hong Kong harbour on either side of the ferry, it's a ride that begs to be done at least once and is probably one of Hong Kong's best travel experiences.There are two separate Star Ferry routes - each return journey originates from the Kowloon side and heads for Central and Wan Chai, respectively. As the journey is fairly short, seasickness is unlikely to be a major problem. However, do beware of getting too close to diesel fumes, wet decks or generally impeding an occasionally impatient crowd at disembarkation. Although the turnstiles now take digital Octopus cards for payment, I find it much more nostalgic to pay cash and gain entry using the circular token system.
Lovely views. Cheap & a great way to avoid the underground! Views day & night are amazing. Disliked the amount of people with selfie sticks who push you out of there way to photograph themselves 😄

Best way to cross the harbour. Much quicker than walking to and from the MTR and cheap too. As a bonus you get great views of the waterfront on both sides of the harbour. Its also a quick way to get to the ferry terminal at central for those longer ferry rides. Take the trip close to sunset and you get some really fantastic views of the sunset.
Good view of the Harbour. If you take the Star Ferry from Kowloon across to Hong Kong Island, or the other way you have a good view of the harbour and the shore.

It is simple and good.. It is cheap, very good views especially at night. It's short so you won't get bored. Remember commuters really use it so avoid rush hour if you want to enjoy a bit more. The walk from the central pier is a little far but not too bad. But it is covered so you can actually walk to IFC without getting wet in the rain.Its a HK most excellent must see. It also goes to wan Chai. I never got sick on it and I usually get sick on the bus, so probably you'll be OK if your worried about seasick. But it does bob around a bit without moving sometimes while waiting for a big ship to pass.. So... But its still a short trip and you can enjoy.

Great experience. This is a great experience if your in HK, the ferry goes between the mainland (Kowloon) to HK Island. The waters can be a bit choppy so don't try and walk around once on board. You would think the guy steering the boat had done the trip hundreds of times so why did he come in too fast and crash into the jetty.

History. Nice to be able to travel a short distance using a piece of history. My husband had been on the star ferry many years ago so it was fun to share that with him. Easy terminal to find and get through, you were able to use your subway card to travel on, easy and fast way to go across the harbor.
Great views. This is a vreally cheap trip from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and you see so much on the way and it is also very quick with frequent ferrues

We kept going Back. Our Hotel was close to the Star Ferry Terminal. We could see it from our room, and we kept checking out what was coming and what was going out. We wandered down to the terminal several times just to watch the people, bustling off with their luggage to catch their ferry. It was very busy,and quite fascinating. A very busy terminal.

Super Star Ferries. I've always loved taking the ferry across the harbour, be it day or night. Perhaps it is my inner child that is that is writing this review but there is just something so fun and exciting about taking the ferry that I have, on several occasions, just taken back and forth just for the heck of it.Ferries come on a regular basis, roughly 10 minutes, give or take.It is cheap and cheerful and gives you a great view of the city. It only costs about USD$ 0.35 (one way) so unless you get sea sick then what are you waiting for?

The only way to cross Victoria Harbour. Get yourself down to Star Ferry in TST and jump on what must be one of the cheapest ferry rides in the developed world. Get ready with your Camera and make sure you get a seat with a good view. I recommend you do this trip also at night on the Star Ferry so you can appreciate the illuminated sky line of Hong Kong island. After the ferry ride you can walk along the pier and take some snap shots if you keep walking along the harbour front you will come to the Avenue of Stars.

Shop while you wait. After deciding to do the Star Ferry cruise, I went down to the pier to purchase my ticket. There was time to wander along the pier to enjoy the small shops selling food and keepsakes. I was so pleased to find a vast selection of local postcards, stamps and a box to mail from. A quick stroll along the waterfront ducking from time to time into some welcome shade gave us a chance to soak in the scene and enjoy the warm salt air breeze.Even if not going on a cruise, it's a lovely way to enjoy the view of Victoria Harbour from the Star Ferry Pier.

Star Ferry !. Another must do, the ferries are an institution in HK, they are cheap and fun to ride, be adventurous and ride the top deck, the harbour is always choppy but makes it more fun, forget the bus and take the ferry !
TOP HARBOUR. If you want to know places where the sea/ocean transportation of the world real activity you MUST start here

Old is Best. Without this amazing service Hong kong Victoria Harbour would loose its heart. these old but well serviced ferries are such fun and so cheap - for this on a budget this trip allows you to see the lights and city from the harbour and to catch a desperately desired wift of breeze on those hot sultry summers days.

Budget Victoria harbour view trip. It is actually a ferry service from to kowloon and Hong Kong by local people but nowadays most of the tourist choose it as sightseeing for day and night harbour view it's only 10 mins trip but can experience the 2 side harbour front building especially night time around 7:45pm has light laser show for 2 sided habor it's beautiful and stunning so convience to connect others tourist spot very cheap as well

Old but good. A few minutes on the star ferry from HK Island to Kowloon is just so relaxing. disregard the cattle like mustering of people and enjoy the city from the water and the people watching.For next to nothing this trip is worth doing a couple of times.It won't satisfy the thrill seekers but is definitely a great change from the MTR.

Easy to use, cheap and great to see harbour!. So easy to work out what to do - just read the signs. Only costs a couple of dollars per person (or use your Octopus card). Lovely and relaxing trip across to Hong Kong Island.

Great place to cross the city.. Took the ferry to get another view of this fabulous city. The pier is easily accessed, MTR stations close by, lots of shops, restaurants and places of interest in the pier district. Ferry crossing gives great views, ferries take you to Central or Wan Chai, views of Victoria Peak and skyscrapers of the Bank of China and HSBC are some of the highlights, if you are visiting Hong Kong you have yo experience the Star Ferry.

A Must Do In Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is an old but well maintained ferry. Services are incredibly frequent and you can go any time in the day/evening and buy a ticket and there will be a maximum 10ish minute wait. Tickets are very cheap (2.50HKD), and the boat journey offers spectacular views of the HK skyline.

Cheaper than the ferry across the Mersey !. Lovely way to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island - only 7 minutes and very efficient. Downside to the Pier area is the constant pestering by people to buy fake goods. Nice views of the Harbour on the ferry and well worth the 25 pence each way.

Worth doing. We did this as a way of seeing the harbour, and because it is only about 2 dollars per person.
It is right next to the metro & there's a taxi rank just across from it too. Really handy!
Only takes about 10mins to cross but well worth it.

A must do ride. We had a ride from TST to Central and back on a Star Ferry. It was a rainy day but was nice. Ferry is still the old fashion but well maintained and clean. It took about only 5 minutes to cross the water but the view of both Hong Kong and Kowloon side was great. Only thing is you can't go out to the open deck and see around due to safety (actually not much open decks on these ferries).On TST Pier there are some snack shops and some gift shops. Also there were many marketing people trying to sell various tours, shows etc. On Central Pier nothing much.This may be the quickest way to go to Central if you are in TST and is very cheap (HKD 2.50 one way I think). We used our Octopus cards. This is a must do if you visit TST.

must-go!. the tsim sha tsui star ferry pier is one of the oldest landmarks in HK which still serves its purpose today. due to land reclamation the harbour has become narrower and a ferry ride takes only 10 minutes. it's one of the cheapest form of transport in town and a ride in the evening is suggested as you can see the skyline on both sides from the middle of the harbour.

much convenience for transporting between TST & CENTRAL. Star Ferry Pier, Central may refer to any of the successive generations of pier in Central, Hong Kong used by the Star Ferry for its services across Victoria Harbour to Tsim Sha Tsui Ferry Pier and until April 2011, to Hung Hom Pier.

I liked the Ferry better this time. A must see, and very functional. Tourists use it so do the locals, quick efficient and inexpensive. At night, the harbor lights shine bright and reflect in the water, love that. The Ferry goes slow enough too to get great photos even while the boat is moving.One important caution, there are two Ferrys coming back to the main harbor, one takes you to the pier near the convention center and the Renaissance, the other takes you more central. So you have to be careful which one you get on. Also, the Ferry to the convention center stops running much earlier in the evening than the central Ferry, so, after 1030pm or so you will no longer have a choice of where to go, that said, you can easily take a cab from there anywhere on the waterfront and beyond.

Great old time ferry ride. Beautiful view of the harbor.. A taste of old Hong Kong on a vintage style ferry. Cheap ride that offers an unparalleled view of both Kowloon and Hong Kong island. Quick and efficient boarding very clean interiors. A must do for even a one day visit.

Fab fab fab. We used the ferry a few times.We wanted to see the light show in Hong Kong harbour so got on the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island 19:50 but the light show was just starting as we arrived Hong Kong side so we ran around to get a returning ferry back to Kowloon and just made it. The ferry is so cheap and just the best way to get around and joins the locals moving between the two places. Don't miss the experience. It's not posh but functional

Way to see HK skyline. Enjoy the breeze over a very short ride. This is one of the good way to see the skyline of Hong Kong. Take a ride at night going from Kowloon to Hong Kong side at 8pm, you can catch the light show. Snap up a few shots with your camera! Spectacular!!!!

Love it. A must for me everytime I'm in HK! Cheap & fun!. For only HKD2.50 you can get a nice cruise on the historical star ferry! Cheap & good!I love to ride the star ferry and make it a point to do that everytime I'm in HK. It brings you to wan chai or central piers from tsimshatsui. Very fast and convenient! I love to connect to HK island this way better than crowded subway trains. And it's scenic too!Do not miss it when in HK!
A century of boats. Watching and sailing on these ferries is a real treat and flashback to the past. (Very inexpensive) And a good way to see harbor
Can't beat the price - and fun. The star ferry is a fun choice for getting back and forth from the island to Tsim Sha Tsui and for a cost of about 30 cents US each way, it's pretty hard to beat.

Star Ferry. Travelling on the Star Ferry is a must for all visitors to Hong Kong, if only to say you have done it.The Ferry itself is plain and simple but its history is interesting. Look on the centre bulkwark and you will find a plaque giving the name and a short history of the craft you are on. The crossing is short and the views, on a good day, can be fascinating, looking back to HK Island all spread out before you. A trip at night shows the buildings lit up and if you are on time, the nightly Light Show.The fare of HK$2.30 about 20Pence is well worth the experience 10 times over.

Beautiful Views, Fast Ride.. The ride itself is around 10 mins. I waited 5 mins for it to leave. and another 5 to reach Central. it's a $10 ride, which is the same as an MTR Ticket. Just try to get wait by the door to get a seat on the side.

Brightly coloured star ferry. We travelled on a brightly coloured ferry and we liked the ease of getting to Kowloon on the ferry. Cheap to travel by and they are very frequent and seem to be very uncrowded at this time of year during the day time.

Cheap and fast. A cheap and nice way to watch Hong Kong and Kowloon skylines. It goes from Tsim Tsa Tsui to Wan Chai or Central every few minutes. You can use the octopus card.You can try this to avoid the crowds in the MTR and have a good view and smell of the sea.

The unique touch of history. This boat trip is the most marvellous experience to be done in Hong Kong together with their tram.Try upper deck and lower deck. Experience the sound of ropes when boarding on the pier, enjoy the sky and senary during the trip and the soft music of the crazy noisy City behind you.You touch centuries of history, colonial chinese, international million of visitors in this few penny jorney, lowers randevu and business fights. What a momentum!
Difficult to access........ but a trip on the Star Ferry well worth the effort. Very cheap indeed. Octopus Card accepted for ticket
Have to do that. To take the Star Ferry is cheap and you have the nice panorama of the Harbour, both sides. At night is a little windy and colder (stayed december and january).

The good old star ferry. I cant help myself wanting to do a trip on a ferry every time i come to Hong kong. If its a nice day all the better . Its cheap and its been a reliable transport source for locals for since when ? I dont know , a long time ...I still remember when the star ferry was the only means to get to Kowloon before the tunnel was built . The ferries were much busier back then .
You must take a ferry ride. Star Ferry is easy to find and easy to board especially with an Octopus Card. Just jump on and enjoy the ride. Everything is well signed.
A connection to and from wherever you wanted to go. This service of the Star Ferry Pier was excellent and made it so easy to get to so many places. Very cheap too!
Excellent Public Transportation. A ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and back. Every few minutes you have a ferry. the scenery is wonderful, especially at night. the price is close to nothing...
cheapest excursion. this is cheapest boat ride you will ever take, for less than the UK equivalent of 30 pence, you get a 10 minute ride across the harbour

Pleasant, must do for the first time visitor to Hong Kong. A pleasant short trip across Hong Kong Harbor with lovely views for 360 degrees. It is best to take the ferry in one direction and to rake the underground train back to Kowloon.

best ferry ride in the world. Taking the Star Ferry remains an experience - aven after umpteenth years. This must be the cheapest and best ferry ride in the world, with the best skyline views, better than the Staten Island Ferry in New York. For me, the best time is to take the Star Ferry from TST to Central or Wanchai at sunset, when the illuminations of the skyscrapers are beginning to light up (especially the light cascade on the facade of The Centre). It's particularly enjoyable during the Christmas period......

This is the cheapest ferry I ever took!. This is the best way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. The ferries run regularly and the ride is really cheap. You need to buy a ticket at a machine to get a token.

accessible to our hotel. Ferry Terminal is walking distance from this Hostel. I just don't like that people doesn't know how to speak basic English and seems they are not friendly. They get annoyed when you talk to them in English

Fun But Not Functional. The Star Ferry has been a must do for visitors to Hong Kong since, well forever. You cannot go to Hong Kong and not do the Star Ferry ride across Victoria Harbour. Without question you can get some great photos on the ride towards Central on Hong Kong Island in the evening. The buildings are lit up and provide a glittering view. However, a gentle warning, quite frequently the smog/fog/pollution drifting down from China I obscure the view. It is cheap to ride the ferry and fun. But as functional transport there are much better options.

Star Ferry ride. easy to book just before you board. Or if you have an "Octopus card" which is good for most transportation means in the Hong Kong area, it's super quick! Took ferry ride from Central to Kowloon side - just because

Star Ferry Pier. This was my first time to ride the Star Ferry. This is a must for anyone who visits Hong Kong. The ride is short but sweet with an amazing view. I love the water and this ride was the easiest way to get to Hong Kong Island to carry on with our touring day.

Cheapest and best way to go. It literally costs a US quarter ($.25) to go one way to Central on the top deck. It's a nice slow ride over and you can enjoy the harbor views and these ferries come every 5-7 minutes so one is never far off.

Bustling but fun. From buying the tokens to queuing up for the ferry, this was fun! In among the locals coming home from work it gave a real authentic taste of travel in Hong Kong. The ferry trip back to the island was quick and easy.

A SYMPHONY OF LIGHTS HARBOUR CRUISE. At just around 25 US per person, this cruise is a must-do when in Hong Kong. The boat is very comfortable and they make sure you see every building that participates in the light show. They play an informative audio program during the cruise.
What a view. Reknown as the cheapest way to see the outstanding skyline of HK. Not the fastest way to travel but sometime a MUST. Big fun for a nickel and a dime
Great Way To Travel.. Efficient, punctual and inexpensive iconic ferries. A fantastic view of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon can be seen from the ferry.
Cheap as chips. A very pleasant journey across to the island costing virtually nothing. Dead easy to do. Brings you in with easy walking distance of all the attractions on the island.

Great range of shops by the famous pier. This is the ferry terminal for Hong kong fro m Kowloon. Make sure you buy an MTR Octopus car as that will get you around all the transportation in Hong Kong and Kowloon except the taxies. Lots to do here and enjoy the guys trying to sell you 'copy' watches and tailored goods.

Everyone loves a Boat Ride!. For just a couple bucks, you can ferry across the harbour.. Whoo hoo! Sure you could take the subway, but chugging 8 minutes across the waves is way more fun.. 2 stops from the Kowloon ferry station over to Hong Kong Island.. Easy!
Very fast and Cheap. Not a bad way to get across in Hong Kong. My experience both ways ways great and fast. People were friendly and everyone spoke english

Iconic. A must do in HK if you don't then what's the point!
I did my trip on my last night going from the island to mainland and on to the bar in peninsular hotel.

Worth a visit to Hong Kong just for a ride on Star Ferry. Value for money big time! It is the most fantastic ride across the waters of Hong Kong, as it has been done in these ferries for many many years. Super clean, on time and just the greatest ride, we just wanted to stay on it and go back and forth!Please don't ever close this service, it gives Hong Kong character, and it's lost a lot over the years!
One of the best transport in Hong Kong. I really love to move via ferry. It's not only transport, but very good place to fill Hong Kong inside
Good view, it's a must location you have to visit. Good view, it's a must location you have to visit when you come to hong kong, you can walk to here from Tsim Sha Tsui MTR Station, it's not so far.
Great Place. Lots of restaurants and small shops here. A place you must visit if you're in the area. And we did the harbor cruise which was great.

Convinient for turists. Pier has easy access and great connection to the Kowloon mainland. If you want to experience a ride over the channel that's the right place to jump on the ferry. It is a slow ride however but full of siteseeing option for those who like to take pictures.
Always takes bottom deck for view. This remain 1 of the Best value for money in HK for tourists .The trip is getting shorter than before but the sea breeze is still as good as ever .

Take the trip from Kowloon to HK via Star Ferry!. It is not the most efficient way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong island but it is very much worth the trip across via ferry. It is cheap, quick and you get a great sight of both sides and best of all, it beats the crowds in the metro! Great during the day but better at night for the full effect of the impressive Hong Kong skyline of skyscrapers, make sure to take a trip on Star Ferry during your trip to Hong Kong!

Love ... star ferry. I have visited Hong Kong for uncountable times. As far as I remember the first time I came, they still in the old airport and no tunnel and MTR yet, as far as I can remember still under the British.I don’t know why I love Hong Kong, and I am happy that I can still find Star Ferry in operation. Star Ferry was the only passenger transportation across between Hong Kong and Kowloon.They still keep everything the way it is, clean, interesting and enjoyable. On my last visit to Hong Kong, I especially took time to use star very cross, and I am enjoying and love it.They have done a fantastic job. Thank you for the people who involved making sure these ferries still in operation, and for sure if I visit Hong Kong in the very near future I will use this beautiful old transportation.
Not to be missed. Not a lot to say about the Star Ferry but you can't go to HK and not go on the Star Ferry - cheap and efficient.
star ferry. to truly experience HK, one MUST take the star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island (or in reverse). Gives you time to enjoy the sites of the harbor and take it all in.
Have to go on the ferry. Its a absolute must wen in Hongkong to take the Ferry to Kowloon. Enjoyed the view, the masses of people, the salt water.

Convenient and cheap to get around.. For around 3 HK Dollars per ride, you can get around easily from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central or Wanchai. But the most memorable moment was the excellent view of Victoria Harbour and Hong Kong's surrounding skylines.

Really good fun. We loved the ease of being able to criss cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Not expensive, and very quick across. Beautiful views at night of all the neon on the buildings. Extra neon for Christmas themes.

must try item. must try at least once if you are visiting HK.
just few mins , it could bring you from TST to Central. very convince with good view

Cheap as chips ferry worth taking. There is not a lot more to say beyond the title. Get the star ferry to move around and see the skyline from both sides of the water. It is easy to do and worth doing. You will likely get people trying to sell you suits as you get off the ferry - avoid these cowboys
It's Still Here. And will continue for a long time as an essential cog of Hong Kong's people moving machine. No visit here is complete without a ride on the ferry.

Easy way to HongKong Central. It's a good way to get to Hongkong (Central side). It spends just 2 dollars and during the trip we can enjoy the fantastic view of Victoria Bay, but nightview is the best.

Perfect way to see Victoria Harbor and skyline. The Star Ferry is an iconic symbol of Hong Kong much as the Staten Island Ferry is in New York.The ferry runs between Hong Kong Island and the Mainland Peninsula with a few stops. It is an inexpensive, simple, and casual way to cross Victoria Harbor as opposed to the car tunnel under the harbor. There is an historical and romantic spirit about the Ferry. It has been running since about 1870. It was started by British businessmen, who were vital in the robust development of the Hong Kong as an industrial, trade, shipping and financial center of China. Locals and visitors have been crossing this stunningly beautiful harbor for centuries in simple ways like the Ferry. It is very quick, maybe 15 minutes to get to one side from the other. So, if it is a nice day, I encourage visitors to take a few minutes to ride the ferry and bask in the views of the harbor and the skyline, one of the best city views in the world.
A must at least once. You have to take the Star Ferry at least once during your stay. You can also taking the metro to get across.

Far East Trip. You cannot come to Hong Kong without a trip on the Star Ferry between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon,it's like going back in time and allows you views of the river traffic , other trips up and down the harbour are worth enquiring about.
Star Ferry. Buy and Octopus Card and make travelling in Hong Kong easy-peasy. The Star Ferry is an icon and you must experience it.

Fun. Fun little place, i imagine it hasnt changed in the whole time it has been there. its efficient and the ferries were a good way to cross the water. Not a tourist attraction as such, but riding the ferry is a must
Great but difficult to reach by foot. Liked the terminal and facilities but had to walk a lot from Central with construction under progress. Well connected by Bus to City and Peak tram station.
Fast n cheap way to go to central. Fab public transport to get to central from TST..cost 2HKD per adult. Last ferry from central is at 11:30pm
Best way to travel to the island. Does what it says on the tin...nothing fancy but a great way to move between Kowloom and Hong Kong Island
a good service. used the star ferry to go over to the kawloon side.so cheap and easy to travel.also did the harbour trip for 1 hour,well worth it.
beautiful scenery. The place is scenic.Lots of attractions to see.Fresh sea breeze.Must visit place in Hongkong.The ferry ride of one hour is beautiful and enjoyable.Enjoyed the Museum of Arts.

Cooooolldddd. I love star ferry!!!!!!! I ride from Central to TST using star ferry and it was indeed a great experience. It was brief but refreshing! Love to go back again to sail at Victoria Harbor! It was so cheap but very nice and smooth transport, no wonder tourists and travelers loves it so much! Check out my blog at http://alifewithoutlimits.weebly.com/

Boarding terminal for the star cruise. this place is like a super expensive mall. I window shopped for almost 2 hours at this place owing to the fact that we reached early for our start cruise boarding and the terminal was yet to open. But i did not dare buy anything. There were only the most exclusive designer labels present all around us. There is a decent wait area though, with coffee shops .. so if you dont like window shopping, get a gook book to pass the time. :)The immigration and boarding was a breeze and before you know it, we were on the cruise :D

Good. Goes to many islands surrounding Hong Kong, and the ferries are often enough. Ferries are clean for the most part and don't take too long. It only took 5 minutes to get from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon.

Star Ferry Pier. They have this ferry ride which I found very unimpressive because it lasted all of 2-3 minutes. Apparently thats because of the reclamation on the island.
Anyway, you can check it out if you've never been on a ferry ride before. But I am sure that there are nicer ferry rides available around HK.

Impressed. I was impressed with the modern efficiency of the terminal which coped brilliantlty with the huge and constant flow of commuters
Easy link from MTR

Keep On Cruisin'. I am surprised that the Star Ferry is only the No.10 attraction in HK - I reckon it's No. 1 ! A genuine antique, it is nevertheless a masterpiece of efficiency and, most importantly, enjoyment. Victoria harbour is one of the wonders of the world and it be able to experience it from the best vantage points for free ! ( for us Elders anyway ) is a supreme privilege. I was in HK for a week recently and I must have done the ferry trip at least 10 times just for the hell of it, it's that good. Please, please when you are in HK do the ferry trip lots of times - you will never tire of it.
An iconic part of Hong Kong. This is a must as it is so easy now to go by Taxi through the tunnels. this bring the feeling of Hong Kong to life from the old movies.

Easy transport. This is a fast way to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. I suggest an Octopus card that makes getting around a LOT easier. We took the ferry across and walked to the escaltors that took us right to the shopping area in Central. Catch the Man Po temple for some local culture.
Cheap and cheerful. Where else can you get from A to B for so little money , but such a spellbinding view? Ok so staten island ferry compares but this gets the job done in less time! Love it.

A fun trip and great for photography! Only 2.5 HKD!. See the official Star Ferry Website http://www.starferry.com.hkI planned our trip using the info on the above website (English and Chinese) , recommended routes and maps,....fares and schedules like tourist A SYMPHONY OF LIGHTS HARBOUR CRUISE!I watched the laser show during Xmas while we were dinning at Nanhai NO. 1 in iSquare and it was fantastic!We took the ride in the afternoon in June and it was fab and great for photography!I took loads of photos and really enjoyed the trip!Be ready to grab a seat near the side of the ferry when you can seat and take photos of the harbour. A visit to the toilet before boarding just in case. I did! On board the ferry it just wasn't that ladies friendly. It was quite breezy so bring a scarf or jacket and a pair of sunglasses. Course don't forget your camera! Plus sunscreen or long sleeves!
Nice views. The pier itself is nothing special but you have a great view. And riding the ferry is ridiculous cheap! i think we payed about 4 HKdollars.
A must do when in Hong Kong. prior to building harbour tunnel the only way to get across the harbour was by ferry. it is a short 10min trip but is a great way to view the busy harbour

Great way to see the Hong Kong skyline. This is a great way to see Hong Kong. It is a traditional old ferry and is really cheap to go across. It is the easiest way to get across to Kowloon and we went fairly early in the morning when it wasn't very busy.. It has a lovely traditional feel about it.

God attraction. Bags of life and bustle. Some inexpensive places to get a coffee and a custard tart for about HK$15. A place with a charm all of its own. Even the tour company reps aren't too annoying.
The tourist information place is super with very helpful knowledgeable staff.

No Hong Kong visit is complete without taking the Star Ferry!. It is such an important piece of Hong Kong so this is absolutely one of the "MUST" Things to do in Hong Kong. It is a wonderful and cheap way to sit and look at the skyline from the sea, and it is a very quick and efficient way to travel to and from the Hong Kong Island.

fully agree...a must see and do. We took a trip over to Hong Kong island on the iconic star ferry. Great way to travel across the harbour and so cheap. I agree and endorse all the other positive reviews.

A must visit icon... Travelling these days is always about speed. Zip and you are there already. if you are not there fast, you're outdated / slow.But not all travel is about speed and time catching.Taking the Star Ferry is taking your own sweet time and enjoy the ferry ride.Ferry may be outdated, but Star Ferry has its value, which is an icon of Hong Kong Whenever you are in Hong Kong, taking the Star Ferry is a must whenever you have the time to do so.
A must do. Cheap, frequent, amazing views plus the feeling of wonder as you pass between the skylines of Kowloon and Central HK, fabulous!
Must do!!. A trip to HK isn't complete without a trip on the Star ferry. Wonderful views of the skyline and Victoria Harbour, its great even if you just go there and back again.
Great. Efficient, clean and a great way to travel to TST from Central. Indeed a great experience fro young and old. And did I say its cheap!?!?

Good place to hang out.. This place gets very busy at night especially on the weekends. They have a great view of the water and city- walk a bit further and you have good shopping. There are street entertainers along the way. Make sure to take a ferry ride at night!

Clean, efficient way of getting the best from HK. This regular service across the harbour allows easy and quick service to Kowloon or Hong Kong Island. Cheap and straightforward to use - they are included free if you are on a Big Bus Tour. Be ready for the hawkers of watches, shirts etc once you arrive in Kowloon - they don't know what 'No Thanks' means
Brands all the way. We went to cruise and the way to cruise is through the mall, full of brands of high end.Even outside rows of shops selling premium brands best place for window shopping.
Cruise the HongKong Harbour Front.. Nice short cruise to enjoy the view of Hong Kong harbour. You can use the Octopus card (for MTR train and buses) on the ferry ride too.
Harbor Ferries. Best way to get out to the islands. Also great way to cross the harbor. Make sure you get the Octopus card as it is a great way to get around without having to use cash.
Cheap, quick trip across the harbour.. Very easy to access. Can use your Octopus card to swipe in. Very efficient. Really cheap.lovely views of the Hong Kong skyline.

It's one of those things you just have to do..... Being my second trip to Hong Kong I wanted to do something new. Having previously seen the HK harbour from the Peak, I wanted a different perspective and Star Ferries was an easy solution. Having already purchased the nearly obligatory Octopus card (150HK$) for the week, the ferry hardly made a dent as each journey between HK Island and Kowloon is only 2HK$. The journey is short but you get a great view of the two harbour sides. If you want the top deck then you have to board the top deck from the harbour as you cannot change once you're on the ferry. Personally I prefer the lower deck as it is open and better for photographs whereas the top deck is windowed. On Kowloon side turn right and you have the old clock tower and the promenade leading to hand prints of movie stars and some statues such as Bruce Lee. You are also very close to the Museum of Art.
Great way to get around. Travels on the star ferry are always a fabulous time, they are clean, reliable and a great way to see Hong Kong.

Great way to see the harbor!. One of the cheapest mode of transportation - great view of the harbor. One of the must do in HK! Do it during the day and do it during the night! Totally different experience!

Really easy. If you go to Hong Kong you must cross the river at night for the full experiance. Go down to the Star Ferry pier where you can buy a token to cross. It only costs approx 30p per person one way. Well worth this very small investment to see Hong Kong from the river.

Classic Hong Kong. The Star Ferry has become a trademark of Hong Kong. I remember riding it years ago as a kid, and it hasn't changed much since then. The views of either side of Victoria Harbour are fantastic during the short ferry ride. At HK$2.00/2.50 (lower deck/upper deck) one-way, it's cheap as chips. Even if you didn't have to go anywhere, a ride back and forth is well worth the experience and views. A must for any visitors to Hong Kong.

HK trip is not complete without Star Ferry~. Spent only $2.5 for upper deck seat on a normal weekday. It was not very crowded, the ferry was barely half occupied. I must say it was a great experience! The fare is unbelievable cheap taking passengers crossing HK island and Kowloon. The view was simply amazing! Trip to HK is not considered complete without taking Star Ferry! There are comments about taking tram (ding ding) is a must, I actually think it must be Star Ferry! Anyways, probably shouldn't make comparison between both as they are both important historical transportation in HK. It's unbelievable that the ferry looks exactly the same as the one featured in old HK movies!! Enjoyed it very much~ Disembarking at Tsim Sha Tsui pier leads you directly at doorstep of many attractions such as Avenue of Star, Light of Symphony,the clock tower, Space museum, Art museum, Science museum and even many many shopping centres!!!

Efficient, dependable. The Star Ferry is the best way to get between Kowloon and the main city of Hong Kong. It is dependable, efficient, and affordable. It takes about 10 minutes to cross the harbor and runs continually. Tourists and locals use it for transport.

Timeless, and very cool. I first rode the Star Ferry in 1986 and I swear it has not changed one iota since then. Well, maybe a tiny bit as now it accepts the Oyster card, but the boat is the same one, and it was quite old in '86. I guess if you had to rank attractions on a 'bang for the buck' scale, the Star Ferry would be number one in Hong Kong. In my opinion, no trip to HK is complete without a ride across the harbor on this ferry.

Highlight. Loved the star ferry service. Took it a few times to get across the other side of HK island. The pier itself is pretty run down but the ferry service is still prompt and cost effective. Enjoy the ride but occasionally the wave can be quite bad. If you suffer from motion sickness, i suggest avoid the ferry ride at all cost. There is other alternative way to get across the island via underground MTR train. Overall very satisfied with my experience.

Easy and cheap to use. The Star Ferry is a quick and easy way to get across from Tsim Sha Tsui to HK Island. The service is slick and very frequent and really low cost. You get great views of the harbour on both sides as well. We also had a ticket for a 1 hour harbour cruise on a ferry which was included in our Big Bus ticket and this is really worthwhile doing.

Rated as one of '50 places of a lifetime' - National Geographic. We planned our trip such that after lunch in Central, we will take the Star Ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui for Avenue of Stars. The ferry ride only costs us HKD 3.40 (public holiday) each. We were there at about 6 pm so we could see the beautiful sun setting against the backdrop of many skyscrapers in Hong Kong. The ferry ride only lasted about 10 minutes. Worth a ride, since it is cheap and doesn't acquire much time.

A trip with Star ferries is a must.... The Star Ferry pier has been very nicely refurbished since I was here some years ago. The ferries are as good as always and offers the best view over both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island.

A "must do" in Hong Kong. A tradition in Hong Kong - take the Star Ferry across the harbor! (From the Island to Kowloon) Cost all of fifty cents!The ferry terminal on Hong Kong Island side has been moved to allow for "Even More Development"!!! You have to sort of "find your way" - but there are signs and everyone of the locals will help you find it! It's in the area that has been developed for all the inter-island ferries that go from the Hong Kong side.It's more fun in rush hour - double deck - takes a couple of hundred people and the get on and off in about a couple of minutes! Bring your video camera!Drops you on the Kowloon side, - lots of action here - especially at night!Most of the sights, museums and the Cultural Center are on this side.You can get the ferry back to the island (Wanchai) - which is a fun area - lots of shops, restaurants and night life!Have fun!

Enjoyable and amazing views. The bang for your buck is amazing and the views are breathtaking. This is a step back in time from the pier right to the boat. I loved my many trips. Taking it at night is even better! Just be warned once you land in Tsim Sha Tsui and outside the terminal you'll be offered to buy "Copy watches, purses, wallets, custom shirts/suits" from "local" vendors on a near constant base

Biggest Bang for your Buck. I love riding the star ferry. There's something about the history, the smell, the wobbly ride that brings so much nostalgia. For about 2 HKD, it's a steal and you'll be rewarded with great views of the harbor.
Best value in Hong Kong. . No better place to view or take in Hong Kong than taking a ferry across the harbor. Great experience. A must for every visitor to Hong Kong.

Most enjoyable and great views!. This is a must-do for any traveler to HK. Its cheap and safe. The ferries run very frequently. Get a window seat for great photo ops.The ride for 10 minutes or so. Pay with cash or credit card or with Octopus card.

See the harbour from the sea!. For 85 HK dollars ( I don't see how others paid a couple of dollars, they must have put the prices up!) we took this little trip around the harbour. The boats were heritage and seemed stable enough! For the price of the ticket we could choose a soft drink and a mediocre pack of biscuity things, which I declined; maybe the prices went up to pay for the snack... The English voiceover gave details of buildings and general facts about the harbour but I could only hear bits of it standing outside under the speakers. You couldn't hear anything inside. It was chilly but much better in the air - not exactly fresh air in Hong Kong. I did enjoy the hour long trip though.

This is really a step back into history. The Star ferry across Hong Kong harbour is one of the best journeys one can take. The ferries are quaint and maintain a link with the history of the city. On the way one can enjoy the view of the city and get some feeling of the atmosphere of the place. It is relaxing and I like to use the ferry as often as possible as it gives me a short time to relax from this busy city.

Fast, Easy and Cheap. Taking the Star Ferry between Hong Kong and Kowloon is a great way to see the harbour views. Ferry ticket purchase is in English and it's simple and easy. During the week the fare is HK2.50 for the upper deck. You can lower the window and take great photos. The trip takes less than 10 minutes. You never have to wait long to catch a ferry.

Nice Experience, Great Views. A nice experience taking the ferry. It's a cheap mode of transportation that offers amazing views as well as convenience. For just a couple HKD, do not miss this great ferry ride. You can pay by coins or use your Octopus card, it's just a short ride. And the service seems frequent. Hang out at the Arena of Stars before or after the ferry ride.

An absolute must!. No trip to HK would be complete without a trip on the star ferry. Go on the top deck and try to be near the outside of the ferry for the best views. Try the TST- Wan Chai route and sit on the right hand side for amazing photo opportunities with the HK skyline.
Immerse yourself in local life. Take the historic Star Ferry from Kowloon to HK Island or vice versa. It's a great way to see how the locals of Hong Kong get from one side to another. Nice views too.

You just have to do it!. Quintessential Hong Kong experience. Save some coins from your other purchases and use them for your tickets. Incredibly easy to buy. I also never seemed to wait too long for a ferry, so don't worry about the schedule. Take it across the harbor -- really in either direction. Enjoy the incredible views by day or night (try to do both; it is worth it). Best tourist value in the whole region!

Stunning harbourview. Festive season is just around the corner. Everyone, no matter tourists or locals flocks to Tsim Sha Tsui seafront to take photo so as to capture the best night view throughout the year. One of the best view is on the star ferry which only costs you a few HK dollars to enjoy this worldclass harbour view. If you would like to give your loved ne a more memorable evening, try the Italian Restaurant in Marco Polo Hotel where the alfresco seating area can give you the same fantastic view.

Bargain trip across the harbour.. We used the ferry during our recent trip to Hong Kong. It was really interesting and a great way to see the activity in the harbour. Also a total bargain costing about 20 pence.

HK Way Of Life. The Star Ferry has been providing harbour crossing service between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon since the 19th century, ferrying more than 70,000 passengers a day across Victoria Harbor. Presently it serves the routes Central HK-Tsim Sha Tsui and Wan Chai-Tsim Sha Tsui vice versa. It also provides a 'Harbor Tour' for tourists making an indirect circular routes to the three stops.
