Even after the opening of the Cross Harbour Tunnel in 1972 - paving the way for railway and road access between HK Island and Kowloon peninsula - the Star Ferry continue to provide an inexpensive and enjoyable mode of transport for passengers and tourists. It has established itself not just a commuter boat but tourist attraction as well.

The Star Still Shines. The Star Ferry trip between Hong Kong & Kowloon is still one of Hong Kong's best scenic trips. Various harbour craft bustle their way around Victoria Harbour while the Star Ferry negotiates it all with a minimum of fuss. Whilst the MTR has taken a little gloss from the ferry crossing, it still remains along with the "Ding Ding" trams a cheap & attractive way to explore Hong Kong. Try a night time charter cruise on the specially designed Star Ferry that has an open outside deck for viewing all of the night time light show spectacular.

Look at 1 million Hong Kong dollars from the sea!. I can taste the trip of a comfortable ship even if I go on board from whichever.I can taste the best Cruise feeling when I look at the skyscraper day and night from the sea

Hong Kong heritage. I came to Hongkong many times, but I never forget to ride it. Looks old, not many people, but tourists ride this very. because local people prefer to ride MTR ...., enjoy your 10 minutes ride, and you will feel hongkong heritage from here ....

A Dimmed Star. As from 1898, the Star Ferry was a Bright Satr shining in the Victoria Harbour. Everyday the stars(ferry's name) carried thousand of FORTUNE and FAME seekers to and fro the Hongkong Island and the Kowloon Peninsula. Ever since the MTR(underground rail) started their services in 1979, this 'Star' was dimmed. Nowadays, this 'Star' is carrying out another important missing-to carry Tourists from all over the world,to see the beautiful scenery of Hongkong and Kowloon at a lower angle-a few meters above sea level. Senior passengers using Octopus to pay the ferry fare is Free-of-charge. Edward CHAN in Hongkong.

Last bits of real charm - The Star Ferry in Hong Kong. Having lived in Hong Kong for well over 14 years, I was lucky enough to have used the Star Ferry as a commuter, and what a way to start your day! Hong Kong, which means 'Fragrant Harbor' in Chinese, has been clogged up with pollution from the Pearl River delta, but the Star Ferry ride remains cheap, well-loved by commuters and tourists alike, and the views can range from foggy to brilliantly sharp views of Victoria Harbor and both Hong Kong Island and Tsim Sha Tsui. It is never boring, and you can see the ocean liners very often as well. Small fishing craft, the ferries of the Outlying Islands and Macau, and the helicopter pad on top of the Macau Ferry Terminal all come to mind. Don't expect dolphins, but the bustling harbor makes this a rewarding experience. I miss the Star Ferry!

A history of over 100 years !. The Star Ferry Company came into existence around 1898.The ticket prices between Wanchai and Tsim Sha Tsui are the cheapest: adults cost HK$2.20; children and the disabled cost HK$1.30 and seniors are free. On the other three routes adults cost HK$5.30; children and the disabled cost HK$2.70 and seniors are free.
Great View that You cannot Miss. You can have a look or take a picture of the stunning night view of the Victoria Harbour at the Pier! Pick a day with nice weather to go there!

Pay 3.4HKD and choose upper decker. I've been on star ferry several times, but never tried upper Decker because the fare is doubled as compared with the lower deck. I went to the upper deck by accident the other day. It feels so damn good. The seats are much wider, you don't need to smell the gasoline and hear the noise from the engine. Going across the harbor is like a breeze and feels very relaxing. The only drawback is you can only stay on it for several minutes per trip.

Best cheap public transportation.. I love the old school charm of riding the ferry from Kowloon to HK. It reminds me of one of my favorite old movies "The world of Suzie Wong" The views are nice, the ride is short & cost is less than a buck, can't beat that!
Great Experience. Nice ferry ride and very quick and large ferry - We enjoyed our trip very much and would recommend this ferry company

The way the locals do it. We wanted to view Hong Kong harbour. The concierge suggested that the water tours were expensive HK $80 per person and therefore suggested the Star Ferry crossing from Kowloon side to HK Island and all for HK $2.50 per person (one way).
A simply stunning way to see the HK skyscrapers and no better way to do it.
Highly recommended.

Must do during the day & at night. Another must do for visits to Hong Kong & definitely try to take a ride both during the day & night. The Ferry service is constant throughout the day & links Kowloon to Central & Wan Chai.
Recent upgrades to the areas around the Star Ferry terminals make it a breeze to navigate.

Star ferry Service/Star Ferry Cruise. The star ferry service is such an amazing experience, as others have said a great and traditional way to view Hong Kong, Kowloon and the harbour.We also took the 1 hour afternoon cruise twice - lovely well fitted out Star Ferry for this tour of the entire harbour, including free cold drink and bun. Views were spectacular, a good cruise on the first day to help find your bearings. Highly recommended.

Full harbour ferry. My family took the full harbour ferry which is an hour long ride at nite. It was spectacular. My children and wife enjoyed it very much as we could enjoy the sights and the skyline along the harbour. The only complaint is the very steep price. If u are on a budget, take the local star ferry across from Kowloon to the other side and enjoy the scenery. It is so much cheaper using the octopus card.

The best, cheapest tourist ride in the world. You must ride the Star Ferry over to Kowloon and back to get wonderful views and a nice breeze on hot days. Sit upstairs near the front by an open window and fire away with your camera. The skyscraper lights make the night trip fantastic but day time can be fun too especially if there is a lot of shipping in the harbour.

Cheap travel from hong kong island to kowloon. We had done an afternoon tour organised through our hotel in kowloon. The tour finished on hong kong island but included the ferry trip back to kowloon. Very impressed with how cheap it was $2 australian dollars and took only 10 minutes to get back

Best Cheapest Hong Kong Attraction. This is one of the ways to travel from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon and visa versa. It is also one of the cheapest attractions I know as natives use this as a way to travel too. Not much has changed but it is a great way to see both Hong Kong Island's skyline and Kowloon side.

25 Cents US to cross the harbour. Historic, vibrant and fun. We rode round trip at night after dinner. Very romantic and invigorating. The lights are hypnotic and the some of the boats a blast from the past. Just do it. We took a cab round trip to the terminal on the Hong Kong side...saved our legs a bit after a long active day.

Take the Star Ferries Instead of the MTR between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. The Star Ferries between Kowloon and Hong Kong provides an excellent opportunity to the see both Hong Kong and Kowloon skylines either during the day or night. The ferries are old but safe and a short ride across the harbour.

Must do when visiting Hong Kong. It is one of those things that in the busy city it is just lovely to take the ferry across the water. Whilst the MTR is super efficient and will get you across faster, I would highly recommend taking the ferry at least once especially if it is a clear day!

The Star of Hong Kong. We visited Hong Kong many years ago and did Victoria Peak, Aberdeen Harbour etc then, but one of my favourites was the Star Ferry. Although mainly a means of travel for locals, it is a great way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong. It is very cheap, about 30 pence each way and is a great way to see all the other water traffic. It belongs to old Hong Kong and this gives it a certain charm.

Must do. One of the highlights of our trip. The charming cruise across the harbour gives a great view of both the Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. An absolute must do and ridiculously cheap as well, the fare is about 20p!

Very disappointed. We went to take our young son on the Star Ferry Harbour Cruise as a treat before we left Hong Kong. On arrival at the pier at 11am we went to find out what the sailing times were which should have been been 12.15pm sail and the sign we saw stated to be at the ticket office for 11.45am.We waited until 12.40 pm and had approached several different people at the terminal and each time we were told somebody would be with us in 5 minutes. Guess what nobody came each time and as you can imagine how frustrated we were becoming. In the end we left. We would definitely not recommend this trip to anyone what a waste of time and more importantly we had a very unhappy little boy.

Take a Boat to Kowloon. The Star Ferry journey from Central Pier to Tsim Sha Tsui is a must do. It does not cost much at all to hop on a ferry. You can do tbhs multiple times (go back and forth) and it won't break the bank! Payment can be made using your Octopus card.Once you hop off on the other side, it is within walking distance to Nathan Road.

Harbour tour at night. A must do. The Star Ferry must be a bit of an institution anyway. It's an excellent foot passenger service between Kowloon and Central and cheap as chips (20p one way). The night time harbour tour at about £15 a head (cash only, booked in advance) is twice the price of the day time tour, and worth every penny. The harbour at night is after all one of the main reasons for visiting Hong Kong, and where better to see it from. Highly recommended

Great Value - Great Experience. You really would be silly to go to Hong Kong and not go on the Star Ferry.These almond shaped boats travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon every few minutes so no reservation is necessary. This is the mode of transport the local people use to get around. It costs only 20p and each boat holds approximately 300 people so the system is well maintained and considered a very safe mode of transport.You don't need a full harbour cruise when you use this ferry - why waste money?You get a super view of the harbour, the waterfront buildings of Hong Kong Island and indeed Victoria Peak.Go for it - you won't regret it!
A bargain ferry ride. A bargain $2.50 (about 20p in £!) to ride across the harbour, the only way to see both sides of Hong Kong, and probably one of the best value rides in the whole world!

Why pay for a harbour cruise?. When you can take the ferry across the same stretch of water, enjoy the same sights and for minimum cost. A real piece of history, and great views all around. Cheap, frequent and comfortable, with different options - I went Wan Chai to TST.

Paid for the full harbour cruise….not impressed. The windows on the boat were dirty on the inside with peoples nose and finger and face prints. Not much to see but high rise Hong Kong buildings and a few junk boats- not many of them left.The price includes a bottle of water or juice or soda and a packet of odd buns. I would suggest to just take the $1 ferry to the other side and explore and come back. Not worth the harbour tour.The tourism information desk at the ferry terminal is very helpful and friendly and spoke english excellent. Happy travels.

Must do scenic ride across the harbour. The Star Ferry and Pier and a "must do" in Hong Kong. After living there for a year, I can't believe it was my first time and I wish I did it before then. The price is so cheap and it is so easy as long as it fits within your schedule. It is a bit hard to see the full skyline from the boat, depending on where you are sitting but it is a very smooth rice and still is iconic and well worth it!

See the Old Chinese Junk Boats. This review is quite late. The Star Ferry Pier is located in Kowloon Point, Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon. I took the cruise for 15 minutes which was a good experience to see the activities in this busy harbour.

Serenity, a sense of history and cheap. For all the things you have to pay through the nose to enjoy here, this, thankfully, isn't one of them. It's a few minutes of serenity as you cross the harbour, looking at the skyline, and you get a sense of Hong Kong before there was tunnel traffic. Best of all, a crossing costs less than US$1, though there is a tiny difference in price between the lower and upper decks.

Cheap and scenic, a must-do. The cross-harbor sail is as scenic as ever, and is probably one of the cheapest cruise in the world :-) One of the must-do's when in HK. The longest ride is between Wanchai and TST, the shorter one between TST and Central. Too bad the old piers have all been destroyed by now, because the new ones are further away. Read that because of this the number of rides had come off 30% and I am not surprised...

Cheap Quick Ferry. Certainly a quick way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. The pier itself appears old and can be a little confusing for the first timer with so many signs there. the ride is on an old ferry but very rustic and quite an experience. cost is minimal

Great views. Take the famous Star Ferry from (and back ) Hong Kong Island to the mainland , enjoy fantastic views , watch traditional working junks intermingle with cruise ships , helicopters flying overhead !A lot to see on the quick 12-15 minute crossing

Cheapest way to see Victoria Harbour. First off, this was never meant to be a tourist attraction but a mode of transport across the Victoria Harbour. The ferries are nothing glamorous and the trip is short taking around 10-15 mins only. The new Central Pier (next to the ferris wheel) is also at an inconvenient location. Like most things in HK, its also not got good wheelchair or baby stroller access. tHowever it is a part of HK's history and the service dates back over a hundred years. And the actual ferries and the piers at TST and Wanchai still retain the feel of the good old days.Although I am a local HK resident and whenever I have time I still go on the ferry for no reason other than the ride itself. I consider it a part of the fast disappearing HK heritage, and also the best way to get so close to the harbour. How they are still running such regular schedules with half filled boats at HKD$2.50 ($3.40 on weekends) I do not know.Tips: If you are in HK on a clear day, go on the Star Ferry (day and night!). If you're in HK when the Christmas lights are up, most definitely go on the Star Ferry at night and take the TST to Wanchai service, you can't beat the view (the trip costs a little more but is also longer). Pay the little extra and go on the upper deck, its much quieter and even has air-conditioning in the summer (follow the signs to go up BEFORE you reach the ticket gates).

Best way to be in Victoria Harbour. Only a few HK dollars per ride can allow you to travel from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central or vice versa. Visitors can take many photos while in the ferry for both sides. And there are a lot of interesting places to go at TST or Central after the ferry ride. A transportation that should never be missed in Hong Kong !
This is true Hong Kong. I love this little five min ferry ride on the old star ferry . Five minutes to relax and enjoy the view of Hong Kong and it is dirt cheap!

Amazing views of the Hong Kong skyline at dusk without the expense. Such an amazing view from the ferry at dusk. By accident our journey from Kowloon to Central Pier coincided with dusk so we saw the city light up. Although the trip was quick (about 8 minutes from A to B) it was definitely worth the cost of the trip (less than HKD10). It was also possible to pay for the trip using our Oyster card - a very well coordinated system!

best sightseeing tip... I could just do the ferry ride from central to Kowloon over and over again. Day, night, sunset it's great...the views are awesome and it's a cheap option to see the best of hong kong. It's definitely worthwhile doing!

Simply A Mode Of Transportation. Everyone hyped this ferry ride up do much I couldn't wait to see what all the fuss was about. Well, the 3-minute ride across Victoria Harbor was simply a quick and efficient way to get from point A to point B - nothing more, nothing less. The pier is busy and full of tourist-related shops. There are several places to eat/drink at the pier. Note, it is cheaper to travel on the lower deck of the ferry.

Sailing away across the South China Sea. Having lived in Hk for 15 years I returned to become a tourist for a week. The Star Ferry trip is a must: a short ferry ride across the harbour makes a trip to HK special. During the day the tall still monuments to capitalism soar along both sides of the harbour, at night they display wonderful neon signs as well as a light show so great for photos. The ferry cost less that $3HK but you need to get an Octopus card from the MTR (subway station) as most public transport is cashless. The Pier on HK side has a Starbucks and observation deck. One of the best cheap trips in HK.

Best Way to travel to Kowloon. The Star ferry is the cheapest and quickest way to get from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. It costs buttons too and is an amzing way to see Hong Kong Island when half way across the water. There is boats leaving every 15 mins or so.They also do a tour around the harbour which is great though I found it a wee bit choppy! The pier is at central and very easily located adn a defo must by anyone visiting Hong Kong.

A must - short but great. Love the whole experience - from getting on board to the trip across to the Island.You've not done HK until you've done this. Incredibly reasonably priced. Love travelling by ferry.

Relaxing journey. I used the Star Ferry for the circular route which took about 1 hour, during the day time. It was as expected although much quieter on the boat which was very nice. The boat itself looked good inside with lots of varnished wood etc and although you can only sit inside, there are standing decks at either end which I spent most of my time on. A big bonus is the free drink and snack you can get.Reccomended as a nice way to float around the harbour and see some of the city's amazing buildings from a good distance!

the best option to cross the harbour. the pier has it all!from lip-smacking restaurant to nice souvenir shops, the star ferry pier tried to offer a nice package to all visitors. If you plan to take a ferry as a tourist, you may consider Wanchai / Tsim Sha Tsui Service as it offers a little longer ferry ride than the Central-TST route. the fare is same.Please carry changes as you can buy tickets only through vending machines. On the ground floor of the pier, there are some good souvenir shops and they often have items on sale/discount. The restrooms are not very clean.

a cheap way to see the harbor. The star ferry is about a ten minute ride between Hong Kong and Kowloon. It is a nice view and fun. The signage is a little unclear but we figured it out. We used the Octopus card, which is a great way to just wave the card and go on the boat or on the trams or MTR.
Very Relaxing. The star ferryis very nice mode of transport in comparison to the cramped MTR subway. On a good day you get a briliant view!

Cross the harbor cheaply on an icon with a view!. The Star Ferry is a must “do” when in Hong Kong. It is a historic icon (started in the 1880’s) that gets you from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island (or vice versa), while providing a gorgeous view of the skylines of both coastlines and coming as close to being free as you can get these days. The ferries are pretty old and beat up (they do get a LOT of wear), but pick a trip during the middle of the day when there are no crowds and you can get a good view with a breeze. Its only a 10-minute ride to or from Central, and you get to watch the crew in their blue sailor uniforms tie up and cast off with the old hemp rope, just like in the old days. The MTR might be more efficient and fast (and more costly), but cannot compare in providing that view! We found it worth the time getting an octopus card at the airport since it provides quick access to the Ferry and many other transportation options and activities without having to worry about correct change or exact fares. The Star Ferry is Hong Kong!

Star Ferry Harbour Tour ... Recommended. Not only can you use this service to cross the bay from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island, but the Star Ferry services also include an hour long cruise of Victoria Harbour for sightseeing. It is exciting and provides you with a different view of your surroundings and the majestic buildings/skyscrapers on both sides of the bay.The tour operators are friendly and some speak good English to answer all questions. Make sure you have your camera ready to take some awesome pictures while on the boat.

Great way to cross the bay. Cheap, quick, reliable and offers stunning view of the bay. The pier in Wan Chai is difficult to find though, the best way is to go through business centres rather than make your way along construction sights =)

Ferry is awesome from A-B but light show tour is poor value. Definitely use the Star ferry to get to/from the island but avoid the light show tour. Save money and watch it from the riverbank instead. You'll get the full experience from that so job done.

Great mix. A great mix of locals and tourists ride this historic run. The ferry's themselves are from another era, and are wonderfully Maintained. Buying your token and lining up on the floating pier is reminiscent of an older time. Also, there is that incredible view! Also the similarities to Sydney's ferries and Circular Quay abound, and they were so obviously built by the same colonial power. It makes the whole experience familiar.
Needs an upgrade. The Kowloon Pier is definitely in need of an upgrade and the number of hawkers can make things a little oppressive.
Star ferry is a must do while in Hong kong. Cheap and easy to get on and off with a nice view as you go across the harbor to or from Hong Kong to Kowloon.

Tagged as a "must-do" when in HK, but its a little overrated.. My friend and I took the Star Ferry Symphony of Lights cruise from Central to TST and back. The boat was very rocky, and the light show was not impressive. (If you stay for the round trip it takes 1-hour). At the very least, they gave us a ticket to redeem for a free drink and a cookie; but the whole experience didn't give me a "wow" factor and it made me felt like it was a waste of time (and I could have ride the regular Star Ferry over 60-70+ times for the same cost). On the other hand, the regular Star Ferry is a good way of seeing HK and getting from one side to another inexpensively. I like that you can use the Octopus card as payment. Timetables can be found on their official page ----> http://www.starferry.com.hk/en/service
Cheapest way to enjoy the Hong kong skyline. It's a 'must do' while visiting Hong kong & is really cheap.Just get on to the Star ferry and enjoy the ride & the view of Hong Kong skyline.

You have to do this!. This is SO Hong Kong (and cheap) and you get great views. As an added activity, try to get through during rush hour and feel like a real Hong Kongite :) There are upper and lower deck access points (you cannot change once you are on board) and lower is a tad cheaper (for those who want to save a bit and have seen the skyline plenty of times) .. both have great views. Easily my fav form of transport in HK

a must do at least once in HK. its a must just to experience the the iconic ferry travesting the victoria harbour. Its just a short ride but it was definitely more fun riding the mtr.If you are on the Kowloon side and going to visit the victoria Peak. I suggest you ride the star ferry and cross the harbour . Take the Bus 15c at the Pier exit 7 that takes you to the Peak tram terminus. Nice way to experience the iconic landmarks and transport system of Hong Kong.

You cant leave without a trip on the Star Ferry.... We stayed on Kowloon side so had no choice but to use it...it was always fun....people watching...locals/commuters etc.Take a trip just for the short experience...you wont be disappointed if you are interested in human nature...

I've done that!. It's only a ferry and the journey is about 8 minutes but I have to say I was genuinely excited about going on the Star Ferry across Victoria harbour. You get another view of a very exciting city scape, particularly at night and its very easy to use.At only a couple of quid per person it's probably the best value attraction in Hong Kong.

Was free last time I went but still a great value "attraction". At 2 to 2.5HK this is a bargain. A great way to experience the pulse of Hong Kong and also get from Hong Kong itself to Kowloon. Note you have buy a token from the machines before the automated gates. Boarding is also by deck. They also offer harbour cruises including one to see the light show. The staff wear quite ild fashioned Sailor outfits which add to the experience.

You must do it!. Let's be blunt. If you don't take the Star Ferry at least once, you have missed out on one of Hong Kong's cultural treasures. This city tears itself down and buries its past so often. Not with this icon.The Star Ferry is part of the history of the city. It used to be the only cheap and practical way to cross the harbour. It's cheap, it's easy and it's fun. This is like a budget harbour cruise! Take photos of the harbour as you take the short journey. There's a top deck and a bottom deck. If you want the top deck, you have to enter at the right level at the pier. No changing once you're on board! It's slightly more expensive on top, but the whole thing is so cheap that it shouldn't matter much to a traveller.Pay with the Octopus card (you should get one soon after you land) or buy a token to board.The journey from Kowloon ends at Central on Hong Kong Island. You can always take the MTR train back if the ferry made you sick! Yes, it does go up and down a bit, so be prepared for motion.

Iconic ferry ride - a must do if visiting. The star ferry is one of the oldest icons of Hong Kong, having been around since the turn of last century. It is cheap to ride and provides great views of both Hong Kong and Kowloon. I advise everyone to at least ride it once whilst in HK for the experience.

Great experience. Travelling between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon by the star ferry makes a pleasant change to the MTR. It's a more relaxed way with a better view and cheaper too. It's a short trip about 10 minutes and they run frequently so younever have to wait very long. I love the old world charm of these ferries.

Exceeded my expectations. In every guide book it states that this ride is a must do while in HK. And they are correct. It runs frequently, quick boarding, and the ride is actually really fast. I wish it lasted longer, more like a harbour tour. Anyways, the alternative is to to take it both ways. Sit on the same side, so you get to see both views. Tip: Also, the machines that you buy the tokens don't give change, and only take small bills, and no one around wants to change your large bill, so I had to go one of the store and buy something to get change. So bring enough coins.
Very efficient great view. At only $2.5 you get amazing view of both sides of the bay plus efficient transportation. Sound like a good deal and proved to be one as well

Star ferry. Day and night.. You must go on the star ferry. It's such a great way to get across the harbour. Yes, it's quicker on the MTR but not as much fun! It's especially good at night, when the whole of Hong Kong lights up. Sit on the upper deck, in an outside seat.

Great, Cheap At to Enjoy the City Views. At only $2.50HKD each way per person, this is a cheap and easy way to see the harbor, other ships, and the skyline on both sides. Everyone should definitely do this at least once and probably twice.

Nostalgia. One must take the ferry in one direction taking the slow way across the channel according nice views of the sky line. Many take this around 8pm when the light show is underway, but if you do make sure you get the ferry when the open upper deck.
Fast. Fast and cheap we like it we take it near from IFC mall and it's stop near of victoria harbour and u can walk from there ،there is many places to go
Star Ferry is #1. Quintessential must do experience in Hong Kong. Everyone agrees and everyone is right. Enough said. Do it.

Iconic. Everyone calls this iconic - because it is. Australians - think Sydney Harbour ferries!If possible, push to the head of the queue when moving from the waiting lounge to pier side as the seating is unallocated and there are only a small number of prime tables with two chairs against the windows (it was raining on our trip so outside seating wasn't an option). No one will be offended as the locals all push, slam the door in your face and generally carry-on a treat without a second thought.A great way to see Kowloon and the facing part of HK Island from the water with a running commentary. Cheap - only HK$85 pp and that includes refreshments!Have a look downstairs -it's also where the toilet (very clean) is.

Star ferry. Take the Star Ferry from Hong Kong Island over to the mainland of Kowloon. It only costs a few dollars and the ride is very quick as it,s not far at all. But the Star Ferry is one of Hong Kong,s iconic attractions and a must when you are there. It,s very easy to find and even easier to get a ticket from the machine before boarding. The hard varnished wooden seats all add to the atmosphere ...... Enjoy the trip !!!
It's the experience. For HK$3 you can cross a great harbor and experience a great view. It's probably one of the best iconic trips in the world.
Best Deal in Hong Kong. This is a must to go from Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. And the view is amazing. Definitely would recommend.

A must in HK. For literally cents, you can take the Ferry from Hong Kong to Kowloon and vice versa. This is a really cool thing to do with the family or even as a couple in the evening with the great view of the HK skyline. You can even use it as your method of transport for crossing the harbour. A really large shopping centre on the Kowloon side also.

THE iconic thing to do in Hong Kong. The ferry costs HKD $2.50 during the week and HKD$3.40 at weekends and is one of the best bargains you'll find in Hong Kong. If you take the ferry from Kowloon to Wanchai, sit on the right hand side of the ferry on the top deck for the best views, and if you go to Central also sit on the right. If you don't have an Octopus card, then just buy a token as you approach the entrance to the ferry.If you time it right for the nights that the laser show is running then sit on the right hand side of the ferry leaving Central heading to Kowloon and you can watch the show while you're on the move.An excellent way to see the harbor, the skyline and get across to the Island.

HK Must DO. Ok so this is purely a boat(s) to get from Koowlong to the main part or vice versa but I believe it is a very iconic part of HK. The skyline of the city has certainly changed over the years but these boats have not, and it gives you a great view of the bay, harbours and the city skyline (if you are lucky to visit when the smog isn't about). You have two options where to sit; (top or bottom) a lot suggest the top level, but I choose the bottom for the water level view and to be part of the crowed. A trip during the night time is also very recommended to put a different perspective on things.

I like the 'No Spitting' signs .... Star Ferry is an experience - cheap, efficient, great views of Kowloon and HK Island (especially at night), a must-see tourist destination - plus a very useful way of getting from TST to Central and vice-versa.

worth doing. this was something worth doing it was very special and a famous thing in hong kong the ferries are very old but nice to experience gives you a break from the rain or the heat too a must do when visiting hong kong I think.

A bit of nostalgia...nothing amazing though.. Yes, it's an old ferry in a modern city. I had fun but I'm not sure it's quite as amazing as some would have you believe. It's cheap, kind of funky, and a cool way to see the harbour though...I'm glad we tried it out a few times. I don't know, wouldn't say it was a highlight of our visit to Hong Kong but it was cool enough.

Cheap and cheerful. You can easily and cheaply get a cab across to the island through one of the tunnels from Kowloon, but for ambience, views, and bustle you can't beat the star ferry. And when it is hotter than hades as it is in Hong Kong in September, the moving breeze is very welcome indeed.

A Great Way To Enjoy The Hong Kong Harbour. Despite the convenience of MTR (which goes cross tunnel from HK Island to Kowloon), the Star Ferry has always been an integral part of Hong Kong history. Be it daytime or night-time, the Star Ferry is an inexpensive way to travel across HK Island and Kowloon, as well take in the views of the harbour (HK side) that Hong Kong is famed for. A must-do and an experience worth having if you are not in a rush.

Convenient, affordable and a great way to take in the skyline.. The ferry itself is no frills and nothing spectacular. However, for the low price, it's a convenient and extremely-affordable way to commute between Hong Kong and Kowloon. It's also the best way to take in the Hong Kong and Kowloon skyline.
Great way to travel between islands. Also its BYO and you can stock up from the local 7-11, plus it has air conditioning and the seats are clean

Great sevice and inexpensive way to see the city. A must do when in Hong Kong, great way to travel on water to see the city and a night amazing views of lights. Inexpensive and reliable. The upper deck is great but it doesn't matter too much. Leaves on time too.

A great inexpensive way to get from central pier to Kowloon. We took advantage of the Star Ferry, which is an inexpensive quick trip to Tsim Sha Tsui from downtown Hong Kong. The ferry is not anything wondrous or great but, but it is an affordable way to get across the Victoria Harbor (body of water). You can buy your tickets at the pier before boarding the ferry and their schedule is posted nearby as well. The ferry is covered in case of rain as we experienced on our ride, or there is an open observation deck above. This is a fun and easy method of transportation and a great way to capture photos of the city skyline.

Star Ferry Pier - A must. We always take visitors on the star ferry and to the laser light show. The star ferry is iconic Hong Kong. A ride to and from Central is a must for those visiting HK. I prefer travelling on the upper deck but it doesn't really matter. It is a short trip across to the island and back ad time out just to enjoy the ride and view. The star ferry pier also has a laser light show at 8pm every evening . Go to the top of the viewing platform in front of the clock tower to get the best view and hear the music that accompanies the show.
A must do. If you don't go on the Star ferry you've not done Hong Kong. Try and do it at night and get the light show in. It's spectacular.

There and back and back again. Without a doubt one of the best things about Hong Kong has to be the Star Ferry! Every time I go to HK I head straight for the ferry and go back and forth a good few times.It's the best, the cheapest and the most authentic way of finding the pulse of this vibrant city.A tip is to go about 2000, as this coincides with HK's brilliant harbour light show.... And you get to watch it from the water - fabulous!
Value for money. A fantastic way to cross Victoria harbour, at a cost of 2HKD. It's got to be done, try using them in the evening, for a great view of the HK skyline.
Awesome. I love being on the water, regardless, but being able to take in view of Hong Kong at the same time for such a low price? AMAZING! I highly recommend!
One of the best attractions in Hong Kong. ...and not at all expensive. Yes, the MTR is faster, but there is just something nostalgic about the ferry. Romantic short journey also.

Cheapest way to see Hong Kong's skyline. The trip will cost you a few bucks and you'll get some of the best views of the skyline on both sides (Hong Kong and Kowloon). There is an air conditioned section but stay away for the true HK experience; plus you can't really see the skyline or take pictures from in there. Go at night on a clear day or during the day - both offer the best way to travel from Central to TST. Tip: the backs of the benches flip over so you can face forward in either direction.
Bliss on the harbour. Great way to fill 60 minutes talking in the skyline in the sun. Free drink and snack with your ticket.

Bustling place. The star ferry pier is very popular with locals and tourists alike as the view day and night of Hong Kong Island can be spectacular.... there are buskers and tour reps but also there are plenty of buses and taxis to take you to other parts of Kowloon. The ferry is the main attraction to go across to the island as it's cheap and quick.

Awesome Views of Hong Kong. This is a must for any traveller to Hong Kong. Take the 9 minute ferry ride and you'll love the skyline views. Take the trip during the day and also again at night because the views are totally different. And it costs under 3 hks!!

Short but exciting.. You will not find many attractions as cheap as this one, 2 hk dollars per adult well worth the 5 minute ride across the harbour from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon, star ferry pier 7. So much to do and see once over there, walk along the promenade, see the boats going by then jump on the ferry for the ride back when you have had enough. It gets you out on the water for just short ride for those who perhaps do not have the sea legs for a longer trip across the water. It is exciting, the water fairly choppy and the water is quit high up to the boat side, The ferries run every few minutes, you will pass the other one coming back as you cross. Don't go through the big new shopping centre as we found the signage misleading, walk down to the water front off Connaught Road by the end of Des Voeux Road West, then walk round the waterfront to the piers, Star Ferry is almost the last one you come to. Follow the joggers, there are always plenty of them running along the waterfront.
Nice and cheap. Nice views, cool old-school boats, easy, almost free and definitely the best way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong island.

If you've not been on The Star Ferry you've not experienced Hong Kong!. The Star Ferry is such a historic and iconic part of Hong Kong life, (since it started running a service across Victoria Harbour in 1880), it is an absolute MUST for any visitor to this magnificent city.At just HK$2.50 to cross (about GB£0.20) it is ultra cheap and probably the best short ferry crossing in the World... The whole experience is great, from the bustle of boarding up a ramp as the ferry bobs about in the harbour swell, to switching the back of the seat depending on which way you are going and want to face (the whole back swings through 90 degrees), to looking at the amazing views of both the Kowloon side and the Hong Kong island, and the other vessels ploughing up and down the harbour, (junks, sampans, other ferries, fireboats, barges, luxury cruise ships... I've seen them all), to watching the crew in their blue and white Ferryman uniforms tying up the ferry for disembarkation it is simply fantastic... Go experience it either at the Wan Chai or Central Ferry Piers on Hong Kong Island or at 'The Star Ferry Pier' on Kowloon side in Tsim Sha Tsui (TST) by the Old Canton Railway Clock Tower.
Most Spectacular views of Hong Kong can be seen!. You can see the most spectacular views of Hong Kong by travelling a 1 hour ride on this Star Ferry! 160$ trip is worth spend for night views!

An absolute bargain. Taking the Star Ferry across from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island makes you feel like you are a local as it is so reasonably priced and so obviously has commuters using it for work. It is a very quick trip across but had amazing views of both shores and offers a little breeze in the incredible August heat.

Top experience in HK. The boats are a wonderful way to see the skyline of the city. We took one towards Hong Kong island. They are cheap at 2.5 HKD. On the Hong Kong side you connect to all the nice streets and attractions through a very long raised walkway.

Take a trip across the water.. Every visitor to Hong Kong should take the Star Ferry which plies the harbour between the island and Kowloon. It;s cheap,quick and easy to catch. Star ferry also offer longer harbour cruises which are great value for money, Tickets for all these can be bought at the office at the front of the Star Ferry Pier.

NICE. I was visiting Hongkong only for 4days 3 nights(a very short trip), but this is a MUST DO on your list. I took a Star Ferry Harbor Tour at about 1755, which was perfect for me, I still got to see the sunset toward the end of the harbor tour. Great way to see both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon side at the same time. Very picturesque.
Great night views. Went over to Kowloon on star ferry at night, got some great pictures of the skyline all lit up. This is a must if you go to Hong Kong

Must do in Hong Kong. Cheap, regular ferry service across the harbour. A good tourist attraction as well as a cheap and easy way to travel around Hong Kong. Good to take the ferry in the day and at night to see the lights!
got to ride the ferry. its not a trip til you take the ferry. Its a short cheap trip from HK island to kowloon but its an experience you have to have to complete your visit.

Cheap and fun. It's over in a few minutes, but the view is great, you can see all around the harbour and the skylines of Kowloon and Hong Kong island. I like to go as the sun is setting.This is something of an initiation to Hong Kong, and shouldn't be missed, just as getting the tram is a great and cheap way to orient yourself and get a feel for the city.Having an Octopus travel card helps (if you're visiting HK, get one as soon as you arrive and top it up). If you're travelling from the island to Kowloon, be ready to be accosted a bit on the other side by hawkers - you can get past them pretty fast though and on your way.There's another star ferry route from Wan Chai, and you can also get ferry rides across the harbour from North Point to Hung Hom and from Sai Wan Ho to Sam Ka Tsuen. http://www.hongkongextras.com/_other_ferries.html

A must for all HK visitors. Even if you don't need to use the Star Ferry to go from HK to Kowloon! I think they said something like 60,000 people crossings per day ... Ok, you can also use MTR or the tunnels. But this is much nicer!

Third time in Hong Kong and always enjoy!. Do not hesitate to spend 15 minutes on the transfer by ferry from Kowloon to Central at night. Magnificent 3d view of the illuminated city.Very affordable, for about €0.50Each time in Hong Kong I enjoy it, this time with the whole family and even my eldest son (18 years old) loved it!Just coming back from a shopping expedition in the nearby pier shopping center, we went back to Central HK using this amusing out of time ferry. I first tried it in 1988 and I believe that not a bolt has changed since.Missing it would be like visiting London without once taking the "tube".Next time for sure we will try the harbor tour!I suggest once arrived in Central to walk to the escalator that leads to Soho where plenty of touristic restaurants are located, also an interesting experience, free of charge.

Not sure about the fuss. Several people have told us that if we get to Hong Kong we "must" take the Star Ferry. I get it as a means of transport between Hong Kong and Kowloon, but other than that, it was just o.k. The staff at the pier were rude/unhelpful--especially to tourists. We weren't sure about how/where to get a ticket, and the signage is pretty poor. We finally managed to get tickets and then asked a staff member about the best time to catch the ferry to see the light show at night. He was clearly displeased with this question, and started berating me --telling me "You no wait--this is not tourist attraction--you go now. We don't want people hanging around here." Not even tourists, I guess. The boat ride itself was unremarkable. There are two decks: get a seat on the upper deck for a better view, but the way the windows are configured if you are not sitting directly next to one, it will be difficult to see much. The frames of the windows/walls pretty much obstruct much of any view unless you've got your head right in one. The ride from the Exhibition Center/Convention Center to Kowloon takes about 10 minutes or so. It's a straightforward ride across the harbor. Cost was 250 HKD per person, one way. As a quick, efficient way to get to the other side of the Harbour, I think it's great; other than that, I'm not sure why people recommend "ride the ferry" as a top attraction.

Best ferry service ever!. You probably won't find a better experience for less Money than going for a star Ferry tour. Crossing the harbour from TST to HKI take approx 15mins, the Ferry leaves every 10mins and it costs approx 0,50€ (50 euro Cents) to go back&forth. Make sure you dont miss this very nice opportunity to get amazing views on both kowloon and hong kong Island.
My Seventh Wonder!. If you have not traveled from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island on the Star Ferry then you have missed one of the worlds man made wonders!

Fantastic - again!. We used the star ferry between HK island and Kowloon a number of times. Its cheap, authentic and the views are great. Its best to use an octopus card and you just scan and go! The boats also slow down mid-harbour, so you can get a look. Sit upstairs for the best views. We also did the harbour cruise. They are every hour and stop at HK island and Kowloon too. I cant remember how much it was but not expensive and it includes a drink. there is a recorded description and you can sit inside or outside. A good way to spend 45/55 minutes.

Great view from the ferry. With only HKD2, I used this transportation to go Hongkong island from Kowloon island. Reach here at 9 pm and the ferry still operating, but less passenger inside. The view from ferry is beautiful, its come from the light of Hongkong skyscrapers. This is a must to do activity when you visit Hongkong.

Cheap, frequent and excellent views of the city. . I used this mode of transport on the weekend and weekday. The prices are different. Adult on the weekend $3.40 and during the week $2.50. You have the option of using the Octopus Card or use the machines which will give you a tokin. This was from the Central pier which has an under cover walk way from IFC. There are MTR stops on either side so convenient to get you where you need to go. One of my favorite things to do in Hong Kong.
highly recommend it!. The ferry ride is super cheap and super easy to navigate. It was a nice way to get to the island. My grandparents really enjoyed it, too.
Must do!. We took a star ferry ride from Kowloon to HK Central. A nice 10 minute trip with great views across the harbour. Inexpensive and a great way to get across to HK island

Can it get any easier?. Wow....what a way to really get a taste of the harbour and city from the water. Very affordable, runs on a regular bases right into the night which is a plus for those night shots of the city. Timing it, it takes about 10-15mins to cross over to Hong Kong Island which is ample for the camera. Easy to get the pier from Tsim Sha Tsui station.

Pleasant travel. At first, I was skeptical about this. A 10" ride on an old ferry? There was a lot of buzz….But after our first ride, I was hooked. So quaint, nostalgic of a bygone time, as well as a much-needed break from the summer heat. The views are engaging, with so many interesting ships on the water as well as the skyscrapers. The embarkation process was a snap--as most of HK transit seemed to be--walk on, walk off. No long queues, never had to wait more than a few minutes, and no snarky attendants. Beautiful! Loved the sailors in uniform who worked the pier and ferry! Oh, be sure to flip the seat back bar if you wish to face the other direction :0)

Great ride across Harbor. Taking the Star Ferry across Hong Kong harbor is a great alternative to the subway system. You get great views of the harbor and it's very efficient to get across. If I brought my family to Hong Kong this is certainly something I would make sure and do with my children!
A must absolutely. Hong Kong to Kowloon Kowloon to Hong KongInexpensive and very pleasant means to commute between the Island and the Mainland via the harbour

The easiest way to cross the bay. The ferry is quick, very cheap and the easiest way to cross the bay. Tickets are purchased from a vending machine (it does give change) and non rush hour crossing fee was less than 1 US Dollar and rush hour was 25 US Cents. The ferry runs every few minutes so even in rush hour there is not a long wait.

Good and short sea ride... We travelled in Star ferry on our way back to Central from Tsim Sha Tsui.. The ride was so pleasant and the buildings' view from the ferry added more beauty to the journey.. A ride that is definitely needed for leisure.. :-)

A must do to go back in time and enjoy the view. A must do to go back in time on board and enjoy the view on the Hong Kong skyline... There are 2 levels: above which is a bit more expensive and below. You need to choose before you board the boat. Best way to get from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui.

Historical transport, great fun. We went on this on 29th May 2014 and as such it was free as it was travel free day, so I can't comment on token system. However we loved our trips from Hong Kong Island during daylight and back from Kowloon at dusk showing the harbour in all it's splendour at both times of the day. The ships are a unique way of seeing the vistas, similar to the Sydney-Manly ferry in Audtralia. I loved watching the skills of the on board crew and dock workers with the hooks to help tie up the ships, clearly a simple system that has worked for years.A must do!
Good Ferry. We took Starferry from Kowloon to HK Central. Use octopus card. Only 2.5hkd. 10min ride. Good harbour view. Smooth ride. The cheapest transport from Kowloon to HK Central.

Charming attraction. The Star Ferry has been around over 100 years, and it's something every visitor to Hong Kong should experience more than once. It was hot and muggy when I was there, and I greatly appreciated that every ferry I took had a section that was air conditioned. The standard ferry ride is only 5 - 10 minutes; I also took the 1-hour Star Ferry tour, and it's a relaxing way to get a great view of the area from the water.

Star Ferry. We took the ferry ride from Tsim Cha Tsui to Hong Kong and absolutely loved it. The ferry is huge and ancient and takes you across the harbour in a few minutes. Do this for the vintage value if nothing else.
Never cease to amaze. Views of HK don't get any better than this. Plus, it's a bargain. It is included in the Octopus card, but also easy for a one way ticket.

Take the night tour!. We did the 1855 night tour. In my opinion it is probably the best time to go. From the pier near the Avenue of the Stars you will see both the sunset during the tour start and by its conclusion the Hong Kong skyline will be in it's full nighttime effect. It's the best time for photographers. We went on a Friday and our tour was nearly empty. The symphony of lights (the laser show over the water) after us was packed and honestly didn't look nearly as good.

The Pier itself, not so great but do cross once with the Star Ferry. The Star Ferry is not what it used to be before 3 or 4 underground tunnels and all the subway lines. Still crossing the Hong Kong harbor 1st class on Star Ferry is still a nice way to cross and a great way to see the Hong Kong skyline.

Do not miss it. Do not miss to take the traditional ferries to cross the harbour. Buy your token at the price of 2HKD, abt 0.20€, take your place at the upper deck and feel the breeze!. The best way to tavel from Hong Kong to Kowloon and vice versa. The trip is very short, abt 10mins, and I am sure that you will stay on the ship for a trip more!

Still the People's Transport. There is little of the old Hong Kong left in the metropolis, and the Star Ferry is one of the few things left from "the good times". You can take the antiquated boat from Hong Kong to Kowloon or vice versa and from there get quite a good view of both sides of Hong Kong (it's not great for pictures though).The amazing thing is that besides being an interesting attraction, it's still a popular choice for travel across the channel. The cost is something like 1.5 HKD, much cheaper than any other mode of transport for the same trip, and the trip itself is shorter than a bus trip (comparable to the metro, depending on where you're going). Even after all these years, this remains the people's transport.

Super. Take the star ferry for next to nothing across the harbour. Costs something like 50p for a ten minute ride to the south part of the island. Catch the views, gaze at the ocean. Brilliant way to travel. Less crowded, very frequent.

Last of the character in Hong Kong.. Unfortunately HK has grown and developed so much the small areas of character are quickly disappearing. Star Ferry will hopefully outlast the developer's continual push. Great cheap harbour crossing offering views of the Harbour, Peak and Kowloon.
Good Views. Very cheap to go on the ferry and a great way to see the city from the water. Doesn't take very long to go to or from Hong Kong Island.

Star Ferry fun travelling. Great value trip across from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and back again, turnaround was really efficient even during rush hour. The best way to catch the view of both sides and good fun too!

must take the ferry - always. Since my first trip to HK 15 years ago, I always enjoy to take the ferry to Central or Wanchai.
The trip is so good and relaxing and I enjoy so much to relax those 10 minutes and watch all the people there

Cheap thrills. Hey the ferry is just a middle-aged working boat but what a way to see to see the harbour. There's nothing so great as messing about in boats. Peer down at the oily hot throbbing motor. Check out the blue sailor suits on the wharf workers. Pick out the skyline. See if the harbour is clean or dirty. See if you can get a smile from the captain.All for $2-3 HK dollars.Cheap thrills indeed

Star Ferry Pier. We like the ferry ride and the pier itself has some upgraded work done. The ferries are all old but clean and well kept. Like the Ding Ding, it gives you the nostalgic feeling of Hong Kong. The ride has its charm, is worth a ride.

Steves trip. Take the Star Ferry over to the Island,only $2 each way makes this a must, even if it was $20! Plus on one of my trips the boat did an 180 degree turn! Don`t ask me why, but it added to the fun! An absolute must. As for the pier there is not really that much there as it is mainly a transit point.
Not bad. Good going just used to cross the river between 2 island. nothing interesting in it just a transporter.

The Star Ferry must be done!. It's one of the things you absolutely should do in HD and costs pennies. Great view of the harbour worth doing in day light and at night, you'll get some good photos either way. Not much else to say except you won't have to wait long for a ferry and the journey across the harbour is only 10mins but it's a must do.

A great view of the city, with a great for money. The Star Ferry is a great way to cross the Harbour to or from Kowloon, much better than using the subway if you have some time and want to see the views. The trip takes about 20m, and it's a wonderfull experience, not to be missed if you're in Hong Kong. The cost of a ticket is a bargain, one of the cheapest things in Hong Kong. Highly recommended.
Amazing view. A fantastic view for Hongkong skylines, also amazing to take the Ferry tour, it will help you explore hongong

Nice Escape. Star Ferry is a nice escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. It beats taking a taxi in rush hour. I'd rather look at the skyline from the water than be stuck on the road. Its quick and not too crowded as you might expect. Bonus it's inexpensive!

The route to everywhere. We stayed at the Holiday Inn near the pier and used it frequently. It's very easy to use and provides a frequent means of getting across the harbor with great views. We also took the harbor cruise tour run by the same company and found that equally pleasing.

Interesting. This is so interesting great to spend some time soaking up the atmosphere watching the ferries and the hustle and bustle of the harbour as well as people watching all for free well worth a visit

Enjoyable way to see the Harbour. This is a very cheap way to view the Harbour and skyline of Hong Kong. The journey takes about about 15 minutes and is a welcome relief for tired legs and also relief from the humid air. You can use your Octopus card for quick and easy entry.

Absolutely love the ferry.. Love the ferry crossing, so quick and inexpensive especially when you consider the time taken not to mention the expense of going by taxi. Well worth the extra few pence to go over on the upper level and there is even a small section with air conditioning. Great views of the harbor whilst crossing too.

The views are amazing. Its a normal ferry pier on the inside but what it lacks in beauty it makes up with the views of hongkong island that it offers.There are some small souvenir shops selling tourist stuff as well. Go there for the views.

Star Ferry. It is the best way to go from one side of the harbour to the other and minimal cost. Considering how long the ferries have been in service it is amazing that "things never change". I have used the ferry since I was VERY young & a resident of HK and the views never fail to amaze me - a new cruise liner at Ocean Terminal, the tugs bringing goodies to the upper harbour, tourists on a junk ride and in the evening the light show. You really don't get the feel of Hong Kong if you don't even have one ride on the ferry. Often tourists don't even realise it goes to & from Wanchai as well, and that there are 2 classes of fares.
Nice views and very cheap. This was a nice experience and I took some great photos as we were departing to return to HK Central. It was unbelievably cheap.

Not really an Attraction.. Have used the ferry system in Hong Kong on many occasions. Works well, but you have to consider the peak times. Even in the off-peak times, the ferries are pretty crowded. Routes are well laid out and specific. The staff are always helpful (but that will probably change when they start using Mainland Chinese), and there is change available at the turnstiles.Have an Octopus card is the best way. If you are staying for a week or so. You can use them in convenience stores.

Attractions. A way or travelling between Kowloon & Hong Kong Island as well as other tours or places.The ferry is so cheap to ride on when you convert back to Aussie dollar a must do as it is fun & on a warm day the view on the harbour is great

You will love the trip. We travelled daily across during our trip to HK for the trade fair.Loved it and enjoyed being on the ferry even though the trip across was not too long.Will do it again and again like we have done on previous trips to the island.

Hong kong night view above the water. Taking the ferry to cross the sea from central to kowloon had been an amazing experience especially at night . Along the way, you get to see the brightly lit skycrappers and building and also the light show across the harbour. Definitely a must do while in Hong Kong.

awesome way to travel. Star Ferry is a great way to get across the harbour and beat the traffic and expensive taxi fares.I use star ferry all the time, its so convenient and the ferrys depart regularly (i think every 15 minutes) never seem to wait long at all, The trip across the harbour is so pleasant and you get a great vantage point of HK from all angles.If you get the chance for sure use star ferry its cost now is about 2.5HKD so its economical and good to see a government has kept on these types of services for the community and visitors to HK.If you dont have a local octopus card then make sure you have the change or small money as the token issuing machine will only give you change back
favorite place in HK. I love to board Star ferry. It is cheap and convenient transportation to go to HK Ireland or Tsimshatsui. If you didn't try yet, you must do so.

A Freebie on the Ferry. It's been a while since I took the Star Ferry. On my last trip to Hongkong last May, I had a free day and decided to take the ferry from Kowloon to Central. Imagine my surprise when I found out that it was free that day. In fact, even tram lines were free that day. It was a pleasant ride across the Harbor, not too crowded though it seems with all the reclamations being done, the gap between Kowloon and Hongkong sides seem to be getting shorter. The new Central terminal is very impressive though you would tend to get lost there which was what happened to me.
Go at night. It is a very very short trip only last less than 10 mins, but go at night will have a good chance have nice picture of the HK skylight

HK Icon. The cheapest, most iconic thing to do in Hong Kong is to take the Star Ferry. Sure, modernisation has made its mark. The sailors (right word?) are no longer old men with leathery faces and white gloves pulling up the gangplank; the turnstiles look updated. But this is the transportation equivalent of a 1-star Michelin meal. I still never tire of it after all these years.

A bit of history.. We always stay in Wan Chai when we visit Hong Kong. The Star ferry is a cheap and fun way to visit other islands. The view at night is great as it travels at such a slow pace. Highly recommended.
Low end price High end views!. You can not get a better or cheaper perspective of the Hong Kong skyline than you will from the Star Ferry services. A great and convienent way to get around as well

Iconic Landmark. The Star Ferry is a popular meeting point and the gateway from Kowloon Peninsula to Hong Kong Island. Whilst the Pier proper is badly in need of a cut and polish, the ferries themselves are in good shape and reminding people of bygone eras. From Kowloon there are 2 landing point options on the Island and the journey with return is spectacular both during the day and after sun down. There is also a Harbour cruise available at selected times. The entire Pier area is filled with atmosphere and activity irrespective of which direction you head. For newcomers I always suggest a trip to the Island followed by the Peak Tram and taking in the views from Victoria Peak and a visit to Bubba Gumps for a meal.

A Must do. if spending time in Hong Kong a trip on the Star ferry id well worth it , for a few coins , ( we bought a credit Card , ) when we arrived , I purchased two 50-00HK Dollar Cards , still had money on them when we left after using it all the time , the trip over to the Island is a part of local custom , mix in with the Hustle and go with the flow , you see so much from the Water that you never see from the land . Kids would love this trip ,

Great Views@ a great price.. Most people visiting Hong Kong will take this ferry across Victoria Harbour as it is an icon. We really liked the old pier & the leisurely cruise across the water from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. The views from the boat are very impressive day or night as the skyline unfolds before you. Loved it!

HUB OF ACTIVITY. Gr8 place to feel the pulse of HKG. Take an old but well preserved ferry across the bay for a small fare, get delicious pastries, walk to the museum or mall. Thousands of people coming and going by the minute. A bit "grungy" because it's well used but a must see. HINT: Bathroom is surprisingly clean and accessible!

night time cruise. IFf You Have Time Tke Night TIME River Cruise See Skyscraper OF Hongkong And
With Live Music And Dining Or GO Amusement Park In Day Time Swings Are So Amazing You Will Feel Like Falling In The Ocean That Is All
Take this to get from Kowloon to the Victoria Peak station. Very inexpensive, runs all the time, used by locals and tourists alike. Nice boat ride across the harbor.

excellent and cheap!. This is a great experience in Hong Kong. It is easy to catch from the end of Salisbury Road on the Kowloon Side to Hong Kong Island (or vice versa). You can buy the ticket from the pier (no reservations and cheap) and simply hop on and go.The views are fantastic of the island and Kowloon and you can also catch the Symphony of Lights Harbour cruise to see the show at about 19:55. This is a simple thing to do, and well worth the effort.

Great views for the price. Only gave 4 stars as it is a pretty quick trip across the harbor and it was not the easiest place to get to from my hotel at Pacific Place. Would be better to do an actual tour versus just a ferry crossing.

Great views at low prices. Yes in the end it's a ferry going across the sea but you feel it's far more than that.The fact that it's been running for much longer than most people can remember, the fact that it only costs 27 pence (UK) per journey on the more expensive upper deck and the fact that you get great views of both the Island and Kowloon makes it far more than just a ferry ride.Get aboard and take your camera with you.

Best Way to See Hong Kong. My Mom loves the Star Ferry. It is one of the best ways to see Hong Kong's harbor and skyline.We must have taken it over 10 times in 3 days. We stayed in both Victoria and Kowloon. Each side has its own personality.

Best views of HK. Got to be done whilst in Hongkong. We sailed back and too at every opportunity day and night. Very regular service from Kowloon to both Wan Chai and Central, easy to use, super cheap as well. We loved it, was every thing we expected it to be!!

Much better than MTR. We took the MTR from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. Having to change trains twice was cumbersome. Plus, there was nothing to observe except other passengers on board. People-watching can be boring. After watching the Symphony of Lights, we took the Star Ferry, which was just a few minutes' walk away, back to HK Island. It is both a cheaper and more scenic option. The journey seemed faster and more peaceful too. Words of caution though. Wait a while for the crowd to disperse, after the Symphony of Lights ends. About 30 minutes later, there were only a handful of passengers left. No hassle. From Wan Chai Ferry Pier, the walk on the long bridge to Wan Chai MTR is quite a distance.Otherwise, the ferry is indeed a scenic form of transport.

loved it - no other way to see Hong Kong. Yes, very inexpensive, and user-friendly but highly recommended - just no other way to see Hong Kong. I loved it so much I took about 6 rides in 2 days - just for the fun of it. Lots of options and I will look into more choices next time, but for my first experience, gosh this was easy and absolutely enjoyable. Highly recommended - a MUST do.

Great experience. A ride with Star Ferry was a point to which I was really looking forward. The journey has surpassed my expectations. Amazing view of Hong Kong skyline, Victoria Peak,...inexpensive - 5HKD per ride. More lines are running, be aware to which Kowloon you are traveling from North Point - because you could end in Kung Tong Ferry Pier instead of Kowloon City Ferry Pier.

Star ferry pier light show. We took the Starr ferry to watch the light show. The ferry is clean efficient and cheap. The light show was free and a very enjoyable experience, sitting with lots of other tourists in the warm evening.
Take the Star Ferry. If in Hong Kong you just have to have a trip on the Star Ferry. All for a crazy low price as well and great views of the harbour. An experience you just have to take.
It was a ferry ride- that's it.. We did not tour the pier. We only rode the ferry return from Wan Chai. It was a ferry.I really don't understand the excitement.

MUST do in HK. Great way to travel from Kowloon to HK - less than USD1 per ride and free for Senior citizen(with valid ID)plan your trip in such that you cross to HK Island with Star Ferry and continue your journey in HK Island on the legendary ding ding tram.

BEst value for Tourist. A trip across in Star ferry cost HK $2.5... WOW!!Great views of HK and Kowloon side and harbour either Day or Night (Night views are better). We took ferry from TST, Central as well as Wan Chai side.A must when you visit HK. Best value for money. Avoid those expensive harbour cruises, take multiple rides in Star Ferry.One thing, go for Upper Deck, highly recommended.

Great view of the harbour. Took the ferry from Mui Wo on the way back from NP360. We took the one to the Central Pier 6, and this one was the Fast ferry, which took approx 25-30 mins. Decent ride, we sat on the upper deck, all air-conditioned. I wanted to do the slow ferry to get a good view of the harbour but could not, maybe next time.

Cheap and fast too get across from Hong Kong island. These ferry boats are said too be original and have been in service for over a hundred years, it's cheap, cheerful and fast. This is a definite for leaving your manners behind because once you go through the pay barrier it's every man/woman for themselves. But as I've said on other reviews of the city it's a must do when in HK

A Must Experience. The best and cheapest way to experience the Victoria Harbor with its sweeping views. You will find two types of fellow passengers - 1. who will be busy feverishly clicking and snapping (you can take some great photos while onboard the short ride) and the 2. those sitting nonchalantly are the ones for whom its a daily mode of transportation.

Top HK Must-do. With a 12 double-deck ferry fleet, Star Ferry Hong Kong operates the passenger ferry service between Central Piers on Hong Kong Island and Kowloon Point at Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon. It not only provides a means of transport for the locals wishing to commute between these two places daily on a low fare but has in fact become a very popular must-do attraction for tourists to Hong Kong these days.For just a nominal fare you get to experience the ferry trip of a lifetime with a magnificent view of the beautiful skyline consisting of overcrowded rows of high-rise buildings and skyscrapers lining the entire waterfronts of Victoria Harbour on the Hong Kong Island side as well as the Kowloon side. It was truly an enjoyable ride with the sound of the waves and the wind brushing against your face. Unfortunately the ferry ride across the harbour takes only about ten minutes or so only….a bit too short I guess, but then considering the low fare, you may go on and have as many rides as possible until you are satisfied. Alternatively, there is a Star Ferry harbour cruise which takes you on a much longer circle around the whole harbour at a much higher fare. All you need to do is enquire for further information at the counter.There are many tourists who do the crossing every time they visit Hong Kong. It was the shortest, most enjoyable and unforgettable ferry ride.

A HK visit must-do!. Having been to HK many times in recent years, the Star Ferry experience between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon is one of those must-dos that we repeatedly find ourselves a part of every single trip to HK.The 10 minute journey is nothing extraordinary or WOW but the unbeatable views, the old-school ferry, the staff in their blue sailor uniforms and the sea breeze during the short hop across Victoria Harbour make this one of those old-to-new world experiences that you can never get enough of - imagine old-school ferry, refurbished junks on Victoria Harbour, Victoria's peak in the background amidst a sea of never-ending skyscrapers on both sides of the harbour (HK preferred).Would certainly recommend this as a must-do for its price and novelty.

Most Panoramic Bargain in Hong Kong. I've been a Star Ferry fan since my first trip to Hong Kong in 1977. Every time I visit, I ride it as often as I can. The ever-changing panorama of the HK and Kowloon skylines coupled with the non-stop shipping activity in Victoria Harbour always make for an enthralling crossing. And at HK$ 4.50 (60 cents US) for a return ticket, it's definitely one of the greatest bargains in Hong Kong.

KOWLOON CROSSING BALMY HONGKONG EVENING. On business and conference for 5 nights, we all decided the three us to take the Star Ferry over to Kowloon, it was the first time for one us, which impress Nick with the fantastic skyline of lit skyscrapers and newer impressive Carlton Ritz Hotel. We wonder through the area tsim sha shui, if your are shopaholic for designers clothes boutiques galore and a big fat wallet to purchase those goods. Anyway the best part is crossing with those rickety ferries dating back from the 30'S the experience is unique and not to be miss HK $6 is very cheap enjoy the trip.

Cheapest way to experience the stunning view. For people who are first time to Hong Kong, I would strongly recommend them to take the Ferry in Hong Kong, as the stunning view is one of the best attraction in Hong Kong, and each ride cost you less than HK$3, even the locals love it as it only take 10 mins to go across the harbour, even quicker than taking taxi. I would suggest people to take the Ferry at night for a better view of the Harbour. you could even enjoy the great Hong Kong view from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central. A must try experience in Hong Kong.
Great fun, great price!. You can just climb on, pay about $2.5 HK, and cross the water, see the sights, and enjoy the breeze. It's a beautiful view, and completely enjoyable. A simple pleasure.

Great Views. At first we were going to pass on this excursion but we are glad we decided to ride the ferry! It has a nostalgic feel and lovely views too. The ferry was not crowded and we took some amazing photos as we crossed over to Central. It was very inexpensive too. Yes, it is worth it.

Great inexpensive Hong Kong Experience. A ride on the Star Ferry that travels between Kowloon Point and Hong Kong Central is a must for first time (or returning travellers ) to Hong Kong. The price $2HK hasn't changed in all of the years I have been coming to Hong Kong and that represents incredible value for such an 'authentic' local experience. The ferry is used by all sections of Hong Kong society and it is the most common means of moving from Kowloon to the Mainland. The tube is probably more efficient but travelling on, rather than under the harbour, is so much more interesting. The harbour is one of the busiest in the world and the view is always fascinating. The trip never ceases to be enjoyable and interesting to me.
Fantastic. A must for anyone travelling to HK. Wonderful views of the Island and Kowloon. Highly recommended. Very cheap and quick getting over to the Island.

Must do just to feel the history..... The Star Ferry, my father traveled on it, and now i have. The ferry has been running for years and for a whole 2.5$HK on an Octopus card it's really worth a trip. The ferry ride lasts about 10 mins taking you from Central Pier 7 to Kowloon district. The ferries are very frequent and the service is good.In conclusion....The Star Ferry is a must do when in Hong Kong

Cheap transport and very nice view. The star ferry is a very cheap transport and it allow to have a very nice on hong kong harbour. The star ferries are also part of the Hong Kong history.The ferries are very frequent so you did'nt wait at all.
Cheap and cheerful. The crossing from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island takes just a few minutes and costs HK$5 (just pennies really). The ferries are very frequent and it's a handy way of getting about.

One of the best ferry rides in the world. Best ride time is sunset or dawn but anytime will do. Rush hours between 8:30am-9:30am and 5pm -6:30pm as many communitors go to work. There is air conditioning compartment on upper deck in summer. Upper deck is quiter as engine room is on lower deck. On a rough wave or strong windy rainy day, better avoid standing/sitting near either front side of lower deck as water can splash onto deck. The Tai Cheong Bakery in Kowloon Star Ferry Pier is famous for its egg tart (local Chinese version of England's Bakewell pudding).

Perfect place to rest on a week day. Great holiday atmosphere always. However, there are increasing numbers of tourist coaches with large groups of visitors from the Chinese mainland, which makes some parts hectic. Look out for those parts and avoid them. The part right next to the pier itself remains lovely for an ice cream and for clearing your head amidst the busyness of the city!
Cheap transport, and nice views. Just liek the title says, it's cheap, and offers views from the harbour, but that's about it. Nothing too exciting about being on a ferry...

Enjoyable ferry ride. This is a great way to cruise the Hong Kong Harbor. It was quick and quite reasonable. This has to be on the "To Do " list for anyone on a budget. My wife and I enjoyed it very much !

Differnt time and different place.... The ride takes you to a different era if you compare it with the modern HongKong. The view during the ride is awesome. This is an experience not to be missed when in HongKong. You don't need to visit it as an attraction, whenever you cross the harbor use it. It take very less time and its very cheap in price.

Enjoyable Ferry Ride. The initial primary purpose of my taking of the Star Ferry was actually to travel from Central back to Tsim Tsa Tsui where my accommodation was, but I got more than what I expected. The wait for the ferries are almost nonexistent given the high frequency and large capacities of the ferries. Boarding and alighting was swift, and there was plenty of space on the upper deck where I sat. The Octopus Card can also be used instead of paying cash. It only cost HKD2.50 as I took it on a weekday. On weekends it costs HKD3.40 for a similar one-way adult ticket. The views were magnificent and unique as you can't get such views from anywhere else. I took the ferry at night and the lights and colors of the HK skyline were beautiful. The ride was pretty short (about 20 min) given how efficient everything is, and it just made me wish it was longer.

Excellent - Top of the "To-Do" List. Not that it's high tech, far from it, it's very old-school, having not changed in years, but it takes you to another time and place. The ferry terminal and the ferries are from another era in time, and are up there with the ferries across the Mersey, and the Mississippi paddle-steamers - and if you are of this ilk, then you'll be impressed and excited. When the manila rope was measured in circumference and not in man-made diameters, old sailors & old school - whether a seasoned sailor or a sea-sick Sunday sailor, this will 'float-your-boat'. And, at HK$ 5.60 a journey - about 45 pence in english or about <70 cents american - you can yo-yo back 'n' forth, if your heart's desire.

Take the Star Ferry! Quick, efficient, cheap and fun!. Instead of taking the MTR we primarily took the Star Ferry to shuttle back and forth between the Central and Kowloon sides. Seats were always available. It's very cheap and takes only 10 min! The views from the ferry are nice and it's a true Hong Kong experience.
