Loading and unloading the ferry is incredibly fast and efficient compared to anything I've seen in the US. I loved riding the Star Ferry and recommend it as a fun way to get around Hong Kong.

Symphony of Lights is disappointing. We did the symphony of lights cruise and was sorely disappointed - it was just a bunch of buildings flashing lights seemingly not synchronized and random. Other tourists on our boat were similarly disappointed. Perhaps the day tour would be better worth your money.0/10 will not recommend.

Definitely worth your while if you're got time. While in Hong Kong, I stayed and did business on Hong Kong Island and wasn't sure if I would make it across Victoria Bay to Kowloon. But after my conference ended, I walked from the HKCEC over to the Star Ferry and took the ferry across to Kowloon. I give you some pretty awesome views of the skyline on both sides. Cheap too. Definitely worth the ride.

Cheap, efficient and scenic. At $2 it is ridiculously cheap, it is a lot quicker than you may think, never full so always spacious and the views are fantastic. Much more pleasant than being crammed on a tube
Good experience. I took a ferry ride on Star Ferry for return 1 hour trip. Liked and enjoed the experience.The views of Victoria Harbour and a comfortable ride on the ferry are recommended.

A must do in HK. The classic Star Ferry costs next to nothing, runs every ten minutes and is a wonderful ride across the harbour with commuters and locals for great views of the city. You get a feeling of having done something that millions of Hong Kongers have done for many decades in ferries that probably haven't changed that much in that time. One of my favourite things to do in Hong Kong.

Sailing the Star Ferry. One of the iconic things to do while in Hong Kong is to take a trip across Victoria Harbour from Kowloon to Central on the famous Star Ferry. The Star Ferry Company began sailing in 1888 as the ‘Kowloon Ferry Company’. Nowadays it is one of the prime tourist attractions in Hong Kong, with over 26m people sailing across the Harbour each year. I found the experience to be very good value for money, but I wouldn't do it again if there was another way to get to Central.On the Kowloon side of the Harbour, you can often spend ages admiring the best skyline in Asia and often wonder why there is ever a need to cross to the other side, when presumably the view back to Kowloon is not quite as impressive. Well, this assumption may be true in a way, but remember over at Central there is the roof of Hong Kong - Victoria Peak! From there, you can look down over all of Hong Kong and her islands, and believe me the view is amazing, especially at sunset. There are road and rail tunnels that pass under the Harbour to get from Kowloon to Central, but the most traditional method of making the journey is certainly by sailing on the Star Ferry!The cost of an adult one-way fare across the Harbour from Kowloon to Central will set you back around $HK5.20, though there are discounts for children, the elderly, and the disabled. This is without question the cheapest way to get across the Harbour and as such is a very popular method of transportation with the locals.When I boarded the Star Ferry at Tsim Sha Tsui Pier, I was surprised to see that it was virtually empty. Maybe I just got lucky on this day. Anyway, I enjoyed the short and smooth ride across the Harbour and took in the sights, sounds, and smells. I changed my seats a few times to get better views.When I had arrived at Central Pier, I made my way to Victoria Peak – but not before I did a little shopping…
Must do. This is must do in Hong Kong. We got the ferry across to causeway bay and it was cheap, easy and chance to see Hong Kong from the water.

Very efficient and easy to use. If you're visiting HK, Star Ferry is a must. It's cheap, quick and easy to use. The service is efficient and the facilities are good. It takes only 10 minutes to cross the water and the views (particularly at night) are sensational. Do not miss out!
star Ferry. The Star Ferry is Hong Kong, best transport to and from the island, cheap, runs frequently and the ride on the harbour is fantastic. Don't miss.

The ferry Ride. Quite a short ride- under ten minutes from start to finish but what really makes it worthwhile are the skyline views of all the buildings and offices especially as you get towards dusk.

Must do when in Hong Kong. There is not a lot more I can say that has not been said before. It's dirt cheap, it gives you an awesome view of the city, it's 120 years old, it's a lot of fun and it is just an awesome experience as a tourist. something I wish there was more of in Hong Kong. Do it, you won't be dissapointed!

Iconic Star Ferry Pier. No visit to Hong Kong can be considered complete without a Star ferry ride in the Victoria harbor. During our recent maiden trip to Hong Kong we enjoyed the scenic harbor & panoramic Hong Kong skyline view from the Star Ferry both during the day & night. We travelled a number of times from the Tsim Tsa Tsui Star Ferry Pier to Central Pier No. 7 at Hong Kong island enjoying the views from both the upper deck & lower deck of the Star Ferry. The historical Clock Tower and the Tsim Tsa Tsui promenade are located just next to the Star Ferry Pier.

Best bargain in a world city!. For something like 15 cents (US$) one can cross Victoria harbor on a short historic ride between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon on a funky old fashioned ferry and get a world class visual tour at the same time.Easy to get on and off and Hong Kong terminal right near all the good stuff and metro, etc.Day and night fun too.I think there is even a senior rate!What a deal!

Star Ferry. The ideal way to get across the harbour, offering fantastic views and less than HKD$5. The ferries depart every few minutes, so you won’t be waiting for very long. Once taking 40 minutes in the late 1800’s, this trip is now significantly shorter, around a few minutes long.The ferry service is steeped in history, even down to the crew using billhooks to moor the ferry on arrival.The harbour can get a little rough toward the middle, so best to be seated and secure your items.Went both ways across harbour…. TST to Central, then from Wan Chai to TST
Night Harbour Cruise. Excellent view. A must do if in Hong Kong in the evening. The ferry was well maintained and spacious. The sea can be a bit sickening experience if you are not use to it.

Cheap and good! Top up with night view perfect!. Star ferry ride across victoria harbous was probably the highlight of my trip. The ride cost only HDK$2.50. You get to enjoy the night breeze (I took upper dec) and night view. The ferry ride takes about 15mins from Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui.

Must do when in HK. It's cheap, only take 10-15 minutes, you get great views. What more else can you ask for?! I highly recommend this and a great way to rest your feet too. You can pay via octopus card.

Stellar star experience!. We took the star ferry over to Hong Kong Island from TST at night on the lower deck as this offered an amazing view of the skyline. The lower deck is more atmospheric as you can hear the swish of the sea and, if you stand close to the gunwales, feel the cooling balm of fine flecks of plume. This is one of THE things you must experience in Hong Kong.

Nice time killer. Great way to get out on the water for a bit and relax to take some pictures and have a glass of wine. The ride was about an hour and takes you all along the way. It was a really relaxing hour, away from the hustle of HK and there are awesome restaurants around as well.
Ferry ride at night has a nice view. At less than HKD 5 per person (upper deck) for a one way ride on the ferry is cheap. It has a very nice night view.
Nice view, great value!. A must for all visitors! Best way To get in contact with Victorias Harbour and see first hand all the Hong Kong and Kwoloon buildings....

Stunning. Star Ferry is relaxing area with stunning view of Hong Kong island.. Nearby museum, cafe, outdoor musical events (if you are lucky), hall of fame (Bruce Lee statue) are few attractions. Get there any time of day and easy to get there via ferry from Hong Kong island, bus, train (MTR) etc. Just beautiful skyscrapers.

Introduction to the busy waterway.. Go on a return trip on the ferry and sit on the upper deck just to get full experience of the sights. On the Hong Kong side, you can always drop over at IFC for shopping/food. Similarly for Tsim Sa Chui, Ocean Terminal has a lot of shopping/food options.

Star Ferry. An absolute must - its not nearly long enough but a fabulous little breather from the fast pace. Nice way to cool down and see both sides of the harbour. The cheapest sight seeing ride their is!

Star Ferry. An inexpensive and entertaining way to get between Hong Kong Island and Tsim Sha Tsui, As a visitor, you will enjoy the harbour views. If you start on the Tsim Sha Tsui side, you can connect it to your trip to The Peak as the buses are right there to take you to the tram when you disembark on the Hong Kong Island side. Love it! Great for anyone.
Best way to see Hong Kong. You get a feel for the bustle of the harbour and the sense of the energy of a cross road fir the world. This must be a priority when visiting Hong Kong.
Real HK. A short but sweet taste of real Hong Kong, just by taking a short ferry ride, a must do when in Hong Kong

Must do in Hong Kong. Taking the Star Ferry across the harbour is one of those a visitor should experience when visiting HK. The skylines on both sides (Kowloon and HK) are amazing any time of the day, but HK island is especially enchanting at night. The cost of the ferry crossing is very good value, the ride relaxing and the view unforgettable.

Cheapest way to travel between the islands. The cheapest way to travel between the two islands and also a good way to see the skyline up close if you travel from Kowloon to Honk Kong Island. The boats are big and spacious and you can easily carry you luggage with you on board.

Best cheap thrill in the world. The Star Ferry between Tsim Sha Tsui and Hong Kong Island is the simply a 'must do' if you're visiting Hong Kong. I've lived here for 30 years and I still get a thrill every time I cross the harbour on these lovely old boats with their magical names: 'Morning Star', 'Celestial Star', 'Shining Star'. Do the crossing twice, once during the day and once at night for the wonderful lights. You can afford it -- HK$2.50 for adults on the top deck (first class) and HK$2.00 on the lower deck (second class). If you are at all infirm or disabled, you might want to choose the lower deck, as there are no stairs from the pier to this deck. Oh, and if you're over 65, it's free. Just produce a proof of your age.
A must do. Take the Star Ferry from Kowloon side to Hong Kong Island at night and look at the best waterfront view in the world - and, yes, I've seen New York at night.

An iconic must do when in Hong Kong. Its a working ferry...lets get this straight out there. It's noisy, has all the associated harbour & boat smells, and can be a bit smokey if wind pushes the ferry exhaust downwards and through the open deck cabins. But it is a FANTASTIC way to view the harbour and is a ridiculously cheap way to travel between HK island and the greater Kowloon area...so much better than a modern efficient but otherwise sterile MTR. It's been plying the waters forever so you get to participate in a bit of history too. If you just want to get across, take the MTR, but if you'd rather spend a few mins longer with wind in your face and a picturesque view...take a trip on the Star Ferry :-)

A good rest point. The Star Ferry Pier offers a good rest point after shopping or sighseeing. It has several goods shops and restaurants. The best part is to simply enjoy the sea breeze and watch the ferry in and out of the pier.
few minutes to relax and take a rest. I am local.I always love to ride the ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Wan Chai or Central.It cost cheap and really relaxing!

Must go. Star Ferry used to be an important transportation for Hong Kong local people to across the Victoria harbor. By now the role has been transformed for visitors. Though less than 5 minutes' time, you can take a breath of the air when you go to the lower deck. I will recommend to take the ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island side. You can see the whole view from the Peak, the flats in Mid level, and also the business area, Central district. Bring along with your camera, it is one of the scenic view must take a shot in Hong Kong.

SHORT RIDE BUT WORTH IT.. The STAR Ferry is an icon of the HK Scene. Highly recommend to take a ride both ways to get the best of the HK and Kowloon skylines, especially at night. Unfortunately, due to several reclamations over the past decades, the width of the harbour between the two piers has been considerably shortened, hence the ride itself barely lasts 8 minutes. An excellent platform to view the HK skyline at night is from the roof car park of Ocean Terminal, 3 mins. walk from the Kowloon Ferry Pier. Several escalators can be taken to reach it. the STAR Ferry also offers a leisurely Harbour Tour during the day and night. The latter is recommended, as it traverses the Harbour from East to West and operates from both piers.

Dont miss it. after you spend a few hours on HK island or Tsim Sha Tsui, site seeing or shopping, it's good to take the ferry trip to relax. it doesnt take that long and it is not expensive. most of the time the ferry is not crowded and i rarely hear noises on the ferry. it's clean too. you may just close your eyes to feel the breeze, take photos, or just read.

An inexpensive way to explore Hong Kong Harbour. Star Ferry was the main cross harbor transportation between Hong Kong island and the Kowloon peninsula. It is cheap, comparing to the cross harbor bus or subway, and more direct. The relocation of the new pier on Hong Kong side already caused some inconvenience. However, if you have time, or as a tourist, it is still a good choice. In fact, you do not want the ship go to fast, so you can enjoy the beautiful harbor and the breeze of gentle wind. You can stay on the ship once reached the other side, to enjoy the round trip.

A valuable traditional HK old style ferry experience in the modern city. Really love to take the star ferry.Not only due to its historical value but its a romantic,fast and most comfy style to cross the harbor.Suggest to take it at the night time (I personally like to take it at the summer night time) where the breath taking Victoria harbour views with lots of HK signature buildings will give you a lovely remarks of this city!

Historic Star Ferry a Must for the Hong Kong tourist!. Google some Star Ferry history before you go. This sweet little ferry is a transportation powerhouse and friend to all Hong Kong commuters! The underground subway is more efficient in most cases but the views can't be beat! Enjoy the island side docks and visit the Maratime Museum too. On Kowloon side check out the Cultural Center. If your schedule allows be sure to get to the Kowloon side in the evening in time to get a spot on the viewing stand to see the phenomenal light show! Don't mix up the Wanchai ferry with the Central ferry. They both get you to the island side but their docks are. It near each other!

One of the best Hong Kong views, at a reasonable price!. If weather is good, go at sunset time the ferry ride can give you the best harbour view. Just a few dollars for a magic moment with sea breeze, suggest to sit in area with no air conditioning.

Got to do it...it's iconic! It's cheap and its a good way to see Victoria Harbour.. Don't expect any luxuries this is a working ferry. quick efficient and cheap and in peak hour...packed. Good view of the harbour and you are in a bit of HK history...enjoy.

Best water ferry in the world. This has to be the best, and easily the cheapest, water ferry crossing in the world.
Ferries leave every few minutes, very efficiently and effectively - and gives a wonderful view of the harbour, Kowloon and Hong Kong Island.

Ideal transportation. This is the main form of transportation to get from Kowloon and Victoria Island. These ferries run back and forth on a regular schedule and not much money. A lot of locals will also be using this transportation and although you should do it because it is convenient, you should also do it for the experience.

a fab and cheap way to se HK harbor. My top "must do" in HK is the Star Ferry. HK$2.50 for the ferry ride from Kowloon across Victoria Harbor to HK Island. Busy and efficient and full of history and atmosphere. Fab and cheap to do. You can also do it after sunset to get a different perspective of the city.

Cheap thrill!. An absolute must do in HK is to cross the Victoria Harbor on the Star Ferry. I took the ferry from the Kowloon side for HK$2 or maybe it was $2.50. It's short and sweet but let you take in the amazing skyline on both sides of the harbor. The old pier on the HK side had been replaced by the current pier which is just a short skip from the new Maritime Museum. When you get out of the ferry terminal, turn to your left for the museum and/or a nice walk by the water. The walk will take you all the way to the new HK government admin building and the green area around it. I was told that the walk will eventually link all the way to the HK Convention and Exhibition Center in Wanchai. You can either ride back to Kowloon on the ferry, or ride the subway at the Admiralty stop which is just beyond the big opening of the admin building.

Very short & scenic trip. We rode on the upper deck. You get a spectacular view of the harbour for just HKD2 from Central to Tsim Sha. Definitely a must -do when in HK!We enjoyed the very short & scenic trip.

A "Must" in Hong Kong. Taking the local ferry is usually the best and cheapest way to see most of the great harbour cities of the world but I don't think any are as big a bargain as the Star Ferry. It's a short ride but you have all of Hong Kong (and Kowloon) laid out in front of you. Yo can't visit Hong Kong and not do it!

Ride the Star Ferry if it's the only thing you do in Hong Kong. Having lived in Hong Kong since the 70's I recommend that you go on the Star Ferry. It's the cheapest tour in Hong Kong! It only takes a few minutes to cross between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island, however, it gives great views of both sides of the harbour with excellent photo opportunities. If you get the chance try to ride it during the day and at night as you get a totally different experience after dark.

How to use the ferry. Look everyone is right, this is a must on your stay in HK, but when I use the ferry the most frequent question from tourists is how to buy tickets?There are three ways:1) Buy a tokenThese rather innocuous vending machines are about 15 metre from the automated gate entrance. You can only buy single tickets. Push button for number of passengers eg 1 adult and the prices comes up (the fare is slightly more expensive at weekends and if you take the upper deck – for the better views) put coins or notes into the machine and your change along with a plastic token come out of the bottom. Go to the automatic barrier marked tokens only drop the token in and walk through – simple! It’s very cheap!2) Pay exact fareIf you have lots of change you can pay for the exact fare at the barrier marked Exact fare only – obviously. Remember its coins only, so have them ready before you get to the machine.3) Buy an Octopus CardThis is by far the best way all-round. HK has an excellent public transport system and an Octopus card allows you to travel on all of it. The MTR is effectively the Tube, or Subway its fast, frequent, clean and safe, although I have never travelled on it after midnight. Go to any service desk (manned counter) at any MTR station and ask for an octopus card. The minimum purchase is $HK 150 – about £12. This includes a $HK50 refundable deposit you can get back at the end of your trip – just take it to a service desk and they will give you your money back. Once you have your card just walk up to the barrier marked with the card symbol and hold the card to the marked spot and the barrier will open – even simpler!You can check the remaining value on your Octopus by going to a machine marked Add Value Machine at any MTR station. Put your card in and it tells you how much you have left if you need to top it up simply put more money in!Now back to the FerryOnce through the barrier go to the waiting area which has two closed gates for either side of the jetty. Once the ferry has docked and people have got off there will be a buzzer and the barrier for the side of the jetty for the next ferry will open, you can walk down and get on-board. The upper deck has the better views, while the lower deck gives you a better view of the docking etc – if you like that sort of thing. There are two seating areas; a glassed area at each end which provides some protection from the elements – it’s a short piece of water so unless in torrential rain I wouldn’t bother, and an open area in the middle which as the better views. If the bench seat isn’t facing the way you want, grab the top of the back and you can move it so you can sit whichever side you want – as long as no one is sitting there of course!Enjoy its great fun even after 100s of trips

Go for the ferry trip but remember to have good look around too. The Star Ferry Pier located in Tsim Sha Tsui on the Kowloon peninsular is not just where the famous Star Ferry can take you over to Hong Kong Island, there is also some shops that offer affordable souvenirs and is also the home of the Hong Kong Tourist Boards information centre. There are also some great spots to shoot some excellent photos from so you can remember and share you visit with friends and family on your return home. The Star Ferry is one of the most inexpensive modes of public transport on offer around Hong Kong and is well worth the around HK$2.50 for a one way trip on the upper deck. You will see views of both sides of Victoria Harbour that are not to be seen from anyother vantage spot. The journey on the lower deck is a little cheaper and also offers excellent views.

Great old-fashioned ride. Star Ferry is one of the many must-to-do-things in HK. Great and easy way to go from Kowloon to Island or opposite. Viewing is amazing especially at night when it's dark.It costs 2 HKD to get to downstairs to ferry and 2,5 HKD to upstairs. On sundays and public holidays it'll cost 2,8 HKD. The fastest way to get to ferry is to pay exact money. You can also buy token from machine and it'll give you back changes. Or if you have octopus card you can pay with it.

Possibly the finest ferry trip in the world. The trip from Wanchai to Tsim Sha Tsui and back is quite magical, especially after dark. The cheapest, most spectacular way to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong. At the equivalent of 20p in Sterling, it's 10 minutes of sheer delight. It's a pleasure just to stand at the terminal and look at the view across Victoria Harbour. A must on anyone's to-do list in Hong Kong.

Great way to get a different view of Hong Kong. The ferry ride across Victoria Harbour is JUST long enough to get to have a look around, take in the sites and to get off without getting sick! Super easy and convienent. I crossed via taxi several times before discovering how easy the ferry actually is. ( a bit chilly on the water at night so make sure you have a jacket)

A piece of history on Victoria Harbour. The Star Ferry is an old, historic boat that takes around 10 minutes to cross Victoria Harbour from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. The ride provides you with excellent views of Hong Kong for taking photos of the magnificent buildings along the way. It is very inexpensive costing less than $1.00USD. A nice way to cross the harbour!

A must do when visiting Hong Kong. If you walk along the pedestrian bridge fron Central station you will come to the Ferry Terminal. The fare during yhe week is 2.5 HKD which is aboot 20 pence to us Brits. The trip takes about 10 minutes, but is a great way to see Hong Kong and Kowloon. You can get some great pictures. We jumped on the ferry a few times. I cant say avoid the rush hour because it starts at 7.00am and finishes late at night. Great fun.

A Short Trip across the Harbour. Approx 5-10 minutes across from one side to the other, this short, cheap commuter boat ride on Star Ferries is a nice way instead of travelling by taxi or underground. Great 360 views of the city and always packed with locals and tourists. Boats leave very regularly.

The best and most cost effective way to tour Victoria Harbour. It has been in operation since the late 1800s and it is still the best way to cross Victoria harbor and enjoy a stunning view. For literally a few cents one has the best tour, especially in the evening when the lights are on and one can enjoy the stunning skyline of Hong Kong Island. The ferries are very frequent, you rarely need to wait longer than 10 minutes and the 10 minute crossing is relaxing and stunning. The ferry can be very crowded at peek times (morning and evenings) but it is worth it. Why take the metro to cross when one can do it in style with the ferry? Most of the ferries are at least 50 years old and they reflect colonial England and an era gone by.

Slice of history. The Star Ferry remains one of the best ways to see the Hong Kong harbor and skyline. The smog can obscure the view from higher vantage points, but from the water, you can really sense the massive jumble of steel and shimmering glass that is Kowloon.

An Iconic Experience. Along with the Trams and the Peak View experience, The Star Ferries are one of the "Must Do" features in Hong Kong which are famed worldwide. The journey from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon across The Victoria Harbour provides tremendous views in either direction for a simple $2.50 fare ($3.40 at weekends). Apart from the efficient crossing it is great fun meeting and talking to fellow travellers. On both sides of the Harbour there are a number of shops and information areas near to the Piers. On the Hong Kong side, a selection of tours start from outside the terminal. On the Kowloon side, The Cultural Centre is but a short walk and it is ideal to travel over for an evening event.

Star Ferry is a MUST when visiting Hong Kong. The green Star Ferry boats are synonymous with Hong Kong so when visiting for the first time we knew we had to make a point of crossing Victoria Harbour in one of these iconic vessels.In the end we used the Star Ferry numerous times as it is the easiest weay to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island or vice versa. You really feel a part of the city when you get on board with all the locals and with the trip costing pennies and taking less then 10 minutes each way it is a wonderful way to see both sides of the harbour.Twinkling Star, Shining Star, Solar Star and Day Star will live long in our memory and hopefully we can return some day soon to ride the rest of the fleet back and forth across Vicroria Harbour.

Not what is was. The Star ferry is still a marvelous ride, but it is not what it was. One used to embark from, essentially, downtown, but now with reclamation on the Hong Kong side, it takes some deliberate footwork to get to the Central Pier. And with reclamation, the trip is far shorter. Another rather gloomy thing is that in the past the harbour was always filled with ships and boats. Naval vessels, barges, junks, water-taxis - the full spectrum of seacraft. Nowadays, the harbour is more like a small lake, with little traffic and nothing anchored. Granted, the view of Hong Kong island is fantastic in its way, but not in the way it was, the way that got the blood and eyes moving and the mind flooded with the "Mysterious East". Take the trip and enjoy it for what it is, but I suspect in another twenty years it will be gone for good.

Great vfm and good views of the harbour. Very cheap and good fun. Much better than the mtr. Old style ferries that have been running for many years. Timely, efficient, clean and safe. Well worth the money. An experience not to miss whilst in HK

Best Bargain in Hong Kong; lovely views. We loved taking the Star Ferry and you will as well. It's inexpensive, easy to find and you can connect to the MTR or Bus routes, using the same Octopus Pass. Get a pass and use the public transport, it's excellent and easy to understand. The Chinese are light-years ahead of the United States in terms of public transport, ease of use and track safety.

Light and Sound Symphony. Use this means of transport to get to the other side of Victoria Bay- Kowloon- the modern part of the city of Hong Kong. At 8pm sharp you can enjoy a Symphony of Lights and Sound, in which the main skyscrapers (Bank of China, International Financial Centre and HSBC) light up in synch to music. We watched it from the ferry and on the other side of the bay. Buy the second deck of the ferry, so you can see it better. Just manage your time, as the ferry takes less than 8 minutes to cross the bay. Next time, I'd rather watch the show from Kowloon already.

Cheap Way To Cross The Harbour...?!. I took this ferry many times to cross the harbour, how good the view is really depends on the pollution on the day because one day you can see the other side and the next you cannot see two feet in front of you!Particularly cool at night when you can see the Chinese Junks with their red sails lit up against the skyline.The experience isn't all that wonderful, but it is a cheap way to cross the harbour and view at the same time, I am sure there are better albeit more expensive ways to do it.The dinner cruise on a junk boat would be cool I reckon.

What a great way to get around from Hong Kong to Kowloon. Don't miss the star ferry while you're in Hong Kong. It's a very practical and efficient way to travel as well as wonderful sightseeing opportunity!
Great view of Hong Kong / Kowloon. For very little cost you will get a harbour side view of the city and the lightsAn attraction where you can mix with the local people
Great way to see the city. We finally took the ferry across yesterday. For $.80US, it's not only a great deal, but a cool way to see the HK skyline. Would be fun during the light show for sure!

COUNT THE NUMBER OF STARS !!!. You have not seen it all in HK,unless you take a ride on the old ,but safe , Star Ferry . This is a great way to see the harbour and take several photos of all the famous landmarks .

an absolute must. unless you're terrified of being on water, this is the cheapest, most interesting way to see HK harbour. It's only a ten minute journey, but my favourite way to go between HK Island and Kowloon.

Great Way to Start the Day!. After our cruise ship docked at The Ocean Terminal, we met our private guide and boarded the Star Ferry. It was the perfect way to begin the day as we sailed across the harbor and were able to take the beauty of the skyline of this beautiful city as well as travel with the locals. We loved it!

Great 30 min experience.. Economical way of getting a feel of HK. Depending on the weather conditions and time of the day, the scenery may not be perfect for all. I was there on a misty/hazy gloomy day, so it didnt take my breath away. What was interesting was a display board of how the ferry evolved over many years. The current ferries are apparently the 4th in the lineage. One tip, i'm into photography. I though sitting at the bottom level will have better photographic opportunities. Or if you are on the top level, pull back the plastic curtains. I was seated in the front, the glass panels got in the way. Still able to take photos, but u cant really stick your camera out of the window for a better perspective.

Forget the yacht and got on a ferry. Very often, tourists would go for the easy and expensive way of getting around. Subway is easy but the ferry in Hong Kong is one that is never to be missed. The view is spectacular. A trip from TsimShaTsui to the Hong Kong island (Central or Wanchai) takes only less than 10 minutes. This trip would enable you to view the great harbor view of both sides. You will be very busy taking pictures. This mode of transportation dates back to when there was no under harbor tunnel. Hence, experience what the locals went through decades ago.... and at a very cheap fare.

A perfect way to travel. When on holiday people sometimes don't want to stray too far away from the usual 'touristy' things and travel is probably near the top of the list.The Star Ferry is a must; easy to get to, easy to understand getting tickets etc, easy to know which ferry to get and cheap.Oh and the main plus.........the view! Don't miss out on this great way of get from one part to another.

Cheapest And Unique View. The cheapest way to cross the harbour. A nostalgic transfer from Kowloon to Hong Kong city and back. For a city with expensive real estate offering world class views, what more peaceful way to enjoy this great city, but with a must do Harbour Ferry Ride!

Excellent & Cheap!. For less than .50 cents USD you get a ride across Hong Kong Harbor; a wonderful way to see the beautiful skyline and get out on the water for cheap! If you don't want to do it both ways, you can always take the MTR (Metro) which is a lot faster. Also, every night at 8pm is a laser light show that can been seen from the Kowloon side which is really cool! I first rode the Star Ferry @ 17 years ago on my 1st trip to Hong Kong so it was kind of like seeing an old friend again!

An absolute must do in vibrant Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is an absolute must do attraction in Hong Kong. This authentic and historic service offers a wonderful photo opportunity. Each Ferry has a different personalised name and provides excellent value for money and a great timetable (available in every hotel) to cross between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. The wooden boats are comfortable and sturdy and a much loved and oft used mode of transport. The old and the new blending seamlessly in this beautiful vibrant and cultural city.

Easy, quick and inexpensive. While the MTR is definitely the way to get about for most of your travel in HKG, the ferry should still appear on your list of to-dos at least once for the experience. With the ferry you get the views and not the bustle. It's a short ride across the water, costs hardly a thing and you can use your Octopus card.
Nice and historical. Nice ferry and very historical. The journey is a little bit short but you could do several times. You must do it during sunset time, amazing views.

Go at least once!. Traveling with the Star Ferries is just marvelous. If in Hong Kong at least go with them once it is a great peace of history and culture these small green ferries crossing the Victoria Harbor. I loved them so much so I tried to fit as many crossings as possible into my schedule.

Nice view and relaxing. Enjoyable night view with many beautiful and colourful lights display from the building. Encourage to buy the ticket earlier or else u won't get a chance but the ticket counter had inconsistence opening time. So it's better to wait there.

great excitement was flavoured. the travelling on this was breath taking,the service was faultless,very precise and again efficiently well run,service was good and paying for the ride was easy and cheap,best way to move around in Hk

Great way to see HK from the water. This was a cheap and fun way to cross the harbour. The ride is really cheap. The only complication is working out you have to press the ticket button before putting in the money. From HK Island, you can cross to Tsim Sha Tsui and directly walk to the Avenue of Stars

Got to be done!. This is by far the best way to see the famous skyline of the city and in a setting that is evocative of its colonial past. The cheapest way to do this is to purchase a simple crossing ticket for about 50 cents that takes you wither to Kowloon or Hong Kong. (The Kowloon Hong Kong route give a better view) Or You can purchase for a little more, the hour long harbour tour that takes in all the coastline and offers you some of the best picture opportunities going. Prices for the tour are around $200HK each and departs funnily enough on the hour, every hour from any of the various stops along the route. Included in the price is a drinks voucher that you can redeem on board for a hot or cold drink, this also includes free nibbles in the form of cookies or crisps depending on your preference. A continuous commentary via recorded audio is playing that tells you facts and interesting stories about some of the landmarks that you pass by. Highlights and plus points:Great value for moneyComfortable Good commentary trackDrinks voucher a plus Helpful staff Can get on at any of the various piersNegative points:The commentary is a little behind where you actually are.If a bit rough the experience can be off putting. Its relaxing and actually a great way to either start or end your time in Hong Kong. The food is good and setting is exceptional. If you don't have a trip on the Star Ferry whilst in Hong Kong then you have missed out!

Inexpensive Attraction!. You can get a boat ride across the bay for about 50 cents and the same back. Buy a ticket from the dispenser ( go to the central side the upper deck) you can use HK bills or coins no problem. Once you have your token you will walk about 20 meters and put you token in the slot. Walk straight and look up for the sign that is lit up to indicate which side the ferry will come on. It's about 10 min total. Get off go down the stairs and walk left to bus stop 15c not the big bus one the last one. Take this to the tram terminus. There is a great park across the street to walk around and just enjoy a beautiful park and for sure go to the Aviary and enjoy the birds all free. With the ferry bus and park you will have spent about 16 Hong Kong dollars for a 3 hour tour. Take the 15c back to the pier and reverse you trip. Great budget tour!

Can't be missed. There's no excuse for not travelling on the Star Ferry while in Hong Kong! The fair is very reasonable, the trip short and the location central. You'd be a fool to miss this authentic experience - left relatively unchanged for decades. There's no better way to see the bay across Hong Kong. On the Kowloon side there is also a very handy stamp dispensing machine and mailbox for those postcards that have been floating around your handbag...

Best Outdoor Bar on HK Island. Leffe on draught and a Happy Hour. Lots of UK bottled beers look out for the Manager 's Special. priced around 30HK$. Follow the walkway down to Pier 4. The bar faces towards the entrance to the pier. There is also an excellent bar in the entrance to Pier 5 about 35HK$ for range of bottles. You can take the drinks out and sit on the steps or on the seating benches and watch the water traffic. Beware of high strength Gin and tonics knocking you off your feet. Public toilets are on the bus area if you need.

Must Do!. A trip to Hong Kong is not complete without at least two trips across Victoria Harbour onboard the Star Ferry. One in the day time and one at nighttime. Both rides will give you different perspectives of Hong Kong and Kowloon. It is a very inexpensive way of seeing the harbour from at Central and Kowloon. Only $2.50 a single trip. This must be on your 'to do' list when you visit Hong Kong.

Don't miss it!!. The Star ferry is so convenient and cheap you have to experience it at least once to see the views around the harbour. I actually did 3 trips accross the harbour with one of them at night in order to see everything lit up!!
A must do. This is the most inexpensive way to see the harbour and the Hong Kong skyline, it costs about 3-4 HKD per way. It is very well signed, I caught it from Central to Tsim sha tsui.
Best bargain in Hong Kong - perfect for Harbour tour. For only a US buck you can see Hong Kong Harbour. Best bargain way to tour the sea. Clean ferry and easy to purchase a ticket.
Cheap and fn. We took the regular ferry from Hong Kong island to Kowloon. It's short and cheep with great views. Next time I'll investigate longer trips.

Great way to see the harbor. Great way to see Victoria harbor and travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Ridiculously cheap and ferries depart frequently. A great way to get back-and-forth while visiting Hong Kong.

Good overview, both in terms of views and information. I took the day tour at 16:55 and paid HK$85 for a single adult ticket. The trip took about 1 hour and I got to see the sunset behind the skyscrapers during this time. One drink was included in the price so I had coffee and got almond cookies with it which were amazing. The automized English speaking guide aboard the ferry was, unlike many other similar recordings, very clear and informative. From time to time the waves made the trip quite shaky, so you might wanna take this into account if you easily get seasick. While waiting for the boat I enjoyed the view over Hong Kong from the pedestrian plateau right next to the harbour. I also had time to take a picture of the Watch Tower from there.

visiting Hong Kong and The Star Ferry. Visited Hong Kong about 2 years ago. Great experience and fairly easy to find your way around. Everything is so cheap there. We used the Star Ferry to go from Kowloon to Central. You get the best views of Hong Kong here. Caught a bus uptown to view central and walked quite a way back to the ferry. We also visited Victoria Peak and rode the Peak tram. The views from the Observation Deck are spectacular and we were lucky as it was a fairly clear day. Had a nice lunch there also. From Kowloon we caught a bus to Aberdeen and walked along the harbour it is lovely there. We seen all the floating markets, the Junk boats and different cultures. All the big shopping centres are great with lots of bargains. The MTR transport system is good, clean and fast. Hong Kong is a good place to visit.

Ferry Fun!. We used the Star Ferry every day for commuting around the harbour. It was cheap, fun and made you feel like one of the locals. It was great to hit the water and feel the breeze on your face, especially on a hot and humid day.

Scenic and convenient. Using the ferry to cross the harbour gives an opportunity for sight-seeing and the convenience of going from Central on HK Island, directly to Kowloon, where it is a short walk to the promenade or Nathan Rd.
Cheap and Great Views. Fantastic way to see the city lights, and it's so incredibly inexpensive. I took the ferry a couple of times, and it's very well run, clean, and fast.

A pleasant trip across the harbour and some good views on the way. The Star Ferry is a pleasant trip across the harbour from Hong Kong island to Kowloon. It is cheap and offers good views of the surrounding buildings. Offers a cheap seat to sit down and rest for a little while too while walking around to look at scenery!

Use it to get from Kowloon to HK Island. Use this Ferry to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island, cheap and probably used more by tourists ??? to get their photos of the Hong Kong Skyline. Runs quite frequently and from memory the crossing is less than 10 minutes. Note; Star Ferry passes are included in the Big Bus Tour but anyway the Ferry is so cheap it doesn't really matter. With Bug Bus Tour a 1 hour victoria harbour ferry ride is included (good) which we took but we also did the Star Ferry a few times just to get from Kowloon to HK Island because it is so convenient. Recommend to try the Star Ferry as a Tourist.

fast ferry. take the ferry to macau..
pretty fast, you don't feel a thing during.. can sleep, the trip takes about 1 hour..
pretty cold, although not cold in the city..

Old world.... A pleasant form of transport and as means to take in the amazing skyline.
Cheap as chips and regular service so do not have to wait long.

A nice historic ferry ride. It is a great addition to all the different types of transport that you can find in Hong Kong. You can use the Octopus card just like on MTR. There are some great views of the harbor.

A must. As you can use the Octopus card on the Star Ferry, it couldn't be easier. You never have to wait long and the views are excellent day and night. Top deck is best. We also did the Star Ferry Cruise which is about an hour. Check timings where you pay as we found the actual sailing times were different to what was on their website. This is a nice little trip giving more photo opportunities.

A Definite Must!. For the traditional approach to travel in HK the ferry is a must. Worth the journey for the views of both Hong Kong Island and TST.I always use the ferry and for a few dollars it is worth it.

Great way to see the city from the water. We had a octopus card (u can use that for the metro, the star ferry, as a kind of debit card at some stores, etc) and we could just get on the ferry right away. Amazing view from the water.

From Central to Kowloon via the Star Ferry. Taking the Star Ferry is an absolute must! Whether from Kowloon to Central or Wanchai or Central to Kowloon, it is an absolute must! Nothing to do with the fact that it's "cheap as chips" the experience is really worth it. Whether by day or night the experience shouldn't be missed. Over the years I have taken many photos but this one was taken November 2013. I do recommend however that you opt for the top deck each time you travel on the Ferry.It's a very short trip, with all the reclamation of land over the years, the trip has become even shorter. Fares are easy just at the terminal, there are vending machines which give you a disk which you then use to admit you through to the waiting area. Ferries are very frequent so you shall never be left waiting a lengthy period.If you are taking the Star Ferry from Central to Kowloon you can pop into the Ocean Terminal which is on your left as you disembark the Terminal. There is quite a lot do see just around that area. Should you walk to your right from the terminal you can stroll along the viewing platform where you can take some lovely photos. The light show is shown each evening I believe around 8pm (free). It's a bit ho hum but worth it if it's your first visit to Hong Kong. The Harbour view is truly spectacular especially in the evening.Hong Kong is very exciting; it's so diverse in what it has to offer. I don't think I'll ever become tired of visiting Hong Kong.

Do it & you Will like it!. If you would like to experience the local, try this! -- and not those ferry design for tourist! It will gives you the perfect view of the Harbour, do it both way if you felt that the route is not long enough! If you are sick with the staircase of their MTR, you should even consider this as first priority to reach HK Island (provided you stay nearby the Harbour like Tsim Sha Tsui...). Less crowded even it's working hour. This is one out of the 50 things that you must do as traveller as recommended by CNN, it does carry some weight :)Note: you can find the famous Tai Cheong Bakery (egg tart is real good) branch at Tsim Sha Tsui ferry station (walk in a bit, around the shop where it sell tickets for tourist ferry tour...)

Great experience riding on this historic ferry!!. I would highly recommend anyone who is traveling to Hong Kong for the first time to take a ride on this ferry at least once! I was there in September and made it a must to experience it, I did not regret it! It does not take a long time to get across from one harbor to the other and you could take pictures of the city from whichever side you are coming from. I wished I have the chance to take the night tour on the ferry though, that would have been amazing! I love how the back of their bench-like seats that you can push 2 sides depending on which side you want to face (and providing noone is sitting on the same bench ;) )

A must try.... If you are in hkg n wanna feel the local vibe u have to try the star ferry. As many have said it is the cheapest attraction in hong kong which will cost you only HKD2 and u will get amazing views of the harbor n hong kong skyline. Its not a very long ride from harbor city mall to central, its about 8 mins but its worth a trip. If you are in hong kong this is a must. The star ferry terminal is very easy to find its right next to the entrance of the harbor city mall and very close to other attractions like clock tower n avenue of stars.I hope u guys try n have fun.

Iconic!. The best value for money of anything, anywhere, ever! Don't believe me? You have one last thing to do in your life. Kiss the wife? Hug the baby? Count your money?
Take your HK$2 and ride the Star Ferry! Do it! Now!

Atmospheric & good value too!. Took the Star Ferry over to Hong Kong Island for a meeting. Tickets are very good value but it takes a bit of sorting out to find a machine to get a token. I went out on the top deck - assumed to be the better option- it is more expensive. Came back on the lower deck which is quite a bit cheaper, but I felt gave you a better feel for the ship. You are closer to the water - can look in on the engine room - which had a shiny nice new diesel installed.The doors are left open - I think to assist cooling. On this deck you can walk right forward to stand along side the skippers cabin where the anchor lie near the bows. Its all an atmospheric setting oozing history out of its pores. Tried to find a ships plate stating when & where the ferry was built but to no avail - and I could find nobody who could tell me. Wikipaedia informs that the original Star ferries were built 1871 in England - but the current ferries in service hail form the Hong Kong & Whampoa dockyards - the oldest dating from 1956.

Great Views. The Star Ferry is a quick and scenic ride between Central and Kowloon. The city views especially at night are amazing. You can use the Octopus card to pay the fare or else you have to have the exact change.

Breathtaking View. The cheapest way to go from Central to Kowloon. Able to use the octopus card to pay for the ferry rides. You can see breathtaking views of the skyline of both sides (HK Island and the mainland) at night. It take less than 10 mins to cross over from central. After crossing, you may check out the symphony of lights shows at 8pm.

Best Night Time View of Hong Kong. The best way to travel from Central to Kowloon offering stunning views of both sides of the Harbour. Crossing time less than 10 mins. Night time crossing is a must as the view is stunning. One of the Top Ten experiences in Hong Kong !

Best ferry ride in fhe world. This IS the best way to see the city and harbour. There is even a tour if you want. Easy to find too...just short walk from end of Canton Road on Kowloon side and Central on Hong Kong Island is connecged with covered walkways to main shops.AND the ferry ride is so cheap, and you can use your Oyster Card. There are both upper and lower decks...doesnt matter which one, they both give a great view. I agree with the others....day or night its fabulous. MUST DO.

Best way to get around. This is a cheap, traditional and effective way to go from Central to Kowloon. It offers breathtaking views of the skyline and a peek into how folks traveled Victoria Harbor back in the day.

Fabulous view and opportunity for photography. Location : One end @ Tsim sha Tsui and another one @ Central, time required to travel is 10 mins onlyIts very economical and the same thing you can travel with MRT (under the tunnel) but from ferry you will get the view of sea and building of two ends. Both day and night gives fantastic view, wherein night view are more interesting ones due to lighting effects. I have used this ferry 3 times to get this fantastic view and to take fantastic photos.Also you can cover the Hong Kong lighting shows which gets displayed from 8:00 – 8:15 PM everyday which is also quite amazing. Tips- You can go comfortably with baby and stroller, no problem of staircases in any case.

cheap but unique and rewarding. There is no better, more leisurely and cheaper way to see the beautiful Hongkong harbour, especially at night. There are two services, both connecting Tsimshatsui in Kowloon with Central and Wanchai North in the Island. The best way therefore is to go from either pier in the Island and then back to the other. t
Amazing views. The views are amazing. Especially at night and also about the cheapest thing you can do in Hong Kong!

the best deal in town. The famous Hong Kong Harbour is one of the most beautiful in the world. but the way to see the famous skyline is to take the star ferry! For 3 HKD, one gets to ride this enjoyable ferry, and there are 2 routes - TST to Wanchai, and TST to Central. Best time is around 8pm - there is also a laser show for 15 / 20 minutes - can't beat that for a bargain deal!

Love this place!. The best and cheapest way to experience the well-known harbour and view! Also, a good and convenient method to travel from kowloon to hong kong. Different expeneice for travelling at day and night, so relaxing and so romantic(at night)!

Wow Wow Wow. After 22 years of living in Hong Kong, everytime I watch the back drop of Hong Kong Island from Kowloon Star Ferry Pier in Tsim Sha Tsui, I'm still very pround of being a tiny part of the city.

Two of The Best Hour Spend In Hong Kong. After you check-in Airport Express airline counter, walk a few minute to the Central Pier and board the ferry to East Tsim Sha Tsui,, will take you to Kowloon side, while on this less than ten minutes ride, you will see both the sky'scrapper of Hong Kong and Kowloon , after you leave the ferry on your right is Tsim Sha Tsui promenade, the best spot to take your picture Hong Kong as your back ground, Hong Kong Conventional & Exhibition Centre, International Financial Centre are landmark of Hong Kong, make sure you included both or wait a little until a ferry come into frame, don't forget included yourselves in the pictures too, Avenue of Star is here with Bruce Lee's statue, if you have time to spare, walk to hotel Peninsula for an afternoon tea to round up your perfect best two hour spend in Hong Kong, then take the ferry return to Central and board your train to the air port, hope you enjoy your Hong Kong visit and go home with some good memory.
The Star attraction. The best ferry trip in the world,a classic from the uniforms to the coir ropes may it long continue

Best way to relax. This is the best way to travel from Tsimshatsui to central or vice versa to avoid the crowd and to see the beautiful scenery of Hong Kong in a very relax manner. The fare is extremely cheap which is below HKD10 one way and no need to book ticket in advance. Just pay the fare and jump in the ferry.

Just fantastic. Looking across the harbour from Kowloon to Hong Kong island the view is stunning and everyone takes photos when in Hong Kong. Often days are hazy so the views are not clear. Using the Star ferry gives a different perspective on this view as the island becomes closer.When travelling from Tsim Sha Sui there are two boats that can be taken, to Central or Wanchai, it is a 10 minute trip and the cost is HK$2.5 making it surely the best value boat trip. You can use the octopus card.Even if you don't need to cross the harbour, I recommend that you do it, if you want to come stralght back you just walk off the ferry and loop round to get on again. A round trip would take maximum 40 minutes. The journey is quite different at day and night, the lights at night are spectacular.These boats are a little haven of tradition and history in a very modern city, I've travelled several times and every time I'm in awe of the wonderful views.

very good. We took the ferry from Kowloon (East Tsim Sha Sui) side to Hong Kong island and it was quick and very reasonably priced.The view is very good.If you want to go the Peak, it is probably a good way to reach Central MTR station and also see the skyline.While you are at the Pier, you can also see the ancient Clock Tower and the Avenue of Stars.

take a ride!. when i have time, i would do this over and over.. the view was spektakuler. should try at least at day and night (arpund 8pm ) when the symphnoy of lights begin! wonderfull!take the upper deck :)

take the ferry and see the waterfront skyline. Its a really inexpensive way to get from hong kong to kowloon. The ride over will provide you with a chance to see the skyline from the water. I was lazy that day and sat within the enclosed portion of the ferry the windows near the back you could slide down but a crew member wandered by and closed the window.
Great way of transportation!. It's the most enjoyable and fast way of crossing the bay! It costs nothing and you get great picture opportunities of the city... It's an attraction itself!

A must do bargain. Its an extremely cheap and interesting way to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. The ferries are frequent and you get good views of the harbour as you travel. You can also use your Octopus card to pay if you have one.

A bargain way to experience HK, Tsim Sha Tsui and Kowloon. In an age when travel can be expensive, bloated and complex, nothing could be simpler than riding the Star Ferry lines to see and get around Hong Kong. The service is quick, regular and frequent, and its short harbor jaunts are really rather fun. I have been known to ride the ferry back and forth for hours at night just to take in the sights and skyline. The Star Ferry has always been and will probably always be one of the greatest travel bargains on earth. I adore the Star Ferry.

a great way to travel!. I could have spent hours going backwards & forwards on the ferry! There is so much to see - the boats, the skyline, the fellow passengers. A perfect way to get from Kowloon to the Island & so reasonably priced at just 2HKD. The ferries run frequently & are very clean.

An inexpensive way to see the views. A relaxing and an expensive way to see the Island & Kowloon skylines is to take the cross harbour trips on the Star Ferries. The ferries go between Central & Tsim Sha Tsui and Wanchai & Tsim Sha Tsui. It is also a great way to see HK's skyline at night. Suggest you take the upper deck for the better views.

The simple things are the best. For only 2HKD, you can take a 10min ride from HK island to central Kowloon. The view is great both daytime and night. Probably wouldn't ride if sea is rough. However, it was perfect and far cheaper than cab across the Harbour. In fact, we found that many cab drivers don't want to cross from HK island
And nice view. Very easy, but also quite fun. The crossing is a great ride and will take you to an area where you can get great views of Hong Kong's skyline.
Cheap family fun. A nice way to get across the harbour. Great views are a given. I wish we had have done a night crossing as well.

Once upon a time. Once upon a time the Star Ferry was the 'it' mode of transport between HK and Kowloon. Sadly with all that development on HK side, what remains is a shadow of its former glory. I was appalled to see how close HK is to Kowloon now due to all that dredging and land reclamation. Soon one would be able to simply walk across.I do recommend a ride on the Star Ferry when in HK before this old treasure disappears.

Another Good View of the City Skyline. Nice view of the City of Hong Kong from the water. The ICC is the best view of the Island City Skyline. However, this gives you a good view and feel of the city and how people used to cross over to the Island side. It is a short ride, and must do at least once. I suggest a day and a night crossing, and a good camera to get some great pics of the old boats and the skyline lit up in the background. In the end, this is a must visit to see another perspective of an amazing city!Visited September 2013

Great local experience. Took the Star Ferry to Kowloon with my 1 year old son. It was great crossing the Harbour on the ferry with the locals, there was an air conditioned compartment (very handy given it was 34 degrees Celsius with 90% humidity), and there was a great viewing area on the water from the Kowloon side. It was cheap and a nice way to spend an hour or twoOnly downside was there are a reasonable amount of stairs with no elevator nor escalator, so not easy with a pram or if you are less mobile

Nice. The journey itself is nothing special, take any ferry for that matter. Most advisable to get into the Victoria harbour just before the 20.00 laser-light show performed on both sides' skyscrapers.

a historical & cultural landmark, a jewel!. The Good =)~Lowest priced attraction in HK.~Will bring you down a nostalgic walk down memory lane.The Bad =(~Intervals of 10 minutes so missing the boat will make you wait for 10 minutes.My Tip for future visits:~Taking to TST is better than the opposite direction.

Star ferry. We went on the star ferry to get to the peak. It was an experience, and really cheap you have a really good view of Hong Kong ,the city skyline and the harbour. You have to have correct change to put in ticket machine, the local people were very helpful and helped us get the right change .
Cheap way to see the laser show!. We took the ferry often back and forth and lucked out by taking it at the same time the Laser show was on! Refreshing, inexpensive way to cross the harbour.

Inexpensive and efficient. Well, this is a regular ferry service to across the harbour and to nearby islands. Regular, efficient and inexpensive. This is not a 'luxury' crossing, but it is convenient. I used it regularly while visiting Hong Kong.

still charming. This is one of the oldest things to do in HK but still well worth it --- the ferries (more accurately old boats now) may creak a bit here and there but for a tourist, especially with young kids in the party, I still think its a perfect way to see the skylines of HK and spend a lazy afternoon...Highly recommended

Star ferry - what an experience. What an experience. It is an absolute must for every traveller. Pay the "high" price and sit upstairs. The view of the harbour is brilliant. At night is is even better watching the lights and sounds of the harbour. Don't miss it........

Golden Oldies but Goodie. 0.30cents Oz to travel on the ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island so cheap and a great ferry ride. If there is any ocean liners in you are right next to them.a great way to travel across as a taxi is min $120.00 HK

Is this really an attraction?. I'm not sure why this is listed as one of the attractions of Hong Kong. It's feels more like a mode of transport to get you from A to B. It's cheap, regular and you do get some beautiful views of the harbour but it's not particularly special.Good way to get across to the islands.
Classic Hong Kong Experience. You can't visit Hong Kong and not take the Star Ferry to Kowloon! Gorgeous at night with views of the glittering Hong Kong skyline.

What changes 10 years on!..... for the worse.. I hadn't ridden the Star Ferry for over 10 years as every time I visit HK, the piers seem to get further and further away from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong and Kowloon side! But with time on my hands, made the effort to locate the Star Ferry pier on Central.Ten years ago, it was a brisk 7-8 minute walk from the front lobby of the Mandarin Oriental hotel. This time I was dismayed to discover it entailed nearly double the time. Gone is the charming pier with rickshaws parked in front, the stalls selling hot snacks and mango ice cream past the turnstile. Instead it's been replaced by a much larger 2 storey pier with standard tourist shops and travel agent. At least no more confusion if you need the ferry to Kowloon or Hung Hom! Still the ferries themselves and the gang plank, angle depending on the tide level, remain unchanged. BIG TIP for newbies :- the seat backs need to be flipped so that you're facing in the direction of travel. Intriguing ride as you see the variety of vessels and remember that Victoria harbour remains a true working thoroughfare.
Efficient Transport. I used this ferry a number of times and found it to be very efficient and reasonably priced.It has the added advantage of giving a good view of the harbour during the trip.

A boat from the Past in today H-K. The star ferry a must do when in H-K. Ride a boat from the past and enjoy today's H-K skyline, also ride at night for the skyline light show. A great Historical Value in today world. A Must Do

Bucket list item ticked for 1 dollar. This is rated as one of the top 50 things to do in a lifetime by National Geographic Traveler for good reason. At a few Hong Kong dollars. It was even free when I did it! For some reason it was a free day when I was here in October. I brought my folks over to HK and they loved it, a really 1930's feel, and amazing views. You can not come to Hong Kong and miss a ride on the star ferry or the cruise.
Best value attraction in Hong Kong. You will not find a better way to spend your pocket money. Cheap and good. Great view and sea breeze. Historical value with convenience and location.
Must do in Hong Kong. This is one of the highlights of my visits to Hong Kong as the skyline changes every year. Sure the MTR is more efficient but this is far more interesting and cheap!
A must do!. Fun and inexpensive way to see the skyline, especially pretty at night. Ferries run till late and are reliable and frequent.

Great value. Its great value for money. Has great views both sides of the boat but do try get as close to the windows as possible. Its well sign posted, so easy to find. Octopus card works for it too.

Quick ride across Hong Kong harbor. It is a great experience and you should try it at least once when you visit Hong Kong. It takes just minutes and costs almost nothing to enjoy the trip across the harbor. The quickest route is from Central to TST, where you can also enjoy great mango desserts at nearby Hui Lau Shan or visit the many malls nearby, including Lanson Place and along Nathan Road.
Very good and real HK. Very easy to use and cheap and gives the traveller a real feel of HK Harbour etc.also god views and an exciting quick trip.

A serene trip on a star ferry. We took the ferry from kowloon to hong-kong island to do some shopping the sun on the water i nearly fell asleep on way over,the trip was over so quickly if you go to hong-kong don,t miss atrip on one of the star ferrys.

Perfect Hong Kong Experience. it costs next to nothing to experience the real Hong Kong with a trip on the Star Ferry. HIghly recommended. Also a great way to get from Tsim Sha Tsui to the Island and beat the traffic.
A must do in Hong Kong. It is definitively worth doing it. It only takes few minutes and you end up ad the beginning of Canton road. You will Hong Kong from a different point of view.

An Icon of the harbour.. Watch any of the old movies set in Hong Kong and you will see the Star Ferries. They have been transporting passengers across Victoria Harbour for decades. It is an absolute must do when in Hong Kong. The old markets on Hong Kong Island have been replaced with modern office blocks but the attraction is still the same. The ticketing is something to be wary of, and there is little help to be had. Put your tenner in and press the button for the passengers with you then collect the tokens. As usual you will learn this with 30 people behind you in the line! Enjoy!

Did this everyday. Loved the ferry ,very clean ,cheap,and easy to buy tickets great view at night Makes staying in Kowloon a great option it's so peaceful in Kowloon always happy to be back on the ferry to go home .

The best value, the best skyline view. Star Ferry is a venerable institution in Hong Kong. Everyone told us we had to do it. It was really reasonably priced, not fancy, but had an amazing view of the harbor at night. A must see tourist attraction.
Cheap as chips. The most incredible way to view the harbour at any time. Made three trips, 2 of those at night. Extremely cheap and very memorable.

A unique ferry route!. Star Ferry is a very cost effective way of getting across Victoria Bay from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. It's very interesting when the ferry is dodging in and out of the shipping moving up and down the bay. A 'must do ' when visiting Hong Kong.

A must do. Very inexpensive and if you also purchase a Hop On Hop Off Big Bus ticket they will include a return ferry ticket. Only a short trip from Hong Kong Island to Kowlong but it's one of the few places I know that you can make such a journey.

Nice cruise. I crossed from Hong Kong to Tsim Sha Tsui on the Star Ferry, it is a nice and relaxing way to get across. An evening ride is perhaps better with night views of the skyline. There is also a one hour cruise round the harbour which is much more pleasant and comfortable, with food sold on board and commentary. My tickets were part of the Big Bus package, which I found to be good value.

Star Ferry. Used this several times over a few days, rained every time.The ferry itself is a bit grotty - but then it is a working boat.The experience and convenience is excellent.Good views of Kowloon and Hong Kong, except during the rain!Frequency of crossings is excellent.

Nice sail in a rainy stormy day. It was July 8th when we used the Star Ferry tickets supplied with the Big Bus Tour Tickets. It was OK in the morning then all of the sudden the sky was full of rain & it was raining very big & heavy rain drops. Sun was masked behind the dark sky, but overall experience was very good. Very nice breath with the rain during the excursion. The boat was equipped with windows & shades in other sections of the open side deck. The Pier itself is full of attractions, from Cafe', Fast Food, Small Shops & Delis, Tours & Travel Agents, ...etc. You can spend 2 hours moving around & within the Pier and enjoy your time as we did.

Enjoying ride. We really enjoy the ride, we were able to see both side of Hong Kong and Kowloon skyline. It's something you must do to get the experience of Hong Kong. We would probably do it again if we go visit.
A must do in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is a great little trip across the harbour. A very cheap ride with great views of both Hong Kong and Kowloon. A definite must.

pleasant cruise. We took a 1hour Harbor Cruise at the Star Ferry terminus at TST at dusk. It costs about 70HKD per adult; comes along with a drink/snack on-board. You could additionally purchase more on board if you need. Sit back an relax on the deck with your drink as the cruise takes you around the harbor for an hour. Best done around evening as the lights are just coming on in the buildings and you could get some great shots on your camera. If you choose to sit indoors, you could listen to the audio commentary during the journey.Be aware that there is a 'light show' cruise that takes you mid-harbor so that you can get a better view; almost twice as expensive..

Relaxing way to see the skyline. We bought 8o'clock tickets to see the light show. The ride was enjoyable but we all found the"light show" a little hard to follow. We never knew which side of the water to look at because on either side, nothing great was happening. No matter, I would probably do this again just for the view on the water.

must do - can't go wrong. the trip is good, fast, and cheap - not many things in this world can say all three! A must do in HK, even if you just go over and back without stopping, it's only 3.4 HKD per adult each way on the weekend (less during the week). A different perspective on the harbor and the skyline from the water view. Not crowded - even during the Chinese holiday 5-October.

A must-do Hong Kong experience. Everyone told us that riding the Star Ferry was a must-do while we were in Hong Kong, and they were right. The views are extraordinary and the whole experience is fun and feels very much like an "only in Hong Kong" thing. We rode back and forth between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui 3 or 4 times and it was enjoyable each time because every time we spotted something different. Upgrade to first class on the top deck (it costs practically nothing) and get a seat by the sides for the best views. I also recommend riding the first time during the daytime and then riding again later at night. Absolutely beautiful in both directions and a nice change of pace from riding the MTR back and forth under the harbor.

Star ferry still shines!. Getting around Hong Kong is so easy. The underground is user friendly but the true star of Hong Kong is the Star Ferry. Nothing beats a boat ride from one side of Hong Kong to the other or makes you feel more at home in this beautiful city. The views at night are just spectacular. It's got to be one of the cheapest attractions going, at only a couple dollars round trip. If you use an octopus card you almost feel like its free! Be sure to move the seat back of the bench to the direction you would like to sit so you have the best view possible if you snag the row first! I always head for the spot on the bench closes to the side for an unobstructed view. Once you arrive at port, take your time disembarking, it takes a few minutes to moor and you can soak up the atmosphere and save your energy for the pounding your feet will take as you explore this wonderful city!

Good trip for the price..... The Star Ferry was a must do for when we visited Hong Kong recently, pretty good value and stunning scenery to look at when crossing! Obviously make sure you get a seat near the sides for the best view of the beautiful city that is Hong Kong.
Would recommend to anyone visiting!

Great view both ways. Traveling with two teenagers we ventured down to the harbour and after viewing the Avenue of the Stars caught the Star Ferry over the HK Island and back again.Didn't cost much and easy using the Octopus Card.Great view of the islands in the 10-15 min trip. Easy to get on well sign posted and plenty of seats.One way top level and back on the bottom level.Just one of those things you have to do in Hong Kong.

Nice good for value short trip. Costs around $2.30 and take about 15 minutes to cross. Service is frequent and not crowded. Return trip is best as you see different virws. Caught it from pier 7. Got there by tram and then walked over the overpass. Well signed. There is also a tourist info place to pick up maps.

When you go to the pier take a ferry ride. This pier hasn't changed much in the last 10 years and it was great to take a ferry ride across the harbour again and see the Hong Kong harbour with it many boats but no sampans to be seen. You see a fair bit of the harbour from the ferry and the trip is very cheap. It is a must thing to do for all who come to Hong Kong .

Value for money.. The ferries are getting on a bit however a terrific way to get aroundCheaper and faster option then cabbing from Hong Kong island to Kowloon approximately 15 minutes and for a bargain price of 20 c australian.

Cheap as chips and a great view of Hong Kong. For 2.50 hk dollars each way you get a great view. You have to get off at the other end and buy a return trip, all up the total cost per person (in the upper deck where the view is best) is less than 1 aud.

The best ferry offering the best view, day or night. Its cost hardly anything yet offers the best view of Hong Kong harbor.It looks like it has never changed, its efficient, fun and the night views are stunning.You have to take a few trips to really get the most from it, I always noticed something new.There are toilets on the pier but non on board.Use an Octopus card for best value.

A must visit for every hong kong traveller. One of best ferry ride of my life . It gives the most beautiful view of hong kong skyline . At day time it looks so beautiful but at night it become even awesome . Very cheap and fun way to tarvel between two sides of hong kong . Its a must must visit attraction for every travelling visiting hong kong .

Has to be done. You can use your Octopus card or as we did the ticket was part of the Big Bus Tour. The ferry trundles across Hong Kong Harbour giving views of the island skyline and Kowloon. The view at night is good, and the terminal leads straight into a shopping mall. It is more fun than the MRT for getting to Hong Kong Island and is part of the experience.
Gotta Ride the Star Ferry!. We stayed in Kowloon and took the Star Ferry across to Hong Kong several times. Fun and easy, especially with your octopus card!

Amazing views of Hong Kong skyline and a fun boat ride. Every time I go to Hong Kong, I try to take a trip across Hong Kong Harbour on the Star Ferry. This is one of the oldest and most famous attractions in HK. It's also one of the cheapest. The ferry landing has plenty of shopping and eating opportunities. Once you get on the ferry and cast off, the views are magnificent. No matter which direction you're traveling it's beautiful. Enjoy this bit of HK history!!

Really good.. You can't complain about the price for a good ferry ride across the harbour. What a way to see the city and do it in day light then do it at night to get the best impressions. Check you have cash to but tickets at the pier.

star ferry. It's a ride you should take at least once... It's nostalgic, sitting on a ferry with the backdrop of a modern city... Depending if you are travelling from Hong Kong side to say Kowloon side, specifically to go to the Ocean terminal shopping mall, then the ferry will just about take you to the doorstep as opposed to taking the mtr (mass transit railway) and having to walk

Classic quintessential HK, and great in times of high MTR traffic. I love the Star Ferry, It's a little bit of the tortoise and the hare when the trains are full of commuters..hop on the star ferry (it will take your Octopus card for the fare) and have a pleasant Island breeze filled crossing. The old school seats have back the flip so that you can face the way that the boat is going, choose a seat close to the outside of the boat so that you can see the panorama of the city or kowloon as you bounce along to the other side. One of the cheapest and best tourist and not so tourist attractions in HK. I take it at least once every time I am in town.

Easy cheap crossing. You can't beat 2$ for the ride across from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central. The ferries leave frequently and efficiently. The upper deck is an extra 50c but I can't work out what the benefit is. Lower deck has fresh air, well as fresh as you can get in Hong Kong, and has the same seating.

A must do for a trip to HK. Having grown up in HK, I am very used to taking this ferry trip and sometimes take it for granted but it is a super cheap (about 40c Australian for a trip) and a lovely way to see the harbour. The star ferry takes you between Tsim Sha Tsui and Central and there is also a ferry to Wan Chai. A must do for tourists - great photo opportunities available. Note: a lot of touts trying to sell you suits/watches/bags, etc....especially in Tsim Sha Tsui. Just ignore and DO NOT buy!!!

See the harbour close up.. This is a great and cheap way to see the harbour. Study a map in advance to know which pier you want to go to and head to the departure pier. Buy an octopus card in advance from the train station then swipe to get in. No need to buy extra tickets.

A cheap and quick way to see Hong Kong Harbour.
