We took the trip from Kowloon to HK Island about mid morning and were unsure where to go, a lady at the Tourist Information centre was extremely helpful, she told us what pier we needed to go to and as we mentioned we were going to The Peak via the Tram she told us to catch Bus 15C, to the tram then sit on the R side up to The Peak to get the best view.We only waited about 5 mins and as it wasn't rush hour and a cloudy day we didn't have a problem getting a seat by the window, at peak hour I could imagine getting a seat could be a problem. Even though the Ferries are old it's still a great way to see the Harbour and it's cheap and the journey took about less than 10 minutes. We used the Ferry on the way back to Kowloon as well. If we were in HK longer I know I'd have used them more frequently.We used our Octopus Card to pay - it's about $2-3 AUD each Adult, each way.The Ferry's run from about 7.30am till 10.30pm

A very basic, VERY inexpensive ferry service.. The Star Ferry is nothing special in and of itself. It's just a very busy, very basic ferry between Kowloon and Hong Kong or Wanchai. The stations can be busy and I'd be careful of pickpockets (although I don't personally know of any problems) but the wait is never long and the wooden seats are comfortable enough for the short ride.The things that make this ferry special are the price (so inexpensive I don't even remember how much it was and easily the best value ANYTHING in Hong Kong) and the length of time the service has been operating. It is certainly a Hong Kong icon!Another good thing about the ferry is that it can be a great platform for tourists to take photos of both the Hong Kong and Kowloon sides as well as the maritime traffic if that's your thing,
great view. Get the star ferry across from Kowloon to Hong Kong island instead of the Metro. It is a great view and costs pennies. See one of the great harbours of the world for nothing!!

Take the ferry to cross or tour, its cheap and a great view. I took the Star Ferry back forth for simple transit across the harbor and I took the Star Ferry Harbor tour. Both are cheap ways to get a great view of Hong Kong. Very enjoyable ride with lots of wind to keep cool on a hot day and wonderful view of the cityscape.

Nice ride on way to Peak. Easy to get from Kowloon to Central on Ferry using OctopusCard - costs about $9.
To get from Star Ferry Terminal to the Peak either go downstairs and turn left to head to bus 15C to the Peak Tram Terminal or turn right for bus 15 all way to Peak.
Note - Bus 15C only runs 10:00 to 23:40.

Short ride. The ferry ride is getting shorter and shorter due to the continuous land-fill projects on both sides of the harboour; thus narrowing the Victoria Harbour. But it is worth going to have a brief experience. Try riding on the lower deck if possible to get the breeze.

You simply got to do Star Ferry if you are in HKG. Much has been said about Star Ferry for the past century. Star Ferry to Hong Kong is like the Statue of Liberty to New York, or the Eiffel Tower to Paris. When you are in Hong Kong, you simply have to do it once.i would make a recommendation though, if you are planning to do the Star Ferry, go from Tsim Sha Tsui in Kowloon to the Hong Kong island. In this way, you can see the Hong kong harbour view. You may even enjoy more if you do a bit of homework first. In YouTube, search for "Nacny Kwan Susie Wong", the movie "The World of Susie Wong" should pop up. Click on it and see the beginning of the movie, the first 6 minutes. You will see William Holden walking right into the Star Ferry building on the Kowloon side---the sequence starts at 01:15; see how it was, and how it is; truly nothing has been changed except that there are less passengers nowadays. Interestingly, at 06:10, you can see the Hong Kong harbour view from the Star Ferry. See how Hong Kong has changed in the past 50 years. it is really cool if you can see the beginning of the movie first, and then take the ferry ride.Hope you enjoy this.
Star Ferry. A great way to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Highly recommend very cheap great views always on time. Will be using again when next in Hong Kong

Honkong is nowhere as beautiful as from the water.. Star Ferry, a beautiful boat trip from Tsim Sha Tsui, an urban area in southern Kowloon, to the mighty skyscrapers of Hong Kong Island . The ferry is not a new type of boat, it looks a bit curious but works great. The trip take only a few minutes with a wonderful view of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. The city is nowhere as beautiful as from the water. We did the trip several times, even in rain and in the evening, it was always very photogenic and impressive. Many (Chinese) tourists will accompany you.

Easy and interesting way to cross harbour and link with mtr. This is my 6th visit to HK and each time use the star ferry. The pier itself is well organised, the only negative being the stairs you need to climb at the Tsim Sha Sui end. Ticket machines need cash but if you are organised you can get a tourist pass or an octopus card before you enter. It is a love.y and quick ride across the harbour and enables you to see the sights up close.

Good view of Harbour with little fuss and cost. Often said to be the best way of seeing Harbour quickly and at minimal cost. Not quite so convenient now that Star Ferry on Hong Kong side has been moved but it is near IFC which is a good shopping area

Best way to cross the harbour. The star ferry is a short ride across the harbour and allows you to see the spectacular view of the city's buildings whilst simply getting from A to B. The price is good and the ticket machines accept banknotes and coins (which is practical). If you are travelling with young children, ensure that they don't touch things as some things on the boat aren't particularly hygienic. However, as a normal passenger, cleanliness wasn't an issue for me.

Star Ferry Evening Harbour Tour. The evening harbour tour starts with the ferry positioning itself mid-harbour, between Hong Kong island and Kowloon. At 8:00pm the famous evening light show starts, lasting about 15 mins. Being on the ferry is a great place to witness this but can get a little wet! After the light show the ferry continues to do a circuit of the harbour for another 45 mins, making the whole tour a fascinating experience. Definitely one to do when in Hong Kong!

The best way to see Victoria Harbour. The Star Ferry not only provids a cheap conveyance to the residents of Hong Kongit also gives the tourists the best channel to see one of the most photographic harbours of the world. The reasonal low fare , 2 to 3 Hong Kong dollars, gives the passengers a comfortable and enjoyable ride across the harbour. There are two routs,(1) Tsim Sha Tsui Star Ferry, on Kowloon side, to Cetral, Hong Kong side and (2) Tsim Sha Tsui Star Ferry to Wan Chai, Hong Kong. Though the ferry has lower deck and upper deck, there was not much difference except the upper deck is more comfortable.

One of the remaining "Best Deals" in town!. Traveling between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon via the Star Ferry is a must-do!Go ahead and splurge riding on the upper deck for only HKD 2.50 on weekdays and HKD 3.40 on weekends and holidays! Bring your camera and enjoy the view and photo opportunities. A spectacular view of HK Harbor and both HK and Kowloon waterfronts! Suggest you take it both during the day and in the evening!

A "must do" if in Hong Kong. We took the Upper deck one way accross and then the cheaper lower deck on the way back, just to experience both. Very easy to do, buy a token for 16p- 20p each way from the pier for an historical trip across the harbour from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. I preferred the cheaper lower deck as we got to see the sailors dropping the anchor and the workings of the ferry. Slightly cheaper with wooden benches instead of seats but a fantastic trip. Loved it!

value for money and a must go place for both day and night. cos u a few Hk $ around 10 minutes ride and u can see one of the most beautiful harbour in the world. All skycrapers are on yr sides and convention centres waving at you. Take at least 2 trips one in the day and one at night and you will taste the dynamics in Hong Kong. Don't miss it!

Nostalgic!. The Star Ferry has been around for decades and it's still very well received by both locals and tourists. Take the upper deck for a leisurely ride and the lower deck for moving easily around to take photos. And it's a best way to see both sides of the harbour and got a chance of mixing with local people (while sitting comfortably there). Daytime ride is preferred as you can see more of the harbour.

Great View to from the Victoria Harbour. Great view for taking a ferry at the evening and at night.May arrange the itinerary so that you can take this as a transport as well as a viewing spot. The Wanchai <--> Tsim Sha Tsui one takes longer time means having more time for taking photos and enjoying the breeze.

the star ferry. you have not been on the star ferry, well than you were not in Hong Kong, you were in a shopping mall, you did the golden mile, you took the indian tailors, but did not go with the star ferry at least one time up and down, you may not say I was in Hong KOng

breath in city. it's worth to spend some time to have a short trip to cross the harbour by star ferry, although the "journey" is short, only for few minutes. But you can take a look for the real, tradional work in Hong Kong, since the ferry company had been established. So choose the seat in lower deck to see the "sailor" how to cooperate with the others in pier.And that's great from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central, as you can see the amazing city - metropololitan high rise building in Central, especially during sunset, it's really beautiful!

Great Value & Views. The Star Ferry is without a doubt the best way for visitors to cross the harbour. One of the icons of the city (along with the trams on Hong Kong side) and at only HK$2.50 it is exceptional value and a great way to take in the splendor of the city & harbour. I would recommend visitors crossing both daytime and at night to experience the different views on offer. Crossing the harbour on the Star ferry is a 'must do' for any visitor to Hong Kong - don't miss it!

Fresh breeze in big city. Taking the start ferry by night from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central remains one of the high lights of living in Hong Kong. Still so impressive to see those high rising buildings and their llghts

Best way to go to Hong Kong island. This is also a must do while in Hong Kong. Take the star ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central. Upper deck or lower deck is available. Views from both are great. There's no aircon but most of the year thats ok. Board early to get a window seat. I've taken this ferry over the last 20 years and I'm still amazed about the ever changing skyline in this great city.Be sure to buy an Octopus card for your easy travel by MTR, bus, ferry etc. You can also use it to pay at supermarkets etc. No need to carry too much cash.

The must while in HK. There is no better, cheaper and more efficient way to watch the skyline of HK. In addition it is good fun and the ferries are really an attraction. Hint: buy the Octopus card to get access

Never get bored with the spectacular Victoria view. I am a local Hong Konger but I do take the ferry ride often, it's a cheap way to travel from Kowloon side to HK Island. Whether I take the ride during day time or night time, I never get bored of the view and it just gives you the feeling that there is no reason not to fall in love with this vibrant cosmopolitan city. Highly recommend to take the ride from TST to Central since you can see the spectacular skycrapers from afar.

Great angles to photo all the buildings and birds above. its very cheap to ride across the harbour $3. Its a great way to see both sides of the land and big cruise ships in the port. Great angles to photo all the buildings and birds above

Local Fun. You really cannot beat the crossing of the harbour in the Star Ferry. How can they run this service for the price of HKD $2.50 (USD .32)? The view is exceptional and they run all the time. First time users notes you can go from Kowloon to Central or to WanChai.

The cheapest sea voyage in the world!. The Star ferry across Hong Kong harbour is one of the best journeys one can take. This is really a step back into history. The ferries are quaint and maintain a link with the history of the city. On the way one can enjoy the view of the city and get some feeling of the atmosphere of the place. It is relaxing and I like to use the ferry as often as possible as it gives me a short time to relax from this busy city. The price is so cheap and if you are a senior citizen - it's free!

Marvellous old style ferry service. This ferry service from HK island to Kowloon has been in operation for over 100 years. There is also a service from HK island (central ) to Hung Hom which is longer and you can see more of the harbour. Price is low and trip is spectacular , do it a few times ,it is fun. The trip at night is even more fun and you can see the lights, especially at Chinese New Year or Christmas

5 stars for the ferry ride, 1 star for the pier.... I was born in Hong Kong, then lived in Australia from the age of 11 for many years, upon returning to HK, one of few landmark icons which have not changed over the years was the Central Star Ferry Pier on HK island, until a few years ago.The sad news is the government, in the name of progress and development, have dismantled the original star ferry pier on the Central side. Massive protests did absolutely nothing to change these pen pushers' minds and the destruction went ahead despite all the voices against the move. The new Star Ferry Pier on Central side is like a 'disney' version of the original, a little fake, a little far (from the original spot and it's a bit of a hike over the footbridge, so don't carry too much when heading to the Central pier), and a little disappointing for those who have seen the original. However, the good news, is that at least the ferry company did not pack up the old ferries and gone for something modern and luxurious, in fact, lets hope they have engineers in the years to come who can continue to maintain these wonders on the harbour, as they're an absolute joy to be riding on. It's a slow ferry (although it used to take longer - now, it's just simply because the harbour's width is getting narrower, so a 'faster' ride....), but it gives you time to admire the harbour front of HK, allows you time to take a moment to think, reflect on the day you've had, or plan the day you're about to have. It's magical that ferries like this still exist and it's something to be experienced when you arrive in HK. In fact, get on, walk about when you get to the other side, and get back on again, and again, and again. It's cheap as chips and guarantee to be the most economical tourist ride you'll ever be on, and enjoy. Ok, apart from the HK tram perhaps, but that's another story.Last words, don't just try the ferry ride between Central and TST (on the Kowloon side of HK, over Vic Harbour), because you can also take the ferry from TST to WanChai, then from WanChai to Hunghom also. I'll leave the rest of the exploring to you. Enjoy Hong Kong!

Do you want a cheap harbour ride during the light and laser show?. Every day there is a regular star ferry to Wanchai that leaves the Star Ferry PierKowloon Point, Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon at 7:57pm (ie: 3 minutes before the start of the light and laser show). The journey takes about 12/13 minutes so you are 'at sea' for the duration of the 10 minute show. Bag a window seat and this gives you a perfect and every changing view of the show for HK$34 (about 30p).

One of the Great Ferry Rides of the World. You can go first class (upstairs) or second class (downstairs) for well under an English pound or a US dollar. It is a very civilised way to cross to the harbour and far more relaxing and scenic than taking the MTR. Sitting upstairs you get great views of the Hong Kong skyline and resultant photo opportunities. Whilst there are harbour tours offered by the Star Ferry, the basic ferry ride gets you great views, fresh air, most of the time and is still used by Hong Kong people. If you haven't been on the Star Ferry, you haven't been to Hong Kong.
Great way to see HK Harbour for a few cents. This ferry is a HK icon and is a great 10 minute trip across the harbour from Kowloon to HK Island (or vice versa). Worth doing day and night.

A must do. It is in the middle of the city with easy access. One could capture the overall picture of the Hong Kong island across the harbour. Especially beautiful at night of with millions of lights on inside the tall buildings.

Fantastic. The best scenic view of Hong Kong day and night.
And a great price, treat yourself to First class ( less diesel fumes)
The new Terminal is ok but not as convienient as the old one.
Lovely.
Buy an Octopus card for all your Hkg travel

Excellent place to cross the Victoria Harbour. It's amazing every time to cross the harbor by the Star Ferry Pier. Especially when you cross the habour in the evening, splendid sea view by the harbor as you could see all the Tsim Tsa Tsui areas buildings in the limelight. It's really a great ride and the harbor is so beautiful at night time.

Just the world's most beautiful Harbour. Cheapest entertainment in town! Nice to be a spectator or to be seen! Lots of beautiful people, great harbour sight. Spend US30 cents you will have a wonderful cross Harbour trip. Need to go there twice - day and night. Go there at night with your love one, and a bunch of flower! He/she will love you forever! It is sooooo romantic!
Great cheap way to tour HK. It's only a 10 min ferry ride, but you see the whole Victoria harbor quite clearly; also the ferry is still the old style wooden ones that's was used in the old days.
A view of a life time. The trip takes only 10 minutes but the fantastic view will burn into the memory forever. Do it at night to see the skyline of The Pearl of the Orient.

Star Ferry. Cheap as buttons and plenty of them so don't worry if you miss one as another comes along very quickly so getting from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon is easy-peasy. You can walk around the boat if you wish and not miss the views or sit on the wooden benches if you prefer. Remember to purchase your tickets at the barrier before boarding.

Fun alternative. My husband and I watched the Symphony of Lights show and then jumped on the ferry back to the Central Station. The ferry added a special touch (compared to just taking the metro) to our evening. They run frequently all day and evening. Try it out!
A Must to Tour at Night. Only few cents and you will make your dream experience with someone you love, why not go? You will never forget this experience in your life time. Guarantee!

Its not the pier - its the ride. Ok now this is one of the greatest cheap rides in th world (cheaper than the Staten Island Ferry).Go one way Upper Deck and the other lower deck - the smell of the diesel and the bench seats - that's the real Hong Kong.Day or night the ride is different and so you NEED DO IT TWICE.This is the shortest of the many Hong Komg ferry rides but if you loved it try and make time for the trip to Cheng Chau or Peng Chau all from Central Piers

Pleasant boat ride!!. Very enjoyable experience while traveling to HK... A must do for sure! Took this ferry from tst to HK and Sight seeing is great, beautiful views of cosmopolitan Hong Kong, took many pictures while on the boat.

Star Ferry tour. One of the best ways to get a feel of Hong Kong Victoria Harbor is by taking the Star Ferry. They have both a day rate which just goes across the bay and an evening tour which lasts for an hour or so that goes all along the city front. Which ever you choose be sure to bring your camera.... Although I prefer the evening version so you can see the light show. It is by far the best bargain in HK

Inexpensive way to enjoy the night view of Victoria Harbour. An inexpensive way to enjoy the harbour view, especially during night time. The trip is short but you can take the return ride as well. Upper deck is much better because of the engine smell in the lower deck.

Old time fun. It has its quirks. The layout is a bit confusing and some of the benches are very old, but it's a fun place to visit. Wonderful ambience. Very Hong Kong. You should definitely pay the pier a visit.

Go at 7 PM Romantic. Ok,,, forget Light show,,, just enjoy the wonderful Hong Kong view,,and ferry ride,,,, well worth the 18 dollars,, no kidding,, take pics,,, the air ,, music,, ride,, view,,, yes yes yes,, !

star ferry. This of course is something you simply must do when in Hong Kong. The trip across is much shorter than it used to be because of the continual harbor reclamation schemes. The new pier is not as conveniently located on the Island side, although the Kowloon side is in much the same place as it has always been. Probably only worth doing once due to the inconvenient location in Central.

A must in Hong Kong. For a couple of HK dollars you get a trip of a lifetime on the public Star Ferry across one of the world's most famous harbours. You can take the trip to Tsim Tsa Tsui from Harbour Road Wanchai or the Ferry Pier in Central. Perhaps best at night when the towering buildings that line the both sides of the harbour can be seen at their best. The skyline is indeed spectacular. This trip is a must for first time visitors but even those of us who live here regularly take the trip!

A must do when in Hong Kong. We purchased tickets from the machines right before the barriers - 2 adults on the top deck for 2.50 HKD. Make sure when boarding the boat from Kowloon you sit on the left hand side - it will give you the best view of the harbour and cityscape upon approach to Hong Kong island. A quick and inexpensive way to get across and see a great view of Hong Kong.

A great ride for a great price. The Star Ferry is a great institution and up there with the HK tramway. They discontinued the Hung Hom to HK route, so it's only Tsim Sha Tsui to Wan Chai and Central. The new Central terminal is a bit further out than the old one (land reclamation). You get a great 360 view of HK' Victoria Harbour rain or shine, and more interesting when it gets a bit windy or when the waters are a bit rough. No trip to HK is complete without a ride on the Star Ferry.

Launch Point. Star Ferry was quick and unbelievably inexpensive to get to HK Island. It was frustrating that you had to go to HK Island to get to any other islands or locations by ferry. But, the Star Ferry is quick, inexpensive and there is food on both sides to make the wait more pleasant. Happy sailing!

On the Star Ferry. All of the reviews are correct here...this trip over the water is excellent.
Yes get the correct change, yes it looks and is old, and YES the experience is worth it!
Within 15 minutes you are over the other side and enjoyed the harbour.
I would recommend this trip!

Nice experience. I recommend riding the ferry at least once. It's very cheap, but you need exact change I believe. It's 2.80 for the top deck and 2.50 for the bottom (hk dollars). There's quite a bit of history and the views of the harbor are very beautiful. Purchasing the tickets is simple. You just go to the pier and purchase them there. I bought mine using the ticket machines.

Great view with a cheap price. I went to TST from Central by Star Ferry. The walk from Central MTR station was pretty far, but it's not hard to find it. You have to choose to go to the upper deck (go to the upper floor) or lower deck before you buy the ticket, which is very cheap. The upper deck is slightly more expensive, but still very cheap. The ferry itself is not luxurious at all, but the view is! I thought it was some sort of recreational cruise but apparently people use it as a real transportation. I think it's one of the best way to enjoy HK's view, along with from Victoria Peak and from the Avenue of Stars.

I feel like a little kid again!. I did not regret crossing the sea with the ferryalthough it was really short, i'd say its a must do in hong kongThe breeze, the lights, the excitement all that worth an excellent for this review

Great Ride for Less than a Dollar!. This ferry is a great, cheap way to get out on the harbor. The token system is a little annoying, so use the Octopus card if you have it or pay cash (more than a token since it doesn't give change, but still less than a dollar). It takes less than 10 min to ride across the harbor, but I stayed on the boat and just rode back and forth for awhile.

Kowloon to HK Island, Spectacular!!!. Rode only in the Kowloon to HK Island direction (after the SymPHONY of Lights), it was truly magical. Pay the little bit extra to go 1st class, you get the better views from the upper deck and you don't get splashed by water.

Go everytime you're in HK!. It may be a much slower alternative compared to taking the bus or MTR, but whether you live in HK or are a tourist, you absolutely must travel by ferry at least once in your life. The relaxed ambience coupled with the sea water gently crashing on to the boat makes it a great experience, and to top it off, you get no better view of both sides of the harbour than by taking star ferry. There's an infinite amount photo opportunities too! Great for tourists!! The fee is extremely minimal, and if you get a chance then do walk on the promenade, especially on the Tsim Sha Tsui side. If you're lucky on a friday night, you may get to see talented musicians singing & playing popular songs, like maroon 5 and john lennon. It makes for a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Cheapest tour!!. A nice getaway on Victoria Bay. Only $2.5 HKG as of July 2013. Slow ride compare the MTR or taxi but worth the ride. Great views and photo opportunities.

Be ware: there are 2 Star Ferry. Please be ware there are 2 star ferries. Both are running from TST pier to Central Pier. The regular Star Ferry is under the company name: "Star Ferry Company Ltd." This Star Ferry is actually one of the alternative transports beside MTR, so, the ticket is also very economical around 2 - 2.5 $/pax. And at night, you would see the HK island skyline quite spectacular. The main target of this ferry is all the commuter between TST and HK Island.The 2nd ferry is under the name: "Star Ferry Harbour tour". This ferry is mainly for the tour to see the HK skyline and its laser show at 8 o'clock pm. The ferry will stop in the middle of the see for you to see the laser show. The ferry itself looks very fancy with all the bright colorful lighting. The main target of this ferry is all the uninformed tourists who want to see the HK skyline at night with the ferry. The Ticket of this ferry is starting at $170/pax or higher. (YES, believe it).At the end of the day, if you want to watch HK Skyline, both can serve the purpose.
Friendly and Convenient. The workers are very friendly and helpful to foreigners. It is very convenient to travel between central and Kowloon. Can't beat the price.

Good views of Hong Kong. With the low cost of a ride to cross Victoria Harbour there is no reason not to go. The views are amazing. The trip across is short and sweet. Both sides are nice to walk around and enjoy.
A must-do when in Hong Kong. Cheap, reliable, and you get great views of the Hong Kong skyline, day or night it's easy to do - can't fault it.
Romantic. Cheap ride across Victoria Harbour and if you do it during the night in November, a romantic ride and great views of the harbor and the Hong Kong skyline.
Best value harbour cruise in town. What's not to like. Less than A$1 for the best view in town. And you get to go somewhere new. The custard tart shop on the Kowloon side was fabulous.

Trip from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. My hotel is in Kowloon and getting to Hong Kong island is by Ferry , Train or taxi.Star Ferry terminal is in Kowloon and the Ferry to Hong Kong island is $HK3.20 which gets you a token from the ticket machine.The Ferry departs every 30 mins and takes 10 mins to arrive at Central pier Hong Kong island. There are so many fantastic photo opportunities. Its a beautiful scenic city and I really hope that each and every one of you can see it for yourself.Have a great holiday.
A must. Too cheap, too reliable, too easy to not do. Plus, you get great views of the harbor and the Hong Kong skyline. Hop on, hop off, ferries run all the time. A no brainer!

You just have to !. No visit to Hong Kong is complete without at least one trip on the Star Ferry. For HK$2 (or $2.50 for upper class) you get to ride across the harbour on a piece of history. It runs with Chinese efficiency and has some lovely touches such as the bench seats where the backs are moveable so you always sit facing the direction of travel. Just hope on board, relax and take in the scenery
A short cruise. I just used it as a way to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong IslandVery easy and very cheap...At Hong Kong Island, it connect to IFC Mall, so very convenient for me...

A must. One has to travel on the Star Ferry, from Kowloon to Central, to experince life before there were tunnel, or MTR's and now bridges to transport one from Hong Kong Island toKowloon and now Lantau as well. Travelling on the Star ferry will give you the taste of Victoria Habour and all that it has to offer. Inaddition, you can test yourself on the skyline to name the buildings and see how many you get correct. Do it and not just think about it.

This is a Must. You can take the Ferry from 2 different departure points to TST! It leaves from with Wan Chai or Central. The journey is quick and you will need to keep your eyes peeled on both sides to see the most kong sights. You my see junks, to steamers, to cruise ships to cargo vessels, all within the space of few minutes. The ferrymen wear blue tunics and they they hook the ropes to allow you to disembark is an art!The views are magnificent and make sure you have plenty of film/battery available.This is a wonderful very cheap crossing.

Awesome. We happened to ride the star ferry on the fare free day (sponsored by big businesses), but even at full fare, this would still be one of the bargains of the century. A good vantage point to view one of the most scenic harbour cities in the world. Make sure you go on the upper deck for the view.Oh and check out the giant rubber duck near the pier, whilst it's still in town!

A must. With Hong Kong tearing down most of it's past it is wonderful to see an 'antique' still chugging along . The actual ferry ride is so quick it is difficult to absorb all that is going on . People watching , the fabulous views of the skyline , water traffic and the touch that I love , the uniforms of the men who hook the ferry and help it dock . I always imagine how it must have been a century ago , same sounds and smells before all the skyscrapers were built .  Locals joke that with all the reclaimed land expanding , both HK island and the Kowloon side eventually will join . There still is a lot of harbor before that happens , but I hope the Star Ferry's route is never shortened .

SPECTACULAR VIEWS from BOTH sides of the Harbor! Must Ride!. I have taken the Star Ferry at least a dozen times ( Round Trip) and every time is never a disappointment. Traveling with the locals and people from all over the world across one of the most famous harbors in the world is Magnificent unforgettable experience ! The skylines from both sides of the harbor are amazing. Go at different times. For example, early morning, dusk, and at night ( the lighted skylines, unique to HK ) . Take some time to linger, browse,shop, before you board on either side to savor the flavor of the Orient and let it sink in. When crossing, you never know what you will see. A huge Cruise ship coming in at a distance , small oriental craft, or large sea going vessels . Share your stories with the various tourists from all over the world . Don't forget your camera. Take home the Memories.

Still a Great Boat Ride. The Star Ferry is old but retains its character and is a delight to ride from Hong Kong Island across the Bay to Kowloon. On Wednesday this week it was free, celebrating its anniversary. Try to ride both day and night especially just on 8pm when the light show starts.
Brilliant. One of the easiest ways to get from Hong kong side to Kowloon side, The views are awesome and there you can use your octopus card.

Ferry from Hk to Kowloon side. One of the easiest route to get from Hk side to Kowloon side without the battle underground . Timetable is very frequent , hence you get to see the magnificent view of Hk harbor for just a few Hk dollars , highly recommended to all tourist and even locals

The best way to travel in Hing Kong. It only costs about HK3 to travel from Hong Kong island to Kowloon by ferry. If you take a taxi it can cost up to HK150 depending on which tunnel the taxi driver chooses!! Note: West tunnel is most expensive It is so convenient and you don't normally have to wait long for the ferry to arrive.No traffic and you can get across the harbour in about 10 min.It's really convenient and so pretty. You get to see the sites and sit back and enjoy the city. This is the best way to travel in Hong Kong!
Great way to get back and forth . Great way to get around. Views are amazing and there is little to no wait. Everything is well marked and very clean. Make sure you get your Octopus Card

Great antique style and so convienent!. Lovely old ferry services that runs between HKG Island and Kowloon. If you use your Octopus card you only pay $25 and within 10 minutes you have crossed the water and arrive in th emiddle of all the action either in Central or on Kowloon side. A must do!

Great way to go from HK island to Kowloon. It's so convenient and cheap. Plus you're away from the crowded mtr and you get a nice feel of the breeze as well. I always use it and prefer it as an alternative to the MTR when i'm in central and going to kowloon or vice versa.

Best value in Hong Kong. In a city that isn't cheap, this is one attraction that is. Very efficient service. Useful to be able to cross from Kowloon to either Central or Wan Chai, so you can do a loop or avoid using MTR. Good to do both day and night to get a different perspective on the city

Cheapest & Best Attraction In Hong Kong. If visiting Hong Kong make sure you have at least one trip on the Star Ferry from or to Central to Kowloon. It is even better if you are a senior as there is no charge at all. Hong Kong is very caring of its seniors and extends that courtesy also to foreign visitors. It is almost a tradition in Hong Kong and I have been visiting regularly for about 50 years and the Star Ferry remains the one constant in this magnificent city. There are all the high speed ferries plying around the harbour back and forward to various islands and destinations close by (Discovery Bay, Lamma Island, Macau etc.) but this one retains the colour and authenticity of old Hong Kong. It bobs up and down. chugs a bit but the kids love it and it still has a bit of the slow paced world that seems to be left behind in Hong Kong. The 5 stars is more for the experience rather than the attraction itself and the 2 of you can cross this magnificent harbour for less than A$1 (free if your old enough!!!!!).

Easy, great view, and cheap. Getting where we were going (from Kowloon to Central) felt like an experience in itself rather than a chore. We used the token machine and it was less than $1 for two of us to cross. Loved the view, even from the lower deck. Definitely recommended!

A far better way to cross the harbour than the MTR. This is well signposted and really is one of those unmissable things to do whilst in HK. There never seems to be more than a few minutes wait to board a ferry and a nice touch are the old style and very smart naval uniforms all the deck hands and dock workers wear.The views of either HK or Kowloon are well worth seeing and there are plenty of photo opprtunities of these green and white vessels as they go to and from the mainland. The journey can also be made by MTR but is nowhere as enjoyable. I liked it so much, I used it time and again.

Fast and easy. We were lucky that on the day we used it UNIQLO was offering a free ride for everyone. It's cheap when you have to pay anyway. Great way to cross the bay with Ferries every few minutes. Fantastic views of both sides of the city.

Way more interesting than the train. Cheap fare and great views while crossing the harbour. Definitely make sure you catch the Star Ferry instead of always getting the MTR to/from central. Make sure you board on the upper deck for the best views!
Fun way from hong kong to Kowloon. This is a fun ride and you are able to see the skyline of both Hong Kong and Kowloon. It is cheap and his fun day or night.

a must when in HK. To get to one of our evening location we had to decide between taxi and the star ferry and i'm really glad that we chose the ferry. It is very convenient and affordable and one of the quickest ways to get from Central to Kowloon. Views are amazing especially when you go around 8 pm and catch the lightshow.

Fantastic old boats - like travelling in a museum exhibit!. Ridiculously cheap fare. Although it's very short, it's a great trip. The boats are marvellous, fine examples of marine engineering, and it's more like joining the locals than a tourist ride.
Best way to cross the bay. Load on the upper deck for the best views/photos. Great adventure for kids of all ages several times in the same visit to HKG.

Fun to ride. Great ferry service to the other side and back, view are great, day or night. Since locals use it for commute to work etc, and tourists use it to get to more shopping, they really have there act together to manage crowds, and it is cheap, we bought the metro pass and it worked like a charm. I had a little trouble locating the metro stations to go home, signage could be a little better, but we managed, we had good help from friendly residents.

Worth the price and time!!. Worth the view! A 15 min ferry ride from one point to the another for 3 HKD is so worth it. Locals use it for commuting, tourists use it for the sight it offers. Only do it at night, during the day its like any other ferry.

Great ride. The best ride in the city. It has great views and you can't beat the price. Similar to the Staten Island ferry -- a short 6 minute ride between Kowloon and Hong Kong that drops you near the Central District in Hong Kong. You can also get a ride around the island that takes about an hour.

Wish we had this sort of transport in our country. Well miracles to happen...The day I caught the ferry a company had sponsored the ferry and it was for FREE.The ferry is very well organized and even though there are many people - everyone is very civilized - no pushing and rushing.I don't understand why tourists would pay to go on a harbor cruise.For a few coins you can do this ferry.It is a no brainer.I took some nice photos and had a wonderful Starbucks coffee on the other side.I just want to point out that if you are catching the ferry to then connect with the MTR - it is a serious walk. The station is right there but to actually get to the train I sure hope you have your hiking boots on!It is honestly a good 2 kilometer walk.

Laser show. On 7:00pm there were not so many people on a pier waiting for the famous laser show. Nevertheless, at 7:30pm there were a lot! You can see laser show from the terrace on the second floor, but the same view with a less people you can see from the first floor of pier. The laser show starts on 8:00pm and lasts for 12-15 minutes. Lights on high buildings on HongKong island side with a few lasers on the roofs of three some other high buildings lights on the night sky by the sound of music. So, it is interesting to see, but it is not so amazing like you can read in different guides.

Must do: costs next to nothing, splendid views. Often the simple attractions are the best, and this applies to the Star Ferry too... Takes you between the mainland and the island for a few HK dollars: excellent views, and one of the best ways to see the city. Sit back and enjoy the view!

great views. I could have jumped in a taxi and gone directly to a meeting, but I decided to take the ferry and enjoy a relaxing trip across the harbour. The old pier is still in reasonable shape, and works efficiently. The ferries are relatively grotty, but for HK$2.50 then what do you expect! It's one of the best attractions in HK and it is cheap as well ... what more could you want!

Nice way to spend an hour. Took the harbor cruise during the day, don't know if it was really worth the money, not that it was expensive, but you might as well just take the trip across instead. Only difference is you see the shoreline from different sides and its a bit longer. I really enjoyed crossing on the Star Ferry from Central to Kowloon but the harbor cruise was nothing too exciting. Don't get me wrong, it was nice to just lean back and do nothing for an hour but nothing I would do again.Included in the price were some dry "Black tea cookies" and a coke and those cookies were plain nasty *lol* Another thing that made me a bit annoyed was the fact that you got your ticket and had to go up some stairs to wait, then they came and got us all, and took us down the same stairs again, walk across the entire complex and up another set of stairs again. Not a problem for me, but there were some older couples and parents with prams that couldn't really keep up and had problems with the stairs. Why not just take us to the right designated area in the first place?Besides that, it was a nice sunny afternoon :)

A 'Must Do' when you visit Hong Kong. Still the most enjoyable way to cross the harbour and the only attraction / facility we repeated on this visit to Hong Kong. Not even the Peak, Hong Kong Gardens, the Zoo, Ocean Park, Disney, numerous temples and visits to Lantau Island were afforded such status on this visit. There is only time to do so much on each visit to Hong Kong but every visit deserves a ride on one of the ferries. Loads of ambiance, history and a great speedy service.

Nostalgic - hasn't changed in years. Must be the cheapest form of transport in the world and for a few HK$, best views of the never changing, busy harbour. If you don't have time, loads of $$ or simply don't want to do anything else whilst visiting HKG - this you absolutely MUST put on your bucket list.Trip from TST to Central is too quick - although there are other runs to be had. Note: Octopus card accepted - even better, so no mucking around with small coins.

Started our Big Bus Tour at the Star Ferry Pier. This was the best value in travel that we have enjoyed in a long time. We bought the 48 hr Big Bus ticket package. We rode all three lines and really covered the city in our two days. Plus we got a Harbor Ferry tour and The Peak tram tickets and a Sampan boat ride. . .good narration and nice music to accompany us on our journey.

nice and convenient place. if you take the ferry from kowloon to hongkong island, you will definitely see the star ferry pier. The shops there are a tourist attraction by themselves - a glimpse of hongkong. many tourist items are priced almost the same as how they are priced in other shops in TST.

Must do!. What an unique way of transportation ! Apart from tourists it was packed with the locals all going about their way using this terrific mode. Bang on time, spacious wonderful views , inexpensive , definitely one of the to do things while in hong kong.

Easy, affordable, and scenic tour. A must experience transportation whenever you need to get to the other side. You can even use your Octopus card to pay for the trip. Locals and vusitors use this crossing everyday. Morning and evening rush hour can be a pain in the butt.

A Must-Do When Visiting Hong Kong. There are lots of ways to get around in Hong Kong - a top-notch subway, cheap taxis and cheaper busses and trams - but my favorite is the Star Ferry. This line of charming old boats is bit of working history, running from central to Kowloon and back every few minutes. The vessels run back and forth without turning around, so the backs of the seats flip over to accommodate both directions of travel. Sure, the seats are hard and the waters of Victoria Harbor can be a little rough at times (standing while under way is not allowed), but it is fun and offers great views of the city from the water.Be aware that the prices on the weekend jump all the way to HK3.40, or 43 cents US.

A Glimpse of Yesteryear. The Star Ferry is an experience from yesteryear and although of a very short duration is well worth doing.It is the ideal way to travel between Kowloon and HK Island.If you are on a time budget and unable to do a full harbour cruise then this is the ideal way to get a taste of Kowloon and Hong Kong from Victoria Harbour with the spectacular views of the Hong Kong skyline.A must do if you are in HK.

A quick ride across the harbour. We took the quick ride across the harbour on the Star Ferry. It was a good way to travel across and very cheap. You get quick close on the water to some of the attractions (such as the Convention Centre) and can snap some good photos along the way. Well worth the small price.

Like a 'water bug'. The green and white oval shaped ferries scuttle across Victoria Harbour shuttling people across continuously. The ferry is a part of the local transportation system in Hong Kong and a more pleasant way to cross the water than by the underground although it takes more time.The cost is minimal (slightly less for the lower deck). There are more stairs for both getting to the upper deck and leaving the terminals from that level. Lower deck has quicker but there is a hint of diesel fuel as the ferry makes its way. It is fun, though, to watch the sailors from that level as they secure the thick ropes holding the boat in position. They quickly coil the line as the ferry leaves the dock and reach with a grappling hook to catch the rope when the ferry arrives.The upper deck provides some indoor seating areas. On both levels the back of the seats is adjustable in order to be facing forward regardless of which direction of travel.Whether you sit in the Upper or Lower decks, the experience is an integral part of Hong Kong.
A bit of boating nostalgia. What a quick and cheap way of getting from Kowloon to Hong Kong island. Take the hour tour round the harbour for a good guided talk.
Best value in Hong Kong. So easy to use and just 10 HKD each, have change and buy the token and off you go. If you want to sit on top look for the upper deck signs before you buy your tokens.

Best value and "must do" when in HK. I think the Star Ferry is on the list of "1000 things you must do" book and I agree, a trip to HK isn't really "seeing" HK without a ride!Enjoy the old fashioned boat that is a bargain of just over HK$2 which allows you to see the skyline of HK and enjoy the beautiful harbor that HK is famous for. A trip across to Tsim Sha Tsui only takes about 10 mins and it's a great way to get from IFC to the Peninsula to enjoy high tea.A bit hot to do in the summer, but not any stickier than any other mode.

Harbor Ride on the Cheap. Been to Hong Kong twice now and I have to say it's a "must do" each time. Great views of both sides of the harbor and the boats and ships on this waterway. Previous reviewer, ABM583, sums it up quite well.

Must do to really feel hk. its a nice ride...i read somewhere the time it take from one bank to the other is the same time it would take you to read the old newspaper call the hk star. the boats swings a lot from side to side, and are very "characteristic". enjoy

Brilliant. Some things you just have to do. If you are in Hong Kong you have to take the Star Ferry. It is fantastic and one of the cheapest things you can do. You should also take it a couple of time - daytime and nighttime, upper and lower decks.

You have to, don't you...?. Star Ferries are an institution. It is less than 10 minutes to get across from Kowloon / Hong Kong, and its much more convenient to simply get on the MTR. But - you just have to have at least one journey on the star ferry. Boats are from the 1950s, and the technology is 'basic' - but worth it for the views across the water. Do it.

You have been to Hong Kong until you have been on Star Ferry.. For a couple of HKD you can experience one of the surviving institutions of a bygone era, the crossing is actually shorter now than when I took my first trip due to the land reclamation but I never miss the opportunity to cross the harbour on Star Ferry when I visit Hong Kong. Take the crossing after dark when the Hong Kong skyline is at its best combine it with a tram ride on Hong Kong side both will cost less than 5 HKD and you do not need to pre-book or plan!
Fun ride. The Star Ferry is a fun and painless way to travel between Hong Kong and Kowloon. An Octopus card makes travel as easy as possible and a little water spray makes the trip perfect!!

Must Do - Good with kids and for disabled - Also do Harbour Tour!. We travel with two Kids (3 and 6) a little on a budget. We were here on March 20 to 25 in 2013 (I was here also in 1972)MUST GO!!!You do not have to use the Star Ferry to get across to Hongkong Island. You can take the metro (=subway) Don't - Use the Star Ferry!Otherwise you will miss out on one of the most historic and individual, easy to access and travel experiences.How to get there:Just ask for Star Ferry- Everyone knows how to get thereWhat to expect:A rather short boat trip with a very individual view from the water onto Hongkong and KowloonCosts:3 HKD (=EUR 0,30) You can not travel any cheaper than that anywhere in the world I guess.Comfort:Overroofed. First level is also windprotected. Try to go on the top once and at the bottom once.Must Do:Book a harbour tour with the Star Ferry (=110 HKD = EUr 11,- per person) takes about 1,5 houres.. Bring food and drinks.Must do with kids:Be at the front on the top and see the water swirrl when the ferry "hits the brakes". See photo.Small children will love it. Ours did (and I did too when I was small some 40 years ago!)Did you know that:A ferry does have a front and a back. Although the Star Ferry seem to look the same back to front, you can recognize the front at the white pole. The back pole is green.Not so good idea:We thought it a good idea to look at the Lazershow (every night at 20h00) from the ferry, to get the best view from both sides. No good, for you miss out on the music which makes a big difference to the show.We will be on the Star Ferry again, when we visit Hongkong.

Star ferry must do. When in HK you must go on the star ferry especially at night. For about two British pounds you can get the best pictures of Hong Kong skyline at night. Just make same mistake as me and leave flash on!

Harbour Cruise. Definitely a fun thing to do to see the skyline and get a little bit of history on all of the high rise buildings lining it. This is a fun activity with kids too - they will enjoy being out on the boat.
You Have To. It is just something you have to do in Hong Kong. I did not do the tour, but the passage to Kowloon was worth the effort. Just do it.

Something Different. If you are not in a mighty hurry, crossing the straits using Star Ferry is a good option. Besides the MTR, tunnel, public buses, one can cross from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central using the ferry services.
Great night photo opportunity. Great photos of Hong Kong island at night. This is THE place that you see the light show 8pm-8:15pm and take great night photos of HK
Easy way to cross. Very easy, but also quite fun. The crossing is a great ride and will take you to an area where you can get great views of Hong Kong's skyline.

Must do ferry trip. We make it a point to take at least one ferry ride each time we are in Hong Kong. I have taken my son on this since he was 3 on each of our trip to Hong KOng. THis time, we took it from Tsim Sa Tsui to Central. Very short trip, interesting for the kids and nice view. Cheap was too, to travel onto and out of the island.

Definitely a must-try activity in Hong Kong. One of my favourite activities whenever I visit Hong Kong is to take the star ferry to & fro between Hong Kong Island and Tsim Sha Tsui. Thus, when I came back to Hong Kong last year, it was no different. This time round, I was even more keen to take the ferry as I know it offered wonderful photo opportunities. Feel the wind in your hair during the short and comfortable journey between Hong Kong Island and Tsim Sha Tsui (vice versa too) and marvel at the majestic skyline of Hong Kong.Truly, I can't recommend it highly enough.
Easy, quick and cheap!. Easy way to go from the central to tsin sha tsui...in the ferry you can see the sunset at 18:30 more or less and it is really beautiful!!!

Convenient and Cheap !. A must have experience in Hong Kong, we stayed at YMCA at Tsim Sha Tsui and it takes less than 5 minutes to the pier and another 7 minutes bumpy but fun ferry ride to HK island (Central).It cost only $2.40 one way. Don't miss it !

An experience. We took the ride from TST to the island. Its cheap and you can use the Octopus card. The frequency is like almost every 10 mins. Short and enjoyable ride. Experience this once by using it as a mode of transport (instead of the MTR) to the island or vice versa. Must do.

Best little boat ride. The Star Ferry has always been one of my main pleasures in Hongkong, since I first visited 30 years ago. The ride takes just a few minutes, it is shaky but fun. Much better than crossing between Kowloon and island by road tunnel or subway. Don't miss it!

star ferry. we stayed in central district on hong kong island sowere able to walk to star ferry terminal for the ferry to kowloon.the journey takes about 7 minutes,the cost is 2.40 (more at weekends)you can pay using prepaid card or get tokens from machines for turnstiles.we got the ferry to kowloon spent time there then got the other ferry back to wan chai then tram back to central. allows you to see a lot easily

The Star Ferries are the best way to view of Victoria Harbor. Taking the ferries is dirt-cheap, and there's no better way to see Hong Kong than from the water. The ferry route dates back to the late 1800s, with the current generation of ferries having been built in the 1940s.Dodging working boats all way across, the ferries ply the waters of Victoria Harbour. There are substantial waves - principally made of wakes from various working boats in the harbour.This is the best value in Hong Kong.

Not to be missed!. You cannot visit HK and not go on the old Star Ferry! As the harbour shrinks with continued land reclamation the trip gets shorter, but nevertheless it is still great fun and an unrivalled way of seeing the harbour and the buildings. In fact while we were there, every night a 8pm there was a light show which lit up the buildings along the water front, so the ferry was the perfect platform to see the show.You can also buy a harbour tour with the ferry company, something we did not do but I imagine it would be fun.Soak up a bit of HK history and ride the Star Ferry - so cheap and a lot of fun!

Great Way to see the City. If you are in Hong Kong you must take the star ferry, its a 15 minute ride that really gives you a view of the city. I would reccommend taking it at night during the light show.

A MUST when in Hong Kong. My first trip on the star ferry was in 1965; must most recent trip on the star ferry was Jan, 2013. Not much has changed on the star ferry though EVERYTHING else in Hong Kong is vastly different. You can ride in 2 different classes; we prefer the second class which is downstairs - there are lots of locals and also many tourists from all over the world. The winds blowing thru your hair and the waves lapping at the side of the boat all add to the picture - it's an outstanding ride.

Harbour Cruise. Whether this is your first or oft repeated visit to Hong Kong, you should find the time to take the Star Ferry in the evening. It has to be one of the very best harbour cruises available in the world. Once you know the price of the ride you will undoubtedly agree that it is absolutely unbeatable in terms of value for money. A ride in the evening especially from the Tsim Sha Tsui side to the Hong Kong side gives you the best view of the fabulous harbour lights and if you can time your ride to coincide with the usual 8:00 pm laser light show you will be amazed at the sight!

A must do. If your a tourist in Hong Kong, chancesa re your not in a crazy hurry anywhere, these old ferry boats are a great way to travel. The views as you cross the harbour are amazing and constantly changing. It is great to avoid the underground system, nice to do something unique. every time you cross the view is different depending on light levels, time of day etc and its something i never got tired of doing during my week in Hong Kong.There are loads of boats so never much of a wait and they are not priced extortionately by any means.

A must do. If you happen to be in Hong Kong, it is a must to travel between the main island and Kowloon on the ferry. It is very cheap and a wonderful spectacle. I think some of the boats must have beenin service forever, but come rain or shine they travel to and fro, giving the traveller an excellent view of the skyline and harbour.

Star Ferry Pier. We arrived to go across to Kowloon for the afternoon and were looking lost and straight away one of the staff was looking after us we have found so money people so helpful during our trip to Hong Kong it has been great and a must visit
What a star. the star ferries are a very efficient way to get across to Kowloon, they get quite busy but are definately easy to get tickets and extremeley resonable.

Star ferry. This is the connection between Hong Kong Island and Kowloom. It is a very short and inexpensive ride that is well worth the time. Tokens can be purchased at machines on the pier and you can sit upstairs or down depending on which token you purchase. It only takes a few minutes so have camera ready. This is the best way to travel between the two parts of HK.

Convenient ferry, pleasant boat ride. The Star Ferry service was started by a gentleman named Dorabjee Nowrojee in 1898 and has become one of Hong Kong's tourist attractions. The locals and many tourists find it a cheap and convenient mode of transport. Look at it whichever way you want, it's something you must do.Even the boats in use today are from the 1960s. They have a rudder, propeller and helm at both ends so they go one way and return the other. The upper deck is covered, the lower deck is open and more interesting.I've used the Star Ferry every time I've visited Hong Kong and in rough weather and choppy seas the ride can be fun for those who enjoy it.All their boats are named as stars, like Morning Star, Twinkling Star, Shining Star and so on.

A couple of HK$ for a harbour tour? Yes!. If I've been on the Star Ferry once I've been on it a thousand times over the years. Anybody who has been to Hong Kong has been on it at least once. It only stops for Typhoons.By far the most pleasant and cheapest way, if not the fastest, to cross the harbour. It is best at night when you can see the lights. If you're smart you can time it for the light show around 8pm.There are routes at between Tsim Sha Tsui (Kowloon side) and Central or Wanchai (both on the island). The Wanchai-Tsim Sha Tsui route is the best.

Cheap and efficient. Not only is it the cheapest way to travel between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui (only $2.50 per crossing) it's possibly the fastest, too. Coming from the UK I'm used to over-regulating and long delays, but this was anything but time consuming. Simply buy the token (if you don't have exact change there are machines to buy tokens which give change) and wait for the next ferry. Maximum waiting time for me was about 5 minutes. There is no faffing with leaving and arriving the piers and the doors open to let you on/off within a couple of minutes of reaching the piers. The crossing itself was great as you get to see both central and TST coastlines and it only takes 5-10 mins, but I can imagine it can get very cold on a bad day if you don't have a jacket.

A great treat. There is always lots of interest on this ride across the harbour between Kowloon and HK island. Boats are bustling past all around you as you enjoy the Hong Kong skyline in the background. The crossing is cheap and frequent but you might have to be quick to get the best seats.

Must take if this is your first trip. Must take Star Ferry if this is your first trip to Hong Kong. It is just 5 minutes walk from Tsim Sha Tsui MTR and no need to buy ticket as you can use Octopus card to pay. It will be better to travel from Tsim Sha Tsui to Wan Chai ferry terminal as your can enjoy a longer ride with better picture of both sides (Hong Kong and Kowloon). Try to go during off peak hours or weekend - less crowded.
Star Pier. Dirty and very smelly on occasions it is also the area for a large protest group. The ferry sevice though is quick and cheap.
Great transport to get from HK island to Kowloon. Cheap and fast service! Keep it up!You should open the lower deck as it will bring in more customers and increase revenue.
Another must do!. The shops & restaurants and also the views are lovely. There is so much to see & do here and you will not be disappointed.

Simple pleasures. Definitely any trip to HK should include a boat ride across the harbor. It's a simple quick ride with amazing views of the city on either side. You've got to move quick to get a seat by the window or in the front of the boat because everyone rushes for those.
Another Must Do in HK. A must do experience with fabulous views and very reasonably priced. Sit in or out. Easy to board and very frequent.
A pier. Its a ferry pier thats all. Convinient way to cros between islands of Hong Kong but not an atraction to see...

Very handy and frequent. Good , ferry was there very frequent and was close by.
we had free ferry with big red bus tour, very quick
The Coolest and cheapest way to cross Victoria harbor. It's Fast, it's cheap, it's historical, it's fun....in 5 min you are from Central to Tst for less then 3 Hk$ u got the boat trip.

Impressive. I come from the country that is get used with the ferry things but when i came to the ferry pier in Kowloon to cross to Macau it was impress me with the very good standard and service of the staff from the ticketing until boarding and the ferry interior itself is clean, modern, and comfortable. I wish my country can do the same.
Can't beat it. Cross the harbour for a few pence and take in the spectacular views - both by day and by night. Unbeatable and great value.
Star ferry. One of the must-go activities when you travel to Hong Kong. It is cheap for a trip and the ferry station is located at the most popular tourist centers.

Nice trip. Really nice and inexpensive way to cross from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon, and see the city from the water. The staff was really friendly, and if you time it properly the light show on Victoria Harbour starts at 8pm. Lots of history, try and fit it in.
Great crossing. The Star Ferry is the only way to cross the harbour, when you get on move the seat back to the other side so you are facing the way you are travelling!

The cheapest way to see Hong Kong Harbour. I took the Star Ferry quite a few times, the Piers are old but they are so typical of the area, they are clean and easy to navagate. The Ferry is cheap, make sure you take the upper deck, it just costs a few cents more, the view whilst crossing the harbour is wonderful. When you get to Hong Kong, go to the nearest MTR and get an Octopus travel card, they cost HKD150 of which 50 is a bond for the card and 100 of credit for travel, it can be used on the ferry's, MTR, Maxims bakery, Pacific Coffee, Starbucks, 7 Eleven and a tonne of other stores, best value and most convienient card every made, pitty we are not that smart in Australia.

TurboJet to Macau. We found the China Star Ferry terminal to be well-marked and easy to navigate. We took the TurboJet service to Macau, so I can't say anything about the ferry service to Central, but the terminal itself was well laid out, clean, and easy to find your way around. There was a taxi stand right downstairs in the terminal, so it was easy to get a taxi when we came home at the end of the day.
Star Ferry. An amazing experience and convenient trip across the harbour. Incridible good value and frrequent service.
A nice ride. It is a pleasant way to go back and forth from Kowloon to HK Island and marvel through the beauty of Victoria Harbor. The fare is cheap but the experience is priceless.

Excellent - should not be missed!. Fantastic and exotic - complete with very strange ATM set up to get your money (the numbers are reversed from the European system). You MUST MUST MUST take the star ferry, it is a great experience, and it costs very little.
Buzzy. Very busy old terminus, great for a wander in the evening. Lots of Chinese propaganda against Falun Gong. Don't accept all you read - get the full facts

Efficient!. Star Ferry is very good and clean Pier. They have a friendly and helpful staffs. The best way to take a ferry boat is by octopus card. Which can save you time buying a ticket and avoid queue.

Does it still exist?. inflation is hot, ferry needs to increase fares, the company is experiencing loss, i doubt till when it will still be running, besides, the surroundings are over-developed, i saw a lot of mainland visitors, or asian maids, it dos not quite really feel like a place of hong kong

Enjoyable way for crossing Victoria Harbor. Star Ferry trip from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon is a must in your visit to Hong Kong. It is the best and cheapest way to see Victoria Harbor and both coast. On your way down think that it is crossing Victoria Harbor since 1880’s.
Basic, But so Cheap!. easy as transport, does the job and gives you a view at the same time. costs barely anything to ride.

Regular and efficient. Plusses - as the title says, plus clean and very easy to use. Dead cheap! A good way of getting around and not crowded when we aere there. Very helpful and friendly staff. Lovely to see the sights from the water.
Minusses - non that come to mind!
Must do trip!. Get to Kowloon via the circa 1958 boats. Cheap to do and a great way to explore Hong Kong. Crossing takes around 15 minutes, us ethe MTR to get to the docks.

nice 1 hour tour. its a one hour tour between Hong Kong island and Kowloon, giving you good information about both cities on the go, you can have drinks or food inside the boat as they have restaurant.
Simple and nice pier. With everything so modern, Star Ferry pier is a piece of history very well accessed from Hong KOng Island as well as from Kowloon.

boat tour. Hongkong is a city which you have to see from the otherside (Knowllon),(It is like Newyork you have to watch New York from New Jersey side) Therefore go Kowloon and when you return take Star Ferry from Kowloon and wathc the city view, day and night will be good but my advise is night tour
A must do thing in Hong Kong...... Cheap easy and convenient locals and tourists alike use this mode of transport to travel between HK island and Kowloon specifically.

pay more - keep dry. pay the extra 50 cents to go on the upper deck.
It is less crowded and you don't get wet!
.....and 50 cents is all of 4 pence!

scenic ride. We rode the ferry at least six times in our three days there. It's not only a scenic ride with a chance to be out in the harbor where you can see both sides at the same time, it's also an economical way to get around. Whether you stay on the Kowloon side or the Hong Kong side, you will want to go back and forth for sightseeing, restaurants, whatever. Enjoy the ride and the view.

Wonderful view and relaxing ferry ride!. This is a must ride when you visit Hong Kong, to feel how it is to take a leisure short ride across Victoria Harbour, to smell the sea water without freezing, to enjoy the skyline for a fraction of cost.It’s nostalgic as you taste the light salt water breeze that takes your mind off of the super busy city while you mesmerize how it was years ago. There are a few small eateries along the pier-- gelato, bakery, McDonalds, Starbucks to name a few. There is also the Hong Kong Tourism Board where you can find out where else to visit, and a newsstand. Note this is no American pier with organized look and feel, but more self-contained shops.This is also a popular place to check it out before your shopping spree at the Harbour City.

This is Hong Kong. I can't think about our 3+ week stay in HK without thinking of the Star Ferry Pier. We were on the Star Ferry almost every day. It truly is iconic, and best of all it is the least expensive, and best overall, way to cross Vic Harbour. Go ahead and splurge, take the 'first class' seats, they are I believe HK$2.50 v HK$2 each way. (both are less than $1 US)
Quick and Easy. Very quick from one side to the other, always seems to be one in or just coming in. Ferry that is. And you have to do it don't you, if you are visiting.

Relax and be sure if a seat. The ferry is not as busy as it once once was but it still remains a treat if you are not in a hurry. The seats are clean and it is good to hear the polite request for travellers i.e westerners, not to put there dirty shoes on the seats.The trip from Central to Kowloon or vice versa only takes a few minutes but it provides a rekative oasis of calm and a breath of "fresh (?) air " .One real bonus is that the trip is free with an Octopus pass for elders. I always take at least one trip each visit just for the nostalgia.

So worth it. I spent only around 2HKD each going from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui, then immediately from Tsim Sha Tsui to Wan Chai. Both ways were really really fun (it was windy on the boat!), the boats came very quickly and the view was great! If you're tight on time, I would really suggest riding the Star Ferry. The absolute maximum amount of time taken to cross the harbour twice (including waiting time) is 40 minutes and you get to see so much of Hong Kong.

Star Ferry shouldn't be missed!. What a great experience. The old ferries crossing between Kowloon and HK island is a must do.The short ride gives a super view of the skyline and harbour. No reason to pay for a day tour... just take the regular ride across and back. If you want a thrill however take the 1 hour harbour tour at night and see the lights. Best thing we did in HK.

A must do!. After a long bus journey we decided to use the famous Star Ferry across to Kowloon! Something you have to do! It was evening and all the high rises were lit up, as it was nearly Christmas, it all looked pretty spectacular!

Nice breeze. Expect a slow cruising ride across the islands if you are not in a rush. It was enjoyable to get away from the usual packed MTR subway/stations. The view could have been better if it wasn't spoiled by the hazy condition. Cool sea breeze during this time.... Remember to go for the upper deck.

Nice little ride. Frequent service and easy to manoeuvre with older people. Really nice way to get from the Kowloon Peninsula to Hong Kong Island and back again. Smooth journey (I didn't even realise the boat was moving at first!!). Great snapshot of the harbour.
fantastic view. The trip was about 5 minutes. But it was very cheap $2.5 . A very relaxing journey with spectacular view . Try to avoid peak time.

For the 30p fee, you can’t go wrong.. The ferry chugs across the harbour from Kowloon to HK in a few minutes. It’s a quick ride – about ten minutes I guess – and there are usually seats available on the first crossing you turn up for. The fee is 3.40HKD each way.

Is Star ferry the best short and cheap water journey of the world??. Brilliant views, comfortable and wholly reliable ....!Not sure, though about the air pollution of at least one of the ferries.But all or most is forgiven. Star Ferries are brilliant and essential icon THanK YOU

Star Ferry Pier. come down to the Pier and the ferrys will take you anyway around Hong Kong harbour. cruised across to Kowloon and returned at ourr own leisure., If youi know Sydney and the ferries this is way better.

Nothing to write home about. Unlike the former Queen's Ferry pier, which was bustling with shops and near the City Hall Concert Hall, this one is ugly, with only large fast food chain outlets. It has poorly located lifts and the whole pier is far from anywhere. If you wanted to slowly strangle the ferry business this would be as good a plan as any. What a pity!
Nice way to Tour. We took a taxi to the Ferry and cross the river and we enjoyed the fresh air.It is very cheap but remember to carry some coins with you.
You must do this. If you want decent pictures of HK, then you have to be on the Kowloon side. The Ferry is the obvious choice. Its fun, cheap, clean, historic, busy, commuters, tourists. A must do.
The Ferry Ride is good, pier is OK. I always take the ferry when I visit Hong Kong. The views from the ferry are spectacular and the price cannot be beat. The pier itself is just OK, nothing special.

Quick and efficient but crowded. We liked the efficiency that we experienced. Easy to pay fare and quick loading and unloading at destinations. The ferries may have been old, but very well maintained.
take the ferry. It's all about tourists in Kowloon. Take the ferry to the Hong Kong side. it's very inexpensive and a nice view.

A little bit of 1950's history. A small corner of Hong Kong as it used to be, under British rule - the ferries are extremely efficient, very cheap indeed, and quite the best way to see both Kowloon and Hong Kong. The architecture of the Pier is both attractive and utilitarian.
must take a trip across the bay at night. a must for any traveler and only cost you 2hk$. A truely amazing city and always enjoy my trips as i discover something new every time.

Old charm of Kowloon. The edge of the Kowloon peninsula would be be empty without the pier. Though the place looks old , the pier still has it's old charm, I wonder how the place would look like had they changed it to a modern steel and glass structure ? A must see in Kowloon !

Hong Kong heartbeat. This is a bustling part of Kowloon. You can't miss it as it is one of the city main heartbeat. First of all, the view over Victoria skyline is spectacular from there. But also this is an unescapable place to take a ferry across the bay. The nearby clock tower is also a definite landmark in Hong Kong. It is nice to walk along the bay esplanade that runs from the pier along the channel between Kowloon and Hong Kong island.

Inexpensive Harbour Tour. This ferry is just the best way to go between Hong Kong City and Kowloon. 2nd floor, sky lined harbour on both sides. It's inexpensive, never overly crowed since it is very frequent.Day is wonderful but after dark, all the buildings are lit up in every shade of the spectrum, just breathtaking.

One of the cheapest and most spectacular things in the WORLD to do. I absolutely love the Star Ferry. For how cheap it costs, it really has to be on your list of things to do when visiting Hong Kong. Whether riding in the day or at night, the views are guaranteed to be as spectacular. The last time I went on it was at night a couple of days before Christmas, when lots of the buildings on Hong Kong Island were covered in neon Christmas messages, it was fantastic. You don't have to wait long for a ferry at all and they run until about 11pm at night so they are really accessible. They are plenty of seats onboard but I like to stand up and get the breeze as we're crossing, it's such a magnificent and surreal experience, overall it takes about 10 minutes to cross the water depending on which pier you travel from.My review title must sounds quite dramatic but it's completely true. Hong Kong Island and Victoria Harbour is so incredible that taking the views in via the Star Ferry does make it one of the best things in the world to do particularly as it's so so cheap as well. Lots of facilities at the ferry terminals too: toilets, food and drink outlets. If you were pushed whether to do it in the day or at night I'd definitely go for at night, all the lights make quite a spectacle.

STAR FERRY THEN AND NOW. When I think of Star Ferry Pier it is the old pier on Hong Kong side known to anyone who lived in or visited Hong Kong before the Millenium. The old pier was adjacent to the Post Office and to City Hall, which were both on the waterfront, so more convenient than the new pier which is out on the reclamation. Minibuses stopped right in front of the pier and the bookshop provided a good place to meet up with a friend. This was before the days of mobile phones!Compared to the new pier it was a bit scruffy but adequate. The new pier is quite magnificent. Built in the old style it boasts restaurants, shops and cafes.Although the Harbour has shrunk considerabley over the years, the Star Ferry ride is should still be near the top of the list for visitors. Nothing quite compares with the view of Hong Kong either by day or by night. You can see that I am heavily biased!

Bustling Hong Kong. If you want to experience the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong while getting a great view of the skyline then take the Star Ferry. An iconic and amazingly cheap way to travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.

easy short trip to cross harbor. Instead of taking the subway; try the time honored old fashion Ferry Boat crossing--short break, but worth the trip just to get the vista of the harbor of both side of the great city. Night travel will dazzle anyone with the lights!
convenient and great views. thrilling way to go between Kowloon and HK island; the views of the skylines from the ferry are amazing. The trip is short and frequency varies from 6 to 12 minutes.

Excellent way to travel. Going to and from Kowloon couldn't be easier. Much nicer to take the upper level. If you go to the train station for an octopus card makes travel very easy. If you are over 60 it is free

Clean and good signage. Catch the Star Ferry here or the bus to the Peak Tram. If you purchase an Octopus Card from the metro station you can use this for your trains,buses and ferry rides by swiping your card At the entry and exit gates which is quicker than cash or buying tickets.

Riding is a MUST. I liked everything about it - the low fare, the cool breeze and the wonderful view. If you're a tourist/traveler, it's still the best (and cheapest) way to travel from Kowloon Island to HK Island. Make sure to have your cameras ready before you board the ferry because you won't be putting it down during the entire 10-15 minute trip. The views from here are fantastic!

Cheap and awesome ride. This ferry goes between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. The ride is quite short, but the views are absolutely fantastic. Although there's a ton of people that ride these ferries, the wait is quite short. The best part of this "attraction" if you can call it that, is the low price. I'm not sure if anybody takes this ferry for actual transportation. I think more for people that take it just to take it. As in to sit back, relax, and enjoy the view and short ride. As a tourist, this is definitely a must do. If you can, ride it multiple times. Once in the day and once at night.
