It beats paying for the Aqua Luna boat ride when you basically get the same views for a fraction of the cost.

A Cheap Alternative To A Harbor Cruise. At only $2.00 (Hong Kong dollar) per person this is a very cheap alternative to a more expensive Harbor cruise. It's quick, but you get to see so much of the beauty of the skylights in Hong Kong. Well worth the ride.
Short Ferry Ride is a treat. The Star Ferries run regularly between Kowloon and Hong Kong. It is a short ride across the harbour with wonderful views of the skyline. Was a very comfortable trip.

Loved the ride. When we first arrived in HK, we just got on a ferry and rode back and forth just for the experience! Eventually we worked out where we wanted to go and enjoyed several ferry rides from this pier.

Nice view with cheap ticket. It's all about Hong Kong you can see in the Victoria Harbour. Imagine that the small fish village turn to big city, all stories started from the Star Ferry, Cheap ferry ticket, nice nightview. Busy but peaceful when you go for a ride in the ship.
harbor view of honkong. mainly the harbor view is excellent. u can see all skyscrapers at a single moment. More then the light show the climate and skyscrapers were awesome
Great ride across the Harbour. Inexpensive 10 minute tour across the Harbour.wonderful views, frequent ferries, very easy access .quaint boats, wood detail interior.

Kickin' it Old School. For those that want to experience Hong Kong pre 1980s when there was no MTR this is the transportation must-do when crossing the harbour. Still is very cheap ($3-4 HKD) and will be a great 10 min ride across the harbour from Tsim sha tsui to either Wan Chai or Central pier. Go at dusk for the best views.
Part of Hong Kongs history. Hasn't changed in years, still worth a visit and a trip across on the ferry. The sky line is continually changing
best travel deal between Kowloon & Central. for HKD2, how can you go wrong? But this was because we spent most of our time between Harbour City & Central.

Must do!. If you go to HK and do not ride the Star Ferry you are missing out! Its a nice relaxing ride across the water and you can view the beautiful skyline while you do - what more could you want? A definite highlight to a HK visit.
A must do in Hong Kong. Very cheap mode of transport to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. This iconic ferry is worth taking for the views alone!

Just Fantastic. Take the ferry by day and enjoy the bustle of the harbour and the view. Take the ferry at night and enjoy the sky line. At 8pm there is a laser light show. All for about 25 pence each way.

so handy and cheap. for $2.50 hong kong dollars, you get a comfortable 5-10 minute ferry ride across the harbour. it allows you to take photos of the skyline if the sky is clear.
an excellent way to and from either side of the harbour
Cheap, efficient and fun. The ferry was cheap and a great way to see the harbour. At 4.30 pm it wasn't crowded and I'd recommend it.

must do activity. If you are looking for activities after shopping, visit this area you will see the nice lighting show. Worth visit.You will get a night pictures of Hongkong. And it's free of charge!
(please check date and time before go)

Old Guys go free!. As I recall, my first trip on the ferry the price was 15 cents coach and 20 cents first class. We went coach! What an enterance to Kowloon. It's about a 15 minute ride and a perfict time to rest your legs for the marithon of Nathan Rd. with all the shops

The only (fun) way to cross the harbour. The Star Ferry is an institution in Hong Kong, loved by tourists and locals alike. The 5 or 10 minutes acros the harbour on a nice day is a great experience.And for once, you can save money and get a better experience! Use the lower deck entrance, and you can look down into the immaculate engine-room, watch the crew use the ropes, and watch the skipper pilot the ferry safely across the channel. Great!And although the ferries are all locally made, the polished brass and wood wheels in the wheel-houses have "Greenock, Scotland" cast into them - an added bonus for any Scotsman crossing the harbour.Finally, the new ferry pier at Central may be a modern interpretation of the originals, but still offers the look and feel of the old ones, but with better catering, toilets and other functions.

a must for epic views. meet the locals at the market close by, so many smells, sights and noises to explore. on the ferry see fisherman and a view of the city is amazing. the plane landing at night is thrilling going through the skyscrapers

Must do, but nth impressive. Normal i guess, but the ferry do leave very frequently, you don't have to wait long. The ride was pretty quick, about 10 - 15 mins across the sea. Definitely better than the Aberdeen boat ride that I sat while at HK. Go at night to see the lightings of the skyscrapers.

Easy to navigate to Hong Kong central. We grabbed a taxi from our hotel down to Star Ferry Pier for around $6 AUD and then paid less than $1 for us to take the ferry over to central Hong Kong Island (cheaper and probably quicker than taking a taxi the whole way...more scenic anyway). The token system was easy to follow in English.

Star Ferry. This was a quick way to travel to Hong Kong Island from Kowloon. We purchased a Octopus card which can be used in all modes of public transport. Well worth purchasing the card, cost is HK$150 which is around 15 GBP.

Dollar for dollar the best value in Hong Kong. Both practical as a means of transportation and spectacular as a tourist trip, the Star Ferry is cheap, fun entertainment. We were lucky to be returning to Kowloon from Central one evening while the light show was taking place. Very memorable for the cost a buck!
Great value. Run every 10 minutes and only 2.50 hong kong dollars each way and the views are amazing, well worth the trip just for the views

Best value travel. The Star Ferry is worth every cent just to sit on and go back and forth Kowloon and Hong Kong especially at night and the low price unbelievable. The piers on either side has food and refreshments available.
a little boat ride. looks like the most insignificant form of transport but a ride on this little boat gives you a nice sea/ground level view of not 1 but 2 sides of the hk shores!

Authentic Hong Kong. Authentic, historic and a great was to take in views of Victoria Harbour and the Hong Kong skyline. The Star Ferry is such an authentic experience and synonymous with Hong Kong. I used it each day to travel between Central on Hong Kong Island and Tsim Sha Tsui on Kowloon. It is super cheap and if you already have an Octopus Card then you can take the Ferry without needing to buy a token each time. I preferred being on the lower deck as it is not enclosed and you get better views.

Board the history of Hong Kong. The best way to see the harbour of Hong Kong and also the cheapest. There are two routes: from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui and from Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui. The ferry has extended hours (until 11 and 11.30 pm according to the route) and it runs very frequently. For nicer views, board on the upper deck (from the station since you cannot change deck once on board).

Easy to use without knowing the language. Make sure you have change for the ticket machine. Easy to use and because the Chinese are such orderly respectful people, the wait in the terminal, boarding etc was very smooth.

Cheap ride, excellent views and experience!. A must-do when in HK! You get to cross the harbour in less than 10 minutes.Not only is the ride dirt cheap (HK$ 2-2.5, you'll get a great view of the harbour. From Central to Tsim Sha Tsui (and vice versa). Lots of photo opts. You'll get to see how the star ferry staff man the ferry the good ol fashioned way. When you're at the pier, head upstairs to ride on the upper deck and stay on the ground level and enter from there if you just want to sit on the lower deck. It's more breezy on the upper deck.The last rides are at midnight.The Tsim Sha Shui pier is just a stroll away from the Avenue of Stars and the Clock tower.

There's Nothing Like it - Fabulous History. I always think of Star Ferry in terms of 'if you haven't been on it then you've missed out on a big part of history.' It's cheap [still], busy, full of the old Hong Kong, it provides magnificent views across Victoria harbour and it's top of the list of places to visit in HK.
Very convenient. Ferries are most convenient to move around in HongKong. They are on time and not so crowded like the MTR. Offers lovely view of the harbor too.

Very cheap fare. Rather than taking a cab to cross Kowloon to Hong Kong side, try taking the Star Ferry. It's faster, cheaper and effective way to go around Hong Kong. I just love that they have this mode of transport because taxi fares can be so expensive.
Authentic. Got to travel on this as it is part of HK history, short journey and you can get great views of the skyline.
Must Do!. Great chances for photography of the awesome HK harbourview. I recommend taking the night ferry. It would be mostly empty and give you plenty of chances to take photographs
Have to say you did it. This is the way to cross, and it's nice to see it's still genuine, not a tourist attraction. The ferries are old and the crowds are mostly local.

Riding From the Past. It feels like you're riding from the past on this boat. Of course, the boat structure is like a "Mississippi steam engine boat". This should be on your itinerary list. We experienced all kinds of transportation in Hong Kong like trams, bus, trains, etc. Pound-for-Pound rating in terms of "value of experience" in relation to "cost", this is the top-ranked attraction. The fare range from HK$2.0 to HK$3.4.
Ferry Across the Bay. Historic, well used and a must for every traveller. The ferry's are frequent and old but give you a birds eye view of the skylines as you cross the bay

an absolute experience. A really good experience and great value to see both sides buildings from the water. The easy ticketing machine gives tokens which are easy to use. The pier is clean and efficient.
The ferry and pier. I liked that we could use the same card for the subway and the ferry....it was a very nice experience to take the ferry across the harbour.

Love it!. Every single time we had to pass the harbour we take ferry - much cheaper than subway and giving much more fun, especially on a hot day - wind works better than any airconditioner :) . No matter what time of the day you take it, it's still wonderful. If you stay for few months I suggest making 'octopus card' to move around city, that includes also ferries rather than exchange coins into plastic tokens every single time you take a ferry. They go very often, I think around every 10 minutes so don't worry if you miss a ferry. One more suggestion is take a night ferry before 20, then wait for light symphony on TST side

On the Edge of the Island. A fun place to be, watching the water traffic, the Hong Kong skyline, and having a bite to eat! It's also the place to pick up your tour buses, and these are well worth investing in to give you an overview of the city and its environs.

A happening place. Went from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island just before Christmas. A great place for a stroll, to take pictures of the magnificent waterfront or have a meal at one of the may restaurants. Took in the fantastic laser and sound showalong with several other thousand people. I don't know if this was just for Christmas or is done on a regular basis but is not to be missed. If just at Christmas time I was very lucky to have experienced it.

Star Ferry you've gotta do it. An absolute Hong Kong institution, if you're visiting for a few days you have to ride it even if you don't really need to. I took the trip from Central to Kowloon late one afternoon and then took a very plesant walk along the Kowloon waterfront. The ferry is perfectly organised and gives spectacular 360 degree views of the famous HK skyline as you cross. If you're using Octopus card to pay it couldn't be easier. Definitely one of the world's great working ferries.

Star Ferry ride a must. A visit to Hong Kong would not be complete without a ride across the bay on the star ferry. You can see both sides from the middle of the harbour so a great place for pics of the skylines.

Nice option to have a boat trip. This is a very cheap way (2.5 HKD) to see HK's skyline. Very nice views from a different perspective than from the peak and of course much cheaper than tourist boat cruises with the same views. It just takes you some minutes to cross the river but you really can enjoy. For me also a must do in HK. We came from Kowloon and left the ferry in Central, there we immediately jump in bus no 15 for the trip to the peak, so also very good in combination to another attraction.
Antique. A ferry boat with long service years and history. Faster to ride in train than the ferry and this will remain a memory to most HK people.

Harbour view of the Hong Kong Skyline!. To get a good view of Hong kong beautiful skyline, one can get on the star ferry. It lasts an hour. There are many ferry stations, one in kownloon, central, wanchai.We took the ferry from kowloon side in the day time. There is commentary on board so it was good.You can get good photos in the day. Of course, if you want evening photo shoot, you can take it at night but you may not be able to see the building clearly.We enjoy the trip. Just go to the star ferry ticket counter and buy the tickets. The ticket comes with a complimentary drink and snack, so quite a good deal.The locals take the normal ferry which just go from one point to another.The ferry is one way to avoid traffic jam.Gorgeous view and very peaceful as we cruise along to just enjoy an excellent scenic view of Hong Kong City!

Dream fulfilled!. Riding the Star Ferry was at the top of my list of must do's while in Hong Kong. As a first time visitor, I found the signage and experience easy to navigate, and rode it all four days of my visit. Ensure you have HK monies to purchase a token ($2.50) and purchase a return ticket. Better still, do a Hop on, Hop off tour - the return fare is included in your purchase. While we use it for pure tourist purposes....it is commuter transportation for the locals. Choose the time of your experience wisely.It's a great way to be "on the water", enjoy the vistas of both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, and especially grand at night while taking in the building lights. Treat yourself and imagine having taken it's maiden voyage in 1880.
Nice.. A nice little ferry to go form one island to another. Is a quite, sort trip, perfect to take a little break. If you couldn't go, don't worry, its not a must do.

Must do this. You must take the Star Ferry across the harbour - it's much quicker than it used to be as the harbour has been reclaimed for building but this is an iconic part of Hong Kong's history and not to be missed.

ferry ride is good. The Pier is not attractive! The old ferry ride across form Hong Kong Island to Kowloon is! and cheap, 3 HK$ each. and scenic. We went at night to enjoy lights on both sides. It is a working ferry so no cruise refinements.
star ferry a must. crossing to Kowloon on this ferry gives you the opportunity to see the very modern Hong Kong alongsidde the traditional

Experience Victoria Harbour. Star Ferry is a great experience for first time visitor. It has a great view of Hong Kong island skyline as well as Kowloon skyline. The ride takes approximately half an hour between Tsim Sha Tsui and Central. The star ferry is great sightseeing but it is not a sighseeing boat. A lot of locals use it as form of transportation. Be aware of people pushing past you to get a seat or rushing off the ferry to get somewhere.
Star Ferry Attraction.... A little over-rated but still a nice boat trip on a pleasant day and tourists do love it! A must is the view from the mens toilet on TST side -- prime!

Clean but no discipline. It's cold during winter. The place is clean. But the passenger do not really care about the discipline. Some of them walk very fast and will push you aside so that they can get their seat. NOt a very good experience.

It works efficiently. Even for a first-time visitor to Hong Kong, the pier is easy to navigate, the ferries run to schedule, make sure you buy your token. Everyone catches the ferry, it's the best way to go.

This is a must do at least once. Great uninterrupted of the city skyline on both sides. Wan Chai (the convention centre) to TST or the other way is best as it has to run parallel with the skyline for a bit. Like the trams and MTR its very cheap way to travel.

wonderful memories. My first experience riding the Star Ferry from Kowloon to HK was 30 years ago when the airport was still in Kowloon and the only way across was by ferry. This was a mandatory thing to do on my most recent trip with my kids (their first to HK and overseas) and the smiles on their faces confirmed that this ride will also be etched in their memories.

A blast from the past. You feel like it's decades ago as you tromp the boards to your ferry. The boats themselves are wonderful throwbacks -- the service is super-efficient and incredibly cheap. Plan to ride the Star Ferry back and forth and forth and back!

You Must!!. Couple of bucks for a ride on an old ferry across the harbour from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central on Hong Kong Island.Great views, terrific old timber boat and cheap. Why wouldn't you. As you get on on the Tsim Sha Tsui side make sure you grab an egg tart as you walk up the ramp (HK$5). They are delicious (but you aren't allowed to eat on the boat).

Wonderful cheap fun!. The historic Star Ferry takes one back and forth between Hong Kong and Kowloon. Its old, wooded rails and seats are a nice break from the new and old and crowded of Hong Kong. Take it from HKG over near the Museum of art and see the Andy Warhol show, awesome!

Easy transfer from Tsim sha tsui to Central. Lot of fun to travel on this ferry! We can reach Central in less than 10 mins. Views are simply awesome. Feels like, you are in the sea, surrounded by huge buildings!

to be experienced. I love it. quaint. historic. a heritage of hong kong. you feel like you're transported back in time. and the experience of crossing the harbour on the water is just magical, especially at night when the lights are up on all the skyscrapers.but i have to stay in stinks though. the water stinks, and the pollution from the fumes coming out of the ferry. just adds to the already atrocious air quality here.
The best way to see Hong Kong's skyline. The best way to see Hong Kong's skyline!For just a couple of bucks you get a 10 minute ride across the bay. Definitely a must!

Must see when in HK. Take a ride on the Star Ferry - for no reason other than you should do it! The cheapest and greatest attraction in HongKong. I love to do it when I am there - also ride a trolley on the HK Island.
Great way to cross the harbor. Loved the ferry, easy to use, great views of the harbor. We used out Octopus card which meant we simply walked on to a waiting ferry, no waiting ever.
hop on a ferry to hong kong island. take a trip to hong kong island and while away a few hours exploring the narrow back streets and temples
Amazing Skyline View. The scene is breathtaking from the pier over to Hong Kong Island. Defiinitely a must do if you are in Hong Kong

Worth the experience. The cheapest mode of transport and so much fun, reminded me a little of the ferries in Sydney. Not for the fainted hearted if you need to use the loo.. Keep your coins for the ferry ride and possibly buy a couple of tokens at once. They are very frequent and docks in a few minutes away from the apple store!!,!
Worth a visit. Take the Star Ferry for the best and cheapest views in Hong Kong. Watch out for rough weather as the boats are extremely hazardous to board and disembark!

Quick ride. Cheap and quick way to get to Hong kong Island from Kowloon.
Takes about 5 minutes. The tickets on the star freey are also included if you take the Big Bus tour.
See Hong Kong skyline from the sea.. For only 2,5 HK dollars you get the breathtaking wiew also from the sea. Excellent for getting from Kowloon side to HK Island in no time too.
Get a harbour-view for nix. For only a few dollars you can get a view of both city's skylines and mix it with the local water traffic.
A cheap harbour view. A great cheap trip to see the Hong Kong harbour. Our kids loved to see the boats and other water action to move between islands rather than sit on another train.

2sd spectacular water way in the world. 2sd to the manly ferry in Sydney this is one of the best & cheapest water ride in the world. 5 times in Hong Kong have to experience it every time even if only to ride across & back with no destination. Impressed that the ticket machines are sanitized regularly, other cities could take note, I guess a legacy of SARS.
Ferry ride. We had a good experience on the ferry ride. However, the public toilet at the ferry pier were not very clean. There was a nasty odour from the toilet, whilst waiting for my other half.
Easy easy easy!. I loved it. Get yourself an Octopus card and it's easy on and easy off any where you go. Short ride to either side of Victoria Harbour. Excellent view no matter what time.

oldie but goodie. take the star ferry, everyone does. its great and you'll get your camera a workout . there are other locations in wan chai to take the star ferry, depending on where you are heading to. kowloon being the closest

Rustic fun. Hong Kong is a very interesting place because it merges the old and the new. I like how the government tries to preserve the old such as Star Ferry. The ferry ride is calm and relaxing. It allows us to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city life. Of course, please do not expect the ferry to be that of Star Aquarius standards. The ferry traces it origins to 1880. Visitors must at least take the Star Ferry once during their trip to HK. It's a very good experience for kids too!

No need for a tour.. I used to commute via star ferry. It's only a little bit slower than the mrt, but you feel much better each time. For kicks, take the really cheap seats below just once. But the top deck always has the best view.

Brilliant views and lovely atmosphere.. Love the star ferry, so easy and useful. Much better at night, with incredible views and amazing atmosphere always makes me appreciate being on holiday.
The ferry takes you straight to TST shopping and restraunts on Canton road. Coming from TST it take you to Hong Kong central right next to the big shopping IFC.
Possibly the best thing to do in HK. The star ferry is always a great experience. The night trip give a particularly beautiful view of both the HK and Kowloon Skylines. A definite do at the price.
Always a wonderful Hong Kong Experience. The Star Ferry at night never disappoints. the sensational views of the HK and Kowloon skyline make this great value experience a real treat.

The other view of Hongkong from Star Ferry. If you want to see hongkong in the other view you can try this transport. With HKD 2.5 we can see all of building in hongkong and also kowloon. Based on experience, it is really nice if we try star ferry in the night from hongkong to kowloon. In the 8 PM, from star ferry we can see the spectacular of symphony of light. So don't miss it for star ferry because star ferry is the most cheap and antique transportation in the world.
Classic. This is the best and most classic way to cross the Hing Kong bay between Central and Kowloon. It's cheap and efficient and a real tourist attraction. Fantastic views of the city skyline.

Travel in old fashioned style. 25 pence! I tell you, how much fun can you have travelling from Hong Kong to Kowloon, and all for 25 pence.Ok, the seats have backs that slide from one side of the bench seat to the other, depending on which way the ferry is going, and they are wooden. So the trip is 10 minutes in length. This ferry route has been running for centuries, and it is way cooler than driving through a tunnel!

Easy to navigate!. If you're staying in Central and want to go to Kowloon, skip the taxi and take the Star Ferry. It costs HK$2.50 (you can't beat that where everything else in HK is expensive). The ride is scenic and peaceful and both times I went around noon, it was not crowded at all. You can get pretty good pictures if you're on the upper deck!
View Of Habour. Purchase the ticket for the upper deck to have a good view of the harbour. Fare is cheap, only HKG$2.50 for travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and vice versa.
Must try. It is wonderful to take the ferry in Hong Kong from Kowloon to Hong Kong. It is super efficient and a lot of fun for family traveling.

An experience. Another mode of transport to cross between HK island and Kowloon apart from using their MTR or buses. Great view of HK from the ferry both day and night. Can't recall exactly how much the fare was. One can even use the octopus card to pay for the fare. Definitely must take ferry at least once to cross the harbour.

Amazing slice of history . It is simply amazing that the HK people treat such a big integral part of their heritage with such ease and pride. instead of turning this into a touristy, experience endive expensive, my partner and I were surprised that it was much cheaper to cross from Kowloon to HK island via the ferry! and with nicer views to boot. I recommend you taking this if you have time to spare, or if you have to, do spare time to experience this! for just HKD$2 you get to enjoy and be part of the heritage of HK. The anti-falungong banners and signage on the Kowloon star Ferry pier were also an interesting sight to see. The ride takes all but just 10 minutes and the frequency is pretty good too. Just be sure to choose your deck correctly as once you choose the lower deck you can't go up and vice versa. i would recommend the upper deck asbit is usually less crowded and offer nicer seats with less gasoline odours :) Together with the Ding Ding Tram on HK island and peak tram, this is a must do after a nice stroll on the Avenue of Stars.

nice ride ............ a hassle free way to get across Kowloon to HK island. Or just take the ride for the experience, sit back and relax... the ride is comfortable and short, under 10 minutes. At Central pier, there is a long covered walkway that links to IFC mall and beyond. Octopus card can be used for ferry rides. Ferries arrive and depart frequently. There is a Tai Cheong bakery outlet (egg tarts ! ) and Big Bus Tours counter on TST pier.

A little joy!. The Star ferry from Hong Kong to Kowloon and back again is a cheap treat of an attraction. Travel across the harbour on the little old boats for 2.50hkd which is about 20p gbp and enjoy great views of the skyline and harbour. They run from early until late every few minutes. As tourists with cameras we found the locals to be very nice too in giving up their seat so we could take pictures of the crossing. Nice, friendly people!!

Fun for kids. If you have kids they'll get a kick out of it and it's a cheap activity for a whole family. But if you're pressed for time, I wouldn't recommend doing it twice, especially if you're coming from Central, the ferry pier is quite a walk from the mtr station.
Value for money - must try. Cheap/ fantastic way to ensure the city skyline esp in the evening. Skip the queue for tickets by using your octopus card.

Whiff a breeze. Although it may be a brief ride across the harbor, the ride is totally worth it! It's affordable at a low price of HKD$3.60 and even less, depending on whether you travel on a weekend or weekday. You would get an unforgettable experience and scenery of the Hong Kong pier. There is nothing quite like it.

Use the Ferry to joint Hong Kong from Guangzhou.. Much faster and cheaper (~3h vs ~6h and 30 us$ vs 125 us$) than the taxi, use the Ferry from Shedun Harbor. Order a ticket from travel organisers of good hotels and for 1 $ more, they will give you a free MiniBus to Shedun Harbor... Just great!Nice view approching Hong-Kong, very plaisant way of travelling.

A short but great ride on the ferry. I purposely took a ride on the ferry from HK island to Kowloon just to experience what the locals had since the time when this was the only way of transportation to get to the either side of the shore. It's not expensive at all and you can just use the Octopus card. I stayed in HK island, took the MTR to Central, walked to the Star Ferry pier and took the ferry ride across to Kowloon. Nice!
Typical. Cheap and local way to cross the river to Kowloon of back to Hong Kong. It is a short ride to the other side, but you can enjoy the skyline and many boats nearby
Love it!. Just to experience the views from harbour level , and to arrive at either side on the historic and cheap wonder makes this possibly the best value for money trip anywhere!!

A must a night-time. An iconic part of Hong Kong. Unfortunately the old ferry pier was destroyed by the Government to enable redevelopment of prime land in the centre of Hong Kong - money speaks louder than hisrtory and heritage in Hong Kong! The pier is now a longish walk from town but the ride at night on a clear day is well worth the effort. Its cheap too.

Very nice, but need to find a good day!. Enjoy the view on the star ferry. However, on the day that I am on the ferry, the weather was so bad that I can't see clearly. Make sure you pick a good day to take the ferry.
Short and sweet. The ferry is very well priced and a fast means of transportation from HK to Kowloon. The ferry takes you from the terminal near the convention center to drop off spot in Kowloon.
Amazing experience of stunning Barbour. This is an all time must for Hong Kong, day or night, all the views you can see, weather dependent, for a very low cost. Smooth efficient and fast.
Best way to view the Victoria Harbour. I took the star ferry in the morning and night. My daughter and husband enjoy it alot! It is very fun and cheap. HK$2 or HK$2.50 only.

Good way to see the city. Good view of the city and everyone needs to experience Victoria Harbour at least once in their life. Maybe once at night and once during the day. There are some options. If you just want to experience the ferry ride, which is cheap and takes about 10 minutes. It is also a commuter route, so pick a non-peak time and you can have more access to the boat for pictures, etc. You can also consider doing the ferry tour which is way more expensive compared to the normal ferry ride, but it would be worth it if you did it during the nightly light show. It is a historic and a cultural icon of HK that you must experience. But it is not the most glamorous ride, but it does gives you a glimpse of HK's past, a time before the city became a world metropolis.
Has to be done !. Couldn't come to Hong Kong and not go to the Star ferry pier and take a trip across the harbourwell worth the experience and very inexpensive

Interesting views of life and Harbour. A good view of harbour and the people of Hong Kong giving an honest view without being filtered for Tourist. Worth while going to the different destinations and walk about .

The skyline view is something to remember. The skyline view is something to rememberThe ability to walk around & to see, breath & smell as much as you can is a kind of experience mostly during twilight. Once you cross to the other side at that time the movement of people, cars, buses is more than impressing.
Nice ferry ride across the harbour. Although the ferries look old and dirty ,it is actually an enjoyable trip,only takes ten or so minutes .Very cheap and give opportunity for some nice pics.

Incredible value, great photo opps. It costs only about $0.50 USD to ride the ferry across the channel and the views are incredible. Takes about 10 minutes. It's also a very convenient way to get from central over to the island.
Iconic. This is one of the things tagged as a "must do". It probably is if only for the great views of Hong Kong and Kowloon as you cross the harbour
A must do when in Hong Kong. Taking the ferry is a must do in Hong Kong, and it is a cheap pleasure. You will get some nice views of the skyline. Price is also very cheap..
Great Transportation!. Very easy to use. Lots of fun to ride. Great views of the harbour! We loved using it for our visits to Kowloon and back to Central.

My Favorite Mode of Transportation in HK. Went to try the ferry on my 1st visit to HK back in 2008 and have tried really hard to ride it during every visit. Nothing Spectacular or whatever, but I think it's crossing the Victoria Harbour for such a cheap price and getting a nice view that does it for me EVERY TIME.
Breathtaking. I will never ever tire of this journey and the view. Ok, I may feel differently if it was part of my daily commute.. An absolute must.
Quickest way into Hong Kong Island.. I loved taking this. We were going to a convention and the exit of the ferry was right across the street. It's cheaper and faster than taking the train.

Apparently not what it was, but still a treat. Cheap as chips to Kowloon and back, great views, and apparently one of the 50 things National Geographic says you "must do". We did Wanchai to Kowloon and back. As the authorities reclaim the Harbour the trip gets shorter, but the views at night are spectacular.
One of the "must do's". There's not much harbor left anymore with the landfills but the Star Ferry ride is one of the inexpensive must do's . Particularly beautiful at night
Just a pier. I don't know why is it here, that's just usual pier with ferries and excursion boats. There is nice view of the Hong Kong island near this pier.

The pier is nothing special, a place where the boats come and leave.. It is a bit old and grey but I like harbours and boats, just make a trip to another island, it is cheap and it is nice to see Hong Kong from the water.
Vet' after a week. great place to soak up the atmosphere and the best place for spectacular views - and $2HK for a trip on the ferry great value!

A ferry with of view. And what a view... All the skyscrapers of HK are yours. So much fun, full of locals rushing from HK to kowloon or vice versa. there are two accesses. The upper deck costs more than the lower one. Definitely a must do

Nice but expected more.. Although the ferry ride was pleasant I think I expected more. It was a LONG walk from the metro stop and the staff would not let us go upstairs even though there was a higher deck. I was nice to use to see the skyline and for it's historical value.

Think of is an an experiance and not just transport. Don't just sit down, get up walk around look at the plaque (the boat we were on was launched in 1964). The old windows, the photo as you leave/arrive at the port and back towards the city. Once is a must because of it's historic value, and 'must do' appeal but the MTR is much quicker and easier.
An experience. We wanted to cross over to Kowloon via the ferry. It served it's purpose. Got to see the view of the Harbour while crossing over.
boat from Kawloon to HK. departure from Kawloon to HK, very cheap, but very nice, max 10 min to cross over, must do it once instead of taking the metro
Good value. Great value for money. It was a nice little boat trip. Cheaper and more novel than taking the metro to and from Hong Kong Island.
just once. you just need to do it once, but it's a nice thing to do in HK. the MTR is much easier but of course a lot less romantic.
Quick, efficient, cheap!. This is such a great way to experience Hong Kong. We rod the star ferry back and forth a few times to get to places, and it was always fun with beautiful views!

A must experience. Easy to get I recommend to use the Octopus card though. Nice views, you don´t need to get a seat for a few minutes trip. Take pictures, get the fresh air in you face and experience this beautiful harbor, so live and vibrating as decades ago.
Also, so inexpensive...
Not sure if handicapped accesible.

Good accessibility at very low cost. Liked: The frequency, low cost, avoid city traffic
Disliked: Not sure if there's anything I disliked
Nostalgic trip in time. The Star Ferry hasn't changed in decades. Still the same ride to cross from Hong Kong to Kowloon. You can get some great photos of either side from the ferry.

Reminder of a Scottish childhood. Because we stayed on the Kowloon peninsula, we had to visit the pier just to get to Hong Kong. A few crossings were included in the price of our City Sightseeing Tour, but even when we had to pay the tickets ourselves, it was very reasonable. The City Sightseeing Tour rep advised us to go on the upper deck, as the view is much better. Also, the engine fumes and noise are less noticeable. (Note that the price of the ticket for the upper deck is slightly higher). My Scottish- born husband enjoyed the experience even more than I did because it reminded him of growing up / using ferries in his childhood in Scotland.

nice way to travel in Hong Kong. Took the ferry to the other side of the harbour, for visit the Peak or the escalators.It is a pleasant way to see Hong Kong. Easy to buy a ticket and a short walk to the ferry. You have a beautiful view and also in the evening it is nice to take a ferry and see the lasershow.

Must travel on the Star Ferry to feel the atmosphere in Hong Kong. This was obviously a grand building in days gone by, but rather battered and bruised with the thousands of travellers using it every day. A must do experience if you are visiting Hong Kong for either business or pleasure and is the cheapest form of transport across the harbour.

OLD MEETS NEW. You simply can't stay in Hong Kong without needing to travel on the Star Ferry at some point. Hong Kong Island and Kowloon both have there wonderful attractions, but the Star Ferry is what really brings them together. These trusty old ferries are so iconic that to travel on them is an experience in itself. Whether you're a tourist, or simply a daily commuter, the Star Ferry is necessity. And at only $2.50 HK Dollars from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui, it's a such bargain too! Unfortunately though, the old Central to Hung Hom route is no more (sadly, the end of an era, in my opinion) so if you're staying in the Hung Hom area, you'll need to find alternative travel arrangements.
great mode of transport. Efficient, quick and cheap, some nice little shops to buy snacks. Great view of laser lights from Kowloon side

Best deal ever!. I love riding the Star Ferry whenever I am in Hong Kong. It's a great (and inexpensive) vehicle to see the the skyline around Central and TST. I recommend the short trip to enjoy the view by day and by night!

Must do when in Hong Kong. This is a must see and do for anyone coming to Hong Kong. The famous Star Ferry has been a fixture in Hong Kong since the early 1900's, it once was the connection between the island and the Mainland until the MTR tunneled under the harbour. I suggest that you do one trip on the top and one on the bottom, these have to be pre planned at the terminal as you can't go up or down once you board. These 5-10 minute boat rides give you amazing views of both HK and TST as you roll side to side over the waves. The lower side give a different perspective as you can smell the Diesel engine room which reminds me of railway ties or creosote power poles. The smell is not over powering at all, combined with the ocean breeze you can close your eyes and remember the old days.

Loved Taking The Ferry Across Each Day. We stayed at the Harbour Grand Kowloon so had to take the ferry across each day to visit Hong Kong. We loved it as it is used by tourists and locals and the hustle and bustle of each crossing was different each time. Its only a five minute trip and as you go across the harbour every type of boat from large cruise ships and small local fishing boats. I great way to start each day.

Very convenient and so cheap. I was told this was a "must-do" when in HK. So I did. Around €0.50 gets you a ferry across the harbour. Very fast {5-8mins?}. No frill onboard but a cheap way to get across the water.NB: It does take the same pre-paid swipe card as the MTR metro{Octopus card}.

Hasnt changed much apart from the scenary. Hong Kong life at speed. Dont think that this is an area to relax in. Its busy bustling and no time for hanging around and watching. Bustled on and bustled off. But then it is real life in Hong and has certainly not changed in the last 300 years much.

The best 30p you'll ever spend. The Star Ferry is a really convenient way of getting between Kowloon and Central - gets you between Tsim Sha Tsui and the pier, which is adjacent to Central Station and the IFC mall in much more comfort than an overcrowded MTR train. Add to that that it's both a travel icon AND a bargain, and has amazing views of the harbour, make this an unmissable experience
Take the Classic Ferry. A fun ride through the harbor with a bit of history thrown in. The relaxing views toward Kowloon and then back to Hong Kong Island are truly worth the trip.
a must. I always bring international guests for a star ferry ride. really nice at dusk or daytime on a clear day.

Old style but still very efficient. Once you get to know the system, using Star ferries is very simple and good value for money. We also joined a Harbour trip and enjoyed the sea view checking on skyscrapers and important places in Hong Kong history.

We did the one hour tour but I think a simple trip between Kowloon and Central is enough. We did the one hour tour but it was difficult to hear anything over the loud speaker. I suggest just doing the shorter and equally scenic crossing.

Every trip to HK -Ride the Star Ferry. One of the most enjoyable things to do in Hong Kong. Every time I go to Hong Kong, I'll ride the start ferry. Even when I'm on a rushed 1 day business trip, I'll carve out time to for the sea air, wind and sights of Victoria Harbor

Never gets old. Nobody ever forgets the Star Ferry since it's a favorite for locals and tourists. The views of the harbor are spectacular especially at night during the light show. The perfect means of transportation to so great restaurants with views of HK and the best place to watch fireworks in the harbor.

Classic transport in Hong Kong. You must travel on these ferries at least once during your visit. I've been using these over a forty year span and they're pretty much the same boats. Pier 7 at Central Piers to Tsim Sha Tsui, different embarkation areas for Upper Deck (for scenic) and Lower Deck. Tokens can be bought at the dock.
Great fun. Cheap way to see Kowloon and the outer islands. Take a ferry at night to see the lights and take a trip in the day to see the chaos

very original boat ride. very original boat ride travel between tsimshatsui and central district. only a 5 minutes ride gives you the most stunning view along the harbour. and it's so beautiful in whatever direction that you can choose!

Very efficient transport. To go from Hong Kong side to Kowloon side is so easy . one can avoid the traffic and the expensive taxis by taking this transport. While on board the ferry, enjoy the harbor view and the coastlines dotted with buildings. At night. You can even take one of those boats cruising around the city which also includes dinner.

Over a Hundred years old and still going strong. Located on the waterfront in TST and the ocean terminal,home to visiting ocean liners,the jetty is like a time warp and little has changed over the decades,the boarding area for a quick few minute crossing to Central affords passengers the delight of two great vistas to photograph,rarely is the crossing choppy and it is safe for all ages,however beware of pickpockets,it rarely happens but be warned do not allow this to spoil your trip so be on your guard and enjoy one of the oldest modes of transport still in daily use......................

The little ferry that delivers. No trip to Hong Kong is complete without a ride on the Star Ferry. For just $2HKD you get the best views of both skylines and great unimpeded shots. These jaunty little ferries also provide a welcome moment to rest before you take on the hustle and bustle of this amazing city.

Very efficient and easy to navigate. Another Hong Kong institution and so we had to make a point of using the Star Ferry on this trip. Just like the MTR, we found the Star Ferry really easy and enjoyable to use. The Octopus Card makes commuting very simple no matter which type of vehicle you chose anyway.The Ferries are all clean and neatly presented and your never wait long for one. The trip across the harbour is very quick as well... plus the view would never get old - it's amazing!The Star Ferry pier itself has a huge variety of shops and services available for the commuters as well and the Central Pier is quite a sight to behold as you approach. What a beautiful old building.Every tourist to Hong Kong should try the Star Ferries at least once!

Excellent value for a fun trip. The ferry's are a fun and affordable way to see Hong Kong harbor. It's incredibly cheap by US standards and if you use it at night you get a great view of the lights. Catch the ferry across to Tsim Sha Tsui to watch the 8 PM light show and then catch it back.

great piece of HK history. Every ought to visit the Star Ferry Pier. The Star Ferry is a part of historical HK as it is the ferry that linked Hong Kong island to the Kowloon peninsula. Right next to the pier is the Avenue of the Stars as well. That whole stretch of harbour front is a really fun place to be and to take in the HK skyline.

The site to see in Hong Kong. This Hong Kong classic is a must see and do item. Try riding across the harbor both at day and night. It is amazing and gives a real feel of the "vibe" of Hong Kong. And considering it is one of the coolest tourist things to do in the world it is cheap. Around one USD. Just have some coins to pay. I even do this on my own when on a business trip and am staying on the Island side. I usually cross to Kowloon and have a few beers at Dan Ryans in the mall and cross back. Great stuff.
Part of history...... A quick and cheapway to get between the main areas, with v frequeny services. Excellent harbour views.
Dirty And Crowded But Worth A Trip. Enjoyed taking the ferry, crossing over and taking the tram up to Victoria Peak. What a site. Truly unforgetable

Must see. If there is any way to see the symphony of lights, it is via the star ferry. Take the sail just before 8pm, and you will be treated with a wonderful display of lights at the top of HK's banking skyline.

HK Island Terminal 7 - Most disgusting public toilets in HongKong. catching a ferry is a must - but make sure the kids have been to the bathroom beforehand!! We needed to use the bathroom at Terminal 7 - catching the ferry from HongKong Island over to Ocean Terminal The bathroom just before you go through the ticketing section was the most revolting, dirty, non functioning toilet

Efficient, scenic and dirt cheap.. For, literately not figuratively, small change (one trip costs 43 cents in USD) the Star Ferry offers a breath-taking view of Hong Kong's breath-taking skyline and yet delivers you quickly and efficiently to the other side of the harbor.
Enjoyable. Far nicer way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong island.Better than the MTR any day, any cheaper too. Beautiful views of the harbour and skyline

Cheap, cheap, cheap. This is by far the best way to travel in Hong Kong. The views are stunning and its just so convenient. Its great travelling with the locals and getting a feel for the city. We did get confused with the different levels but to be honest they are both equally as good for views. Its a quick trip across and like other reviewers have said make sure you take lots of photos. Its a must do!
Cheapest way to enjoy the amazing harbour!. Another must for any visitor. Great harbour views, good to visit just before the light show at 8pm. Take a return trip and enjoy it twice!

Not sure we people rate this high. Yes, the Star Ferry is a cheap and fast way of getting to Kowloon from Hong Kong.However, I am not sure why this was named in the Top 50 places to visit by National Geographic. Yes the views are amazing from both sides, but the it is not the Pier Itself, it is whatever surrounds it :)

Fun Ride at a Bargain Price. The Star Ferry is probably the best bargain in Hong Kong. It quickly moves you between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, with the skyline providing the entertainment on the short trip. You can leave from the pier in Kowloon, and travel to a number of locations. I'm most familiar with the trip to Central (drops you off near the IFC shopping complex), and the one to Wan Chai, which drops you near a major bus station. Just ride back and forth, if you will, just to have the experience.

Part of the whole HK geographic idea a must for transport to and from HK island. This area houses the pier the Harbour City Mall and the promenade which is located above the pier. This area is very crowded usually, but a visit to the pier is a must and you must take the ferry cross to the HK side and back. It has a very big history in HK

Busy. On the Kowloon side this is a very busy pier but it is convenient for the Ocean view mall, peninsula hotel and the Intercontinental hotel. There are always some activity going on here as well as street sellers and shops. It is a wee bit smelly and not overly clean but a necessity if you are going on the ferry .

A must on your trip. Cheap and easy a trip across the Harbour is a must. Many people use the Ferry to commute to work and the journey literally takes a few minutes. At night make sure to bring a camera to take some awesome pictures.

Best deal on the planet. The world-famous Star Ferry Pier. It was an amazing view and an even more amazing ride. The ride takes about 5 to 7 minutes and has a price of $2HKD which is .30 cents U.S. This is the best deal for a world famous attraction (outside of free) in the entire world.Keep in mind if the waves are choppy, entry and exit out of the ferry can be a little challenging. This is not something you want to do in high heels or any shoes that are already a challenge to walk in. Ride this ferry day or night, either way, the views are jaw-dropping. It is one of the most enjoyable experiences in Hong Kong. Personally, I could easily move to Hong Kong just to ride the ferry on a daily basis.

average. the ferry itself is a quick journey and runs pretty smoothly with plenty of photos to be taken, however their toilets are less than good and you really need to take some wipes as they dont have toilet paper.
You've got to get on it once. It just an old ferry boat. But, there's something about crossing the stunning Victoria Harbor that way. Do it once. You'll be glad you did.
Cross to Kowloon on the history Ferry!. A fun a quick trip from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. Lovely on a clear day. You can use your Octopus Card.
Amazing!!!. The ferry pier is a wonder. The boat ride is great and the Floatng restraunt is amazing. Rest assured u can get a glimpse of the beautiful Yatch's

Fun and relaxing. This is my favourite way of getting from HK island to Kowloon and vice versa. You can go under the harbour on the MTR, but you miss the scenic views.From Kowloon side, you can go either to Central pier of Wan Chai pier.If you can time it be on the ferry when the laser & light show is on. Best views as you can see both sides of the harbour.Very cheap and you just use your Octopus card.
Great value. Do it through the day and at night. So cheap and you get great views of both sides of the harbour. The lights in the evening are spectacular.

the best way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong island. Of course you can take the MTR to travel underneath the water between central station and Kowloon, but you will be missing out on the fun!Ferries leave the Star Ferry Pier on a very regular basis (we never had to wait more than 3 -4 minutes), and cross the channel between the island and the mainland. From the ferry, you have an excellent view over the Hong Kong skyline, and a ticket cost hardly more than crossing underground via MTR. The ferries have two decks: the upper deck offers a better view, but on the lower deck you see better what is involved in handling and mooring the ferry.Upper deck tickets are slightly more expensive, and weekend tickets are more expensive than week tickets.
A great way to cross the harbour. This came free with my bus trip. however, its really inexpensive and a fun way to cross the harbour.. It really is a must do in Hong Kong.
Star Ferry Pier Hong Kong. Get the ferry from here for the short journey across to Hong Kong Island. Cheap and easy to find. Shopping centre next to ferry terminal.

Lots of help for wheelchair users.. It's not easy to board the ferry as the gangway was quite steep, but several large crew members appeared and helped to push my wife's chair on and off the ferry. For just a few pennies it's an easy way to cross the harbour and one we throughly recommend.
A must do trip. You simply cannot visit HK without a round harbour trip on the Star Ferry! It's the only way to experience the whole cityscape!
Great, working class ferry to see and learn about the city. Strictly blue collar. No putting on heirs here. Star Ferry is the absolute best way to see Hong Kong, Kowloon and Victoria Harbour.
Ferry with style. Going to Macau thru ferry is a breeze. Just 1hr 15 mins. The area is clean and well organized. Staff are helpfull.

Must Visit - cheap and historical. Not only is this is a cheap form of transport it is also part of the history of Hong Kong. The ferry are fairly frequent and comfortable during non peak hours. You could read about the history of the ferry at the pier. There are a number of unique shops there including traditional snacks shops and traditional clothings. Highly recommended if you have not been before.

old ferry but new pier. took just few min to cross the harbour by this star ferry! The pier is quite new, and was moved to west side of central, the new pier is bigger and lighter than it was before, also there is starbuck and restuarant on top, when u stand at the side of the pier, and take a photo of the opposite shore, that must be a charming photo, esp at weekdays night

#1 attraction. If you do nothing else in Hong Kong, take a ride on the Star ferry across to Hong Kong Island. Weekends are ideal as the ferry boats are not too crowded, but rush hour will assault your senses.
Mixture of old and new on the harbour to be seen to be believed.
Easy!. Navigation is easy, it's cheap, quick and lovely at night for the crossing to Kowloon. Bring change for the machines if you don't have an Oyster Card

Takes you anywhere you want. This terminal gives you access to the whole of the Hong Kong Harbour's must see spots. It has a classic older look which still reminds me of the old Hong Kong which is fast disappearing. You can get to all the outlying islands, Hong Kong island and all the tourist spots cheaply and very pleasantly. It is so cost effective and gives you some unwind time from the hustle and bustle of the roads while you enjoy this beautiful harbour city
Repeat visitor!. Upper deck or lower deck - both good. It's a great way to take in the HK skyline and it costs so little! Probably my number 1 pick of all the HK attractions.
This is a must!. So cheap and so lovely to cross the water. This is something you have to do when in Hong Kong. The skyline just takes your breath away. We paid about 2 or 2,5 HK dollars.
Buzzing Harbour. The Star Ferry is a great way to get across to Hong Kong Island, very cheap, clean, efficient and fabulous views. One part of an excellent public transport system in Hong Kong.

A must when visiting Hong Kong. Safe fun way to travel across the harbor both day or night time. I found it a great place to take plenty of pictures of Hong Kongs skyline and harbor activites. Also a cheap way to get across the harbor.

Unbeatable Views for the Lowest Possible cost. Take Star Ferry from Central to Kowloon and enjoy the greatest possible views on what is arguably the most scenic ferry crossing in the world. For about 50 US cents each way you will have views of both Hong Kong Island (Central, Wanchai and beyond), and the Kowloon peninsula. As you cross you may also enjoy watching various types of barges, tug boats guidning ships, traditional Chinese boats, etc. About 10 minutes in each direction, it is perfect for picture taking and never too crowded - the ferries go back and forth all the time. Together with going up to Victoria Peak, this is a MUST do while in Hong Kong.

A must. If you're planning to go to Central or Causeway Bay, you need to catch the ferry at least once! Just for the view of HK and to experience Victoria harbour crossing! It is nothing special but really but a must try! It is also very cheap.

RUDE tour guides!. Make sure if you need to take the bus that you stay away from big tour group of people especially if they are KOREAN and have tour guides that are men. My mom, sister and I just finished the Symphony of lights at the Avenue of Stars and waited for the crowd to die down before taking the bus 1A. We walked up to the line but there was a group of like 30 people that wanted to wait for everyone before getting on blocking the line. Since there were only 3 of us, one of the tour guide toward the back of the line waved at us to go ahead so we walked past the whole group of people but along the way we were blocked by a few so we had just missed the bus and the door was closed by the time we got up to the front. Then the tour guide in the front started to have a fit and started yelling at us that we were cutting in line. Of course they then were speaking in there own language and making bad remarks toward us. I then tried to flag the tour guide in the back of the group and he had the nerve to pretend that he never told us to go up. He started calling me crazy in English and said somehting else but I was never rude to him at all. I just told him to ask his own coworker what he had told us to do and be reasonable and not to lie. They just kept talking back and forth to each other in their own language. That was when the next bus pulled up. I refused to get back to the end of the line because seriously there were only 3 of us and we were already there in the front. I made sure those people did not push us around because if anything happened I would have called the cops. I told them I have never been to the police station and I had all night to do what is necessary. So we got on the bottom section and each of them got in to the bus and stared at us. It's ok. I was not intimidated at all. But you know, I have no idea what they were arguing about because the whole tour wanted to sit on the top level of the bus. The 3 of us had the whole bottom level to ourselves. So, my advice to everyone is PLEASE STAY AWAY from all tour groups! Also, if you are on a tour please get our own tour buses to ship you around. Do not block public transportation at your own expense, other people are entitle to use it!

A must on anyone's itinery. The laser show starts at 8pm every night. Get a milkshake from McD's, find a spot on the harbour wall and enjoy.
Take the Star Ferry at night for the best views over the harbour. The ferry costs 2.5HKD one-way.....that's around 20p!! It would be criminal not to do it.
Ferry. They are a wonderful way to get around the Harbour. Even if you just want to ride on them, and sightsee. There is a harbour tour at night, which tells you some of the local history.

Definitely take the ferry instead of MTR/Taxi once or twice. We took the Star Ferry from TST to HK Island one morning for a tour. It really didn't take much longer than taking the MTR would have and it was a great experience to watch the city wake up from the water. Definitely take it at least once. We were amazed at how CLEAN the water is, too! Not a piece of garbage and it appears blue and clear.

Enjoy it!. This is ferry is an icon in Hong Kong and should not be missed.It used to be located near the City Hall in Central much closer to the MTR than now; you need to do a little more walking to arrive there.You can take the ferry from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui or in Tsim Sha Tsui to Central or Wanchai. The trip from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui is very fast, around 10 minutes and you get out near Ocean Terminal, a very big shopping mall. The trip from Tsim Sha Tsui to Wanchai is a little longer maybe 15 minutes and you get out near the Hong Kong Convention Center.The ferry is very charming and you get to see Hong Kong from a different point of view: the sea and can get very nice photos from both sides of the harbour.The boat has a lower deck and an upper deck. It is very cheap, with the lower deck being cheaper than the upper deck. On hot days, the front cabin of the upper deck has air conditioner.I go to Hong Kong every now and then and I always use the ferry to cross the harbour so I have a card (Octopus card) to use on the transports and some supermarkets like 7/11, but if you don’t buy one you need to have change to buy the ticket in the machine. Choose the number of tickets, and then insert the coins.The back of the seats can be pushed to change according to the direction the ferry is travelling so you never need to seat facing the back of the boat.
Blast from the past. Kowloon-side pier (and the ferries themselves) are just as they were twenty-five years ago - wonderful (and still great value)
loved it. went on this 3 times, brilliant must do in hong kong.very cheap, good ferries, good service, do it on the nightime when the lights are all lit up..get your photo opps
Ferry. The ferry has history - the ferry was clean and tidy - very cheap way of transport to get from one island to another.

Star Ferry. It was an amazing experience to travel to Macau on Star Ferry. Managed and run in such a professional manner. Very Very comfortable and smooth. Just that there is little focus on entertainment and F&B service is seemingly discouraged...
Easy and cheap!. One of the best rides in the world the Star Ferry, it's easy and day or night will always delight ! Easy to get on and off

Great views of the HK skyline, Invigorating sea breeze.. A trip to HK isn't complete without a ride on the Star Ferry. It's the quickest way from Harbour City, Kowloon to Central. The Central pier is close to Hong Kong station and the City Hall where Maxim's Palace dimsum is located . Great pics is an added bonus

Fast, efficient and worth the ride. For just a few dollars, you can catch the Star Ferry to Hong Kong Island - it takes just 7 minutes and they welcome you to time it. They don't muck around - docking, off-loading passengers, boarding new passengers and setting is all done in less than 5 minutes. It's also a great way to check out the harbour and skyline. Well worth doing!

The ferry's are brilliant!. The Pier itself has seen better days and is stands out as something not quite as clean and well kept as much of the rest of Hong Kong. The ferries are a brilliant way to get between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island and Kowloon and Wan Chai. The fare is HKD3.40 (30p) each way for a 6 minute trip across the harbour. There is no timetable the ferries just ply back and forth all day until 11:30 at night, they are clean and spacious.
Good. Every evening there is light and sound shows, which is very good. Also you can take ferry from star ferry for Central.

A way to escape the crowds. After a few days among the busy crowds in the mtrs we decided o take the ferry from tsim sha tsui to central. There were no crowds and the journey was not rough. We took in the lovely sea breeze and felt the calmer side of Hong Kong.

A must do. Part of the fun in Hong Kong is the Star Ferry ride between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Still an extremely cheap trip the public ferries ply their way across the harbour on a very regular basis.A night time crossing is a must to see both sides of the Hoarbour and if you time it right you will in the middle of the daily night time laswer show. This as a MUST DO!!!

Star Ferry in the Evenings. Star Ferry is to Hong Kong what the Merlion is to Singapore. It is really a unique experience to ride the Star Ferry and if you can schedule it, try to take the ferry in the evenings around 7.30pm so that you will reach Tsim Sha Tsui at 8pm, in time to catch the Symphony of Lights display.Try to get a seat on the upper deck and away from the air conditioned section if you want to get nice pictures of the 5-minute journey.
HONG KONG STAY. I think that anyone visiting HK should take the opportunity to ride on the star ferry. A very worth while and INEXPENSIVE trip.

A classic in Hong Kong. I like the Star Ferry piers at Tsim Sha Tsui or Central...there is a newer one on Central. Love the workers in their uniforms. A classic part of Hong Kong and you must ride the Star Ferry.

Star Ferryness!!. Having first visited in the 60's was pleasantly surprised that the ferries,and terminal hadn't changed much. The ferries are still an iconic experience , and easy to use,especially now one can use the octopus cards on them.well worth a trip on them just to say you've been on a top 10 ride.
Not for the poor sailor. Frequent and cheap and an experience but if like me you are a poor sailor, go downstairs for the boats roll dreadfully.
Nice touch. The are building a lot there, but to travel from Hong Kong island to mainland is easier with ferry than MTR

Iconic!. There is no other way to get from HK Island to Kowloon, in my view. It's ridiculously cheap, efficient, and the iconic way to travel that route. The boats are great! I don't know how old it is but my Dad used it in the 1940s and he said it was brilliant then as well! Great photo ops, too. This isn't just a ferry, it's the Star Ferry!!!

great way to cruise for a very small fee. it costs HKG$2.50 for a ride from Central or Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui. for 5 minutes and a very reasonable price, the whole family gets to "cruise" and enjoy the ride. don't expect much from the Star Ferry itself though. it is old but still safe and reliable. staff wears a "sailor" uniform.
A must for visitors. It's hectic and noisy but the Hong Kong ferries are a must for any visitor, cheap, great views and photo opportunities

Easy. So easy to find and so easy to use, we used it 4 times, convient and reasonably priced. Enough seats for everyone, no one is allowed to stand up, had lots of tours so it reduced our travel time.
A bit like Circular Quay in Sydney. The Star Ferry Pier was bustling. Some interesting shops and cafes and views over to Hong Kong Island.

Lots of fun. Ferries are ferries I hear you cry but if you are not a local (and even if you are) this ferry is absolutely iconic. You cannot truly say you have been a tourist in Hong Kong without having visited the pier and traveled on the ferry. Quick, efficient and very very regular it provides you with a cheap alternative for a view of Hong Kond harbor from the water. It can get very busy in peak hour as the workers traverse the harbor from/to home and work.

history. you have no choice but to visit the Star Ferry and do it in the day and night. It is very cheap and worth while. It has been around for a while and as you will see all roads lead to the Star Ferry Terminal.
Easy river crossing. Like most HK transport the Star Ferries are cheap and very efficiently run. Bit of a crush sometimes but always got a seat. A must do.

Traditional cheap local adventure. Star Ferrys belong to Hong Kong as black taxis to London. You have not visited the city if you have not used them. The main line (Central <> Kowloon) links two interesting places to walk around and do some shopping. Just go up and down to enjoy the view of both sides of the waterfront. Or go one way and return by MTR. Keep in mind that you have to decide which deck you want to sit on, because once you are on the ferry you can not change anymore, so select the correct entrance at the pier station. Price is a few HKD per person.

Cheap enough transportation. Fairly inexpensive transporation between HK island and Kowloon. Everything has been unchanged for many many years, leaving and arrive at the same place, never get be faster etc. but it is typical HK.
romantic scenery. i am housed at Marco Polo Hotel. this pier is right behind it.. i find it as an avenue for people to meet and have a little view of the sea over cup of coffe or a great meal:P
The only way to get to TST. The Star Ferry is the best way to get to Kowloon. It is efficient and quick. The vessels are timely and fast across the harbour.
More than a ferry. Took the ferry in 2006 and I have always made it a point to do so every time I'm in HK on business or with the family. Smooth ride and at a very cheap price as well

Must to do. Like everybody this is one to do things in hk.....trip from central to Kowloon this very old fashion ferry wich have had fare for years same ....almost nothing.Offcourse beautifull night wiev with thousands of lights and busy harbour traffic.this is trip from past.
Dank but efficient. A must do ride if you're in Hong Kong, not exactly luxury, but quite inexpensive and efficient and a neat way to see the harbor.

Typical transportation. When we visited Hong Kong, we were staying on the island and we used the Star Ferry to cross offer to the mainland! This is the cheapest way to go and this is so pleasant to admire the views while enjoying the cruise.

A Hong Kong Must Do!. We live in Hong Kong and ride the Star Ferry at every opportunity, it is a very enjoyable way to journey from Central to TST. It is a great way to just unwind for a few minutes and watch the water pass you by!Most tourists will ride on the top deck, but we enjoy changing it up and riding on the lower deck. On the lower deck, there is a bit more of the diesel smell, but the trip is short and it isn't a problem. The lower deck offers better photo opportunities since you are so near the water level. Don't miss this fun and cheap opportunity to travel on the Star Ferry, you'll be glad you made the journey!
Dirt cheap and fun transportation. Great way to get from one side to the other and the city views are fantastic. Slower than the subway, but still an interesting experience.

You can't miss it if you catch a ferry!. On the Kowloon side, there is the HK Tourist Bureau, good little souvenir shops, an ATM in an enclosed space, Benland Shoes - good quality and European sizes - upstairs (first class level) a shop selling beautiful, smocked articles.

Wonderful by Day and Night. We had a rare opportunity to go on the Victoria Harbor Cruise during the day and then again at night when our cruise ship was allowed to transit the harbor at the start of the 8:00 PM light show! The day was warm so the the cruise in the harbor provided some relief. Your truly get a great view of the city from the boat and it was impressive to see the skyline and I was amazed at all the contruction projects going on. At night, it was just as amazing!

Easy, cheap, and fast. Pay attention to when the last ferry departs. I didn't see the sign and missed the last one to Wan Chai by one minute! I had to take the next one to Central and walk an extra ten blocks.
Cheap and easy crossing. Best for have small change. You have to enter the number of tickets you want BEFORE putting your money in the machine. Very good price.
Great fun. We done this at night and the views were amazing. The wate was a wee bit choppy. Kwoolan was also well worth visit

Hong Kong October 2012. This took a little while to get to but easy on the trains. The trains are very cheap to travel on and all clean. No litter seen at all in the 8 days there. The ferry trip was ok and not too wavey. Next time will do the harbour cruise.

Does what it says on the Tin. Fast, efficient service from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. We purchased the travel cards for our four days and were pleasantly surprised we could use them on the ferry. We got some great day skyline shots as well..

Good way to travel across the harbor.. The pier used to be located by City Hall, it looks like when they moved the pier they didn't bring the clock tower along with it which is a shame. The journey across the harbour is much shorter as well. It's amazingly cheap to travel on the upper deck (approx 20p). Good views of the harbour as well.
Everyone should experience this. this is the ferry used by locals to go between Kowloon and Central. It is very cheap and worth the trip
Inexpensive side trip. For a few dollars you can cruise around the harbor and see the sights from the water. Efficient and on time.

A Star Ferry Ride is a Must. You can't visit Hong Kong and not catch the Star Ferry to or from Central or Wan Chai to Kowloon. It only costs about 30c a ride (and that is the upper deck charge) so cheap as! And the view as you cross Victoria Harbour is just amazing. Definitely worthwhile.

Pier Observation deck. Make sure you see the clock tower, and walk up the steps to the observation deck to get a clear view of the harbour. At night it is lit up and the lazer beam show starts at 8.00 p.m.

A Gem in HK. What a brilliant way to see HK and the harbour... Time is never enough in HK, however, if you have a spare second , you may take the ferry from TST to either Central or Wan Chai. It takes about 10 minutes as it is short but you can see HK better and can appreciate more when at night with all the lightings. Try to sit on both the top and bottom deck on either journey. ! thing that I didn't like id the diesel fumes when going across but the wind does away most of the smell when moving.
NICE RIDE. For something different, catch the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. It costs about 30c Australian and is good fun. Easy to get there and well sign posted.

What So Special?. It just a ferry that cross the harbour. While taking this ferry, I look around and try to understand what makes this service so special and highly recommended. By the way, its not a great place to admire HK skyline. I rather sit 2 hours at the Promenade to enjoy the view. However, its worth to try but you shouldn't upset if you leave HK without trying this piece of experience.
Cheap and quick transport. Going from Hong Kong to Kowloon, it is practical, cheap and quick.Try to sit upstars, so you enjoy the few minutes you have on the water.

EXCELLENT. The ferry fare is cheap. fantastic service and great value for money.Simply one of the most exciting and scenic public transport experiences in the world.The ferries are quick and cheap connecting the middle of Kowloon with the middle of Hong Kong Island.

Water Taxis at Star Ferry Pier. Star Ferry Pier is very accessible from Victoria Harbour and a good 15 to 20 minutes walking distance from Hotel Benito. There are ferry schedules every 30 minutes going to Macau and back. The fares are reasonable.

One of the best modes of transport... Great way of getting from a to b and a wonderful way to see the Hong Kong skyline during the day or night. The workers are dressed in little sailor suits which adds to the charm, cheap, relaiable and quick.
A must see for Boat lovers. See boats boats boats and similar see crafts and enjoy the breeze and harbor near or from afar. See to enjoy.
Classic. This is the classic way to get from Hong Kong to Kowloon and it should not be missed. Great value and gives you a feel for where you are.

Part of Hong Kong history - you must do it at least once. The Star Ferry has changed very little (if at all) since I first used it in 1978. It's a cheap and fun way to cross the ever-diminishing harbor. Slower than the MTR but infinitely more scenic. It's a must do for tourists; and can actually still be convenient for residents.Some of my old favorite shops at the Kowloon side have gone: Aji Ichiban for dried mango and the old fruit store where we used to buy young coconuts for the juice.
Efficient, cheap and fun.. A pleasant break from the hustle and bustle can be found on the ferry. It's cheap, well ventilated, and fun. Not to be missed.

Star Ferry. Cheap and a lovely trip over to central, lovely smooth crossing, always on time, every 15mins, once in central your right in the heart of all the shops and close to the peak, the tram ride is amazing
everybody does it.. for a few cents you can cross the harbour the old fashioned way, then get a trolley bus on HK island, does not cost much, but the tour companies will charge you extra for it.

Quick, cheap and easy to use.. We used the star ferry as part of the "Big Bus Tour" and found it quick and easy to use. The staff are helpful and the ferries fun like a well oiled machine leaving every couple of minutes.Great views of the island and the harbour.
A relief from the heat. It was sweltering for the first 4 days that we were in town and being on the pier and near the water in general helped.

Runs constantly and very cheaply. What more do you need?. I never could figure out why people would take the subway between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island when there's the Star Ferry. I have decided they must need to put more money on their Octopus card, which can only be done in the subway stations. St least that's the only reason I bail and go below ground. One note - although you save a small amount by going to the lower deck, the fumes aren't worth the savings. Take the upper deck entrance whenever possible.

Cheapest cruise. After more than 10years, I am taking the same ferry again as I promise to take my hubby for a ride. Last I remember it costed me HKD2.2 per ride and now it is HKD2.5, what a low inflation over a decade? Departing from Central jetty and arriving at Tsim Sha Tsui within minutes while enjoying the great view from both side of Kowloon and Hong Kong island, how could you miss this cheapest cruise ride?
Quick and easy. Easy and cheap to use, great way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong island.Ferries run about every eight minutes and the crossing takes about 10 minutes total.
Visit to Kowloon. A relaxing way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong island. My husband and I enjoy this trip which we did a couple of times day and night.

6 minutes in heaven. I doubt i could ever get bored of the Star Ferry. Unrivalled views, cheaper than the proverbial deep fried potato bits.
Worried youre facing the wrong way for the view? Just flip the backrest. Genius.

They've moved it - get it from Wanchai now. The reclamation has meant the old Pier on Hong Kong side is now nearly half way across the harbour - and a long trek to get to it. It's still worth doing - but you would be better to go to the Wanchai Ferry which is still where it used to be.

Better than the MTR. I took the Star Ferry late in the afternoon from Wanchai to Tsim Tsa Tsui as an alternative to the MTR (train). This is one of the best times to catch the ferry as the sun is setting and great photos can be taken of the sunset. Ferry fare is cheap and the ferry is nowhere as crowded as the MTR. The ride was very pleasant and relaxing. I highly recommend this ride.
Superfast and supercheap; it's worth a few rides!. Local transport is always the best way to enjoy a city. Pay extra once to ride on the top deck, and then ride below with everyone else.

Great way to see HK whilst crossing to Kowloon. The Star ferry is a Hong Kong institution, a wonderful and cheap way to cross from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. journey time is generally 15 - 30 minutes and a gives great views of the harbour and city. fare is very cheap ......overall a must do experience when in Hong Kong.
