It's something to do, but.... I didn't think it was anything special. There's no organization to the boarding process. People just jam up and push their way on to the boat so they can run to the front deck and get a seat. So, if you're not one of those "pushy" people, you'll get a seat without a view. Also, why would a sightseeing boat not have an open deck so you can get a 360 degrees view of the harbor? All in all, I am glad we did this. But I don't know how this is a top 50 lifetime experience. I think we would have had just as good of an experience and view if we sat on the shoreline and watched the light show.
Cheap and Convenient. Timings are frequent and it beats sitting in a cab. Probably woudl rethink if it was raining through,
Quick and cheap. Another must if you are visiting Hong Kong. The ferries are quick and cheap connecting the middle of Kowloon with the middle of Hong Kong Island.

Yummy Egg Tarts at the Star Ferry Pier in Tsim Sha Tsui. If you are going to the Hong Kong Island from Tsim Sha Tsui, catching the star ferry is a very good option. It is stable, quick and comfortable. A must try is the Egg Tarts available at the Star Ferry Pier on the Tsim Sha Tsui side. They have 2 branches, one shop right at the entrance of the pier but before the gate and another shop after you got inside the gate. The egg tarts are kept hot and yummy, only HKD8 each. Their chicken pie is also great. Between the 2 shops, I found the tarts at the branch before entering the gate is fresher and hotter. So don't forget to buy these special Hong Kong pastries when you visit Hong Kong!

A step back in time. Even though there are multiple options concerning the crossing of the Harbour i.e. MTR underground and cross-harbour tunnels, the Star Ferry and its piers is a throwback in time and still a bargain at $2.50 HKD or about $0.35 one-way.Tokens: Be sure to have change to get a token which unfortunately is a cheap plastic disk, not historic yet does its function. Most riders use their Octopus card for access. If leaving Kowloon, you have a choice between Central and Wan Chai. The Central dock is energetic with a bus station and many shops leading to Canton Road. If looking for upscale shopping on HK Island, the Central stop would be the choice. Also the Central stop is the closet to the Island line of the MTR.The other stop option is Wan Chai where the Convention Center is located. In general a less active option as there is a bus station upon arrival, however a solid 10-15 minute walk to the MTR station an Wan Chai. Best of staying or conducting business in Wan Chai.Views: While all the views heading south from Kowloon to HK Island are impressive, Central would be the better of the two as you have a view of not only of Central but also the mid-levels and Victoria Peak. The ride at dusk is truly breathtaking and be sure to have your camera ready.The ride takes 8 minutes of less. Used to be longer, however with infill on both sides of the Harbour, the ride seems to shorten every few years. If looking for a historic and relaxed option for travel between Kowloon and HK, this is the best option.
Cheapest way for the best view. Try and get on the ferry at sunset for some great pictures as the light comes back from the Hong Kong side buildings.
Hystorical. It's a must in Hong Kong, take the Star Ferry and cross the harbour, amizing in all weather conditions, but by night give the best, specially from Kowloon to Central .

Those were the Days!!!. The ferry ride to Wan Chai from Kowloon reminded me of the good old days when I used to travel from Butterworth to Penang Island. Besides it gave one the feel of what old Hong Kong was like.We can see the beautiful view of Victoria Harbour especially the night scene with the Symphony of Light displaying at the same time. The cost of the ferry ride is reasonably cheap.

Sort and sweet. Loved it ... You'd be hard pushed to find a better value for money attraction. Grab a seat on the far side of the boat midway back and get your camera ready ... It's not a long ride! A fantastic view of the harbour and after sunset and the laser show they're not too crowded.TIP make sure you have coins for the token machine ... I think it was 2 /2 and a half HKD each. If you find yourself stuck there's a little late night shop next door which will give you change if you buy a bottle of water / something!
Star Ferry. A must visit, after all it's been there years and is still running, the ferries still well kept and well used by thousands of visitors a year

Fun way to see the city and commute. Incredibly cheap (less than 1 USD!) way to see the city from the bay. If you have a few extra minutes, it is a practical way to go between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island, especially if you want to avoid the crowded MTR.

EXCELLENT way to see and experience Hong Kong!. Hong Kong is a commuters PARADISE! There are SOOO many ways to get around the city; the options are truly endless. The Star Ferry is one of the more scenic ways to get around this city with something like 200 or so islands! While I HIGHLY recommend a trip on the ferry, I'd recommend that you simply go for the standard fare. The upraded fare simply allows you to sit in an air conditioned space...not really worth it, in my opinion.
Great!. A great and cheap way to get to Kowloon/Hong Kong Island. Travels very frequently and allows amazing views. I'd recommend the top deck.

Incomparable. Simply one of the most exciting and scenic public transport experiences in the world. The ferries are frequent, and easy to use. There is a waiting area with cooling fans and some vending machines. You can purchase the ticket at machines or a small kiosk.

Amazing value. I made a point of finding the ferry port as I had to have a trip on the ferry. I ended up using it to get to/from Kowloon each evening, for roughly 20 pence it was amazing value and a lovely way to see the harbour lights. I even did the 1 hr trip which was a great way of finding out more about the HK harbour and getting your bearings.
amazing after sunset. watching the Hong Kong Island from Star Ferry Pier is amazing during evening . there are lots of tall building on the other side of the habour
A must do. The ferry is cheap and safe and very quick. make sure you sit on the correct sides for taking pictures of Kowloon or Hong Kong Island and is just incredible at night.

Odd shaped but it works. The Star ferries have no Bows or Sterns as they ply between piers on Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Once docked the skipper moves to the wheelhouse to steer in the next direction as these ships have dual controls. When I first saw these ferries it struck me as odd but I am now convinced that the system is brilliant. Also the backs of the bench seats can be moved so the passengers can see the views ahead of them. Sometimes, though, people do not move the seat backs so you see a mixed group of people viewing where they are going and some seeing where they have been. If you are over 65 and have bought an Octopus card that can be used pretty much everywhere just swipe it and go through the turnstile. The fare will be ZERO Hong Kong dollars. This is the city's way of thanking its senior citizens for living that long. :) BTW previously there used to be separate lane for senior citizens but this year they cancelled that and ask that you use your Senior Octopus card. You can use the Star ferry system to get to your destination or just hop from one to another and have a great sightseeing tour of the city and Victoria Harbor.
Easy and Convenient. This was not far from our hotel and it was easy and cheap to get to Hong Kong. At $2.50HK dollars for each ride it's a bargin…

Best Little Harbour ride in HK. Every visitor should make it compulsory to ride the historical Star Ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to either Central or Wan Chai. It would be one of the most pictureque and cheap ferry rides in the world.

Cheap, Efficient and Historical. No trip to hong Kong can be complete without a cross harbor ferry ride on Star Ferries. It's easy to use the ticket machines which dispense tokens. I prefer the top deck. Remember that the bench backs move to accommodate the different directions of travel.

A Nice Ride. This was a fun, easy and inexpensive way to take in a bit of old Hong Kong. The fare is very reasonable and you can obtain an exact fare token from a machine similar to the machine used in the MTR Stations. Almost no crowds and the Ferries leave quite often. Very nice views for the quick ride across the Harbor. Got a close up view of an old style "Junk" as we were crossing, which we were able to get some great photos of.
Going back in time. This just reminded me of going down to the pierhead in Liverpool and catching the ferry to Birkenhead but on a much warmer day with great views and only 25p Brilliant

great little jaunt. This was just so much fun and so cheap. Great views, short trip, not at all choppy although in bad weather it might be. Perfect for running over to Kowloon, walking along the waterfront and just takingbitbeasy. We will go again because access and price cannot be better.
Star Ferry Ride. Pretty quick, nice views and you don't have to wait too long for the ferry either. I think the MTR is faster so this is something everyone should try atleast once.

A ferry cheap scenic ride. We'd been urged to try the Star Ferry by everyone we know who'd been to Hong Kong. It wasn't as convenient as the MTR (especially as it seems impossible to find an online bus map of Hong Kong or Kowloon so as to get back to our hotel in N. Kowloon). So after coming down from The Peak on the tram (funicular) we got the Star Ferry to Kowloon. It was amazingly cheap and the views were a real bonus - good for photography, with no glass in the way. A must-do when in Hong Kong.

Exciting. Loved riding on the boat over to Kowloon, quick and inexpensive, nice breeze and good views, especialoly in the evening with the lights. Enjoyed the rush on and off the boats, like a speeded up film, reminded me of the old Hong Kong before China got their hands on it!

A must do. Used the Star Ferry to ride across from the mainland to Hong Kong Island. Mty family and I took the trip early one morning. It was a great way to see the harbour and also to get a great look at both skylines.Its very impressive as you make the trip across the harbour to HKK island as you come up to the tall skyline.Its a very cheap way to transport across, and once you are over there you are right next to the bus terminals to get around the island, and you can use the Octopus card as wellBoth our children and I enjoyed the journey. The ferry is open and allows you to see a very unobstructed view and is very quiet. THere is something about the rocking around on the water that makes the trip great.

Ferry to Hong Kong Island. A must catch the star ferry across to Hong Kong Island is easy and a great experience with amazing shopping at IFC on the other side. Take coins with your for your return ferry.
an historic must. Helpful staff - and get on the upper deck loading area - easy to use ticket machines and friendly botsmen to get us on and off the boarding ramps.
Required. A the title says, if you're in Hong Kong you must ride the Star Ferry. A throwback in time, we rode it in the afternoon (packed) and the morning (empty).
Water transport. A bit daunting at first, we used this firstly to get to Lantau Island then again for 2 days. Quite easy to use.
Historical ride. This is always a great pleasure when you visit Hong Kong. It is nice to see that this has not changed and provides you with that old world charm.
An alternative to the m t r. Took this after visiting the peak. An inexpensive way to see the night view and it brings us right to our door step of the hotel.
The ferry fare is cheap.. The ferry fare is cheap. fantastic service and great value for money. you can see the beautiful view of Hong Kong, it was very nice experience.

Tip: Lower deck on Star Ferry. everyone has a ride with the Star Ferry - but take care to enter the Lower Deck entrance: even more historic, seating, lightning, view, experiance. Its less cost , but much more fun than upper deck...
Clean. It's clean and convenient cos you'll either be in Kowloon or Hong Kong island in just a few minutes. The ferry fare is cheap.

Must see!. Great way to visit the harbor area and pretty inexpensive. We took the ferry to HK island on our way to Stanley market. Wasn't busy as far as people go and we had great views of the harbor and skyline. There are some nice restaurants on the HK side which we visited, including Subway. Would definitely recommend visiting at least once in your lifetime.
a little nostalgic. The Star Ferry is a small piece of Hong Kong that remains as it was years ago. It is wonderful and efficient and refreshingly unmodern.

Old-world ferries in a 21st Century City. The best way to travel from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon and back. Try it at night for a stunning view of the Hong Kong Skyline. There is a range of restaurants on the Kowloon side, facing the harbour.

Harbour Tour. We took the Star Ferry across to Hong Kong Island to go up to The Peak and also for a tour of Victoria Harbour. It was punctual, very reasonably priced and efficient - just like we found the rest of Hong Kong - the staff were helpful and we got lots of photos. The only slightly negative point was that there was no commentary with the tour - this might have been useful.

A Great Way to Experience Hong Kong. Ferries are good efficient transport, cheap and easy to understand. Fun to ride on an old ferry from Central to Kowloon. Much more expensive to take a cab through the tunnel to Kowloon.

Convenient!. Cheapest way to go to Kowloon side, good for photo op too! You can have a good view of the famous landmark in Hong kong from the harbor. You can see the symphony of lights during 8 PM, must see for tourists!
Everyone should travel on Star Ferry. A very cheap way to view the City and the beautiful buildings. If you travel around 8pm the boat slows to give you a view of the nightly laser light show.

Busy Busy Busy!!. It is not really geared for tourists as the Star Ferry is a commuter ferry between Hong Kong and Tsim Sha Tsui on Kowloon side. However as it a very cheap way to see the harbour a lot of tourists also use this public transport. Don't miss it

It's changed so much in the last 8-9 years. The feel around the Star Ferry Pier (well, the several piers) is very much like it was back in 2004 or so, when I last visited but the walkways have been expanded dramatically in line with the land reclamation programme and now you can practically walk to Central. There's a great gelato place on the Tsimshatsui side (XTC gelato) that you don't want to miss while waiting for the ferry.

Cheap and Cheerful means of transport. To get from Hong kong to kowloon takes only a matter of minutes on the star ferries which run every couple of minutes, the price is Hkd 2 (20p). Once you land at the pier in Kowloon you get pestered to death with street Hawkers trying to ply their trade in either suits, shirts, shoes. The ferry is also a great way to get some scenic pictures of the busy waterway and the harbour front by either day or night.

fantastic value. fantastic service and great value for money. HK$2.50 gets a seat upstairs on the ferry - the best value in town. The ferries are very frequent and run to military precision - if you miss you ferry just wait 10 minutes and another will be ready to go.

A Hong Kong must do.. If this is your first visit to Hong Kong a trip [or two or three] across the harbour on The Star Ferry is a number one priority.This has to be the most preferred, inexpensive and enjoyable way to cross.Mix it with the locals and be prepared for a bit of jostling - which all add to the pleasure of this short but memorable trip.Make sure you take your camera of course to 'snap' the ever evolving dynamic harbour waterfront.
cheap and nice experience!. It's the cheapest way to Hong Kong island, you can see the beautiful view of Hong Kong, it was very nice experience.

Star ferry an experience. We took the star ferry from wan chai pier to Kowloon. It was late in the evening around 7.15pm. It was very packed and crowded. People were pushing their way through to the counter to pay using octopus card, tokens. Hold on to your child tight. Everyone gets on to see the beautiful light show across Tim sha tsui. Good experience if you don't mind the crowd. The ferry has been around so long that it is running down.

So well executed. It is just so easy to hop off and on the Ferry that I find it more difficult atching buses in London than I do crosing the water here: never a hitch, always on time if heading of for the outlying islands, cheap, clean and fully efficient in every way.
Go on a clear day. It's just as easy to get across the harbor with the subway, but this is more senic if it is a clear day. Very cheap and easy and quick way to travel.

A Ferry Ride with Views. You can´t miss out this very cheap ferry ride between Hong Kong Central and Kowloon, The trip takes approx. 15 min. and can be paid with the Octopus Card or in cash. During the ride and from Kowloon there is a fantastic view over Hong Kong´s sky line. Also in Kowloon you can find some great shopping opportunities.

LOVE the star ferry. You HAVE to do the star ferry while in HK, along with the outdoor travelator! Definitely the best way to get to the island & an experience in itself. It is also super cheap - and even cheaper if you go second class downstairs!

Cheap and Great Views. Yes, it's old and takes a bit longer to get to and from the island then the MTR, but this is a classic. It's cheap, relaxing, and you get some great views of the harbour at night. It's nice after a long days shopping and sight seeing to be able to sit down for 5 mins, enjoy the breeze and the views. The upper deck is the best.
Cheap way to travel.. We went on the ferry to Kaloon I was amazed how cheap it was, 2 hong kong dollars each way which is about 16p

Exceptional way of getting around. This ferry is used to go to the Kowloon island from the main land. It takes a very short time to cross. Nice old ferry but clean and spacious. You can get a nice view of the Hong Kong sky line from the ferry.

Pretty views, doesn't run that late.. If you're looking for a great way to see the city and cross the harbour look no further, cheap and efficient. However be warned they don't run as late as I'd have thought, check out last crossings before you have to run like we did. Check out my blog for my Hong Kong details and photoshttp://www.globejetter.co.uk/2012/09/night-markets-hong-kong.html
Beautiful view. The ferry was a cheap and fun way to see the beautiful skyline!! Plus it's in National Geographics "100 Journey of a Lifetime" :)
quick ride to central hk. it's a good experience to ride across to central hk... take the upper deck & enjoy the sea view... the ride around 8pm has a good view to the symphony of lights...

Touristy? Yes. Necessary? Yes.. Classic Hong Kong to visit star ferry. Not bad that they also have a Subway on the Island side. Starbucks there too. If you are prone to seasickness, ride the ferry on the lower level in the center of the boat... much less movement.

Another fab transport in Hong Kong. We used this Ferry to get back to Hong Kong Island after we had been to see the light show and Avenue of Stars. There was no queueing we were straight on the ferry, we went up on top deck. You have a chance of viewing the skyline from a slightly diferent view. It is very cheap to use. Well worth a trip of two.
Take a ride on the ferry. The ferry goes between Kowloon and HK island every 10 minutes or so. A cheap means of transportation and the shopping on the Kowloon side is amazing

The best views of Hong Kong. Want the best views of Hong Kong at the lowest price. Take a Star ferry across Hong Kong and Kowloon. At the alarming rate in which the sea in the middle is disappearing due to reclamation, this ferry trip may not be around in a decade. Hong Kong Island will be physically connected by land to Kowloon by then!

They old in the modern. The star ferry has been operating since the beginning of time! Well may be not that long but it is an experence every one visiting HK shoud have. The boats are old dating back to the 50's but the atmosphere is wonderful. Sit on the top deck and watch the view. The trip is getting shorter and shorter each year! or join the locals down stairs. A night crossing gives you some of the most wonderful city scapes any where in the world

Entertaining area. Great place to go to watch the light show that starts at 8.pm every night. Get there early if you want the best view. Many other entertaining attractions around the area also worth looking at
Easy and Convenient. On time, clean, reliable, fast journey to Central. Can pay with the Octopus card. Ferry's come regularly and go all over the harbour. Cheap, safe and convenient.
Cheap way to experience the Harbour. Really cheap way to experience the harbour. Easy to use and an authentic way to travel. Travelling across at night allows you to view the lights from both sides
Ferry. If you do nothing else in Hong Kong go across the harbor on the Star Ferry. Use the upper deck and sit in the front. It is great treat to go back and forth.

Don't miss the experience. Due to reclamation along the Victoria Harbour, the trip has been shortened to only 7 minutes. But still, it is worthwhile to get an experience; not just from post card. Connecting Central District n Tsimshatsui, you can visit both ends at a small cost. Don't forget to see how the sailor use ropes to help stable the ferry next to the berth.

Cheap, inexpensive way to cross Victoria Bay. This is the best, cheapest way to cross Victoria Bay from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon or visa versa. Cost only $3.40 HKD (or .44 USD) for a 1 way travel!! Using the MTR is more expensive!The seating is simple but can't beat the views!!

Fast service. I expected immigration to take 1-2 hours. But it did not. It only took us 30 minutes. We went there on a weekday. I heard it would take longer if it's a weekend. People were friendly and can speak English somehow.The ride is still "wavy" and I got a little dizzy at first. But I think it does not depend on the boat type, but on the weather condition.
Unique way of transportation. Its an public transport over there.I like that a lot.Usually its convinient to travel between kawloon to Hongkong

The ferry from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui is a cheap way to see HK skyline. I love taking the ferry from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui and vice versa. It is a cheap way to see the HK skyline and have a short cruise across the harbour. It is especially pleasant in the evening/night as it is cooler and you can see the night lights.
Great ol' boat. Great service which is easy to use, recommend using it, the only way I reckon to get between Kowloon and Hong Kong!

The Biggest Little Trip in the World. The Star Ferry could easily be the most anachronistically grand experience available in the world. There is something indescribably fine about churning across the ever diminishing Hong Kong harbour aboard these chubby, stubby, iconic ferries. Incredibly, the cost difference between first class (upper deck) and poor-person's class (lower deck) is about a nickel - and even more remarkalbe is how much more satisfying the lower deck experience is. Everything, from the billion dollar views, the roiling water, the smell of the harbour, the smell of the engine, is all so very magical. I go out of my way to cross the harbour this way as often as I can.
Shabby. Been around for a long time with no update, looking a bit tired, however a very efficiient and quick system.

Cheapest way back to Kowloon. At 3HKD its the cheapest mode of transportation going to Kowloon. Plus the view of HK and Kowloon is really something.Take the 2nd floor of the Star Ferry. In the 1st floor smells all gasoline.

Yust Do It. If you are visiting and you are not on a tight business schedule (or just to take a breath after a busy day), than this is a great way to commute to Kowloon. Very efficient and cheap. I would argue that the ferry might even compete with the taxi for convenience in peak times. For a great view. stay on the eastern side, maybe even on the upper deck. It's a pity it's so short!

must do experience. Once you have worked out how to purchase the token from a coin machine, it's really a fun experience. The views are amazing. The boats are old sturdy ferries and only take 5 minutes to cross from Kowloon to Hong Kong island.
Ferry is a great transportation. The pier itself is boring but the ferry is great. Good view of the skyline and great to cross the water.

every aspect is enjoyable. Definately take the ferry to hong kong island for a couple of dollars and enjoy the short scenic trip At the Pier, there is a very sizable shopping mall, which I managed to get lost in, not too hard to do either. The pacific coffee shop, they had free PC you can use, take as long as you like if no one else is waiting. We thought this was awesome.Many many tourists were here the day we were in as the cruise ships docks here as well.

A must do.... As mentioned in other reviews, you should do it. Affordable, vintage, the way to get around The trip is pretty fast, but oh the views. You truly get the feel for the city in the ferry, you we not regret the ride!

Bad Service. The ferry was old and smelly. They gave us coupon for refreshment but the bar was already closed when we wanted to claim it. A service with NO SMILE, as if they are not happy to work for it, but the view was great.
good. with only small money hkd 2.5 can ride u from either hk to tst or tst to hk....yet can view the million dolar view from the star ferry...

Absolutely essential for any visit to HK. As mentioned in other reviews, everyone should do it. The easiest way is to use your pre=loaded MTA card. The trip is quick, but in good weather the photographic opportunities are inumerable. You truly get the feel for how awesome this city is from the vatage point of a ferry crossing Vic Harbor.

Take it once just to say you did it. The trip is a short one to Hong Kong Island but none the less gives a waters view of the skyline. We later took the subway over to Admiralty on the Isand which is faster.
Busy. Clean, busy and no smokers. Decorated with a wax model of queen E , good advertisement . Dislike is the crowd.

Rude Staff. Such an enjoyable quick journey, but the staff are so rude. We had a free pass with our Big Bus tour and the guy snatched our tickets and would not give them back. He said it was one way. The ticket had in english clearly written return, but he would not even read it. Very disappointing and horrible man. Big Bus confirmed our story and reissued us a return pass.
Quick and easy. A must do for any traveller business or pleasure when your in Hong Kong. Its efficient, its fast and the perfect way to view both sides of Hong Kong from the Water

Another great HK to do. Star ferry is another great thing to do in HK. Where else can you do something like this for 2.50 HKD ( 0.33USD) each way. It is historic, fun, and alaround a neat thing to do. You land in Kowloon. Take it at night and see the city light up.
Good transportation. I travelled in Star Ferry from Hongkong to Macau. It just too 45 mins to go. Very fast and pricing would be between 140 to 180 HKD per person one way fare

An experience one has to have.. The Pier is well organised,thogh a little difficult to communicate if needing help.Ferries are on time and efficient,all the staff on the ferries wearing their sailor style uniforms are an extra bit of character.Cooldrinks and snacks are available at the entrance of each ferry and on the ferries themselves too.
Convenient to discover the other side. Convenient , cheap, great way to view HK at both side from the Ferry, also easy to get to many island if you want!

Easy transportation. Very crowded on weekends. Hard to use the machines to buy tickets. Construction around the pier made it difficult to get back to the hotels. People were pushy getting on and off the ferry.
A must. We took the Star Ferry during the day and night to/from all 3 piers. It is excellent value and the views of the harbor and skyline are fantastic especially at night.
Ferry Ride. The ferry ride is a must and at about .50 cents US you can't beat the value. The views from the ride are breathtaking.

Hong Kong Essential. Want to know Hong Kong, but don't have much time. Make sure you visit Star Ferry Pier and take the ferry across the water to get a good look of what Hong Kong looks like. Then go up to Victoria's Peak.

Convenience and options galore. What must contribute to making Hong Kong one of the biggest tourist destinations in the world, is surely the ease for travelers to get around. There are so many transport options, from the tram, to bus, to MTR, to taxi, to ferry. It is just so easy!The Star Ferry is an experience, as it is part of historic Hong Kong and even if you just cross the bay and back again - do try!

A Must Do. One way to do it, is to catch the Star Ferry from Wan Chai to TST and then return from TST to Central or Central to TST and the return back to Wan Chai to see a great view of both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. At both ends there a plenty of taxis. Travel during the day and the night and have your camera ready. If you time it right and catch one just before 8pm they normally stop in the middle while the nightly light show is on. If you are using a seniors Octopus card they are free.

A HK must. Go at night and take the Star Ferry from TST and back. If you go to TST at dusk, you can see the nightly light show on the side of the HK skyscrapers AND hear the music that it's choreographed to at the TST harbour.

New additions but still the same. Had been here 30 years ago and the inside of the actual landing where you get on the ferry is pretty much the same, however the terminal and surrounding area is very built up and full of shops, not to mention about 150 yards of new waterfront landfill full of hotels and an exhibition center - quite a shock!

Icon of HK. One of the must-dos in Hong Kong for any visitor, the Star Ferry is the city icon. For only HKD 2.5, you get an unblocked view of the harbor and city skyline.It has been decades since I took the Star Ferry so decided to show my toddler this time. Oh! He loved it! Choose the upper deck for AC and better air quality.

Great way to see the harbour both in the day and at Night. Really cheap way to get across the harbour and see the views of the skyline at the same time. It costs HK$3.40 on weekends and HK$2.50 on weekdays for upper deck tickets. If you are interested in the views definitely opt for the upper deck. The entrance is further along from the lower deck entrance past a few bus stops and stores. The seat backs switch sides so you can face the direction of travel which is a nice touch. A must do in Hong Kong for the price. If you can go at night and in the day! If you time it right you can see the light show in the harbour too!
Has to be done. Super cheap and iconic, pleasant and easy to travel on- how could you miss a trip on the Start ferry?

Star ferry. This is just something you have to do while in Hong Kong, and it is inexpensive! It goes often and all day - good for taking to the light show that is on every evening at 8pm - goes from central pier to TST pier.
Night view... The best night view to take a photo for memories. But it close at 11pm if you wish to be on the higher floor.
great view. The ferry is just about ten minutes but you get a great view to all the buildings both from Hk island and koolong. I liked that the seats can change direction.

Good view from the water. The pier wasn't anything special, but the ferry ride across the harbour gave a different perspective to the buildings on both sides. It was also a cheap and convenient way to travel between Wan Chai and Kowloon!
Great Fun. This is a great way to cross the Victoria harbour they a re frequent and cheep as chips. Upeer deck for the toffs and lower deck for the pesants but I travelled up and down great fun.

Great way to travel. I was in hong kong for a convention at the convention centre, so the ferry was a really great way to travel to the convention centre from kowloon island. The pier is just opposite the convention centre! Much more convenient than taking the MTR and its much cheaper too. For $2.50 HKD per ride, its quite a steal. When you travel at night, you can watch the light show that's on at 8pm every night.

Good facilities.Ticketing easy.. Once on the ferry, there are better views than travelling under the harbour using the MTR! Novel way of travelling; a bit like going on the ferry across the Mersey, without Gerry singing.Takes 10 mins approx and gives access to Kowloon.Lots of photo opportunities of river transport and amazing buildings/ sky-scrapers.
Must do Hong Kong experinance - especially at night. If you don't do anything else in HK go on the Star Ferry at night! Cheap and frequent with fantastic view of the skyline.

A cheap and enjoyable way of getting into Hong Kong island. This is a very classical form of transportation and it dates back to the time before the tunnel was dug. My family and I took this ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong island in the morning and we experieced the morning hour rush.The trip ware not that long, about 15-20 minutes or so, but we certainly enjoy the sea breeze and the wave splashing against the ferry. Of course who can ignore the smell of dissel coming from the engine room.The ferry waas not crowded and there are enough seats for every one. On the way, it is possible to also enjoy the scenic view of both Hong Kong and Kowloon covered by a layer of fog.It is definitely a good experience and a must when you come to Hong Kong. This may be one of the few places left where you can still find the ferries of the old time.

Has to be done in HK. Really easy to use - we had Octopus cards, so we just swiped and went.The views from the boat are stunning and the old styling of the boat is fab.The back rests of the seats are movable, so if the seat is facing in the direction opposite to that which you want to travel, just move it to the position you want!Costs cents to ride - great way to see HK.

Easy to use. You can buy your tickets for the Star Ferry from machines which are located in the Star Ferry grounds, once purchased you go through turnstiles and it's a short walk to the safety gate. The gate is opened and you can board the ferry.

GREAT WAY TO GET AROUND. My first visit to Hong Kong, I went with my brother who has been visiting Hong Kong for about 30 plus years. Travel on public transportation is the way to go providing you know where to go and what ferry, MTR route.We took the Star over to Lantau Island. We stayed all day on the island and returned on the Star Ferry night and got an opportunity to see the night skyline of Hong Kong that can not be missed. The ferry is efficient, clean and punctual.
A must do !!. The MTR is a great way to travel but you miss the views.Do this at least once at night & once during daylight hours to see this magnificent city from the Harbour.

Historic. From the days before tunnels and the MRT--the Star Ferry was "the" way across the Harbor. It's not nearly as crowded as those days--but we like to ride it occasionally--and enjoy the views--rather than pack into the MTR for a sub-terranean ride--although it's marvelously efficient.

Efficient. Although the pier is crowded all the time, it runs very efficiently. It is easy to buy your ferry tickets from the the ticket dispenser and the ferry runs so frequently that you needn't fear that you'll miss the boat!

A must-do for visitors. We took the ferry over to Tsim Sha Tsui to watch the symphony of lights. Transport in HK is very cheap (not much else is). We travelled over on the upper deck which is slightly more expensive than travelling on the lower deck. If you're lucky and get the ferry that leaves just before 8pm it stops in the harbour briefly to get a close-up of the symphony.

A must do... for locals and tourists alike!. Nothing compares to taking a trip on the Star Ferry across the harbour at night.Its the cheapest and most spectacular form of transport in HK... and always a favourite with out of town visitors!

A scenic ride. Quick, cheap and scenic route from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. The ride across afforded excellent views of Victoria Harbour, Kowloon waterfront and Hong Kong Island. The return trip was while the lights and laser show was on during the evening. The lights and lasers I think are better to view from Victoria Harbour than from the ferry.

Good Destination. I was able to take the No. 8 bus from my hotel, the YWCA Anne Black, to the Star Ferry Pier, where I could shop for souvenirs like keychains and tiny jade figurines or do some of the high end shopping Hong Kong is famous for. The shopping areas near my hotel did not carry postcards, but I found them here and, after doing so, took the Victoria Harbor tour. This is also a good location for meeting tailors and getting fitted for handmade clothing.
Old World Charm. The Ferry ride is an experience in itself. Costs HKD2.50 from TST to Central and the scenic ride both in the morning and night is something any traveller to HK must not miss.

Efficient. Ferry travel on The Star Ferry is easy. Just go and purchase an octopus card from the MTR and enter the ferry system by swiping the card at the turnstiles. There is an indicator which tells you which line to stand in to enter. The ferries depart what seems to be every 5 minutes so if you just miss one ferry, another one is pulling in. Upstairs seating is marginally more expensive than the downstairs. Easy as.
Great for viewing the Laser show at night. Excellent for viewing the nightly laser show. Beautiful weather and people watching. Definitely worth it.
Just something you have to do. Quick trip across but a bit of history. Cheap as chips and very regular service. Would recommend to anyone visiting as a must do
Cheap and cheerful. Great for children. Well worth it.A great way of crossing fom Kowloon to Honk Kong Island and vice versa.Ride up top one way and down below on the way back.

Don't bother with the night cruise-stay on the pier!. If you want to see the light show you should stay on the viewing deck of the pier. Tickets are limited for the cruise which takes in the light show and they sell out very early. We had a fantastic view and got amazing photos from the pier.

A definite must do!. A trip on The Star Ferry that plies the harbour between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon is a definite must do for anyone visiting Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is one of Hong Kong's most famous attractions which provides an inexpensive way of crossing the harbour and enjoying some spectacular views of the harbour, Kowloon waterfront and Hong Kong Island at the same time. The service has been in existence for over 130 years and currently 12 ferries operate on two routes, plus harbour tours. I have mentioned the Star Ferry and posted photographs on my blog Travel Tales.
adventure hong kong style. taking the ferry from kowloon side to hong kong side is part of the adventures in hong kong, crossing the island on an old style ferry is something to look forward to
Star Ferry is interesting. The Star Ferry is an interesting old fashioned way to cross Victoria Harbor from Central Hong Kong to Kowloon.

Fantastic. Truly old Hong Kong, which has become a bit harder to find amid all the steal and glass. Careful to board on the top for great vistas, but I prefer to sit below with the engine chugging and watch the crew toss the ropes. These boats aren't as old as they seem, but you'll really feel like you're in the 19th century.
Good Views andCheap. The views are good and the ferry is peanuts for a ride. It is really just a boat ride but is nice to go for a walk or visit attractions on Hong Kong Island.
Must do activity in the evenings for superb views of Hong Kong at night. Brilliant. Punctual. Great value for money. Views from back of boat leaving ferry terminal on HK island
Harks back to a different era. Given the gleaming and glitzy skyline that is now hong Kong the ferry terminals at TST Wan Chai and central are from a bygone age. For that alone they are wonderful.
Convinent. Easy to move around by ferry. Get to see sights. You can see both Hong Kong Island & Kowloon. Get a feel of what the locals do. :)

Cheap and Convenient. This is the easiest and cheapest way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Tired of being crammed in the MTR and having to switch trains at Admiralty during rush-hour? Take the Star Ferry! For only $2.5HKD you get a relaxing 15 minutes journey from Wan Chai to Kowloon. Go around the time of the "Symphony of Lights" and the Ferry will pause in the middle of the harbour to ensure that passengers get a view. Plus, even when the ferry is "crowded" you won't have people invading your personal space like on the MTR. Did I mention the same journey on the MTR costs about $10.50HKD/person?Even if you're just in HK for the day, take some time to ride the Star Ferry. Chances are you're going to want to explore the Kowloon side as well as HK Island anyway.TIP:If you're travelling from HK Island on the Star Ferry around the time of the Symphony of Lights, turn right out of the ferry terminal in TST and head towards the Avenue of Stars. This provides the best vantage point for light show and also broadcasts the accompanying music and script (in English M/W/F) that enhances the show.

A fantastic place to take a photograph of just have a swift drink. A fantastic place to watch the world go by as you enjoy a drink.the view of the harbour is amazing and it is so central to everything.
HK must-do!. Cheap and cheerful way to get a great view of HK and get across the Harbour. The kids loved it! Got to do this when in HK!
A must do. This is the only must do really. If you do toning else in HK then take a trip on the star ferry. Then you've visited HK.

Great experience. This is not to be missed. The Star Ferry pier is where you catch the ferry to go from TST to Hong Kong Island. try the ferry, It is a great experience. Mix with the locals. Take picturtes. It is fun.
Star Ferry Pier. Brilliant, quick and easy to get around from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. We stayed at the Novotel Century and used walkways all the way to the Pier.

Experience hong kong in the old days. Inexpensive. Good view of the Victoria Harbour. Good experience to travel on one of the oldest means of transportation to experience old hong kong. Trip across Harbour is very short, about 5 minutes.
great little ferries. Cheap easy to use and great fun. $2.50 has to be great value for the experience. Upper deck best for views.
A bit of nostalgia. Take a ride on the Star Ferry - your trip to Hong Kong is not complete without it - it's an icon. A bargain at only HKD2 (about .30c Aust).

Star ferry ride a must. The Star ferry and its pier are not modern, sterile nondescript high lights of Hong Kong they are the working cogs of Hong Kong use these to get to the island if staying on Kowloon or elsewhere. These are not tourist sites but an everyday mode of transport we loved using and was extremely cheap. Hong Kong is full of old and new this is an oldie but a goodie. Travelled on May 2010 but could not go back that far.

Important part of the commuter. In Star Ferry Pier, You can try to cross over from Hong Kong Island to Kwolon. You can use the Star Ferry Company. With 2 dollars HK, you can enjoy a boat to cross the two islands.You also see its elegant clock tower. This is the re-creation of a distinctive building reinforcing the history and character of the Star Ferry with its identity as an important landmark at the new waterfront in Central.

it's just a ferry...but it's great!. The Star Ferry is one of those iconic HK 'activities' that you just have to do! We've been travelling to HK since the mid 80s, but the Star Ferry has never changed...love it!

Star Ferry is a must do. The ferries themselves are basic, rustic and anything but luxurious, but that's the charm and its why they're good value. For HKD $2 its a cheap, fun, quick and interesting ride from the island to Kowloon or the reverse. The terminals may not be glitzy and glamorous either but seriously who cares, they do the job.
Same old. Nothing great about the pier but the ferry itself has a history to it and is the cheapest mode of transportation to Hong Kong island.

Great Scenery!!!. A MUST visit place in Hong Kong.Beautiful scenery especially during the night time!!!You can buy some Hong Kong street food and eat at the Avenue of Star.It was very relaxing.Dun missed out this place.

Take star ferry to Hong Kong at night. Wonderful experience. This is the way to go If you want to see great waterfront views of Hong Kong at night. I can't believe one of the highlights costs practically nothing and what an experience. We also found the Indian street food to be superb at the terminals especially after a few beers. What great value all round.

An Icon or Hong Kong. The Star ferry terminal is a long walk on the Hong Kong Side, however the walk is on a walkway above the road and it is easy to get there, it is easy from the Kowloon side, we enjoyed our trip on the ferry and there are markets and shops at the terminal to see local crafts and fare.
A must "go to" in Hong Kong. Visiting Hong Kong but not going to the Start Ferry Pier would be a sin!! It is not very expensive and a great way to take pictures
great view. excellent view, cheap fare, except now you have to walk a mile to the ferry terminal on the Hong Kong side, it is still worth the effort

Lovely walk around the harbour. But a bit smelly! The walk around to the Intercontinental Hotel was great. Remember to walk upstairs before you board the ferry, as you cannot do it once onboard and it's quite fumey at the bottom!

Excellent Views. I have used this ferry on a number of occassions during trips to Hong Kong. For those that say it's just another ferry ride.....well, they're right. Not sure what they excepted from a commuter ferry to think it would be anything else. However, you get an excellent view of the harbor for virtually nothing. The wait has never been long during my times there and there are plenty of things to do near the terminals.

Star Ferry. Great quick trip across the harbour from Kowloonn to HK Island and back. Use Octopus card to pay fare - easy. Pier area on Kowloon side does have quite a lot of Hawkers hassling you to buy cheap watches and handbags without having them actually there. They expect you to say 'oh yes just what I want a cheap rip-off' and then follow them down some alley to take a look!!!! Don't do it people. These guys, mostly Indian, are just annoying.
Cheap and Cheerful. This is a wonderful, touristy thing to do in Hong Kong; so do it! The view is fantastic and your fellow travelers are interesting for people watching. It is safe and very cheap.
Great views. Very cheap (around 0,30 euro per journey).You get the best views. Go also during night.It leaves you right next the Apple store!!! (HK side)

Fun and inexpensive way to cross the harbor. Based on other reviews, I purposefully took my family to Central pier specifically to take the Star Ferry across the harbor. To be honest, it was just another ferry ride. Nothing spectacular. The only reason we did it was to say that we rode a ferry in Hong Kong. I think it is just one of those things you should do to check off your bucket list. An added bonus, however, is that waiting just outside of the Tsim Sha Tsui station is a shopping center called "Harbour Town" that has some nice shopping and dining options. (Biggest Toys r Us in Hong Kong)

A must to do .... While the Metro is available and faster ... we have ALWAYS crossed with the Ferry. It's a must to do !!! Waiting time is rare, and it's simply so typical. Just do it, you won't regret it !

Just Another Ferry Ride. I'm almost ashamed to say this with all the great reviews, but it just wasn't that special for me. Granted you can get some different views of Hong Kong, but it wasn't any where near one of my top moments in Hong Kong. The Staten Island Ferry and the Seattle Ferries were my all time favorite ferry rides.

A great place to start your journey. There is not that much going on at the pier, but, once there you can of course take ferry to various islands or simply use it as the starting point or a good walk along water on sidewalks relatively (for HK standards) empty...if too hot simply go back a block and use malls for your walk
Cheap way to enjoy HK harbour. Delightful old wooden ferry - it's a short ride with stunning views. It's best to have an Octopus card for paying the fare.

Easy & Inexpensive Activity. I am only in Hong Kong for an overnight layout, but wanted to get a sense of the city since this is my first visit. I took the Airport Express to the Hong Kong station and went directly there to the ferry termimal (less than a 5 minutes walk). The kiosk for a token was easy to use, and I was on a ferry within minutes. Although there is an hour long tour option, I just went across the harbor, stayed on while everyone else departed, and came back for a 20 minutes round trip. Great views of the skyline, and the best part is that it only cost about 32 cents US ($2.50 HK)!!

Short but memorable. This is one of the highlights of our trip. We hop from TST to Central. Although the trip was short, the kids loved watching the water and the other boats, even the adults. Cheap fare, good view, cool breeze of air, felt relaxed for a moment in the middle of HK. Will definitely try this again.
Great view. The nightview was an incredible sight but on a warm summer day/night it was too humid to walk along the entire pier. But recommended for those who love night scenes.

It's a must-do thing in HK. taking into consideration of it's relatively central location and low price... for us local people, it's also a relatively cheaper means of transport from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central or Wanchai. As I prefer to take MTR, the last time I took the ferry was a year ago with my expat friend before his transfer to the UK.Believe me, you won't regret it even though one may find it nothing special -- for those who like taking ferries, I strongly recommend taking ferries to Lamma (Yung Shue Wan) for seafood dinner / hiking / just to see the place or Mui Wo or Discovery Bay. Ferries for these outlying island are at the pier near Central MTR station / 10 mins walk from the Star Ferry Central pier.

A bit of old Hong Kong. This is a must do for visitors. It is an authentic part history. It is very cheap to use. We went from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island, and it a good fun way to get across. Everyone should use it at least once.
HK Ferry. A HK classic & very cheap. A great way to travel between Kowloon & HK island whilst taking in the sights.
CHEAP THRILL. I took the ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island on a Sunday morning. A real cheap thrill to explore HK!

Great experience. Take the ferry at night for fantastic views of HK island and Kowloon and their glorious city lights. Fab value costs approx 20p for a single and travels late (think the last crossing is about 12pm) to save yourself a taxi fare through the toll route.

Old Novelty Compared to Newer Ferry Services. If you like the hustle and bustle and fighting crowded to get on and off, then definitely go, its so cheap; but prefer the more civilized and cleaner alternatives.

Best combined with Symphony of Light every evening. The ferry itself is nothing special at all. It is a cheap and quick way to go from Kowloon to Hong Kong island and the other way around. Is worth a higher rating if you take the trip comined with the Symphony of Light at 8' o clock in the evening.

It is a must.. for HKD$2.80. C'mon for just over 20pence e/w you can go from Central to Tsimshatsui... To go across the water on the Star Ferry which traces its origins to 1880, what fantastic value for money.
Just do it and do some shopping and get some food!

A little bit of history - well almost!. You cant go to Hong Kong and not take a trip on a Star ferry! We were staying on kowloon island and used the ferry most days to get to H/K island. The are cheap, great fun and good way to sightsee. The pier is lovely- a great place to have a coffee/ people watch and relax while you wait for you ride home

The way to travel to the island. No better way if you have time than to take the Star Ferry from TST to HK Island. Sliding over the waves as you near the skyscrapers... It is a true HK feeling for me and only 3,6 HKD. Get ur Octopus card and swipe it...!!!!

The most fun you can have for $2. Take the 15 minute trip to Kowloon even if you dont have to go there. The ferry is fun and economical. Shopping in Kowloon is fun too. Great place to view the 8 pm fireworks from.
old style ferry. I was fun to put a plastic coin in the slot and hop on the ferry for a short ride to Hong Kong from Kowloon. Old style and fascinating despite dirty water all around
Long walk. Seems like the reclamation/infill is pushing the ferry pier farther out--long walk from Metro on the Hong Kng island side.
star ferry.. cheap must do. A piece of history, a must do and at the price of a couple od HK dollars you get one of the best views in the world/
Fun cheap ride. This is a great way to cross to H K island from kowloon if you do not have a lot of money. Its like 50 cents or something. The only cheap thing in HK.

Get you Big Bus tickets here. HK has an awesome hop on hop off Big Bus service on Kowloon and HK Island. Great value indeed and easy for the not so mobile traveller who wants to savvy the sights and sounds of this great city. Buy you tickets from the young vendors representing the Big Bus at the Star Ferry Pier. The ticket includes the ferry and is valid for one or two days depending on your choice. Then hop in, sit back, put on the headphones and be transported through the soup pot of sights, sounds and smells as the double decker winds its way all over to include The Peak, Aberdeen, Stanley Markets, Ocean Park, Hollywood Road ( antiques) and much much more.
Fab. Brilliant little boats. Amazing for photographs of the harbour and a must do on a visit to Hong Kong. Much more exciting than getting the MTR!
A practical and memorable way to cross the harbor. At less than HKD 4 (one-way) and fabulous views on both sides, what more can I say?

BEST way to Cross the Island. Its so convenient and cheap! My family and I used to ride this to cross the islands before. Good memories! :) Brought my boyfriend to try it this time. It was short and sweet. We took this short ride from Wanchai Port to Kowloon. Took pictures while we're at it. Got off, and there we were at Harbour City. It was better than walking to the MTR.
Overcrowded and Exciting. I love a trip on the harbopur and the Pier is crammed with Restaurants Cafes and Bars get down there and soak up the madness I LOVE IT
Good way to see the skyline. Caught this a couple of times. Very cheap and a good way to see both sides of HK.

The Pier and the Ferry - Both a Star. The Star Ferry is a safe, convenient and inexpensive way to get to either side of HK. The ferry ride is short and gives a nice feeling of being on the harbour waters. Though old, it remains clean.The pier is near many tourist spots and can thus be easily included in your itinerary. At night, the colorful lights of different buildings make a fascinating sight.

Great spot to view the laser show!. We were told to take the dinner cruise or just the laser light cruise, but I'm glad we didn't spend the money unnecessarily. We had a great view from the pier and it was just across the street from our hotel. FREE!
A MUST DO IN HK. This is a HK tradition and mybe the cheapest boat ride in the world. No trip to HK is complete with out a ride on the Star Ferry. It never gets old!

Great for the money!. An efficient way to get across the harbor, for a good price. Be aware that if you want to be upstairs, you need to buy the tickets upstairs and board there. We rode it a few times, as it is a relaxing, inexpensive, quick and postcard-worthy way to travel around. Recommended.
Good choice to visit the islands. Great place to take a boat to visit the Hong Kong Islands, and it is also very cheap.

A Must in Hong Kong. The Pier is a very large area where you can sit and watch Hong Kong pass by, the people and the boats in the Harbour. Easily accessed to hop on board either a tour boat to one of the many Hong Kong Islands, a Harbour Cruise or to catch the wonderful Starr Ferries that traverse Hong Kong Harbour and mix with the locals.
Clean & Large Pier. Clean & Large Pier / Almost like an airportGreat facilities

Iconic Hong Kong. While the rest of Hong Kong flies to the sky, this has not changed much over the years. You can still get a feel of the old Hong Kong by walking around here. Hard to believe that these old ferries are still going. More power to them! I hope they keep going for a long time yet.
So cheap!. Great way to go around the islands and sooooo cheap. Kids loved it

Such a bargain for a great view. Never tired of this trip. So much fun and great views. It is HKD $.5 cheaper down stairs but can't say we ever tried it. Even the locals loved a window seat to take in the impressive skyline. It is prob longer than the MTR but the views alone make it worthwhile.
Ferry of choice. Fantastic mode of transport - and a great way of getting around to the other side.
The only way to cross to the Island. Star ferry is a must, still incredibly cheap and gives a birds eye view of Kowloon and the Island.

Cheap and scenic. The pier is nothing special but the ferry ride is memorable.The star ferry is a must do on any trip to HK. Sure beats the MRT.The best way to travel between HK and Kowloon enjoying great views.

Star Ferry Pier :-(. The star Ferry pier was in need of modernisation and we felt more English written signs explaing where each Ferry will be going for connections to popular sites could have been displayed to inform travellers of what ferry they should be boarding. We also found that not all of the pier staff spoke fluent English which became an issue for us at times.

the cheapest and best way to see HK and kowloon. take the ferry from kowloon to central (and vice versa) to see both sides of the harbour. at HKD2.20, it's the cheapest mode of transport in HK. HK trams cost 2.00 but you see more of the skyline on the ferry.
Have to try it at least once in your life. I love taking the Star Ferry to get to the other side. Price is relatively inexpensive and the view is fantastic. A definite must do in Hong Kong
ride between past and future. Another old, reliable and cheap transportation of Hong Kong. The short ride between Hk Island and Kowloon gives you a glimpse of the many faces of Hong kong.
beautiful. a mustwonderful viewgoodromanticnight viiew - greatChristmas is the best time to come
"Excellent". This historic Pier provides a cheap way to travel by Star Ferry from main Island to Kowloon island. View of city skyline from Star ferry is breath taking. A must do while in Hong Kong.

Don't take the tunnel. If you need to cross the Harbour the Star Ferry is an absolute must. You can sit in the upper deck (First Class) which is not really any different from the lower deck, just a slightly better view. It's very inexpensive, crowded,and the most entertaining way to cross the water. A "must do" when in Hong Kong.
The classic ferry ride. My only disappointment is that Hong Kong harbor is no longer filled with Chinese junks. It's still a great ferry ride.
So cheap. Getting the ferry to main island and back was so easy and super cheap. Get an Octupus card it's so easy and the ferries are very frequent.
free from traffic jam. best transportation from / to between tsim sha tsui and central

Famous lightshow!. Get there just before 20:00 to see the famous HK lightshow: whole buildings are alive with lights as the music plays, and from across the harbor it's a real treat.
However, it lasts only 15-20 minutes, so plan something for later, or come rigt after you've landed and get some sleep afterwords.

Good way to see Hong Kong. The Star ferry terminal has toilets, places to eat very close and a Hong Kong tourist office. If you are over 60 and have a senior Octopus card you travel on the ferrys free.
Best 5 minute boat ride. I rode the Star Ferry in 1964, and now in 2012. Not a lot of change - just a great short boat ride across the harbor. Not to be missed whenever you visit Hong Kong.
Take the ferry. It was just so normal, it made me feel like a local, and the view crossing the harbour was wonderful.

Excellent Value. Excellent value and a great way to travel across to and from Hong Kong Island.
The views are great from the ferry
worth the 20p!. cheap and convieniant but also good fun, the firework show is amazing
ONE OF THE WORLD ROMANTIC PLACES. Take the ferry on late afternoon during summer time or after lunch on winter time when is jast a little bit foggy

Expected just a pier but got a good view!. A friend who lives in Hong Kong told me to meet her at the Star Ferry Pier.Little did I know there's a spectacular view of the skylines from there and lots of shopping and food near by. By the looks of it, looks like a popular meeting spot.You can get your photo taken for a small fee (I think HK$10). Otherwise, bring your own camera and snap away! I took a picture of it when the sun was setting :-)
what a steal!. very economical way of getting a sea level view of the hong kong landscape, love it!

convenient transportation. I liked it. It's very convenient and cheap transportation to cross from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. At the same time you will enjoy the view of the towers surrounding the coast.
Loved the ride. Take the star ferry in the afternoon and then take it back late in the evening to experience the lights of HongKong
Great way to get around. Easy and versatile to get around Hong Kong and surrounds
Star Ferry. Cheap reliable and an institution must go. I make it every time kids loved it
Romantic. A wonderful way to see HK. Beautiful to use at night
Great experience round trip. A fun and cheap transportation. It's a great view going either way during day or night.

Great way to get across the harbour!. The ferrys were always on time and were a cheap and efficient way to get across the harbour to and from Kowloon. We also were able to make our way across to Macau. We were really surprised at how reliable the ferry service was!

Must-do trips for tourists in Hong Kong. A have a cousin who lived in Hong Kong for about 8 years. When I asked about things to do & see on my recent visit, he quickly stated, "Ride the Star Ferry across the Harbor, and visit the Peak." I'm so glad that we did both! The ferry is cheap way to see the harbor ( think the Staten Island Ferry in NYC). We also took a city double decker bus from the Ferry terminal to the top of the Peak and back (requires two fares), and a double decker city trolley around the lower city, again a cheap way to see the city.I highly recommend you do all of the above, but also, if time permits, take the tram to the top of the Peak during daylight, have dinner at the top, and return by tram after dark.
big bus tour. fun experience and we enjoyed the scene at night. i would definitely want to go back
Fun taking the Ferry.... Reminds me of the Hong Kong of my youth! Good fun to ride the ferry and there is plenty to do on both sides.

9 minutes, less than HK$5 each way - fun for all ages. The boats have been in use for a long time, and the design is the same as in the 1920's. Great on a nice, clear day... This isn't set up for tourists : expect nothing posh and you'll be delighted! Modern addition: you can pay with the octopus card (which you'll want to invest in, even if you're in HK only for a few days).

A must on the to-do list!. Take the twilight ride & stay on for the laser show, its lovely! The lights of the city are just wonderful & being out on a boat can be fun for the kids & romantic for couples! A good way to spend a couple of hours just relaxing & taking in the sights of Hong Kong!

A 'must do' in HK. The Star Ferry is a must do in Hong Kong. The 6 minute trip from TST – Central is a good way to view the harbour and enjoy a taste of the past before stepping back into the ciaos of the current lifestyle in Hong Kong.
It’s cheap and allows one to relax for a short few minutes.
A nice way to travel if the weather is good. The original method of transport between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Romantic in this day and age.

This is a ferry. You want to cross the river? Then use the ferry of course! This is not a flash ferry - its smelly, the seats a hard and it's like sheep eing herded into a sheep truck, but it's cheap, quick and the ferry terminals are cleanish, and have toilets, refreshment stalls and able to accommodate big flocks. The process is streamlined to allow passengers to Geoff before allowing the new herd on. And there is only a short waiting time. Good choice of routes too. It would be nice if the boats had an open deck, but hey, these are not flash craft. They are designed for herding as many people as possible across the river in the shortest time using cheap and reliable technology.

Burger Box and a Beer. At the Star Ferry, while waiting for your boat, pick up a box of chili cheese fries w/ Jalepenos. About 10 feet from there you can pick up a beer. Excellent if you happen to need a west hemisphere fix.

Best 4 dollar value. take the Star ferry out and back just to get a feel for the island and admire the architecture - we timed our trip for sundown so that we could get a good spot for the Light and Sound show at 8pm

Yes, THE infamous ferry. Funnily enough I was expecting more, something posh and something more touristy, but it is in fact an ordinary ferry going about its business between Hong Kong island and Kowloon on the mainland for residents and businessmen. But what does make it different from any other ferry is the sensational view of Hong Kong's miriads of amazingly designed buildings.Note that the ferry doesn't berth fully but the sailors just hold the ropes so it nudges the quay for people to hop on. Also, that on the HK side there are a few touts. And that on hte Kowloon side there is a long taxi rank. Definitely worth a trip for the amazing views.
Ferry not across the Mersey. Fast and fun way to transfer from Kowloon to HKG..and the sidewalk of stars was fun. Great light show at night downtown

Stunning View When Crossing at Night. I would say this is not a tourist attraction, but it's a public transport to cross islands. Btw, you will get a stunning view of Hong Kong island / Kowloon when you are crossing the island. Take a picture with your loved one. Btw it's cheap! :D
Iconic. The ferries are rickety, but come on...you're a part of history riding this across the water....cool and cheap. Make sure you follow signs to be seated on the upper deck ( only 50 cents more)
I would ride this 20 times a day. The perfect view and historic feel and a historically low set price. Splurge a little and go upstairs. Then on the return, go downstairs just to see the difference.
From the sea. Still the cheapest way to cruise the harbour and see the city skyline.
Very nice ferry terminal. The ferry terminal is very nice, it is clean and organized. It is just like an airport.

If you are Vacationing in Hong Kong - riding the ferry is a must!. Star Ferry rides are very inexpensive and so much fun to do - whether vacationing with the family or by yourself. It is fun to explore Victoria Harbour with the different packages offered by the ferry company.

View from the deck. Efficient and interesting way to travel...tourists, shoppers, families, workers, commuters---here comes everybody! the view of your fellow travelers is as interesting as that of the harbour and the infinite variety of boats.
Good transportation!. Fast, efficient, thankfully the water is calm, frequent ferries back and forth to the Island, cheap!!
Ferry to Central. Great quick way to get across and cheap. Ferry is quick and leaves every few minutes.
Symphony of Lights. Viewed the Symphony of Lights show from the Star Ferry terminal plus used the Star Ferry to go to Hong Kong Island. A Fantastic service.

Simple ferry. We stayed at Kowloon Hotel and used ferry often.
Simple and easy way to get to Hong Kong Island.
Reminded me of Statten Island ferry in New York.
A must do!. Apparently one of the top 50 things to do before u die. It's a very cheap and short ferry ride across and you can save your pennies to have tea at the peninsula!

Very effective form of transportation. The ferry runs frequently and is an quick way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. It drops you off on the island at a pedestrian walkway. You can easily get to a mall or the central bus station to do all the sightseeing you want.
The old sSar Ferry rang each hour to tell the time.. The old Star ferry was demolished. The new one you see is not so good.

Love the Star Ferry!. If you just missed the Star Ferry, never fear, the next one will leave in 5 or 10 minutes. Fun, cheap & quick way to get from the main Island to the Kowloon side. The Star Ferry is such a tradition & a must do in Hong Kong.

Get on da boat!. I wouldn't hang out here unless you like the smell of fish (hey some people do!), but you only really linger to get on a ferry boat to connect to the other side, so writing a review about this is a bit silly. Oh, if you do get seasick or have an inner ear disorder, during a rough chop or rainy day, take the subway or else you'll be in for one heck of a ride! (and not the good kind)

Fast Ferry Cruise. We took this after our tour of Lantau Island on the way to Hongkong to feel the gentle seas...Reaching the port, there are stalls for little more souvenirs & kiosks for quick grab-a-bites before sailing time. We boarded the fast ferry & amazed that it's really fast per se, the crew were likewise pleasant,,,we had a great view ot the harbour, kowloon island & added attractions of dragon boat race practices & rowing...we likewise had fun taking pictures of the bridges we saw very similar to the Golden Gate of SF in style..

Excellent way to get to the other side with siginificant historical value. Easy to access, clean, smooth sailing, professional and helpful staff and a geat way to get a feel of the actual harbour and a veiw of both sides of the city. A definite must do

Needs a face lift. The service is good and ferries run on time, its a well organized system but it looks so dowdy, l dont think just repainting would help, the entrance is hidden behind the front shops and it can also be reached from most intersections by the subways. People are very helpful to the tourists and everything is written in both English and Chinese.

Must see...but don't raise your expectations.... To see the Hong Kong night sky from the Star Ferry pier is a must when you visit Hong Kong. It is exceedingly captivating when you look across the straits from Tsim Sha Tsui to Hong Kong island and see the myriads of buildings all lit up with their extravagant neon displays. Add to that ferries dressed up in similar bright lights traversing the sea between Kowloon and Hong Kong makes it an even more mesmerizing view. That being said, I wasn't too impressed with the light show that goes on display every night at 8pm... the harbour view itself is already more than adequate to leave an impression on you without the drummed up light show.
Great experience and fantastic views.... Try and take the ferry to Kowloon and back at dusk as the views of the lights on both sides are stunning. And it's fantastically cheap too...
Star Ferry. Well the Pier is nothing much but the ferry is fantastic and living piece of history.
Must do. For close to .25 u.s. this is a bargain. Great view of both sides of HK.

Steeped in History. Anyone who knows History will understand the importance of the Star Ferry ( if you don't look it up). You feel part of HongKong when you use the ferry. Locals and tourist all together. Very cheap and a great way to see Victoria harbour and the enormous buildings.
A great Hong Kong Tradition. One must not go to Hong Kong and not cross the harbour on one of these iconic ferries
Great view of the island. Worth a visit. One of those must do things. Can be very crowded when the light show comes on.
A PIECE OF HISTORY. A trip to HK with out going to the Star Ferry is not a complete trip. Please be sure to go you will not be dissappointed!

Take a ferry ride for the best views of the city!. The pier is not very interesting but take a ride on one of the ferrys around the bay. It's cheep, relaxing and a great way to see the famous skyline.
It was ok.. I went on the ferry from hong kong island to kowloon. It wasn't that special.

Worth the Adventure. Taking the Star Ferry is certainly an adventure that you should undertake if your in Hong Kong. The adventurous part is the boarding and departing of the ferry. Many times the water is rough and the ferry is moving about...walking on a swaying gangplank can be a bit unnerving.

A classic for ferry-lovers. For those of us who spend a lot of time in the Pacific NW of N America and so on a lot of ferries, this is another classic ferry experience. Really liked the unique rows of seat-back that switch directions depending on which end of the ferry is going forward.

Better than taking a taxi. The Star ferry is definitely worth taking from a visitor attraction perspective. Views from the pier from central are quite picturesque. During our few days in Hong Kong, we also came to appreciate it as a quick, safe and cheap way to cross from Central to Kowloon. As it takes a direct route, you travel in the shortest possible time - literally less than 5 minutes - which avoids the traffic and expensive taxis. There is usually very little wait also as a ferry docks every few minutes. While you may not be travelling across in luxury, you spend such a short time on the boat that you need to see it as merely a functional way to cross from one side to the other. We absolutely loved it and the time it saved us!
GREAT Harbor View!. A MUST DO: See the Hong Kong Harbor for cheap! Go and EnJoy!!

Definitely a must if in Hong Kong. Only took the ferry once and used my Octopus Card so I'm not sure how much it cost. We took it from Tsim Sha Tsui (after seeing the light show) back over to Hong Kong island at night. It's great to get a feeling for what the place must have been like when the British arrived via the sea - kids will enjoy it and it's only a short crossing, so even if you get seasick, it's worth doing as it only takes 10-15 minutes max.

Relaxing and awesome!. We rode the star ferry so many times in one week. We totally enjoyed the gentle (but quick) ride across to / from HK-TST islands.Lots of great photo ops during the ride.A HK "MUST-DO"

Pleasant mode of transport.... Nice way to commute between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island...fantastic photo opportunities of unobstructed skyline...If you have an Octopus card you can use on the Star Line Ferry...the seat backs easily flick forward or backwards depending on what direction travelling so you can sure to travel facing the correct way...As a few people have already mentioned the crew still wear the classic blue & white sailor attire...

Cheap and quick. What a wonderful way to see the harbour from the water. For the price (about 30 cents Australian), I can't think of a better way to do it. Forget the traditional junk cruises, you could do this one 100 times over!
Star ferry to Kowloon bay. Another must for the 1st time visitor. Go be4 the laser light show starts about 7pm and watch from the ferry and when you arrive a few minutes later in Kowloon itself.
Comfortable experience. Although it is no any air-conditioner, but the sea breeze make you feel comfortable. Take it at night can also see the night view of Hong Kong too.
Nostalgic. The workers on the ferry still dressed up in traditional sailors suits

Calm escape from heat and crowds. It is so easy to cross Victoria Harbour on a Star Ferry. 5 minutes of welcomed peace in ferries that take passengers back in time. Gorgeous views at night of both sides of the harbour,

An absolute must when in Hong Kong. While the MTR will get you there faster, nothing compares to a ride on one of the Star Line Ferry boats that cross Victoria Harbour between Hong Kong and Kowlooon. Buy a ticket on the upper deck and enjoy the view!!

Interesting history. The Star Ferry Terminal on Kowloon side and the ferries themselves ( all of which have great names like "Celestial Star or Morning Star"are still the same as when I lived there in 70s and I love that! Star Ferry has a really interesting history including being used to evacuate expats prior to Japanese occupation. Don't miss a trip across the harbour on Star Ferry!
cheap transport. Likes:-cheap, fast and convenient mode of transport to and fro hongkong and kowloon-stunning view of the city horizon -sailor donned in 'cute' sailor uniform
Great way to travel!!!!. Old school way to get around. Great taste of history and good to have fresh (reasonably) air in hong kong.
No-brainer. Even if you are not planning on seeing anything on the other side of the river, take the super cheap ferry for the ride and views alone.

Transportation with Entertainment Value. The Star Ferry is a fun way to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong. The ferry is easy to use, inexpensive, and it's just a blast to be on the water and look at everyone and everything. I took it by myself with my kids and we all enjoyed it.

Fast way to look around!. This was an easy and inexpensive way to get to the other side of Hong Kong. The ferry was very spacious and had these great benches where you could flip the seat backs depending which direction you were headed. The ferry times were very convenient.
A cheap thrill in Hong Kong. And a nice way to cross the harbour. You have to do it at least once.

A walk through historical & contemporary Hong Kong. Apart from riding the iconic Star Ferry, the Star Ferry Pier area itself is a curious amalgam - home to a great deal of history on the one hand, and a showpiece of contemporary Hong Kong on the other. I would recommend its best to explore the Pier area on foot. Some key sights to take in (also great photo opps!):1. Start walking from near 'The Pen' - the blue blooded Peninsula Hotel, once rated by connoisseurs as 'the finest hotel east of Suez', and still living up to that title by all accounts. Opened in 1928, the Peninsula combines colonial & modern elements, and apart from its luxurious rooms and restaurants, is also noted for its large Rolls-Royce fleet. Fourteen of them in signature 'Peninsula Green'. Hang around and take some good snaps of the hotel, the Rolls-Royces - you can't beat history when it comes to good snaps.2. A little further down from The Peninsula is Heritage 1881 - the headquarters of the Hong Kong Marine Police for over a century, until about 15 years ago. Built in 1884 and now officially christened as 1881 Heritage, it is a very stately, handsome building with a striking Victorian facade in line with its rich colonial past. Today, apart from offering up some part of Hong Kong's history, its shopping arcade is home to an impressive range of luxury brands.3.
