Across the road is the Hong Kong Space Museum for astronomy and space science in Tsim Sha Tsui - the planetarium's dome covers a huge 8,000 square meters, making it a very recognizable Hong Kong landmark.4. Right next to the Space museum on Salisbury Road is the Hong Kong Cultural Centre - a multipurpose performance facility, most easily recognized by an intriguing installation of mirror 'pillars' that throw out myriad reflections. The Concert Hall here is home to the Hong Kong Philharmonic. The Grand Theatre with almost 2000 seats is part of this complex - it stages musicals, ballets and operas.5. Adjacent to the Hong Kong Cultural Centre is the Tsim Sha Tsui Clock Tower virtually at the end of Salisbury Road facing Victoria Harbour. Earlier known as the Kowloon-Canton Railway Clock Tower, it is built of red bricks and granite. We are told that the clocks on this tower began ticking in 1921, and have kept going since, except during the Japanese occupation of Hong Kong during World War II.6. And now you are at Star Ferry Pier itself - a place where history was made when in 1880 Dorabjee Naorojee Mithaiwala began his ferry service across Victoria Harbour with his first steamboat, the Morning Star...While taking in the view, please do sample the fare from the bakeries at the pier (they are on the left when you face the pier terminal) - they offer a most delectable selection of goodies - tarts, cakes, puffs - divine is an understatement!7. Adjacent to the Pier is Harbour City on Canton Road offering a large variety of fashionable, trendy brands. In fact, flagship stores of virtually all leading upmarket international brands are concentrated on Canton Road - living testimony to the Hong Kong people's love for the big luxe brands.Walking through the the Star Ferry Pier area is veritably a walk through historical and contemporary Hong Kong.
the best way to spend 80 cents. SO cheap and so much fun. It is a must. The boats are old fashioned and they leave every 20 minutes or so. Great fun and the views are fantastic. Try it at night!
Cheap and efficient. What an excellent way to get across the harbour - frequent and easy!
Star Ferry. Fab, fab, fab it has to be done. Very cheap and fun way of crossing the river.

A Hong Kong must-do. This was my second trip to Hong Kong and one of the first things that I wanted to do was to take the Star Ferry across the harbour. The ride itself is short (5-6 minutes), cost is inexpensive and the views phenomenal. On the Kowloon side, the pier area itself is somewhat dingy, however, there are two high end malls a few steps away. We chose the upper deck for the trip to Hong Kong Island and the lower deck for the trip back. Either one gives you the views. Usually there are more people on the lower deck (it's cheaper), but neither time was it crowded. If you are planning to use the MTR, Star Ferry, and other means of public transportation, buy an Octopus card which you swipe and the fare is deducted. This saves you needing to have exact change each time you travel.
Excellent. Definitely put on the list to catch the star ferry. A great way to travel across the Victoria Harbour.

Great place to stroll around and eat. We loved walking through this area. There is so much of activities and excellent places to eat. Hong Kong offers some of the best restaurants in the world in my opinion and if you are a foodie.... you'll love this area.

Cruise with views. Choose the upper deck fare and enjoy unparrelled views of Hong Kong skyline. The gentle thrub of the engines and rocking motion add to the relaxation and definitely helped this busy traveller plan the next move.
Must try. This is the cheapest way to enjoy hk! The best view and you will see pretty much everything

Super way to see and learn about the harbor and the city. The harbor area is central to the downtown area, the pier is right on the harbor, and the Star Ferry is the best way to quickly learn about and see the harbor and the city. We went just before dusk and the nightly light show (which is amazingly fun). So, we saved the higher fare and yet were right on the promenade in the harbor for the show. The one-hour tour of the harbor is very interesting, and you get a beverage and snack (pound cake, for us) as part of the entry price. We truly enjoyed the pier and the ferry tour.
Star Ferry. The pier on the HK side is not central and walk far from the Central MTR station. The ride on the ferry is OK.

Quintessential Hong Kong experience. When you are in Hong Kong, getting on the ferry to cross between Kowloon and the Island is a must. It is really cheap and convenient. Of course the MTR will get you cross island faster but certainly not as much character as on the ferry.
cheap and good!. this is a really cheap and good way of getting a good view on both sides of the harbour.
Essential for any trip. Take the Ferry to the mian Island and then the tour up and down the harbour. Is cheap and good to do - great photo opportunities
Inexpensive Travelling. I suggest for tourist to try this at least once. It gets you to the pier that is near the bus to The Peak Terminus/The peak.

good view for a good price. loved the sea level view of skyscrapers on both sides of the harbour as i took the ferry across from tshim sha tshui to central hong kong. happened to be free the day i took the ferry due to some charity among the business organizations in hong kong but am sure it is value for money even if you had to pay - 2hkd if i am not mistaken?the only thing is the smell of the water if you are at the lower deck - yes... i was on the lower deck but good overall!
Great views of the city. Cheap way of getting from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon with great views of the city skyline and Victoria Harbour
Hong Kong Ferry. Don't miss the ferry. At 2.5 Hong Kong Dollars, less than 50 cetnes each way, it's a wonderful way to travel back in time and go between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.,
Nice trip. Great way to get from Kowloon over to HK Island. Both fast & clean with a lovely view

Some nice photos as you travel.. The start ferry is a 'super' cheap and nice way to cross the harbour. There's no air-conditioning but the breeze is a nice change from the perfectly air-conditioned metro.Tip: It's quite quick by you can get some nice photos as you travel, so be ready.

the only way to cross the harbour. Join the queues for the short trip across the harbour and see how east meets west and the old meets the new as the ferry navigates its way through barges, junks, ships, tenders and all sorts of marine traffic. Very exciting!

Costs almost nothing and Just fun!. The Star Ferry is long known to be the best deal in Hong Kong costing aboue 35 cents Canadian for a one-way trip. We enjoyed travelling around the harbour so much, we spent a hour or so one day taking several trips around the harbour. Pay the extra for the top deck, which also has A/C section for those very hot days.

Still a must-do thing after all these years. A wonderful experience everytime I am in Hong Kong. Will definitely prefer to take the ferry than the train if I am travelling to Tsim Sha Tsui to Central, and vice versa (even though the walk to the ferry is further now).
A must do. The start ferry is a must do in Hong Kong, great way to see the habour and costs next to nothing!

just like a taxi. word famous and never seem to change each time i go to Hong Kong. These run regualar and very cheap geting you from one side to the other.
Infact i would recommend taking them just to see the sights.
A great boat ride!. Nothing surpass the beauty of the skyline of Victoria harbour, especially at night, don't miss it
ferry ride. An easy way to cross the harbour.Frequent,fun and traditional.
Basic travel. Nice and effective way to travel, is a great sightseen trip you get to catch a good view of the skylines. Make sure you board on the corridor that leads to the upper deck.

such a cute little pier!!. Super fun and short ride to go to the other side of the pier where the Red Bus tour begins. An amazing way to see the Hong Kong Skyline. Not for you if you easily get sea sick!!

Quick Fun Ride with the locals. Took a quick ferry trip around the harbor to see how the locals travel. Real hub bub and fun. Smell of gasoline a bit overwhelming, but worth the ride to and fro. Gives you an opportunity to see the city skyline and the beauty of Hong Kong. Suggest doing the trip around sunset. Bring your camera.
Great boat trip. Love the Star Ferries...oldies, but goodies. The flip seats are cool and the precision of the trip is great. and cheap!
Good value for money. Very frequent ferry services giving access to numerous areas.
great way to see the lights especially at night. easy to use, quick, reliable and on time, great way to see the bay and city.

Very affordable. Works like clockwork! Such an affordable way to cross from the Island to mainland. I bet children will love the crossing. It is also nice to see how all the boats come and pass in the harbour. Great views as well.

quick efficient....must ride if in hk. too short and always get to the upper deck
try to go during night time to see the skyline

On your bucket list. If this isn't on your bucket list, then it should be. Any time of the day this place is hopping. Ride the ferry on both decks, take the 1 hour harbor tour. Stop and people watch. This is it. Bonus, riding the ferry is not only FUN but it is cheap!
Thrilling ride. If you ride in December, brace yourself for the chilly winds! Truly freezing but enjoyable!
Star Ferry is Classic Hong Kong. I know it isn't flashy or ultramodern like most of Hong Kong but the BEST local experience is taking the Star Ferry. My favorite 'taste of Hong Kong' moment!

Star Ferry - Must Try in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is a double-decker commuter ferry service across Victoria Harbour. It is considered a heritage and cultural treasure of Hong Kong. The 10 minutes journey is a great way to cross Victoria Harbour and at the same time, enjoying superb city views and sea breezes. A cheap and Must Try attraction in Hong Kong.

Quick trip to Kowloon. You can take the bus to cross, the fare is the same, but the ferry is a much more fun experience. Very frequent and it gives you a different perspective of both sides (Hong Kong and Kowloon) as you are approaching them. Take one in the evening if you can.
No trip to Hong Kong is complete. without a trip on the star ferry! The trip from Central to Kowloon is one of the great ferry rides, superb city views and I love the quaint old pier at Central
Fast, Fun and Frequent!. Be local and go bottom deck! Great views of both sides of the Pearl River Delta.

Research where your next stop is after the ferry.. Great 10 min ride but you have to plan carefully otherwise you are in for a long walk. The ferry is great for making connections to other ferries but if you. Plan on catching the subway to other points just use the subway. Also if you go toward the right entrance on the TST side you end up on the lower grittier deck. It is more pleasant for tourists if you go to the upper deck. Don't know if there is a price difference, but it is more of the local flavor. We used an Octopus card and got around easily.

The best value for money transport in Hong Kong!. Sail with them to cross the Victoria Harbour. This historic ride which is still used as a public transport is the most scenic way to get around Hong Kong!Tips, 1. To me, it is regardless which direction you sail from, just make sure you face the Island of Hong Kong to get the dramatic view! 2. Please sit at the top deck, don't save that few HKD by sitting at the lower deck and suffer breathing in the diesel smog. If you do, don't claim about the ride! You pay for what you get. (btw, there is aircon on the top deck. :P)
A nice break. A nice way to relax for a short while and take in the skyline.. and dirt cheap

Easy to negotiate.. You have to cross Victoria Harbour on the Star Ferry while in Hong Kong. You pass large boats, little junks with traders in them and you wonder how they manage to miss each other. The pier itself has good signposting so it is easy to find the correct boarding place.

Needs a little more signage but it's still efficient!. Taking a trip on the Star Ferry is great. It's hustle and bustle all the way but is worth every sight.See the Hong King skyline from the water and your jaw will drop. When boarding and disembarking though - be careful not to slip. It's reasonably busy but then, this is Hong Kong. It's cheap and a great way to get from one island to another.

Part of the Daily life. Well, the new Star Ferry Pier is very different from the old one. Maybe it is me as a historical person. However, with the new maritime museum coming next to the pier in Central, hopefully it will drive the visitor traffic to even higher.
fun quick ride. easy to find, easy to get on, fun ride, inexpensive too.
Efficient like everything else here in HK. Efficient, runs on time, great views from the ferry.
Must ride the Star Ferry .... Victoria Harbour at night is a fantastic sight! Loved the cool breeze and the mist of the sea.

JoH883. This iconic pier was undergoing construction on the Kowloon side, so was a bit messy - but who can resist a ride on the Star Ferry?There is a fantastic shoe shop on the Kowloon side pier called Perfect Born. Leather shoes from $A50 - in sizes to fit western feet. Worth a visit!
Do this if you are in HK. If you are in HK it is worth the short trip on the Star Ferry. So cheap to!

Great views of HK go at sunset. $3 HKD for a one way ride is the cheapest sightseeing tour you will ever have.
I stress, go at sunset, you get daylight shots and sunset shots one direction, and night shots on the way back. Great food in the mall at the Kowloon stop.
HK by sea. an uncommon view of the city, even if the sea is not blue. the route from central to kowloon is really cheap. a good alternative to travel by subway.
Sight seeing at night is the best. A very goods and enjoyable experience to have a trip on star ferry boat to enjoy the sight seeing at night time.

Cheapest ride in town--free if you are a senior. While it is easier to take the metro, you would be foolish to miss this old-fashioned way to get across the harbor. I particularly like the original seat backs on the benches that rotate back and forth depending on which way the boat is going. It costs around 25 cents, but is free if you are over 65.
Quick and efficient and cheap. Best way to cross the Harbour and only HK 2.50. Ferry's run all the time and often.
Taken For A Ride. A great and inexpensive ride across the Harbour to the Island on a historc ferry.

Memorable Experience!. It was a fun and memorable experience to cross Victoria Harbor. Must do a night ride! With less than a dollar, you get a second level seating and a fantastic night scenery of the Pearl of Orient!

Just Watching the Boats. It is a nice change from peopel watching to just lean on the rails overlooking the harbour and watch the boat traffic. It was quite rough when we were there and we could watch the waves. However despite this the ferry trip over to Hong Kong Island was not uncomfortable.For us as seniors it was free to travel on the lower deck. No problem with that.
star ferry pier. the peer is fantastic in the night, with the lightned skycreeper
Well worth taking!. A cheap way to get to Kowloon and to get stunning views back toward the Hong Kong skyline
Amusing. An insight into the way Hong Kong people live their lives. Bustling, noisy but friendly!

Don't miss this!. I love going by ferry between Central -Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. It is cheap HK$ 2.50 and gives one spectacular views of the Hong Kong skyline.Certain times it is a bit busy but a visit to Hong Kong wouldn't be complete without it

Best way to travel between hong kong and Kowloon. Don't bother with the star ferry harbour tour, it's better seen by foot, but definitely use the star ferry to cross the harbour between hong kong island and kowloon. It is extremely cheap (equivalent of £0.20) and much quicker than queuing in traffic in the tunnel.
must be done. At some point in your HK trip you just have to do this. We took it one way and it was pleasant and enjoyable. Try to go when not so busy.

Star Ferry - Harbour Tour. Not worth at all, we paid HK$ 140 per person, it's not worth at all. We live in Dubai and we do have cruise with dinner and other entertaintment, we were really dissapointed since we have better expereience in ferry rides.
signature ride. Short, Cheap and Fast ride from central to Tsim Sha Tsui. Remember, no air-conds!

a piece of history. Travelled from Kow Loon back to Hong Kong as you do ...it was good to actually try a piece of history..the pier has been renovated in recent years and is a lot larger than it was originally..a good experience and worth trying out

Great way to get to work. This has got to be the best value public transport anywhere in the world. A one-way trip will set you back HKD 2.50 (USD 0.32) and if you're a senior, it's free. The views are breath-taking. During normal weather the trip across takes about 10 minutes but in rough weather, docking can sometimes take a while. Stay clear of the open windows during these periods as you might get wet!
nothing special to me. nice gentle walk on a hot day, not much to see really apart from the view

Still unique but lost the shine. Because of the relocation years ago, the Star Ferry Pier at Central of Hong Kong has moved away from the old but more convenient location to join the Central Pier now which is less convenient to most people. The shine of the luster when it stayed individual has disappeared. However, this is all about the Hong Kong side of the pier. The one at Tsimshatsui of Kowloon which is the other end of the Star Ferry Pier is better. It is still unique although it has also lost the shine of the old days when there was a train terminal.
Star ferry. A trip on the Star Ferry is a must do when you visit Hong Kong.
historical. great trip to do, to experience the HK and Kowloon ride. cheap cheap at HK2.50 per person. Clean ferry.

EASY to navigate. I think it is almost impossible to get lost in HK. The signage was great and the ferries are very frequent. Definately take a ferry! It's no dirtier than Circular Quay in Sydney and much cheaper :-)
Star Ferry. A must if you are visiting Hong Kong. Excellent value for money and fun.

Best place to take in the Hong Kong skyline. Cheap thrill for only apxmt 2hkd. Both evening and morning rides are splendid. The view is as wonderful as that in Victoria Peak. Will try out the evening cruise wherein you shall a 2 hour ride aboard a handsomely decked out Star Ferry boat with refreshments to the watch the Symphony of Light Show. This is one attraction that has utility ( quick and cheap ride to reach Central district) and aesthetics combined. Will never get tired of riding the Star Ferry.

Nice nostalgic ride across the bay... First thing I did in Hkg was to go down to the Star Ferry Pier at Causeway Bay and took a ferry back to Tsim Sha Tsui. The ride was quick and the scenery was great. The ferry itself was iconic..

Boat boat boat!. Two in one.First, it is convenient way between Island and Kowloon + second, it is great five minutes in open water on a classic boat. Smell of the water and mild wind (if you get lucky). P.S. Star Ferry even has iPhone application (which looks idiotic and fun; reminds of a sea-battle game).

Affordable, Must Do Fun in HK. The view of the HK Harbour at night is to die for. Just HK$3 for a trip to the other island. You get a small discount if you pay by Octopus card. It felt like a journey into history, with well-preserved Star Ferry and boatmen in sailor suits. It's a must do in HK!
a ride into history. still the same as it was years ago. a preferred way to the island when you have the time.

Efficient chaos. The pier and the ferry service which operates across the Harbour are not necessarily the place for the faint hearted tourist. But the system works well, is cheap, and it is easy to just follow the locals. On one crossing the swell was quite severe and there was some trauma in getting tied up, so travelers might need to appraise conditions occasionally.
Must DO. It's like every movie you have ever seen them in.I always think of the movie Dragon when I ride the star ferry, never gets old!

Old original transport at an old world price.. The ferry has been running for decades and is still one of the 'must' have experiences of Hong Kong because of the tradition. We found it a wonderful experience.

The best view!. Cheap! Just HKD2.5 to travel to & fro hk & hk island.
The night view is great!
Awesome!. Take a boat across the river. It's a great experience and much cheaper than the Metro.
Ferry. Great way to travel between the mainland and HK island. It is even better at night when the light show is on.
Great way to travel. Nice to see the harbour area nice peir area, And to walk at night to see the firework display

cheap way to get a harbour view. this is an amazing way to get a view of the harbour on both sides at once as the ferry crawls like a snail across the harbour which is definitely a good thing for tourists and their cameras. do note not to choose the bottom level as there seems to be a stench from the water which kinda ruins the moment =)
the greatest attraction for a few pence. it's real, it's practical, it's not only for the tourists and it's almost for free,
Take the Ferry. Not for the pier, not for the smell, but for the view of the HK skyline for $2HK and the bustle of the crowd.

A must do. I can't imagine a tripto Hong Kong that didn't include the experience of the Star Ferry. It's part of the heart and soul of Hong Kong and the price is so reasonable. You haven't experienced Hong Kong unless you've been on the Star Ferry.

A Hong Kong must do. Very cheap for a harbour ride - a must do - unbelievable views from the ferry and extremely cheap - about HKD $2.
There are upper and lower decks with different entries from the pier. Octopus card accepted.
A good cheap way to travel.... Fast and easy way to cross this busy waterway... over 65 free...

Move along nothing to see here!. The Star Ferry is a great outing but the pier is just that a means to get on the boat. It's been around a while and for me you don't hang around there (it can be a bit edgy) just go about your business.
HK Institution. Must take at least one trip on these magnificent fifty year old green work horses.
Good enough.. Everyone should take the Star Ferry at least once while in HK. The view is fabulous. Great for photos.
Very cheap and excellent at night. Cheap and easy transport across the river, amazing views of HK skyline all lit up at night
Go for the experience. Go for the experience & view. Plenty of stuff to do around the pier & taking the ferry across to Kowloon is a real deal and can save a lot of time compared to taxi in traffic

Better than a cruise !. The best attraction in Hong-Kong. It's nice to do by nice weather, by misty weather, during the day time, at night, always a wonderfull picture to take .
And for such a cheap price ....
So cheap and easy. You can't go to Hong Kong and not get on this ferry! It's about .25cents and takes you across to Kowloon in under ten minutes.
A nice way to see the handout. Costa only 2.50HKD and is well worth the trip as there are many activities on both sides of the harbour
Cheapest great views in the city. For 4 HK$ you get some fabulous views of the Hong Kong sky line
Romantic and cheap. The best view you'll get of Kong Kong; for less than 50 cents...
Easy and Pleasant. Carry the Star Ferries is great,easy and cheap. If you want to just go to the island or take a harbour cruise.
Pretty Awful. I guess there aren't that many nice piers. Its a long walk from the station too. There is a Starbucks though.

Nostalgia in 21st century. The star ferry pier is perfectly maintained and preserved.
The ferry ride was wonderful and pleasant.
good cheap fun. for around .50 cents usd, its a great little trip across the harbor. go at night and see the amazing city lights from the water
Great ride to Macau. Very clean and comfortable ferry to Macau. Be aware, if you're going to Macau to gamble, do NOT change Hong Kong $ into Macau $. The casinos only take HK$.

Magical. It was evening when we arrived in HongKong and checked into our hotel, and it was raining. in the month leading up to our trip, it was my father's one request in Hong Kong to ride the Star Ferry. After dinner in the hotel, we put on our rain gear and hopped in a taxi to the pier. After a bit of a tussel with the token vendor, we were on the boat, headed out over the bay, with the skyline of Hong Kong in front of us. There were seats right up in the front, and the windows opened, so my dad and kids had their heads out in the cool night air, enjoying the beautiful lights. I highly recommend this trip.
Classic Boat Ride. This ride hasn't changed in 25 years going back and forth from HK island to Kowloon. What a great way to photograph the HK skyline. Definitely a must do in HK
the boatride to do in Hongkong. Interesting history of Hongkong area and the tall buildings there.
Great. great value and quite fascinating. It was like going back in time.

Cheap but great. It is not only the best way to cross the water, it is also a great way to get perfect views.
Cheap, easy to do and never boring!
oh please!! in hkg mandatory. hong kong without a ferry transfer to the island and back, is a travel incomplete...expende a morning go to one or other direction, cheap and lovely
You need to use ferry to feel this city.. It's not just transport - it's spirit of old colonial time. It will take 10 minuts only to reach Hong Kong from Kowloon.
First trip aboard in Hong Kong. Wonderful and inexpensive! Great transportation for the first few days, then used the metro subway.
VFM. You need to check it out. Cost very little but a very nicee experience
Highlight of the Holiday. These ancient ferries are incredibly cheap to use and an icon of Hong Kong.
Functional but not comfortable. Ferry service was very basic, not like Sydney's hustle and bustle ferrys

Cheap and entertaining. It's easy and inexpensive to take the quick Star Ferry ride from Hong Kong to the Kowloon side. You can buy your tokens from a machine right by the boat. Victoria Harbor is surrounded by great views, so it's a treat to be in the middle of it. I agree with the reviewer who says you haven't seen Hong Kong if you haven't taken the ferry. That is because Kowloon is the part of Hong Kong that visitors dream of. That is where you find the busy streets, shopping, and bright lights that you see in movies (similar to Times Square). I recommend taking the ferry so you are in Kowloon after the sun sets. The view of downtown, with brightly light office buildings, is magical.

The Alltime Must Iconic trip in Hong Kong. So simple, so cheap, so much fun, so safe, so quick, so calm (weather was dodgy too).It just has to be done. And I do everytime I am in town.Recommend that you take your camera - there are some stunning scenes to try and capture, day or night and in all weathers.
great way to go to HK island side from Kowloon. it is cheap, its fun and it is easy to get to and back
Best way to view HK. So cheap and you will love it, do it by day and night to see the light shows..only costs pence.
great way to get across to HK island. Fast & easy to use. There were little to lines and transportaion once you got off the ferry was convient and easy to use
dash liverpool. a great experience not to be missed when in hong kong
good value. good views of bay and best value around-- use octopus card - good access to Kowloon bay from mainland
.. Very busy cross harbour ferry terminal always a delight to visit to see the passing ships and boats.
It's where you catch the ferry--food options, too. Clean and easy to get around. Lots of food options in case you're hungry.

nice ride and even nicer view. The ferry was easily accessible from our place in Wan Chai, and it was a very cheap but tasteful way of crossing into Kowloon and back. My parents, being seniors, were free of charge. We all enjoyed the view during the trip. This ride should definitely be part of your Hong Kong experience
Excellent scenery. very reasonable priced ride into the centre of Hong kong.Lovely scenery and plenty of room aboard.
Quintessential Hong Kong. A visit to Hong Kong is not complete without the ride on the Star Ferry
efficient- even with a buggy. Well run and efficient transport. Easy to use even with a buggy.

My favourite "touristy" thing to do. Whenever someone comes to visit me in Hong Kong I am sure to take them on the Star Ferry at dusk. It is a great way to see the skyline and slow down the pace of life.
An interesting and convenient way from TST to Central. Yup ... a must do thing while in HK. Great sceneries along HK coastline.
Great transport. Access to cheap transport between numerous stops. Scenic way to travel between Kowloon and Island.
A must do. Travel back and forth on the boat and enjoy the skyline. Cheap ride, with some great views.
Vintage !!. The boat is really vintage and you could see unbeliable the HK skyline
A must do. Wonderful - cheap & frequent crossings between Kowloon and Hong Kong island. Fun in itself as well as a great mode of transport

Beautiful. Easy way to get around.
Hope to visit hk again soon.
Favorite part of my trip was Star Ferry trip. LOVED this journey. Make sure you hit up the 8pm light show in Kowloon (TST). Can't miss it- everyone is headed that way around 7:45 pm.

Breathtaking Views of Hong Kong’s Victoria Harbor—a must for all visitors to Hong Kong!. The Star Ferry has been crossing Victoria Harbor for more than a century. The ferries link Hong Kong Island and Kowloon and are a pleasant way to make the harbor crossing. The ferry ride was voted in 1999 as one of the “50 Places of a Lifetime” by the “National Geographic Traveller” Magazine and was voted Number 1 in the “Top 10 Most Exciting Ferry Rides” poll by the Society of American Travel Writers in 2009.This ferry ride provides the traveller with one of the cheapest sightseeing trips in Hong Kong. At the same time the traveller can gain an insight into the lifestyle of the people of Hong Kong. The ride is a delight at all times of day but is probably best at dusk or during the night when you are treated to breathtaking views of the iconic skyline of Hong Kong. The buildings along the shoreline compete with one another to provide an interesting light show at night. Do not forget to take your camera with you since you will be given numerous opportunities for great pictures of what must be one of the most interesting skylines in the world.The Star Ferry Company can trace its history back to 1880 when Dorabjee Naorojee Mithaiwala, a Parsee cook, started a new business providing ferry service across Victoria Harbor with his steamboat, the Morning Star. Sir Catchick Paul Chater purchased all the boats and in May 1898, the Star Ferry Company became a public company. Its name is derived from the fact that all the ferries bore the name “Star”

Priceless experience almost for free.. One of the most cherished experiences one can take from Hong Kong is the experience of the Star ferry pier and the cross harbour ferry from Central to TST and back. And all that view and the lovely ride for less than 25 US cents! This is my most relaxing commute back from work, even though its out of the way for me i still trek there on stressful days after work just to take the ferry back home.

Great way to travel...go native. This is by far the nicest way to travel across the city...it's fast..ish and cheap and gives enough time to see the sights, it's central ... the only thing is the continuous smog ruins photos.there is no language barriers and we used a few times.
Cheap and excellent. Easy to access and fun. Suggest getting an octopus card if you are in HK for a while
Convenient. Smooth Operations Spacious Safe Helpful staff Quick service
Great experience. We used them a few time. Once you have worked out how/ what you pay, it's easy. Most people speak English, so if you et stuck, just ask.

gotta do it. what more can be said? you simply have to take the ferry...it's so cheap and such a great way to see the Hong Kong Island skyline. I took it on a cloudy day and the view was somewhat obscured but still amazing. It takes only a few minutes to cross the harbor and the views are unforgettable (pics don't do it justice). Navigating the ferry system is easy and you can use your octupus card or loose change. Just pick your destination and you're off.
Easy to navigate. The Star Ferry pier was very user friendly and certainly punctual. Be sure to be on time. They leave as scheduled and not a minute late.
Best way to travel.. I love the Star Ferry and I think it evokes the real feel of Hong Kong. I think we calculated the return trip was less than 40 pence. Excellent value and real nostalgia.
A must for a Hong Kong visit. This is great way to get across from HK Island and at 25p a trip it doesn't break the bank!Great photo opportunity too.
great ride. a great bargin and a great ride across victoria harbor. very cheap ride. gives you a real feel for transportation in hong kong. faster and less crowded than subway.
From Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Ferry was short and got you over to Central quickly. It was also cheap as all the transport seems to be on HK. Lots of photo opps also on board.

I love this ferry. This is a great way to see the harbour when travelling from Hong Kong island to Kowloon for shopping or sightseeing. If you are on the ferry at about 8pm you can see the laser light show.

Great way to see the skyline. We use the ferry to visit Kowloon and were not disapponted. Great views, even during the day. That said we didnt get a chance to go on the passing junk, which I believe is actually free from Wan Chai and run by the local tourist board.
Either way a trip on the water is a must.
Fast. The ferry leaves frequently and it was a cheap crossing of the bay from Hong Kong to Kowloon.

Photo ops. The best photo ops place you could ever be. You have to make sure you have nice camera to be able to get all the pictures you like as the trip is quite short. Very wavy (sloppy as they call it) but enjoyable.

Excellent. A MUST DO in Hong Kong. Star Ferry is famous and a must do in Hong Kong. Take the trip to Central or Wan Chai from TST. It is a great way to see the harbour and amazingly inexpensive. We also did the Star Ferry night cruise. It was fantastic just sitting out the front going around the harbour. Love the Star Ferry.
Nice way to observe both sites of Hong Kong. Although ferries aren't new, but still it's a very cozy and old-fashioned way to reach both sides of Hong Kong.
Highlight of HK. The second cheapest (I think the tram is pennies cheaper), but definitely the most exciting way to travel in HK, the Star Ferry is an institution. Good day or night.
Excellent viewing location. great viewing location of the HKG harbor..gets really crowded in the evenings
Must do. Okay, it is a 5 minute ride, but it has been crossing the harbor for 100 years. Its a fun way to get to kowloon from Central
must do. see the sights of the harbour at night and day- what a difference
Easy Transportation. We walked to the pier and the 15 minute trip is free for seniors

Star Ferry excellent mode of transpo in HK. It's very cheap, efficient, and convenient. Ferries arrive and depart every 15 minutes. You simply buy tokens at the harbour piers in both HK island and Kowloon using HK coins. Children and senior citizens pay less than the 2.50 per adult fee.
A must do. Always love to cross the harbour on the Star Ferry, if it is your time to Hong Kong you must take the Star Ferry.
A must-do. Get off the bus or MTR and get on the upper deck of a ferry. It's fun and cheap, and a unique way to experience Hong Kong. I think the fare is just a little more than 3hkd.
Critical hub and spoke between Kowloon and Central and Wan Chai. take this was across the harbour as much as possible - to walk and get the feel. Not as fast as MTR but beats tunnels by taxi

Cheap mode of transportation in Hong Kong. It's very cheap! For only HK$ 2.50 - upperdeck / HK$ 2.00 - lowerdeck, you can enjoy the ride from Kowloon side to Hong Kong Island side or vise versa. You can enjoy the scenery of the high-rise buildings while riding the ferry boat. Do not leave the country unless you've experience riding this ferry. One of the must-dos for visitors.
Traditional Hong Kong. You need to go on it if you are visiting HK as it might disappears soon with more sea being reclaimed...

Star Ferry Pier. We travelled to Stanley Market on Hongkong Island...via the ferry...quick , cheap and easy way to travel....and excellent bus service to the market....we came back at night and saw the magnificant show of lights.....
Star Ferry. Regular service, cost about 20p per trip. Great fun!
Character Ferry service that is Iconic. For $2.30HKD you just can not go wrong with this cross harbour service.
Travel Hysteria. Typical Hong Kong bustle,great entre to the most amazing ferry crossing,and so cheap.

great way to commute to the city. it's worth a stop, it's the easiest, cheapest and quickest to go from Central to main land. The view of both sides is great, especially in the evening with the laser show! Don't miss it is all i can say
Very good value. The Star Ferry is well worth the efort. A cheap time with great views and a real taste of Hong Kong.

Ride part of History. Just about every movie to do with HK; the Star Ferry is part of it. When boarding it felt as though I was on a movie set; but this was real! For HK$2.50, you get a great view of the city and harbour and be part of History; not to mention the fresh air when compared to the MTR!
Ferry and boat services great. Don't worry if you miss the ferry, another one will be along in a few minutes. Don't have to wait hours for the next one!
Great to see. Cant go here without a ride on the Ferry. Old school ferry crossing very busy Harbor makes for a great amount of sights to see.
interesting. It's China, noisy, grubby, toilets horrid for ladies, but it's an enjoyable experience of the local culture.
An easy Must do whilst in Hong Kong. Do yourself a favour and jump on the Star Ferry when in HK, do both day and night, both ways if you want. lots of fun and a wonderful view of the city
a must. if you want a great view of the skyline ... this is the way to see it

What would Hong Kong be without it. I told my wife about the Star Ferry, and it is one of the few things that has never changed since I first travelled on it in 1962. The pier is now more like a market, but no visitor should go to Hong Kong and not travel on the ferry.
see the view. A view not to be missed. Take a ride on the ferry, one of the best things to do in HK.

Alot of things to Do. Beside catching the Star Ferry to cross the Bay there are many shops, restaurants and History Museum to see in this area. You can also ride in a hot air balloon, which will give you a good view of the bay. If you have little kids the balloon is on a long rope so you do not go extremely high. So before you catch the Ferry make sure you look around the pier first.
Cheap, Quick and Great Views. Hong Kong's harbour is one of the greatest in the world, the star ferry lets you see it for ridiculously cheap and its a fast way to get from one side to the other.
For 40 cents US - a great way to get to Central Hong Kong!. If you buy a "big bus" ticket on the Kowloon side, the ferry ride is free. Convenient and easy access to central HK.
Dream Realised........... Always wanted to visit & my dream came trueGreat Experience
Easy and convenient. It's also cheap and clean. After exploring Hong Kong, it's a good way to sit down, relax a bit, and enjoy a great view either direction you're crossing the harbor.
A Must!. You have to take the ferry when you are in HK! Only $2 witch is a steal. Its very relaxing as a contrast to the otherwise extremely busy town.
Convenient and easy trip across the harbor. Nice to get the view while crossing the harbor. Clean, quick, efficient.
Great ferry ride!. Wonderful way to see the water and move from place to place.
Great views for under $1. Definitely take the Star Ferry for a trip back and forth. Doesn't take long but gives great veiws from the harbour and is really cheap.

Exceptional Way to See Hong Kong. If you're visiting Hong Kong, you simply must use the Star Ferry. The view is outstanding, and the old-world charm of the ferry is something that should be experienced. You get a true sense of the mixed British-Chinese history set against the very modern view of the city while riding the ferry.

Best ride in Hong Kong.. Even if you don't have to cross Victoria Harbour, you should! This is the greatest ride you can take for just a few Hong Kong dollars. I've been doing it for 30 years and it hasn't changed a bit except for the view. This is a tradition in Hong Kong and everyone should give it a try. Great photo opportunities across this very busy harbour. It is recommended that you cross at least one way in the evening when the lights are on.
Nice veiw for under $1. Great way to get back and forth from mainland to Kowloon - and for about $1. Peir has lots of shops and things to eat.

NO big deal. The Star Ferry Pier is nothing to brag about. The most interesting thing are the protestors that are protesting the Chinese government and the public material pertaining to the torture and abuse of groups that the government does not "like". The material is eye opening. The Star Ferry is worth taking to Hong Kong and is very inexpensive. It departs at several times during the day.
Best mode of transportation between Hong Kong and Kowloon side!. Its so efficient...not like other ferry's in other major cities. Super cheap and you get great views on both sides on the ride.

OK. Last for 7min only, so you don't really have time to enjoy it. Cost about 2,5HKD and takes you between Central and Tsim Sha Tsui. It was easy getting on and off. A good alternative to the metro. The view is OK. You see the skyline of both HK island and Tsin Sha Tsui. Probably a lot more beautiful when it's dark.
Always wonder. It's always wonderful to take a ride on the Star Ferry every time I visit HK.
Hong Kong experience. Stanley Markets excellent.Take a day trip on local bus better than tour as they never allow enough time for shopping
Cheap transport. Constant ferry to Kowloon from island cheap and simple
A must do in Hong Kong. If you ever go to Hong Kong you should take a trip on the star ferry. It is one of the cheapest trips in the world set against the back drop og Hong Kong harbour.

The best value tourist attraction in the world.. A must do when you are in HK. Superb views of the Harbour day and night. And so cheap. The only (slight) disappointment is the Central pier is now such a long walk from Central - was much better in the old days.
Ferry Fun. The star ferry is a great way to get around for a ridiculously cheap amount of money and a very regular service.
See the Sunset. To see the sunset in the late afternoon from the harbour you will catch up another romantic view of between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, and the feeling.
nice ride and view. nice way to cross islands,and enjoy the city view. trips are for 3$ and they are short,around 8-10mins
Super Easy. The Ferry is amazingly easy to use, on time, and cheap!
a must. if you visit HK without using the green ferry's , you miss a typical item of HK
cheap and cheerful. but a must do when you in hong kong even just to get away from the hustle and bustle of either Kowloon OR Island for twenty minutes
Ferry to HK Island. great transport to HK Island a taste of the old HK
Great tourist attraction. Something old in a very modern city and gives you great views of Victoria Harbour
Reliable and cheap. Love these ferries, they just chug back and forward across the harbor. They are charming old things, I never waited more than 3 mins to catch one.
A typlical shopping center.. With chain stores and chain food shops. If ur gonna board the ferry get there a little early and take a look around but not worth JUST going there.
LOVED IT, great way to travel. And SO CHEAP!. It's a must. Travel with the locals! Frequent from morning to night. Every day between Kowloon and HK Island.
Cheap and frequent. lots of very cheap ferries ot outer islands or just across the harbour running every few minutes
Great way to see the skyline. Sooo cheap, and a great way to see the famous skyline

must do in HK. it costs only hkd 2 or something to cross the harbour from Tsim Sha Tsui to Centralwith such an exciting transportI really love ityou may bring your bike to cross harbour with thatmine is a folding bikethe staff asked me to fold it and got a bag to cover itit's to avoid any other passengers would get hurt by the bikeanyway, just do it

Nice views and Cheap but oversold on Trip Advisor.. The pier was as promised a place with nice views and a really cheap way to cross into Kowloon (2HKD). The ferry itself has some nostalgic value and the trip across to the other side is pleasant enough. Maybe I was tired from the long walk from Central or maybe I'm jaded but I expected something more breathtaking for something rated so highly on the list.Catch it if you can but its not a must see in my book
Very convenient. It is spacious and punctual. It is by no means new but has a lovely traditional feeling.
Tour. Easy access and a great tour to see the sights around the water

Best way to experience Hong Kong. Given the importance the sea has played in Hong Kong's history, I feel this is the true way to see Hong Kong. The ferries are cheap, quick, clean, and stable (so it should be fine for even those who tend to get sea sick).Well worth doing the crossing even if you don't need to get to the other side.

Evening cruise well worth it. We did this in the evening and we had great views, the 1hour trip is enough as you get the choice of a 2 hour one as well. You get a free drink and nice slice of cake which pleased us

Take the Ferry. The Star Ferry is still the "real" Hong Kong experience. I've been to Hong Kong many times but never get tired of the Star Ferry crossing. Treat yourself. If you onlly have a short time take the Ferry one way and the subway return.
Nice but no great. Not so special after all, but very cheap. We had some seats next to the window but you can not see a lot, better at night
Old and crudy. Lets the rest of the HK public tranport down. Dirty and tired, but a very quick and cheap way to cross the harbour.

Might as well be free. The cheap as chips ferry ride between Central HK and Kowloon is quintessential HK. It offers a brief respite from the hectic chaos of Central and TST with views to either side of Victoria Harbour unhindered. The ferries are old but clean and efficient with one making the harbour crossing every few minutes.

Cheap and easy way to see Hong Kong. Take the ferry from TST to central and you get to see a great panoramic view of both sides of Hong Kong. It costs HKD2.5 only and is faster and FAR less crowded than the MTR. You can move the back of the seat so that either direction you are facing the way the ferry is going.

always worth an hour. its pretty crowed as you can imagine but its always worth sitting there an hour just enjoying the skyline, the ships passing bye or the sun in your face... try to avoid peak hours around 8pm (the lightshow anyways is rather boring or better watched on another spot)...
Very Nice. This is an awesome place with a cool character. The place doesnt feel uber crowded, and feels quite relaxed considering it's so important for ferries in hong kong. Quite nicely done..
Part of Hong Kong Experience. Super cheap, something like 50cents for the ride to Hong Kong. Do it.
Cheap, Must Do.... Great way to see the city... Amazing Views... Cheap price! A bit of a walk from Central, bc they moved the piers...

A slice of "real" Hong Kong. You can't visit Hong Kong without taking a trip on the Star Ferry. It's so cheap it is almost free, and it has amazing views of the harbour from both sides. For a "budget" experience, take the ferry from Wanchai to Kowloon around 6 pm, have a bite to eat, and watch the light show on the island later in the evening, before taking the ferry back to the island.
to get to the other side. Lots of fun stuff to do and great place to take off for the island

Not To Be Missed. Sit at the top and pay the extra as the deck below smells of diesel fumes and the view is better from the top. Go at night time as well as a really cheep way of seeing the Hong Kong lights.
Green Star (not Gold). Good fun and very cheap - comes free with Big Bus pass.
The best way to travel. A nice slower change of pass getting to Cental and Admiralty. Hugely inexpensive.
Chep harbour viewing.. A very cheap option to cross the harbour or even enjoy having a look around.

Awesome and cheap experience.. Victoria Harbour is one of the cooler places on earth. The Star Ferry is the best way to fully experience it. A one way trip on the ferry is about 40 cents USD, so it should be in any one's budget. I love being able to see Hong Kong Island and Kowloon from the middle, and also seeing the activity on all sides.

Good place to start. Star ferry Pier is a good starting point to go off to many places. Lots of buses stop there including the H/K Tour bus which is great value and goes places you wouldn't otherwise see.The pier is a good place to watch the goings on on the water - all sorts of craft can be seen from sampans to cruise liners.The trip back and fore to Kowloon is short and very cheap but a lovely way to see the skyscrapers on both sides of the harbour.
Star Ferry. Clean, organised, and instructions always in Cantonese, and English, both spoken and read
Good and inexpensive. Great way to see Hong Kong and VERY cheap.If its a cool day expect a very cool ride. The ferry we went on had no enclosed area and the winds was VERY cold

A Hong Kong Must. There are three main piers for the Star Ferry - Tsim Sha Tsui on the Kowloon side and Wanchai and Central on the HK Island side. The view from the piers is magnificent. The ride on the ferries is even better - approx $3HKD for a one way trip on the top deck - even cheaper on the lower deck- don't miss it.
Crossing the water. An easy way to travel and there was never any pushing or shoving to get on and off the ferry

Wow this is Hong Kong. What a view from the Star Ferry Pier. Star Ferry operated many ferry services to Wanchai, Central, Hong Kong Island and other places. You can view the beautiful skyline of Hong Kong from here. Don't forget to take a ride on the Ferry!
Nice mode of transport. It's a nice option on a calm day for traveling between Central and TST.
Fun and cheap way to see the bay. I believe it was about 0.50 USD for a one way ticket across to Hong Kong Island. It took maybe 10min to cross. Great way to great around

A must-see for all Tourists, cheap as chips ferry crossing. The Star Ferry Pier & crossing, is a 'must-see' attraction for all Tourists. It's cheap as chips & gives you fantastic views of the city. I used it numours times during my recent visit to HK. First class & second class travel are both worth a try. I highly recommend it.
Star Ferry. You have to go on a star ferry !! the staff on the pier were very helpful

Cheapest way to see the Victoria harbour. From TST - Wan Chai / Central.For taking photoof harbour, I suggest to take the Wan Chai Lane. Longer duration and better view. Day / Night trip also suggest!
Best View In Hong Kong. I love the Star Ferry Pier at night. A great view of the Hong Kong Island skyline.
Legendary ferries. From Tsim Sha Tsui in Hong Kong island from ancient times can get a ferry. We were lucky to try it and it was unspeakable ..

The most soul filling transportation method. It takes you at the right speed, under the right breeze with the right swing through the most buzzling harbor, to the most magnificent city appearing magically closer in front of you.

Great Short Cheap trip with views. totally recommend it! it is so easy and cheap you have nothing to loose. Take your camera, the views are so fantastic, I regretted the trip was so short, like 7 minutes.
A Must. This is must for any visitor to Hong Kong, costs pennies but great views of the harbour, bring your camera

Fun trip. I hope you can swim:). It was bit foggy on our trip on the Star Ferry across the bay but it was fun and cheap. I did notice that there were no life jackets on this boat, only a half dozen or so life preservers outside. It sounds like a tragedy waiting to happen.
Busy place. We were here a couple of times to catch the ferry. It's a lively place but really not worth the visit by itself unless you're on the way to go somewhere else
Cheap and great views!. Very easy as you can use your octupus cards, cheap and really quaint boats athat give you a great view of the harbour.
Refreshing and Relaxing. Well-organized and relaxing way to cross from Hong Kong island to Kowloon island, or vice versa. Tokens are now used instead of coins.

Easy access to Hong Kong from Kowloon. Frequent and easy to use, we took the Star Ferry several times to go from our hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui to "Central" Hong Kong Island. Fare is $2.50 one-way. You buy tokens in a machine, but if you plan to use public transit a lot, look into the "Octopus" card. Information is in English and there are magazine and fast-food stands throught the pier. The ride takes about 15 minutes.
Worlds best Ferry ride. This used to be how the locals travelled in the old days, very cheap and relaxing way to view the City
Revisit.. We were in Hong Kong about 30 yrs ago so it was "visiting the past". Although it has improved still a great experience.
Same as it was 40 years ago!. Runs every 6 minutes - fast efficient way to cross the harbour.
Yes ok. I had heard so much about the star ferry but when you see it you think oh is this it , it's an old boat and the pier well I can't remember a pier ,like we know a pier .
A must do when you visit Hong Kong. There is nothing better than this during your visit. Getting to see Hong Kong from the harbor is special, and especially so during the evening. Go and enjoy.
Better a night!. cheap and convenient way to cross the Harbour. Great for a after-dinner cruise, catching the bright night-lights of Hong Kong harbour.
Loved the trip accross the river. the ferry is so easy to get on just buy a pick and ride accross the river so many points to go to and lots of great places to look at along the river and so cheap

Don't Miss the Ferry - but Pier is Average. Of course, no trip to Hong Kong is complete without a ride on the Star Ferry - and I highly recommend making the trip. Just don't expect to be waiting in comfort for the ferry to arrive!
great view. the view you get from a star ferry is just unreal great expérience
Take the ferry, but the new central pier is nothing worth mentioning. The original star ferry pier in central was a much better example of 'old' hong kong.

An enjoyable short journey but soo Hongkonese. Taking the ferry from HK Wan Chai to Kowloon Tsim ShaTsui is a short crossing, but you have good views over both sides.
It is a standard ferry but very much part of Hong Kong's commuting experience that it makes it special to me.
This is a must, as integral part of HK.

Welcome to HK!. Everything is good about it. Your cameras will be put to test to see
how well it captures the spectacular scenery. Welcome to the city of
lights, welcome to HK!
star ferry. nice way to get from hong kong island to Kowloon. beats the traffic jam. and not too expensive

Excellant vibe and atmosphere. The star ferry is one of the highlights of Hong Kong and shouldnt be missed. It is very cheap and a good way to see outlying areas. You really get a sense of what hong kong is about when you travel on this ferry. Tip - Board on the top entrance so that you can get on the highest level which is better for photos.
Excellent service.. The menu suited every taste. Prices reasonable. Service was attentive and in excellent English

Great experience. So cheap! Try a trip to one of the other islands such as Cheung Chau - amazing. But don't bother upgrading to 'deluxe' seating. The normal seating is comfier. Also, beware that the 'snacks available on board' is by vending machines which only accept oyster cards and not cash.
Central Pier to Kowloon Pier. To avoid peak hours as it is crowded. Use the lower deck as the upper deck cost slightly more but the upper deck gives you better view

Ride the Star Ferry!. over Victoria Harbour. It is touristy but well worth it. Cost is very reasonable. If you begin your trip on the Hong Kong Island side, beware of hawkers who want to sell you electronics, tailored clothing, etc. I do not advise purchasing cameras and watches on the Kowloon side - it's just a scam. Buy cameras in your home country where they can be serviced! I've lived in Hong Kong 18 years and you can get much better prices at the large wholesale shops in the U.S. if that's where're you from.

What a great place to see the city lights. Loved this place there is a bar on pier 7 the star ferry terminal where they give you free nibbles with a drink in the evening. We went ther twice to watch the nightly laser and light show at 8 pm

For the ride!. Do this just for the ride - theses ferries are just great, plying back and forth across Victoria Harbour to Central every few minutes. They cost a matter of about 40c a ride, and the view is spectacular, day and night. Love the bump arrivals! Find out what I mean...go soon.
still good. Star ferry pier has moved 200 metres closer to Kowloon on the reclaimed land since we were last here but it still has all the old style charm and is a 'must do' in HK

cheap and nice. nice way to go across and its cheap as well...there was a little rush getting into the ferry (i think thats normal for anyone who is in HK- everyone is in a rush and i don know why) ;)
Fun in Hong Kong. I just love to take the ferry to the island, you get a great view of the city

Cool way to get around. It is cheaper than the metro and so much cooler than staring at underground tunnels. I didn't do the official tour thing I just used it to get from Kowloon side to Hong Kong island and back. It's cool becuase its not just a tourist attraction but a legit regular form of transportation they use. Having an Octupus card makes it even simpler.

a nice place to chill out :). this is the old pier you can spot some old memorabia for sale & on display on the way to the ferry :)get on board via the top floor as while waiting for the ferry you can see the view of hong kong island harbour ! :D
An experience that shouldn't be missed. Very quick trip across the harbour but enjoyable just the same
see the HongKong and Kowloon skyline for a few dollars. A panoramic view of both sides of the harbour for a few dollars. Well worth the trip.
Best transport system ever. Everything ie cheap, efficient reliable,scenic etc etc
Star Ferry. Great way to get to the other side of the island! Fast and efficient!
Old fashioned transportation across HK harbor. I like the nostalgia of riding this form of transportation and the fact that it is so efficient to take to cross the harbor.

Smooth as silk. Whether you are sipping coffee, devouring a Dim Sum or a burger, burning your lungs with a smoke, the place is beautiful. Just allow yourself to merge into the surroundings and feel the vibrancy. If your using the facilities like shopping or catching a boat to go to Macau etc. the the entire experience is amazing!

Ok. Given how much we had read and heard about it, it was fairly disappointing, and certainly not like the specatular image we had been given to imagine! It was old and almost crumbling - I was actually a little scared to step on to the planks, being a heavy person, fo fear it would break!
Not much to offer. Some small shops selling souvenirs. It is a place to spend a few minutes while waing for a ferry - or the light show at 9pm.
The best harbor view at the least inexpensive cost. My son's must-do thing EVERY time we visited HK. Always amazing views either under clear sky or rainy foggy days, day or night.

What a lovely way to travel. My husband and I stayed in Kowloon and needed to get to Hong Kong Island often. Traveling on the subway from Tsim Sha Tsui to the island was usually 2 stops, but the way we really liked to travel was the Star Ferry. For 2.5 HK$ (more on weekends) one could travel the harbor and SEE Hong Kong. The ferries The Octopus Card worked on the Ferry. Yes there was more walking involved, but again, then you could SEE things. I advise you to do the trip at least once in daylight and once at night. Not to be missed!
Good. Ferries are well serviced but if you need to ask a question go to a tourist stand.
Participate in a piece of history. The star ferry is a very fun, cheap way to get across the harbour. Both the upper and lower deck are good, but warmer up top and better for taking pictures.
star feery, cheap and fun way to see the cityscape. $3HK, less than $1usd, 15 minute ride between kowloon and HK center. nice views.
So Cheap. Lovely way to travel to & fro, hong kong & kowloon, costs only pennies
great value. easiest and cheapest way to get to either Hong Kong or Kowloon, with a great view of the shipping and local life
Great location for views and ideally go to the viewing area to the side of the star ferry. The ferries are very affordbale and give great views and one hour tours.
Star Ferries. I love the atmosphere at the Star ferry piers, each one is different as a mix of commuter, business people and toursits.
Must try this slice of HK life.... Like going back in time to Colonial Days...wonderful and super cheap...get your camera out and fight for a good seat near the edges...
still a must for first time visitors or those that havent been in a long time. used to be better at the original Hong Kong pier end. longer ride and historical
Try a new style. Loving this journey! instead of taking underground, you'd rather take the ferry to see the harbour!

Boats as stars. It's fun to watch the Star Ferries come in and out of the dock, catching glimpses of all the different names of the boats. Twinkling Star. Morning Star. etc.
The adjacent harbour is also a great viewing platform.
CHEAP. only a few Hong kong $ great value, sails every half an hour & very easy to pay in the machines

LOVELY WAY TO SEE THE VIEW. cheap, cheap and cheap. Very efficient. You can see a lovely view of Kowloon and hong kong at the same time. Make sure you pay the price for top deck which is only pennies!
Very Convienent. Brilliant handy to hotel via subway and by crossing harbour you can do more sightseeing on your own

Easy peasy. Getting on the ferry to Kowloon and back was very easy and hassle free. Travelled off peak so no crowd ansd just walked on.Quick no nonsense type travel and cheap for less the 2.5 HKD. Pay minimally more if you travel upper deck, about 0.5 HKD more. Good way to see the harbour and views of Kowloon and HK island.

Very Customer Friendly. It's very easy, cheap and very good service. It's good to have a nice area for photgraphy atleast at the ferry terminal or in the ferry as many tourist use this service.Also it's good to have attention towards the security / safety of passegers.

Very easy to find and use. The ferry is the best way to get across Victoria Harbour (and the quickest) between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. It is inexpensive and the routes are straightforward. The ferry ride is only about 10 minutes. If you get an Octopus Card to manage all your public transport fares it's even easier - it's a snap! There are boards there telling you how long before the next ferry departs (but you can see it coming anyway). They are very frequent. There is a bit of a walk from the ferry terminal to the heart of Hong Kong island, but the Kowloon side is only a short distance to shops etc.

Very cheap to cross on ferry. if you have $2.50 in coins you can just put them in the barrier and get through to the ferry - its soooo cheap and great fun . On Hong Kong Island side there is a walkway that connects with the bus station , where we jumped on the bus to Stanley Market - it as all so easy

Star Ferry - another must do in HK. We did the Big Bus Tours in HK and these included free rides on the Star Ferry so we did that a couple of times in heading over from Kowloon to HK Island to pick up the bus.The ferry gives a different perspective to the city and offers a few minutes of calm away from the constant bustle of the streets.We also did the evening Harbour Cruise but unfortunately there was no commentary in English so we didn't learn anything although it was still interesting to see all the buildings lit up at night.
Kowloon at its busiest!. The absolute hub of Hong Kong - just try to avoid the copy watch sellers!
Cross in the old-fashioned way ..... Very regular service (every 15 minutes); great harbour views; shades of old hong-Kong.
A short trip to enjoy the harbour view. The ferry takes about 10 minutes across the Victoria harbour. It cost less than 50 cents. But the view is priceless.
so efficient. everything just WORKS in Hong Kong. No problems, just good natured efficiency. So impressed
Experience local life!. A cheaper alternative to taking MTR and taking the boat reminds me of scenes in HK dramas!
Easy access to both islands of Hong Kong. Clean and efficient service.Service was frequent and did not have to wait long.
Very Nice!. Cool place cool people~~ Cool place cool people~~Cool place cool people~~ Cool place cool people~~

Lovely Quick Ride. This is a great way to see both sides of the harbor. The trip takes only maybe five minutes and is easy and convenient. The boats run every five or six minutes I believe, and it's very inexpensive: maybe 2.5 HKD? We were on it at rush hour, and there were still plenty of seats.

Good memory to make. Every time when any of my friends come to Hong Kong, for sure I will bring them to take the ferry. It is a historical sign of HK and people not always have the chance to try. And for sure not with this spectacular city view. If you love taking photos, I would highly recommend you to take the ferry because you can see the another side of Victoria Harbor better.However,I also recommend you to go at night time because it is even more prettier!! After a dinner in Central District, take the ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui and wait for the light show near the coastal at 8pm. It is always a good choose to make.
History... I remember this when i was stationed in Hong Kong...not a lot has changed..great wee trip...

It's a pier!. The Star Ferry Ride is on most people's wish list when they visit Hong Kong but the pier is just a means to an end to use the ferry with the usual of collection of food and newsagents outlets.
Efficient. Quaint.. Every time i come back to Hong Kong, riding the ferry across to Kowloon is a must. It is magic. It is quaint. It has great scenic breath of fresh air. it is cheap.

The Star Ferry - period charm and spectacular views. The Star Ferry is undoubtedly the best way to get across Victoria Harbour from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and back. The MTR (the Hong Kong Underground) is also fast, clean and efficient but on the Star Ferry has period charm and spectacular views of skyscrapers on both sides of the Harbour (even if you no longer see any junks in the Harbour). On the Kowloon side, the Star Ferry Pier is close to the Peninsula Hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui, and you can pay for the crossing with your Octopus Card (designed and implemented here first, then exported to London as the Oyster Card). The crossing only takes about 8-10 minutes but it really is one of the big attractions of Hong Kong, especially in the evening with the lights shimmering on the water, and is said to be the finest ferry crossing in Asia. Be careful: the last ferry leaves at about 11.00 pm.http://www.starferry.com.hk/
Even in the rain and fog it was fun.. Cheap way to see Hong Kong from the water. Beats the MTR!

Cheap way to see the harbour. Travel back in time and see the city as so many people in Hong Kong saw it in the days before subways and traffic tunnels. The ferry is extremely inexpensive, frequent, and offers a wonderful way to see the harbour.
Must put on bucket list. Best ferry ride in Asia, see Hong Kong at its best
short trip to hong kong island. cannot remember the fare as it was so cheap. ferry service so frequent its not necessary to look for a timetable.

Different perspective of HK. We had been using the tram for the first two days of our stay, the we decided to try the ferry for a change. Wow - such a different view and perspective of HK skyline and the sheer size of the city. Amazing way to travel to Kowloon side - and may be to travel back to the Island to Wan Chai
Nice trip. Cheap travel and you have a good view of the harbour. And there is not much waiting time between ferries.
A must do. If you visit Hong Kong you have to take a ride on the Star Ferry.

People, people, everywhere people. This is our 5th trip to Hong Kong and the place still excites us. The Star Ferry Pier is a very busy place that becomes especislly crowded when the sun goes down. Don't let that put you off, it's great fun. You have to experience it for yourself. It's a safe place. No drunken yobs and yobesses behaving badly. Just ordinary people having a great time. Shop here, see the Cruise Liners, catch a ferry to Hong Kong Isand etc.

A must-do when visiting Hong Kong. Didn't expect the boat to be so small, but had a couple of journeys both ways across the harbour. With the weather so grey & gloomy in mid-January, & the harbour very choppy, the photo's weren't great but still an experience to remember
Must do it once!. If it's your first trip to HK take a ride you won't be sorry. However if you're in a hurry use the subway.
Get ur camera ready. As u can take awesome shots of the beautiful harbor!

Brilliant value. The star ferry is known throughtout the world and if you go to Hong Kong it is obvious to use it to get from the island to Kowloon. Incredibly cheap transport.I didnt purchase an octopus card, I know it is easier to get round HK with one but our group got by. At the pier you could buy a token to enable you to go on the star.If ony England was so cheap for transport !!!!

If you don't take the Star Ferry, you weren't really in Hong Kong. It's HKD 2.20, and the nicest way to get from Kowloon to HK Island and vice versa. Take it in the daytime and nighttime for the best views and to experience this HK institute that people have been using for years and years.

Free for seniors. The Star Ferry crossing is free for seniors (65 and older) using the Octopus card. The Octopus card can be purchased at any MTR station (subway) and is good for travel on the Airport Express line, MTR, buses, trams, the Star Ferry, and can also be used for many local purchases. Just show your senior Octopus card when passing through the Star Ferry turnstiles and you'll be waved in for free.

The best 20 pence you will EVER spend!. There is only ONE way to get across Hong Kong harbour and that is via the Star ferry. one of the oldest services operating world wide and never an accident! (they do not operate in the fog!)Stunning views which ever direction you are going in but the best is from Kowloon (mainland) across to Hong Kong Island. Get you camcorders and cameras at the ready.Even if you are in HK for only one day, you must take this short 5 minute journey and if possible make it after dark, and if really possible, between 8pm and 8;15pm when you will be engulfed in the nightly "Symphony of Lights" show when all the lasers on all the buildings give you a free 15 minute light show!You won't be disappointed.Mark.
Travel in style. Brilliant if only they had them in London!! Star Ferry was a great experience, they are efficient and the best way to travel to to and from the isalnd.
star ferry. Travelled to Hong Kong City, from Kowloon by Ferry, all was good.

Nice start to the evening. I am a boat person so any excuse to sail and I am there. My hubby and I took this very basic but cool 12 minute trip across to Kow Loon to watch the Laser display (to music) spotlighted on the high rise buildings on the Island. Nice way to go although extremely cold in January this year.

Not what it used to be. Hong Kong has reclaimed some shoreline and as a result the ferry takes you to the Hong Kong side from Kowloon and you must take a long walk on a passenger bridge to get to Connaught Road, the main street. The piers used to be right in the center of visitor sites and activities.
Don't Miss... Great way for that first visit to Hong Kong to see the HK skyline and access Victoria Harbour.
Best views of HKG and harbour. A must do in HKG. The gentle slow trip across Victoria Harbor is spectacular.

Efficient and inexpensive. Precision running of this ferry and its inexpensive price make it a Star in our minds. My husband had the senior rate 1.5 HK$ and mine was 2.5 HK$. Crossing only takes about 10 minutes from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. Use pier seven for this crossing.

Centre of Hong Kong. The Star Ferry Pier is the entry and exit point for the star ferry on Victoria Harbour. Always busy, the pier has a Hong Kong Tourism office located there which make it very convenient for visitors to Hong Kong. There are numerous little shops and stands but you would do better to buy elsewhere, it will be cheaper.The only downside of the area are the guys who constantly approach you to buy knock-off watches/handbags or be measured for a suit. I find them a little creepy!
Convenient. Ferry is located next to BIG BUS hop on hop off tours. Several stores available to purchase coffee/sweets/etc before boarding ferry or bus tour.

Nice view on historic ferry. This historic ferry is a pleasant way to get across the harbor. We were staying in Mong Kok so we took the MTR to Tsim Sha Tsui then walked to the ferry terminal. It's faster to take the MTR all the way to Central but the view is much worse than on the ferry.We had been told that our Airport Express MTR cards would work on the ferry but this wasn't the case so we had to go to the 7-11 near the ferry terminal to add fare to our cards.

Good restaurant. There is a very nice restaurant at the top of the Star Ferry Pier - at the viewing station. They have a buffet lunch with a different carvery each day and a good variety of salads. Good value at less than a hundred Hong Kong dollars.
Full view of the harbor. The one and only in HKG, a must ride. See the entire view of harbor for hardly anything.
It is "just" HK. It is "just" HK - not that special, but go for the boat ride to the other side. That is an "authentic" experience
Is so far now. Since they move it to its new location, you have to walk a long way from the MTR station to the ferry.
easy on. get your tokens at the machine as you walk in. I think coins are taken as well as octopus cards
See the HK harbour lights. The harbour lights should be on everyone's HK itinerary at least once and the Star Ferry is probably the best way to see them all in one night.
for 30 cents US the view can't be beat. step back in time on these old clunkers. It's lovely. I suggest going one way 1st class, one way 2nd. Down below you get to see the engine at work.
Ferries going everywhere. Fast, efficient and cheap. Like all other public transport in this city it doesn't disappoint. The ferries aren't ultr-modern but they do the job.
Great way to travel. make sure you try this atleast once in your lifetime. a throwback to days of old.
so authentic - must do in HK. I always take ferrys whenever I am in HK, this makes me feel like I am travelling in time

Cheap and efficient. This is a great way to travel between Kowloon and Hogn Kong Island. The views in all directions are simply breath taking. It is a clean and efficient way of moving on foot between these two areas. Ticket purchase is very easy!

Visiting the past. Impossible to say, I do not like, as it is always a fantastic trip, over the years, I remember my first trip almost 30 years, and the sensation today, is very much the some. To go to Hong Kong, and not to a ride at the ferry, is a shame, even being, very busy. And I suggest, as compulsory, visit, as a tourist, or business man.
One of HK's iconic features.. A lovely old ferry service that is really cheap and actually still very useful. Get a top deck seat.

I miss the old one but the new one does have a nice cake shop!. I've lived in Hong Kong for many years and so I miss the old Star Ferry pier, which was dirty and unkempt, but much more "Hong Kong". The new confection, with its new clock tower just seems a bit fake. However, they have some nice little shops and the cake shop sells lovely, warm egg tarts – just the ticket while waiting for the ferry.Of course the ferry itself remains the best value ride in the territory – where else could you experience the wonderful harbour views for less than the price of a newspaper? And it is such a peaceful way to travel between Hong Kong Island and the rest of Hong Kong.Highly recommended!
Not what it used to be. Clean fast but the character I remember it in the pastHas gone.

Great. Highly recommended to take the ride if you ever visit Hong Kong.Great experience at low fee, good view of the coast, journey only takes about 5 minutes from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon or vice versa. Its also clean and neat! You can buy the tokens at a self-service machine.http://youtu.be/5pl78v9-7wg
A must in Hong Kong. Do use the Star Ferry to view Hong Kong and Kowloon. The best time is at night to see the light show and the sky scrapers lit.
as efficient as ever. not crowded and easy to access and better than the hectic subway

Amazing view of the city skylines. If you have time, I would recommend a visit to the Star Ferry Pier at night to see the city skyline light up at night! Pretty amazing views in my opinion. If you want, arrive just before 8 for the 8PM light symphony show. It is just a bunch of lasers shooting into the sky and very touristy but since your already there for the pier, might as well arrive when the light starts!
Ferry ride. Very busy and packed, very rocky on the water, not very clean but quick to cross - only 7 minutes
Take a ferry from TST to Central. You will love it, and it only cost a penny. Ride on at night and daytime could be different story completely .

A Must Do. What a great way to cross Hong Kong Harbor. This is something everyone has to do at least once. Nighttime crossing was breathtaking and the views were stunning especially with all the special Christmas lighting up which was when we were there.
Easy. Good concession food, a lot of neat trinkets, and better shopping on the Kowloon side. Prices were cheaper in the shops than in the markets.

Iconic Ferry Ride. We try to fly to Sydney every year and our preferred stopover is Hong Kong. Not just because their airline, Cathay Pacific is excellent but because Hong Kong is a very vibrant and exciting place to be. very friendly people and so much to do and see. One thing you must do whilst there is to take the Star Ferry that plies the stunning harbour. It offers some magnificent photo opportunities and is a very very cheap way to see the sights daytime and of course at night when Hong Kong lights up in some style. It's an absolute must-do and an experience you will cherish forever.
