cheapest tourist attraction but the best. take upper deck as it is not crowded plus the view is breahtaking! nice winter wind.
Super ferry. The best value excursion/trip/transport in the world with views to die for.

great cruise to hong kong. its very cheap to ride across the harbour $3.Its a great way to see both sides of the land and big cruise ships in the port.great angles to photo all the buildings and birds above

Great, convenient, cheap. This was really great because it was a great way to see the both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island from a boat and it was a very convenient way to get to HK Island from Kowloon. The ferry pier is all very well sign posted and very easy to find the right one.The easiness of using the octopus card is amazing. Just swipe it when you get onto the ferry and it'll deduct a nominal amount, and you just get on the ferry. So easy, just like everything in Hong Kong, and exactly not like Britain.
Ferry. Worth a trip , to see the fantastic Hong Kong lights by night
Reminded me of the Birkenhead landing stage. Atmospheric vintage facilities rather like Mersey Ferries; no concessions to tourists. I felt quite at home. Hong Kong seems determined to erase the past.

Quick easy transport to Hong Kong Island. Perhaps the only thing that hasn't changed in Hong Kong is the Star ferry. Smelt like it had just been painted. Quick regular and easy to use. Try it it's great.

get a ticket to ride. i can only repeat what everyone says: star ferry is best travel bargin in the world, ever. we hopped on the ferry at twilight and fell under the spell cast by the HK lights. Knockout
Quick & Convenient. Ferry Runs every couple of minutes from Kowloon to HK island.
You have to do this once. The short trip is easy and frequent. It is a must do because it puts Hong Kong, Kowloon, and the Harbor into perspective.
ferry from kowloon to HK island. it is like traveling back into the 60s in HK. take a ferry that ply between HK island and kowloon.
great way to cross HK island to Kowloon. It is about 5-10mins journey on the ferry and it quite relaixng. very cheap too but another must-do for HK
Best value for getting across the harbor. The star ferry is legendary - crossing Victoria Harbor for decades without an accident. An inexpensive way to travel between HK Island and Kowloon.
Star ferry more fun than the pier. Star ferry is just great and a wonderful and cheap tourist attraction - miss the pier and take the ferry!
Star Ferry has not changed in 30 years (or more). I last travelled on Star Ferry 30 years ago and it was like nothing had changed, when all around the city has transformed.

Best way to get a great Vista of HK and Kowloon!. It's a great trip only like 5 minutes across but in that trip you will get to see the best views of HK from the harbor , the reason HK was founded in the first place, much better for me than taking the mtr across as I see where I'm going . The only hassle is now they have moved the central ferry terminal quite aways from the main roads so it's quite a walk perhaps half a km . But it's only like 2 dollars and lots of fun so still very much recommended.
Great value. A brilliant trip to see the harbour and to people-watch, although it only lasts a few minutes.

Upper deck. Fare is cheap either way. Upper deck has better view. Night view of course better than day time. If you are staying in Hong Kong for a few days, try on the day when you see the weather is clear.
Best HK views. Favourite spot to people, boats watch and catch whatever sunshine going.

Historic Ferry Ride A Must To Hong Kong Island. Although crowded and somewhat dirty this is one of the landmarks of any trip to Hong Kong to cross the ferry ride to the other side of Hong Kong. Enjoyed it basically.
Not a must see. Boring and nothing really to see or do. Too many people trying to sell me something.
Good fun. good fun , and easy and very cheap way to get a view of Victoria Harbour

GREAT WAY TO SEE THE SKYSCRAPERS. We used the Star Ferry on a couple of occasions during our four day trip. It is very efficient and cheap. We went over to Hong Kong Island on it which only takes around 10 minutes and it is interesting to see the locals using their public transport. We also went on the tourist round the harbour trip which visited several of the islands. It's a great way to get some breathtaking views of the skyscrapers from the water and a cheap, fun way to spend an hour.
Quick and efficient. An old fashioned but very efficient way to cross the river!

Really great way to get around. We were staying in Kowloon so we used the Star Ferry for commuting to Hong Kong Island. Once we charged up our Octopus cards we were able to use them on the ferry as well.
No trip is complete without a ride. You have to take a ride on the Starr Ferry. The hustle down the gang plank, the view from the water. Cheap transport with an nostalgic charm

Nostalgia for the Colonial times. This is a blast from the past with upstairs on the ferry as de-luxe and downstairs normal class. You can travel from either Central or Wan Chai to Kowloon or the outlying Islands. Don't miss it as it is a real piece of history.
best value ride. You could take this ferry a dozen times and still be amazed at the views

great view on a nice slow ride. love how slow the boat goes so that the passengers can get a good view of the buildings on both side of the water... maybe not so good a ride for the locals rushing for time!

Not to be missed!!!. We went on the ferry twice and both times had great views and an overall good experience. Saturday and Sundays are busier than weekdays and the cost is about 20p each way ( a bit more at weekends ) A good cheap fun way to get from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon.

The Star Ferry - an Institution. Anybody who visits Hong Kong must go on the Star Ferry at least once. There are great views from the ferry of both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon and you also get to see some of the harbour traffic up close. It's cheap - the upper deck is HKD3 at the weekend and cheaper during the week and the lower deck is cheaper than the upper deck. The ferries are frequent (roughly one every ten minutes) and probably take about ten minutes to get across the water - great fun. And there ar ethings to do at the jetties too.

Boring ..... Well, for few minutes we were excited to see the skyline building from the ferry..... The kowloon side and hong kong island side from the ferry is nice.but the ride in the ferry took around 1 hours, just to see the symphony of lights... which I think is not worth waiting 1 hours in the ferry
hong kong must. the star ferry is a blast. cheap, great views but the trip is so short
It is Hong Kong. If you haven't been on the Star Ferry, you haven't been to Hong Kong.It's that simple!
Take the boat!. You have to do this one time for the best view at the skyline of Hong Kong.

A must do. Going down to Star Ferry Pier and taking the trip across the harbour on the Star Ferry is a must do in Hong Kong. Getting on and off the ferry is an experience in self with the crew judging when the swell is at the right height for you to get off. Its so cheap and gives great views of the harbour

It is a pier... so??..... The pier is so-so.
What a visitor should do is to ride the ferry to Kowloon. The view is great.... plus the 'smell' of the Victoria Harbour....

still a great way to go from hong kong island to kowloon. I still enjoy the star ferry even if its a little bit slower than the mtr. You can enjoy the skyline and enjoy the breeze that comes with it. and very cheap.

Complete your Hong Kong experience. We took a trip across the Harbour to Kowloon to view the Symphony of Lights on the Star Ferry. You can pay by Octopus card, a token (obtainable from a machine which gives change) or in exact change. Cost is HKD$2.50. Service is very regular too.
Complete your Hong Kong experience by taking a trip.
Short trip across the harbour and back. Easy and paid with using the octopus card. Quick journey across the harbour and back. Tickets where easy to buy

No trip is complete without a ride on the ferry. Jump on the ferry from the Kowloon side at 8 pm to catch the buildings light up. Free spectacle, totally worth it, and a fun, quick ferry ride to the Hong Kong side. We took the ferry 4 times...it is cheap and beautiful to see both harbors at night. Get a window seat.
Lovely trip. We did a trip across the harbour to visit the Peak. A must do in HK
Great Star Ferry. Lovely old fashion Service use your Octopuss Card on Ferry
A true icon.... A visit to HK wouldn't be complete without a trip on the iconic star ferry. Taking just 8 minutes to to cross the harbor and costing less than $0.30, a truly unique experience.
Must do. You've just got to cross the harbour on the Star Ferry. So cheap and a great view of both sides of the city and the harbour traffic.
FERRY CRUISE. Enjoyed the star ferry cruise, very relaxing and ferry was very luxurious compared to other ferries we have been on

Good value. Taking the Star Ferry is a cheap and entertaining way to get from TST to Central.
Even without the Octopus card, tickets are easy to buy from the machines. It was a pleasant 8 minute ride and an experience not to be missed when in Hong Kong.
must do. It is a must do when you are in HK. take a trip from Central / Wan chai to tst!
Authentic Hong Kong. It is as cheap as it gets and still one of my favorite things to do in Hong Kong. It is a relaxing trip across the harbor and provides some great photo opp's!
a trip back in time.. Travel like the locals all around Hong Kong harbor, the boats are very old and you really get a feeling of being a Hong Konger traveling on he Star Ferry. And it's dirt cheap.

Good way to see Hong Kong. Even I live in Hong Kong, I enjoy a lot by taking ferry from Central to Tsimshatshui as it's so relaxed. If you're tourists, it's highly recommended to try it. You will see how nice is the Victoria Harbour especially at night.
Here you join in. The start or finish point of that cross harbour experience - Star Ferry. You must do it when in HK.

A must do in HK. Functional, practical and a staple in Hong Kong.
Great way to see locals and get a great view of the skyline, day or night.
Star Ferry Pier. Nothing special in paricular but recommend you to take a ride on the ferry at night and enjoy the breeze and the night scene.
A Part of History. Before the MTR this was the main way people got to and from the mainland. It's worth at least one trip across to experience what it was like before all our technology.

Cheap & Cheerful.. Plod slowly across Kowloon and HK island on the iconic Star Ferry.
Top deck is with A/C. Amazing way to see the Harbour.

Great Experience. My wife and I took the Star ferry from central pier a couple times and I must say what a nice experience if your in Hong Kong its a thing you must do. Its just a short trip to Kowloon but very nice
Must try!. Very touristy, but nice to go to the star ferry pier and try out every Hong Konger's standard mode of transport. It's fast and a good way to take in the city sights!

Experience a piece of history. A ride from Hong Kong island to Kowloon or vice versa aboard the Star Ferry is a must!
I prefer riding on the lower deck as I feel it's more carefree and fun than the upper deck.
Memorable experience. Got the chance to ride the ferry both during the day and at night. Took just a few minutes from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island.
Good Experience. It's a short 5 minutes ferry ride from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central. I enjoy the view of Hong Kong very much. It's cheap too. Just use the Octopus card. Very convenient.

A must. A great way to see the harbour at a minimal cost. Very affordable, and reliable. Make sure you travel both during the day and night to see the harbour in action during the day and the lights on at night. Wonderful
What a deal. For the price, the best views and best people watching.
wonderful. very well organised and cheap to travel, great fun
Have a ferry ride across the harbour.. Always worth a ferry ride between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Visit coffee bar at YMCA in Kowloon.
Best way to see HK!. What can I say - the cheapest and best way to enjoy the sights of HK!
Best way to get around. Loved the hustle & bustle of the ferry, those with impaired walking should sit on the top deck .
a must do. cheap, convenient, good service. The late night view and calm environment was enchanting. A must experience in HK
star ferry. Just really part of the everyday transport infrastructure. Ferry is good fun though & cheap

Interesting Journey. Brilliant trip across the harbour. Very interesting to see the boat people who never step on land, they live totally on their boats, while we were there we saw a medical boat visiting as this is the only way they can get medical treatment. You buy your ticket & wait for the next available boat - very smooth crossing & excellent views of the building which we'd seen the night before all lit up. Great time ;-)
Excellent for getting around the Hong Kong area. The ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong is free for those of us who are over 65

Budget travel providing fabulous views. Even if you only take this ferry once, you will be rewarded with fabulous views for a very cheap price - we used our Oyster card and i think it was only about 3HKD. Take the upstairs of the ferry to give yourself better views, and it is cooler up there in summer.

Quick Ferry with a great view.. We took the ferry as part of the double decker big bus tour...(another must do) and had a great time. This is an excellent way to see the harbor and is really quite cheap.

Great way to travel. Cheap and efficient travel. Just put money in machine and you get a token which you put in the barrier. Downstairs is cheaper then upstairs on the ferry. If you are a senior citizen you can press the senior button and it is even cheaper.! So many people use it that the cost is minimal
Cheap and cheerful. Star Ferry Pier in TST has the best view of HK island and close proximity of the large shopping centre (Ocean Terminal)
Trip is too short. Because of all the land reclamation, the travel time is too short to enjoy the sights... plus it's a long walk from the pier to IFC when you get to the HK island side from kowloon.

Unmissable a great short trip across the harbor. Its one of those journeys all visitors to Hong Kong should take from Hong Kong Island acoss to Kowloon on the manic busy Victoria Harbour. I always enjoy taking it day or night and you get to see HK in all her glory.

Best Value for Your Tourist Buck. This truly is the best value for money in the world. For first class with the option of air conditioning on the upper deck, you pay HK$ 2.50 for a one way trip. Second class, lower deck, is 50cents cheaper (but sometimes has fuel smells). Weekend fares are slightly more. For fares, and a useful map visit the Star Ferry Website: http://www.starferry.com.hk/services.html.Though it is always an enjoyable trip, I think you get the most from the experience by travelling at night from the Kowloon side to Hong Kong Island (Central). That way you see the lights of the business district and may be lucky enough to see the laser light show.You should also be aware that the seats are reverse-able so just adjust them so that you are facing in the direction you are heading.

Low cost way to Hong Kong island. The Star Ferry is a great way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Token machines are on the concourse to the ferry. Follow the directions on the machine...which drops the token and the change into the same tray for access to the waiting area.
Of Course!. Of course you're going to take the ferry across the harbor. It's quick, easy to use, and gives you a great view of the city. Do not miss the chance to take this pleasant ride.
a must do in hong kong. before the mobile phones, a star ferry trip was the only quiet part of your journey fom hong kong island to kowloon or vv.
Disappointment!. There was nothing special about it; you are in the boat and surrounded by skyscrapers.

Cheap travel.. The cheapest way to travel between Kowloon and HK! Go to the upper deck for a good view. Fare is low and the frequency is good. Could not think of a better travel option. Can be crowded in the mornings and evenings but good way to quickly move around .
best way for a cheap view of hk. seriously, i think taking the star ferry is the best way to view the buildings lining the coast... but beware, the harbour stinks though!
Was OK. If on your first trip to Hong Kong then it is just one of those things you can tick off from you list.
A 'must do' while I'm Hong Kong!. The Star Ferry is a must. Very inexpensive way to see the Harbour and visit the island. Stayed in Kowloon and even on a foggy, overcast day it was a treat.

Star Ferry, ther bargain way to see the harbour.. Well, the pier is necessary to board the Star Ferries! They are cheap and the best way to cross between HK Island and Kowloon. Good views of both waterfronts and the skyline. The ferries themselves have a certain historic charm.
this is a must do item...the ride excellent. great view of the city, and most impressive at night...the lights are amazing. drops off at a central part of Kowloon...easy to access from the MTR

Home of the Star Ferry!. You have to love it because it's where you board and alight the iconic Star Ferry! A simply "must do" when in HK!! However, I MUCH preferred the old Star Ferry Pier, once located in front of City Hall and sadly no longer standing, having made way for yet more reclamation of Victoria Harbour! The new Central Star Ferry Pier is such a long walk from Central, especially if you are not very able-bodied, as we noticed with our father having real trouble with the distance this visit. Where once, due not only its appeal (and price) but also to its location, you would use the Star Ferry as a legitate means of getting across the harbour whilst going about your everyday business, now unfortunately it seems to have been solely relogated to a tourist attaction that needs a special effort to reach. I still love it, but the new ferry terminal is a real shame!

A must in Hong Kong. You MUST go across the harbour on the Star Ferry when you stay in Hong Kong, it is part of the history and due top the increase in tunnels and other ways of getting between land and island, this mode of transport may diminish in the future.

A nice break from the MTR. Whenever i need to go from TST to Central, i hop on The Star Ferry and cross the harbour to the Star Ferry Pier. Its a short refreshing ride across the harbour that should not be missed when in Hong Kong.
Must do. It's not the fastest way across but the view and energy of the transit have to be experienced. Don't miss it. Once in the day and once at night were perfect for me.

The best value trip in HK. These little ferries are a great way to see the city and offer a good way of getting to and from Kowloon - especially if you want to see the art gallery or walk the avenue of stars to see the laser show
why not?. Along with Victoria Peak, it is a must do in HK. Enjoyable trip from Kowloon to HK and back.
Amazing Views. Very inexpensive. Stunning panoramic views. Should be a must for every leisure traveller to Hong Kong
travel first class on the ferry. travel first class on this very old ferry means, you take the second deck. Its a nice short trip to Victoria with a lot of impressions
Inexpensive transport from Kowloon to HK. More scenic than using metro. Cheap. Easy esp using octopus card. No struggling for the cash. Beautiful views if taken at night.
Easy to use. Ferry is brilliant for a trip around the harbour. 60 dollar for opulent to have one hour trip

Cheapest ferry in the World??. The ferry pier was moved to it's present location a few years ago. Quite a walk from Central, but overhead walkways make this easier. You can buy your ticket in a machine, by Octopus card, or from a kiosk if you have no change. A single crossing will cost you about 23pence, or is free if you are a senior citizen. You never wait more than a few minutes for a ferry and watching them come in and dock is a unique experience in itself.
Great views of the harbour at night. What a great way to see the harbour. Take it at night to see the lightshow of all the buildings at 8pm each evening.

Beautiful night view of Victoria Harbour. Less than USD0.5, you can enjoy the invaluable night view of Victoria Harbour. Take the ferry between the piers at Tsim Sha Tsui and Central. Go to the upper floor of the pier if you don't prefer the machinery smell. Each ride is less than 15 mins. There is also a laser light show at two sides of the harbour at 8pm Saturday night.
must do. love HK. the energy and the fast pace.. Dont like the taxi..and the pollution
Dont miss it. go down stairs save 50p and it is nicer - although upstaris view is better
Very nice. Inside the star ferry you can breath fresh air and relax. Very cheap
Catch a star. The ferry rides in and around Victoria Harbour are fabulous and so cheap - it's a must do on a Hong Kong trip - we stayed in Kowloon and visited HK Is. many times.

you catch the most fantastic views here!!!. I like taking the Star Ferry. There is so much you can see when you reach the pier. First, you get a fantastic view of Hongkong Island or Kowloon Island whichever side you're on. On the Hongkong side,There is an organic market of fresh vegetables and fresh herbs, bakery, hot dog kiosk. There is an elevator for those who hate taking the stairs. The Central Station which houses the Landmark, premiere shopping place and the IFC mall is only 100 meters or less away.
Great sightseeing opportunity. Where else can you get a view and experience of HK like this for pennies

Amazing ride. The efficient, effective way to have a glance of the Victoria Harbour no matter in day or night time. Stunning view with the feel of modern citizen mixed with bristish colonial style environment.

Ferry Trip. Nice enough Ferry, good way to kill an hour or two if you are just there for a night, it's pretty comfortable, not like a foot ferry, it's nicer than that, more like a vintage ferry! Great views of the harbour and not too expensive!
Star Ferry. It was just like my last trip there, 40 years ago. Nice to have somethings stay the same.
Great price and easy to use. The service is regular and at $25HKD across to Hong Kong Island, it's a great way to travel
Just a Pier. The boat ride however is well worth it very cheap and stunning views, also the star ferry is iconic

A Definite Must Do In Hong Kong. We used the star ferry to travel across the harbour to the Exhibition Centre. There is simply no comparison to this experience. The harbour is spectacular, the ride is quite quick and best of all it cost $2.5 HK It is worth catching at least one ferry while you are in Hong Kong as it is such a unique and inexpensive experience!
Easy. Once you work out where you are going buy a token and get on the ferry , they are very frequent
cheap and beautiful view. the fare is cheap and you can enjoy the beautiful view of Victoria Harbour during the ferry.
Star Ferry. Easy to get back and forth on Star Ferry from HK to Kowloon. Easy to take the Hydrofoil to Macau, Taipa and Cononae.
Simply enjoy the pier and the ride.. Just like the entire setup and feeling of the pier and the ride in the ferry. Something that may not be there for too long. Enjoy it while we can.

Great Scenic Ride for a Pittance. Came from Tism for dinner at Peking Garden (excellent restaurant by the way), we needed to get back to Park Lane Hotel in Causway bay. Rode the star ferry to Wan Chai, found that we had a pleasantly surprising romantic, late night, economical ride crossing Victoria Harbor . Great scenic ride for a pittance. Not to be missed when you come to Hong Kong, no matter how many times we visit. Take the evening trip, it's breath taking

Don't miss this!. Your trip to Hongkong would not be complete without travelling on the Star Ferry at least once. They leave every few minutes and for a few cents take you on a short ride between Kowloon and HongKong Island. They are an integral part of Hongkong life. Have small change handy to speed things up.
Best way to cross the harbour, cheaper than a harbour tour and just as good!. The price to cross the harbour is about 20p, this is the best way to cross from Hong Kong to Kowloon

Cheap quick and fun way of crossing the harbour. You cant go here and not take a trip across the harbour in the iconic ferry. If you use the lower deck it costs approx. 17p per adult and the view is brilliant. It take about 5-10 minutes.

Must for Any Trip to HK. The Star Ferry is incredibly cheap, gives a great view of Hong Kong, and is actually faster than using the tunnel in many instances. Beside, it is a great Hong Kong experience. I used it about a dozen times during my visit.
Cheap but unique. Rode for only 2.5 Hong Kong dollars, so can't really complain at all. Quite a nice ride.
Essential part of Hong Kong. You can't visit Hong Kong and not ride the Star Ferry, for the price, you get a great view of the wonderfull harbour, day or night
Must experience the short ride between TST and HK Central. The boats are so old ,black smoke all around, so many interesting characters and always a good energy crossing the channel ....

An easy Top 5 attraction in Hong Kong, commute Victoria Harbor on loose pocket change. We still love to take the Star Ferry between TST (Kowloon) and Central (HK Island). This is easily one of the best HK$2.50 (US$0.32) per adult, HK$1.50 (US$0.19) per child that you will ever spend. Where else can you cross one of the world's finest harbors, admiring one of the world's finest skylines for the price of loose pocket change? Another option, that many don't seem to know about, is the evening harbor cruise and the hop-on/hop-off afternoon services available with Star Ferry. The boats allocated for these services leave every hour from the three major piers; including Wan Chai (HK Island) and make a slow circular route around Victoria Harbor, allowing much more time on the water to admire the wonderful harbor and skyline. Costs for this service vary between HK$90-190 based on which service you book. You can sort this out at the harbor cruise ticket booths at each of the three ferry piers. We love the historical and iconic Star Ferry. The fact that it still serves such an important purpose to local commuters and is so easily accessible to visitors wishing to experience a bit of the world famous Hong Kong Start Ferry, makes this a real source of pride for Hong Kong.The Star Ferry is a 'no-brainer' inclusion for visitors considering what to do/see when visiting Hong Kong. Even as locals, we love this attraction and visit it often.

We enjoyed our cruise. My husband & I did a night cruise on December 31st. We were blown away by the selection of the food, the service and to see how popular it was. We would definitely recommend it.

Get on the boat..!. Get yourself to the very tip of Kowloon at the TST, Star Ferry Pier... Don't just stop there... Get on the boat..! It is one of the best and cheapest (2.5 HKD) experiences in HK... From there you can go to Central or Wan Chai... If you need to go to Hong Kong Island this is the way to do it in traditional style and with one of the best views of the harbor... Be sure to do it both day and night..!
one of HK's best experiences. ok, so I'm a Hong Konger but I will NEVER get sick of travelling on this. Go second-class, to really enjoy the whole experience.
Floating history. The hustle and you just merge in, no concessions to tourists.

Cheap, interesting and reliable. There are other, faster ways to travel between Kowloon and Hong Kong island across the harbour but none that is cheaper or more interesting. This is definitely a "must do" when visiting Hong Kong, even if, like us, you're only in the city for a 24 hour stop-over.
A MUST in HK!. I have riddend the ferry perhaps 100 times for more over the years. Every time it still is fun. TRY IT!!

Enjoy the ride!. the star ferry ride is such a great way to get a view of the city's landscape and of course, a rather cheap way as well... I am just surprised to see people still using the star ferry as a form of transport even though there are the train systems set in place... prolly due to the price.Overall, a very good ride for the money (with all good intent) but just note that it might be a little chilly during winter seasons
Best Value in hong kong. You cant go there and not take a trip in the iconic ferry across the bay, it costs pennies and the view is brilliant
Long Live the Star Ferry. Cheap transport across to Tsim Sha Tsui or Hong Kong Island whichever side you are on. Great views of the harbor especially at night.

star ferry is the one thing that remains unchanged over my 30 years visiting HK. the ferry tokens have changed from metal to plastic, they rerouted the pier so it is no longer as Central and involves lots of walking but it is still refreshing that the ferry offers a respite from the throngs, and some fresh air.
Fun way to cross the harbour. The historical Star Ferry ride only takes a few minutes, but there's not really a better way to cross the harbour. Keep your camera handy!
nice experience. i enjoyed the 10 min back and forth ride..i like it..
A must do while in HK. I loved the night time views of the HK island - really spectacular. Make sure you sit on the right side of the boat. The ferries go regularly and you can pay by octopus. Enjoy.

Down to a hop, skip and a jump.. Can't even stand going there since they destroyed the historical value by moving it 10 minutes walk toward Kowloon--and contemplating how business interests have destroyed that beautiful harbour. It has been rendered a middling river.
Short ride. Rode the Tsim Sha Tsui to Central and is very short...maybe 10 mins at best...if you want a longer ride I would take the one to Wan Chai
Cheap and pleasant trip to hong kong. A short cruise to hong kong with great view Of hk skyline. This is a good way to go to hong kong from kowloon, more pleasant than the mtr!

Great, cheap view of the Hong Kong skyline. Visit the Star Ferry and cross the Harbour while you can - rumours are that the service is financially troubled, having to compete with the MTR and the road tunnels to Kowloon from the island. But they don't afford the wonderful views of the Hong Kong skyline that you can get from the Star Ferry. And they can't compete with its cost either - along with the trams, this must be the cheapest mode of transport in Hong Kong.

Seating is reserved and assigned at gate. You can reserve your seats but make sure you watch how the seats are assigned when presenting your boarding passes. Otherwise you may be separated or end up in the middle seating.
Good fun. It's great to travel across on the ferry for a few pence. At night you get a wonderful view of the harbour lights.

Hop in for a romantic ride!. For only $2, you get to cruise Victoria Harbour and get a very nice view of the skylines both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. One of the most romantic things we've done ever! :)
tried and true. delightfully nostalgic and beautiful views both ways during the lighting (of the buildings) at night
Spectacular scene. Great way to see the skyline & ideal for travelling Hong Kong Island -Kowloon

One of the best way to see Hong Kong. Ferry runs from Central to Kowloon every day every 5-10 mins.
Its a great way to see Hong Kong.
Free Ride. As a senior citizens, my wife and I enjoyed the endless free trips.

Iconic trip across the Victoria Harbor. This was a highlight of our free time in Hong Kong. We took the ferry both ways across Victoria Harbor. On our trip out we found a man selling bookmarks with individual names in Chinese. I bought some for many friends. upon our arrival to the opposite side we found a wonderful store selling museum quality items. Even though most were out of our price range, it was a great place to just look. The trip was inexpensive and easy to get to and use. The boat was not full and the water just gorgeous.
Really well worth it!!. Really worth the money for awesome views of the city!!!
Star Ferry---a fun time. The Star Ferry is a simple inexpensive way to travel across the harbor. I had no idea how beautiful the Hong Kong skyline is! It makes Chicago looks small.

Cheapest sightseeing by Ferry. View is terrific and the experience is unforgettable. The star ferry has been around for ages and is very iconic of hong kong. A cheap way to sightsee by ferry. I took the ferry from Tim sha tsui to central and had an enjoyable time taking photos on board the ferry and at the pier with my friends. I also took a nice stroll to the star ferry terminal at night and the view is simply stunning and magical. Luv it!

a ride worth taking. If you visit HK, a ride on the Star Ferry is a must. It is real local culture, plus it is the fastest way to get to Kowloon from Hong Kong Island except the MTR, which is fast but not scenic. Go at night, if you can. The harbor is one of the most beautiful in the world, and the colorful, lighted buildings are spectacular -- and make sure to take your camera.
The soul of HK. A must for all visitors to HK. A fun way to commute between HK island and Kowloon, enjoyable during day and night.
A must do. One of Nation Geographic's top 50 sights. No trip to Hong Kong is complete without a Star Ferry trip across the harbour

A Hong Kong institution. Bit run down on the Kowloon side, old fashioned but everything works and no visit to the harbour is complete without a tip on the Star Ferry. Lots of construction work going on, by the Hong Kong island pier but doesn't stop the ferries!

I miss the old place. I am one of those boring people who reminisce about the old days but ..... though the new ferry piers are undoubtedly cleaner, smarter, more efficient ..... I used to like the grotty i little shops ..... Still ridng the Star Ferry is a Must-do ....
busy place. Interesting, buzzing with people. well sign posted, easy to access the ferries.
Must ride!. This is one way to get across the harbour, nice, easy & fast. Need not go for the expensive river cruise, just take the normal ones and sit by the window.
It's a ferry pier!. It's the views from the ferry when you are crossing that make the trip worthwhile.
Easy to Use & Cheap. I have never used a mode of transport that leaves so bang on time, cheap and efficient!!
A must. A must. You have not really been to HK if you have not tried it. Great sites at night!
Inexpensive, easy. The Star Ferry is an inexpensive way to travel, with great city views. It is very easy to figure out.

A Cheap Way to See the Victoria Harbour. I took the MTR underground train from my hotel in North Point to Wan Chai ferry pier and crossed the Victoria Harbour to Tsimshatsui by Star Ferry. It is always something I want to do whenever I return to the city I was born and grew up in. You can use the Octopus card on the ferry too, not just on MTR, tram, and double decker buses. It is a relaxing short ride, a must to do in Hong Kong.

Hope This HK Icon Never Vanishes. My husband jokes that if they keep filling in Victoria Harbor, we'll be able to walk across the Harbor. The Harbor has been filled in a lot, especially since the late 90s.The not funny thought about the Harbor and Star Ferry is that as the Metro lines have been added and extended, locals are using it less...and that it could one day be ruled obsolete and taken out of service. This is a sad, sad thought.My absolute favorite way to get around in HK is Star Ferry. Usually I prefer the upper deck for the better views. But the lower deck gives you more of the sounds and smells that make the Ferry go back and back, back and forth, all day long.The Tsim Sha Tsui side still gives you the original Star Ferry feeling - the older pier with its rusting metal painting over and over again with that green, green paint.The Central side is more modern, and hints of the ferry's demise.Best enjoyed at night.I hope Star Ferry is still putting through the Harbor the next time we are in Hong Kong!
Value for money!. A great way to get from Wan Chai to Kowloon. It is very cheap and simple method to pay. the trip is very short. make you have your camera with you.
A must do whilst in Hong Kong. Short trip but worth going over to Hong Kong if you are staying in Kowloon

Only way to cross the harbour. At $2.50 HKD what a bargain! Lonely planet has one thing right when it says it is the world's best value cruise. I wish I'd known earlier that there was a New Year's eve cruise and I would have prebooked this for New Year's eve. Would have been wonderful to do....

A nice ride. Although a short one, the ride from Tsim Sha Tsui to Hong Kong Island is worth it. It costs only 2.5 HKD, the ferry runs very often, and you can use the Octopus card. It does also offer a nice river view. Other than this, it's just a really short boat ride.
Nice and cheap experience. Love that you can have an excellent view and ferry boat ride only for HKD2 per person.

Top of the list for all Hong Kong visitors. Get to the front of the line, and then get on the right side of the boat from HK to Kowloon, or the left side for Kowloon to HK. The seat backs swing front to back. Quick and cheap way to cross the harbor. Use the Octopus Card so you don't have to buy a Token.

A "must do" attraction in Hong Kong. A ride on the Star Ferry from Central to Kowloon isamust do.It costs almost nothing for the <10minute experience and lets you walk along theharbvor front and takepictures of the Central skyline.

Not your postcard sampan but just as fun.. This is still the best way to cross the harbor even after the cross-harbor tunnel was built. We enjoyed the short ride which enabled us to experience one of the best ways to view the famous HK harbour. The boat is packed especially during rush hours so plan your ride around it. We took this to reach Kowloon and rode a cab back to our hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui from Victoria Peak tram.
Great way to get around!. Cheap and worth it! You get a great view of the skyline. We took it twice, once during the day and once at night.
Nice if pricey egg tarts ( TST side). Nice fresh out of the oven egg tarts at the TST star ferry pier. A bit pricey at HK$5 each, but they are very yummy, and much cheaper than in Australia.
Nostalgic Ride. Good, fast ride across the harbor, and very cheap, but alas the Chinese junks are no more so the scenery isn't what it used to be.

An essential part of any HK trip!. Going to the Star Ferry peir at either Kowloon or Hong Kong island is an essential part of any trip to Hong Kong. It is a quick and very cheep way of crossing to the other side, and is used heavily. The ferry is quite dated (peir's and ships), but is non the less quite an experience that you will remember for your trip.
Fantastic service. Make sure to take the Star Ferry, it is a great way to see the City and skyline, smell the sea and hear the sounds of Hongkong.
Loved it!. We enjoyed crossing the harbour in the ferry, we loved the scene :)
Great way to cross the harbour. Fast, cheerful and cheap. Recommend upper deck, unless you like the smell of diesel engine.
must do!. short and fun great for photos...go 1st class! fast efficient
Nostalgic. Nothing has changed since the last time I rode the ferry in 1987. One of the best ways to view the cities.

Has to be on everyone's HK top 10 list to do.. Just a brilliant way to experience HK Harbour. Take the ferry HK side or vice a versa and get yourself a seat on the side to experience the sights, sounds and smells of one of the most exciting harbours in the world.
It's a pier. Although it is now a long way, and a longer walk, from its original position, it is still just a boat stop.

The Star Ferry: history, relaxation, joy!. I love the Star Ferry. The ferries are charming, the ride is lovely, and the (often grumpy) guys in their 'star' sailor outfits who tie the ferries up at the piers just add to the atmosphere.The Piers themselves are a bit old and tatty, in a charming way. The price is almost non-existent (actually, it's free for the over 65s). Use an Octopus card or buy a Star Ferry token from the vending machines to travel. Timetable and prices here: http://www.starferry.com.hk/services.htmlCatch it from Tsim Sha Tsui (Kowloon side) to Central or Wan Chai (both on the HK Island side), or vice versa. It really is a case of "sit back, relax, and enjoy the ride". It's fun to people-watch. It's fun to watch the other boats on the harbour, and it's fun to see the work going on around the harbour. The views are wonderful, and you feel like you're part of history -- which you are, as the Star ferries have been working HK Harbour for over 100 years. A ride on the Star Ferry is something that every visitor to HK should enjoy!
Nice and Fun. a boat ride... a boat ride....and old boat. you can see the view from there. just nice. it's only cost you 2.4$ or 3$ on weekend and holiday.
Best Deal in HK. It is hard to tell how this operation makes any money? Best value in HK, plus the sight of both Kowloon and Causeway Bay/Central are incredible, especially at night!

Nothing really attractive. Star Ferry Pier is the hub to the outer islands and from Tsim Sa Tsui and Central. For HKD 19.00 you can land on Lamma island or the others. Refrain from using the toilets if you can since this is really the bad face of the pier. Otherwise I really enjoyed the place which is linked to IFC centre
a great way to travel.... The Star Ferry is a must if you are in Hong Kong. It is really cheap, quick and the view from Kowloon to HK island is amazing so make sure you have your camera.

Fascinating. Having in even a short ride between Kowloon and Hong Kong is something all visitors should do. If you have time walk around the first floor of the terminal building on the Hong Kong side as they have models of past ferries and some details of the development of Hong Kong and the Star company.

Great Value and a little bit of history. We used the Ferry to go back and forth between Hong KOng and Kowloon. IT is currently $2.5 HK dollars. We used the Ferry at night for the Lazer show. A pleasent evening
Good fun. So much easier to take the tube but this will give you such an amazing view of the harbour for so little. Well worth paying the few pence extra for the first class upper deck.
Cheap. Great experience. From Kowloon to Hong Kong Island (Wanchai & Central). Ferry depart every 15mins. Good value. Only HKD2.5 (weekday) HKD3 (weedend).
Nice and effective. Nice for a quick ride. You get to shoot some pretty awesome pics and you don't have to pay much.
Good fun. Went both ways Kowloon to HK Island return cheap and a great photo opportunity,

Cheap transport across the harbour.. We liked using the ferry to travel from Tsim Sha Tsim to Central as it was refreshing and offered more scenery than travelling on the subway. It was cheap and we were able to use our Octopus tickets. At the times we travelled we did not find it crowded.

Average.. We travelled on an evening. I had hoped it was cleaner. It wasn't dirty, but neither was it spotless, either. I wouldn't have been bothered much, but the smell of the gas fumes was overpowering. Still, it was an enjoyable ride, and if you are not bothered by those I mentioned, you could easily ignore them and just concentrate on the passing scenery. I wish they improve their piers, though.

Functional and worth seeing once. Mostly a way to see the harbor and get from one side to the other. Quick,economical, efficient. I guess I was expecting more but it was ok. One interesting dynamic at night, the boat moves just fast enough that my nite photos came out blurry, so not a great way to get harbor shots, there may be a tour which goes slower or stops, this was just the straight shot across the harbor.

Part of old Hong Kong. If you visit you should try and make a trip on the Star Ferry still running after a hundred years Well organised with a gate for boarding and a gate for exit controls any crush that could occurThis is a good chance to take those photographs of the Peak and have a look at Kowloon
Quick and efficient dispatch of Ferries. The speed and efficiency with which the 8 minute ferry crossings are turned around is quite staggering.

So easy and scenic. What a bargain for HK2.50 (kids HK1.25, seniors free)! The ferries arrive quickly, load quickly, and sail quickly. The ride was beautiful and a great way to see the harbour. For visitors, it's a much more interesting way to cross the harbour than the MTR. The piers are conveniently located in Tsim Sha Tsui, Central and Wanchai.
Worthwhile visit. For almost HKD$2 we took the ferry across the Harbour. Quite ride, but wonderful views and worthwhile exercise. Highly recommended.
Hong Kong Side Inconvenient. Since they moved to the Hong Kong side pier and filled it more of the harbor the ferry has lost some of its convenience and lustre.

Interesting but sort of crazy. We ended up here because we wanted to see Macau. The station was a bit hectic and it was difficult to figure out where we needed to go. We finally paid one of the ticket seller people who led us to the correct line. Unfortunately, the ferry got delayed by 2 hours and we opted out until the next day. Despite the confusion, and while we did not necessarily enjoy the ferry, we were happy to have gone to Macau. It was lovely. Also, the views of the harbour from the ferry were amazing.

Senior Citizens Ride Free. For those 65 and older, you can ride the Star Ferry for free! You show your Senior Citizen Octopus Card and walk through to the side without going through the turnstiles. We loved riding the quick and easy transportation system to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island and back again. Just follow the signs to board the ferry. Also, there are many shops on the pier including a 7-eleven. The ferry is crowded during rush hour and other peak times but not crowded during the day.

Excellent out of beaten path in the middle of city. I think this is still out of beaten path, since I did not see a lot of foreigner using this ferry. Very cheap, just use your octopus card. Note: Be sure to visit the ferry model souvenir show in the TST side, we missed it last time and couldn't find it in hong kong side
Simply Wonderful.. Quick, frequent, convenient and ridiculously cheap with views to take your breath away night or day - what's not to like?So top up your Octopus card and away you go!
Must do. Great views do the city and very cheap. You can pay for your trip with your octopus card.
Lovely boat ride. The view of both Hong Kong harbor and Kowloon are amazing. It's cheap. There is a high frequency of boats arriving, so you don't have to wait too long for the next one to arrive.
Ferry Travel. Easy to work out which ferry to catch, very clean and a great way to see the harbour.
Great way to travel. Wow if uk public transport could be as efficient and so cheap and clean. Found the whole place to be clean and free from litter.

Still Memorable. Even for an ex-Hong Kong Chinese it is still a must every time I visit. How childhood memory makes way for development and prosperity. The waterfront is always beautiful, and travelling Star Ferry separates the genuine sight-seers from the ever-rushing tourists. However, do not limit oneself to the usual Tsim Sha Tsui - Central route. For me the Tsim Sha Tsui - Wanchai route takes longer AND takes on better scenery of both Hong Kong and Kowloon waterfonts. The Wanchai route beats the Central route hands down both day and night!
Great sway to travel.. Cheap and easy way to get around and see the haber.
a must do in Hong Kong. A nice experience and a must do.Nice view on HK Island and Kowloon during the ride. It is a cheap and nice way of transportation.
All aboard!. Very nice pier with a lot of history about it & the Star Ferry is an excellent operator for boat trips.

Fast, Convenient, and Cheap. Can't beat this deal. Not only is the Star Ferry system great for views of Hong Kong, but it's very convenient. I needed to use it a number of times for practical reasons, and it's superb. No-nonsense and useful.

Be as busy as you want at this location!. I took it slow and just looked at the Harbour and piers, not shopping. But even with this little activity, it should not be missed as the beginning of your ferry ride from Kowloon to Hong Kong over the water, rather than under the water by subway.
You have to do this. All visitors should take the ferry, during the day and in the evening. It is not expensive and is such an experience.

Must try at least once!. We took star ferry from Kowloon to HK island around noon time after we have strolled along the avenue of stars.
Pier is easily accessible and the harbour view is very magnificent.
Kids enjoyed the ferry ride very much.

Visit Kwalloon the other Hong Kong. The ferry ride is an experience that is the best bargain in town. The Kwalloon side is charming and allow you the time to visit the other side of HK. Wander through the street there and take in the sites and smells of a great part of the city. The Pier offers close proximity to great local restaurants and bars. I found this area to be the most vibrant and real part of the city.
sf. A must on any visit, collect the names of the different ferrys.

So much history, a Hong Kong institution. This is a MUST DO. Yes the subway is super efficient, air-conditioned and makes crossing the harbour so quick and easy. BUT the Star Ferry is such a classic way of going from one side to the other & you can click away at the city skyline as the ferry slowly makes its way so regally across the waters. It is an old world experience in such a fast paced city. Good for young as well as old. Cheap as ..... well very cheap and pensioners even get a discount!!
Best trip in HKG!. For 20p you get to take the most iconic journey in Pacific Asia !!

The ferry is an instiution and super cheap. Taking the star ferry across the bay is super convenient as the ferries run every few mins and the journey only takes about 5 minutes. Also it's inceadibly cheap. Plus if you do it at night you get a lovely view of the harbour for free as part of your trip. I would recommend you get an octopus card so that you can just swipe in and out (like the oyster card in the uk).

Cheap and nice way to go from Kowloon to HK Island vice versa. Good and nice way to pass from one side to the other side of HK between HK Island and Kowloon. Only 2.5HK$
Cheaper than the subway and I think more interesting for tourists !
O.K. If you have chance you can see the lazer lights, it was not as beautiful as the pictures of it. The food is O.K but the music was not that great
Cheap and good experience. It's quintessential hong kong... Great character and nice ride. Good way to see the skyline, even if for a short while. Quite clean.
Star ferry. Star ferry to Central is a quick and cheap way of getting around.Quick turnaround time,clean and neat
A classy way of traveling. One has not been to Hong Kong unless tried the Star Ferry between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island - a really nice and refreshing experience. Do not miss this!

Fast, Nostalgic, Cheap. The best way to cross over from HK Island to Kowloon or vice versa. The double decks ferries are a nostalgic leftover in the middle of modern days Hong Kong. On the Kowloon side the pier is next to the Avenue of Stars and the Clock Tower. Be there 19:50 to see the lightshow.
Best Harbour View Experience. The fare is cheap and the ferry ride was memorable. For tourists, take the upper deck to have the best view.
love the activity at the Star Ferry Pier. This is just a fun place to pass through on the way to the ferry. Lots of activity, especially on the Kowloon side.

Best 40 cent ride on earth. I have taken the Star Ferry countless times over the years for the breath-taking view of the prettiest skyline on earth. Only 3 HKD for a ride makes it the best 40 cents one could ever spend!
A must do in Hong Kong. Get the first class ticket, expereince the harbour, take in the atmosphere

Very clean and well kept. The Star ferry pier is lovely and clean, you walk around at night and not feel threatened. Wonderful views at night of Hong Kong island all lit up. The Star ferries are regular and they are really cheap way of getting across to Hong Kong Island where you can get buses to other places of interest. The boats also leave from near the star ferry terminal to go across to Lantau Island.
Nice. Top deck is quieter! The bottom deck is quite loud from the engine.
A nice day on the ferry. It is a cheap ride, where you can see beautiful views of the harbor and when you alight, you can get a cheap cab ride to the tram up to the top of Victoria Peak
The best travel deal in Hong Kong. Best way to cross between Hong Kong - Kowloon ....great views of the harbour and skyline
Priceless, a "Hong Kong" must do!. It just has the history and flavour of Hong Kong. It only csts about $.50 to $1.20 depending on your destination.
Another Must Do. Another must do, the famous Star Ferry, cheap at 2.50 HKD for the upper deck one-way.

Busy, Busy, Busy. The Star Ferry has to be one of the most efficient operations in the world. The ferries dock, unload, load up and are off again in a few minutes during most hours of the day and night. There's nothing fancy about the piers or the ferries, but they work superbly.

A nice ride with the locals. It's just a ride in a ferry used more often by locals than by tourists. But there is a reason why the locals don't go on a much faster train... The view, the fresh smell of the sea breeze... Dirt cheap, too!
Excellent value. Great value and a good place to just hang out...always something interesting happening around the terminals

The must-try when you are in Hong Kong. The Star Ferry is the ultimate representation of Hong Kong past and present. The ships are still those rickety shacks that I was familiar with. The ride from one side of the harbour to the other brought memories of all previous visits to Hong Kong. Some improvements are present though, such as using the multi-purpose Octopus card to pay for entry instead of fumbling for coins, better benches and good flooring. The ferry terminal at the TST side remains unchanged, but the one at Central has been replaced by a modern building.
Very Cheap. Great ride across the harbour, runs till about 1130pm. Nice to see at night. Pick up bus 15c once across the harbour to take you to Peak tram.

Relaxing ferry ride. We wanted to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city, and decided to hop on the cruise around Victoria Harbour. Tickets go on sale 30 mins before the next departure time. The pier itself was very old, a little run down, and for the life of me, I did not understand why they gathered us at one end of the pier, on the second floor, only to take us down to ground level and back up again. If you have elderly folks or kids in strollers, you might want to ask about that.Anyways, the cruise was quite relaxing, it wasn't crowded, nice way to spend an hour :) you could get a pass that lets you hop on and off the cruise.We took a 4 pm cruise, the 7 pm cruise includes a view of the lightshow at Avenue of The Stars and refreshments.Don't buy the hot chocolate on the boat..it was gross. On another day, we ended up on the passenger ferry after our cab driver ditched us at the pier at Central (?). That was also a nice experience as we've never had the opportunity to commute on a ferry before :) great view of the Xmas lights in the city.
One of the world's greatest simple experience!. There are few better experiences for 20p in the world. Aim to travel around 8pm and you can experience the harbour light show too.
What A Deal - Convenient And Pleasant Route From Hong Kong Island To Kowloon. I'm staying in Wan Chai so it was a breeze hopping over to Kowloon for just HK$3. Prompt, clean, and easy to use.
Old But Still Good. We have travelled to Hong Kong many times but we always use the Star Ferry its great just for the experience!
A must place to visit and a hub of activity.. The best way to cross the harbour and get to the other islands.
Wide and Clean. We live in Macau so we used the Ferry terminal all the time, i love it there being so organise and when they know it is busy they will open more counter.
Excellent, cheap, and often the fasted way to commute. The ferry is quick, cheap (2.50HK$), and often the quickest way to cross the Harbour, particulalry if you travel points are close to the piers.
take the ferrry to the hong kong side. Iconic ferry across the Victoria harbour no other place like it in the world !
Cheap and as basic as it gets. Great way to cross to the mainland but its basic.Its very cheap and very quick, busy at peak times.

Ideal form of travel. for very little money one can grab the Ferry, sit on the Upper Deck and cross over to Kowloon and on arrival try and convince all your Indian friends that have come to meet you, that NO you really, really don't want or need a Tailor, nor a fake watch and that your partner is really not up to the delights of that very special lady.The Ferry runs regularly in all weathers, is not only a quick and cheap way to get to Kowloon and the Ocean Terminal but also an ideal way to see the Hong Kong skyline for picture taking. The most difficult thing about it is working out how exactly the system of getting the gate entry disc works. Once fathomed one realises that the directions are in fact easily explained ... but a bit like "how does one put a Giraffe in the "Fridge".
Convenient. You can almost get to any outlaying island around HK from here & many places in HK island from the bus interchange just in front of the pier

Ferry service is fast, frequent and cheap. Star Ferry Pier is accesible for wheelchair users. The service is very frequent, fast and cheap. Only HKD2 for adult and HKD1.40 for wheelchair users. The service from Tim Tsar Tsui to Wan Chai or Central, Hong Kong Island.

Nothing special. The Star Ferry Pier was quaint, but nothing to write home about. It's old and it looks old, with coats of paint covering coats of paint. Directions to the ferry were very unclear unless you already knew where to go.
Nice Ride on the Ferry. Very convenient way to move around. Cheap. Comfortable seating with great views seeing Hong Kong from the water.

Cheap interesting travel. The Star Ferry was a great way to get from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon. They run very frequently and take just a few minutes to cross the harbour. You are able to get a nice view of the skyline and take a few pic's. The only downside was all the street sellers waiting to catch you as you disembark. At least they do accept no as an answer and move on.

See, Smell & Hear. Ferries run from all the piers and because of time constraints we only used the Star Ferry to Kowloon. The ferries are old, strong and smelly. They have 2 decks, wooden seating and are well used. The sights, smells and sounds were a fantastic experience. If you travel back after dusk, the City lights make the view unforgettable. Also, it's one of the cheapest experiences you can have in Hong Kong!
One of the best views of the world. Wonderful very cheap way to see the bustling Hong Kong harbor and the tremendous skyline
Fast and effective. Easy to handle, hard to get lost! Good value price :)
FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE A MUST FOR HONG KONG. Great views and is a part of Hong Kongs history....a must do

best and cheap travel. it is best to travel in star ferry rather than taxi cause it is much more cheap .....and this ferry has 2 views one is roof and one is under roof and it is very clean and i can say that you will enjoy this ferry at night because of the lights coming from the building city looks more beautiful

Very easy - cheap - totally worth it!!. We never had to wait on the ferry and it was a great trip. Just like everyone says...probably the cheapest tourist thing to do. Lovely views. Right now, all the building are light up for Christmas, so night time is the best!!! But, during the day is a nice ride too.

Iconic thing to do. During our visit to HK, although we took the MRT most of the time, we made sure to take the Star Ferry once since it's the iconic way of traveling between HK Island and Kowloon. We took it during non-rush hour which is what I would recommend as well. There were plenty of seats during non-rush hour although I spent the entire journey standing at the side of the ferry for photography purposes. The fare is inexpensive and you can use the Octopus Card (oh well, you can use the Octopus Card for almost everything in HK!). Definitely an iconic thing to do when visiting HK.
Efficient. Efficient and cheap. Easy to use, very regular service. Many different routes to choose from.

Great lights !. The Christmas light up is totally amazing. We wanted to take the boat ride but decided to take a walk on the pier and ended up having a great time just soaking in the cool sea breeze and the ambience. Don't forget your camera !
Another experience. Always good to use the star ferry Used both sides of the Hong Kong harbour at Waichai and Central. lot cleaner than in 1971 when I was there

Inexpensive and efficient cross harbor travel. Prices were in expensive, the ferry is easy to use if you are mobile, and it is very pleasant to commute on the water with the locals all day and night long. The views in the evenings are divine with all the buildings lit on both sides of the bay. We saw little difference between the main floor and 1st class (2nd floor), though both are incredibly inexpensive. A 5 minute ride with great access to other places on both sides of the water.
Great thing to do after Thanksgiving. Runs like clockwork. During Late November the lights on Hong Kong Harbor are beautiful.

A working pier. This is a working city and the pier offers a ferry that is used by commuters. It is quick, cheap and efficient and with no frills but even a short journey provides great views of the front with gleaming buildings and iconic skyline.
worth a trip. fantastic views of Hong Kong for not a lot of cash
Always amusing. Easy to get on and off and a fun way to cross from the mainland to the island.
I could ride these boats all day long ..... The view is so nice from these ferries that I could ride them all day back and forth from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island just gazing at the skylines.....
10p tourist attaction. Never go to Kong Kong without taking the the star ferry between the island and Kowloon. So cheap. Take it at 7.50 to get a front row seat for the light show!
Convenient, cheap and romantic.. Cheap ride across Victoria Harbour and if you do it during the night in November, a romantic ride.

Scenic ferry ride, especially at night in the lead-up to Christmas!. We hopped on the Star ferry from Hong Kong Island at night and the kids throughly enjoyed watching the skyscrapers embellished with Christmas fairy lights and decorations! It was a pleasant and reasonable 15 minute trip to Kowloon. Once at Kowloon, we spent a happy half an hour admiring the gorgeous Disney 'Toy Story' themed giant Christmas decorations outside Harbour City Shopping Centre.
Ferry service. Quick & efficient - make sure you have change to buy tickets

cheapest and best ferry in the world.. it is best to travel in star ferry rather than taxi cause it is much more cheap .....and this ferry has 2 views one is roof and one is under roof and it is very clean and i can say that you will enjoy this ferry at night because of the lights coming from the building city looks more beautiful...

A must-do tourist attraction when in Hong Kong.. Whether you opt for the lower deck at $2 or the upper deck at $2.50, it has to be amongst the best value harbour attractions - offering great views from Victoria Harbour. Sailings very frequently throughout the day between Tsim Sha Tsui (TST) and Central, and also between TST and Wanchai.

Smooth, easy and comfortable. Had visited the ferry pier on couple of occassions ...it is very easily accessible and the boarding process is very smooth and comfortable..staff is very helpful and polite....nice view of the coastline
Still the best way to travel from Kowloon to HK Island!. This is cheap regular and has not changed in many years!
Best views. This really is a Hong Kong experience not to be missed. It costs next to nothing and the views are spectacular. It's a quick ride so little kids won't get bored.
Easy and quick transport across the harbour. It was very easy to purchase a token to get on the ferry. It was a quick ride across and the views where nice also.
Easy and Cheap. The ride takes 8 minutes and costs 35 cents! The ferries load and unload very efficiently, and the ride is very comfortable.
Quick & cheap. It is a cheap method of transport to get to Wan Chai or Central when you are in Tsim Sha Tsui

very nice. It was a very comfortable ride from HKG to Macau and back and quick too. Some time the high tides of the sea might sum people feel uneasy but otherwise it seems to be the best way to commute between the 2 places.
Easy. Easy to get tickets and use - good view of the harbour

If in HK then you cant miss this experience. You can't travel to HK and not travel on the Star Ferry at least once, twice, three times....
The view of the city on both sides from the water, together with the buzz of the harbour traffic, will never cease to amaze you.
And so cheap!!!
still good and cheap. always a good view of HK harbor and always so cheap.. good quick trip to go to the other side...
Must-do. Catch the ferry at least once – ideally at night. Amazing view and it costs almost nothing.
A Must do. Pay only $40 and go to the upper AC deck. The music is good and its not very crowded . The musicians play your choice and you can dance too on a reasonable size dance floor

Under Contruction Modification. The harbor tour Star Ferry 2 Hours was a disappoinment. No colorful Junks, Floating Restruants ETC. BLAND. The hardor may have been absent those old colorful floating crafts due to dreding and or multi peer modifications. Just don't know why Victoria Harbor was emptied. We totally enjoyed a visit years earlier. earlier
What an expeience. A must in Hong Kong and for pennies - this is the best way to appreciate the harbour

For the experience. All visitors to Hong Kong must take the Star Ferry for the experience and the view - Hong Kong Island view is more impressive. The ferry runs quite late (don't remember if it shuts down) and is very cheap. It is an economical way to have a quick harbor tour
Cheapest transportation in HK. Stunning views and best way to cross over to the other side of the harbor. Costs less than 3 HKD (US 40 cents). Brilliant photo opportunity as well.
Good journey. This is quite cheap and a good experience, more enjoyable than the metro! I only went during the day but am told the night journies are the best.
Just ok. short and alternative way to travel from hong kong island to kowloon. nice experience

Great way to get around - plus great views. It is a Hong Kong Staple - but the Star Ferry Pier is well worth it, such a handy way of getting between Tsim Sha Tsui and the Convention Centre or Central. Really cheap - plus if you have an Octopus Card its quick and easy to board. You can choose upper deck or lower deck, the view from the upper deck is a little better I think, but the lower deck is cheaper and often not as crowded.Well worth it and a lot more enjoyable than taking the MTR under the water.
accessible. Walking distance from where we are staying.. plus, you get to visit nice malls along the way!!

Not to be missed!. Recently stayed at the Conrad Hong Kong in a harbour view room on the 60th floor. This gave a bird’s eye view of the harbour and the ‘tiny’ Star Ferries shuttling from pier to pier, avoiding all the other traffic on their way.Only by getting down to ground (water) level do you get into what Honk Kong is all about, the crowds, smells and organised chaos. Don’t miss a trip on this iconic institution!There is also a reasonably priced harbour cruise on a slightly more refined ferry.
Great quaint quick and convenient transport to HK Island. Very cheap,( about £0.50 single) reliable and on time. Real piece of history surrounding a very modern city!

Best way to transit the harbor!. Forget taxi's, and the MTR! If you are just heading over to Tsim Sha Tsui and Kowloon for some fun, take the ferry. In october I used the ferry about 8 times in 2 days. The Star Ferry Pier in Central was never crowded, and it was a Saturday and Sunday! So easy!
Must do. Love the star ferry but somehow we must have missed the entrance to the upper deck and travelled on lower deck from TST to HK.

Worldclass Travel Bargain. We were recently in Hong Kong for the first time and one of the things I wanted to do was to ride the Star ferry between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. For some reason this stood out in my mind as an iconic trip.Well it exceeded my expectations. I guess it helped that the day was fantastic, with a mild breeze and blue sky. The harbor was jam packed with traffic going every which way. The temperature was just right and the cool breeze into the ferry was just what the doctor ordered for a warm day.I came to discover that seniors (over 65) can ride the ferry for free! So not only did I get to check off a bucket list item, I did it for free. The ride exceeded my expectations and I could have spent all day riding back and forth had I not had a list of things I wanted to do.A great price, a fantastic experience in a beautiful city.
Must Try experience. when in HK, do as the HKers do. yes, we use it to Central and Wanchai back and forth to our hotels in TST. my kids loved it.
Busy Pier. Some folks like to cross over to Macau. The last boat ride is at midnight. Best for taking pictures.

It all starts from here...... We used to visit this place ever day to visit hong kong from kowloon. We also got the big bus tickets from here. The tourist information center at star ferry pier is also very helpful.
We have enjoyed the Cruise ride. One should take ride at 7.15 pm boat to have good view
The travel on the Star Ferry was awesome. The ferry ride from Kowloon to Hongkong & back was beautiful. Really enjoyed the cool breeze and the skyline
cheap and beautiful. i think this is the cheapest attraction in hong kong..
very efficiency. we had ferries to Hong Kong Island to see Hong Kong University. very convinient and effiency. Landing the Hong Kong Island you will see a lot of busstops and taxi.

Star Ferry - Must Do in H K. Must be the best bang for the buck in Asia. We loved every crossing on the Star Ferry, and we did lots of them, but the best was a night crossing to co-incide with the light show at 7 pm (or 8 ?) It's all in the timing, but I'm sure the captain slowed down so we could make the most of it. Mosy memorable.
star ferry terminal. good location for the star ferry and the bus terminal

Cheap water views of a great skyline. ALthough the subway may be quicker, take the star ferry from Kowloon to HK island at least once for the view. Several Kowloon buses travel down Nathan Road to teh ferry terminal.
Easy to find. It was easy to find and get on to the ferry to Hong Kong Island we used this two or three times

Must go on this. I only given this three star as I spent most of the five minutes ferry trip trying not to be sick. However, when I did managed to see the wonderful view of Hong Kong. Get your cameras out!!!
So easy. easy to use and good value for money, we used the ferry as a connection to get to the other side of the river
Nice place for a view. Star Ferry was great, quick ride across the harbour. Good views
It is just a ferry but Hong Kong is not just a city.. If you want to see the city from the river, this is a must. Take the ferry and see the city. It is cheap but joy is a lot.
Star Ferry - a must. Great experience and very very cheap. Go on lower deck with locals and see the engines.
worth a ride. Convenient and fun mode of transport from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. Sea was choppy but such a quick ride there was no chance for any seasickness:)
is cheap and good way for crossin to HK. you can try that especially when there is traffic saves time.
Confusing. Although having visited Hong kong many times i still find the directions to ferry destinations difficult to follow.
bustling but well organised. essential trip on star ferry while in hong kong (day and night)

Part of the history of Hong Kong. There was a time that if you wanted to go to Kowloon from Hong Kong and vice versa you had to use the ferry to cross the harbour. After the construction of the tunnels for cars and for the MTR the need of the ferry diminished but, because it's very cheap, it's still used by locals. The view of the harbour is impressive and very beatiful.
Efficient Public Trans. Travel across the river in style. Gorgeous views as you go along, and so cheap too!

Tradition at its best. It should be a ritual when you goto Hong Kong to try the star ferry whether you use the top or the bottom deck the views from the middle of the harbour are fantastic. It costs so little to take a trip, I would always advise the octopus card saves you lots of time...

A must try. If you come to HKand dont take this, means you have not visited Hong Kong yet! Its the most enjoyable ride apart from the tram. My toddler just love taking the ferry back and forth, just for the feeling of being in on the water and the beauty of the harbour looming in front of you is awesome! And its cheap too.

Nice ride...the view is awesome!. It's not expensive at all and runs frequently! Make sure you take it at night because HK looks just beautiful with all the lights in Victoria Harbour. If you are there at 8pm, they play a great lights show with live music, every day, that lasts for 10-15min I All buildings are lit in different colors.... Just an outstanding view!
An experience to remember. No trip to Hong Kong is complete without a trip on the Star Ferry. You do need change to purchase a token prior to boarding.

Strolling along the sea. we walked past the pier hoping to soak in the sights but unfortunately we chose the wrong time to do that and missed out on the night breeze and the building light up. So make sure u visit the place after 7pm.
Great Place - Great View. And of course nice to travel by Ferry to many places. Our trips to Macau with the Ferry will be never forgotten. And the Duty Free Shopping was also really fun.

Nice to see Hong Kong at night from the waters. Hong Kong is a sight to see from the waters when the neon lights are on. One way to do this is to get on the Star Ferry.
It is an open-air ferry which is a 15-minute ride that would take you from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui.

Classic HK Attraction. You must do this at least once while in HK. Try to arrive in mid morning or afternoon when it is not too crowded so you can get a window seat. The price in amazing. It is only 2.5 HKD. Sometimes I ride across and then ride back just to enjoy the harbor view.
The Star Ferry charm. After all the advances in transportation in HKG nothing beats the charm of taking the Star Ferry to cross the harbor. It may not be as fast as the MTR but it's got class :)

A "Star"experience. A cheap, relaxing and entertaining way of discovering Hong Kong. A trip with one of the old-fashioned ferry boats owned by the Starline. Enjoy the ships themselves too.,We crossed for example with the Northern Star, built in 1959 in Hull, Britain A perfect example of a cartoon ferryboat.Boarding and on boarding goes quick and very efficient.The skyline on both sides of the water is breathtaking if you are lucky the are close to the pier big cruisships docking.A very very nice crossing I like to recommend to everyone when visiting Hong Kong
A trip just to watch..... Peak hour is intense...with lots of commuters coming and going to HK

Like everyone says, a "must do" trip" which costs peanuts. I took the Star Ferries Harbour Tour one afternoon which at $60HK for about an hour is excellent value. Apart from the sights and sounds of the renowned Victoria Harbour, the passengers provide a show in themselves. Don't miss the Star Ferries, they are not just a way of getting from A to B but an entertainment and an education in themselves. For example, on my trip a young newly married couple took the trip to have their wedding pictures taken, providing considerable additional local colour and glamour to my trip.
Quick and convienent.. Easy to get to, easy way to travel from Hong Kong Island and back, fun and the view of the harbour; the only way to go.

Bargain from TST to Wan Chai. Walked from the Hyatt TST down the avenue of stars and ended up at the Star Ferry Pier. My colleague and I took the ferry for a mere $3HKD across the harbor to the Wan Chai area. What a bargain! We had dinner on HK island and then had to take a taxi back as the ferry had stopped running at 9 PM. Plan accordingly.
Don't miss it!. Always one of my first stops when shuttling between Hong Kong and Kowloon. Bring a camera and sit near the side. One of the great travel bargains in Hong Kong.

unmissable - cheap and convenient too. Yes, yet another review that says you really must do this - take the ferry from/to Kowloon to Hong Kong island! These picturesque ferries, many decorated in bright colours (see photos), will get you over Victoria Harbour with speed and efficiency from Tsim Sha Tsui on Kowloon into central Hong Kong and you'll get marvellous views of this stunning harbour en route, day and night. If there are children in your party they will love the ride too. You can use an Octopus card to pay (you really must buy one of these cards each if you visit Hong Kong, great value and convenience for public transport, including trams). Yes, the MTR is also very efficient, but do take the ferry at least once.
Star Ferry. Great to view the lights on Hong Kong Island if you catch it from Kowloon. If you catch it at about 8pm you will see the laser show as well. Not to be missed.

cheap and great fun - much more interesting than the subway!. definitely take a trip across the harbour on the star ferry, heading towards central is the most photogenic, and the upper floor has the best views! very cheap so doable on any budget!
You must take the historic star ferry. No trip to Hong Kong is compete without a trip on the famous star ferry. Definitely shoud be on your to do list!

You have to do this one..... Who could come to Hong Kong and not do this! The Star Ferry us super cheap, fun, and the best way to see the harbour up close and personal. Do it at least twice....once in the day and once at night. It costs a tiny bit more to ride up top. Do it for the best view. It was never crowded when we went. A plus for those over 65.......the Star Ferry is free, so go as much as you want!!

Indeed a must do and inexpensive too. Yes yes it's boring to read this because everyone says it's a must do. hahaha... But you really should take the ferry at least twice. One during the day and one during the evening. That way you could enjoy different views.Don't be cheap! Take the upper deck! haahhaa... the price difference is too small for what you gain from upper deck view. People say they can take good pictures from the ferry. Yes they are right but it's not that much difference if you just take pictures in either terminals =) So don't worry too much about picture taking. Just enjoy the ride.Tip: Try out the egg tart before you board the ferry from TST side. It's actually pretty good.
