Nothing's cha. I remember riding this when I was a teen and now I'm with my teen son and younger children. Nothing has changed except they now accept Octopus card. Same feel, same ambiance even the seats were unchanged. I love riding this ferry. Very economical, fast and relaxing. But the best part, the nice view of harbor and HK skyline. I hope to ride this again when I come back to Hong Kong in the future.
"feel the history". take the H$2 trip by Star Ferry from Tsim Sha Tui to Wan Chai. wanderfel views over the Victoria Harbour are trully rewarding!
Honk Kong Hustle. Very crowded the day we went being a weekend. Waiting lines were over half an hour. Better to go during the week to see attractions accessable here if your time is short.
A Must-Do!. An authentic slice of Hong Kong life. Such a cheap, reliable and fun crossing across one of the world's great harbours. Approaching Central Pier is like stepping back in time.
Gotta take the Ferry. It is great. I think it is around $0.60 for a ferry across the bay. Its great at night.

A must do. Going cross the harbour with Star Ferry is a must for everyone visiting Hong Kong, it has been a major transportation way for many years, it cost nearly nothing. Perfect to go to Central or WanChai from Kowloon...

CHEAP. One way ticket works out at about 16p
Easy to use and a good way to see Kowloon and Hong Kong Island
Star Ferry ....great views of the harbour. Make sure you cross the harbour on Star Ferry....cheap and easy with great views
An important historica, and still functioning,l part of Hong Kong. Cheap, great views,and a pleasant respite to the hustle and bustle...until docking on the other side.
A must ride during your lifetime. If you have never been to the Star Ferry Pier or ride the ferry between HKG Island & Kowloon Peninsular. You have never been to HKG yet. Period...........

Perfect, Inexpensive way to see the lights of Hong Kong at Night. Enjoyed riding the Star Ferry on my trip to Hong Kong at the end of October. For little less than $.50 USD, I was able to ride over on the ferry and enjoy the night skyline. If you have not ever seen Hong Kong at night from the Star Ferry, you really are missing something. Recommend to everyone.

Need to do when you visit Hong Kong. Nice to travel from Kowloon to Hong Kong island.
Ideal to take the Ferry Boat from Kowloon to the exhibition center.
Cheap and no traffic problems.
Only less then 10 minutes travel
Hong Kong local experience as well. Part of the HK lifestyle!
Best value in Hong Kong. Like going back in time, riding ancient ferries from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central. Super cheap, convenient and great sight-seeing

Hong Kong's equivalent of NYC's Staten Island Ferry. The trip across to Kowloon is best at night, with the expansive backdrop of illuminated Hong Kong and a crowd of locals for company. The views are iconic and wonderful.This is an equivalent experience to New York City and the famous Staten Island Ferry which goes past the Statue of Liberty - traveling with commuters for a few dollars and seeing some amazing views.
Sightseeing on the Cheap. How cheap can you get for a ride across the harbour?

Easy way to get into Macau. Had a easy trip getting from travel across the harbour. Buying the tickets,waiting for and getting on to the ferry was a breeze.It was very interesting to see a various mix of people. Once we got on to the ferry the journey was pleasent, great scenery. I would definately reccommend it to travellers.

A must!. Me and my family took few rides crossing the island. From Tsim Sha Tsui to Central, TST to Wan Chai and vice versa. We've tried upper and lower deck. Day and night ride. It was super fun! The tocket price is very cheap too. It will cost HKD2.50 for lower deck and HKD3.00for upper deck.
Piece of History. We took numerous trips back and forth across the harbor using the Star Ferry. Incredibly cheap and efficient service, plus the ferries have a character all their own.

Cruising Victoria Harbour the old-fashioned way.. We liked the convenience and old-fashioned aspect of the old terminal with the old terminal tower preserved and nearby. Initially, we didn't know about the two floors and ticket prices for the ferry...but figured it out (pay more for upstairs...a better view).
Very nice transportation. It's cheap and fast, very convenient for travelling between Hongkong to Macau.
Star Ferry. A can't miss thing to do. Try to do it day and night. It only cost a dollar or two to travel back a forth between Hong Kong and Kowloon. Great photo op.
A bit confusing at First, But a Great Transport. Th eride across Victoria Harbour is the real treat. The boat is basic public transportation that is cheap and reliable.
An absolute must in HK. There is no reazon not to ride the star ferry. You need to do it during the day and during the night.
Convenient. Convenient (and cheap!) way to cross Victoria Harbour with an incredible view. No need to do a harbour cruise after riding the Star Ferry.

easy way to macau. use cotajet, its fast , realible and convenient. leave in the morning , just in time for city tour, dont forget to try the sky walk or bungee jump in macau tower (if you dare). try to sample the famous egg tart, go shop for souvenir at the foot of ruins of st pauls. take the shuttle to venetian hotel in taipa and experience the gondola ride (line are long so be patient). go back to hongkong late, see macau at night and the dancing fountain of wynns.
Awesome view of Hong Kong skyline. So cheap to cross the harbour with awesome skyline views
enjoy the spectacular view of Victoria Harbour. If time is on your hand, take the Star ferry to Kawloon and enjoy cheapest way to see the spectacular view of Victoria Harbour.
Easy to use. Very easy to get across from Hong Kong Island to the Kowloon side by ferry. All the piers are clearly numbered.
good cheap travel. use the ferry to go between HK and Kowloon it is cheap to use and you get a good view of Hong Kong especially at night!
Excellet service. Service was great. Octopus card was an excellent idea. Nice easy trip across the bay
It's like the Staten Island Ferry. Been there, done that. It's a convenient and cheap way to get to Kowloon.
Brilliant. Great view, easy to access and little cost. Short trip to central and back to kwoloon.

Short but sweet!. What a delightful way to travel across the harbour. Star Ferries have been operating for over a hundred years and there is a certain amount of old world charm about the trip. Definitely the cheapest way to see part of the harbour. Really enjoyable.

Still the best value in Honkers...... We have been taking a ride to/from from Central or Wan Chai every visit for the last 20 years or so and for us the Star ferry for commuters and tourists alike is the most iconic, best value ride anywhere around the world.What can one say about the view while crossing where you see mountain and dazzling skyscrapers on Central or Wan Chai side and the Kowloon foreshore with it hundreds of high-rise apartments on the other!It’s a busy place and at times it can be a bit of a 'rush' to get the best seats in 'first class' all for a few cents a ride. Looking out the open windows in good weather is a busy harbour with all manner of traffic.In recent years the Central harbour front land has been reclaimed and the ride is somewhat less than it used to be. Tokens can be bought from the vending machine and it is much more streamlined.It is a singular joy to just 'cruise' across the harbour and back. Nothing changes except the works improving the Central pier area, however it is a longer walk this end where as Kowloon side remains virtually the same year after year.Enjoy your ride!
iconic ride. A fantasic tourist attraction , cheap , fast , efficent. Well worth doin.

Nice transportation alternative. I like the idea of connecting Hong Kong and Macau with ferry. It's a different experience than taking a bus, taxi, trail, or flight.
Schedule are so many and fix. Nice.
Unlucky, that one of the time we across the sea using the ferry, it is late for half an hour.
Efficient, cheap, and a great city view.. What a cheap, efficient way to get around. Brilliant views of buildings and just good fun.
very good. very good service for a very cheap price - don't let the tourist offices cheat you on the pricing of a boat tour - same view for a funny amount
Ferry ride. Gotta take the ferry at least once across the harbor, just to say you did it.
Frequent ferries. Easy to use, toilets accessible. The views from the ferry make it a fun mode of travel day and night.
Tradition. Still a great part of the HK tradition and probably the cheapest thing you will do in HK apart from walking around.

Best way to cross the Harbour - do the tour!. Just a tiny bit more expensive than the stupidly cheap trams - the Star Ferry isn't just a regional icon, but also one of the best ways to cross the harbour.$2.50 HKD will that you from either Wan Chai or Central to Tsim Shai Tsui or back.$120.00 HKD (+/- $60 HKD depending on time of day) will get you a 1 hour tour round the harbour on the specially adapted ferry (much posher). This also includes "light refreshments", which for us was a soft drink and a slice of rather nice cake.We used the MTR to cross the harbour if we were already on it, but regularly used the Star Ferry to cross it, as it was a far nicer way to experience the crossing and make the most of our holiday.We did the Ferry tour during sunset, so we had great views of both sides of Victoria Harbour in daylight and at night (when it's all illuminated). RECOMMEND YOU TRY THAT... it's like getting 2 cruises for the price of 1.Both sides of the bay are fairly easy to use, you can touch in with an Octopus card or use exact change, or anything else at one of the token machines....You can't say you've been to Hong Kong unless you've used the Star Ferry at least once!

Move fast and enjoy. This is like a commuter train for the locals; nothing more annoying for them than slow tourists. So queue up fast, walk fast onto the boat, go to the upper deck if it’s not raining, and then relax for the ride and take your photos. It’s a not to be missed experience, makes you feel like you’re back some years in history. The other boats you pass are as much an attraction as the fabulous skylines both ahead and behind you.
awesome way to travel. easy to travel, cheap, goes to all or close to tourist attractions. get a octopus card as it makes life alot easier.....and if its a little rough take the upper deck

Fun and the cheapest way to cross the island. We really enjoyed crossing the island from Central Pier Station to Tsim Sha Tsui, and vice versa. For me, it's the cheapest option for transportation at HK$2.20, plus, as an added bonus, you get to see Victoria harbour within Victoria bay and the tall skycrapers up close.Try to experience the beauty of Hongkong especially at night during the symphony of lights at 8PM while on board the Star ferry and blend in with some the local folks. You bet it's one of the best experiences we had within the city!

Christmas in November!. Just to the right of the Star Ferry entrance there were spectacular Christmas displays, just right for taking Christmas card photos! To the left is a raised platform in front of the Clock Tower. Recommend seeing the artisan treasures of China at the Star House, then high tea at The Peninsula, cross the street to view the Hong Kong Opera House and exit on the harbour side to the raised platform and The Avenue of Stars and then you will be in place to find a seat to enjoy the breathtaking Symphony of Lights. A great day!

get on the ferry. These ferries are extremely inexpensive and give wonderful views of the harbour. They tend to be crowded in rush hour so avoid the morning and evening commute. ***For seniors follow the YELLOW painted floor path for FREE travel all day. If you get off in Central you can take the tram from end to end of HK Island for $2 ($1 for seniors). At Star Ferry terminal on Kowloon don't miss the Harbourfront walks and at dusk the Laser light and music shows all free
Just Go!. quick, cheeeeap and authentic!3 HK dollars, 7 minutes, beautiful views: feels like coming back and foward for some rides to make it last longer.Just do it!
A local experience. Inexpensive, a photo opportunity, very easy to buy tickets and board

A Must. Travelling Star Fery is a must while staying in Hong KKong and a big one. It is cheap, close to local people, fast. The ferries are going all the time so we never waited longer than max 10 minutes.
Fantastic!. This pier is where a lot of action is. It is so lively and entertaining with all the ppl scrambling to board the ferry. I loved it and it is so inexpensive.

Authentic Hong Kong. I used to use the Star Ferry to commute to work and looked forward to the ride every day. I dont think you can get better value for your money for siteseeing in any major city in the world.

Cheap Way To Experience Ferry Rides and Amazing Views. It's amazing that there is still cheap means of transportation available in Hong Kong. This is a great way to cross over, and offers brilliant views. If you have the time, do take the ferry both in the day time and night time as they offer a different experience.The fare is only HKD2 for the lower berth; and i think it costs slightly more expensive; maybe 2.50 on the upper berth.

The best way to see Hong Kong. Dont' waste time with other ferry companies, or cruises. Star ferry is iconic and simply the best. I remember this the first time I went to HK, 34 years ago. Last week I rode on the same ferries, the 1960s big, strong, timber ferries that I did when I was 14. They're beaut to look at and do the job perfectly. The piers are interesting too, and historic. Some nice shops, but it's the ferries you're going for.Don't fiddle with coins, buy an octopus card at a Metro station (Customer service centre) for a small deposit and load it up with a few dollars. Then you can swipe it on any public transport, like the ferries and avoid every queue. GREAT.Try to pop up the front of the top level of the ferry, you'll get some GREAT pictures, andit's air conditioned. They're very picturesque, and you'll get fab views from the windows of the amazing harbour.Star Ferry have great, cheap, fun cruises, especially the night cruise, try the 8pm one where you can see the lasers from the buildings. But its the neon lights that really take the cake....oh, did I mention that? you get drink and cake on these cruises.Star Ferries are part of HK history.

Cheap & does the job. Once you purchase your Octopus Card from the train station, you can use it on the ferry. This allows you to travel back & forth across Hong Kong harbour. Very cheap. Ferries run continuously so you won't be waiting too long to catch the next ferry. It takes about 10-15 minutes to get from one side of the harbour to the other side.

Iconic experience best done at night - the view really is great. I have been to Hong Kong many, many times over the years, on business and for pleasure, but I still love the combination offered by the Star Ferry of traditional ferry travel, sea breezes from the harbour, and a view that is one of the best in the world (especially at night). Although rather a hassle to get on and off when compared to the MRT, this experience is still fun as long as you are not on a tight time schedule. Kowloon to Central is one of the best routes for views, although the new Central Piers are rather a walk from anywhere useful as compared with their previous arrival pier of some years ago. Nevertheless, this really is an experience that you should try at least once in avery itinerary to HK!

like every one says, this is one thing you have got to do in HK. bit difficult to get to either from Central (long walkways) or Kowloon (no metro nearby) but the pier and the ferries have a great character and the views are sublime, especialy at dusk or nightime.

Nice transportation to Hong Kong Island. The Star Ferry Terminal is an easy walk along the boardwalk. The Ferry is inexpensive about 2.50 HK$ during the week and there are nice views as you are crossing the harbor.

So cheap and easy to use. Such an easy way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. It costs maybe 30 cents (one way) and needs you to buy tokens or have exact money. We used the ferry to Wan Chai and central as we were based in Kowloon. The turnaround is very fast and the trip takes less than 10 mins.People in Hong Kong are pretty orderly and there was no hassle to get on or off. One of the fun things to do in Hong Kong.
nice program. a good and cheap choice for visiting hong kong is the star ferry, Taking from one world to an other...

Star Ferry a must!. Every time we go to HK, we ride the Ferry for the joy of it - and to get to the other side. You will get a great view up and down the harbor that you can not get from either side and a little of the HK flavor. Ride on the upper deck for better views. Also if you are a Senior, it is free. Otherwise, it is cheap!

Go out and see the harbour lights!. Did the evening cruise around Victoria Harbour on the Star Ferry. Ticket sales were a little disorganized, but I refused to give up since it was my only night in HK and just paid on the ferry. Gorgeous views of the harbour and nice commentary. At 8 p.m., there is a light show on Victoria Harbour - the ferry parked in the middle of the harbour for us to enjoy the sights (and the music broadcast on the boat). Truly memorable and moving - must do!

spectacular views. Well this is just a ferry pier but it is very much the heart and soul of HK. From the TST Star Ferry Pier you can take ferries to either Central or Wan Chai both on HK Island. Ferry tickets are about HKD 3.00 (lower deck is cheaper than the upper deck) I am not exactly sure of the price because I use an Octopus card which can also be used on buses, the MTR and also in places like McDonalds and Starbucks. Views of the HK Island skyline across Victoria Harbour are second to none. Ferries depart every couple of minutes, the trip across Victoria Harbour takes about 10 minutes.

Sunset - Must See on Star Ferry. If you have just 1 hr and want to do just one thing in HK, this has to be it - the Sunset on Star Ferry is the best I have seen. I had take the one from Wan Chai to Tsim Sa Shui side and was just mesmerized. Amit

A must do while in HK. For a very inexpensive ride you can see the harbor in all its glory. It's fun to ride this ferry across and experience a piece of Hong Kong history at its greatest. Plenty of seats and great views. The ferries have two levels-both are wonderful experiences. if your in Hong Kong you have to try the ferry at least once. It provides a great memory of ones time in HK
By day or by night - a wonderful experience. Buy an Octupus card and use for the ferrry/MTR(subway) or trams.Easy to find the right ferry and very frequent. Loved it : )

Best bargain & view of Hong Kong!. This was probably my favorite thing in Hong Kong - or at least a close 2nd to the Peak Tram.It was so easy to use (we had an Octopus Card), the running times made it easy to go back and forth from HK Island to Kowloon/TST. It's quick - taking you from 1 port to another in less than 10 minutes, but the views were breath-taking!

Great experience in HK. Everybody say this is a ‘must do’ experience in HK, yep I went there as soon I arrived in HK. I took a walk from Guangdong Hotel to TST promenade for star ferry. It was hot afternoon, but managed to capture panoramic view of star ferry crossing to HK mainland and Kowloon vice versa. HK3 per journey. The journey took around 15 minutes. It was great experience . Ferry Pierre 7 is for TST pier to Central Pier. Dont miss this experience for only HK3 ( around RM1.20). Should try the Ferry experience at night. To capture the symphony of light.

very efficient. For just a few pence you can get over to kowloon or hong kong with amazing frequency.It is simple an easy to use. You buy a token in the machine and put it in at the barrier, its as simple as that. There are large fans blowing in the waiting area although we never had to wait long.There is an air conditioned areato sit in on the ferry if you dont want to sit outside.
Great value. Fast, economical way to get to ZhuHai or Macai. The chairs are comfortable, upholstered with room to store a lunch bag underneath.

Hot, uncomfortable, poor tour organization.. We were staying close by (YMCA Salisbury) so this was a natural. OK, we thought, lets book a Star Ferry night cruise. I got into the line about 7:10 to find a sign saying that ticket selling was to start at 7:30 for the 8:05 tour. I was only 6 or so from the front. When ticket selling finally opened, the first few people got tickets, then the "closed" signed went up!How strange! Were they using a rowing boat, perhaps? A couple of days later we used their terminals for some commuting as part of a larger tour, and were quite impressed with the efficient way they did this day-to-day commuter traffic. So, the premises are a bit down at heel and dingy, but it manages commuter traffic and the ferries themselves are good, but basic. Their reversible seats are good though, if you don't like travelling facing aginst the direction of travel.
Great service. Great service to get across the water, very well used by everyone!

Just take a ride. For very little money, you can take a ride on the ferry and it's a must-do. Just get off at Tsim Tsa Tsui and take the ferry instead of the metro on its way to Central. You'll see all sorts of life in the bay. In fact, it's worth doing at least a couple of times!

An absolute must-see!. We went on the Star Ferry in August 2011 and went on it several times with two small children (aged 6 and 7). The Star Ferry is possibly the oldest and most well-known of all Hong Kong attractions. It consists of several green and white ferrys that go back and forth from Tsim Sha Tsui and Central as well as a newer route from Tsim Sha Tsui and Wan Chai.The ferrys are clean and easy to board. There are two decks - the upper deck is slightly more expensive and has windows / covers whereas the lower deck just has railings. If it is a nice sunny day then the lower deck is a good option and if the weather is a bit wet then the upper deck will keep you dry.The crossing is usually only a few minutes long and gives you some fantastic views of Victoria Harbour. Our two boys loved it and I cannot see any reason why families with small children should be put off. Services are frequent, cheap and fast. It is well worth doing and something that should be on every Hong Kong visitor's 'to do' list!
The 'Star Ferry' gives a traditional flavour of access to HK Island. If you are visiting the Island then at least one trip on the Ferry is a 'Must'...............enjoy the moment !!

Cheapest & shortest cruise in town!. Altho' taking the MTR betw Kowloon & Island is the most efficient method, opted to take the ferry from Kowloon to Wan Chai (meeting friends for lunch) as wanted a change of view from the elongated sardine can & underground stations. Turned out to be an excellent decision as the short ride in the cool sea breeze was a refreshing respite from confined spaces & hot weather. Long enough to enjoy a great view of bobbing fishing boats framed by skyscrapers, short enough for those without sea-legs. Definitely the cheapest cruise in town! Note to those with mobility issues as going up/down the ramp may be a little challenging.
brilliant. once you have arrived at hong kong island there are a whole load ot jettys all going to different places chose your trip buy your ticket and off you go it is that easy
going to hong kong island. take the ferry to hong kong island for a few hk dollars and enjoy the short scenic trip

No changes in 20 years and it is still great - the same shops are there!. A trip on the Star ferry is a must in Hong Kong. It is still the cheapest way to get to HK Island at HK$2.30. The boats are clean and the ferry slowly bobs it way over to HK Island, giving you a fantastic view of all the shiny high rises. Try to stick to travelling on the upper deck - the lower deck is unbearably hot as the boat's engine is down there. Cheaper of course but not worth it.

enjoy the view. I join on the evening trip to enjoy a beautiful view of Victory bay and the art town, boat are clean and provided both indoor and outdoor setting space. The trip took approximately 1 hour but the both also offer longer hour cruise. Don't miss this trip to reward your long day in busy town : )

Take it if you have time. We took the star ferry to see the sound and light show at the harbour. Waited in line to take tickets for 15 min. Just as our turn came the lady closed the counter cause the ship was full. Ok such things happen, but she didnt let us buy tickets for the next ship, saying in an impolite way you can buy them in half an hour from now. Which ment that we had to cue again to buy the tickets. Such nice customer policies.....!!!The one hour cruise we took around the harbour was Ok allthough the ship wasnt the newest in the world. To cut it short, it is worth to take a ride if you want to have closer views to the harbour skyline and the price was Ok around 8 Euros including a piece of cake and a refreshment like coke, sprite etc.
Worth the experience.. Great views of Hong Kong skyline. Cheap fare for ferry trip to Hong Kong and back.

Do not go in winter. Nothing special, just transfer from one border to another side, even we get out at the first stop. It's quick and convenient to cross and avoid the peak time of subway. But avoid it in winter time, you will not enjoy at all. During the trip, you receive information on the main construction on both side.

Wonderful !!!. My family and I took the star ferry night tour.....it was a great way to see all the sky scrapers and the view was pretty good.........it was also very relaxing after a whole day of sightseeing...you get a complimentary snack and drink once aboard...overall.....very pleasant.....

icon of inclusivity. I have conducted a number of rides on a ferry internationally. This one is my favorite because it serves me a feast for the eye (and soul) as I slow down from the hustle and bustle of a metropolitan centre like Hong Kong, * views of both the Downtown and Suburban areas along the shorelines of the Victoria Harbour around us, *landmarks that reflect the city`s evolution from a classical Chinese society, to a British colonial lifestyle, and then to its current modern Chinese life style, * Christmas lights twinkling on the major commercial buildings on the shoreline, * the complimentary energizing audio visual laser 3D show that is on every evening at 8, showcasing the beauties of the major features of the City, making the shorelines on both sides of the Hong Kong Harbour its stage. Most of all, it is cheap. With a couple of bugs, you can treat yourself with all of the above entertainments; and spare the money to enjoy this world famous Shoppers` Paradise of Hong Kong that is tax free and for the most part allows you to have fun bargaining as you shop.
Lovely!!. A very scenic, sweet ferry ride to Hong Kong island. Inexpensive and quit pleasant!!

Unmissable return boat ride acroos the harbour. The HK2$ fee each way is great value as you see the cities from ground level which is almost impossible to do from anynother location.Look out for the top deck entrance as you get a better view than the lower deck.Half way across the rains came and hid the whole skyline but by the return trip all was clear so added to the fun.The hoto opportunities are the best in town especially when you can snap a Junkwith a skyscraper behind
Bargain Ferry. Sweet, historric ride.. Inexpensive ride between Hong Kong island and TST.Calm.Great views, good for photos.Old steam ships.
It was a highlight. My husband had never been to HK before and the ferry was definitely a highlight for him. It was scenic and such a genuine cultural experience, he absolutely loved it!

Nostalgic ferry ride on wonderful Star Ferry. V cheap way of travelling, and fast too. Clean and fresh breeze all along the ride. V nostalgic to be on the ferry, which is amazing since its been there for such a long time.There are many ferries and at frequent intervals. Fare is slightly expensive if you chose upper deck. I enjoyed the ride, with beautiful sceneries.You buy the ticket before entering the gate, from ticket machine. Need coins though.

Cheapest and funnest view of the city. You can not go to Hong Kong and not take the Star ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. the view is stunning, especially at night, but I find it especially moody in the fog or rain (or heavy pollution which isn't a stranger to Hong Kong). The price is amazing and even those of us who appreciate the MTR for its efficiency have to take the ferry to get our fill of the city. Bring your camera...

Top of list for visitors in Hong Kong. Star Ferry is part of Hong Kong history, in the old days, long before the tunnels this is the only way to cross the harbour, it's a cheap fare, to see hong kong and Kowloon from the ferry, you probably wish it didn't end too soon, it take just a few minutes , do it again in the evening, wow, maybe see the light show together on the building around 8pm, then you say to yourselve, this trip is worth it.

A ferry with nice views, but really not that speciall.. I agree that the view is great, but the tour is not that speciall. If you are going from Kowlon to HK Island or vice versa its probably a good choice for transportation and u also get some new angles to see all the skyscrapers.

A Hong Kong institution - you have to take a ride on the Star Ferry!. Personally I can't get enough of the wonderful old Star Ferries, they are so well priced (as close to free as can be) and it gives you the most incredible views, whether you're heading to Hong Kong or Kowloon. Sit back and enjoy the spectactular outlook, it's a short trip but it's a must do. In fact, it's a must do more than once!

Take the 1-hour tour if you want to see more of Hongkong's water-front. The ride across the harbour only costs HK$2.30 or similar, which can be easily paid using the Octopus card so why not? :)It was rather choppy when we took the ferry, and I felt nauseous after a while haha. But it wasn't that bad since it was just 5 minutes across from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central.If you want to have more views of the water-front buildings, take the 1-hour tour. It was not very expensive, though I thought that the on-board commentary was boring. The breeze blowing in your hair as you sit on the outside deck was nice though. Drinks are sold rather inexpensively, which shocked me because all attractions hike up prices for their food and drinks.That said, I rather enjoy the inexpensive non-tour version and it was enough!

great way to see and get to hong kong central. after you get your octopus card you are able to jump on and off of all transport in hong kong simply go to the harbour and jump on a the star ferry. they run to a number of location in hong kong they run regularly and it is a great way to travel you get a great view of the city and a new experience do note there are two ways to travel on the star ferry lower deck which has limited views and upper deck which was best and cost a little more.

if you don't go on it, you've missed something!. it may just be a ferry, but it's a great experience! wow! it's such a peaceful experience, for 1 thing, plus the views of the hong kong skyline in daylight are wonderful! i was lucky to have a hotel which was on the promenade anyway, so i could see it all from my room, but that also meant that the ferry station was close by. definitely, go on it atleast once!

An absolute MUST-DO for HK!!!. Besides being an iconic and historically significant feature of the HK landscape, this is the easiest way to get a quick cruise onto the Harbour. The Ferry is very accessible (make sure you get an Octopus Card which you can also use for riding on the MTR), extremely cheap and the best way to cross from Kowloon to the Island (or vice versa) in style. SECOND MUST-DO: Take another ferry trip in the evening after dark and see the wonderful skyline all lit up as you cross the water! Fantastic!

Best value public transport. The Ding Dings are a little cheaper, but don't offer the excellent harbour view crossing that the Star Ferry takes. The sailings are so frequent. The sea felt a little choppy when crossing sometimes but that is all part of the experience.

Historical icon of HK with views of the modern country. Star Ferries has been around for a long time in Hong Kong and they offer and excellent service around the bay in their distinctive white and green ferries . I went on a 1 hour daytime cruise that did a circuit, stopping off at several point along the way. The ferry itself was beautiful and felt genuinely like old fashion steamers from years gone by. They ride was comfortable. You could easily spend your time inside the ferry, either exploring it's displays or just relaxing in a seat. The real attraction, though, is the water-level views of the wonderful buildings and attractions along Hong Kong's shorelines. Great just to see and even better to photograph. The ferry had two large viewing areas with comfortable seating, so you will not miss out on a good view.  All in all the Star Ferry trip was excellent and I highly recommend it to all visitors to HK!

Its cheap, fast, and a quick thrill day or night. Tickets are cheap. The Ferry comes very often. There is usually a crowd for each Ferry since it is probably the cheapest way to cross between islands and the most scenic. Its a quick ride, but fun all the same.

Cheap, easy and my son wanted more!. The Star Ferry is a Hong Kong icon, it is very cheap, runs regularly and easy to find and access. You have several options and can do tours. Peak periods can get very crowded but that adds to the atmosphere.

Very Cheap - only way to travel. We took the ferry from pier 7 to Kowloon and it cost 2 KH dollars each. It's well worth doing this route at night as well so you can see the harbour lit up at night which is beautiful. Your never have to wait long for a ferry.

Excellent. The only thing to stop you going on this would be sea-sickness. If you don't suffer then give it a go. We took both the 1 hour cruise and the regular 10-minute HK-Kowloon ferry and greatly enjoyed both. Well and truly worth it and cheap as chips.

TAKE THE 1 HOUR TOUR. I took the Star Ferry to Central my first day. It was great fun. But I came back a few days later and took the one hour Victoria Harbour tour. It was great. The main lounge is very comfortable. The rear deck alowed me to take some great photos of both Hong Kong and Kowloon. It was a great way to spend an hour.

A Must-Do!. It's more than just an attraction - it's an actual every day mode of transport for the gazillions of people who actually live in HK! I LOVE the ferries and try to take them as much as possible. It's a great way to get some stunning pictures of the harbour from both sides and plus it's quite refreshing way to get about. The ferry rides are super cheap - maybe around 2HKD but you should try to get an octopus card for travelling around as you'll get a slight discount then

Vintage style, modern convenience!. While the Star Ferry dates back to 1888, it is still one of the quickest and most popular methods of transport between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, carrying a staggering 26 million passengers each year!It takes less than 10 minutes to cross the harbour and provides great views from the upper deck, but it's also a bit of fun to travel on the lower deck once or twice just for a different experience.Make sure you take the ferry at least once during the day and again at night to really appreciate the harbour views.

Retro boating. The star ferry turns out to be exactly as you anticipate.An old boat, complete with rope moorings, steam funnels and a salty sea dog for a captain.it's a short (5 min) ride to the other side but it's good fun and worth the very cheap tariff.Try and get a seat at either one of the ends so you can see where you are going/coming from.

Wonderful views - cheap way to see the harbor and city. While you can take the subway to get back and forth from the island, taking the Star Ferry gives you great views of the city skylines.If you are in Hong Kong, take the time to go on at least one trip with their ferries especially at night during the light show.

A quite place in Hong Kong. It is hard to beat this attraction. On the ferry between Hong Kong and Kowloon you can rest for some minutes and enjoy the ride on the water. My family and I used the ferry to get to Kowloon pretty often. It is cheap and on the Kowloon site you are right at the attractions, the shopping and the bus terminus.But, be carefull with the waves. It happened, that two girls stood at the railling and suddenly a wave came and they where completely wet. Great experience, everybody smiled, even the sailors.

the cheapest harbour cruise. The star ferry is apart from the tram one of the oldest means of transport that is still in use in hong kong. A star ferry ride combines a lot of things and is a MUST-DO in Hong Kong:- cheap (1,6 - 2,2 HKD)- easy transport across the harbour- historic character- amazing view of both sides of the hong kong harbour and its skylinesAt every time of the day, the ride is a highlight of a hong kong visit.
A Fun way to Travel. The ferry is a great and cheap way to travel in Hong Kong. It offers great views of the Hong Kong skyline.

Best at night. It was nice to experience.... Best at night. It was nice to experience how people travelled to and from the island in ancient times. Mind the long walk to and from any mtr stations. It is best to experience this ride coming from tst, as the view is better. When in the ferry (and facing hk island), sit at the left side. Note that its seat's back rest is adjustable, depending on the direction you are facing.

A must do in HK!. The star ferry is great. Its cheap (2.50 HKD) and takes you across the harbour in about 10 minutes. You get great views of HK Island and Kowloon. They leave every 5 minutes or so and run until late at night. This is something you must do on a HK trip, both during the day and at night. They also do a day tour (50 HKD) and night tour (100HKD)

Cheap, fun and fast way to cross one of the world's best harbors. We live in Hong Kong and really love the Star Ferry. Its one of the few remaining 'old' bits of Hong Kong that can be easily enjoyed while crossing the wonder Victoria harbor between HK island and Tsim Sha Tsui (TST). The fee is silly-low price, just a few HK dollars, maybe $.50 USD, compared to using taxi and you get to cross one of the best harbors in the world with sky-scrappers, Chinese junk boats and loads of everyday boat traffic around you. It never gets old and can be done between visits to more famous spots. The Star Ferry is so easy, you really shouldn't miss it.

Tourists and locals alike use this Ferry.. An inexpensive way to see the Hong Kong Harbour. Using the Octopus card makes it convenient. It makes one think of life in colonial HK as the ferries look authentic and old, with the sailors wearing traditional sailors outfits and the smell of diesel.Good fun and well worth going on.

Must Visit. I go to HK annually and I always make an effort to go on the Star Ferry. It's a fantastic way of escaping the mayhem that is HK and gives you a few minutes to soak in the views of HK harbour or TST. The cool breeze is a welcome feeling in the scorching summers.Make sure you sit upstairs!

Can't beat it. Being from Hong Kong myself, I'd recommend any visitors to take a ride as its a very uncostly experience on one of the oldest mode of transportation and you can get a very nice scenes of the Victoria Harbor. Especially at night you will be naturally inspired to take many pictures, and its good even in the day time. I use it too whenever I can. Its very very safe and clean.

the one thing you must do. This is such a cheap and wonderful way to see the harbour city - HKD2.50 per adult! the ride takes only a few minutes, and it is particularly beautiful at night with all the city lights.

Great value and trip. Star Ferry is a quick and easy way to get from Kowloon to the island. HK$2.50 per person and you MUST get on the top level. Definitely a must thing to do. On the island a short walk gets you to the bus transfer points to get to The Peak, Ocean Park, Stanley Market...

Definately a must do. You bustle on with all the locals, the ferries are not that big and if it is rough, they move around a bit. My kids were not that sure as we got moving, however this is a must do for the tourist.

You MUST MUST MUST try this!. Star Farry is inexpensive (HK$2.30 per person approx. depending on where you're traveling from/to) Its a gr8 way to see the infamous waterfront of Hong Kong. It takes under 8minutes to take the ride. Must see in the evening, when all the city lights are on. Absolutely glamorous!

An inexpensive Hong Kong essential!. I highly recommend you take the ferry across the Harbor.It is remarkably inexpensive, and you can use your Octopus card (a universal public transport fare payment card).The view as you take the cruise across the Harbor is sensational- it is a short cruise, so you may want to do it more than once! You will mingle with locals who use the ferry for commuting.The points of arrival on each side are close to interesting things to do.They offer scenic cruises as well, which are worthwhile.Incidentally, the ferry is not the only way to cross the Harbor- the city's modern underground rail system (MTR) also crosses below the Harbor.

A bit of mystery and history. We were in Hong Kong for 17 days and rode the Star Ferry almost every day. It was a spectacular way to see the skyline, mix with the locals, feel mysterious in the fog and participate in a bit of history.
Best way to get between Kowloon and Central. A great quick way to see the harbour and the best way to get between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island.

Happiest place in HK. Riding the star ferry is a link to the past--the harbour is the harbour, the peak is the peak, the kowloon clock tower is ... you get the picture. cheap, regular, stunning views, interesting activity on the harbour. this is essential travel for many hong kong residents--you are part of regular life, not a theme park ride.the shops at either end are an evil necessity. it's the ride on the water in these old style ferries that just soothes the soul and brings a smile to your face. the best part of HK is being on the water and what easier way is there than the star ferry?

One hour cruise good way to see Symphony of Lights. We ended the day with a cruise on Victoria Harbor to watch the Symphony of Lights using the Star Ferry. It’s about an hour cruise that hits all the main ferry piers. After dark, when the skyline is lit, about 30 of the buildings do a light/laser show each night (8PM). There were buildings on both sides of the harbor to watch and it was quite a sight. If you aren’t taking a cruise, plan to be on the Kowloon side as the buildings on the HK side are much more impressive to watch across the Harbor. Star Ferry (which you can also take during the day) does an evening cruise that puts you out on the water during the show. It’s also used by many of the locals to get back and forth across the harbor. One tip --- if you have a tendency to get seasick – plan ahead. Once the light show starts, the ferry basically stays in one place, and with the amount of traffic in the harbor, there’s lots of bouncing up and down. Being prepared with whatever seasickness cure you use will help you enjoy the lightshow without worrying. Also, it is very difficult to take photos due to movement of the boat and low light. If the photos are what you are after, you might want to find a viewing spot on the Kowloon Side of Victoria Harbor or in front of the Convention Center on the HK side... Once again, the big banks – Bank of China, HSBC, Standard Charter and AIG had some of the best lighting effects. Apparently the show is better on weekends, and sometimes they add fireworks --- but the regular show is good too. Show lasts about 10 minutes or so. The single ride night ticket is $100 HK and includes a concession ticket good for a beverage and a cake.

Don't miss the "Symphony of Lights". We wanted to do the Harbour Tour at a time that we could watch the Symphony of Lights. We took the 2 hour tour at 19h, because we had the impression that it was the shortest one to include that show of lights (starts around 20h). Later we understood that there is a shorter tour (1 hour), departing at 20h from the Kowloon side, which still gives you time to watch the Lights Show. Nevertheless, we enjoyed very much the 2 hour tour (includes one drink and a slice of cake) and the show.

Best way to cross. The Star Ferry is simply the best way to cross Victoria Harbour. Despite running for well over 100 years, it is still very reliable and the oldest of the fleet has been replaced. There is also one running with the "Hong Kong - Asia's World City" livery which I must agree is very stylish. The normal livery (green and white) though is also easy to spot and truly an icon of Hong Kong. The ferry is probably the most economical way (approx. 2-3HKD) across the harbour (short-haul) and like most public transport in Hong Kong, Octopus card is accepted. However, not recommended for those who get easily seasick although the boat handles waves really well.

Beautiful views of Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. Only takes 8 minutes to cross and very cheap!. Star Ferry was only $1.80 HKD (just less than 25 cents US). It's an 8 minute ride across the water between Hong Kong and Kowloon island. The view is beautiful at night.

You're in Hong Kong! How could you not?. It is the perfect way to get around. What could be wrong with seeing the harbor two or three times every day? If you are staying in Kowloon there is no other way to travel. Unless of course the weather is bad and then take the subway!

Cheap and scenic way to get to Hong Kong Central island. They also have a Star Ferry tour which doesn't actually go to central island, it just makes a big circle in the bay between the island and Kowloon. This costs more, but comes with a narration, but I personally don't think it's worth it.Taking the normal ferry to Hong Kong Central Island is pretty cheap, I think it is somewhere like $2USD or less and is a pretty scenic way to get to Central Island where you can conduct your other activities. It docks right by the Convention center, so you'll have plenty of photo ops for that. Sit on the right side because it docks to the left of it.It's cheaper to take the subway to Central Island but you miss the view. And I think none of you will gripe about $2 vs. $0.50. It's cheap either way and this way is prettier. :-)

Cheap and scenic way to see the Harbor. This is a great way to see the harbor for less than a US dollar each way and still get to your destination. Take the upper deck it is a better view with less exhaust smell of the ferry.

A Hong Kong must-do. Taking the Star Ferry across the harbour is a must-do while in Hong Kong. It offers great views of the city and is very cheap. Ride on the top level for the best views. Beware of all the sleazy suit salesmen and panhandlers in Tsim sha tsui.

Hong Kong Twilight. As well as the Star Ferries that just take you from one side to the other (best 20p you'll ever spend!), there's also a circular harbour tour route. It runs every hour and for most of the day costs HKD 40 (a little under GBP 3 at the moment).At 7pm it jumps to HKD 80, then at 8pm to HKD 120.My tip would be to get the 6:05pm one - the last HKD 40 tour. We went at the very end of August and it was just getting dark while we were on the boat. Getting to see all the skyscrapers of Hong Kong light up a bit at a time is pretty magical.
Great views, great value!. The best way to travel from Hong Kong to Kowloon, with great views of both from the water. A good chance to get some snaps of the skyline too.

Fun and easy way to cross. We took the Star Ferry across from HK Island to Kowloon on 1st Nov. It cost us each only HKD$2.20. The ferries come every 10 mins so there was minimal waiting time. It was clean and comfortable and the ride gave us a fabulous view of the skyline. It's very convenient to reach Nathan Rd from the ferry terminus. We went into Sogo and took the escalators down to the underground crossing which was nicely airconditioned and with shops along the way. We got out from the Sheraton shopping arcade onto the main street of Nathan Rd. The ferry is an easier and faster way to get to Kowloon than it is by cab. We took a cab back to HK Island's Central from Kowloon and there was a slight traffic hold-up at the tunnel entrance. There seems to be perpetual traffic congestion when heading to Kowloon from HK Island via the tunnel link.

Will You Marry Me. This is the one of the most romantic journeys you can make. Travelling from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island with the mass of neon lights in the background is the perfect place to propose.Neil from Cheltenham

Cheapest thrill in town. Costing pennies, this is one of the best tourist trips around - day or night the views, the sights and sounds of crossing HK harbour are thrilling - whilst the high speed crossing is quicker, this has just the right amount of charm. One of my favourite memories of HK is using the Star Ferry just to get around.

Quanint but efficient. An excellent way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong accross the harbour - quick, cheap and efficient and a real taste of old Hong Kong. You can ride on the bottom deck with the hum of the motors or sit on the top and enjoy the fantastic view. Especially stunning at night when all the sky scrapers are lit up.
